reviews.review: Beautiful at sunrise, stunning at night. There's a lot of places where you can go to get a good view of the Manhattan skyline. It looks stunning at sunset.

Superb!. The skyline offers something for everyone. Unlike some tourist attractions, when construction is taking place you never seem to miss a photo oppotunity, simply take a different angle for the photograph. What is amazing is the different positions and photo locations that can be taken from the City.

Walk over brooklyn Bridge to get the best photos of the skyline!. with the sun shining on you - sunrise or sunset - you get the best profiles and sun shining off of the buildings - you can see the Stature of Liberty from the bridge

A classic, must-see view! . I'm not quite sure how to review this,but if you're visiting New York, you can't help but see the skyline!
Our first view was from the plane with the skyscrapers poking up from below the clouds, the second on the journey from Newark airport and the best was probably from Rockefella.

Best Skyline in the world . If you enjoy movies you've probably seen it dozens if not hundreds of times. Certainly an experience you'll long remember. Try the Empire State or the new opened World Trade Center for best views
AWESOME!!!. Best views are across the river from Brooklyn, it is quite a sight, you should not miss this, walk the Brooklyn Bridge!
New York New York.... From any and all angles, the NYC skyline is unique, always changing and ready for a good selfie or photo opp!

Icredible tall buildings. Really enjoyed the skyline of Manhattan and walking amongst the tall buildings. The midtown and downtown areas are quite large and the buildings rise on average of 40 to 50 stories into the air with an occasional tower topping off at 100 stories. I enjoyed the shear mass and height of the structures and wondered how such a small island can support such large buildings.

The city that never sleeps. The largest cityscape you can see. The Manhattan skyline is one of kind. The largest high rise metropolis anywhere. If you see one city skyline in your life, make this the one.
stunning. stunning skyline. glorious Americas! every vantage point offered interesting view. awesome experience

Ever inspiring! . Every time I visit NYC, I look forward to seeing the Manhattan Skyline. It's ever inspiring and awesome! This time around the view from Hudson on the NJ side was fantastic, but there are many other vantage points to view the Skyline.
Most Beautiful Skyline in the world. We saw the skyline from both Brooklyn and the ferry departing from the NJ side of the Hudson River. It's an awesome sight.
Unreal view. One of the best views in the world. Best place to see this view is from the front of the Statten Island ferry coming back into New York. The ferry is free and well worth the trip

Everything you thought it would be. The Manhattan Skyline is incredible, everything you've seen in pictures and movies and then some. Get on the Staten Island Ferry for the best views. It's a free boat ride to boot!
Unforgettable!. You can view Manhattan Skyline from the ferry or the Circle Line - this may be the best way of seeing it! On a clear day nothing beats that experience!
That's NYC. Try to scroll through historic photos of NYC skyline. Even in 1983 it looked much different. It is amazing and inspiring. That city is definitely worth 20 bucks Indians were paid for it.
Always impressive and memorable. It's a view I never tire of seeing. You see so many changes in New York, yet the Manhattan skyline never fails to impress. Magic.

The best place to see the skyline is........ We saw the skyline best at the Statue of Liberty. There you have an unobstructed view and can see for a long way. You have to buy a ticket to visit the statue but it's well worth the trip and money.
Choose right time. Fantastic view! Recommend this visit it in morning or at night. We viewed it afternoon from Hoboken and downtown was in a shadow.

Manhattan view from Long Island city. The view from Long Island city is spectacular !gantry plaza park along the east river is very clean,beautiful .there are free fitness ,yoga classes there during the summer on the weekends .love this area.

Best Free View of the Skyline..... Take the free Statten Island Ferry - every 15 minutes, 24/7... 364 days a year (excl Christmas Day). Enjoy a quick ride across the river, best view of the Statue of Liberty, stop for a drink or ice-cream on the Island and take a sunset trip back to Manhatten for a breathtaking view of the city lights.... ALL FOR FREE!

Unbelievable as seen from the Free Ferry!. We were fortunate to have beautiful weather and also a perfect view of Lower Manhattan. As you will be able to tell from my photos, it looks spectacular!I also did write a blogpost about it. Just google: We both enjoyed the FREE Ferry to Staten Island, New YorkFrom Google+ you can click through to my blogpost.Highly recommend this to anyone!

Vantage Points of the Skyline. You may either see it from he tallest building - The Freedom Tower, The Empire State Building, Top of the Rock at the Rockefeller Center, from Brooklyn in Eilliamsburg or Long Island City in Queens. In Brooklyn and Queens go to the water edge way west so you can admire the skyline. Beautiful at dusk too where you can see the sunset.If taking photos at night, best to keep the flash off - you won't be able to see the skyline with lights. You might as well take a photo anywhere as the subject matter is you.If you are lucky to have a friend with a rooftop or nice views - take advantage of that.
just a bunch of buildings. the manhattan skyline is just a bunch of buildings spaced closely together. if they weren't so many and spaced so closely together there wouldn't be a skyline.
You cannot get enough of it!. Best viewpoints are either from the boats on the Hudson, Liberty Island, Ellis Island or from Brooklyn Bridge park and along the promenade there.
Awesome. Can be viewed from endless amounts of sites ,angles.and walks.not forgetting East river and the hudson and even New Jersey!
just amazing. Walking through the skylines, feel the wind, take a picture, better more, have a coffee, walk again, eat something and walk again .....
Views from the river or park. Obviously a must do photo stop with views from either central park or the river boats either way a pretty standard memory of new york
The most iconic skyline in the world.. The Manhattan skyline is the most iconic skyline in the world. Driving into Manhattan from the airport takes your breath away.

Stunning. What a fabulous transformation and preservation all in one. Stunning views. Amazing planting, it's really a must see....so tranquil....plenty of viewing plant forms so get those cameras ready...

Iconic. New York has architecturally significant buildings in a wide range of styles spanning distinct historical and cultural periods. These include the Woolworth Building (1913), an early Gothic revival skyscraper with large-scale gothic architectural detail. The 1916 Zoning Resolution required setback in new buildings, and restricted towers to a percentage of the lot size, to allow sunlight to reach the streets below. The Art Deco design of the Chrysler Building (1930) and Empire State Building (1931), with their tapered tops and steel spires, reflected the zoning requirements. The Chrysler building is considered by many historians and architects to be one of New York's finest, with its distinctive ornamentation such as V-shaped lighting inserts capped by a steel spire at the tower's crown. An early influential example of the international style in the United States is the Seagram Building (1957), distinctive for its facade using visible bronze-toned I-beams to evoke the building's structure. The Condé Nast Building (2000) is an important example of green design in American skyscrapers. It doesn't matter these days what building is going up the whole skyline is iconic. We were on a harbor tour and the guide had an amazing fact about all the famous skyscrapers. I could have stared at it for hours. If you are here then you have to do some sort of tour whether it is by boat or helicopter to see this amazing site, it will stick with you for the rest of your days.

See them on a boat ride. There are tons of different boat rides out there. I suggest taking the staten island ferry. Same views but more locals than tourists. If you do want to take a tour you can see the skyline via a guided tour or on the way to the statue of liberty. You can also head over to brooklyn and get those views as well.

Not what it used to be. While observing the New York skyline from Warren Street in Jersey City while waiting for the ferry, my wife and I both remarked how we missed the old skyline, with the twin towers. That was an iconic image and defined NY's skyline.Unfortunately, it will never be what it once was.
One of the most famous. Amazing to see in real life this famous skyline. See from various locations but Staten Island ferry is really good

Most beautiful. If I could pick just one skyline in the world, it would be New York. To really absorb it all, you need to take a tour in the day and another tour at night. One of them should be on the Hudson, and maybe the other on a double decker bus. Either way, the view is amazing. Yes, the skyline has changed since 9/11, but nothing has changed the commanding statement that this beautiful city makes. There's nothing like it anywhere else.

From Brooklyn!. Cross by walk the beautiful Brooklyn Bridge and you will fine one of the most beautiful places in the city, I had felt in love of Brooklyn... Just walk on the Barbour and you will see the beauty on the Skyline..
Stunning. The New York Skyline is one of the most stunning skylines in the world. If you get the opportunity take a night cruise on the Hudson Rive to really experience it.
Its awesome. Cant think of a better more iconic skyline. It has changed a bit with the new Freedom Tower and lots of construction but there's no skyline like it in the world.

Better than you expect. Having seen photos of the skyline and seeing it in films, it's quite amazing just how surreal it is when you see it with your own eyes. A truly wonderful sight and I hope I get the chance to do it again.
What a view!. A perfect view which will stay in your mind forever! It's clean all over and wonderful to view! Buildings of different heights and shapes!

Impressive skyline.. The Manhattan skyline can be viewed from land, air or water. Taking a cruise along the Hudson River, in my view, is probably the most enjoyable way of seeing this impressive & varied architectural skyline. Cruises are approximately 2.5 hrs duration, unhurried & not overcrowded, with a well presented narration offering many historical & other interesting facts. The vessel l was on had bars, toilets & ample viewing points. Wheelchair/disabled access.A great relaxing time on the water viewing the great architecture of not only Manhattan but including: around the island, New Jersey, Queens & the Statue of Liberty too.Viewing from the water - Highly recommended.
Best view. wife and I love to cuddle while kids slept. drink wine and enjoy. I wouldn't want to live here 24/7 but for a few nights. it's all ok.
Outstanding views. Amazing views towards downtown Manhattan,Empire State Building and One World Trade Centre from one angle and right across Central Park from another.Would highly recommend this.
Unforgettable. We would highly recommend taking a cruise to get the best views. We used Circle Line who were great. Also walking over Brooklyn Bridge towards Manhattan is brilliant.

NYC Skyline. Took a night bus tour that went to Brooklyn so that you can see the Manhattan skyline when coming back over the Manhattan bridge. Great experience if the weather is clear. A must see from the upper tour bus deck.
Spectacular. Is there a more iconic city skyline in the world? I'm not sure. You get a real sense of the scale and wealth of Manhattan. On a clear day the photos will be amazing.

Well worth looking at from different angles.. Although much changed since 9/11 the Skyline is well worth looking at from various angles.I would highly recommend the view of Lower Manahattan from the deck of the ferry going over to Liberty Island.

Has its place in popular culture!!!!. We did love it because its soooo familiar. We had a hotel room that was virtually in the clouds so did love gazing at it - dusk was amazing - however take the familiarity away and its just another high rise city
NY Getaway. Amazing to see during the day and especially at night all lite up!! We saw it during the day on a boat in the harbor and on a double decker bus at night. Just Beautiful!!

Amazing skyline not found anywhere else. There is nothing like the Manhattan skyline. It's impossible to get in one picture without using a panaramic photo. It is breathtaking no matter how many times I've seen it. After you see the Manhattan skyline, every other city looks like a mini version.
best skyline. New York skyline is mesmerizing. weve been to many capital cities but this one is by far the most beautiful day and night.

VERY IMPRESSIVE. The sheer size, extent and differences in the shape of buildings which make up the Manhattan skyline, combine to make it architecturally very interesting. From sections of Central Park, the vista, as a backdrop, is stunning.
Stunning. Absolutely beautiful. I didn't quite realise how stunning NYC was until I room intros view from the Brooklyn Bridge, best place to admire it in my opinion.

The City Lights by Night. The Manhattan skyline is beautiful at day, but to appreciate it the most, you should be in a place to enjoy it at night. However, to really appreciate it, you have to get out of the city. You can do this from several different places. The ones I like the best are the cliffs above the Hudson River in Weehawken, NJ, Liberty State Park in Jersey City, NJ, a dinner cruise around Manhattan on one of the many dinner cruise lines, or my favorite, which is Long Island City, NY just across the East River thru the Midtown Tunnel or the 59th St bridge. In Weehawken you get a beautiful view of the city all day, night and if you are an early bird, at sunrise over the city. Bring your camera or iPhone. Liberty State park is by the Statue of Liberty and there are many areas to get great shots of lower Manhattan and NY Bay.The dinner cruises are not very expensive, and give you great views from the Hudson to the East River, so you get all the angles except from the North.My favorite is from Long Island City, just across the East River from the UN Building. If you are visiting the city with no car, this is the best place to go, since the 7 train out of Grand Central has it's first stop in LIC, and you can walk a couple of blocks to the waterfront. LIC is the fastest growing part of the city and perfect place for young couples with children to live if you work in NYC. Many great restaurants, rental apartments, condos, and public parks right on or close to the river. Again, don't forget your camera, or be sure you have memory on your phone, because you will take a lot of pictures. Oh yes, from LIC, you have a clear view of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building and if you catch it right, sunset thru the the Canyons of building in the city.
Great view. Travelling from the airport and seeing the view for the first time is amazing, especially after seeing it on the tv so many times!
This is the view ..... .... I have spent 20 years waiting to see .... got a little choked while on ferry to Liberty Island.

The Best Skyline in the World. I've been able to enjoy the Skyline of many places both in North America and in Asia but New York's Skyline is a step ahead, the history of those buildings we all know about and the new architectural wonders make it a unique view.

Great Manhattan skyline view from the roof of the Met Museum of Art. You don't need to go to the top of a tall building for an inspired view, the roof garden at the Metropolitan Museum of Art provides multiple vistas from the vantage point inside Central Park. Additionally, the roof garden has an outdoor show and a bar where you can find light refreshment or a coffee. This comes free with your admission to the museum (which is still pay what you want, but you must pay something).
Makes you wanna cry. One of the best skylines in the world. We had the pleasure of seeing the skyline from a helicopter ride. The best way to see it.
beautiful. have seen the skyline many times, it's always inspiring.beautiful sky, buildings, sunset and sunrise. Cant miss it

Take the Harbour Lights Tour!. Probably the best thing we did in New York! The boat takes you out on the Hudson at dusk, where you can view the lights of Manhattan. The tour guide was extremely interesting and pointed out loads of buildings. It takes two hours and the boat is licensed and has plenty rest rooms.
Awesome. There are places on earth that everyone can recognize by one picture. The skyline of Manhattan is one of these unique locations. Best view from the Brooklyn Bridge Park
so beautiful. Went to the pier at night...the scenery was amazing, amazing view of the skyline, I was so taken by the sight that all I could do was stand there and take it in.

Pretty Sure You're Going to See This. If you're going to NYC, you're going to see the skyline. For that matter, you'll see it if you go to Hoboken, Jersey City, or any of the surrounding cities. That's not to say that it's not a glorious, iconic skyline, but it doesn't seem that you have a lot of choice in the matter.
"Great from any angle". Quite difficult to write 100 words on the Manhattan skyline because it is just brilliant in all weathers, from any angle and any time of the day or night
great to see. have to see this in person once if you can. Just like the photos we have all seen, but it has a more personal feel when you are actually there

Iconic. You cannot imagine going to New York and NOT seeing the Manhattan skyline view, it is amazing
So many different vantage points to consider viewing from, land or water.
We took the New York Water Taxi and got some great views.

Hop a ferry for a great view. Having never been to NY before, I only had seen the skyline in movies and photos. It was great fun to focus on the beauty of the city on the way back from our ferry to see Lady Liberty. On a clear day, it really is something to see!
Spectacular. We saw it from the Statue of Liberty cruise ship. It is truly spectacular. Easy to capture on camera.
Iconic view has to be witnessed in real life.. Coming from a small country let alone a small city, this view is just fantastic to see. Wether view from Empire state, Rockafeller or Liberty Island.

Harbor Lights Circle Line Cruise. This was a great overview of the city at night. Being there of 9-10 gave us the special "dress rehearsle" of the twin towers lights. Also we around the Statue of Liberty and under all the bridges.

Good view from the Brooklyn Bridge. The view from the Brooklyn Bride of the city was awesome. There are some road side eateries for a quick munch. Lots of people walking and cycling around. Feels comfy being there and watching people do their things

Greatest Skyline in the world!. The New York City skyline is absolutely amazing! there are over 100 buildings in New York City that over 600ft tall! There are so many places to admire the skyline of New York City I will name as many I can. for great views of Lower Manhattan I recommend Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Heights Promenade, Liberty State Park, and the Statue of Liberty. For great views of Midtown Manhattan I recommend Gantry State Plaza Park and Four Freedoms Park. For amazing views of Lower, Midtown and Upper Manhattan I recommend going to Weehawken, NJ! Take the PATH trains from NYC to Jersey City and then take the Hudson Bergen Tram to Weehawken. You can also use the NYC water taxi but it's not so easy to get tickets for that.

Just a fabulous view. The sky line is fabulous and changes mood depending on where you are looking at it from and from day time to night time. A great place to view it from in the day or at night is to walk over the Brooklyn bridge ( great views) and view it from Brooklyn.

Wow. What a city. Day or night it's amazing. Loads to do, very expensive but fabulous. Take boat tour on the Hudson or bus tour around the city. Chinatown And financial district worth a visit. Excitement wherever you go.

Beautiful!. We are so lucky that we had a skyline view from our hotel room! It's mesmerising, and even better at night! Never seen anything quite like it! Go to the other side of the river and have a look! You can see it on the river boats to the Statue of Liberty too, and can get great pictures!

Wow!!!. You have all seen the pics growing up but nothing experiences you for seeing it in the flesh. It is mind blowing and the memory will live with us forever. See it from as many different angles as possible as they are completely different depending where you are viewing it from.
Stunning. This was one of my highlights ! We walked so much and this view was a graet reward! A must on your trip!
Girls trip. We did this on the spirit dinner cruise which I would definitely recommend the view you get from the river at night when the skyline is lite up is amazing

Visited on a harbour lights tour by Circle Line 25th Sept 20016. This is the best tour to take to see the Manhattan Skyline in all her night time glory Takes 2 hour from pier 38.The views are stunning and the commentary none stop. Great photo opportunities from the boats bow. The Harbour cruise takes in from MidTown area on the Hudson side and passes under the main bridges of Brooklyn, Manhattan and Williamsberg, ging up as far as the Queens Bridge. Then out to the Statue of Liberty and passed Ellis Island on the way back You must not miss these sites.
We got see it.. We got to it from the Newark Airport Marriott and again from the New Jersey side of the Hudson. It was spectacular.

Really, you have to ask?. It's the most beautiful skyline in the world. No matter where you view it, you'll be impressed. I recommend the Whitestone Bridge to the VanWyck expressway, but any road in will give you a great view.
Amazing views!. Incredible views and definitely something you have to do if you're in NewYork on holiday! I think it's probably a one time thing but still an incredible building!

Just a slice of the Big Apple .... It's not were the most New Yorkers live, it's not even the biggest part of the city, it's not a city at all ... it's the neighbourhood of the world (and it's biggest scar since 9/11). The fluidity of the ever changing skyline is a promise of progress ... even in bleak times where progress seems just to much to hope for.
Worth staying out all night for!. The NY skyline is great especially when seen from either the Manhattan bridge or the Brooklyn Bridge.

Amazing. The view of the Manhattan skyline just never gets old and is always fun to look at. From afar you get a totally different view of the city, and it looks like a huge giant from up in the heavens was playing with lego blocks. Amazing.
Looks pretty stunning. Good view from both Liberty State park(boarding for Liberty statue ferry) and from Ellis Island. Must do.

Arguably one of the most Wonderful Man made sites in the World. We have had the privilege of viewing this From Liberty and Ellis Islands, Brooklyn Bridge and Queens and it is just so amazing.It is just so unique, iconic and totally magical. The images will live with us forever - What an amazing city this is!

Best seen at night. Take a bus tour to Brooklyn at night to see the famous view of Downtown Manhattan at night. Glitters like many jewels. I would hate to live here but it was good to see it. Took 1 and a half hours.

Great views of the Skyline. Best views of the Manhattan Skyline are from either Top of the Rock,or from over the Brooklyn Bridge.Get the subway downtown to the Brooklyn Bridge and walk over about a quarter of the way.There you can find a great view back towards Manhattan.Also cheaper souvenirs are to be found at the start of the bridgewalk,like pictures for 4 $,new york keyrings 1 $.Hats and tshirts 5 to 9 $.Cheaper than many shops and souvenir shops in the city.The Staue of Liberty Ferry (Staaten Island) Ferry is free and you can also get great views and its worth the trip.

Numerous perspectives. From the Staten Island ferry, or the Brooklyn Bridge, or New Jersey, The Manhattan skyline has many perspectives and many building, bridges and islands to view.
If packing allows, a small pair of binoculars would be extremely handy to allow to for closeup views of architectural details and styles.

Amazing Skyline. This is one of the most iconic skylines in the world and is worth the view. Can be seen from all areas outside Manhatten
There are great views from some of the taller buildings like the Empire State Building.
Amazing views. I saw the skyline from both the Statten Island ferry and whilst walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. Its such an iconic view and definitely a must see when you're in New York.
Always Impressive. This skyline is like no other and always impressive, however many times you have seen it. Great to go on a boat ride and see from the water, as this is the very best view

Very impressive and looks great at night. The Manhattan Skyline is fascinating, for the sheer number of tall buildings alone, some of the buildings don't look good or look out of place, like the huge concrete building downtown or that new apartment cube by the park.At the same time it has some great looking buildings, Th Chrysler Building, Empire State Building, One World Trade, The Woolworth Building, and many more.As people say, it's a concrete jungle, so it can look great from some angles, ugly from others, but almost always great at night or during sunset (practically any city does)The best places to view it from, inside the city, is from the top of the Rock, Empire State and One World Trade.I didn't get to see the it from Jersey City, but it's supposed to have some great vantage points over there and it looks amazing, I've seen pictures of it though.Two other places i did see it from is the Twilight Cruise, it starts at peer 78 and takes you a good length around the island and past the Manhattan bridge before turning back. It looks amazing at night time, going under the bridges with all of the lights on.Probably the best place to view it from that I found is the park below the Brooklyn Bridge, on the Brooklyn side. On that side the Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge are right next to each other, so you get great views from below both bridges, great to be there during sunset, it's a shame I never got there at night.Two other great places to view it from is from Liberty Island and particularly Ellis Island. It looks amazing from there and I was there on a day when a big rain cloud was hanging over the city, so it looked even better (starting pouring down the moment I got back into Manhattan)

Silent Sillhouette. I had an amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline whilst on a Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island cruise. When you're in Manhattan the noise is constant but out on the water the skyline silhouetted against a beautiful blue, cloudless sky was awesome. I experienced the iconic night skyline travelling in a yellow cab from JFK airport and as the cab approached a tunnel to go under the Hudson River, you could see the skyline, breathtaking!

Iconic From Any Angle! But See it From The Brooklyn Bridge or Promenade. Manhattan's skyline is heartbreakingly beautiful, but since 9/11, poignant for what's not there. That said, the city is always changing, new buildings are transforming the Far West Side, Tribeca, Columbus Circle--everywhere. The classic 3 hour tourboat around Manhattan Island, or free trip on the Staten Island Ferry is one way to get a view, but three hours is more than you need for most of our skyline, and you may not need to take the Ferry to and from Staten Island, even for free. Here's my suggestion, should you be downtown, perhaps for the Trade Center Memorial. You will be at the start of the Brooklyn Bridge pedestrian path if you walk over to City Hall Park and keep going (you'll see the Bridge!). Just start walking. Within ten minutes you will be at the first, awe inspiring span. Stop, look back at the city. You could keep going, and you will soon (15-20 minutes) be in Brooklyn, where you can exit off the bridge and make your way to the Brooklyn Promenade, a famously expansive view of the lower Manhattan skyline, especially at dusk. There are subways back into Manhattan nearby. Another way to see the skyline is to walk around the Jackie Onassis Reservoir in Central Park (1.3 miles), at any time of day, and watch the changing skyline of elegant apartment buildings especially on the West Side (see if you can spot the Ghostbusters building), then the scrim of skyscrapers to the south of the park). Can't walk 1.3 miles? Enter anywhere and plunk down on a bench. Voila: waterscape, skyline, the whole schmear.

(Must See At Night) - Day or Night - One World Observatory & Top of the Rock for best views. Take the Statue By Night cruise at Pier 16 for an amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline and the Statue of Liberty. Tip: Sit on the highest deck, last row facing the back of the boat (Zephyr boat).
Energizing. I love the NYC skyline! I think it is the most beautiful city in the US. It energizes and excites me. The modern mixed with old.

An iconic view.. We experienced this the best on the FREE Staten island ferry service. It is my understanding from a friend that the best way to see Manhatten is by helicopter, located close to the ferry. Unfortunately we did not have the time to experience this.
What can I say!. The best way to get a good view of the skyline is from a boat or over the water in Brooklyn, day or night its an awesome sight.

Skyline. What a view. So many wonderful sights.
Something for all to see.
Stunning buildings and architecture

NATION'S ICONIC SKYLINE. most famous skyline in the world......viewed best from top of the rock (rockefeller center) or other well-known midtown skyscrapers but also approaching by car from new jersey turnpike or queens

Tranquil Narrated Boat Tour. The best way to view the Skyline is by taking a narrated boat tour. The cost is reasonable. The boat tour is about 2.5 hour in duration. Your learn about the history of the city, neighborhoods, and buildings. The boats are covered with the option of outside seating. Snacks and beverages can be purchased on board. Full restroom facilities are available.

Breathtaking experience. Seeing the Manhattan skyline for years just in Hollywood movies, it had been in my bucketlist from a long time. It was definitely worth spending a couple of hours to actually go view it and experience the calm breeze of hudson
Wow. It's just like the movies,was completely awe struck...cross the Brooklyn bridge and absorb the awesome view and skyline

Neck ache from looking up. The skyline is famous around the world and even more amazing when you are standing in it! The views are different from every point. Viewed from street level or from one of the observatories the buildings are all different and individual. The new and old blend together and bring to mind the many films and programmes set in New York.
Fantastic. We went to the top of the Empire State Building to enjoy the sunset. It was fantastic.The Manhattan experience can be enjoyed from here too! Amazing! What a city! :-)
everything you image. There are some amazing views , particularly at night when there is a full moon. Good to see from the water on the free ferry.

Breathtaking. Not much beats the view of Manhattan's skyline. Such a fantastic city in general, and to experience all of it, as well as take in the skyline is really a great experience. Brooklyn of course is the best place to get a view of the skyline. A definite must if visiting NYC.
Best viewed from the water. A magnificent skyline, if you haven't got a head for heights, it's best viewed from the water, either during the day, night or both.
Never fails to please. Arrived on The Queen Mary 2 to be greeted by the impressive site as the sun was rising,simply incredible well worth getting up at 5-0am to see
Breathtaking views. Me and my friend went to see the city skyline at sunset. It was judt amazing. You just forget about everything and just stare at the huge buildings while the sun is going down.

serious skyline. See the Manhattan skyline from Staten Island Ferry. Fabulous to see and really appreciate the views including the Hudson river
; Ellis island and statue of liberty. All easily photographed. No charge to use ferry so don't pay for boat trip as not necessary.

On my way to catch a bus to BOSTON. I walk a little bit at the skyline. Didn't know before about that part of the city. It was beautiful. I ate some pizza from a restaurant nearby. There are many constructions around. My best friend who is and engeneer was so impressed with the methods they used. I will go back with more time!!!!

Mesmerizing !. I had heard a lot about Manhattan skyline but I did not expect it the way it looks. There is indeed something Amazing about Manhattan skyline, that inspite the fact that I had seen many beautiful cities, it still looks fascinating and you do get spellbound looking at it !It is very beautiful and you should see it with your own eyes the feel the beauty !
Amazing!. Greatly visible from the Empire State Building you will not be disappointed by the views on offer its out of this world.

Approach from anywhere and you'll love it.. Approaching Manhattan is an experience in itself and can be done from anywhere. Driving is not the reccomended way, however. Be a passenger in a car on any highway, ride Amtrak, Metro North RR, Long Island RR, NJ Transit, any of the NYC surface subway lines from the Bronx, Queens, or Brooklyn. Sale aboard a commuter ferry from any direction, especially aboard the Staten Island Ferry. On clear days views from the hills of New Jersey 20+ miles inland, even coming down from Upstate NY or across Long Island, vistas are fascinating tens of miles away. Each time of year, each time of day, every weather predicament offers something different to see and enjoy. Coming down from Summit, NJ on an NJT train is great on a winter afternoon with the sun setting on the buildings for instance. Or from Jamaica LI on the J train as you zoom the picture in until you cross the Williamsburg Bridge. Amtrak spread things out wending its way through the Bronx and crossing Hell's Gate high above the East River waters enroute from New England or catching glimpses as your train winds along the east shore of the Hudson River until you are under the George Washington Bridge. Drive? NJ's Pallasades offers some close ups especially into Weehawken. But between the buildings of Hoboken, Jersey City and Bayonne in NJ are also great places (don't want to drive here? Then ride the Hudson-Bergen Light Rail line out of Hoboken Terminal for unque perspectives). I've done them all over the years and each time I go to a different place in the area, I see something different. Most recently, while riding the surface subway lines in the Bronx. What is nice, is that you don't have to spend a huge fortune for guided tours to see and enjoy.
smoggier than you think,. If you are going to be walking or riding in outdoor conveyances, bring wipes for your face and hands.

Quintessential part of being in NYC. The first time I saw the Manhattan skyline after having arrived in NYC, it brought an huge smile to my face. I now knew for sure that I was in this iconic city, with an incredible adventure ahead of me and I was excited to embrace it!

Beautiful skyline on a summer day. We took a tour boat out to get a proper view of the city and once your further enough out to take it all in, the concrete jungle looks stunning. It's even more magical if you can get a tour just before sunset.
No problems here!. Stayed for 3 nights on the way to Vegas. Fine accommodation, great buffet breakfasts, and helpful, friendly staff. Well located for walking touring.

First View of Skyline NYC. Took my breath. Most cities only have a couple tall bldgs. in the city center, from the ground level you could not see the city end. The Staten Island Ferry provided breath taking views of the skyline both day and evening.
Pretty!. We stopped by here a day before we cruised out of the port just to check it out. It was a fun day trip and is easily followed up with a trip to the statue of liberty.

Sunset Tour. We traveled out to Manhattan in the early evening. Returned to the city just as the sun was setting. The sun set on all the glass buildings was breath taking. The lights came on in Broadway and Time Square lite up. Awesome. Highly recommend.

Spectacular but not the same. There is something so awesome about New York City skyline but for me the twin towers will always be in my vision. The new tower is impressive but I have no way to forget the twins, they were so solid and then gone. BUT the skyline is worth seeing without them, I am just a sentimental softy.
Great views!. Somehow, you need to get to a spot where you can see the skyline! a ferry trip was nice for this, also saw a great view from the plane coming in

quite spectacular. Being in New York without a camera is like having a car with no wheels. The skyline can be very breathtaking from a variety of points in the city and provides hundreds of photo opportunities.

Take a picnic to Brooklyn. We visited in the summer and took a picnic to Dumbo in Brooklyn to watch the sunset over Manhattan. We then walked back into Manhattan in the dark over the Brooklyn Bridge, it was spectacular. The views were amazing and I was able to take some fabulous pictures.
Love it. The Manhattan Skyline, its beautiful, very warm, and always welcome, I have been there innumerable number of times, but each time I go to Manhattan, I just love it
Unique!. Try from the Brooklyn side - we had the pleasure when we visited The River Cafe, and we will never forget the view!

Awesome.. Looking at the skyline you instantly are taken back to all the songs that you have heard over the years about this place. The concrete jungle is stunningly beautiful and something that I will never forget.
Great from any angle!. Seen on approach from airport, from the water, or up high from Top of the Rock or Empire State.....stunning! Best seen from the water at any time of day.

WOW!!. The big apple ahh? What a city!! i loved it,and it lived up to all the hype.It just kept giving and giving.Im not sure what i was expecting if im honest but what i got was above and beyond.JKF i have to say was so dissapointing as one of the major gateways to this fabulous city.I took the subway all the way into manhattan early evening it was so cool and i have to say i felt safe.It takes a little time to get your bearings though.Upon leaving the subway i can only describe it as bursting on to time square!! wow what a place alive and kicking what an introduction to the heart beat of the city it didnt dissapoint.I checked into a local hotel fairly pricey i have to say for the standard of accommodation but hey it is what it is,i was only resting my head and showering each day before heading out to see the sites.You know all those movies you see?OMG here i was stood in the middle of the biggest movie set ever!!It felt really familiar and it just didnt give up giving.I could sit here and list off all the places you should visit but hey your gonna do your own thing?but just a couple of things you should try and do.The new world trade centre is a must the views will take your breathe away and the ellavator to the top just has to be done!!.Its an experience in it self.Ground zero wow what do you say except wow.Puts life into true perspective?If you have the finances the hellicopter flights accross the city are a must that will always live with you!!One tip though is puchase one of these muli-attraction passes saved me a fortune plus you can build your day arround them and decide what attractions you wanna see but the biggest freebie is just walk and walk and walk.The best way to get arround is on foot omg i walked mile upon mile but the views were well worth it. Food was fairly expensive were ever you go but i did find one little gem of a place on 42nd street called the west bank cafe i ended up sitting next to elderly couple from brooklyn they where simply charming and full of ideas of things to do and see.The restaurant was full of New Yorkers from what i could tell they seemed to know alot more than the tourist boy was the food good fresh hot and tastey service was slick to.I dinned there twice durring my stay it was that good.Well needless to say i wanna go back and do all the bits i didnt get to do this time so dont think about it go on give it a bash!! you really really wont be dissapointed.

VRBO APARTMENT. Highly recommend trying VRBO for renting a luxury apartment for the same or less price than the hotels. We rented a luxury apartment on the top floor 32 stories high for $350.00 dollars a night. That includes 24/7 security, apt mgr, and doorman. The views were spectacular. You could also use the rooftop deck and enjoy a360 degree view of the entire Manhattan skyline. You need to book way in advance to get good rates. Our apartment normally rents for $750 per night.

As seen in the movies. A delightful view from one of the many tour boats that ply the harbour. Stunning, just stunning. When going away from the harbour look away from the city centre and then turn round to gasp at the skyline.
One and Only. This is one of the most iconic skylines around.So many ways to experience it.Night and day it never fails to inspire.

Always Beautiful. When you get to New York, there is always this special moment when the city reveals itself in all it's glory. It is wonderful in every hour of the day and every season of the year. It is particularly moving to remember how the city's skyline has changed after September 11, 2001, now - without the World Trade Center "Twin Towers".

Manhattan Skyline. Best place to see Manhattan Skyline is to view it from sunset cruise . You have an opportunity to see daylight as well as twilight and night. Building lights glitters like star at times. And from distance it a marvelous view. Circle line is one option.

Still get goosebumps whenever I see it. Being a born and bred New Yorker, I should be used to seeing the Manhattan skyline.But I am not. It is a thrill each time--especially at night with all of the lights twinkling,rivaling the stars in the sky.I only pray that they don't overbuild so that one receives a claustrophobic feeling.
Amazing view. I enjoyed the view from the Staten Island Ferry. It's really fabulous and it's for free. Don't book a diffrent tour with a ferry.
Amazing. What an amazing site to see you can see it in magazines and pictures but nothing beats the real thing. Totally stunning. Totally worth the trip to New york the veiws are amazing
What a sight !!!!. Saw the views from the top of a tour bus, a taxi and the QM2,,truly magnificent. No words could explain the views to their full extent. Do not miss if in NYC.

Simply Amazing. This view is iconic, you don't need to be told where you are you just know it from everything you've seen on TV.
The buildings tower and make you feel tiny, a must visit for everyone at least once but be warned its easy to get hooked, I started missing the place as soon as we left
Never get's old. The Manhattan skyline makes me gasp every time i see it. It is a view like no other. It's beautiful morning, afternoon and night.
Beautiful SKYLINE. We were here on a very clear day and the skyline was amazing! Definitely worth a visit during the day and night.

Memorable from so many different places. Great from the river. Take a boat trip down the Hudson rive great views of the sky line and the statue of Liberty, ground zero and all the bridges a

Man-made wonder of the world. Unique, unforgettable, and seemingly ever-changing depending on the time of day and the light. Surely this has to be the best man-made skyline in the world. I can only imagine what my ancestors thought of it back in the winter of 1899 arriving as emigrants. I was able to see it for free from the Staten Island ferry and the Brooklyn Bridge and it is well worth taking in the view from the observatory at the Rockefeller Centre or the Empire State.
Perfectly. The skyline is so beautiful. Best way to take this in is in a helicopter. Worth every penny you spend on getting to the 86th floor. Dont miss it! Its like a dream come true!

Iconic - perfect for photographers. My recommendations for viewing the Manhatten skyline are: Brooklyn Bridge Park, Dumbo - Enjoy the park, grab a snack and watch the sunset.Liberty Island - visit the big lady herself and take in the views across the water

Amazing View of New York especially at night.. It is possible to see Manhattan at night from both Hoboken, New Jersey across teh Hudson River, or from Long Island City in Brooklyn. I took a couple of friends to the two place within 1 hour. There was a full moon, and they were fascinated because not only was it a beautiful view but they took pictures of the same moon from opposite sides. Beautiful view. Enjoy something sweet from Carlos' Bakery in Hoboken or what used to be an abandoned area just a couple of years ago and is now a beatiful places that has many skylights and the alternative to living in Manhattan, a 5 minute ferry ride away from Queens (Gantry Plaza State Park).

Unique. The NYC skyline is truly unique and is awe inspiring. Take a trip up The Top of the Rock, The Empire State or No 1, WTC to view. I actually recommend all three. Also, take a ferry from Battery Lark as the views are amazing - enjoy!
Beautiful. As our cruise ship depart, your jaw drops as the New York Skyline passes by. All types of buildings different shapes and colors makes you feel exuberant.
Great View. We viewed this by ferry. It was a good trip and also took us by Statue of Liberty. we did this on same day as 9/11 Memorial as they are close by if you use underground

A beautiful view one will always appriciate.. I good or bad weather it is always special. The view always changes with boat traffic on the East River. I live on the waterfront with an unobstructed view of the Manhattan Skyline from Williamsburg Brooklyn... it is like looking at a painting that changes ALL THE TIME. If you are visiting, on a clear and beautiful day you should take the EastRiver Ferry that goes back and forth between Pier 11 (Wall street/South Street Seaport) and 34the street. Both of these stops are in Manhattan. In between, the stops are in Brooklyn (3: Dumbo, So. Williamsburg, No. Williamsburg) and in Queens (2: Greenpoint and Long Island City). The cost is $4 for week days and $6 on the weekends. The skyline in Brooklyn and Queens are getting better by the day and lots of developments are taking place. From the ferry you can decide which parts of Brooklyn and Queens to see and discover.

As amazing as it looks!. Best views are from pier under Brooklyn Bridge or walking back over Brooklyn Bridge or Statue of Liberty ferry. Just amazing! Recommend, and while you are in Brooklyn a must visit is Juliana's Pizzeria & Brooklyn Icecream factory.
None Better!. The Manhattan Skyline view from the New Jersey side is not to be missed in my opinion. For the best view go to Liberty Park and take the ferry to the Statue of Liberty.
great view. Manhattan's skyline is the best I've ever seen! Really enjoy the view from a tall building or from nj/Brooklyn.

Fun for all. I go to the high line whenever work brings me to Chelsea. It is an urban respite while having a unique metropolitan feel. The gardens are well maintained landscaping pieces in some areas accented with sculpture and natural seating areas of modern architecture, and they are wind blown wildflower patches hardening a more refined mad max or apocalyptic feel, where the wild flowers overgrow old train tracks. I went during an art exhibit of creative architecture design that was interactive! Monks roam the area asking for offerings and blessing you. I jammed out with a drummer. Friends of mine did a Butoh piece atop this great garden!

A World Class View. The Manhattan skyline will rivet you all day long. The best views are from across the rivers from Queens, Brooklyn and New Jersey. You want a panoramic view unobstructed, and these vantage points give you what you need. You cannot appreciate the diversity or vastness of the skyline when up close like walking through midtown Manhattan. A boat ride from the lower Manhattan Battery Park area is where you want to start.

Spectacular, Day or Night. There are several different vantage points with different views. I usually see it from New Jersey. Some of the best views are just across the Hudson River such as the Hoboken Waterfront, Jersey City Waterfront, Weehawken, West New York, etc. Some distant areas where I have seen the skyline - from the north, Montvale NJ and from the south, Woodbridge NJ (both at least 25 miles or more away).There are also good views from Brooklyn, just across the East River near the Brooklyn Bridge, South St. Seaport, and along the elevated Brooklyn Queens Expressway. At night, the entire skyline is lit up and the Empire State Building generally has colors for different occasions, What is really interesting about the skyline is when you are close by. you can see the different building shapes, Some of the buildings are very unique and there a quite a few very tall buildings in the skyline.
Beautiful. The view is just breathtaking. You have to go. Take the most amazing pictures. If you don't do this is like you never being in NYC!!!!

New York City's Amazing View both day and night. New York City, known world wide as the city that never sleeps can be taken abreast by Queens, Manhattan, Brooklyn and New Jersey. The City offers amazing views both day in and day out. In the day time you enjoy the engineering and the architecture of the building and at night you enjoy the lighting of the building especially to the now LED light technology that can be seen far away.

Get out of Manhattan!. The problems with being in Manhattan is that you can't appreciate the iconic skyline when you're buried in the canyons! You have to leave Manhattan in order to appreciate it's amazing profile.You can do this from Queens, Staten Island, and the other side of the River Hudson (New Jersey). While you can get some idea for the tourist boats which circumnavigate the island of Manhattan, they are really too close to get the awe-inspiring grandeur. Taking the boat to the Statue of Liberty or the (free) ferry to Staten Island will give you a nice view of the bottom of the island.However, the three options I would most recommend are as follows:1. If you are coming into Manhattan from JFK or LaGuardia airport, and are lucky enough to enter Manhattan through the Midtown Tunnel, you will see the 'Great Wall of Manhattan' shortly before you enter the tunnel. It is especially dramatic at twilight. Manhattan rises like a wall before you - a truly unforgettable vista.2. If you are coming from Newark Airport, regardless of whether you are coming by bus, coach, taxi, Uber or friends, once you pass the Bayonne exit, you will be treated to amazing views on the right side of the car, stretching from the Statue of Liberty to mid-town.3. If already staying in a hotel in Manhattan, the two best options are to take a ferry to Jersey City or the PATH train to Hoboken. Ferries cost around $5 - 8 and the PATH around $2.75. The ferries leave several places on the River Hudson - ask your hotel concierge. Average tsailing times are 10 - 20 minutes. PATH trains go from a number of stations beginning by Macy's at 33rd Street and 5th Avenue (again, any decent map will show you the route and the stations). This goes under the River Hudson: make sure you take the Hoboken and not to Journal Square train - look for the destination on the front of these underground trains). Travel time is around 20 minutes. Either way, simply make your way to the river's edge and enjoy! Evening is a particularly good time, since the sun lights up the glass buildings in golden tones as it sets. Keen student bonus: if you take the PATH train on to Pavonia-Newport instead, as well as the views you'll be at Pavonia-Newport Shopping Mall, and New Jersey sales tax locally are less than a third of Manhattan!
Nice view. I always love to look at the Manhattan skyline, with its lights twinkling. It is colorful, yet in a way calming. The different size buildings like a puzzle.
Always impressive. Whenever I go to Brooklyn or to or from JFK I love watching the Manhattan skyline it never gets old.

A place of pride. It was only in traveling to other cities in the US and foreign countries did I begin to appreciate what an amazing city I grew up in. While recovering in HSS, my bed was beside the window and for 10 days I drew strength from gazing on the skyline from dawn to midnight.
Awesome!. My favorite way to enjoy is by air or taking a stroll across the Brooklyn bridge, The bridge walk is my favorite bring your camera and some walking shoes!!!!!
There is nothing more beautiful*. I can tell you that just being in New York can be overwhelming, but when you take in the sights............OMG one great city to be part of*

Saw from liberty island- excellent!. We went over to liberty & ellis island on a boat trip and the views of the famous skyline from there are unreal! Gives you a new perspective on how big NYC actually is!
One in a million. I gotta give it to you NYC the view from my hotel roof top in the evening was beautiful. It's like no where else.

Everything I thought. Loved it! I know I sound a bit repetitive with this New York City trip on how much I loved everything, but how can you not it's New York City! It brought tears to my eyes. I was so happy to finally be here.
Beautiful. There is no where else in the world with this skyline... It's pretty magnificent! Will definitely be back to make more memories!

Experience the Skyline from the Water. One of the best ways to experience the skyline of New York is to view it from the water. Two easy ways come to mind. One is to take the Staten Island Ferry back and forth. It runs daily on a regular schedule and is free. Spectacular. Another way, more extensive and more close up is to take a Sunset Cruise on the Circle Line. This cruise is about 2 hours and goes from 42nd Street on the West Side on the North River of the Hudson to Upper New York Harbor around the tip of Manhattan and north to the East River of the Hudson and then back to 42nd Street. It combines a view of many of NY's most exciting locations, including the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge. The really neat thing is that you get to see a sunset and then the skyline of New York lighting up. It's breathtaking.
BREATHTAKING!. The skyline is breathtaking! What an amazing view and this was my first time to New York City....it won't be my last!
Beautiful from Brooklyn, Queens and Staten Islan. A great way to see and take photos of the Manhattan skyline. My personal preference is from the Queens waterfront, but others may disagree.
The image of New York. There are many images that define the city of new york but none is as representative as the Manhattan skyline
Wow. Amazing view both during the day and night time. You can't miss it and the different buildings and lights just sparkle. Such a beautiful view
Awesome!. What an amazing view, we saw it from the 102nd floor of the Empire State Building and from the observation floor of the One World building.
Amazing. Great views from the water or the bridges to totally blows you away. Makes you wonder how much is such a small space
Great views. Great views and could not stop taking pictures of the skyline. Low Manhattan skyline views from the river are the best.
Easily recognizable. The skyline view of Manhattan never fails to impress me! We see it often on movies, television shows, and ads. It is always more impressive in person!
Wow! if you get the chance don't miss this. Enjoyed the Manhattan Skyline from a number of different viewpoints, especially walking the Brooklyn Bridge in glorious weather.
NY's top attraction. For us, NY's top attraction is this! Look at it from the street, from Top of the Rock, Empire State, Statin Island Ferry, ... both night and day you are constantly wowed.

Great overview of New York city. My friend and I took the Manhattan Harbor cruise starting at pier 78 which was hop-on and hop- off. We chose to stay on the boat and take in the views-- which took about 90 minutes. Great view of the Statue of Liberty! It was a beautiful day and this was a great way to see the Manhattan skyline. However, we could not hear the commentator -- there were transmitter problems so we missed out on that. But even without the commentary, this was a good buy considering what things cost in NYC. If this is your first day in NYC, I would recommend this cruise so as to get a global perspective of Manhattan. Hopefully you will get to hear the commentary!

Impressive as always!. It never stops to impress me. I used to live in NYC and always loved this skyline. Best viewed at night, from either the Brooklyn side or Hoboken (New Jersey). Recommend to do a helicopter ride, day or night, and a night cruise from Hudson and up East River as offered by several companies. Bring your camera! Have fun :-)

Impressive. We viewed the skyline on our trip to the Statue of Liberty. It was amazing to gradually take in this view as the boat slowly made its way across the bay.

Find a Way to Get a Good View. I still have not visited Ellis Island but I am sure the views are spectacular. My experience is from taking the subway to Brooklyn and getting views from the Park and from walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. Another great way is to take the East River Ferry.
Amazing. . Take a river cruise and just enjoy the splendor that is NYC. Regardless of the weather I reckon it'll be awesome.
