Best view is from Ellis Island. View from Ellis Island of the Manhattan skyline. Better view than the ferries. Not dealing with a moving boat nor other people in the way.

Uniquely Beautiful. The skyline of New York City when viewed from New Jersey across the Hudson River is uniquely beautiful. While visiting for a wedding and have driven to NYC we stayed in New Jersey across the George Washington Bridge. Drove around some of New Jersey and particularly enjoyed to NYC skyline.

Gantastic. You need to see this at night time the lights are amazing
I had seen it during the day on s return trip from jersey gardens but took a taxi ride to see it st night, Cost $30 and worth every cent
Wow. Take the Big Bus nite tour cost 30 dollars takes just over an hour. The sights are unbelievable you go over manhattan bridge and see it all!
cant be beat it. cant beat it till you see it.its so much better in real life.so you got to see it.although its the 1st thing you see on the way into the city cant miss it

Beautiful skyline. Although missing the twin towers the skyline is stunning.
Really good photo opportunity is the boat to Ellis Island and Liberty Island where you get the full view of the shore and skyline

Unforgettable. What a view! We loved Manhattan's Skyline.
For us, it was taken in from the water both during the day and night. We also viewed it from Brooklyn Bridge and enjoyed every moment!

It looks just like in the movies. We didn't think that New York would be that great a tourist attraction for us and just want to use as a stopover. Much to our surprise, we cannot wait to get back there. On the ferry we had the most beautiful view of Manhattan skyline

Nothing beats this view. New York has a skyline like no other... Best seen from the point between Brooklyn bridge and Washington bridge. Sit at Brooklyn bridge park and see this world famous view while the sun sets and you never forget it
Night tour. We took the Big Bus night tour and loved it! Out tour guide was informative and the evening was perfect! The buildings all it up are amazing
from the boat it is mesmerising. take big bus 2 days and ask to give 3 rd day free,,,,this way you can cover half your intersts ,,lowe r manhattan is better.
Beautiful . Beautiful area...place to relax and enjoy the view. There's restaurant around and food trucks in the area.

Weekend in August. Had a weekend in August taking in the sights of NY great views of Manhattan from doing the Statue of Liberty, Top of the Rock and Empire State Building
My lad said you can tell a tourist as they are always looking up
Beautiful. Always a great place to capture a perfect moment. Nice for walks and to just take in the city. If visiting from out of town make sure to stop here!

Love it!. This is one of my favorite cityscape, it has changed since my last visit years back.
Loving the constance change and yet there is a strange sense of continuity.

Iconicly emotive. Best seen from the free Staton Island ferry, the skyline is one of the most iconic views on earth.
It's also one which reflects the abrupt change that can happen when warped ideologies conspire to impose their hate on others.
See it on a sunny day!. Always a good photo. Can be seen from the ferries, from Brooklyn, and many other good spots. Bring good walking shoes and a good camera!

Needs to be seen to fully appreciate. The skline is beautiful. You can see pictures but you really need to experience it to fully apprecite it. My favourite perspective was from a boat but also great views from any of the tall buildings (of which there are many!)

Stunning at Night. "We viewed the skyline on a night time tour to Brooklyn from the top of a double decker bus. It was stunning and one of our favorite memories from our trip. This is a "must do" for your trip itinerary!

Famous for good reason. The Manhattan Skyline is possibly the most recognized skyline in the world- looking at the beautiful mix of old and new buildings, it’s easy to see why. In my opinion, a cruise is the best way to see the skyline without having to travel around the crowded city.

Roberta, Glen & Ella. Amazing, better than I could have ever imagined, memories forever ever. View in the day & night are a must if travelling to New York.
10/10
This is still the center of the world. Take a night tour on any of the open top bus companies around Times Square and get a great view of the Skyline at night from the Manhattan bridge.

From the New Jersey side.. From Liberty Park the skyline was so beautiful and the lines for the Statue of Liberty were not anything like the long waits from Battery Park Go to New Jersey and enjoy the views.

From Lady Liberty. definitely worth the view, be aware however that if you aim to go into the Liberty Statue you must book online before you go - the tickets can not be purchased on the island. having said that the island is worth the trip regardless

No where on earth has a skyline like this!. You can see photos of this and see it in movies but there is nothing like standing afar and viewing it in person. It is a must do if you are visiting the city!
Incredible views. We saw the view from the bus in Brooklyn and from the boat on the boat trip. absolutely stunning. Take the opportunity to see the views from different perspectives
Awesome. Looking at the skyline of Manhattan from the Brooklyn shoreline is a treat at night. It shouldn't be missed.

Unforgettable . One of the most recognizable skylines in the world! It's iconic, breathtaking, irreplaceable.
Make sure your cameras and phones are fully charged and click away!
Skyline. Probably one of the best in the world, no matter from which side, Brooklyn or NJ, and probably even better at night

Beautiful skyline . I must say New York host a beautiful skyline the building are tall and unique. It is lovely in the day but in the evening when all the lights come on it is a wow!! A must see if your staying in New York. I would love to see it with a birds eye view on one of the helicopter rides they do but i didn't want to go alone so I didn't do it I saw it by boat.
Great view great. I just laved it.. I can keep looking at it.. so beautiful.. I saw its beauty when coming back from Statue of liberty island in a ferry...
A little hazy. I have taken a fair few shots from liberty island but alas it was a little hazy but managed a nice view
famous and unsurpassed. You can view the Manhattan skyline for FREE (no need to take an expensive boat ride) from Governor's Island (via ferry), the Hoboken waterfront or the Brooklyn waterfront.
sunset to dark, what a view. The view is very impressive, we were able to catch it from the Bronx rooftop. the colorful sunset gave way to the colors from the lights of the city. very impressive

Beautiful Skyline. This skyline is beautiful and easily recognizable. We got to see this skyline from New Jersey, the Staten Island Ferry and the Top of the Rock observatory. This is likely the most photographed skyline and with good reason.
Awesome view. Great view.... any time of day... preferable in late evening... Mostly you find a young crowd.. so great and must place in your list

New York, New York. The skyline gives you the real feel of NY, we saw it from the Ferry going to and from Ellis Island, walking back across Brooklyn Bridge and from the Water Taxi. Seeing the skyline really makes you realise how the area has developed and how much there is to see and do.

Is there a better skyline?. This speaks for itself. The Manhattan skyline is awesome, breathtaking, and although you feel a familiarity through numerous movies, nothing beats seeing it in reality. Whether you take a trip to Hoboken and view it from the Jersey Shore or by boat from the Hudson and East rivers, the skyline truly stops you in your tracks. If you have the means, take a Liberty helicopter ride and enjoy the 20 minute arial view which is beyond fantastic.
What's not to love. A view of the Manhattan skyline encompasses some of the most iconic buildings on the planet. A must, when visiting NYC...,

Manhattan, Manhattan!!!. The classical view of Manhattan is there for you.You have seen this landscape hundreds or thousands of times but not on "air".It´s wonderful and superb. Take your camera and ready, steady, go...
There's nothing like it!. From so many angles and locations (Highline, Empire State Bldg, Top of the Rock, Hudson Hotel rooftop terrace, etc), and the views of the city are spectacular!
Awesome view. Saw the skyline from the top of the Empire State building at at Rockefeller Square but go the best views from just across in Jersey City boardwalk and on the ferry to Liberty Island.

Amazing view. This is the best way to contemplate the city of Manhattan, New York. A beautiful city with the rivers, buildings. The atmosphere was great, it will be better if you should go at the late afternoon or at night!

Magnificence in Construction. The Manhattan Skyline is a living dream: part and parcel of an ever-expanding reality constructed by engineers and architects, visionaries who have propelled a once ground-bound humanity to the far reaches of imagined possibility. These towers of Manhattan are the towers which stand, built to endure the vicissitudes of time. They are living testaments to the gusto of the American Experiment, our shared commitment to use science and knowledge to bring out the divine spark of creativity in each human individual, and so use this spark to shape and build, aspire and challenge, climbing ever upward, come what may, persevering through any tempests of fear. Though this Skyline, surely, has been assaulted in some tragic ways by those still caught in the nightmares of a superstitious and ancient fear, these towers stand as the protectors and propagators of freedom, architectural manifestations of the iron resolve of our Experiment---ever enduring, ever rising, and ever fulfilling the undaunted beauty and peerless majesty of the American Dream.

Hop on the Staten Island Ferry..... You can't go to NYC and not get a picture of its iconic skyline.The best way to do it (in my opinion) it to jump on the Staten Island Ferry. It's free, and it'll give to the chance to get the perfect picture!
Very beautiful, especially from a cruise. I saw the skyline from a cruise and from a tour bus and it really was a photo worthy moment. Especially nice at sunset from the Brooklyn Bridge.
You don't have to get the ferry. You can see this from Battery Park and from Brooklyn Bridge so you don't have to get a ferry to get a decent photo

A sight to see. I was fortunate enough to appreciate the iconic skyline of New York from both the Hudson Exchange waterfront area in Jersey City during the day, and Top of the Rock after sunset. Both stunning! Wow. A must do on your bucket list. The Big Apple is a very special place indeed.

nice. Old tracks turned into a very lovely ecosystem promenade on the lower to midtown west side NYC . You can enjoy a calm stroll here looking at the buildings around you from a different angle , watch the beautiful panorama of the river ,and have a relaxed beer/coffee and see other locals and tourists enjoying themselves .Come at dusk . It's really nice .While there , take a peep into the neighboring Chelsea Market .

Must do... This is a great way to see the sights and buildings of Chelsea and mid Manhattan with no traffic or traffic lights. This is an old railway track that has been transformed into a walkway and beautified with gardens for everyone to enjoy. A must do while in Manhattan

Nothing So Iconic as the Skyline. We love looking at this skyline. Don't know why. For me, New York is a great place to visit (and visit only). The best place to see this skyline is from the water. The best free ride around to see the skyline is the Staten Island Ferry. If you do nothing else free in this city ride the ferry and see this view.
The most amazing scenery. You feel like you know it, because of all the movies you've seen... but you don't. It's still an astounding view and an amazing feeling when you first spot the skyline.

NYC has so much to offer; lots of variety. You can simply observe people walk by, or be in awe of architectural wonders, or just enjoy the breeze whistling through the leaves. If you look, you will find great beauty. And you don't have to look hard at all.

Superb and mesmerising! . We viewed the lower Manhattan skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge Park, which is right next to the water and right in the center! It's situated West of the Brooklyn Bridge. A great place to photograph the skyline at night. There's a large, square sports arena in the park, surrounded by a walking path, and here there are fences with large square poles where you can place your camera for some still photos at night with long exposure. After taking photos, head East along the walking path towards the Brooklyn Bridge, and you'll find a superb ice cream place which serve a fantastic banana split.

So many ways to see the Manhattan Skyline. Yes, you can pay a fortune, but there are so many ways to see the NYC skyline that are free or cheap. Take the Roosevelt tram for the price of a subway ride and see it from on high, stand on a pier in Brooklyn, or take the Brooklyn or Staten Island ferry and see it from the water. On the NJ side, get a glimpse from along the river (Liberty State Park), look out the window at the Liberty Science Center, or even watch the view from NJ Transit or Amtrak trains. Lots of views from many directions!
Girls weekend Break . No other skyline in the world can beat the New York skyline. Breath taking. A view that you never get tired of seeing and remember from so many films and TV shows.
Picturesque. Amazing view of the skyline at night makes for a perfect photo opportunity. Stay outside for the sunset and you'll be amazed by the dazzling views.

The moment I saw it, I got that "I'm in NYC!" feeling!!. The Manhattan skyline, every time I see it, I either get that feeling of "oh my god, I'm almost in NYC!!!", or I get that sad feeling of leaving the great behind. Either way, the Manhattan skyline is aww-inducing. I feel there are thousands of vantage points. My have either been from New Jersey, from LaGuardia Airport, or in the air, or from the Top of the Rock.

Enjoy Manhattan . Crossing Hudson river by boat to imperial port, the view from the hill is very nice. I want to recommend the night view which is breath taking. There are 250 metal steps to the hill. Good to test your condition. Otherwise you can take bus 165.166 from The Port Authority.
Nearly as good as Liverpool's skyline!. The iconic Manhattan skyline, unmissable and unmistakable. Get yourself in on the photos to prove that you were there.

One of the best sites in the world. One of the best sites in the world and best seen from the Staten Island ferry and cheap way to either see Brooklyn for the day and also take some spectacular pictures of the worlds most famous skyline.
Nice enough walk. Access to the high line is not well posted and a bit hard to find. Nice enough walk but not essential. I enjoyed the walk through Greenwich village at the end much more.
It is an impressive skyline. But probably best appreciated from the water and at night. We did a sunset cruise which took in both but not cheap.
Wow! Every time WOW!. Great view any time of the day, any season... unbelievable sight is from Brooklyn Heights....check it out..and bring a camera... Wow!))

See the skyline by helicopter. We took a helicopter ride to view the Manhattan skyline and would recommend this as a must! We flew around the Statue of Liberty, across to Ellis Island and up the side of the river, amazing experience.
Bucket List Fulfilled. Driving Into NYC & Seeing This Was Absolutely Amazing ! You Feel Like You Are In Another World THe BIG Apple !

One of the best skylines in the world. To see the Manhattan skyline is one of the most exciting, uplifting things to do in New York City. It is so familiar from hundreds of films, but to see it for real is breathtaking. Best seen, for example, from the Staten Island ferry. Not to be missed.

Great view. Manhattan skyline is great site to watch, and capture some amazing with one of the best sky lines in background.
I would recommend a view during sun rise or sun set from Jersey city water front.

Perennial .. You can enjoy the view from a lot of different angles. My favorite is from Weehawken Nj . You can catch it from two different levels and it can be quite romantic. If you can get to the higher level near some houses there is a small area where a couple were able to dine and enjoy the sights. If you are not up for the drive then I like the view from Long Island city . You can get some great shots of the sun setting between the buildings. The view isn't the same since 9/11, but life is about evolution after all. Another way to enjoy it is hop on the Bateaux, or any other dinner cruise. One of my best shots is from the Brooklyn bridge half way.

The best view of the city of New York . The best way to see the skyline is by boat. There are many tour boats that circle the city of New York. You can also go to the top of a few skyscrapers like the Empire state building or Top of the rock for great views or a trip to New Jersey will do the job if you are afraid of heights or not a boat person. Either way, it's something that you have to see.

Manhattan superb skyline. Manhattan skyline is a great view any time of the day, although particularly beautiful at sunset. Identifying the structures is fun and good to gain knowledge of the city itself. We also took great photos from the cruise boat and the plane as we took off.

I always took it for granted till my wife showed me the way. Having lived in NY all my life I avoided most tourist must see landmarks....Always thought yeah one day soon when it's less crowded....My wife who has only been in the US a few years loves America especially historical landmarks.....She insisted on taking me to the top of the Rock at night to see the lighted NYC skyline..Wow.....I advise Anyone living or visiting here to check it out..and bring a camera

What can you say?. I've been to many cities, both in the US and abroad. There is NO city in this world that has a skyline that comes even close to Manhattan. To really appreciate it's majesty, take it in from the NJ side of the Hudson River, easily reached from NYC by the PATH subway line.

A Crystal City At Night. During a recent business trip I once again was amazed at the New York City skyline - especially from a high level floor of one of the high buildings at night. An even better way to see the "crystal city" view is by grabbing the window seat on a night flight in or out of the Big Apple"
Best Postcard. Best in the world! Spectacular, gorgeous, must see.Best way to view this unbelievable sight is from Brooklyn Heights.And when in Brooklyn.... enjoy the best pizza and ice cream.
Incredible!!. New York's famous skyline and iconic sights from the Dumbo/Brooklin side is a must see! If you go to NY, this is a must see, it is just picture perfect.
Excellent and always refreshing!. This is the place you enjoy always , we saw using boat tour and enjoyed and kids even loved it, you don't get bored!

Spectacular at night. I haven't seen a skyline to compare with this. My favourite view was from the free Statton Island Ferry, we left Manhattan just before dusk and returned when it was dark, this gave us a spectacular view, . Our round trip took around an hour and was very enjoyable.

A must see. We took a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge at sunset which in itself was pretty special. We then ate pizza in Brooklyn before walking down to Brooklyn Bridge Pier 1 for a breathtaking view of the Manhattan skyline by night. This is situated right in front of the Brooklyn Icecream Factory.

Looks like a picture. Stayed on the other side of the Hudson ( jersey city) as we stared over to Manhattan it looked just like a picture, it was so unreal. It was also amazing at night when the lights came on, so mesmerising.

One of a kind. This is one of a kind skyline. I love the mixture of old sky scrapers with all the details and stucco and some of the new once which mirror the old buildings. Best to see from a cruise.

Pretty at night. You must try to do this at night.
The skyline with all the lights twinkling in the distance is an extremely pretty sight.

Stunning. Best viewed from trip over Brooklyn bridge or river
Free service on Staten Island Ferry gives you the perfect view and photo opportunity

View it from a boat for a different experience!. We took the hop on hop off boat and they took us under the Brooklyn Bridge, gave us up front views of the Statue of Liberty, and awesome picture taking opportunities on the One World Trade building. They also narrated facts about them as they dropped us off at various locations. A great way to see the skyline and much less walking!
Best to view from Weehawhen. Weehawhen offers amazing views in a free public park area near the Lincoln Tunnel. The views are amazing!

NICE BUILDINGS . New York is a Tall building city. I mean with really high towers and the skyline is amazing. I enjoy watching this fantastic building when I walk or relax at my hotel.Many many pictures.

big city living stunner. You get to appreciate the beauty of NY through this skyline. it makes you think, inspires you and makes you feel like by just being here you've conquered mountains. A definite must see in your lifetime
Feast of eyes. Watch this spectacular view from Jersey City, or Brooklyn. A view to behold. It shows how majestic NYC is.

Take the NYC Water Taxi to achieve and experience several skyline views. $31 for a hop-on/off pass for 24 hours - you will see all of the main sights and get really close up photographs of all of them, as well as an insightful guided tour. Includes Brooklyn Bridge, Wall Street area, Statue of Liberty. See their website. Would highly recommend.
Best at night. Go there after it is dark, you will see a great view of NY. It is the only way to get how huge Manhattan is.

Good from all angles. Looks great from out on the Hudson, out near the Statue of Liberty, on the East River or from Brooklyn. getting a bit further away is better since close up it's too much to take in . The view along 42nd street from out on the Hudson is makes for an amazing concrete canyon.

Iconic and Mesmerising. I viewed it from the Brooklyn promenade from Montague Street to Dumbo on the Brooklyn side. It takes about 30 minutes to walk each way and an extra 30 minutes stopping to take endless pictures. Go at sunset and get pictures in the light walking one way and pictures at night walking back. For some reason it is mesmerising and worth putting high on your wishlist of things to do in NYC.

Must do. You really must take a trip either on a boat or the Staten Island ferry (free) or as we did a night bus trip to see the Manhattan Skyline. It is an iconic view of NYK and is beautiful either by day or stunning by night.
What a view. This is an essential part of the trip to New York. It really needs viewing by day and by night. The night view is breathtakingTry to do both. Wonderful

Awesome. There are so many different places in NYC which offer a great view of Manhattan's skyline. You can see the Downtown skyline very well from the Staten Island Ferry. If you cross the Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge Park offers you view of both Downtown's and Midtown's skyline. A visit to Liberty or Ellis Island also offers you a nice view. There are also a couple of parks in New Jersey by the waterfront which you can visit for nice views of the skyline.

As you would imagine. The iconic Manhattan skyline is something everyone would have already seen without ever visiting New York, but it is necessary to get out of Manhattan in order to look back at the view.We did a guided night excursion/tour with a Spanish speaking company who were hawking for business outside our hotel on 8th Avenue. This was simply because Mrs Mono is Spanish, I speak Spanish and the group was going to be much smaller than the English language tour, and the rep was the least pushy of the lot.Leaving central Manhattan at around 6pm seemed rather early but being December it got dark very early and so we had an interesting ride around the city before heading to Dyker Heights. I'd never hear of this place before, but it is very famous for the extent to which the residents decorate their houses with Christmas lights (and the amount they spend on electricity to keep them illuminated!). It was very beautiful, but started to snow, so the 30-40mins we were given out of the minibus to explore and take photos was a bit excessive under the circumstances.We then went to Brooklyn Heights where we parked and went to view the skyline from the opposite shore. Everything was illuminated as you can imagine and it was pretty spectacular - even for a sceptic.There is also another good view from Long Island City which we also did during the daytime, but this involves a short train/subway ride from Grand Central (or maybe other stations) which provides another perspective, this time including the UN building.

Skyline. Get a great view of Manhattan's skyline on one of the best free things to do in NY; riding the Staten Island Ferry. Have your cameras ready as you leave the dock and/to return from Staten Island.
Salim . I had taken the helicopter ride which takes you around. What a spectacular view you get if The Manhatten skyline. Specially when the helicopter gets closer from the sea.
impressive. Very magic view. As well as during the day and at night. The best view is from Brooklyn. You can walk through Brooklyn Bridge 30 min.

The amazing Manhattan Skyline. The best way to really appreciate the Manhattan skyline is either from a boat traveling towards Manhattan or from the Brooklyn shore line. Did both of the and I think the boat sailing towards Manhattan is an amazing view.

Manhattan's skyline - a world famous must see. There are so many different places in NYC which offer a great view of Manhattan's skyline. You can see the Downtown skyline very well from the Staten Island Ferry. If you cross the Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge Park offers you view of both Downtown's and Midtown's skyline. A visit to Liberty or Ellis Island also offers you a nice view. There are also a couple of parks in New Jersey by the waterfront which you can visit for nice views of the skyline.
Best view ever!. I loved this view of NY, you see the inmensity of the city while having a relaxing walk. It is a MUST in the 1st visit to NY.
My first look at the skyline was a ripper.. Nothing prepares you for that first expansive view ...coming into the apple early misty morning in mid June from Jersey....breathtaking in a hue of blue.

Terrific Mid Town Manhattan Views. This is a very easy and safe thing to do. Take the 7 train from Grand Central or even Times Square to Jackson Vernon subway stop (1 stop from Grand Central). Now you are in Queens. Walk to 48th Ave and turn left and head toward the East River. Terrific views of mid town Manhattan. The UN building will be directly across from you. Many movies and tv shows are filmed in this area. Great walking areas. Lots of restaurants in the area especially on Vernon Boulevard.

Great to see even from Verrazano Bridge, day or night. The skyline is incomparable, even from the distance of this stately bridge at the mouth of NY harbor. It's great day or night, with or without clouds.

4th of July 2016 firework, unbelivable. There are many ways, but one of the most impressful is by boat on 4th of July to see the fireworks (New Jersey and NYC) amazing - and if it not 4th of July perfect pictures from Staten Island Ferry (for free)

Nothing Else Like It. There are many wonderful vantage points. I took a boat to the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island from Battery Park as well as a ride on The Beast (a high-action boat ride that heads that way) and a tour on Circle Tours. All afford great views of the skyline. My favorite vantage point had to be riding a tour bus over the Manhattan Bridge to and from Brooklyn - but the trip back was after dark. Awesome.

Uniquely Magnificent. Best seen from the water (see my review of the Staten Island Ferry) this skyline is one of a kind. Best seen on a bright day, or late in the evening with all the lights, you will see for real what you've seen in films.

Planes, Trains and Boat. We got three different views of the Skyline being on the left side of the plane as we flew into EWR. On the train ride from EWR and with TriBeCa Sailing (and this was the most spectacular view as we were up close and personal from the Hudson. Simply awesome and inspiring; one of the great views of one of the greatest cities in US.Enjoy your view of the overwhelming and inspiring Manhattan Skyline!

Great view. We took the underground to Clarke Street station in Brooklyn. And walked to Brooklyn heights from there. It was a very wet day when we went so it was quite dismal. The view however was fantastic. I here, if you go at sunset, you get some fantastic photographs.
Spectacular. Amazing site , the skyline of NY. Best view is from NJ side looking East. Best seen from Weehawken north until North Bergen.

The best in the world. Instantly recognisable and beautiful always. So many different vantage points for you to find your personal favourite. Statten Island Ferry gives fantastic panoramas and a walk across the Brooklyn bridge is similarly rewarded. Gorgeous both day and night.

Consider a subway ride to High Street stop in Brooklyn and walk the BBridge towards Manhattan. Probably a realistic 45-60 minute walk to enjoy leisurely pace with photos. Take bottled water or purchase on bridge.
Spectacular and unforgettable views.. It is a sight not to be missed so much that is free when viewed from the Staten Island Ferry and Brooklyn (Dumbo) either by day or night.

Iconic skyline. The Manhattan skyline is a must see for every visitor to New York. You can see it from all sides. See the front view from a boat, from Brooklyn at sunset or for the morning fresh, from New Jersey at Sunrise. Bring a camera where ever you go. I saw it from all sides, also from behind from the Empire State Building.

Best view. Ive been to NYC many times however never caught the ferry over to see the full skyline behind me. I managed to on my last visit and my oh my it was fantastic! I love Manhattan just for this view alone.
Wow. The best way to see the skyline is on one of the cruises. For a panoramic view New Jersey is the place to go. We drove down to Hoboken for a great nighttime view of the skyline.

The Night Skyline will blow you away!. The skyline is amazing but when you also see it at night will take your breath away.If you are lucky enough to be in the upper floors plan to spend a long time absorbing the site!

Very interesting to see. When viewed especially from the Brooklyn Heights promenade the Manhattan skyline is an impressive sight indeed. Early morning just a few hours after sunrise and in the evening when the lights are on you can get great views. Definitely a NYC must-see.
stunning especially at night. i live in the middle of the country and i didnt expect to fall in love with busy New York but i did because it is so beautiful. you must see it at night, it is stunning

Wonderful. A fantastic sight from many different places
My favourites are Brooklyn Park, Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island ferry and last but by no means least, Liberty park New Jersey. This gives a wonderful view of the Statue of Liberty

Statue of Liberty Circle Line Cruise. The Liberty Circle Line cruise is a great affordable way to see the Manhattan skyline, New Jersey, & lady liberty herself in little more than an hour (which is all you need and great for loaded itineraries). The boats are large, clean, and well organized. Plenty of pic opportunities for all aboard. Bring sunscreen during the day! The boats of air-conditioned inside seating, but you will spend most your time on the deck with no shade taking in the view.

Take the ferry to staten island!. The best views of the manhattan skyline, in my opinion, are for free. I would recommend either these two options: a) take the ferry to staten island, which is a public free transport, you will see the skyline from the south view. It's nice if you take it in the afternoon with the sunset, and you take the next to come back in the night. b) from roosevelt island. You can take the tramway and enjoy the views of the chrysler and other skyscrappers while crossing the east river

Quite simply breathtaking.. The view of the skyline is very special now owing to the building and completion of World Trade One. It shows the city is recovering from the catastrophic events in 2001. To get the best views either go to Brooklyn or take a trip on the water.

Take the Circle Line!. So cool. I live one state over and I always wanted to see the NYC skyline from the water. We took the Circle Line from the Hudson River on the westside. Couple hours later, we have seen SO much. The Intrepid, Statue of Liberty, all the docks & history, the Freedom Tower and that famous pic of the skyscrapers from the water viewpoint. Around and up the East River, interesting factories, the UN, South street seaport, under the GW bridge, Brooklyn bridge and so on. Then return.Comfortable seating, snacks, great narrative and history.Very exciting experience to see it all!
Very Impressive. We found the best view of the skyline to be from the boat that goes to Liberty Island and Ellis Island.
Incredible. Awesome skyline from many different places. My favorites from DUMBO, Jersey Gardens or Smogarsburg. Also from the Roosevelt Island!
Beautiful.. We stayed in Hyatt Regency Jersey side. It is a must to enjoy the views. Both views (day and night) are awesome. Must visit.

I like seeing the Manhattan skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. It is challenging to get to view the skyline from Manhattan. I like seeing the view from the Staten Island ferry. As a commuter for 14 years I never tired of the beauty of this view. The commute yes but not the view.
Amazing views!. Saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. The park is free and has an amazing view of the harbor. There is also a yummy ice cream place close by!

Daughter's Birthday. It is a hidden gem. It makes for a nice walk the High Line changes as the day changes night, the Manhattan skyline at night looking up the Avenues is unbelievable. The setting sunset on the water is beautiful.

a must see. Best way to see the manhatten skyline is to take the Staten Island Ferry which is free and takes about 30 min each way. For someone coming from a country with very few tall buildings it's a great sight!

Tips for the best ways to see it. OK, so you are visiting NYC and want to be able to best see the skyline. Obviously if you are actually in Manhattan (one of the 5 boroughs of NYC) you cannot see the Manhattan skyline. You need to be someplace else. Viewing Manhattan from the north is not the best. Viewing from the south is pretty cool, as well as from the east or west. If the day is clear you can see it from as far away as Nassau County on LOng Island, but obviously only the tallest buildings such as the Empire State Building and the Freedom Tower. You want a view that will 1.) allow you to view the skyline from several different viewpoints 2.) be close enough to see many buildings and 3.) allow you to stop and see it, not rush past it (like in a car on a roadway in Brooklyn)My first suggestion is do a boatride. The circle line is great for casual viewing with a narrated view. There are several options depending on how long you want to be on the water. We did the half island tour, which allows you to view the most popular skyline views (midtown going south to battery park) but you can also opt for a longer tour that goes all the way north to the Bronx. There are clipper ships that do a tour of the harbor around the statue of liberty and southern Manhattan that are also great (all outside, though, so if in need of shelter from sun or rain this is not the best option). Many people say the Staten Island Taxi (free) is the best, but we felt it was way too crowded to be able to get a good view without feeling like cattle. Also, the ferry to the statue of liberty provides a nice view of southern Manhattan. If opting to see it from New Jersey, Liberty State Park is nice. If opting to see it from Brooklyn, the Brooklyn Bridge park is great. And if you can walk across the Brooklyn Bridge (early on a weekend morning is best as this route gets VERY crowded) you will have a gorgeous view of the Manhattan skyline and you can take pics at your leisure. I mentioned that you can't see the skyline from Manhattan, but that doesn't mean you can't see parts of it, or buildings from Manhattan. The Freedom Tower (I have yet to do), the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center all provide great ways to get an amazing view. Our favorite is top of the rock, as the lines are much shorter than the Empire State building and the space is larger. It also provides a great view of not only Manhattan buildings (like the Empire State building, Chrysler Building and Freedom Tower) but also of Central Park, which is pretty cool from this vantage point.

If you like skyscrapers - this is a must see. The NYC skyline is ever changing. Even with certain permanent anchor points - such as the MetLife building or the Citibank building etc., there are always new additions. It was great seeing the One World tower standing tall among the other mighty buildings.
Big!. No end to skyscrapers and looks just like it does in the movies! Easiest to see from a CityLine boat tour. Awesome at night!

A lovely view dear. by any stretch of the imagination the site of the Manhattan skyline is worth the visit to New York alone. It's great fun to stand and try to pick out all the places to visit from Brooklyn

Magnificent Skyline!. There is no other skyline that can compare to the Manhattan Skyline and it's always changing! With that water view and those tall buildings, it just breathtaking!

Manhattan Skyline from the Top of the Rock. What a view of NYC from Top of the Rock - a must see! It's a beautiful view of NYC. You can see beautiful buildings and a wonderful view of Central Park.

Amazing sight. For high rise view do Rockerfeller centre from the restaurant/bar on the 68th floor - a drink here is chapter than the cost of going 1 floor up!

Lower Manhattan Skyline View. During a recent visit back home to Northern New Jersey, I decided to get some photos of Manhattan from the Jersey side...I decided on this trip I'd try from Liberty State Park, and capture Lower Manhattan at sunset..!!! What an exhilarating time..!!! Got there, maybe, 45 minutes to an hour before sunset..So, had ample time to scout around for best vantage points..! Sun started setting and you not only see the City turning from day to dusk to night, but you can feel it..!! I had a grand time just photographing and didn't want to leave, but the Park Rangers ride thu in their cars and on loudspeaker tell you it's time to go..! I could have photographed for at least another hour or so..But, that's the photographer in me...! Lol..! But, a definite to go to location...! Enjoy the views, some tranquility and peace! I did..! I wonder what it's like at sunrise...? I bet just as exhilarating, peaceful and tranquil...!
Breath-taking . At any time of day, this beautiful skyline can be admired to its full potential. I could never get bored of drinking in this breath-taking view.

The closer the better for viewing perspectives - if you're really, really interested in a great view then make the schlep over to Weehauken and stand on the cliff park and take a look from there.

Impressive sight. There are several locations/possibilities to view the Manhattan skyline. Personally I find the best view to be from Brooklyn Park. Take the subway to Brooklyn and walk down to Brooklyn Park and walk around to find the perfect angle. This will give you a closer and more "undisturbed" view of the famous skyline. Whichever option/location you choose, you cannot visit New York City without viewing the skyline from a distance.

The Best View of the Iconic Skyeline. Obviously there are so many different spots to view the Manhattan Skyline from and many digging angles to view it from- however, my personal favourite view of the skyline is from JFK Boulevard (and surrounding parks etc) on the New Jersey side of the river.From here you can see from the Freedom Tower in Downtown Manhattan all the way through midtown with the Empire State and up to the uptown area. Getting here is so simple - the NJ Transit bus runs regularly from the Port Authority Bus Terminal and only costs $3.50 and will take you to Boulevard East - whether it's during the day or after dark, the view is breathtaking as soon as you step of the bus and take in the view.After taking in the view, you may want to take the ferry back across to the city (it only takes ten minutes) which provides more panoramic views of the city from a different angle.

The NYC Skyline is gorgeous!. While I am a bit prejudiced and realize that many big cities have beautiful skylines, it is certainly a unique sight to see the Freedom Tower (on the grounds of the World Trade Center), the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building and others from across the river in Brooklyn or New Jersey. It is quite breathtaking. It is a particular attraction to visitors from smaller cities. I strongly suggest seeing the NYC skyline from those vantage points across the river before going to the Observation Decks on either of the two tallest buildings. It will give you two different and unique perspectives: Looking in from the outside and looking out from the inside.

There is nothing like it!. To see the Skyline in its entirety take one of the ferry cruises. If you purchase the hop on hop off city bus this can include the ferry fare so check before you buy. We also enjoyed the view of the skyline from Brooklyn Bridge so would recommend you walk along that too as so enjoyable.

Escape from the bustle. This recently extended walking trail gives a different perspective on Manhattan. With a number of sculptures and paintings along the way, together with small market-type stalls, this was an unexpected view of the city.
A view from The Hudson. Fabulous view from the boat trip we took. A view we have seen on numerous Movies and T.V shows. Awesome!
See it from a distance. Air-conditioned Circle Line Tour was a great respite from the scorching heat. Drinks and snacks on board plus narrative about what you are seeing.

big lake beside the city. i never see the place like this before. i dare say that is place have lager lake beside the city , just like the beach in the city. well you should come if you get a chance.
see you

Gorgeous view. The Manhattan skyline is one of a kind. We had beautiful views from the ferry, Statue of Liberty island, the Brooklyn Bridge at night, Empire State Building at night and the new One World Trade Center.
Simply amazing. What more can be said? The best in the states. The opportunity to have the green park in front of you provides beautiful contact to the towering buildings.

Nothing like it in the world.... it is just mesmerizing to look at, especially from places in Jersey like Hoboken. It reeks of history and industry, some lost and some still there. Many dreams and lives came and went. I love it.
Scary. Nice scenery, you can see buildings from miles end, if your scared of height don't travel that way, just a bucket list thing.

Floating above the heat. What better place to spend an hour than wandering through the grasses and other prairie plants of the New York Skyline. You are literally floating over the city - very important on a sweltering July day. Lots of others with the same idea but good for people watching and feeling you are part of the New York scene. Definitely recommend.
Breath Taking Views. Wonderful from the open top tour night bus also from the river cruise. a wonderful place to see at night and during the day.
Lovely. There nothing better than this wiev, at sunset time or evenlaer this magic metropoli leaves you breathless

Best view is from Statue of Liberty. This is truly a sight to see. The one you only get to see in posters & movies. Best place to see it is from Statue of Liberty. We only got to see it during the day but I'm sure it's even more breathtaking at night. I love visiting NY but now that I have children, I don't think I can live there but always enjoyed visiting it.
Beautiful!!. The perfect skyline!!I loooooove it!!Take the Staten Island ferry (free!) and you'll have a nice trip with the greatest view!
Staten Island Ferry. Great view of the Skyline at no cost, a definite must-see. Staten Island has much more to offer, so don't go back tto the city on the next Ferry!
Beautiful. The skyline is unique in the world. The viewpoint may vary but you will still be impressed day and night. My preference is around Central Park area.

Quite a Sight. This is one sight that never fails to impress. Photos and movies do it no justice. Be it by ferry, boat tour our helicopter it is quite spectacular. I prefer the perspective from the New Jersey side. Take the ferry for $6 each way from the World Financial Center to Paulus Hook in Jersey City. It's the perfect way to see the mass of buildings that make up the Manhattan skyline. Grap a cup of coffee or beer and a snack and sit on the patio and watch the Big Apple do its thing.
Cross Over. Best viewed by taking the ferry to Jersey City Piers. Inexpensive, fun and short trip offered regularly.

Quite a sight!!!. Nothing is more beautiful than the Manhattan skyline. Simply beautiful! There are a number of ways to view the skyline. The ferry taking you to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the Staten Island Ferry and many other ways. I am in awe of it each time I see it. Especially beautiful at night.
Breathtaking.... It was cool to see my children's reaction as we first caught sight of the Manhattan skyline on our way to NYC. It really is breathtaking!

Doesn't disappoint!. Probably the most recognisable skyline in the world. Absolutely spectacular.
Best seen from a boat or the Top of the Rock!
Awesome.
Helicopter Expetience. Wow, this is a must, 15 minutes of a great experience travelling up the Hudson River viewing the buildings from above. Great picture opportunities and memories to be savoured

Beautiful, classic skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is a symbol of New York, and one that definitely cannot be missed. Whether you go on a harbor cruise, Top of the Rock , or the Empire State Building, the view is amazing. I did Top of the Rock and a Statue Cruise. Don't forget to take lots of photos! It's especially pretty at night, when all the buildings are lit up, and at sunset/sunrise.
Quite a skyline. It really is quite impressive seeing all those skyscrapers. We were fortunate to have clear weather so we had quite a great line of visibility.

The View of New York. The view of New York is spectactular which ever way you look at it. We chose to take a tour around the island with the Circle Line which was great as we could take in Manhattan from every angle. So many pictures to enjoy, and worth a trip just in itself whether off the island or just floating around it.
Never fails to amaze. Manhattan skyline is always breathtaking - take your camera with you and enjoy your day! It's an unforgettable experience
Statton Island Ferry. We went on the Statton Island Ferry (it's free!!) and you get fabulous views of the Manhattan skyline and the Statue of Liberty we loved it!

An Iconic Skyline. Seeing the Skyline of Manhattan does make your heart flutter. Its an iconic skyline that most people would know. I liked seeing it from various places but like most, Staten Island was one of my favourites. Its nice to go at dusk, seeing the buildings light up. Its picturesque and certainly a view to remember.
Lovely old subway line converted for citizens and tourist delight. Love the amazing walk. Do check out the creepy old bald guy lifelike sculpture. The cool breeze hudson breeze make it a delight.

It's a great view. Lovely view of the island from Staten, and it's the place to stay if you are in New York!
My teenage son was really keen on spotting get the various famous buildings so it creates a little fun!

Very impressive. New York skyline spectacular, doesn't matter if you see it from a river cruise on the Hudson or from high above the Empire State. My favourite building is definitely the Chrysler Building, such a great art nouveau design and the building is visible from all over NY.

Always awesome!. New York City is probably my favorite destination in all over the world. Its skyline is really awesome at any season! Whenever coming from JFK airport, it is almost impossible to describe how touched one gets as soon as he spots the very first glimpses of "Manhattan Skyline". Iconic, majestic, impressive, beautiful, or simply stunning! Enjoy!

Great for pictures and sunsets!. The best view is from the Staten Island Ferry. It's absolutely gorgeous.
You also get a great view of the Statue of Liberty when you are near the skyline.

Fabulous Views at Night and Feom the Rivers. You have some choices here to take in the Manhattan skyline. You can see if from New Jersey, from a boat tour or a bus tour. The bus tour we took was at night and we were driven over the Manhattan beige which offered a wonderful view of the city lit up! You can also go up to different observations decks around the city to see the skyline from above. We saw it above from the observation deck in the World Trade Center Observarory. All views are breath taking and you won't be disappointed in any view you decide upon.
Easy sightseeing. very enjoyable relaxing cruise which is complete with a very knowledgeable guide. A very worthwhile trip
So many buildings. Seen it on the tv, but to see it for real is surreal. So many buildings compacted into a small area. Seen it from the air, boat and a open top bus.

Nothing like it. As a long islander I see the skyline several times a year, either going into or through the city. Every time I see it I'm impressed and proud to be a New Yorker. There are buildings of varied age, height and style. Those to impress with girth and those of beauty. But like the city and her people themselves, the skyline is a living, changing work of art. So I suggest you find a few different perspectives and soak it in. Find a favorite building, bridge, view point. ..etc. I happen to like the Manhattan bridge and the Chrysler building, at first thought.  But it you have the time, check out Lincoln Center, the chandeliers of the MET (opera house), Carnegie Hall and of course the top of the Empire state building.
Modern sightseeing. We took a helicopter with our two teens to help us though the NY sightseeing. The tour was fantastic and one of the highlights of our NY trip. Unforgettable.

New York, New York... I want to wake up in a city that never sleeps. Love the city skyline. Plus it is free. The best place to view is in Brooklyn Heights! Or on the Staten Island ferry for a free ride. But if you have the money a boat ride and get a commentary of the buildings.
lovely views. New York skyline is one of the best views of any city I have seen both during the day and at night and its free

Spectacular skyline in the daytime and at night. This most certainly is one of the world's most interesting skylines. It is outstanding at night with all of the lights but is also impressive during the day. One good perspective from which to view it is the roof top of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Bring your camera!

Interesting perspective of NYC. The NYC skyline is iconic, and a good view of it helps you realize you are in this amazing city. We got great views from the ferry that goes to NYC from NJ where we stayed in a hotel.

Best times is in spring or in fall - definitely NOT in summer or in winter!. IIn 1985, after my studies at a German Technical University I travelled to NY CIty. I had got a training as a stock, options and commodities broker at a Wall Street brokerage house. The final training and the brokerage exam was in NY CIty, I lived half a year in a hotel near to Grand Central Station and I enjoyed to visit a lot of interesting places in NY City.I can strongly recommend you to visit NY City in spring or in fall, but definitely NOT in summer (extremely hot and humid), and NOT in winter (very cold). Visit the Manhattan Skyline; it is definitely worth to visit it! You won't regret it.
Never fails to wow!. Best viewed from New Jersey across the Hudson - take the PATH to Paulus Hook, have lunch and sit and watch the view

Many Places to view this incredible skyline. . One of the best spots is the Brooklyn side of the Brooklyn Bridge. Stop by either Grimaldi's or Julianna's for some of the best pizza in NYC. They are next to each other under the Brooklyn Bridge

I love New York. The Manhattan Skyline is so picturesque! There are so many ways you can capture great moments/memories during your stay in New York. The best views are from the New Jersey side of town.
Eye catching.. Beautiful view of New York Skyline. If youre a fan of skylines and beauty, must see at night. This place wont disappoint you.
Wow. We took a river cruise and viewed the Manhattan skyline at night. It was pretty awesome and you will re-live the experience every time you see the skyline on TV or in a film. Iconic!

Gotta See!. This is the most amazingly iconic city skyline that exists. Do the boat tour, go across to Brooklyn or Jersey City, go up a tall building, or get a helicopter but if you are in New York City see the skyline!
Iconic Skyline. Having travelled all over the world, NYC has to have the most iconic skyline of any city in the world. it's always an impressive sight to behold and always makes me want to return.

WOW!. Yes--we've all seen the Manhattan Skyline a zillion times through television but nothing can prepare with seeing it in person! Whether by day or night, its truly impressive! Here's a tip: We took the FREE Staten Island Ferry in the evening and were able to view the skyline and the Statue of Liberty all lit up. Breathtaking! It takes about an hour to travel back and forth but is worth your time. We arrived on Staten Island and immediately boarded the return ferry to Manhattan.

Magnificent view!. Visited the location with my friend..Beautiful skyline covering all the great buildings of New York. Worth the visit. It was raining when we visited the place but it was worth the visit,

Amazing, a dream!. We were lucky enough to see this from our plane, it was jaw dropping just what I had dreamed of. Then you also get to see part of it from Statue of Liberty ferry, Staten Island ferry and the Ferry which takes you all around Manhattan Island.
Worth seeing. The skyline is every bit as beautiful as you have seen your entire life in TV shows and movies. Seeing from one of the many observatories high in the sky around Manhattan is a must.

what can I say, the empire city. this is the product of what a nation can do being an ruthless empire with the entire world. I mean, its enormous, so much money goes through here. still indeed a skyline that will raise eyebrows.

New York City at its Finest!. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the must see experiences to have while you are in New York City. My favorite view is from the Promenade across the river in Brooklyn Heights. Of course you can see different parts of the Manhattan Skyline from New Jersey and Long Island City and other areas as well. However, if you want to get the real affect of seeing and living in Manhattan, the view from Brooklyn, whether from the Promenade or from the newly created Brooklyn Park, is the best place to go. It's almost unbelievable to accept the fact that so many fantastic buildings and landmarks could fit in one place.

Where you wait in line to walk. I don't think the skyline is high enough to get great views of the city however if you plan to lay out on one of the deck chairs it can be a nice break from the hustle and bustle of the city. It gets quite crowded so you're mainly seeing people's backs while you wait to walk.
The first sight!. The first sight of the skyline you know where you are! ... You can point out and name the important buildings! It's one of life's wow moments!! ...You got to love NYC!!

Simply stunning!. New York is everything you expect of it and more, that includes the skyline. It is iconic regardless of whether you are viewing it from the top of the Rockafella centre or from Brooklyn Bridge. Simply stunning!

THE BEST. No one can beat this city skyline.
New York has it all.
This is the original big city. All others try, but don't quite make it!

Simply Mesmerizing and Breathtaking!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. There are not enough words to describe how beautiful the Manhattan Skyline is. It is simply impressive to see so many tall buildings lined up in a way you get to have the most beautiful pictures. The best spots to get the best pictures are the East River Ferry or the Statue of Liberty Ferry. You can also get cool pictures from Gantry State Park or Hunters Point South Park, but they will not be as good as the two previous spots. Look at my pictures.
New York Skyline. Blue Sky sometimes cloudy ,Many Skyscrapers, scenic ,in a friendly area, Part of New York City.In the Downtown area of New York

Not to be missed!. Weather-permitting, this is a perfect thing to do in New York City. My husband, friend and I were on the "Statue of Liberty & Skyline Schooner Sightseeing Cruise" at 3:45 PM on Friday, 6/17/16. There was plenty of seating and the young crew was great! Even if you've been to New York countless times, there's nothing like seeing the Statue of Liberty and skyline while sailing by with the cool breeze. We were able to easily switch seats from side to side on the benches. I tend to get seasick easily, but was fine. The crew served drinks (all you want) throughout the cruise. Thankfully, there was no narration, recorded or live. Reservations are needed, as I understand that many of the cruises sell out early. I'd go again -- probably for a champagne sunset cruise that my friend said is spectacular!
LOVE The Skylines!. I always wonder why its so much cheaper to live in NJ when the views are so spectacular! Some great restaurants along the waterfront with stunning views.

Amazing scenic view. I always love to watch this image of the scrapers-skyline from, especially, two sides: From the Water street area, where the RIver Cafe is (in Broolyn), where there is a nice area to rest for a while over the river, and take some beautiful pictures of both the city skyline, and the Broollyn Bridge just aside...And also from the Staten Island Ferry, that takes you round trip from Whitehall St. to Staten Island, the skyline view is amazing. Also the view of the Liberty Statue is close and beautiful.And the best is that this city service is for free!

Another must see at sunrise or sunset!. Go over the Brooklyn Bridge from lower Manhattan & find Brooklyn Park where you can water to the water's edge and take in one of the most awesome sights at sunrise or sunset! Bring a bottle of wine & a snack and just take it all in. If you're a photog, this is a requisite visit!!

The most spectacular way to see New York City skyline is to take a boat ride around Manhattan.. I'm a native New Yorker. One thing I do for out of town guests whenever possible is to take them on a boat cruise around Manhattan. This trip always is a highlight of anyone's visit. The skyline vistas are simply incredible, both on the East River and up the Hudson. And cruising over to the Statue of Liberty is always inspiring. While I take my visitors in my own boat, the Circle Line cruises are a terrific way to do it. Plus, you get the guide's commentary along the way. Simply put, there's no other skyline like New York's, though what's up with those new needle-like mid block towers? Ugh!

So classic, so ever-changing!. I simply love the pulse in this city! The skyline is cool from West, South and East, from One World Observatory, from Empire State Building and from Top of the Rock. I wonder if I will live to see when skyscrapers merge Midtown and Downtown?
Got to be seen.. Amazing views from above from one of NYC famous tall buildings or ground level on the SIF, which is my favourite.
the reason. One of the reasons you want to go to New York is the skyline. Just to watch from a far the skyscrapers and the line of the it is a whole visit.

Stunning . I felt as if I was looking at a photograph or was watching a film. Something magical about the skyline! So many places to view it from. Brooklyn is probably best (book a nighttime bus tour) or a boat cruise.

Day or night - attention-getting!. We saw this view both during the day as we moved toward the city from the airport. We saw it again on a night Big Bus Tour - attention-getting. The skyline hints at the sea of humanity that moves through this bustling city.

Still gives a tingle. It's changed over the years sadly. But still recognisable for its iconic skyscrapers and now includes the Freedom Tower. Takes on a whole new look at night with the Empire State often lit in red white and blue. A great view is from the lower east side travelling north past Long Island en route to Stamford.

One of the best sights you'll ever see!!!. What can I say that hasn't already been said before of the world famous new york city skyline.... This is truly one of the best sights you'll ever see in terms of urban views. The first concrete jungle and arguably the best city in the whole world. The best views are on the jersey side. You can go to the Hoboken, Newport or the Paulus Hook areas in jersey city. And also the liberty state park is probably the best place to see the whole downtown skyline.
What;s to say? There's a lot of it.. So many varying views and places to see it from. An amazing variety, not just the famous downtown and midtown views, but smaller, interesting details everywhere.
Good view from the Brooklyn Bridge. You don't have to walk over the whole bridge, you can just walk halfway, turn back see the skyline and head home.

so lovely. saw from water hop on hop off ticket that we got on south of the Brooklyn bridge and went past the statue of Liberty and go off pier 78 near the high line trail. and saw in the sunset on night tour of graylings hop on hop off bus. Sunset is best!
Great pics!!. We went over to liberty island and took some fantastic pics of the skyline it's so huge it doesn't seem real. Loved it!!

Nothing quite like it anywhere else. The best place to see the skyline is from the Ellis island ($18) or Stratton island ferry. The Stratton island one is free (orange ones).
The other place to go is the Brooklyn bridge on foot or bike.
Go in the afternoon for the Ellis island side to get the best light.
Sky line. Great to view from the Satin island ferry which is absolutely free to travel on.Great chance to get got photos.Have a beer on Statin island then come back all free of charge
spectacular. we saw this when we first arrived in new york and its really marvellous all those lovel buildings climbing up to the saky wow its good

Just love it. Breathtaking and amazing. I loved it! We took an helicopter ride over Manhattan and got to enjoy it fully. We also had great views when walking over Brooklyn Bridge and enjoying an ice cream at the Brooklyn Ice cream factory.
It lives up to it reputation. It gives you such a sense of the depth and variety that New York has to offer. It is a city where you can find so much to do and enjoy.

Great walk, great views. Nice way to have great views of the city. You can get up and down, and do some shopping or have a nice coffee or food while you walk.
It is a great way to see different type of architecture and take pictures.

Our hotel had a great view. The architecture and skyline by boat, walking or from your hotel room if lucky enough is just stunning. The sun sets and eveningtime is especially nice at a rooftop vantage point.
stunning views. It's hard not to stop and stare just to take in the skyline when you're in town. Absolutely beautiful and with constant construction, it's always changing.
None Like It!. Truly an amazing view of a great city. The skyline is an awesome in the multiplicity of it's many buildings. Dare to venture into the monstrosity of these giant buildings.

Different angles, great views. If you love photography or if you take pictures with your iPhone, I'd say there are three excellent spots to photograph Manhattan skyline: from Long Island City Piers (Queens), from Hoboken (New Jersey), and from Brooklyn Heights Promenade (Brooklyn). My favorite spot is LIC Piers. Watching the sunset from that spot is something.

Railway in the sky.. A good place to relax above the hustle and bustle of the streets but still be within touching distance. With lots of flora and fauna and the odd art sculptures. It is also wheelchair friendly .

Nothing Like It. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the modern wonders of the world. For my money there are two perfect places to view it from. The first is either from the Chart House in Weehawken or the Ferry which also leaves from Weehawken. The second is during a flight landing at Newark. The Skyline evokes an expanse of memories and emotions for me, having witnessed the post 9/11 aftermath from my hotel in Secaucus, the Tribute in Lights six months later as the City recovered and today with the addition of the Freedom Tower. The Empire State Building, with all of the different color combinations, commemorating holidays and sports teams, add an occasional change to this magnificent view. And the Chrysler Building, in my opinion, is the most majestic of all.
Surprise. Nice place to walk and relax, a lot of interesting views, very informative. A lot of exits to the street level.

Outstanding day or night. The view from the Empire State Building was great. The day was clear and sunny and we were able to look at the city from the observatory all around. The 4th of July fireworks also left us awed and amazed. They use color on the Empire State Building to make it stand out at night. Beautiful!
In a word, wow!. Driving down from JFK, your first glimpse of the Manhattan skyline is awe inspiring. Don't take my word for it, go visit NYC!

Iconic skyline. This iconic skyline has been featured in countless films...very exciting to see it in person!Excellent views from the water, whether from Battery Park or while riding the boat to Liberty Island /Ellis Island, or from the Staten Island ferry, or by foot while traversing the Brooklyn Bridge.
Amazing Manhattan at night. We cruise last July 4 to see the Macy's fireworks and we passed by the jersey city and manhattan. I was really amazed by the beauty of manhattan at night.

One word.. Awesome!. We've been coming to New York City every 10 years. First, just the two of us in 1996 for my 40th Birthday, then in 2006 I couldn't think of anything that could top it, so I did it again for my 50th. (with our 9 year old son). Guess what?.. I've just got back from the third visit for my 60th (with our 19 year old!) It's just as good as ever... and boy did we do everything!!.. fantastic, superb, happening, vibrant.. see y'all in 10 years!

loved this city. i have taken a lot of photos of the skyline, fantastic city i have come home with loads of memories and i cant wait to come back again, i was lucky to have fantastic weather which made the trip even better
Finding Netherland. Play is closing in August. It was wonderful. A real NY Broadway production What great actin, special effects and touching story I'd highly recommend it
An amazing 4th July. Looking over the whole city late in the evening while watchig the 4th July fireworks display....was amazing. Had a great time, and this was a very special night.
Lovely photo oportunites. We saw the Manhattan skyline as we landed at JFK. Then from the Ferry leaving Staten Island. Looks immense!

Awesome & Mind Blowing View. Manhattan skyline had written the definition of a truly Megacity that too almost a century ago.. Setting the world to follow its foot steps when it comes to building sky scrappers..... It's treat to the eyes, mind and heart to view those magnificent buildings standing very close to each other almost like rubbing shoulder to shoulder.. !!The avenues, streets, lanes and by lanes of Manhattan were laid down very nicely and these magnificent buildings are then constructed side by side. The traffic management is amazing on the road and subway network in Manhattan is just awesome. The Empire State building, World Trade Center building, Met life building, One Penn station building, Lexington avenue building to name a few sky scrappers that welcome the tourists and fill their hearts and minds with amazing and astonishing feelings.I walked through the Lexington avenue, Madison avenue, Times Square Street, 34th street and had my mind and heart with countless praises and appreciations to all the engineers, owners who invested their amazing skills, huge money and precious time in creating such magnificent modern structures. Also, you got to see the beautiful rivers "Hudson" & East rivers on both the sides of Manhattan and also a vast and beautiful "Central Park" in the middle of Manhattan. Walking or a cab ride through the streets of Manhattan is a must and without which your trip to New York city is incomplete..

Wish I could stare at this everyday!. The Manhattan skyline is amazing! I could stare at it endlessly! I get super excited every time it comes into view when I arrive in New York, and depressed when I'm on my way to the airport to leave and it fades into the distance :(
Stunning. Just like the movies!From someone from a small town this view is unreal with all the buildings that you only see in movies right in your eyeline.Stunning, especially from sea or at night.
Amazing View. It is just really amazing to view the skyline via Liberty State Park, or from Ellis Island. Pick a sunny day and enjoy the sunset.

love it. I always love the skyline of Manhattan. We saw it from several angles during this trip and still loves all the angles. Best ones I think are the view from Long Island and from the circle line cruise.
Went with the bf. Best seen from Brooklyn! Went on the Go New York bus tour and got on the night tour. It was great. Thanks to Avi our guide and Joseph the driver.

By car or boat, make sure you get out of Manhattan for a proper view!. We got two opportunities to appreciate the incredible view that is lower Manhattan's skyline, the drive back to the airport and taking the East River Ferry from the Wall Street Pier to Brooklyn. The ferry was a terrific way to see so much of the panorama and much more fun than the train. Whether it's public transportation or a boat tour, make sure to get out on the water for one of the best photo ops around.

Best thing to do on a low budget. A very pleasent walk through the meat packing district and more. For a tourist that didn't have much time and money in NY it is definitely something to do. The walk come across some great places to eat (off track a little bit) and is something I would recommend for everyone traveler to do.

NY Skyline is great from Hoboken, Brooklyn and the free Staten Island Ferry.. The NY Skyline is great from Hoboken to Brooklyn. take a subway, bike, car or river taxi from manhattan and you'll see a truly beautiful NY skyline. Take the Staten Island ferry (free) and back and see the Statue of Liberty and the best view of lower Manhattan. Cruise ships coming and going from Manhattan are departing and arriving back at the best times to see lower Manhattan (also NJ) and the Westside. Circle Line and river taxis are also worth the trip.
Breathtaking on a Clear Day!. Highly recommend visitors find a way to view the Manhattan Skyline from afar. Absolutely Breathtaking and one can truly see how large it is.

Places to visit.. I viewed the Manhatten Skyline from one of the river trips around the island and also viewed it from the top of the Empire State building and the Rockefeller Building, though the view from the river gave you a scale of the city district. Whilst helicopter rides are available, the cost and duration was off putting despite the thrill of a helicopter ride. More than happy with the river trips, viewing the impressive skyline and buildings, both new and old from all around.Well worth capturing the view, another 'must do' attraction to experience.
Beautiful. The Manhattan Skyline is gorgeous by day but at night it is just spectacular! We went in a dinner cruise and coming back the skyline was so amazing! Definitely worth seeing!

manhattan is changing. We visited the new Ground Zero. A sobering moment, reflecting upon one of the most tragic events in our country's history. The new memorial is splendid - amust visit for any tourist

View the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn!! . A view that does not disappoint! Walk the Brooklyn Bridge, and enjoy astonishing views from one of the most recognized bridges in the world! Take the staircase to street level and find your way to Brooklyn park promenade... Stroll and enjoy!

An iconic image of modern life.. The skyline of New York must be one of the most breath taking views of the modern world. It must surely be a must visit destination for everyone. The image of New York will live with you all your life.

Must see. Manhattan skyline is definitely beautiful and worth to see. I personally like the view from booth as it provides you with unique experience. View from Empire State Building, top of the rock or One World is also nice.

Love the NYC skyline. When visiting NYC, it's easy to forget you need to travel out of the city to truly appreciate the skyline. I recommend heading over the Brooklyn Bridge and observing from Brooklyn.

Beautiful to see from many angles. This is a really gorgeous city for skyline. Very nice view of it from the Brooklyn Bridge Park, also nicely viewable from New Jersey for a different side. Iconic part of NY.

This is what it's all about for us. We got to take in the beautiful NYC skyline very day of our trip because we stayed at the Hyatt in NJ. Very glad we did. All the views, none of the noise and hectic pace of NYC. Watched the sun come up over the Empire State Building and loved the colors the Jully setting sun painted on the skyline at dusk.
Manhattan skyline. This skyline is as impressive as i had in mind. it's truly what you see in movies, or tv series. It's an absolutely fantastic skyline !! :) :)

Love it!. I loved every second of my visit to NY, seeing the skyline from Staten Island was a lovely sight and it makes you realize just how tall the skyscrapers are. One of the highlights from our trip!
Awesome. Like looking at every TV show with my own eyes! So many photo opportunities and stunning day or night
Breath taking view. Unique experience!!! Weather was excellent, perfect for walking and admiring the scene. For the photographer this is for sure reaching nirvana.

Amazing Skyline! . One of the most photographed skyline in the world, you surely won't miss it, if you get to be in New York! Sure way to view it is from the ferry to and from Liberty Island and or Ellis Island. Another way is from the Top of the Rock observatory in Rockefeller Center. Or any other observation points in the Empire State Building or the new One World Trade Center. I also had a great view from the Megabus going into the Hudson River Tunnel in New Jersey. Of course, a plane ride out of LaGuardia Airport or JFK will be awesome too!

Fabulous view!. Looking at the Manhattan skyline, either during the day or at night, from the quietness of New Jersey is fabulous.Take a bus from from the Port Authority, 42nd st, usually gate 212. It will take you through the Lincoln tunnel, and you need to get off at the El Dorado stop. An adult ticket costs about $6 return. You need to buy this before getting on the bus.

Just like the Movies. Having seen the movies and tv shows, the surprise, if any, is not the sights and sounds of the New York Skyline, but the sheer scale and familiarity. It is exactly as you imagined, only more so. I would strongly recommy you do not restrict yourself to Manhattan only, but experience the other boroughs because each has its own architectural style and ambience. Enjoy :-)
View from Ellis island. Lower Manhattan skyline from Ellis island is stunning. We did the combined trip to both Statue of Liberty and Ellis island.
what a view. Re-live scores of movies and tv shows with this iconic view of lower Manhattan. Best viewed from the ferry boats.
Take a look. Take a look and you wont regret. The skyline of manhattanis world renowned. The trip is a worthwhile one
What a view. I've stayed in Brooklyn, Newark, Queens & Jersey City & which ever way or by different ways of travel you approach this fantastic city the sights are marvelous (except the subway)
Beautiful. Beautiful skyline! The iconic New York City skyline is beautiful and world renowned! Obviously a must see when visiting the east coast!

Walk the Brooklyn Bridge..... My friend and I walked from the Manhattan side of the Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn and back. The view of Manhattan on the way back was incredible! So many buildings!
Next time I come back to NYC, I'll do the walk at night :)

Free from the Staten Island ferry. A must see wonderful views of even the Statue of Liberty from the Staten Island ferry. The ferry is free and normally runs every 30 mins. My family and I only had 24 hours in NYC so we tried to make the most of it. The views of NYC from the ferry cannot be beat.

I sailed into New York on QM2 and was greeted with this.. If you did not get the opportunity to see the skyline like me there is a choice of alternative options such as the helicopter rides or the ferry where you will be greeted by this amazing view. It is a clean and inviting vista. You think of the BIG APPLE but it's views are wonderfull
The best. Seen the skyline from our room at World Center Hotel and Staten Island Ferry. Next time I'll take a boat tour around the whole island so I can take in all of it.

Ellis Island for distant view. The image that makes you realise you really are in New York City! Try the view from Ellis Island for a distance shot and the Empire State for good high level , wide angle photos from an outside viewpoint.
Awsome view. The Manhattan skyline from the New Jersey side is beautiful. We were there in mid June when there was a full moon and a clear sky, and the view was spectacular.
Iconic. Although air pollution seems to be taking its toll, graying out the skyline and creating a yellowish haze in the sky, this is still breathtaking.

Be a flaneur!. Just walking around looking at the city can be a great experience, especially if you are prepared. Read some guide books and travel writing about the city, something besides Lonely Planet or Frommer Guides. They are a good introduction but lacking in nitty gritty details. There is more NY there than you can see in a week, a month, maybe even a lifetime.

Sit left flying into EWR. I like EWR as my primary hub for many reasons, especially the great Manhattan skyline view during landings. Approaching from the north is most common, so sitting at a window on the left provides the best view.
Movie scene. No one grew up without watching movies with Manhattan's skyline view. It's speechless, perfect in all senses. Go to the Brooklyn to enjoy the best view.
