Great city structure. It is great city structure with the skylines at different style and height. There is almost no repeating style. Love the Manhattan city plan.

Only a few American Cities can show this well. Chicago, New York, Seattle and maybe a few more. Best places to grab view and snap a pic include: Brooklyn waterfront park, Brooklyn Bridge, top of One World, Top of the Rock or Empire State Building if you must. Even the roof top bars of many hotels are great as well Also from Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island have great views. The High Line provides good architecture views of the west side
Unlike anything Else. What can you say about the Manhattan Skyline - its wonderful, unique, awesome, changing - can't take enough pictures of it

Always changing. Never get bored of looking at this skyline as there always seems something new to see. So many ways of catching sight, but I do like the drive from Newark and that first glimpse across the river!
Breathtaking... For me the best view in the world. Stunning by day and by night with those lights twinkling it gives me goosebumps and brings tears to my eyes. It's stunning, go see it!
View from the Brooklyn side. Photo opportunities galore from the Brooklyn Bridge. Wish I had brought my wide-angled lens. Next time, I'll look at it from New Jersey.

Look for a view from Brooklyn. You might get a great skyline view from Brooklyn area.Either taking the Grayline or Big Bus 2ble deckers, or the Ferry from grayline as well.We got incredible memories both ways
Never get tired of this...really is iconic.. This skyline means so much for all of the world...look for places, bridges, planes, etc. to view this beautiful city.

Must see . Take a ferry ride in the evening to enjoy the best of the skyline that is decorated by the mighty Manhattan downtown. The engineering foresight of the pre world war days is epitomized by the skyline.

The Best. I marvel at the skyline of Manhattan. I went to graduate school in NY.
We live in FL and visit several times a year and I still marvel every time I see it.

There is no other panorama like it. One of the best places to view the Manhattan skyline is from the other side of the River Hudson in New Jersey. We took the Liberty Harbour Ferry from the World Financial Centre to the Liberty Harbour Marina ($12 return). The view of the Manhattan skyline from the promenade round Liberty Park is truly spectacular. You can then buy tickets for the Statue of Liberty ferry at the former railway station. If you want to eat well stop off at Warren Street (just across from the Marina and a stop off point for the return ferry) and go to Amelia's Bistro

Waterfront Views Of Manhattan. The best views of the Manhattan Skyline are available for the price of a subway or ferry or Tram ride. 1. Take the Tram or subway to Roosevelt Island, for a aerial view I preview the Tram. The residential Island faces the East side of Midtown Manhattan and the UN. As you step off the tram pick up drinks and snacks at the Duane Reade or coffee at the Starbucks before you walk south along the water front to the new Roosevelt Memorial Park. If you stay late stop at the one of the restaurants near the Tram for a light dinner. 2. Long Island City in Queens is a 10 minute ride on the number 7 train from Times Square. Hop off at the Vernon-Jackson stop. If time allows visit PS1 MOMA Museum. Exiting from the subway walk east towards the river, to Gantry State Park. This park faces the upper East Side of Manhattan. Vernon Blvd. has cafes restaurants and botiques. 3. The number 4 train from Grand Central or the ferry from lower Manhattan will take you to Brooklyn Bridge Park under the Brooklyn Bridge, which faces the waterfront skyscrapers of Wall Street, and views of the three iconic bridges of NYC.

Holiday. Amazing - take the bay cruise to appreciate the variety and scale of Manhattan viewed: a must do on any visit.Most cruises leave from around pier 83, allow at least 30 minutes for queuing and collecting tickets before the scheduled sailing.Recommend taking a taxi since the piers are not close to the metro.The cruise piers are close to US Intrepid which is also a very interesting historic experience as well as seeing Concord and the space shuttle.

breathtaking. I was not a fun of New York. I did not plan to visit that city, but plans sometimes change :) I am so so happy that I saw the skyline as i totally changed my opinion for this fantastic city. I watched it from Bedford and from Brooklyn bridge. Breathtaking!!!

One of the best skyline in the world. Go in the evening so you can view day and night time view. It is amazing. Night pictures of the city will not come out great unless you have a professional camera!
Stunning!!. A night time trip to Brooklyn gave probably the most stunning views of lower Manhattan, but any time of day from any vantage point you will be amazed.
Urban Marvel. It's part of collective imagination since decades, an icon of the silver screen, and a must for all newcomers

Still Spectacular, But.... I am a native New Yorker. I live on Long Island & commute into Manhattan to work on the Long Island Rail Road every day. I am fortunate enough to be able to see the Manhattan Skyline daily as the train approaches the East River tunnel from Queens to take me into Manhattan. I still am in awe of the beauty of the skyline every time I see it. It is a monument & testament to all of the architects, engineers & construction workers who devoted years to creating these magnificent structures. It's also organic, changing periodically. One57 was added fairly recently and is very visible from Queens. The Manhattan Skyline was also radically changed on 9/11/01 when the Twin Towers of the World Trade Center were destroyed and thousands of lives lost. The Skyline is still a spectacular site but there is a scar in the Skyline where the Twin Towers once were that will never heal.I love New York City & believe visiting it should be on everyone's bucket list. The Manhattan Skyline is a site that should also be on everyone's bucket list. If you come to visit, as you gaze at the beautiful Manhattan Skyline, say a prayer for those lives lost on 9/11. You should also make a point of visiting the 9/11 Memorial.

Spectacular views must be seen. The view of the New York skyline must be seen by any visitors .We found that the skyline as seen from a boat trip to Ennis Island or similar trips.Breathtaking don't miss it

Iconic Skyline Immediately Recognisable. Manhattan is a wonderful part of New York City and its skyline is instantly familiar, but nonetheless impressive. So many good places to see it from, too: Staten Island Ferry, Ellis Island Ferry, East River Ferry, Empire State Building, the Top of the Rock, or even Brooklyn. I love it!

Trip around the reservoir. A walk or run around the reservoir in Central Park affords some magnificent views and a snapshot of 3 different neighborhoods..upper east side, upper west side and south Harlem.

Wondrous . One of the most wondrous sights in the world. When you first see it you have to be amazed how all these fantastic buildings can be on such a small island. There is nothing more to be said. Just look at the picture accompanying this question. And I'm from Los Angeles.

Nothing like seeing the city that never sleeps, whether it be daytime or night time.. Be daring grab a subway map and hit the rails. Find your interests, take a ride to Canal street, Chinatown, find out what's happening in the city upon your arrival. Be a New Yorker, walk fast, be alert! Have fun in a city that offers just so much. Whatever you do please remember DO NOT STAND IN THE MIDDLE OF A BUSY SIDEWALK!!!!!!!!!!!!

Head to Brooklyn to see the best skyline. walk the promenade at the end of Willow street and make your way back over the Brooklyn Bridge by foot. The vantage point from that entire area gives the best Manhattan skyline view. But don't delay--the area in front of the Promenade is being redeveloped--hopefully city fathers will preserve the views

The Symbol of New York City. Bright Lights, Big City. The skyline is the iconic image of the Big Apple, the City the Never Sleeps. But actually, it does--and the city has taken steps to reduce the death rate of migrating birds who become confused by the lights. Many of the tallest buildings coordinate darkening their lights to coincide with bird migrations that pass through the city. But you should find a great rooftop bar and enjoy the lights with a friend, glass in hand.
It's the view from our roof.. What's not to love about the Manhattan skyline? The trick is to get out of Manhattan to enjoy it! Try Brooklyn Heights to see the best view of lower Manhattan.

A view of the skyline of NYC. Go to Hamilton Park in East New York, New Jersey.I long walkway follows the tops of Palisades for about a mile.Views of NYCity are excellent day or night. Finding parking on Kennedy Blvd. is sometimes challenging.
Central Park. Just an absolutely wonderful place. Amazing that they planned this over 100 years ago. we should have such thinkers today

Its Big and its Tall!. What can one say about the Manhattan skyline? It is really big. It is really tall. You can look at it forever. Find a spot and look at the place it meets the sky. Sunsets are great too

Wow. The first time you see the skyline your jaw will drop, there are no words for it. I saw it from the plane and I burst into tears, it's something you see on tv all the time but to see t in real life is just unbelievable. We went on a circle line cruise as the sunset and saw a bit of 'manhattanhenge' which is definitely worth it!
Amazing views. The Empire State building and better yet, the World Trade Center Freedom tower give you the most amazing views of the city!

Like no other!. We went mid June and the weather was fabulous, so it really makes it when you look back on your photos of the Manhattan skyline, that clear blue sky in the background! You really can't get enough of this view, it's utterly fabulous even if you're a country dweller like me, you can certainly appreciate the immense buildings and think about all the people in them and how on earth does everyone fit??! But they do!!

Cruising best way to really see beauty of NYC Skyline. WE really go great NYC skyline view from our sunset champagne cruise aboard the yacht Manhattan, don't believe you can get a more complete skyline than from the water, including Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty & much more
Amazing views. Doesn't matter where you are standing or looking the views and skyline is amazing. Hotel views, cabs, buses all has something new to see

Most famous skyline in the world. We saw Manhattan from a helicopter, One World Trade (Freedom Tower) observation deck and from the Top of the Rock. Every viewpoint shows iconic buildings like the Chrysler Bldg., Empire State, One World Trade, Central Park and across the rivers to New Jersey.
Impressive but a bit samey when you are in manhattan.. Its cool to see all the streets lined up across the whole of newyork city but it's not that impressive after a while it just looks the same.

Lady Liberty leads the way. From the Statue of Liberty, which seems small against such a back drop, to the towers, Hudson River and glimpses of the Brooklyn Bridge, this is a skyline that makes others pale by comparison.

One of my favorite views in the country. How can you not love the Manhattan Skyline. My favorite place to view it from is the top of the Metropolitan Museum. There may be other places to view it from...but give it a try.
Lovely sight. Never tire of the sight of the skyline, it's amazing, even from the harbour cruise, took so many photos of it.
Great experience lovely walk with some great views. Great experience lovely walk with some great views. A little more history information would be educational and beneficial

All you can do is Stare! . The skyline is endlessly enjoyable. From every angle there is something to see. Visit The Rockefeller centre for the top of the rock lookout on level 69 or go to the Empire state and look out at the skyline from the 86th floor, but whether you do this or just walk the streets and look up you will enjoy the skyline.

OK during the day; see it at dusk for the best view. The Manhattan skyline is pretty impressive from a distance, with the mix of modern and older architecture pushing up into the sky. At dusk, as the sun goes down, you start to get the silhouette coming through, with the building lights breaking through the blackness of the buildings.
Awesome view..... it is worth the trip. the skyline is a distinct picture. do not forget to pick up a coke with the skyline image as a souvenir

Boat view. I enjoyed a boat ride around the island, and the sight of all the skyscrapers by the shore were very impressive. There were a couple of ducks on the quay side, and the sunshine was wonderful.
Nice view. Nice view and feel of the majestic Manhattan. Its a little priced, but If you want so be able to see the city day or night you must visit.
Beautiful!. I am not the most cultural tourist, Im a foody but when I first looked at the new york skyline from Hoboken NJ I must admit, it did nearly take my breath away. Its beautiful.

GREAT VIEW FROM THE STATUE BOAT. Terrific view from the boat taking tourists to see the statue and Ellis island and plenty more picture opportunities when on the island to get a background picture of one of the most fantastic concrete skylines in the world.

Everyone should see the Manhattan skyline before leaving New York!. I would recommend going on a boat to see the skyline as its much easier than when on Manhattan itself. It's such an iconic view that everyone should see before leaving the city! It's breathtaking and every photographers dream!

Go across the Brookly Bridge and head to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. Instead of turning back half way across the Brooklyn Bridge head off on foot to Brooklyn Heights, the Prom is a great and relatively quiet way to view Manhatten from a different perspective and you can head along to Court ST/Bourough Hall Subway station after the Prom walk through the nice tree lined streets, stopping in for a Drink or Meal in a nice quieter part of the city away from all the hustle and bustle of Manhatten
Beautiful Skyline!. Beautiful majestic skyline. Viewed from high above even more beautiful. New York has one of the most beautiful skylines in all of America.

The best view!. This city is truly beautiful from any side of the rivers. Jersey, Queens, Brooklyn, and Staten Island all give amazing views. MY favorite views are from Jersey City and Hoboken though.
Best from Brooklyn. An iconic view - best seen from a boat or Brooklyn. Every one should experience this once in their live

Pretty at night. We took a Gray Line city lights evening tour scheduled through Viator. The Viator description said the tour was 2.5 hrs and allowed you to walk the Brooklyn Promenade. In reality, the tour is about 1.5 hrs and you do NOT go across the Brooklyn Bridge nor walk the Promenade. You cross on the Manhattan Bridge. This was a great disappointment and huge misrepresentation by Viator. The Viator folks said it was Gray Line's description and the Gray Line folks said it was a Viator problem. In any event, we did see the city skyline in the dark, from the top of the open air tour bus. We were not allowed to get off. I was extremely disappointed with Viator and will NOT use them for any future tours. BEWARE!
Best observed from the river or at the top of the Empire State Building. The New York skyline is best observed from the top of the Empire State Building or from a boat on the river.
Wow. Being from a small northern town the skyline is almost overwhelming. It is amazing to see and a item that should be on everyone's bucket list
World famous. One of the most iconic skylines in the world. I love to see it from the West at sunset. In the early morning, my favorite skyline view is from the Whitestone Bridge.

Wowzers!. We caught the skyline from a ferry as well as the Empire State Building. What a marvel of American engineering & history! Tall & small buildings of all different architectural styles. The skyline is beautiful & inspiring, interesting & makes you proud of our American history & heritage.

beautiful view from the Empire State Building. From the top of the Empire State, the view of Manhattan is breathtaking...very amazing that so much could be in such a small area. If you want to see the skyline the Empire State rooftop is the way to go!

BEST FREE VIEW FROM LIC. Just 1 stop off the 7 train there's a park on a water a few blocks from the subway. I used to work in Queens and found myself seeing a sunset atleast once a week. If your not from New York, this is what it's all about. It's a great spot for family's friends and even couples. It's a newer park and isn't really on the radar yet.
Manhattan Skyline looks so beautiful. From the observation deck we saw the Manhattan Skyline which is simply beautiful. We all love New York!

Circle line sightseeing tour CityPASS. I went on this cruise with a CityPASS. You can choose between 4 different tours, ranging from a 30 minute boat trip to a 2 hour tour all around Manhattan. If you want to do the big tour, there's only in the morning and at 2pm a tour. Other tours are available until later.
you can't miss this. stunning in the freezing cold, when visibility was for miles. There is no better skyline in the world,
Like no other. Doesn't have the lights of Hong kong but has a great contrast of old and new, best viewed from Governors Island
A vision you will never forget!. I think this is what made me fall in love with New York. I will never forget the first time I experienced seeing this beautiful vision!

Impressive day or night. Manhattan skyline is impressive day or night from any angle.It's even better from the sky if you get a chance to go up in one of the helicopter.It's great to see the freedom tower standing after all that has happened down there. The amount of people that take picture of the skyline is unreal but then again it is an iconic piece :)

EXTRAORDINARY VIEW FROM TRUMP SOHO. We have stayed in Trump soho about 6 times. Try to book upper levels above floor 36 i think and request the corner room facing the Avenue of the Americas You can see the water to your left and also the Empire State Bldg and all the lights from the all night traffic it is beautiful up that high, not to mentionn Koi restaurant on the first floor. Excellent .

Is there anything more iconic?. Wow... just wow. First saw it off I-80 on our way to George Washington Bridge and again from Statue of Liberty. Both were really cool, especially views from Statue of Liberty, where you can see skyline, Brooklyn Bridge and Verrazano Narrows Bridge.

Impressive when in full view. When coming from the Airport you do not get the feel of the skyline or the size of the city. Once you move around and travel on the Hudson you cannot failed to be impressed by the skyline and buildings
Background for Gotham. Great views from the water, even better at night. Take the Statten Island Ferry for free to get a great view.
Wow. Best viewed at Weehawken, NJ which is not too far of a drive. Once you get there and see the skyline beyond the Hudson, wow...you'll get a feel of how big the city really is.
The skyline is beautiful. We took an evening cruise just to see the Manhattan skyline. We went at dusk so got some amazing day and night photos. Very beautiful views
Beautiful view!. Whether viewing from a ferry, cruise boat or Liberty State Park, the view is amazingly beautiful. The view of the World Trade Center is stunning!

Wonderful views from the CircleLine "Harbor Lights" tour. Going by boat was wonderful start to our trip. Completely set the stage for the next three days.
Amazing photo opps from the boat.

Find a Booze Cruise great view for Cheap!. The way to see the night time skyline! We pushed off the dock on the East side and traveled down past the Statue of Liberty for great pics and Ellis Island and the 1 World Trade. Docked by 10pm Perfect romantic night. Or find a boat dinner cruise.

Interesting skyline from the air. We flew in at dusk and watched the skyline of New York. It was beautiful and this was the first time I'd been to New York since the Twin Towers went down. A little sad to not have them anymore. I think from the plane was the best view I had of the skyline.

Worth being on a boat to see. Everyone needs to see this but if you think that the view from Roosevelt island will do it, you will be disappointed.
Roosevelt island is currently under a lot of construction too.
Get on a boat with a bottle of champers and do sightseeing properly!

Superb scenery, great city. The Skyline of NYC is phenomenal. Where else can one see such a majestic city? The Skyline is breath taking, especially if you see it from one of the tall buildings, like the grand old Empire State Building, or if you see it from a helicopter.
None like it.. Best skyline in the world. Easy to see from Staten Island Ferry or one of the many boat rides available. The view changes every foot you move!

Best seen from the Hudson River. The best way to see the skyline is from the Statute of Liberty ferry and indeed the statute herself if you are a visitor to NYC on a tight timescale.
Best seen on a crisp clear blue sky day.

Memories that will always stay with you . There are many ways to see the Manhattan Skyline we went by boat and we were not disappointed , the weather was very hot ,so go prepared .
Its was a must do on our list and ticked all our boxes 📷🗽🇺🇸😎🛥

here for the Xmas visit, 2015. you can only say one phrase...New York--there is no other.the skyline is partly why that really is true. even without the world trade center, the view is breathtaking. if you look at it from the Newark Airport, you can see it from New Jersey. if you can try to also see it from the Empire State Building, and then compare your notes. i can never get enough of it. i will go back until i am 90.New York, New York

hop on hop off ferry. you must buy a hop on hop off combo ticket while you are in New York because you can reach every important attraction easily and safely the ticket give's you an uptown tour down town tour Bronx tour Brooklyn tour and a free ferry tour ,a free entrance to two museum and 15%discount on certain restaurants with only 54 dollars for two days ,so the ferry tour was amazing because you can hop on hop off many times on certain areas of your interest and the skyline of manhattan is breath taking

A beautiful city with a beautiful skyline. "What a view" I said to my girlfriend while walking over the Brooklyn Bridge to see the Manhattan Skyline. It is a great thing to see that I recommend to everyone.

New York, New York. Flew into LaGuardia to catch a cruise up the East Coast and Canada. There is no other skyline like it. Standing at the Manhattan Cruise terminal, my ship was docked next to the Concord. Seeing Ellis Island, the Statue of Liberty and all the other New York iconic landmarks was an experience.
Oh my goodness . You will never see another skyline in the world to compare with this one.Take a trip to the Top of The Rock to appreciate fully how impressive this beautiful city is.

The city experience. Many people come to new York due to its historical status as the largest US city. The skyline in Manhattan reflects the history of the development of this city and is more historical of earlier architectural trends than the more modern and innovative skyline along the PuDong in Shanghai or in Dubai. Some of the high rise towers have observations decks or visit the empire state building for that historical experience and enjoy the cityscape.
Stunning . If you go on a boat ride that's part of a tour then it's one of the best free things that you can do! This is skyline that everyone knows and you can see it and be blown away by it!

Beautiful. What an incredible sight to see day or night. There are a lot of different places to see the Manhattan skyline. Taking a stroll in the park at the downtown Brooklyn Waterfront is a really nice way to see the Lower Manhattan Skyline. Or even better take a harbor cruise. I personally think right around Twilight is the best time to see the Skyline.
Truly awesome. What is there to say? Thered is no place on earth like new York. Buildings are so varied in style and all interesting in their own right.
Must see view. You may have seen it in the movies so it's nice to see it in person. Take a ferry and pass under the famous bridges and see the distinctive New York skyline.

Sky is the limit. The early morning sun fails to reach the roads till it is late in the morning. The view of the skyline is blocked by concrete structures. Welcome Manhattan. With sky scrappers lining up on close proximity, even a ten storied building looks like a bald patch from the heights of neighbouring building. But even the concrete jungle appears to be a sight that is imposing and unique. The view can hardly be compared with any other place. The Manhattan skyline is clearly a marvel of technology that will amaze visitors.
From the boat. Arrived in Manhattan via the Staten Island Ferry on a clear sunny day. Wow. Isn't the Statue of Liberty small!

Manhattan Skyline. Fabulous skyline from lots of different locations at different times of the day or night, which includes Top of the Rock, The Empire State Building and the Staten Island Ferries. Renowned skyline throughout the world that does not disappoint.
Totally memorable!!. The best places to see the skyline are:The One World ConservatoryTop of the RockThe River Cafe in BrooklynThe Empire State BuildingTook soooo many photos!!!

Just like the movies!. I loved seeing this with my own eyes. It was my first time in New York and we did a ferry cruise. I was totally smitten with the sights and have taken enough pictures and videos to bore my relatives while replaying them!

Do it by Boat. We did a boat tour which was 2 hrs. and that was great not too long. We took it through neighborhoods which was described by the tour guide and got to the the tenements, the Financial District, Brooklyn, Ellis island, New Jersey, and many others.
Magic. From all angles it's amazing. So far I've taken a cruise, seen it from The Brooklyn Bridge, Liberty Island and The Empire State Building. Not to be missed however you view it.

You can see it best when driving in . It's a beautiful skyline but not the same without the twin towers :( depending what part of the city you are in depends on the skyline you will see. Recommend going to Jersey city to see the downtown sites or Brooklyn Promenade.

Iconic. We viewed the Manhatten skyline from Liberty Island and also from the Staten Island ferry and it is stunning. For a truly stupendous way to view it however I would suggest a tour bus trip at night when you'll see it all lit up - amazing!
The most iconic view in the world. Everyone can recognise the Manhattan skyline. What is really impressive is seeing it from your hotel and when it is lit up at night its simply magnificent.

What can you say?. Breath taking views of the tall skyscrapers reaching up so high. Makes you feel real small. Make sure you take a day cruise around the island to get the full effect. It's even greater at night with all the lights on.
Stunning. One of the great Skylines in the world but the best view is from the New Jersey side. If you want the full effect take a 4 hour cruise on the Circle line it is worth it.
Great views. We went on one of the helecopter tours, the views of manhattan were to die for. Loved this wee trip. I would defo do it again.
Simply stunning. I've always thought the Manhattan skyline was the most beautiful there is and I was not dissapointed seeing it in the flesh
The best ever. I just don't think it possible to see a more awe inspiring skyline in our country, and maybe the world. Too s picture from the far side of the Hudson River. Just simply awesome!!!
Impressive!. Very nice area and incredible skyline! The streets here are always buzzing and the crowd is dressed well! There are some great restaurants close by and awesome places to shop.

Just like the postcards!. We saw the view from the Staten Island Ferry, it was just how you see it in movies. For some reason it made me feel very patriotic, I was filled with love and pride for our beautiful country!
Epiv. Quintessential city skyline. Empire State Building, freedom tower, Chrysler Building, new condos that reach to the sky. Wow

The most beautiful skyline in the world . I've traveled around the world. The best skyline is that if NYC! Whether from east, west, north or south during the daytime or at night, the NYC skyline is magnificent. Climb to the top of the Empire State Building or the 'Top of the Rock ' to see it in its gradeur, hugged by the Hudson, Harlem and East Rivers.

Angled Perspective. The New York City skyline is one of the most unique view from any vantage point. One of the most enjoyable trip for me to see the changing skyline of the city is to every other month take the free ferry shuttle to the IKEA store in Red Hook. You have a front seat view of lower Manhattan plus western Brooklyn. You get a glimpse of Jersey city as well as the Verrezanno bridge. The free shuttle is only available on weekends and can be taken near the South St seaport. Enjoy your trip.

Nothing man made is more beautiful. The skyline is something I never take for granite. Every time I see it I am in awe. The contrast of the lbusy lights against the stillness of the dark. The several shapes and sizes and billions of dollars of private and public investment that shapes the most beautiful skyline in the world. I never get tired of gazing at it weather from a window, the sidewalk, a bridge or on the water. You get lost in the endless activity
Stunning!. Take the Staten Island ferry for the the free view. Have seen this view in a hundred films but even more stunning up close and real!

Beautiful view! . The whole city is beautiful whether you view it at day or night time. I would advise any travelers to visit and enjoy scenic views also have your camera ready! :) great to have photographic memories!

A Beautiful City. If you like architecture you will love New York City.The sky line is beautiful day or night, and it's worth making sure you see if both during the day and night., whether by land or from the water.

Very famous, you can't help but see it when you're in New York. Obviously you've got to see this skyline. It's not going to completely blow your head off, though it is impressive. It's not super futuristic a la Shanghai.
Lovely skyline. New York skyline seen in the daytime from Liberty Island and then at night from the night tour of the hop on hop off bus tour. Was lovely to see the views at both day and night.

Brooklyn Heights . Great views from Brooklyn Heights get off the subway at High St Brooklyn and walk down Cranberry St to the promenade. It's peaceful, quite and away from the crowds in Brooklyn Park.

Better than I thought. . It's exactly the same in the movies. It's just MASSIVE. I honestly had a sore neck. It's great from Liberty. There's so many times you see it when doing the tourist bit. Again amazing lit up. Honestly I was taking photos of everything

I felt I had been there before. This was my first trip to New York. It won't be my last. However, my first impression was familiarity. Many parts of NY feel so familiar. It is the countless movies and TV shows I suppose, although many are now filmed in Toronto and dressed up as NY. In fact in the UK the premier film studios Pinewood are about to build a permanent set representing a NY street. But nothing can beat the real thing. I first saw it driving over Manhatten Bridge just after darkness. It is stunning. Just look and wonder. Because the open bus tour guide had a crisis - it was her first night and someone insulted her, so she refused to carry on for a long time - the driver took is on a detour to Brooklyn and parked at a viewpoint so we could take pictures and the guide could have a sneaky cigarette. It was well worth it. Another stunning angle to view the skyline and spot the famous buildings. it's pinnacle is the new Freedom Tower of course, a clever piece of architecture. Don't miss this view. Looking is free. I bet it looks great in all weathers.
So pretty!. Loved the skyline from Brooklyn near sunset! I took so many photos, it is hard to decide which I like the best!

A stunning view. The best local to admire the skyline of Manhattan. Prepare the camera for taking the best photos os the ground zero area. Take the boat to state island to view this kind of landscape.

Cool to see it live!. So if in NYC, make sure this is one moment during your trip! You can book any boat tours that take you to the Statue of Liberty, but we took the FREE Steten island ferry which passes the statue and also is a quick 30 minute lovely ride outside the city. At the end you Have to get off, but if you are quick enough and do not want to wait 30 mins for the next ferry, you may catch the one that goes back to the city. The skyline is beautiful daytime, but I am sure it's beautiful at nightime as well.

Nothing like it. The skyline is iconic and something everyone should see. Coming in on the plane when it's out the window is amazing. You can see it on a boat tour or at one of the skyscraper tours. I love the classic buildings especially the Chrysler building and the new Freedom Tower.

You will remember the seen the rest of your life. New York, New York, this is the destination of every traveler in the world. The most important seen in New York is the Skyline. The Good news is you can this from too many places in New York, I will mention some, Empire State Building, The Top of the Rock, Under the Brooklyn Bridge (Dumbo) and so many other places. If you are in New York ask someone and you will find some place close to where you are that you can see Manhattan skyline from there. Do not forget or your visit will not be complete.
awesome. simply stunning views of the manhattan skyline we got from when we walked over the brooklyn bridge!!

Magnifique!. Staying on Manhattan on earlier visits it was a treat staying right on the waterfront on the Jersey side and waking up and going to bed with this most marvellous view in sight. Blue skies made it even more spectacularly with the mirroring on the glass highrisers

The most iconic skyline in the World. To enjoy the skyline you need to eat a sandwich or drink something and just observe. Observe it during the sunset, the night, a great blue sky, the rain... Every weather suits the skyline.

Nothing like it!. If you're a skyscraper enthusiast like me, this is the place for you! The last couple, and next few years promise many new additions to this already magnificent skyline, it's an exiting time to be a skyscraper fan!

Incredible. Every time I go to New York I always go to the skyline. You can walk, lay down on the floor, Sit down and read a book, just seat there and relax look at the people walking or simply listen to the music of those that are either playing their instruments or practicing or wasting their time there.
Not a better view in the US!. Cannot beat the skyline of Manhattan. I could look at it every day and not get bored. We saw it from One World Tower. First class!
Awesome. Amazing view, seen well from the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island ferry and amazing from New Jersey.
Unmissable. We flew in to Newark , so as we approached the city , the skyline was breathtaking , like a movie scene

Exquisite Paniramic Manhattan Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline which comprises of several tall skyscrapers are examples of both Art Deco & Modern architecture. The splendidly illuminated Manhattan Skyline is a feast for the eyes and the best way to enjoy the panoramic view is to go for a sunset cruise in Circle Line Cruise. The Empire State building, One & Four World Trade Centre towers, Woolworth building, 40 Wall Street, Chrysler building and NY Times building make up the most prominent skyscrapers of Manhattan Skyline which arguable is the world's best skyline on view and is one of the main tourist attractions of New York City.
Amazing. Amazing views from a boat or helicopter. Fabulous for all ages, families and couples. A must for everyone visiting New York!
Beautiful at night. Best views we from our nighttime double decker bus tour. You go over the Manhattan bridge and get amazing views. Very cool and fun experience.

A mesmerising experince on the banks of River Hudson. We visited during evening hours with strong chilly winds blowing. Shivering with clod and light drizzle, we enjoyed the lights and sky rocketing towers. On th ebanks of river hudson with high tides, it was a sight to treasure.

Spectacular Skyline. You can get views of the skyline from several different vantage points. Take a harbor cruise, go to the Empire State Building, or visit Top of the Rock for some incredible views of the ultimate concrete jungle.

No other skyline can do it like this one. The iconic New York skyline is like no other and on every visit gives the excitement goosebumps when it comes into full view and you start to pick out each of the landmark skyscrapers. It is well worth doing some of the harbour cruises or heading to Staten Island to look across at the skyline.

A picture is worth a 1,000 words. We've all seen shots of the Manhattan skyline in movies and TV shows but drinking in the lights at night in person is so much better. I just made my third trip to New York and for some reason, this time I fell in love with it. It is a busy, noisy city that vibrates with excitement. Such lovely people and so many wonderful places to visit both off and on the beaten track. I can't wait to go back.

Must see!. The Manhattan Skyline is the ultimate in skylines. It is so sad that the Twin Towers no longer exist as they'd defined Manhattan. Regardless, flying into Newark airport or other airports is still the ultimate city experience.
A view to die for!. This was the most spectacular view through my New York trip. The best time is to go around dawn and watch it light up.

Always Impressive. NYC's skyline NEVER fails to disappoint!! Sunshine, overcast, nighttime, shrouded in fog it is always a breathtaking view from the moment you first see it either flying in or driving in on the NJ side.
Everything you wished it would be. The best way to see the skyline is on the sightseeing boat which gives you excellent views. Also from the rock.
Sightseeing. Can't leave New York with doing a cruse around its majestic skyline. Truly awesome. One of the best in the world.
Nice skyline. Bring a ton of extra space for digital photos as you'll find yourself taking picture after picture of buildings / skyline / and other sites.
Beautiful. Manhattan skyline visible from across the river or from one of the many boats / ferries you can pay to go on, on the river.

View from Union City or Hoboken is spectacular. Our apartment in Union City had a perfect balcony view of the Manhattan Skyline. I highly recommend staying that side of the Hudson, it's only about 7 mins by bus through the Lincoln tunnel to the port authority in Manhattan

Awesome New York.. New York city never sleeps -very true it sure is.As suggested by Kazan from Russia going across the Hudson river is good idea. Since everyone goes to WTC memorial, take the path train to Hoboken from the WTC station. The Hoboken path station is on the waterfront. Enjoy the Mahattan skyline from the waterfront park or from any of the many waterfront restaurants. o

When you see it for real!. When you see something that is so familiar to you through movies, pictures and other sources for the very first time in real life, it generally disappoints you since it does not add up to the huge expectations you have built in your mind. But Manhattan skyline was an exception for this, for me. Although the twin towers were sadly absent, one world center, empire state building and the chrysler building more than makes up for it. Although I got to see it from NJ shoreline, the elevated highline, the best view was the staten island ferry!

What a diversity of NYC archetectures, what a diversity of folks living in or working at these locales.... The variety and history of players involved in the building and use of these buildings is truly mind expanding and intriguing, besides the facts involved with each structure, its owners, its purposes, and how well each one served its mission!
Man-Made Wonder. Stunning and amazing for those of us who do not live in a city! One of the reasons to visit...so impressive and beauty in concrete and steel and glass!
Amazing view! . Great views across the Manhattan skyline when you take the ferry to Staten Island. It's free and there's a great bar over the other side to take some great pictures.
Wow what a way to view NYC. Viewing the skyline is a magnificent vision. Dynamic and exhillarating. Caption of view from anywhere in this fab town.
amazing. This a great view and the best place to see it is from liberty island. worth the boat ride across the island just to see the skyline.
Always love this view!!!. By day, or by night...it is gorgeous! A must see! Everyone who loves the city will definitely love Manhattan!

BEST FREE THING TO DO IN NYC. The best view of manhattan skyline can be viewed from 2 places. First from the main street park in Brooklyn DUMBO and second is from the Gantry plaza park in Long Island city. The best view is from the evening time.
Beautiful skyline!. We took a boat ride to see the skyline. It's very pretty! The skyline is varied depending on which part of the city you are able to get a picture of.
Spectacular. Simply amazing, I must have taken hundreds of photos on my trip but never got tired of looking at the skyline from different parts of the city. Simply iconic.
Took tons of pictures. We went out on the water taxi to get a better view of this and it was totally worth it. I took tons of pictures and they turned out great.
Clipper trip. We used our New York pas for a 90 minute trip out to See the Statue of Liberty looking back to the Manhattan skyline was awsome.
iconic. This was an amazing sight well worth experiencing. We went on the circle route boat trip to witness the skyline and it didn't disappoint!

A must see in New York. The ferry to Staten Island provides a magnificent view of lower Manhattan Skyline. The ride is free. No one visiting New York City should miss this great view. Make sure you stay on the back of the boat going to Staten Island and reverse when coming back.
What a Vista. From the top of the new one world trade centre tower we got some fantastic views, rent the video tablet and listen to the guides.

Beautiful . The skyline has been the background of movies for almost a century and is both stunning and ever changing. The Empire State Building and Chrysler Building are awe inspiring, as is Central Park.
A place to be!!!. It is definitely a place to be in! The tall skyline of New York including the Empire State Building is a place to enjoy.

Energy generator. Just looking at this skyline injects energy. Within such a small space sooooo much goes on, sooooo many decisions are made and life is fast. The skyline changes through the day and weathers. By night the lights create a twinkling sparkling vision of fun. However beneath all of this is a sadness that was more evident than ever, poverty and the juxtaposition of the rich and poor. The homeless disabled and sick left on the street doors of the mansion blocks of the privledged.

Breathtaking experience!. Visiting New York this is a must-see attraction. Walking among skyscrapes might be a good experience, but you'll never get a full impression of Manhattan if you don't see its skyline. Sure, the best way to observe the Manhattan skyline is taking a helicopter tour, but it is rather expensive for an ordinary tourist. So we'd recommend taking a boat trip around Manhattan (by the way, bus tour companies usually offer a complimentary boat tour tickets) or visiting townships of New Jersey along the Hudson shore (e.g. Weehawken, Hoboken, etc.). Bus tickets to New Jersey cost 3 dollars/person, the buses usually start on 42 Street and then through Lincoln Tunnel to Boulevard East and further (depends on bus route, ask the driver). Then you hop-off on any bus stop there and have a nice walk observing the skyline of Manhattan.
What a sky line......... Whether its from the air, sea, land or outside bar its fab! You will find your self constantly looking at a different view! I think from a boat in the harbour is my fav!!

A Variety of Vantage Points. We captured several photos of the remarkable skyline from the Statue of Liberty, the New World Trade Centre and the Brooklyn Bridge. All have their own perspective and advantages.
Amazing . Amazing view the skyline of Manhattan at night or day !! The skyline is more amazing if you are from other countries that the skyline of cities are very lower.

Breathtaking. In our taxi from the airport I was very excited to see the New York City skyline and it did not disappoint. I'd been waiting to see this skyline since I was 11 and I couldn't believe I was actually there. The best view of the skyline for me was from the water taxi on our way to the Statue of Liberty. You get a real feel of how big Manhattan is. The skyline is just as beautiful at night as it is in the day.

View by water, Land and high rises. The great city of New York has an incredible skyline. It was great to be able to see it from our boat, the bus tour in daylight and evening tour from Top of the Rock and View at the Marriott Marquis.You can't mistake the New York skyline. A couple of new high rises have been completed and changing the skylines look a little more since my visit 3 years ago.
Lovely walk in the afternoon sun. Great walk high above the noisy streetsLots to see and great views of the Hudson RiverSeveral seating benches allow you to rest when you need to
One of the most impressive views. One of the most impressive man-made vistas on the planet...Great views from the air, flying in a helicopter.

Nothing else like it anywhere.. Manhattan is surrounded by water. Take any street and walk all the way west or all the way east and you will see a wonderful sight..Millions of people at work and play and the water has the same energy. So nice.
See it from both sides. We saw the skyline from the ferry to Staten Island at late afternoon and from Rockefeller's from above. After this you know you've been in NY. Great views, awesomeness.
It is a thrill to see from the ferry.. A picture taking moment for so many, for when you get to Battery Park and board the ferry for The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, the skyline is terrific.

Cityline Cruise for 2 hours is the best of NYC.. Enjoyed the trip and narrator on our 2 hour voyage on a 7PM cruise. The only issue was the patrons, who despite being told repeatedly to sit in their seats OR go downstairs for standing at the bow and rails for great pictures. These idiots wanted to sit, until they felt the need to record or snap photos with their IPAD, phone or professional camera, blocking the view of every other person who was seated. They serve drinks on the boat and the return trip, gives all the splendor of sunset and a lighted Manhattan skyline.

a great view,a unique picture!. this is a stunning view,breath taking,not because of where it is,but it has it own unique thing like an attraction that is created by nature,even though it is man made and made of concrete!!it has to be seen from the water to get it's beauty and scale.
Amazing!. So many different views from so many angles you'd be spoils for photograph opportunities. A must see attraction for any visitor.

Wow!. First saw the skyline from the yellow cab we got from JFK. Again the next day from the Staten island ferry. We walked the Brooklyn bridge from Brooklyn with fabulous views of Manhattan on the way over, it just has the Wow factor whenever you see it.

Simply a must!. I flew by helicopter over and around Manhattan, and got the best view possible! All the famous buildings, 5th Avenue, Broadway, Central Park... everything you've ever seen on film - as you saw it on film. I don't really like big cities - but it is undeniably an experience of a lifetime!
Breathtaking!. We saw this view from daytime harbour cruises, night time harbour cruises and a nice taxi driver who stopped on a trip to New Jersey.

Stunning . There are many ways to view the skyline, all very impressive, from small churches and dwellings to the breathtaking world trade 1 observation deck.take a river cruise,skyline views from many varied angles.
Amazing. The Manhattan skyline is pretty amazing, in the day time it looks very average, but night time is very magical to see all the glitz shine on the skyline.

Love looking at the Manhattan Skyline!. We spent some time during our visit in Brooklyn and then in New Jersey right on the Hudson and I just couldn't take my eyes off of the skyline our whole visit. Just spectacular day or night. And you can view it for FREE...

Go to Brooklyn Bridge Park at Sunset!. The best views of the Manhattan skyline can be found at Brooklyn Bridge Park. Get there for the 'blue hour' (just before Sunset) and stake your claim to a prime place for the greatest show in NYC. Things change rapidly with the falling sunlight - an absolute spectacle.

Yep - It is Majestic - Man's Desire to Build. One of the best cityscapes to be seen in the world. Breathtaking, awe insipiring, tragic all at the same time. See it by day, by dawn, by night - all three experiences are different. Best for me was from the Brooklyn Bridge.
Best Views from Brooklyn Heights. Take the subway to Brooklyn and walk on the Brooklyn Heights Promenade for the best views of the Manhattan Skyline over the water.
Yeah.... Yeah...really, if you are in NYC, you should make the most of it, check out what this city is famous for.
The best views are from the river.. We were lucky to have a sunny Circle line cruise around Manhattan island. Great views of Manhattan skyline and many other buildings and bridges along the way.

Empire State Building (Best Viewing). We scheduled a visit to the Empire State Building using the Express Lane option and were brisked to the 86th floor ahead of the crowds...that's the way to go.From that level, I believe you get the "best view" of Manhattan from north to south and east to west, because you are in the middle of Manhattan...a 360 degree view of the entire city!! The 911 Freedom Tower gives you a view, however it only gives you a view from the southern tip of Manhattan...not a 360 degree view showing "all" of the highlights of the city!!!

A view to remember . We have visited a few times and we're still in awe at the skyline.You will end up with a stiff neck walking around looking at the skyline we all recognise from so many movies.The new One World Trade Centre is a sad bud stunning addition to the skyline..The usual favourites such as the Rock or Empire building are a must also

Excelent view and you can get it from brooklyn. Stunning views that could see clearly after crossing the bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn .. nothing you should pre-plan for, just go to the beautiful Brooklyn and get the views out of your list

An Oasis in the City. On an Island of 2 Million this is yet another Oasis of a city the just seems to manage to create space from no where. This is a delightfull place to iether have a pleasant stroll or go for a short run. You can also stop off at a number of streets to either visit a restaurant or go shopping. The garden space are well maintained and some of the views are worth stopping at to take that iconic photo of NY.
Famous in the world. Manhattan skyline is famous all over the world. Can be seen from the boats, from other quartiers. Choose your ....

Touching the sky. An amaIng view. I like looking at skyline from the ferry and have the feeling that if we are strong enough in our thoughts we can touch the sky in our every field we wish to. Sky is not the limit for any success.Get inspiring and do go for ferry ride.

WOW!. View it from Brooklyn bridge. We walked twice, once in the evening in the dark and during the day but make sure you get the subway over to brooklyn and walk back as you are always looking at the view, plus its less busy to start off.
Beautiful NYC Manhattan Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is a beautiful sight. We took photos and my wife and I basked in each others company under the beauty of the great view.

Skyline of New York. How can you not say anything but amazing about NY skyline. Growing up in Brooklyn looking @ the changes over the years. Still my favorite skyline. The Sept before 9/11 we were in the building and really able to see the lay out of the city. It was amazing
Love NY city

No Better City. Let's face it, there is no better city to visit in the world. One of its great advantage is that it's an island. There are five boroughs that make up New York City but my focus is Manhattan, my home town. When arriving you should opt for a bridge over a tunnel to get that first view of its splendor, unless you are flying and have a window seat on the "right side" then take a Circle Line boat tour, a Roosevelt Island Tram ride, a Staten Island ferry or enjoy a riverside dinner, in Queens or Brooklyn, with a view. Don't forget the Empire State Building or Freedom Tower 1776 feet above lower Manhattan).

The Manhattan Skyline is renewed yearly!. I have been living in Manhattan since 1997 and cannot believe how its skyline changes every year. So if you haven't been to NYC in several years you must come back just to see some of the new skyscrapers. The best way to see the city is from a distance. One excellent way is to take a ride on the East River Ferry starting from its terminal at 35th street on the East River. It makes various stops and goes down the length of Manhattan to the Wall Street area. Then ride the Staten Island Ferry back and forth along New York Harbor. Both of these alternatives are relatively inexpensive ways to see the skyline.
An amazing view. You can get a great view of this skyline from the free Staten Island Ferry.There is no other view like this any where in the world.
Amazing View. Get the free boat to staten Island. You will see this amazing view more clearly from afar. You get to see Eilis Island and Liberty Island on the boat ride.
Day or night. Walk over Brooklyn Bridge or subway brilliant at night beautiful during the day, got to view from Brooklyn

Just go over the river. Travel over the river to NJ and you may enjoy a wonderful view! You can picknick there when you buy some food and drinks on the way or just freely walk around the river shore of NJ and see the fascinanting views...
Great skyline. This skyline is beautiful I love how I got to see this the skyline is amazing and when you see it from a far away it is great I highly recommend seeing this.

View from DUMBO . Go to Brooklyn and walk the park under the Manhatten and Brooklyn bridge. Absolutely a gorgeous view. There are many places to stop for pics and a bite to eat. Great view of Manhatten. Can't be beat.
NICE. The skyline is like no other worth a look at least. It is best to see from Brooklyn or New Jersey. Manhattanhenge is fun to see to - look it up if you don't know what it is.

City so nice they named it twice. New York, New York. I'm a native New Yorker. Born and raised in the city. It's interesting that being a native and living here most of my life I have this infatuation and desire to venture out and look for new and different shops, restaurants, buildings and neighborhoods. So many attractions, things to see. The people, so many different ethnicities and cultures. It's great..come visit..I LOVE NEW YORK.

Secret to the best view of Manhattan. Very few people know this but the absolute best view of Manhattan is on the Brooklyn Bridge. It takes a bit if getting there, but consult your subway guide and take the subway downtown to the Manhattan side of the Brooklyn bridge. Then time your trip to be on the bridge at sunset. It will take your breath away.

Historic and refreshing. It is a very good example of how urban architecture can deal with its own degradation. Fine recovery of "lost" bits of the city, its past activities and capacity for renewal. An extremely enjoyable walk!

Amazing. The view of the Manhattan skyline from the Empire State Building is just amazing .We visited one very cold but sunny day in February and the view was brilliant.The 360 degree view gave us a great idea of the beautiful skyline and a lively clear view right down the river

Unmistakable. The Manhattan skyline is another feature synonymous with New York and is easy to view In many ways. We took pictures from our boat trip to the Statue of Liberty but reasonable shots could be obtained from the Staten Island Ferry which is free. It's up to you but find some way of overlooking the view, it's very rewarding

The Manhattan Skyline: Classic. No need to say much more than the title. Don't come to NYC and only visit the bowels. You need to stand back from it too, versus total emersion. The skyline is great seen from shorelines, boats, bridges, plane or helicopter. It's good by day but especially impressive at night.
enjoy!. There are many places from where you can enjoy the breathtaking views of Manhattan skyline: river cruise, Brooklyn Bridge, Roosevelt Island and many more. Don't miss it, it's a must!

Breathtaking view. When visiting NYC, you do not have to miss the Manhattan skyline. It is so magical and timeless, it constantly changes but its uniqueness remains. You can choose to see it from the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge or from a helicopter.

View from Greenpoint Brooklyn. Take the E train from midtown Manhattan, switch to the G train at Court Square and get off at Nassau Avenue. This is a lovely neighbourhood to wander through as you head west to the river. Here you get a beautiful panoramic view of Manhattan. You can return to Manhattan on the subway or catch the East River Ferry.

Beautiful and forever changing. Probably one of the most recognizable skylines in the World. The Manhattan skyline is impressive. The Empire State Building takes its rightful place in the middle of the skyline with the Freedom Tower further downtown and Midtown with all its skyscrapers. There are also new buildings popping up which will change the skyline.
Beautiful view. We got to see this beautiful skyline from the ferry from Ellis island. It was spectacular and it was a clear day, so you could see everything.

Nothing beats this view. Staying on the river in NJ, nothing beats this gorgeous daytime or even better, nighttime view! Even got to see the Empire State in red, white, and blue for Memorial Day. Very nice.
I <3 NY. It's classic, it's beautiful, it's free and you can even choose from where the view is better: from the statue? Brooklyn? On the cruise boats?

Honeymoon . We took a night cruise, 2 hours long so we got a sunset and lights. Loved it, wish I it hadn't been so cold had to come inside and lost my place for better pictures but would definitely recommend taking a night cruise. Also took a helicopter ride and that was fun but the cruise was my favorite.

Love this city. The first time we went to NYC, we stayed in Jersey City with a view of the Hudson and NYC. Just awesome. We've walked the Brooklyn Bridge and it's such an incredibly scene as you walk toward Manhattan. You've seen this skyline in so many shows and movies. You feel like you KNOW it. It makes me sad when I leave every time as I feel like I'm saying goodbye to a good friend.
Good . A boat trip was part of a local tour we had booked so seeing the Manhattan skyline was good for photo opportunities.We were also able to take pictures of the Brooklyn bridge and skyline.

The Best. Pictures do do it justice...it's truly the best. Get the impressive firsthand concrete and glass jungle feel with incredible magnitude and depth. It does not disappoint. It's great to drive into the city and see the skyline in the distance beckoning, from downtown to midtown...most impressive.
Amazing. Amazing, especially from a helicopter or from the Hudson River on a boat, either from Liberty Island or further.

Picture perfect. When we visited the Statue of Liberty we were sure to choose a clear day as you want to take pictures of the skyline from the Island towards Manhattan. There is picture of the Manhattan skyline before 9/11 - it is really sad but important to remember the tragedy of 9/11 and the people who lost their lives. If you stand next to that picture, the skyline of Manhattan makes for the perfect backdrop for your picture, you can even see the Brooklyn Bridge from the Island.
Ferry . Take the staten island ferry, for free, best way to get a view of this great city. The new one world trade center also has a great view but for that you will have to pay.
Breathtaking. No matter where u look from the views of the skyline are breathtaking and impressive. I thought London was 'high' but not a patch on this city which seems to be growing taller.

Unique skyline that's a must see in person. The NYC skyline is awesome from many different vantage points and is a must see. The skyscrapers in the city are so unique. Mets stadium offers a really neat sunset shot. Flying in and out of JFK gives a great perspective. The Staten Island ferry is another great vantage point.
What a view. Get on a boat and head out across the bay. Make sure you have your camera with you to capture the view back. Truly stunning.
Great views. It took us about 30-45 mins to walk the whole thing and was lovely, you get some great views overlooking Jersey and a little bit of history about the walkway as well.
Great Sight. Best seen from Brooklyn, you can sip wine somewhere or go to a park and catch the view. Look from the Battery up north, bridges sparkle at night.
Super skyline, city that never ever sleeps. Great views in day as well as night Excellent views if the water from and skyscrapersJust awesome and inspiring

Went with a travel group on World Yacht. World Yacht is the best way to have a great meal and see New York/New Jersey highlights by water including the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island.A new concept called floating restaurants do 90 minute cruises in the harbor while you eat lunch or dinner. No charge to board only to buy your drink and what you want to eat. They have great choices and there are two floating restaurants to choose from.

An Incredible View. To really appreciate how big and beautiful Manhattan is, you have to see it from a distance. If you don't want to go to Jersey, taking a cruise is a nice alternative. The skyline is simply incredible and I could look at it for hours. A must-see.
Breathtaking . We had an amazing view from our 42nd room of the Manhattan skyline to include the Empire State Building and the new One World Trade Centre

Stunning from any angle. We first caught a glimpse as we were landing in JFK (we were sat on the right hand side of the plane).
The view from the Brooklyn side of the East river was great but the best view was from the front of the (free) Staten Island ferry on the return trip to Manhatten...A real jaw dropper.
Buildings eveywhere. We saw the sky line from several vantage point. All venues make you feel small and aware of how big the world really is.

Gorgeous . Check out dumbo meaning down under Manhattan bridge overpass. Reminded me of shoreditch a lot. Arty sort of place, great views of the city again, cute carousel in the middle of the place. Night time is stunning!

marathon weekend visit. this iconic skyline can only be fully appreciated from a distance. My advice is to take a circle line boat trip around the whole of Manhattan to get every perspective possible. Alternatively a trip to the Statue of Liberty will give you the famous view of the downtown skyline
Miss the twin towers . It's substitute will always be a reminder of the Twins they replaced and what that day meant to all of us.

Brilliant. Either beside the water or on it......a treat for all. Beautiful views and fabulous walks. A must for everyone who visits the city. Plenty of space to sit and chill, eating, playing and having fun.
Jewel. Head over to New Jersey, reserve a window table at Molos Restaurant and watch the sun set on the Manhattan Skyline. Delicious food and outstanding view!
This Skyline Is Beautiful!. We did a hop on hop off tour at nite and was able to witness this Skyline during sunset it was breath taking. I loved the tour, skyline, and the city.

A view that one should never tire from seeing.. The view of the Manhattan skyline is never tiring yet it is always changing. I have been blessed by having the skyline always in my memory or available to view in person. I am partial to the view from New Jersey especially from Sinatra Drive in Hoboken, also from Liberty State Park in Jersey City, and from Boulevard East in Weehawken & West New York. Each site has a special point of view one focuses on midtown, another on the towers of Wall St & WTC, while another looks south upon the harbor from the palisades. The views are breath taking and unforgettable.

Brilliant views from the ferry. We went on the ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and were so very lucky with the weather, it was a fabulous day and the views were crystal clear. The ferry is definately the best way to see the skyline.
Drems come true!!!!. The landscape is great! you feel you are part of a movie, it is like a dream! Manhattan is so beautifull!!!!
Water taxi gives great view. If you take the water taxi to Hoboken and back to Wall Street you get the awesome view for the price of the ride.
Amazing. There's nothing else like this view. The city I come from has a few "tall" buildings. But it's absolutely nothing like New York City. Must see it to truly understand the size of this city!

Breathtaking Urban panorama-Manhattan. The view of Manhattan and New York city skyline from the New Jersey water front is simply awesome.The reflections in the water specially at night is magical.The view from exchange place, Jersey city,NJ was breathtaking.A must see place in new York.
Fab!!!. Just so lovely so breath taking!! New York is just so full of breath taking sky lines. Like a movie set but real. We love this place.

BRROKLYN BRIDGE WALK. We caught subway to Coney Island and then back again to Brooklyn. Hopped on the end of the Bridge and enjoyed the sights as we headed back to Manhattan. I had printed out the self-guided walk so my daughter narrated as we passed various points of interest.

See it from another state. The best place to view the Manhattan Skyline is from across the river in New Jersey. Took a ferry over and walked around the shoreline for 1/2 the day. The city is 'gentrifying' many areas and they look beautiful. Found Frank Sinatra Street, which my mother was excited about and ducked into a local cafe for a pick-me-up.During all my time in New York, I never saw a better view of the skyline than from the New Jersey side. It's worth a ferry trip to see.
Can't miss it. Spectacular - even on an overcast day. Best view we had was from the Top of the Rock. All 360 degrees of it.
Always interesting. Somewhat unique due to the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building architecture, however in recent years it has become too glassy and boxy.

There's a reason this skyline is often tauted. No matter the time of day or the angle from which you view., I never tire of this skyline and I have lived either in NYC or the suburbs all my life. One of the best ways to see it is crossing any one of the multitude of bridges or from the NJ waterfront across the Hudson River. It's a constantly changing skyline too. New buildings are constantly going up and if I'm not mistaken, some are even taller than the Chrysler Blgd or the Empire State! A few are even residential towers. I would say that the best view I ever had was at dawn as my cruise ship entered New York Bay. The lighting was such that he lower East River bridges and the Statue of Liberty were highlighted spectacularly.
Big Big City. I saw the Manhattan skyline from the State of Liberty and from a harbor cruise. I loved looking at the buildings in this big big city.

A million places to see it. I walked over the George Washington Bridge every day to New Jersey and the view there was particularly amazing. Brooklyn has a good view also - and I'm sure there's so many more.
Best views in town. A must is to walk from Brooklyn to Manhattan, hopefully at around 5ish for a beautiful view. Use comfortable shoes!

Fabulous sight. This is best viewed from either the ferry/boat trip or by walking onto the Brooklyn Bridge. Looking at the view you suddenly realise just how condensed Downtown Manhattan actually is. The boat trip is part of your Greyline open top tour ticket. The boat goes from Pier 11 and you can get off at Pier 78 if you choose.
Better at night. Can't deny it. It takes my breath away each time that I see it. Especially since I'm looking at it safely from New Jersey. Best time is any time of the year to get the true impact.
Best seen from Liberty Island!. If you find the time, take a boat-trip around Manhattan or go to Liberty Island to get the best view! Well worth a look. Especially on a warm, sunny day!
Amazing!. I work in the city, but love to play tourist. The skyline is so amazing. The architecture is great and varied.
Grt view. It's a amazing experience to see the skyline of NYC. It's very crowded with visitors. It can be best viewed from any location but the best place is New Jersey city to enjoy the view.

Breathtaking. Wherever you see it from it is amazing. Eather you are in Brooklyn, New Jersey or you took a ferry or tour to the statue of liberty, the view is unique. It is that signature view of NY that we all see on post cards. Many parts of Manhattan are man made and built additionally, it is still great to see.

Best viewed from Jersey City. the skyline is beautiful especially early in the morning or at sunset. The lower Manhattan skyline is brilliant View is also great from the Hudson ferries. It is ever changing and always interesting

A bonus for staying in New Jersey . We stayed in union city, which caused us more challenges than expected. Bus transport is available, but it is necessary to plan ahead, and it takes quite some time away from sightseeing every day. A positive side to that, was that we got to enjoy the west Manhattan skyline from the ferry when we crossed at night. A very beautiful sight indeed.
Mesmerizing. There is so much to observe from the buildings to water views. Every direction has its own unique view.

different looks at the skyline. The skyline of manhattan is so beautifull that you keep taking pictures! We made a walking trip from the Brooklyn boulevard and at that place the skyline of manhattan is also very beautyfull!

New York. A great place to visit and you should plan for lots of walking and plan carefully what you want to see. We bought the New York Pass which ended up as great value and encouraged us to do things we might otherwise not have done. New Yorkers are friendly and the place is safe. A little grubby in places, especially the metro.

Staten Island Ferry. There is a beautiful view that is free if you take the Staten Island Ferry. You will be close enough to get great shots of the Statue of Liberty and the skyline and it's one of the FREE things you can do!

Iconic skyline which is best viewed from the water.. If you do the Statue of liberty and Ellis Island trip then you get it thrown in from the ferry. Otherwise take the Staten Island Ferry for free for the same view. In both cases get a place at the back of the boat on the right hand side to be in the best vantage place.If visiting Ellis Island don’t forget to go into the gardens at the back of the main building as these afford excellent views of Manhattan as well.

What a skyline!. Take a tour to the top of one of the skyscrapers to get the full magnitude of the NYC skyline. So many tall buildings and great vistas. The advantage of seeing it from so high, like the Empire State Building, is not having to walk among the literally millions f people on the street below.

Amazing . More and more skyscrapers have filled in the skyline since my last visit to nyc. My favourite places to look at the skyline is at ground level ....from the reservoir in Central Park & also from the Staten Island ferry.

Manhattan Skyline. We visited Manhattan over a long weekend to see some sights and a couple of shows. The Manhattan skyline is unique. The few days we were there allowed us to see it in the rain, in an overcast cloudy sky, and in the sunshine. New York is New York. We always enjoy it whatever the weather.

Great view from many angles. Here's the thing-you can see many interesting views of the skyline from lots of different angles-many exceptional and picturesque! We had fun catching the view from all over Manhattan, the sky from plane, and New Jersey. I wanted to see it from Brooklyn, but we also caught in on the road from Laguardia. Great picture opportunities everywhere!

East Coast. Breathtaking view even though it was a cooler rainy day when we visited. Can't imagine the view on a clear sunny day.
The security folks were so fun and welcomed us well!
Manhattan Skyline. Awesome Manhattan skyline. Beautiful view especially on the Gray Line night tour, Jose was an amazing tour guide!

Impressive View. Our hotel across the Hudson was across the street from the NJ Transit stop that whisked us to Times Square every day. The ride afforded us a wonderful view of the skyline of NYC both during the day and in the evening and the views are very impressive.

Our wedding. We did the most amazing tour through grey line called night on the town. It went to meat packing district , then on to the ferry to view the skyline ,Brooklyn bridge, Statue of Liberty great pics of All. It's just a must to see either by ferry , or a walk across the Brooklyn bridge. Don't miss it!

The NY everyone wants to see... For those travelers who have not been to the Big Apple, there are few landmarks that witnessing live would either make their trip or end up disappointing. The Manhattan Skyline definitely does not upset. Even if it is a dark day with rain now and then, if the sight is clear not much would be taken from the beauty. As the tailors would say, the fabric is good..

Beautiful emblem of the U.S.A.. Flying in and out of New York is a special treat if you can see the Manhattan Skyline coming in. A bit of sadness to see the World Trade Center towers gone, but the new One World Plaza building is inspirational and a sign of hope.

iconic. It's the most famous skyline in the world. We saw it from all angles. From the top of the rock, empire state building. From a boat on the river and from a helicopter flight. Could look at it all day long
Nice view. The Manhattan skyline is iconic and it doesn't disappoint. Seeing it from the water and the Empire State building were both enjoyable.

Wow - neck srain!. Went up to the revolving restaurant in the Marriott Hotel on Broadway. The view is amazing - as are the cocktails. If you are there before 8pm it is cheaper but the cocktails are superb and the service matches this. Well worth the visit - one of the highlights of my trip

Manhattan. Breathtaking view! Manhattan - The city to be in!
You can see it a hundred times from from Brooklyn, New Jersey or even the Staten Island ferry, sunrise or sunset, it is always awesome

Iconic views of Manhattan . The Manhattan skyline can be seen from a number of viewpoints that highlight its grandeur. Perhaps, my favorite is coming into the Holland Tunnel on the Lower West Side from the NJ side The skyline looks like a Wiz of Oz set. Another is from the Staten Island ferry which is a great choice at night and in good weather . A third is to stand at sunset or sunrise on one of the major avenues such as 42nd or 34th and look from east to west. Manhattan's unusual grid pattern allows the viewer to see from one side to the other in a virtual straight line . One of the simple pleasures of Manhattan.

Must see the city from the water!. Several options: boat ride around Manhattan, Staten Island Ferry, cross the Brooklyn Bridge. Boat ride is nice but the most expensive option. Staten Island Ferry is free and you'll pass Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. Walk or drive across the Brooklyn Bridge and spend some time in the park there on the Brooklyn side for great photo ops. And of course if you spend some time in Brooklyn, don't forget to have pizza there - it's a New York thing.
iconic skyline. Travelled by bus from Washington DC and your 1st glimpse of the big apple as you approach the city is that amazing skyline. Takes your breath away.
Awe some !!!!. just one word to say: "awe some!!!". Love this view, so romantic, unforgettable view in Manhatta. I will back with my love :D

one of a kind view. The Manhattan skyline always has been a sight to behold. Whether entering the borough from Queens, Brooklyn, New Jersey, the Staten Island ferry or flying over the city on take off from La Guardia - I am always amazed at how unusually dense the city is. The skyline shows a city thick with buildings that seem to poke up like matchsticks of varying sizes and shapes. It is always a wonder to imagine the millions of people that are buzzing around the city on any given day -- within those buildings as well as down amongst them. One should really gaze upon the skyline from one of these entryways at least once. After more than 30 years of entering and leaving its gateways, I still marvel at the the density of humanity making an effort to fit into the tiny strip of island, trying to make a go...

Best View. So i live in West New York, NJ and can view the NYC skyline from my balcony!! I live directly across from the cruise ship dock!! What a view. The skyline is everchanging and it is what makes New York, New York. But i can tell you it is worth a trip thru the Lincoln tunnel by car or bus (from Port of Authority bus terminal) to view the skyline from NJ. The bus #128, 166, 165 goes along John F. Kennedy Blvd. EAST!!! Many people take wedding, prom and above all sunset pictures of the view. When one experiences the sun setting with its' glow bouncing off the skyscrapers it's amazing!!! Something i never get tired of seeing!! If only they would bring the July 4th fireworks back to the Hudson River!!! .
Iconic views. Probably the most famous skyline on the planetFantastic views of world famous buildings, my favourite was the Chrysler building but the new freedom tower is excellent

Lives its reputation. Amazing pictures guaranteed. It's beautiful by day, when you're cruising on a ferry, but it's even more amazing by night when you can see all the lights on the buildings and really understand why NYC never sleeps !
Not the same without the Twin Towers. Seeing the skyline flying into JFK and driving around and from the Staten Island ferry and Empire State building is a good contrast.

Rise to New Heights. Make a trip to Hamilton Park in Weehawkin, New Jersey and you get a double bonus. You can stand on the actual site where Alexander Hamilton and Aaron Burr had their infamous duel and then you can take a look at the breathtaking vista that is the Manhattan Skyline.
Always pretty. Best place to see skyline is from LIC and B'klyn. Never fails to disappoint. Of course, nighttime is magical with all the lights!
