Nothing like it in the World!. If there is anyway that you can arrange a visit to a place where you can see the skyline in all its glory, DO IT! There is something magical that automatically make your heart go a bit faster and you r toes start to tingle. I grew up in New York, and one of the best ways to see the skyline is to take the Staten Island ferry to and from the tip of Manhattan, or to take a trip on the circle line boat ride. You cold also cross into Brooklyn and see it from the Brooklyn Heights promenade. I recently got a different perspective when I went over to Edgewater, NJ. It was awesome!
Amazing!. It's something you'll never forget! Simply amazing! It's everything that you've heard and more. We loved it!

Obviously amazing and a must-see!. You HAVE to view the skyline of Manhattan from Jersey City, Brooklyn, or from a ferry! It helps you appreciate the scope of the skyscrapers that you'll be walking between when you can see it from afar and take it in and soak in its entirety :)
Is there a better skyline on the planet?. Some would argue, some would agree. For me, there is nothing better. Seen from the air or from the Statue of Liberty park in NJ, the skyline is epic.

See the skyline at sunset from the water. We booked the sunset cruise on the Circle Line. Had a beautiful evening weather wise. Beautiful trip around Battery and the East River bridges. Don't think it would be nearly as enjoyable during rainy evening. Should arrive at pier plenty early so you can claim best seats on top deck in back of boat. Have coat during cooler months. You have ample opportunities for photography. Limited food and well worn ship's appearance and basic folding chair seating. Plan ahead for your transportation home since rarely are taxis found near pier area at night.

Sightseeing. We were so pleased to have booked the Helicopter ride ahead of visit. I was very apprehensive as I am not one for heights but would not of missed this once I had done it absolutely incredible.

Superb!. Just as I'd imagined it having seen it umpteen times in films. One of the best known skylines in the world and a truly cosmopolitan city. Worth seeing from either up one of the skyscrapers, walking over Brooklyn Bridge, by boat or helicopter....or all of them! Another must see in NYC.
Can't beat the view!. Took the free Staten Island Ferry just for fun and had a great view of Manhattan. Beautiful city to see from the water!
Nothing beats it!. I love this view. It has a little of everything; romance, bustle, passion, picturesque beauty. Try visiting during a sunrise or sunset. A must for the bucket list.

Cascade of lights. No more iconic skyline exists than Manhattan. This is the sight that people who were coming to America longed to see. By day it is like a forest of skyscrapers, by night it is a cascade of lights. Other Amerian cities have their high poingts, but none are high as Manhattan.

This view this wonderful memory. This view has to seen to be believed I took lots and lots of pictures if this view . I bought large pictures of this view for my house and it's my screen saver , I am going to return just to look at that view again

Fabulous From Every Angle!. Our hearts race every time we get our first glimpse of the city skyline. Whether heading in from New Jersey, catching a peak through the trees in Central Park or standing on the Brooklyn Bridge.
One World Observatory. Is a must. Going from level one to 104 in just 60 seconds is mind blowing. The view is breath taking. It is an experience you will never forget
Amazing. Can't beat this for best city skyline in the world. Take a helicopter ride up the Hudson for the best views it's certainly worth the money for the amazing experience.
Beautiful.. Beautiful view! Even on a cloudy and rainy day, it is still a wonderful sight to behold. Everyone should experience it!
It's what makes NY!. Best seen from Brooklyn (High street subway station), Statue of liberty island or Ellis island (South Ferry subway + ferry). Sunset are highly recommended.

This view is best seen from the ferry or from Brooklyn . If you take the East River ferry you can enjoy a beautiful view of Manhattan and if you get off in Brooklyn in Williamsburg or under the Manhattan Bridge overpass known as Dumbo from there you have a Instagram photo opportunity.

Great views from Brooklyn. We actually crossed the Brooklyn bridge by foot...best way but busy mid day. It was mentioned that over 190 thousand people cross the bridge every day? Great views of the Manhattan skyline.

Great Views from Statue of Liberty Boat. I found one of the best views of the Manhattan Skyline was from the boat you take to the Statue of Liberty. (And this view does not require you to go to the top of a building, if you are afraid of heights!)

One of the best skylines in the world. What a beautiful view. My wife and I stayed at a hotel in Long Island City. The view was unparralelled. There was a rooftop bar and the view from our room was breathtaking. They also had a free shuttle that dropped you off at Lexington and 59th. Z NYC.

Photo shoot. Took so many picture from so many different vehicles ie a clipper ship a speed boat a water taxi and our cruise ship NCL Breakaway as we set sail for Bermuda again try and get as many vies from as many forms of transport as possible.
just wow. how can you summarize the skyline...it is just amazing, even when its a bit cloudy outside. breathtaking views from the boats as well
Historic View. Seeing the Manhattan skyline from the harbor or when approaching from Queens or Brooklyn is an sight every American should see and one that has been seen by so many of our ancestors.
Huge buildings. I come from a small town and was somewhat overwhelmed by the towering buildings. The architecture was very mixed with a skyscraper sitting next to an antique church.
A great WOW. More skyscrapers by far. Viewed from the 7 line, the Staten Island ferry or the roof of the Met Museum, fair weather months [pay as little as you want to get in], fabulous
What you come to see. You can't help but admire the views here and the skyline is a memory you'll remember for a lifetime.

What you see is what you get.. The Hollywood perception of Manhattan Skyline at night with the 80's Sax music background is something that most of us grew up with. The same mental image that is presented to us with this skyline is associated with strong positive emotions, and that is the effect that the skyline had on me. Especially at night were the lights presented something magical in the dark NY night. If I had to one skyline to see in a lifetime it is this skyline. It defines the name skyline as it is.
Love the view! . We went on a water taxi and enjoyed the view. Took lots of pictures. Got sun burnt pretty bad. Really loved the skyline. Pretty special!
Boat ride. we could see this from our boat ride to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty awesome view it was a clear day got some great pic's
My favorite view . There is nothing like the Manhattan skyline . The first time you see it takes your breath away and it continues to do that every time.

Stunning! . One of the most stunning views is of the Manhattan skyline. Whether from the air or Hoboken it's so worthwhile. I saw it 20 years ago with the twin towers, it's interesting to see how it's changed in all those years. An architectural dream.

Stunning. We visited in March and the scenery is a photographers dream especially at night.
Beautiful high rise buildings and the view of the Hudson is just great.
Loved every minute of our holiday.

It's one of the few man-made majestic views you'll see. When you imagine all of the meetings, interactions, business deals, meals, etc. that are happening in that picture, it fills you with a vibe that's hard to resist (and why would you?) It's such a beautiful place, it's like capturing "life" in a photo. The skyline means a lot more (to me) after visiting many different parts of NYC. It's then that you feel like "yes, that is the snapshot of everything I experienced!"

Love the View of the Manhattan Skyline from the Air!. Just flew in and out of Newark. It always thrills me to see the skyline and Statue of Liberty off the lower end of Manhattan. I miss the Twin Towers, but am grateful that the attack, which terrorists thought would break us, did the opposite! God Bless America. Land of the Free and Home of the Brave!

Simply Amazing. When you see the Manhattan Skyline for the first stand, you will stand in awe and remember all the movies that picture this iconic scene. From Brooklyn you get spectacular views of the Statue of Liberty and of all Manhattan skyline (including the World Trade centre, Empire state and Chrysler building).
Very cool! Take a nighttime tour . Just very cool, take a night time tour to Brooklyn and look at the sky line from there. During the day it's nice but I really like it at night with all the lights.

Amazing to See. Whenever you get a chance in New York, make sure to try and get up to the roof of various buildings (be it One World, Top of the Rock, etc.). Any of these will let you see the amazing skyline that is so iconic!

Manhattan´s Stunning Scenery. Enjoyed the magnificent and stunning scenery of the Manhattan Skyline by taking the Best of New York Cruise with Circle Line Cruises. Such an enjoyable and informative 2.5 hours on a lovely sunny Sunday morning. So many different scenes and buildings (some quite hidden but with a good zoom camera you can get fantastic shots)

Breathtaking . When you see the sky line for the first time it's amazing I have seen it alot on the TV but it's great to see it for real we did a night bus tour to get some great photos at night it looks completely different at night

It was like a dream seeing it for the first time. We came to the city in a taxi and the skyline was breathtaking when we saw it for the first time. Felt like we were in a movie. There is no other view in the word that is so iconic and well known.

Brilliant. Go to Brooklyn with metro and admire the view at night !!
It really is stunning and very much worth the trip.

The unfortunate unplanned Manhattan Skyline. After spending a wonderful weekend in NYC (I was born in NYC and lived in Rockaway Beach), I realized how horrid the skyline looks up close and from afar. The mirror gold glass buildings of the Trump Towers is a vision of absurdity and a glaring monstrosity. The blue glass buildings remind me of my insurance card. As I was walking the streets and avenues I could not help but think of NYC at the turn of the century into the 1940s. The old brownstones.and the now 'midsize' high rise building. The Dakota, Empire State, Chrysler, Metropolitan Life Ins., One Grand Central, Woolworth, Wall Street, the beautiful stonework and cooper details, gold leaf of the almost gone old buildings. The future of the skyline? Can it really get any worse? Bring your sunglasses.
Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan. A walk across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn is the best way to see Manhattan skyline at it's best. well worth doing and it's FREE!!
amazing. when you visit new york you most go there to see the real beutiful city from the top. do not miss that view
Justifiably World Famous. Surely one of the world's top skylines and well worth a trip out of Manhattan (either east or west) to look back and reflect on the city that never sleeps.

No one ever comes away disappointed. Where ever you go, whoever you meet will likely tell you that NYC is the most interesting place on earth. I lived there, I hate it, I love it and i go back frequently - it's the center of the universe.
Iconic. One of the best known skylines n the planet, it was so cool to see it in real life. Have some good memories of my own now.
Beautiful at night!. See it from the water or from Brooklyn or the Brooklyn bridge. A must see when you are in New York!!

Staten Island Ferry View. It is what it is...an amazing skyline. Whether seen from the Queensborough Bridge or the Staten Island Ferry (we saw both), it truly is an amazing sight--especially at night.

From Brooklyn the view is breathtaking!. No doubt from any direction the Manhattan Skyline is beautiful beyond words. From a harbor tour boat or from the free Ikea ferry, one feels like being in the midst of a 3D painting. Really, a highlight of my trip!
Amazing . Love NYC cannot wait to return! It was our honeymoon and I will always have a special place in my heart for New York.

Manhattan from NJ is the best spot for viewing. You will never see the Manhattan skyline in Manhattan. You have to zip over to Jersey to get those sweeping movie skylines with the buildings reflected in the water. There are some great (and pricey) restaurants but the view is worth the price even if the food isn't....

See it from Jersey, Brooklyn, Queens or Staten Island and it will alway give you goose bumps. There are other great skylines but not with the history of this one. You won't be disappointed. Sunrise from Jersey and Sunset from Brooklyn. Words can't describe the feeling.
Skyscrapers. An amazing sight at any time but particularly on a sunny day. See it from the water for the best view.

One of the best skyline in the world. Manhattan consist of many tall and beautiful building makes one of the best skyline in the world. Most promising and beautiful part of skyline lies in lower Manhattan. Skyline can be seen from different parts of city. One of my favorite is from Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge. After WTC, now World trade center is the highlight of skyline.From Photography point of view, you can enjoy the skyline from East river side, West side, From Brooklyn Bridge and from Exchange plaza place. I loved the skyline and if I Visit again nearby NY then I will visit NYC again for just beautiful architecture of skyline
Fabulous scene. The skyline is fabulous. Great for pictures. There are not many cities that can compare with this view.

Simply Nothing Else Like It. Personally, the Manhattan Skyline is my favourite when viewing from a 10th floor + rooftop in Harlem (see attached picture). But, regardless of where you're capturing a view of this magnificent city, you just cannot go wrong!It's truly a testament to the hundreds of years and billions (if not trillions of dollars) that have gone into the architectural design and development of the concrete jungle. Truly a must see bucket list destination for any and everyone!
Skyline. Its exciting when you arrive and see the iconic skyline, you don't realise how much is packed in until you are their
Beautiful and sad. Always beautiful to see, but also very sad after 9/11. Breaks my heart every time I look at the skyline. Changed forever. We will never forget.

Best views from Brooklyn or the Staten Island ferry. The views of the skyline from Brooklyn or the State Island ferry are amazing. Most visitors to NYC tend to stay around midtown. It's a must to go explore.
Great experience. Lovely walk enabling you to see lots , great photo opportunities along the route . Ended up walking to Grenitch village lovely shops , cafes and restaurants

what a view. When visiting New York, try to book an hotel with high level rooms, we may be lucky enough to enjoy a beautiful view on Manhattan skyline. If jetlaged, do not miss the sun rise on the building with bequtful colour reflecting on skyscrapers ; it is magic :)

It is there for all to see. Viewed it from a cruise trip and from the Staten Island Ferry and it is truly a fine sight indeed and it is all that you have ever seen in the films and photographs.
A fine sight.
stunning. took the 7:30pm tour on the big bus, was perfect time for those pictures going across the bridge then looping back. Looked like a post card.

Don't Miss -A waterfront view from Astoria or Long Island City is spectacular.. Personally I prefer the Long Island City or Astoria views of the skyline. Come down to Hallets Cove (nearest subway is N or Q to Broadway and transfer to Q104, or another view is from the 7 train to Hunters Point and walk to Gantry Park. You can also get great views from Astoria Park, but its a walk along Hoyt Avenue from Astoria Blvd (N or Q) subway to the waterfront.Note the waterfront along Broadway, and 31st Avenue is going through a major transformation. There is free kayaking at the weekend at Hallets Cove on Sundays. Oh and for those who like to shop, checkout Costco on the waterfront. FYI there will be a ferry service between downtown Manhattan and Astoria starting in 2017, or you can currently take a ferry from mid-town to Long Island City (Gantry Park) and catch the 7 train back to the city. Non US tourists -these locations mentioned offer some hidden gems of NYC and fantastic views of the Manhattan skyline. You should definitely not passed up. All Astoria and Long Island City locations are with 20-30 minutes of the city. You can also visit a Japanese garden at the The Noguchi Museum, and stroll in Socrates Sculpture Park and relax at Hallets Cove, just to name a few attractions along the waterfront.

Iconic. How can you not see this when you travel to New York? It's a little eerie though when you see it for the first time. It's in so many movies and TV series. The history and the sheer volume of people that come here to see the skyline really awes you.

Not really an attraction. This is difficult to rate, since it's not really an attraction. However, it is one of the most recognized city skyline in the world, so if you can view it, it's amazing. The best place (other than New Jersey) is on Staten or Liberty Island.
Always impressive!. Whether you fly in from Europe or sail up to Brooklyn on the QM2, the Manhattan skyline is always an exciting spectacle!
Great to walk of lunch :). This is a very short walk and perfect to enjoy after lunch or before dinner. Great to get away from the traffic and the path is so clean and tidy. Really lovely highlight.

Cool place for a morning jog, afternoon lunch date or evening stroll. What a fun place. Step out of the city hurley burley and grab a quick bite overlooking the awesome Hudson River. Take a break in the middle of your business day and sit down and smell the wild flowers. Stroll down the narrow path and just enjoy the views. What a wonderful hidden, city jewel.

Best looking City in the World. When the sun goes down and the stars come out a beautiful vista presents itself. You can enjoy the skyline from many vantage points. A good start is from the Brooklyn Heights walk. You will dsee the lower part of the city. You can also view the skyline from several high restaurants and bars such as the Penninsula Hotel. For those who like the water there are cruises which cirfcle the island of Manhattan. You can also view the beauty of the skyline from the top of the Empire State building or the "Top of the Rock" in Rockefeller Center. You will be impressed by the lights of the city. You can also view a variety of architecural designs of the buildings. In the day time you can also see the sights by just walking along some of the avenues or going to the high buildings. A new addition is the Freedom Towers observation tower at the World Trade Center. From here you can see all the way to Central park.
Manhattan Skyline from the Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island. you will have the best view of Manhattan Skyline from the Liberty Island where the Statue of Liberty is located and from the Ellis Island.

Simply the best. There is a reason why the manhattan skyline is so well know worldwide, well it is because it is really amazing. You will love it in the daylight, at night, in a rainy, sunny, snowy day. You just gonna love it

Spectacular . Greatest thing we did. Absolutely fantastic
Breathtaking views. If you go to new York. You have to do this

who doesnt want to see the manhattan skyline?. go out in a ferry on a nice day on the west side and take a spin around manhattan.....fabulous....you can also rent a bike or do a bike tour with get up and ride on s3 st in williamsburg of the brooklyn waterfront and see manhattan from there....both ways are great....i loved the get up and ride tour.....biking and eating.....
See it from Brooklyn. Brooklyn was awesome, you gotta walk the Brooklyn Bridge and have the best Pizza at Grimaldis (the large white building on the corner), get there early or be prepared to queue

Manhattan's Skyline--Where and HOw. Seeing Manhattan's skyline is important and delightful, but it becomes better when you know how, when and where to do the viewing, especially when it's free.  Here are some viewing tips from a life-long New Yorker:1. If you are coming into town from one of the airports, take the time to look:a. from Newark, there are some great views looking eastward across the Hudson, especially from Hoboken just before you go in or out of the Lincoln Tunnelb. Coming accross the Triboro Bridge from Kennedy or LaGuardia Airports--or to them--you have some great views of Manhattan from the East Sidec. An even better view is from the 59th Strteet Bridge (Queensboro Bridge) made famous by the Simon-Garfunkel song;d. Another great view is coming into Manhattan from the LIE (Long Island Expressway--495) coming into the MIdtown Tunnel2. If you are in Brooklyn, there are great views of Manhattan and Financial District from the south, viewed from Park Slope and the Heights3. Inside Manhattan, the views from Freedom Center and other buildings near Ground Zero give some beautiful views of the syline, along with explanations4. Another great set of views is from the Empire State Building at 34th and Fifth Ave.5. A great and unusual view is from the Whitney Museum outside cafe at just below W 14th Street6. A smaller but more charming view is from Sheep Meadow in Central Park, looking south at Central Park South7. Other buildings which have great views include Rockefeller Center's various building, the Chrysler Building etc all around Midtown.8. If it's the Fourth of July, you want to be along Hudson or the East River for the Fireworks at Night, though you can also get some great night-time or day-time viewing from a helicopter ride, though it is expensive9. The Staten Island Ferry is one of the cheapest rides in NY, and it gives beautiful views of Manhattan, as does the more expensive Circle Line cruise around NY10. The view from the Statue of Liberty is the greatest view of NY
Impressive. You must have seen it a thousand times but there is no doubt about it, you have got to see the Manhattan Skyline in real life.
Bateaux Cruise. We did a Hudson River dinner cruise - wonderful food, caring and helpful staff, spectacular views of NYC at night, up close and person at Statue of Liberty. Highly recommended!
Outstanding!. One of the most famous skyline in the world, it is truly beautiful and most of all iconic!Great photos op from the sky, from New Jersey and if you can from a cruise!

Probably the best skyline in the USA. I visited all the big cities in the USA and probably the best skyline is this one: the NYC skyline. There are beautiful buildings in other cities but New York City has a charme that it is difficult to reach.

Something you won't see anywhere. The Manhattan skyline is one of the main things that makes New York city a unique place to visit in the whole world. The skyscrapers and the buildings you are going to see are extroardinary and the lights make the skyscrapers imposing . In my opinion the best view of the Manhattan skyline is from Brooklyn and even better from Hoboken.
WOW...breathtaking. a must is to go down to the water and look at the fabulous skyline..or in our case from the 33rd floor of our condo. Just amazing
killer views. I think it's one of the most famous skylines in the world. You know the fellow tourists we are looking up!

Take the subway to Brooklyn Heights and see Manhattan. Get off the subway and walk toward the East River. There is a promenade that runs along the bluff on the western edge of the Heights. The views of Manhattan and the Harbor are great, particularly because of the height.
Nyc trip. This must be one of the most recognised sights ever but to see it from a boat trip is truly amazing or see it from the statue of liberty
One of a Kind. Nowhere else will you see such a spectacular display of a City! A truly exhilarating memory of the Big Apple! From the ground, an airplane or a big skyscraper NYC is awesome!

New York New York. The Grey Line hop on hop off 4 stop tour was a great way of viewing the New York skyline. Each stop was visited by a boat about every hour. Each location was interesting and the views from the rivers excellent. Commentary was informative. On a sunny day the decks were crowded later in the day. The tour started at Pier 78 and all the boats kept to schedule. A worthwhile day in good weather. Cost $35 then a senior discount of $5.
Very impressive. WE saw the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry, from the plane and while walking. No matter how you see this skyline, it is impressive! I want to see more.

Walk the Brooklyn Bridge. Make time to walk the bridge from Brooklyn into Manhattan. Take the subway into Brooklyn, High St. Wander through Brooklyn Heights and Brooklyn Bridge Park before strolling back across the Bridge.
Breathtaking. Everything I hoped it would be and more. In the day it looks fabulous but at night I took the bus tour and the skyline was breathtaking all lit up

View from a boat.. We took a boat trip from Pier 11 around the southern tip of Manhattan, out to the Statue of Liberty and back again, along the Hudson River landing near the Intrepid Air Museum, near 42nd street I think.It was late afternoon and sunny and mild and throughout the journey we had an informative commentary over the speaker system. The boat was full and there wasn't much room to move around though that wasn't a problem. As we left the pier we had good views of Brooklyn Bridge and out into the bay to the Statue, passing it and returning.The view of Manhattan was truly spectacular with the buildings appearing to rise out of the water, all different designs, sizes and colours, the ones finished in blue materials disappearing against the blue sky. The Peace Tower got brighter and brighter as our position in relation to the sun changed until a brilliant and blinding flash as it reflected exactly opposite our eyeline. There was an occasional tourist helicopter giving passengers and aerial view as well as other tour boats.A lot of my photos have the hands of other passengers in them holding their camera phones in the air but with a bit of elbowing I soon got the edge of the boat where I had uninterrupted views . . and better photos.The tour lasted about an hour and a half and I would recommend it. We took a night bus tour to view Manhattan from the other side and though brief, with just a two minute stop, the night view is also spectacular and well worth a visit.
Best skyline in the world. He title pretty much says it all. Whether you are observing the skyline from NY or NJ it's a pretty cool experience.

Amazing views. Great to see this in person. Mazing photos
Great to visit from the UK and see it for ourselves.
Love NYC
View from the Staten Island ferry. Stunning and well viewed from the free Staten Island ferry with the bonus of good views of the Statue of Liberty. We also caught a glimpse from the aircraft.
Gotta see it to believe it. Cant really get over the view. Expert tip- take the Staten island fairy and get around for free :0 !!
Amazing view from Manhattan. View from the Manhattan is amazing, river looks extremely beautiful, boats running in the river looks awesome from Manhattan sky... Great experience...

Who can argue?. I'm amazed to even see the Manhattan skyline listed on tripadvisor. It's one of those things that isn't a destination or a site or an entertainment venue, it just is what it is. The view is best enjoyed, in my opinion, from DUMBO or the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, but farther up in Williamsburg, Greenpoint, Long Island City and Roosevelt Island you'll find equally striking vantage points.

From Liberty Park, Williamsburg, Roosevelt Island, Brooklyn Bridge Park, the cruise, Hoboken college or ................. Walking on the bridge while enjoying the view. Early in the morning, when the locals go to walk, mingled with them you feel like you are also local, Great city view from Brooklyin to City hall direction! Try it,

Helicopter ride well worth doing. Everyone comes to new York for the skyline whether you're seeing it by boat, helicopter or from the Brooklyn shoreline...My wife and I went on the 15 minute helicopter ride which left from downtown. We went with liberty helicopters (although there are a few similar companies which operate from the same place). Worked out about $160 per person with a discount with our new york passes. This may seem like a lot of money but definitely worth doing once. The tour takes you up the Hudson river as far north as Yankee stadium (whilst taking in the statue of liberty) so you don't miss a thing.Not sure the 20 minute helicopter trip is worth the extra cash. Staten Island Ferry. I saw this from the Staten Island Ferry, I really don't think it's worth paying for a boat ride when this one is free and has amazing views! It is just as cool as it looks in pictures. We did this in January and I couldn't feel my hands even though I had gloves on, but still worth it for the pictures!

The Montague Street Promenade in Brooklyn. Its my opinion that everybody should stop by the Promenade day or night to view the Manhattan skyline. Take the R train to Court Street Station in downtown Brooklyn and enjoy then walk the Brooklyn Bridge back to Manhattan.

The best views are from Newport, NJ. The riverwalk in Newport, NJ will give the best views of the city. This is one of the most iconic views of the US, not just NY, so its a must do and must take pic kind of a thing.

Best view ever (biased) lol. Love this view of Manhattan, I think its the best in the world. Love bringing friends and family from out of town and watching them lose their breath as they see it for the first time. Its nothing like seeing it in person versus seeing it on tv or the big screen.

Multi-million dollar view. People love Manhattan but in order to really appreciate the view, buy a multi-million dollar apartment in Brooklyn Heights or DUMBO (Down Under the Manhattan Bridge Overpass) to appreciate lower Manhattan, Wall Street Financial District, and World Trade Center.
Great view!!!!!!!!. One hidden gem of a place to see this is the Promenade at Pierrepont Street in Brooklyn Heights. You can have a family picnic there.

Skyline. One of the most famous and beautiful skylines in the world. You can get the best view by visiting one of the outer boroughs (Queens, Brooklyn, Staten Island) or even New Jersey. You can also get a pretty good view from the Statue of Liberty. If you are not afraid of heights, try visiting the observation decks within some of these famous buildings for a breathtaking view of the city.
Excellent memories . It's the must see in New York! The view is just stunning. And the place is quiet, that is wonderful for the metropolis. A perfect place for a romantic shooting too!

EVery time I see it I am knocked out.. There are many angles from which to view this amazing cityscape, but in general I prefer the view of the East side of Manhattan, or the Southern tip. The west side views are now dominated by horrendous "luxury" hi-irises, boxy and boring. Most of my favorite views are from the Brooklyn side; if you are taking a car over the Brooklyn Queens Expressway, there's a great broadside view over Calvary cemetery, itself a kind of landmark ("Harold and Maude" was filmed there). A walk over the Brooklyn Bridge from the Manhattan side also yields an ever-changing vista --keep looking over your shoulder-- and once you are on the Brooklyn side, sit on a bench on the Promenade for the best view of lower Manhattan anywhere. And there is still something thrilling about taking the #7 train to Queens (also dubbed the International Express, and you'll see why)and emerging from underground, rounding a corner and seeing the skyline appear.

America's most iconic skyline. I've lived here for 5 years, and I still have never gotten sick of this skyline. The best vantage points are from Brooklyn, New Jersey, on the (free) Staten Island Ferry, and for a unique view, a walk across the George Washington Bridge. Also amazing from a plane. It's a much different feel looking at it than being in it.

Best skyline in the world. Haven't seen one that tops it yet. Go on an afternoon and the evening to the Jersey coast - Hoboken and Jersey City have little piers that jut out where you can get great pictures. The view is drastically different between day and night.

Fantastic View. You can see the Manhattan Skyline from either Brooklyn, Brooklyn Bridge or Staten Island Ferry. The view is simply stunning. We have been lucky every time and saw it on a very clear day each time. You should not miss this view when over there and it doesn't cost anything to look at it!

Better than pictures. We were so excited to go to NYC for vacation. I was expecting the tall buildings, but when we went up on the Empire State building and the boat tour I was impressed. To see it all from above and from the water was an awesome experience. Way more than I expected. Walking among the buildings is a little humbling. Makes you realize how little we all are.
The best skyline in the world. Incredible views from all over the Big Apple. The historic views are breathtaking from everywhere in this city. You must see for yourself.
First time in New York. Beautiful skyline in both day and night time... We coming view to this exciting city, would definitely come back!

Manhattan Skyline. View it from the ferry or on an open top bus is the best way to get a feel for the grandure of this iconic New York district. Then close up on a walk around.Stunning buildings and views especially for the Empire State Building.

Just breath-taking.. It looks so innocent from the skyline view but is it absolutely full of people every single day. People are polite in terms of not walking on or over each other. Police are very present to offer direction and protect everyone.

Spectacular. We took a trip to New Jersey during our visit to NYC and our driver was kind enough to tell us in advance to have our cameras ready as we were approaching the Lincoln tunnel.He was not wrong! the view of the skyline was amazing. it was very short lived as it disappeared shortly after, but we had just enough time to snap a couple of photos in order to remember it.

Go To Brooklyn. Get out on the Hudson River or over to Brooklyn day and night to catch this view! You have to get away from Manhattan survey this skyline, and once you start getting over the Manhattan or Brooklyn bridges, you will reap your reward.

The best skyline in the world!!. Whether you're looking at if from the street, from an airplane coming in or going out of NY or from some of the great observations places (Empire State Building, World Trade Center, Top of the Rock, etc.) you will never be disappointed. Such an amazing skyline!!!

Top of the Rock, One World Trade Center, and Staten Island Ferry. To us, the skyline is the star of New York. We enjoyed many views from the above vantage points. There are many new buildings going up all over town, so the skyline we know and love is ever-expanding. One World Trade Center is a must, if the weather permits.
Beautiful views. Just sit back and take a gander at the amazing New York skyline. You see the iconic buildings as well as the bridges connecting the surrounding areas. Amazing to see at night.

Viewed from Manhattan Bridge. I walked in the morning, 7am from Chinatown to the bridge to capture an image of the Brooklyn bridge and the skyline.perfect weather and its free. There was also an arch in the middle of the beginning of the bridge. Here's to your morning walk. Should only take 20 mins.
Something cool to view day or night. We got a few good shots from the airplane and in the taxi heading to the Westin Grand Central. Very pretty at night.
Best Picture of our Trip. Ellis Island provided a great backdrop picture of the skyline! Our most memorable picture from the trip!
Doesn't get any better really. Without a shadow of a doubt the Manhattan Skyline knocks spots off of most others around the world. But it's the unique nature of this place that really sets it apart.
Stunning. No matter where you are in the city or surrounds there is something new to pick out of the skyline. The different building designs make it interesting and stunning.

ONLY in NYC. Simply GREAT place to spend some time by yourself or with a love one or with friends or relatives.
very relaxing space in New York City
awesome. Just like being in a Spiderman movie! Lots of lights and sights. Iconic views from all angles. Mixture of old and modern architecture which you will recognise from many movies.

Stunning by Day Spectacular by Night. Manhattan is just amazing to look at! Taking the Staten Island ferry is free and gives you a fantastic view of the city and the Statue of Liberty so well worth it. I would also recommend the River Cafe in Brooklyn which has amazing views of Manhattan and great food (it's expensive but worth it)
beautiful. great view from brooklyn for the skyline. also at night on a clear night. During the day a great view would be from one of the tour boots or the free boat to stanten island.

Can't See It From Here. You have to be in NJ, or Brooklyn or Staten Island, I suppose, to get a proper view. Although I live in Manhattan again, I've been looking at it from many different angles for many years, and it never disappoints.Despite losing the Twin Towers, we still have the Empire State and Chrysler buildings in midtown, not to mention Woolworth downtown, all of which and many more have comprised the most recognizable skyline in the world for most of my lifetime.From a plane, or a boat, or a nearby shoreline, it is and will always be an awe-inspiring sight.
Manhatten Skyline. NYC th eone and onlygreat skylinewonderful cityexplore, enjoycan you identify your favorite locations in the skyline?

How could you not love it?. This is one of the most famous skylines in the world. Your best bet is to sit in the correct seat on a flight in and get the aerial view, but if not, try to see it from one of the highways in or around the city.

Manhattan. One of the most spectacular and famous places in the United States. A beautiful view of the city, the view is good especially in night time. For all lovers to escape from the city bustle and gape at the skyscrapers from afar. Manhattan perfectly combines an urban city environment and nature.
Best at night. We took a hop on bus, night tour with greyline and they stopped to give us a good view of the skyline at night. It was really beautiful. The lights of the city really are impressive.

Like a postcard. This is a picture perfect view! We did this both from the ferry and the Brooklyn bridge and took so many photographs of it. A must see!
Cruise . We saw this skyline while on a cruise. Amazing view! Iconic part of NYC! Amazing in real life works cannot explain! Do not leave without visiting!
All the movies of NY rolled into one. Walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and walk up and down the waterside for sweeping views. Then walk back over the bridge for more.

Great view from the Brooklyn Bridge in the morning. Walking the Brooklyn Bridge toward Manhattan in the morning with the sun behind you illuminates the skyline and makes for a great photo. The colors and buildings were so picture perfect it looked like a fake photo.

New York City glitter!. We were fortunate enough to stay with a friend who lives in the upper west side of Manhattan on the 34th floor of her apartment building. The view of NYC from that height is fascinating. There is nothing else like it! The excitement of seeing the skyline of Manhattan and also seeing the hustle and blustle going on below you is exhilarating to say the least. (Unfortunately, some of it was probably due to pollution but it was gorgeous nonetheless.) It seemed we were standing in front of the windows overlooking the city most of the time we were in the apartment. The NYC skyline is a must see.
on a clear day. On a clear day you can see just why New York City is so busy and why so many people come to see it. A massive city!

Spectacular . Very moving. Walked all the way to the top. It wasn't as hard as I thought it would be. Perfect weather. Nice guards who were friendly and talkative. A must see.

Manhattan skyline from the water. The best way to see the Manhattan skyline is from the Statue of Liberty ferry or the Staten Island ferry (free), or the Circle line ferry, or from the Brooklyn Bridge. You would now be surprised to see the Empire State Building ushered into third place by the new One World Trade Centre (Financial District) and the new residential tower on Park Ave and 57th St, one of a new breed of 'Pencil towers' - high rises of astonishingly slender proportions.

New York wonder . Nothing quite compares to the Manhattan skyline . We drove in from Washington late afternoon which is prettying amazing but even better at night . Dozens & dozens of skyscrapers ech vying to be taller than their neighbours . Unfortunately the wind tunnel effect is not pleasant when you are walking the streets .

"The" view of the Manhattan skyline. This view can be partially seen from the new 1-WTC building, or from Liberty island and its famous statue, or by the unbeatable views taken from a helicopter joy ride (taken from pier-6). See photo.

One thing you can't miss. The manhattan skyline is like no other skyline in the world. You have seen it so many times in movies,books,series,news that you will connect to it even if you are non-american. You get that feeling of being in the most powerful city of the world.Best view is from the ferry on the way to statue of liberty and while going to new jersey. Don't miss the skyline nightview .

AMAZING VIEWS!. The best way to admire the famous and spectacular Manhattan Skyline is by taking a harbor cruise that also includes views from the water of the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges.

Wow. You just have to experience this spectacular sight. It truly does take your breath away. You can marvel at the height and vastness from many different perspectives. Impressive View. My favorite place to enjoy the Manhattan skyline is from the Staten Island Ferry. Hard to believe that the ride for this amazing view is free! Be sure to stand on the outside deck to full enjoy the view.
Perfect. great way to see the skyline is through the sightseeing cruises.be sure to check the weather for clear skies.

Rockerfeller view is just as nice as empire state building in my opinion. Better really. Rockerfeller center building view is just as nice as empire state building in my opinion. Better really as you can get a picture of yourself in front of the empire state building from the Rockerfeller, with a shorter line

Of course it's splendid!. What can one say! There it is! You see it from the the plane as you arrive! You see it from the taxi as you approach Manhattan from the airport! You see it from the LIRR! You'll also see it at the conclusion of the NBC evening news! For those of us who love NYC it is quite a sight!

Manhattan Boat Trip. We took the Circle Line Boat trip around the whole island of Manhattan and it was great. Two and half hours to see the skyline and the rest of Manhattan and the Hudson. Tour commentary was informative.
No better skyline in the world!. I gasped when we arrived over the brow of the hill on the bridge, breathtaking view, best city in the world!
Never gets boring. Whatever angle or time of day it's beautiful, we hired a car so literally have pictures from all ways.
Simply impressive. Take a trip to Brooklyn Bridge Park and admire the Manhattan skyline. It's truly impressive. It definitely puts things in perspective.

Nice view!. I've been to several cities in the US and Canada, and I must say that the Manhattan Skyline is a sight to see! this coming from a Montrealer!! There is something special about it. The architecture coupled with a blue backdrop while standing in a park with colorful leaves....I can't justify the feeling with mere words. All I have to say is you must experience it yourself.
Impressive view. Impressive view, but can this count as a tourist attraction? You can get a glimpse of it from across the river

Unsure why this is a standalone attraction. There are many different parts to the Manhattan skyline. There are also many different places from which to see the Manhattan skyline. One of my favorite is from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. One of my least favorite things about the Manhattan skyline are the ugly new super-tall, super skinny luxury condo buildings. The Chrysler Building is iconic too.
Quintessential New York. This is what you see in all the post cards and honestly it's worth it. It's such a part of us all...
Awesome view, especially from a helicopter.. Breathtaking skyline. If you come in from JFK nothing prepares you for the first time you see it. Take a helicopter ride to get the most from it.
Amazing view. We went to Brooklyn by subway and we were able to see the Manhattan skyline during the journey. Very impressive.

Manhattan Skyline. I took a ferry trip around the Statue of Liberty. This afforded a beautiful view of the Manhattan Skyline on a sunny Sunday afternoon. I can recommend this to any visitor to New York City.
spring trip. beautiful skyline, especially at night, take the big bus tour and it is absolutely beautiful at night.
From the Hudson . Did a river cruise saw the skyline from the Hudson River great view of a great city also from the Brooklyn bridge some great sky scrappers
Wow. Seeing both from the harbour cruise and at night on a city tour and the skyline view is fantastic, especially at night.

If you're lucky. If you are lucky and take the ferry to visit the Statue of Liberty on a beautiful sunny day like I did, you will get THE most amazing views of the Manhattan skyline. Those of us who live in the hinterlands have a tough time imagining the island of Manhattan. It's a wonder to see, even if it's your 3rd or 100th visit!
Beautiful view. I don't think one can ever get tired of these views. This was not my first trip to New York and I still thought it was magnificent.

Out of a movie!. The Manhattan skyline is unbelievable. Looking at it is like being in a movie but a thousand times better. And if you get the chance to presence a sunset it's something difficult to top!
Wow!. The most iconic skyline in the world - you can't match it! Best views from the water - take a cruise around Manhattan for the best views.

Love the skyline. The Manhattan skyline is what most picture when you think of New York! It's great to see it in person.. Good views from Brooklyn or Long Island City as well as on the Staten Island ferry for a different perspective
Historic Buildings. Awesome to view the city in person! Not a huge fan of the sun being blocked out by buildings, but getting to see the famous skyline up close was worth it.
Great View. Beautiful view that everyone must see. Great skyline,one that ranks with the best of any city. So much to see.

The famed skyline. Missing to see the Breathtaking skyline of Manhattan is a no-no. Just the very sight of the skyline can give goosebumps to the viewer. Must see for all visitors and is best seen when the skies are clear.

Impressive. It is definitely the best and the most unforgettable memory from our trip to NY. We saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Promenade and also walking from Brooklyn to Manhattan via Brooklyn Bridge. Do it! It i's something you just have to do in NY :)

What a Skyline!. The Manhattan is just unique and there is simply nothing like it anywhere in the world. It is just so special, but the dated mess of the city lets it down. At goroundlevel the city has poor shopfronts are old and the streets dirty.
The Skyline is unbelievable. Beautiful and amazing feats of engineering! Especially the bridges. It is worth a look, I know we enjoyed it.
Just a beautiful skyline. One of the most impressive skylines there is. Take the ferry ride on the Hudson to get a good view. It's a must see if you are here on vacation.

Great, free view on Manhattan. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan, took a right turn into Brooklyn to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. View is splendid! You can get some good icecream in the leighthouse nearby, and we took a ferry back to downtown Manhattan.

All I can say is wow, it's exactly like the movies. How do you spot a tourist, they are always looking up, from the moment we arrived at the airport, it was there to see. The highlight has to be he night tour we took, where you go over the Manhatten Bridge and the sky line is all lit up behind you. This is a must see. For those who love New York it takes your breath away.
Great Views. I got great pictures from Battery Park, the Statue of Liberty Cruises and The Empire State Building. Recommend the ESB at dusk for great views.
Family ttip. Head across the Brooklyn Bridge into the DUMBO area to witness the skyline in full glory.. Plus, you get to marvel at both the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges in close proximity..
Take it in. Take in this massive concrete jungle. It may take a while but if you embrace the insanity of the city and the volume of people it gets to be pretty good.

Iconic from almost any angle. While vacationing in Manhattan, take every opportunity to get as high up as possible (or out on a ferry) and view this iconis skyline. There is just nothing else like it.
Gorgeous skyline. Even on a grey, cloudy day, the skyline is so impressive and definitely worth taking the ferry out from the terminal to see.
Wow. Our first glance was through the window of the airplane flying into Newark. Great to see the view that you see on TV.

Nothing like it in the world. The Manhattan skyline is breathtaking and energizing. Each punctuation of the sky is a demonstration of dreams, creativity, ingenuity, determination, and brilliant minds. Gazing up into the sky, the negative space is a work of art.

Gleaming. With the reconstruction of the world trade center site most complete, the New York City skyline is whole again. It was encouraging to see numerous construction cranes in Midtown as well as downtown. The city that never sleeps continues to redefine itself.

NYC skyline. It really doesn't matter from what angle you view this you will never stop gazing at it. We went to the Top of the Rock, the Empire State Building, bus tours, Staten Island Ferry, boat tours, even on a helicopter trip....and could still just sit/stand and stare at the Manhattan skyline. Utterly amazing and so beautiful. Soak it all in and remember it forever!

beauty magistracy and energy from a distance -. It is a bit strange and odd to write about a “sky line” but Manhattan’s is one of those that require a word or two.If you are in Manhattan you are too close to the trees to see the forest; you must view it from a distance. That is for me usually the NJ side of the Hudson although the preferred venue for me is from the Staten Island Ferry. From the ferry I love to watch the sky line from a distance come closer and closer until one is engulfed within its magistracy and energy.Living in a major city as I do, I am used to tall buildings creating cement canyons but Manhattan is different.Although it no longer contains the tallest building in the world, from across the river you can not help but see the Freedom Tower and the Empire State Building, tall enough to make any body’s list.One can just sense the intense energy level that such a place generates.Some years ago I was traveling at night by bus to JFK Airport. I was on the east side of the East River looking west into Manhattan and the lights reflecting off the glass of the buildings just radiated with a sparkle like colored diamonds.Emerald City come alive.

A view to remember. If you are in NY and don't have the chance to have the view of the Skyline you will not be able to find out the payback for teh neck paint to look the skyscrapersIt is a must that I recomend to better do it by night from Brooklyn
One of a kind!. there is nothing like it in the world. Once you see it you will never forget it. It has some of the tallest buildings in the world.
Walk Along the East River. After visiting the 9/11 memorial - walk along the East River .... it's a wonderful site... stop and relax at a local bar...watch the boats....
Beautiful drive in from Newark . Driving in from Newark, you get a great views of Manhattan skyline, passing Liberty State Park and getting a distant view of the Statue of Liberty.
BEAUTIFUL! LOVE NYC!. We stayed in Times Square recently for our first visit - I must say it was so worth the wait! We traveled all over Manhattan and loved every bit of it
Amazing!!. When travelling in to the city, the skyline comes out of nowhere, its an unreal view and simply breathtaking. Good photo opportunity.
Epic. The best man made skyline I have ever seen! A must see from the empire state building. Try going to bar sixty five in the rockefeller centre and see it light up at night with a cocktail!
Skyline . This is amazing, especially if you're from the English countryside like me. Absolutely mesmerizing, I loved it very much.
See this from a ferry. My thoughts on this are to see it from a ferry which also takes you out to the Statue of Liberty it takes about an hour and is well worth the trip.

We took a water taxi, and also saw it from the Top of the Rock. That view is overwhelming , if you go to New York you can not miss it, I recommend both the water taxi that makes several stops in the route, and also the Top of the Rock because it is less crowded than the Empire State, anyway I have been there more than once. In the water taxi you see both sides in detail and have a guide, they are usually nice.

Lovely view by day and night. Lovely view by day and night, at night we was the view from the Marquis revolving restaurant. There are plenty of roof top bars to take the views in without paying an absolute fortune if you are on a budget. Beer about $8 a small glass, but worth the experience.
NIght View will never be forgotten. Enjoyed the night view of the Manhattan Skyline from a water taxi. It was worth the cold. Took some fantastic photos.

THE City, THE Skyline. Manhattan has perhaps the most recognizable but ever changing skyline of any city. The Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building are constants. It's recognizable from land, sea and air and you've seen it in films as long as you've been alive.

Cool place. Great view of the city, must see for all visitors!
The trade mark of New York City
Very busy always, amazing pictures get ur cameras ready ;)

Don´t miss a stroll over to Brooklyn. We walked the Manhattan-bridge over to Brooklyn and strolled in a charming neighborhood och to Brooklyn promenade at got a gorgegous view of Manhattan Skyline. Then back on a much more busy Brooklyn bridge.

Wow!. We took the boat trip around Manhattan, we took a late afternoon trip and were lucky enough to see it as the sun was setting! It was amazing to see the scale of the buildings. It is definitely worth a trip!

Just Amazing. I am falling short of words to describe my experience.If this is your first visit to a city like new york you will just amazed by view. This is the view you saw in Seasons you watched like friends or how i met your mother.I felt like i have been to this place many times this is the first when it feel so real. Its like meeting someone famous. Everyone knows new york everyone want to visit new york every one want to experience what the heard so many time or saw on TV or movies.You want to take clear city view take sky tour.

Iconic views of the city. The Skyline is so iconic and well known these days form TV and the movies. And it is spectacular. Many of the buildings are quite dull but the few classics (Empire state, Chrysler, One world etc.) make it something special. Going back to NYC after about 13 years it was great to see the skyline as we headed in from the airport. (detracts form the interesting Taxi driving!!)
Its famous. Whats to say. Its famous for a reason and completely man made. Got to find a good vantage point. Empire state... chrysler.. Rockerfeller centre... take your pick

Ok New York..you win!. Born and raised in Chicago, I thought our city was better than anyones, untiI I saw that your skyline is three times the size of ours. It's also beautiful, meaningful and colorful!
Wow!. We took the hop on hop off ferry for amazing views of this world beating skyline from every angle. Just amazing!

A beautiful walk, slightly too crowded. A lovely walk with a few glimpses on the Hudson river. The trees were not yet in bloom and the flowers not very numerous either -so it will be better in a few weeks'time. But then I can imagine the crowd will be worse. When the leaves are open it will feel more secluded from the city, which must be nice, but will afford less view.

Only one way to see it properly. The best and really only way to see the Manhattan skyline properly is from the deck of a circle line cruise boat. Fantastic photo opportunities of the area. Take the landmark cruise and it's quicker and cheaper than the full circle. Pier 85 departures next to the USS Intrepid.

Unforgettable . Absolute unforgettable views all round Manhatton with no two buildings the same, be it style or height.
I have always wanted to visit, and boy I am not disappointed.

Best view from Jersey City. The ideal view the skyline is from Jersey City which is a short ferry ride from Manhattan. Once in Jersey City you will be amazed at the cleanliness and newness of everything. Lots of places to eat and drink and feels very safe.

The view from the Brooklyn Bridge is awesome!!!. We caught a cab from Lower Manhattan, crossed the Brooklyn Bridge and walked back over the bridge around sunset. There are spots to stop and take pictures and see the City start to light up as the skies darken. It was busy at times with people walking, running and biking. The bikers have their own lane and many are flying by, so watch your step!
Try the Brooklyn Bridge walk. The skyline can be seen from many locations, I recommend the Brooklyn Bridge. Also the perspective from the Staten Island Ferry is also worth the time.

Walk the Brooklyn bridge to Brooklyn heights. We walked around Wall Street, trinity church and then walked the Brooklyn Bridge from the city hall, to Brooklyn heights where the best views of the NYC skyline can be found. Walk down the promenade and grab an ice cream before heading deeper in to Brooklyn to prospect park, for food in Williamsburg smorgasburg or head back in to NYC itself.
Just unbeatable. You can't visit New York and go home without this photo!! We took great pictures from Ellis Island but I guess the Staten Island Ferry works too.
From A Different Vantage Point. See NYC and circle Manhattan from the Circle Line. Amazing sights and even native New Yorkers will see and learn new things!! Amazing and worth it.
Amazing!. I love Manhattan, so much, its such an amazing place and it never gets old. I simply love it very much!
The best at night. Millions have seen it. It stays an impressive view. What else can you say about this . You keep taking pictures and pictures.
Goto Brooklyn pier 5 at night. I was told to look at the skyline at night from Pier 5 Brooklyn. WOW took my breath away , Amazing view

Nice for your photocollection. Well, you need at least one picture of the skyline! When you get back you can show this picture to you're family and friends. Some nice pictures can be taken from Liberty Island ;)
Mother - daughter trip . So many amazing views and wonderful architectural marvels! We are lucky to be able to enjoy their beauty. Take advantage of the views where you can!
A must see when in Manhattan. You cannot go to Manhattan and not enjoy one of the most famous skylines in the world. Dont forget to take a hat and wear sunscreen when you're out!

Awesome!!! Need to see it at night. My daughter and son-in-law took me from southwest Harlem to Long Island so I could see the Manhattan Skyline at night. Was quite an experience!!! Definitely a great trip!!

Best view in the house.... In Manhattan, you miss the skyline views. When my family and friends are visiting town, I like to take them just out of Manhattan for them to appreciate the splendor of the NYC skyline. Some of the best views of the Manhattan skyline are from Roosevelt Island and from Brooklyn Bridge Park. The promenade in Brooklyn Heights is also a great view. The key is to see the skyline and the bridges at the same time.
Beautiful Skyline. Cracking views from the Staten Island Ferry. Worth the time on a clear day, you wouldn't get the full glory in a miserable weather.

Breathtaking and Iconic. Everything you recognise and seem familiar with - up close and personal. Absolutely stunning from any and every angle - Empire State Building, Roosevelt Island Cable Car, The Highline - everywhere you view from, you seem familiar with.

The love of my life. When I was a kid, I lived in Pennsylvania with my grandparents. When I would come to NYC to visit family or friends, crossing any bridge to arrive into the city, I would be overwhelmed by the beauty of the NY Skyline. At times the mere sight of it brought me to tears or I would be over the top excited but mostly I felt safe, like I was coming home. I now live in NYC. Once I submitted a recommendation that the NY Skyline be named one of the wonders of the world, since NY certainly is a wonder and the greatest city on earth. I have lived in other places and traveled extensively, all the while pining for NY. The love of my life.....
Best skyline. Had head a lot about Manhattan and also seen in movies like English vinglish. Both the tours are good I would recommend one from Sky its breath taking

The ferry trip between Manhattan and Staten Island is free. I had read in a novel by Paul Auster that the ferry trip over the Bay of New York is free between Manhattan (East River side) and Staten Island, you have only to pay for the back turn. I wanted to verify ! So, I visited the Buddhists Gardens of Jacques Marchais (a woman !) in Staten Island which ias a haven of peace ! And I took a bus fare to Conny Island over the Verrazano-Narrows Bridge and admired the rusty Attraction Parc seen in so many movies ... The Skyline ? YESSS ! My trip overthere was in September 1997, so I could see the Twin Towers (and visit one of them on a Saturday) ... I bought a very cheap card of the shyline on the Fifth Avenue and sent it to all my friends in Europe, France and Germany ... And to me ! What a surprise, before I had to move to another place, as I found this card : looking for the first time at the picture, I had the surprise of my life ! Only One of the future Twin Towers we are missing now since 9/11 2001 !!! I understand why the cards were so cheap ...
Iconic and breath-taking.. Manhattan skyline, what can I say? We saw it at its best from a Circle Line cruise, highly recommended.

Iconic and stunning . Too many things fail to live up to expectations. This world famous skyline isn't one of them.
There's no doubt that enjoying the view on a beautiful spring day like we did, helps massively.
Always something of interest to see and even with the enduring skyline, it's surprising to see just how much change and construction the city is undergoing.
Breathtaking. We went on a Circle Line Sightseeing cruise all around Manhattan. The skyline is also visible from The Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island. Got some fantastic pictures!
Gorgeous.... Just so beautiful, you'll need to pinch yourself! Perfect from whichever way you look at it. Exceptional from Greenwich Village piers at dusk.
a piece of awe. this is a view you will never forget especially statue of liberty and the landscape of new jersey and new york
Nothin like it... . The diversity of buildings architecture and bridges make the city quite unique. I so enjoy looking up and finding the interesting features of buildings.

Beautiful at Night. We saw the skyline on an open tour bus at night. This is a great was to see the city at night. Open bus tours leave in the evening from Midtown. Do wrap up though, because it can get chilly!
Mesmerizing opportunity!!!!. Just to be able to sit and enjoy the view makes you realize how many incredible pieces of art makes NYC the city of architectural wonders.....

What can you say. This is one of the most iconic skylines in the world.
I would recommend going to chelsea piers or a boat trip or helicopter flight to get different views. But either way just enjoy it

Greatest views of NYC are from NJ. North Bergen, West New York, or Gutenberg New Jersey are the best views along Blvd East. Leave from Port Authority and take a bus that routes to any of the above destinations via Blvd East. You can walk along the cliff for about three miles of spectacular NYC views.
3/26/16-One Of A Kind. There's nothing in the world like the New York City Skyline. From the Ferry the views are literally straight off of a post card. Excellent.
Beautiful.. Best seen from afar...take the Staten Island ferry and you can see the downtown skyline and Statue of Liberty

Amazing site. This really is an impressive site. Both from Liberty Island with the Statue of Liberty in the foreground or from Brooklyn Park it really is a must see and if you walk over Brooklyn Bridge it's free!!!!

One of the most well-known city skylines. There is no other skyline in the world as impressive and well-known as New York. See it from: the Circle Line boat trip round Manhattan, the Staten Island ferry, a helicopter, the top of the Empire State building, the Brooklyn bridge, Ellis Island, Central Park - many choices.

Enjoy this beauty best from the sky!. The skyline is strikingly beautiful when the night is falling into New York. I recommend you to take one of the many helicopter tours that are offered to have the best view you can get of this marvelous thing. I got a good discount looking on the internet. There are always discounts offered by one of the operators so have an eye opened and try to make your reservation that day. It is well worth it.
Wonderful from anywhere and at any time. One of the world's great urban skylines. Here are three separate views, one from Brooklyn, one from the Staten Island Ferry and one from New Jersey at night.

Best seen from on high or from the water. After having made the trip up the Empire State Building during the day and at night to see the NYC skyline we thought we'd take to the water for a different view. Well worth it. Hop on any of the boats that do the harbour tour from Battery Park and be taken around the southern section of Mahattan island. Great views and a different experience from having to look up all the time

Best Seen from the Brooklyn End of the Brooklyn Bridge. You've seen it a thousand times in movie after movie's establishing shots, both with and without the Trade Center towers. But nothing can prepare you for the majesty of seeing it in real life (especially on a clear night or a sunny spring afternoon). The southern tip of Manhattan (Battery Park) looks then like an immense ship proudly sailing into the wind, the towering buildings crowding up against each other as if in a race to pour into the harbor. Republicans who rail against "New York City values" haven't got a clue what they're talking about and obviously haven't ever seen for themselves what has got to be one of the most impressive & beautiful sights (and preeminently human places) anywhere in the world.
Breathtaking Skyline on clear day!. Some of the best Manhattan skyline photos are while taking the ferry to Statue of Liberty. On a clear day it is a sight to see!
Always good . And seems to get better. Staying in hotels on the high floors always give you a great balance of day and night views which are naturally contrasting in extreme.

Must see view. This is my first trip to NYC and probably the Skyline view is certainly really up there as a highlight of the trip, we have had the view from several locations, across the Brooklyn bridge sat in the park, from the top of the Empire State Building and my favourite by far for the classic view was onboard a boat trip, this really does give you the view seen on so many postcards.

Great views from cruises. For some of the best views of lower Manhattan, try the Staten Island Ferry (free) or Circle Line cruises which is apart of the CityPass. I'd recommend both night and day photograph as it is beautiful. One World really sets off the skyline like no other.
Wonderful from the water or the Empire State Building. This is an amazing city, the skyline is great to see from across the water in Jersey or from any of the skyscrapers in town.
Manhattan Skyline. Manhattan Skyline makes an impressive selfie shot. Relatively small in size, but huge in density. Amazing to look at.
Brooklyn view. We walked over the Brooklyn bridge then walked down Pineapple and sat on the front to am incredible view! It was really quiet there with no tourists. Perfect spot!!
awsume. can not describe the view or the sights must see from the hudson river.and at night.never seen anything this exciting
Absolutely Gorgeous. The Manhattan Skyline is absolutely gorgeours. It was especially beautiful at night and great to see from the top of the Empire State Building.
Impressive skyline. Impressive skyline indeed. It's nice to look at from the other side of the river. What we did was cross the Brooklyn Bridge on foot and then go to Brooklyn Bridge Park.

What else is there to say apart from Manhattan skyline!. There are just so many iconic buildings that make up the skyline that it's difficult to not just smile. It equally good at night all lit up or just 'awesome' on a cold sunny March day. New York is meant for walking and it's one of the best ways to see the skyline from all angles

from the top of the Rock it was the best day out yet. The price was not to high but the views well so good we loved the park and the water front a great morning of fun to be had here well worth a visit good shops to look round and entertainment as well Got a great shoe sine place here
Great views from the Staten Island Ferry and for free . Great views of the Manhattan Island skyline from the free ferry over to Staten Island and you can see the Statue of Liberty en route too.

Great Skyline View. Took in the Manhattan Skyline view from a tour boat out to the Statue of Liberty. It was a great view full of picture taking opportunities. It would have been a lot better in the Spring on a clear day without the cold winds blowing across our bow. Take the Big Bus tour for this view.
Amazing. See it from over in Brooklyn (walk over the brooklyn bridge) or a great view from Hoboken railway station too. Breathtaking.

It is the best!. All hours, from any direction, NYC skyline is iconic and can't be missed! If you want to pay up...go to Empire State Building or Top of the Rock....otherwise just keep your eyes open. Also cool from The New Whitney Museum.

Toto we're not in Kansas anymore. As we flew into Laguardia you could see the skyline. The Chrysler Building, Empire State Building and of course the new Freedom Tower which dwarfs every other building. A must see for sure!

Nothing short of spectacular!. Being a bit of a travel jaded Londoner I didn't expect much from a city skyline, but as I approved over the bridge I saw the skyline for the first time and I was blown away!
Like in films!. This is a nice promenade to do around downtown manhattan and Brooklyn Heights. Easy walking, impactful views and for free! Don´t hesitate to walk around and have fun in a sunny day!
One of the worlds most iconic skylines. Often best seen from the New Jersey side of the river one of the World most famous and iconic skylines. Very cinematic.
Everyone must see once in their life. It is truly amazing to look at and see the skyline. NYC skyline is truly amazing no other skyline is quite like it.
Fabulous. Very nice skyline views from midtown - Top of the rocks and also very nice from the new One observatory in downtown. Nice on daytime and nice in the evening. Must see it.
Magnificent. Observed from the observatory of the ROCK of Rockerfellow center building is a beautiful view of the city skyline. The price of 37.00 was well worth it.
Has to be seen. And the best way to see it is from the Statten Island Ferry, or from accross the bridge to Brooklyn.

New York city has more to visit. After 115 years living in New York city I found a lot of places to visit thanks to skyline, they have tours all day long and is not expensive, the only problem I found is that a lot of people are looking for their services and sometimes you have to wait until next bus.There are many ways to get to see what they offer by bus, by boat or helicopters, if you want and is able to pay.

A once in a life time stay. The are no words to express how great the views are from the 3 hour boat tour around the island of Manhattan. The images from TV does not do it Justine and if that is not enough just start walking and every time you look up it is another great view.
Awesome. What can I say. I ♡NY. Enough said. Took the ferry from NJ and got a great view of the skyline everything we came over.

On a clear day.... Drive across the 59th Street Bridge (a/a the Ed Koch Bridge) from Queens into Manhattan. Careful! Keep your eyes on the road. Glance up. You are looking at one of the most famous, fabulous skylines in the world, No exaggeration. On a clear day you can pick out the skyscrapers every elementary school child can name. On a clear evening, lights twinkle from the windows and challenge the stars to a 'better shine' contest. Citicorp., Chrysler, Empire State, Pencil, One World Trade Center.. The list goes on and on. And, if you go from Manhattan to Queens, you'll see a wonderful vista of lights as well.
Amaezing. There are several high points around the area of New York The skyline still looks great and is a sight to see :)

Most photogenic skyline nomination from me. Personally I'm not a fan of NYC.. However... I have to admit it is a photographers dream especially when seen from the water - take a boat trip out on the bay to really admire it

Manmade view that steals hearts !. I really don't think I could ever tire of this view which completely took me by surprise it is truly awe inspiring ! looking back from Liberty Island is perfect a true testament to the ingenuity of Man ! Really beautiful on a bright day and a grey day !

Always a Pleasure. Whenever I go to New York, one of the things I look forward to most is going over that little hill on the highway and seeing the skyline in all its glory, visible off in the distance like Oz. Granted, there have been some pretty ugly buildings coming up in NYC lately, but yet I never have a problem with it. The skyline is always magnificent, and every time I get that first glance at it, I am reminded of the first time I came here, and how beautiful it was seeing the Empire State Building rising up over the horizon.

Best in the World. Take a Circline circumnaviagation cruise around all of Manhattan Island. Most people do it in the daytime, but if you go at sunset, it will be absolutely amazing. You can look through some streets from the East River as the sun sets. The buildings transpose themselves as lights get turned twinkling on. Some buildings will have colored lights and the Empire State Building usually commemorates a group or history date. And of course, you can't miss the Statue of Liberty shining bright nor the proud Freedom Tower.
mikey speaks. best viewed from the Brooklyn Heights promenade or the BQE by car between the Brooklyn Bridge and Atlantic Ave.

The skyline is always beautiful to me.. The best place to see the Manhattan skyline is from Queens: Gantry Plaza State Park. In the evenings, with Manhattan lit up, it is just lovely. (There's a nice playground for kids at Gantry). In the summer, there is often free music at the waterfront, generally local talent.

A great new skyline. Having visited on a number of occasions since 1972 and seen the unfortunate change in the skyline. The new skyline is a hope for the future and a memorial to those who were tragically lost.
Beautiful!. Best view of all times! It does not matter day or night it is the best view of the world!To see the new tallests buildings is fabulous!
Awe inspiring. The skyline is just as impressive during the day but at night time it is magical. No wonder it is the subject of so many pictures

Skyline is fantastic but some of the people !. Came to Manhattan for 3 days and had a fantastic time. I would recommend it as a must visit place for anyone. I do though have to mention the people that I've and work there. They are some of the rudest, arrogant people I have ever come across. They are not typical of Americans in other parts of the USA who I found are very friendly and easy going these New Yorkers though are something else. Fantastic NewYork. We visited New York in February 2016, for the first time. We had a fantastic time visiting all the iconic tourist attractions. We weren't disappointed. Very street square is like a film set, which you have previously seen. No better way to see the manhattan Skyline than from the river Hudson. we departed from pier 81, for an approximately 2 hour cruise. You will experience a different view, cruising down the Hudson passing New World Tower, Ellis Island & Statue of Liberty on the rightside or Starboard side of boat, onward under Brooklyn Bridge, Manhattan Bridge & Williamsberg Bridge, as far as the United Nations Building on Eastside of Manhattan, and return. Great trip.

best city in the world. not only is the skyline of Manhattan impressive and ever changing, but the streets are bustling and memorable. Oh boy, What a change!. The entire West Side of the Hudson has been transformed! The walk goes from uptown all the way to the end of the island. Beautiful, funny and modern art statues are everywhere, views forever. I could go on and on. It's a happening and plenty of places to eat. If you bring your own picnic, you can walk out on specially made piers with special chairs and tables - the river below you!!! The once many unused piers have been reformed into walk-outs!! The railroad tracks have been preserved and the street names are welded into the path as you go downtown!! I hope this gives a fairly accurate description. Absolute must to visit. Lots of walking!!!!

The most recognizable in the world!.
