Helicopter flight. A great but not cheap way of seeing New York and areas from a different viewpoint. an experience worth taking

Hints on seeing the best skyline in the world. The Manhattan skyline is incomparable, and there are many ways to see it. Here are hints:1. I will start with the best and highest priced: take a helicopter tour. That's what is done for visiting VIPs, and we are all VIPs, right? There are several helo operators. Just google and see if the price makes sense for your budget.2. Harbor tours. Lots of these at various prices. Besides a helo tour, this is the only way to see the skyline from almost every angle (except from Central Park, which is also terrific.3. Reservoir in Central Park. This may well be our favorite view, and it's free! Go to the north side of the reservoir, and you will have the lake and the jet d'eau (fountain) in the foreground, the lovely park just beyond that and the towering skyscrapers, If you scan with a video, you get more of the park and the lovely, classic buildings to the east and west of the park.4. Observation towers: One World, Empire State. Rockefeller Center. These are expensive, especially if you have a number of you. Hard to say which is the best. They each provide a different perspective. Not worth it, in my view, if it's not a clear day.5. Staten Island Ferry. Another free one, with lovely views of the southern skyscrapers of Manhattan as well as the Statue of Liberty. Hard to beat at this price. There are more options, but I will leave it here. On our visit earlier this month, we did all of these except One World and Rockefeller Center. I think one skyscraper observatory is enough.

It is a Skyline, see one, see them all.. A typical skyline but it can be seen from pictures and films. I guess I am use to it but it is not special when you see it often. Still, a lot of history is here.

Brilliant city, brilliant views.. The place is amazing and the mix of old architectures and modern skyscrapers is amazing. Excellent views. No matter how many times I visit New York City I will always go out of my way to see the Manhattan and other NYC skylines. There is something iconic and surreal about seeing it in person. I would always recommend taking time out to see at least one view of the Manhattan Skyline

Best skyline one will ever see . Beautiful new York city skyline is enchanting and a pleasure to the eye. A man made marvel, best place to click photos of the skyline especially from Jersey city get the whole view of downtown, midtown and uptown Manhattan!!

Do it by boat or walk. It's great to see this by river and walking. Great photos and it's like the postcard images. At night time it is amazing with all the
Lights

The most iconic skyline in the USA. While I was on the Acela train from Boston to NYC, I looked out my window to see this iconic skyline. It is heartwarming to see the new Liberty Tower at WTC 1. The loss of the twin towers on 9/11/01 was a defining moment in US history.
great view. we went to new york in may 2013 and had a great 5 day trip visiting the local attractions and tasting NY cuisine

NY is my kind of town. Spent 3 days in NY. Saw everything on our bucket list and more. New York is the best city in the world.
There's nothing like the Manhattan Skyline!. Love this view! Especially at night I visit New York a couple of times a year, and it never gets old.

For a good walk. I find Central Park to be a quiet enjoyable place for a good long walk. You are among trees and grass, and that puts you a very different place in Manhattan. It's quiet because the traffic noise you hear while walking along the streets seems to be filtered out. Or maybe it's because you are lost in the surroundings of trees and the stress level drops.

Always Magnificent . The NY City Skyline is always a thrill no matter how often I have viewed it. Even though one only has short glimpse of the skyline while driving in on either the LIE & the Whitestone Expressway, it is a short, but beautiful sight. The best views are flying into Laguardia from NC (& probably other places). Try to sit on the Left side of the plane. If it is clear w/ no clouds, you can often see The Statue of Liberty, World Trade Center, Empire State Bldg., & MidTown. The plane then often turns right & you can catch a glimpse of the remains of the 1964 World's Fair and the USTA Tennis Stadium at Flushing. Then a quick glance of what used to be Shea Stadium, now replaced by Citi Field as the plane straightens out for its approach to Laguardia. I believe NY is a city of change, adventure, growth, full of vibrancy & life and I believe all this reflected by it's Skyline.PS: When leaving Laguardia, the views are good, but you don't get the great skyline as coming in.

The Manhattan skyline is nothing like it in the world by airplane. If you are traveling to NYC by air, you need a window seat to see the magnificent skyline of NYC and Manhattan. Seems like it goes on forever. A great sight, take pictures.
stunning! . very pretty! If you get a chance just take a walk there and enjoy the view! It is a bit more windy and cool so dress appropriately.
$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$million dollar view $$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$. To wake up in the morning and get to look at NYC from the Brooklyn side is priceless! truly lives up to the hype!
Wow. Absolutely beautiful view of this amazing city which can be taken in via Brooklyn bridge. Great place to take photographs for a memorable visit.
Never stop looking...... Have seen this from a cab in Brooklyn, out by JFK and many others. It never gets tired or stayed....look look and look some more.....it's immense!

You can be videoed for an additional $60 and souvenir photo is $20 tours lengths vary but there is no better place to take in this city than from following the Hudson river

Just like the skyline of any other city. If you visit Hong Kong, Shanghai, Sydney, etc. you will not be able to differentiate the skyline of Manhattan from any other big city. Was included in our Hop-On-Hop-Off ticket, otherwise I wouldn't have gone.

Whether arriving by plane, looking out from the back of a taxi on a parkway in Queens, riding a ferry from Staten Island or Jersey, sitting on a Central park bench, walking across the Brooklyn Bridge or just trying to take it all in from a skyscraper observation deck, the Manhattan skyline is truly exciting.

The most recognisable skyline in the world - has to be seen in person!. My first view of the manhattan skyline was in a taxi coming from JFK - as we came over the bridge, I saw it, and the Empire state building. It was breath-taking and very exciting! The moment I left, I wanted to go back!

Beautiful at night. Saw this during the daytime and night. The night tour to Brooklyn was amazing because we saw Manhattan skyline at night.

One of the great landmarks of the planet. Though Chongqing, China, now dwarfs Manhattan in terms of the sheer number of huge skyscrapers, it has no viewing points like those around Manhattan, including the Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn, Central Park, etc., from which to take in the striking clusters of skyscrapers that make up the various glories of the New York skyline, nor does it have the bay, nor, needless to say, the blue sky on a great day! So, yeah, the actual views of skyscrapers, if not the raw numbers of them, are the greatest on earth in Manhattan, though Hong Kong is a close second, and is actually much, much more colorful than Manhattan's skyline at night from Kowloon or the Star Ferry.

One of the all time greats. Viewing Manhattan's Skyline is always something that leaves great impression upon my mind, be it when approaching from JFK by taxi, or making way into the city by rail from Newark or southward from Boston, it is also an image that remains etched in my mind long after having left the city.During a recent trip to NYC, we took the Liberty Island and Ellis Island ferry, something I hadn't done in nearly 20 years. In addition to the attractions at both locations being quite special, I really enjoyed seeing the Lower Manhattan Skyline from the Star Cruise vessel as we made way to the Statue of Liberty. Perhaps more impressive and memorable was seeing the skyline as we approached Battery Park upon our return. Wow, what a skyline! The sleek look of the skyline as it gradually encroaches upon your field of vision is awesome. If it similar to what we have in Hong Kong, when taking the Star Ferry across Victoria Harbour between Kowloon and Central. Seeing skyscrapers as you quickly approach by water vessel is just really neat. You have little in front to obscure your vision and can take lovely pictures. I had forgotten how much I enjoyed this aspect of the Liberty Island, Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty tour until our recent visit. Now, I look forward to taking this ferry again and will eagerly look forward to seeing the Manhattan Skyline from the harbour in the future.

From any angle it's great. I landed at Newark and was impressed. From Staten Island and Statue of Liberty it's like watching TV. From upstate on the Hudson it's still massive.From any angle NYC and the Manhattan Skyline has the X Factor

What an Impressive Sight!. I got to see Manhattan Skyline from two different perspectives. Firstly, from a ferry (going to Liberty Island) and then at night travelling over the Brooklyn bridge.Both were equally spectacular. The day view showed the massive difference in size from normal buildings against the backdrop of the skyscrapers. One World Trade Centre left even the Empire State building in its shadow.To view it all at night was amazing. Unfortunately, my camera didn't capture the true magnificence as the bus was moving quite fast but it truly was a sight to see.Manhattan Skyline is something you have got to see whether it's by bus, ferry or helicopter!

From anywhere on the other side of the Hudson it's a great view. When I'm on business I can feel sorry for myself that I don't get out enough but when I'm on the Highway and see the skyline I can't help but feel grateful. It looks amazing in any light but I love it in the daytime with the sun.

Best viewed at night. Manhattan skly-line is best viewed at night from the Brooklyn Bridge. This bridge is very busy during the day but quiet at night and the view over the city from the centre of the bridge at night is great.

BE ENTRANCED BY NEW YORK CITY. By all means at least once in your life take the Circle Line Cruise around Manhattan - on a beautiful day morning or afternoon. The only experience that compares is flying in low over the city, and the cruise has the advantage of showing you every aspect and most neighborhoods along the rim from the high towers to the lower brownstones, Columbia University's playing fields, the GW Bridge, Inwood and Riverside Parks. And yes, you see the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island in the near distance. Take a sweater in case it's breezy on the water. As I recall there are beverages and snacks available as the trip takes several hours. For a more luxurious experience, chartered tours are available - you'd have to check them out on the web.
Iconic. One of the most famous skylines in the worldSo beautiful at night Different view every block / avenueSoak it in and enjoy and admire

Panorama Personified. One really cant say they have seen NYC without seeing the Manhattan Skyline. It is probably the most famous urban skyline in the world. And it is well worth a look. To get the best view, you have to cross over to Brooklyn (you also have the same option on the other side to cross over to Jersey, but this is more popular). I would recommend you to walk down Brooklyn Bridge. Its a lovely walk indeed. Once you cross over, you should head down to your right and you come up to a pier like structure and there it will stand at the other of the Hudson. Best time to view is at dusk. You can catch the sunset and wait around for the buildings to light up like a million fireflies. You can sit and enjoy this over a beer and hot-dog or an ice cream. The pier is full of stalls ready to satisfy the weary city tripper. Whats so amazing about this place is that you know the hustle and bustle on the other side, you know how choc-a-bloc Manhattan is, and yet the skyline gives you a serene tranquil view of the city sans the noise and the rush but intact in all its urban architectural splendour. One can always take the ferry by the river back to Manhattan. Ticket counters will be right there. I would advice against walking back via the Brooklyn Bridge if you already walked in that way. Its way too long to do it twice.
Stunning. Loved the views of the skyline - went on a boat trip and got some fab photographs! Recommended visit by boat or even helicopter as they do tours of the skyline too!!
Very Beautiful and unique. I watched the Manhattan Skyline from Long Island City in Queen, NY. It is especially beautiful at dusk when the lights are turned on.
First Trip. This is such an awesome view and I was in awe to finally get to see it in person. TV does not do it justice.

Everything you image. We saw the view in a couple of ways - as sunset as we came into manhatten from the plane, behind a sheet of snow storm (amazing) and from the statue of liberty/ellis island on a cold winters day.Everything you imagine it to be from the pictures

Add it to your bucket list!. If you haven't seen the Manhattan Skyline, I recommend that you add it to your "To Do" list for the future. It's one of the most recognisable sights in the world, and it looks jaw-droppingly amazing from so many angles. Absolutely magical at night!

Best seen from Brooklyn in good weather. Go to Brooklyn, find Remsen Street, and walk down to the 'promenade deck' which is above I-278. You won't be able to park at the end of the street so walk down and enjoy the brownstones. You will be looking across the river at the southern end of Manhattan. There are benches where you can eat lunch and lots of walkers. Best views are early or late in the day. Lady Liberty visible too, plus all the river and helicopter activity across the river.
Gorgeous. I was lucky enough to be staying in Lower Manhattan during a business trip and one of the highlights for me was getting to see the Manhattan Skyline.

The view from the 7 train. The best view I get of the city is either from the 7 train to and from Grand Central to Woodside, Queens and from Jersey City. I just love seeing how peaceful it looks from a distance then get swallowed by the vibrant jungle the minute you get into the city.
It's just beautiful at night . As amazing as it is during the day, it's really the nighttime skyline that is the most beautiful. Dazzling lights, colors and just amazing views from queens.
What a view!. Best viewed from Long Island City or take a ferry. See how many landmarks you can identify as you enjoy the view.
Stunning. Wonderful sight, especially in the evening with all of the lights. A must see from some high point. Stunning!
Stunning. There is something about the expanse of Manhattan skyline that will ever be breathtaking and mesmerizing, no matter the sky or the weather!

Amazing View - Go at night!. Ok so we did this and Top of The Rock. Highly recommend this for night time as it really does take your breath away and the view it has is better for a night time viewing.We did Top of the Rock in the day and that has a bigger span of view and better to see it day time! So if you have to pick day / night do it this way round (trust me!!!)Enjoy the view, take your time taking it in and have a great time!If this review was useful, give me a thumbs up to let me know :))Thanks people

the best view of manhattan. you can google best view of manhattan and get a variety of suggestions. from the brooklyn bridge, from the park in hoboken; from the top of the empire state building. but my two favorite ways to see the skyline are from a private plane or a boat. in both cases i was lucky, i have a friend with a plane and another with a boat. nothing in the world beats watching july 4th fireworks from a boat putting around in the east river. but if you don't have high flying or floating friends, no problem. several boats set out daily, some shorter cruises than others. not to mention the staten island ferry is still one of the sweetest deals in the world.

Very beautiful from below (port of Bayonne, NJ). We took a cruise to the Bahamas last week that sailed from the terminal in Bayonne, NJ. I must say that I had never seen the Manhattan skyline from that angle, and it really was impressive and beautiful at the same time. The morning light really illuminates the tall buildings, and casts a gorgeous tint on the Statue of Liberty. It is probably not worth a special trip, but the view from that angle is really something.

Best skyline you'll ever see. We took in the view of the New York skyline from various places but I think the best view was from the Brooklyn Bridge at night. We took a walk over to Brooklyn one evening and the skyline lit up with the twinkly lights over the river was beautiful and rather romantic. My husband and I got chatting to a local who took a picture for us and it's our favourite pic from our trip.

Iconic. We flew into Newark, so had a good pre and post view of the skyline. I had visited NYC many years ago so remember the Twin Towers - the One World Observatory is now iconic and a memorable structure.. Also visited the Statue of Liberty and again excellent views from the pedestal and lower levels.

Great view from the Statue of Liberty. I did a cruise to the Statue of Liberty and was able to see the skyline. It looks awesome during the day and can only imagine what it would look like at night. Definitely worth the view
Really worth to see!. It is very nice to look at lower Manhattan skyline. We did this from Statue of Liberty island, Ellis island, Staten Island ferry at night and day. Would really suggest it.
Great View. We took the boat to Ellis Island & Statue of Liberty and while your on the boat can look at the Manhattan Skyline and see the new One World Tower it looks fantastic

What a place . New York is a must see for everyone once in their lifetime and I guarantee you will have seen the Manhattan Skyline at some time in the past an will recall the film or TV show you saw it on. Don't miss a view of the skyline from the ferry over to Ellis Island.
Pretty. Amazing site to see and take pictures of when flying in. Totally breathtaking. Ready to go back already!!
Amazing views. Amazing views of the skyline on the water taxi. Breath taking during the day and I'm sure at night as well. The architecture is amazing.
breathtaking. great views, seen in daylight from Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island ferry and Empire State Building at night

Amazing. I love the skyline but for me the best skyline is from the Staten ferry on the return trip. Skyline is great from all the observation points like ESB but I think the full majesty is from the water or on Brooklyn bridge.
It is very cool to see, as you would expect.. The cool think about this is that you can see it from New Jersey! There are several locations to see it from!
Dazzling at Night. When returning on the Staten Island Ferry we were dazzled by the lit up skyline. It is a breathtaking view.
A view from a bridge. It literally takes your breath away, and excites me every time I'm lucky enough to see it, it's been a few years, and I been too long. Hello Manhattan.

Possibly the BEST City skyline anywhere in the world.. The Manhattan Skyline has to be the Best city skyline in the world and one can enjoy it from many vantage points. One of my favorites is to take the Staten Island Ferry, its FREE and in operation 24 hours a day 7 days a week, runs every half hour every 20 minutes during rush hours. Great picture taking of the skyline. Next head to 90th St and 5th Ave, the entrance to the Jackie Kennedy Onassis Reservoir, walk up the stairs and there before you is the incredible Manhattan skyline of the Upper West Side.If you are going to the Metropolitan Museum check out their roof top also good skyline views. Naturally the top of the Empire State Building and Freedom Tower have great view but be prepared to pay $30.00 per person to enjoy the views. Of course there are many rooftop bars available so check those out as well
Amazing. You get the best views from Liberty Island, top of the rock or Empire State Buiding. Truly iconic and a must see when you are in NYC
The Skyline. The most famous skyline. Now missing the World Trade Center. But lots of new buildings. Worth getting s photo.
Magical sight. Flying into New York is it self stunning but taking off at night from New York is a truly magical experience see the Hudson River and the Manhattan skyline is really worth seeing

Beautiful. Definitely, a very beautiful sight. Wither from Jersey or the ferry back from Statue of Liberty will highlight the skyline and it is breathtaking especially especially in good weather. A must see!

Beautifully wonderful. Absolutely beautiful and iconicIt is a truly breathtaking view and is a must see when visiting New York or Manhattan.Manhattan skyline view is one of the best I have seen perhaps based on how iconic it is!A definite MUST!

Spectacular and Iconic. Skyscrapers prevail in this skyline and my favorite is the Chrysler Building at night. That's because its V-shaped lighting inserts on the facade's top floors identify it immediately, and often various colors achieved by floodlights embellish the upper part of the structure even more. At 1,046 feet, this Art Deco building used to be one of the tallest in the world.Day or night, as an architecture buff, I like to pick out various skyline buildings as I do with constellations in the sky. The Empire State Building is easily identifiable, of course, and I always picture King Kong when I see this icon. The tallest skyscraper now is One World Trade Center at 1,776 feet. It is also the tallest in the Western Hemisphere.There are myriad places to get good views of the skyline, but I prefer to look at it from afar, such as underneath the Brooklyn Bridge, on the Staten Island Ferry or on a boat tour. On my most recent visit, I got a remarkable - but quick -- view from New Jersey on the Airport Express en route to Newark Airport.
Pictures can't do it justice . Just so beautiful. Whether you're looking at it from Brooklyn Bridge, the Liberty Island boats, or from a helicopter tour. The view really is phenomenal.
Unique!. Once you see it once, you'll find it again and again in movies, TV series, but also in your heart. The best is at sunset.

The most iconic of skylines... The best view in my opinion is from the Brooklyn Heights promenade. Easy access and a great area to walk around to enjoy the sunset over the skyline. Also, fantastic for photography.
Best view. The best place to see skyline is to take a ride on Staten Island ferry. It is a cheap way to see Statue of Liberty too ! The children will love it and the wait line is short and quick
Beautiful. The skyline view is one of the best I have seen in my travels. It's truly breathtaking and is a must see when visiting Manhattan.

Photos don't do justice !!. You have to see this with your own eyes. Photos don't do justice to this breathtaking view. All you have to do is just stand there and take it all in. I would recommend this to anyone who appreciate the beauty of Mother Nature

To be seen to be believed. The most iconic skyline, peppered with the classics (Empire State, Chrysler, and now the new Freedom Tower) really is breath taking. I didn't do a boat tour, if you discount the Staten Island ferry but viewed from different rooftops in Manhattan and Brooklyn, and of course at Dumbo underneath the Brooklyn Bridge

Take in the views from several points around the city. The Manhattan skyline is a great photo opportunity. I've taken pictures from several points. I recommend the Staten Island Ferry for this as well as shots from the Brooklyn Bridge.
Awesome Views. Just taking in all the amazing sites and different architectures makes NYC breathtakingJust a fun fabulous city!
It's better than the movies !!. Oh how wonderful to see the skyline as I've seen so many times before on the movies. I can't describe how wonderful it felt.
One of the wonders of the world!. Awesome! Go in ant direction, and you'll find something to see or do. One of the mest metropolitan areas in the world!
Lots of tall buildings. Probably interesting for people who love big cities (I don't) to see all the NYC skyscrapers. It is kind of exciting to see at night with all the lights.

Sums up New York. On our way in from the airport we got a great view of Manhattan at night. The next day we took the ferry out to Staten Island and got a brilliant view of the skyline from the southern tip.

Utterly Breathtaking. There is no where on earth like the Manhattan skyline.
The breathtaking views from anywhere around are just incredible.
From Ellis Island or on the way to the Statue of Liberty, the views are just phenomenal, from FDR Drive at night, the city looks like Gotham, just incredible sights that you will never tire of....

A concrete visual of Architectural Design that displays the Creativity of Man and Matter. A view only rivaled by the sky line in Hong Kong but a splendid delight to ones visuals on your way out of the city. The proximity of water which is bordered with such large edifices makes for a great photo. A view that can awe anyone visiting from the lesser developed world.
Just like the picture. Stunning skyline just as you would see on the TV! Impressive by day and also by night when all the lights are on!

Part of why I love driving into the city. Part of why I love driving into the city is seeing the Manhattan Skyline. And as it so often happens, I see it during the day coming in, and they I enjoy it at night on my way out.I imagine a lot of people that come to NY just jump right on, and I think it's a very good idea to just step back, take a deep breath and enjoy the city view. The cheapest way is probably one of the vantage points off Palisades Parkway or the Brooklyn Bridge, but if you've flown out to NY especially, then you most likely want to take a cruise. My recommendation is to do it at dusk.

Stunning. The Manhattan skyline is simply stunning and anyone who has seen movies and series from NYC will recognise it. We saw it both in daylight and during night time and night time was my favorite!
views. The views are absolutely amazing , Itr doesnt matter what angle you look at new york it is a wow factor.
Mezmerising. The Manhattan skyline changes constantly depending on which angle you are viewing it from and the weather. In my opinion each and every view of it is stunning and mezmerising.
Nothing like it. There's is nothing like the Manhattan skyline! If you love New York City, which my wife and I do, the Manhattan skyline always brings a smile to our faces

Breath Taking. Best view has to be from the ferry to Liberty Island, or perhaps from a helicopter should you have the opportunity.
The view is breathtaking as there are so many skyscrapers making up the impressive skyline.

The best view is from the Promenade in Brooklyn!. We were there with our "adopted" family which includes an native New Yorker. He took us to some really nice places to view the city and gave insights as to its history. Walking along the Promenade has a magnificent view of the Manhattan Skyline all day but sunset is absolutely spectacular....and it's free!

Stunningly. The Manhattan skyline is beautiful, especially at night. You can't see it from the city itself but you can view the skyline from several locations across the Hudson River in New Jersey, from Liberty State Park to Hoboken and beyond, is an excellent viewing spot.
Beautiful. Beautiful manhattan skyline is unavoidable. You can enjoy it from the view restaurant atop the Marriott
one of the most beautiful skyline in the world. you must spend few hours to have a look to that sort of skyline which I do think is incredibly facinating.

Cruising the skies. I was lucky enough to actually go down to just north of Battery Park and ask how much the helicopter rides were and to my surprise they were so cheap, as long as you were willing to ride with other people. Straight up the Hudson and then out over Yanky Stadium covering Ellis Island and the Statue was very much worth it
Amazing.. It's a magnificient skyline and the pictures will turn out very nicely. Recommended, and it can be seen from different places, a boat tour on the waters or from Brooklyn or anywhere.
Excellent Scenery. Its a nice place to look around all the beautiful City scenes both views are good day or night. I liked it specialty at day time.

Meh?. After 10 minutes, the novelty wore off and I was wishing for a European city. Recognise I'm not the voice of the consensus. In truth I found NY a bit dull, like a vegas copy of a european blended city. LA had more to compel, even if all palm trees and fake tan.

Impressive. There's a few good vantage points to see the Manhattan skyline, Stattan Island Ferry, Statue of Liberty, walking around Brooklyn Bridge, cruise or from top of tall buildings. Worth it every time.

Concrete jungle. There are obviously a lot of cities now around the world trying to vie for the best skyline accolade...however, this I believe, is all down to this great city. Everyone I know wants to see the New York skyline...not just see it...many have them as pieces of art on the walls, some as bed spreads. Seeing it up close is a must. I saw it from my hotel in Chelsea...on the boat to/from the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and from Brooklyn.
night time view is breathtaking. From top of the empire state building where ever you look the lights going as far as the eye can see.
Night time. Had a trip on a river cruise in the evening, needs to be seen, breathtaking views of skyline and Miss Liberty.
Wow!. This view is so amazing! No matter what the weather is, it looks amazing! Highly recommend having a look at this!

SPACTACULAR ALL YEAR AROUND. We have this view from our apartment and for over 6 years it still stops us for a moment to admire the scenery. The best view of Manhattan is from NJ and the increase in tour busses on my street is the proof of it. They come all year long and even the locals living in the area when the weather gets warm drive over to have a look.

amazing. It is one of a kind skylines in the world. We got the skyline shots from Empire state building, Top of Rock and from the statue of liberty cruise. My favorite one is from the top of the rock.
There is no other like it.... The two best ways to see the Manhattan skyline is on a one of the many cruise around Manhattan. The second is from Brooklyn Heights or Long Island City.
Okay to kill time. Nice enough walk but there is so much more things to do in this amazing city. The nimrod would be a better bet or the Whitney museum or anything really.

Stunning . So many different view points to get the skyline in - top of the rock, aerial tram, Brooklyn etc.
Whatever point, it's stunning.
Iconic, beautiful and visually stunning.
Nothing like it!. No matter what the weather...even a gray misty morning...can't stop admiring this skyline! View from NJ is the best!

The higher your room the better. We stayed at the Hyatt at time square we started on the 21 floor there was only a view of the next building. We upgrade to a suite an moved up to the 49 floor. This is the views of All the popular attraction and rivers.

Destroyed?. Many people are very distressed by the new type of tall narrow buildings going up on 57th Street. The first of them dominates many views of the skyline; there will be others: 432 Park, 117 West 57th Street, One57, and 111 West 57th Street.From New Jersey, the Bronx and Queens the first looks taller than the Empire State Building. In fact it is 1004 feet, compared to 1,454 for the Empire State and 1046 for the Chrysler Building nearby.I tend to be on the negative side at the moment, but the skyline may be more interesting when the other three are constructed. It's very true that the many boxy building give a rather clumpy feeling to the whole ensemble.In any event, there is nothing to do about it, but perhaps to dream of Tuscany and the city of towers there.
evening walk. this is a great place to walk and take in the sights of New York.the Skyline takes you through some nice neighbourhoods and the chelsea market place,selling all manner of foods
Never get tired of that view!. Love to walk the bridge and admire the view then nip into Starbucks around the corner.Don't forget your camera! I have to go here at least once everytime I visit NYC...
Beautiful. Whether you see this from the Staten Island Ferry or on your way into town, it's easily eye catching day or night.
There's no view like it. To get to see this stunning view was a fab experience. Get a water taxi over to Brooklyn and walk back over the Brooklyn Bridge in the dark. Truly amazing.
Tour. we saw the skyline while in New York, but the best is at night its just WOW!!!!! Yes it's impressive indeed ,

Day time or night tour. Yes it's impressive, but i think even better from the top of the night tour bus. Lots of these tours are available, pick a nice night. You can see the view from across the water without taking a tour of course

January Is Perfect. What can you say about the Skyline of Manhattan thats not been said before. Viewing it from The Top of The Rock, Liberty Island, Ellis Island, Empire State or Brooklyn.. It is fantastic.If you like your photography then their is no more iconic scenes to photo than those of New YorkHead across the Brooklyn Bridge to Washington Avenue and then under Manhattan Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge for spectacular views anytime of the day.

Stunning . No matter where you are in Manhattan and if you're a tourist, you will usually be looking up. Wonderful views from staten island and even better at night from the ESB or RF. Wonderful memories
New additions and always better.. New additions, such as the 432 Park Av make it look even better! The cold/dry, sunny winter days offer the best view range.

Stunning!. The beautiful skyline can best be viewed from many places: Brooklyn bridge, the observatories, from Statue of Liberty. Just can't get enough of it-----it feel good to linger at your leisure when looking at this skyline.
Can't be beat. This is the only skyline you need to see before you die. From NJ, from the river, ftom the plane... the best.
well worth seeing. Breathtaking views, we visited this during the day , one of many fabulous things to see and to be able to tick off the bucket list
Historic and amazing architecture. What can you say but BEAUTIFUL! The architecture is just amazing. You can walk around all day and wonder at the mammoth scale and detail.
Fantastic!. What you go to New York City to see!!! Fabulous. I saw the skyline from Central Park and the Staten island ferry and it was just as good as I hoped it would be!!!!
Cant get a better skyline !. Cant get a better skyline ! , amazing photos from liberty island and Top of the Rock ! Concrete Jungle where dreams are made :)
Skyscrapers Galore!. I was in NYC last year and I still haven't forgotten the skyline. It was what you'd expect to see, with the WOW factor that this is a real view! The view is amazing!!!
From The ashes. How great is this. You can visit the new World Trad Center up close or get this beautiful view fro the Westin, Jersey City

An iconic scene. The skyline of Manhattan is iconic. We have all seen it before, whether in person, in movies and tv shows or in pictures. To experience it firsthand can be hard to define, but here goes.Traditionally, the expansive view comes from across the Hudson, from Jersey City or Hoboken. Just get yourself down to the river's edge and there you have it it is best for seeing the density of skyscrapers, both in midtown and downtown.Another option is to travel through Central Park and see the glimpses of buildings through the trees. This is most delightful in the fall where the colors of the trees set off the buildings behind. Best for views of the wonderful structures along Central Park West.The view of the skyline coming over any of the East River bridges is one of my favorites. Depending on the bridge you choose, the view will be different, but I find them to be the most intimate.The least explored is probably the views from Governors Island. I love these views. Most dramatic is the view from the Parade Grounds, where one can vies the skyline as if you were in the middle of the country, with Oz riding over that next hill. Awesome views herd as well of the Statue of Liberty, And both the Jersey City and Brooklyn waterfronts.
Picturesque . Saw this from the ellis island ferry. Amazing sights. Great for the old photo album. Haven't seen at night, so can only recommend to see it during the day!

Modern mountain tops. We started on the Staten Island Ferry, and then walked around Mnahattan, viewed the skyline from the top of the Standard Hotel, then the Whitney Museum. Caught it in sunlight, sunset and at night. Who knew that skyscrapers could make such a fascinating view? The differences in texture, colour and form make an interesting and attractive panorama, and you want to watch it for ages.

My old apartment remains part of this incredible skyline. The skyline from the Hudson River is simply magnificent and awe inspiring. Whenever I found myself on the river itself, I would seek out my apartment and smile.

Great views of the city. Loved all the scenic views on my travels around NYC, Manhattan skyline one of my fave views. A must see, great view from the Statue of Liberty ferry trip and also on Brooklyn Bridge

Stunning & Beautiful. New York City has always been fascinating for me, one simply can't beat Manhattan Skyline view from water, or boat trips. Its literally same as we see in movies, so was delighted to see movies stuff in real. Recommended best view is from water.

One of the best views. I was lucky enough to see the Manhattan skyline from a boat trip I planned for myself and my wife. We were on the water at night and the water was quite still so you had a great reflection. Although it is probably one of the most common views on TV etc it doesn't take anything away from seeing it in reality.

Beautiful!. Manhattan skyline is a must see! It is beautiful. I actually took a boat tour which puts you in a good position to see the skyline. The boat tour went near snapple, statute of liberty and brooklyn bridge. This area is a must see!I highly recommend!

Marvelous. Manhattan is one of the most beautiful cities in USA and is marvelous to be able to enjoy it. The skyline is like a movie or a picture that you are enjoying with your own eyes. The beauty is amazing, I definitely want to come back.

Everyone should visit NYC at least once in their lifetime. NYC is fascinating to me. There is always so much to see and do and it is such an eclectic town. There is something for everyone and there is no shortage of great food - whether you're on a budget or want to splurge. Go in different seasons and enjoy this wonderful city.
Beautiful. You can't beat the view of the Manhattan Skyline, especially from the water. It isn't quite the same without the twin towers but it is still beautiful both at night and during the day.

Stunning. You cannot miss the skyline view from the boat trips, absolutely stunning and well worth the money. Or take the Staten Island Ferry for free.
Best view is from the water

Exactly as you see in movies..... The views are exactly like you see in the movies... breathtaking. Pick your skyscraper (top of the rock, Empire State Building, of Lady Liberty) and gaze at the skyline by day and night.

Best viewed on a ferry from Staten Island !. Growing up watching sitcoms, it could be easily told that New York city's skyline has always inspired people from around the world to visit this city..so i did..and like i said the skyline can be seen best from afar when on a ferry from staten island back to Manhattan..Really beautiful !!

From all angles great. Doesn't matter if you are in New Jersey, Staten island, in an air plane, or in uptown Manhattan. The skyline is great as long as you can see it. My personal favorite is from rooftops (20th floor) uptown Manhattan (>160th St)

There is no other place like New York to live and to work.. I lived here for 25 years...I am SO happy I did. I wouldn't want to spend half of my life in any other place. The feeling when I visited the city was amazing. I always loved looking at the skyline from far away. And I always loved coming back home and driving on a bridge to look at the skyline after going out of town.

Manhattan Skyline. For great views of the Manhattan Skyline I would recommend crossing into Brooklyn and then walking back over the Brooklyn Bridge or also you could catch the free Staten Island Ferry which takes around 25 minutes eachway but offers great views of the skyline and also of Liberty Island.

Mesmorizing. There is nothing like the Manhattan Skyline, which I believe is why there are so many places that allow you admission (paid or free) to view it. You can take advantage of many paid admission buildings with wrap around viewing, take a harbor cruise, or you can walk across the Brooklyn Bridge for free and take in the view on your walk towards the city. Daytime or nighttime - both offer different, spectacular views!
Just amazing!. One of the most iconical and remembered thing of NY is Manhattan skyline. Beautiful night or day, a must see.

Simply Beautiful!. From the promenade in Brooklyn Heights and while walking across the Brooklyn Bridge, I was able to get fantastic shots of the skyline. Also, from the Jersey turnpike, the views are simply beautiful! Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge was one of three favorite highlights of our trip. We took a subway to Brooklyn Heights, walked the promenade and then walked across the Bridge...quite exciting! There is no fee to cross the bridge.

Wow Factor. we visited this week and its one of those things where you don't expect it to live up to what you have seen in films, tv etc . well it really does live up to it , I couldn't actually believe I was there seeing it with my own eyes .there are many views I would rate but Manhatten would be in my top 5 probably my top 3 , the buildings are huge towering upwards . for me the best place to see them was from the Hudson River boat , breathtakingly beautiful , magnificent buildings . From the top of the rock the sun setting in the background is a truly beautiful picture with the iconic Empire State proudly standing alone in the middle of Manhatten dwarfing the surrounding buildings and behind her in the distance the financial area of Manhatten standing proud , the Freedom tower towering out above them . out in the bay Liberty looks so small but in her own way just as iconic.the view of the skyline is free , but gaining the position of height/distance will cost you entrance unless you are on Brooklyn bridge walking over I am so glad that I have visited this spectacular skyline , it shouldn't be missed

the city that has everything. The Manhattan skyline is stunning , the first time I saw it , it took my breath away its my favourite view of all the cities in the world ,the best time to see is when the sun is going down coming over the Brooklyn bridge.

Stunning. The Manhattan skyline is probably my favourite view in the world, especially when seen walking over the Brooklyn bridge.You get your people who like to see fields and trees and then people like me who could look at this skyline all day long
Such a thrill to see it for real!. Just couldn't believe I was seeing it. You see so many photo's and bits on the t.v but nothing prepared me for the thrill of seeing it for the first time. Awesome!

..a true kaleidoscope... There is not one skyline in NYC, but many, as it will change from area to area... The cheapest way to enjoy the skyline to get at sunset to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal. This is best done with warm weather and with some cheese and a bottle of wine. Take the ferry (IT'S FREE!!) and just take in the breathtaking view you will enjoy. The skyline will change as you approach Staten Island at any segment of the trip, it will change. Sunset will turn Manhattan on fire and that will add further beauty to the trip. You could also do in the morning or at night. At night, one of the most beautiful places to take in the skyline id the Brooklyn Boardwalk, an ideal place to take memorable pictures. If you don't mind spending a few bucks, especially with good weather, you should take a boat tour of Manhattan.
From the Empire State building. The skyline was breathtaking. Although I saw this in March for the first time it is still stunning to see.

Partner with New Whitney Museum Stairs. Hit The New Whitney- order tickets online the day prior, or tough out waiting on line. Worth it worth it! The sky over Manhattan turns kobalt. The entire NYC skyline illuminates from inside each tower- against an Installation created by Nature herself.

Top oft he Heap. The Manhattan skyline of New York City has to be one of the most impressionable sights in the world ranking with the Rocky Mountains and Great Wall of China. It never fails to impress me after all the numerous visits I have taken there, whether it be viewed from a distance from New Jersey or a plane ride above the city. Walking in the canyons of the city's skyscrapers is an unforgettable experience with its variety of architecture and traveling by boat around the city is breathtaking. A must for the urban traveler.. .
Very nice!!! Excellent idea!!!. Can access via subway or bus. Nice view of the bay and walk among the buildings. Amazing for architect lovers!

Very few places are this unique. It sounds a bit crazy to be writing a review of the Manhattan skyline, but since TA asked, here goes. This attraction is absolutely free and the sheer number and density of unique architectural sites is rivaled by very few places--perhaps Shanghai, Chicago come close but New York probably still takes it for the enormity and diversity and overall numbers of tall buildings even if it no longer has the tallest. The only problem is that to see the skyline of Manhattan, you have to be at a vantage point that takes you out of Manhattan to get an optimal view--and even once you are there--in New Jersey, in Brooklyn or Queens, on the Circle Line boats, or (for free) on the Staten Island Ferry, you still can't see the whole thing at once--just too long and too wide. The very best way to see it is on a plane descending into or ascending out of one of the two NYC airports if you want to see its vastness and get some sense of the geography. Other wise, the view from DUMBO in Brooklyn, from the Triborough Bridge entrance ramp going toward Queens (it goes by fast), from the pedestrian walkway on the Brooklyn Bridge, or on the Lincoln Tunnel helix in New Jersey or one of the unobstructed park views from Weehawken, Hoboken, or even Edgewater will provide the most encompassing views, though each a bit different. Should you really want to take in the whole thing, you need a higher and further vantage point. I recommend Eagle Rock Reservation overlook in West Orange, NJ--which is 17 miles away but from which on a clear day, with or without binoculars, you can see from below the Statue of Liberty nearly up to the George Washington bridge.
One word - beautiful!. By day or night, morning or sunset, by road, rail, water or air or on foot this vista is amazing. Absolutely beautiful.

Start of a Love Affair. Previous visits had left concerns about security and uncertainty about no visible horizon due to the masking by tower blocks. What a change this trip brought to our attitudes? Our earlier trip had involved a couple of days in the city (pre 9/11 but after the first attack) and a hire car circuit of New York State, Niagara and the Canadian cities as far as Quebec, before returning through New England. This time we had a week in the big apple, and oh how we fell in love with the buzz!We used the tour buses for transport as well as the tours and boat ride which was convenient and economical. It was supplemented by taxi and rickshaw journeys - experiences in themselves. The good weather let us enjoy the top of the rock and central park to the full, and the Guggenheim was open this time. We took in the irreverent but hilarious "Book of Mormon" show and had a great meal at the Da Marina Italian restaurant nearby.There is nothing to match the solemnity and respect due at Ground Zero (except for the Pentagon memorial to that fateful day) and the entries recording lost infants still make me well up at the thought. Perhaps it is these memorials more than all else that unites our hearts with the citizens of New York.In summary, we now love NY and cant wait to get back to the energy of Manhattan.God bless America!
a must see!. A must see - especially from a helicopter! The iconic buildings make for great photos! We loved this view.

Beautiful. On a sunny, clear day, the Manhattan Skyline is a view that cannot be beat. We got to see it from Liberty Island during the day, Long Island during the day/night and from the Empire State building at sunset. It is a view that must be experienced from multiple angles once in your life!
Whoever you can see it!. ...make sure you get to see a view of this amazing city... walking,subway,cab,car..get a spot and enjoy it!
See it from a boat. Take a river boat tour and marvel at the sights of Manhattan Jersey Statten island Ellis island etc. and all of the bridges. It helps put the skyline views into perspective.

Breathtaking. We took a boat ride a Lund the Statue of Liberty, but you can get the Stanton Island Ferry too just for the ride, and see this magnificent view, its breathtaking great building serving up into the sky standing proud and full of glory just amazing.
One of the reasons to go to NY !. One of the reasons to go to New York ! The skyline is really quite amazing and I think this is one of the reasons that makes New York special !
Always great to see. Be sure to walk across Brooklyn bridge or take the Staten Island ferry for a great view of the skyline.
amazing. I really enjoyed this view. just sums up the size of new York too. I would highly recommend this as it is breathtaking if you like this kind of thing.

Unique and awesome. From the sidewalks of Manhattan, the N.J. Turnpike or a cruise ship on the Hudson River this is the most impressive skyline in the U.S. Two newer vantage points for viewing are the Highline and Whitney Museum terraces. All offer breathtaking panoramas. The Empire State and Chrysler buildings are enough reason to look up and be thrilled by the sights. Locals do it and so should you.

see it from the night tour. take the night tour bus to see the night time skyline - much better than the daytime one! We had a great guide who gave us lots of time to get the photos. Would advise to wear warm clothing jackets as it is quite cold at night in the water area.

A beautiful view to see. I come from Staten Island, the 5th borough of New York and see it every day in the morning from the Verrizano Bridge. I can see downtown, such as 1 World Trade Center to 432 Park Ave, Chysler Building and the Empire State Building. These are beautiful tall pieces of art over 1000 feet tall. No city's skyline can be compared in the world to New York's Skyline!
The most amazing. After so many times i've been to NY, each time i approach the city i look at the skyline as if i am there the first time

It doesn't get any better. 3 good options for viewing the Manhattan skyline: 1) across the East River in Queens at Gantry Plaza State Park...you're directly across from the United Nations, with views of Empire State and Chrysler...very nice at sunset. 2) from the Statue of Liberty Ferry....going or coming, directly in front of Battery Park and Lower Manhattan 3) from the East River Ferry...great views all the way down to the Brooklyn Bridge.
Beautiful. Lovely views of the skyline. Especially on a lovely crisp day like we were lucky to experience. Beautiful.

Bright lights of New York . Took a night time tour to see the skyline of New York in all of its bright glory. Well worth it. Whether day or night, your efforts will be rewarded with views you will never forget.
Unforgettable!. We loved the view most from Hoboken NJ, easily accessible by the PATH train. They leave from 34th street and have some stops more downtown

A unique view. Over the years, we have visited NYC. Its skyline is so unique with so many iconic buildings like the Empire State building, The Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, and now the Freedom Tower.We have been to the top of the Empire State building for viewing. Coming into the city on the Amtrak from CT offers great views. We have sailed several times on cruise ships and the views are terrific.
Nowhere else in the world could compare!. You see it everywhere in the movies and it looks exactly like that in real life. It truly is a concrete jungle!
breathtaking. Hard to put in words how massive the city is until you're riding in from JFK and see the sprawl of the city in your windshield.

Breathtaking... at night!. There are many ways to view this but I went to Brooklyn Bridge Park for this instead. It was a long ride from Manhattan but it worth the time. There was not big crowd so you can take your time to choose your shots carefully.

Sure, any view of the skyline is awsome, but it's best seen from the World Trade Center Tower.. Beautiful views at night. The night sky is really something. Bring your camera. A cell phone isn't good enough for good photo of the skyline.
Must See!. On any trip to New York this is definitely a must see!! I've lived here my whole life and it still takes my breath away every time I see it!
Night Cruise recogmended.. Helicopter Flight or a cruise are worthwhile to take in all that there is to see. Remember to always look back to see what the other view is behind you and also look up.

Breathtaking. The famed Manhattan Skyline is every bit as impressive as it is made out to be. Whether you see it in daylight or after dusk, it is a spectacle to be seen. You can see it either from the Brooklyn Bridge, on the Liberty island or even on the Staten Island ferry.It is a spectacular view which is not to be missed.

Great Views. The Manhattan skyline is impressive from any vantage point but looking into the city from a boat was a unique experience that gave us panoramic views of the city during the day as well as night.

New York lights. The skyline is amazing we viewed the skyline from the Brooklyn bridge from the bank of the river always different depending on the weather. Something you you see while visiting just look up.
Nice view. You can take some great shots of the skyline either as you are walking along the Brooklyn Bridge or if you have landed on Statue island.
Can't go wrong. Take a boat tour, or the Staten Island ferry, or go to Brooklyn. However you see it, it is a wonder of the modern world.

Awestruck. Anytime that I travel to the busy city, I am in awe of this amazing Skyline. People from all over the country should make this trip, only once if possible, to view the inspiring city that has a Doctorate in making a city great!

Overwelming. I viewed the skyline from the top of the Empire State Building shortly after 911 and I could still see smoke rising from the rubble. It was a great view of something that I really didn't want to see but now it's better to go to the new World Trade Center Building on West Street. The new building is 1776 feet tall.

What a view!. We got 2 great views taking the NYWaterway ferry from NJ to NYC during the day and a spectacular one indeed taking the ferry back late at night. You're paying for your transportation to NY with bonus views of the Manhattan skyline thrown in.

Amazing. We saw the skyline from different viewpoints, Top of the Rock, Empire State Building and the Staten Island Ferry. I honestly can't separate them and rate one over the other as no matter how you view the skyline it is truly spectacular. My advice would be to mix it up a little and view at sunset, sunrise and night time.
Excellent view. The excellent Manhattan sky line can be observed wither on the Hudson cruise or from the Manhattan Bridge.
Famous skyline. Just because when you stand here looking at this you realise just how huge everything is and what a real buzz it is to just actually be here
Ney York is Fantastic. The new York skyline is something special to see and photograph. A good place to see the skyline is from Brooklyn Bridge.

No other view like Manhattan Skyline. You may ross the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges , or ride on the Staten Island Ferry Also you may rent a ride in any of the Fulton Market vessels offered and get close to the Statue of Libertywhile enjoying a coktails. Another option go to Governor Island and enjoy the view.. Worth the trip !!.
1seminole . I recommend a ride on the free Staten Island ferry for a magnificent view. You can come back at your leisure as the ferry has frequent service.

Breathtaking!. Seeing the New York skyline was by far the highlight of our trip. Would recommend going on a boat trip as you get great views from the water. It's also a spectacular view walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. Our favourite view however was from the waterside DUMBO. Absolutely spectacular and breathtaking.

Sailing into New York. We sailed into New York up the Hudson river on a cruise ship on a beautiful sunny day.We sailed past the Statue of Liberty which looked smaller than envisaged and we then sailed up the Hudson. The sun was shining on the buildings which made for lovely photos. We docked at pier 90 (?) which was very convevient for walking to Times Square.

Center of the universe. . The New York City skyline is certainly a breathtaking sight. The best views are on either the Brooklyn/Queens side of the east river or in New Jersey side of the Hudson. Of course a visit to the top of one of taller buildings provide a different view, including Central Park. A crisp, cool October day does the trick best. No smog! The nighttime view is spectacular.
Best. Famous skyline famous city so many people so unique, virtually everything there you could think of in a city but a boat on the river gives you a fantastic view

A city view.. What can you say,everyone has seen it before on the big screen.
But to actually see it for real is something else,and if your lucky enough to do it on a clear day all the better.
Deluxe helicopter tour. Breath taking trip of a lifetime taking in the magnificent skyline of manhattan with a comemtary by the pilot who encourages interaction. Totally worth the half hour trip.

Do it yourself . Take a water taxi from wall Street across to Dumbo (it's only $4) from there there is a large area to view the skyline. I recommend visiting grimaldis pizza shop for lunch whilst on that side (it's a 2 mins walk)

That's it. One must experience the city from many locations to gain insight to NYC. Try the Promenade in Broolkyn or the park in Astoria, might be dangerous. Empire State Building good. Depends on you. So many answers .What are your questions?
One of the world's best views, and constantly changing.. Don't think you have to be in NYC to appreciate it. Try Jersey City, or Brooklyn, or a bit up the Hudson.
Fantastic skylines. Loved the skylines of Manhattan both at night and during the day. The juxtaposition of old and new buildings makes it very interesting.

No where on earth quite like it. Is a magical moment when you head into the city from JFK, you crease a hill in the road and then the skyline is revealed to you. Best viewed at night from the 360deg viewing deck of the Empire State building
Skyline. We stayed in North Bergen so had a fantastic view of the Manhattan skyline from the other side of the Hudson. It is a beautiful sight at night.

Awesome views. We were there week of December
2nd for tree lighting. We went to top of the rock and to top of Empire state building and both views are awesome.

Something you don't want to miss. We drove in to the city through the Lincoln Tunnel. The view across the river is much to take in. We also saw the skyline from the Statue of Liberty. The view of a "bunch of buildings" is truly amazing. Especially for a southern girl like me!
Iconic view. Anyone who watches movies knows how iconic this view is. It is a great skyline and worth seeing, Take the Statten Island Ferry to and from, so you can see it in all it's glory.
A must-do for visitors to NY. Beautiful walk along the skyline with great views. Amazing way to see parts of NY you'd not ordinarily see.

Viewd from many locations - always fascinating!. We saw the skyline from many angles and locations. It is fabulous from anywhere it is seen, including from an aircraft in the pattern to land at Newark after dark on a clear night. This is an experience of beauty to be enjoyed. From the river cruise, the NY skyline was absolutely gleaming in the bright sunlight. I have seen it many times, but my recent visit was the best, as my Wife was with me!

Must see .. Easiest from ferries , river taxis or helicopters . Our first view was from a JFK taxi at night which was amazing . Whatever way you do it , don't miss it ! As many ways as possible would be best .

Twilight cruise. Took a twilight cruise (really a night cruise) around lower Manhattan from pier 78. Had a wonderful narrarator and learned a lot about Manhattan. It was a great way to get some perfect skyline photographs.

A Must See From Land, Sea or Air. While I freely admit to being biased, New York skyline is the best in the world. I've experienced the view on the ground from Times Square, Brooklyn and New Jersey. I've sailed NY harbor in my boat and flown up and down the Hudson River in my plane. It's ... New York!
A must!!. A must!! You have to do this its so unique, atmospheric and great in Summer. You can get some great photos ops.

Absolutely stunning. The only way to see the skyline properly is to go into Brooklyn. Brooklyn Heights is a beautiful, historic area with tree-lined streets. I brought my sons here because I wanted to share the incredible view with them. It is spectacular!

Boat trip with a view . This skyline is a phenomenal view from the Hudson river on a boat trip it's a must see! We did the last afternoon trip which finished at sunset so got some great photos and panoramic shots of the skyline! Beautiful and lived up to my expectations
Amazing. Walking and admiring the wonderful initiative offered by those who designed the path for us. As you walk you can see the smile and the optimism shining from people's faces.

World Class View. If you've never seen the New York skyline in person you need to add it to your bucket list. Whether you view it from the air, the ferry or your car it's a not to be missed sight when visiting New York.
Sunset to Remember. Walk or pedal via the Legendary Brooklyn Bridge to the Brooklyn Heights take a seat at one of the benches and enjoy the sunset when Manhattan turns into the City of Lights!

Take a Boat Trip. Best vowed from the Yellow Taxi Ferry loads of photo opportunities get off a Brooklyn Bridge and walk across some great selfy pic then get back in the next ferry on other side And finish the trip
iconic skyline. We first saw Manhattan travelling in by bus. The best way to see it is from the air. Recommend to take a helicopter flight to really enjoy it.

Beautiful scenic view. Manhattan skyline gives the indication of how long have we travelled from ages of stones n plasters to the tall mesmerising buildings... a must watch.. world famous Manhattan Skyline is worth the applause.
Just amazing!. Fabulous and iconic view of NY city. An exceptional view from Central Park especially!! Some really famous buildings to see.
Wonderful. New York is one of the friendliest and most buzzy cities that I have ever visited and I would return in a heartbeat!
wonderful sight. A truly wonderful sight by land or sea or from the statue of liberty. Great in blue sky weather shame that it is missing the iconic 2 world trade towers
bus ride. went on the open top bus as great way to get around also to see lots of attractions luckily the weather was kind no rain beautiful view along the brooklyn bridge
Awesome Skyscrapers. Took the ferry from the Jersey side to experience the cool Fall breeze and see the views from both sides of the channel. Really a worthwhile experience.
Beautiful. Great views from the ferry to Ellis Island. Also the snack bar on the ferry was extremely reasonable.
Best place for viewing the skyline. Manhattan skyline is indeed something you sholdn´t miss when in NYC. One of the best places is Brooklyn Promenade near Brooklyn Bridge

Best view from Brooklyn Bridge. Cros Brookly Bridge by bike and take your photo from the brige overlooking the gorgeous view of the Manhattan Skyline. Then take your time to rest on the other side of the river and enjoy the view with an icecream in your hand!

NYC!. This is New York from the movies. We have had glorious warm sun, thick fog and pouring rain. No matter what the weather the Skyline is something special.
We did top of the Rock but I have to admit I preferred the view of Downtown Manhattan from the free Staten Island Ferry as you slowly move away from it.
Great way to see Statue of Liberty - Harbor Cruise. We walked down to the harbor and went on the Harbor Cruise also boarded the Navy carrier. They both give military discounts.

What a skyline!!!!!!. By sea or by helicopter you must go and view , take the camera for some great pictures. A different aspect of an impressive skyline, plenty to see and hear about how NewYork developed

Best viewed from the ferry/water. It looks great from the top of the Empire State or the Rockefeller, but it look best from the Hudson. Either take the Staten Island Ferry or take a proper tour from Pier 83 on the East Side for the finest views of the towering sky scrapers rising magically out of the water...
Like no where else. This type of view is like no where else that I have ever been. Other cities have skyscrapers but not in this number. Lovely at night and form the river views
Brill!. We went with The Circle Line for our tour and it was a beautiful view! We just wish we saw the skyline at night, I don't think we would have been disappointed.

breath taking. Manhattan Skyline is something you must see..all the buildings reaching to the sky. I think best time is just at sunrise.. but just about anytime is good. take your' camera, makes a great backdrop.

Cannot be confused. New York city and Manhattan skyleline are unique.
Cannot be confused with anyother city.
Look a t it when you get in the city by cab or from the near islands.
wha. i would love to live in new York if i had alot of Money of course but i such a good place to hang out have a drink and go shopping
What you see on TV. I know the title sounds so shallow, but it's true. What I see on TV, I see it in real life. Breath-taking.
Mind-blowing. Don't forget en evening cruise around Manhattan.It's even better than the helicopter ride!Totally worth the money and the 3 hours time!
One of the most beautiful things you'll ever see!. This is by far the most mesmerizing place in New York you'll probably see. Truly beautiful and on a rainy day, this is surely out of the world.

One of the Great Cities of the World.. If you are in new York, you simply have to head into Brooklyn for an evening on the waterfront. The view of the city at night is breathtaking. It is so easy to get there, by subway, and then to walk around once you are there. There are also a number of great little places to eat in the area as well.

My favorite skyline. I live close to New York(Couple of hours of drive) and I never get tired of this view. We drive all the way to Jersey City just to have the view on some week ends. You could watch the view from various view points in NYC and New Jersey and multiple observation decks. You are definitely going to see it if you visit NYC.
Wow. What can I say except wow . We went on the hornblower cruise around the bay and the views of Manhattan were absolutely stunning , it will be one view I will remember for a long time

New York, New York! Its a wonderful town.. Many metropolitan skylines are impressive to see. If you want a mixture of old and new, classic and contemporary and one you will never grow tired of --you are there.Take your time either scanning or fixed on one particular area - you can't go wrong.If you are walking, you will feel the city; if you are inside one building looking at others, you will be amazed. If you are on the water or driving from a distance, you will fall in love with this incomparable skyline.
Wonderful. You should include it as a part of your trip as you will have a chance for a panoramic view of New York City. Easy to access with public transportation.

Breathtaking. Whether you see it from your airplane seat, Circle Lines, Staten Island Ferry, Ellis Island, Governor's Island, Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, or standing on a sidewalk, the Manhattan Skyline is breathtaking.

Freedom Tower Observation View. Amazing view, would not have been worth the 3 hour wait ( on a saturday) because we only had a weekend to do Manhattan but with certain credit cards, which we luckily had, you skip the line, become a VIP, get taken right to the elevator. The elevators are SO cool, as you go up you view the NY skyline being built. Very impressive. The view is amazing, you can stay as long as you like, gift shop, restaurant and bar up there. Staff were all very nice and friendly. A bit expensive but worth doing once anyway.
one in a lifetime trip. liberty helicopter tours was amazing. very friendly and assertive. great commentary from pilot and felt very safe

Scristmas Time In The NYC. Best time to see NYC is Christmas time, night, light snow. Just take a ride alongside Hudson River, from G.Washington Bridge to the Brooklyn. All bridges will be on the way. Fantastic!
Views. We saw the skyline from a river cruise, and wow it was impressive. Good weather and calm waters are needed to get the most out of the experience

Nothing like it!. It's easy to see when riding from NJ. It's also easy to see when coming over the RFK bridge and heading towards manhattan. It's easy to see coming in from BKLYN. Makes me proud to be a New Yorker!

the best. Staying with a mate in Brooklyn Heights can see the skyline just like the film Moonstruck,it is beautiful morning noon and night,going to stay at the Plaza for a night ,see what it's like from the Manhatten side.

Poignant. We saw the skyline from the Hudson River as part of our Hop On Hop Off bus ticket. We caught the ferry near to ground zero. Very pig ant given that the skyline was missing the twin towers. The ferry did a few stops taking in the Statue of Liberty. We were on the ferry for almost an hour and great alum for money given it was part of the "bus" ticket.
Just like the movies. We saw the skyline on a bus tour it was wroth the ride. Have your cameras ready you might take a good picture to hang at home.

One of the most iconic city view in the world. A great view - but remember that you need to be in NJ to see it! Take the PATH to Hoboken and visit the bars and restaurants there, and then you'll get a great view at sunset

Magnificient!!!. During my five days trip to New York city ,I visited Manhattan several times.view of Manhattan skyline from a ferry to liberty island and from Brooklyn bridge is really breathtaking!!! I simply loved walking through the streets of Manhattan..

Perfect view . Visited Brooklyn with my husband so we had the experience we walking over the pulaski bridge each day. This gave us the chance to see the skyline in morning, dusk and night. I would recommend people jumping on the metro from grand central it's one stop and a 5 minute walk to get an amazing view.

As seen from the Hop On Hop Off Bus. It was overcast the day we were in NYC but it is an amazing place to visit. We took in many sites and enjoyed the beautiful November weather. Inspire of being a high rise view it was worth seeing.
Unforgettable experience. Thete is nothing more impressive thas seing the skyline of Manhattan from the boat going to the Statue. Try on a sunny day. You will be mostly impressed

Unique and striking. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the most striking in the world, even with the twin towers missing. There are multiple locations for a great view, including from Jersey city, and the Staten Island Ferry
What a View!. We crossed over into to the Brooklyn Heights area for a fantastic view of New York City! It definitely is the place to go to grab that great picture!
Manhattan skyline. Beautiful view , we did the helicopter ride , the views were amazing , you could see so much with out the crowds

Best View. The best view of the NYC skyline is from the Hyatt Regency Hotel in Jersey City, NJ, which also happens to be a great place to stay. The PATH subway station at Exchange Place, is one stop, a $2.75 fare and five minutes from lower Manhattan. The view at sunset and in the evening is best. From tone spot on the boardwalk in front to the hotel you can see the Statue of Liberty, the Staten Island Ferry, the Verrazano Bridge, the Freedom Tower and Lower Manhattan, The Empire State and Chrysler Building and the George Washington Bridge in the distance.
Must See. Must find a way to see the Manhattan skyline. You won't be sorry. Great view. This place is amazing. Brooklyn is a great place to see the skyline.

Best seen from the Watchtower. The best view of Manhattan skyline, is down at the pier, but on Colombia street (where Jehovahs Witnesses headquarter are situated), there is also a spectacular view on the skyline. We took a free provided tour at the Watchtower headquarter, and got a glimpse of the skyline inside the building.

Take the boat to Liberty Island for a great view. Take the boat to liberty Island for a great view or dinner on the Bateaux for a great view of the skyline by night. Both stunning ways to get a great view.

Awesome sight.... Visited NYC in Nov/Dec. The weather was very mild and the day I chose to see the Statue of Liberty didn't disappoint. We took the free Staten Island Ferry and managed to get a great vantage point at the back of the ferry. From there we were able to see the Manhattan Skyline and Lady Liberty. Worth doing.

Nothing to write home about. Was there one evening after dinner, walked half the skyline from the bottom, definitely nothing special to write home about. I wouldn’t waste my time walking there, only if one wants to have a nice walk after a large meal.
Spectacular. As spectacular as it is in the pictures we see online. The best view was from the private cruise we took.

Brilliant. Loved walking along the front in Brooklyn getting a picture of the NY skyline.
Then walked back across the Brooklyn Bridge.
Great experience and memory forever!
Love NYC. Never fails to impress, great to see it appear as you approach from any of the airports, on this occasion jfk and then entering Manhattan via the bridge rather than one of the tunnels.

Not to be missed. . The Manhattan skyline is constantly in evolution and is one of the most spectacular aspects of this city. There are an infinite number of perspectives from high buildings from the park from the West Side Highway and from every other angle of the city. Find a venue and enjoy.
Concrete Jungle. Fine line of concrete sturctures that make up the skyline.There are some iconic buildings in the skyline.Very nice to view it in the night.

See it from the air first. When you fly in, plan to watch out the window and play a game trying to see where you are on the island with the landmarks. When there, you can always look up, or you can go to the top of one of several observation decks. Skip Empire State though....
Great View. The Manhattan Skyline is a just a spectacular view. It is so beautiful and just great view. Its is a must see sight if you are in the area.
See this at night from the river. I think the best way to see this is by travelling on the river, during the day is good but at night it is spectacular.

Beautiful views. We took in the views from above at One World Observatory and we loved it. It was an amazing setting to see Manhattan from above. I highly recommend checking it out. Worth the money!!!!
Amazing. Pictures say more than words can on this occation. Stunning Awsome Amazing Mindblowing Beautiful etc etc etc
Huge. This is awesome. We saw it from liberty Park and came across by ferry. It's everything you thought it would be.

Can't get enough of it!. Iconic! Really! I recommend you take your subway train to Brooklyn just to return via the bridge and see the striking panorama unveil suddenly right in front of you! You'd see people jump up their seats to come close to doors and have a proper look at the skyline.

See it from the ferry. We viewed the Manhattan skyline from the Staten Island ferry which you can travel on totally free of charge. Brilliant and a great way to get a close view of the Statue of Liberty too.
Great Views Night and Day. Take the free Staten Island ferry for views of the NYC skyline and the Statue of Liberty. The ferry leaves every half hour.
Wonderful!. On our recent trip we were lucky enough to see the skyline from the Empire State, a helicopter ride and from a cruise ship. Each time I was in jaw dropping awe at Manhattan!
Iconic. World known, iconic, majestic. Really nice to get to see this site, from up above (Empire, Rockefeller, Freedom) or from the sea or from Brooklyn side...

Look back and hanker. Fabulous perspective of this iconic panorama. Take a bus from the central bus station, maybe visit the Ice Hockey in New Jersey and take in a game and see the skyline from the other side of the Hudson.
Husbands 50th birthday treat . We were lucky enough to see the manhattan skyline by helicopter. A definite must do. Absolutely amazing buildings and gorgeous at sunset
Fab. Best way to see the skyline and I would recommend going at night as it is truly a spectacular sight and makes for beautiful photos.
Helicopter ride is a must. Highlight of our time in New York, you get to see so much, loved it and can recommend this to everyone and it's not that expensive for such a wonderful experiance

A meadow above the most amazing sophisticated city. Highline is calm full of beauty and so very NYC Hip happy and a calm oasis above the hard buy sell and sarcasm of the sometimes brash city A good walk from 14th to 34th suspended above the traffic and throngs of people Surround by the gale of bars and restaurants You feel voyeuristic as you walk calmy though and along an english meadow Run by locals it celebrates the citys cutting edge and inventiveness A fitting tribute to the residents of Gotham spectacular

Excellent Views a must see. No matter where you go in the city you get excellent views. It does not matter if you are at World Trade Center, Statue of Liberty, Top of the rock or empire state bldg they are a must see.
Gorgeous!!!!. We took a Dinner Cruise, as well as Ferry rides; both in the day time & night time. The views of the skyline are incredible!!

Most breathtaking view. It's simply the most famous skyline. And it's so easy to see it from afar for freeOn a bright day take the Staten Island ferry and just look back. It's for free and you have amazing views besides seeing the Statue of Liberty.
Great to see. Best to see from the ferry on the way to the Statue of Liberty, some excellent photos can be taken from here!
