Famous. It´s simply one of the most if not the most famous skylines in the world so you might just as well get a good look at it. I prefer it during the night when you can see al the lights
Beautiful. We saw the Skyline from Brooklyn at night, the view is amazing. I read there are various points where you can see the Manhattan Skyline, I personally enjoyed this point very much.

Probably one of the best skylines you will see. The NYC skyline from any angle is very impressive, no matter how you look at it you are unlikely to see such a famous skyline or density anywhere else, very impressive indeed!
Trip to the Top. Great views of New York. Ticket was included in our Hop On Hop Off tour. Would suggest it to everyone.

The most breathtaking view. Having seen the Skyline from the One World Trade Center and from ground level, knowing it's history this is an experience for life. It makes you want to come back and in the mean time - listen to Frank Sinatra. Great view!

So invigorating to visit NYC. Enjoyed the sights of NYC with a tour on the hop on hop off bus. Another day, walked from W. 90th Street to W 29th St. exploring neighborhoods, Central Park, Times Square, Bryant Park, Broadway.

Spectacular! . We had the chance this past weekend to spend the weekend in NYC but since we stayed in New Jersey, we took the Lincoln Tunnel across and had the most incredible views of the Manhattan skyline. I'm my opinion, this is the best spot to take pictures from, right on the over pass after exiting the tunnel. A must do while in the area!

A most perfect drink and photo opportunity!. There is nothing more perfect then watching the sunrise or sunset as it envelopes NYC in an glow of delight and wonder. There are so many views, from so many perspectives, you cannot get it wrong. Make sure you take your camera!
Fantastic views. The Manhattan views are great, we visited top of the Rock and Empire State and the views over this skyline did not disappoint.would recommend.
Stellar view. Everywhere in every direction, the views are breathtaking. From the Brooklyn Bridge to Staten Island to Central Park - you won't be disappointed.
Unique!!. From the water you have a marvelous view on the most famous skyline in the world. And don't forget to pose from Ellis Island.
New York New York!. In the grand scheme of things they are just concrete buildings, but buildings you cannot take your eyes off!, its the city that never sleeps that carries a fantastic mystique!
What a view. The urban setting is incedible view. The problem is you think it's close but it really isn't. 50 blocks is easily a mile walk.
Fantastic & unique.. So familiar from TV & films but still you get a "wow" from wherever you view it. Staten Island ferry is a must and it's free.

Nothing Like It. The NYC skyline is unique and spectacular. I have seen it from the water taxi, the Staten Island Ferry, the Brooklyn Bridge, and on helicopter tours, both day and night. By day or by night skyline is marvelous.

spectacular. views are best from the Brooklyn Bridge at night and then looking back in. Or to get a photo with the bridge in it, hop on the Landmark cruise with Circle line sightseeing. Tickets are included in the NYC city pass and you get spectacular views of the skyline from all angles.

Love the view.. There is nothing quite like the Manhattan Skyline. It is really special see it from the air as you fly in or from the ferry as you return from The Statue of Liberty. It is nothing short of impressive every time.

Iconic!. We sailed into NYC on a cruise on a gorgeous bright sunny autumn day under the bridge up to Manhattan and past the Statue of Liberty... Just doesn't get much better! Gives you a real sense of scale to the place!

iconic. One of the most recognisable skylines in the world, it cannot be missed. We were going to take the subway over just to take photos but you get a really gooď view on the bus tours. The brooklyn tour gives you day time views and the night tour gives you breathtaking veiws of the sky at night.
Amazing views. You are able to get some amazing views of the city, if you go over the Brooklyn bridge at night and look back over the city sky line it's amazing to see the lit up buildings.
Great Skyline. Loved the view during the day and at night. A great view from the Brooklyn Bridge and from the New Jersey Pier
Hrandeur. We decided to stay on the Jersey City shoreside which give you a nice flat for a decent price in a very modern, tidy and secure neighbourhood. As a bonus, you get the most amazing view!
Stunning. We saw the view by night on the night bus tour and by day on the Circle Line City Sightseeing Cruise - Stunning
hop on hop off boat. you get a great view if you take the hop on hop off boat it also takes you out and around the statue of liberty
Don't Miss. Many a backdrop in TV/Moves so a must see when you are here. Never fails to excite approaching New York and seeing Manhattan!
Breathtaking. It was so amazing to see. I took so many pictures, I had to buy more film. It almost looked like a painting on canvas. It is even more beautiful to see at night.

Iconic Skyline. It's something you've seen in film & TV so many times, but to see it in real life really is breathtaking. We got great views from the hop-on hop-off ferries & also the hop-on hop-off Night Tour. Wear a coat & don't forget your camera!

Absolutely beautiful. I've been to NYC a fair amount in the last couple of years for work, and I still can't get enough of this city. The view of skyline when flying in on a clear night is second to none. The architecture, lights, and design of the city is mesmerizing and amazing. If you're never been to the top of the Empire State building at night, go. The NYC skyline at night is just beautiful. You won't be disappointed.
Amazing. Who goes to NYC and not look up? It is truly amazing the buildings go on and on and on and the height will blow your mind.

Beautiful city skyline !!! . The skyline of this city is like no other I have seen anywhere in the world. There are bigger cities, cities with more buildings, cities with more people, but no other city has Central Park and the other things that make New York City unique !!!

What you see is what you get. What is there to say, one of the most legendary views ever. And even if you've seen it 100 already, it strikes you every time! Iconic building mixed with a few "regular" skyscrapers that nonetheless are just amazing experience. If you have time, it is great just to sit down with someone, grab a drink and just enjoy the view. Simple as that.

Long Island City is the place from where to see it!!!. And dusk is the perfect time. Gantry Park, which provides these amazing views, is one of the newer parks in NYC, but it is very relaxing and beautiful. You can take a taxi, but you do not need to. Take instead the 7 train in Grand Central Station, and get off at the first stop in Queens, Vernon Jackson. Exit at the Vernon Boulevard exit, and walk towards the waterfront. On a crisp fall night, the Manhattan skyline shimmers.Great view of many architectural landmarks including the Empire State Building, the Chrysler building, and the United Nations.
Not much can beat it. Took the Statue Cruise to Liberty & Ellis Islands so get optimal views from the ferry.Great day out even if all you want is the view!

The Manhattan skyline. We were on the cruise ship the Queen Mary 2 and were transfixed when we could see the Manhattan Skyline for the first time.We had seen it before in photographs and in films but to actually see it with our own eyes is an iconic experience.
Prettier View in Person!!!. We were able to see the Manhattan skyline from the Staten Island Ferry side as well as from the Brooklyn Bridge. Whether day or night - the skyline was breathtaking!
Fantastic View. Absolutely brilliant view of Manhattan - we loved itlThe views are great at night too.Our selfie stick came in handy.

AMAZING. when you visit the statue of liberty, or stattan island ferry you get some amazing views of the skyline and after walking the streets you cannot imagine it is the same place well worth a trip to see the amazing view
One of the best in the world. Saw it from the top of the Empire States Building, from the Hudson river and from the Statue of Liberty. I will never bore of looking at it.

Fantastic view of Manhattan Skyline. The Manhattan skyline is unique and distinct. The tall skyscrapers in Wall Street and the financial district makes the view awe-inspiring. Sunlight reflecting off the tinted windows of these buildings gives the view a different perspective when seen at sunrise, mid-day or at sunset. At dusk, just before sunset, the skyline takes on a golden hue. At night, the skyline comes alive with a million specks of light - a view worth taking in. If you have the City Pass, you will have 3-4 opportunities to view the skyline - by taking the Circle Line cruise along the Hudson river or taking the ferry to the Statue of Liberty. From the statue, the skyline includes New Jersey, Manhattan and Long Island. If you have never had the opportunity to take in this view before, then I would highly recommend it. Great views of the skyline may also be had from the top of the Empire State building or The Top of the Rock.

One of the 7 wonders of the modern world..... Who does not stand in awe of this incredible site? This site is a monument to man's ingenuity, perseverance, and determination to shape the world for future generations.

nothing even comes close. there is no skyline in the world like the Manhattan skyline....especially if you facing lower Manhattan from a boat on the river or from Brooklyn....nothing else in the world like it....and at night it is an absolute jewel.

The Ferry. We saw the Manhatton skyline from the free very while doing a round trip , Good way to chill out for an hour or so
Also get good views of the Statue of Liberty.
Sunset Boat Cruise. What a place.... Got to see the skyline not only from the empire state building but also from a sunset cruise... Amazing

Beautiful. Beautiful pic day or night, you really must enjoy a bagel or any other wonderful New York treat while catching shots of the amazing skyline... Why not have a Manhattan while in Manhattan ??? Hahahaha ....
View at night!. View is so unique! Especially from the Spirit cruise. Lit up at night it has identifiable iconic buildings.
Caotic beauty. I love NY, I enjoy everything it offers and through out the years the skyline changed but still mesmerizing.

Beautiful. This is a must!!! Anyone who visits new york must go and view the skyline it is so beautiful to see. Just make sure you have a camera because it is amazing and you will want to take pictures.

A Big WOW. No matter how you view the skyline... from the New Jersey shoreline, from the boats cruising the Hudson or East Rivers, or from the Top of the Rock... it is a jaw-dropping sight! I have never seen so many buildings so close together, and all reaching for the sky. Amazing!
Unique view. Such amazing view day and night, great picture opportunities from Brooklyn, from Governors Island or from the Staten Island Ferry.

The Symbol of America's Greatness!. I can't drive into NYC without being moved and amazed at the beautiful sight of Lady Liberty standing proudly in the New York harbor. All the people who have passed this way on the way to becoming Americans is a stunning reminder of our multicultural and rich heritage.
Iconic. It's fun to write about the skyline of a city, but this one is very recognizable and definitely worth it to check out fro it;s many locations
Breathe taking. Just being in manhattan is breathe taking. We always enjoy our trips to NY. It is hectic and go go go but always worth the effort. We look forward to coming back in March.

A beautiful sight from so many perspectives. We saw the skyline on our approach to Newark International Airport; and we saw it again from the boat that took us to the Statue of Liberty. It is wonderful on a clear and lovely day which we were fortunate enough to have during our trip. It is constantly changing and, of course, the new World Trade Center has changed the skyline a lot (and the loss of the twin towers).

Another must see. So you have arrived and fallen in love with NYC. Make time to visit downtown Manhattan, jump on the Staten island ferry, which is free and get your free view of the Statue of Liberty and coming back the Manhattan skyline
Best view. NY is busy,noisy,crowded fast paced and it's My Home. Even the sunsets look great. Dont forget the beauty of Central Park.
Must see. Whether by land, sea, or air the Manhattan Skyline is one of the world's iconic sites. So grab your camera and get taking some photos!!

View of a lifetime. I went to New York City with my husband to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. We drove from Niagara Falls with a one night stay in Scranton PA. To get the best night time view we stayed in a river view room at the Sheraton Hotel in Weehawkin. The spring night was clear and I managed to get a photo of the full moon reflecting on the river high over the skyline with the slight ripples from the ferry adding texture to the photo. It's a picture I waited a long time to get and I enjoyed sitting on the benches along the walkway just taking in the whole scene. Amazing!!

AMAZEBALLS. Saw the skyline in the air on a helicopter ride with New York Helicopter. IT WAS MIND BLOWING! 100% recommend you do this!! You saw everything that you needed and more. We had a fantastic pilot who obviously knew where everything and made sure we didn't miss a thing. He was also very reassuring as one of our friend was very nervous.

Brooklyn park. Its sunday go to brooklyn park at manhattan brudge best view of ny skyline great space and best view of best city in the worldWalk iver to grimaldis have a poo izza ar 3pm greatest time and vibe hereJimbo bateso
Best from Newark airport. The best view is from New Jersey. If you have the opportunity to fly into Newark the hidden plus is the NYC skyline on landing and in traveling into Manhattan.

I view the Manhattan Skyline every day from my Jersey City Apt.. And I never tire of the view....it is unique and impressive. So come to Jersey City and walk the Hudson River promenade and enjoy the view of NYC. From World Trade Center you can take the PATH train on stop to Exchange Place (5 minutes) and then walk the uncrowded river walk of Jersey City

I miss the World Trade Center but the Skyline is still BEAUTIFUL.. One of the best things to do is to hop on a boat or ferry in lower manhattan, ride around the Hudson river and view the Manhattan Skyline. I do it a lot in summer on a day when I've got nothing particular to do. You'll end up taking pictures, selfies, and just enjoying the day. Take friends and make it a party, but I pack a lunch in my back pack, some water, a book and just GO!!!!!! ALWAYS something to do in New York and the Skyline is sublime in summer.
Awesome!. Great view from Liberty and Ellis Island. Was able to see the skyline on the Big Bus Night tour. If in the fall or winter, bundle up -- but still enjoyable.
Stunning.. Good views from Central Park and from Empire State too. Breath-taking, definitely worth having an explore around town to get some good hidden views!

Iconic. The Manhattan Skyline is one of those views that everyone surely must have on their bucket list. It is spectacular to see with your own eyes, and we found it certainly lived up to what you see in the movies. Highly recommended.
Viewed from Brooklyn. Beautiful view from the balcony of a Brooklyn building. Then we walked down to Dumbo and viewed from there. Loved it.

View to die for. We could not get away from the view. We came early morning, during the day and again at sunset. It's a great view whenever you go. Very pretty st sunset as the lights of Manhatten are coming on.

lovely walk. It was wet and windy when we walked the Manhattan Skyline, only walked one section of it but it was worth it, an excellent completed project and would like to walk the whole of the Skyline

Absolutely Incredible!. The late Kurt Vonnegut (author) supposedly once referred to Manhattan as "a skyscraper theme park"...and he was right!Not only is Manhattan's skyline awesome, but also it KEEPS CHANGING! One way is the addition of what are called "Super-Tall's" -- i.e. residential buildings of 1,000 feet (304.8 M) such as "OneFiftySeven W. 57th Street" and "432 Park Avenue" (which are visible from everywhere in the city.And then there are the newest buildings rising on what was once called "the Far West Side" of Manhattan (an area between the Hudson River and Tenth Avenue from W. 34th Street south) in an area called "Hudson Yards" (it is near the Hudson and OVER the train yards for the Long Island Railroad!)But wait, there's more! On West 57th Street and 12th Avenue is rising a building resembling a pyramid or a sail, and in the Financial District there are many construction sites, with their giant construction cranes towering over other buildings.So Manhattan's skyline IS a skyscraper theme park, one where architecture buffs will never be bored!

Manhattan Skyline is one of the Iconic Skylines of the World. The Manhattan Skyline is spectacular from all vantage points: the air, the water, the city itself. There is a great deal to see and experience in this world-class city. A Manhattan cruise (about 2 hours) is a wonderful way to view the skyline from the water - cruises leave from the south-end of the island. These cruises are beautiful day or night. You can also see a great deal of the city by Hop-On-Hop-Off bus tour. Manhattan has experienced a building-boom in the real estate surrounding Central Park. Giant, towering residential buildings are popping-up everywhere.
Wow. Absolutely amazing views from the freedom tower last night. We stayed to watch the sunset just beyond the statue of liberty and it was stunning. Not a sight I'll forget in a long time.
Spectacular View!!. Anywhere you go and look up, the Manhattan Skyline was there to take in. The night lights are worth seeing!

Manhattan Skyline as you approach Manhattan from the State Island Ferry. Amazing! Amazing! Amazing! It's just too beautiful. There's nothing like this in the whole world. Try to time it as the sun sets either approaching Manhattan from Staten Island or vice versa from the State Island Ferry. The Staten Island Ferry is free.
Breathtaking. ...and makes you wonder about the soul of the city and the people that have erected those magnificent buildings. Truly awe-inspiring sight.

The most famous skyline. Also if a lot of skylines are growing out of the soil in some other countries, this one remains the most famous and beautiful for me.
What I suggest is to go on the piers on the Brooklyn side (I think Pier 5 was the best location) to watch the sunset over the skyline. That's really beautiful.
Amazingggggggggggg. Always seen in movies, but felt the difference when saw it in real life. The amazing view of skyline from the Brooklyn bridge.

Watching the sun go down from Brookly. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge and watched the sun go down over Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty. If you are up to it, a great way to see the lights come on over the city. Walking back over the bridge in the dark is pretty special too.

Mother and Daughter Holiday. We took a boat ride round Manhattan so as not to miss seeing it from all angles. Spectacular. A sight that we never get enough of. A sad moment looking at it as we left. We will be back.
Best views from NJ. The best way to view NY skyline if from NJ. Take the Ferry or Path to NJ and enjoy the incredible iconic views of NYC.

The Best!!!. One of the most amazing skylines in the world. In some opinions THE most amazing. Great views from the Brooklyn Bridge and I here Hoboken is off the beaten path but something to consider for great views. (and...a cool place to visit)

Best Night Views are from Brooklyn. The Manhattan Skyline is so big, you have to go to Brooklyn or to the some of the rooftop bars to take in all in. My favorite views were of the lights at night, like looking a jewels. The new World Trade Center and the ever-present Empire State Building are easily recognized.

Amazing buildings. The view of the Manhattan Skyline is absolutely amazing! These are some of the tallest buildings in the world, besides visiting Manhattan, you should see it from a distance as well.

Breathtaking View. Best time to visit is in the night when we can see the lit up Manhattan skyline across river Hudson. Go to Brooklyn park under the century old wooden bridge. Good restaurants available there. Slowly walk over the Brooklyn bridge taking in the magnificent sight of sky scrapers on the other side. Brooklyn bridge is also available for cycling.
Go to Manhattan bridge. Lovely to se the Manhattan skyline and especially from the Manhattan bridge and at night you get a true picture of the size and business of New York

Caught Between the Moon and New York City. How can one not love the view of the Manhattan Skyline? This is an iconic skyline that takes you away to many memorable movies. I still remember the skyline with the twin towers and miss them greatly each time I see the skyline. You have to somehow find a point to observe the skyline during the day and at night. If not, you've wasted a trip to the Big Apple!

Manhattan is an adventure. New York, New York - you want to sing it. It's never boring visually or in humanity. It's fun looking out over the skyline with the varied buildings and looking out to the Statue of Liberty is always moving. Just jump in, walk and explore. You won't eb sorry

Gorgeous Skyline. Viewed it from a Zip helicopter, the statue of liberty and the Empire State Building. The Empire State Building was during the day and at night. I highly recommend the helicopter view and crown tickets from the statue of liberty.

Lovely sight...!!!. The Manhattan skyline looks so familiar even for a first time viewer. Blame that on the American soaps and Hollywood movies. But still, the view is simply breathtaking. The pick of the lot is the view of lower Manhattan from the ferry that takes to Staten island. Glorious, and makes a fantastic backdrop for selfies.

As good as it looks!. What a view!! I used to see this on photos and in movies and always wanted to see it in real life, I am so glad I did, taking a boat out to the Statue Of Liberty gave us amazing views of the city, what a fantastic place to take photos.

Excellent. Walk over Brooklyn Bridge to visit Brooklyn Bridge Park for a great view of the Manhattan skyline. Also worth a visit is the East River State Park in Brooklyn for a great view. Spend the day in Brooklyn which has a relaxed and chilled out atmosphere compared to he hustle and bustle of Manhattan.

Recognizable anywhere!. The best way to see the skyline is to head to the top of the Empire State Bldg. but if you want to see the skyline and don't have much money, take the Staten Island Ferry. Besides the skyline, you'll even get to go by the Statue of Liberty!
Especially Great from Brooklyn Bridge. It's particularly great if you walk on Brooklyn Bridge from the Brooklyn side to Manhattan! Most important, it's free!

My all time favorite!. I like to see the skyline, flying in or out of Newark. The view is just perfect, if you choose the right side of the plane ...Another great way of looking at the skyline is taking the Brooklyn Bridge. Walk all the way to the other side and feel the breeze, enjoy the skyline and amaze yourself like thousands of people must have done arriving at Ellis Island, so long ago!
Awe Inspiring. Seeing the skyline at all hours of the day and night is fabulous. Occasionally you can see a rainbow over the city.
Movie lovers photo op!. If you are a movie lover as most of us are, then definitely a photo taken of the Manhattan Skyline must be added to your travel or movie landmark album! :)

Make sure you see it at night as well as by day. If you go to New York and don't take time out to see the skyline then you've missed the who point of it. And the best view is from the South. You can do a 30 minute harbour ride out and around the Statue of Liberty in the day, and then get the night bus tour to see the city from across the bridge in Brooklyn. If you get the Big Bus two day ticket both of these experiences are included.Don't miss it!

Cheap thrill to last a lifetime. I can't believe that reviewing the Manhattan skyline is even a thing. It does not need reviewing, it is the Manhattan skyline. Save yourself some bucks and get on the Staten Island ferry (free ride to SI, 75 cents back to Manhattan). One of the best and most memorable views anywhere and certainly the best deal, except maybe from the Bklyn Bridge (which is free), but they views are very different.

It gives you the goose pimples.. For people somehow connected to Manhattan the sheer view is an emotional feeling.Whether you arrive from JFK, La Guardia or EWR it is the same thing. You can spot a skyscraper and figure out where you are. It's like feeling the vibration of the most lively city in the World. The best approach to New York City is by car, cab or limo.By the way, the 59th Street Bridge (Queensborogh) is toll free.
Fantastic view. What a skyline. Awesome. Boat trips well worth doing to get best views. Have many photos shots of the various views and of course you get up close to Statue of Liberty .

See it from the GWB. Great place to see the Manhattan skyline of from the middle of the south walkway on the George Washington Bridge. Access the walkway from 178th St. and Cabrini Blvd., a short walk from the 175th A train station. The walk all the way across (about a miles plus) takes about 20-25 minutes, about 10 minutes to get half way. Just be aware that because there are so many bikers, if you walk, you may have to do so single file Make sure you go on a clear day. The north walkway gives you the view of the Hudson, NY and NJ looking north. It's also free. If you only want to walk one way you can continue on to the Bus stop and take either of the numerous buses back across or the Spanish Jitneys. Bikers note that the North walk way entrance at 179th St. and Pinehurst has stairs. The south side does not.

Many places to views on rooftop hotels. A lovely place to view n.y.c. s rooftop view is Rare bar and restaurant in the Sheborne Hotels rooftop. See the Chrysler building and the Empire state building on clearer nights, beautiful views. Just take the rooftop hotel elevator. A do not miss!
Mesmerising any time - Day or Night. Enjoy it from Brooklin/ Bridges/River - If you are a shutterbug.. you are going to love it.. possibly the best skyline..
Beautiful pix from the Statue of Liberty. The skyline is amazing with great views from several places. I liked the view from the grounds of the Statue Of Liberty.
Great views. Lovely vista for the weary traveller!😊 The city looks so pristine from afar...not so up close! Still, some memorable pictures to be taken.😊

Free and outstanding skyline views from Brooklyn. The promenade over the Brooklyn Queens Expressway in Brooklyn Heights is my favorite, ice cream nearby, some great pizza, and Brooklyn Bridge Park just minutes away. So what are you waiting for! Pizza: Grimaldi's, Ignacio's,for whole pies (walk down Old Fulton St. look for crowds), Frascati for slices (on Henry St.)Ice Cream: next to River Cafe under the Brooklyn BridgeSplurge: River Cafe, can't beat the food, service, or viewFast, good food in Brooklyn Bridge Park

No matter if you see it by land or by sea, it is wonderful!. We have had the privilege of visiting New York City twice in as many years and we still do not tire of the skyline.Whether you are on a Circle Line cruise viewing it from the water, or on Liberty Island with the Statue of Liberty above you or from the Top of the Rock or the Empire State you can't help but be blown away by its majesty.Although the skylines silhouette has changed since the tragedy of 9/11 the new Freedom Tower just illustrates the resilience of New York and her people. It really does represent America and what she stands for.
Skyline. We saw most of the Manhattan skyline from a boat trip around the harbour. This also included sailing past the Statue of Liberty.

Wow. Stunning wherever you see it. In the day on the free Staton Island ferryAt dusk from the Brooklyn bridge.At night from a cruiseAlways changing. Always beautiful.Get a wide angle lens for your camera!
AMAZING to say the least!. It is truly one of those things you have to see, especially at night time to appreciate. The pictures just don't do it justice as opposed to seeing it in person.
NEW YORK, NEW YORK!!!. There are several spots and locations along Hudson River at the New Jersey side where you have a great look out over Mannhattan Sky Line.
wow. Breathe taking to see especially at night with all the lights shining bright. We went by boat and saw it which was fantastic with plenty of time to take pictures. A must do for all
Stunning!. You must see this skyline... so full of history and emotions. Classic in every way and well worth a cruise around the harbor.

Cold but Awesome. Went there in early January 2015. Snow was on the ground, and I almost froze my behind off-literally.
But... after the 2 flights of stairs, I saw an amazing view. I would recommend going when it's nicer out (unless you're a penguin or like not having a ton of people around).
#recommend.

Screaming Skyscrapers - Nowhere in the World equal to this!. Being in Manhattan at least once in ones life is a dream come true. I got to see what a truly busy 24/7 city life is like. People walking with serious intent, taxis scurrying to beat the red lights, the flashing signs and lights from the commercial establishments, all the sights and sounds associated with restaurants, malls ... It's an unbelievable experience.

Always Impressive; Always Changing. Approaching the City from LaGuardia Airport you get the best views coming East; coming EAST from NJ on the turnpike you get the hudson views. But do come from Staten Island by ferry to see lower Manhattan. And take in everything 360 by boat. We hired one from 23rd Street Pier with an architect for the narrator.
Stunning during the day, more so at night.. the views from the Empire State Building day and night as well as the Rockefeller Centre are well worth it.
Always spectacular. The cruise to the Statue of Liberty continues to give a magnificent view of the Manhattan skyline. The new World Trade Center building gives it a new and inspiring look.
Gorgeous. Views from Manhattan are simply breathtaking. When visiting hotels try to get a room on a high floor. These views are the best!
Central Park- gorgeous in Autumn. . We were lucky enough to be staying near Central Park. Go as many times as you can when you visit New York.

Iconic view. Do a cruise to get the full impact of the manhattan skyline. Such a great view of an amazing city. Pier 83 is where you catch the boat. We bought the city pass that included the cruise, it only went half way around manhattan and returned back the pier 83. Book a cruise that goes around the whole of manhattan. Ours went past the Statue of Liberty and under the Brooklyn and manhattan bridges, then turned around and went back to pier 83!

Brooklyn bridge and Roosevelt Island Tram . The bridge is a wonderful walk to see the skyline. Can't beat that view. The tram is a free ride (with metro card) in the air with great views although through a window
Post card perfect. The best way to see the Manhattan skyline is from the free Staten island ferry. It makes for a great desktop background.
Exchange place. Best view take the PATH from ground zero to exchange place, one stop. Great view from there. You can as well take the ferry, but more then the double for the price
View from Jersey. We dined at the Haven in Edgewater, NJ and enjoyed stunning views of the Manhattan Skyline. Highly recommended! Worth the trip.
Great view of skyline. If you want to get a great view of the skyline you must get away from Manhattan. It is definately a must see if you are in NYC
Nice. Take a boat ride, I can't remember wht company we took but we bought the NY pass worth $$ if u have 4-7 days. We can stop at few places & it was nice. Had ample time 2 take pics
excellent way to start the day walking. it got us all the way to the Whitney museum. Amazing view from every direction. it was very clean. great for all ages.

The "Lady" is beautiful from the water!. Don't miss taking a boat tour of the Harbor around the beautiful Statute of Liberty and Ellis Island. It was far better than standing next to our Lady of Liberty and looking up.

So beautiful!. The Manhattan Skyline is stunning - make sure you check out the view from different angles throughout the city. (Looking up from Central Park; looking out across the water from the Staten Island Ferry; view from Brooklyn Heights Promenade.) View by night is the best!

An essential view point on your holiday. not much to say about the skyline other then it blows away your perception of the city.. a gorgeous view both day and night.. and well worth a look from different perspectives.
Gorgeous. What a stunning skyline! Not much else to add, really. It is hard sometimes to reach 100 characters.

A spectacular view at night. The Manhattan skyline is beautiful during the day but is really spectacular at night. From the Staten Island Ferry you can see both the skyline and the Statue of Liberty. It is a quick ride on the PATH subway to the New Jersey side and walking along the waterfront with views of both the Skyline and the Statue of Liberty at night can't be beat.
Wow. When you first see the skyline it's unbelievable , you only usually see it in TV.Breathtaking and unreal.The closer you get you then realist how huge these buildings are!!
Stunning. Viewed from every angle it's simply stunning. My personal favourite was the view from Brooklyn Heights/Brooklyn Park at dusk.

Got me every time!!. Just amazing!!We caught it with clear skies, nightfall, sunset and cloud and every time it was amazing!!The first time we drove across from our hotel in Brooklyn and the three of us were in aww!

This is awesome and free of charge!. The ferry to Staten Island will give you a great view of the Statue of Liberty, but it will also give you a great view of the south of Manhattan and its skyline!Another option that I have explored is to walk over Brooklyn bridge and gaze upon Manhattan from that side

WOW, what a view!. Take a water taxi or any boat you can ride and just sit back and enjoy the iconic views of NYC. Travel under the Brooklyn Bridge, see the new Freedom Building, feel the energy of the world's greatest cities...
Iconic skyline. Whether you look at if from Liberty Island, a passing boat, Brooklyn Bridge or Brooklyn Promenade, this is a truly iconic skyline.Great during the day; amazing at night.

Repeatedly pleasant visual surprise. I never tire of this skyline. It is visible daily when we are in our NJ coop with a view if GW bridge, Hudson R, Manhattan and E River, but I love it when it magically appears from other vantage points. Yesterday I took a wrong turn exiting the Lincoln Tinnel in NJ and found myself gazing directly and closely at midtown. Wow!

stunning. We sailed into New York on a cruise ship and when we finally saw the sky line my comment was "thats what I was hoping to see" I was not disappointed . The lights were on as it was early morning and as the day dawned you could make out more of the buildings . It was a really exciting feeling . When you get into the middle of it its mind blowing , noisy , exciting , high thrilling
Best Skyline. it is worth finding a place to see the skyline from. There is nothing like it almost anywhere else, we took the ferry.
Familiar but always magnificent. Wherever you stand the skyline is imposing. Its probably the most famous skyline anywhere but still grabs one's attention!
A must-do. Take the transport to Brooklyn to get a great view of the Manhattan Skyline. It's a lot like in the movie, except it's for real... Romantic, free and fun.
Iconic. It really is as good as you have imagined it to be. Take the free Staten Island ferry for one view or the ferry from East 34th Street across to Williamsburg for another.

Awesome is best description. One of my favorite ways to view the skyline of NY is from the New Jersey side around Hoboken as you can grab a warm piece of Coffee Cake at Carlo's Bakery and sit and view the skyline while enjoying the cake early in the morning.
a view. you can never have enough of it. day, night, evening, enjoy the view from various angles at different times.
wow. get a hop on/hop off bus pass go on the night tour its breathtaking they take you over the brooklyn bridge to see the Manhattan skyline
Can't be beat. Here's a tip. Take the free Staten Island ferry to pass the Statue of Liberty and get an incredible view of the Manhattan skyline. A great Where are you? To see the scale of the city.

Goode Music, Good Food and Drink. A well known Jazz Sunday Brunch 4 hours long. You MUST book ahead or you may be unlucky. Service was spot on. Unlimited Mimosa free for the first hour and $6 for the rest of our visit. Outstanding service. Fixed price menu of infinite variety, which was value for money indeed. A Jazz venue, which was the purpose of my visit, and the music was superb. All in all a great afternoon which I would recommend even for non jazz lovers.

Awesome!. Whenever I spot the skyline on the trip in from the airport, I hear Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue (as used in Woody Allen's Manhattan) in my head and the hairs stand up on the back of my neck! Magical!

MANHATTAN SKYLINE with the GV TRAVEL KING. One of many classic scenes in a movie, One of many classic landscape photographs, One of many memories from your life– feature this skyline. It's fascinating seeing the literal visualization of "mankind" ascending structurally in a space. Feel free to analyze the poetics of that statement.

Hop on Hop Off night tour. We bought a two day bus pass and did the night tour. This tour is free and lasts for about 2hr and you can see the skyline of Manhattan brilliantly when you get to the Brooklyn Bridge. Ive some fantastic photos. The Skyline is fantastic

Just fantastic. Take the suway to Brooklyn High and walk to the Park at Dumbo. Just Wow!!! Or take the
aerial Tramway to Roosevelt Island, and see an other skyline, and fly in between the streets and builidings.
One of my favorite views. Always love flying in or seeing the skyline from liberty island, Brooklyn, etc. Next trip were planning a helicopter tour, should be fun!
An interesting architectural experience. An interesting architectural experience - especially during the night with all the lights. Must be in the list when you visit NYC.
GREAT VIEW. New York is a great place to visit. 9/11 Memorial breath taking experience. Fine restaurants, great shopping and luckily great weather
Stunning. Absolutely stunning. Best seen from a few places, Staten Island Ferry and the Top of the Rockefella centre in my opinion.
Just lika a postcard. I saw this view from the roof terrace installation at the Met. It was a clear day so everything was just like on TV or on a postcard. Stunning.

World Class. NYC is a classic, beautiful skyline that competes with the great skylines of the world whether it is Hong Kong, Dubai, Chicago, Shanghai, or any other city in the world. The ongoing reconstruction of the World Trade Center and the new One World Trade brings the distinctiveness of the great sky scraper back to the city. Every angle is awe inspiring.

Overwhelming View!!!. What can one say about the New York skyline? Never enough! You see it in movies and TV shows but until you come here and see it in person you just can't believe it!! The size of everything is overwhelming!
Overwhelming !. It was unreal to be standing right in front of this beautiful skyline and to also get a glimpse of our Statue Of Liberty !!

Skyscrappers in the clouds. Saw this skylines from the open bus from the across the bridges and from the ferry to Statue of Liberty in the night and in day. Its awesome night view is far more exciting to watch and when its raining the most skylines you can see the half and rest half is covered with the clouds but it looks amazing. Seems like skylines going in the clouds.

Family break in NYC. Fascinating and very impressive City, the whole family absolutely loved it, although we walked for miles covering everything, definitely recommend the sightseeing tour bus, made great use of it for the week
Wow Wow Wow. Brilliant time, go and do Manhattan New York. Make sure you go up the Empire States and the new Freedom Tower, so much to see, don't expect to get to bed early though.
everybody needs to see the famous skyline. definitely worth a look at you can get some amazing pictures of this from the ferry that goes out to ellis island and the statue of liberty
Very pretty. Saw this while at the Statue of Liberty. Very expressive. Would love to see this at night. If people have time while in New York it is worth seeing

From every angle it's just wow.. Up close, from onto of the Rock, Empire State, the shores of Brooklyn, walking along the street the. Skyline is jaw dropping. And beautiful. Like no other city on earth and with so many vantage points.

A movie view. Cant think of a more awesome city skyline than that offered by New York City. How many people who have never been to the big apple will recognise the view. Great fun picking out the buildings and giving name to them. a return is a must.
incredible view. This has to be a must see or a bucket list item. What a great city. The view from Empire State and Statue of Liberty is absolutely beautiful.
what can one say.... There are few better skylines in the world. there are many POVs from where you can see it... Staten Island ferry or Brooklyn bridge or Central Park..
Just wonderful. At first I didn't want to do it, but I did and if you have time, do it, you won't regret. and the view is unique

You MUST visit the Skyline (not in winter). This is one of the you must in NYC, is a very nice walk on a railroad train of an abandoned and totally recycled, something different and beautiful, very NYC. ONLY if the weather is nice!!!
Fantastic. While I worked in Manhattan, i was able to appreciate the skyline only when i went to Status of Liberty and saw the skyline from New Jersey side!
Nothing like it. I can't help but take pictures of the Manhattan Skyline from New Jersey or Brooklyn when we're on our way into the city. Beautiful!
Beautiful from the Ferry. Take the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island Ferry Late or the Staten Island Ferry it is a really nice view from the boat !

Now, this is one of my greatest haunts. I love going to the Brooklyn Bridge Park as I can see the Manhattan skyline.. From the Brooklyn Bridge Park, one can see the Manhattan skyline clearly. Binoculars would be helpful. So many photographs are taken of the skyline. It is beautiful in the daytime and nighttime on a clear day. You can also go on a cloudy day. It gets cold doing that type of activity in the winter, though.
Amazing. Looks different without the twin towers but a sight to behold from the river cruises or Liberty Island

Many views available of the Manhattan Skyline.. I enjoyed the Skyline from my plane heading into LaGardia,
from walking the Brooklyn Bridge, from the Staten Island Ferry, from the rooftop of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and late at night from the Empire State Buildling.

BREATHTAKING. The worlds most awe inspiring city scape, never ceases to hypnotise the viewer. It looks amazing by night as you approach from Queens and equally stunning looking down from the Empire State Building.

It stays impressive every time you watch. The Manhattan skyline stays impressive every time you watch. From wathever side you look. Especcialy from the Brooklyn height promenade the view stays impressive.

Best View in the World. There is only one New York Skyline in the world and several advantage points to see it. I suggest the view from Stevens Institute in Hoboken or the shoreline walk, Brooklyn at Columbia Heights or the Circle Line (well worth the money and the 3 1/2 cruise around the entire island. Staten Island Ferry also a good view too.
So many ways to see it!!!. Wow! There are so many different ways to view it (via helicopter/river cruise/on foot/bus) and honestly whichever you choose you will not be disappointed in the least!

So many locations in NYC to view the skyline. Just to mention a few: from the Staten Island ferry, the IKEA ferry, both free, the Roosevelt Island team, it takes the subway pass, from the marina by TriBeCa. Just walking down any street in the city you can look up and see amazing architecture. Go very to Brooklyn and go under the Bridge and there's incredible views of Manhatten. Central Park has incredible skylines around it.

A strol through the skyscrapersl. We were told of this skyline walk through the hotel. A few blocks away having had breakfast we joined the walk. There was a lot of building work (to be expected) but the views are worth it. We walked along with many others until we got close to Chelsea market.

Fantastic buildings. One must visit not only the skyline,but to admire the architecture of buildings in mass.If you look from Statue of Liberty location,the scene is fantastic and any one will admire the view.

Beautiful sightseeing. As a first time in NYC I had always been in awe from these scenery whenever I had seen it on tv, but when you get close to it, that's when it hits you the two bridges of Brooklyn and Manhattan and the Manhattan skyline itself are all breath taking.

What a large city should look like. With the large variety of buildings in a 360 degree view interspersed with various colours,central park,waterways and spectacular views at night this is a real treat to see.

Wow!. One of the best views of the Manhattan Skyline is from the Staten Island Ferry.....and its free! Take the ferry across to the island, get great photos of the Statue of Liberty on the way over and on the way back and the photos you can take of the Manhatten skyline cant be bettered! Worth the trip.

Ride the Staten Island Ferry to see it. It's free and the views are incredible. It's about a 30 min ride each way and you do have to disembark and whichever end you turn around on, but it's very quick.
Beautiful Fall Day. This is amazing site at night as well as on a pretty day! There are several places to see the skyline.

Fantastic - like none other. Wow - what more can you say? The skyline of NY City is truly iconic; all those skyscrapers reaching upward along the shores of lower Manhattan. The new Freedom Tower is fantastic as well. Don't forget to bring along your camera. Also, point the lens that way of you happen to take the ferry to Ellis Island, as it makes for some great shots!

The best. I have traveled a lot all over North America and Europe, enjoyed most of it but New York City is the best. It has everything from great restaurants to great museums, the various neighborhoods are wonderful and diverse, despite the comments of the unknowing, the people are helpful and kind. Yes, NY moves at a very fast pace but that is stimulating, plenty of entertainment of every sort in the city that never sleeps.
Wunderfull. Skyline of Manhatten is one of the best in the Word. Especially when its shinning or in the evening.
One of the most beautiful Skylines. One of the most beautiful Skylines in the world. Also one of the most famous skyline.  Empire State Building is lit in different color depending on holiday.

Nothing like it in the USA, Try the Jersey angle for pics, really nice. My first time in years.... We stayed in Jersey City, too path into city, but best view is from JC side for sure.Check out York Street, just out of the path station.
Awesome every time of year!. Loved the view from the warehouse district Brooklyn at night. Any view of Manhattan is great day or night!
beautiful skyline. we did it by bike, by hop on hop off bus and by boat. allways just great. at night its so lovely. a must if you visiting new york

Silhouette Like No Other. I complain about the hustle and bustle, crowds and expense. But there is forever something in my heart that goes "ahhhh" every time I look up and see the NYC Skyline. There is no place like it anywhere in the world. It stands for the strength within our country and hope for our future. So...Start Spreadin' The News!!

Hop on and off night bus. Do not pay for the day time hop on and off bus as the traffic is so busy it ruins the trip, also there is no guarantee that you will get a seat, upstairs or downstairs! Do the night tour, wrap up warm and you will experience the most fantastic night views of Manhattan.....could do it by subway but will have to walk some distance.

The City That Never Sleeps. Always something to do -- and a skyline that is always impressive. So tall. So many lights. Keeps you coming back for more. My favorite time to visit is December -- with the holiday lights and shows.

The best skyline. We viewed the Manhattan skyline from several places - The Top of the Rock, the Empire State Building observatory deck, the Statue of Liberty at Libery Island, the Brooklyn Bridge and the top of the Wonder Wheel on Coney Island. Each view was unique and equally wonderful.
theres only one. this skyline with all the history of ticker tape parades and triumph over devastation , just makes it more majestic. there's only one NEW YORK,and only one NEW YORK skyline.
Capital of Money. Amazing place to visit starting with Time square , Central park , Broadway , Brooklyn bridge to state of liberty

Best way to view skyline is from the water.. We booked a circle line boat cruise around Manhattan. There are several departures during the day, there is a bar on board and you can get snacks also.The tour guide gives very good information on the trip which starts at pier 83 on the west side at the Hudson River and goes around downtown Manhattan and up the east river to take in the whole skyline, Statue of Liberty,Ellis and governors islands and the Brooklyn and Williamsburg bridges.Trip well worth doing especially if you have trouble walking as you see a lot and get great information from the tour guides commentary which is in English.

Check Out the Staten Island Ferry for a Great View. The free ride gives great views of the skyline. You can ride both ways but you have to get off and back on. If you do it at dusk, you can get views in daylight and at night with the lights.
Strangely familiar. Seen on so many US films and TV programmes, but so much more in real life. Amazing views from all around the city, but from Central Park at dusk is very special.

Great vieuw of the Big Apple. You See a lot of special thinks on youre way by boat.State of Liberty,Chrysler Building,Empire Statebuilding,New World Trade Center 541 meter long.The Tallest Building from Amerika
Iconic. This needs to be witnessed firsthand to truly appreciate it. A must see for everyone. There's one on NY skyline. MANHATTAN is it.
Pretty amazing skyline if you go into the Empire State building. If you go in the empire State building you can see all of New York pretty amazing this is a must see

Need to see it from different points fantastic. Need to see the skyline from different points from the ferry to Staten Island from Statue of Liberty from rockefellers and you get all different looks it also gives you a good idea of the different points
Very nice view. From Brooklyn you may have a very nice view of Manhattan skyline. It is just a few meters after the Bridge. You walk for 10 min and you reach the opposite side of Manhattan
Do not miss the helicopter tour.. It's hard to see New York from the ground. A person feels like an ant. Check it out from a helicopter. Amazing.
Must see. Day or night this a great place to see and off course you can see it by a little walk around town while having a coffer or beer

It's one of the best in the world. What else can I say, it is one of the best known skylines in the world. The mix of architecture, the iconic buildings and the modern history of the city are all reflected. The issues is often which angle to view it from. Brooklyn promenade and the Staten Island Ferry both other great views and differing angles and it's all free!
NY Holiday. NY has changed quite a lot since 911 & become even more ride daly and aggressive. If you don't like the heat I would avoid the extreme summer months and be prepared for LOTS of walking

This is New York. The Traditional view of New York but so much more when you see it yourself in real life. We viewed it from a boat cruise and from Brooklyn and were not disappointed. Even better on a night the lights really bring it to life. It's a must for every visiter to the Big Apple

from Staten island ferry. You can get some amazing views of lower Manhattan from the Staten island ferry which is free. Get on the right side when leaving manhatten and the left when leaving Staten island for the best views. The view of Manhattan is also excellent from the Empire state building and Top of the rock, on a clear day. At the Empire State building I was asked for photo ID so make sure you have some in your pocket or bag.
Amazing. Simply amazing. There are loads of opportunities to see the Manhattan skyline, from helicopter rides to City tour hop on and hop off bus rides. This is just a must.
Skyline = NYC. Simply choose where from: Brooklyn? Staten Island? Circular line cruise? If you have doubts.... Take them all!!' Or take an helicopter tour!

Saw it from the Brooklyn promenade, simply stunning.. We saw the sunset over the Manhattan skyline from the Brooklyn promenade after walking the bridge and must say that it was simply awesome. Highly recommend!
it is conveniance. It is convenience if you are tourist. You save money and see more places in Manhattan. But walk and see any way much better.

Bucket list ticked.. This has been on my husband's and my bucket list and we had to pinch each other to make sure we were really there, its the most beautiful and iconic skyline in the world and to see it in person was the best.

Brought tears to my eyes. I have been to NYC three times in my life. The first two were for business, and I had zero time to really experience the city. As they say, the third time is the charm, and my trip started on the highest of high notes. I took a shuttle, mid-day, into Manhattan from La Guardia Airport. I can't provide a lot of specifics as to the route that the shuttle took, but suffice to say we made our way from the airport to the Queensboro Bridge. A few minutes out from the airport the view opened to reveal the new One World Trade Center tower, which was gorgeous to see. That proved to be the tip of the iceberg, as the highway continued to bend to the right, and suddenly I was presented with the full length of Manhattan Island, from One World Trade Center at the south end, to the Empire State Building on 34th Street, to the Chrysler Building further north. It was breathtaking, and I must admit to tearing up at the beauty of the view. I wish I had been in a position to try to capture it on camera, but it will be burned into my memory for a lifetime.

Unmatched!. We have to been to a number of much larger cities around the world, inclusive of Japan and China. For a spectacular skyline no other cities can match Manhattan. Best checked out from one of the two rivers and/or Empire State Building/Rockefeller Center. By walking the streets of Manhattan (especially midtown) you really gain an incredible appreciation for the skyline. It is free as well! A blue sky day is the best.

Beautiful at sunset!. We had an amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline from our hotel in Astoria! There is no other skyline like it! However, the highest building in the middle (apartment building) is too high for the rest of the skyline and sort of spoils it a bit.
via night tour. We saw this skyline from Brooklyn at night at was absolutely fabulous! It was on a night tour! We ate at an ice cream factory and fountain there.

a walk to remember. So I decided to walk the whole stretch of Brooklyn bridge, it was crazy busy crossing the bridge so getting to was a nice relief. (as you can see from my other reviews, I do not enjoy noise lol) check out the neighborhood along the water, very interesting architecture. AND there's a lot of great food place!
I'll Take Manhattan. Iconic, stunning, classic, historic, beautiful, inspiring, awesome, impressive, memorable, must-see....all this and more.

Stunning. Day or night.. We were able to view the skyline from several different directions. Firstly when we arrived by plane; then on approach to Manhattan by taxi; from the water boat and best of all from TheTop of the Rock Observation Deck.All of the views are stunning.

Saw again Oct 2015 ...very America and proud. Flying in and out of Newark...gives an impressive view and solemn time to remember 911. Seeing Statue of Liberty is also an inspiring moment from airplane. Empire State Building is very visible from airplane also. A working city as transportation is moving in air, land and sea as saw barges moving goods.
Stunning. We caught a view of the skyline from New Jersey as we drove to Philly and it was a beautiful, clear day.
The Big Apple in the sky.... I saw it from the airplane as we landed and as the taxi sped to Manhattan...and it was quite breathtaking.
Stunning!. This is definitely one-of-a-kind. The view of the Manhattan skyline is so breathtaking. It is hard to take it all in but sure made my New York excursion come to life.
Best scene from New Jersey. It's worth a trip to Hoboken or West New York, New Jersey to get the expansive view of all of Manhattan. There's nothing in the world quite like it.
What an amazing view. This is one of the majestic view of the New York City. The tall towers of lower Manhattan were great view to watch during the ferry trip to Liberty island.

Well known. The Manhattan skyline doesnt disappoint. You can see it on a clear day when you are taxying on the runway of JFK airport. The best way to view is to walk the Brooklyn Bridge and head down to the decks along the river. Just beautiful and peaceful!

Best Views from Brooklyn. If you truly want to take in the Manhattan Skyline, take the subway to Brooklyn and walk back towards Manhattan over the Brooklyn Bridge. Another great way to take in the skyline is the water taxi between Brooklyn and Manhattan.
Beautiful skyline. One must see the Manhattan skyline by helicopter or by boat but whatever way you choose it's a beautiful skyline
What a beautiful City. The lights that you will see is just unbelievable. Your mind flows with the wind. You are like a kid living a fairy tale dream

Breathtaking views. We boarded the ferry for a short crossing to statue of liberty, light refreshments were available for purchase...when you look back at the manhattan skyline it is breathtaking, all the buildings standing at different heights in different colours, it's just as you see in photos, beautiful
Great view. If you have the weather, like I did, this is like most City skylines, I enjoyed seeing it from the Liberty Island ferry and a evening meal cruise. Great on a clear night or day.
Never get tired of this view!. Best place to see it from Brooklyn Heights promenade (lots of space, seating, cafe/ice cream parlour nearby, or the Brooklyn side of the bridge!

Beautiful!. Best seen from Liberty Island (or a helicopter!). Breath taking views we have all seen in celluloid!
An amazing city that never sleeps.
Amazing View. The Manhattan Skyline is best seen from a ferry or from a bridge while going towards New Jersey. No one can miss this imposing skyline with skyscrapers trying to touch the sky.

Iconic skyline. The skyline is iconic h so many tall attractions such as the Top of the Rock, Empire State and the Chrysler Building. Especially good from the other side of the river or from Liberty Island
Beautiful. The New York skyline is so beautiful, so many amazing and stylish buildings. By day or by night it is a fantastic sight.

It's classic!. It's famous! It's classic! You've seen it everywhere! It's iconic! It's beautiful!
Just go and see it!
From the Staten Island Ferry or from Brooklyn are the best views!
A Unique Experience.. Every visitor to New York City should take the opportunity to take a boat trip around Manhatten and experience view of the iconic skyline.

Best viewed from the ferry.. The skyline is best viewed as you take a ferry ride with one of the many operators who conduct such cruises from one of the Piers on the west of the Manhattan Island.We took the sunset cruise with one of the cruise lines when we were taken around the island from the south end, from which we could see the entire Manhattan skyline. We took the cruise starting from one of the Piers and were advised to sit on the left side as that would be the side facing the buildings on the way back. We got the views of the World Trade Centre, the Chrysler building and the Empire State Building, both before it got dark and later while being lighted up. On the way back, we were brought back via the Lady liberty.This way we could see the entire skyline. Highly recommended.
Staten Island Ferry. It's free and it's beautiful. We took the ferry from Manhatten to Staten to see the Statue of Liberty. Found out on the return trip that the bonus was the Manhatten Skyline.
Jaw dropping. One of the best places to see the NYC skyline is from Blvd. East in Weehawken in NJ. The view from the NJ side is spectacular at all times of the day, especially at sunset

A place with a view. On top of the new "WTC" tower, there is a splendid view over Manhattan and the rest of New York. It only takes some queing and approx 30,00 $ to take the secured elevator to reach the top floor and being overwhelmed by a complete view over "the big apple".
Statton Island Ferry. Manhattan Skyline is best viewed from the Statton Island Ferry which is FREE! The views of the Statue of Liberty are superb!

Manhatten from helicopther. Fantastic overview of the Manhattan skyline from a helicopter sightseeing. This is a wonderful experience that gives you a whole new impression of the Manhatten skyline and throughout New York.

Iconic.. Best seen I think from the water a boat cruise provides commentary too so you know which building is which. Obviously worth seeing both day and night a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge also repays with a good view.

View from Brooklyn Bridge Park or Top of the Rock. Head to Brooklyn Bridge Park at sunset for a free stunning view of this skyline just after sun set. Alternatively pay for a trip up to the Top of the Rock for iconic views of the Empire State Building dominating the inland skyline and to truly appreciate the size of Central Park as it stretches out before you.

Iconic, awe-inspiring and all at no cost.. This is one of my favorite top sites in the city. It is iconic, unbelievably awe-inspiring and you can see it at no cost.I enjoy seeing the skyline from Brooklyn. A good place to start your visit is at the Ice cream factory on Water Street. Day or evening you will be positioned for good views. A few minutes from this location is Brooklyn Battery Park. Definitely go there to take in the view.Nearby Brooklyn Heights Promenade provides a second exposure of the skyline with breath-taking views. If time permits another of my favorite locations for viewing the skyline is to actually walk back and forth across the Brooklyn Bridge. It is simply magical.Best times to see the skyline are early in the morning to catch sunrise or late in the afternoon before, during and after sunset. I use my DSLR with a tripod for capturing beautiful images of the skyline after sunset when the sky and the city are all aglow.The New York City skyline is something you should not miss.

Take a boat ride to see this best. Take the Staten island ferry, still very cheap and then walk out from the terminal and see the City from the other shore. WOW. I can't begin to describe how awe inspiring it is.
Best viewed from Brooklyn!. The best place to see Manhattan is to not be in it - stroll over the Brooklyn bridge to see the city lit up from a distance.

Wonderful view from Brooklyn. We went over to Brooklyn via the tube, had a nice walk walk around Brooklyn heights, we then stopped for a very enjoyable drink of October Feast Beer, we then walke along the pier and took in the view, as the weather was so warm and sunny we could not ask for more. We then found the bridge and walked back over a very enjoyable day.
Amazing. If you are going to USA, this is a place to if you are in the area. Its an amazing place where ever you go.
TOP of the world view. Over looking the Manhattan skyline on TOP of Empire State Building, breathtaking view of the whole of the city,
Very Impressive. We spent three days in the city prior to a New England and Canada cruise, and since this was our first visit, we were blown away.
Iconic skyline and a special city. The Big Apple in teeming with life. So much to see and do, so expensive, noisy, smelly and alive, you must experience it!

A view from the top NYC skyline. I love to visit NYC as I was born and raised here, I always love to go home to visit. The view of NYC from a nice hotel in a room up high a night is wonderful and a site you won't forget. I know the city has been cleaned up a bit, but still do not travel to areas I am not sure of. I love to go to nice restaurants in the city, it's a shame some have vanished, but there are great bars all over. The thing is to go to a nice play also on your visit, then all those touristy attractions are there also. Have a great trip.

Cricle Line tour was great!. Off the West Side Highway you can catch a boat with Circle Line tours. They take you along Manhattan Island, where you can see the Statue of Liberty close up, plus sailing ships, the skyline, which only gets better as dusk approaches and all the sights. Very stable ride, suitable for the entire family. Wonderful look at NYC!
Gorgeous. The Manhattan skyline was absolutely amazing. It is a sight everyone should see at least once in their lifetime.
You would visit New York and Avoid this?. Saw the view from Brooklyn Bridge and the Staten Island Ferry. In this we were not alone. Maybe lucky neither was very crowded.

Week in Manhattan. Our family of 6 (4 teenage girls) spent a week in Manhattan in August. Used the 7 day New York Pass to access the top attractions (great value). We viewed the skyline and the city from the Top of the Rock during the day and the Empire State at night - both were great. There are so many different places to get great views of the skyline - including Central Park, Liberty Island, any boat trip, crossing the bridges and driving in from upstate or New Jersey. I have visited Dubai recently and went up the Burj Khalifa (the tallest building in the world) but nothing compares to Manhattan and its wonderful Skyline.
totally amazing and awe inspiring. all i can say is wow..... get your butt up a very high building or on a helicopter to see this amazing skyline, so so beautiful for a metropolitan view

must see. New york has some amazing views if you get up high enough to see them. In the day beautiful blue skys you can see the whole city, and at night the whole place lights up like a christmas tree. A must see if your not afraid of heights

Best seen from a ferrry, water taxi, Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty or the Top of the Rock. Great to see the Manhattan Skyline as it helps you get a lie of the land. There are also lots of interesting land marks which are best seen from a distance such as the wonderful sky scrapers than adorn the city, the many bridges and the frenetic pace of the city that never sleeps.
skyline view. great from Liberty Island. We loved the boat ride , walk to the top etc. Very striking views from the deck
Magnificant Brooklyn view. Brooklyn is the best place to see the skyline of NY. Walk the Brooklyn bridge; and enjoy! Don't forget your camera! You may also enjoy the views by boat or by helicopter!

Day and night. See in the daylight and at night. We viewed the skyline from the Empire State building during the day and the Top of the Rock at night. We also enjoyed the view of the city from the Statue of Liberty ferry.
andreinottawa. The Staten Island Ferry is one of the best places to get a fabulous view of lower Manhattan. It must be one of the top city views in the USA.

New York skyline of dreams. We caught the Subway over to Brooklyn and walked back over the bridge - there wasn't a cloud in the sky and we took some fab photos of the skyline - could never get bored with that view !
Breathtaking. It's just amazing... really!!! So much so, that you'd be like.. it this a picture or real life? It's amazing.

Best view of NYC skyline. Gantry state park is the best place to see/photograph NYC skyline especially midtown
the UN, Empire State Building,and the Chrysler Building. The park has many different seating options ,bathrooms,a good cafe with seating near the water taxi,playgrounds.. even a fishing pier..its just wonderful and rarely crowded..within walking distance of the Vernon/Jackson subway stop ..which is one stop from Grand Central

Bueatiful. The view of Manhattan form Brooklyn was amazing. This area had a great pier for tourist and locals to relax and enjoy the view. on a clear cool afternoon this is the perfect place to take a memorable picture, A must see.

A view to remember!. There Re so many places from which you can view the marvelous skyline of Manhattan. Anyone who visits will want to see it from the Empire State Bldg or the Top of the Top of the Rock in Rockefeller Center. We were recently able to view it from a new angle, a cruise ship as we left the Brooklyn Harbor. At the same time, you get a beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty! Truly an American Treasure!!

Never fails to be exciting. The best way to see the dramatic and ever-changing New York skyline is to view it from the left side of a plane landing at Newark Airport. It affords a complete scan of Manhattan from Harlem to Wall Street. Made famous in movies and on television the iconic skyscrapers such as the Chrysler building, the Empire State and the new World Trade Centre complex are joined by new structures every year while still remaining identifiable and uniquely New York. Another way to view the skyline is from either of the rivers on a ferry going to or from Staten Island or the Statue of Liberty or New Jersey or any of the signtseeing boat operations. From day to night it is a completely different experience but always exciting.

It never stops taking my breath away. I am in Newyorker yet I am always in awe every time I get to see the skyline- particularly at night The Empire State Bldg changes color to celebrate holidays or acknowledge a special event. The Visuals are eclectic and range from Art Deco to cutting edge modern. There is no place in the world quite like it
friends weekend. It's New York, some days were cloudy. Sunday saw sun and wow. See the rebuilding of the towers. Watch from atop Statue of Liberty, and go the 196 steps to observation deck.
Impressive. just what you have seen in the movies and tv shows, but so much more impressive when seen for real, maybe from you hotel rooftop or from top of the rock or empire state.

Iconic Skyline. What is more iconic then seeing the Manhattan Skyline from the Brooklyn side or The Jersey side. Every time I fly in to the NYC airports I look for the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building and even the Statue of Liberty. Now the lower end of Manhattan is once again dominated by the beautiful architecture of the new Trade Center which again takes it's place as one of the worrld's tallest buildings.
Stunning . Iconic and gorgeous, you never tire of seeing the city's magnificent skyline from land, sea or air. I recommend one of the ferries or hooping over to Brooklyn or Hoboken!

Try different angle. My last time i NYC I had several possibilites to se the Skyline. Coming in from New Jersey or Staten Island in daylight or at night from Pier 2 in Brooklyn. Try the last and you will be blast.

Manhattan Has the Skyline, Brooklyn Has the Views. The three best ways to see the Manhattan skyline and get the photos you have always wanted: 1) Take the Staten Island Ferry - It is FREE!, 2) Walk the bridges. All New York City bridges are open for pedestrians! 3) Take the East River Ferry from the 34th Street terminal in Manhattan 25 minutes down to the Brooklyn Bridge and then walk the promenades in Brooklyn for fantastic iconic views!
amazing view, both day and night. i loved this view, it was great to see in day and at night when it is all lit up, it really is a fantastic place
Mother and Daughter NYC extra Long Weekend. Is there anything more relaxing then looking out at the awesome Manhattan skyline? It is so beautiful, a picture of a thousand words!
DON'T - DON'T MISS THIS PLACE. Do not miss this attraction when you visiting Milwaukee. AMAZING view. Fully recommend to see this place! Get a water taxi to another side of river.

Best from the air. it manhattan skyline, what else can you say. it is very sexy and romantic. As i was flying onto LGA the view will just take your breath away. so many big building and the place is always busy

Is there anything more iconic?. No, there isn't. Nothing says America quite like the NYC skyline, even without the twin towers dominating lower Manhattan.
Best ways to see the skyline are from Liberty Island, the ferry to/from Staten Island or Hoboken, NJ. Hoboken will take the most effort to get to, but gives the best views in my opinion.
Gorgeous . The Manhattan skyline is beautiful and iconic.. A good place to see it and take pictures with it is the Statue of Liberty.

NYC - what a place!. Visited New York in August and absolutely loved it. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful. If you can walk The High Line which is wonderful walk through parts of the city (10th and 12th Ave) on a raised disused railway. (Google it if you don't know what it is). I'm not going to try and review NYC as it would take a book to do it. It is safe to say the place is epic with so much to do and see. Brilliant holiday destination for sure.
One Of A Kind!. The architecture in NYC is one of a kind. All sorts of different buildings. Come ready to take lots of pictures!
A view for all types of camera. The Manhattan skyline is best place to get a picture to show off where you have been and it once in a life time
Amazing views of the skyline. Pre-booked visit to the Statue of Liberty and this gave you a fantastic view of the Manhattan skyline whilst travelling to Liberty Island.

Iconic scenery all round. Catch the views from a selection of place. Top of the Rockefeller centre or Empire state building. For an altogether different perspective how about getting on the hop on hop off river boat and checking the scene from the river. Just amazing especially if you are on the boat while it is day light and then watch the transformation as it gets dark and all the lights come on.

Fantastic View. The Manhattan Skyline is amazing, different views depending on what part of the city you are in. Head to Brooklyn promenade or up One World Observatory to see the downtown skyline. Uptown is best seen from Rockefeller centre.
Beautiful views. the skyline is always wonderful in New York. The weather was clear and we were able to see for what seemed like miles.

Awe inspiring!. Nothing compares to the first time you see the Manhattan skyline in person. Recognizable world-wide, it has become almost commonplace--an icon of America. However, traveling across the Brooklyn bridge, coming face-to-face with one of the greatest cities in the world, leaves me breathless. The energy of the city draws you in, until you are enveloped in the sights and sounds. New York, I love Chicago, but had I met you first, things might have been different... ;)

Breathtaking.. Had the pleasure of seeing this from a lot of different angles helicopter being one of them, stunning doesnt even come close, got an amazing picture with the sun setting behind it from by Brooklyn bridge.
A Must see. This was a surprise for us. We didn't expect the view to be so grand. It just goes on and on and on.

the BIG APPLE!. Stood on my family's rooftop apartment for a private view of the skyline. Really enjoyable. The city truly NEVER sleeps. We were told it costs more to shut off all the lights and turn them on again- so the entire skyline is lit up at night and you can see an impressive sight.

Anywhere is a good view.. It's just like you see on TV.You can view it from so many places,ie,form over the Brooklyn Bridge or form a the Statue of Liberty or best of all as we did,from a helicopter on a wonderful sunny day wth blue skys.Not cheap but so glad we did it.DON'T hesitate to do it.It's worth every dollar.

Unbelievable. The view was breathtaking, specially when you realize that you have seen it only on tv, movies or pics. Just so beautiful, its an amazing click from every time. Can never get enough of it, be it day or night, from the sea, land or atop a skyscraper.

Great views from the Liberty State Park. One of the best views you can get on the Manhatten Skyline is from NJ, either from Exchange Place (Path train from NYC) or in the Liberty State Park on NJ site.

So many free places to see it from. The best places to see the infamous Manhattan skyline are from the Brooklyn Promenade, or while you're walking over the Brooklyn bridge (back towards Manhattan obviously), and also from the free Staten Island ferry while floating past the Statue of Liberty.

Best spot to view the skyline- Governors Is. The best view I got of the skyline, looking like a beacon ball of bright sky scrapers was from Governors Is. Its only a short 10min max ferry trip, which costs $2 return from near the Staten Island ferry, plus the views of brooklyn Bridge and Washington Bridge from the other side of the Island are great too.
Awesome. Whether you view from the top of a skyscraper or from a boat in the harbour, at day or at night, this is an awesome experience.
Best in the world. No comments ,, speaks for itself, no city on earth can even come close. ...60+ building 50 stories or higher, and only growing taller
great view, quiet part of manhattan. A go to spot for any visitor and an always relaxing place to walk around with your loved one, in the summer months especially.

Everything you expected it to be. It was just like you see in the movies. The place is massive and there are so many places to see. Its great when you recognise the buildings from all the movies and TV series you watch at home.A great view.

Iconic Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is a spectacular sight. We enjoyed watching the lights come on at dusk from below the Brooklyn Bridge. There are also great shots from New Jersey or the Straten Ferry. A must on any visit to New York.

world famous. This was a must viewing considering where we come from. Never seen anything like. Absolutely loved it. I think I took a 100 photos just to say to my friends that we really seen this skyline first hand. Wondeful.
Awesome. When you get a live look at the Manhattan skyline you can truly appreciate the size and scope of NYC. Amazing

The Stunning Manhattan Skyline. This was our first visit to New York and definitely will not be our last visit. although the city is very popular, noisy and crowded this did not spoil the experience.
