We were here for Five days and this was not enough time to explore and visit all of the attractions. We visited Wall Street, Ground Zero the Memorials and the 911 Museum. We went on a Big Bus Tour, two Hudson Cruises and experienced the fantastic views from the Empire State Building. We saw Grand Central Terminal, Bryant Park and Central Park. We walked up and down & East to West around Manhattan Island. We had sore feet but thoroughly enjoyed the entire experience here. There are great bars and restaurants and great shopping experiences to be had. Only thing i would say is it is definitely not cheap in New York - You will be shocked by some of the prices....

In NYC - It's got to be The Manhattan.. The place to be and it will make you feel great with a spell of "WOW". I personally njoi Manhattan as an area and have been there a cpl of times.It is a great place to be and you will njoi the spectacular view of the skyline.

Amazing view. Great views, we even watched the grass being painted green. Only in New York....Wherever you are the views are great. The boats in the river, the ferry, the statue of liberty, the freedom tower. Just beautiful no matter where you stand along the river.

Not impressive anymore. Yes it contains some of the iconic buildings like the Empire State, Chrysler, Rockefeller. But looking at it from afar, its not that impressive any more. WE have much better looking skylines in places like Dubai and Shanghai etc

Gorgeous in day and night. You can't go to Manhattan and NOT see the skyline! It's one of the most iconic images of New York City. Whether it's driving through the bridge or being at some other location, the skyline is a must see. And of course, it's free of charge.

Gotta see it for yourself. The New York skyline is recognizable all over the world, but there is nothing like seeing it for yourself. A daytime photo opt is great, but it all changes at night. A short trip across the river or from the balcony of a cruise ship makes for some great photo opportunities.
Views were Amazing. The Views were amazing, iconic we took the ferry to the Liberty Island and I think I took a million photos 360 degree viewing. I was cold though it being February.

Have your cab driver go into Manhatten on the Queensboro bridge. I have been to NY many times and because I first saw the skyline from the Queensboro bridge I love going in that way. It's the 59th St . bridge song, or Feeling Groovy.Most cab drivers want to take the toll bridge. Sometimes faster, adds to the fair.Ask nicely and maybe your driver will take you in this way.GREAT view of the skyline.
Amazing. We took the free ferry across to Staten Island and the view of the Manhattan Skyline was amazing. The buildings are spectacular/
Too many great views to take a picture of. At every turn there is a photo opportunity. The views were amazing day and night, Many of the best pictures can be taken from the water taxi.
what a skyline!. some of the best views are from Ellis Island and Liberty Island, so make sure you take that trip! Brooklyn Bridge Park is also a great viewing piont for this iconic skyline.

Lots to do and see - not enough hours in a day.... The best view for the NYC skyline is on the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) ! Get there early in the morning to avoid long lines. Also go to One World Trade Center - the new Freedom Tower, view only from inside behind glass.

Picture coming to life. Even after seeing the picture a million times in a million movies, the Manhattan Skyline still does not fail to impress us. It has the charm of the largest cosmopolitan and also the serenity that comes from witnessing something natural. Saw a hundred other things in New York but nothing beats this experience.

Iconic and inspiring. There is just something about the NY skyline. Love glimpsing the iconic treasures like the Empire State, Chrysler building and now the Freedom Tower. Then just marveling at the sheer magnitude of the city and the throngs of people who converge there. You have to enjoy it from within as well. Check out the view from a hotel room or observation deck, not to mention from the streets below. Check out the diversity of architecture much like the diversity of the people there. Simply amazing!
Hey its New York City. Whether you are driving in from Newark or Kennedy you cannot help but we awed by the Skyline . It is like none other in the world

Up and Down of New York More Ups than Downs. Don't get me wrong NY NY is irresistible and I would rate it as one of the best destinations on the planet. Its a tourist mecca everything about NY is geared towards the visitor. First things first if you intend to travel in NY alot or even a little then you just got to buy the 7 day subway pass unbelievable value at $31 even a 5 year old could make there way around NY on the subway together with the ingenious street grid layout you cant go wrong.LOL. The Hudson cruise is a must which in a lot of cases its thrown in if you buy a three day Manhattan bus tour (we went with Graysline) and it was fun especially the banter and good humour of the on-board guides you can hope on off so spread your sightseeing over the three days bring water and a sun cream and a hat it can be very hot in summer.You can buy legit cut price tickets to Broadway shows from TKTS kiosk on Time Square but be willing to cue get advice on best cueing times and strategies it will pay off Must visit the MOMA museum of modern art free on Friday evenings. With an intro like don't get me wrong NY NY is irresistable you can guess there is a word of warning coming up so here it is Keep your precious plastic friend within eyesight at all times mine got turned over. I didn't heed my own advice and it turned out a wasty surprise for me. NY dosent operate chip and pin (how amazing is that) so your card is always been swiped through this machine and that and unfortunately ended up a just another victim. Here's another gripe small enough if you are not a big foodie but a major one if you are. The food in NY is not up to standard its full of hype and presentation and low on delivery and it is relatively expensive. I would advise if your don't have a fundamental dislike then McDoanalds is a safe bet at filling the main course and treat yourself in the evening but do shop around. Speaking of shopping go to Maceys you just got to....... Hope my advice will be of some use to you Ciao for now.
Breathtaking view of the Manhatten Skyline!. The Skyline of Manhatten is so amazing!!!We were very fortunate to see it from a lot of different places. It is truly breathtaking!
Not worth the money. A long, kinda boring trip where you don't really get to see much. For the price, I would prefer to throw in a little more money and do a helicopter tour of the city instead.

Lot's of concrete. There are some very interesting building in there from an architectural perspective, but as an ensemble it's just a big mass of gray concrete. Go see the Rocky mountains instead, that's something else.

2nd best skyline in the world. Always been impressed with NYC skyline. It is the 2nd best in the world behind Chicago's and has two separate skyline's in reality one for the financial district and the other for midtown.
Spectacular. Absolutely loved and spectacular skyline, well worth seeing. We chose to view via a round trip to Staten Island via the ferry of an evening. No cost for the ferry.
You never get tired of looking at the skyline!. Enjoy the view where ever you are in Manhattan...its always dynamic and you'll see something different all the time! Always look up!

this view never gets old. in september we did a stay-cation all while looking at neighbourhoods for a possible move to the city. we saw the skyline from a boat, from a high rise in the bronx and daily as we walked around
All that you imagined it would be. For the best view of the Manhatten skyline take a river taxi to Brooklyn and view it from there, you feel like you are on a film set.

Wow Experience. NYC is all busy 24/7 and This is the center of the universe. You haven't lived until you spend good quality time in the city.
We were in NYC for 15 days and it simply wasn't long enough. Brilliant restaurants where the service is second to none. and Manhattan skyline is a treat in night.
Always beautiful. Either from Brooklyn Bridge Park or from a Williamsburg rooftop, always beautifuil... Night or day, this view is incredible..

Imposing site. Manhatten skyline from Statten island ferry was quite a sight and not to be missed. Very imposing. Its interesting to see how vulnerable it looks sitting beside the water, doesnt look much above sea level.

Stunning from the Hudson.. Great to see ,the best way is from the river on one of the tour boats,lots of new things rising down near the water front which will take the full spectacular views out,so go soon if you are..

Must see!. Fabulous way of seeing this amazing skyline is to take a River Cruise, we used Gray line in conjunction with the bus pass. The tour guide was very funny & extremely knowledgable, a very enjoyable river cruise taking in Brooklyn Bridge & Statue of Liberty. Shame the sun was shining.

Over Rated. New York city is advertised for its glamour & glitz by the movie makers. The night skyline is beautiful, but having to spend mega bucks on hotel; sub standard food; dirty streets, subways & surrounds, the city offers poor value for travellers. Shibuya & Shinjuku in Tokyo offer better night skylines. On foot, the strees, subways & trains are old & filthy beyond embarrassment.
Amazing view. Whether you check it from Staten island or from across the river at Union city it looks amazing. Beautifully lit at night and even better at sun rise. A must see.
Stunning. We had the chance to watch Manhattan skyline from the cruise on the hudson river. It's been a wonderful experience.
Greatest in the States. The Skyline to Manhattan is the greatest skyline whether it's cloudy or sunny. The greatest part about it is that you could honestly get a good view from anywhere.

See it from the Staten Island Ferry. Best way to see this is from the Staten Island Ferry.
We walked from Ground Zero - momentous - round to the ferry port. On board go to the rear of the ferry with your camera to get the best photos.

See Manhattan from the water.. View from boat on way to Liberty Island is fantastic. Also the same from the Statten Island ferry. If you're not into boats just walk across the Brooklyn Bridge for stunning views from the park.
short visit. great view especially during night time, we did the trip with Big Bus but were very unlucky wit the weather

Awesome!. Overall New York City experience was outstanding. We took Grey Line Tour, a very good choice. Guides for the most part friendly and knowledgeable. Only complaints; a few were very "pushy' in requesting tips and wait time for pick-up at a couple stops.

Breath-taking...a MUST see. I travel to New York very frequently, but the skyline always takes my breath away. Amazing, just amazing. The best views are seeing from the Statue of Liberty. As seen in my picture.

Must-see. The Manhattan skyline is incredible. You definitely need to get good views while in the big apple. The best ways to see it is by walking the Brooklyn bridge or on the Staten island ferry. The skyline is gorgeous at night.

Beautiful views, remarkable architecture. Went for a walk with my husband, beautiful, relaxing, and surprisingly romantic. The buildings around you as you walk are pieces of art. Nice spaces to sit and enjoy the weather and the views. This is a new NYC must see spot.

Beautiful Skyline. America's best. Every time I fly into New York or Newark I love seeing the skyline. It is impressive and beautiful. A true sign of American freedom as you pass the Statue of Liberty.

Best Way to See Manhattan. Do not miss the Circle Line tour around Manhattan. It is fabulous, even for those of us who grew up in NY. So many things to see and the staff is great at pointing out points of interest. It gives you a different perspective on New York.
Night Tour. Greyline night tour, spectacular!!! No stops on the night tour. We took the 7:00 PM tour, when it was dark.
View from a height. We saw the skyline from a helicopter tour . Amazing all round and thoroughly enjoyed it . We done our tour in the day but I could imagine it would be breath-taking also at night!
FANTASTIC AT NIGHT. A must see at night all lit up. The skyline is exceptional and well worth a visit. Great smaller shops in the locality but had ques for food.
Fantastic to see the iconic skyline of New york. Great to see the iconic buildings such as the Empire State Building and the Chryslar Building. Some of the older skyscappers architecture is superb.
Impressive. What can I say, it needs to be seen with your own eyes :) Best ways to do it - take one of the sightseeing boats.
Best view of NYC skyline on foot. Awesome view of the financial district. We went there on a sunny morning 30c, very touristy but still great. Opportunity to take panoramic shots.
Unforgetable!. A real treat to see 360 degrees of the skyline from the Empire State Building - 102 floor (extra $, but worth it).

Manhattan Skyline: Best Skyline in the World. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from a restaurant across the water from the city, and thought it was absolutely breathtaking. After traveling all over the USA and even a few other large cities worldwide, I don't think there is a better skyline in the world. Make sure you head over to NJ to see it for yourself!
Romance in the Sky. The helicopter ride was wonderful and romantic. We saw everything with a birds eye view and the tour guide was perfect.
Great Views. What a mad city it definitely is the city that does not sleep... but some great architecture and you spend most of the time looking up at the buildings and skyscappers
I'm in a New York state of mind. Best viewed from the Brooklyn side of the city, spectacular especially at night when the entire Manhattan buildings lit up.
Amazing. Looks great, even when it's raining. Worth the trip to Brooklyn just to see this amazing skyline....

Breathtaking. The best views from the river or walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. I would recommend an early evening boat cruise to see the skyline as the sun sets and then with all the illuminations at night time.

New York after dark. We used the hop-on hop-off bus to visit New York by night, and had a very good guide on the bus. City tours, tickets from their office in entrance to Madame Tausades.at Times Square.

Its Old, Its New-Its horizon of time. We went on a surprise trip to NYC. I have always watched the Manhattan Skyline in News, Films and serials. We had booked Liberty cruise to go and see Lady Liberty.During that one and half hour of tour we witness some of the oldest standing, time defying buildings, piers and some erected during last decade or so. We also saw some of them under construction, which in future will be part of magnificent skyline of Manhattan.
Spectacular Views. Visited the Observation deck at Freedom Tower and went to the Top of The Rock. Both offer extensive views of the rivers, harbor and skyline. Highly recommend.
Only one in the world. Well this is a no brainer! Its the NYC Skyline!Wherever you are in the area, NJ, NY, parts of new york city, the view is unbelievable. Love it.
Highest Manhattan SkyScrappers.. I like to see by myself the amaizing buildings, so tall and all toguether .You can see this view from many places.
Worth the walk over to Brooklyn. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and had a wonderful view of Manhattan. Went to Grimaldi's under the bridge for a great pizza. Good walk along the rivers edge

Iconic!. Goes without saying that this is the postcard view/shot of NYC.As stunning as you would have seen it in the pictures. If you get a chance,visit it from the Goldman Sachs premises, you will get to enjoy the board walk too!

Fabulous experience!. We saw this view from a boat called the Hornblower, which took us out and round the Statue of Liberty. It was a bitterly cold day, but the views and the experience were worth the discomfort. The Hornblower had a cafe where we purchased very welcome hot drinks!

Stunning view.. Just got back from New York City, where we stayed on a family vacation. We truly enjoyed the view from Liberty Island, on the way from La Guardia airport and the Brooklyn Bridge. This view is absolutely stunning no matter which angle.

The peddlers on the wharf are tough - but all part of the experience!. This is one of the best views in the world; soaring buildings, stunning river and all the ambiance of a world class city.... the trip around the harbour is spectacular, past the Statue of Liberty and the landmarks we've all read about. Never tire of being here!
classic view. nice view to be had from many many vantage points. The water being one of the best. I would suggest Circle Line tours or one of the other reputable companies
Skyline is a must to see. It is always a MUST to see! Wonderful view!!! It is more than like in a picture or postcard! I am not a big NYC fan, but the Skyline is a great view!
An iconic vista. You keep pinching yourself when you see this. Just as you expected it to look like but never thought of that feeling as well.
Divine. Unbeatable magic, this is the view of a lifetime, always changing but the thrill never dies. A must see

Great way to see the city!. This is a wonderful way to truly understand NYC and the various boroughs and see the famous skyline! I've taken the tour at least four times both day and night and loved them all. I would especially recommend this for first time visitors!
Great views. Went on the free boat ride with the big bus tour ticket..excellent views of Statue of Liberty and the shore line of New Jersey and Manhattan.
Magnificent Manhattan!. You can never tire of the Manhattan skyline! You can try to name some of the buildings that you recognize. It's beautiful day or night!
Unusual. An unusual way to deal with a redundant railway line. A nice traffic free walk with views over the busy roads.
Amazing view at dawn. Terrific view from Brooklyn cruise terminal from a cruise ship! There is an uninterrupted view right across the water of the Manhattan skyline.

Do it once, but doubt I'd do it again. We had heard a lot of people rave about this new attraction. It's kind of ok. it was very busy and is really just a long walk way with garden beds. It's a creative use of an unused rail line that's for sure. If you find the 1 bathroom, suggest you use it, as there doesn't seem to be many of them and there are a LOT of people.

Wonderful day and night. There is nothing in the world like the Manhattan skyline. It is always changing, never dull. Get to see it from the Staten Island ferry, from the New Trade Center tower, from the Rockefeller observation deck and from The Empire State Building. Each one will give you a different and wonderful perspective. if you go late in the afternoon to any of those sites, wit until the sun is down for beautiful sunsets and then the city illuminated.

You know you're in "The Big City" when you see it the first time!. The first glance i had of the Manhattan skyline was when driving in from New Jersey. If not for the traffic i was in, I'd have stopped and just stood there taking it all in. Pictures don't do the skyline justice. You're just suddenly aware, more than ever, of the fact that you're looking at millions upon millions of people, and that this is the De Facto capitol of the free world. I could go on and on ad infinitum, but words do not compare to the actual sight. Just go. that's all, just go.
Best view from the Exchange Place!. Beautiful deck and public plaza made with outdoor activities with a few cafes around. Best view ever!
Such a breathtaking view!. The Manhattan skyline is a beauty to behold especially from the Statue of Liberty! One of the prettiest sets of pictures I took on my trip was of this magnificent skyline!
Wow factor. You will have seen the manhattan skyline many times on the tv or in pictures but in real life it's amazing.
Manhattan Skyline. Best view in the world. Love the atmosphere. Great in night time also. Have to have photo if you are visiting NY

Stunning and Surreal. After seeing this view in countless movies it was dreamlike to gaze upon it with my own eyes... We walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and saw it from different angles - Astounding - it's a definite must see experience.

Best NYC skyline. Viewing the skyline, from the ferry ride from Statue of Liberty, to the view from Rockefeller plaza. Absolutely fantastic experience. Views over Manhattan and beyond were amazing. An experience to remember forever!

Better than even possibly photograph. The most amazing view in my life. It shows the true tru American spirit, the fantastic architecture, the determination to prosper in a new homeland. Makes me so proud to be an Anerican. The city of the world. No disappointment from any venue.
New York. best view we had was from a ferry going/returning from Ellis Island just as I imagined feel it's more spectacular at night.
Incredible view!. To see the Manhattan skyline you need to go to Queens, Brooklyn, New Jersey or take the Staten Island ferry. Breathtaking views!
Spiderman town. Amazing experience , saw the skyline while lost looking for a shop , and it made me feel okay . You can truly imagine spiderman flitting through the buildings

Beautiful. Take a trip on the Staten Island ferry for some good views of the Manhattan skyline. We also took a trip to Hoboken and I would highly recommend doing this for some great photo opportunities. You will get some lovely views of the skyline from there.

Nothing Like It. When you travel a lot, and return to someplace, it drives home what's unique about that place. In New York, the skyline, the buildings and bustle make you feel alive. Tip: go to Williamsburg on the Brooklyn side not only to experience the skyline, but also a wonderful, hip, lively area with lots of restaurants and shops.
Manhatten Skyline. Taking a boat to Staten Island and having a unforgettable look to the Manhatten Skyline, the Brooklyn bridge, the wonderful architecture of Manhatten: like I said: unforgettable :)
waiting for my next visit :-). the most amazing skyline on the globe, so much to see everywhere and from every where and its extremly easy to get to
Amazing. This is one of the worlds most famous skyline and it does not disappoint you. Form so many different angles it amazes you by day or by night.
Take ferry for free . Take the Staten Island ferry for free boarding to photograph the statue of liberty and the skyline ,not for special use
Awesome View. Viewing the skyline, from the ferry ride from Statue of Liberty, to the view from Rockefeller plaza. The one thing wished we had done was to view it at night.
Awesome views. Go to the Top of The Rock - excellent views. Take the Staten Island Ferry - see the Manhattan Skyline from the ferry. Great ride and it's free with a subway ticket.
A unique way of looking at NYC. Walk over the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn and enjoy the skyline or take the Water Taxi on the West Side and look over the city and the Hudson. Love it.

One of the most amazing views I ever had. The Manhattan Skyline is overwhelming! When I first saw it on my way from Brookly to Manhatten I was really impressed by the amazing view. For a very good view I can recommend the free Staten Island Ferry, especially at night!

City Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline view is beautiful. I fully enjoyed the view on the Circle Line boat tour and learned about the history as well. I would highly recommend this boat tour as you get to see the Statue of Liberty as well.
Worst Ride ever. The service at the Empire state was disorganised and confusing, the SkyLine was past its best and really needs updating, not at all good value for money
Spectacular. What can you add what hasn't already been said about this attraction, takes your breath away whether you view from the air river or one of the many elevated viewing platforms
Here You Are...Manhattan...Love it...Stay with it...It's for you Baby.... Beauty is in the 'eye' of the beholder...I can say, this is my most memorable time...Love it or Leave it...
amazing. Of course beautiful, huge and amazing. We saw the skyline form a boat on the Hudson and East rivers as well as from the walkway of the Brooklyn Bridge.

Magnificent Views. The skyline that has greeted millions over the years never fails to impress. There are so many different vantage points to experience it, and each one gives you a different view. Just wonderful!
Amazing. The view from the Empire State Building at sunset is not to be missed, and make sure you enter through 5th avenue entrance and avoid the lame New York Skyline ride....

Try a walk across Brooklyn bridge. Great to walk across the bridge as it gives a wonderful view of the city and also helps you soak up a little of the city's atmosphere on the way! Great shots to be had both day and night!
very good!!. Very exciting "landscape". You need to get on top of either 1 world observatory, or Empires or on-the-rock..

Breathtaking New York!. Stunning every time I see it...This is my 4th visit and it always takes my breath away.Character and charm!
Love the Freedom Tower and the Chrysler Building the most.
Not to be missed. The NYC skyline is a lovely experience and is best scene from one of the many ferry boats, as well as from on top of the Empire State Building or Rockefeller Centre
Skyline of the City. The Skyline has changed, but is still beautiful. Even if you are not a City person everyone needs to experience the City at least once in their life.
Beautiful. Looks really stunning when you take the free states island ferry. Great photos. Also lovely from the rock- day and nught
skyscrapers galore.. Impressive. Best views from afar such as the New jersey are looking across the river. Day or night it is a sight to behold.
Million dollar view.. we were able to get great views of NYC from the Whitney Museum's outside spaces. It's one of the best and most beautiful compared to the worlds best cities.
A great photo opportunity. A must see attraction, don't miss Chelsea market at the end of the line try the Lobster bar for fresh sea food great value and lots of choice
Perfect at night. Saw this during the day but at night it is even more spectacular. It was just as wonderful as I had hoped.
incomparable. if you are visiting in the summer, try and get out onto the Willie Wall, a floating bar in the middle of the summer. Fantastic views of downtown, you can't get better.

Once supreme, now just popular and beautiful. Still impressive after all these years the skyline of NYC once was the unquestionable queen of altitude in buildings. Now that every major city in the world has a cluster of skyscrapers somewhere,and the tallest buildings consistently pop up elsewhere, not even in the country, but mostly in developing nations in the East, it has lost the glamour of the new and it is less surprising or impressive than in the past.Love the new addition of Liberty Tower.

Great views from the Top of the Rock. Went to top of the rock to view the skyline etc of Manhattan. On a nice day the views are great. Once you have done it the first time you do not need to go again in my opinion.
Gorgeous. This is such a gorgeous place to come see. The view is spectacular and a great photo opportunity. The weather was gorgeous, and that made the skyline crystal clear.
NYC - greatest city ever.. The greatest city I've been to. So much going on we did Baseball, Central Park, Empire State, Times Square, fifth Avenue and don't feel like we scratched the surface.
Simply the best. Manhattan skyline is simply the best in the world. treat to watch the man made structures. Tall, taller, tallest. Great view and great photo opportunities.

Walk across Brooklyn Bridge to the Promenade. The entry to Brooklyn bridge is not far from the Twin Towers memorial and it is well worth the walk (toll free on foot!). Carry on to Montague Street where there is a good choice of eateries to refuel. Now on to the end of Montague for the skyline across water and a bonus view of the Statue of Liberty.

Nice walk through the old train track. Totally recommended. It's a very interesting walk through a park located in the old train track. At night it's has a beautiful illumination and it's perfect to have a picnic

a great skyline but missing two great buildings. the skyline of NYC is one of the best known in the World but some great buildings since 9/11 are missing from our view. The Empire and the Chrisler buildings still stand out and now the new World Trade Center Bldg. is right up there with the best of them. Go where you can see them.Many buildings have area's where you can go up to look over the skyline and enjoy the view
Great views from all around . Great views. Even more beautiful ftom brooklyn and queens. Try taking the ferry to governors island or williamsburg for 5 dollars. Will not be disappointed

Beautiful!. Manhattan skyline is amazing!! Best enjoyed from some of rooftops or the Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Heights or Brooklyn Bridge Park - a beautiful promenade by water where you can see the skyline in all its glam!

Beautiful Skyline. Manhattan Skyline is an amazing view from a boat ride. Well worth the money to take a "skyline" boat ride. Just make sure you get one that give narration. Makes the trip that much better instead of just sitting on a boat wondering what exactly you are or should be looking for.

Best view from Staten island ferry and Liberty / Ellis islands!. I got the best view on the Manhattan Skyline from the (free) Staten island ferry. It is completely worth the time spent on the boat. I enjoyed the view and could take few photos. The view is obviously great from Liberty and Ellis islands. Do not forget to turn your back at the statue of Liberty once in a while to enjoy the skyline!

Skyscrapers soar and shimmer. Utterly gorgeous. You will not be disappointed. The 9/11 redevelopment is magnificent too and best seen early in the,day when there are light clouds to be reflected off the expanses of mirroring glass. The combination of old with the new is arresting and, quite simply, second to none.

Quintessential Skyline. There is no more beautiful skyline in the world. You have to leave the confines of the city to see it best (I'm talking 'bout you, Jersey). But it is fabulous from any angle. I've seen breathtaking sunsets over the skyline that I've never witnessed elsewhere. We still see the World Trade Center twin towers in our mind's eye, even as we admire the new building that has risen in its place.

See it from Weehawken and save some money.. The Manhattan skyline is every bit as interesting and attractive as the one the whole world know from countless movies/tv shows, and even better when it's "real". But... you can't see it from NY because you are in it rather than looking at it. (An obvious point, but one that might not occur until you're there.) You could spend $ for cruises, etc. but there is a cheaper way. Go to NJ! Short easy trip and that "picture perfect" view you see it the one that Weehawken views 24/7/365... for free (or.. the price of the ride out there), for as long as you want to "gaze".
Fab views. Do the night time bus trip amazing but wrap up warm !!Excellent photo opportunities with some amazing views everwhere you look
I♥NYC. I am a small-town girl and was initially intimidated to visit NYC. That was over the first 10 minutes I was there! NYC is fabulous!
Iconic. We viewed this from a city water taxi - the photo's you see just don't do it justice. To see the skyline 'in real life' is just spectacular.Highly recommended.

Great walk. What a wonderful walk through the city, and I could really see the Statue of Liberty at the end! I went on a weekday, so it wasn't too busy- but I imagine it can get pretty packed with tourists on a weekend.
Beautiful!. First time in New York from Australia. Loved the Manhattan skyline. We saw it from a few different sides and especially loved the night time view.
always a great place to visit. being a native nyc we have returned many times and we never tire of the wonderful manhattan skyline. just the best!

Manhattan View from. We took the boat out on a tour to see the Statue of Liberty. The day was completely clear, very warm, and windy. The skyline was just asking to be photographed. So of course I obliged. Thanks for the great memories and pictures!
My beautiful city :). Nowhere else in the world is as beautiful. At night, it's even more breathtaking with the city lit up. I grew up looking at this skyline, and I miss it so very much.

Amazing place out of this world. Really enjoyed this and the view is out of this world. We walked along the promenade on the Brooklyn side, which was great and the area is really enchanting. Walked back over to Manhattan on the Brooklyn Bridge, a life long dream which did not disappoint
More history and beauty than most. One of the most inspiring and beautiful skylines in the world. While many cities and skylines exist, this is one of the most visually appealing.

old art deco facades and interiors were wonderful. great mix of glass, steel and concrete with old world bricks jammed between sky scrapers; Rockerfeller Ctr was amazing and Central Station was delightful, beautiful structures; must see Radio City Music Hall and take the tour.
Awesome. take the station island ferry at night it is free and gives you a great view of the city from the water and great for kids

No other US city compares. The best views are from new jersey and queens where you can take in large parts of the skyline especially the large clusters of buildings in midtown and the financial district.
Always a pleasant & luxurious stroll in NY. Excellent & unusual promenade. Would always stroll there. Don't eat there, maybe have a beer or an ice cream. Lots of better eateries downstairs.
Breathtaking!. Flying into New York we were able to capture the pure beauty of the Manhattan Skyline...it was truly breathtaking! The most beautiful skyline that I have ever seen!
Iconic. This was our first visit to the city and the skyline driving into the city was invigorating. Cannot wait to go back!
Lady Liberty. Amazing experience! Battery Park is incredible. Took the Hornblower out to see the Statue of Liberty. Really nice time!

Best viewed from...?. Iconic in ever sense of the word. But don't PAY to see it! Get yourself on the Staten Island ferry, IT'S FREE!!!! On a clear day, you can get amazing shots of Manhattan AND Stature of Liberty. Highly recommended
Different Perspective. We took a round Manhattan cruise to get a different perspective of the skyline, very well worth doing, very professional and a fantastic view.
Nothing like it. Beautiful yesterday, today and tomorrow. The skyline is always changing. Uptown and downtown are great
Beautiful View. If one has the time to see theManhattan Skyline from Brooklyn, close to the Brooklyn Bridge in the evening one will not be disappointed.

Wonderful View - a New Yorker's Opinion. Beautiful and free to look at. Best viewed from the Brooklyn Promenade. Take the A, C or F train to Jay Street Metrotech, or the R to Court Street or the 2, 3, 4 or 5 to Borough Hall. Then walk west.
An awesome sight. This iconic skyline is best viewed from the Empire State Building, especially at night, or one of the many boat trips to the Statue of Liberty and Staten Island
Awesome!. The view is breath taking be it from looking up while you walk to being at the top of 'The Rockerfella' centre. Wrap up warm though, being up that high the wind can come at a gust!
its an iconic skyline, not much else to say. its an iconic skyline, not much else to say, looks good day or night : ) it has not changed much in all the times i have visited.
Sightseeing NYC. Lovely from the Big Bus on Brooklyn bridge or from the ferry on route to the Statue of Liberty. Take photos

Skyline by Water Taxi. We took a water taxi from Battery Park which took us around to the Brooklyn Bridge, out to the Statue of Liberty & then right up to Midtown Manhattan - the views were amazing from the water :)

Viewed on a kayak.. Gorgeous at night. Check out Manhattan Kayak Company at Pier 84. The after dark tour was fun.
There are also boat trips nearby.
Best free New York sight. This is a must see. This still blows me away every time I see it. Great to see from the Staten Island ferry.

Central Park, What A Lovely Place.. We liked Central Park so much, we visited it four times during our one week stay in New York. The Loeb Boathouse is a fantastic place to stop off for a relaxing drink.

The skyline from jersey .. The manhattan skyline is incredible, for some of the best views stay in Hoboken or jersey city in the Waterfront hotels and ask for s room with skyline views. Amazing at night around sunset. You can also easily take the ferry or train system into manhattan.
Iconic. Iconic, it is simply something that once in a lifetime...at least you have to see, like the Godfather, love this, the island has everything, and, it never sleeps....
Nothing beats the NYC Skyline. Whether you are east or west looking at Manattan, the skyline is beautiful. You cannot help but become excited when you see the city!

Great for a relaxing day.. If you are tired of the busy city a day walking the Skyline is just what you need. It won't take you a day but certainly half a day. Great for taking photos and there ae plenty of good eating places when you get near to the end..

DUMBO (Absolutely THE BEST place to check out the Skyline!). DUMBO (Down under the Manhattan Bridge overpass) for the price of a subway ticket (forget the Empire State Observation deck) you, especially at night will be totally blown away. As a once removed Brooklynite (CA resident 30+ years now) back in the day (up until the late 90's) under the bridges on the Bklyn side was not a place, any time of day you'd want to be. This last trip I was there alone with my camera till three in the morning and it was simply amazing, and safe . . . Best views of Manhattan IMHO, especially at night . . . and Free! Don't pass it up! You will be glad you did . . . if you do.
Always great. Worth viewing from many angles. Try taking the ferry from Battery Park over to the NJ side. The boat trip alone is worth it.

Best view of Manhattan Skyline and. I live in NYC and I am always looking for the perfect rooftopo in the warm weather or for the perfect spot where to have a gorgeous view of Manhattan . I went to Brooklyn, in the area arounf Old Fulton Street and Furman Street. From there you have a terrific view of Manhattan Skyline and you are able to take some artistic pictures of the brooklyn bridge even if you are not a professional photographer. It is a must see place once you plan a visit to the Big Apple. This is the area called DUMBO

Be there in Manhattan Style. If you really want charm the beauty of NYC.Manhattan is a place. Visit it any time of the day .Do view it from different parts around .Don't miss the Empire state building

As close as you can get. We sailed on the Circle Line, a very interesting trip, of the skyline and The Statue of Liberty. You can take great photos. Andy our guide, had a fine voice. That made you want to listen.Cafe on board.

Great photo oportunity.. This is beautiful. We were there for sunset photos and boy did we get some. However it got very cold very quickly even in April so take warm clothes. We wanted to get the famous Grimaldi Pizza, but the line up was too long. We wanted to get some Ben & Jerry's ice cream but the line up was too long. Kind of a trend going here! We stopped for pizza on the way home. I'm sorry, but nobody makes pizza like an Aussie! It was bland, salty and too much cheese.
Great Skyline. Great view from the empire state building. Stay in a hotel that thats overlooks the skyline. You can get nice views there. period.

Million dollar views. Okay photo buffs (like me), for lower and even mid town Manhattan shots, go to Jersey City (New Jersey). There is an extensive promenade with the best shots of the city, especially at night as the Hudson River glistens in the foreground. You can even get away without a tripod as there are many railings to steady your camera.

Beautiful even on a cloudy day!. The view is beautiful. It was a rainy day and coming back on the Staten Island Ferry the World Trade Center was covered by the clouds. It was still beautiful. The ferry is free and the view is great.
Brooklyn Bridge. Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge fantastic view both at night and during the Day " watch out for the irate cyclists !!! "
Very Nice. We were on the Hop on Hop off buses and took the night tour to Brooklyn and stopped and looked at the Manhattan Skyline, very impressive!!

Great View. I had to experience the sun setting behind the Manhattan Skyline in my recent visit to New York. I would advise getting the subway to High Street rather than walking over Brooklyn Bridge and round as it is a long walk. If you stay for any length of time wear insect repellent.

Jersey city Nj across the river is manhattan. the view from Jersey City Harbor was excellent. that is the best viewing location that you can go to for unparalleled and unobstructed views of the NYC (really Manhattan) skyline
Always Nice To See & Free. Or almost free since you need to get out of the city to see its skyline. Interesting both by day and night. A few restaurants on the Jersey side have it as a backdrop.
Love the ever-changing skyline!. You can't beat the skyline - especially at night or sunset! Our favorite views are from Hoboken and also the US National Tennis Center in Queens at dusk.
Love it!. Best to see it from the Brooklyn promenade at night when it is clear. there is (almost) nothing like it.
Awesome view. Awesome view. Relaxing boat trip. Great views of the Manhattan skyline. Great opportunity for taking great pictures.
Dumbo. From Brooklyn you have an amazing view and excelent food. There are a lot of restaurants . And visit the Dumbo area .

Skyline View. Especially pretty at night with all the lights. Interesting variety of building heights but mostly large glass and steel structures with a few exceptions such as the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. Definitely a steel and concrete jungle.
A "must see" in new york. A harbor cruise gives you the best skyline view. Even on a cloudy day, the view was spectacular. We also passed by the Statue of Liberty and our guide was very informative.

There is a lot going on here. I won't say it is the prettiest skyline but it is definitely congested. When you see a lot of buildings you immediately imagine a lot of people that live and work there but then add on all the tourist. That describes your visit to Manhattan. Crowded! I loved it though. Can't wait to visit again to finish my tour.

Amazing NYC Family Trip. Beautiful sight. Almost hard to describe, especially at night. But don't overlook the *free* skyline view (well, lower Manhattan) from the back or front of the Staten Island Ferry. Incredible both coming and going and really gives you a sense of the "island" of Manhattan.

Powerful. You can experience this over and over and always find something new to see. It represents so many things to so many people. It's a manmade beauty that blends in beautifully with it's natural surroundings.

Breathtaking !. walked miles around all the piers and all around the streets of Manhattan
Up the trump tower and top of the rock ,Empire State and the view is just breathtaking from anywhere ,I couldn't stop taking photos ! . It is just as spectacular at night and so beautiful . Will stay with me for a long time.
Exhilarating Experience on the Grayline Downtown Tour Bus. Well worth the Donwtown trip on the top of the Grayline Tour bus to Brooklyn.mmwhat am exhilarating tour....and the skyline👍🎈
Enjoy the view!. Take any opportunity to enjoy the skyline, wether from a rooftop bar, a ferry or the view from Brooklyn, it never ceases to amaze.

Feast for your eyes. Spectacular at every turn it's like a picture postcard. Nowhere in the world will you get this WOW factor. The Empire State, Chrysler & One world trade buildings dominate and are a feast for you eyes. Awe inspiring

Lots of places to get a great photo. best seen on the Highline trail. Or walk across one of NYCs bridges. Lots of harbour tours as well. Take the ferry to Staten Island.. its cheap and worth the view!
Capital of the world. What can you say? I am sure I've seen this skyline from EVERY angle. It never gets old and its evolving as I write this. I'm sure it will impress. I'm proud to live here.
Wow. We saw Manhattan from all vantage points, Top of The Rock, Empire State, Staten Island Ferry both day and night and it just never fails to be amazing.

What a City.. To view the Manhattan Skyline from the other side of the river is a sight to behold but to see it from on the river is even better.Nightime is best of all as it turns into a grown up Fairyland !!

When I see this, I know I'm back home. This view, especially at night, is the beauty of New York City. It seems like the gateway to New York. When we were flying in, I pointed it out to my family, who thought I was a little nuts, and asked them if they thought it was beautiful. The general consensus was yes, but I think they did that to appease me. Nevertheless, this is a spectacular view...it is no wonder that it has been depicted in several paintings, movies and TV shows.
Fifty Stories never looked so small in the USA. Different since 9/11, but still one of the most awe-inspiring skylines on the planet - a must-see for any self-labeled world-traveler.

No visit is complete without a view of the skyline. We took the Staten Island Freer (FREE) and was able to get some great views of the city from the ferry. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the famous in the world. While in and around the city you have several options on how you can see the skyline. However, you end up seeing it, it's worth it!
Fantastic. Circle Line Cruises was the company I went with to view this amazing popular skyline. Brilliant view. I was lucky enough to have the best weather for it. Blue clear skies.
What a sight, amazing view.. What a sight. We were lucky to see this on a lovely (but very cold) clear day. This and Empire State need to be done!

Manhattan skyline. We took water taxi cruise on the Hudson and saw the statue of liberty and manhattan skyline. It was magnificent. The tour guide was a lot of fun and had everyone singing. You get a lot of history and its well worth the price for the tour.
If you are only going for the skyline you can do better.. Meh, big city. Loud, dirty, and industrial. Good old architecture, and many deco buildings remain...
an evening to remember. Fab, did by night on a boat while having dinner ,great food,great friends for company,service and staff fantastic
Nice walk in the evening. Nice to see that you can create something different from what would normally have been pulled down and destroyed. This will only get better as the trees and plants mature.
Manhattan from the East River. Go on the Staten Island Ferry, the Liberty Island Cruise or walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to get the best views.
New York in the summer. What an iconic skyline. It's is as impressive by day and by night. A great way to see it is by one of the hop on hop off tour buses. You get a chance to take in all the views
Sightseeing in Manhattan was wonderful. So was the shopping. Gorgeous skyline. Visiting the Empire State Building was amazing. 360 degree views of Manhattan . You could see for miles.
New York in Summer. Just beautiful, especially from my window at Double tree Suites. Also recommend the night bus tour which gives you a great view from Brooklyn.
One of a kind. So many but we did do a sailing trip from battery park and that view with the freedom tower is inspiring
Sightseeing. Scale and architecture were amazing. Things like the Empire State, Flatiron building, Times Square, Brooklyn Bridge and Central Park

It's everything you see in the movies.. Stayed in Times Square area which is perfect and only 5 mins away you can see the main sky scrapers. you need an underground train to get to the World Centre and it's worth going.
Wow. Love architecture, especially skyscrapers. Place is beautiful to visit. You really learn about "a new York minute" being there for your first minute. Great experience!
Take the Big Bus Night tour. Be sure to get Tommy the Tour Guide - he's a great guide. The lights in Manhattan at night fabulous.
Not to be missed. Best seen from the water. The Staten Island Ferry is free, or you can take a water taxi, or take the trip to The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island.
Beautiful Viewing!!. Take the ferry to Liberty Island or the free Staten Island Ferry but get on a boat and view the beauty that is the Manhattan Skyline!

Thrilling!!!. You will never forget your first time! Jaw-dropping, exciting, intimidating, breath-taking, overwhelming...but, above all, magical. The quintessential city you've envisioned from every fairytale you've ever read. It really exists!

Night skyline not to be missed. The NYC skyline at night from the Empire State Building's 86 floor is like a fairy tale Christmas! The lines were long but worth the wait. If you don't mind spending more money get advance tickets and skip the lines.

Spectacular views of NY .. Picked it up in mid-town and walked down to 8th Street . Beautiful sunny day, wonderful plants, views of the city that are otherwise unseen. And fun places to eat at the end of the walk.

Consider purchasing a bus tour. We bought a two-day bus tour and an evening drive over the Manhattan bridge and through the area was included. You have never seen the skyline until you see it at night from the bridge!
It was absolutely breathtaking!!!

Plan AHEAD & get an awesome-ly GREAT view!!. When heading from the JFK or LGA airports INTO Manhattan - take a cab and tell the driver MUST go to the Midtown tunnel.[...middle of the island.]There is a crest that the vehicle must go to the top of before it goes downhill to the tunnel tolls. On a bus it is not so easy to see cuz u r either on one side of the bus or the other so you do not get the entire view...Unless maybe you're sitting 'shotgun' aka in the front seat next to the driver.T H I S ...is the BEST view of Manhattan's skyline - gotta look quick from left to right - you can see from the World Trade/Freedom Tower to the Empire State building to the diagonal topped building [that was suppose to be for solar power] and up to the upper East side...[to your right]...- AWESOME on a clear day - BTW - if it is overcast or raining it is NOT so spectacular....so don't bother - but even at night the lights are awesome. There is no other place to see that huge a vista of Manhattan...well maybe from a helicopter ??? ....coming from Queens towards Manhattan.I do this every time I traveled...it's the "home sweet home" view for me!!However long the traffic allows - well that's how long it takes..but hey ya gotta go that way anyway right? ...well if you are staying in Manhattan!This is for everyone - young - old - vacationers and even on a business trip - just look up from the cell!!You won't regret the cost of the taxi - this makes it worth it!!BTW going back to the airport is literally a pain ...keeping turned around looking out the back window of the cab! LOL!
Beautiful by night from the river. stunning views of Manhattan Skyline and Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty from our dinner cruise ship.
Beautiful Skyline Views. Best Manhattan Skyline view is seen from the "free" Staten Island commuter Ferry, not to mention clear views of the Statue of Liberty!
Better than I expected. I don't usually like cities so wasn't expecting to be 'wowed' by the Manhattan Skyline, but it really is worth seeing. I would like to go back.
Syline. Manhatten Skyline is definitely worth a look, take a stroll along the disused rail way amongst the shady trees
New York. Too get the view in Manhattan you could do the boat ride to Statue of Liberty , breathtaking !!! In my opinion it's one of the best views to see

A MUST IF YOU ARE IN NEW YORK. The best way to see the whole city in one perspective is the Helicopter Ride. There is no doubt that this will orientate you .Not expensive but great to get your bearings.
Ian

The Skyline. The most beautiful skyline! I live in NYC, so I may be biased =). The best way to see it I have found is if you get lucky enough to fly by on a trip home to Laguardia, keep your camera ready. If this doesn't work for you try taking the Path train over the Exchange Plaza in Jersey City or the ferry. There are some great views from there, not much going on in Jersey City though, and you have to pay to get over there. You can also get some pictures from Staten Island by taking the Free Ferry. You can also get some pretty good views from all the bridges leading to/from the city.
must see once in your life. must see once in your life, could spend much more time there, pleasant, felt safe sending my 15 & 16 year old there during the day.
most amazing thing. the most amazing thing I have ever seen. Except for when I saw Lady Gaga live. But truly , New York City is the Best.

Don't choose a misty day. Looking forward to identifying landmarks I knew. Alas when I went up a tall building with supposedly great views of Manhattan. Could just make out the Empire State Building with the eye but not effectively in my photos' it was shrouded in a heat haze so the effect was lost. I was told it could have been worse since some of the tallest skyscrapers are shrouded in cloud - then visibility zero.I have seen it before in past years. It's impressive but not today.

Magnificent. Changes continually! Even as you walk around it is like being in a dense forest of buildings, with little light. Then you come to one of the many relatively open spaces where you can get a perspective of the size and architectual features of many buildings at once. Awe inspiring!

Amazing Cityscape Skyline. Arriving into New York by cruise ship the views are spectacular, even outside the bridge. Approaching the Hudson River the views of downtown and uptown Manhattan are amazing.If not on a cruise ship, take a round trip on the free Staten Island ferry. It is worth it for the view.

SPELLBOUND. Wherever in the city you take a moment to view this amazing work of art you will be spellbound .....just like the whole of ny is a melting pot of cultures so the buildings reflect the same .

Awe inspiring!. Great views from the cruise boats that go to Liberty Island and Ellis Island! Also from the Staten Island Ferry. The gaping gap created by the loss of the World Trade Towers is partially filled by the Freedom Tower, although the skyline is not really the same.
Empire State Building. Amazing View of New York skyline. You can see in all directions and on a clear day you can see where the earth curves.

Well worth a Visit. we walked the 1.5 mile Highline Route on a BeautifUL Sunny day.The whole concept of the Public/Private sponsors donating Plants, Time & Funds to convert a disused Railway line into a Beautiful walkway surrounded by Plants/Shrubs & Trees in the middle of an Industrial Area is amazing. The whole area below the LINE is also developing into a thriving Retail & Restaurant Zone.

wonderful!. NYC is an amazing city full of things to do, see, visit, a city full of life... beautiful!There are two kinds of city tours, that covers two areas of the big apple, so if it's your first time in New york, you can't miss them...it's the best way to visit the city.
Great to see at dusk. Pictures do not do it justice. Watching the skyline at dusk after a day on the town really gives a sense of a great city that really could take weeks to experience.
Nice. When driving in, the skyline is amazing! This is one of the key aspects of New York City. Advice: Just do it!!
Great to be back. There is nothing quite like it is there... Best view for me is the one you get for free from the Staten Island Ferry.

Places for pictures. You can get reasonable photos from the Staten Islamd ferry which is free, or from walking (or using subway) over the Brooklyn Bridge. We also did the State Cruise trip to the Statue of Liberty and felt it was worth it to get up close to the statue where you can better appreciate its size. Book online in advance to cut down on queuing time for tickets. I think if you want to go up to the crown you need to book well in advance. I looked 2 weeks before we went and it was sold out but we had a good time just visiting the statue and going up to the top of the pedestal.
Iconic. Stayed in New Jersey and the skyline was really pretty from the NJ shore. Very iconic. One way or another you should check it from further away.

A must see at night.. Accessible via the Empire State Building and it was incredible at night. It was a little crowded but it was not overly crowded. The views are breathtaking and you will be above all the pollution from the grounded buildings etc, so it is literally a breath of fresh air!
Amazing. Try and do a river cruise in the evening, the skyline is such a beautiful sight once the lights come on.

Stunning. The Manhattan Skyline is a one in a life time experience. It is the most beautiful thing I have ever see in my entire life!! If you are in Manhattan you have to see the Manhattan Skyline! It blows you away!!!!!
Skyline NY. Take a boattrip around NY , that was amazing and you see everything about NY , the skyline looks so nice , amazing to see

Blown away by the views.. I went straight to Brooklyn, upon arriving in New York, to visit my son who has moved there. The next morning I took the subway into Manhattan and walked out into an amazing experience. I was totally blown away by the skyline and the atmosphere. Huge buildings surrounded me, with the Chrysler Building dominating. The 'buzz' was amazing as were all the people I met as I wandered around. I also saw the skyline from Brooklyn, which is a view I will never forget.

Iconic NYC. I love this skyline and I would recommend viewing it from many different vantage points. Take a Circle Line Tour or the free Staten Island a Ferry. Look back from Governors Island or Ellis Island, Newark Airport or Brooklyn. There's even a good view from Arthur Ashe Stadium! Look down from the new Observatory, from the Empire State or 30 Rock. I love it!

Never Disappoints. We spent so much time just looking- from below on the street, from above (most of it) up the Empire State, from the Staten Island Ferry, from behind the trees in Central Park and from the Jersey shore of the Hudson - there is no place like it - familiar and yet always surprising.

Walking 15 meters above Manhoattan from 9th do 35th street. ....is just amazing, you can visit Manhattan from above starting or finishing (as you wish)from 9th street down or up to 35th and the other way round. Very tidy area, lots of flowers, bushes, trees, benches to have a rest. Put it on the MUST SEE IN NYC list.
Iconic view. Such an iconic view, Andes we travelled both by bus and boat tours we got to know the names of some of the buildings.

new york. The sight of the Manhattan sky line takes your breath away when you see it for the first time ! We have all seen it in pictures of it but there's nothing like seeing it fo real !!!New York visit is a must

Premier gateway for legal immigration to the United States. Situated on one of the world's largest natural harbors, New York consists of five burroughs. The skyline is a dramatic testament to the most densely populated major city in the U.S. with over 8 million residents that speak 800 languages. Almost 60 million tourists visit each year.

The best in the WORLD. Whether from the Jersey Hudson river Shore, Brooklyn Promenade, or Queens there really is not another skyline quite like the NYC skyline... though as I write this review on 9/11/2015 it's heartbreaking to think of what the skyline used to be when the Twin Towers stood there.... God Bless all the souls lost that day... Its just not the same now but its still the best in the world IMO.

A place too crowded. The view is great, but depending on the time of the day you have to fight your next step with people coming and going. If you have kids' strollers think two times before you go up.

UNIQUE and BEAUTIFUL. All these tall and unique buildings will leave you with a WOW factor. So unique and beautiful. We were on the Ferry heading towards Liberty Island when I turned around and saw the incredible view of NYC Skyline.

The ultimate urban skyline. Manhattan has a spectacular skyline that's instantly recognized by practically everyone the world over; it's been celebrated in countless films over the course of the last century, and rightly so, because it's the ultimate urban skyline. There are basically three vantage points to choose from: from a tall building such as the Empire State Building or the top of Rockefeller Center, from the harbor or across the East River (from Queens) or Hudson River (from New Jersey), or from the air (in a plane). If you have the opportunity, check them all out. My favorite view is from the Staten Island ferry returning from Staten Island to Manhattan just before sunset on a sunny evening -- it's spectacular.
Not to be missed. The iconic New York skyline must be viewed by everyone at least once in their life. I think it is best seen from across the river at Brooklyn Heights.

Didn't disappoint. We saw this iconic skyline from the Staten Island Ferry and from the far side of Brooklyn Bridge. Both days were beautiful and the skyline glistened and soared in the sunshine. No matter how many times you might see it on film or photo, the real thing is impressive.
View . This famous city Skyline should be viewed in the morning evenings and night. Its very pretty. If you are in Big Apple you will not miss the view.

One of the most famous skylines in the world. Our best views of the Manhattan Skyline came from the Liberty Ferry (on the way to/from the Statue of Liberty), the Top of the Rock, and walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Although you get amazing views from the One World Observatory/Freedom Tower, you are looking down on everything so it's not really like you are getting a "skyline" view.

To truly appreciate it - you have to view from NJ. If you truly want to appreciate the NYC skyline, head to Jersey and go up to Weehawken, Union City, and West New York and drive along JFK Blvd East - the views from this road are million dollar views.

Panorama Views for the Art Lover. If you want to indulge in the New York skyline with the extra added benefit of ramping up your art cred, head for the newly relocated Whitney Museum just right of the Highline at Gansevoort Street.

It's NYC!. This iconic view is known by people all over the world even if they have never been to the U.S.
Everyone loves it!
New York, New York.. There really aren't enough superlatives to sum up the sheer enormity of the views of and from these amazing buildings.

NYC SKYLINE - Unique and BEAUTIFUL. You just have to LOOK UP while strolling the busy streets of Manhattan. Be sure and take photos from the ground vantage. It's exciting to see the architecture and to be amidst these tall and elegant buildings.
Splendid CIty View. Experience what New York is all about, watch the beautiful Mahattan skyline and you'll know what cosmopolitan city is all about.

Amazing.. the best views of the skyline are from The rockerfeller centre and the water. We took the City Clipper sunset sail from battery park at 6.30pm and the skyline was stunning. you get to see it in the sunlight and once it is all lit up in the evening,

Great View!. This Skyline is something which will give your eyes a pleasant view.

incomparable beauty. there are more magnificent buildings in Shanghai and Dubai now, and NYC is resting on its laurels from 100 years ago. imagine arriving in New York in 1915 from some village in Europe and being blown away by the skyscrapers! the skyline hasn't changed much since then, largely due to over-regulation by the city. however, nothing beats being in a cab coming over the Brooklyn bridge into the city, dressed up to go to a show or party or theater, and sitting back mesmerized by the historical magnificence and power of the skyline. great views from Wburg and Long Island City. or take one of the touristy cruises around the city, have a few drinks and take in the splendor of the skyline. I love NYC!!

Best Skyline in the World!. With the addition of The Freedom Tower the New York skyline is looking great again! While nothing can replace the twin towers the Freedom Tower gives Lower Manhattan a modern look.
Breathtaking. It doesn't matter how many times you see it, it will always take your breath away. The best view is from New Jersey, on the other side of the Hudson river.

Man Manhattan!. I have had to great opportunity to stay in quite a few great hotels in NYC. So I have had the great opportunity to see the skylines of many cities. Aside from my own home city, I would have to say I love NYC's. That probably why I am here so much!

Manhattan Skyline: soak in the beauty of the architecture.. OOOOOOhhhhhhhhh! I love seeing this skyline! It's the best thing in the world to be driving into the city and see this skyline. It makes me feel happy! But sad when I have to leave.

This city never sleeps. absolutely amazing place ,plenty to see and do.

Great views. The Manhattan Skyline is a great walk on a skyline that used to be railroads and it´s the perfect plan after visiting the Chelsea market.

SEEING N.Y.C. FROM THE OUTSIDE BEAUTIFUL. The Manhattan skyline is quite an experience especially from the Queens side looking over the river on a beautiful clear day or night. A weekend stay at the Ravel Hotel in Long Island City along with it's fabulous restaurants will give you a view of the skyline you will not soon forget.
How do you visit a skyline?. Duh, of course it's amazing but how do you review it? I suggest you make friends with someone who has a good view around fireworks time.

Looking for, but not quite finding, the ultimate skyline and sunset pictures. The best way to see the skyline is from a boat, and there are many choices - the free Staten Island Ferry, the ferries to the Statue of Liberty, the New York Water Taxi, many cruise choices including those at sunset, cruises on old masted clipper ships, etc. You can also see the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge (take a walk or bike ride across, there are bike rentals there) and from the Brooklyn or New Jersey parks directly across from Manhattan. There are two main areas of skyline - the southern end with One World Trade Center towering above the others, and then midtown where the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and Rockefeller Center are just 3 of many huge buildings. Don’t forget the UN complex which can be seen from East River. We had a New York Pass which included several of the boating options. One we took was the sunset cruise, hoping to get some nice skyline with sunset pictures, but that didn’t work out as well as I had hoped as, though we were in East River at the time with Manhattan between us and the sun, most of the sunset took place hidden by the city. We got a few snapshots of the still bright but reddening sun between skyscrapers.

Mesmerising Manhattan!. We took a circle line cruise around the Manhattan skyline which started in twilight but ended with the illuminations all around us. We got a glimpse of the famous buildings as we moved along the Hudson river and East river passing below the famous bridges and seeing the sun set with its hue cast on the Statue of Liberty standing in its majestic way. The newly built World Trade center tower and the Empire state building,very familiar in any photo of the Big Apple are clearly visible as is New Jersey. As dusk settles its a million stars glittering and beckoning you to go and enjoy the nightlife of New York.

The best view is outside Manhattan . Everybody knew the Manhattan Skyline but the best way to enjoy it its outside Manhattan, like Weehawken or Williamsburg, the views are outstanding during daylight and at night, specially at sunset you can see some buildings turn red is beautiful.
Breathtaking. Breath taking wherever you are in the city looking at the beautiful skyline. It transforms from day to night.
Creative!. Very creative way to attract visitors. There are cafes/ice cream shops and there are seating areas. In summer, the wet areas are so refreshing, especially for little kids!
A place to make wishes.. One of the best place to see this is on top of the Metropolitan Museum. The skyline is spectacular day or night.

Beautiful view. You see this all the time on TV and as we are from the UK, it was fab to see it in real life. This is an amazing place for the various styles of building and height of the buildings against each other.

Awesome View in the day and night. On my last trip to New York, the first thing that i went to see was the Manhattan Skyline. You can see the skyline from 3 to 4 places. One is the Brooklyn Bridge which you will cross when you do the Hop on Hop Off; the next time is when you take the Staten Island Ferry. You will see it again from Sinata Driver. I would rate all of them great. You should do all three of them. I did the Staten Island Ferry in the night so that i could see the Manhattan Skyline by night. So i managed to do it by day and night.
Manhattan Skyline. We bought tickets for the green hop on and hop off buses for a 3 day duration. Cost $39 each but well worth it as we took an evening tour of the city when all the lights were lit.
Amazing!. Everything I expected it to be. Loved it in day time or at night from ferry or Top of the Rock and Empire State Building.

Time for a quiet overview. A quiet opportunity for a high level walk around the west side. Not only are the old rails still in existence but some nice planting and water features

Great places to see the NYC Skyline. This is what we all expect of NYC but there are some good places to see it from. Try Central Park near the lake at the southern end for some contrast of natural surroundings against the skyline. Or take an around Manhattan boat trip that is great for a quick orientation and some spectacular skyline views. Or go up high - the Top of the Rock at the Rockefeller Centre is a great view. My personal favourite - 7th floor roof garden cafe at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

View from Statue Cruise. I took the ferry to Liberty and Ellis islands and the views of the city skyline are breath taking. The ferry to the islands was still a little foggy in early morning, but on the way back around lunchtime it was amazing.

Amazing!. My family and I viewed the Manhattan Skyline from the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock (at night) and via a Helicopter. We also went on a night bus tour. Words can't describe the views. New York is amazing by day and night!

amazing. central, which is great because you can take the subway right around the corner. The neighbourhood is just amazing; restaurants, shops, culture you name it...

Beautiful. ..!. The 2 best places to see the amazing skyline of Manhattan are from the Rockefeller centre .. or from the Empire state building on the observatory deck or if you can handle heights then go up the very top on the 102nd floor.....an experience I'll never forget....

the most iconic skyline in the world. there are so many different ways to see the skyline and each one will have a different slant to it. from the harbour lights cruise to the other boroughs, brooklyn, queens, jersey etc. just one piece of advice try and see it both at night and in daylight to get he full experience.
DUMBO views are incredible. Every time we came back we find something new. Big city, tones of options from shopping to walking. BTW the DUMBO offer amazing views of the city

Amazing on film, better in real life.. Nothing fully prepares you for the image that is Manhattan. Best view is just before the tunnel entrance from New Jersey although the ferrys give you great views. A priceless view for free!
Big city. My children are born in Rotterdam, the only city with a skyline in the Netherlands. And I love it! The Manhattan Skyline beautiful, awesome, gigantic!
New York, New York. These views are fabulous from many different viewpoints - my favourite was from the Statue of Liberty.
Lovely skyline. Spectacular skyline! Best to view from somewhere high (Rockefeller Center, Empire State, WTC) or from the water (taxi or Circle Line).

The mixture of art deco buildings and the tall glass sky scrapers. This was a magical experience in NYC. I was with friends and we planned ahead of time and were able to see many of the sights and even walk over the Brooklyn Bridge

This was my best part of Manhattan!. Went over into Brooklyn, at dawn, to look at the skyline. Stayed there until it was completely dark and all the lights had turned on. It was totally worth it, even for pictures.

Best skyline there is . Manhattan skyline is majestic and beautiful from all vantage points high and low. It's also great to go on a boat and get the view from the river. The view from Hoboken NJ is also amazing

We got some great pictures. It was included in our City pass, so not sure on exact cost, but well worth it for us..
Take Circle Line.. I've taken the Circle Line many times and that view never gets old. Highly recommend it to see the entire city from the water.

The Classic Skyline. The city has an iconic skyline - be sure to take a few photos (unless you are driving). Good views from Brooklyn - and when crossing most bridges. You can also get some good photos from water taxi's and ferries.

View it from Brooklyn. We went to Brooklyn promenade at sunset...wow! That's the spot to truely see Manhattan skyline!
Just take the subway there, walk a little bit and enjoy the view :)

Iconic. If you get a chance to get over to Weehawken/Hoboken/Jersey City on the west side of the city or Brooklyn on the east side, you will get those great iconic views! Definitely great photo opp's.

Empire State Building Experience. This tour was one of the reasons we returned to New York for our 32nd Wedding anniversary.
It was a great experice. Seeing Manhattan and north Jersy from 102 stories high in the air. The view was amazing all around.
If you want to see the full landscape of Manhattenm the Empire State Building is a must.

Take the Circle-Line for an amazing view of the city.. I did this via a Circle Line Cruise. I took the longer round island cruise and loved it. The weather was brilliant and I took a Premier Pass - this meant I had a fantastic view from the back of the boat and got some great shots. I think that this beats the helicopter ride hands down as it is so much more informative and less frenetic.
Ride the Ferry for Great Views. Best way to see it is take the Staten Island Ferry for a free ride! We did this on a Sunday morning and it was nice and quiet.
A Chance for Some Timeout. Use the park to unwind a little and get away from the non-stop hustle of the city. Look out for Turtle Pond and visit the boating lake restaurant.
Unmissable. Unmissable. Best view is from the Rockerfella Centre, and the Top of the Rock Attraction. Definitely go up at sunset.

See the Magnificence of Manhattan at Sundown. Go to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade around sunset and look at Manhattan as the lights come on and the sun sets behind Manhattan. Almost a religious experience.
Skyline of Manahattan. Simply stunning and breathtaking. Definitely a picture worth a thousand words. Stopped on our way back from a day tour tour to Washington DC.

The spirit of the city. Most probably the best Skyline I've ever seen. I think, the best place to enjoy it is the Rockefeller center in the bar with a glass of wine as you can spare the money for the observatory fee and to spend it on the drinks
Never boring. You cannot help but be impressed when you see the Manhattan skyline be it by day, night the water or up the Empire State. The more you look the more impressive it is.
Just amazing - has to be seen from the water. Just stunning lived up to every expectation. No film shots or TV shows can do it justice ... You have to see this before you kick the bucket - amazing!!!
NYC. Well whats to say except This is New York New York New York - a wonderful city and so so fun. I love this place and its iconic beautiful skyline.

New York City Skyline. You see Manhattan shown in many pictures and movies, but seeing it in person is much more exciting! New York City epitomizes what the United States is all about, a melting pot of many cultures and ethnic groups, all of whom came to the United States seeking freedom. You have got to see it first hand to believe it! What a sight!

Unmissable. This is the one unmissable attraction in New York, along with the Statue of Liberty. Goose bumps either at day or night.You can choose to do a paid tour (circle line, for example) or a free ride in the Staten Island ferry. Both worth it.
Manhattan Skyline - Awesome. We saw the Manhattan skyline a few times, on the ferry to Liberty Island, the water taxi, the sunset cruise, Each time it felt like the first time that we see it.
Breathtaking. Absolutely gorgey view as we waited on the pier before going in to buy our tickets for the ferry. Wondrous weather and an excellent view before our adventure.
Pretty at night. Took the grayline night tour and this is always terrific - the pictures from Brooklyn and going over the bridge too and fro are worth the effort and your time

Amazing!. We visited NYC last autumn and could not get enough of the Manhattan skyline. Would definitely recommend getting a water taxi around the island as you get some amazing views and get to go up close to the statue of liberty.We also did a sunset water ride of the skyline, which was absolutely amazing. Definitely recommend - be sure to take a camera!

Impressive at many angles. I would highly recommend taking a tour on the water and see the skyline day or night from the back of a ferry or water taxi. Nice views are also possible from some hotels on higher floors if possible.

Beautiful Views!. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the most breath taking views I have ever experienced. I was on the Gray Line New York Sightseeing tours heading back into Manhattan after visiting Brooklyn and the skyline was absolutely stunning. It was near sun set and it felt like a scene out of the movie, you can see the Empire State building lit up, the one World Trade centre, all of the high rise skyscrapers with the lights flashing, and in the far distance you can see the Statue of Liberty overlooking the entire city. Seeing it in the movies and TV shows simply do not do the skyline justice, it is a must see experience.

A true modern wonder of the world. The first time I saw the skyline travelling from JFK through Queens it took my breath away. It is something you have seen thousands of times in films and on TV but in real life it is amazing, especially at night.
He view. Fantastic views, great sightseeing. Easy sightseeing with the open top buses, although because of the traffic , can take some time to get around
Wow. All I can say is wow! you have to experience this skyline in person. We elected for the boat tour, and I think this is the best way.
A must to do. Lovely walk, green and interesting. Unusual architecture of buildings. Huge construction sites along the way. Plenty of things to look at.
