Gob-smacking. Visited here during the Cunard 175 anniversary transatlantic voyage aboard the QM2 (Southampton, Liverpool, Halifax/Nova Scotia, Boston, New York). I shall never as long as I live forget the sunny crack-of-dawn view of the sun rising over Brooklyn and bringing the majestic Manhattan skyline into the beginnings of dayight, beyond the Verrazano Narrows Bridge. In the murky half light of the river, with the Manhattan skyline still some miles off in the distance I shook my head in disbelief at what I was seeing and hearing, as the bells on the river buoys rang out with their distinctive tones. A truly majestic experience by any measure, and one that was made all the more memorable by experiencing it aboard the equally majestic Queen Mary 2 cruise liner. Of course, the nearer we got, the more majestic the view of Manhattan became. Sheer perfection.
Magical !!!. i found the Manhattan Skyline to be best seen from the Long Island train heading into the City. The skyline grows and blooms like Oz. it's Magical!

Liberty View. Best view and a great photo op was from the Statue of Liberty and also from the ferry going over from the Battery.Day we went over was clear with blue skies anda great view of this iconic skyline...The one I missed was in the plane flying back from Dallas into La Guardia as we had a Birdseye view as we passed the Empire State Building but were in aisle seats and could not get to the window with the camera!

Fabulous views. There are plenty of views of Manhattan. We had two which impressed us particularly. The one from the ferry boat that takes you to Ellis Island, but also the one from Brooklyn Heights after crossing the bridge by foot. The latter view is particularly on lower Manhattan.
Unique. Very interesting and unique. You can see the Empire State Building and the missing twin towers. We loved looking at it from the ferry to Liberty Island.
Great views of the skyline from brooklyn bridge. We walked across the brooklyn bridge at night and got a really cool view of the skyline all lights twinkling.definitely worth doing and free!

Dream comes true of USA seeing the High Rise Buildings. What a lovely side, when you enter from New Jersey City you see the River reflection of all high rise Building including the State Empire and One world Trade centre
Nothing quite like Gotham City!. There is nothing quite like NYC, Be sure to see it from every vantage point possible. It is spectacular!
Tall buildings. A vista that is well worth a look. From the Statue of Liberty it is seen as a packed gathering of very tall buildings in various shades of blue.

So beautiful! Love the photo ops!. Everywhere we went (especially throughout Central Park) we were able to take beautiful photos of the Manhattan Skyline. It is just so majestic. I love taking photos "through things" and there were unbelievable views everywhere we turned. We were up on observations decks (1WTC and Top of the Rock), down through Central Park, up on 230 Fifth (at night), The Highline, and others. It is a photographers paradise!

Better than the movies. There are so many places where you can check the Skyline, but from Brooklyin Boulevard is the best. Also, from Standard Hotel you can have a great view and a drink, although its kinda fancy, so dress up.
breathtaking!. its hard to write a review of a skyline, but i think this one really needs one because it is so breathtaking!
Cruise around Manhattan. Book a Circle Line Cruise. This is the best way to view and capture photos of the fascinating New York City skyline.
Best Skyline in the world. The best skyline in the world. Very few cities can match the excitement and energy. Life is fun and exciting every moment when you visit.
When The Sky has a Line its got to be Manhattan Skyline. The spectacular view ever seen, one just can't get enough of it. See it during sunset, the reflection of the Sunset is extremely beautiful
Manhatta Skyline. Breath taking, beautiful. We took a tour on the double decker bus. I have never seen so many tall buildings and so much traffic.

New York, NY--You Have to See It to Believe It!. The Manhattan skyline is one of the wonders of the earth. I drive into the City to visit friends, the restaurants, the Broadway shows and the sites as often as I can and the approach to the George Washington Bridge and view of Manhattan beyond is always a thrilling experience.No matter how you see it--from the East, from the West, North or South--The Big Apple is a view to behold and remember.
Skylines. There's a rating for the Manhattan Skyline? Ok, I'll play along. It's nice. One of the best in the world. Was better 15 years ago, but we're all moving forward. Bring a camera.

Memorable view. Manhattan Skyline a view you can remember for lifetime..All around New york you can view this beautiful skyline..this can be viewed from top of the rock @Rockefeller centre & Empire state building & Statue of liberty & not to mention the beautiful brooklyn bridge..the tall scrapers of NY adds beauty to all the attractions..

NYC Skyline - # 1. A piece of Americana that must been seen if you travel to NYC. Historic landmark we see every day on TV and in movies. In the very top when it comes to skylines in the world. I really miss The Towers. When you got lost you could always get your bearing once you caught site of them.

Manhattan Skyline. From Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island the Manhattan Skyline is awesome - so close, and yet jampacked with buildings. You get the feeling that it's pristine . . . until you walk the streets :-)

Famous. Visited May 2014. One of the most famous skylines in the world, enjoy looking for all the landmarks and seeing where they are in the city. Plan which ones to see and how to get there. Manhattan is a must see for all.

Great View. I visited New York just a couple of weeks back. I went to statue of Liberty and the Manhattan skyline view across was enthralling. It looks like concrete jungle surfacing the city border. Very good view for those to love photography.

Birds Eye View. You see this on many films, books posters etc, but until you have walked the streets looking up and then viewed the skyline from the Empire State Building you cannot fully appreciate the size and height of Manhattan, New York. Worth doing at Day and at Night.
It's all you expect it to be. Where are you going to see a better skyline of buildings? Great viewed from the rivers, Empire Statue Building and Top of the Rock

Amazing sight!. This view just takes your breath away especially the first time you see it.the best way to enjoy it is to walk the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn side towards Manhattan.this is one of the best things to do in New York and it's free!

A must see for anyone in New York.. Many places to see it from, including the Staten Island Ferry, the tram to Roosevelt Island, and the buildings such as Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building. I would recommend going to any one of these
the skyline. Its an amazing city and the skyline makes it look even bigger, definitely need a picture if you go there.
Different. Nice walk if in the evening. Close to timesquare. It could get pretty busy depending on the time of day but it definitely worth going to.

It's a skyline. It's classic new york, all the skyscrapers, the hustle and bustle of the ports, the people going about their days trying to get things done. It's one of the most beautiful skylines in the world. Enough said.

MIssing two towers, but still majestic. The Manhattan skyline is tall and seemingly endless. Its temporarily missing two towers, but One World Trade Center is back up and proud, and at least one more tower will follow. We come from an urban city ( Vancouver, BC) so we are used to high reaching towers. However, New York City and the Manhattan districts is a true Metropolis, and the skyline is memorable and ever growing. In the outside burroughs skyscrapers are rising up as well making this whole region a megalopolis. On our recent visit, it seemed every second or third building was surrounded with scaffolding and construction workers improving and renovating skyscrapers. This is a city that never seems to sleep, and is back to once again growing and prospering.

The Grandeur of it All. Take it all in! Great views from The Brooklyn Bridge, The Promenade, in Brooklyn Heights & in the cab ride from LaGuardia. Once you have experienced it first hand, you will never see it the same way again, when you see it in the movies! If particular buildings appeal to you, look them up online. The more you know these buildings, the more you will get out of the experience.
Night Bus Tour. The Best view of the skylight at night was from one of the night bus tours. It gives a different experience seeing all the lights at night!

Great view from the air or a tall building. Probably the best in the world as far as skylines go if we're talking about skyscrapers. NYC has had the tallest building in the world 11 times. Land is very valuable and hard to come by, so the best thing you can do is build up instead of out and that is what has been done in NYC for 130+ years. Amazing to think that the Empire State Building was the tallest building in the world for over 40 years and it is still a major part of the NYC skyline at 80+ years old.
Go to the top of the rock. immence!!! go to top of the rock for best view!! 67 floors up, lift to 65 then two flights up....you will love
The best skyline in the world!. Amazing to see for real what we all know from TV! The view from the Rockerfeller Center is something else!

Amazing City. Manhattan is a must-see! So many attractions! The hop-on hop-off buses provide great access to all areas, including a harbour tour to see Lady Liberty. The people are so friendly. The sidewalks are packed with tourists. It is best to park and walk, as traffic is slow moving and mostly cabs and buses use the streets near Times Square.

Hoboken State of Mind. Hoboken view, it is worth the trip to stop in Hoboken for the quaint neighborhood and the view across the water. Sit at the waterfront park, in this mile by mile town, and enjoy the view. Then hop the ferry or Path and head to the City.
Just the place to visit!. This one of the most talked of cities in the world. It has a beautiful skyline and seeing ti from various angles including the cruise are great experiences.

A sight to behold.. The Manhattan skyline is just something you have to see to believe. Every time I come to the city I just find myself starring at the skyline. I love it at dawn, dusk, and night.
Let me know what you think.

A great start to visiting NYC!. Circle Line 3 hour tour around all of Manhattan is the way to go on your first full day there. It gives you a great orientation to NYC and you can see all of the major sites from the boat before you actually go to visit (Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, etc)
It looks like it does in the movies!. Best way to see is on the Circle Line Boat tours. Pay particular attention to the detail in all the architecture.
Skyscraper paradise. If you want to see skyscrapers, there is no place like Manhattan. Simply amazing views and the sheer number of skyscrapers make for an amazing sight
See it from the top of the Empire State Bldg.. The Manhattan Skyline is the best place to come home to.We were able to see it from many vantage points.

Night tour to brooklyn. I went with gony tours, our tour guide, Manice was an awesome company! He had a lot of knowledge, he kept telling stories and all the information he had,. He was also well prepared in interaction with travellers. The tour would have been boring without him.

Night tour to brooklyn. I went with gony tours, our tour guide, Manice was an awesome company! He had a lot of knowledge, he kept telling stories and all the information he had,. He was also well prepared in interaction with travellers. The tour would have been boring without him.
Powerful and breathtaking view!. Gorgeous!! I am not really a fan of big cities but looking at the skyline of Manhattan is such a powerful and breathtaking site.
Like in the movies. This place looks like no one else and it is hard to imagine to such a landscape has been made by men!
Romantic place!. A must in New York! Visit the skyline from next to the Brooklyn bridge at night, you won't regret it! Just, the area is not great, but felt safe in the evening
Manhattan Skyline. Right out of a movie! The Manhattan Skyline is just amazing on a clear day! You can see forever, as they say.
NYC. Stunning panorama from Central Park and the rooftop of the Metropolitan Museum. Looking forward to revisiting the Empire State Building
Fantastci views of the city!. Take the Gray line hop-on & hop-off buses that run all day 7 days a week. Its a bargain for the money!

City Skyline. Best views are from the water. Take the Island Ferry for free!
Great if you catch a sun set. Just feels like a picture postcard.
Amazing. What can I say! It was everything I expected and more. The skyline of Manhattan is best seen from above. I recommend the Rockefeller Roof Top Bar for a more sophisticated experience.

impressive skyline of manhattan .... Impressive views can be bast seen by taking one the water taxis or enjoy it form the Brooklyn side. Other possibilities are the observation decks of the known buildings (Empire, Rockefeller, etc.)
Breath taking. Just beautiful. See it from the Brooklyn Bridge at sunset or from a Circle Line tour boat. Amazing view.

I´ve been here before..... I guess when you have been living in a city like Tokyo, or used to a skyline like the one you get at the Marina Bay at Singapor, is not difficult to feel a litte bit dissapointed about the Manhattan Skyline. Of course there is a feeling of cinematic on every look you take, but it makes you feel that you´ve been there before many times (blame it on Hollywood!) It worths the views, and that´s what really matters...

Truly Iconic. Is there anybody in the world who would not recognize this skyline? We've all seen it in photographs and on TV a million times, but there is nothing that can prepare you for the first time you see it in person. Especially if it happens to be at night. It really is just breath-taking, and it doesn't matter how many times I see it, it never fails to impress. And the best way to see it?? From the Circle Line cruise. Try to take one towards the end of the afternoon so you can get daytime photos on the outbound portion and evening/night photos, with the glittering lights, on the return journey. Hands down, this is the best thing to do in NYC. If you only have time to do one tourist thing, this should be it.

Fantastic from any angle. We saw the skyline from the Statue of Liberty boats, the City Clipper tall ship, the Circle Line boat, and even I-78 as we drove in to Jersey City where we stayed for a 4 day visit to New York. We never tired of it!

Best to see from New Jersey shore!. I always take my friends who I first time in NY to the New Jersey shore first so they can see entire Manhattan at one glimpse. The best view in my opinion you will find at Old Glory Park (Union City).
A City Like No Other. We enjoyed the skyline from several vistas -- the Staten Island Ferry (free), Brooklyn Bridge (walked) and the Brooklyn Promenade. Breath taking.
Stunningly Beautiful!. It looks very beautiful from the Staten Island Ferry. It is always changing depending on where the sun is in the sky. It never gets dull to look at.

The Manhattan skyline is worth the trip alone!. You can't get a better view than the NYC skyline. Each building is unique and has a lovely back story. The architecture is part of the experience! You have iconic (Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, The Plaza Hotel), Modern (the Frick, the Met), reknown (brownstones), etc. Sometime for everyone.
View of Manhattan. Since I lived in NJ, the skyline of Manhattan was breathtaking especially at night. Looking toward the city was a memory I'll always cherish. Jane H.
New York sight seeing!. We saw this first from the NEW York water taxi tour during the day and then again via the Hop on Hop off Night Bus tour. Brilliant- the tour guides gave a great commentary too
Staten Island ferry for free. Cheapest way to see the city sky line by any means. Beautiful skyline boat takes long enough to get you any pictures you want.
best view from hudson river. Amazing view of the skyline, best from the river or from the little grand ferry park in Brooklyn. Sunset view is also beautiful.

On a clear day unmistakable skyline......... No other place in the world like New York. The skyline is only one
of the many recognizable features. Times Square is another.
Manhattan view. Every big city boasts a great skyline. But there is nothing like Manhattan! So much to see. And to to Brooklyn and see it from that angle is really beautiful.
Beautiful walkway. Loved the unique way that the neighborhood was renewed. What a pleasant way to enjoy a walk in the city!
From above to get the full experience. A hellecopter trip is a must to get the full experience of thes iconic skyline, seen in so many films and TV programs it really is a breathtaking experience

You are actually there !. i went on the walk in Brooklyn to see this skyline,I sat on one of the many seats looking back over lower manhattan and took in the view,WOW....I was actually there looking at what i have only seen in movies.AWESOME moment in my life.

One of Manhattan's best walking experiences. See Manhattan from a different angle: no transit lights, attractive and superb well done gardens with a blast of green. A very creative project. Cannot miss it and, if you have time, bring a book and read it here!
Central Park views. jog or walk around the central park reservoir for great views - evening views can be awesome. Most important thing is to put on comfortable shoes and enjoy the walk!

beautiful at any time of day!. Manhattan is simply impressive, we had a NY Pass and did different activities to enjoy the city from different angles: we took a boat cruise around Manhattan at sunset (it was excellent!), went up Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building and we also walked along the Brooklyn bridge (free) towards Manhattan to enjoy the view! Just awesome!
Mr. Robert Nason. Excellent Skyline Views, especially from the Promenade in Brooklyn, walking on The High Line and walking across the Brooklyn Bridge!!!
Amazing View. The view is amazing, Unique to NYC and free. I had the best view from my Statue Of Liberty Cruise Ship. You can get great pictures from the Hudson River.

Look up, but don't bump into people.. There's always something new and something old to discover! Some of my favorites are the deco towers of the 30's. Those lobby designs just hold their luxury. The "pseudo Babylonian" towers are another of my favorites.

from Brooklyn. We walked the Brooklyn bridge to get to the other side. It presented a few really good photo opportunities. Watch out for those cyclists and stay out of the cycle lane. Nice way to spend an afternoon if you're up for a walk..

A View in awe.. Go to the ROC or someplace higher and view it all. To know what it all means and bring it all into focus. This is the biggest focus of those who would destroy America, New York and to see it and all it represents in one singular view is breathtaking.

One of the great cities. What a great city. Visited at least 20 times and still get excited about NYC. Go and see all the neighbourhoods, TriBeCa, soho, Hell's Kitchen, little jtaly, mid town and flat iron. The Waldorf hotel bull and bear bar is terrific to spoil your self. Oh, experience one acre park and the whispering gallery at grand central terminal.
nice. The biggest city has a gorgeous skyline. Always great to look at always a fun visit it the city of New York.
Breathtaking!!!. The Manhattan skyline was breath-taking day and night, from land, sea, bridges and high places ......a must on anyone's bucket list!!
Great restaurant on the water. Merchant River House Restaurant a fabulous place for lunch...particularly outdoor dining in the spring, summer, fall.
From governors island. From governor s islAnd The city just looked magnificent. When you were by the hudson the views just got better

Nothing Like It!!!. The skyline is breathtaking and although it stays the same in so many ways it is constantly changing, too. When you fly into La Guardia and you are lucky enough to see the Statue of Liberty and the Empire State Building: Wow! You can't explain that to someone until they see it. We took our kids for the first time last year and it was wonderful to see how thrilled they were as they experienced NYC for the time. If all you do is walk around and sightsee and just look at the buildings you could have a great trip. I truly believe a person could visit a thousand times and never see or experience everything and never get tired of New York.

Viagra buildings. Enjoy the Manattan skyline while you can before it is ruined by grotesque pencil buildings that are shamelessly a Viagra ad. To ruin one of the great city landscapes to provide unused flight money apartments for mostly wealthy foreigners is obscene. When these buildings are completed an iconic view will be ruined.
Fatal attraction. The Manhattan skyline looks awesome weather you see it during the day or the night. The best view you get is from the other side of the Hudson river.

The REAL city of Gothem!. No city can compare with New York, it is exactly like the song sang by Frank Sinatra "New York, New York". I spent almost a week in New York (mostly in Manhattan) and I enjoyed it. The scenes we saw in Hollywood movies, for example: Batman... It is like the city of Gothem in real life, really fascinating!!!

The best part of the Manhattan Skyline is.... ...that is ever changing. Before this summer, my last visit to the city was in 2010. One World Trade was nowhere to be seen on the skyline. Today, in addition to 1WTC, there is the new One57 in midtown as well as 30 Park Place and a host of other new skycrapers. And with the new Nordstrom Tower scheduled to top out at only 1 foot below 1WTC, and all the construction cranes around the city, the skyline will be different the next time I visit!

Really...No Place Like It!. There are several places to get great views of the NYC skyline -- airplanes coming and going; renting an uber-expensive helicopter ride; the tram to Roosevelt Island; on the subway coming back from Queens and Brooklyn. But, by far in my humble opinion...the best view of Manhattan is the south end with all the tall buildings in the financial district, including the new Freedom Tower -- go get on the absolutely free Staten Island Ferry! Enjoy the free and relaxing ride...take some cool pictures of south end of Manhattan, Statue of Liberty, and surrounding lands. Watch the other ships navigating that busy area. Very, very cool!
Nice walks.. Very nice but well behind Chicago. Manhattan is very jumbled Chicago is much more impressive. The Hancock and Sears Towers more than make up for King Kongs spot.
View the skyline from the Jersey side. The best view of the New York skyline is from the Jersey side of the Hudson River. Drive along the Hudson and view the entirety of Manhattan.
Skyline. Large buildings, Birds, water, people, boats. great view but quite smoggy. Although Iconic, not that awesome

Breathtaking View Of New York!. We bought a hop on hop off ticket which included a boat trip out to the Statue of Liberty. During this boat trip, we were taken all along the Hudson River and had a magnificent view of the Manhatten skyline. I'd seen it so many times in pictures and photos, but it was incredible to see it for myself on a beautiful clear and sunny day! It certainly gives you a perspective on New York that we wouldn't otherwise have had. Definitely value for money when bought with the Hop On Hop Off ticket!

Helicopter ride & Circle Line.. We enjoyed the Skyline from the air & later in the day did the full Circle Line ferry ride around Manhattan island. The helicopter concentrated on the southern end having great views of the Statue of Liberty through to Central Park. Was surprised by the number of bridges we sailed under. Good commentary on ferry, Worth the 3 hours.

The Manhattan Skyline at night from NJ is dazzling!. We got to experience it from North Bergen, NJ at night and it was spectacular. Our hotel was a few miles from the river and we didn't expect to come upon this view. Loved it!
City View. We had the chance to see the skyline -- day and night. By day on the Staten Island ferry, and at night from the Brooklyn Promenade. Just unreal. A must see.

What a breath taking scape. Seen it on the movies but seeing in real time is out of the world
Large high and touching the sky and ground, important to look from the ground up but also view from the heights of the rock or empire
Must see!. Visit Brooklyn heights. Great view of the manhattan skyline and walk across the brooklyn bridge afterwards!
Stay Away, Better Hotels Elsewhere. Not the best neighborhood. Hotel is priced way too high for what you get. Beds are not comfortable and need to be upgraded.
Beautiful Giant Puzzle. So iconic and lovely to see. Try to name the buildings & match with the areas of the city they represent.

More impressive from a distance.. There a few better places to view the skyline than from the Staten Island Ferry (free) or from the DUMBO neighborhood across the East River. You can take the subway to Brooklyn, enjoy the restaurants and bars in DUMBO, soak in the view from there, and walk back across the bridge into Manhattan.

Take a boat trip!. Best views we had was from Staten Island ferry and, enjoying Manhattan lit up at night, going on a dinner cruise on the Hudson. We did both in April, which was cold, but at least meant less crowding. Nothing warm clothing can't cure.
I have so many pictures!. Beautiful view as we walked the Brooklyn Bridge. Even more impressive at night. You will never get tired of seeing it.
skyline so pretty. best views are from Queens.. truly remarkable. At night you can see so many pretty lights thanks to my friends tour.

Photogenic.. The skyline is one of the reasons I go to New York. Numerous pictures from Central Park on the big rocks or the bridge. The Brooklyn Bridge Park and The Brooklyn Heights Promenade also offer picturesque views of the skyline.
New York with my daughter a friend & i.. We went on Staton Island ferry passed the Statue of liberty & looked over are shoulders & the view off Manhattan is amazing

Relaxing walk in NY. During my last trips to NY I go to the highline, take a walk, very interesting place , a lot of vegetation near some old the train rails. Great to visit the Chelsea market during the walk, eat something and continue the walk up in the highline. From there you can see the river , Empire State and other great NY buildings. You are clos to Chinatown / Little Italy and the Soho.I recommend this walk, especially during weekends.
See at night!. Goes without saying that the Manhattan skyline is really spectacular. at night with lights is truly amazing
Free ferry ride. Brilliant, go by Staten Island ferry for free and cruise past the Statue of Liberty, eat on the other side looking out towards Manhattan.
Easy FREE spots to view. We enjoyed great views of the skyline from both the Brooklyn Bridge (walking) and the Staten Island Ferry.

The Most Beautiful Skyline In The World. Just the best. Whether it's downtown across the World Trade Centre and the lofts of Tribeca or the iconic midtown views of the Empire State and the Chrysler Building there is nothing like it on earth. Best viewed either from Brooklyn/ Hoboken or on one of the many boat trips available (the view of downtown from the free State Island Ferry is incredible. See it in all seasons & all light and it never disappoints.

One of the kind!. One of the most beautiful, spectacular & amazing skylines of the world. I am sure it reminds every individual of Spider-Man & BAt man tale at once wen they see it for the 1st time...

The most iconic skyline in the world. Although the Manhattan skyline is the most iconic and recognisable skyline in the world there are a million different ways to see it. There are an abundance of high rise buildings you can view from but can also get an amazing outsider view from the other side of any bridge connecting to Manhattan.
So good they named it twice.. This'll just knock your socks off. Yes. It really does look like that. And yes. You will feel like you're on a film set.

Manhattan and Rest of the world. Yes thats how my colleague put it and I cant disagree.
There is something about the city skyline that got me in awe. The fact that its where probably the global economy is centered and the centrifugal force behind everything.
Each building has its own story to tell.
Aim for sky. A skyline that is awesome and also the stark reminder of what ca be achieved by human endeavor. great site to the sore eyes that must have travelled thousands of miles to see.
NYC a unique experience. Doing a cruise around the harbour gives an excellent view of a beautiful skyline of a concrete jungle.
BEAUTIFUL!!!. Best way to see it is on a circleline island cruise tour where you will be able to see it from different angles. LOVED IT!!!
AMAZING. Was walking down Manhattan in the evening and looked around and was amazed at the gorgeous skyline. The amount of tall buildings in such a small area is amazing.

Beautiful.... The skyline was phenomenal to see in person. Brings back all the memories from movies and you can view some famous buildings easily. We viewed this from the Staten Island Ferry at sunset... recommended!!

Skyline from a ferry. The Manhattan Skyline is best seen from a distance. I recommend viewing it from one of the ferries, or from Ellis Island or from the Statue of Liberty. You will have an amazing view.

Twilight Cruise-Gray Line City Sightseeing. We took the Gray Line Twilight Cruise at 7:30 PM and it was lovely to see the city all lit up. We went under the bridges and circled around Manhattan. It was beautiful. I don't understand why they make you take a picture (for purchase if you like) before getting on. I said I didn't want my picture taken, but they make you anyway. When Gray Line sold us the bus/boat tour they said the boat ride was included, but then when we got to the pier they charged us extra for the "twilight cruise" even though it is listed as the same price in the brochure. If you take a cruise, you might want to go with a different vendor.
Fantastic. Everyone should see this skyline once in their lives truly incredible and it reinvents itself on a yearly basis with new skyscrapers going up it is constantly evolving.

One and only!. This is that one and only skyline that we are all familiar with. But it has altered a bit over the years. The twin towers have gone , but that empty space has now been filled with this majestic new Freedom tower which soars high on the Lower Manhattan sky line.I love it from all sides. We had take a few cruises and ferry rides and it was awesome from all sides.

Take the East Pier Ferry for $4. A couple told us to get the East Pier Ferry which is at the end of 34th street as the cruise gives beautiful views of Manhattan and they said better than the expensive ferry tours from the west side. The cost was $4 per person and it was great, fantastic views particularly of the ESB and under the Brooklyn bridge. The last stop is wall street ferry, we got off then walked a few hundred yards to get the free Staten island ferry which goes right past the statue of liberty and is a communal ferry free to get on. A fantastic day out at a budget price.
NY NY. Love NY skyline. Recommend walking the Brooklyn Bridge into the city. 9/11 Memorial is incredibly moving. City is crowded in summer but most everyone is very friendly.
View the skyline by water. The Manhattan Skyline is a thing to see. Take the Staten Island Ferry for a free view or take the East River Ferry for $4 from mid-town to Brooklyn. Great views either way.

New York at night - a real beauty!. One of the most beautiful skylines I have ever seen! My first time there, I landed at night time. It was awesome! This time I wanted to go up the Rockefellar but August is still too busy and the number of people in the lines are overbearing. Instead I went daytime which was also great. View just a bit hazy though
NYC Skyline. Definitely worth to do one of the boat trips to see the skyline. Also amazing view from Long Island ;)

Many ways to discover the amazing Skyline. The Skyline of Manhattan is breathless, either you do a sailing tour - how about with 'I sail NYC' or other boat tours, by bike, walking over the Brooklyn bridge. Day or night - the view is amazing.
Purely breath-taking. You can't even start to imagine the beauty of Manhattan's Skyline. The view is breathtaking, especially during late evening hours

My kind of town!. Beautiful view from the Hudson River cruise or from New Jersey. Gorgeous city! Love all the buildings in Manhattan and love the way the Empire State Building is lit up at night. Miss the twin towers, but there are new buildings now to take their place.

King of the Skyline is Manhattan. Take a walk anywhere in Manhattan and you'll be over shadowed by the skyline of skyscrapers. Some of the best viewing points are as follows and in no particular order: the Brooklyn Bridge, Top of the Rock, Empire State building, a helicopter ride, Central Park, Staten Island ferry ride, High Line walkway, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, etc. If you make it to NYC take a camera, start taking photographs of the buildings and appreciate the engineering, architectural marvels, historical value that this city and it's Skyline offers to America.
What's not to like?. I love the high buildings in New York and how they blend with the sky colours. The views of Manhattan Skyline have been in so many moviews that you feel you are in one of them.

To see it in real life is indescribable !!!!. I saw the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry on the brightest of days and it took my breath away, so impressive, but the best view I saw was as the sun was setting and we were going over the Brooklyn bridge with a bus tour and they timed it so we could see it, this is not even seen in TV shows, it was really special and will never be forgotten. An absolute must see and experience
trip of a lifetime?. Beautiful skyline, panoramic views and a special city....If you haven't been to New York City, you really should go.

Surreal Captivating Phenomenon. Without a doubt, the most magnificent, man-made sight, in the world. I believe it should be viewed, from the New Jersey side, from the Union City area. Sunrise, and sunset, provide the most stunning, memorable, scenes. Another lovely sight can be obtained, by watching from the walkway, north of the brooklyn bridge. Take pictures, or just soak it up, its majestic! In my humble opinion, it should qualify, as the 8th, wonder of the world

Great views from the Brooklyn side. You can see great views of the Manhattan Skyline from taxis or car rides along the Brooklyn-Queens Expressway (both ways) during the day or night, especially if stuck in traffic.
NY NY its a wonderful town. Never tire of the fantastic skyline and the many vantage points to see it. Everchanging with still its heritage buildings its a great place to visit.
Wow!. Wow! A perspective you can't forget, a view that will leave a imprint in your memory for years to come.

Really happy with this photo!. We took the ferry over to Govenors Island {the terminal is next to the Staten island Ferry. $1 each way. Secluded, quiet and historic and the place from which I took the picture of the Manhatten Skyline uploaded here!
A View Not to be Missed. Excellent view of Manhattan Skyline, All toll skyscrapers looks fantastic. You can get the view from Brooklyn. A view not be missed.

Outstanding Views. We caught the subway from Manhattan to Long Island City and walked to Gantry Plaza Park. The park itself is great to walk through beside the River and the views of the Manhattan skyline are impressive and give a great perspective. Absolutely worth the trip. We caught the ferry going along the East River back to Manhattan.
Always recognizable . If in NY you must take a boat ride so you can capture the site of the city from the water. It is used in many movies but always stunning to see in real life.
Nice area. This is a great place to relax and look at the great views of the city. Very relaxing, safe and clean!

Can't get enough........ After riding Citi bikes along the West Side Bike Path we finally arrived at Battery Park! To be standing across from the Statue of Liberty was amazing! We docked our bikes and hopped on the ferry to Governors Island with the most beautiful view of the Skyline!! What a view!!! Can't wait to do it again!
Breathtaking View of Manhattan!. The Manhattan Skyline view was incredible!!! We stayed in SoHo on the 14th floor of our hotel and the view at night was breathtaking!!! Love NYC!!!
What a view!. It worth your time to take the ferrie or the water taxi, to Ellis Island or to Liberty Island in order to better comprehend the magnitude of this man-made structure!

Breathtaking. My husband asked me a question, what would I rather do live n the heart of Manhattan and be right with it all, or live in Brooklyn and see Manhattan every day, my answer was mbrooklyn! When you get down to the waterfront and see that gorgeous skyline staring back at you its just amazing, the houses that get to wake up and see that everyday are very lucky. If you want to experience it, hop on the subway and take a look it's literally a two minute walk from the station.

Beautiful but much better view from New Jersey. The manhattan skyline is amazing but I feel like the view is so much better if you cross the river with a 15 minutes bus ride to Weehawken NJ or a train ride to Newport NJ to take a look at the beautiful skyline with all of its glory. More and more tourist buses are crossing to NJ to give admiring tourists better bang for their buck. It's worth the short trip and you're a shutter freak , you will be satisfied. :)
Amazing. Very excellent shots from the Statue of Liberty. The skyline and the views is amazing. Many excellent shots of lady liberty.
Quite an experience. beautiful the sunsets give the city a reflection of being a town that everyone should see. Put it on your bucket list!

Manhattan by day or night is fab. One of the most beautiful things I have ever seen is the Manhattan skyline by night. I liked the twinkling lights and the beautiful sunset. There was nothing to dislike about it.

Amazing, breathtaking skyline. We decided to walk the Brooklyn Bridge late evening. Although my husband kept turning around every few steps, I resisted the urged and only looked back after we had walked approx. half the bridge. The view was breathtaking and I couldn't take my eyes off the lights, the buildings and the impressive skyline. we also had the opportunity to view the skyline from the Hudson River , whilst on a New Year's eve cruise. Highly recommended
many places with different vantage points. most iconic view. can be seen from Brooklyn , queens (long island city), from new jersey, liberty island and various boat rides.
MUST SEE!!. Manhattan skyline is a must see when visiting the US. It is exceptionally beautiful during the day and even at night.
breath-taking. The view of the skyline from Brooklyn, especially at night, is breath-taking. Be sure to bring your camera!

Wonderful!. If you haven't fallen for NYC already... you will! :) I have never been a person who like living in big cities...but NYC is city I honestly could picture myself living in for a couple of year!
Can't get much better!. Such a gorgeous place to look over, it's just gorgeous from all angles. The famous sight is overwhelming.

Skyline. We were fortunate (?) to be circling the airport when I did a trip of America from LA to Atlanta the view of the skyline and Manhattan was fabulous and the Statue of Liberty too! Far better view than on the ground I was sorry to land at Newark!!
Amazing!. Unreal! Best seen on the river by boat tour. We took it in with the Hornblower tours (offered free with your hop on hop off bus ticket)
Viewing Manhattan from the Brooklyn Bridge. Breathtaking view. We viewed from the Brooklyn Bridge and were awestruck by what we saw. A great walk.

Self explanatory. It is impressive.. You have seen it in movies and pictures hundreds of times and it is even more impressive in person. Check it out from the staton island ferry. It is free, gives you many great views from the skyline to the Statue of Liberty. If you go to NYC, you have to see it.

Bucketlist item!. Skyline is best appreciated from Brookly Bridge Park. Stroll down the Brooklyn Bridge or go across the Hudson and have a great view too from Jersey City. Should you be able to book a nighttour - go and do! it! immediately! The skyline looks amazing after sunset too.

Magnificent and exhilarating. Uniquely New York, only one city in the world gives you the adrenaline that this skyline gives you. If you approach the city on an airplane on a clear day it looks like Lego blocks of different forms, shapes and sizes. It is magnificent and then when you are walking the streets and you look up you might get goose pimples.
A must visit in NYC. Nice place to stroll around. A must if you visit new york city. The area is sorounded by gallerias, nice shops, restaurants and bars.

Gotham's Towers. The largest city in the US has an awesome and ever changing skyline. I highly suggest seeing the city from New Jersey and Brooklyn during the day and night. I also suggest seeing the city from within by visiting buildings of your choice downtown and midtown.

Iconic for a reason. never disappoints you can see it from air, from bridges, from high buildings in NY it is iconic for a good reason. best views from either Brooklyn on the Promenade or Governors Island.

Magnificent!. I'm a native New Yorker.I live in the suburbs now.Every time I come back to Manhattan I'm awed by the Skyline.I live on Long Island,and drive to the city on the Long Island Expressway. As one approaches the Long Island city area of Queens, an exquisite panorama unfolds. Breathtaking!

3 nights of manhattan. The Manhattan skyline had been near the top of my bucket list and after seeing the famous view for myself, it was like a dream. I would suggest the tour buses that bring you around the city, but i had the best experience on the night tour where just as the sun was setting and newyorkers were turning on their lights we were brought to see the skyline and it was better than anything i had expected and i felt like i was in a movie seeing the famius glowing lights ofthe city that never sleeps.

She's something special!. This is why we come here isn't it? The skyline that has captivated us in movies and art, doesn't let you down. The best views are looking back across from Brooklyn but for a more "amongst it" experience try the bar atop The Standard hotel down by Chelsea Piers.

After 911 even more dramatic . We viewed this well known skyline froma boat . You can imagine 911 , marvel at the replacement Freedom Tower , and stare in awe at the buildings diarist up so close together , stunning .

You can't Miss it. Anywhere you are stop and take a look at the skyline in NY. The best places to view it are from the NJ side of the river while coming in on a train, or from numerous other spots. The State of Liberty, Ellis Island, and the ferries offer great views of the skyline.
Breathtaking. Saw from Top of the Rock, Brooklyn Bridge, & kayaking on Hudson. It is amazing from all vantage points.
Wow!. Just breathtaking!! You have to see it to believe it. Wholeheartedly recommend a visit to this fabulous city!
Epic views!. The new skyline with the World Trade Center One is amazing. This city is beautiful from every angle!
Wonderful town. Loved it. The largest town in the world. Wonderful skyline from Brooklin and his bridge. One of the best experience in my life
Gorgeous skyline. Pretty great pics taken all over New York. Recommendations for the Explorer pass great way to see alot at a reasonable price.

Fantastic skyline view from the Staten Island Ferry. Skyline is Always a great view. One of the best options is taking the free Staten Island Ferry, with a wonderfull view on the skyline and Miss Liberty.

from brookling promenade, stroll and view the extrordinary famous panoramic manhattan!!. One stop on the best place to visit: the brookling view to manhattan skyline, (in the afternoon,or a dusk) on the " brookling promenade". is the place to appreciate this unique and wonderful panoramic view from the statue of liberty, manhatan, the brookling bridge. As a global traveler, i think that this stroll, on brookling promenade has an unforgettable sight among the best 5 places in the world.

Skyline best viewed from the Staten Ferry!. Personally I think the Manhattan Skyline is best view when approaching the Financial District from the (free) Staten Island Ferry. When leaving Manhattan, stay at the back of the ferry for the best position to take photographs of the receding skyline OR when joining the ferry head to the front where you will have a great view of the approaching skyline.Another great way to view the majestic Manhattan Skyline would be from the Brooklyn Promenade or Brooklyn Bridge.

Amazing. You can look at the photos all you want put you haven't really seen it until you've been there as you can't capture the true beauty in just a photo compared to the human eye. A warm sunrise really does put it into perspective though so that's a great time to have a look at all those humongous buildings that New York City beholds.

Skyline is amazing. My wife and I use the Hop on Hop off tours over a three day span and it included so much i recommend it for first times in NY they are very helpful and guide you to all the main attractions
Breathtaking. An amazing view from whatever angle, any day or nighttime, any perspective. Worth to go to NY only for this...

Stunning skyline. Wow, talk about an impressive skyline. It's impressive not only from within Manhattan (Financial district), but also out on the Hudson via a boat tour. One can only imagine how much more impressive it will be when they complete the other World Trade Center buildings.
Reborn!. With the completion of the exterior of 1 World Trade Center, the Manhatten Skyline is once again a feast for the eyes. See it after dark to get the full effect of the lighted buildings.
8 days East Canada trip. Only have few minutes to take valuable picture. Not enough time to understand deeply. The view how ever is good..
Skyline nr 1 in the world. By boot or ship early in the morning by sunrise in springtime is the very best time to see what I mean

Better than on the postcards. It is motivating, inspirational, wonderful! You can enjoy the long shadows in the morning the skyscreapers in full sun and the citylights at night. Best places to see it from- Brooklyn Bridge, Williamsburg, Brooklyn waterfront, The terrace of the Metropolitan museum of arts, as well as the tourist(y) attractions with observation decks.

Skyline best from the Ferry!. Great to see from the Staten Island Ferry. Highly recommend using it as it is free. It leaves on the hour and half-hour and returns directly. Takes about 1.5 hours with waiting, etc.

Manhattan Skyline. One of the absolute must see things not only in NY but in the world. To take the best photos either go on the Staten Island Ferry, which is free, or take the Statue of Liberty / Ellis Island Tour for which you have to pay. Hugely impressive.

Breathtaking View. I grew up here but it still takes my breath away when I go back to New York - it's the most beautiful sight when you come over the bridge from the airport - it's breathtaking - no other city view like this one in the world
Greatest skyline in the world. Love to stare at the skyline from different vantage points and imagine all that went in to building it over the years.

Marvelous view at sunset. My husband and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at the Liberty State Park in New Jersey watching the sunset over the Manhattan Skyline and the twilight deepen. We joked that it was one of our most enjoyable anniversary celebrations and one of the cheapest as it is free. I spent time photographing the sunset as it progressed and was amazed at the various colors reflecting off of glass building and a number of sailboats adding a humanizing effect to the "canyons of steel".
Love New York. Took the NY Water Taxi to Battery Park to visit the Freedom TowerPerfect way to get there and enjoy the skyline at the same time!
Glorious. We saw this from Ellis Island, the water taxi, the Staten island ferry etc etc and you can never get too much of it.
Impressive view. Went on Staten Island ferry - good view of skyline both in daylight and night time. Walked over Brooklyn Bridge - worth doing this - nice walk and good views.

I never tire of this view. My first glimpse of the Manhatten skyline was through my plane window this trip and it always makes me smile - it's just so iconic but also changing because of try new buildings going up in the financial district. I ventured across to Brooklyn this time and the view across the river was great, I spent a good while there just staring and taking photos. I'm a sucker for city skylines and this one is definitely one of my favourite in the world.

Iconic scene. Going by boat to see the Statue of Liberty was an unforgettable day !!!!!! Was amazing !!! But on the way back we had a chance to LOOK at the Manhatten skyline , Such an iconic scene , buildings I have saw in pictures now in front of me !!!! Brilliant

Best Skyline View. It deserves the hype it gets. One of the best skylines around the world. There are so many vintage points that its a treat to roam in area's around Manhattan. It is glorious in day light and spectacular at night.
Classic NYC Views. Classic views are waiting to be enjoyed by all who are looking for the total picture of New York City.
Manhattan skyline. Fabulous, so much more magnificent than any photo or TV or movie views. It is so sereneBut also gives the feeling of being alive -- with sounds and smells, all fabulous!
No other like it. Breathtaking, especially from the air! One of the most beautiful cities I have ever seen. The way the Manhattan Island jets out you get lots of great views from the water as well.

Beautiful. This is an absolutely mesmerizing skyline. You have to see it at some point in your lifetime. View the skyline from the water, the empire state building, and walk around times square to feel the magic.

The Rock rules.. We did top of the Rock at dusk and it was reasonable price and great view of the other talls and skyline. Before going up we did the centre tour which was very informative about the Rockerfellers and the art works around the buildings.

3 areas were all I could take in.. The Sargent exhibition is marvellous.The European wings are quieter, I ate both downstairs, & on the roof, which is badly in need of more shade, it's so hot up there.

Surreal views from the river. If you can get on one of the many boat tours to see the city skyline, then that is the best way to see it. The city is a sight to behold at least once in your lifetime. Something you will never forget.
Must view from a plane. Fly in during the day. The view coming into LaGuardia is amazing. It is almost like a toy set. It is so crowded it seems like nothing else can fit into Manhattan!

The best views are from Brooklyn Bridge. Walk over Brooklyn Bridge and there is even a small area on the other side to take great photos. Worth a walk just to look back at the skyline.
It is a NYC must!
Nothing like it in the World!. Really a site to behold! It is hard to believe the man could creat such an enormous amount of buildings on that tiny piece of land!
A Must See. I loved this gem of a park! Very crowded because still fairly new, but loved the art and location. Sits on an old railway line.

What more is there to say?!. A water taxi ride around Manhattan, a view from the Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building, the view walking up the stairs from a subway station or the view coming into the city from the Queenstown Vridge, the Staten Island Ferry or the intimacy of the Brooklyn Bridge brings a thrill and a smile every Time!A great sight any time of day and time of year!Jimmy and Catie BrownBrooksville, florida
One of the Best Views in the USA!. My husband and I love New York City and you just can't beat that amazing Manhattan Skyline and everything it represents!

Breath Taking.. Breath taking!!! I used to live on Central Park West so I had the most amazing view of the Park. I find the NYC skyline to be one of the most beautiful. If you can stay in a hotel that has a great view then do so.

How Do You Rate This?!. It's iconic for godz sakes. What a ridiculous item to rate. Better to ask where are the best views. There are so many, but you can start at the top of the new World Trade Center.

Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn. The best view of Manhattan I have seen was definitely from DUMBO, which stands for Down Under Manhattan Bridge Overpass. Other spectacular views you get by crossing Brooklyn Bridge or taking the subway to Williamsburg, where you even have a little beach (picture below).

Try to get up high and overlook Central Park. Went to the top of our hotel for a sweeping view of Central Park and the area. Got a great panoramic shot! Seeing the tops of so many buildings (famous and not) is inspiring.
AMAZING. The best skyline I have ever seen, it has changed so much over the years. The wonder of it never ceases to amze
Great view. Make sure to take a cruise or a ferry to enjoy this views!! It is amazing to see the mix of the old and new NY

Just like on tv. We were luckily enough to get 2 views of the sky line, both with the big bus company (reviewed that tour separately). The big bus ticket comes with a harbour cruise, which offers a great view of Statue of Liberty and the skyline going out and coming back. The big bus ticket also does a night time tour, which gives amazing views as it travels back across the river after a brief look at Brooklyn. Looks exactly like a movie set and you get some amazing photo opportunitities.My kids never believe people read my reviews. So if this was helpful to you on your travels, please give me a helpful vote. It's always nice to point out that people rely on others reviews when making choices in unfamiliar locations.
Vibrant. Breath taking skyline view is worth a visit to this city, every single building is a stunner! One of the most exciting things to do for free. Love NYC.
An unforgettable experience. It's beautiful and i could spend hours admiring the city and even better if you do it at night. There are several places to enjoy the view.
View from under the Brooklyn Bridge. We made our way to see Brooklyn Bridge and took the opportunity to see the Manhattan Skyline from there. View is spectacular and it's a great spot for pictures.

What you expect.... I guess pretty much everything is said and known. But the view of Manhattan has a certain "spirit" somehow. You don't want to miss. My recommendation is to take the subway to Brooklyn, stroll along the waterside and walk back on Brooklyn Bridge.
Awesome. The Manhattan Skyline is spectacular, of course. We did a boat trip on a hot Sunday afternoon and it was well worth the visit.
worth the trip to the Freedom park.. at day time or night time it is an incredible view. Specially from the Freedom park omn the Bronx side.
See the view from the water. Beautiful view of the Manhattan skyline from the Staten Island ferry which is free! Totally recommend.

Don't buy ticket on street. Ticket on street are over priced they charge you cup but that's a lie
There is a show that they show you a movie and charge you for that skip it
There is another ticket to see sky lounge and around 20 bucks extra to go higher to 100th floor

Amazing night and day. Saw the skyline from Brooklyn Bridge at sunset and during day on a boat cruise. Both were beautiful views. Could not help but think how the skyline looked post 9/11. Makes you think about how fragile life is and how important it is to live in the moment.

It will do.. I like how I can write a review for this. Obviously, seeing the skyline of any city is great. However you just have to know the best spots to catch the views. We usually stay across the Hudson in Jersey City at the Doubletree By Hilton Hotel & Suites Jersey City. Apparently you can get skyline views from some of the rooms, but I have yet to be blessed with such an experience. However, if you just walk out along the Hudson River Waterfront Walkway, you get a nice view of the NYC (check it out at night, so you can see all the pretty lights).
Great View of the NYC. Took the family to relax by the waters. Great view of the city especially if you are on board "City Cruises.

Quintessential View. There is no better place from which to see and photograph the Manhattan skyline than the Brooklyn Bridge Boardwalk. It's a wonderful, inexpensive experience.Take the A or C train to the first stop on the Brooklyn side of the East River, then follow the signs to the pedestrian walkway. The view is breathtaking, especially on a sunny day. You come off the bridge on the Manhattan side right by the government center, within easy walking distance of Wall Street and the South Street Seaport.

You start to understand how big this city really is. To get a real grip of the size and structure of the city it is really helpful to see it from some distance. Also so interesting to see all the different kind of architecture meeting in one place.

The dark lit up. The Manhattan Skyline is certainly quite impressive during the day but at night time it's something else. We took a two hour bus ride at 9pm which showed the state from many angles especially when we went over the Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges. Lights shining intermittently, a vast array of colours and images proved just what a fantastic spectacle Manhattan is in the dark.

My heart skips a beat. New York is one of those cities you either love or you hate it.Standing in Brooklyn or on the top of the Empire State building, you realise that you in a special place. The lights, the sounds, it is something special.  What can I say, I am in love with New York. Every square inch of it. The best way to describe New York is like a girlfriend that just when you think you think you have had enough of her, she will surprise you with something to make you fall in love with her all over again.
lights. Breath taking. The city that never sleeps. Special in so many ways, walking thru these streets is like crossing countries. Love the diversity, and energy of every corner in New York.
It's the Manhattan skyline, the most famous in all the world.. Whenever I fly back into NYC at night after visiting anywhere. And see the whole skyline twinkling and lit I think to myself ...magic

Go to Brooklyn at night, it is a MUST!. I've been to NYC a number of times now but have never made it over to Brooklyn at night to see the Manhattan skyline. I finally did on my last trip and I would say this is one of the must do things for anyone visiting NYC. I caught the subway over and walked down to Brooklyn Heights Promenade and sat and watched the sunset over the Manhattan skyline, it was awesome and really comes alive.

Awesome views. Awesome view so beautiful and peaceful setting looking over manhattan the hudson river is amazing take a ferry over to Ellis island very interesting then see the the awesomeness of the statue of liberty in all her glory look back over the river see that beautiful skyline
View of New York City. Saw the Manhattan skyline from the Rockefeller Centre. It was amazing. Had a nice sunny day, no lineups and lots of space to move around and get some really good pictures.
Awesome. Everything about Manhattan was excellent, and the skyline is just awesome. Would have loved more time to soak up the experience.
Can't miss. You can't miss this. It is visible from anywhere and it is just as impressive at night as it is in the daylight.
Iconic. Beautiful and iconic. We saw from a ferry out near Ellis Island and took lots of pictures. True perspective that can't be found from within the city itself

Nothing like it anywhere else!. Got fab views of the skyline from Top of the Rock, a nighttime visit to Brooklyn and a boat trip to Statue of Liberty. Every view was spectacular, nothing like it anywhere else and so recognisable! :)

Best skyline views. Great views of Manhattan Skyline from the Whyte Hotel in Brooklyn. Generally, root top bars in Brooklyn offer the best skyline views. During the day, a free boat trip to Staten Island offers amazing views and at dusk, roof tops in Brooklyn are recommended.
Loved NYC.... The Manhattan Skyline is amazing... take the staten island ferry just before dark to get the best views.
Beautiful. Brought our Grand Son to NYC for his first trip. Although the wait was very long at most attractions especially in 91 degree weather, the experience was well worth it.

Best city skyline in the world.. If you can walk across the Brooklyn Bridge at night you will see the most amazing city skyline in the world. If short on time , take a taxi to Brooklyn Heights at night and look at the Manhattan skyline from there. Another wonderful view is from the Staten Island ferry ...at night of course.
Enjoy.
Must. When you go te new york "the city", you just have to see this. It beautiful and it is pretty by day, in the evening and by night.
Really something!. There is nothing in the world like the Manhattan Skyline. Really unique. Day or night it's a site to see.
There's Nothing Like It.. The views of the NYC skyline are breathtaking. My favorite view is from a rooftop deck in Greenpoint Brooklyn. The iconic skyline is only enhanced by the new Freedom Tower.

An OLD Classic. LOVE NYC - we spent most of our time on the upper East Side this time where it is a little less busy. Not as many franchise restaurants. Plenty of cabs and places to eat with mini groceries.
Breathtaking.. Took the grayline hop on hop off night tour. It is a MUST SEE for anyone who wants to see the sparkle of the city at night.
Worth a detour and after a good restaurant in meat district. Nice walk and interesting views. We recommend to start from the northern side and then ending up in Meat district.

World Famous!. Every time I see it, I am amazed by the size and diversity.
One of the best ways to get a view of not just the Manhattan skyline, but also Liberty and Ellis Islands, is to trip across to Staten Island on the ferry. The ferry is, of course, free!
Top of the Rock - do it!. I've been to NYC a zillion times but this was first time to the Top of the Rock. I was floored by the views, especially of Central Park. Worth the ticket price!

What a walk!. The Skyline is a fabulous walk along an old raised railway track, converted by planting gardens and installing great artworks. It starts at 34th Street and ends at Chelsea. Quite a walk and very crowded, but certainly worth it. Eat at Chelsea or at the old diner in 34th Street.

Perhaps the best "free" thing in NYC. Whether you're viewing the skyline from a Circleline cruise, or looking out at it from your hotel window, it's hard not to feel that New York is the most vibrant city in the world when you gaze at its skyline night or day. Thanks to the gift of geologic bedrock from Mother Nature, Manhattan was uniquely positioned to be the home of the skyscraper, and the skyline continues to evolve and amaze. Especially now as the Freedom Tower and new World Trade Tower replace the towers destroyed on 9/11, the NYC skyline is not to be missed.

amazing new york. Everything I thought it would be and more, you get use to it in the daytime, but night is magical every time. We took an evening grey line open top bus ....made memorable by the funny brilliant guide and awe inspiring skyline.

Exciting!!!. Unbelievable icons coming to my eyes.Only if you will be there can understand.Very good idea is to take a ferry to State Island (it's free and every 30 min). So you can take the best photos especially in evenings.Enjoy....
A life time must. A definite boxed ticked went by both water taxi and Staten Island Ferry ( free) beautiful views and a relaxing way to spend an hour or two

One of Few City Skylines that are worth seeing. This is incredible to see and especially how many buildings are in one small area, especially after 9/11. This is easily seen on a gorgeous day from the Empire State building.

One of a kind. The New York skyline is one of a kind. We got to see the skyline from the roof garden of a nice coop in mid-town. The iconic One World Trade Center building, the Chrysler Building, the Empire State Building all are interesting points of reference in a sea of skyscrapers.
Best view fr.o.m. Boat. The Manhattan Skyline us best viewed fr.o.m. The bokats operation fr.o.m. batteri Park to the Statuera of Liberty and Ellis Island
Skyline from the river. We tok the new york water taxi around manhattan to get a good view of the skyline. Nice trip, the boat was a hop on hop of boat departing every 45 minutes.
Nice. Saw it from the ferry. Really liked the view...Nice. Would like to come back and see it at night when it's all lit up.
gorgeous.. first time here. This was a dream come true. Will definitely do it again. The skyline is out of this world. Make sure you take camera.

Worth every second. Three months after that journey I can still remember how stunning the skyline of Manhattan is gorgeous. I've been spending few days in N.Y. And one of the most impressive souvenirs is certainly that scenery. Look deeper and try to catch the sunset time, the colors of the sky, that zesty orange line will be a memory that will last forever.

Nothing like it..... Amazing to see the skyline.... you can see the skyline from multiple angles and every view is breath taking.... There is nothing in this world that you can compare it with.... One can never forget the views....
A timeless classic. What can you say? You keep seeing it, and it keeps fascinating you.The view from the One World observatory is particularly beautiful. Definitely recommended

Peace and relaxation for FREE in NYC. do it- go and enjoy. the day I went here, I was not in form for walking, but by the time we reached the Standard hotel for drinks, I was in great form and really enjoyed this park- a must for those living there and tourists alike
Night view of Manhattan sky line. It was absolutely beautiful. We went across to the New Jersey Shore and viewed the Manhattan sky line from there. It was clear sky night and half moon.
Spectacular. We went to the Top of the Rock during the day and enjoyed an amazing view towards Midtown and downtown as well us uptown towards Central Park.
skyline. Always look and take photos. Take walks, ferries, subways to get a new vantage point for my photos. Walking across the Brooklyn bridge is a must.

The #1 Attraction on Earth. Seeing the Manhattan skyline from different angles and different views has to be the number one attraction on the planet. It never gets old, you never get tired of looking at it, and it will stay burnt to your memory forever. I was fortunate enough to be sitting in the right seat on an airplane that landed in New York, and got some beautiful drop-dead gorgeous views of the island of Manhattan, which I've posted here on Tripadvisor. If the skyline of Manhattan doesn't leave the mesmerized, not much will.

This is why you're in NY. The Manhattan skyline is one of those views you'll never forget. And you could call it one of the modern wonders of the world. Just look from above or from the ferry and get the best views.
Breathtaking. Unbelievable! It's a must see, as the skylines is actually awe inspiring. There's nothing quite like it!
An evergreen beauty. I guess it's breathtaking for someone who's not used to those skyline. I definitely believe it's something one should see at least once in a lifetime
Wow. One of the most iconic views in the world. In fact better than you expect as when you look closely you see detail not apparent from photographs. A not to be missed sight if you visit NYC.
Eh. Seriously not impressive. Singapore, Chicago and Shanghai are all better! There is no creativity in its buildings. Just some tall linear boxes... zzzz

Awesome Views, Awful Experience. First, let me separate the two things; the view you get from the 86th floor is awesome. Everything that happened before that was regrettable. The line (on Wednesday in July) was between 300 and 500 people. One reason is because it takes an inordinately long amount of time to get to the elevators that take you up stairs. The line snakes back and fourth between displays about rivets and pictures of old lunch kits the workers had. If you're not an engineer or history student, it meant very little but you still had to walk right buy the displays. Do yourself a favor and buy express tickets. It's the best value in New York. You get to bypass standing in the lines (no where to sit either) in both directions. The view from the 86th floor suffices in terms of awesomeness. You're at the perfect height to where you can recognize what you're looking at but can look up and see the landmarks. It's something every American should see so they can gasp at wonder (or disgust) at what man wrought. The managers of the Empire State Building should do a better job at allowing you to get upstairs in the easiest way possible.
Impressive. Went to both the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building. Although both had considerable wait times (at night), the views were so worth it. A great family experience.
Very nice, even on winter days. Save some minutes of your trip to see Manhattan Skyline - you will feel really pleased and in a true "New York state of mind". Beautiful architecture and river stream.

Amazing at night. The most beautiful view of new york city would be at night, all the lights of the cit make it a an amazing thing to see! I've lived in nyc most of my life and can say that the view from any bridge or building, at night is one of my favorite things of new york city.

Beautiful Skyline all year long. Staten lsland Ferry will give you a nice view of Manhattan Skyline for no extra money. Small ferries to Jersey City are a great idea as well, especially in the evening when the sun is going down!! But if you want to indulge, any ship that goes around Manhattan will give you a nice experience. You can also splurge on a helicopter ride, but these are expensive and short. In my opinion the ferries are the way to go.
New York, New York. Very recognizable. It's in a lot of movies. How do they squeeze all those buildings in net to each other.I do miss seeing the Towers.

Wonderful sight. We took the Circle Line full island tour starting at 10 am and finished it fully satisfied. It surely would have been better to take the evening cruise but we had no regrets. Seeing the skyline with your own eyes is unbeatable.

stunning views across the water. going on the ferry to Staten Island and looking at the skyline is amazing. always busy but good to relax on the ferry as it makes it across the water, so much to see and do. one of the best holidays we have had, and we have been a few times over the years.

One of the Best. Though overtaken by that of Shanghai, Singapore or Dubai, Manhattan's is every bit as if not more grandiose and charming. The other cities might simply have a tract of land that's dizzying illuminated, but the whole Manhattan, from Battery to Uptown, scintillating at night is still the most impressive.
What a Skyline. I was memorised by all the buildings and couldn't stop myself looking up in amazement and to see the skyline from an advantage point was something you really need to do
Beautiful at Night. Great to see at night from the Staten Island Ferry. It's free and the view is simply incredible. A must see.
Two views - Staten Island and Brooklyn bridge. Walking over Brooklyn bridge and taking the free ferry over to Staten Island were two ways in which we saw the iconic skyline
Beautiful!. Have seen skyline many times but never have seen it from a cruise ship sailing down the Hudson. Beautiful!

NYC. From any angle the skyline of NYC is beautiful. See it in both the day and night. The view varies greatly. I really miss the old trade center in the cities profile, but the new Freedom Tower is lovely.

Jersey City/ New York. Manhattan sky line is really beautiful to see from the other sideof Hudson river.We were staying in Jersey City side. It`s cheaper to stay in Jersey City than at Manhattan.It takes only half an hour to get to 33rd Street. Path train is easy to use.We were staying at Holland Hotel, 12th Street and it is not too expensive for family of four persons. Staff are really helpful and kind. There are laundrymat and grocery nearby and also a mall.
Iconic. You have watched the movies, and the TV series, its exactly what you expect and more,Best views are from Empire State Building and Liberty Island.Travelled since Sept12
Love NYC!. ALWAYS love visiting the City! So much to do and time seems to run out. Best to prioritize every thing you want to do and HIT it hard.
Stunning. Breathtaking skyline. We saw it at it's best from the Hudson River, stunning views of all the skyscrapers, with all their contrasting shapes and sizes.

Worth a Ferry Ride to NJ!. The Manhattan Skyline seen from across the Hudson River is just spectacular. Take the Ferry to North Bergen, sit and enjoy lunch along the Hudson and take it all in. I grew up in Weehawken and this was my view every single day, watching the big ocean liners come and go with tugboats guiding them. While the ocean liners are no longer there, everyone should experience the breathtaking view of Manhattan from across the sparkling Hudson.. A great reason to go to New Jersey!. .
the skline of skylines. always stunning every time. my kids didnt understand until they saw it. nightime and daytime its is a true wonder

magical. breath taking. completely surreal and so much more amazing seeing it in real life rather than on the movies. NYC is not a once in a lifetime trip! It can be booked really cheaply and it is not expensive when your there. I would go every year if I could! anyone who hasn't been, GO!!

Great view from Brooklyn. One of the best places to appreciate the Manhattan Skyline is from the ice cream place in Dumbo in Brooklyn. I can't recall its name. Of course you have to get there; we drive. Also great views from the Esplanade in Brooklyn Heights--google it.
NYC Trip. We did all the usual sights - new Freedom Tower, The Rock, Empire State Building - and thoroughly enjoyed everything we did.

Magic. The Manhatton skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge or from the Statton Island Ferry cannot be beaten.
Also from the Holiday Inn on 57th looking towards Times Square day or night was also just a wow.
Everyone needs to go to New York once in their lives.

Inspirational. Nothing makes you feel like you've arrived in New York City then a view of the Manhattan Skyline. Ever changing, as new buildings are constructed the view is inspiring whether seen from New Jersey or Brooklyn.
Breathtaking. The Manhattan skyline is beautiful during the day and totally magical at night. No matter where you see it from it is really special
If you haven't been there, I suggest you go. The view is awesome. I've only seen pictures until now, now I have several screensaver pictures that I took myself and I think that's cool
impressive. just great saw it from brooklyn and statue and it always impresses. i loved it most from ellis island in the afternoon great reflection of the sun

See for miles and miles and miles and miles. . .. Climb the One World Observatory to get the best view all around.
You really can see all five burrows and maybe two or three states.

It never gets old.. It doesn't matter the angle you see it, the Manhattan skyline always pulls you to take another picture, from Boulevard East, from Weehaken, from Brooklyn, From Liberty State Park, From Hoboken, it doesn't matter, the skyline always looks beautiful.
Best in the world. One of the largest in the world. Suggest you take a ferry out to Ellis Island which will get you some of the best views.
Beautiful. The skyline is magazine perfect, and it looks just as it does in the New York commercials. Wonderful to see.

Nothing Like It in the World!. We are staying on Staten Island for a long weekend in NYC. Each day we take the ferry past the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and Governor's Island and dock next to the Battery.We thought we had this skyline thing down solid! Then we took the Circle Cruise around the entire island on Manhattan. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from the West Side, the South, the East River - you name it. And each view was different and fabulous! I had just finished reading of the battle for the Tallest Building and it was great to see them once more!
Mr M is always in awe of the NYC skyline.. Regardless of being in NJ, Queens or Brooklyn, the NYC skyline is truly one of the wonders of the world.
Worth it every way you see it. The first sight of the skyline created excitement. From the top of One World awe and as we walked into the city on the Brooklyn Bridge at dusk calm and relaxing.

UNFORGETTABLE. This is THE skyline that is unparalleled across the globe. We took pictures of it from Ellis Island that are magnificent, especially the ones from August of 2001, not long before the Twin Towers were destroyed.
Staten Island ferry. Best view of the Manhattan Skyline was on the ferry to and back from Staten Island. Also get a decent of the lady.

Manhattan. Brilliant view from our hotel across the "Hudson River".We ,my.family and I had traveled that day through New York., to see the fantastic sites there and stayed in a Hotel quite near Comfort Inn .

Brooklyn Bridge Park. My favourite place to head to in NYC is Brooklyn Bridge Park for sunset. The view of the skyline is spectacular and even if there's cloud cover, the lights of the city are beautiful

Breathtaking!. Lived up to all my expectations. It's better than it was in the movies! Go to Brooklyn and view from under the Brooklyn bridge. The boardwalk has comfortable seats and amazing ice cream to help you make the view even better.

Fabulous!. Take the ferry out to Ellis Island or the Statue of Liberty for the best view! Just before sunset gives you daylight and night time views for incredible photo opportunities! The Staten Island Ferry is free and also gives you a view of the city from the water!

great views. what a good excursion, a must to do in New York
Views are amazing
I was there in February and was nice with the snow on the rooftops and ground

Stunning, unlike any other city in the world.. More skyscrapers per square mile than anywhere else in the world.
