Top of the Rock (not Empire State as you miss the building you're stood on)By night is a different experience. makes sure you see the skyline in its full glory with al the lights on!
Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant - would definitely recommend a visit, brilliant views of the skyline from all over the city.
Nothing like it. Nothing like this iconic view of the city. A great place to see this is from Liberty State Park. Worth a stop!

Skyline viewing via Sirit Cruises. Went on a dinner cruise and a 3 hour cruise around Manhattan area. Circled and viewed skyscrapers and points of interest , Statute of Liberty to name a few. Cruise would be fun if had a partner as nice dance music. Nice buffer meal, drinks of choice. Skyline beautiful when sky dark. Depart from Chelsea Pier., pier 61, Manhatten and Lincoln Harbor Marina.NJ

Mind Boggling. No matter where you are in New York the Manhattan skyline offers something for everyone. We saw it from a number of vantage points including the sea ferry, Brooklyn Bridge, The Bronx and the Empire State Building. It really is breathtaking. You cannot fail but to be impressed.

No better sky line. This is best view in the city. Wether you get a glimpse from your airplane or another spot in the city you must seek it out. A few spots to get a view - Statue of Liberty, ferry, Empire State Building.
Breath Taking!. View to remember.Such a mix of Nature and man made design! Remarkable.Usually makes you want to go back over and over.

New York New York - What a Skyline!. I was in the NYC area for 5 days and was at first overwhelmed by the choices of what to do. But I had the fortune to take a Circle Line Tour which turned out to be a good decision. It was a narrated tour which gave you impressive views of the Manhattan skyline. One would be pressed to get such a good description of the skyline and many of the components/areas. However you do it, don't miss the skyline of this great American City.

Great Place. We are staying at the Intercontinental hotel 300 44st on 29th floor, what a great view of Manhattan, about 3 blocks from Times Square and Theater District. Would recommend to anyone that would like walking distance anything in Midtown.
Enjoy this on a clear summer day. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful especially on a clear sunny summer day. A nice way to enjoy is by taking the ferry over to Governor's Island.

Manhattan Visit. Never been to place better than this.......lights, lights, lights and people, people people!!!!!!! I waited over 14 years to visit New York so I could come with my wife and not alone. This decision to wait proved to be the right thing. SHE LOVES BEING IN NEW YORK WITH ME!!

This Beautiful Skyline is Breath Taking and can be Seen from Miles Away!!. The Manhattan Skyline is so beautiful and it is great to see as you enter Manhattan, like foreshadowing all the great things you're going to see while visiting Manhattan. It has so many historical and iconic buildings within its skyline. So no matter where you take this sight in from; from the harbour, from the Brooklyn Bridge, from New Jersey, from 100 miles away, from one of the tallest skyscrapers, from Central Park, or from wherever, it is such a beautiful thing to witness.

Good walking activity. Well worth the 60-90 minute walk. The final (I believe) extension to the high line is very nice, and I'm assuming will be someone modernized, but none the less I like very much how it starts off at street level by the convention center. Great views of the city, Hudson River, walks you through several neighborhoods, finalized museum in the Meat Packing district is very nice which more great views in the paying museum.
You have to see this at least once in your lifetime. So much to see and do in New York, go to the statue of liberty island for a good view of the skyline.

World of Skyscrapers. Either by climbing on top of Empire States and from above or paying a short visit across Hudson River and watching the city from the distance. Either way it is an amazing experience!

Liberty Harbor Camp ground provides easy access. We traveled back and forth from the Jersey side to Manhattan for four days and nights while visiting NYC for a wedding. It only got easier as we learned how to use the trains and buses. We will do it again when we visit NYC

Awesome Experience. We had the exciting experience of seeing the New York skyline from the 34th floor of the Mandarin Hotel. It was awesome.
Enjoyed it during a boat trip. Take a boat trip and enjoy beautiful views on the Manhattan Skyline. Great experience and enough time to enjoy.

Iconic landscape. Iconic NYC with the Empire State Building. the beautiful Chrysler Building, and now the stunning World Trade Tower. I get so excited when I fly into NYC and catch my first glimpse of the city. There is only one New Your City.

Breathtaking. Having lived in NYC for half of my life, I never tire of admiring the New York Skyline. It is beautiful from down below as well as high up. I work on the 40th Floor of a building near Central Park and have a hard time keeping my eyes away from the window.

Unique and powerful. Unique, powerful, inspiring, dramatic- find the right vantage point: in the air, on the water, above the town, across a river and you can enjoy the most visible and perhaps one of the less seen feature of Manhattan

NYC Skyline - quite the sight. This is one of those things that you need to see in your lifetime - yeah it is just a bunch of tall building but the sight of them all together really inspires awe and wonder. If you can take a quality photo, you will have a keepsake or a least a quality wallpaper.If you are coming from NJ, catch the 320 bus and sit on the left, you will see it in all its wonder.

Skyline from the bay. From a ferry across the bay of the Hudson River and the East River, you can get a beautiful view of the skyline of New York. Day and evening, the view is just great. The city has a charm that makes it impossible not to return.

Ever changing, always exhilarating. So many shapes, sizes, and textures. So many stories and so many storeys:) The very best way to appreciate it is from a boat. Circle Line, Staten Island Ferry, and others afford great views.
Great as seen from across the river. Make certain to look at the magnificent Manhattan Skyline as you travel towards the island over many of the NYC bridges.
Back to my city. I was born and raised in NYC. There's not another city in the US that comes close what NYC offers. The city is alive 24 hours a day. If NYC doesn't have it, you don't need it.
Beautiful. Beautiful skyline from Liberty Islands, or the Observation floor on the Empire State building. Try and see in the daytime and evening

Enjoyed the trip. Enjoyed central park so quiet and peaceful ground zero very sad ....empire state went day time but perfure night viewing much more exciting Macy store much too big to look around ....
You have to !. Saw the whole view from Hoboken. Awesome !!!, just take the ferry (it is free) and take some pics. Great at night too.

Famous skyline in the flesh.. We saw this from the Statue of Liberty - and it's simply amazing to see. It's worth taking the ferry even if just to get some shots of a skyline that's so famous and yet you don't realise how impressive until you see it firsthand.

Safe and Clean city to visit! Very fun and happening place!. We had a wonderful time visiting New York for the first time, spending most of our time in the Manhattan area! The historic buildings alongside the newer ones were just wonderful to look at.
Beautiful view!. Beautiful view!View of the Mathetten fascinating, impossible to look away. Very unusually, there is a desire to fly.

<3 NYC. If I was to do it again, I would go for a week at least in order to be able to enjoy all those sites which we had, and cathc up on the ones, we did not have time for. On the top of the ESB when the city is lit up? Magical! You are just transfixed there!
Great!!. You can see New York from the top. I can stay there for hours just to relax and watching the great view..better to go in the noon.

Must do in New York. I can't say enough how much you should do this while in New York! Fantastic especially in Summer when there are little vendors along the way serving scrumptious ice-creams.
The Big Apple Skyline. Traveling to New York City is always a thrill flying in, riding as a passenger or driving into the city! Love it's spectacular view everytime...
Definitely worth the view.. Definitely worth the view. An iconic view that you've seen time and time again in TV, Movies, art , etc but best viewed in person.
Breathtaking!. I absolutely love this city. I fell in the love the minute we flew in, and was heartbroken having to leave.

2 best ways to see it.. Although I grew up in the vicinity of NYC (lots of relatives there), I never tire of looking at the skyline.July 2015 trip, took my midwestern family to NYC for their first visit. Skyline never fails to impress.My (new) favorite 2 ways to see it:1. One World Observation deck (pricey but worth every dollar on a clear day or night.2. Staten Island Ferry, day or night.It really pays to make the effort to see the skyline from the highest point possible or from the water. Enjoy!

Must see. Loved the theatre of the elevator show, the views as well as the city overview sessions. I personally love New York, so this also enhanced the whole experience. Definitely a must see attraction
Manhattan Views from Staten Island Ferry. have been NYC several times - first time we took the Staten Island Ferry and it was a new view - plus for free!

its a must see - preferably by helicopter. Best seen by helicopter! totally recommend liberty helicopter tours, worth every cent. Also really enjoyed our boat tour around the island, although recommend the shorter trip, the 3 hour one wasn't needed!
A must do!. When you are in NY, you should do the boat trip on the River so you can see the Manhattan Skyline and take unforgetable pictures! You can also see the different beautiful bridges of NY.

Manhattan's Skyline. One of the most famous skylines in the world does not disappoint when you see it in real life. Take a boat out and do a 'round the island' tour to see the Statue of Liberty and you'll get a great view of the skyline.
Just like the movies. At night the lights twinkle like stars and the best view is from The Empire State Building at sunset.

Go to Long Island City or catch a boat for a great view.. Go across to Long Island City for a spectacular view of the New York City skyline. You can also see the iconic Pepsi Cola sign as well. It's good viewing day or night. Another way to see the skyline is from the free Staten Island ferry or any of the boats that circle Manhattan and depart from the Circle Line at the west end of 42nd Street.

Its NYC Baby. I mean its NYC, the most recognizable skyline in the world. My suggestions to take full advantage of it would be the observation deck on top of the Freedom Tower, the Circle Line Cruise, and the Empire State Building Observatory. Of course a Heli ride is pretty awesome if you can afford it. The Cable Car to Roosevelt Island is also fun.

Manhattan sky line is same as in those movie you only saw on TV. watching much Hollywood movies? You must have familiar with the Manhattan skyline. No comment. Fabulous, but enjoy Brooklyn Heights as well. And don't worry about reading the rest of this review because I have to make 100 characters minimum.
City That Never Sleeps. We loved seeing it from the 86th floor of the Empire State Building. You can also see it from the crown in the Statue of Liberty.
Love to walk. Quick walk to the Highline walkway. Views from rooftop deck ok- nice place to sit and have a glass of wine at night

Which is a good place to enjoy such a magnificent skyline. Obviously there are many places with unusual views. From New Jersey there are many vantage posiitons on the cliff face. Manhattan. The best way we saw the Manhattan Skyline was by taking the Circle Line Tour. It was our first time to the city and it was such a refreshing and relaxing 2 1/2 hours on the boat.
Great Photo Spot. Very cool pics from across the water at the Statue of Liberty. The skyline, and bridges, great spot for photos.
A symbol of NYC. The New York City skyline is amazing and more so if you get to watch from above as either you land or take off from one of its three area airports. A must see.
Great view from The Statue of Liberty. We saw the skyline from the Statue of Liberty, which was pretty cool. We did see the skyline at night, pretty awesome. We will return.
just beautiful. trying watching at both day and dusk. has its own beauty at both times. i got the best shots during my ferry ride towards statue of liberty.
A Town with a View. Always wanted to see this skyline in person and it certainly lived up to expectation: both from street level and from the water

A train ride away in Brooklyn Heights is the best view. Brooklyn Heights has by far the best view of the East Side of NYC. Take the train to Borough Hall and walk down Montague Street to the promenade. Bring your friends, a lunch and a camera. Great views without the congestion and hassle.

Looks awesome. Manhattan skyline from statue of liberty is just awesome, and to know that these skyscrapers have been there for more than 50 years add to their aura. View from top of Empire state building also gives you a feeling of being in the truly world class city.

Time to relax. We got of the subway in Brooklyn, picked up something to eat and headed for the Brooklyn Heights. We were lucky enough to get a table and chairs. I don't know how long we sat there but even though the few was the same it was mesmerizing to enjoy a break and take some amazing pictures.

Most recognizable skyline in the world. The best way to see the Manhattan skyline is from the water, and it's free! Take the Staten Island Ferry. Also a must is Central Park, especially the south side with all its incredible rock formations. No bad views wherever you are.
Sensational. Go and check out the view from Williamsburg or Rocafeller Plaza. It's crazy to think that humans were capable of building this.

Giants to the sky. Visiting New York City on our small boat cruise we entered ths River just after dawn, passing the Statue of Liberty on the waý. Seeing pictures is one thing but viewing it in the flesh, so to speak, is quite another. Very, very imposing. Walking in the City gives a different aspect as one looks up at the towering buildings. Then as a fitting finale we viewed the brightly lit skyline during our evening departure. So many photos taken which wilĺ never do justice to the views. great visit to one of Àmerica's major sights.

Best view at night!. Night view is amazing from Liberty state park (New Jersey side), Staten island (take the free ferry) or go to Brooklyn bridge part or Gantry state park. WIlliamsburg also offers the best views of the Manhattan Skyline.
amazing skyline. the skyline is incredible from Brooklyn, New Jersey and the Statue of Liberty Island. There are so many skyscrapers...
Lovely walk with great views. Lovely walk with great views. Not much shade so wear a hat. Lots of steps on and off so start and stop where you like

Fantastic views. Seeing the skyline in real life is just as you imagined it from the movies. It is great to walk across the Brooklyn bridge and see the skyline at sunset. At the park just by the water under the Brooklyn bridge you can see the Chrysler building, the empire state building and the World trade centre. it is worth doing it during the day also.
Amazing views. Those long awaited views do not disappoint. We experienced this during the day and night. Both amazing.
See it from the Brooklyn side.. It is good any time of day, but sunset and night are spectacular. I've lived here all my life and never get tired of it.

still in competition with "Sagarmatha" ( Everest). Everybody rushes to wherever they are going in New York but get away from such behavior and look down the avenues at the skyline and you will understand why New York is an iconic symbol of success. Don't just look at shop windows,look at the skyline every once and again,and imagine these as a mountain chain built by hand. Click yourself in one of the "mountain" canyons,but be careful to cross only when the lights allow.Unlike in DC,where drivers are more respectful of pedestrians,in New York they are likely to come at you if they feel you are too color-blind to know when to cross

viewed this from the worl yacht cruise. Just stunningIt was a misty night which seemed to give the whole sky line an extra glow Fantastic experienceReally good night on the cruise as well as the amazing views

Cruise around the Island. Best seen by a cruise around the island. We did the NYC pass HOp On hop off sunset cruise for 90 minutes. This guide was amazing. 45 minutes of not stop great information!!! by far the highlight of our trip to NYC. Of all the thing we did in 7 days. This was the highlight. We cruised under the Brooklyn bridge the back to the the statue of liberty with the sun setting behind her. Truly great!

One of the most known skylines in the whole world. One of the most known skylines in the whole world. Many films , hundreds were done in Manhattan showing its beautifull Skyline. It was especialy known till september 11 with the wonderfull Twin Towers in world trade center.which where brutally distroyed by the arab terorist attack.

A sight not to be missed..... NY is simply one of the great cities of the world.... we just walked and enjoyed all parts of Manhattan... definitely walk the High Line (old rail track now made into trendy outdoor walk, just keep walking and enjoy...

You will not be able to walk away. Every time of day offers a different perspective, a new light. From Brooklyn Heights or down in Brooklyn Park, stop and look and take lots of pictures. Sit on a bench and wait a few moments to see the various in light.
Amazing view. The best place to view the skyline is it from the Empire State Building both day and night. But I prefer night view which was fabolous!!!!!

Best skyline in the world!. One of the best places to view the skyline, and it's free, is the Brooklyn Bridge. The further you walk the broader your view! And if you walk all the way across, you will reach the promenade in Brooklyn, another great place to see.
Group Tour. Manhattan is a very classy place. Top of the lines in fsahions,buildings, latest news from Hollywood and famous celebrities,politics,business and tour experience.
Impressive. we took many photos from the NJ side and from the ferry as we we traveled to to Liberty and Ellis Islands..there are many opportunities for different views...
A MUST SEE. Take a bus over to Brooklyn when the sun is setting, you will not be disappointed. The Manhattan skyline is something else!
Can't be beat. The higher up you go, the better the view. Try Top of the Rock. Or a Grayling Open Top Bus - you get a free ferry tour which is fab
Excellent. The best place to view the skyline is from Top of the Rock! We went at night, and it gave excellent views of all the New York skyline highlights.
Amazing views. I could take my own photos of the skyline as pictured. I also enjoyed views from the Empire State Building & The Rockerfellerbuilding
Leaving New York on the Queen Mary 2 the skyline in the distance. Leaving New York on the QM2 watching the skyline and the Statue of Liberty, was awesome. What a beautiful site ...

Just incredible. Whether you're looking from New Jersey across the Hudson River or Long Island City across the East River, the view is spectacular. .....especially at night. Being a lifelong New Yorker, this is one of the nicest views you can imagine
Absolutely breathtaking. Sheer tranquility the colours are amazing I watched the colours change second by second loved it breathtaking totally in awe

ESB during 4th of July!!!. July 4th Fireworks were viewed this year at the top of the Empire State Building. All I can say is WOW! It was totally worth the wait and the express line pricing. Do yourself a favor and do this sometime in your life and you'll be amazed!
Manhattan Skyline. How does one review this magnificent icon? It's not possible; go see it and you'll know why! Walk the Brooklyn Bridge or go to Brooklyn Pier Park for another perspective.

Absolutely Captivating. You can't help but look UP whether you are walking, driving, or cruising on the water around the city. The Manhattan Skyline is breathtaking. The architecture is just amazing. The detail that is displayed in some of these buildings in utterly amazing. I never get bored sightseeing my way through this amazing city. So stop looking at your cell phone, and take in everything that is around you.

Breathtaking from anywhere!. You don't have to spend much to enjoy the skyline. Go across to Brooklyn, Long Island City, take the Staten Island ferry, circle line, anywhere. Just remember, wherever you are in New York City to look up!

Just walk outside your hotel and look up!. Be sure to keep looking up as you walk around Manhattan! You can see the Empire State building from most corners, and the new Freedom Tower dominates downtown. Don't miss the Chrysler Building and the Flatiron Building, either.
Perfect. This is a great place to look and see the magic of the city that most people see in movies and TV. Good just to soak up the overall vibe of the city from.
places to see. went to see a show and just walked around . went to st patricks cathedral, rockfeller center, times square.

Wonderful View Of Manhattan Skyline.. Manhattan Skyline is a wonderful vision of variety of Architecturally rich and famous buildings in Manhattan forming part of New York. Manhattan Skyline is made up of 100’s of Architecturally constructed Skyscrapers and some of the famous ones forming the Skylines are;One World Trade Centre, 4 & 7 World Trade Centres, Empire State Building, Bank of America Tower, Rockefeller Centre, Chrysler Building,New York Times Building,MetLife Building, Manhattan Municipal Building, 40 Wall Street,70 Pine Street,Woolworth Building,One Chase Manhattan Plaza, Exxon Building,383 Madison Avenue & Triumph World Tower.Some of the famous building like, One World Trade Centre,Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, Pine Street & Woolworth Building & New York Times Building can be seen from most of the places.Anytime, day or night the splendid view of the Manhattan Skyline can be observed from;> During the Ferry ride to Staten Island & Statue of Liberty. > Great views at various points of Governor’s Island.> Birds eye view of Manhattan Skyline can be best viewed from the Rockefeller from where you can also get a fantastic view of the great ‘Central Park’,with all its greenery. Recently observation facility is opened at ‘One World Trade Centre’ also,we could not make it due to time constraints. > While walking around the great Brooklyn Bridge Park & when you walk across the Brooklyn Bridge. > Even from,certain observatory deck in ‘High Line Park’.Watching the fantastic Manhattan Skyline with so many beautiful & tall buildings created out of technological excellence for a better existence, gives a sense of pride,strength and confidence as human being to establish a better & better human existence in this universe using well being and technology.

Best from the Empire State Building. Best place is to see it from the Empire State Building both at night and in the day not when it's hazy. Get your tickets from the guys at the foot of the building, they're trying to sell you deals and you can make a deal with them. I found in NY every bus/sightseeing company is trying to get the business so you can actually haggle with tour deals on the spot, and my mistake was to prebook everything at high cost. If you can, do it on the spot and you can secure a good price.
Lovely skyline view. Seeing the skyline by evening by boat was lovely in the summer. Excellent family outing. We were able to see the statue of Liberty at night that is also awe inspiring.

Do it the way the locals do. Take a yellow water taxi from west side of Manhatten and travel east to Brooklyn . And then back via Statue of Liberty. The view of Manhatten skyline is very good. If your feeling fit get off and walk over Brooklyn bridge (great views). Then pick up water taxi for return journey.

Best City view by water ive ever seen. Great view from many places. I saw it from a circle Line boat going out to the Statue of Liberty which is a great
I believe its the best opportunity for photographs of the skyline

Best viewed from Brooklyn Promenade at sunset hours. Contrary to the real estate brochures, the downtown skyline is best viewed from the Brooklyn Promenade. Nothing compares to a clear day at sunset casting a silhouette onto each other. You can get naturally occuring (and spectacular) lens flare effects during sunsets in late August.

Wonderful Views but You Need to Know Where to Be. The skyline of New York City is definitely very impressive but you need to see from a distance to really take in a large panorama. Best Views of Lower to Mid Manhattan can be had on the Brooklyn Promenade on the Brooklyn Side of course.Best views of Midtown are definitely wonderful from Long Island City (Hunters Point South Park area to the East and West)And if you like views of the West Side Manhattan Skyline, Best views can be found on the Palisades Parkway northbound side. There are three different scenic lookout points over the Palisades which give you stunning views especially around sunrise and sunset. Enjoy!
Unbelieveable!. The empire state building is famous for capturing these views, but I recommend the Top of the Rock! And the view from the brooklyn side of the Brooklyn bridge.

now you know you're really in new york. between the bridges, the buildings, the water there really isn't anything like it in the world. With a good tour guide or some research prior, the skyline truly comes to life as you can see New York's "Big 3" bridges on the Hudson River and every major tower New York is known for including the Freedom Tower, Chrysler Building, etc...

iconic. Views from the Harbour cruise, Top of the Rock and Empire State Building are quite breathtaking. we took the twilight cruise, and that was worthwhile although the boats were a tad crowded. We also visited ESB both in daylight and night (using the City Pass - well, worth it.

The most beautiful view of my life. Yes it is true, it was The most beautiful view of my life!! Bynight of course it is magig but olso byday is wonderful!At the sunset till night , you cannot miss this fantastic skyline a take a lot of pictures!
Best view from Brooklyn Bridge. Get up early before sunrise, take a cab to Brooklyn Heights and walk back to Manhattan over Brookly Bridge and you will have the best view of Manhattan's skyline ...

Greatest Skyline on the planet. As a military guy who has traveled the world, can honestly say that New York City is second to none in the breadth and scope of its skylines. True vision of American ingenuity.

VERY DIFFERENT. This is a stunning,iconic scene best seen from well out on the water. The ferries are frequent and inexpensive. For those of us who remember the previous view the eye is drawn to the new tower and what might have been. A must for a first visit to the city and superb after dark.
The best place to see the skyline is Brooklyn. The best place to see the skyline is Brooklyn. Either the Brooklyn promenade (higher and better) or the Brooklyn park (on the river shores).
Texan. Have been to New York several times, but this was first time since 9/11. Very emotional and New York did it well.

Manhattan Skyline by Night. The hop on hop off NIGHT BUS TOUR is the way to go. You get to see the beautiful Manhattan Skyline all lit up and sparkling in the night. You will see it up close and from a distance as you pass over the Brooklyn Bridge and view from across the river.
Doesn't get any better!. New York has one of the best skylines in the world and it keeps getting better! It seems that the construction never stops!
beautiful. How can you not love the skyline of the city that never sleeps? It is beautiful every time I visit & I look forward to seeing it every time
Picture Perfect!. Skyline which is Picture perfect. Best viewed from New Jersey, the magic of this city is visible in its skyline.

Step away to enjoy the skyline. One really must observe the Manhattan Skyline from a distance to fully appreciate its impact. We visited a fabulous newly developing area across the East River in Long Island City and had incredible views. We took the E subway to Queens (23 & Court Sq.) and then walked west for 20 minutes to the water front. Then we rode the East River Ferry (exact name?) to lower Manhattan passing under the Brooklyn Bridge on the way. It was a beautiful day, such a nice break from the sidewalks and bustle. There's not a big food scene in Lower Mantattan, but plan in advance for what you want to see and do once there.
Spectacular. Absolutely incredible. Loved it. I hope to go back again and marvel at the Manhattan Skyline. Awe-inspiring.
Awesome. Awesome sight. Everyone should have this on their bucket list to do. Absolutely love this city. So much to do. Each time I go back I see something else new.
Just like the movies. Loved the view of the skyline from the Staten Island ferry. We all got some amazing camera shots and to cap it all, the ferry is free!

Spectacular views.. We took this in from a place called The Press Lounge which has 360 degree views of NYC so the skyline and Hudson river were visible to us. Amazing - a must do at least once kind of thing.

Beautiful!. Such a beautiful view. I love going here just for a walk whether it's with my dad, my friends, or alone. It's quite it some areas, and it's nice to hear other voices here and there. Nothing quite like it, as I think it's a beautiful concept and really is somewhat of a tranquil getaway compared to the surrounding area.

The city lights never sleep. There is something fairy tale like about Manhattan, when you see it at sunset turns to night. Take a free ride to Staten Island and back, just to see that!. Whereas most cities exhort residents to save electricity, Manhattan's zonal mandate exhorts that all buildings be clad with illuminated display boards, higher the lumens, the better! Through this contrarian directive, NY wants to strengthen its brand differentiation. Another great way to see Manhattan is from atop the Empire State Building.There you see so many famous buildings up close. In the dark of the night, they change their dignified daytime outfits, now showing off their naked profiles accentuated by lighting, in this midnight cabaret.
There is no Imagining!. Just as there is no imagining the Grand Canyon, there is no imagining the Manhattan Skyline. It is a must-see foryourself.

Visited Art Fest, their Sculpture Garden is amazing, Red Chairs spread all around and baseball fields, Hammack fiel. Two options for amazing view - under the Brooklyn bridge from Dumbo and Brooklyn Bridge park - grass and stairs to sit on, facing Skyline accross the East River. Free. Icecream factory near,Grimaldis PIzza and many more.2nd option is view from Governors Island - there is free water shuttle around noon on the weekends, or 2 dollars tix for a ride at other times from Pier 5 in Brooklyn, off Atlantic Ave. Island has variety of food,lot of grass and fields, Hammack field, great chilled place with lot of events goin on. Public toilets accessible, Alcohol sold here too! :)
Great Architecture. It;s not only very beautiful but also historic and you can see the evolution of society in the various buildings.

Manhattan Skyline. A well known view from movies and tv-shows but there is something special viewing it yourself. It can be viewd from on top of several of the sky scrapers, but also from outside the city.

Quick Trip to NYC. Went to shop and did very little sightseeing. The Chelsea Market is fun for foodies but VERY crowded on weekends. We walked the High Line for a little while. Beautiful walk with neat city views including the Empire State Bldg. Love the subway system! Best place in world to shop!
Gorgeous!. Just such a gorgeous view! Get out at the red line Court st station, walk down to the water and enjoy the view! A 100% must see!

Simply Awestruck and Amazing. We all were awestruck while visiting NEW York. There is no place else in the world such as this.
You get lost and keep wondering at the engineering wonders of modern times. We visited the Hotel opposite world trade towers(Top floor of the hotel) to see wonderful views and construction work going on.( In year 2004)

Iconic and not to be missed. Whether you see it from the Brooklyn Bridge, a ferry or in any other form, the Manhattan skyline is an incredible sight. I've seen skyscrapers in London, Paris, etc and nothing quite compares to this.
Whatever you're in NYC for you must see it.
Could stare at the Skyline for Days!. I particularly loved the older skyscrapers - some almost 100 years old - their ornamental tops have so much character!

Lot's of options to get the best view.. Probably one of the most famous views in the world. Either during the day or at night. You have a couple of options to get the optimal view. You can pay around 30$ a person to go into one of the skyscrapers (Rock, Empire or WTC) . I recommend the WTC for its experience (the elevator ride itself is great). Only problem is that you don't have a view of Central Park. So if that is important for you , choose the other two. Another option is the Brooklyn Bridge or the Staten Island ferry. Especially at night those are great. IMHO the best way to enjoy the view is by going to Brooklyn Bridge park. Great atmosphere, very relaxed and weather permitting, great views.
Manhattan Skyline visit. Oh this was amazing,.. the view was just great! Great way to see New York. I was there during winter... so i would suggest going on a clear day.

must see!. The Manhattan Skyline should definitely be seen (from whichever place you choose to see it). Either from Liberty Island or the Staten Island Ferry or from Jersey City, its beautiful! From Statue of Liberty Pedestal, they have a picture of how the skyline looked when the Twin Towers were there and now...its really sad.
Wow!. So many buildings, such great architecture! So much to see and the views of the skyline from up high are amazing, especially at night.
Breathtaking.. Not sure there is a bett skyline anywhere. The new WTC is a welcome addition. Best views are from Brooklyn and grant photo ops at night.
Impressive. You can see pictures and watch it on TV but until you see it in person you really cannot grasp how impressive it really is.
Great Skyline View. Saw the skyline from Brooklyn Bridge. It is a must if you are visiting NYC. So great to see the skyline from a distance.
Definitely a must see!. I would say visiting NYC is a bucket list type of thing for me. It was great to go one time and experience it.
See it from Brooklyn.. We went on the bus night tour and stopped to take photos of the skyline. Well worth it. Amazing sight.
Super.. From Grand Central station, you can take the 7 subway to Queens (first stop Vernon blvd) , Long Island City, and walk about ten minutes to the river. Beautiful view of Manhattan.

This is the centre of the universe.. This is the centre of the universe. NYC is a buzz 24/7. You haven't lived until you spend good quality time in the city. We had 12 days and it simply wasn't long enough. Brilliant restaurants where the service is second to none. Wait staff know their stuff - from the hidden ingredients in meals to wines or beers.Luv NYC
The Millennium Broadway Hotel Times Square. Fantastic Hotel stay in NYC every year this is the best experience ever in the hotel. Friendly staff clean and large rooms with fantastic views

Best (free) way to see Downtown Manhattan. One of the best, free ways to see the Manhattan Skyline is to take a (free) trip on the Staten Island Ferry to St George Ferry Terminal on Staten Island and to wander up the hill and look back towards the city. If you can't/don't want to go uphill you could always meander along the waterfront to the Postcard Memorial and look back at the iconic skyline.
Get it on your bucket list. I love this place... I never get tired of it and I just keep returning. It's such a wonderful view and is stunning. It's so iconic and everyone must come here if they can

How can you not like it?. Best skyline in the free world... Have to view it from the water, and not on a crowded boat. Lower Manhattan is impressive when you see the new Freedom Tower and the old buildings together. Love New York!

Like a Crystal City at Night From Brooklyn. The New York Skyline is fantastic viewed from across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan after dark. There is an Italian restaurant and ice cream store on the Brooklyn side to the right of the bridge as you go from Manhattan to Brooklyn. In front of them is an open space which provides a wonderful view of Manhattan - at night it looks like a crystal city - just beautiful!
Busy and beautiful.. Wish I could have seen it with the twin towers. Its not the same without them. :( Busy city. Beautiful skyline. Take a trip to the statue or Ellis Island to get the best pic.
Awesome. Skyscratchers; One Trade Centre, The Rock, Emire State Building, etc. ... Must see view one day-, one nighttime

AMAZING VIEW. This amazing point of view is simply great. It should have been an other railway for the subway, instead it became a suspended garden within the town. The flora is great and changes from a point to another, don't hesitate to go after a diner for a walk or before going out in Meatpacking
Enjoy,
Louis
Nyc skyline. Brilliant! It's Manhattan skyline- enough said. Breathtaking, especially with fireworks on the 4th. Wonderful.
So Beautiful!!. New York's skyline is the best in the U.S. Whether you see it by land, sea or air it is beautiful. Many options to take in the views. Enjoy!
Love it. The NYC Skyline is amazing.. I love it. And depending where you are viewing it from, it changes, as well as the fact that the skyline is constantly changing as new buildings go up.
Makes New York City, New York City. The NYC of the movies, the famous skyline. Best viewed from outside of Manhattan. Of course can be seen from pretty much anywhere

Breathtaking!. There aren't many words to describe this attraction other than breathtaking and similar words: I've been here on a lovely sunny day (you'll get quite a few of them between June and August) and on a bad rainy day - I definitely recommend coming over when it's bright, as you can then have the perfect, beautiful way of Manhattan from East to West.

Manhattan looks better from Brooklyn. I look at it every day out of my living room window and from my terrace. I can see the Empire State building from my bed, let alone most of my apartment. I think Manhattan looks a lot better from Brooklyn than from Manhattan.
best viewed from the water and at sunset. Amazing. Loved it most from the water and at sunset. Did a dinner cruise and New York water taxi. All boat trips take you to look back at the views.

Look up because the streets are filthy!. As always the skyline in my home town seems to change every time I return. That being said, I am saddened by how dirty the streets have become. Sad state of affairs here.
MILLION DOLLAR VIEW. The Manhattan skyline is so surreal you keep looking to make sure that it is the real thing. Unbelievable.
beautiful nights. we were sitting on a sky terrace on our 20th anniversary and at night it just lit up and there was always a nice breeze

Exciting Week for 15 year old Grandson. I loved the DoubleTree Suites in Times Square- In the middle to Times Square but not a sound came through the thick windows. Great Suites that prevent that feeling of being in a hotel room and crowded. Large living room, and bedrooms with great bathrooms. The cost was great. If you need a limo, car service or just get stuck somewhere and need a pick up you can trust, Call Luxor Limo / Car Service. They can even give you great suggestions on where to eat, or cost effective city options. This trip changed my Grandsons ideas of how big a city can grow. Yankee Stadium was almost as great as their old stadium across the street. Easy to get to by subway also.

awesome skyline view from Brooklyn side. We experienced nice skyline views from Staten Ferry, Liberty Cruise and tour buses that cross the Hudson river. I would strongly suggest walking across the Brooklyn bridge from Manhattan to the park at the base of the bridge in Brooklyn. There were a lot of people taking the walk in the late afternoon on the Sunday in July when we were visiting. The evening view is spectacular if the weather is right.

wow. everything in manhattan is big, the building are tall as well as wide never saw anything on this scale, the video screens are a must see, i was on 7th and 42nd just amazing to see so many info screens that look like you can touch they are so realistic.

Amazing!. Nothing to dislike about this iconic view!! We went to the Top of the Rock and would say this was definitely the best view in the city. You can see the Statue of LIberty away in the distance.
A must. The most amazing view. Seen in so many films it feels unbelievable to be looking at it for real. Probably best seen from the new trade centre.

Great to view from east or west. View it from the Brooklyn Promenade (south of Brooklyn Bridge) or from The Water's Edge restaurant in Queens or Giando's restaurant in Brooklyn or 1000 other places. The view from NJ is also great, but you'll pay tolls to get back to the city. Also viewable from the BQE (let someone else drive).

Manhattab Skyline Remains Unique. From atop a high riser one can appreciate the Manhattan Skyline. The beacons of buildings at nighttime are distinctive. The Empire State Building is still to Manhattan, as the Eiffel to Paris, the Burj Al-Arab to Dubai, and Big Ben and London Bridge to London. The Empire Beacon changes colors with occasions, as in red, white and blue on July 4th, Green for St Patrick's day, orange for Halloween and Christmas colors for the holidays and some for changes for even lesser occasions. Newer buildings, mostly residential/business keep sprouting. Their designs and architecture although tend to be modern generally blend well with existing edifices. At night specially week days when offices and residences are lit, the city sparkles. The skyline can be fully appreciated from a bird's eye view or an ants eye view. It is a well coalesced city of buildings new and old.
Brilliant. Best seen from the Brooklyn Bridge or from a boat cruise which also takes in the Statue of Liberty. Try a night cruise as well to see all the lights. Amazing
The everlasting "wow". How can you not be impressed by it??? You saw it in so many movies, but when it's the real thing, you can just say "wow"!

Cruise or Ferry. The view from a ferry or cruise is best. Well, maybe if you take the helicopter for $20 a minute.. but still a fun sight. If you enjoyed this skyline then you should really check out Hong Kong.

Put it on your "to do" list if visiting New York City. It is a a good display of lights and tall buildings. Its attraction can range from good to just ok, depending on the weather. My apartment is actually part of the skyline, but I have looked at it time and time again from across the East River at Long Island City. Some nights the reflections from the buildings' lights are more saturated and extend some distance across the river. Other nights, the colours in the water are subdued and the reflections are shortened. The colors of the Empire State Building always stand out though and are always prominent except when it plays misty for you (pun on the movie). Best times for viewing are very early mornings as dawn breaks and in the evening, when there is still some light in the sky, giving it a very blue effect, which contrasts with the recently turned on reds and yellows of the building lights.During the daytime, it is deep, narrow concrete and asphalt gorges.I recommend a ride in any ferry that traverses the East River; you will enjoy it.

Can't wait to see it again!. Beautiful by day and stunning by night! We rode a sight seeing bus during the evening hours and went across the Brooklyn Bridge and got a terrific very of the city at night. It was amazing!
amazing views. amazing views and great fir budding photographers ..The Rockefeller building offers some amazing views

The Manhattan Skyline is incredible. it reminded me of a Mondrian Painting, vibrant, friendly, packed with giant cubic buildings following a carefully designed grid pattern. A city that never sleeps. Amazing. Was disappointed to discover things are no longer cheaper than the UK but it was great to experience such a wide array of choice, particularly with clothing.

Its what makes NYC. Every big city has a unique skyline. Chicago, London, even Los Angeles. New York City is no exception, and it used to be even more prevalent with the former World Trade Center. The tall buildings exempfies what a Big City represents, and there's nothing quite like it.There's plenty of great places to view the NYC skyline. The Ferry, Ellis Island/ Statue of Liberty are some of my favorites. Or, even when you cross over the Brooklyn Bridge, you can get a great view of Manhattan.
Wonderful skyline. We used a 3-days Big Bus Tours with a free boat-trip on the Hudson. The Manhattan skyline was beautiful.

So good they named it twice. I have gone to New York many times now, but never tire of it. The skyline is always changing, and is spectacular at night. Try to get to the Top of the Rock at dusk and just watch the lights come on.
Mahattan ferry. Loved going on the free ferry met a lot of locals who love talking about the city. Wrap up though because it can be a little bit chilly.
Wow. Beautiful Views! Breathtaking even to see it in real life when Ive seen it in so many movies!!! Pretty day and night

Manhattan - The Place to be. Any trip to New York is incomplete without the trip to Manhattan. The epitome of culture, fashion , energy and excitement. Whether you stroll down the shops on either side of the iconic 5th Avenue, or just soak in the energy at the Times Square or eat at the 100s of options (roadside Hot dogs and prezetells to the finest of dining experience of every possible cuisine of the world), Manhattan has it all. the perfectly planned grid city makes it so convenient to locate a place and this is one place that NEVER sleeps.
Skyline Views.. We have a photo of the Skyline which includes the Twin Towers before 911. We loved the actual view from the Empire State Building and the Harbor Cruise.
Dramatic. It looked awesome in the day and even better when we did the night time tour bus ride with the Grey Line Bus company stunning !
Take the helicopter!. The view from the top could not be beat! Nothing like seeing the buildings and statues from a birds eye view.

Astonishing. The NYC Skyline is breathtaking and can be seen from many places. I love the view across the East river from Brooklyn or Queens and from Staten Island ferry. You can also pay for a helicopter tour or a boat tour around Manhattan. And wherever you are, just don't forget your camera! :)

quick, before it melts. so we're just coming over a Jersey rise on a Greyhound and suddenly there it is, just as promised to a grandchild about an hour earlier.... breaktaking and the bus driver, a grouch up to here, raised the shades for easier viewing... but you gotta be quick
wonderful views. Took the hop on/off bus at night and enjoyed the views of both cities Manhattan & Brooklyn. We had a wonderful narrator.
Beautiful as always. A review for the skyline? o.k! It's amazing. I live here and still find it enthralling. Best ways to see it? Go over to NJ or to Governors Island or Brooklyn.

Lovely urban oasis. Very pleasant urban oasis, although brace yourself for crowds. It's a great way to see Manhattan differently. The area around W 4th at the end of the High Line is really nice to walk around and have lunch so the High Line walk followed by lunch in Gansevoort Market is a good half-day outing.
Amazing Views. The whole skyline of NY is great and can be seen from different views around the city - would recommend helicopter/boat tours to get a wide angled view!
Gorgeous at night!. Flying in over this at night or taking a boat cruise around Manhattan island. NYC skyline is deforest distinctive. You never wonder what you're looking at...
Beautiful. The skyline is beautiful when you take it in from the ferry that goes out to the Statue of Liberty. It is distinct and memorable.
enjoy it everyday!. There are few cityscapes that surpass this one. Either from the roof at MOMA or a boat on the river. Nothing looks more wonderful!
Best Views at Night. This place is a busy bee all hours of the day. We were there for the 4th of July and the buildings were dressed in red, white and blue. A lovely sight to see.

As awesome as I expected!. For a first time visit to NYC, I was really looking forward to the personal view of the skyline that I have seen so many times on tv and in print. It did not disappoint. On our first night, we did a sunset cruise with one of the companies that offer several different ones. The view from a boat on the Hudson and East rivers is excellent. For those with a budget that doesn't include the price of the cruise, there are a couple of other ways to get the panoramic views. We also walked across the Brooklyn Bridge (free) during the day at it too was outstanding. You also get great looks from the Staten Island Ferry (free). Either way you choose, you can't go wrong.

Skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge. The NYC skyline is breath taking from any angle, but one of the best viewing spots is from the Brooklyn Bridge. There is a walkway elevated about the traffic where the views are terrific. If possible walk across the bridge at dusk when the sky scrapers start to light up.
Iconic Manhattan. Another one of those things everyone should see at least once in their lifetime. The largest city in the world is graced with an amazing skyline.
Fantastic!. I enjoyed the view and it was great to see the buildings from a different angle to appreciate the size of the buildings. Even photos do not give you the perspective,,,you will love it!
Pretty amazing from the Roosevelt cablecar. Loved riding it....catch it from 1st Ave and 60th. Once you get to Roosevelt island, there is park and an old remenants of an old hospital.
Nice. We saw it on one of the bridges on a double decker tour bus at night. I believe that is the best way to see it but that is simply my opinion.

Nothing like it anywhere else. worthwhile to see the Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn side and also in the evening. Seeing the skyline from the Empire State Building is most worthwhile because visitors are in the open, not inside. So good weather is recommended to get a good experience.
Simply Beautiful!. Fantastic urban Planning and a beautiful skyline. Love the Architecture and detail. Do look up Rockefeller, JP Morgan and Carnegie to truly understand their influence on NYC.

Day or night, it's the best. I suggest that you go to an observatory (Top of the Rock, Empire State or One World Trade Center) at around 7pm to enjoy both cityscapes of Manhattan, day and night. By far, the best view overall was with the One World Trade center observatory. It gives you a 360 degree view of Manhattan, Jersey City, Brooklyn and some parts of Queens. It also features a view that you wouldn't see in other observatories, the 3 big bridges on the East side of Manhattan.Top of the rock is a treat too for real Manhattan lovers. You get to take a selfie with the Central Park and Midtown to downtown New York.I enjoyed all of the observatories thru the New York Pass, except the One World Trade. I hope you enjoy your New York trip!!
Night Bus tour to Brooklyn. Night Bus Tour to Brooklyn was brief but the views from Manhattan Bridge coming back from Brooklyn were worth every cent of the cost. Iconic NYC skyline at night. Wow!
Gosh darn pretty. Absolutely gorgeous. It was a dream. I thought it was definitely worth a ferry ride. There's something beautiful about looking at something you always see in movies.
Fantastic views. The views of the Manhattan Skyline is fantastic, we went up the Empire State Building, to view Manhattan was second to none. Get the Staten Island ferry and see more of the skyline.

An oasis in NYC. Nice views of NYC and close to Chelsey Market wich is a must see. Great shopping and food there . Many access points to facilitate your visit . Mother nature must be on your side though cause its an outside attraction
Breathtaking, stunning, iconi. Wonderful skyline-iconic and breathtaking-be sure to experience this-try to see from afar or from a high level

Panoramic views are extraordinary!. From our first glimpse from the NJ turnpike to views from the Staten Island ferry, Hoboken Pier C, and while walking across the Brooklyn Bridge we couldn't get enough!

Stunning - A Must. Empire State Building is busy, purchase your tickets from the sales people outside, a little faster entry. However, MAKE SURE you obtain a couple of quotes because the ticket price varied from $58-$68 (not sure why). Great views of the city. Hop On/Off also includes a ferry trip which provides great views of the city and also Statue of Liberty.
Views amazing from a hight. The views from any high building are just amazing to see a must if you visit New York, even if you are a bit scared of heights you feel very safe.
Nyc. One world observatory beautiful experience, brought back memories of all Americans we lost. Walked alot
A marvel. Variety of architecture. Historical buildings to the new World Trade Center. View it from every angle that you can, Brooklyn, Staten Island, top of Empire State...
Amazing architectural details. What is absolutely amazing is how some of the tallest buildings have such architectural detail right at the top of the building which is floors away from the ground.

Beautiful, stunning, a must see !. When you come to New York, the Manhattan Skyline is definitely something you have to see. And there are so many different ways to get to see it... for free or for only a few dollars. You can take the Staten Island Ferry which is free to see the Skyline by boat, or STatue Cruises on your way to the Statue of Liberty. Whenever you want to see it... sunrise, afternoon, sunset, night... it's always amazing. You also get a nice view from the Brooklyn Bridge or the parcs at East River.

Empire State and Top of the Rock. Visit one during the day and one after sunset. Empire State is very busy, but they do a good job of entertaining you during the wait with an audio tour and exhibits. We did Top of the Rock at night, they have several viewing decks, so it wasn't as crowded either.

Must see. Manhattan skyline is most important to see in the trip of New York. Manhattan is the place which is seen in movies and every visitor of USA has in his mind that all of America is like Manhattan but when visit all of America, the image of America is changed. It is a green country but visiting Manhattan skyline the image refleshes.
Loved Manhattan Skyline.. Loved the energy I felt while looking at the skyline during the the daylight and at night. Made me proud to be American.

Sight for sore eyes. What can I say, The Manhatten skyline has to be one of the most icon going!
Try the Circle Line daytime tour - you wont be dissapointed. Do pick a sunny day to do this justice.

May ways to experience the shoreline.. First take a ferry boat to NJ and take in the sights. Or splurge for a ride on the thrilling Beast on the Hudson River in midtown, or take the Water Taxi, you can take it from Manhattan to lower Manhattan to Brooklyn with uncles views of Manhattan. Or if you are in a romantic state of mind, go down to lower Manhattan a catch a sailboat the embarks a little before sunset, and it is an amazing was to see the skyline. There is a 20 minute free kayak excursion that let's you see the skyline fro a very different perspective. But my favorite all time splurge of a lifetime and every bit worth the thrill is a copter tour up the hudson, circling around Yankee Stdium, the George Washington Bridge and the Upper West side. To this day I feel ecstatic feeling just thinking about it. Enjoy whichever you choose. You are bound to enjoy. There is also one other way to see the skyline, a brief view. Take the Governor's Island fro ferry on a weekend. There is always entertainment. If the budget allows rent a bile, and you will see the skyline in a very delightful was. It's no wonder NYC is my favorite city.
Great City. There are so much history, culture and sites that you can not see everything on one visit. Spectacular restaurants and little shops and cafes
amazing. The views are stupendous. No matter where you are, you can get a different view of the skyline. The age of some of the buildings make the architecture unique. enjoyed it.

Breathtaking.... From Top of the Rock, the ferry to catch a Mets game or any other place you see the Manhattan Skyline... it IS breathtaking. Especially from the Empire State building, 360* views .. looking down toward Central Pk and Harlem etc.. was the most amazing to me. Long line ups - can buy tix in advance. The ferry is a great way to go around and catch full sight lines and be on the water

Amazing Manhatten Skyline!. The best views of the manhatten skyline were from the Night Tour Bus that crossed the bridge over into Brooklyn AND during the day from the Ferry that shuttled us to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty.

It Doesn't Get Any Better Than This. The view of the Manhattan Skyline will take your breath away. It is incredible to see during the day but at night, wow! A trip to New York City is an absolute "Must Do".

Skyline Tour. The female tour guide was enthusiastic and cheerful and gave us interesting facts about the city. She seemed to enjoy her work. The tour gave us a sense of the layout and we could then plan where we would get off the next time. I loved the on and off option.

a must see new York gem.... If you're only in New York City for only a day and you only have time to visit one place, the High Line should be it. It's like no other place you've been: a park, botanical garden and walking paths all built on an elevated railroad line. The walkway twists and turns and meanders in between buildings and then goes out on the straightaway again. At every turn there are stunning views of the Hudson River and New Jersey to the west, the rest of Manhattan to the East and more gardens and pathways to the north & south. It's different at each season and at different times of the day and night. Combine your trip to the High Line with a meal at one of the many Chelsea and West Village restaurants that line the streets below. And it's perfect for the whole family with benches to rest on when you get tired of walking. Best of all: its free! The High Line has quickly become one of New York's best treasures.

Bucket list view. Seriously, what can you think of that out does this? The Grand Canyon maybe? Anyway, if you have not seen it you should. Do yourself a favor and take the cheap ride on the Staten Island ferry and just look at the skyline. It rocks. USA! USA! USA!

Buildings as far as the eye can see!. The Manhattan Skyline is impressive and beautiful. We enjoyed it from the Top of the Rock (that way we could see all of the sparkling lights on the Empire State Building), but you could also look at the skyline from the Empire building itself, or from the new observation area in the World Trade Center.
Great Photo Ops. These parks in Dumbo are busy at all times of the day with photographers. If you want a great shot of the city, head down to this park.
View from Brooklyn. It was amazing to be on a ferry and in Brooklyn at roof top bars looking back at the skyline made so famous from all the movies.
Nice. One of the most famous skylines in the world. Beautiful from the water, and exciting for us who has just seen this on TV.

Stunning. It's difficult to find enough superlatives for what is one of the most iconic skylines in the world, rivalled only in my view by Sydney Harbour. We enjoyed views from Liberty Island and from the Rockefeller Building.
A wonderful September stroll. Walked from Battery Park to General Grant's museum with dozens of stops hundreds of photos and a ferry ride

Must see. Walking around is the best way as taxis are nightmare to find at weekends as even though it is illegal for drivers to refuse to take you but they do eventually found a illegal taxi to take us in freezing cold weather
It is amazing.. It's iconic and at night time just amazing. Either from the river, from a helicopter ar from the bridges, it's amazing.

Worth the cost - fabulous and colourful views. Don't miss the nighttime skyline from either the Top of th Rock or the venerable Empire State Building. Be sure to book your time in advance, otherwise you may have to wait several hours to be admitted.

It will make your heart skip a beat the first time... I love being in the cab, especially if the taxi takes the Brooklyn Bridge, my first glimpse of the Manhattan skyline literally takes my breath away, its that feeling of being in the best city in the world..
The most amazing Skyline, no matter what time you arrive!!

The Manhattan is the soul of the city. It is an experience to walk aroung Manhhaten and observe the energy of the place . The lovely joints , the fancy label of clothing stores will arrest your attention .
NY Skyline. Visited the Empire State Building to see the NY skyline and was thrilled at the view; however, no where to sit and after walking several blocks to get there we were tired.

Honestly, do you have to say anything?. This site is one of the most beautiful sites in the world. When you see the Manhattan skyline, you are in awe of the excitement, the deals, the thrills, the laughs, the heartbreaks, the song and the dance that is every day New York. This is where life happens. How great to be a spectator for even one little moment. Night time is the best but anytime is awesome. New York, New York.

Freedom Tower. It was great, because I love my country. We were able to get a great view of the city and learn about many different landmarks.. The architecture was amazing and truly a tribute to our country.

The supporting player in countless movies.... It's the supporting player in countless movies, and Woody Allen's most faithful mistress in his time here. You can see the progress of American History and Architecture in its signature buildings and districts. The capitalist pantheon of US capitalism include: One World Trade, 30 Wall Street, Chrysler Building, Empire State, RCA/GE/Comcast, Citicorp Center, Waldorf-Astoria, Woolworth, Time Warner, New York Life and on...the show really starts at sundown, when the competition for attention extends well into the night. You will enjoy the skyline best from Roosevelt Island's Four Freedoms Park...take the tram. or the Water Grill in Long Island City. Ignore the waffle-like monstrosity called 432 Park Avenue at 57th street.

As far as the Eye can see. As big cities go it is wonderful to see the variety of architecture. The iconic Art Deco of Emprie State Building and Rockafeller Center, Brooklyn Brown-stones, Bridges and modern buildings many of which are still under construction. You would think cities of this size would collapse under their own weight. How far we have come from sustainable communities. Pick your high point. WTC1, Chrysler Building, Empire State ... there is even a book dedicated to the high buildings of NYC, about 100 of them with observation decks.

The Best Skyline. It is strange to rate a skyline, but this particular skyline is world famous. Can be viewed from several lofty observation points (Empire State Building, Top of the Rock and the new World Trade Centre observatory level). Also viewed from cruise boats from the harbour view.
Gorgeous views day or night. Gorgeous views day or night! After a trip to or from the city always stop for photos with the family!
Seeing Forever. The observatory at One World Trade is amazing. The elevator up is a treat and the views are simply spectacular.

Like the old gray mare, "she ain't what she used to be"!. I have lived in Manhattan non-stop since 1963. (Yes, that's over a half century!) My first visit was 1956 and included a visit to the top observation deck of the Empire State Building -- where we could look down on the huge Wanamaker Building fire that afternoon. For a kid from Central Vermont, that view of the skyline was more than impressive.I have, since moving here, viewed the city's skyline from hundreds of angles. Until the mid-1980s or so, I have loved showing these views to visiting friends and family members. The sights were magnificent!HOWEVER, this is absolutely no longer the case! Rampant and largely unregulated construction of hundreds of UGLY skyscrapers with no regard whatsoever for line or beauty has turned my pride in the city to an unwillingness to show it off anymore! It's all part of the ruin of the city caused by the real estate industry! (Unfortunately, It has spread to the other boroughs, too!) Greed seems always to promote uglinesss.I'll still escort visitors to the top of Empire State ... but only if they insist.One possible helpful hint: wait until after dark and take the Staten Island ferry out from southern Manhattan. As you board, hang back and stand on the rear of the boat. As you move away from the ferry slip, that awesome display of light opens up as a magnificent panorama before your eyes. When you reach Staten Island, just get off the boat, follow the signs through the terminal and go back down the entrance ramp (you'll get on the same boat when it next leaves). This time, move through the boat quickly to the front -- and take your photos (that you may have missed on the trip out) of the beautifully lighted Statue of Liberty! Oh, yeah! I should mention that the round trip is FREE!
awe inspiring. Best views i have come to see in almost any oart of the world. I think its best seen at night. As you seen it at its best.
Very touristy. Empire State building gets packed at night. Yet a must see. Instead of waiting at for the second elevator we used stair well for last 6 floors.

Manhattan by sail. I wish we could have had a tourist guide on board to tell us more about the places we've seen. The tour operator opted instead for a wet bar that sold rather pricey cocktails even during the Happy Hour.

Gorgeous to photograph in the evening!. What can you say about the best photo opportunity in the world of the greatest city and skyline you could ask for? This is a once in a life time scene and a photographic haven for a photographer. Architectural master pieces on a lovely skyline that makes you fall in love with this lovely sight!

Views of George Washinton bridge at sunset. We were staying in Washinton Heights and a local told us about the wonderful sunset views of Washinton Brisdge and the New Jersey shoreline. We found a great spot on the wall and waited. We were not disappointed. If you are up that way, take some time to enjoy the views

Manhattan Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline was observed from two different places. I saw it from the Brooklyn Bridge, as the plane arrived in New York, and at night from across the East River. What a sight with all the light glowing.

Manhattan skyline from the Staten island ferry. the best way to see the Manhattan skyline is by boat. go down to the bottom of the island and catch the Staten Island Ferry, it's FREE, Fantastic.We got on the ferry and bought a cup of coffee from a couple of guys, who supported the Pakistani cricket team, so i spent my outward journey chatting to them about cricket. When we got to Staten island, we just stayed on the ferry, and came straight back.The view from the Ferry is fantastic. you can see the skyline laid out in front of you.a added bonus is you sail close to the Statue of Liberty and you get some great photos of the Lady. But beware, if you get a coffee, don't tell them you like cricket.

Nothing quite like it............. Seeing the Manhattan skyline is an amazing experience. Yes, you see it in the movies and pictures, but seeing it in person is an amazing experience. Beautiful by day and by night.
World Renowed. A trip to NYC always starts with the view of the city as you arrive. The skyline is breathtaking. World class skyline for a world-class city.
A top must. The famed skyline is not overrated. It is fabulous and it is always changing. New buildings which one cannot always identify are cropping up and the view is unsurpassed.

Top of Rockefeller Centre is worth the price!. We wondered about spending $ 30 per person to go to the Observation deck of Rockefeller Centre - which we felt it was worth it!!! We got to look AT the Empire State building, which is special, the views are incredible, and at the highest level, you can be outdoors with no glass to mar the view. It was fabulous!

Get the ferry to Staten Island for superb views!. Iconic view! Hop on the Staten Island Ferry (for free!!!), although you have to disembark and get a different one back. Wander along the shore for more views and visit the very moving 9/11 Memorial to local people.
Nothing beats this view. It is #1. Expansive but grim and dirty. It makes most other USA cities pale in comparison...but keep in mind that the closer you get the dirtier and oppresive it becomes.
New York New York. Nothing like it. It's defiantly a must see. New York is absolutely amazing would definitely go back again and again

Excellent walk. I was in NY, this year. Manhattan skyline was a great way of knowing Manhattan from another perspective. It was a pity I joined the walk just minutes before its closing and I think it is worth doing it during the day, but to finish in the evening, because Manhattan lights can be also appreciated from the Sky.
What a view!!!. Is there anything more iconic. The best place to view is from Brooklyn. View both daytime and at night for an interesting contrast.
Iconic!!. I think there is not much to say about Manhattan Skyline. This is one of the places that you have to see at least once in your life. The views from the Brooklyn Bridge are stunning.

WOW - This will make it anight to remember. Take the nightime bus tour and enjoy the full spectacle of the Manhattan Skyline. Cross the Brookline Bridge and park up in a spot facing back to Manhattan - the view of the nightime skyline is stunning and portrays the full majesty of the place.
Lovely skyline of Manhattan. I was so glad to see such a great view of a great city. You know you are in New York when you see the Manhattan skyline.

What a skyline!. Iconic. Didn't think I'd enjoy a skyline so much! Viewed from Empire State, paid the extra to go to the 102nd floor, on a slightly hazy day but still amazing. We spent much longer tha we ever would have thought gazing over NYC.
To see Manhattan go to Brooklyn. Brooklyn is incredible, super nice townhouses. From the promenade you have a magnificent view of the Manhattan Peninsula. Breath taking at any kind of weather!
Skyline. What a great view! Everyone should experience seeing this in person at least once during their lifetime.
A must-go if you have yet to visit. A must see if it's the first time you are visiting the Big Apple! Great view, and definitely worth the walk.

Live the Cliche. And love every minute of doing so!! Recommend the Empire State Building at night or for the more laid back 5 star experience the rooftop bar at 60 Margaret Street in the Tribeca area. Not too many skylines can compete with my beloved Sydney but this place can - big time!!
Wonderful. Its amazing and like everything you see in movies, tv and print. Walk and try to pick out landmarks - its awesome.
NYC's Best. Historic and brilliant, the skyline of NYC. Seen best from the empire state building or the New Jersey parks.

The View from our hotel across the Hudson River!. We are watching the skyline tonight from our room-- enjoyed it up close during the day today as we visited Ground Zero, 911 Memorial, Times Square, Central Park. More to see tomorrow!
See this from a boat!. Went on a boat tour and was able to see the entire skyline of Manhattan from the boat. That is a must do!
Best skyline view. I have seen nyc by helicopter, traveled around Manhattan in a boat, but. As far as I am concerned the best skyline view is on the ferry from Brooklyn.

Bright lights. Breath taking and everyone needs to visit. The billboard must be seen at night to get to see their true beauty. It goes on for miles so please make sure that you wear your walking shoes.

One of the country's best. The city's skyline is stunning because of both the old classics, like the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building, and the newer stunners, including the Freedom Tower. If you're not able to stay on a high floor of one of the city's hotels, be sure to visit one of the observatory floors open to tourists.

Breath Taking. There is nothing like the Manhattan Skyline anytime of the year. This is one sight you need to see in person. Movies, tv or books does not do it justice. The glowing lights from the buildings, moon glimmering on the water and the boats going by was awesome.
Stunning. The most recognisable skyline in the world has been enhanced by the Freedom Tower which must now be one of the best if not the best attraction in Manhattan.
Viewing the Skyline. Went to the top of the rock and Empire State building-Breathtaking view and immense amount of history re: the construction of the Empire State Building.

Iconic Towers. Funny how a collection of buildings can become iconic. When you see this skyline in a movie you recognize it. Even if you've never been there, it is a part of most Americans' life. From devastation to euphoria this is something that must be seen to capture great and tragic moments in history.

Best seen from Liberty State Park. Unless you stop to think it through, you'll go to Manhattan to see the Manhattan skyline, and miss it. If you're in Manhattan, take a ferry to Liberty State Park, in Jersey City, New Jersey. You'll find a great walkway, an architectural treasure (built for the rail lines taking immigrants from Ellis Island into the hinterlands) and fantastic views of the skyline and of the Statue of Liberty. Take a picnic and stay awhile or just figure out that you're on to something and start dazzling your friends. Ferry is the most direct from Manhattan, but auto is preferable from anywhere else.

Almost limitless versions of "The Manhattan Skyline", and they are all pretty cool!. The Empire State Building, and now the "Freedom Tower" are the two buildings that immediately stand out as part of the "Manhattan Skyline". Like the canyons, buttes, and mesas out west, the views change by the hour and throughout the year. I think the views from NJ, across the Hudson are the best, but others might like the views from Brooklyn. One of the free attractions in NYC!
Amazing. The Manhattan skyline gives a true feeling that you are in US , it is something people imagined only before coming here for first time , NYC is the actual downtown of US.
Iconic. Iconic in every way. Something everyone wants to see and it really is impressive form off the island. If you want an up close and personal view go to "Top of the Rock"

Amazing View. If you want the feel of NYC, the skyline view is a must. While there are many places to see the view- Brooklyn Bridge Park in NYC and Jersey City (Exchange Place Path Station or Near Hudson River walkway in front of Hyaat Regency) area are some of the spots where you can see this amazing skyline and click pictures too.
The million dollar view. See the Manhattan skyline while on the Ferry to the statue of liberty of Ellis island. It has many locations for some great photography

Cruising out of New York. We were cruising out of New York on the Norwegian Gem on our way to Canada and the New England area. It was worth it just for the view of the city skyline, the new World Trade, and the Statue of Liberty. And then passing under the Verrazano Bridge...way cool! One imagines what it would've been like to be coming to America in the early 20th century going past "Lady Liberty". Wow!

Perspective is everything. Whether it's just me, I don't know but when I am in Manhatten everything is big.... But it never looks mind-blowingly big. I just thing that building like the Empire State should look like they tower of everything else. They just don't.Until you get on a ferry, that is. As the boat pulls further and further away from Battery Park, the really tall buildings suddenly rise up above the others, until you are well of shore and their is a clear difference.It's all about perspective. I would recommend taking the Staten Island Ferry just to experience the NYC skyline as it should be.
Top of the world!. Probably the best in the world too, Tokyo and mega cities in China still can't match it (Shanghai's Pudong getting close).

Manhattan. This is the city that never sleeps and is a must visit destination . The views are breath taking either from Brooklyn or the top of many high buildings. Such a diverse city of many cultures .

The sun going down behind Manhatton must be seen. You may have seen the Manhatton Skyline in books or on television but nothin beats seeing it from a boat on the Hudson. We saw it first on an early evening boat trip with the sun going down behind the buildings. It is a magnificent site not to be missed.
Amazingly beautiful!!. The Manhattan skyline gives one of the best views of the NewYork city.The view is so beautiful and inspiring.Attached is the view of New York city skyline from Hoboken side.
Manhattan. Smaller than I thought as New York is a lot like London big in character but you can get around very easily and quickly.

New York, New York. The sky line is everything you have seen in magazines, papers and on the TV and Films, but more!.What a mind blowing place it is, the buildings truly are 'Sky Scrappers'.The city is amazingly clean given its size, an amazing place.
Free Ferry Ride. Take the Staten island Ferry its FREE go around sun set and you'll have beautiful photos of the city, the sunset and its all FREE.

Beautiful Day or Night. Saw it from many different locations at many different times and all were great. Think the best views were from the Statue of Liberty and at top of Empire State Building. Loved the lights on the Chrysler Building at night and the 4th of July lights on Empire State.
Beautiful NYC skyline. Beautiful!!! The new Freedom Tower is now a part of the NYC skyline. Amazing views from Top of the Rock, and the Statue of Liberty ferry.
Stunning. Sunday morning wandering through Lexington Ave street fsir gazing at the Chrysler Building in the sun - besutiful!

Manhattan, a skyview. The views from the Heliport are beautiful and if you get a nice clear day which there are a lot of you will see some magnificent sights, there are a few Heliports you can do this from but I chose the one on the East Side at about 30th Street. For under $100.00 we were able to fly around Manhattan see all the Bridges, the skyline, Statue of Liberty, and Central Park. Make sure you bring a decent camera because you're in for some awesome sightseeing
