Nothing like it!. We took a ferry tour that took us around the lower part of Manhattan and over to Brooklyn. The views of the skyline are amazing!

Kidnapped to Manhattan. Sat in Central Park and look at the Manhattan Skyline. Worth every penny I spent for that view. Watched kids play in the park as the urban jungle of the city wavered in the background.

Thank you Macy's for the best fireworks ever!. My husband and I took a dinner cruise out on the East River to watch the Macy's 4th of July fireworks. The skyline with the Empire State Building all lit up in red, white and blue and the Freedom tower glistening in lights, were spectacular!
spectacular. attended the Macy's fireworks... very well organized and run. The whole Police Force was out and made us all feel very safe. The lines were long but quick and no problems at all
Beautiful. We viewed the skyline from the statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn bridge and a few other places. It was spectacular. NYC is a beautiful city!

great for July 4th. We were able to watch the fireworks and experience the New York city fireworks from a friend's rooftop near midtown. The view was amazing that the fireworks were something to remember. However, the fireworks are on the East side, so keep that in mind.

Skyline. We have seen it numerous times from the One World building to the Crown Line waterway tour. Both are highly recommended. There are also Sunday Jazz Brunch waterway tours which we enjoyed. We were last there in June 2015 and will be back in December.
one of the great sights in the country. one of the great sights in the USA. can be seen from bridges, boats, and even from the city itself. unique as NYC is.
Stunning. You get stunning views from the Hudson, Empire State and Top of the Rock as well as the newly opened Freedom Tower

Beautiful skyline. We took the subway to Brooklyn and enjoyed the Manhattan Skyline as we walked across the Brooklyn Bridge. It is well worth the trip. We visited DUMBO while in Brooklyn which is also worth a visit.

Spectacular views. Nothing like it anywhere else.
Views seen from 30 rock, empire state, and a ferry sightseeing tour were fantastic.
Highly recommend both night and day visits.
See for miles and miles!. From any boat, Circle line, Statue of Liberty boat, Staten Island ferry.....Awesome, certainly worth some picture taking!
Just like the movies. What ever you may think off when you hear the words New York , this is right up there , it looks spectacular when views looking back from the ferry .

Just as you've seen on the movies. It's everything you ever imagined. Its okay from the streets, great from the parks & terrific from the water. 1 round trip on the Staten Island ferry gets you the most iconic view & it's completely free

world-class. Many cities have buildings that are taller or more modernl, but very few cities have so many historic and architecturally-beautiful buildings as the Manhattan skyline. If you get to see it from one of the local helicopter tours, boat cruises, ferries, or the Jersey side, it can be even more spectacular. It is truly the City that never sleeps and can be appreciated 24/7.
Amazing Skyline. Manhattan Skyline is an amazing experience. The skyscrapers in New York city is very well placed. Every visitor must have the glimpse at Manhattan Skyline.

Iconic. A life time memorable view which is great to reflect back on.
Worth seeing both during the day and the night
Wow. take a ferry out and go see this! Best views of the city in all its power! Perfect pictures! Photographers dream
Amazing at night. We took a night bus tour which was fun. Very good value for money especially when you book a three day package.

Empire State Building. A must for all visitors is the Empire State make sure it's a clear day views are spectacular , tip if you can afford it buy the express pass saves you time as you miss what can be very long waits to buy tickets.
Amazing. Best seen from an open top bus tour or the top of the platform of the Statue of Liberty. Also worth seeing on a night bus tour.

Best sunset!. Wallking the Brooklyn bridge at sunset is a must when visiting Manhattan... once you reach Brooklyn, walk the promenade for a great view of the Manhattan skyline at night! Crossing the bridge can get a bit windy in the evening!
Breath taking. The view of the sky line from Ellis Island is breath taking. Would recommend this. I liked view from across the river

Exuberant. Love NY city and love to photograph the skyline during both day and night. There is something in the skyline that makes me excited. It looks different from different angles. From the ferry, on the way to Lincoln Tunnel, Liberty Island, NJ Side, Brooklyn Bridge.....the beauty never ends.

My City New York City. Go there and see it this is the city of all cities in the world. I have been to all the big one in Europa Asia Africa South and North America. If I can choose a city to be mine it must be New York
picturesque. Love the skyline from a far before we enter the island. You can see empire state building, one world trade, etc.

Beautiful skyline!. Manhattan Skyline is amazing to see from New Jersey, from the bridges, from your hotel room on an upper floor. Always ask for a room with a view for a couple reasons - less street noise and better view! The skyline is always changing, but yet always the same.
Week after week I visit it and it never gets boring!

Iconic skyline... now with Freedom Tower added. It will never be the same without The Twins of WTC, but it looks great with newly open Freedom Tower.If you are staying in Jersey City there is no way you miss it. Fantastic photo-ops from both the Exchange and Hoboken. For a complete perspective, feel free to book a tour on a boat - anything will do, honestly. Also, check it out from a Brooklyn Bridge.
Stars against the night in the skyline. Breathtaking view with colors to match. A true New York experience. Can't leave NY until you see it at sunrise and sundown.
A week to see the sights in New York.. Just a visual feast... You must see it from both Liberty Island ( get some outstanding pics) and also front the Staten Island Ferry
Not to be missed. One of the most iconic skylines in the world and not to be missed. Best seen from the top of the Rock or from one of the many tour boats.
Night time. for a great view of the sky line take a night cruise, taxis will take you down to the piers.Amazing!

Circle Line boat trip. Hazy weather though hot on the day we went, so skyline not that clear. Commentary ok but very parochial - overseas visitors like us have not a clue what the rather opinionated guide was talking about. The 1.5 trip is definitely long enough.
Breath Taking. We viewed it from the top of the Rock get there early to avoid the queues which are not as long as the ones for the empire state and the view is the same.
Iconic. Try going on one of the ferries or boat rides to get a great view. Brooklyn bridge has a nice view too!

Skyline at Night. Go to Brooklyn by the sports piers to get a classic night picture of it. You can see it on the Hop On Hop Off Bus (Grey Line) night tour, "Downtown" segment. The bus stops for about ten minutes for people to take pictures of it and the Brooklyn Bridge. If your camera takes good pictures, the shot will be great for blowing up and making a poster size picture.

Manhattan Skyline. This is the view that you see in so many photos and TV. It is the best skyline view that I've seen. Stay in a hotel in Jersey and you have this view every time you look out of your hotel room
This should be an item on your bucket list!. If seeing the Manhattan Skyline is not on your bucket list, that list is not complete. This is a must!

The architects in NY are great!. I just love seeing the different building structures! The ere are so many different styles yet so much of the old feeling still remains in the city. Seeing the skyline at night is still the best and gives you the best pics ever! A must!

Worth the trip!. Manhattan Skyline is 'complete' again with the Freedom Tower open for business. We viewed it from the Empire State Building (best at sunset), from a old schooner sailing on the Hudson near the Statue of Liberty, and from a helicopter. All are spectacular and highly recommended!

Beautiful Skyline. What can I say? It's the Manhattan Skyline! It's amazing. It's grand. It's beautiful. The hustle and bustle of the city streets is an experience itself, but seeing it from a distance is very tranquil.
Amazing. Amazing especially from the Brooklyn Bridge. I wished I had seen it at night time as well. If walking to Brooklyn you will need to stop and look back.

Spectacular Manhattan Skyline. Amazing to see the skyline from New Jersey (Edgewater, Fort Lee, Hoboken, Jersey City, etc.).....also great views from the George Washington Bridge. However, for longer views, stick to Jersey or take a ferry across from Weehawkin. Brooklyn offers a mirror image of the view. Great photo ops.

Sites and Sounds of Manhattan worth a trip!. Stayed in Manhattan only for a weekend to surprise my gf. Had a great time! The different views throughout Manhattan and sites you can see are absolutely worth a trip.
gorgeous views. Had a great time when i visited this past month!!Great presentation, stunning views!! highly reccomend for a great experience!!

Best City Skyline!!. I don't think any other US skyline can beat Manhattan. Of course the best views are from New Jersey. Stayed in Jersey City and ate at a restaurant just across the Hudson. Great views from Liberty Park and the restaurant there is very good.
Great from every angle. No matter if you see this from the air, water taxi, skyscraper, pavement or the Statue of Liberty, you will be impressed and wowed with the incredible view.
Most impressive. Best seen by helicopter, or from vantage points such as across the George Washington Bridge, the RFK Bridge, or the Circle Line Ferry circling Manhattan
Like No Other. There are several places to get a view of the skyline, including New Jersey, Brooklyn and the observatories at the WTC and Empire State Building. Like no other in the world.
Gotham Skyline - Amazing!. Perhaps one of the most famous skylines in the world, the Manhattan Skyline is without compare. To truly appreciate it's colorful beauty, it is best seen at night.
Wow. One of a kind! Must experience in person to truly appreciate the awesomeness of the majestic view. Take lots of pictures.

One of the most beautiful views I've ever seen. Nothing can quite describe the breathtaking view of the Manhattan Skyline. Day or night it is simply spectacular! From many spots throughout Manhattan you can catch a wonderful view. My favorites are from Liberty Island and from the Empire State Building. It is just truly something to see at least once in your lifetime.
Nice. Great for a stroll. The views are great. It does tend to get a bit crowded though, but you wouldn't expect anything different from NYC.

Previously Undiscovered View..... ...at least for me it was. I was in NYC for a business trip and decided to use public transportation to get around, instead of being stuck in traffic and paying a fortune for cabs. As part of my trip, I had to visit a client office in Jersey City, and I took the PATH over. When I arrived in JC, coming out of the station, you are deposited into a nice waters edge/boardwalk area, with a terrific view back over the skyline. If you have an extra hour and want a view most NYC visitors don't get, take the $5 trip over to JC, it is worth it.
Stunning. Of course no trip to the city would be complete without seeing it. views from The Statue of Liberty were outstanding as they were from the New York by Night Tour. A must see!

On a clear night. Late in a clear warm June evening went to top of Empire State Bldg. Wait to get there was long, but worth it. You could see all the places you'd visited in the daytime. Was my teenage granddaughter's favourite thing to experience!
Beautiful. I would suggest a water taxi awsome. You DO SEE the skyline. Or do a water tour. Either way so worth it.

World Trade Center skyline. Waited a long time and drinks were expensive
View was incredible. Elevator trip was cool with the video. Nice presentation
Manhattan heart of N.Y.. there is nothing like this view, no matter where you might be. This view is even more exciting in the evening.
Highlight of the trip. We did a boat cruise up the Hudson as twilight was falling & there was some stunning views of the city as all the skyscrapers started to light up

Amazing. I guess its probably one of the most famous skylines in the world, every TV show or movie shot in NYC has a panoramic shot of it and being there to soak it in was well worth the effort. An amazing city and a wonderful skyline.
Thrilling !. This to me says Ny as much as The Statue of Liberty what an awesome beautiful site I get excited thinking I can come back some day and see it again !

An Awesome Sight. Stunningly beautiful, the skyline is best seen at night. Do yourself a favor and view it from the Staten Island ferry (free) heading into Manhattan or take a bus ride from Port Authority to Weehauken, NJ and stand along the water. It is an awesome view to see the skyline and the Freedom Tower in all of its glory!
The most famous in the world. The most famous skyline, great view from many places. Impressive. Nice to view from Brooklyn. Live being in a movie

anywhere on the west side is a great view. The best time to see the skyline is a sunset, the sky turns blue and pink and you can get great photos. No need to do it from the water, just walk or drive among the west side highway.
top of the rock. Breathtaking - worth taking over and over. Multiple views, enjoy lunch at the many wonderful restaurants in the lobby when done.

the ulimate. can there be a better man-made view anywhere in the world? everywhere you look is history, record-breaking buildings and movie sets. i recommend one trip to the top of the empire state at night and one to the top of the rock in the daytime.

View from the Rock. Save this for a nighttime visit as the lights of the city are fantastic! Since it is open until midnight I would advise going around nine or later as the crowds really thinned out then.
Awesome. Everyone knows and has seen pictures of the Manhattan skyline and does not disappoint. The 1 World Trade Centre tower towers above everything.

newyork.......Awesome........ What can i say.........breath taking........the night life is just as good in the day........the food is fantastic.........evrything about new york and Manhattan...... is brill...........
Best view from the boat. If you have a couple of hours time, the boat trip around Manhattan island is highly recommendable. Spectacular views!
Top of the Rock. We took the tour and went to the Top of the Rock.....not to be missed. The view is fantastic and the tour is very interesting.

Most famous Skyline. Whether you come in by plane or if you see the skyline from a ferry its really impressive how many skyscrapers Manhattan has. I always wanted t see it and i didn't regret taking a trip to New York.
Besides its skyline Manhatten has got quite some other very nice attractions!
Enjoy your trip,
Alex
Awesome view. best seen at night, from either one of the many bus tours, or from the Top of the Roc. This would be a great spot to ask someone to marry you, fortunately I'm already married...

Amazing, views, well worth taking the helicopter flight. Amazing, views, well worth taking the helicopter flight. We got to see the whole of New York, flying round the Statue of Liberty, over where the twin towers were, right up to Central Park and back. Briiliant

Light up the Skyline. There is something very special about the New York skyline. Your first view is usually in the cab on the way to your hotel from the airport. However, my favourite view is to take the Staten Island ferry from Manhattan in the afternoon. On the way out you get the view of the skyscrapers as the sun goes down. Then, if you timing is right, you get the view of the Manhattan Skyline on the way back with the lights coming on in the buildings and you see it in all it's glory with all lights blazing!
Best view of skyline. Best views of skyline is from Brooklyn Bridge Park and Staten Island Ferry. Did those in the daytime and at night for the lights.
Coming Home. Every time I see the skyline I know I'm closer to home so how could I not love it? It's iconic, and a must see for New York Lovers.

Manhattan skylines. We didn't plan to see it from the distance but a flight's change to Newark allows it. It was amazing to see Manhattan Skyline from short and medium distances, quite different views and feellings made the experience awesome. Something you shouldn't miss if having the opportunity to travel from NJ to NY

Breathtaking architecturally !. Did the ferry out to the Statue of Liberty , what a stunning view of the manhattan skyline you get from there! How many photos can you take? Lots!!!!! Was great to get a different perspective from the water
Beautiful view from the water. It's worth taking some time to get off the island of Manhatten to see it from afar, either from the Brooklyn Bridge or from the water etc. You won't be disappointed.:)

Great view. Just gorgeous! Went to top of the rock on this most beautiful clear day!We were lucky,as many told us it had raide for several days.You go through alot of security for top of the ROCK,but very worth it,and very décent price!

Take advantage of bus or boat tours to enjoy Manhattan Skyline. If you are new to New York you need to go on a bus tour and maybe a boat tour. Plus you can go for free on the staten Island Ferry or on Sundays go by boat free to Governor's Island - - take advantage of the boat tours and enjoy looking back on way out and look forward on the return journey to a wonderful skyline. If you go to Brooklyn to Grimaldi's Pizzeria (best pies in New York- despite no alcohol licence or air conditioning) you can stand on the shore and have the most beautiful view across to manhattan on the newly re furbished shoreline where many a wedding party turns up for the backdrop photos of Manhattan.
Fantastic!. It looks like be in a dream. The best way to understand the beautiness of Manhattan! I suggest go to brooklyn Heights

NYC from a different angle. It is interesting to see NYC from a different perspective. However, after a while, you may want to walk by the streets. I would recommend paying attention to the many art pieces hidden between the buildings... specially graffitis.

Manhattan Skyline. Manhattan Skyline never ceases to amaze and with the new WTC area taking shape especially with the main tower completed it's back to its best.The older stalwarts- Empire State, Chrysler are still equally impressive and prepare for neck-ache as you constantly look up to the sights.
Majestic Skyline. The skyline was majestic and breath-taking. So large, powerful and historic, with varying heights and architectural styles.

NYC tips. We took the train from Wilmington De to NYC instead of driving. It was worth the money as no hassles or worries about driving and parking. Everything is accessible with sub ways which are fairly easy to use. Do watch out for pan handlers though. We decided to buy our passes to the Empire State building and the 911 memorial on the train. Good decision because I got to go ahead of the line at the Empire State building (the line was wrapped around the building!) and we didn't have to wait in line for a very long time at the 911 memorial (you reserve a time slot). Neither site rushed us through so it was really enjoyable.
stunning. I can never tire of the views from within the city, from the river, from the viewing points e.g. Empire state. One World centre and Brooklyn. ever changing.

I will never forget this!. I stayed on the other side for 4 months and have seen the Manhattan Skyline during mornings / evenings / nights.It's been unforgettable experience. You will love watching the skyline during different timing of the day.
Breathless. Beautiful from any side you can see it. The buildings to the bridges it is amazing. From the water or Brooklyn is the best sight!

A wonderful way to see New York without the hustle and bustle. It was beautifully peaceful in the busy city, it allowed you to take a pleasant stroll through out New York, view the harbor. Beautiful plants and views. A really nice place to stroll / sit and relax. You dont feel that you are walking as far as you do. Nice to get out of the city crowds but still see the city

Iconic skyline. I must admit to feeling the wow factor when travelling in from the airport in the dark and seeing the Manhattan skyline all lit up, its like a scene from a Woody Allen movie, it just needed the music playing at the same time.It will stay with you forever, that first view, it is so impressive.Cant wait to see it again, sometime before i die
Iconic. This is the iconic, movie moment view that you think of when you imagine New York. I love it! Be sure to take a selfie and enjoy a cup of coffee or a picnic with this view in the background!

Take one of the boat tours, relax, enjoy. Hectic city, of course. Lots to do, lots of people wanting to do the same things you're doing. Take a couple hours in the afternoon & check out of one of the boat tours. Unparalleled views of the skyline, very relaxing (and I have a fear of water -- these boats are big, no worries) and you get a chance to just talk, maybe have a glass of wine, enjoy without the waiting & the hassles. And you see the Statue of Liberty from the perfect point of view - the water! Definitely a plus plus experience.

Awesome sight !!!. Unlike any other city in the United States this skyline is just amazing ! Now with the Freedom Tower completed it is even more majestic. It just goes on and on with building as high as you can see, especially when you are standing at the base. Just something to see.
High Line at night. Walk the High Line at night, open until 11pm. Not crowded, cool lighting on plants and great views all around.
Love the View. Awesome view of New York City. A great place to see the whole city. The cool breeze from the river made it a great place to sit and relax
Nothing like it. saw it from the Circle Line Boat tour, great sites, saw all the main bridges and where different important people live/lived

a skyline like no other. The Manhattan skyline is like no other in the world, at night it's really special. It's even attractive in the rain and on a day or night with low level clouds or fog. Especially from the ferry
Look up all the time. Where I come from in Scotland we don't have high sky scrapers just amazing walking about the city and looking at the new ones and the old ones

simply the best. Love NY. See the skyline while walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Or see it from LI City. Venture out of the norm. Go over the bridges. Most people stick to Manhattan and I will never understand why.
Breathtaking. the manhattan skyline is awesome. Best viewed in one of the many open top bus tours which are available. We used citysightseeing which we got with the new York pass.
great view from the harbour tour. iconic skyline looks fantastic from the harbour, good to have a commentary on the buildings and historic aspects.

Beautiful Manhattan from Brooklyne Bridge Park. Crossing the Brooklyne Bridge on foot is an experience by itself. No one should miss it while visiting NYC. After crossing the bridge just walk down to Brooklyne Bridge Pard and you will ger a dreat view on not only the Manhattan skyline but lots of other things. A must activity.
Nothing Beats the skyline. To me this is New York. After seeing this skyline in so many movies and tv shows I was awe struck by it. Truly America!
Pictures don't do it justice. The view from the ferry to/from the Statue of Liberty was amazing...but wow, my pictures don't even come close to expressing the experience.
Amazing. Simply amazing. Great photo opportunities. Brilliant views from Brooklyn Bridge. Fantastic views from a boat.
Stunning Views. Can't say much more about this view but wow I could never tire of looking at the Manhattan Skyline - from both the Hudson and the east river, the views are amazing

Every time this was awesome!. Saw this from liberty island (have to do joint boat trip ellis island) , photo spot great! Then again from top of the rock (and over central park) and nighttime from the free statten island ferry (you can do a round trip straight away at night). Stunning!

Manhattan: The Financial district, that's it.. Probably I am a spoiled European tourist, but Manhattan really disappointed me. 5 days walking thru Manhattan. Central Park, 5th avenue, Midtown, Downtown, Time Square, etc ... The fifth avenue is quite low profile compared with Paris Champs Elysee. Ugly and narrow. OK, about the skyline. Midtown is very disappointing. Old grey buildings for the average of them. Special ones : Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Centre. Crossed the area from South to North and West to East.The Financial district is the place to be. Been 1 of the first 4000 foreigners to visit the One World Trade center, the highest tower. Beautiful architecture, nice and beautiful area. A must do. The best boat trip you can get of Circle Lines. A 1 hour trip on East and Hudson river to see that skyline of South Manhattan. It is nice, but expected more. I have seen Pudong in Shanghai, may be it not more impressive, but beautiful it is.I just expected more of the skyline and Manhattan.

Breath Taking. The Manhattan Skyline is absolutely breath taking and overwhelming at the same time. From whatever observation area you choose to visit, you will see thousands of rooftops and fabulous scenery highlighting the BIg Apple,

BAZINGA. it was so beautiful, especially at night. I took a night tour and it was just amazing. All the lights Beautifully lit Bridges, It is breath taking. I sat on top of the bus for a bird's eye view. Next time I will bring my spouse so he can enjoy it just as much as myself.

Stunning!. The view from the Top of the Rock or from the Circle Line boat were all just stunning ways to view the Manhattan Skyline. We purchased the New York Pass (no I don't work for them) & were able to save at least $100-$150 on all of the attractions we went to see during the short time we were there. We hit the ground running!
Amazing. Such beautiful views of the city at night. We hopped on the red double decker bus and saw the beautiful lights. Be sure to do this

Nothing like Manhattan skyline anyhwere in the world!. Skyline of Manhattan never ceases to impress me even aftervisiting NY a dozen times past nine years. The view especially from NJ side across the Hudson river makes one truly appreciates the immense scales and sizes of this man made concrete jungle. Even after travelling to over 45 countries around the world, it never ceases to impress me.Truly one of a kind!!

No Place Like It. Spent last week in New York and had a great time. I was so impressed at how stunning the Manhattan skyline looks from the Statue of Liberty that I went out to liberty a second time to take more pics. One example posted here. Great place!

Too good to believe, best in the world. I was lucky enough to be staying across the river Hudson in jersey city right on the river front where I could enjoy the Manhattan skyline downtown and midtown every day and night. It's just amazing.
gorgeous. The views were spectacular and of great photo quality. Highly reccommend to come and see for yourself this great place.

A sight like no other in the world. It is best to see the NYC skyline from Brooklyn waterfront near the Brooklyn or Manhattan Bridges. I suggest you go in the afternoon and stay till sunset and you will be blown away in the colors and lights. Bring a camera, drinks, sandwiches and sit on the grass or benches along the riverfront.

What is there to say? It's iconic.. There's nothing like the Manhattan skyline. Take the Staten Island Ferry or walk back *into* the city from Brooklyn via the Brooklyn Bridge to get a nice view. It's great!

Awesome! No other words. The best way to see skyline and Lady Liberty and a "must DO" is a sunset cruise. Spend the money, take the time.....it will be the best "tourist" thing you do while in NYC. We took the circle line and it was perfect, but a dinner and dance cruise would be amazing for a romantic evening

See the Skyline from many views. We recently walked across the Brooklyn Bridge as the sun was getting ready to set and we could watch the city as the lights of night came on. The next day we went to the top of the Metropolitan Art Museum and looked at the skyline from their rooftop. Finally views of the city from the Top of the Rock are wonderful as well. Nothing like this impressive city of towers.

City of Cities. The New York skyline is simply amazing and something that pictures can never justly deliver. An amazing feat for mankind and the ultimate city for just about anything you want to do. Breathtaking, similar to the first time you see a mountain or ocean scape.

Best ever seen!. Hands down ,this is the best in America that I have seen.Every American should visit 'Greatest City in The World".Even from 30,000 feet above it stands out when passing in the jet streams.

Evolving Skyline. I saw the Manhattan Skyline from the top of Empire State and Top of the Rock, from Brooklyn and a great view from Greenwood Cemetery near Prospect Park. It is such an iconic skyline which evolves every year. Venture out of Manhattan to see it

like in the movies. We had the Chance to see the Skyline from a couple of places.
From the Top of the Rockefeller Center and the Empire State Building. It's a codak Moment.

One of the best in the world. Loved it - particularly from the water. Make sure to do a Statue of Liberty cruise and enjoy the Manhattan Skyline from the sea - nothing else like it. It's an eclectic mix of buildings of old and new - but it all works. What a city!
The best skyline in the world!. I love flying into LaGuardia airport and driving into Manhattan. The view from the bridge never ceases from giving me the goosebumps!
Out of this World. Manhattan skyline seen from the Staten Island Ferry must rate as one of the best views of mans creation on this Earth. One World Trade Centre looks truly amazing!!!

unique skyline must be seen from different spots. Wanne get nice views of the city?
Go to the top of the rock, Empire State and Observatory One. Then take a boat around Manhattan. Spend the sunset in Hoboken (NJ) staring at the Island. Brooklyn bridge also offers a unique view. Last, but not least, the Queens docks.
Best Seen from The River. Beautiful sight at night especially from the water. From that perspective you miss all the grime and unusal smells. There are some truly unique buildings.

still the most amazing sky line in the world. It really is amazing each time I come back how special this city is. In the meantime, I've been back to London and Paris but NYC is very special. Many new buildings have gone up in the 10 yrs I've been away but they add to the beauty. I always enjoy coming to NY.

Stunning, iconic skyline. We went over to Brooklyn and caught the passenger ferry between Williamsburg and Brooklyn bridges and took it to the stop near ground zero. Crossing the river gave clear unparalleled views of some of New York's finest skyscrapers including the new tower one at ground zero, the Empire State Building and many more. On,y a few dollars and a short ride this is a good alternative to walking over the Brooklyn bridge for a similar view.
Beautiful!. The view from Top of the Rock was beautiful! The elevator ride up was a great part of the experience.
Must see. How can you go to New York City and not see the Manhattan skyline at night?It's amazing how different it looks from the day to the nighttime, lots of quaint bars for a nightcap.Great views.

Manhattan - What a World-Class Skyline!. Whether seen from across the Hudson River in NJ, staring straight up at the monster buildings towering above as you stroll the pulsing streets, or from the observation deck on the 86th floor of The Empire State Building, the Manhattan skyline is distinctly New York, and most definitely the most recognizable and prominent skyline in the United States, if not the world. You've just got to take a trip and see it for yourself. The new One World Trade Center building is gorgeous, and surely will be iconic as time goes on. I highly recommend a visit.
Manhattan henge spectacular. I think it only happens every two years, when the sun aligns with Manhattan buildings on east/west streets. Terrific event....

Amazing. The Manhattan skyline is one of a kind. Others are right in that you get a great view from the ferries. Seeing it at different times of day makes for different experiences; also make sure it's a clear day. Smog makes it harder get a clear view.
So Good They Shoul Have Named It THREE Times!. Just blows you away! Awesome during the day but get yourself to the eastern side of the river to see most incredible sight at night.

Best Viewed From Staten Island Ferry, or Brooklyn.. We went to NYC twice last year and, on the second visit, we took the Staten Island Ferry and would certainly recommend this as the best way to view the skyline. That being said, on the first visit we walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and was an amazing view from the other side. The great thing about seeing the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry, is that it takes it time travelling each way, meaning that you can really soak it up and appreciate it. If you're heading over to Staten Island, sit at the back of the ferry and vice versa coming the other way... we really enjoyed it and got a hugh number of photographs which came out really well. I know it sounds silly, but this is a must do when in NYC - it's iconic. **Happy to answer questions**

One of a kind. I've had the privilege to see the New York skyline twice in my life. In my opinion it is been viewed from the Staten Island Ferry. I love the new Freedom Tower, but it just isn't the same.
breathtaking. So many times watched on movies, tv series, post cards... Watching the skyline is one of the must do in every NYC trip. You can do it by walking to Brooklyn, by sea or by air,

Peace where you least expect it. I still have so many friends who don't understand the peace I find in New York. This trip, took some photos of central park with the skyline of Manhattan in the background - Amazing!

Great place, amazing view of the city.. ecycling concept and excellent use of space are perfectly applied in the skyline of Manhattan.A former railway line is the space adapted to public promenade that reassess the city and gives the possibility to take a tour of about 12 km without pauses by the heart of Manhattan. It is recommended to go with comfortable shoes and camera!
amazing garden walk. a must see as this is a great place to get away from hustle and bustle of street level. Very well conceived and fantastic job done.
breathtaking. Our view was from Brooklyn and from the Top of the Rock. Absolutely beautiful. Wish I could've afforded the helicopter tour.l

Famous skyline. We've all seen it in pictures. It's every bit as glorious in person. No need to go to the 102nd floor of the Empire State Building; the view from any of the tall buildings is tremendous.

Beautiful skyline. Can be viewed from ground level or from Empire State and Top of the rock. Try and view after dark as well as through the day also beautiful view from the river. Never tired of taking photos
Beautiful skyline. This is a stunning view at any time of day or night. I thoroughly recommend walking across the Brooklyn Bridge and you will see some amazing skylines.

Quintessential New York: Classic big city older style skyscrapers. Views of the New York/Manhattan skyline can be seen from many different places. My preference is from the water capturing some of the water with the amazing views of the classic and iconic buildings right on the edge of the river. I also prefer the night view, but my camera was not good capturing that! We took in the views from the hop on/hop off Ferry. One thing: YES it's a great view. YES there is nothing like it in the world. However, other cities (Hong Kong, Shanghai) are also stunning yet very different. The New York "we are the best in the world" attitude gets old...

Walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Early one morning I took the subway down from 56th Street to ensure I beat the morning rush to the downtown and I walked the Brooklyn Bridge. It was a warm morning and to see the columns up close was quite special. Also, it gave me spectacular views of the skyline of Manhatten!! I would recommend this to anyone!

Beautiful!. We took the Staten Island Ferry. It is FREE! And a great way to travel. It gives you a fantastic view of Manhattan as well as Lady Liberty. Loved seeing the Freedom Tower. Still breaks my heart that the Towers aren't there and all that happened though do like the Freedom Tower.

Watch it from Brooklyn Heights. From Brooklyn Heights, the skyscrapers in Manhattan look splendid. The view is great at any time of day. During the day they're like glimmering towers of silver piercing the blue sky, and at night their lights look twice as beautiful reflected off the water.

Stunning. I loved seeing the skyline from lots of different vantage points. Google where is best - from Staten Ferry to Brooklyn Bridge there are lots of places to obtain some great views also take in the skyline at night!

So iconic!. The view of Manhattan is beautiful. We saw it from Top of the Rock, which was fantastic for close ups of buildings and viewing Central Park. However the view of Lower Manhattan from Liberty Island is really special.

A taste of the countryside right in the middle of New York. Great place to go to chill out for a while in the hustle and bustle of New York. Whether you just walk two or three streets then leave again or whether you walk The Highline in its entirety, it's a must on your trip. Great to see original art installations on your journey.
Best seen from NJ. Varied buildings and a classic skyline. Go to Weehawken or Hoboken and view from there. There is even a ferry to Hoboken for a"sea voyage".
Manhattan views. Easy to visit pick a day without fog. We went to Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building. Bring quarters for the telescopes.

Breathtaking. Nothing beats the NYC skyline – it’s awe-inspiring and a bit humbling! The most excellent place to view it are from Brooklyn Bridge Park in DUMBO, The Brooklyn Heights Promenade, and of course, when walking over any of the three bridges from Manhattan to Brooklyn.
Beautiful sight!. No cons really, it's there and just as it's always pictured, but it all did seem so much bigger! The city skyline is pretty impressive....
What a view!. I love driving in from New Jersey. There's nothing like it! The toll is $14.00 GOING THUR THE HOLLAND TUNNEL.
Breathtaking. There are many ways to see the skyline--Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn Promenade (walk across the bridge if you can), Statue/Ellis Island tour-- day or night, it's a beautiful skyline.
Stunning. Its was so pretty to see the city lit up, it was also beautiful in the daytime but if yiu can try do the rockafella at nite! The empire state is beautiful in lights

From Empire State Building. Went to view from the 84th floor of the Empire State, we went at dusk to see the city change from day to night, it was a truly great experience. We stayed up there around two hours and had there being a cafe up there would have stayed longer. Went on a wednesday evening and we didn't have to queue. There were too many people trying to sell tickets outside, it was getting annoying from a few blocks before the building itself. We brought our tickets inside where the staff lady was really nice, id recommend buying at the venue or online before.

Very Impressive. There is nothing quite like this city, there something always going on. The choices of what to do vary and can be interesting to just about anybody. I find the hop on hop off tours to be the best value for seeing new places.
You can get a crick in the neck. Wonderful, pick out the iconic buildings, remember the Empire State building is best seen from the Rockefeller Centre

Best photos! No Substitute for these three words!. Want the BEST photos of the Manhattan Skyline? Well, there are three little words you should remember - Staten Island Ferry. It's free, and the course of the ferry between the terminal on Manhatten and Staten Island gives you magnificent views not only of Manhattan's skyline but of Liberty Island as well. Best time? Well, that is a matter of personal preference. You may want to avoid hig traffic and commuting times, but my own preference is for a late afternoon, early evening, twilight time to see the play of light off of the skyscrapers. Enjoy!

Nothing quite like it in the entire world.... The view from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, looking out over the East River, is unique. It must be experienced to be believed. Try hitting it about an hour before sunset, watch the photographers line up to get their best shots.

Gorgeous. We caught a boat/ship from Pier 40 on Wednesday night, it was wonderful went around Statue of Liberty and back and around Manhattan Skyline at night, absolutely beautiful and something you will never forget.

My Favourite View. I love the buzz of Manhattan and the skyline just helps increase that buzz! My absolute favourite view is the one from the Staten Island Ferry overlooking Lower Manhattan - wonderful.
Ace!!!. Loved it all!!! Even more impressive than the movies! The only thing missing was the marshmallow man and the Statue of Liberty walking down the street like in Ghostbusters!!
Just stunning. You can never get bored looking at this from any angle, any height, it is just stunning. Spent a week in NYC but would need a month to do even half the things I wanted to see there
Great to see. Very good to see from Manhattan or the surrounding lower lying building areas, you really see the contrast.
A1. The skyline view is spectacular! I grew up in Manhattan but left many years ago. Returning now I was truly awed by how it has blossomed!
New York. Didn't miss home when i was here last summer! Excellent restaurants and tourist friendly superb sub ways to take us around the city.
What a view !. What a view ! It is free and what a view, exactly like in the movies... We spent tree hours there, there is a park and you can take a pizza in the famous restaurant.
Can't be beat. Best seen at night - even better from One World Tower. Try one of the ferries, or the Statue of Liberty.
Indescribable. However you choose to do it, the skyline must be seen, both during the day and at night. Try the Staten Island Ferry and Circle Line Cruises - Best of NY.
Amazing skyline. What is there not to like, beautiful skyline. World known. Glad we got to see it. Also must go to 911 Memorial so you know what is was before.

You know you are not in Kansas anymore .... ... When you see those iconic buildings: the Empire State Building, Citicorp (or whatever it's called these days) and the Chrysler Building ... Well, there's no mistaking that you've arrived in NY.

Best in the World. We usually take the train into town, and I always get thrilled when the Manhattan skyline comes into view! There is just something magical about it. I get chills when I take dinner cruises and see it at night
Waking up in Manhattan. What a skyline to wake up to every morning, You leave New York with a stiff neck because you are always looking up.

Beautiful Skyline. My wife and I on our trip to New York did the Harbour Lights Cruise, we fortunately got a clear evening sky, with the sun going down gave a fantastic view of the Manhattan skyline, particularly when we passed the new One World Trade Centre. Well worth doing.
Manhattan skyline. One of the most beautiful city landscapes that I've ever seen in my life. New York is a place where you can find everything you look for in a city
Indeed. I love to take pics of all of the skylines.. Just fun fun fun to see all of the city skylines that I go to. You see it on tv, but in really life it is almost surreal.

Incredible View from New Jersey. The Manhattan Skyline is amazing...and changes over the years. I remember when I first moved to New York City, one of the first things I saw when I was on the NJ Turnpike was the Twin Towers of the World Trade Centers, now after 9/11, the new construction has changed the skyline forever...the skyline looks very different from the Brooklyn point of view especially if you have the Brooklyn Bridge in your sites....there isn't any city in the U.S. with such a recognizable skyline the way Manhattan is...and some of the iconic buildings you see are the new Freedom Tower, the Empire State Building, The Chrysler Building and of course from Brooklyn, the Brooklyn Bridge...are amazing by day & night. There are helicopter tours of Manhattan & Circle Line Boat tours that tour the full length of the skyline. You can take private boat dinner tours with a view of the skyline at night for an incredible treat....when you fly into New York & have a window seat...you can't miss it.
Amazing. Wow. Have never seen anything quite like it. Really need to see it from the water or the Jersey side to get the full effect of it.

Started From the Bottom Now We Here.. There is likely soil under all this cool human garbage, carefully stacked on top of more complex human garbage. Regardless.Overall my rating of the New York skyline from 1200ACE - Present on a scale of 1 - 10 is as follows: (1 being trees, 10 being a skyline)1200: 11300: 11400: 11500: 21600: 21700: 31800: 5 (like 1980's Philly)1900: 71950: 92000: 8Present: 9This feels empirical and accurate. I've done my research.Bring your fisheye brand eye lenses to take it all in.

Breathtaking and Iconic.. Really is amazing to see, especially with the completion of the One World Trade Centre. I never got tired of looking at the skyline from all angles, you even get a glimpse as you land at JFK. It is worth seeing the skyline at day and night, and from the viewing platforms at the Rockafeller and the Empire State Building. My favourite view was from the Brookyn Bridge and Brooklyn itself, it lets you see the skyline in all it's glory.In my opinion one of the best things about NYC. Unmissable.

Skyline from Staten Island Ferry. First time on SIF. Huge line but the huge ferry got us all in with lots of room to spare, so don't feel like you need to rush to get in line. Our weather that day was rainy, but still enjoyed the skyline and Statue of Liberty. Some reviews mention getting on one side of the ferry or the other. To us, it didn't matter, as we crossed over several times. Great free event! Great pictures.
Welcome to New York.. You know you are in New York when you see the most iconic skyline in the World. A great experience a must for any traveller.

Stunning. Iconic... Best viewed from Brooklyn Bridge and over by River Cafe. We loved our walk over Brooklyn Bridge even though it's busy and poor cyclists shouting to get out of their way when you stray onto their cycle path! Once over bridge, lovely walk to water front for more views. Coming back over bridge, the view facing you, especially at night, is simply stunning.

Go to Brooklyn for the best view. We went to Brooklyn for the best view of the manhattan skyline and we were not disappointed, we sat on benches and soaked up the fantastic view of The statue of liberty and all the buildings ,there are lots of nice shops in Brooklyn and nice and breezy.if your a Truman Capote fan you can visit the house he used to live in ,its not very far and although not in use at the moment is a lovely building to view.
Most developed real estate on the PLANET.. Best way we ever appreciated it was on a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge - see pics posted with this review.
Nice to see. An amazing architectural assortment from one end to the other. The 9/11 building stands out. Go see it by day at Top of the ROck and at night from Empire State
Something special. It is more that you can see.A must to experience for any human being.It is something that no picture can show you.

Great place. It was lovely to see the skyline from our hotel (Washingston Square) of an evening when it was lit up with a myriad of different coloured lights. Nothing really to dislike about the view.

Waw moments. We had the NY skyline view from both observation deck at Rockefeller as well as Empire State Building. The views from top are just thrilling. We could see the Central Park and Hudson River and also the skyscrapers. We saw the beauty before sunset and after sunset all illuminated. Really enjoyable.
A walk atop the city. Go to the great Whitney Art Museum, have lunch there too and take the magical walk that is the High-Line

Ive seen many...this one still takes my breath. Night time is best. A cheap cab ride around the city over bridges is incredible. Gansevoort Park Hotel & Club has some of the best views in the city from its rooftop.

Breathtaking Manhattan Skyline views...Unforgettable.. There are various ways of appreciating the gorgeous Manhattan Skyline but for me by boat is the way to go. Creating various angles and opportunities to capture stunning views. Remember to drop the camera for a few minutes and fully appreciate the stunning landscape that is NYC. Unforgettable. Dec 2012 and mon 15 June 2015 YB.

A must see when in NYC!. The Manhattan skyline holds so many different feelings for each and every viewer. I haven't seen this skyline in person since 1986 and it was just as breathtaking now as then. Only difference now is all that has transpired in those years that make you REALLY stop and pause to enjoy it.

Beautiful scenery. If you don't know about it in advance you could miss it but you would really be missing out. It doesn't matter where you get on as its all gorgeous but make sure you Walk to the end and get off in So-Ho such a beautiful place and an awesome food market.
Special sight. If there's a skyline you have to see it's the manhattan city scape, there's nothing like it, especially if you're driving over manhattan bridge
Central park. I think as a first time visitor Central Park was the best photo opt for the view of Manhattan. New York is so beautiful!
A Memorable View. There are no words to describe the Manhattan Skyline as it is impressive, but also massive and a reminder of how big the City is.

Brooklyn. People look at us as if we were mad to book Brooklyn but we found it a great place to stay, cheaper than Manhattan and fantastic views from Brooklyn heights promenade and Brooklyn bridge park. . Fornino was a great place to eat and watch local kids playing all sorts of sports as well as watching the sun go down over the Manhattan skyline. Finally a walk across Brooklyn Bridge must be the best free thing you can do in New York.

Breathtaking views of skyline. Stunning skyline during the day, but especially evenings. Go to Top of the Rock for spectacular views of skyline. Or on a boat trip. Take an evening bus tour and see the magic of NY skyline.

Skyline. We took an evening tour ride with City Sights - the gray line of the city and the sights were great. The bus took us to New Jersey and we were able to see the Manhattan Skyline. Joe, our tour guide was great.

Another Place During D & L 's Travels. Just like in the tv shows and movies (after 911 of course). Best to view from the water or the rock (get the city pass). Also because of traffic don't expect to see more than 3 places in one day and that is if your lucky.

Many options; night or day; from street, river, or a tall building. Impressive-each in its own way. The iconic Manhattan skyline is breathtaking, and can be seen from many venues. Obviously some go to the Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center, some to the Empire State Building, and the freedom Tower (1 WTC) has just opened. CityPass has options for the first two; individually elevator rides are about $32.  The skyline is also appreciated on a trip to the Statue of Liberty (or at. Isn't from the water is CircleLine tours, or returning from Staten Island on the free ferry--all these see lower Manhattan. Walking back from DUMBO over the Brooklyn abridge at sunset or at night also gives a great view of lower Manhattan skyline. Finally, walking along Broadway in the Financial district (start at Battery Park and the famous bull is at 23 Broadway, and veer to 5th Avenue at a Washington Park and head north past Empire State Bldg at 34th and Midtown to the Plaza Hotel, FAO Schwartz and Apple at 59th/Central Park. Or veer back to B'way at 42nd. Night skyline when many buildins lit is a sight.
Greatest city on earth. What is there to say? The greatest city on earth. Top to bottom. Food and subway best in the nation. If you have not been, get there. Soon....
Nowhere can trump Manhattan. The Manhattan skyline is a beauty. One will recognise it immediately and feel awe-inspired that they're actually there. Only NYC can have such an impact.
Amazing at Night. Great view from the Staten Island Ferry at night.One of those amazing, iconic views it's essential to see once in your life!

Easily recognisable, and often awe-inspiring. Millions of photos taken or published, and seen by millions around the world. Good times and bad times. An awesome array of skyscrapers, scary to some but inspiring to so many. Choose your view - from street level, out on the river, or from up high at one of the city's many observation decks. And look out for the changes in colour as day turns to night or vice versa.

WHO SAID YOU COULD NEVER FALL IN LOVE AGAIN.. You've seen it in countless films, on television, greeting cards, gift wrapping paper, postcards and I don't know what else. It is, without doubt, the world's most famous skyline. And deservedly so. Dramatic, majestic, awe-inspiring, powerful...these are just a few of the many adjectives that attempt to convey what you feel when seeing the Manhattan skyline for the first time. And as many times as I have seen it over the years, and it must be tens of thousands by now, I continue to be stunned by its magnificence, each time still feeling that thrill of a chill running up and down my spine. Who would not be overwhelmed by its towering spires piercing the sky, fearlessly and courageously standing tall, thumbing its nose at the rest of the world with that irrepressible New York attitude. To wax lyrical in describing New York's skyline is a well-deserved tribute to a sight in its entirety that is truly without equal. Whichever way you choose to see it, it will take your breath away. Because it is more than you could ever imagine. Welcome to New York.
Nothing like it!. Two great places to view the Manhattan Skyline are: 1. Brooklyn Height Promenade and 2. Gantry Park in LIC.
Amazing. This was my first visit to the financial capital of the world and while visiting manhattan I pinched my self to make me sure that I am in NY

the views. the views were fantastic but sometimes the queues were very long & sometimes it was an hours wait but the wait was worth it. We have some very good photos from the Empire state building which was only 2 blocks frome the Wolcott hotel.
View from liberty island..... As said in my other review the venue from Liberty Island is amazing..... You just have to pinch yourself to believe you are seeing it and are actually there.

Skyline is priceless. How do you rate a Manhattan Skyline, its priceless and the best time to see it is at night! To see the Statue of Liberty, Empire State Building and Freedom Tower all lighted up is magnificent!

Views.. You definitely need to check out the skyline whether at night or in the daytime. Took the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island. Great city day views from the ferry and from the pedestal at the Statue of Liberty. Need to book 4 months in advance to go up to the crown. Again, bought tickets in advance and etiher went very smoothly.
Stunning. Especially at night! Best seen from the top of the Rockefeller in the evening or from the Liberty Island or Staten Island ferries during the day

You've Seen it in the Movies.... What else is there to say, really? It's the Manhattan Skyline, for crying out loud. If you're ever going to feel like you're in a movie (and in New York this is true almost all of the time) this is it. Get the Staten Island Ferry or one of the tour boats and head out into the bay for one of the most jaw-dropping views you're ever likely to see...

Take a night tour of Manhattan!!!!. Take the NIGHT TOUR with Grayline Bus Sightseeing, worth every penny. Takes 2 hours to downtown and lower Manhattan and over to Brooklyn, over and back on 2 different bridges, the skyline and lights at night is truly stunning. You will see EVERYTHING.

Amazing. Walked the entire length from the Whitney Museum end. It exceeded expectations. Unique, pretty, obviously loved by the people who maintain and run it voluntarily. You walk from a very urban environment between apartment and office blocks until you it the Hudson River. Brilliant time.
AMAZING!!!. Seeing the skyline in photos etc does not come anywhere near to seeing the real thing. Saw the skyline at night and day - just jaw dropping. One of the great memories of NYC.

Hard to beat. Perhaps one of the best known skylines anywhere in the world, the Manhattan city profile is an absolute highlight of a visit to NYC. The trick is finding the best place from which to view it - I quite like the view from within Central Park, but the view from down near the Brooklyn Bridge is also pretty good.

Magnificent. The skyline of Manhattan is always a photo opportunity. We can in on the QM2 and got pics just before sunrise and then we took the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and go photo's from the water. You can't help but be amazed at how wonderful the site is.

Beautiful. We saw the skyline through tours of the many skyscrapers. Freedom Tower, Top of The Rock and Empire State building. We also did a cruise. I would recommend doing some tours during the day and some at night. Both are beautiful!

Night and day. What is not to like! I definitely think looking at the vista at night is amazing. To hear the hustle and bustle of the City at work is food for thought to wonder how many people drive that hummmm. What are they doing Where are they going.

Iconic. From any direction the skyline is impressive, we came in by train and really enjoyed this initial look at Manhattan. In four days we were able to see the skyline from various directions and angles and must admit were impressed each time.
sunsetting on manhattan. Did a night time tour to Brooklyn which allowed views of the skyline during sunset. it was unreal. Tour company was Big Bus, highly recommended

beautiful park. Its amazing to see what some creative minds can do with a place that was forgotten and unseen. This tracks gained magic and where turned in to one of the most amazing parks in the world

Ferry, roofs and the Empire State Building, it's all the Top!. What can be said of the NYC skyline that hasn't been said before? Great from every angle, uptown, downtown, east river and west.............the higher up you go, the more you see, naturally. Big view, Empire State, small view, what ever roof of whatever building you happen to be in. It's all good. A favorite of mine is from the Staten Island Ferry and it's free. Leaving and coming back. Downtown Manhattan, it's a great skyline. Also, any boat tour will give you great views, and a free one here is the ferry to Ikea!
Breathtaking. We enjoyed a glorious sunset view of the Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn, which literally took our breath away. A great view not to be missed.
Wow!. It is truly impressive, especially since the 911 Memorial tower is not up. It is well worth the time and money to take a ferry ride around the island to view this city and all the buildings.
Always Inspiring. Love how the skyline is constantly changing amid the reliable and faithful standards. We visited the World Trade Center which was a profound and deeply moving experience.
Urban art. Iconic skyline. recommend you view from top of the rock. My opinion better than the empire state, however you decide.

Great to watch if you have the time. The new York skyline is amazing to watch at anytime of the day but I am partial to the night time view. My views are from the NJ. Hotels across the hudson river in newport pavonia, grove street, exchange place or hoboken would be great. The walkway connecting hoboken to grove street is great and I have seen people strolling in the night too (though I do not recommend very late night for travellers). Newport pavonia is residential so generally safe if you want to sit and watch the skyline and also watch the ferries go by. Another place to sit and watch the skyline is peace is boulevard east (there is a garden right near the hudson river). Great views of george washington bridge as well. Great for a couple :)
chill. nice way to relax after a long tiring day of sight seeing, snacks, ice cream, beverages including beer and wine available on the skyline

Simply excellent. Started our trip in New York with a walk over the Queensboro bridge towards Manhattan. Absolutely thrilled by the view. Our hotell, in Long Island City, has a terrace on the 10th floor heading towards Manhattan. Great view at night with all the lights.
Iconic skyline.. I grew up in NYC, and, when I visit, my heart always stops at my first view of the skyline whether it's day or night.

Lovely!. Was in New York City recently and got the opportunity to view the Manhattan Skyline again - it is truly a breathtaking sight.Lovely to see at day and at night, it is one of the world's most distinct and impressive views of a city.No trip to New York is complete without taking the time to enjoy this remarkable sight. Highly recommended!

Wow. The first thing that came out was wow. IT is marvelous to see the skyline, we also took the night tour, I would very much recommend you all to take the night tour as well. Worth every single penny.

Best viewed from the ferry to Staten Island. Best viewed from the ferry to Staten Island. It is free as part of public transport of NYC. Right hand side of the ferry offers the Manhattan skyline views. Not hard to figure out since people tend to rush to that side with their cameras.
Skyline. The Manhattan skyline was best from the top of the Empire State Building, the bay cruise also gives a great view.
Nice Nice Nice!. We were at the top of a double decker and seeing the Manhattan skyline from on top was breathtaking! It was especially beautiful at night
Beautiful. Liked to see the lights and huge LCD Panels advertising,lots of entertainers and artists and the fascinated crowd around..

A skyline like no other. The Manhattan Skyline is unique. It seems everyone has seen it somewhere, sometime. In person, it is marvelous to behold. I think it is best seen from a ferry like the free Staten Island Ferry or the Statue of Liberty Ferry. You could also take in more of the skyline by going on one of the skyline boat tours. With the One Trade Center now constructed, the skyline holds even greater meaning and significance.
Amazing views of Manhattan at dusk.. Liked: Circle Line on-board commentary and historical facts about Manhattan, the bridges, Brooklyn, etc.Disliked: people taking selfies
Stunning. A view that will live long in my memory. Superb. Worth doing a boat ride to see it from a different angle.

Awesome. The first time I used the word awesome was when I saw the manhattan skyline. Only word to describe it. Like my sister in law said, it's like being on a movie set, everything you look at is so familiar. No other city like it.
High Line Trail. A must do! Bring your walking shoes and be ready for a delightful adventure. the plant life and view of the city and harbor is amazing!

Great walk even though it was drizzling rain. This is a great walk and to see how they have tried to preserve the rail links yet planted some greenery to make the walk feel like you are walking through a high rise park is extremely well done. The views along the way provide a good representation of the NYC skyline, the street art and some impressive graffiti artwork.A nice way to spend a couple of hours that is an easy walk for all ages.
Spring Break Vacation. so beautiful! We love visiting Manhattan every chance we get. There is always fun to be had in New York City. Every visit is a new adventure.

Fabulous!. One of the most famous skylines in the world. Sadly lacking the twin towers but these have now been replaced by the World Trade Tower - viewing gallery opens May 2015. Best view from Empire State Building r the Staten Island Ferry
Amazing site.. Took a cab into Brooklyn to look back into Manhattan on a Sunday night and it was amazing. Cost $50 and the photos we got were incredible. Just like the movies.
Great for an outdoor walk. The engineering project is spectacular enough. But if the weather allows, it makes for a great outdoor walk, with great views and no cars.

The reality that inspires dreams.. Central Manhattan is the pulsating and symbolic zenith of modern urban life. Everything to the power of everything.
Sitting on a bench at sunset on the far side of the reservoir in Central Park, you get to see it in silhouette, and reflect on it, from a tranquil and distant vantage point.

Rockefeller Centre Bar 65. Amazing views over Central Park downtown Manhattan. Bes part is looking straight at Empire State building and Times Sq. On a clear day can see Statue of Liberty too. Get there before sunset and watch the changing scene! Tasting plates and wine menu is very good, although expensive.

need to see. Huge sky line, need to say youve seen it.
It was a little hazy, and a grey day so the overall impression was dampened by this.
However still worth the visit

just brilliant. Seeing it for yourself in all its splendour is the only way to truly appreciate it. Try and do it by day and then again at night. Have fun picking out and naming all the famous buildings and sights
Pretty skyline. Great places to view the skyline are the Staten Island Ferry and the Brooklyn Bridge. Just amazing to look at.

Can see it from Staten Island Ferry. Great view during the day. loved how clear the sky was on a Spring morning. Can get a bit chilly on the waters so dress warm.
Quick ferry to Staten Island and back gives you a chance to see anything you've missed out.

Crossroads of the World. When viewed from New Jersey, Long Island or the harbor at night, there is no American skyline that can match. Chicago (from the lake) and St. Louis are more iconic, but the Manhattan skyline is the only one that can compete with the big Asian skylines!
best at twilight. Great view from Brooklyn Bridge or Circle Line tour, Take the Harbor lights tour for an awesome view, including the new One World Trade Center
Magical, emotional!. We took an evening dinner cruise April 2002 to celebrate my husbands birthday, that was one of my all time favorite moments.

Empire State Visit. Excellent opportunity to see the greatest skyline in the planet!
Try and go early before 11, but be careful of touts en-route who harrass you to tears (including those in uniforms)
Amazing. If you haven't been to New York all I can say is go, go,go, it will not disappoint. I never thought a concrete jungle could be beautiful but Manhattan is

Quintessential Views. The best views of Manhattan are not what the tour packages tell you. For the best views, get a water taxi or one of the public taxi shuttles that go to Brooklyn. It's so much cheaper, so much less crowded, and will allow you to enjoy the skyline with other New Yorkers. The free ferry to Staten Island is also worth hopping on if only to see the Grand Old Lady in the harbour.

Brooklyn Bridge at Dusk. If you go to New York you have to do this. Take the subway to the High Street station and walk all the way across Brooklyn Bridge as the sun is setting. You get an incredible view of the Manhattan Skyline and can hop right back on the Subway as you finish walking across the Bridge. The photo opportunities are endless and will be on our Christmas card this year.
outstanding. with good weather conditions a really outstsnding experience! express tickets are a good choice! go early in the morning!
America. This view is so much a part of America. I love it. It is unique and changes with our history. It will change again and new construction continues.
awesome. Do one of the cruises for a great view or better still the new world trade center observation deck is now open

One of the Best. I've traveled all over the world and have to say the NYC Skyline is one of the best and one of the most recognizable. The iconic Empire State Building and Chrysler Building are two of my favorites. Whether you are looking at the skyline from atop one of the larger skyscrapers, one of the other boroughs, from New Jersey, or a tour boat it's unforgetable.
Beautiful. Awesome, a little cloudy but awesome! We saw most of it from the empire state building and a tour bus!
Spectacular. A total unique city and a unique experience. Lots to do and see and if you want reasonable priced accommodation stay in Queens.
I like the pretty lights at dawn. It's always nice to see a beautiful skyline, and manhattan's is nice! You cans identify a lot of buildings and this is what makes it special!

Cream of a Sci-Fi dream. New York City is a rush, in several senses of the word. Its Manhattan skyline tells you that the city wants to reach for the sky. The best way to experience the city is to walk its many varying neighborhoods. The best place to experience its skyline, in my opinion, is from across the Hudson. Take a hike, or a car, to the Palisades (themselves worth seeing, both as in the Palisades Park and from across the Hudson, from Manhattan) and look toward Manhattan. Then repeat the visit at night, when the lights are lit in the countless towers and apartments of the city. Then store the memory.
Beauty. One should never miss this either from the east river or the Hudson.I took a cruise that covered the shoreline of Manhattan and provided a view of the Manhattan skyline. Excellent!
Lovely green space, ideal for an afternoon stroll.. Well designed and welcoming. Great people watching. Lots of seating for those who want a break from walking.
Just love it. Always my all time favorite.The lights in the night. People walking on the streets all the time.The city with life.
amazing views. Loved be able to look down from The empire state and also top of the rock. go for it. the views are fabulous but choose a sunny day

Best skyline in US. The best skyline by far in the US. Best seem from stop the Rockefeller building, New Jersey - especially at park on west side of George Washington Bridge, and along Pallisades Parkway. Best time is late afternoon. Bring camera, and enjoy.
Unbeatable. Maybe the most iconic view in NY. Best seen from Brooklyn! Take the ferry over East river a decide for yourself!

Majestic and phenomenal. There's not much more to add to these reviews. The skyline is the single most beautiful thing you will ever see. New York City is worth a visit just for this! Go see it and take your friends and family and have a picnic and look at the skyline all day long!

iconic!. Common! It's manhattan so of course it's one if the top attractions! Come to williamsburg or line Long Island city piers for the best view. Or take a water taxi! It's iconic! Even locals never get bored with looking at it.

NOVEMBER IN NEW YORK. what an amazing sight, we sailed into new york on a cruise ship, and docked at pier 88, we had a wonderful view from our cabin window and an amazing time exploring the city once again
magical. We went at dusk across the Brooklyn Bridge, turned right and took photos of the lights coming on. Magical! (despite being 0 degrees!)
New York Skyline. Seeing the skyline is part of the great excitement of New York City. The city is alive 24 hours of the day. Saw the skyline from New Jersey. Bright, electric, exciting

New York, New York. We arrived on the Queen Mary II and had a view of the skyline from the cruise port in Brooklyn. I think this gives you the best view from the Brooklyn side. It is easy to hop on the subway from Manhattan to Brooklyn. I believe the ticket price is $2.75 one way.

You can't believe it until you are there!. Amazing experience. Would have loved to have seen it from the air. The lights are on almost 24/7 and so picturesque. We have a canvas picture that we took from the top of the Empire State and we are still picking out different sites within the skyline!

One of my favourite skylines.... I love a skyline and have been lucky enough to travel to enjoy and have been lucky to enjoy many around the world but I have always had a soft spot for the manhattan skyline. One of the best places to see the skyline in all it's glory is from Brooklyn or failing that one of the many ferry rides on the river.
Gantry view. Gantry park itself is very nice. Kid and adult friendly. The view of the Manhattan skyline across the East river is awesome.

Amazing Skyline View and National Historic Site. If you really want a great view of the New York Skyline, nothing's better than the view from Boulevard East in Weehawken, NJ. It's easy to get to by car, bus, van and Ferry and only a few minutes away. Also there's a small monument there on the cliffs of the Palisades, marking the spot where Alexander Hamilton and Aaron Burr had their famous duel.All along the Jersey side of the mighty Hudson River from Jersey City and Hoboken, north to Edgewater and the George Washington Bridge are great sites for that postcard picture. And there are some great restaurants, bars and parks as well to enjoy the view from. And one can also consider fine spots in Brooklyn at Brooklyn Heights, Dumbo and Williamsburg and in Wueens at Long Island City

Two excellent (and very different) options for viewing it. Of course it's famously spectacular. Probably the best views are from the New Jersey side, so take a water taxi or the PATH train to Hoboken and walk to the lovely park adjacent to the train station both the PATH and the ferry will take you to. Another option is to take a subway over to Brooklyn Heights to view the city from the other side, which while perhaps a little less spectacular, includes a view of the Brooklyn and other bridges.
Awesome!. Well worth seeing, so exciting as this skyline is so famous. We viewed it from the Statue of Liberty which was amazing!
So gorgeous!. I just love this city and the skyline view is iconic!! There are many places you can go to see the views. Each offering its own perspective!
have to seee it !!!. one of a kind..have a look from exchange place...hudson ...whre ever u can...u will not see someting like this every again....its beautifull...waooooooo
Best from the river. Or Brooklyn!! The view is magnificent from the other side - especially at night. Magical - there is nowhere like it
Best when viewed from Top of Rock. The best way to see the Manhattan Skyline is to go to the Top of the Rock. From Top of the Rock, one can view the iconic Empire State Building
Fab fab fab. First time in NYC and definitely won't be my las visit! Was more than expected and would def recommend you visit this city that never sleeps!
Immense Views. Iconic views with some of the most famous buildings in the world... Theres not a lot you can say about the Manhattan Skyline but you have to see it in person to really appreciate it
Brilliant skyline. Great Architecture great buildings make New York a great place to visit overall there are some stunning buildings to look at
Fascinating skyline. Excellent views from both Liberty and Ellis islands. The Manhattan skyline seems to go forever - fascinating to see it from below, from above, up close and from a distance.

Awesome 360 views.. The WTC had a soft-opening on 28 May 2015 but I missed it. However, the view of this magnificent modern piece of architecture built at the location of the late Twin Towers is a fitting response of the people of NYC to 9/11.
Ground Zero. We went to the new observatory and what a sight to behold. While it's sad to see the reminder of 911 the view of NYC is stunning. this is a must do while in NYC
Impressive.. The Manhattan skyldige must be seen! Best from a boat or from one of the islands outside Manhattan. It is absolutely stunning to see the sky skrapes growing up from the water surface.
Wonderful park. There are sometimes interesting people in Central park. Kids using their boards down the steps. It is so beautiful in the Spring.
What's not to like?. I've travelled a lot but this was my first trip to NYC and I loved it even more than I anticipated. But flying in and seeing the skyline from above? Very impressive!

From the Top of the Gray Line. There really is nothing quite like the appearance of this fantastic, fully recognizable skyline coming into view as your turn off the highway in Jersey, or cross the bridge in New York. Even as I type this, the old familiar scents begin to faintly invade my senses. The sounds, the motion, it all adds up to the wonder that is the "city that never sleeps". This view is remarkable, and I enjoy it most, from the top of a double decker Gray Line bus, in the evening, coming back over from the Brookline Loop!
Manhattan Skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. Manhattan Skyline is so beautiful; you have to experience it for yourself. I absolutely love it! A true must see!

Still awesone - not with new One WTC!. The skyline is still one of the most interesting views. You have to watch downtown Manhattan - should cross the Brooklyn Bridge then you see it! Also nice view from Liberty Island!

breath taking views. The NYC skyline is impressive during the day but night time cross the Brooklyn Bridge and stand to see the majestic light spectacular of the skyline you have seen in the movies and so familular to everyone. Try not to look up at the tops of the building from the base of the building because you will strain you neck and back and most like fall over like penguins
Skyline- A site to see. Took a boat ride with an amazing view of the skyline and the statue of liberty, bridges, islands, beaches, etc.

A must see. The skyline on a clear evening is amazing. I have to say that the best view I have had is from the top of a double decker bus crossing the Manhattan bridge. I recently took a night bus tour again for this very reason. I'm sure that the view from the walkways of the Brooklyn bridge would be ideal, but the view from the bus top is fabulous.

Beautiful. Beautiful to view, but sometimes difficult to do view. You can view a partial the skyline from the Roof of the Park South Hotel. While not up high, the 9th story, you can get an idea of what the skyline might be like.
Amazing!. It was so exciting to see the Manhattan skyline in person for the first time. I liked everything about it.
Manhattan skyline from the Empire State Building. Visit the Empire State Building at night & get the most memorable views of the NYC skyline. A sight I will never forget!

Awesome walking through and enjoying the foliage. Walking and enjoying it so much I didn't realize I walked almost 3 miles. Viewing the river during our walk and the plants gave it a special peaceful touch. Highly recommend.

Impressively Memorable. Saw the skyline on a Circle Line cruise on the Hudson River.
