Mesmerising, the towering skyscrapers, the history, the indomitable spirit exemplified by the 1776 feet high One World Trade Center, the Brooklyn Docks reminiscent of Brando, the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, entry to the great melting pot. One has not traveled and seen the world if one has not seen the New York skyline.
WOW. When on boat coming from Ellis Island approaching \NY, the view is wonderful, especially in sunshine, its hard to describe..

Manhattan. Just returned from a trip to New York and I have to say you can't really appreciate the magnitude of the place until you are actually there. The downtown area is really something to see, the revamped finical district and all the magnificent buildings, really well worth a visit.

Like None Other. Flying over Manhattan during our first trip to New York is like seeing the Grand Canyon for the first time; no matter how many pictures you've seen or how glorious it's made to be, it can't be over-hyped. There are possibly only two cities on earth that are unmistakable; Venice and NYC.

Center of the Universe. I love Paris more but New York IS the center of universe and I'm not sure what "Manhattan Skyline" means but from the top of the Empire State Building, or from the Staten Island Ferry (free) or the lounge on the 38th floor (?) of the NY Mandarin Hotel, the view that Manhattan or "New York City" projects fills one with both awe and beauty.
spring. NYC in spring is breath taking, everything and everyone comes alive. Trees are green and line the walkways where people are sitting in open cafe's sipping their wine or espresso.
Amazing.. Seen from BIG BUS night tour off Manhattan Bridge, "Top of the Rock" observation decks and The Bateaux Dinner Cruise up the Hudson river.
Fabulous!!. We did this on a night bus trip and it was absolutely stunning!! If you visit New York, you MUST do this :)

Amazing jaw dropping. You cannot appreciate this skyline on a photograph and need to see it in person. One of the best views of the skyline is from the Brooklyn Bridge.The volume of skyscrapers is mindboggeling.

Great Skyline. Worth it to get a room with a view here if it's in your budget. Best skyline I know of. It's very impressive to me and the only place where I even get a window seat when flying in and out of the city if I can.
Glorius. What you come to New York for. The skyline. Gorgeous buildings everywhere. Don't hesitate to walk around at night, the city seems even more attractive after the sun goes down

Dramatic from every angel!. Yes, this skyline is know round the world & is truly magnificent. One of the best places to see the skyline is from Cape Liberty in New Jersey and/or from a ferry circling the island...GRAND!
top of the rock. found the view in particular from the top of the Rockefeller center absoulutely amazingduring the day equally at nght from the empire state building

Living in the clouds, not a dream!. Empire state building, National September 11 building, the Brooklyn bridge, and Tall buildings, other Iron bridges cruise through the skyline is unique to NYC.Pros: Empire State building, National September 11 building, NJ to NYC Lincoln Tunnel, Ferry to Liberty Statue, Wall street, Times square, Cons: Traffic and crowd.Would recommend this to all and I would visit again to other places.
wow. What more can you say we went to the 102 floor and the view was amazing just walking around the observation room took your breath away
Beautiful , and free!!!!!!!. I like everything, you can see different views of the city and also you can sit and get lunch. You can see some art, too. Go when it is a sunny day
Can't be beat!. We saw the skyline during the day, also by bus ride and by night with a bus ride. So much to look at. Liked the Empire State Building with the red, white, and blue.
Like nothing else in the world. The Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn is awe inspiring whether sitting on a bench or walking the Brooklyn Bridge. Should be a definite must on your itinerary to NYC
Did the Bateaux River cruise to see this. fantastic when seen by river cruise, set off during daylight and ended it darkness. fab sights and the cruises include a trip up t the statue of liberty

China may have more skyscrapers but can't beat NYC for this spectacular site. Chrysler Building and Empire State are the stand out buildings. But this really feels like the hub of the world. Best city skyline any where.

Best place to see the skyline. The best place to see the skyline is on the ferry out to the Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Very beautiful! Get down to Battery Park early so you can get one of the first boats to beat the crowd. If you wait until late morning or early afternoon, you're going to be dealing with a lot more people.
sky viwe. Manhattan skyline looks very beautiful and amazing if you see it very carefully you will feel very good and will enjoy seeing it.

one of the great skylines in the world. Ok I admit I am biased - Hong Kong is my second home, and the Hong Kong skyline viewed from the Star Ferry or the TST promenade remains the most spectacular skyline in the world. But Manhattan's skyline is great too - whether you admire it arriving from JFK in a taxi, from Brooklyn or from Staten Island. For me, two of the best opportunities to view the skyline is from the Rockefeller Center and from the Staten Island Ferry (the latter option being cheap).
Not to be missed. Excellent from Brooklyn Bridge and Staten Island Ferry -at no cost!!. Probably better but a lot more expensive from Top of the Rock or any other Building top

A "Must-Go" location in NYC especially at Night!. If Time Square is where you look into NYC in detail, Manhattan Skyline is where you see the "Big Picture"!
Remember to bring your tripods for slow shutter speed photos during the night!

Beautiful City. From the ferry, from Liberty Island, from Empire State Building or from Brooklyn, Manhattan skyline is wonderful.
Best in clear days.
Historic. Most recognisable skyline anywhere in the world it has changed but is stilling exciting and inspiring
Pretty cool. If you've never been to NYC, it's pretty cool to walk around and see the famous buildings you've seen on TV

Best to view from 30 rock. Go to the Rockefeller centre for a great view of Manhattan as you get the Empire state building. If you go up the Empire State you do not get this iconic building in your photos. Best just to visit the Empire State Building lobby.

Nothing in the world can compare!!!!. The Manhattan, New York City, New York, USA, North America, Earth skyline is truly one of a kind! My favorite building has to be the Flatiron building, but there are so many to choose from!! A true concrete jungle.
Super awesome view. The skyline view is quite overwhelming and magnetic. My favorite time is the dusk, it feels out of the world.
breathtaking. a must see. quite literally like nothing you've seen before. great spot for photos, memories and just taking it all in
Manhattan skyline. One of the best point to see (for free) the skyline by night is the bar on the top of the Rockefeller tower.

Last view of the City, the memory will stay. Lovely day when we took the Staten Island ferry,even better when we left NY on the Queen Mary 2. South Manhattan looks so much nicer from the sea and even more impressive than when you are at ground level on the land. The added height of the liner gives really great views, including Brooklyn bridge.Skyscrapers don't normally do it for me but the view from the sea can only be marvelled at. Looking down from the Top of the Rock,as we did on our trip, was great but here you have no ugly sights on top of the buildings just clean lines stretching to the clear blue cloudless sky with seemingly endless helicopters buzzing around. Memorable.

After all, this is Manhattan. The most recognised skyline in the world is still always best experienced in person. The recent plethora of movies set in NYC makes the visits so much better when certain locations triggers memories of the movies.

So Awesome...like nothing else!. For our anniversary we went to NYC (May 14-17,2015) and my to do was to go on the Staten Island ferry! We boarded and the views of the Manhattan skyline were amazing! It's like Houston, like Dallas, but also nothing like them at the same time.Absolutely breathtaking. HUGE! The buildings are just massive and beautiful, each with their own characteristics being strikingly nice. I must go back!

Still gives me a thrill. Nothing like the NY skyline. Just looking at it, you know the names and streets of a half dozen buildings. Empire State Building is still great. Remember SLEEPLESS IN SEATLE and AN AFFAIR TO REMEMBER?
Does not need explaining. Amazing any time of the day, however my favourite is dusk, when you get to see the lights on the Empire State Building lighting up for the first time.
What a view. One of the best views of the skyline can be seen driving on the Williamsburg bridge or on the dock areas of Williamsburg, Brooklyn itself.

Probably the best bit of new york. Viewed it , from the Empire State, (about the1st customers) on a sunny morning , and from the Rainbow Bar in the Rockafella centre, at dusk, 25 dollars for a drink, but worth it

Spectacular day and night. We were thrilled to see the Manhattan skyline during the day from various locations and at night. We especially enjoyed the Staten Island ferry where we were able to get beautiful pictures of the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan Skyline. The ferry is free of charge and a must to experience. Although it seemed as thought there may have been 500 people waiting to get on the ferry, (and probably was) it was easy access, lots of seating and we all got on board. The ferry ran 24/7 every half hour so there really wasn't much of a wait. Can't wait to go again and take some more pictures.

Best Viewed from Brooklyn. On a clear day, it is stunning. The best views are from across the river, in Brooklyn. There is a promenade on the bluffs at the west end of Brooklyn Heights, appropriately called "The Promenade." All the locals know it if you need directions. There is also a park that goes along the river front. The best access to the park is at the base of the Brooklyn Bridge. The bridge itself has a pedestrian walkway above the traffic lanes so it is a very nice walk between Brooklyn and Manhattan with great clear views on a nice day.
Dramatic Skyline. Like nowhere else in the world, the New York City skyline is an awesome sight... From a distance as well as in, around and above... Spectacular!!!

Well worth the walk. Such a nice thing to do. Was such a great idea to make a disused railway track into a walk. You get to see parts of the city you'd normally miss in a relaxed walled walk. They've spent some time and money making the walk ways more interesting with pretty gardens and modern art of graffti. And half way through, you can stop off in one of the trackside bars and get yourself a cider to cool down. There are stopping points all the way along so if you see something you like, you can use the stairs to get off. Finishing in greenwich village. I'd certainly suggest stopping there for lunch!

Breathtaking. I loved Manhattan lit up at night and found nothing to dislike.
I found the streets of Manhattan at night, and indeed at any time, felt safe with so many people out walking.
We enjoyed the night tour on the Greyline hop on hop off bus.

From Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn Bridge Park. I loved the mindblowing impressive view. For me it was the 1st time in New York and everything I saw was so much more than I expeceted from all the series and movies with scenes around the Bridge. We already spend the whole day there by walking over the bridge and relaxing in the Park afterwords.

Its Manhattan. New York is one of the most thrilling and dynamic cities in the world, and taking double-decker sightseeing tour of this multi-faceted city will let you experience all it has to offer. Throughout your tour of New York City you can explore several neighborhoods spanning Downtown, Midtown and Uptown.
And Manhattan skyline.
Day or night. It is pretty impressive. Take the Staten Island Ferry or view from your trip to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Island.
Love NYC. Love love NYC! Go to Brooklyn to see the skyline from that perspective. Well worth it. Empire State Buidling views are wonderful!
always and exciting and dramatic panorama. there is no comparable skyline in the U.S. - the office and residential towers plus the established high and low-rise buildings are exciting and memorable

Beautiful. The Manhattan skyline is just gorgeous! Before I had seen it only in pictures, but it is much more impressive when you actually see it in person. We took a water taxi to Brooklyn, and got great photos from the ferry!!
What a view....................... Unreal.......fantastic......top of the world.....do not miss this......try and wait till sunset and you will be blown away..................
Impressive. Unique and unforgetabel and for photographs or amateurs a must to be at ones in live in Rockefeller or ESB.
Iconic view. We got good looks of the Manhattan Skyline from the Staten Island Ferry and when we walked the Brooklyn Bridge towards Manhattan.

A MUST. Wasn't going to do this, but I am extremely happy we did. Inredible, best to do a night!Loads of photos taken and a great expeirence. Our tour guide was great too, however I cannot remember his name. There is a bar on board so it was lovely to have a couple of drinks while enjoying the sights. I never thought the Statue of Liberty was as beautiful as she is.
New york. Everything and all the places were great. The show ( jersey boys ) was amazing and we got so much done it was very tiring.What a great trip!

The view from the River Cafe. Located on the Brooklyn side of the Brooklyn Bridge, the River Café gives a dynamic view of Manhattan. Of course the food and service AND piano music are exceptional, if a little pricy.
The Best. Went to Las Vegas and saw the skyline and said :"It's nice, but it's not NY"NYC is the best city in the world/

Do not miss it!. A view from Empire State Building, especially on a sunny day, is something worth waiting and walking in long lines before and after fast elevators. Despite the large crowd, the staff do its job effectively.

Beautiful Walk in the Spring.. Beautifully maintained gardens and art installations line this restored railway line. It was magic walking it this month. The souvenirs available on site are unique and high quality. I love the DVF fridge magnets I bought from them.
Gorgeous. The Manhattan Skyline is gorgeous, Absolutely beautiful from all angles. Seeing it from the water at night is particularly stunning.

By Night or Day It's phenomenal. We saw the Manhattan sky line by night from The Empire State Building and by day from the "Top of the Rock" Rockefeller Building.Very busy at the Empire so a bit of a queue and wait but no time limit as to how long you stay once you're up there. The "Rock" gives a brilliant view of Central Park amongst other New York landmarks
best from tour boat. it is not until you are way from the land that manhattan into its own from the boat view you can see many areas of they city...........

View this from Staten Island. Took the Staten Island ferry after dark and saw lower Manhattan Skyline. Good views along with view of Statue of Liberty. You can take the return ferry without waiting, all at no cost.

Awesome skyline. Best viewed from Hudson River - I took sightseeing boat which provided lots of opportunity to photograph this view. Also some nice views from Brooklyn - especially via night tour bus/boat
Iconic.. Good to see this iconic skyline 'in the flesh', after seeing it so many times on TV. Our best view was from the boat coming back from Ellis Island.

Concrete Jungle. While Manhattan is clearly a concrete jungle it is probably the most impressive skyline anywhere in the world, not just in the USA.
It's a shame there aren't more trees there but then I guess it wouldn't be Manhattan if it were different.
The best of New York. The Manhattan skyline view from a boat on Hudson river is an unforgettable experience. Don't forget your camera.

very good. did the night tour on the green bus which takes about two hours,
don't go upstairs on the open deck if it is windy as it's freezing.
we enjoyed it even though we were cold.The tour guide LW is brilliant, he's like a sponge he knew everything and could answer every question that was asked. Well worth doing
Where else?. On manhattan it is hard to see. But landing in Newark, looking from the staten island ferry or walking across Brooklyn bridge it will be right ther in front of you - it is addictive.

Totally Awesome!. We bought tickets to a night bustour and it show us the most beautifull view of the Manhattan slyline! Great ride and awesome view! Our busdrive drove very slowly over the briges so we could have the best view!

From two vantage points. Saw this magnificent view from Top of the Rock Observation Deck and from the Empire State Building. Never get old. However, next time I will do at night to see the city in lights.

short stay but a great location.. What a fab skyline. One at night. One by day do the night tour
Well worth it to see the skyline from Brooklyn it makes a fab backdrop on your photos.
You can't miss it!. From our first misty views as the Queen Mary 2 came in to Brooklyn, to the stunning views from Top of the Rock, we just couldn't fail to be amazed at Manhattan.

This isn't even a thing!. What company manages this page!? It's actually nonsense that TA allows this page to exist. Is this the skyline from NJ? Is it Brooklyn? Queens? Staten Island? Who gets to take credit for the Manhattan Skyline? If this is a page I think the View Of My Apartment Building should be a page as well. Also The Tree Next To My Apartment.
Fantastic views. Well worth a trip up there. My only regret was not going up there at night. Will definately do that next time!!
Away from the bustle of New York. This is worth a visit if you have some spare time. Good views of the city and a pleasant, invigorating walk away from the bustle of the Big Apple
Not like it ones was. It is not as reconisable as it was when the twin tower was there. but it is still nice. Miss the twin towers.

Looking Over. Great walk across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn. Lots of spots to take photos. Once on the other side, go see the DUMBO community of shops and boutiques, have some ice cream on the boardwalk and ride a carasoul

One of the most memorable views in the world. I love returning to New York and to view the Skyline on a clear and sunny day. One can view the Skyline from one of the many boats or across from the Brooklyn Bridge or the Statten Ferry. There isn't a skyline like it in the World and now the buildings around Ground Zero are nearing completion it makes a visit here really worthwhile and Children especially will love it.
It was ok. I visited the Skyline in the evening and I didn't think it was a big deal. It was also raining when I went but maybe it's better during the day.
Beautiful place to be. If you are a New Yorker like me this is the best place to be because you could enjoy all the tall blgds & the more than a dozen parks

You haven't gone to NYC until you don't see it. Take the 1 Line of the subway (put check by "is ugly but efficient") to Battery Park (enjoy the spaces), then go to the Staten Island Ferry Terminal (wow) and take the ferry for free. As the ship goes away from the pier you will be watching all the postcards you have been looked for years while a smile appears in your face.

Fantastic. Saw it from the top of the Empire state Building and the Rockafeller Centre but the view from the Statton island ferry was the one that I liked the best _ its true that the tourists go about with cricks in there necks but it is so wonderful to see the Buildings from down below and from the rooftops

Amazing views. This is one of the best skyline views in the world (second only in my opinion to London). Everywhere you go you recognise something from a movie - it is particularly impressive at sunrise and sunset
Awesome. Wow you have to see it believe it a must if you can. So many people and so much activity to see and do just awesome.

Iconic view best appreciated from the NJ side!. This is the view that you must see! and you must see it by day and by night to appreciate what you are looking at. The lights and the buildings are beautiful, especially with the addition of the new Freedom Tower. Although the buildings are spectacular when you see them from NY City, find a way to see them from the water looking in, even it if means a ride on the Staten Island Ferry or looking back at them from the NJ side of the river. Find a map and see which buildings are which. The Empire State Building is often lit in different colors to commemorate some event in the city. Use your imagination for ways to look at it!
FAO Schwarz Toy Store. Like falling back into your child hood. I just found out they are closing soon, so you better get there if you want to see it.
A must see.. A must see, day or night. It's gorgeous, it makes great pictures and you must go see that view before leaving New York.

oz. The Manhattan skyline is magical especially at sunrise and at sunset and into the evening. It is especially awesome when walking or riding a bike on the bike path in Bay Ridge Brooklyn. It really seems like the Emerald City from Oz.
Beautiful Skyline. Best view is from Brooklyn, you can walk across the bridge and relax in DUMBO and enjoy the beautiful area and the great views.

Hard to beat. The skyline of NYC is great. I'd recommend venturing out into Brooklyn or Williamsburg and checking it out from there at night. Also, Top of the Rock gets a better view that the Empire State buidling

Take a helicopter it's cheap and easy. Approx. 15 Minute TourAll aboard for a fantastic bird’s-eye view of the magic isle ofManhattan. Experience the beauty of Central Park, the Hudson River, New York Harbor including the Intrepid Sea Air Space Museum. Marvel at the splendor of Rockefeller Center, the Empire State, Chrysler, Met Life buildings and the World Financial Center. Delight in flying by the historical richness of the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Greenwich Village, South Street Seaport and the 120 year old Brooklyn Bridge. All this and more of the dramatic New York skyline makes this tour a best seller and a must for any visitor.

where to get the best shots. you have two options, get to hoboken on the path (cute town) or to the Brooklyn promenade, on the E, A, or F. otherwise, you can go to the northern border of the reservoir in Central Park, AMAZING shots, or go the great lawn in Central Park also.... you won't regret it!

Nothing Better. Seeing the skyline from Brooklyn Heights Park is spectacular. Always changing different times of the day and the year. Winter's the best because the air is so crystal clear and every building or light at night is so beautifully visible. Sun setting behind the City is another spectacular sight. Sun rising on the City is also spectacular. Very picture-worthy.

Night lights of Manhattan Skyline. What a fantastic experience. It was like Christmas all at once. We were so lucky to have an experienced and skilled host. So knowledgeable. The lights were unbelievable.
Just mesmerizing. It is a great view of the skyline. The best is observed from the sea side while on a ferry to Statue of liberty.
Fantastic!. The beauty of this project lays in its simplicity! Every time I visit NYC I take a walk in the Skyline. Every time I see a different angle of this great city.

just like in movies. Get to spot far away from the island and then you can truly appreciate for what it is. I watched it from the Liberty island and it's breathtaking!
The night view is even more stunning
Everything you expect. Loved the skyline both at night and during the day. Times Square is worth a visit at night to see the lights and it is similar to being there during the day. Great Experiance.
the view. I cannot get tired of seeing the view. Best places to watch is across in the Brooklyn Bridge and or fromm the park in Queens

Gantry Plaza State Park along East River. If you get a chance, visit this park along East River in Queens. It offers amazing Manhattan skyline (midtown). The park is new, with a very long stretch of boardwalk, very quiet and relaxing. Visiting in late afternoon will get a chance to see spectacular Manhattan sunset.

Great view from the bridges and the ferry. It's worth while crossing the bridges or getting the ferrys to get a distance view, it's pretty amazing. The staten island ferry has great views of the skyline, Ellis island and the statue.

Better than on the pictures. Brooklyn Bridge with blue skies: breath-taking. Really impressive, more than I imagined. The views from Empire State and Rockefeller Centre (even better) can take a lot of your time, enjoying the views.

Great Architecture. Buildings all around you are historic. Beautiful to look at. There was a lot of scaffolding for cleaning the building or resurfacing which was difficult to get around in Times Square..

Get back home, you'll wonder where the bulidings are. We felt safe all day. What a city, wear good walking shoes, try the subway and the smaller restaurants. Have a good street map. GPS did not work because of the tall buildings

A different view of Manhattan. It's worth walking along the skyline from 30th & 10th Ave and get off at the Meatpacking district to visit the Chelsea Market. A lot of the planting is immature but it will get better as it grows. It's an easy walk on a good surface.

New York skyline. From the Empire State Building the view is spectacular. Very well organised but be prepared for the crowds, try to get there early. If you're fit you can walk up the last six floors to the observation deck. We also saw the skyline from the round New York island cruise a great way to see the city from different perspective.
Mind Blowing. Fantastic! Everything you might expect and nothing to disappoint. Breathtaking and lives up to all expectations.
amazing. Just like in the movies!! Breathtakingly at night time & so very big!! Take lots of pictures, I ended up with a sore neck looking up all the time

Manhattan Skyline from Dirty Jersey. While I was still in high school, some of my friend and I sat on a cliff in Fort Lee, New Jersey and just looked at NYC in the middle of the night. It was so beautiful. I started taking some pictures. I was getting frustrated they were looking so crappy on my phone but so fascinating through my eyes.Anyways it was free and I guess that's a local-y way to do it because I've been going to the city every year and plus some since I could remember. (And it's only $2 to and from the city from here.)

see it from the water or new jersey. do a boat trip to see nyc skyline at its best...or go across to new jersey and see it from there! the bridges, the buildings, the water traffic are all worth the trip!
As good in the flesh. You see it in the movies but watching the sun set and the lights come on is spectacular!!!Take a trip over to New Jersey for the best views of that famous skyline

Circle Line. Booked online the tickets before flying to New York. We arrived early for the 10 am cruise and only waited a short while before boarding. Photo opportunity was available. We sat outside upstairs and had a good seat.The gentleman giving the commentary was exceptionally good and very knowledgeable and nothing was too much trouble for him. The trip was excellent and the views were fantastic. We saw a great deal of New York without any walking. We went downstairs for a hot chocolate cocktail which was 12$ rather expensive but the girl had no idea how to make it, it was barely warm and they did not have the cream to put on top.We were able to have photo shots of all the iconic buildings and went right past the Statue of Liberty.We thoroughly enjoyed this trip and would recommend it.
Great idea!!!. It is a great place for a walking. The idea of making a park where before there was only an old train track is wonderful!

Stunning views. This really is a must for anyone who travels to NYC as the views are amazing. My tip would be go during the day as well as going at night as in my opinion there is a dramatic change in how you will see NYC.

No where else. This is the stuff that we've all seen from films to TV series. It must be one of the most recognisable views in the world. Everywhere you look there are buildings you know no matter where you live this iconic view must have been part of your memories. No wonder tourists are identified so easily, we're the ones wandering around looking up and saying 'look at that' every few minutes.

World class skyline. I am not sure if it's ranked as the best skyline of the world (it's objective anyways), but you have to see it by yourself at least once and experience the magic view of this legendary city. Mixture of famous buildings: luxurious ones and classic ones, making the skyline special.

Iconic view and a must see from the river at night.. The skyline from the river at night is spectacular.During the day the iconic building are worth photographing and the Empire State Building is memorable

Stunning lights at night.. We did a night bus tour and it was well worth it. Very stunning view. The view of the bridges that cross the river, the Brooklyn bridge was very nice. The tall buildings of Manhattan such a crysler building, Empire State and Rockefeller centre looked amazing. Disliked all the traffic.

It has to be seen. We managed to get the view by walking over the Brooklyn Bridge,on the boat to the Statue of Liberty, but the best of all was the night trip to Brooklyn with the Big Red bus company they slowed over the bridge and the view was amazing.

Amazing View. Amazing views from rooftop terraces and Rockefeller Tower. Recommended for sunset and night time..A lot of modern towers are being built and in a few years this will look different.. It's like a live organism..
THE Skyline!. Make sure you do either the Empire State or Rockefeller viewing decks. The view is spectacular. You haven't done New York if you haven't seen the Skyline.
all i thought it would be. very impressive especially from empire state building. the Brooklyn bridge gave an excellent panorama

amazing view. There is a reason why its called the concrete jungle and it just looks like an island with a jungle of skyscrapers.The best place to get a good view of the Manhattan skyline or other lovely pics like jersey city, Govenors island and staten island is from a cruise.You dont need to pay much for a guided tour, its included in most of the city tours. i used the gray line and it was part of the downtown tour.

Definatley recommend. Stayed here with family for 4 nights, room service was excellent and beds were comfortable. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful along with the hotel being situated in an ideal location, just a short walk from the famous times square. Would definatley recommend this hotel to anyone, really enjoyed my time here.

A view that never tires me. There is only one skyline like manhattan but you can see it from Brooklyn, queens, New jersey or from the air but alwaysbrings me comfort. It is like an old friend bekonning us home. It is however evolving as newer and taller building are erected and changing forever the view.
Amazing views in all directions. The daytime views are wonderful but the nighttime views even better. Depending on where you are in Manhattan & sat what venue at what height the views are spectacular

Wow!. You see it on tv and in films but wow what a sight so magical, I took a boat trip to see the statue of liberty and then the boat took us under the Brooklyn bridge and of course that wonderful skyline.
One of the best views in.... Union City - Hamilton Park!You should see it twice: in daytime and in nighttime with all the beatiful lights.

SKYLINE in chelsea. Brilliant idea to utilise the old train tracks of New york city, up there you can see the amazing view of the river and cheese side of NY, below you can glad some lunch before heading up there and sit an relax..
Amazing- day and night. Had a great time viewing the skyline from the Brooklyn bridge- so iconic and doesn't dissapoint in real life- a must see if you're in the area!

out of this world. well we were lavishing in 80 degree heat with clear skies,we wondered over to Brooklyn heights and had a spectacular sight of the famous sun set over manhattan skyline ,the hudson river,statue of liberty and all three of the BMW bridges.truly amazing experience that cost nothing

A unique skyline. Great especially if seen from the Empire State Building observatory or on a chopper ride. The number of buildings above 200 metres and their different characters e.g. the Chrysler building makes it unique
A MUST when in NY. We go on the Sky-line every time we are in NY...fun for everyone. Really relaxing to sit in one of the lounge chairs, listen to the fountain, and watch the people go by.

Skylines. There are many views of the Manhattan skyline whether it is from the Empire State Building or the top of the rock at the Rockfeller building which you have to pay and wait long ques.There are also many free views of the skyline from the Staten Island ferry, many vantage points from Central Park especially on 5th Ave and 90th.
great views. great views of the city from everywhere, especially from atop hi rise buildings like the Empire Bldg and Top of The Rock. perfect weather
Just love it. So iconic it brings a tear to my eye especially on leaving watch it from the taxi taking us back to airport
Epic. Surreal to see knowing what it looked like before. The city is in rebuild mode. There is a certain strength that is among everyone you meet.

What more can you say..... What can you say about something that everyone already knows so well? It's so incredibly iconic, and the first time you see it either from the plane, or from the cab is a special moment. The view from Brooklyn shore is particularly evocative, but so are many others.
great by night. great friendly service even late at night, and the view is iconic, legendary and wonderful. we were blessed with a clear night, but it does get a bit windy up there, so take a jacket!

Iconic. The Manhattan skyline always takes my breath away. Try to view it from as many different perspectives as possible: flying overhead on approach to JFK; views from the Staten Island Ferry; looking back as you cycle across the Brooklyn Bridge; and if you have to venture to New Jersey in the evening -- the best part is glimpses of the magical Manhattan skyline!

Best seen from New Jersey, Brooklyn, Queens, and by boat. The expression "couldn't see the forest for the trees" applies here. If you are in central or downtown Manhattan, the impressively tall structures block your view of the larger whole. You could go to the Top of the Rock (in Rockefeller Center), the Empire State Building, or the new World Trade Center building for spectacular views looking down, and I recommend that you do so. But there's a lot to be said for viewing all of Manhattan's skyline from outside Manhattan.Good ways to do this are by boat (e.g., the Staten Island Ferry or a Circle Line ride), or by simply crossing the Hudson to New Jersey or the East River to Brooklyn or Queens. From any of these places you'll get great views of the Manhattan skyline. It's equally impressive at daytime or night.
New York New York. Still one of the most iconic sights in the world best seen from the water taxi or ferry the Zepher boat trip is good as well
breathtaking. a must do in NYC. No matter how many times you've seen it on films nothing compares to being there. Would recommend seeing it from any of the ferry services available.

Breath taking Skyline. It is not possible anymore to get up on Chrysler Building. It is under private property now! Therefore: Best overlook on Empire State Building. It is worth to stand in line for quite a while.

Mesmerizing.. It was amazing to see the city from different vantage points throughout our stay. The night view from the ferry was my favorite. Also coming back from the Statue of Liberty in the evening was pretty too. City girl at heart-never get tired of the view.

Choose both day and night opportunities. Empire State Building at night and Top of the Rock during the day.
Recommend reserving a time for the Rock the day before. Lines can be long. Excellent view of Central Park
Nothing Like it. Just like in the movies, only you're actually there. New world trade centre buildings make a special mark, as does the new Park Avenue building -- unbelievably tall!
Beautiful . I've been here a couple of times and it is so bright and beautiful! It's fun to sit on the beach and see the city in the distance.

Don't miss the Skyline. Best viewed from across one of the rivers. Many restaurants across either river. If you schedule a dinner that starts in daylight and ends after dark you can see the lights come on in the buildings.

Very nice to see. NewYork is so beautiful, so big, so great and the Skyline is really great, with the helicopter, boat or Big Bus you have to see this. We also took the light-tour so the Big Bus in the dark, also very nice over the bridges.

Must Be Seen. Perhaps the most iconic skyline in the world, you have to see this! There are many great places to get the classic view, but the WNYC Transmitter Park in Greenpoint, Brooklyn, offers a stunning vista (if you don't feel like paying for the Top of the Rock, or Empire State Building).

Great views from under the Brooklyn Bridge. A great place to see the Manhattan skyline is to walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and then look across the East River towards the city at dusk. You can see the Statue of Liberty across the harbour and the twinkle of the city lights as the sun sets. Grab an ice cream cone and then join everyone else to enjoy the views!

Best way to see Manhattan is from a helicopter. will never forget this experience, is expensive but worth it. 15 min tour lets you see everything. Safe video to watch and you do have to wait for a while. People that is booked onto the flight only get into the building so if not going there is a café down the road for you to go and wait.

Get off the Island. The best way to see the Skyline is to be away from it looking toward it. Go to Brooklyn, New Jersey and the Staten Island Ferry and get views from all points to really appreciate the skyline. Don't forget your camera (and fresh batteries, and lots of storage space on your memory card).

The most iconic skyline in the world. One Saturday, try a different perspective on this iconic skyline. View it across the East river from the Brooklyn Smorgasburg (sic); seasonal outdoor foodie market with 75+ street food vendors in the East River State Park, Kent Ave, Brooklyn, NY 11211
Take a trip to it on the East river ferry.
Fantastic views of Manhattan back across the river.
Skyline. Wonderful day and night, especially the Gehry in Lower Manhattan. Watch the night lights from the top of the Rock. Cool!

It is what it is. Not that I miss the old Twin Towers, but I disagreed with the procedure by which they were demolished, to put it mildly. Every time I go back there are different landmarks to learn and the skyline is more obscure.
Skyline by night. Take a night time sight seeing tour from Time Square to arrive in Brooklyn about sunset. The skyline looks fantastic!

Great way to see by Circle Line. Last night we saw the sunset in one of their ships. david was a great Tour Guide providing hundreds of interesting information about NY. Great way to start the evening
Fabulous!. What is there not to say about Manhattan! Be sure to have a good old Sabrett with all the fixin's and a slice of pizza from one of the many vendors.

Cruise New York Harbor from Staten Island. A great way to see the south end of Manhattan is from the Staten Island ferry. Its about a half hour ride from Staten Island to the Battery and another half hour to return. The ferry is large and comfortable. It passes near the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. From the Battery one can walk to many of the major sites of Lower Manhattan. And the ferry is still FREE!

Beautiful!!!. Awesome view from Statue of Liberty and what I loved the most was the walk across Brooklyn bridge. As advised by my coworker,take subway to Brooklyn and walk towards Manhattan , amazing experience, the whole Manhattan is in front of you and you will realize the unbelievable beauty!!!
Breathtaking. Had an amazing view from the Statue of Liberty, nice to walk around there and take pics of the skyline

Skyline View. Best view from Brooklyn Bridge to skyline with Finance district, great picture spots around the tower plattforms and benches along the path walk. Best time round noon, also aviable by bike with special bike lane.
Beautiful sunset. Find a roof top restaurant and watch the scenery, spectacular to see as if the buildings are changing colour.
Somethig you will never forget. if you don't live busy places Manhattan is not for you. But if u love it then it's place for you , food , music , people buildings etc

Fascinating. I'm hoping this refers to the actual skyline and not a manufactured tourist attraction called Manhattan Skyline.
Does the skyline stay the same for any lenght of time? I suspect not. I loved any view I got of the skyline.

mix and match. I love the skyline with the old and new competing for attention, huddled alongside each other. Ultimately I like the older buildings with their personalities and quirky curves and details. So up high I see the line but the thrill is spotting the details.
Unique. You will have seen the skyline on TV and film - nothing prepares you for the real thing. Best seen from Central Park or from one of the cruise boats that sail along the harbour.

Woody Allen. Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan in the evening just before it gets dark. DO NOT LOOK BACK!! Make sure it is dark when you get to Brooklyn. If there are two or more of you, start humming Gershwin's Rhapsody in Blue. If you are by yourself, play it in you head otherwise people will look. Turnaround quickly, what a sight - and an homage to Woody Allen when he made great films. If you do not know who Woody Allen is - ask a friend who knows about the cinema and then watch his Manhattan

Awful. Just Awful. We decided to go on the skyline because it was free with our NYC pass. Thank god we didn't pay. For starters it was really overpriced. I think it was more expensive than the price to go up the empire state building itself. Then it's basically a poor ride where you travel around NYC with Kevin Bacon and you randomly end up in the Hudson river with a shark and then out in space. It just didn't make sense. I would compare it to a £3 motion simulator you go on at a fairground. The best thing about it was I got to sit down for a little bit. If you have the NYC pass then fine, but do NOT pay to go on this. It's bad. Bad bad bad.

The Most Iconic Skyline Worldwide. The Manhattan skyline to this day is one of, if not the most iconic skyline across the globe. Whichever view you get of the skyline it is sure to leave you amazed with plenty of skyscrapers and recognisable buildings whether it is the One World Trade, Empire State or the Chrysler building there is always a unique building to look at.Liberty Island gives a great shot of lower Manhattan and the financial district as well. I would highly recommend the CircleLine cruises for great shots around the city.

Doable if included in NY Pass. Average tour with ridiculous price tag for what you get. The advantages are that it doesn't take much time and is included in NY pass. But we exited saying "thank God we didn't pay for that one"...
Very short, not very funny and just a little bit informative.

Amazing view of the skyline both during the day and as you land/take off from Newark. Fantastic almost out of this world view. Flown to Newark many times and the view is wonderful every time its good weather!
awesome view. Just a stunning skyline. Gorgeous and so much history, The iconic buildings are even better viewed at night.
amazing. You stand there just looking around at all the skyscrapers new and old just amazing. So much to see and do you just can not get it all in
Best Place To Be In NYC. Visit this place if you are in NYC. One of the best urban skylines you can see in this part of the world.
Awesome. There is nothing that compares with the skyline in Manhattan. The iconic buildings are easily recognized, and the amount of skyscrapers is mind-blowing. You'll never forget seeing this!

Just amazing . What else can I say about this amazing skyline. New York in its glory. Not to be missed!!!
The best view is from New Jersey, but anyway u look at it is just amazing
the city that never sleeps. from the ferry docks through the 5 boroughs, NY rocks. the architecture in all the neighbourhoods is awesome. we loved walking on the high line and in central park.

Empire State Building. Nice Place to be around and visit. Excellent directions and concerned people to guide around. With New York Pass, Getting inside was pretty easy and the view from the 83rd Floor was breath-taking. Overall an experience worth cherishing and remembering.

The most beautiful view-stunning!. Best places to see the skyline- from the Brooklyn bridge. Walk over the bridge and take several stops to see and take pictures- from the Circle line boats - from the Brooklyn Heights promenade- from a helicopter and the heliport- from Top of the Rock- from inside Central ParkWhat ever you choose, it truly is a gorgeous view if you love skyscrapers as much as I do!

Breathtaking Views. Skyline is amazing! It is pretty breathe-taking to actually be there and see the skyline! Best views are from Empire State Building, Staten Island Ferry (free), and Liberty Island.
Amazing. From Top of the rocks (Rockfeller center 48th floor), from the Brooklyn bridge, from the boat... it's just amazing!
There's nothing like it in the world. After visiting NYC many times I am always in awe of the skyline as well as the new construction going on throughout the city.

The Best Skyline in the World. The best part of our NYC skyline are the gold topped buildings, which glitter in the sunlight, and deco buildings such as the Chrysler, Empire State and Woolworth Buildings, that are beautifully lit up at night. Sometimes the Empire State is lit in colors significant of a team, holiday or organization, and then it's very special.

From Empire State. It was a really cold winter day with a crisp blue sky so fabulous skyline of NYC. Just freezing.. The line ups were pretty long as usual for Empire State Building and if you have never done a big tall building in the States - its worth it.
Majestic Buildings. We went downtown to do some sight seeing and shopping, and it was amazing how much we could do in a small amount of city.
Fantastic view. Take in the view from the staten Island ferry, Liberty Island or Ellis , top of the Empire State it is very impressive. Lots of walking but well worth the effort.
Amazing Skyline. What can you say - I am so amazed at how big the buildings are in Manhattan. If you have never been to New York, this is a must see.

Beautiful!. It's spectacular!! It's a don't miss opportunity. The buildings are artful and the architecture is so unusual and varied. You can't stop taking pictures of everything you see! Walking is ideal while seeing it.

Everything at your feet. Don't even think you can't have exactly
what you want...NY has it wrapped, sealed
and delivered!
Like: Movies, Broadway Shows, Sightseeing of
all kinds: road, boat, walking..
Vistas of magnificent proportions, keep your camera at the read!

View better than empire state building. Roof top bar, 200 5th avenue. The view from here put u eye level to the manhatten skyline. The food wasn't up to much. But buy a drink and soak in the panoramic skyline view.
Just so Manhattan. Take a trip on the river to see it at its best. We took a City sightseeing boat trip which takes you around the downtown Manhattan bit of the island. Well worth it.

Amazing from lots of places. The Manhattan Skyline can be seen from various places, such as Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn, Roosevelt Island and lots more. It is truly spectacular. Our favourite was on the Staten Island Ferry. This is FREE. Must do this.Walking along the Brooklyn Bridge towards Manhattan. This is FREE. Must do this too.Roosevelt Aerial Tramway, cost of a subway ticket. All awesome
Always Beautiful,,,. The view of Manhattan at night from the Manhattan bridge is incomparable. It's so beautiful & magical.
Amazing. Enjoy it best from the cab on your way from the airport or on your walk across the Brooklyn bridge. When you have crossed the bridge you can enjoy a nice park to your right.

Nothing beats seeing the Manhattan Skyline for the first time. I have dreamed about seeing this skyline since I was a little girl, so when we drove over Brooklyn Bridge for the first time 3 weeks back and I saw the skyline, with the World Trade Center and the Empire State Building I was completely in awe and blown away.Absolutely nothing beats seeing this for the first time, I actually felt emotional. Whenever you happen to have a view of the skyline from wherever you are you have to take picture, after picture of it. It's simply stunning.I took photos from the bridge, Liberty Island and a ferry, and also the Empire State Building.The feeling in your tummy when gazing at this is unlike anything else, not even when I've been gazing at Paris from Montmarte did I feel this way, You'll love it! And make sure to take as many snaps as you can, but still bask in it's majesty with your own eyes.

Superb views from almost anywhere. Took in the views of the skyline at every opportunity, by boat, from the Empire State Building, The Top Of The Rock, Brooklyn Bridge and even the odd rooftop bar. You cant fail to be impressed especially at night. When walking the streets you end up with a bad neck constantly looking skyward to take in the marvellous architecture. If I ever come back I may even take a Helicopter ride.
One of the most recognizable city skylines in the world..... ....and amazing to see in person. Got lots of pictures from different angles (on ferry to Statue of Liberty, on Manhattan Bridge).

Perhaps one of the best view of modern architecture. We all know Manhattan is famous for its skyscrapers and it can be viewed best from Ellis island.I would say this is one of the best views other than natures beauty i have ever seen.This skyline can also be seen from others points as well. And it looks great after full illumination.

Its all in the history and still happens. A good evening walk to watch the sunset in Manhattan is worth a time of your life for its history.. The big apple still lives up to its history and how these buildings sprung up post WW2. Must visit and worth spending an evening all by yourself or friends / family.

Unlike anywhere else on earth. The most famous city on the earth is New York, and for good reason. There is something in the air in this ecclectic and diverse place and the skyline really shows how this isolated little island really is it's own city of perfection and unique originality right here.

Take photos then take more photos. The best photos are from a boat, Jersey City or Brooklyn and Queens.
Also from the Empire State Building or the Top of the Rock.
Girls trip to NY. Amazing. Saw it by boat, from across the Brooklyn Bridge and by helicopter (the best). Beautiful. Even if you don't like modern architecture it's impressive.

Best View of the Manhattan Skyline!. I was visiting New York last week and visited the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. The view of the NYC skyline is one of the best I've ever seen from the ferry and from both Liberty and Ellis Island. Great place to take pictures of the skyline from!

architecture. The diversity in the architecture and height of the buildings.
The skyline at night with the lights was magical.

An iconic view around every corner.. We really enjoyed the views from Staten Island over New York harbour. The view from Brooklyn Bridge as you walk back to Manhattan and the view uptown and downtown from the Rockefeller centre.
WOW - MUST SEE AT LEAST ONCE. The skyline in NYC is absolutely gorgeous and its sheer size is so amazing. Great from all sides and times of day and night, a must see!
Almost surreal. Having seen so many movies of NYC, it was almost surreal to be there in person! What an amazing city!!

Like no other skyline I've ever seen.. Each time I've visited New York, the first glimpse I've had of the skyline on the way to my hotel from the airport has been awesome. Each day in the City has been a pleasure to see the local spots and to take in the atmosphere. On my first visit to The Waldorf, I had a wonderful view of Park Avenue which was a joy to see day and night. This time I was on the 13th. floor and although my view was the back of a building being renovated, however I had a lovely view of the Chrysler building. A friend in New York told me he never looked up at the tall buildings as it made him look like a tourist. I however loved the skyline and don't mind being identified as a tourist, that was why I was there, apart from celebrating my birthday. The skyline is pure New York City and I love it.
From the Water's Edge. Remember that scene from the TV series Person Of Interest? Visit restaurant The Water's Edge for the most phenomenal sunset view of the Manhattan Skyline!

Amazing Views. These are awesome views of an amazing city. Take the time to experience the mix of old - historic - building along side the modern glass skyscrapers. There are also the mixture of both - in one building - which is where it all started. Take the time to walk around and look up to experience it all. Enjoy.
Spectacular. Saw the skyline from a daytime cruise, a nightime cruise and from the Brooklyn Bridge. It is quite amazing.

BLEW MY MIND. You might think that you are living in the best city in the world, but wait till you see the NYC skyline, it is indeed serene ! It just looks like another wonder added to this modern wold. You really see Love within this city and the skyline just shows there's no limit to where you can be in New York.

Very graphic for photographers. It is best seen from the Jersey side. You will see many photographers all throughout the day taking some amazing pictures. I think this must be the most photographed part of NYC. Make sure to take your camera when you reach here. Evening time when the sun sets, it is magical.
It has o be on everyones bucket list. It's one of those places that everyone must see, do, experience at least once in a lifetime. It's just so amazing.

Little Blurgh. I had this ride included with my New York Pass so luckily i didn't buy it because i think its hugely over priced for what it is.Its a fun simulation ride that takes you round New York.I never usually get motion sickness but for some reason I did on this ride and 2 of my friends did also. If its free...do it. Don't pay!

See it by night. Manhattan Island is just over 2 miles wide, so as it grew it could only go upwards. There are many wonderful cityscapes in the world but Manhattan will also be special as skyscrapers rise from water level in the Financial District continuously up the "hill". Looks impressive from Brooklyn or Manhattan bridges
View from the bridge!. I thought the best view of the city was from the Brooklyn Bridge on the Brooklyn side. Wonderful skyline! Must see!! Go at night!!

Beautiful view, very nice walk. We took a subway to Brooklyn Heights (E - High St.) and took a walk by the East River, then crossed The Brooklyn Bridge back to Manhattan. The scenery was fantastic and the walk was excellent for our bodies and soles.
Always Beautiful. The Manhattan Skyline never disappoints. We took a cab around the city at night and the lights were very beautiful.
Take the subway. Take the subway under the Hudson. Ten minute walk down through Brooklyn and then you get the perfect skyline. Toilets here to.
Still is a breathtaking view!. Had the pleasure of a boat ride around Manhattan and then you really experience this fantastic site and sites!
ESB mandatory. the whole Manhattan skyline can be deeply appreciated from teh roof of either the rocketfeller center or the ESB. A mandatory step in your trip to NY

Epic.. We experienced this from the upper observation deck of the Empire State Building. The most amazing part of this expansive beauty, for me, was the new World Trade Centre. This is a city that will never die, This is a city with amazing passion and pride. This is the most beautiful skyline in the world. (Maybe Toronto is a contender, too!)
Spectacular landmarks!. See this at dusk and you'll watch the city transform before your eyes! Best seen from the top of the Rockefeller Center at their 5:15pm session.
Beautiful day or night!. The best views for us were from the ferry trip that was included in our "Hop on, Hop off" bus tour. We had great views from our 55th floor hotel room, too!
Changing skyline is always the same. Like a few other great cities, Manhattan keeps changing but still retains essential elements that keep it ever-exciting and welcoming.

A view not to be missed. You don't realize just how big, and compact, NYC is until you get a view from up or out of the city.During our recent trip we got a view from the harbor which was amazing to see what millions of immigrants saw when coming to America. We also got a birds-eye view of the skyline from the Top of the Rock viewing site.Both were amazing and I recommend both if you are able. Be careful though if you have a fear of heights because at the Top of the Rock.......high is an understatement.
What a view. We took the bus tour at night, and the driver found a great place to look back over the river and see the lights and the skyline. Truely a wonderfull place.
Interesting. If you like well lit buildings packed close together then don't miss the NYC skyline. It will help remind you how crowded NYC has become.

Amazing Skyline . The best view on Manhattan that I had, was from North Bergen, state New Jersey.
I do recommend you to visit it! Take a bus from Port Authority from gate 212, any bus, it will cost you only 3,20€ - but you will se the Manhattan from another angle and it is worth it!
Wonderfully Romantic. The most beautiful skyline I've never seen. Nothing like looking at Manhattan skyline from the water at a distance.
For sure.. Following advice from TA , we saw the Skyline from the TOTR(Daytime) and Empire state(Night time). Both are worth a look .

The best. Everywhere you look there are fantastic buildings, they just got better and better. Loved it.
Nothing I disliked.

Start Spreading The News..... Though the Manhattan Skyline has changed over the years, it will never-in my eyes-be as majestic as when The Twin Towers were in the line up! Experience it at night time at least once to take in all of her amazing outlines of the buildings. Can't wait to visit again soon!
What a View!. Love seeing this skyline over and over again, especially from tour buses. Magnificent view! We went over the Brooklyn Bridge on a Grayline Tour bus and enjoyed every minute of it.

Best way to see it. Go on the Big Bus tour on the uptown, downtown and midtown bus tour, with Statue of Liberty sail past which is value for money without a doubt
Trip also includes a night trip to see the Manhattan Syline from the Brooklyn Bridge and take your camera the sights and pictures are exceptional

Magnificent. Manhattan Skyline is amazing. The best way to see it is to go to the Jersey City/Hoboken Promenade. It is a walk along the "shoreline" of New Jersey facing Manhattan. Go there 30 minutes before sunset and see the changes in view, from full light to night. To get there, take the PATH from Penn Station or World Trade Center to either Hoboken or Exchange Plaza. The journey costs $2.75 each way. Well worth it!

Empire State Building & Rockefeller Centre. It was fantastic, looking over the Skyline of Manhattan on top of the Empire State Building and the Rockerfeller Center. It was a Gray drizzly day so NO line ups but it still was fantastic.....we loved it!
Spectacular!. Truly amazing, especially when viewed from across the Hudson on the NJ side, with many great photos opportunity's.

Skyline. We travelled by subway to visit The Statue of Liberty, when in the train a local passenger suggest to visit the Brooklyn promenade. It was an amazing experience as we lookout to the Manhattan skyline glittering under the American sun. The spring weather made it surreal.

The Skyline. The New York Skyline is know world wide because it is so amazing!
One of the best ways to see it is the MTA tramway from Manhattan to Roosevelt Island at dusk or dawn. The trip cost $2.75 you travel up above the City and across to the island it is not a long ride but it is a beauty!

Awesome. At night this is a sight to behold. Even the strongest guys will weep at the beauty. But as the song says There are tears in the eyes of the regular guys cause new York ain't new York anymore. As you look you will never forget the damage brought to our shores by terrorists.

Breathtakingly beautiful!. Lovely views, around you. Best enjoyed, by foot.
Other attractions/must-see places close by: Wall Street, The Iconic Bull; NYSE; Trinity Church; 9/11 Memorial Site; Battery Park
Do not miss the nice eating joints by the road side, and even restaurants. Worth every step you walk along this area.

Breathtaking yet Familiar. We all know Manhattan - it being a familiar sight often seen in TV shows, movies, etc.
Experienced live, although known, provides a whole new dimension. You see the city from afar, it is at the palm of your hand... and the frenzy of the Downtown is never the same again.
A unique experience!
Enjoyed from a harbor cruise.. Excellent guide on boat but stops were too lengthy. The weather was perfect which greatly enhanced the views.

Great Views From A Lot Of Places. You don't have to go to the top of the Empire State Building for great skyline views. Really nice views form Brooklyn. Also, check Trip Advisor for rooftop bars. Some have spectacular views. Hotel Americano is one of them!

Amazing every time. Well, just look at all the great comments, you can't deny that this is one of those views that more or less everyone can enjoy so go and do it.
Great walk from Brooklyn (Bridge) during sunset and view of NYC
A good moment for distraction and cool shots.. I loved the experience, good shots you will take there I am telling you! You must go there for unforgettable moments.

One of the most beautiful city skylines. We did the night city loop bus tour and got to see the skyline at night and it was great. It took us over the Manhattan Bridge then back again so it was a great chance to take photos. I would highly recommend doing this but before you do go on Living Social or Groupon and see if there are any coupons.

Absolutely Beautiful!!. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful, especially at night. The view from The Brooklyn Bridge is fabulous, make sure you bring a camera! The Top of the Rock also offers a great 360 degree view of Manhattan. No matter where you go to see the skyline you can't go wrong. It's an absolutely wonderful view!! Enjoy!

Breathtaking!. Still breathtaking, spectacular & exciting to see, observe & be part of after all these years! When one drives in or flies in to Manhattan the views are awe inspiring. Nothing in the world like it!!
New York, New York. No where in the world is there quite the mixture of sky and skyscrapers. And so far, there is enough sky to allow the newer buildings to shine.

Breathtaking. New York skyline is iconic, viewed from our cruise ship is is breathtaking, find panoramic setting on your camera/phone.
On the return trip we viewed again at night, well worth the trip.
Amazing view. You have to see the view from the 'Top of the Rock' Rockefeller Center at sunset as all the city lights come on. You can watch the Empire State light up
View from a boat. To get the best view ever is to take a boat tour! Approx 1 hour long and you get to take the most amazing pictures of the major landmarks from the water

Amazing views and relaxing atmosphere. Loved this place....quiet..peaceful...and BEAUTIFUL...take a stroll along the promenade, watch the sunset, grab a bite, ice cream....
we walked across the manhattan bridge and then subway back to hotel as it was late

Definitive View of New York. The New York skyline is an instantly recognizable sight and it's worth seeking out a good vantage point. We tried from both the Staten Island ferry and from Roosevelt Island. Equally spectacular.
Make Sure You Get on a Boat. Some of my best pictures were taken from the water. Hop on and off taxi's and ferry to Liberty Island made for awesome photos.

Amazing view. From the ferries or bridges the views are excellent. Staten Island ferry is free . You get a great view of the Statue of Liberty. Good in daytime and better at sunset. Well worth the visit.
Not sure it can be beaten. Love the Manhattan Skyline, different all the time. Very spooky with the low cloud moving through as well.

The view from Long Island City is spectacular. Between the tall hotel being built and the glow from Times Square at night and everything in between, This sight is one I'll never forget. I've seen a lot in this country and internationally, but this one I'm glad I had the opportunity to see at least once!
fabulous. what a way to see this fabulous city . Met really interesting people from other parts of the world.Nothing about this trip we didn't like.

Stunning. You cannot be anything but impressed by this iconic view. The buildings are amazing. We went to the 'Top of the Rock' to see this attraction, and it was well worth the effort, and the expense!!!
Beautiful!. The scenery was beautiful! They took such a historic area and made it into something beautiful everyone can enjoy!
This is a City!. The skyline is a large part of what makes a city a city! NYC is absolutely tops in that regard. Though never the same from pre-2001, the Freedom Tower is a nice new addition.

Beautiful. Looking back at the city from across the river was amazing, day and night- It was like being in a movie! If you cross the Brooklyn bridge you can see the whole of Manhatten; the perfect opportunity to get some great pictures!
From Brooklyn heights. Cross Brooklyn Bridge on foot and enjoy the view from Brooklyn Promenade.Choose morning hours for the sun to be in the right position
Views from Jersey towards NewYork , priceless!!!!. I loved the view from where we stayed, we could see Manhattan Skyline and it is wonderful specially at night!
book a night tour. we took a night tour over the Manhattan Bridge for a spectacular view of New York by night. Well worth it

Something FREE in NYC. Took the ferry from Whitehall terminal to Staten Island which goes in & out between itself & Manhattan every 30 minutes. You get to see Status of Liberty & Manhattan skyline which was magical. The best feeling of all is the sense of conquest not having to pay a single dime for your enjoyment!!

Vacation NYC. When you see the skyline from across the river, it is an amazing site. It is beautiful in the day or night. Looking where the twin towers once were is very sad but seeing the Freedom Tower was awesome. You can take the ferry out to Liberty and get a wonderful view.

SO Easy From Clark Street on the 1,2 Red Line Subway. Well what a way to view the skyline of Lower Manhatten, get either the 1 or 2 line on the Red Subway, get off at Clark Street (First stop across the river) come out onto Clark Street, walk back down towards Manhatten.There you have a fantastic (and free) viewing area of stunning views of Lower Manhattendon't forget your camera

Empire State Building. Great view from the Roof Top Bar at the Gansevoort Park Hotel. We took lots of selfie's and night time photo's. Some nights the bar is quite, and some nights very crowded! Enjoyed it both ways.

Breathtaking. It's amazing to see a skyline you've seen on so many pictures and in so many movies in real life. It was beautiful, really loved the view. Both in daylight as at night, the skyline is worth a look.
Bar at the Rainbow Room. Check it out from the bar at the Rainbow Room in the Rock without having to pay for the lift up. Panoramic views and helpful staff to take pictures!

Aaron. First time here..easy taxi from at JFK airport costing fixed rate $58..there is plenty to see and do for all ages. Recommend getting to attractions early..there will be queues but moved quickly enough due to organised staff/security. My 3 attractions were E State Building, Rockefeller and 9/11 memorial. The memorial is free but you pay to visit museum which I recommend as it was very informative and educational. I didn't know where to stay in New York but my hotel and its location being mid town were fantastic...do it !
Skyline from the Rock. The view from the top of the rock is fabulous. Highly recommend this activity. We used the explorer pass to access the rock. Quite a bit of queuing though.

Always a thrill to see. Which ever way you approach Manhattan the skyline is exciting whether it's by boat from Staten Island, from Brooklyn, from New Jersey or even from Uptown. For my money it's the ferry ride in from Staten Island.
gorgeous view. Great view in the Manhattan skyline. gorgeous. tall buildings. beautiful. nice to see all that. perfect to go with family
Outstanding. Even in the snow Manhattan's skyline during the day or night was fantastic. The buildings, traffic , people, workers and general hustle and bustle added to the view.
NY by Night. great during day , Fantastic at night.86th floor at Empire state building gives great views of city.disliked fact that you had to use lifts everywhere as not great fan

The movies dont lie. Great skyline, like in the Movies. I recommend the Ferry to statue of Liberty, it gives a Perfect view of the skyline. Take the Ferry to pier 78 too, you will se the skyline and upper west side on Your right og New Jersey Skyline to Your left
AMAZING. Nothing to compare to it..I loved and surely I shall be back.Everything about it is nice and amazing.
Amazing!. Amazing! Dont miss it! Do the night tour of Brooklin with the Big bus company - you wont regret it! Photo opportunity or a lifetime!
OK. Disappointing if you've been to Hong Kong and similar places. Heresy to many I know, but most are pretty characterless
Manhattan View. The skyline from Brooklyn and at night is spectacular, especially when lit up with all the neon an bright lights.
Again, again again!!. We went for 5 days, two of which were very cold and misty, not a lot of skyline to see, but was still great, once the sun came out it was fantastic

Magnificent from all angles.... If you want to enjoy Manhattan Skyline ... I recommend going to 3 different locations...1. Take subway to Brooklyn and start walking back on the bridge towards Manhattan and enjoy the majestic skyline view...2. Take a Staten island ferry and both on the way back & forth enjoy view of skyline from the south side...3. Finally start walking on the jersey shore near newport area... and you'll find an amazing view..
Most exciting in the world. If you can view NYC skyline from a high rise above the 50th floor, do so, otherwise get in line at the Empire State building
Amazing and astounding !. Iconic and awesome. Best views were from trip inward from Jersey and the harbor tour. Best skyline views in the world! Majestic and beautiful.

Manhattan Skyline. It is very exciting and electric to see so many people going back and forth especially in Times Square. We enjoyed looking at the neon lights, the many, many shops, the many live actors theatres, the coffee shops and restaurants. People are very busy but most would help if one asked. Its a bit intimidating but exhilarating to see the sounds, the smells (good and bad) and especially the sights. Every American should visit NYC at least once in their lifetime. Love it!

great especially from Brooklyn Bridge and Staten Isalnd Ferry. It never ceases to amaze...take these two free options and you will not be disappointed. It is a city for walking an criss-crossing by metro
What a view. Wow, be it daylight or dark, there is no way you could mistake it for anywhere else . Iconic skyline. A photographers dream location .

The World is Here..!. Trust me guys.. if you are here.. you have seen it all and rest all is subjective. The greatest skyline you'll find on planet Earth. One must visit the observatory of The Rockefeller Center or The Empire State to get a Majestic view of the entire Manhattan Skyline.
The big Apple. amazing views on a clear day... you can view from Empire state ( cost) , free Staten Island ferry and free Brooklyn Bridge
Skyline doesn't date. Empire state view is awesome at night cheaper option is walk to Brooklyn Bridge and see Empire State and Chrysler building for free
Awesome!. Amazing array of height and architecture!. Especially amazing from a boat on the Hudson River both in the daytime and early evening sunset.
Classic. It's the NYC skyline, what more is there to say that will fill up 100 characters. Obviously, much, much more.

View from the Brooklyn Bridge. Manhattan Skyline is magnificent by day and by night, from the sea and from the air, but if you are on your own foot, than walk across the Brooklyn bridge and you will experience the skyline intensively enough.

You must take a boat tour to appreciate this view.. So we took a water taxi out to Lady Liberty. The view of the NY skyline was breath taking. You cannot really appreciate it unless you are on the water.
Iconic and marvellous. Amazing ! Surely one of the greatest and well known city skylines in the world, Can't wait to visit again.

View from Empire State building. Breathtaking views at night of Manhatten skyline from observation decks 86 and 102. A definite must do... Queues are long during the day so go up after 10pm when there are no queues.
Simply the best. Enjoyed everything,nothing to dislike about Manhattan, would have like longer to see much more, but what we saw will stay with us for
Superb Skyline. Fantastic sight to see in daylight hours but what a fabulous experience to see the same skyline at night. Will never forget and will be in my mind forever. Nothing bad to say.

Interesting diversion.. A brilliant idea and yet simple. Great care has been taken to utilise this piece of history. A unique view of the city and great execise too away from the crowds and traffic. Do it!!

Many Views. There are so many ways to take in the complex Manhattan Skyline. From a building's high floor windows to a ride on the Staten Island Ferry. From the New Jersey shoreline to any one of many bridges. From a walk on the Hudson River or East River, to a unique vantage point in Queens. No matter how you take it in, there is nothing that beats any view of the beautiful Manhattan Skyline!

spectacular from any side. Whether you are on the East of the East River, or on the West of the Hudson River, the view is spectacular. You can take a cruise to sail around Manhattan. It is really worth seeing the entire island from a boat.

View from Brooklyn Heights. We were lucky enough to have a perfect spring day with blue sky. The view from Brooklyn heights is amazing. You see Manhattan as well as the Statue of Liberty. Would suggest catching the subway across, walking around Brooklyn waterfront and walking back across Brooklyn Bridge to get amazing photos.

Iconic View. To appreciate the view you really have to be in New Jersey and if you love it and want to be a part of it you need to drive over the GW bridge or through a tunnel. Either way its going to cost you about 12 to 15 dollars. Its a ripoff so its better just to stay in New Jersey and get a good look at the skyline from there. Its also depressing to think of all the wealth tied up in the structures that might have been better spent elsewhere but its not for me to say how the rich spend their money.
Best skyline in the US. What other certain city has 2 skylines and no other US city comes close to NYC skyline. i may be biased but it's the best skyline!

Sight Seeing. Had a 2hr private Limo ride to see some of the City's main sights, and it was so much fun. I was there for an overnighter and this was the best way to do as much as we could in a short amount of time.. Real Nice..
Go for the view. Try and get up high. Flying in at night is amazing. Getting a drink at a roof top hotel may be expensive but the view is free!

Ever changing and growing. Dynamic skyline blending old (Empire State Building) and the new.
There is no time like the nighttime in The Big Apple!
Taxi ride for fun. The taxi cab driver took us on a scenic tour including bridges and neighbour hoods. Good price, good information and fun from one of yellow cabs finest!

an amazing skyline.....! missing the two. towers..! But hello to the New Tower (Peace). Her skyline is a sight to see its all New York...!!! She stands tall and has to be viewed from one of her cruise ships or even a plane window!!! I love looking at it over, over again I will be back sooner than 23 years this time

Great View. From any angle I saw the skyline, it was very impressive. Although it was very cold and windy, that did not deter us from walking around everyday. Constructions were everywhere. There were so many photo opportunities around.
Skyline. Great views from both rockefellar and Empire state building. Think empire was possibly slightly better views but not as organised in terms of queuing etc as Rockefellar Centre.

Fantastic views. You will spend your whole trip looking up! The view from the boat as you go to the Statue of Liberty is breath taking. The view from Top of the Rock WOW!! Empire State builiding at night is amazing.
impression pur. i love always to be there and seeing the impressionable views of manhattan skyline, allthough many constructions are going on in the moment

Stunning views of Manhattan Skyline. Park Lane Hotel offers amazing park view rooms. Rooms are luxurious & the higher floor the room, the better the views of the buildings surrounding the park & the rivers beyond
A sight to behold.. The towering New York skyline is a must see. We had great views of the city from our hotel: The Standard also.
Awesome view. 102nd floor of Empire State Building has to be the best view of New York! Must do for anyone visiting NYC!

Nice escape. Walked the skyline for the first time ever. Unfortunately it was freezing cold and windy but we got a good impression of this great project. Since it was only march it was not very green and leafy yet, still a great piece of 'nature' in the midst of NYC. Will do it again in warmer weather.
Bookend a trip with Manhattan. There's always something to do with a couple of nights either end of a longer trip! Mine was up to MA state.

Beautiful site a twilight. Take a twilight cruise and watch how the reflection of the sun change as it goes down off the various buildings. It is amazing.
Then as it becomes dark, lights start to turn on throughout the city and it becomes alive. I don't think it is ever dark in New York City.
NY skyline. What's not to like! When you think of New York, you see its skyline in your mind's eye. Soaring skyscrapers and amazing engineering feats. A kaleidoscope of colour.
