Great walk on a sunny day. One of the most typical things to do as a tourist in New York!
The skyline has a really nice path and if the weather is sunny its a perfect way to pass your day!

Around the Statue. We went on the (free) Staten island ferry. No queue in March, so didn't need to book. You see the skyline from the sea and the ride gives plenty of opportunities for photographs of the skyline and the Statue of Liberty. You get off the ferry, have a look around and get back on if you wish. It's a short walk to the 9/11 Memorial, very atmospheric.
NYC Skyline. Best view of skyline right from your bedroom close to Crysler Building, Grand Central Station and Empire State
A must see. See it from one of the liberty island ferries you will not be disappointed we took the one from pier 15.
Great. If you have not been to New York please go, it's great. Fantastic people and amazing sense of humour with great service.
Beautiful. This is well worth a visit and I think it would be a fantastic place in the summer when the trees and flowers are blooming. There is also a water feature.

Amazing view!. The view from Brooklyn towards Manhattan is amazing and even better from the ferry en-route to Staten island. It's well worth the trip to the top of the Empire State Building too, but go on a clear day and you can see for miles.

City with a View. Gorgeous to see day or night but when the fog rolls in...there's nothing like it. The Skyline is best viewed high up where you can see for blocks. Looking at the silhouettes of the local bridges is amazing.

Brilliant . We caught a ferry across to the statue of liberty and Ellis island. They didn't pack the ferry, so we were able to move around to see different view points and take pictures. Totally recommend seeing manhatten from water.
Unbeatable. Nowhere can you view so many historic buildings mingled with new construction amid some of the most iconic structures in the world.
Night and Day. We had views from Columbia Heights that were stunning throughout the day and even better in the evening

Great hotel for a great price.. I always enjoy my trip to back home to NY and prefer staying in a hotel rather than with family. I enjoy staying at Hotel 17 because, it is affordable and located in a great location. They also always have excellent costumer service! I hardly am ever in my hotel room so this hotel/hostel works best for me! I also don't mind sharing the bathroom at all because like I stated, I am hardly ever in the hotel room other than in the late hours of the night and early morning. Great visit to my place of origin always.
Great way to see a little bit of Manhattan. Great way to walk through Manhattan. There were lots of people using this walk way.. Saw some wonderful artwork on walls of the buildings - loved it
Amazing view. We chose an absolutely brilliant night to go up to the observatory deck of the empire state building, although very cold.
Beautiful and best viewed from Brooklyn. I loved taking the subway to Brooklyn and viewing Manhattan skyline from the shore. Then went for fabulous pizzza and beer.
Superb skyline. Iconic skyline, best seen fro the FREE Staten Island Ferry or from the top of the Empire State Building.

A classic. One of the best known skylines in the world. It is worth seeing from the top (Top of the Rock and/or Empire State) and also from the water. Take part in one of those boat cruises and you will see it from a different perspective.

The Most Famous Skyline in the World. We enjoyed the view at night from the Brooklyn Heights promenade. We could also see the Statue of Liberty lit up for the evening on Staten Island. A poignant reminder of September 11th occurred when we realized where the Twin Towers would have been.
Just AMAZING. I love everything about it, the buildings, the towers. I have no words to explain this experience. I recommend you to see it on the evening.
If you like skylines.... Staten Island Ferry at south end of Manhattan...free, interesting (crowd phobic should avoid), awesome views of Statue of Liberty and Skyline...
Great view from Brooklyn. Go over the Brooklyn Bridge and enjoy the view from the other side, it's really nice and take the subway back if you don't want to walk over the bridge again!

You will be reminded of Spiderman movie! I love walking and taking photos of this place. Super interesting!. It does get way too crowded so do take note. I love the fact that there's ice cream and cafes! Put on sun cream as it was really hot when we were there. take note of the wall murals and the apartment around there. It is really cool just to walk and enjoy the scenery. There are buskers, photographers and artist along the way. all in all this is a must visit place.

Breathtaking. There is no other sight like this in the world. Seeing pictures does not do it justice. Get to the top of your hotel, the Top of the Rock, the top of the Empire State Building--just get to a location where you can truly see this amazing city. Night time is the best!

Most Impressive Skyline in the World. No other city in the world rivals it. Quite impressive when you're flying in and you happen to be sitting on the right side of the plane. I always keep my camera ready for that very reason. But if you're arriving by land, you can still get some great shots and views from the observation deck of the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock in Rockefeller Center or from the Staten Island ferry. They are all different but each one is impressive and breathtaking.

Best in the world beyond doubt-See from SoL. Not only the best in US but also in the entire metropolitan fraternity of the world. Have a view from Statue of Liberty with Brooklyn Bridge in the backdrop. Chicago has the second best skyline in US which is a bit more wider in span but the concentration of skyliners is less. When it comes to NYC, per my opinion, this looks better in the day than night which is more picturesque though. You would just want to gaze at the skyline in awe and do nothing else. The two trademarks - One World Trade Center and Empire State are easily visible and hold their respective importance. The presence of historic buildings makes it all the more amazing than other skylines of the world. If you are visiting NYC, do buy a portrait of the skyline for ur collection.

Nighttime electrical buzz. Night time views from Brooklyn and the Empire State are stunning - this is a must do. Although the daytime is fantastic, on a clear night you can see for miles and there is just a sea of lights, it's magical.
Fantastic view. Watched it from the Staten Island ferry on our way back. Have of course seen it in photographs, but nevertheless breathtaking!
Excellent - best if it's a sunny day. Truly stunning from the river, great from the Empire State Bldg, not so good from the Top of the Rock.
The East River. 38th floor of our hotel all the way on 1st Avenue provided a great view of the water, Long Island, and the Queens skyline.

Pretty amazing view. It is incredible even though it's man made. It is what you would expect it to be having seen it on TVs/cinemas over the years, pretty impressive. Great opportunity for good photos & you can't help gasping at the sheer height of the buildings/skyscrapers & in amongst them there are real gems of churches, houses

Top of the Rock. There are tons of ways to see the skyline, but the way my wife and I chose was the Top of the Rock tour. I would recommend that since you get views of the Empire State Building as well. It didn't feel real even. Almost like I was looking at a picture of the skyline. Very nice up there. You should buy your ticket for a specific time online though as it can get busy there. You'll have a much better experience.

manhattan visit. it was extremlt nice to visit manhattan in so much snow fall.had nice photo graphy there.most memorable day of my life when i visited STATUTE i was having great wish to it so much long long ago.Staten island ferry travel an adventurous trip.without visiting Manhattan ur new york visit is defient.
New York city tour. Too cold to enjoy much and too much walking for husband on crutches, no wheel chair there, either. Only walked around and heard stories of New York.
Great views. It's amazing and unforgettable experience for travelers who like to see many skyscrapers close to each other ... Highly recommended.

Good to visit on a sunny day.. Get a good view of the city. Peace and quiet in a busy city. Good oppotunity for some nice photos. Can get a bit packed in places - people walking in the oppisite direction.
Still the Best!!. The NYC skyline is one of the most recognized on the planet! From Ellis Island or the Staten Island Ferry, the sight is amazing!
rockfeller centre. Go at dusk where you see the skyline by day and night. buy tickets in advance as this saves queueing, this is the busiest time of day
The Skyline. Amazing view from the river, both during the day and the night. Do not miss the opportunity to see the different shape of the buildings and its beautiful conception.
From ferry. From water taxi to Liberty and back, the view of the new Trade Center is so good. I understand by the end of the year, it will be open for visitors as a viewpoint.
Best skyline ever. Take a ferry and look back at the NY skyline, it is amazing and if you get a moody day you will get some fab pictures for your memories.

Awesome. Everything about the New York Skyline is awesome, from historic like St. Patrick's Cathedral, and modern like Time Life building, and many other inspiring buildings. But whether you are just walking to Rockefeller Plaza, and watching the skaters on the ice rink, every building you pass on the way has some history attached to it. And the feeling is mesmerizing to get caught up in the energy and history of this vibrant city.
Stunning skyline. From Willamsburgh at night was the best. You can walk the bridge and then have an easy subway ride home

Empire State Building. Tried to go to 30 Roc but wait was too long. There are many other rooftop bars and observation sites to choose from. The Empire State Building is set up for large crowds but find out the best time to go up to the observation deck and while waiting marvel at the beautiful architecture and use of materials.
Go to NJ in the a.m.. The sun on the west side of these Manhattan skyscrapers are fantastic! Great views are also offered from the Brooklyn side, I am told.

My favorite (cheap) ways to see the skyline:. Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge: The path is safe, it's always busy even late at night and the spirit of the walk will lift yours even if you don't care about the fantastic view.Take a Ferry: The Staten Island, or some of the Jersey Ferries will give you a wonderful vantage point.The F Train: Be patient. Smith and 9th in Brooklyn is 109 feet above ground, and the highest point on a train.

Nothing Like It Anywhere!. It is spectacular! Day or Night. It looks even better from the New Jersey Side. The sheer magnitude of buildings and the new World Trade Center Tower make this a unique sight!
Manhattan Skyline. What is there not to like about this? So different now the Twin Towers have gone, but the new WTC is proudly in place.
The view is thrilling. This is one of the best buildings I have ever visited! Just magical view and simply amazing place to go!
Magical. As everyone esle has said, you've gotta see it to believe it. You might look at tons of hi res photos, but there's nothing better than seeing it with your eyes. Fascinating.

Impressive when seen form Brooklyn. travelled over to Brooklyn late at night. Went down near the river café under the Brooklyn bridge ( I got off the subway at Clark street and walked the short distance down to the waterfront)The view was amazing, although the area was deserted as it was a cold March night,
View from Hyatt 48 Lex. We had a great view in our room at the Hyatt 48 Lex! It was beautiful, especially at night seeing all the buildings and lights.

great views at night esp. but during the day, the skyline is also impressive. We stayed in New Jersey at place that overlooks the skyline, and at night it is really impressive with all the lights. Taking the Staten Island Ferry is a good way to see that skyline during the day.

Really beautiful.. Went to Top of the Rock for the view. It was stunning, a beautiful clear morning, it actually made me cry! Could see over to the Statue of Liberty and beyond and in the other direction to Central Park. One of the best things I have ever done.
I'm proud to be a New Yorker.. I'm so proud to be lucky to live in the city with the most beautiful Skyline. The high rise buildings and the streets full of energy make NYC unique.

Absolutely amazing. One has to see it to live it.. This Manhattan skyline is absolutely amazing, second to none. I am from London and there are very few such views that could match the Manhattan Skyline back home!
City bus tour at night is a must to see the lights of Manhattan. The best view of the Manhattan skyline is from the Brooklyn Bridge. Just don't look down!! It's a very impressive skyline.
World Renown. This is one of the most famous skylines in the world. It testifies to man's ability to design and construct.

Really amazing. The place that we choosed to take a good picture of the Manhattan Skyline was under the Brookling bridge i the side of Brookling just when the sun was about to be hided. After take amazing puctures you can order a very good pizza in Grlimaldis, very close to the observation point

The architecture of the older buildings in Manhattan is amazing ! You could spend days admiring .. Just walking the streets is a joy to take in all the beautiful buildings , stores and people hustling through the streets.

Was amazing. . Must do. It's pricey. $440 for two !
But memories for a life time
Staff super efficient and friendly. Really well ran and the whole thing was amazing
Seeing the NY sites from a helicopter was simply one the best experiences we've had.
You'll not regret it!

awesome sight .....not to miss....defintely coming back. so beautiful by night looking across manhattan skyline......what is there not to like and then visiting juliets all was stupendous....definitely will be back
time your view of the skyline well. Take a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge just before the sun sets, the view is wonderful and very romantic
Big City. The big city bustle can be deterring. But there is nothing like Manhattan skylines. So overlook the smog and pollution for the great sights!
ICONIC. Just to see it in the flesh as it were was brilliant.Seen it so many times in films etc and its one of those places that looks like it does in the movies
Very Pretty. Enough said! One of those must see things in life, best to view it from one of the statue of liberty ferries as you go around the harbour.

best skyline it entire world. Take 'E" subway line to Brooklyn Bridge ( City Hall) station. I visited in winter so it was very cold and vindy. Make sure u warm enough. I didn't like the fact that there is no public toilets so had to use nearby restaurant

The Sparkle has dimmed. Having traveled to New York-in the early 1990's, The skyline of New York as you sailed into her harbour, was breathtaking, with the silhouette of the buildings all lit up is a memory I will always cherish, I also did a night time helicopter trip around the harbour Ellis Island and statue of Liberty and WOW, it was wonderful. Were those early trip experiences a lot to live up to or are the buildings saving on energy these days!!!!!!
A-okay. The pulse-the beat-the people.Different neighbourhoods.Central park.The museums-Broadway shows etc.etc.

Stunning. Manhattan is a stunning place, i loke the buildings. I particularly like the FlatIron building. For good views of the skyscapers take a walk half way across the Brookland bridge and look back.
Meh. Went to this on my NY pass, it was ok but I would be pissed had I payed for it.The Q for it is also quite long.

Just Awesome. Never a time where you cant look at it and see something different. There are some stunning areas out of the city to see the skyline. Travel on the Path, or come in via the Lincoln tunnel.
Amazing view. We went on a night tour of Manhatten and the tour guide took us to somewhere in Brooklyn where the view was amazing, just like the professional photos.
the sky at night. The best time to view and do it from the top of the Rockerfellar centre just off Times Square. Amazing

Unique Views. There was a great view of the skyscrapers in downtown Manhattan. It's an unusual vantage point of the city. You can see new projects being built and some buildings you never knew existed. In terms of having lunch there are limited food choices. You'll find some little kids in some parts doing projects which can be a little disruptive when strolling around the grounds
What a lovely way to see above the crowds.. Great way of humanising urbane spaces. Nothing exciting but very relaxing and aesthetically pleasing.
Absolutely Breathtaking. Saw this from the top of an amazing restaurant in Times Square, i'll never forget it, i'd advise getting to a roof top restaurant to get the best and cheapest view!
Stunning. The best view of NY downtown skyline is definitely from the boats that go the Statue of Liberty. I could not stop taking pictures!

Great view of the city. Fab walk through Manhattan without worrying about the traffic, in the summer am sur sit will be gorgeous but even with snow on the ground a lovely getaway from the hustle and bustle of the street
What's not to love?. Chrysler building is my personal favorite :) I love how the skyline glitters throughout the night. I always miss looking out the window and seeing the skyline.

Fantastic from above or below!. The Manhattan skyline really is something to see. Went up Empire State Building and Top of The Rock (Rockefeller Centre) and both were great but Top of The Rock better (had a New York City pass which included these attractions at lower cost). Also amazing just looking up from the streets. Lovely views from the water also. Didn't manage a night view from above but imagine it is spectacular also with so many lights in the city. A must if you are going to new York.

You couldn't buy the Sunrise View. We were lucky enough to stay with friends in Jersey City who have an apartment on the 46th floor of a 50 store building; it faces out over the Hudson towards the Manhattan Sky line. Due to jet lag we woke early and saw the sun rise over the high rise buildings. Beautiful, awe inspiring and phenomenal. The night time view was fantastic also and stunning in its own right.

amazing skyline, dissapointing city.. Traveling out from the south of the island to see the statue of liberty afforded an amazing view of this city. such a shame that the city itself is quite underwhelming, dirty and outdated.
Best from the top of Rockefeller Center. We went in the morning and bought tickets ahead to get up one half hour before sunset. It was beautiful to watch the sunset and it made beautiful photos.
It's New York people!. Great views from the boat as you go out towards the Statue of Liberty or in the cheap Staten Island ferry, even better from the top of the rock!

Fantastic by day. Unbelievable by night.. This iconic skyline doesn't fail to impress. We seen it by day during a helicopter ride and on ferry to Liberty Island and it was an incredible site. We took a dinner cruise one evening and the skyline was even more spectacular.

Breathtaking , Just like in the movies. To have good view of Manhattan Skyline you need to be at certain points at certain times.1. Day/Early Evening : Brooklyn State Park : Cross the Brooklyn Bridge and land at Brooklyn State Park to have close view of Manhattan Skyline. Its a good place to take panorama pics. Many Bollywood movies shooting took place here, so its been a place I had to Go :)2. At Evening - Rockefeller Center - From the top of the Rock you get great view of whole New York City along and the color effects of Empire State Building as night falls, You can see Manhattan lighting up in different lights. Depending on sunset timing - 6-8 PM would be good enough to Witness the Evening & Night Views of Manhattan.3. Statue Of Liberty : Once you enjoy the cruise and land at State of Liberty you can have a another side view of Battery park of Manhattan.If you cover these three You can enjoy almost 90 % best possible views of NYC rest 10 % is for Chopper Ride .
Just like in the movies. This city has been the backdrop for so many movies that you really feel like you're on the set of one as you look out over the city. It's a magical sight.
breathtaking. just stunning at night,the skyline takes your breath away,always something to do or go,daytime just as bust,shops full of goodies, always get a coffee and macs,no trouble
Top of the Rock-. Views spectacular from top of Rockefeller Center. Enjoy the skyline from tour boat that cicles Staue of Liberty.

One of the world's great sights. Great to see the completed new WTC towering over downtown. To see it you need to get out of Manhattan - there are easy ways to do this: get the Path train over to Hoboken; or cross over the Brooklyn Bridge, or get a Dtaten Island ferry or circle line tour or go to NJ's Liberty Park

As good as you see on TV/Magazines. There are multiple ways you can see the skyline - i saw it from all possible angles - NJ, Up the Rock and Liberty park. The best views are from Statue of Liberty. Take the ferry ride and capture amazing photos. Impressive!

What a skyline. I fly into different cities almost every week for work and the approach into. New York and amazing skyline is just awesome. I love to fly in at night and today I took the PATH over to Jersey City (exchange Place stop) just to walk around look across the river at the skyline. It's hard to believe there are that many buildings in such a centralized location (and it hasn't sunk!). It's easy to forget when you're in the thick of the city (say Times Square or the parks) that you should purposely stop and find a place to just view the skyline. As an additional not it's neat to view it from the Hell's Kitchen side. I stayed at Ink48 and had a skyline view and WOW.
fantastic surreal experience. nothing to dislike, but a very busy place, great shopping and great bars, one of the best trips iv had

The Best Skyline in the USA. This is the most diverse architecture of any city skyline in the USA
At night the colors are vibrant and run the spectrum from one end to the other. Best viewed from the New Jersey side of the Hudson River or the Brooklyn side of the East River. Not to be missed.

Night bus tour. Wow what a site! we seen the Manhattan Skyline from a tour at night, the lights were amazing. The driver stopped for a while and let us get off to take photoes. We seen the Statue of Liberty also.

Awesome!. Stunning, awesome, spine tingling, iconic. A sight I have seen so many times in movies and TV series and there I was looking at it for real. Wow! Great to be driving towards it at night. Great to take a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and have a look back.
Dream come true. Its beautiful and out of the world, especially when it rains - the combination of sky scrapers, clouds and the rain
Iconic skyline. View from the base of the Statue of Liberty was great. On a clear day the skyline looks amazing. Lots of photo opportunities.

The perfect wedding. Loved Hyatt Times Square as my wedding host hotel. I also liked Mark Joseph Steakhouse for my post wedding luncheon. MJS was very elegant, the food was wonderful, and the staff was great. I selected one of the price fixed party menus for my party of 14, and it was a good choice. We actually had a feast! Even the vegetarians in our group raved about the food.I was really disappointed by Luxor Limousine Service. We ordered a 'limo bus' that was supposed to seat 13, but actually could seat 10 at best. The driver was really grumpy and inhospitable. He also chain smoked incessantly. Yuck!
amazing view. the most beautiful view ever, gives you an amazing opportunity to see Manhattan especially at night or during sunset.
Beautiful!. We got to see the skyline from our hotel room as well as from the Roosevelt Island Tramway ride -- which was lovely!

Fantastic City. Seeing the city from the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building and then from the shorline of Brooklyn, Manhattan is a fantastic and very scenic location. I would strongly recommend a reservation at The River Cafe in Brooklyn, just under the Brooklyn Bridge, to really appreciate the Manhattan Skyline

Coming Over The Bridge From JFK into Manhattan WOW. I have to say that since the Twin Towers have gone I feel some sadness at the first site of Manhattan, sadness aside,There is no other sight in the World to equal that first look as you approach The (correct me if I'm wrong) 49th Street Bridge and see Manhattan up close, I've been three times and travel from Dublin Ireland, but it never ceases to take my breath away. My favourite city in the world with London England a close second
Greatest views ever!. saw this on the night tour of manhattan and brooklyn. it was pretty awesome. not seen something spectacular as the manhattan skyline. will strongly recommend!!
Unforgettable view. NYC is a very elegant city and it has a vibe that no other city has. Would always repeat visiting this city.

Rock during day and Empire state at night. Great to see contrast from day to night and hear all the sights and sounds American TV has brought to our living rooms. I had no trouble at either place with getting to top, organised well and staff as friendly as one could expect. most of them happy to talk to relieve the monotony.
None better. The best view is from Brooklyn near the bridge. The Manhattan Skyline is the best in the world. See it better from the Empire State Building AND Top of the Rock (30 Rock).

Drive if you dare. You could go on the boat tour, you could drive it or if you have enough DOUGH you could have the helicopter tour, the best one is the boat one you could go thru the bay and really appreciate the buildings, we've done it twice once in the mid 80's and in 2007 some how it was not the same after 9/11 there was no twin towers and the new building was not there yet, we try to drive it from both sides the most frequent we did(like 20 times) was the one from Battery Park thru the west side HWY all the way thru the henry Hudson to the west side of Harlem, and like 5 times on the east side thru the FDR from Tompkins sqr Park thru the NYU Campus you could see the Queen Borough Bridge on you right thru the upper eastside till the Apollo theater in Harlem. we went from Norfolk to NYC so It was part of enjoying the trip.
Breathtaking. There's nothing like it in the world. There the most emblematic buildings in the world and light up in the night is just breathtaking.

Take a boat. I came into NYC over the Hudson River on a boat, and this was the perfect way to see the skyline in the day, and that night I went the same way back. Popping over on a boat was only a couple of dollars to taxi across and was a pleasant 5-10 min journey over.
Breathtaking!. Can't wait to go back. It's hard to soak in the skyline as much as I wanted!! Every corner you turn brings an amazing view.
NYC skyline. Loved it all. Disliked nothing.The nights are the best time to view the skyline. Some of the buildings are stunning.
Manhattan from The Heights, Brooklyn. A bit of a treck but it does include a walk over Brooklyn Bridge then follow the road a bit but the view is well worth it.
From the Empire State building and the Hudson River. Such a variety of buildings of different shapes and sizes and materials.Impossible to see from street level.

Just another city skyline - snore. I'm afraid I can't get enthusiastic about looking at a city skyline. It's just another clump of buildings, same as Sydney, Hong Kong, or any other waterside city.Don't get me wrong, New York City is a great place to visit, but looking at the skyline isn't worth making a special effort for. Up close New York is also one of the dirtier cities you will visit with plenty of rubbish on the footpaths. I was there February 2014.
Awesome nostalgia. The first really great, now classic, skyline. Outglitzed by Shanghai and a few others, it is best seen from seat A on the approach to Laguardia.

Nice View. My wife and I were in NYC in November 2014 for my Daughter's Run in the Marathon. We took a ride out to Liberty Island to see the Statue of Liberty. While we were there, we enjoyed the sight of the New York City Skyline. Don't get me wrong, the Manhattan Skyline is a good impressive view, but the Chicago Skyline is a better view.
Metro skyline you wouln't forget. Go atop Rockefellor bldg. or Empire State bldg. You find a concrete skyline to remember rest of your life.
Stunning View. What a stunning iconic view... Beautiful and a must if you go to New York City. We found the best way to see Skyline is from the Brooklyn Heights park. Totally unrestricted view..

Stunning. The skyline you see everywhere, TV, film, adverts is no comparison to what you see in real life. From the Empire State to the freedom tower New York is truly spectacular has to be seen to be truly appreciated
Mesmorizing. The skyline is beyond compare; when the sun is shining the buildings sparkle; rivals nature for beauty!
Oh Beautiful. God created the heavens and the earth. And man was created in God's image, a creator. Thus the beauty of the NYC skyline.
No other like it!. NYC is the capital of the world! Thats why the UN is here as well as the Yankees! The Manhattan skyline is a must see for every proud American.

Always an amazing sight. I have been a frequent visitor to New York for many years but the sight of all those skyscrapers set on an island never ceases to amaze me . Views from the river , the statue of Liberty Island and just driving around at night is all wonderful!
The city with a view. It's just cool to stand and admire the city being by the ocean the smog is not as bad as one would think you can actually see well it's nice

Free view of the city. Free ferry from Manhattan to Staten Island, let's you see the fantastic New York sky line and the Statue of Liberty. Beware sellers of tickets to liberty island outside of ferry terminal and subway station. It is cheaper and easier to buy direct from the actual US supplier.

Well worth a look. A great little walk (1.5mi I think) through NY. A nice tranquil bit of green space through the busy streets. We went in Winter and it was a really nice way to get down to Bleeker St.

Best viewed from park slope, brooklyn. There is a park on the east river in brooklyn that looks onto skyline. You can also see it from tram to Roosevelt Island. There is a new building being built that appears taller than Empire State building. It is a condo development, and it is sold by the floor.

Unique. We have seen the Manhattan Skyline in hundreds movies and tv series, but despite that looking it in person was definitely an incredible experience.Amazing skyline, I could not stop taking pictures.I would definitely recommend to get a drink in one of the many roof top garden and enjoy the skyline at night with a cold pint or an hot cider (depending on the season)
manhattan... a place to be…everyone should at least be once there… can't wait for the next time. prb very soon..
Amazing sight - just like the movies!. All those movies that have the Manhattan Skyline - to see it for real is just breathtaking! Wont ever forget it!

goto freedom tower and work your way up west side. great buildings and skyline best way is subway jump on and off get unlimited metro card. start at world trade center stop and check out times square last the later the better.
MANHATTAN SKYLINE. Its beautiful, so many buildings in few sq mile area. But the real beauty is when you visit the area in evening and see the lights. Its just marvellous.

No longer a photo ..... We took a trip down the Hudson on a freezing cold but gloriously sunny day and that skyline, so familiar, was stunning. The absence of the twin towers was noticeable but there is an optimism among the citizens as the new World Trade Centre is being created alongside the high rise favourites. When I returned home and looked at the photos I took of the skyline, I noticed on the tallest building, three floors from the top was a window cleaner in a cradle going about his work!!! Don't miss the opportunity to view the skyline from the river, you won't be disappointed.

Top of the Rock. The Top of the Rock was a perfect place to enjoy the view of the city. The day we were there in March...crystal clear day. They had the right mix of history, photo opportunities, and gifts. I was amazed at the ridiculous hugging of the vistas by people sitting and texting on the IPHONE and not allowing others to view the city from a good vantage point........ shame on them.

Spectacular. Nothing like it in the world. Different times of day give it a different tone. Sanding underneath the tall buildings can take your breath away. Distinctive, beautiful, and a symbol of what man can achieve.
beautiful. you dont actually appreciate the view until you've seen it first hand. everytime you look you see something different.
Visited by ferry. Excellent option for shorter trips its very worth it and beautiful... Love IT its a Must See... You get to see alll the buildings sitting down
A little cloudy due to time of year. Went to the top of the rock. Was fabulous because it was a sunny day. It was windy, but glass barriers made it easy to view all sides of New York.

Best and cheapest way to see it. Get the staten island ferry. It is free and you get the best views. also a good way to see the statue of liberty from very near. Prices in the cafeteria inside the ferries are pretty good too.Just don't loose your time in staten island. Nothing happening there. get out the ferry and re-enter to get back to the good stuff.

so beautiful. I have seen skylines all over the world and some people would say that see one sky line and you have seen them all ......how wrong that statement is!! New York skyline is just breathtaking and really need to see it 1st hand you won't be disappointed no matter what age you are .....
Breath Taking. The view of Manhattan Skyline from Ellis Island on a Sunny, bitter cold Saturday afternoon was absolutely breath taking.
Simply beautiful. I've seen it countless times on TV but nothing prepared me for seeing it in real lifeawe inspiring to say the least

Clear skies and fab vires. We used Zip Aviation they were well organised absolutely on schedule and absolutely delivered. Great views over the early Morning Hudson and beyond we took the longest tour which really set us up in terms of our bearings for what has been a fabulous trip.
unique. Could be on a film set.Saw it from a boat trip around the Island great commentary , brought New york to life!
Must see. It's just as seen on films. The best view is on the way to the Statue of Liberty. Gives you a lot of angles on the view
Fab. Took a trip on the Staten Island ferry which was free! What fantastic views of the skyline ..went during the day and again at dusk

Magnificent. you never get tired of this experience, try seeing it from Governors Island or Staten Island the view is fantastic.NY is an amazing city and the skyline emphasises the beauty and scale of the progress made.Don`t miss it, even if you only view as you fly into La Guardia, better still, take a helicopter ride, expensive but life changing!

Tribute to the American spirit. It is not possible to be awestruck by this extraordinary view, whether from the Brooklyn Bridge or Dumbo on the other side. If you get really lucky the sun will be shining. I love the sight of the Freedom Tower shouting defiance to those that caused so much destruction. I am NOT an American

Iconic. The views dont get old. Whereever you get to see the Manhattan Skyline from is an amazing view.The daytime and nighttime views are both to be seen as they are great to look at for different reasons.

There is nothing else like it!. This is one of the most amazing manmade things you could ever see. Whether viewed from the ground, a helicopter, Top of the Rock, or from Liberty / Ellis Island this is something that you will never forget.It appears recognisable even to those who see it for the first time. The diversity of structures is out of this world and really tells a story.

It 's Manhattan. Coming from Jersey the view never gets old.Only dislike when you can't see it.(Rain, clouds,fog).The best view is from New Jersey,Staten Island and Brooklyn.Check the Staten Ferry for the best view of all.Another great view is from Governors Island, a five minute ferry ride from the battery it'right next to the Staten Ferry.(It' seasonal)

Manhattan Skyline is one of the most beautiful things one can experience.. Manhattan is a photographer's paradise. Its skyline is a most. Go across the Brooklyn Bridge and spend some time at the edge of the river. Try to make it little before sunset and wait until the night comes. It's just wonderful.

Interesting urban oasis. It's a nice walk above the noise and it's very relaxing and they have little chimes and wooden oversized beach chairs it's really nice. My suggestion: First walk through and ENJOY the underground Chelsea market and then grab something really great to eat and drink and then go up to the skyline and have lunch looking over the Hudson! It's worth it!

Try the skyline on a bike ride from the GW Bridge. One of my favorite views of the Manhattan Skyline is when biking from the GW Bridge towards midtown. The skyline starts out in the background and appears increasingly large. You get some different angles as the bike path changes direction. I prefer the view from the bike path to a car is you get time to enjoy the view without moving so fast, but still at a faster pace than walking.

Overwhelming image of a great city. My wife and I were making our first visit to the city, flying into LaGuardia late in the evening. Our first glimpse of the skyline took place then, with major elements of the cityscape coming into view. We were staying in a bed-and-breakfast, in an apartment near Central Park that also offered a fantastic view of the city and framed each morning's first glimpse of the city from a penthouse view. The apartment was owned by a composer and musician who had worked with Elmer Bernstein, so it also was an amazing apartment filled with historical items such as photographs and incredible artwork. The arrangements for the stay had been made by our daughter-in-law who worked in New York, so our experiences certainly cannot be compared to any hotel stay. Imagine each morning, our host would prepare breakfast for us and then liven the day with recollections of his work with the famous conductor.There is so much to take in from the massive skyscrapers to majestic sights such as the Statue of Liberty, that we planned on another way to see the New York skyline. Seeing the buildings at street level, made for a neck-craning and mouth-gap "tourist right here" appearance. We opted for a harbour tour which allowed for a more leisurely pace around the city. We picked a time near the end of the day and on our last day because we now were more familiar with locales such as the Empire State Building.What a beautiful way to see the city- highly recommended.
Gorgeous. Really pretty! Nothing I particularly disliked. Just like it looks in the movies! Very romantic walking along looking at it.
Hey - it's New York!. Try the helicopter tour and go up in the Empire State Building. Might need reservations. The Circle Line also has a nice cruise around in the warmer weather
Birds Eye View !!. Flew in to LaGuardia and could see the Statue of Liberty and buildings of Manhattan at dusk. Amazing view of Empire State Building and all lit up at dusk/evening.
Unbeatable!. Went for an evening boat tour around Manhattan (using our City Pass). Well worth it and it was a great way to see the city as the sun set.

The best view of the Manhattan skyline in Manhattan is at Ink 48.. Great hotel. (It would be great even if the view were limited to Secaucus.) Manhattan is where America flexes its muscles. The skyline is the best pose.
Beautiful Buildings Even in The Winter!. It may not be the same with out the twin towers that I so loved but the buildings are fantastic Summer or Winter
Very impressive!. Fantastic views by day and night, only disappointment is when it rains and the low clouds cut the buildings all to the same height!

Amazing. Saw this during the day and in the evening from boat trip on the Hudson River. Even though a cold and rainy night it was amazing. Also as you come into Manhattan from the Airport the view takes your breath away - got to be seen.
Mesmerising. While we went on our bus tour by night , we saw the Manhattan skyline, it was very atmospheric and awe inspiring. I would recommend to all visitors to New York City to go and view this.

Night time bus. We caught the bus in Times Square and it showed us the sights, it was an open top bus and advise dressing warmly. Some sights a bit borng but Manhattan wad fabulous, had lots of photo opportunities, good value for money would recommend as tourist to new york
A unique experience. Experience the sight of the Manhattan and feel like you've seen the world. A unique sensation, like you are embracing in a glance the beating heart of it all...

View from the Liberty Ferry. Seeing the skyline of Manhattan is very special, especially the One World Trade Center shining blue in the sky. It was very cold standing out on the deck of the ferry but well worth it to get a fantastic photograph.
Spectacular. Feels like you are drowning in the urban jungle. Got a perfect view from Rockefeller. A boar ride is also recomended.
Best seen from Jersey. The skyline is best scene from Jersey city. Evening time is the best time for a photograph here especially in summer. Tall skyscrapers with warm sky.

Gorgeous!. Take the number 2 or 3 subway train to Clark Street in Brooklyn and walk the couple of blocks to Brooklyn Bridge park. You will be rewarded with a gorgeous view of the Manhattan skyline! Walk further into Brooklyn Bridge park and you will see a children's carousel and cafe with outdoor seating. When you have soaked up the view, walk across the Brooklyn Bridge back into the city, gazing at the magnificant skyline the entire way back!

Pretty - not the prettiest. I think the NYC skyline is nice but not as impressive as I had thought. Flying in you get the impact of the density, etc. (being an island) but as far a big cities go, Chicago has a prettier skyline while on land. It's also a much cleaner city overall than New York.

Magical even in the dead of winter. Of course seeing the skyline from the top of the empire State Building is majestic in an urban way, the view is also beautiful from a hotel, airplane and on the ground. It is easy to see why photographers are always trying to capture the city from unique angles.
Stunning. A walk by the Hudson as the sun rises or sets will lift the spirits -stunning views. The old railway track, now turned into a walkway is a great pale to walk and run- you will not be alone!
Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty. Visit the Statue of Liberty to get the best view of the Manhattan Skyline. Learn about the history of New York and how the statue was built.
Hop On Hop off ferry. Spectacular to see in real life instead of on the tv, a must see at least once in youir life. It really is a site to behold once the city lights illuminate
Top of the Rock. Great view looking downtown and North just a few blocks away from Central Park. The elevator ride is almost worth the price of the ticket.

Like no other. Just beautiful! Wow! Even if you don't get to see a lot of what New York has to offer you will always get to see the breathtaking skyline from wherever you are. From ground level to the top if the Empire State Building the skyline is fabulous!
Great view, definitely worth a picture. Great place for the views, however it was covered in snow when we went. Spent less time up there than expected.
What's there not to like!. It's one of the most enduring and recognizable roof lines in the world and visible from 360'....unlike other sizable cities spread between mountains and valleys...
Take the cirlce line at least once while you are in the city.. The circle was awesome! Its offers a stunning panoramic of the city skyline and a great view of statue of liberty.

Top of The Rock. It's definitely an awe-insipiring view! Top of the Rockefeller Center is a must do - and we almost didn't as we were so exhausted and last day in NYC. There was only a few people in line but even still - after seeing, I'd wait in line - it's amazing!

The best place to see Manhattan Skyline is New Jersey. One can take a bus or a train anywhere across the Hudson River to see the magnificent Skyline. My favorite place to see it is along Boulevard East, in communities such as Guttenberg or West New York right across the river. You can take a bus from the Port Authority (8th Ave and 42nd St).

Like you imagine. Saw it from a number of angles inasmuch as I did a bus tour by day, another by night (quite different), boat trip out and around the Statue of Liberty and a helicopter flight (a must). All impressed me. We've seen it in so many movies, but it really has to be seen to be believed. Met all my expectations.
Always a thrill to see. From the air, a car or the top of a building it is the most recognizable skyline in the world and it has never gotten old.

Best skyline in the world. I may be bias when I say that this is the best skyline in the world, but this is my home town and Im allowed to be a bit partial. There are countless places in this city to catch this picturesque skyline. In my opinion I would suggest you start in Long Island City and visit Gantry Park. This is a free attraction to visit and you can bring a picnic and enjoy the views. After you are done with your picnic jump on the East river ferry, which is a $4 ride during the weekdays, sit on the top deck and absorb the beauty that is the New York Skyline as you ride from Long Island City with views of midtown and you work your way south, passing under the Williamsburg bridge, Manhatten Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge. You will then disembark in the Wall street area and from there you can go visit the 911 memorial and the Freedom Tower. Depending on when you come you can then go up to the new observation deck in the freedom tower to see yet another perspective of the skyline.
Stroll it !. What a fab way to move some miles under your feet! Gobble some Chelsea Market and walk it off while you make your way back upstream.
Awesome Views. Manhattan is the place to go and stay at, I liked everything about here, all huge buildings and roof tops to see.
The view was great. this is a great way to see the skyline, highly recommended. Lots of little things to see just watch out for people on bikes
best view. The Manhatten Skyline is impressive, beautiful and makes very nice photos. We had the best view of it during our trip to the Statue of Liberty.
Breathtaking. I seen the skyline from helicopter, Brooklyn Bridge and Liberty Island, I can only describe it as breath-taking!
view from The Rock - brilliant. Don't miss going up to the viewing platform - The Top of the Rock - at the Rockefeller Centre; it is worth the money and queues to see, particularly at sunset.

Great from all angles. Hard to give a best view! 1. From Brooklyn Bridge2. From Hoboken waterfront at any time of day (Path train or subway to Hoboken)3. From the Staten island Ferry best at sunset.4. From the far side of the lake in Central ParkThe syline is truly inspiring from all angles.

Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn Bridge. We found the views from half way across Brooklyn Bridge to be stunning!!! We walked half way across and we had a wonderful view of the Manhattan skyline and the Sky scrappers in the Financial District. We walked over the bridge at dusk and hung around to watch sunset and then waited for it to get dark to see the skyline come to life!! This was an amazing experience and gave us breath taking Views and memorable photos to treasure! ! WOW

Excitment Par Excellence. What is not to like? From any angle, you immediately feel the inherent excitement and pulse of the city when you see the skyline either during the day or at night. Night time however makes it glitter and there is something magical about it. View it from Brooklyn, from New Jersey from the air, or from the water and you are in awe of it. My favorite views are from New Jersey (Weehawken, the heights) and Brooklyn (the River Cafe area). Very romantic.

Even shifting as it has with the demolition of the Twins the Manhattan skyline is something else. I liked it all. It is like a puzzle which one can deconstruct and reconstruct according to the light, and finding, pinpointing and identifying buildings is a great game.Go on the river and view it from there - I have done this, also done it on the Queen Mary....Great fun.....

Must see while in Manhattan. We took both an evening cruise and a daytime cruise to see the full picture of Manhattan Skyline. In addition we visited Brooklyn Heights to see the Brooklyn Bridge and the Manhattan Skyline without any rush..

Best seen from NJ or Brooklyn or Staten Island Ferry. Manhattan Skyline is magnificent when seen from WeeHawkin NJ. or Brooklyn Heights or from the FREE Staten Island Ferry.But take the time to view it.See if you can name all the tall buildingsDo you like the newest tall building? It is at 56th & Park Ave.Traditionalists do not like it. But that is progress.Another way to see the Manhattan Skyline is from the Circle Line - a 3 hour tour of manhattan.Circle line departs from W 42nd St & 12th Avenue.
Sight to see. Fantastic at night. Impressive by day. A mix of the old with the new and unique buildings. Nothing to dislike.
Iconic view. This is a skyline you will have seen so many times on TV and cinema and it lives up to expectations. Best seen fron the Staten Island Ferry on the way to the Statue of Liberty.

Staten Island Ferry is a must!. For the best night-time views of the city, travel on the Staten Island Ferry. Get off at the other side, treat yourself to a nice cocktail at the little cafe on the wharf & jump back on the next ferry back home...a cheap & cheerful evening if budgets are tight!

Great views. We went in winter and unfortunately everything was snowed over and dead, however the pictures look incredible in summer. Either way it's well worth a visit and a walk, you can see some great views of NYC!
loved it !. we were spending our christmas holidays in NYC. We got lucky on the day we decided to visit the skyline. Weather was amazing, a bit cold but sunny. We enjoyed it so much !!
Very nice. . During our walk in central park we all enjoyed the sky line. If you are near Manhattan don't miss checking it out.

Such an Amazing Manhattan Skyline View?. This was another thing on our list of must dos planned before leaving home, after a friend told us about this place in Brooklyn called Brooklyn Height's where the views of the Manhattan Skyline are breath-taking and after locating this place and experiencing those views he was not wrong.Nothing more to say other than to let our two photos try to prove why we are so glad we done this on our New York City visit.Thank you for reading this John & Sue Webb Eastbourne UK
Fab!. Top of the Rock with a clear blue sky really let you see the scale of NY. Really enjoyed this and would like to return at night.

AMAZING VIEWS. It's amazing, I have stayed two times in New York but the first time I didn't come here It was a Big mistake. If you don't stay here you can't say "I saw the Manhattan skyline". We went with my girlfriend to Ellis Island, the way was complicated because I done this inside a Borough Tour throwing The Bronx, The Roosevelt island after Ellis Island We Have gone to Williamsburg and Brooklyn. The views were Amazing ? I don't find words to explain it.

View of Manhattan from our Cruise Ship was amazing.. We were lucky enough to visit New York just before Christmas. Our NCL Cruise was starting in New York and sailing down to the Caribbean. It was a freezing cold day but it was very clear and although we had to wear scarves and gloves and thick padded coats we wouldn't have missed sailing out of New York and viewing the Manhattan Skyline for the World. We sailed out just as the light was changing and everything was bathed in an orange glow. It was an amazing experience, perhaps made more significant for us because we were stood up on deck next to someone from New York who was explaining his first hand experience of the awful day the Twin Towers collapsed. It was probably one of the most amazing sail outs from a Port I have ever experienced and the best way to view Manhattan. We sailed very slowly and I was able to photograph all the buildings I had wanted to see for many years. The view across to the Freedom Tower is something I will never forget. The colours were magnificent as all the lights in the buildings were starting to sparkle around it. The highlight for me came when we passed under the Bridge before we left New York and sailed out to sea. There were inches to spare between bridge and ship and the views back towards Manhatten were spectacular. If you really want to appreciate Manhattan this is probably one of the best ways to do it. We met many people from New York on our cruise who do this trip on a yearly basis and now I know why.
Best view from Weehawken. In my opinion, the best view of the Manhattan skyline is from Weehawken, NJ. Go on a sunny afternoon and this view is as inspiring as any natural mountain scenery out West.

Best view was from our taxi. My Mother-in-law described seeing it like seeing the Queen. You have seen images all your life and it is really strange but wonderful to see it with your own eyes. The best view was after going through the Lincoln Tunnel (just like Elf!) to get to Newark airport. It was dusk and the view was wonderful.
once in life time view. Best way to see eveything go to The Top of The Rock or Empire State Building or do both we day. The views are amazing best at night.
Over the Brookley Bridge. Take a walk over the bridge early evening and watch the sun set. It will be the best view of Manhattan skyline. There is viewing area near the waters edge.

Amazing views!. Breathtaking views from up the Empire State Building & Top of The Rock. Fabulous views from Liberty Island. Amazing day and night views from our 36th floor hotel suite - spent ages gazing out of the window. Totally amazing place!!!!!
Amazing!. How can you fault this amazing and iconic view!! Breathtaking to see it for real! Make sure you walk over the Brooklyn Bridge to look back and see the amazing sight!!!

Too much to take in!. The view of lower Manhattan is breathtaking, I'd recommend taking a boat to the Statue of Liberty or a boat trip around the island...or any boat trip that takes you out towards Ellis Island as the view back is stunning, especially at sunset

The top 5 best views of the Manhattan Skyline. 1: The free Staten Island Ferry gives the the opportunity to see the skyline from multiple angles. In combination with the water I think this is the most beautiful place to enjoy the view of the skyscrapers. You will also see Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. When you arrive in Staten Island, just take the boat back to Manhattan to see it all over again.2: South bike line of the Manhattan bridge. The Manhattan bridge has to cycling/walking lanes, one north and one south. From the southern lane you have a perfect view of downtown NYC and the Brooklyn bridge. You can take great pictures here and it is far less crowed than the Brooklyn bridge. You can take the city bike to save time walking. 3: Brooklyn Bridge Park: This park is located at the waterfront in Brooklyn and allows to relax and enjoy the beautiful scenery. You have a great view of Manhattan, the Brooklyn and the Manhattan Bridge. 4: Top op the Rocks: In Midtown Manhattan, you will find Rockerfeller Centre. At the top of the skyscraper you have a beautiful view of the skyline. Not free of charge, but you have a 360 degree view. North Central park, south downtown. And the great hing it, you have a great view of the Empire state buiilding.5: Rooftop Bar. When you enjoy drinking cocktails and enjoying the view, try one of the manny rooftop bars in the evening. Make sure to dress up as most of the bars are fancy places. Also expect to pay around $15 a drink. But you have a great atmosphere and a rememberable night. Try Gansevoort Hotel in Meatpacking districk or lLe Bain in Chelsea
Amazing place. Such a lovely place.that place is fintastic.I don't have words how can I explain.but such a wondering place.
Love it. Well what a veiw looks amazing at night time can't wait to go back so much to do 24hrs eateries 24hrs subway even there past office opens 24/7

Winter day Day Cruise. Cruised out of NYC in Feb. it was a totally different perspective of the skyline - remarkable to see the ice flow from the Hudson River amidst the backdrop of Manhattan skyline. Likewise the view of the skyline was terrific upon return to NYC harbour.

World class view. I grew up watching it. Make sure to go to port authority bus terminal. Buy a return ticket for zone two and go to platform 212 (check at info booth in case of platform change) and take the 10 minute bus ride to weehawken's Boulevard east ( also known as Jfk east). Get off at Hamilton plaza and you'll see the picture card view of the skyline. You will never forget it.
New York Holiday. On a fine day the view is breath taking, on an overcast day you can still see a great view. Live sceen for your favourite movies.
Brilliant View.. Saw the Manhattan skyline from Liberty Island the view was breathtaking with some great views and took plenty of photo opportunities.
The best city in the world!. The best city in the world! New York is the thyroid of the universe. The best things in New York are free.
Fantastic, one of a kind in the world. Iconic and beautiful. The old blended in with the new. The tall, the smaller, the history, all so beautiful.
Brooklyn bridge. Walked across and back and found it quite interesting, views are nice and would be nicer at night when the lights come on.
Beautiful!. This was our first trip to NYC and the enormity of it is more than what we expected. But the skyline is just as cool to see in person as we expected.

Manhattan Skyline at night. visited New York in December 2014 with family we decided to book a 4 course meal on a yacht in the evening to sail along the Hudson river, what a site of Manhattan Skyline it was awe inspiring i was mesmerized by its beauty and splendour the meal was great but the view was fantastic something that I will never forget.

Best views from Liberty Island and Ellis Island.. The best daytime photographic opportunities for me were the afternoon at Liberty Island and leaving Ellis Island. Significant detail, and great angles provided me with photos to never forget how breathtaking the views were.
Never disappoints. The NYC skyline, what can you say!? I would recommend doing the Empire State during the day and then Top of The Rock at night!

Amazing views. In day and night the views of Manhattan are amazing. Visited Top of the Rock and Empire State, bith had their own different views depending on time of day. Top of the Rock gave the furthest views including central park

First Sight. Being there was breathtaking. Seeing it with your own eyes was something I need to go back for. The view from the Empire State Building is something everyone should see once in their lives.

Manhattan Skyline. Make the effort to walk over Brooklyn Bridge the view looing back at the city is truly spectacular. If you walk all the way over you will also be able to see the statue of liberty lit up in the distance.
Impressive Views. Take the time to plan your trip and how you'll travel around the place. Traffic is always a challenge but the views on a nice Spring, Summer or Fall day is really cool.
So beautiful!. We saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Staten Island Ferry. So pretty! It is so iconic and incomparable.

Brooklyn Heights. Get the train to Brooklyn as it's getting dark for the best views - we walked along the Brooklyn Heights Promenade to the Brooklyn Bridge and back into Manhattan and the view was breath-taking, as always! :)
Beautiful Skyline. Every building has it own beauty! One can spend endless hours just admiring the beauty of the skyline in NYC
Like being in a movie. Do the boat tour at night - breathtaking!! Exactly what you see in films on the big screen and you get to see everything lit up 😊

From the Airport to the Hotel.... From the Airport to the Hotel keep your eyes out for this magnificent skyline! Even as you are about to touch down near by as you fly in, be sure to check your views out the window. I travel the world and I don't think there is a more impressive skyline than that of Manhattan at night. As someone else stated, the views from atop the Empire State Building are wonderful as well! I would describe the Manhattan Skyline as "Magical!"

I live Here!. I am a naive New Yorker. A am a traveler, but I always come home. NY is a place that must be visited in order to understand what all the Hoopla is all about. It is always beautiful.......

The most amazing city in the world. There are many places to view the NYC skyline. Each location offers a unique look at the famous and varied skyline. The Circle Line offers a view from the water as you travel around Manhattan and is breath taking by day or night. If you want a thrill though, take a trip to the top of the empire state building!

The Greatest Skyline. The New York Skyline can be experienced in many ways . My Favorite is from the Front and Rear of the Staten Island Ferry. A trip, by the way, that is Free. The Breathtaking view of upper New York Bay and seeing the full scope of New York City is beyond description . The Ferrys are very large and quite comfortable. And you get to see not only the Skyline at its best but also the Statue of Liberty close up.The trip will take 25 minutes each way and you get to see the awesomeness of the Skyline gong and returning.
Breathtaking. Similar to other cities...but I am just so in love with Manhattan - the stores, chapels and churches, street food, night life...
Skyline. Enjoyed the views we took photos from Brooklyn bridge, a short taxi ride from Times Square".."............................
Unbelievable! Beautiful!. Could not believe the beautiful skyline. We saw it from the top of the Empire State Building! Fantastic!

It has all been said before. One of the best skylines in the world. The best way to see it is from a boat, Circle Line, that goes around the island of Manhattan. It is amazing both day and night when it is lit. You'll not see the stars, there is so much light from the city. Best take the ride after you have been a few days in the city and need a little rest from the hussle and bussle of the city., you will also recognize where you are. There is a guide on each boat.

One of the greatest views on earth. I'm not keen on heights but when we got to the top of The Empire State building I was gobsmacked by the views. My wife had to practically drag me away. I could have stood and stared for days !!!!
Look across from Brooklyn. Take the 7 1 stop from Grand Central Station and stand on the Pulaski Bridge at night, best view ever.

Great way to see New York. It's a relatively short walk above the ground, beautifully arranged on the base of the old railroad/subway tracks. A truly urban experience for such a dense city that doesn't have many parks. It has trees, sculptures, modern outdoor seating places. You can walk it all in an hour or so, or walk down at any block. The southern end is in an area of many great restaurants, big and small

Amazing view. The Manhattan skyline is breath taking. While no longer hosting the World Trade Center buildings, the new Freedom Tower is the tallest building in the US. You have to see it to believe it!

Breathtaking. The Manhattan Skyline evokes every memory of every movie that has taken advantage of this wonderful view. View it from the New Jersey side of the Hudson and it seems to stand alone as one of the most breathtaking views in America.
What a view!. Looking at the skyline is one thing, but being part of it is even better. The view from above Rockeffeler Center lets you see it all

Worth viewing from more than one angle. I like the view from Staten Island. You can go over in the Staten Island Ferry for free have lunch in the area and go back passing the Statue of Liberty and seeing the Manhattan Skyline.+
just incredible !. building of all shape, sizes and styles....I walk around the city just to see and photograph the many spledid building , always surprises with what you find on each adventue out.

Go to the Brooklyn Bridge Park. For the best view, go to the Brooklyn Bridge Park, and if you can, walk to it over the Brooklyn Bridge.
The Skyline View from there is really good

A wonder of the world. Go to Brooklyn so that you can see the downtown skyline from the Esplanade...Get off the 2/3 line at Clark Street and walk west along the street until you get to the end...and lo and behold there is the Brooklyn Bridge as well....Go at sunset for a real delight.

Nothing Else Like It. Whether you are at the top of an iconic skyscraper, seeing it from New Jersey or another borough, or flying into/out of a local airport (if you fly at night, I swear, this skyline will give you chills and touch you in a way that gives you a lump in your throat), the view is beyond belief.BTW, this is my home - maybe biased...or maybe the best one to review.

River cruise. we took a river cruise from pier 78 all the way round to past the Brooklyn Bridge, and back again, there is also hop on hop off stops along the way to enable you to look round and join a later boat, this is one of the best ways to see the Manhattan skyline would definitely recommend

Iconic.. Just one of the most well known, beautiful, inspiring sites ever. You have to experience it at least once in your life time. It has touched me so much, I gave a permanent tribute to it inked into my skin. Love it.
Excellent vwies!!!. I like all of it !!!! Just go to Empire State Buildings during the sunny weather. Amazing! What i dislike... the price ....OMG

See it to Understand. Views from the Empire State Building and Rockefeller Centre are amazing. I don't believe anywhere else on earth has as many Skyscrapers and tall buildings so densely packed together, and it really makes for an outstanding view, day or night.
Awesome. View it from an express cruise, the rockefeller tower, empire state or helicopter.... All give it a different perspective !!

My favourite place in New York, by far!. This was by far my most favourite thing to do, I could stop and stare at the skyline all day! We took the subway to Hoboken and took the ferry taxi back! Also a nice way to see the skyline! You are missing out if you don't go to see the skyline!

Best skyline in the world. Definitely the best skyline in the world. Manhattan is home to some of the most famous buildings in the world like the Empire State building, Rockefeller centre and one World Trade Center.

Top of the Rock. View from top of Rockafella centre - something to experience!
Fantastic view across Manhattan towards the other Boroughs

Amazing - Breath taking!. we did the Brooklyn at night bus tour which stopped to let us take photos of the skyline at night - it was so cool!
we also had dinner at the view restaurant - a revolving bar up 35 storeys - it was the most amazing views!
Views to see before you die. Empire State Building, high line garden, top of the rock, Brooklyn Bridge, view of NYC from Brooklyn, just all amazing.
Awesome. Manhattan skyline view was lovely from New Jersey side. Great location to get some great pics. This is something you see so often in movies -Beautiful sight across Hudson river.

Until you walk New York and see the buildings it is hard to conceive how big it actually is!. Loved the new buildings and the old buildings - it was amazing just walking through and looking up at it all
Fantastic!. The best skyline I have ever seen!. There are so many different places to get a good view of it. Central Park, from Liberty Island and many many more!
Great and Breathtaking. The skyline view is best viewed from The Hudson or the riverfront in Jersey, go to Newport for a great view 10mins from 33rd Street PATH station and some great shopping.

If flying into LaGuardia.... If you can sit on the right side of the airplane fling into LGA during clear sides, you'll get a great view of Manhattan, especially at night. While they can certainly switch runways, the right side usually offers some spectacular views. It's free and the best bargain in New York.The R lounge at the Times Square Renaissance as some great views of Times Square. The Rock Shrimp are the best bargain, drinks are steep, however, the view is worth it.
Magic!. Manhattan skyline from brooklyn in a sunny dayManhattan skyline from the staten island ferry at sunset

Picture Perfect.... This is the perfect place for photos and truly taking in the view. Gorgeous! I was able to see all of NY this way - truly a sight. Such a beautiful city... take a moment and enjoy it.

ch-ch-changes. I have a plate on my bedroom wall that shows the skyline with the twin towers--lest we forget!
recent visit was like having had your tooth pulled and you keep feeling the gap with your tongue.
sorry the review is not on a happy note
Big Lights, Big City. The New York City skyline is best viewed from the Brooklyn promenade in Park Slope, or from downtown Hoboken or Jersey City, New Jersey.
Amazing. Manhattan skyline tour was amazing experience. Must see when visiting New York. It was a fantastic day

Glad i did this. Had to be encouraged to walk this but glad I was. Don't know what I was expecting but it was awesome. Bones in rocks, recycled things of interest made the walk worth the while. good views of yellow cabs and the traffic of New York from a different angle. really interesting walk, even though it was cold-wrap up well as it can be extra chilly with the winds of being higher up.

Best In The World. I live here and experience its wonder every day. What people need to travel hundreds and thousands of miles to see, I have access to by a quick train or express bus ride. I love New York. It's my home town.

Seen it for years. The Manhattan skyline has been on numerous television programmes, more films than enough but it all pales into insignificance as you have got to see it first hand. Quite breathtaking (especially the day we were there as it was blowing a gale). Can't wait to go back!
Manhattan skyline like no other!. This skyline was magnificant! It made toronto's look soft. The best view is from the Empire State Building.
The view from Liberty Park. Visited Lady Liberty on a spectacular Sunday; the Manhattan Skyline is a site to see; highly recommended.
Manhattan Skyline - what's not to like??. Excellent view of the famous Manhattan skyline from the James Hotel - recommended. What's not to like??

OMG OMG OMG..!!! . I've lived in NY fr so many years but I'm always mesmerized by the majestic skyline. Last time I visited was at night and was crossing the bridge from Brooklyn. Trust me, yellow diamonds everywhere..!!!!it was like a dream where u just wanna keep looking n don't wanna arrive somewhere.if u haven't seen it folks, u've seen nothing.
Inspiring. An impressive sight from so many angles. The view of manhattan from the plane coming into La Guardia was one of my favourite moments of our trip.

One of the most iconic views in the world. It does not matter how many times you go to New York you will never tire of the view of the Manhattan Skyline. I recommend several places to view it from. Taking the Statton Island Ferry gives you an amazing view of the tip of Manhattan and if you can do this just before sunset the buildings will glow in the golden sunshine. You also should drive across one of the rivers and get a view of Manhattan at night time, quite breathtaking. However it is hard to beat a view of Manhattan from the air where you can gauge the scale of the city and just marvel at how beautiful it is and the expanse of Central Park in the middle. Just writing this makes me long to go back to New York City.

There is Only One. From the Empire State Building aglow in lights celebrating some occasion to iconic sky scrapers along the river, there is no place like it. From the air as you fly in it is spectacular. At night it is magical. And even while you are in the "Canyons" it is still breathtaking.
Top of the Rock.. Perfect view of the New York City skyline. Camera is a must. Check it out during the day and in the evening to really appreciate the experience.
NYC Manhattan skyline. Spent a fantastic few days in New York, went to the top of the Empire state building what a view a got to see.

All we expected. Our first visit to NY and the scenery was all we expected. We did the daytime from The Top Of The Rock and the night view from The Empire State Building, see the seperate reviews for these. Due to the weather we did not manage to travel on the rivers but we were happy with what we did get.

Fantastic!. The skyline is like no other, and a fantastic city to visit. The view from the Rockefeller centre is top notch and can't be beaten by not only nowhere else in the city but the rest of the world.

What's not to like about the skyline. Always warms my heart to see that beautiful skyline! Driving in from the north over the bridge and coming to that sight in sun, rain, fog or clear skies gives me a thrill--but, then, I'm a native New Yorker though living elsewhere for many years.

Over the top of the Big Apple!. everything was stunning and magic .It seemed to be on a location of a film set .Everytime We get to N.York the magic atmosphere comes out from the magic hat of the skyline !

thrill of a lifetime. ground zero is a must.go to every sight you want to see or you may never get the chance againstatue of liberty breath taking.top of the rock and empire state building a must.museum of 9/11.hard rock café and pplanet Hollywood.brooklyn bridge and tour round manhattan fabulous.for us it was the helicopter ride with liberty over manhattan which we will remember the most.

Splendid view!. On my third visit to New York City, I finally managed to get to Brooklyn to get a view on Downtown Manhattan.
We had to walk a while to get to the promenade, but when we found it, it was so worth it.
We went in the evening and the view was amazing. Really breath taking.
It is not Hong Kong. The best place to see it is from the reservoir in Central Park or from the other side of the Brooklyn Bridge.

Better than expected.. If the only time you have seen the Manhattan Skyline is on a TV show or movie, you have got to see the real thing. Take a stroll across the Brooklyn Bridge in the evening and the view will take your breath away.
From the blu. Of course she is astonishing. She is the one. And I am sailing just so near. Take the free boat to Staten Island. It is a good trip.
sunset @ 6 am. Beautiful view at the Manhattan skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge at 6 o clock in the morning. Nice and quiet, no people around, definately worth it!

Its what New York is all about. The skyline of Manhattan is so iconic and there is nowhere else like it in the world. Instantly recognisable and very photogenic even when the weather is bad. My top tip would be to try and see it from the River for the best views or from the Brooklyn side of the river or from the South Street Seaport Museum.

Manhattan Skyline. It was just amazing when you come for a place with a population of 175,000 people and at the highest building is probably on 15 stories. Than you look out at the skyline of Manhattan and you actually have to crane your neck to see over the buildings. We were on the 18th floor of the hotel.

Manhattan Skyline bus tour. The Manhattan skyline bus tour was amazing, what a great experience...Martin Kelly the Grand Ambassador was very knowledgable and informative, professional and pleasant. Our bus driver Miguel was very welcoming, courteous and fun,. They made our trip very enjoyable....I highly recommend this bus tour and wold do it again.

Breathtaking. Whether you see it from the empire state or one the rock or even from the hudson, its breath taking . Its the skyline everyone thinks they know, but until you come see it and take it in, you dont realise how often you see it in movies, commercials etc etc. it has to be theMost iconic in the world
Amazing. Beautiful day or night. What a view from several locations. A must if in NY and freeThink the best view was from Brooklyn Bridge or Rockafella centre

Just an unique skyline. You can enjoy it going in one cruise starting from Battery park; or just go to Brooklyn.
You'll se it better in the evening BUT Manhattan skyline is one unique view in the world

Epic. The manhattan skyline is epic to see in person. New York really is a concrete jungle but the buildings are stunning with beautiful architecture. Amazing to see at night time but also great during the day.

Great view from atop the Roc or Empire State buildings.. The Empire State Building offers an express to the top. It's costs more but is worth not having to wait in the long lines. Great views during both day and night. The Roc has a video show while waiting in line and the top has some great views of Central Park along with surrounding areas. It's worth the cost for either trip to see.
Views of NY. Manhattan skyline is always spectacular even if you have seen it many time you still need to check it out

Speechless. Nothing can compare to this beautiful Skyline, your neck will begin from staring up, that is when you go to the Top of The Rock and look at the Skyline from there. We also went to the Top of the Empire State Building....Speechless!

Amazing architecture. Amazing city and amazing buildings, just cant stop to explain those lovely views of the citiy. one of the best places in the world i have experienced in my life. must visit place in the world.
Majestic!. Take in the Skyline by way of walking the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan at night (after eating a pie at Juliana's Pizza --- right at the base of the bridge!).
Amazing views. See the skyline by day and lit up at night, by road and by ferry. It is truly amazing and a must see when visiting NYC.
Best view form the Rockefeller Centre. Empire State is a must just because, but better views here. Trip out to Statue of Liberty has great views too.

Fabulous. Such an interesting walk in respect to view of New York and vibrant atmosphere. To see close up and at a distance the contrast of New York architecture, amazing art/graffiti and the Eco culture. How they transformed an old train line into such a beautiful an interesting walk is amazing.
New york, New York!. It's New York! Everyone know the skyline is like no other. Take the Staten Island Ferry for one of the best views.

Its pretty.. Yah, manhattan skyline is pretty. It looks just like the movies. If you live here, you see it every day. If youre visiting NYC, then head on over to DUMBO in Brooklyn, or even the waterfront of Greenpoint or Williamsburg in Brooklyn, and view from there.
