Use the JMZ train going back into the city, as it rides above ground, and you can watch the Manhattan skyline as you re-enter Manhattan.Also, the Staten Island Ferry (at the bottom of Manhattan) is basically a free ride to observe the Statue of Liberty and lower Manhattan from the water.
Unbelievable. What a view. This city never sleeps as Frank Sinatra said in his famous song. This is a must see attraction. New York is an incredible city. And what a view!
Amazing!. This was seriously a great experience. I didn't know about the skyline until I met up with someone who had been before. Would definitely recommend giving it a go, it's a beautiful sight :)
You can't beat it.. What can I say, the view of the Manhattan Skyline from my hotel was breathtaking. It really is something.
Speechless. No matter how many times you see this on the tv .... I was left speechless it truly is out if this world a must to see. I don't and won't ever forget
Perfect. The Manhattan Skyline seen from the Rockefeller Centre and the Empire State Building is a phenomenal one, definitely worth a visit.
breathtaking. Can see it from my Queens bedroom window. Lovely and breathtaking. Simply stunning from Manhattan. So Much beauty.
Empire State View. Brilliant view.Go around dusk to get the transition from day to night...The lines can be huge...even on a good day it takes over an hour to get to the top.
Impressive. The skyline took some time to absorb. There is just so much to see and pay attention too. It is something that everyone should see at least once.
Iconic vista!. View from Brooklyn was simply stunning! Well worth the trip day or night. Easy walk over Brooklyn Bridge from Battery Park.

Sunset View. I have only seen pics and this was a must visit location for me, clicking pics on my smart phone, still was able to get some nice shots (without any filters)
Buy yourself a bottle of water and a sandwich, walk and then just enjoy the view

Unforgettable. The absence of the twin towers is felt as you pull into the city by train, but the skyline remains striking with the old vanguard like the Empire State Building and the new One World Trade Center spiraling towards the heavens. Looking at the skyline the anticipation of arrival is palatable as the excitement of the city begins to unfold. There is no place like it - New York, New York.
Concrete jungle. Seeing NYC skyline from New Jersey before entering the Lincoln Tunnel is an amazing sight, seeing it on top from the Empire State building is an awesome sight.
Wow!. Best view for us of the skyline was from the Staten Island Ferry, it's free and the perfect little detour to get some great pictures!
Amazing!!!. The skyline is truly a sight to see from Staten Island... best panoramic views of some of the most famous buildings on this planet.. sky scrapers standing tall... awesome!!!

Awesome!. Just like you've seen on the films & on TV!!!The view is actually better from the New Jersey side of the Hudson River, because when you're actually there, it just gives you a sore neck looking up all the time!!! LOL!!
Gorgeous. We booked our trip to the Top of the Rock for sunset...it was a perfect blue sky day, and the most amazing sight.

Simply Amazing. I saw the skyline from Top of the Rock looking down on it, I saw the skyline from the water and I saw it from the ground. Which ever way you looked at it, it left you with your jaw trailing on the floor.The new Freedom Tower adds something special or some completeness to the downtown area as well.I think perhaps the most beautiful of the skyscrapers though is the Chrysler Building. I just hope they don't rename it the FCA Building like Fiat and Chrysler.

A view of the city. What you won't realize when you are in the concrete jungle, you will come to appreciate when you get some distance between Manhattan and yourself, and see it yourself in all it glory (preferably at night!)
Better than advertised!. So beautiful. A must-see. I saw it from Brooklyn and from a ferry down the Hudson. Amazing views any time of day/night!

One of the best views anywhere and the best view of this great city. JFK Boulevard right across the Hudson River just north of the Lincoln Tunnel entrance in New Jersey is the best view you can get of this city.

The big apple. The skyline of the BIG APPLE - this is what New York is all about
no visit to New York is complete without it - don't miss it
Start spreading the news. A vibrant city that breeds excitement. Surreal enjoying the view I have seen in countless books, magazines and movies. Delighted.
Beautiful. If you want to walk and see a lot, here is the place. A must do in New York. It was like a postcard. Absolutely Beautiful!

A must see when visiting Meat Pack District or Chelsea. liked the idea, the concept and design. Disliked the first day I visited due to wheather. If it is a cold day, you'll feel it freezing over there
Best seen from the Downtown boat tour. Amazing and just like every film you've ever seen...... but better! Doesn't matter where you go or when you go this makes the holiday

Take the free boat. It is better to get on a ferry 45 minutes to one hour before the sun goes down. So you make the most of your cruise : day light, twilight and night time light to vary your pictures !!

High riser buildings!!. a place to see all kind of high riser buildings!!..Stopover each buildings and click a Selfie. ohh!!!.. i love this place and always wanted to own a building with 100 floors. The Finance district of New York or we can say USA.
Picture Perfect. What NYC is really known for, the skyscrapers! True to the song with the following lyrics: "Concrete Jungle where Dreams are made of.. Big lights will inspire you"
Wow. Wow... just one word... wow. First view as you come into new york. The best view we had of it was from Brooklyn on a clear, crisp day.
Stunning. Nothing like the Manhattan Skyline. Take the free boat trip from the harbour, you won't be disappointed. Try and pick a nice clear day!!

The View in Marquis Marriott. If you want the best view of the Manhattan Skyline, go to 'The View', located on the 48th floor of the Marquis Marriott. This has a spinning top (2 levels, one is the bar, the other a sit down restaurant) and you can see the 360 degree view of Manhattan. Hands down a don't miss!
Ferry view. The views we had of the Skyline from our ferry were breathtaking and we are so glad we were able to endure the cold and take the pictures!
View from a bridge. Take the subway to Wall Street. Find the Brooklyn Bridge and walk halfway across. Turn around. NOW you've really seen New York!
The skyline frome the River Cafe in Brooklyn is unmatched anywhere.. The view from the River Cafe at dusk is remarkable as the sky darkens and the lights of the city are turned on.

It never gets tired ..... I found the best view is from the Staten Island ferry or looking downtown from the Empire State Building, albeit it, it is a poignant view across all my visits to NYC, Twin Towers, then none and now the Freedom Tower. Take a good look left to right and back again, making note of the bridges, all that is old as well as new.The other view to take in is upwards as you step off the ferry at South Ferry and walk up Church Street towards Bleeker Street in Greenwich Village.

Skyline with no sun to peek. Empire State Building, a not to be missed sky scrapper with beautiful glass curtain wall. The view from the observatory is immaculate with a view of tall buildings in New York side and just the opposite towards New Jersey, separated by river and ocean view.The sore point however are its steep charges if you decide to enter.
A most spectacular skyline. New York is so iconic and we got to see it all from a boat cruise. It's simply spectacular! What's not to like?

Man-made wonder. The Manhattan skyline is, in my opinion, the most beautiful city skyline in the world. On a clear day or night, the awe and amazement one garners in viewing such a magnificent set of skyscrapers is overwhelming. I'm not talking from a boat or ship, I'm speaking about taking in the view from the other side of the East River or the Hudson. In areas such as Queens, Brooklyn, Hoboken Weehakwen, Edgewater, Jersey City, etc. It is well worth the expense to dine in these cities at a restaurant with a view. Walking the many riverfront walkways and parks in these cities is also a remarkable experience. If you are close enough, a drive to any of these areas will not disappoint.
Always Beautiful. This skyline is so distinctive. When you travel into NYC it welcomes you and gives you anticipation for the excitement that awaits you in the city.

Everything one expects. What a memorable experience. The Manhatton skyline is just as seen on the television. If you are there in the morning, from the Statue of Liberty side, the sun rises behind the Manhatton skyscrapers and it is an unbelievable sight. If you are coming into New York on a cruise ship, get up early, go on top deck and take in the delights of the sail in. Will your cruise ship get under the bridge????? It is a safe place to walk around but, you are in a City, so take the usual precautions on personal safety. BE AWARE. The metro runs down to Manhatton from the City Centre. Great to walk around the waterfront of tge Hudson Bay with lots of places to eat and drink. Enjoy.
Iconic is the only word that seems fit. You can fully appreciate how amazing the Manhattan Skyline is from Top of the Rock, Empire State Building or from Staten Island.

Beautiful.. A gorgeous view from every angle. Its incredible seeing so many iconic buildings in one skyline! I saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Promenade, so saw the Brooklyn Bridge as well - considering the buildings would be a mile away, they still looked very impressive.
Semi circle cruise to see skyline. Took the semi circle boat cruise, the commentator was brilliant, loads of information about various sites, definitely would recommend this tour!

Ride the Ferry!. For a breath taking view, go ride the staten island ferry at night. The ride is free. Ride over and return. Total time about an hour. You see the skyline of NYC, the Brooklyn bridge, and pass by the Statue of Liberty.
Iconic. You have to see New York from the river - that's how everyone first used to see it, and that's the picture we all have of it
The Postcard. It looks just the way you'd expect it. We've seen it in movies forever. It's nice from a distance. Manhattan is wild.
Amazing!. Such an amazing walk and the views are priceless! A must do in NYC if you wanna walk around and see a lot.

Awesome! Everything I Expected it to Be!. Very impressive and we had good weather to get the best viewing. I took too many pictures but trying to capture the structures was worth the effort. I even bought the street painting and I am delighted with that!

Beautiful skyline on top of the Rockefeller Center. Quite amazing skyline, worth to visit the top of the rock (Rockefeller Center). Could see all skyline over Manhattan.
The best time is at dusk. You could see from day to night scene.
Like the postcards. Even though we've seen the skyline a million times in films or even in reality, it never ceases to impress.
Nothing like it.. So many places to view/photograph. I usually stay in NJ and take the Ferry across the Hudson. Good place to take late photos.
in the 60's and having fun!. Liked just about everything. The only thing I did't liked was the homeless people sleeping on the sidewalks', and that is not only in NYC is everywhere.

Well what can be said, one of the best in the world!. The Skyline in Manhattan is as great as any can get! One of the best ways to see the sky line and the Statue of Liberty is a free, yes free ferry ride to and from Staton Island which leaves close to the finance district. Another is to take a taxi across the Manhattan bridge, eat pizza just below the bridge Grimaldi's pizza then walk back across the bridge and enjoy the skyline at dusk.
not to be missed. The view, especially at night, is breathtaking! If it were warmer, I would have spent more time there. It is one of the best views in New York.
Great to see from Liberty Island. Don't miss the view. The skyline is very impressive...especially at night...especially with a full moon!
top of the roc. It was a great day and the views were magnificient. It has a great view to take lots of photos of the Empire State building.

Astounding and Impressive. Unbelievable the size and structures of the buildings! The history and the magnitude of the borough of Manhattan was beyond words. One must see it to truly understand NYC. It's much more than the photos, especially at night.

Manhattan Skyline. The city particularly at night is fabulous and just to see all the skyscrapers is amazing. Times Square with all the shops that light up were great. My favorite was always the M&M's store. There is nothing that I disliked about our trip

Beautiful, Especially at Night . Some of the best views are from Hoboken, Liberty State Park and Hamilton Park, all in New Jersey. The Empty Sky Memorial for New Jersey folks who lost their lives in the Twin Towers is impressive.
Fantastic. Wow Just fantastic, views much better than expected could see so much and more we really enjoyed this.
Newark suprise. Landing in Newark has its advantages - on the trip in you are greeted with a New York skyline and view of the statue of Liberty

One the best city skylines. Their are many great places to see this skyline and many of which are know only by locals, but here are a few of my favourites:
The Brooklyn Bridge, Top of the Rock, Queensboro bridge, Staten Island Ferry, Battery Park, The Empire State Building and the pleasure boat trips in the evening sunset.
Amazing at night. Manhattan skyline is Dazzling and beautiful to watch over from NJ waterfront areas or Brooklyn bridge, especially at night with its reflection in river Hudson !

World Famous View. Nothing is more impressive that the View of the New York Skyline, especially at night. So many movies have been made with this in the background. just walking around leisurely and taking in the sights and the people. Please be open minded! and take advantage of this and the price is right!
Best skyline in the world. Although the World Trade Center is horribly missed, this is the world's most beautiful skyline day or night.
Absolutely Beautiful!. Do yourself a favor and go to Brooklyn for a good pizza. Then take a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge as the sun sets and watch the city light up! Beautiful!
Top of the Rock. Amazing views of the New York skyline especially if you go just as it is getting dark. Great views of Empire State & Chrysler building.

Skyline Nr.1. If you like skyscrapers you have to take a picture of it. The best in the word, go to brooklyn, walk on the brooklyn or Manhattan bridge, from a boat or if you are a lucky man from an helicopter, from Liberty or Staten Island. It's unique and indescribable. Probably the best view one can have is from Brooklyn park, exactly in front of the Freedom tower

See it from a distance - Hoboken, New Jersey. To get a good feel of the skyline, you must see it from Hoboken, New Jersey. Once you cross over from NYC to Hoboken, NJ, just start walking around, towards the river. There are many roads that lead into the hudson river from which you can see the view.
From any direction!. What is not to like? Love looking at it from any direction! Empire state building especially stands out.
Beautiful. The most beautiful skyline in the world from everywhere you look. Roosevelt island, Staten Island and New Jersey are the best spots.
beautiful!. we went in December/January and it was worth a visit, great to see on a rooftop bus tour or water taxi.

A great few hours. Just to have a walk in the sunshine along this newly revamped railway line, now a pedestrian way was exhilarating and when you reach the Meat Packing District lots of nice delis, eateries surround you, well worth the walk for the appetite.
From the freedom tower. The observation floor at the freedom tower is the best place to see the New York skyline! The new building is incredible and the view is the best in the city.

Spectacular Sight. I have been to many cities, but this has such a different look that it was awesome to see. The lights and the number of huge skyrise buildings was well worth the trip. Saw it as we drove in from the New Jersey side, but the most spectacular sight was from the river. We took a cruise on the Hudson for New Year's Eve and saw it all lit up. Magnificient!
amazing. went to dumbo area to see the sunset on manhattan skyline, you can't miss it! it's very beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!
Impressive!. Seeing it on TV is nothing like seeing it in person! Very interesting archetecture, beautifully lit at night!

Just...different. It`s impossible to describe the feeling that you experience when you are just walking in Manhattan. It`s just breathtaking. I traveled many countries, cities, but really nothing compares with Manhattan. I love it!

The best In The World - End Off. I am a jaded New Yorker, however this iconic,Historic,Timeless Skyline Leads The Rest Follows.
As you walk the streets of this Great City you are surrounded by iconic buildings,Beaty, History - Go & See - You will not be dissapointed !
Visit at night time watched from Hoboken. The most beautiful new york skiline is watched form the other side at night time. unforgetable moment.
Awesome re-vamp of old highline. A creative, amazing redo of an old highline with seating, greenery, and amazing views. Extends pretty far and is nice for a stroll above the streets.

Unique skyline. See the Manhatten skyline from serveral angels. From the staten island ferry, from Brooklyn bridge, from the emire tate building and other spots. Familiar from tv and film, but comes to life once you are actually there.

Always Impressive. the Manhattan skyline is always impressive from every direction, whether flying in or looking out from the Empire State Building of the Top of the Rock of the Staten Island Ferry or the Statue Cruises. See it from a couple of perspectives.
What a huge endavor!. The view is one thing, especially during sunsets, it is beautiful, but the more incredible thing is how big this whole living, breathing mega city is. Mind blowing.
What you come to see. Best viewed from the East River so take a boat trip . Or go to 86th/102nd floors of The Empire State Building .Best viewed from boat though
Amazing view!. One of the best views of the skyline can be seen from the South Seaport in Manhattan. So beautiful!!
Cool but Cold. It was really cool to do the skyline but as it was cold, near water, and windy (since you are escalated) it might be a better attraction suited for warm climates.
Stunning!!!. For the best view of Manhattan go to the empire state building or top of the rock at the Rockefeller centre!!

Top of the Rock. An outstanding night experience. What a view. What an experience.
More sevurity, fairly pricey but worth the wait and the money.

Oh, the view.. Excellent place to get lost and think or just wonder your mind, on a good day you'll have no interruptions and be able to take all the buildings and the marvelous view of the skyline. Whether during the day or at night, its something you must do in New York.

Breathtaking !. As others have mentioned the best way to see the breathtaking site of the Manhatten Skyline is at night from Brooklyn. When the buildings are lit up it really is a one in a lifetime sight and takes you back to so many films and TV shows you've seen it really is stunning. My wife and I viewed the Skyline from the top deck of the Big Bus guided tour which was supurb but very cold !.Dont miss this chance as you will regret it for ever ! its also a chance to visit Brooklyn which in itself is a brilliant place to visit.

Take it in from Brooklyn. The best place to see it from is the Brooklyn Heights Promenade in the evening. It's a very safe neighborhood and has plenty of excellent drinking and eating establishments. The views are great to take in after dinner.

wrap up. wrap up it gets very chilly of a nightie and especially if you have chosen to sit on the top of the bus! fabulous views from across the brooklyn bridge look ing over to manhattan and her famous landmarks all lit up. well worth it tho just for the photos
amazing. a fresh breeze in the middle of the big apple..!! what a surprise to find such a great attraction..!

Theres something missing.... This is the iconic skyline of the country. However, the void created by the missing Trade Center cannot be filled by the One World Trade Center building..., not by a long shot. I have been fortunate to experiance this truely amazing skyline all my life, and to those from "middle America", it must be breath taking.

pictures speak for themselves. Take a tour to statue of liberty. Best views from the boat. Alternatively do what we did. take a taxi over the Brooklyn Bridge and walk back. The views are amazing. Well worth a visit. just make sure its sunny/clear weather or you wont see anything.
Not matched anywhere. Best views from the esplanade in Brooklyn Heights and the Williamsburg waterfront. The alternative is the Hudson River shore in New Jersey.

World's Greatest Right?. Manhattan skyline seems like an unfair category because it depends where you are viewing it from but it is amazing and iconic. Whether it is seen from the Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building or the rotating restaurant on top of the Marquis it is all amazing
NYC Stay. Gorgeous, could see the park and theaters, went to Rockefeller Center and saw the tree and angels. Christmas shopped at Macy's Herald Square.

Turn of the lights...Never!. Some guy came up with the 'brilliant' idea that the lights should be turned off for conservation. While the aim is good, Manhattan skyline is all about lights. Love to cross Brooklyn bridge at sunset, epic pics at that time.
skyline. Good Views of the city - but quite busy - great for a little excercise, but a little cold in winter. Wrap up warm and take your camera with you.
Beautiful. Center of the world. One must see this city. Not comparable to anything in Europe This review is now 50+ symbols.

Manhattan New York skyline from Brooklyn, by night! Stunning.... Head for Columbia Heights in Cobble Hill, Brooklyn, as the sun sets...and see the best night-time view of Manhattan lights! From the Statue of Liberty slightly left, in the distance, look to your right, to the Manhattan skyline and on to the Empire State Building. Fabulously romantic! NY Subway stops at Clark Street. Head towards the river, up Clark Street, then right onto Columbia Heights and onto the walkway behind Columbia Heights for the river views! Good local restaurants nearby.
Skyline. The Manhattan skyline is impressive from the bay both at day and night, stunning. Late afternoon with the sun reflecting and at night lit up it, it is amazing.
Manhattan skyline: like in the movies. It has been amazing seeing the Manhattan skyline from different places of the city, as shown in hundreds of movies. I felt in love.

One of the Best..... Second trip to NYC....decided Christmas trip was in order...the views from The Empire State building... Top of the Rock are amazing....also great skyline views from the Pier area near the Brooklyn Bridge....one of the best skylines....do both day and night visits....

TOP OF THE ROCK FABULOUS!. unmatchable view of the manhattan skyline,a memory chalked off my bucket list this along with the exceptionally warm and hospitable New Yorkers, made this an unforgettable evening.
Great cityscape! Always alive.. Best views are outside of Manhattan in Brooklyn or New Jersey waterfront as well as from a tall building in the City.
Excellent idea. Easy was to access Chelsea Market and take nice pictures as the view is great. The idea is walk through it from end to end.

START FROM BROOKLYN BRIDGE. Fabulous walk. Take the Subway to the 1st stop within Brooklyn then just walk (40-60 mins) over the upper pedestrian walkway over the Brooklyn Bridge. Fantastic view of Manhattan Skyline, Statue of Liberty and new World Trade Centre. Well worth the trip - particularly for photographers!!

Trip to the Big Apple. No city like this in the world...it has a raw energy..and like a magnet it always draws you back in! As a famous singer once said 'the city that never sleeps'. The iconic skyline whether seen on foot,by boat or better still in a helicopter leaves a lasting impression and one that always stays with you. Like I said it also draws you back.

Manhattan. We saw the Manhattan skyline form the East river, the Brooklyn Bridge and from the top of the Rock at The Rockefeller Centre. All spectacular and has to be seen in reality. No film or video has captured the real hugeness and impressive nature of it.
city view. Top of the Rock provided the perfect aerial view of NYC. Best time to go is late afternoon/early evening. Allows you to seet the city in daylight and at night.

Always love the view!. I see the skyline of East Side Manhattan everyday, as my office is located by the Hunter's Point South Ferry Terminal.I bring all my visitors and friends, from far away places, to my office building so that they can enjoy the beautiful view of Manhattan Skyline and there, they can take great souvenir pictures. They had taken the East River Ferry from Hunter's Point to Dumbo/Brooklyn Bridge, and to Wall Street. I am so lucky that I get to enjoy it anytime, rain or shine, morning 'til night when I live my office.

Breathtaking. We viewed the sykline from many vantage points. Take a helicopter flight if you can- pier 16 New York helicopters, great service. Or simply walk the Brooklyn Bridge in daytime and then walk back in darkness. Spectacular - my most favourite view in the world so far.

Christmas tour. We visited on Christmas day thinking it wouldn't be busy, boy were we wrong. It took us forever to get to top and once there couldn't walk around outside due to the crowd. From what we did see, it was an incredible view of the city. Highly recommended, not on Christmas day.

New York, New York. Probably the greatest skyline of them all. The Empire State Building is such a work of art. At night it really shows you another beauty with the lights. Wow. No place like New York.
WOWWWWW. The Manhattan skyline is gorgeous especially at night. I couldn't get enough pictures! Absolutely stunning. Breathtaking!

One of the world's most iconic views!. No visit to NYC is really complete until you see that Manhattan Skyline!It's instantly recognisable and iconic!OK, you'll have seen it in countless movies, but believe me the real thing tops them all!Whether it's in daylight, but especially at night when the city's lit up like a fairy wonderland, it makes you tingle inside.We never tire of seeing it - it's an absolute must!
Nothing like it!. It's really amazing to see! It's so big and hard to imagine people actually built all that! Something everyone should see!
Gorgeous!!!!. What a gorgeous view!!!!!!! We got to see it numerous times while going to and from the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island!!

You will never tire of it. I am not a city person and yet this skyline made me fall in love with buildings and their tops vying with each other to stand out. Best view from the Bloomberg building on 59 and Lex. When you are driving into Manhattan from Queens, this view literally takes your breath away. It's gorgeous.
Great for couples and friends. Beautiful view, free fun. Always the first place I go when someone visits from out of town. Unique makeover from local artists.

The Manhattan Skyline is New York. To me, the New York Skyline is iconic and something appreciated both as an "event showing" from the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock -- but, more simply by viewing it and relishing it slowly from ground level by strolling along the edge of Central Park during the sunset and at night.

Breathtaking experience. The view of Manhattan is absolutely flawless. From flying over it, driving through it, seeing it from the Empire State, Rockefella or Brooklyn Bridge, it really is a beautiful sight. Just like the movies!
Top of the Rock. I MUST see at NIGHT...MUCH easier lines and nighttime lights/views were INCREDIBLE. Daytime waits are too long.

Museum of buildings. The entire Manhattan is like a museum of buildings. They look stunning to look close-up walking among them. Some of nicer places to see them in a distance are: from the Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn bridge, and Brooklyn Bridge Park. Many people take photographs, but I saw no painter painting them for some reason.

Gorgeous!. This city’s lights and skyline are fantastic! One evening we actually took a ferry across to Hoboken and the view was stunning! There are some lovely bars here and it was great to see the view from afar. Would really recommend doing this as you cannot see the view in this way from the city itself!

And it's free. A little like going to see the Eiffel Tower in Paris again and again form different perspectives. At least in our case it never failed to satisfy us. Our favourite places to look were from Manhattan Bridge to the south, also Brooklyn Bridge, and Staten Island ferry. All free. Also driving in or out from George Washington Bridge.

Gorgeous from every angle!. Once you look you can't stop looking. Nothing compares to the skyline day or night. Breathtaking! Our entire drive in from the airport I kept taking pictures. And the new ONE WORLD TRADE Center stands twice as high as the buildings around it, it has transformed the skyline into a new yet majestic view. I love NY!!!!

Stunning skyline. The free Staten Island ferry is definitely one of the best activities in NYC and you should do it to see the Manhattan skyline at its best. Brilliant views of the Statue of Liberty and if you get a good day (and I'm sure even if you don't) there's a stunning view of the Manhattan skyline, as well as a wide view from New Jersey over to Brooklyn. A trip over the Brooklyn Bridge to the park at the base of the bridge will also give you good views.
Stunning entry into new york. Loved all of New York, the trips, the visit to the empire state building, the hop on hop ff buses".............
Amazing view. Amazing view of the city. It is a lovely skyline and so architecturally diverse. Great to photograph.

Fantastic !. You can get a great view from the Staten island ferry. You can take a nice panaromic picture of the NYC skyline next to the Brooklyn skyline. While on the ferr, the view is extra nice because the water is in surrounding the island. Definitely recommend taking a look at this mighty impressive skyline!!

Breathtaking views . We stayed in Brooklyn so we saw the views in various ways across the bridges. Also we got a great view from Liberty island and the statue itself. The view was free. Just stand back and take the view in.
Stunning skyline. Stunning skyline at night from river Hudson party boat... I imagine top of the rock at night would be great too

Sight to see. The skyline is truly memorable and uplifting. Who could imagine buildings could be built and maintained so closely together! The architecture of some of the older buildings and some of the newest buildings is fantastic. There seems to be a time when they were just 'so-so', but they are getting back to making differences to be seen from near and far. Beautiful.

Must see WTC plaza at night. The Museum wasn't open when we were there, but it was late and night and the plaza was mostly deserted. Standing next to the huge square inverted fountains and hearing the roar of the falling water is a powerful sensory experience.
Amazing. A view that is hard to beat! With new buildings appearing on a yearly basis the view is ever changing and still spectacular.

Just like the movies. Doesn't matter where you go, the sky line of Manhattan is amazing. From the Staten Island ferry, the top of the Empire State Building, or just walking around looking up. Take a stroll around Central Park to feel part of the city. An amazing place to be!
night Lights. Empire State for great night views. Buy the express pass. Wait time was greater than 3 hours. As we had pass we bypassed all lines and were in and out in an hour.

Great views from brooklyn. I don't really understand most of the people reviewing this attraction, it seems like they mostly miss the point.Manhattan is supposed to be a city that is incredibly varies when you are inside, but beautiful when looking in. If you want to see the skyline, go to brooklyn, or do the Staten Island ferry for free. If you are in manhattan, you probably aren't going to see the city as a whole. If you are paying somebody to see the skyline, you are doing it wrong.
quite a sight.. The bridge is huge, and the architecture is quite amazing. The best view is from on a boat in my opinion.

Roosevelt Island Cable Car. Base at 2nd & 60th, go across to Roosevelt Island an hour before dusk. Walk south, past the dilapidated Smallpox Hospital, through the Four Freedoms Park, to the southern tip of the island. Relish. Savour. Enjoy. Walk back to the Cable Car station: catch the (free) bus that takes you around the island.Climb on the cable car at dusk. Endeavour to be 'at the front'. Watch sunset to your south. The lights of Manhattan. The beauty and 'pull' of NYC.Magic!
Empire State Building. Wife endured long lines but got great photos of NYC just as the lights came on...I went around the corner to Foleys Irish Pub.
Magnificent. Manhattan skyline has to be one of the best skylines in the word. We viewed it from the top of the rock at Rockerfeller Center and would reccomend it

What? You're reviewing the Manhattan Skyline?. No buddy, I don't think you get it. Manhattan (or West Brooklyn as it's known locally) reviews you: you don't get to review it. All you can do is view, not review.
WOW factor. You could not help but be blown away by such an impressive view. Everywhere you look the city is alive.

Ride the ferry. Riding a ferry boat from New Jersey was a highlight of the trip. Warning: as soon as the last passenger's foot leaves the dock and steps aboard, the captain accelerates at an incredible speed tossing everyone back- hold on! New Yorkers do everything in a huge hurry and aren't afraid to yell, "run!" at us slower moving Southerners
Only one view. The view is unmistakable around the world. Whether atop Empire. State or the top of the Rock or maybe from the free Statten Island ferry check it out!

Iconic Manhattan. Iconic !! Suggest you take the Subway to Brooklyn. Get off at Jay Street, take a left out of the Subway Station and walk to Brooklyn Bridge -- Then walk the bridge to Manhattan. Don't forget your camera. Perfect views of Manhattan all the way with the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island and also to the right hand side of the bridge which also offers great views of a different New York skyline. Also, you could take the free Statten Island ferry with great views on the return journey.

beautiful at Christmas. Some of the large buildings decorate for Christmas. The Empire State building has red and green lights on the top floors. It makes the top of the building look as though it is a huge decorated present. The view of NY city from Weehawken or Hoboken is incredible.

Simply stunning. There are so many places in Manhattan were you are able to view this incredible skyline. However my family and l decided to take the free Staten Island Ferry from Manhattan. The views from the Ferry were breathtaking! It is definitely something everyone should experience! The "concrete jungle" was mind blowing. It is definitely well worth it!
Wow wow. Best way to see this is from air of water or of course from top of the rocks or Empire State Building. The vast scale of nyc stretches out and the hues and colours are never the same twice!
not as expected. simulator ride with movie was not in sync with audio , not worth the $42 charge , used my new york pass which was great
pretty. Stunning with lights when it's almost dark... makes for perfect photos. Feels great to recognize some of the skyscrapers...

Stunning. New York's Manhattan skyline is something to behold. Know the history of several of the landmark buildings will make it all the more the more interesting. There are several great vantage points but I personally recommend the view from Roosevelt Island- stunning.

Stunning!. The best skyline view I have ever seen, left me speechless for hours! We went to the top of the Rockefeller Building and spent about 4 hours looking over Manhattan,we were lucky to have an amazing weather and even more amazing sunset. We stood quietly just watching and absorbing the warmth of the sunset,stunning,welcoming,gorgeous..There were a lot of other visitors,mostly very quiet,appreciating the views..Central Park looked great from above and The Empire state building lit up slowly when the sun was going down..very very beautiful feeling watching all the skyscrapers lights slowly switching on..
Classic View. A classic view, NYCs mind blowing size and lined with enormous sky scrappers monsters. The skyline is beautiful at night with dazzling lights.
Breathtaking!. Absolutely stunning. You just cannot go to New York without admiring the Manhattan skyline. It is amazing!

Nothing Close Like it!. I Consider my Self "Well Traveled" have Been To Every State including Alaska ( on a Cruise) and Hawaii, ( Maui On Our 30th Anniversary) And I Must Say The NYC skyline is the most impressive that I have ever Seen, Always "breath taking". Been To NYC Hundreds of Times and We Are always In "Awe", if it's Summer or Winter the Landscape Is Always Special! The Empire State Building is my Favorite, Can't Get Enough of It, but The Chrysler Building always has Been Very Special Also, No Matter where u Are in Manhattan u will Be Amazed, I know, I've Lived here in The Area my Whole Life, the Skyline is like Nothing you ever Seen In This Country. Take Lots Of Pictures. It truly is Beautiful.

Simply amazing!. Definitely go on a boat tour of the harbour to get a feel of the size of the city. Well worth the kodak moments. The city lights up at night and a treat to sail under all the famous bridges.

Nothing Else Like It. The Manhattan Skyline can be viewed from several places in the vicinity of NYC and New Jersey, and no matter where you stop for a few minutes, the view is incredible, especially at night. You can of course gain a great view from the Statue of Liberty, but there are lookout points along the waterways in NY and NJ. Of course, a river cruise or chopper ride, as mentioned here in other reviews, will give you first-hand viewing, but just driving down the Palisades Interstate from the north offers a great view just before crossing the bridge into the city.No matter where you are in the vicinity of NYC, plan to stop a few minutes and appreciate the view of the Manhattan Skyline, particularly at night. You won't regret it.
Cant Get Enough. as a NYer i have seen the skyline thousands of times, but still enjoy it, there is a reason why people come from all over the world to see it

So mayy ways to see it. 1) by ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island, 2) by Staten Island Ferry, 3) boat cruises along the Hudson. Just make sure it's a good day, otherwise you won't see anything!!!

The Great Big View, however you look. We've just had the great fun and privilege to see Manhattan at dawn as we sailed up past the Statue of Liberty on Queen Mary 2 and then moved into a rental penthouse apartment with a south facing roof terrace on the Upper West Side, looking back down the island towards the great landmark viewAs good as it gets!Always such a magical experience to see those outlines but never before as good as it has been on this visit to NYC!
Good part of the Statue of Liberty cruise. It is a good thing to appreciate while you're going to the Statue. If you take the cruise to the Statue, spare some minutes to relax and enjoy the view.

but you cant see it!!!. you get an excellent view from New Jersey. But if you are going to New York and are expecting to see the skyline you will be disappointed - you're in the middle of it! I would suggest a boat cruise of chopper ride if that's what you want.
One of the best views in the world. New York Skyline is iconic! You can see it from various places. We saw it from the Statue of Liberty and from New Jersey.

OK the children liked it. This was ok and was part of our pass so worth a try. I probably wouldn't bother lining up to do it on its own. The other good tip is if you do do it you skip the line to go to the top of the building

Ever changing but always excitng. No matter the location from which a person views the skyline, this view of the most vibrant city in the world is awe inspiring. New buildings are sometimes derided by the architecture critics but somehow manage to find their place within a few years.

Beautiful at Night. We stayed in a hotel right across the water and had the opportunity to take lots of lovely pictures of the skyline. We really enjoyed it from the top deck of the NY Waterway ferry! It was beautiful in the morning, when it was overcast, sunny and when all the lights were on at night. Some of the pictures look like they were PhotoShopp'd - they were that good!
Iconic. The view from the Staten Island ferry, included in OnBoard New York Tours, was amazing, especially the new One World Trade Center.

Decent place to stay in New York. Liked: near subwayDisliked: printer did not work, elevator did not work . They did not advise us in advance that the elevator was not working. At checkin they brought our luggage at check out we had to bring our luggage down eight flights of stairs.
Enjoyed from Statue of Liberty!. Grandkids enjoyed seeing skyline viewing from the Statue of Liberty! Couldn't believe all the tall building! Always looked for Empire State Building!

Beautiful!. This beautiful skyline is one of the things that makes New york so unique. It never gets old, and I really enjoy watching the skyline, and seeing some of the new buildings that have emerged over the years.
Arguably the best skyline in the world. Fantastic views from various locations around New York. It is one of the best skylines, more so at night.
nice. take the ferry for free to Staten island,or view from Jersea city.the view is not forgettable.Can view also from empire state building

Lots to see!. We spent four days walking and busing Manhattan, and saw the skyline from the ground as well as from specific tour locations. Big buildings seem even bigger when you stand on the sidewalk next to them and look up, and there are a LOT of big buildings in NYC! We saw the skyline from the top of the Empire State Building, and from the pedestal at the Statue of Liberty. We saw it from our 4th floor hotel room and from several different tour buses and boats. All I can say is the view is spectacular, and no specific sightline is any more or less breathtaking than any other. The 911 Memorial will leave you in tears, the Statue of Liberty will make you swell with pride, and even Wall Street will make you appreciate how busy - and old - this city is.If you go to Manhattan to see the sights, pray for sunny warm days and slight breezes. It gets cold and windy on the sidewalks of New York in the winter months! We'll go back in the autumn or spring. See you there!

Tour on Skyline Bus - Orange. Our tour around the beautiful city Manhattan was a success. The driver for our tour bus Rishi Dowlatram did an excellent job in describing the sites. Also, we had a wonderful experience.It was the best trip ever.

It's glories are well known.. The Manhattan skyline really doesn't need a review, it is a global ideal. Be sure to see it from the Staten Island Ferry, the Empire State Building, and especially to see the new World Trade Center from near and far.

Unforgettable. Driving to Manhattan from JFK, the iconic skyline is immediately recognizable in the distance. Love the mix of older buildings (Chrysler, Empire State), and new (Bank of America Tower, Freedom Tower). My suggestion to get a great view of the buildings: don't stand directly under the buildings, but stand a few blocks a way so you can get a picture of you and the whole building.
From the Limo. Didn't like the business of NY but got used to it & was fabulous, so many popular sights & looking at Manhattan from the statue of liberty is outstanding.
Well known view. Take the ferry to Liberty island to see the statue of Liberty and you will get great views Manhattan. You can also take the Staten Island ferry.

Breathtaking. It seems pretty obvious that the Manhattan skyline is iconic, incredible, and breathtaking I've seen it on numerous trips to New York but there is something so magical about seeing it at Christmas time. Going up on the Empire State Building is fantastic because you're so high up but on Top of the Rock you have an incredible view and you have great shots of the Empire State Building.
incredible skyline. Take a boat tour or ferry to see the new York skyline. It is one of the must see attraction in nyc. It is beautiful in the night with the lights on
See from 30 Rock and Not Empire. Got a great and not so crowded view of Manhattan from 30 rock. Buy the City Pass and go to the museums.
A must do!. A some point, you have to get in a boat and see the skyline. It is spectactuclar. We did it duting the day and at night and night was simply breathtaking!

In The Heart Of It All. Staying in a hotel just off Herald Square, right around the corner from the Empire State Bldg, I was able to fully appreciate the city's classic skyline close up. A few blocks north was Rockefeller, a few blocks south was the famous Flatiron District. Treat yourself to a trip to the top of the ESB or the Rainbow Room at Rock Center to your fill of it all. Beautiful at any time, day or night.
Winter Wonderland. The skyline is impressive on its own, however, there is something special about the NYC skyline in December.

What a Skyline!. The Manhattan skyline must be one the best in the world, if not the best. I saw it from the bus coming from Jersey City through the Lincoln Tunnel. A fantastic view to take your breath away! Starting from the Freedom Tower on the right, the up towards the left--Empire State Building, Chrysler, the UN and so many other buildings tall and not so tall. All these makes up the Manhattan skyline to admire and behold.
First time. Great sights. Very cold or rain use jump on jump off bus. Lots to see - bus guide did a good job telling what we were looking at, history and what pats cost.

The Evolving Skyline of NY. A mixture of old and new, the NY City skyline changed with the completion of the new World Trade Center Building and will again with the midtown completion of the world's tallest residential tower. A wonder of wonders and always worth a pause to look up or to travel up to a tall building and look out. Whether one appreciates so much of the variety of architecture or not, the world financial capital lives on.

Awesome and it's iconic. Have seen this in lots of movies and really wished to see it when I visited NY. Finally this was the first place I visited. Certainly the place to visit at NY and enjoy the excitement.
Beautiful.... I love skylines and the NY skyline is one like no other. its amazing. you just have to make sure that your up as high as you can be on the top floor in a building.

Really? There's a review for this?!? PFFFT. I cannot believe there's an opportunity to review this skyline. I mean, don't get me wrong -- the NYC skyline is among the best in the world -- but everyone knows that. It's like reviewing the moon. "Great moon, love it when it's waning, looks great when full, like it when it rises, love it when it sets. Harvest moons rock!!" COME ON TRIPADVISOR, DON'T MESS WITH US LIKE THIS! Heh. Now that I've written this review, I must admit I enjoyed writing this review as much as any other review I've ever written. Heck, from now on,I I should just review large obvious things that everyone already knows about, like mountain ranges and oceans. I'M THE MOST TALENTED REVIEWER ON THE PLANET!! Not.

It looks much better now. The skyline is breathtaking especially now since the new Freedom Tower is finished. There was a huge sad and tragic empty spot for many years thanks to the horrific acts of 9/11. The memorial is beautiful as well.I have not been to all of the big cities of the world but have been to many of them, and there is no better view than NYC at night from out on the water especially. And to top it all of is the beautiful Statue of Liberty at night also. We are a blessed nation!!
Nice experience wit 3 years old child. Nice interaktive experience and nice wiew. Possible with 3 years old baby. We recomend visit Empire state bulding at night.
breathtaking. Best view of this is from Sinatra boulevard in New Jersey. Travelled out to Hoboken from Manhattan on the PATH train for $5 return. Well worth it.

Beautiful at sunset via walk over Brooklyn Bridge. One of our goals was to capture the beauty of the skyline on our camera. We took the Staten Island ferry, but all seats were inside the boat. I got some decent pictures along with the dirt on the windows of the ferry. We took the East River Ferry from Pier11/Wall Street to DUMBO and got some great pictures from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. Our intentions were to walk back to Manhattan via the Brooklyn Bridge much earlier, but everything fell into place perfectly, as we crossed it at sunset. The pictures turned out spectacular! It was the highlight of our trip.
Wonderful. Had drinks at the lounge at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel at Columbus Circle. All glass overlooking Manhattan, absolutely beautiful.
Beautiful. One of the most beautiful cities in the world at night. A must see from the Brooklyn foreshore. Take a night tour by bus or Uber your way to Brooklyn across the Brooklyn Bridge.

Unbelievably beautiful!. We rented a private local tour guide who knows history. He took us to the New Jersey shoreline-directly across the Manhattanskyline. I've never seen such a view. This was a three- hour tour, and we saw a lot. We loved it.

inspiring. If you take one of the ferries from NYC to NJ yuu get a wonderful view of the city in the evening. The Staton Island Ferry is great any time but I find it amazing with the new buildings in lower Manhattan.

Iconic. Manhattan's skyline is probably one of the most famous ones in the world, but it's so fantastic to see it in real life for yourself. The best views are from the water (NY Water Taxi for example) but also from Ellis Island or Liberty Island or Brookly. It looks completely different in daylight, dusk and night and you cannot take enough pictues of it.

Certainly gives an idea of the size, the grandeur and importance of NYC. It was very good, and some of the best views were from the River tour on a beautiful day. There was little about the skyline that was new in the sense that it was a conglomeration of buildings but it was, as I have said, a reflection of the size and grandeur of NYS.
Beautiful especially during Christmas. The skyline is so beautiful and colorful during Christmas. We enjoyed visiting Manhattan and loved the view of the skyline.
Higher floors are better. We were on the 6th Fl. so didn't see much of the Skyline, but the higher floors and rooftop bar I hear offer spectacular views.
Wonderful!. Fantastic nothing like it! Great fun trying to pick out the buildings a good guide book helps. Amazing sight like all the photos but better in real life!

just like the pictures and the TV.... an iconic vie across to the Manhattan skyline in clear weather is hard to beat ... you can pick out all the landmarks and then visit them on your return,everybody was sharing experiences and saying where to go and what to do ....nice to find dialogue again rather than texts and ipads galore ... happy memories to share with visitors of all nationalities .

Beautiful at any time of year. Still strange without the TT's. Great to view it from Statue of Liberty Island or some parts of it from Brooklyn bridge. Wonderful with the sun setting and the light reflecting off some of the buildings. Wonderful with the sun coming up. Her name was New York, New York.
THE iconic view of New York City. There are many vantage points to get this iconic view of the Manhattan skyline but we would recommend the trip to Ellis Island as the best.

A Summer Evening, A Glass Of Wine, A Cigar and the Skyline. Up on the roof with a great cigar and glass of Port, I could sit forever and gaze at the Manhattan Skyline. The longer you sit and look, the more you are drawn into the depth and complexity of the city. It is a visual symbol of the tenacity and ingenuity of a great people. I can't get enough of it.
Great Views. Had a fabulous time admiring the views over Manhatten Despite it being a cold day it did not deter or distract the amazing views friendly visitors all chatting and mixing happily

There is NOTHING Like NYC. What a beautiful place. No matter what time of year you visit, the City is a welcoming beacon when you drive into the City. While it is "different" since the loss of the World Trade Centers, you still can see nothing like this in the world. I love this City. And if you visit, it loves you back. Enjoy!
Amazing skyline. The best view I had was from the boat to Liberty/Ellis Island. I got the whole skyline in the photo from here.

They just can't ruin it. This is one of the world's must sees.Ever changing and much photographed (I took loads again). The new Freedom Tower, part of the World Trade Center (sic) site is iconic like its predecessors, and a constant reminder of the tragedy that led to its construction. If I had any criticisms it would be the amount of power being used to keep so many unoccupied buildings lit up at night, and that now, from so many angles, the clean lines of the Empire State have been ruined by a skinny nondescript residential tower. What were the planning authorities thinking!?

Amazing. Coming in from Jersey, the view of the NYC skyline is truly incredible. All the massive sky scrapers and the sheer size of the city is pretty impressive. Quite impressive, pictures just don't do it justice.
Dumbo place. Dumbo is the best for the skyline view at night as well as during the daytime. You will find yourself between two bridges (manhattan and Brooklyn bridges) which adds to the scenery
Amazing. Find some place to enjoy how amazing it is. I suggest walking across Brooklyn Bridge walk. Amazing views

Awe Inspiring. From the time I was a child living in Jersey City, I would look at the changing New York City Skyline as a magical island. While I have grown up and now drive into New York City every day in route to work, it remains as breathtaking as ever. I know there are many tourists who come to New York City just to say they have "seen" the skyline but for people who live and work in the New York City metropolitan area, just being able to look at the skyline while sitting in traffic, waiting to enter the Lincoln or Holland Tunnels, or as they drive over the George Washington Bridge, the views remain breathtaking.

What its all about!. The best way to see the skyline is from a boat.The trip out to the Statue of liberty is where we viewed it from. Now that One World Trade Center is complete the sky line looks whole again.Just be sure to go on a clear day or the sky scrapers will be in the clouds!
A Magical Moment. If you are first time in NY! Im telling you, manhattan Skyline is an imagine that you will never forget!

Beautiful Day & Night. The skyline is beautiful, whether it's day or night. Night time is lovely when it's all lit up, daytime you can point out the buildings. You can see the skyline from many points in New York, I preferred the cruise around Brooklyn bridge and Staten island. Only wished I had saw this when the WTC were there too. Lovely to see the Freedom tower though.
Stunning. Manhatten skyline is stunning high rise building are just an amazing sight it def is a concrete jungle,
View from the Hotel. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the things New York is famed for and to me it was everything I expected
Iconic View!. The best view is on a clear night. Our bus driver stopped so we could get a good shot! The best views of Manhattan are from the Rock!

Memorable. I still remember the first time I saw the New York City skyline, even though it was almost fifty years ago! Was en route to Europe by boat (!) and as we pulled away from the pier I chanced to look back and OMG!

Iconic. There are various locations you can see the most iconic skyline in the world from. Top of the empire state building, both day and night, top of the rock, liberty island, boat cruise, but from where ever you see it from, it is breathtaking.

Breathtaking. It really is spectacular, we walked over Brooklyn bridge a couple ov times. Once was sunny once was snowy and both views were great also we did a cruise at night when it was cold and crisp and the skyline view really were amazing

Such a difference with the Freedom tower. I photographed the skyline from Liberty Island. It's still iconic and fantastic and the freedom tower now stands high in all it's glory. I'll never tire of the view
Stunning..... Just as you imagine it to be, beautiful during the day and stunning at night, you need to experience both as so different

Awesome in the evening. It is a great view from the Staten Island Ferry during the day but seeing it in the evening is amazing. The sun reflecting off the buildings, the sky is orange, the view is simply post card perfect.

Sublime, iconoclastic, awe-inducing. After having roved around the Manhattan streets whilst warily and somewhat gingerly gazing up to the stupefying Manhattan skyline, I was enchanted, enthralled and captivated by the riveting force and delightful panache of the city's impressive architecture. A must- visit for any tourist.

Fantastic. For downtown views take the Staten Island Ferry (it is free) or head over to Brooklyn Bridge Park to see stunning views of lower Manhattan. If you visit the statue of liberty/ellis Island be prepared for fantastic views on the boat journey. For midtown views of the Empire State and Chrysler Building head to either Hoboken (via the Path) NJ or Long Island City Queens, which can be reached by taking the subway. Alternatively take a circle line cruise around the Island. It is a beautiful city from all sides round.

What a view!. I was with a tour group and we had a local guide called Geoff who was amazing showing us the sights of New York on a 2 hour tour! The best view of the city(in my opinion) is from the top of The Rock, better probably than from the Empire State Building as when you are at the top of that you can't actually see it! Not an enormous queue either. Visited the landing stage where the immigrants landed from the ships in the early 1900's,very poignant for me to see where my Grandfather would have first stepped on American soil after running away from his wife and two children. We learnt such a lot on the trip but can't tell you what company the guide Geoff was from just that he was amazing!Was surprised to see how small the Statue of Liberty is but perhaps it is bigger when you approach by ship. Great to actually see Central Park from up there, quite amazing! The iconic postcard with men (in caps) sitting eating their lunch on a scaffold was actually taken when the Rock was being built, I did not realise that until I read it on the back of the postcard. I was thrilled to think I had been in that iconic place. Prepare to spend 2/3 hours up there just taking it all in. Amazing! Oh yes, the lift!!!! Breathtaking, watch the floor numbers change it is mind boggling!

lights at night. WE did the bus tour at night ,,I can highly recommend this ,the tour guide was great ,he knew exactly when you should get your camera out to start snapping . The lights of Manhattan at night really are something else ,it was beautiful.
So iconic. If you can see the skyline from across the river or from the deck of a boat do it. We all know it from movies and television but seeing it live is special.

World renowned.. The rightly famous skyline of Manhattan is amazing from many places and angles. Among my favorites are the promenade in Brooklyn Heights, the Jersey City shoreline at sunset, aboard the Staten Island ferry as it approaches the city, and from any sea-going vessel at night. Dinner cruise anyone? I also highly recommend the Circle Line for multiple views and to help you get oriented, even for New Yorkers who've never done it! Also, if you can afford it, there's nothing quite like the views from a helicopter!
Fantastic views. Great place to visit without fail if you need to capture the real picturesque view of NY and its landscapes

Great photos from the Liberty/Ellis Islands. Enjoyed views of the southern Manhattan Skyline from Liberty Island and the ferries that service Liberty and Ellis islands. We took the Statue Cruise ferries that depart from Battery Park and shuttle to Liberty Island, Ellis Island, and back to Battery Park. Round-trip ticket is $18.00 for adults and $9.00 for kids 4-12. Young children under 4 years sale for free.
nice city newyork.. Dream of city. nice city newyork......... its real city of theme.....all culture and beauty there......of course artificial but love to llke..........busy and fashion life.
amazing. we saw Manhattan skyline from brooklyn promenade, next to brooklyn bridge and it was amazing! also we saw that from the ferry to the Liberty Island.
View from the Statue of Liberty. On the boat trip to the Statue of Liberty. The view of the Manhattan skyline is breathtaking. This will be one of the pictures that will forever stick in my mind.
Top of the Rock. Breathtaking view of the Manhattan skyline, the rivers, the horizon, from Top of the Rock at sunset time.
Great Skyline!. New York City has one of the best skylines in the whole country. Not much can compare to Chicago's skyline but NY is a distant second
Awesome view. Saw the skyline in day as well in night. Will prefer day visit for photo's but if you want to get amaze try night view.
Great Views. We got fabulous pictures from the Staten Island Ferry. The Manhattan Skyline is so pretty. Would have loved to have seen it at night. Maybe next time.

Undeniable the ultimate in global skylines - Manhattan. Coming to NYC and not taking sights of Manhattan Skyline is like a mortal sin. Try these: when arriving from airports go via RFK bridge and indulge in the first peak of the skyline, that will wet your interest to see more. Next consider climbing on top of Rockefeller Center or Empire State building and look east, west, north and south. And when at Statute of Liberty look up from south. Try Brooklyn side as well especially opposite the three Manhattan Brooklyn bridges. Lastly hire a cab and ask to be driven over the George Washington Bridge to New Jersey Edgewater and enjoy views from NJ side. Drive along Hudson river to Weehawken, stop, stroll on Weehawken high rocks, sit on a bench and enjoy the most famous skyline that fills your entire view.
Beautiful!. The architecture is so diverse and beautiful and the view from the Brooklyn Bridge is outstanding! Don't miss this area!

wow line. The view from ellis island on a clear day was just fantastic, a must do. But be warned buy your tickets from the battery park kiosk and not the offical looking con men who ask you for your reservations when entering battery park , who then try and sell you a boat ride around all the islands for 57$.Offical tour costs 18$.Enjoy.
Beutiful place to go. This place used to be a abandoned rail road, but it's changed to a urban park with lots of benches to sit, sun decks and very pretty landscapes.

What a View from the 42nd Floor!. I was in NYC for the first time recently on a business trip. I work for a large financial company that is located in Long Island City just across the river. While working late on the 42nd floor, I was able to capture some great night shots of the Manhattan skyline.

Iconic!. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the most recognisable vistas of any city on Earth. Impressive, beautiful and inspiring. From any angle, viewing the Manhattan Skyline is an awesome sight. Lovely. Seen at night, it is simply fantastic. Recommended!
Great views & awesome idea. Fantastic was to see the city and you could get off anywhere you wished! Got off near the meatpackers district and shopped till I dropped. Loved every moment
The star of the city. The Manhattan skyline is what sets NYC apart from every other city. The skyline can be enjoyed by by boat, helicopter, from Top of Rock, or from the Brooklyn Promenade.
Fantastic. Fantastic! Amazing! The view is terrific and you can enjoy the green inside of NY city. Try to walk there.
Amazing. The manhattan skyline is best seen from a boat on the Hudson River. It is truly breath taking and makes some excellent opportunities for amazing photographs.

Iconic. from any vantage point the skyline is the Star of NYC! Even in mid rise buildings the view is always interesting. At night it's simply awesome. We recommend getting a roof top view such as Empire State Building or our favorite Top of the Rock.
Fabulous. Excelent experience. Well worth doing, especially if you are unable to do the helicopter ride. It enhances the whole Empire State experience.

Manhattan Skyline from the New Jersey Side of the Hudson. There is absolutely nothing like it on this Earth...the view of Manhattan on a clear night, as seen from the New Jersey side of the Hudson. The juxtaposition of nature's beauty and man's inspiring architectural creations makes for great photography. Get in the car and drive through Edgewater along the Hudson River, down past Palisades Hospital, down to Weehawken's Chart House. Everywhere the view takes your breath away. Just pull in a parking lot, and enjoy the majesty. George Washington Bridge up north, West Side Highway, Grant's Tomb, Riverside Church, midtown skyscrapers and the WTC downtown take on a special look in the clear night sky.

Iconic. Shared by millions, both locals, far-flung Americans, and tourists from the world over. there are very few skylines that rival the history, architecture, and diversity of the Manhattan skyline. I take pictures and drink it in every opportunity that I get.

Gotta be done!. Super skyline at night time...see who can make out the most landmarks!Remember to wrap up warm at this time of the year as it can get a bit chilly ... hey thats part of the fun!Must do really...be thankful the electricity bill for all those lights doesnt land on your doormat :-)happy Christmas everyone...x

a breathtaking view from the top. Viewing the Manhattan skyline is indeed very breathtaking and you can see so much in NYC and New Jersey. The bridges are breathtaking and the tall buildings are most impressive

gorgeous. Most amazing thing I have ever seen, I wanted to look at it for ever. Little tip; get fantastic views without the crowds from across the water in Hoboken, New Jersey. There's a small park next to a pier and the views are just lovely.
One of the World's wonder. No matter the weather, sunny or cloudy and even rainy or snowy MYN skyline is wonderful. Both from water (free Staten Island ferry) and from Central park.
Iconic. The view from the Staten Island Ferry is just that: iconic! It really ought to be on everyone's "to do" list

New and Old. wonderful skyline of both old and new buildings. took a boat around NY and observed some wonderful structures. very tall buildings which can be see from a long ways. great for photo ops. I think best seen from a tout boat. Simply a marvel to view.

Lights... Lights..... Lights, Everywhere. In the middle of Times Square, the new LED signage is everywhere. Gone are the neon's of the 70's. One board was lit and ran the whole length of one building for one block right across the street from Good Morning America. Ever changing signs are unbelievable for Time Square. The pulse never stops.
BUS TOUR. not what I booked with the Loop Bus company book Christmas lights tour on a bus with no communications or guide would not recommend this to anyone

Always Beautiful. The Manhattan skyline is always beautiful even in the rain and fog. Any boat rides you take or crossing any of the local bridges afford you the opportunity to see this magnificent view~~day or night!

Empire State viewing floor. Well worth the wait to take in fine view towards downtown Manhattan skyscrapers , Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty in the distance. If one finds it too cold out on viewing gallery one can always retreat into the warmth of the glass covered interior area.

Tis a site to see...especially at night from Brooklyn!. We were attending an event in Brooklyn at night and were able to go outside on a patio way above street level and look across the East River at the Manhattan Skyline.What a site to see at holiday time with all the lights on the buildings. We could pick out the Empire State Building and the Freedom Tower. There were others but I am not familiar with the names of the buildings.We were in the Green Point area of Brooklyn. If you are staying in the city book an Uber to Brooklyn after dark just to see the site.
great view!. good place to see all manhattan. you can see a lot of NY sightseens and enjoy the scenery. the price is not attractive.

Lived up to expectations. This is it, iconic, striking, awe inspiring.... Everything you'd expect and so much more. From afar, or near best seen from the water or at night shining bright....it's awesome!

skyline is incredible/is this a review for a tour?. I love NYC. I found myself just staring up and down the different avenues and I love it all. I'm sure there are tours and viewing towers etc, but for me, it's all about being at street level and being amazed.
perfect. perfect to see from brooklyn bridge and from the ferry to Staten island. These are both free to do and such a perfect experience. Maybe try one in the day time and one at sunset

Best Skyline Adventure. Simply the best possible way to see the Skyline during both daytime and nighttime is Top of the Rock & Circle line cruises. Both have fantastic views during the day but the views in the evening time are breathtaking. Circle line evening cruise is a Must. Both are outstanding and worth every penny. Dress Warm !!

Go to Top of the Rock!. The view is what you expect it will be: awesome. Haven't been to the Empire State building to compare, but from 30 Rock you can see clearly to the north end of the island, and most of the south end/financial district as well.
Breath taking. A must see. Even if you get the free Staten Island Ferry. You have got to get a boat on the Hudson River to see this day or night.
Love it!. Its NYC you don't have to say much more about that. It is the most beautiful skyline in the world. I took so many pictures, its so famous it was nice to be there in person!
No visit is complete with seeing this incredible cityscape!. My favorite view is from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, a short subway ride away or for real travelers, a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge!

Freedom Tower Helps. I love Manhattan. I love the sights and sounds and flavors of Manhattan. I love looking up into the sky and seeing skyscrapers fill my view. I especially appreciate Freedom Tower. Just go to NYC. YOu will be happy you did.
Night life in New York. It was amazing to see the city come to life at night. My only dislike was the rubbish bags lined up on the side walks.

I dont get it. I dont quite understand what is so special about this. You just walk next to peoples apartments like 3 feet away and there's nothing to see. I would recommend walking down the 5th avenue or by the river instead of skyline.

just wow. its amazing to see this skyline from the far way also at night time.
wonderful creation and its too old but still look new.

Most amazing night view. Any manhattan (late afternoon into night) cruise will give an incredible view of the Manhattan skyline. It's an awesome lightshow, not to mention, beautiful view of Statue of Liberty (well lit)

Amazing View. Afternoon would be the best to see this captivating place, you will be enchanted by NY's Skyline at its best... A wonderful privilege being a New Yorker, time in time again just to see this view and enjoyed also by our visiting friends.

Wow. There is no more exciting skyline that I have ever seen. Manhattan is built on an island so when they ran out of room there was no where to go but UP. Breathtaking - especially from the NJ side. Check out the Chart House.

The best, most impressive skyline in the world. The Manhattan skyline is overwhelming in its size. There are great places to view it, either from the New Jersey side or the Brooklyn/Bronx side. If you're flying into La Guardia take a window seat and you're likely to get a great view. We've often climbed the Empire State Building, which provides a wonderful view from within Manhattan, but there are other skyscrapers that do as well. Coming in any of the major bridges over the East River also affords wonderful views.

View Leaving NYC via Lincoln Tunnel. Just a hint. If you are leaving NYC via the Lincoln Tunnel, anyone on the passenger side of the car will have a perfect view of the skyline in clear weather. In slow traffic, it's a perfect picture. Beautiful during the day, spectacular at night!!!

Fabulous. The skyline should be viewed at night from either the Brooklyn side or the Jersey City side. The buildings glow in a magical sort of way. The skyscraper are majestic and you are in awe when you see them. When you look up and see the buildings in person when in Manhattan, it's unbelievable. I have been to most major cities in the world and New York City beats them all!

Times Square. Lots and lots of different kinds of Shopping, Eating, & Broadway Shows to choose from. You can choose different store to shop from, Restaurant to eat, & even see a different Broadway Show to see every night of your stay.

Glass Towers in the sky. We say Manhattan skyline from many different angles:the Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry, Hunter's Pt/ Gantry Pk( Queens), the tram to and at Roosevelt Is. and the straight-up view at 9'11 memorial. One of main objective for our trip to NYC was to see the skyline and it was impressive. WOW! We have tons of photos of these glass towers reaching the sky. And there is construction everywhere,I gather building more towers. When I got home, I just wondered about all of these towers; I know they look good but are they all necessary? We saw one that was completely empty.

Classic view. We had views from both our hotel and from Top of the Rock, really a nice tourist trap! If you haven't been up to the top, go! Maybe a bit pricy, but we used the MOMA-TOR combo tickets for better value.
Cool walk. Interesting and special atmosphere to walk there. At the end, the Chelsea Market I really enjoyed and recommend too.

See it from Wheehawken. You must go to John F Kennedy blvd, Weehawken NJ to see the Manhattan skyline from NJ. This is the closest you can get to Manhattan skyline. Go there during night time and you will have memorable view.

Hudson River view. There are many views of the Manhattan Skyline, maybe the best is from flying into LaGuardia, JFK or even Newark airport. You can get a closer view from the top of Rockefeller Center or the Empire State Building, but many people probably don't realize you can get an excellent view of the skyline from New Jersey simply by taking one of the dozens of ferries. One of the easiest is from 42nd street near the Circle Line. Just one block down are the ferries that cost only $10 to get to Hoboken in less than 15 minutes. From there you can get a nice view of the city and on a nice day, I would suggest going just before sundown as you will get two different views. You will have the sun shining right on all of the buildings and slowly you get to see the lights come on. A picture with the sun setting and a picture during dusk and later will give you plenty of nice memories. And if you are hungry there are restaurant and coffee shops nearby. The ferries leave quite often and will get you back to the city in no time.

Night Views to die for. The views are to die for, so many people cued for ages but well worth the visit 2 lifts were out of action as there was a private party so they had commissioned the lifts this is on the top of the rock tour.
Nice. We liked very much! Delicious drinks, great service and super cool view! You need at least 1 hour there to see the whole view

It’s beautiful. The views and the whole spread is spectacular and one of a kind and you cannot afford to miss the beauty of the skyline against the Manhattan skyline while in New York. You could catch the view from Rockefeller or empire state building or you could take the ferry ride to meet miss statue of liberty. Either way this is a must do while in New York.

New York Never Sleeps. I enjoyed the Macy's Day Parade, Woodstock, being with my small grandchildren. I also liked seeing Rockefeller Center and the lights of the season. I spent time with my son and his family. New York seems magical during the holiday season.

Beautiful. Me & my wife were on our first to New York and the first view of Manhattan Skyline was mesmerizing. The view during the night when all the lights come on is awesome. It is highly recommended to see it from either Rockefeller or from Empire States building and visit them just before the sunset to see it during the day as well as in the evening. The view is also great from river front at Manhattan, Brooklyn bridge & from river front in New Jersey.Overall, a great experience.
Well worth a visit. Amazing views, wonderful skyline, amazing buildings. Took a taxi along the Hudson River and were able to take some awesome photos
Best skyline in the world! ;). You have to see and to feel it! Take the Staten Island Ferry for free and ride along Miss Liberty towards Manhattan.

Interesting. A worthwhile walk, to peer into little streets and have different perspectives on the city. You can leave the walk at various points and wander through small neighbourhoods, discovering cafés and shops you would not have found on the tourist trail. It can get busy, so just go early or find less busy stretches. The "art" along it is pretty dire...IMO, but you may find it quirky...A good use of the space anyway, and the plants along the way will grow to be refreshing I'm sure.
Sight seeing. Stunning views, busy but lots of space to see from the top of the rock, rocks fella centre just off 5th ave
What a picture. We took photos from top of the Rock and the Staten Island ferry - lovely to see all the buildings - different shapes and heights.

Multiple Vantage Points. We loved seeing the Skyline. We saw it from multiple vantage points; Empire State Building, Jogging along the East River, Brooklyn Bridge, Bayonne Cruise Ship terminal, Driving from Hoboken to the Verrasonoes Bridge and back up to the Bronks. It is one of the most Iconic images in America.
Stunning. Love the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, the mix of old, new and all the different shapes and sizes. Amazing to see lit up at night.

On board the Zepher. Went to Pier 16 and took this cruise. Great part of our trip. All enclosed below with a real nice upper deck. Could take great pics from below and above. The tour guide was wonderful. Well worth the cost.
Rockafellar Centre at sunset. This is a must to see NYC by night. Queues in November were minimal and you can spend as long as you want at the top.
