Manhattan Skyline. Absolutely breath taking. I have never seen anything like it before. A must see if you are visiting New York

Amazing Skyline. The NYC skyline is a great sight whether it be day or night. The variety of tall skyscrapers along with bright lights is a spectacle for all to see.
The skyline is best seen from a river cruise or observation deck.
Memorable and Beautiful. A very special and view bringing back terrific memories. For those from the New York area, beings back lots of smiles.

River cruise. See the skyline by night on the river cruise.... trlly, truly amazing, Even though it was cold and we could have stayed inside the boat i wouldn't have missed seeing that skyline in all its glory.
Amazing. No matter if you come form a big city or you don‘t really like big cities, it is a breathtaking view, especially at night
Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline was Beautiful day & night. It was Serene yet exciting. I wish I could afford to be in NYC longer
Great place to have a view. Spent the day in Brooklyn with my nephew, he ended our full day at the bar at the top of the Wythe Hotel in Brooklyn! Wow, what a view!

Best view is from Gantry Park in LIC!. If you want to catch a perfect view of the Manhattan skyline, take the 7 train, get off Vernon/ Jackson stop (first after Grand Central), and walk to the river. You will be stunned by the skyline views! You may want to come here twice -- at day and at night. It is quite different.

One word: Beautiful. Just cross the Brooklyn bridge around sunset and enjoy the view. It's beautiful. There are a few places where you can see it. On the north side of the Brooklyn bridge to see the bridge as well or just in front of the skyline, on the south part. And don't forget to take the train back over the Manhattan bridge.

We took the historical boatride around Manhattan. The trip encircling Manhattan with a tour guide gave a very interesting perspective on the area. It was a bit cold and windy so I'd do it a bit earlier in the year but well worth it!
Need to see this from the sea. This is one of the most spectacular Skylines in the world and you have to see it from one of the many sea going vessels on offer all over the coast line
Wow!. Just like in the movies. Stunning on a sunny day and at night. Really enjoyed the view. Our bedroom offered us a great view.
night time is the best time. the skyline is something you must see especially at night. the reflection off the water is magnificent
Brooklyn loop. get great pictures of the skyline on this tour with Jose and Miguel who will stop or slow down the bus for you.

Night lights of Manhattan. Leaving New York on the Queen Mary 2 at the beginning of October, we were late departing and had the bonus luck of seeing Manhattan lit up against a clear black sky - pure magic. Photographs didn't come out but what did it matter as the memory will stay with me forever. It was amazing.

Iconic. Never get bored with looking at this amazing skyline. We saw it at dawn from the decks of our cruise ship, then later on from the Hudson River walkway. By night from a rooftop bar and finally as our plane took off from Newark we got a great view from the right hand side of the plane.
Just breathtaking!

Great buildings. I liked all the buildings, especially Empire State and the new World Trade Center. Great views are available from Empire State, see if you can obtain an express pass to save a bit of time.
Unbelievable. Go see it at night from the Empire state Building. You will not see much better skylines anywhere in the world, it took our breath away!

The Best skyline ever. There is no skyline in the world like Manhattan, from the empire state building to the chrysler building to the new built freedom tower. The skyline is majestic by day and eye catching by night. The view from Hobokken across the hudson is enchanting and you can also enjoy it if u ever fly into Laguardia airport
Long View. Good to see at day and night. Saw it from the top of the rock and from the ferry our to Liberty island. Amazing views.

as seen from Brooklyn. We took the subway from Manhattan to the Promenade area south of the Brooklyn Bridge in Brooklyn on an August afternoon. It was a magnificent view, from a wonderful place that was not too crowded. The weather was perfect, with a slight breeze, and we stayed until the sun went down, just sitting, talking, and watching.

Out of this world. One of the most iconic skylines in the USA, perfect photo opportunity
Amazing - out of this world experience
Brilliant
One of the best skylines in the world!. Definitely a sight to behold, one worth taking the time to enjoy from as many vantage points as possible. Heli, Brooklyn, Rockefeller, NJ.

Circle line. a lovely way to know Manhattan skyline::::. The circle line is a boat that takes arround the Manhattan Island, and shows with explanations the places of interest, and you can se NYC skyline in all island

Big City. New york in general is much bigger then you expect! We did a helicopter tour for my fiancee's birthday and I would suggest anybody going to new york for the first time do this as it is the easiest and quickest way to see all of new york.

The best Skyline in America!!!!. The skyline is American, NYC is just point Blake the best picture of the most amazing skyline. The Empire State Building being the most iconic spot to view this amazing show. Sun down is the best!!!

Amaze balls!. No review or photo can give you actual experience of the manhattan skyline. Whether TOTR, ESB or river cruise, the views are just priceless. You wouldn't think a load of skyscrapers and historical buildings squashed together on an island either in the day or at night could create such an experience...but it does....fabulous

Great way to make your way south through the city. A wonderful addition to our NYC trip. Got off at Penn station and is only a short walk to the top end of the Skyline from the train station. We walked the entire thing, and there are lots of places to go off and on if needed. Gardens, seating and artwork is all very interesting. It was not windy and the sun made it nice even though it was below zero and generally windy on the day we went. It would be tough to walk in the rain. Washrooms are tough. We could not find any public ones on the SkyLine but did end up eating something at the Standard hotel/restaurant after and used theirs.
Love. It's awesome. Everything in the city is pure beauty! I will continue to come back multiple times in my life. My son and I truly enjoy coming here every time
empire state in the evening a most. awsome nothing to dislike would imagine if you went to empire state certain times of the year the que to get to the top might be a possible pain for some people.

amazing experience. I just moved into a building in Soho managed by Manhattan Skyline and I couldn't be happier. Upon moving in to my apartment, I noticed a few minor issues (faucet dripping etc.). The super came up right away and fixed the problem-- one of the luxuries of on-site management!I additionally want to praise Chris Kacy- the Manhattan Skyline leasing agent who helped me sign for the apartment. He made the process quick, painless, and enjoyable. He was also a really nice guy! I'd feel fortunate moving into any property managed by MS.

beautiful. visit it from the Brooklyn Bridge at nightor from the Marriott Hotel downtown, they have a skybar, where you can have diner or a drink and have a great view over the whole city, since the restaurant is turning around.
New York 2014. Can't miss the skyline but a visit to Empire State Building is a must the views are amazing look out for some of the roof top bars you can see from there and then go and try them out

OK.... it was just okay.. I certainly wouldn't want to queue to see this attraction again. I was slightly disappointed as didn't quite no what to expect. I would only recommend this if your not planning to visit a high rise building - as the view for yourself if spectacular.

See the skyline from the Rockefella Centre. Fabulous skyline and if you can arrange your tickets to get you started on the journey to the top about an hour before sunset, then you wont be disappointed. Iconic photos - lovely views.

A definite can't miss on a trip to the city!. We took the cruise to the statue. The city skyline is something you don't want to miss no matter how you decide to view it. The last time I saw the skyline the Twin Towers were it in, this time the new Freedom Tower. Each time as equally awesome!
New York City. A"City that never sleeps" says it all. There is so much to see and do,that you need a week to come close to appreciating the dynamic of what the city has to offer.

Something special. walking from the Finance district over the Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn is great but when you reach Brooklyn and having a view to the Manhattan skyline is one of the most impressive views I ever had. Fantastic places for taking photographs. If one has some money left I can recommend a helicopter flight which starts nearby the Finance district and flies over Manhattan. I shot beautiful pictures from Big Apple

Empire State Building. We went to view the Manhattan Skyline on a Wednesday night about 7:30 P.M and the view was awesome and the crowds were light; however the management of the crowd lines were unorganized and a bit chaotic. If this is not part of your tour and you pay the extra to go up I would skip this. Extremely commercial!

Circle Line Night Cruise. Fantastic 2+ hour trip that starts approx 6pm. It heads around the financial district and up to 59st Bridge and then back around for a fantastic view of the Statue of Liberty. Once the boat starts moving, everybody is moving around taking pictures so seats are not important at all. Circle line is worth every penny
Very Accomadating. The staff were very accomadating and efficient. They helped with our suitcases and fixed any issues we had within our room

Better than the movies. Whether looking at the NYC skyline from Battery Park or from Liberty island it is magnificent. The variety of old and new architecture is beautiful to bold, I could spend days just photographing the varying outline of the city. One thing a tour guide told us (that I think adds to the city's skyline) is that the buildings are staggered to let more sunlight into the city. Now isn't that a great idea.
Best view at dusk. Great any time of day, but dusk is special, would be special from a boat trip, and coming towards manhattan over the bridge
Classic view. Great view from a boat on the Hudson river. It is something you should do, mainly in sunny days, it is so emblematic, from there you will have really nice pictures.

Amazing no matter from where you look from. This is what New York was initially known of for us Europeans. High skyscrapers which are impressive from whereever you look from. Have been in NYC many times, but every time I am seeing it from the distance I am still impressed.If you look from Brooklyn the skyline is nice but my personal favorite is a view from a boat on a Hudson river. There are many options to consider, but combining Statue of Liberty visit and taking some time just to enjoy skyline view from the island is most cost effective. If you want to see more, you can still take round trip on the Hudson river.
Manhattan Skyline. Was staying at Sheraton Lincoln Harbor Hotel Weehawken NJ. We stayed up on the 5th floor, and looking out our window and seeing the skyline of Manhattan. OMG!! breathtaking.
Seriously? The Skyline. Well, it is one of the best in the world. Look up, be a tourist! Spectacular views from almost everywhere in the city

Breathtaking. Loved the views from the top of the Empire State Building, absolutely breathtaking. Felt that some of the rest of the attraction was padding that dragged the trip out a bit. Good to have unlimited time at the top of the ESB, it even snowed on us!

For first time visiting and/or traveling back home to NYC, there's no place like: NEW YORK, NEW YORK!. The sight flying over the City is gorgeous! A clear night, gorgeous skyline unveils the sights including the lengthy Verrazano Bridge, the Coney Island beach and Brooklyn waterfront, the distant Liberty Island and Statue of Liberty in the Harbor are visible. The concentration of tall buildings clustered in Lower Manhattan's Financial District is an eclectic mix of new and old historic buildings that is fascinating. The tip of the classic Woolworth building is close to the proud, majestic Freedom Tower or iconic One World Trade Center (WTC), tallest skyscraper in the Western Hemisphere and 4th tallest world-wide. You pass by the recognizable Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges, see the colorful twinkling light program of the Empire State Building at 34th Street and stately United Nations building at the East River's waters edge. There are so many key sights to see. The glowing lights abound. Times Square is illiminated brightlight and further along you may see the Art Deco era spire of the blue hued Chrysler Building next to Grand Central Station. The sloped Citicorp Building can be seen near the Ed Koch Queensboro Bridge at 59th Street, and structures at Columbus Circle across Midtown Manhattan. The skyscrapers are prominent with rich colors of water, greenery blended in the area and surrounding skies. It's a great welcome home sight to see; fantastic sight as well for visitors to explore and enjoy!

Manhattan Skyline--So Many Ways To See It On Every Budget (and from NJ). Everyone knows the Manhattan Skyline but it's still breathtaking to see it in person. How to see it best depends on how much time and money you have to spend.At the high end is a helicopter tour around the city. Naturally these tours are very pricey, but they do offer a vantage point like none other and an incredible experience. Another pricey option: staying at the top of one of the hotels around Central Park and getting a room with a view.The most popular midrange option would be to go to the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center--you'll get a great view also not available from the ground. However, you could also consider a tour on the Hudson or East River (i.e. New York Media Boat or similar), which is obviously much less crowded and personalized, and offer a chance to get out on the water to boot. At the lower end of the range, you can pay $5 for a ticket on the Ikea Ferry that shuttles between Manhattan and Brooklyn. For the price of a train ride you can go over to the Brooklyn waterfront, or also New Jersey. On the Jersey side, you can go to Liberty State Park for fantastic views of the World Trade Center, or just get off at the Exchange Place stop on the Path--the station is on the water and offers clear, close views of the Freedom Tower. Some good views are also available from the Newport path stop. If you have access to a car, you can drive to any number of overlooks--the one of the Palisades Parkway is quite popular, and that road is a pretty drive anyway, especially in autumn. Also, as others have mentioned, the Staten Island Ferry is free.

Iconic. What can you say that hasn't been said before. It looks like a film set, which is what it has been so many times. Incredible and from a European perspective its huge. From a distance the new World Trade Centre dominates, but strangely not so much once in the city itself. We viewed it before dawn arriving on the Queen Mary 2 and it was simply breathtaking.

Totally amazing and a backdrop for so many epic films. So New York so good they named it twice . Take a boat trip and take in the sky line . As far back as the 60s with the man from uncle it's been cool . Add to that the new building and it's just as cool today .

What's not to love?. I grew up visiting NYC and it always took my breath away when I got my first glimpse of the skyline when approaching the city. After living in Australia for the last 27 years I treasure the times I have been able to re-live the experience. Just magnificent.

Favorite place on earth! . The city that never sleeps! What can you do in NYC....ANYTHING & EVERYTHING... Such a great place to visit...we go to NY every year and try to do something new each time. I can't say enough about New York, New York except...it's so great, ya have to say it TWICE!

See it from the Staten island ferry.. The ferry is free both ways and well organised and run. Eithe come straight back or have walk to the right of the Staten terminal on the boardwalk to see the 9/11 memorial and have great views of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan , then catch the next ferry back.
Beautiful!. There is no place on this earth like NYC. The skyline gives the city thst never sleeps a great introduction to New York or a goodbye on the way out!
Best from the Staten Island Ferry. Take the Staten Island Ferry out and then come around to the bow of the boat for the return trip to NYC. Best bargain in NYC and a marvelously romantic event.
Different vistas. Loved all the different buildings and there seemed to be heaps of construction happening all over the city.
Wow. It's just amazing takes ones breath away. So much to take in the lights are fantastic we had cocktails at a bar with incredible views.
disappointed. Streets are dirty and in bad state of repair, very slow to get around, made even worse when raining.

Was I in a movie????. As an Aussie, you see the skyline from afar....
To see it up close and personal is a whole new thing
And when you go home and see it on the TV....WOW I've been there
Nothing like the city that never sleeps...
Amazing. Just amazing. Hudson river view over the city at 5pm was breathtaking, the sun setting no the buildings, just lovely.
Stunning. Probably the most impressive man made sight I have witnessed. Take a boat trip at night to experience the sight for yourself........ remember your camera!

Not to be missed. We took a bus ride out at night and travelled over the Manhattan Bridge and on the way back we were able to take some great photos. Also by visiting The Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island enabled some good shots of Manhattan.

Just like the movies!. This view is spectacular. You can see it from land by the Brooklyn side of New York or by water or even if you fly at night over NYC. It's an amazing view as you can see the tall skyscrapers that stand above the city.

At night, breathtaking!!. Most everyone knows the magnificent Manhattan skyline!! Tip for all, walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and down to the waterfront where the water taxis are!! Boy, you will not be sorry you did. As the sun goes down and the lights come on, you could just sit and watch it endlessly! From here you can get a picture of the Brooklyn Bridge and the skyline and if you walk down the walkway, you may be able to get a pic of the statue of liberty herself. We had walked all day so I didn't make it that far. Another great view is when you are going to NJ through the Lincoln Tunnel. As you come out and up look to your right and get ready to snap some good pics! Beautiful!
Exotic skyline at night.. Manhattan skyline is spectacular particularly at night time.Well worth a view from the Top of the Rock

Nothing like it. So many ways to see it from water, land, rooftops and sky....what else is there to say. Make sure you take the time to see it at different times of the day and different locations, they all have their pluses
Best Viewed from the Brooklyn Bridge!. Amazing, best views at night from the Brooklyn Bridge/ Brooklyn Heights or the Statton Island ferry by day!

Unique. Nearly all major cities have their own defined style of a skyline. NYC is no exception. This is one of the most iconic around. All the pictures you can take simply wouldnt suffice the beauty of this place from afar. Grab a camera, take a photo, and you will not be disappointed.

Always impressive. See it from land or by water, and it is always impressive. Places to check it out: top of the rock, empire state building, statue of liberty, statue of liberty ferry, bar on top of hyatt times square (free), brooklyn bridge (free). The staten island ferry is most likely a good place too since the statue of liberty ferry provides a nice view, and the staten island ferry is free.

AWESOME !. Being brought up in Brooklyn, we would walk on the Promenade in Brooklyn Heights starting when I was six years old. By the time I was 10 I fully realized the Manhattan Skyline just across the river was a spectacle no one should miss. Many years later my Family and I visit at least once a year. I still continue to get the same thrill witnessing this sight just as if I was ten again.

The best in the world!. I've been very fortunate to travel to many of the major cities in this world. I've seen Rome, Paris, Hong Kong, Melbourne Australia, Shanghai and more...just to name a few. There's nothing to describe the view of the New York skyline when we fly back to New York. the best in the world!
Must see. I saw the sky line from an airplane, distance on the ground, up close, but my favorite was on the ferry going to the statue of liberty. It is beautiful and must see at both day and night.

Grand view. There is nothing quite the the manhattan sky line. No other city compares in the size. You can see the buildings from every side of the city. You can see the Freedom tower from almost anywhere.

I'll take New York. Coming to New York by ship, rail, or car, that skyline makes your pulse leap for what's in store. Because of the compression of Manhattan, it's all there in stark silhouette, twinkling lights or glowing at sunrise, a monument to culture and creativity. Seeing the iconic skyline is a thing of unrivaled man made beauty.
Great views. Every time we come to New York the skyline is definitely one of the things to marvel at...just so impressive in daytime or evening.

Great and overwhelming. Skyline looks great especially the one at Manhattan South Side. Go on a sunny day by Boat to Liberty Statue and see it from the water side. Another beautiful Skyline is the one around central park

Sunset in Manhattan. There is no better vantage point to take in a Manhattan sunset than along the Hudson River. Leaning against the wall at Riverside Drive, adjacent to the GW Bridge, one can witness the sky changing hues from goldenrod yellow to dusty rose to seared pink, at the same time watching the skyline illuminate. There are many gorgeous places to catch the setting sun but few are as majestic as Manhattan.

Gorgeous. One simply cannot miss this view, it is the most spectacular one in NYC! I have experinced it in several ways thruout the years: walking thru Brookling bridge an looking back, fom the hon hop off bus and fom thecruise line boat… all paid off. absolute must see.
Found a really good place for the skyline. Hamilton Park provides fabulous viewsNear 773 Boulevard East Weehawken, NJ 07086, USA40.771090, -74.016592

Awe inspiring. Empire State, Top of the Rock, Statue of Liberty/Ellis Island. Pick your spot. Every location offers up an excellent view of New York's skyline. Photos and movies can't compare to seeing it in person.

Manhattan Skyline is Now Complete. On October 4, 2014, we visited the Statue of Liberty. Leaving Battery Park, while on Statue of Liberty Island, and when returning to Battery Park, we saw the skyline of lower Manhattan. Now, it includes the new, gleaming World Trade Center. The sight almost takes your breath away, especially on such a brisk and clear Autumn day as we had. But, you don't have to spend any money to see the skyline. You can take the free round trip Staten Island ferry from Battery Park area. The view is the same without any cost.

Can't think of a better skyline . There are many ways to view the NY skyline. The best views are from outside manhattan, looking in so to speak. You can try the following:1. Walk the Brooklyn bridge.2. Take the Staten Island ferry round trip - it's free and you'll get a good view of the Statue of Liberty. 3. Take a circle line cruise. 4. Ferry to governors island for great views of lower manhattan and east river including the Brooklyn bridge. 5. Riverfront parks in Hoboken accessible via the path train. 6. Long Island City - Gantry Plaza ParkWithin manhattan:1. The view rotating restaurant at the top of the Marriott Marquis2. Top of the rock3. Empire State Building 4. Any number of rooftop bars. 230 5th is a fave. 5. If you've got disposable income - liberty helicopters!!

Manhattan Skyline. Wow, this is a hard one to pick. It looks great in the day time as you approach from Queens or New Jersey. As you drive towards the Lincoln a Tunnel at night from New Jersey the lights of Manhattan are fantastic. If you take the boat trip it's breathtaking too. I honestly don't know which is the best but it's a brilliant skyline from every angle.
not to be missed. the skyline is brilliant, and do not miss the FREE statin island ferry trip past the statue of liberty
top of the rock. great view from the top of the rock; laser lights, quick elevators. fun photographs, fun experience with friends

New York City takes my breathe away!. This city is amazing, its always jumping and there is never a dull moment. Better for east river view. Take a boat on píer 11 to queens and enjoy the cheaper skyline, better than in Houndson river side from NJ view.
Great place to take pictures.. Definitely a great place to go kick back and relax. Should only go at night and great weather. Much better also to go on a mini cruise.
Unforgetable. Iconic, get to see it in person.Fantastic from the (free) Staten Island Ferry.Iconic, unforgettable.
Surprised and impressed by NYC. Loved the people, architecture, being able to walk everywhere, the food, and variety of inexpensive things to do outside the obvious touristy choices.
Iconic. Old and new buildings side by side. I enjoyed walking along in the shade inbetween these tall buildings, spotting movie locations!
amazing city. amazing seeing all the buildings and highrises. just so much bigger than you first expect. well worth seeing.

Mickey's Castle. You forget how wonderful the skyline is from the BQE until your grandkids tell you it is Mickey's Castle. Truly wonderful!!!!!!

Green Space in Manhattan. The NYC Skyline is just fun. Beautiful green space in the lower west side. Plants and flowers galore. Great views of the City. Benches. Chairs. Beautiful was to get away from the hustle and bustle, Without leaving the City
Most iconic Skyline known to everyone!. Picture perfect! Splendid! Mesmorizing! Not enough words to describe this gorgeous skyline, and you cannot take enough shots of the skyline as well!

I'ts awesome. If you like tall buildings and pretty skylines then you'll love Manhattan Skyline. In my opinion it's best viewed from a tall building or a view point, such as Top of The Rock at Rockefeller Center or the iconic Empire State Building. You can also get cheaper views from the river boats (such as the free south ferry) or accross the river from Brooklyn or New Jersey. If you take a metro to Brooklyn you can also check out the Brooklyn Bridge. If you plan to go to an attraction to specifically see the skyline it's good to go during end of the day before it starts getting darker. That way you'll see it in the daytime, evening and night. Also if you plan to go to a popular attraction bear in mind that the queuing times can take time in New York! Everything is popular!
Breathtaking skyline. We saw the skyline first at sunset on one of the circle line cruises, then on the way back in the dark. Awe inspiring. So many things to spot.

SKYLINE--NY or NJ?. Better from the NJ side -- there are some great hotels in Jersey City right on the waterfront. Some of them do specials, especially in the winter months. Tubes and ferry to the City are nearby.

Iconic Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is one of the iconic skylines in the world. A great view can be seen from the Staten Island Ferry, which is free to ride on. We boarded it, sailed to Staten Island, got off (as required), got back on again and sailed back to the dock.

It really is an awe-inspiring sight to see.. My girlfriend & I were on an open top night bus tour that took us from Manhattan to Brooklyn via the Brooklyn Bridge. It was after 9pm so it was dark & the lights of the city were as bright as ever. We were sitting on the top deck of the bus so we were totally open to the elements. It was cold & ferociously windy as the bus drove form Manhattan to Brooklyn via the Brooklyn Bridge. There was nothing really to see as we drove over in that direction but the water below although when the bus reached Brooklyn it turned around & proceeded to drive back over the Brooklyn Bridge & soon revealed one of the most impressive sights I've ever seen in my life. The Manhattan skyline illuminated in the darkness of night along with the Manhattan Bridge. It gave me goosebumps & will be one of my most cherished memories until my finale days on this earth. It really is an awe-inspiring sight to see. If you go to New York City you must do this.

Is there a better view than this?. There are a couple places that boast an amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline. Take a walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to see and amazing view. Also if you can make it over to Hoboken the views from there are equally as amazing!
One of the Best Skylines in the World!. Doesn't matter whether you see it from the Brooklyn Bridge, the Hudson River or the top of the Empire State Building, it's beautiful, majestic and amazing!
Impressive view. Very impressive when you walk over the Brooklyn Bridge towards Manhattan. Use New York Water Taxi to cross over to Brooklyn.
awesome. so glad we took this tour at night. Lemont from Skyline bus tours told us to make sure to have our cameras ready and so glad we did, it was a beautiful sight.

The view which defines NY. The Manhattan skyline is the icon of NY and there are some amazing places to see this spectacle. Top of the rock (Observation deck at Rockefeller center) is a great option because you get to see the Empire state building. Top of the Empire state building is a great option as well.Circle line cruise (Harbor light cruise - weekends only..departs at 6PM)

Breathtaking. You may have seen it on TV, but to see it in person leaves you with a sense of awe. It really is that beautiful. We found the best way to get great pictures was from liberty island, also a great place to visit.
Fantastic. Great to see when you wake and at the end of the night. For us this was the main reason for staying in the area. Important to request a high floor with a city view though.

None other like it. We live in San Francisco and love our skyline and have seen many other major cities, but Manhattan still takes our breath away. It was our 4th visit to Manhattan in the past 20 years and it gets better each time. The view from the Brooklyn Promenade is probably the best place to see it, but so are views from the water (we've taken the boat tour around the island, which gives you every type of view possible). You simply can't visit Manhattan without going out of the city to view it from afar !

the best. The night views are stunning. Just observe the harbor in general from the shore of Jersey City for example. You can see the harbor entrance which is spanned by the lighted Verrazano Bridge. Then there's the complimentary Jersey City skyline that is a prequel to the jewel of Manhattan but before your eyes make it there, Lady Liberty even viewed from behind commands the attention. The main spectacle returns to view and it is stunningly laid out from Battery Park to the Bronx. The Omega urban setting, NYC.
WOW. Absolutely amazing!!! I have wanted to see this for ages and I was not disappointed. View from Staten island ferry was my favourite

What a view. When I went I saw the skyline from all angles from Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty and helicopter and it's fantastic which ever way you look at it. It takes your breath and send a shiver down your spine absolutely awesome.

Four ways. A helicopter ride, boat trip around the whole Manhattan island, walk through the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan and visit the Top of the Rock at daylight and the Empire State Building at night!! And hope that the weather is sunny and clear!!!

"Towering" Experience. Marveling at these constructions especially many are built decades ago, is a true experience, especially NYC is a home close to 6000 completed high-rises with 100 of it which stand taller than 600 feet.

Best Park in NYC. The has got to be one of the BEST parks in the city. Clean with lots to do and SAFE! They're still expanding so I'm excited to see what else they'll add.
Things to do:
Pier 6 Beach Volleyball (Public)
Pier 2 Roller Rink (Paid)
Pier 2 Handball/Raquet Ball (Public)
BBQ/Picnic area (Public)
Smorgasburg

A must see. You have to experience the Manhattan skyline at least once in your life - amazing! Seeing it during the day time shows an amazing feat of human capability - seeing it at night is just magical!
Fantastic skyline. It's just breathtaking - every bit as impressive as you see on films and tv shows! Great views from Rockefeller Centre and Empire State Building.

There is no mistaking its New York. We Vacationed here for 10 years and have now lived here for 8 so for 18 years I have looked at the Manhattan skyline in a awe! As I look back at my first pictures and moments through this short time I can see the skyline ever changing. I love as I approach New York by plane and see the Skyline come into view, Manhattan all jammed onto one tiny island, it means I'm home! As far as viewing there are many free locations, local rooftop bars and garden restuarants. Top of the Rock is a favorite as you can see 360' in the crows nest and get the perfect view of the Empire State Building and there is no wait to go up. I recommend the day pass where you can go twice, at sunrise then at sunset and see the city change from day to night, the lights all turning on, it's amazing. Walk the Highline and get a great view of Flat Iron and Midtown districts. Any view from the water is great whether it be the Hudson or the East River. The Roosevelt Island Tram is great, especially for the price of a subway ride, it's a beautiful, magical city, enjoy the skyline.

The Wow Factor. We saw the skyline from lots of angles - from the Statue of Liberty ferry, from the top of the ESB and from the top of the Rockerfeller (Top of the Rock). But best of all, take the East River Ferry to Brooklyn and then walk back into Manhattan across the Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing views and amazing memories.

Unreal. Just like it is in the movies. Worth a shot from every angle. Get the taxi driver to go in the normal way not on the toll road. If they ask you say no toll. You will see the skyline in all it's glory this way

Good for Young adults. I take the skrider with my children. They loved it but I got ses sick. It's kind of disney ride in front of big screen and supposed to be a helikopter ride over and under New York. Nice for Young adults and children. My kids loved it.
With the boat. Take the boat to Liberty Island and take a look at the Skyline N.Y.If there's to much people on Liberty Island , i think there's enough to see when you stay on the boat.
An unusual walk. We went there at 7am. Such a nice walk! Quiet and peaceful. I recomend an early start. Too early for a coffee though.

Great place. The views of New York are stunning whether during the day or at night and you must see them from every place you can.
I loved these views and can not wait to do see them again

A truly beautiful experience. I have traveled to many cities in this world, but nothing compares to seeing the NY Skyline at dusk.There are a couple of ways to do this. You can always take a boat ride (Circle Line) or you can do what I think it is the best way. Take a cab from Manhattan to Brooklyn Heights. Do this in the late afternoon. Walk around. This area is filled with blocks upon blocks of beautiful brownstone homes. It will take you back in time. Just before dust, find your way to the Esplanade. This is very easy, head towards the East River. Anyone on the street can tell you how to get there. It is a short walk. Get there just before dusk. The Esplanade is a beautiful walkway with benches where you can look across the river and see lower Manhattan. It is now that you are transported from New York's past to New York's future.. While you sit there with the old brownstones behind you and see the sunsetting over Manhattan, the city lights will start going on. Then the magic of the New York Skyline happens. Make sure to do this on a weekday. During the weekend there aren't as many lights turned on in the office buildings. Try it, you'll love it!
More than you can handle!. Beautiful! Take lots of pictures of course, but put the camera down and enjoy it for yourself as well!
Panaramic View. An Absolutely Awesome Experience to Behold!! I love New York. There is so...much to seeVisit often.

Best seen from the water. Take one of the boat tours to enjoy the NYC skyline. There are dinner cruises as well as the daily cruises - both are lovely and well worth the fare and the trip. The new World Trade Center building is now complete and fills the empty space left by the 9/11 tragedy.
Fun night out with friends. We had a great time walking around people watching and enjoying the city! Liked that there were a lot of walking paths, really no dislikes!,

the skyline and the ambience of New York City by foot and on the cheap. As a New Yorker born and bred and still living in NYC I think the best thing and the cheapest thing to do in NYC is absorb the streets, the atmosphere, the smells and characters of the city. I have traveled to many other cities abroad and in the USA and in no other can one interact and have an instant conversation with people as in NYC. New Yorkers are unafraid and open to all kinds of conversations and people especially those who begin by asking, "I need some help. Can you tell me where ...name the street, spot, etc. is"? The first NYorker will stop and help and if you don't get suggestions and directions from at least 5 others, I'd be totally shocked. We are very curious, gossipy, and helpful if only to find out where the person is from and how they like us. Tourists and many of those on the city streets are tourists, thankfully for the city's economy, are most welcome to New Yorkers. We love them. I have taken photos of tourists with their own cameras by the hundreds. I have seen the same thing done by other residents. What some tourists don't realize is that you can have more fun by walking around aimlessly, just looking and smelling the food stalls, sitting in parks, enjoying people watching, asking a few questions, watching street performers, and do it all for nothing, than you can have by standing in lines at various exhibits, restaurants, museums etc. When I go to a new city I walk all over, take local transportation, ask residents questions, and look for the cheapest meals going. In fact I avoid lines at all cost. New York itself is a beautiful place. Don't waste hard earned money by spending it on "tourists traps". Strike off on your own. Take buses up and down town and talk to the people next to you: "I'm new here. Do you know a nice restaurant that doesn't cost too much and where is it?" is one opening gambit. You can see so much from a public bus.Also, the famous Metropolitan Museum of Art, one of the best in the world on 5th Ave and 82nd street need not cost too much. If you read the admissions sign it only suggests the admission price. Anyone can give what they want to, in order to get in. I know because I have given $3.00 and no one said anything. Just a tip! Also, a gorgeous sight on a clear, even cold night is to go to the east river, and watch the lights across the river and look up in the sky. What a sight. You can even do that from Brooklyn Heights, which is downtown Brooklyn; a magical place to see Manhattan across the water. Another tip. If you don't know this already try this out. Eat at the NYC diners, usually on street corners of the city. We have many of them and they have great food and very moderate prices. Enjoy the city. You don't have to go broke doing it.

The highest highs in the USA!. There is nothing like being in NY at twilight when the lights start to come alive! Any high bar will do! I love the back rooms of the Hilton on West 42nd St. In the same block as Madame T's wax museum & Ripley's museum. The rooms are large, very quiet and you are eye level to the observation deck of the Empire State Bldg.

NYC like you may never have see her.. Book the architect's tour around Manhattan. You will not regret it. "The Manhattan" leaves at 11:am for 2&1/2 hours you circle the island while "The Professor" fills in the blanks of where and how Manhattan was 'made'. Nice lite lunch served great weather. Dress Warm!
Breathtaking. We rode the Staten Island ferry 2 nights in a row just to take in the view got some amazing photos & met some very nice locals

what can you say , its one impressive city. you really don't have to review what is very common knowledge if you don't see this once in your life, in person , you will have missed something very cool.

Best Skyline Ever. As a native New Yorker I know I'm prejudiced when it comes to the NY skyline. But I defy anyone to find a more iconic city view anywhere in the world. There are also so many ways to see the Manhattan Skyline--from vantage in Central Park, lower Manhattan from the Statue of Liberty and the Staten Island Ferry, from the base of the Brooklyn Bridge in Brooklyn, coming from NJ over the George Washington Bridge, or leaving the city from the RFK (aka Triboro Bridge to us locals). Sure, Paris has the Eiffel Tower, London has Big Ben and Sydney has the opera house. But NYC has the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building, United Nations, Citicorp Building, the new Freedom Tower, Met Life (formerly Pan Am) Building, the Plaza Hotel, and Time Warner Center to name but a few.

Wonderful... go on Staten Island Ferry or East River Ferry for Great (and Inexpensive views). I love the skyline. The brooklyn bridge and chrysler buildings are my favorites. I also like the buildings in lower manhatten from the 1910 and 1920. I cant get enough of this city. Hit the staten island ferry of east river ferry for even better views with the water.

Best Skyline in the World. New York City is the center of the world and it's skyline is stunning. If you arrive by air, on a clear night, the skyline is a gleaming jewel! If you can't view it from the air, the skyline can be enjoyed on the water. The "Circleline" ferry circumnavigates the entire island of Manhattan. It's not fancy, but the views and history are terrific. If you want to have an elegant experience, try the dinner cruises. If the water is not your preferred venue, you can see the skyline best from northern Brooklyn or Queens. There are several restaurants on the Brooklyn / Queens west coast that enable you to get a great view of Manhattan. Go just before sundown, so you can experience the sun going down behind the skyscrapers, creating a glow rivaling any great art. If you want to have the "lived experience" of the skyline, try the Water Club (on the East River at 30th St) or "Top of the Rock", high above Rockefeller Center. Why not try all the views? They are all spectacular.

Awsome. Hubby and I took a trip up the Empire State building impressive in its own right. But the views across the city from all angles was amazing. Seeing my hubby home birth place of Staten Island, New Jersey, the Bronx, Brooklyn and Queens. Not forgetting all the amazing bridges, the Chrysler building and not forgetting the Hudson river where a plane landed on an emergency landing once. Great sky line.

Gorgeous . Do a night our that takes you into Brooklyn then back over to manhattan, we had a wonderful tour guide who new all the great stories to tell! Back over the Manhattan bridge we saw the gorgeous skyline view...The view is breathtaking!!!
See it at night. From the top of Rockefeller Center, it is breathtaking. Lines much easier than Empire State Building, and you can see the Empire State Building!
Quite different. Lovely way to walk and see the city, old train track reused constructively instead of just pulling it down

Predictable but ....... Still something that you have to see. Great views from the other side of both the Brooklyn and Queensborough bridges. Some of the harbour tours and the helicopter ride also give great photo opps.

Amazing. Best view for photographs was from the Staten Island Ferry- which is completely free and goes past the Statue of Liberty too. The port to catch it is near Battery Park and the Brooklyn Bridge. Another great place is the revolving bar at the the top of The Marriott Marquis in Times Square . Its over 80 floors high. It's open to the public and is free before 8pm , after which there is a cover charge of $8 per head. Great place to watch the sunset whilst sipping a Manhattan cocktail.

How can you not like the view!. The skyline view is amazing! That's all you need to know - like being on a film set! Wherever you are, the view is fabulous. Great from Liberty Island and from New Jersey

Breathless. The NYC Skyline is one of the most awesome city sights that one can find throughout the world. Whether from Southern Manhattan, the Staten Island Ferry, New Jersey waterfront, Brooklyn, Queens or Midtown, the sights are spectacular. From the Empire State Building, one can see the expanse of the skyline throughout Manhattan Island. Wow. I also liked the view from the Staten Island Ferry at sunset, and when returning, the lights of the skyline were all aglow.Enjoy it!!

Only one word to describe.......WOW!!. The skyline of Manhattan is a sight to see. I have taken so many happy memories away from our recent trip to New York, but one thing that will forever be etched on my mind is that wonderful skyline. To fully appreciate it, I feel that a visit to the other side of Brooklyn Bridge at night is a real must. The view looking back on Manhattan is indescribable ........ A real WOW factor. As previously mentioned in another review, the Hop-on Hop-off Bus Tours operate a nighttime visit across the Brooklyn Bridge, from where you can then be enchanted and gobsmacked by the view of Manhattan, just as I was!!A real must when visiting New York!!
Cool Experience... It was amazing experience visiting this. It looks so awesome and would love to visit it again and again..!

Iconic. We were not disappointed and enjoyed fab views from top Empire State and even better views from Top of the Rock. Another great vantage point was the Brooklyn Bridge. We enjoyed a perfect view from the back of the Staten Is ferry on a cool, crisp day with the sun glinting off the towers.

Cover NY. I take the 2 days ticket, it was include a free river cruise and a ticket to museum tickets. The bus trip covered most of New York. However the bus were not always available, the bus never come in 20 minutes not even 30. And they dropped us on mini Italy and the pickup wasn't from the drop point. It was a total miss up we waited more than one hour watching other busses dropping and picking up.
World Class. one of the greatest cities in the world. Magnificent skyline no matter where you stay or where you work.

Skyline. You can probably get lots of views but probably the best one (and with no cost) is by going on the free Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Get off and go through the terminal to the outside and you will get a full unobstructed view of Manhattan skyline - wonderful.
Beautiful city skyline. The Manhattan skyline is beautiful on a clear sunny day. Different view for daytime and night time. Lots of pictures.

nothing to say : just so beautiful !. it is really famous and i understand why , now . the skyline is reallly beautiful . go on the top on the rock or on the empire state , or on the Williamsburg bridge during the night , it's better

Very nice Hop on/off tour. Catch it right outside Chevy's Fresh Mex, many options to see the city (Uptown, Downtown, Night tour etc.) almost all busses equipped with different language sound system and a host to tip you when to get to get off and see what. Ask for discounts.
Still amazes. This skyline still amazes me to this day, made even more poignant with the freedom tower now standing tall above the other buildings as a reminder of the past.
WOW. the most amazing view from the hotel West wing and east Wing gab views of UN building and the East River

What Photo Opportunities!!! Great. Great views from so many angles of this skyline and New York as most people would recognise it.
Uninstructed views from Staten Island are probably one of your best opportunities - see Ferry Review.
So many tall buildings like nowhere else that one can see from afar

Manhattan Skyline By Helicopter. I had a birthday present 15 minute helicopter flight of Manhattan Skyline, absolutely sensation views - central park, times square to name a few. Iconic skyline view and highly recommended.

Nice but no more than that. I was expected by the reviews to see something amazing, but it is not that special. We walked along the rails, we saw the river and it was nice, but i would not rate so high, there a lot better in new york to see.
Whats not to love. The sky line is gorgeous from so many angles; we loved looking at it from the Staton Island Ferry. If the weather is nice, just get downtown and walk around- so many things to see.
Lots of TALL Buildings. This was my first time to the Big Apple. Great experience. I got lots of pictures from the Staton Is. Ferry, from the Empire State Bldg, and from the street.
Wonderful. The skyline is stunning night or day and any angle. We can see the skyline from our hotel room, and I could look at it for hours. It is ever changing and better than watching TV.

Iconic. I love natural landscapes and I must say that my favourite view in the states was not of manhattan, however it is so iconic that as soon as you first see it driving in from JFk it is an amazing sight. You actually get exctied driving along and waiting for your first glimpse of something everyone has seen in photos and on tv.It is huge and impressive - so much to take in... If you come to new york there's really now way to miss this view!

Beautiful. All of it! It is a very "industrial" type city but it's built in such a way that is beautiful. Even the people were nice if we stopped in a restaurant or asked for directions. People were very patient and helpful.

Brilliant way to see this part of NYC. Beautiful day so took what is rapidly becoming a hugely popular and yet respected initiative. Old train line converted so you walk along higher levels that are covered now in quality planting and benches. Really a special one!
Brooklyn Heights. Took the subway and was thrilled with the view of the Manhattan skyline. Was surprized to find the shoreline in Brooklyn so clean and being revitalized.
Amazing!. What more can you say? It takes your breath away and it's all you think it will be, take a trip to New Jersey at night for a look.

Absolutely awesome!!. We saw it in the movies,but in reality its out of this world,unforgettable experience ,we went up to the 86th floor observatory of the empire state building and it just blew me away!!!dream come true!!
Classic as always. I hope the new development uptown doesn't alter the skyline in a negative way. Of course, sometimes you just have to accept the fact that skylines change and always will.
Brooklyn. The best view of Manhattan is to take the subway to Brooklyn and walk back to the Island across Brooklyn Bridge

Magnificent. This skyline is one of the most magnificent in the world. For the best views, head over to the Brooklyn Promenade. Incredible views of the Brooklyn Bridge and the Skyline from this spot. For an incredible view of the Statue of Liberty, head over to Red Hook near Reed St. There is a little parking lot with a wonderful full front view of the Statue of Liberty. Go early in the morning to these two spots and watch the sun light up the skyline.

Top of the Rock. Go early. Top of the Rockefeller building gets busy later in the day, especially around sunset. If you go before noon you can see the vista better without the sun in your eyes. This puts NY into perspective. And the bonus is a great view of the Empire State where the queues are even longer. Don't forget to look upthrough the glass roof of the lift as you go up.

Just Like The Movies. We have all seen it in numerous movies and to see the buildings in real time was exciting.Our first view was from a cruise ship. We also saw it many times as we toured the city. Any visitor to New York can't miss it. If the buildings do not have the sun on them take a picture if you must but if you are there for a few days better opportunities will occur.Kayjohn
Rooftop bar. We were able to access the rooftop bar at the Fairfield and see the Manhattan skyline to the south at sunset. Great view which was an unmissable photo opportunity.
Can't be beat!. No other city has a skyline like Manhattan. I never get tired of it. On this last visit our hotel suite had views to die for. I shot so many pictures.

Post 9/11. I found it quite weird looking at a skyline that had been such a victim of destruction.I had stared at the poster on my walk that proudly displayed the twin towers in all their glory my entire childhood. In 2014 it looked completely different.New York is no longer a victim. It has risen from the ashes and is proud once again.A beautiful sight!

Every Aspect Is Remarkable. We got to see the Manhattan skyline from the street, from the Empire State Building and from a boat cruise that circles the island. They are three different views and all well worth seeing. Needless to say the skyline view from street level is a bit limited but that is where you get the feel of the place. If you go try to see all the aspects.
Disappointed. Boring, takes longer to get through the building than the ride lasts. Nothing much to like, little kids might like it

What a view!. OK - so you've seen it a million times in movies and on TV. But it really is spectacular. I was staying in a riverside apartment in Hoboken, NJ, across the Hudson from Manhattan. The view from there is terrific. If you are staying in Manhattan, take the Hoboken ferry from the pier at the west end of 39th street. Hoboken is small, easy to walk around, has some good shops, bars and restaurants - and agreat view of the Manhattan skyline.

Lower Manhattan Skyline. I did a two hours trip on the subway to see the Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn Bridge park. As impressive as it was, I expected better, the skyscrapers weren't very lit, maybe because of the late time.
it is changing and very modern. the new high rises are super modern and look amazing next to the old buildings. The new tower is everywhere you look. Such a beautiful tribute to 911
Sometimes. I wish I could move back in time when New York Buildings were art deco all over. Some of the new high-risers should have been never built.

Unbelievable sunset. On our way to JFK we looked back at the city skyline which was like a perfect black cutout against a blood red sky with orange sun rays radiating outwards. It was AMAZING! We were too awestruck to take photos but will never forget such am incredible sight.
An amazing sight. Even for those of us that live here we sometimes have to look at our skyline and just wonder how a place like this exists. Simply awesome. A tribute or what mankind can build!

Day or night, it's captivating. What can one say??!! Everything about New York is seen and felt as you view from either off the island as you take the ferry to Liberty Island or from one of the rooftop views. Never will be forgotten....
H. The Manhattan skyline is superb I love it so very much it is totally iconic you must go and see it is Magnificent and very nice
Fantastic view from the ferry. Jump on the (free) Statten Island Ferry for a great view of the Manhattan Skyline. Go to the back of the boat for an uninterrupted view and great photos.
Amazing. I always dreamt of visiting New York City and knew I would love it but the Skyline just blew me away - there is nothing like it

As you expect. Breathtaking. Seen millions of times in movies, never disappoints
Freedom tower poignant reminder of 9/11
Live NYC
Always impressive!. Whether from across the East River or from across the Hudson it is always awe inspiring! Love the new World Trade Center.
amazing views. Amazing and iconic view just like you see in the movies. Great from the river and Brooklyn over the bridge.
great views. Looked at the skyline from twilight cruise. Great experience a must for any tourist. See it at different times off the day. Views from Liberty Island are also wonderful.

Amazing history so informative. Liked everything really only think there should be closer communications with UK travel agents re pickups from Airport etc. Really a bit stressful trying to hook up with the right shuttle bus. Took us 4 hours to get to the hotel.
Beautiful skyline. Seen from the bay, it is the most beautiful city skyline in the world. Take a water taxi and enjoy it.
Amazing!. Do a sunset cruise to take in the beautiful skyline at night. Dinner in Brooklyn then walk back to Manhattan across the Brooklyn Bridge....fantastic!

Empire state bldg. Such an awesome sight. You just have to see it to believe it
Couldn't"t get enough of it amazed at the security at these sights as well
Breathtaking. Day or night the skyline will take your breath away. I got some great photos for the Metropolitan Museum rooftop and the Top of the Rock.

This is a lot of what you go there for. Is unimaginable before you actually see it. We just went around staring and some of the buildings are unbelievably beautiful. Sailed out of the Brooklyn cruise terminal on a beautiful fall evening and it was almost a religious experience!!!
Dislike - watch the pavement - easy to fall due to inattention and state of repair not exactly how it should be.

A walk through NYC history. My friends and I walked through the High Line Park on the first weekend since the completion of the extension which meant lots of crowds! But that was the only real downside. It's a lovely walk through; we saw some of NYC's historic buildings along the way. We went during the day, it was a hot one at that (who would have thought in September); perhaps it's best viewed at night, but it's certainly worth a visit. It can be a relaxing walk with a great view of the bustling city below, more so if the park isn't too crowded.
Beautiful!. It was so great to see the New York skyline in real life! Absolutely amazing to think that it is all man-made!
NICE DAY UP IN NY. One of the best options in NY is to enjoy Manhattan Skyline from the High Line Park - easy walking good food and drink nice gardens and fresh air that comes from Hudson River.
Night Time Is The Right Time. We took a night cruise and the lights were spectacular. Seeing the Statue of Liberty in lights brought tears to my eyes

Loved the Manhattan Skyline. I absolutely loved the Manhattan Skyline. My daughter and I took a night bus tour that took us to Brooklyn and the view of Manhattan was unbelievable. It was a double decker open bus and we sat up top, it was very cold but worth every shiver. I love New York City and hope to return.

Great views. Breath taking from the Top of The Rock, viewd at 5.30pm as the lights came on. A bit pricey $29 each. Long queues to get through security, then long winding lines to the lift, but overall worth a visit.

OH SO DIFFERENT.. Having seen Manhattan from Top of The Rock and Empire State Building we decided to see it from another perspective. We took one of The Circle cruises from near The Intrepid museum on The Hudson which took us down and around The Statue of Liberty then under Brooklyn Bridge and back up the East River on a round trip. The views of Manhattan from the rivers was awesome. Tour guide on the trip was very knowledgeable and humourous.

Fabulous transformation. The redevelopment of an old railway line to provide a green walkway above the city. It provides individual views not possible from anywhere else in the city. We visited early morning, spoke to several people working there, walking from 34th street to 11th. Later in the day we might have met more people and seen some of the food availability
Must do but pre book. We went to the ESB , DIDNT PRE BOOK , TOP TIP , we got in but after an hour of shuffling around, skip 102nd floor just more queuing but don't see anything more

Breathtaking. Cannot miss. I recommend going to the top of the Rockefeller for the best views! It is less expensive than the Empire state building, and you get the Empire in your photos. Wonderful views of all sides of Manhattan.
Awesome. Certainly the most famous and exciting part of NYC is the impressive skyline. It is a must see either from the water or the air so you can get a better grasp of the scope of Manhattan.
Nothing Compares. There is no skyline quite like the Manhattan Skyline. You can pick it out anytime on tv, movies or in print. At night time it is simply beautiful. A true sight to be hold.
WOW. Did a Hop On Hop Off bus evening tour that us across the Manhattan Bridge. Sat on the top of the bus and almost froze but still wouldn't have missed it.
Must see and first thing!. The Art Deco city jungle just amazing and keep your spirit high, just a simple manifest of a great city!

Many Photos. On our stay in Manhattan I took many photos of the awesome skyline from lots of angles, I have seen it many times in movies but to be ably to see it in real life it is amazing. Photos cannot show how spectacular the skyline is.
Great escape in the concrete jungle. Just a nice pleasant walk in a unique environment saved by some pretty smart people. Joyful experience

NYC for life. In Europe you don't see so many skyscrapers, just one after the other. On the funny side our satnav sometimes was disconnected. Both the civil engineers and architects did a brilliant work.
Great walk. The views are fantastic! You really get to see the city! The Sky LIne gets you right down to the riverfront. Lots of interesting things to see!

see at night. went to empire state building at nite. the views at nite with all the lights as far away was just spectacular. cool on the balcony area and breezy. dress warm. ride on elevator good and the lines are shorter.
2nd time to Manhattan after 20 years - great experience. Great experience - lots of people but felt safe. Times Square much cleaner this time. Lots of constructions but very charming.

Overwhelming. The sheer mass of New York City is overwhelming. And the city's skyline is proof of this. Of course, so is walking down just about any street and looking up up up up up! Best seen, imho, from a boat or ship.
Manhattan Sunset. Drinks on the roof bar (the "Rare View") of the Shelburne Hotel at 37th and Lexington was magic. Chrysler Building a few blocks one direction, the Empire State a few in the other.

Photos can never do this sight justice!. Unless you see it you can never really get how awesome the sight is. Totally breath taking and you can never get bored of it no matter how many times you see it.
GO GO GO. If you go to Rockefeller building don't miss this! We didn't know what to expect, and had so much fun. This is really an exiting way to see Manhattan from above!
Find a rooftop. Has to be the most beautiful skyline in the United States. Luckily our hotel had a rooftop bar close to the Hudson so we were able to see some magnificent views. Proud American!!

Amazingly beautiful. Many many years ago when I first moved to the city, the skyline was what made me fall in love with NY. I would often go to Brooklyn bridge to stare at the beautiful lights, or take a drive on the Brooklyn-Queens expressway and enjoy the breathtaking scenary. It is still surprising to me how something manmade can inspire such feelings of awe and romance. Since then I have visited other big cities with amazing skylines and even have to admit that Hong Kong is much more impressive with its bigger and more modern constructions. Nevertheless, there is something to NY that makes it better than any other place. Definitely a must see at nught or at sunset (preferably by the lower east side)
Iconic and Magical. What else can you say - you've seen it in the movies and then you see it for real and it does take your breath away.

From Tudor city place. Great view up 42nd street to the Hudson River. Best is around sunset as the light reflects off the glass of buildings and the Chrysler building is lit. Also good view across the east river.

Torticollis. I have one word for the Manhattan skyline and that is torticollis. Almost broke my neck from gazing up and down those lovely scyscrapers. Wish we had more of them at home. Seeing Chrysler Bldg again after 20 years almost made me tear up. The memory of the twin towers that no longer are there did.

Incredible. No words can describe how incredible this experience is. It's the best things to do in New York just to take in the views and appreciate where you are it really is incredible.I went on the top of the Empire State Building in the day and then I went on a night bus tour which I would highly recommend. It's great to see at night and the day.

Awesome. Absolutely it is the symbol of New York and the U.S.A., we took a ferry and could enjoy this Manhattan Skyline for quite a long while, it could show you how advanced is the Top City of the world, surely a MUST visit attraction!
beautiful. I love the Manhattan skyline and never get tired of looking at it. You get a good view on the Q train as well from Brooklyn. Best view is from the top of the Rockefeller Center.

Was OK... Living in Sydney, skylines are not the most attracting to me personally. But Manhattan was great was good to see the tall and unique buildings. Take free Satan Island ferry , its free and provides great views of the skyline at day and night.
Top of the rock. Do it, it's worth the $$$. I was reluctant when I discovered the fee but was happy I did. Go at sunset. The view of Central Park is almost as good as being in the park itself.

Must see it from the ferry. To appreciate the massive size of Manhattan it needs to be seen from a distance. From the ferry to Liberty Island you get an amazing view - and of course seeing the Statue of Liberty is another "must-do" anyway, plus going to the top of the Empire State Building for a different perspective on the whole of Lower Manhattan. Even though you might have seen it countless times on TV or in films, nothing compares to being there. A fantastic experience!
Awesome. Took a cruise around Manhattan Island so I could view the skyline, a must do and a truly awesome experience.

Wow factor. The scale of the whole Manhattan district is staggering. We checked it out many times when we walked the bridge and of course just coming on to Manhattan by cab gives you a good look. Some of the views in the foreground when you are on the bridge aren't quite as great, but it is a must do.

One of the highlights of our trip. We took a ferry from midtown down to the Statue of Liberty and it was such a perfect trip! The weather couldn't have been better. It was a sunny September day after a day of rain, and the sky was crystal blue. I enjoyed seeing so much of Manhattan in the tour and especially the skyline. Each part of Manhattan has a different view and personality, although the financial district, the Empire State Building, and the Chrysler Building are the most recognizable. I missed the Twin Towers of course, which I saw when I was there as a teenager.
Great view of the skyline. Had a great view of the skyline from our room in the Hilton Times Square. Could see many buildings and the illuminated Empire State Building. Wonderful view

Spectacular. I have traveled all over the work and with the exception of Hong Kong, nothing comes close to the staggering sight of this monstrosity that sits on an island. It must be seen atop the Empire State Building to grasp the magnitude of this city.
Manhattan Skyline. Unparalleled anywhere in the world. You just have to see it. Put New York on your Bucket List - you won't be disappointed.

Amazing!. From wherever you watch it its breathtaking! We had the chance to see the skyline from the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and from Brooklyn. Amazing. Whether you watch day or night or sunset its breathtaking!!

Movie Magic. An iconic skyline, headlined in numerous movies and TV series. The romance never leaves this place, and the skyline adds a certain charm to your preconceived notions based on what you have read and seen. Iconic.

Get it free on the Staten Island Ferry. Join the locals alongside all the tourists on the free ferry, stand at the back going out for the most amazing views back to downtown Manhattan, the Brooklyn Bridge and that green woman.

Amazing. You have to do this, it is so beautiful i would definetly recommend, do by helicopter if you can, its awesome!
took my 66 year old mother in law and i thought she would be scared but it was the highlight of her visit.
The best in the world. Whether you view it from Central Park, The Highline, the Triborough (RFK) Bridge, or on a boat in New York Harbor, our city's skyline is incredible!

amazing. with a friend we have seen this from the Ferry and Liberty Island.
The view is better at night if you like city lights of course but can be enjoyed at any time of day.

The Only One!. There is nothing so iconic as the Manhatten Skyline. As I look over my pictures I must have taken a million! We took them from town, our hotel, flying in, from our cruise ship and everyone is a wonderful different experience. Morning , noon or night it just enthralls you. There is nothing more beautiful.
Speechless.... What can I say...Half my visit to NYC was spent in looking up to the skies. My favourite building ? The Woolworth.

Top of the Rock view better than Empire State's. From both personal experience and what NY veterans have told me, the view from Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Plaza) beats the Empire State's. You get a wider view of Manhattan PLUS the iconic art deco architecture of the Empire State Building. Do both if you want but definitely don't miss out on Top of the Rock

Million Dollar View. The world famous, most appreciated & eternal beauty !! The Manhattan Skyline - for me is on the top of Wonders of the World. This view is so mesmerizing and be it from any part of New York. You could have a great view from Brooklyn - specifically from Dumbo park, brooklyn bridge, from Promenade, Williamsburg Bridge; from Queens side- Long Island City and from Whitestone Bridge; from the ferry goin to Statue of Liberty or going to Staten Island; or from New Jersey side.From wherever you see, the view of skyline is priceless view. Makes you wanting for more..Different beauty at different time of the day and with changing weather sometimes bright as sun or sometimes covered partially in clouds.I can't have enough of it.. Just love my city
Spectacular!. This place is awesome. The view is so beautiful and it doesnt matter if you're a tourist or no. You must really visit this place

Skyline view amazing from Circle Line Cruise. Visited October 13,2014 and boarded the Circle Line cruise boat, part of our New York pass.We enjoyed the skyline and the statue of Liberty, the bridges and the view of Brooklyn.
A wonderful sight. I have visited New York before but would not tire of seeing this fantastic sight. One for the Bucket List!

Do it from the Hudson. We were fortunate enough to enter and leave NYC on the cruise ship Balmoral. Sailing in to Pier 88 on Manhattan as the sun was rising was absolutely stunning. Then the following evening to sail away in the late afternoon sunshine was, if anything, even better. Brilliant to see the new World Trade Centre building ~ a fitting construction.
Grand Helicopter. Brilliant such a great view over the city. Twenty minutes in the air and saw Statue of Liberty all along the Hudson River and Central Park.

NYC like shown in movies and TV series. I love the Manhattan Skyline and you can see it particularly well on the ferry ride to see the Statue of Liberty. Definitely worth paying the price for the ferry to take lots of pictures of both the statue and NYC's skyline.

Have to see it. Unbelievable! We loved it. Great location and so much to see and do, but bring your sneakers! We walked 26 miles in 2 1/2 days but it was worth it and we saw everything from sky scrapers, to great art, fine shopping, and the beauty of a Central Park.

Fantastic View. we have seen this from Brooklyn, Liberty Island, Ellis Island and the Ferry. Not disappointed by any of them. We remember the view with the 2 towers but they have now been replaced with new buildings and like both the old and the new skyline.
A view from Ellis Island. Great views from the ferry! Take the Statue of Liberty Ferry to the statue as well as Ellis Island. Great picture opportunity of the skyline, Lady Liberty and Ellis Island.

Stunning!. It's hard to imagine how a load of buildings can be beautiful BUT this skyline definitely is! Try the Staten Island Ferry, glorious views of the skyline and the Statue of Liberty. It's free too which is a massive bonus in New York!
Manhatten boat tour with the american architecture society. there was nothing i disliked. the tour was most eloquent done, very interesting, lot's of information by an excellent tour guide.
Manhattan Skyline. Take the evening bustour and visit the statue of liberty or take the ferry to Staten Island to enjoy the skyline from a distance to it's full display

Seeing it for real is better than the photos. You have to experience it. You've seen it in movies and in photos, but seeing it for real ... is way different. You have to just stand and stare, and stare and stare, soaking it all in.
Beautiful scene. Went on Grey line bus trip both during the day and also at night. The scene was awesome. Would recommend these trips.

What a view. We timed our visit so we were there for sunset and it was one of the highlights of our stay. Amazing view which includes the Statue of Liberty. We had walked all day so got the ferry back to the stop nearest our hotel and that was the cherry on the cake, with great iconic views all the way back.
try walking. you get good views from the top of the open top bus but you also get great ones by walking the streets and soaking up the atmosphere
Empire State Building by City Pass is easy!. City Pass Book very economical! Most cost effective way to avoid long lines! Don't be suckered in by street vendors advertising no waiting!
Could anything be better. The skyline is more glorious than can be imagined. See it during the day and also at night. The lights are beautiful

fantastic. we saw the skyline both night and day from the land and water, just great the views from the water were the best for me. travelled on the open top bus was a bit chilly at night need to wrap up to keep warm
absolutely beautiful. the best views were from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Staten Island Ferry. both free! the Empire State building had the best observation deck, though.
Birds eye view of New York. We decided to go up the Empire State building. Every visitor must definitely do this. The view is amazing and lovely photos can be taken.
The skyline at night. Nothing like a deep breath before crossing the river and seeing that view befor entering the sleepless city.
Breath taking. The skyline is so distinctive and so pretty. Check it out during the day and at night. Two completely different perspectives.

Dramatic, especially when it's your first visit!. We saw the skyline fror the train from Washington, the Empire State Building (first thing in the morning), from a clipper sail around the harbour and from Brooklyn Bridge by night. All dramatic and breathtaking. Empire State and Brooklyn Bridge by night were the most impressive.

Mother of all skylines..... Living in Dubai, Skylines are now in all modern cities, dubai, China, but Manhattan being the oldest reminds you of all the movies you have seen from Gotham city of batman, or Spider-Man movies, the view from th e island from the lady Statue of Liberty is really spectacular.....it's just amazing how they built such infrastructure and these skylines so early in the modern history especially such large scale when rest of the countries are just trying to catch up....salute....

skyline. What's not to love about the skyline? There are two distinct sections of Manhattan that have some of the city's (and world's) most famous skyscrapers. Midtown is anchored by the Empire State Building and also consists of the Chrysler Building, Rockefeller Center, Time Warner, Flatiron, MetLife, and much, much more. Meanwhile, in Lower Manhattan, the new 1 World Trade Center has risen to the same height as the former Twin Towers and is an incredibly awe-striking building to look at!
View from Top of the Rock. Night view was spectacular! Give yourself lots of time and patience as you are prepared to see the view
Relaxing Big City Walk. Great way to enjoy a relaxed walk through an abandoned train line in Chelsea! It was also the place I tried the best popsicle ever: Jalapeno Pineapple!

Impressive !. Have now seen the skyline from the top of the Rockefeller centre and from two river cruises both day and night. It is very impressive and the new building that replaces the former twin towers stands proud !

Beautiful Skyline. The Manhattan skyline has beautiful views. It is an extremely pretty skyline of buildings. I would definitely try to come and see the manhattan skyline if you are visiting the area.

Manhattan skyline. Walk across the Brooklyn bridge at night and see the Manhattan skyline lit up. Take care on the bridge lots of runners and cyclists. The views are fabulous once you are halfway across the bridge

Swindon UK visiting. After coming downtown to Battery Park and getting the Staten Island ferry over to see the Statue of Liberty, and back again. On the return journey, the skyline was truly spectacular. Fantastic experience.
Just great. I highly recommend you to take the evening cruise of Circle Line at 6:00 Pm, as you can see and take breathtaking pictures of the sunset and night pictures of Skyline Manhattan!

One of the best skylines in the world. How do you see the skyline of Manhattan ? Here are many ways, helicopter, I think too high. Go to Brooklyn but you only see the east side. Go to New Jersey but you only see the west side. You can take a cruise around the island, and that would give a complete view. My best way was from the top of my 44 story apartment building, which gave a view above but also at the buildings, and at night, gave a spectacular view. From the original World Trade Center towers to the Woolworth building, Empire State building, Chrysler building, uptown and downtown, a 360 degree view. I rate the skyline as one of the grandest you will see, but second place, as I still vote for Hong Kong as the most spectacular skyline in the world.

Simply Beautiful . What's there not to like about the skyline of the most famous city on earth. Amazing architecture, tall skyscrapers, one more beautiful than the other. At night it's so beautiful all lit up, I could just stare for hours at the light reflecting in the Hudson River.It's just not the same since the Twins came crashing down on that infamous September 1. I have to admit that in as much as I love the NY skyline, I love the Chicago skyline even more.
