Impressing. From my point of view, the skyline is the most impressing attraction of NYC. The view is great from Brooklyn bridge, a ship or from the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller centre).
Beautiful. It's a beautiful view and you get to see it for free with the Staten Island ferry. It's a nice trip back and forth, and you get to see the Statue of Liberty at the same time.
Best view. The first glimpse of the skyline from the airport when you arrive is everything you imagined it would be, no matter where you then see it from it never ceases to be amazing
Beautiful skyline. Looks so big and beautiful and peaceful over the Hudson River compared to was going on at road level
Ridiculously impressive!. It is a never ending skyline. Highly recommended from top of the empire state building - very very impressive. Definitely something that shouldn't be missed.
Outstanding, quintessential New York. We were able to experience this skyline from a cruise ship leaving the port of Manhattan.It is definitely a sight and quite lovely.
Amazing sight. Great views of the New York Skyline especially from Brooklyn. Also it's really great to do the hour long cruise which takes you closer to the Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge.
Manhattan from the air. If you have the opportunity, go for a helicopter ride !! We did and it was worth it. This will be something to remember for a long time.
Must see!. Gorgeous! You must go! I loved every minute of this trip! The pictures don't do it justice. I can't wait to go back.
Amazing skyline///. The view of the skyline from the Statue of Liberty is awesome... You can see many of the iconic buildings (such as the Empire State Building) very well...
Beautiful on a sunny day. You see this in movies so many times and to see it in person is even better. The beauty in the sky scrapers is truly amazing.
Fabulous view. Loved crossing the Manhatten Bridge at night and looking across the bay to see all the lights, absolutely beautiful
hard to see with the rain and cloud cover. but what we did see was great...top of the rock is a good viewing spot for the manhattan skyline. Go early...lines start for evening viewing.
Stunning!!!. Loved the beauty and majesty of one of the most famous attraction in the world. You've not seen until you've witnessed this amazing sight!
awesome. Manhattan never fails to amaze - the views are just breathtaking. Empire State, Number 1 World Trade Center, the Highline, Top of the Rock.
The most iconic city view. From skyline hotel even more special, liked almost everything, food we had was great avoiding worst of fast foods

A really well thought out walk. This is a great place to visit if you like a leisurely walk for a couple of miles or so. The gardens that have been planted are enchanting and the interesting installations along the way, like the fountain that you can sit in and the wooden sun loungers make it all the more perfect for young and old alike.

One of the highlights. Great walk across the Brooklyn Bridge, although it was very busy at 9am. Walked along Montague Street in Brooklyn Heights, which leads to the river walkway with the view of Manhattan. From there, there's easy access to Brooklyn Bridge park and to DUMBO, where we had lunch before taking the East River Ferry to midtown. Loved the whole experience and will do it again the next time we visit NYC.

Top of the World. There are a few ways to enjoy the Skyline of Manhattan,the obvious choice is the Empire State building which charges a fee,I prefare the Rockefeller Centre Building which has so many storeys & you can get a great view especially at night & its free.There is also a great view from the Brooklyn Bridge which is free & my all time favourite is the view as you return from Staten Island on the Ferry which is also free.So go fill your boots good people.

One off the bucket list. We used the Staten ferry to go to see the Statue of Liberty but the New York skyline just took our breath away. This is something I have always wanted to see & I was not disappointed.

Can't get tired of it. I was doubting about writing yet another comment on NY skyline. It's amazing, incredible, etc.etc. Is there anything to add? I would say you should, you must, take every opportunity to see it from every possible point of view. I've crossed Brooklyn Bridge at day light, at sunset, at night... I've crossed the Manhattan Bridge. I've been to the Empire States Building and the Rockefeller's Top of the Rock. I've watched the sunset from The High Line and from Pier 15th, facing East River. Every single time, no matter what the weather was like, NY skyline was a FANTASTIC sight! I can't get tired of it.For my next visit, I am planning to see it from the Roosevelt Tram, from a boat in the East River and, even from an helicopter. :D

Amazing. You have to cross the river or better yet to take a sailboat ride like I did from the battery park area and when you get out a ways you see something you otherwise don't get to see the beautiful skyline od Manhatten

How to describe??. I was recently asked to name the most memorable or awe inspiring sight that captivated me in the last year and I immediately thought of traveling across the Queensboro Bridge and taking in the NYC skyline. My goodness what a sight! Forget the last year, this is one of the most amazing feelings that I have had in my entire life. This place is amazing and I hope everyone that reads this can at least enjoy this same sight at least once!
wow.. enjoying the height ..crossing hudson. u can enjoying the city view at the Queensboro's bridge ..another mode for enjoying the Hudson river ..this is the straight height view .. ok will enjoy

Different view. It is not so often when you can just walk about in NYC withought having to worry about getting hit by a car or a taxi. In Skyline you can just walk and relax while viewing the amazing city of New York.
Its impressive. Yes it a great skyline for folks to see when coming to the US if you like cities, I prefer a sunset in the Caribbean, the mountains, or the coast of Maine myself.

A New York Must!. get your camera ready and get ready to be intimidated and in awe at the same time. The skyline is one of those things that photos and movies simply can do justice. You have to see it for yourself with you own eyes and just be taken back by its beauty and massiveness. A must do!
From up above. Went up the Empire State Building and saw some excellent views all across New York as I am not used to heights I was apresentative but did it and enjoyed all

Lovely. One of the best skyline view in the world. Can't get bored by this habour view. The Manhattan skyline should be the logo/ landmark of Manhattan. It looks even better at night. I miss this city so much.

230 5th rooftop bar. What a great time we had! It was breezy and cold even though it was 80 during the day. They handed out red hooded floor length robes for everyone on the rooftop to wear. Plenty of seats unlike some rooftop bars. Drinks reasonbly priced. No cover charge to go up. Saw World Trade bdlg. and Empire State all lit up. and the Manhattan skyline. Empire was green for earthweek. Beathtaking views All age groups and nationalities taking photos. I am so glad it was cold. We would never have experienced the robes if it wasn't. Made us cuddle even more!!!Highly recommend. Some soft chairs to sit on. Very colorful surroundings besides the skyline. Staff very polite and quick. She was extremely busy but as back in a flash with a glass for my partners beer. Do not miss this one!!!

Evening cruise around Manhattan. the cruise vessel and guide are nothing very fancy but the scenery is totally worth seeing! You can also see Liberty Statue very close so there's no need necessary to visit it separately (unless you want to go up to the crown).
A Walk & Architecture Too!. The flowers were wonderful, but the architecture challenging and for the future. It was all wonderful. Bring lunch and sit on the various spaces available.

always breath taking. flying into NY one cannot help but stare at the beautiful skyline....last trip I had drinks at the bar in the Mandarin Oriental....the views from their windows are some of the best I have seen

Amazing skyline. The skyline is amazing from the Brooklyn side well worth the walk or ride across the Brooklyn or Manhattan bridge. It's even more amazing at night when the city that never sleeps really comes to life.
Take Lots of Pictures!. New York City has one of the most magnificent skylines in the world. Take as many pictures from as many angles as you can. Trust me, you won't want to forget the views. <3
A W E S O M E - family catchup trip. Its like looking at a film set. We viewed it from Staten Island ferry and rooftop at MOMA. Its a must to do in NYC!
pier 81 tour. went on a dinner and dance evening on 9/11 fantastic views it was the last night of our time in new York we loved this place.
Wonderul, As always. What is there to dislike? It's wonderful and never ceases to take my breath away. It's just one more reason why I keep returning to New York.
Iconic Skyline. This is the view seen on countless films, on TV News and Affairs programmes, never tire of looking at it, warts and all

Sunrise make it impressive with the views of the new WTC. The New York Skyline is very impressive, but if you have the opportunity to see it in the very early morning when the sun is rising and reflecting in the new World Trade Center building it is an emotional experience !!! You will never forget it, and it is even more beautiful if you see when the airplane is landing!!

Mother of all skylines in the world.. NYC skyline is one of the beautiful things to see when you are visiting the city. Below are the spots from where you will have one of the best views of NYC. - Hamilton Park and Old Glory Park, Weekhawken, NJ. 5 Star view of the city skyline. Try to visit during sunset, you will see nice colors. (If you drive make sure you park on the proper side of the road. In most of the roads you can not park without zonal parking pass) If you want to come by public transport to Hamilton park from NYC, come to 33rd street herald square or WTC path station, take path train to Hoboken, then take light rail towards Tonnelle avenue and get down at Port Imperial and climb the stairs. - Hoboken, NJ.  - Exchange Place, NJ - Brooklyn Promenade, NY - Roosevelt Island, NY - Palisade avenue, Jersey City, NJ - Newport, NJ (Better if you know anybody in the Atlantic or any other high rise buildings)
Statue of Liberty view. The view of the skyline from the Statue of Liberty is awesome. You can see many of the iconic buildings (such as the Empire State Building) very well.
Iconic. Everyone knows this skyline but to actually see it from land, sea and above was terrific. An iconic skyline

Never disappointing!. We viewed the skyline from every angle: from the Staten Island Ferry (amazingly, still free); from Liberty Island; from Ellis Island; from the Roosevelt Island Overhead Tramway (fare included in the weekly unlimited travel metrocard); from the FDR Four Freedoms Park; from the Empire State Building (still the best aerial view); reflected in the curved glass art installation at the top of the Metropolitan Museum of Art (a quirky second); from the High Line; and from Central Park at sunrise. From each place, it is an impressive panorama, one which will stay in mind forever!

What a view!. Ever changing, the skyline of Mahattan is a must do if you are in New York.Best captured from the water looking back, either by the free Staten Island Ferry or the numerous boats that go across to the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Island Immigration Museum.The view back from Ellis Island is also spectacular.Don't forget your camera!!
the view. we had a nice view of the skyline from the 22nd floor. the other side of the hotel has views of central park but those rooms were booked.

The greatest city in the world!. If you haven't been to NYC, and seen the Manhattan skyline what are you waiting for?! There is so much to do in NYC; certainly something for everyone! Interestingly, in order to really get a great view you will need to be in either NJ or Queens, NY.
Top of the Rock at sunset. All trips to the top are timed, check local times for sunset then purchase your ticket to catch the skyline at dusk and watch the lights come on. Spectacular
as good as it looks in the movies. I viewed the Manhattan skyline by night from land. I did the same again by boat during daylight and both were pretty special

Fabulous New York. All I imagined and more.. Awe inspiring. So different to home. Great views daytime especially. Liked it all. Thrilling experience, great delis, great cheesecake. Easy to find your way around. Loved 5th Avenue.
Cheap fares on buses and subway. Walking distance from hotel to Times Square. .
.

Among skyscrapers. We wanted just once in our life to experience Manhattan and the skyscrapers! And we wanted to sail to New York in the same way as our ancestors that left Denmark in the 18?? - and pass the Statue of Liberty.

Awesome. Awesome experience, trully a concrete jungle!
You have some free option to see the Manhattan Skyline at:
*. Brooklyn Heights
*. Hoboken - New Jersey
*. Staten Island fery

Ferry Views. The best view of the skyline we saw while visiting was from the Staten Island Ferry. It's free. Catch it at Whitehall Station and ride it across to Staten Island. When you arrive, jump onto the next ship heading back to Manhattan and get to see the view a second time. It's well worth the trip!

Fantastic Skyline. The best view of the Skyline was from Governors Island (there is a $2 ferry to get to), this was much better than the boat tours as you could see the skyline as well as exploring the island.
my highlight. Looking back from staten island ferry or ontop of the empire state or rockafella the views are breath taking. Was mezmorised with it

The best!. Whether you are on Manhattan looking in some direction or if youre watching the skyline from the water, from a plane, bridge whatever we always tend to have a few moments of quietness just taking it all in!
wow!!!!. Nothing else on earth compares to this view. Love New York. Looking at the skyscrapers at night from the rooftop of one of the famous buildings is definitely a must do when in new York.
Just like the Pictures. We saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge, the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock. Beautiful buildings of every shape and size.

A truly gorgeous skyline. My favourite views were from the Staten Island Ferry in the daytime and also the Brooklyn Bridge at night. I did the free ferry trip on a lovely sunny day. On the return trip I was at the front of the ferry outside and took some gorgeous photos as we approached Manhattan. The skyscrapers are spectacular and the blend of old and new is perfect. I walked the Brooklyn Bridge at night and looking back at the Manhattan skyline is so pretty. You have yellow taxi's wizzing by and a glimpse of the Statue of Liberty in the distance. The buildings are all lit up and look so pretty. The fact that there are no ugly neon advertising signs make this a truly impressive view.
Breathtaking. Walked over Brooklyn Bridge early evening. Quite a long walk so high heels not recommended! Went to Brooklyn Promenade. Amazing view of Manhattan. Great opportunity to take photographs.
Amazing. Went up to the top of Rockafellas and Empire State Building and cruised the river Hudson the view of manhattan was spectacular

Fantastic, cheap way to see it!. We didn't have a lot of time or money, so we hopped on the commuter ferry to Staten Island and rode across the water and jumped back on for the return trip. What an amazing view and we sailed close enough to the Statue of Liberty to be awed as well!
Inspiring. The best view of the manhattan Skyline is from the Brooklyn Bridge. Try to see on a bench on a beautiful day and just take it in - it's simply inspiring.
Amazing at night from the Brooklyn Bridge. Take the night tour on the Big Bus. They go over to Brooklyn and the views of the skyline are amazing!

Always a Thrill to see NYC and it's skyline. Being in NYC always adds a thrill to any trip. There is something exciting about being where so much action takes place. It is also fun to get home and recognize places you have been on TV shows and in the movies.

Manhattan Skyline.. I always like the Manhattan Skyline.It is great to see the Freedom Tower towering over the city like the World Trade center did.New York is an exciting city to visit.While there we drove in Harlem, Queens,The Bronx and Staten Island.In Manhattan we drove to the United Nations,went through Chinatown.Soho,went down Broadway from 79th street to the Brooklyn bridge.I don't have any negative comments
amazing!!. See the view from the Rock - you get to view the empire State Building from it. Much better than going up the Empire State!!

Felt amazingly familiar. We didn't realise how many times we had seen this skyline until we actually experienced it ourselves. It just seemed so familiar and yet amazing - and when we were in San Francisco a few weeks later, we realised just how this skyline seems to define New York and the feel that it has.

Simply great. and impressive... Nothing else to add! Watch the skyline during different times of day, it always changes. Impressive buildings, impressive advertisements. Take a ferry in order to get the best views on the skyline.
New York. what can i say........wonderful!!!!I lovely walk in the middle of Manhattan !!!dont miss it !!!!!New York from the top!!!

New Yawk skyline, fughedaboudit.. Not Fuh Nuttin but amazing view of the lower Manhattan skyline when taking the Staten Island Ferry into Manhattan. It's like zooming in in slow motion. Great for photos.
FANTASTIC AT NIGHTFALL. We walked across Brooklyn Bridge at sunset and were rewarded with the most wonderful views of the Manhattan skyline coming to life

From Wherever You Look. Whether its from the Empire State, the Hudson, the East River or the Brooklyn Bridge this skyline never fails to impress. Last time in I was in NYC the World Trade Center was still there and I was lucky enough to stand on the roof. However the new Freedom Tower matches the skyline perfectly. Magnificent!!
Four Stars. Nothing to dislike about this place! Great experience, new/different places. Exiting and memorable, will come back for more.
Once seen, never forgotten.. Breath taking. From Battery Park and the Statue of Liberty Ferry, Empire State and the Top of the Rock at night time, the scenery is unique and memorable.
The most iconic skyline in the world. It doesn't disappoint in real life no matter how man times you'e seen it on film. Bring your camera!

Best seen from NJ. The best view of the Manhattan skyline is from NJ; Jersey City (Liberty State Park), Hoboken, Weehawken or the helix when going into the city via the Lincoln Tunnel (no stopping tho). Or from across the East River from Long Island City.
Above us only Manhattan sky. Imagine an endless sky only supported up high by thousands of different buildings which planes are its only fear. This is the Manhattan skyline. Ever different from 9/11.

Quintessential New York. Loved the views from the ground looking up at the buildings jutting skywards, and from up high looking at the skyline feeling like you're in the clouds - which sometime you are ! Loved the architecture and the history of the taller buildings - my personal favourite remains the Chrysler Building.
Great panorama. Really nice view on panorama, lot of colors, only s little bit to expensive tickets, to be there physically, Empire or Top of the Rock....

Empire State building, great view but it's getting there. We did the skyline attraction , a bit cheesy more akin to Disneyland than a serious high grade attraction that should sell itself.Getting to the 88th floor was a hassle not helped by aggressive, overly officious security staff who talked at us barking instructions and herding us like sheep in an abattoir from one elevator to another but to be honest the view from the 88th floor was worth the hassle.To see the whole of Manhatten, Hudson and icons like the Statue of Liberty from on high was breathtakingly brilliant. I woud have liked to have gone all thecway to the top but time was against us.A tip, we found the City Pass is worthcwhile as long as you have the time to visit more that 4 attractions, we ordered it on line and had to go and que up at their offices across town whichate up our time to visit the attractions and didnt get started until after 11am. If its possible get the pass delivered to your hotel, then you choose when you start.
Magnificent. Viewed from the water, Liberty or Ellis Island or from Brooklyn Park, the view was wonderful. Take your camera with you to impress your friends or just capture memories for later.
Never gets old. Peaceful, lots of greenery, been 3x now, and you get to avoid the avenue/street intersections. Really nice.
Man-made beauty - breath taking!. The Manhattan Skyline is truly a man-made beauty, a feat of modern engineering. You can't visit New York and not enjoy the Skyline.
Skyline of Manhattan. BeautifulFeatured in like every movie/ tv show on NYC--gotta to see at least once in a lifetime if not more.
Awesome. We saw this from the Ferry on the Hudson River which was a great trip as it incorporated the Empire State Building, the Freedom Tower and the Statue of Liberty
OMG. Home town bias but the skyline day or night is breathtaking.And to think it was all made by man!I only wish we had weather like Cal all year round,what a concept.
Most impressive skyline in the world!. You've seen it on TV and in soo many movies. But when you see it live and with your own eyes, it gives you chickenskin all over your arms! WOW.

Nighttime is the best time. The skyline of New York City is breathtaking at any time but it really comes alive at dark.There are many places to view the skyline....try the Empire State Building, The Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center.If renting a hotel room, try for the highest floor and any view you get will be amazing.Also, take the Around the Island boat tour or the City Lights tour with the Circle Line Cruises............this gives you an really great look at the whole island and as the sun goes down and the lights come up it is magical.
How good. It was a wonderful use of an old train line. Very inventive ..somewhere to walk away from the hustle of the city or if you work there a small area of peace
New York City. The most Iconic skyline in the world!There are a few good spots to see the skyline from, our favourites were;The free Staten Island ferryWilliamsbergThe Empire State BuildingEnjoy!
Breathtaking. It's looked looking at an old friend, I've seem this many times at the cinema, but in real like? Simply wow!

Amazing view from Brooklyn Bridge Park. I had my lunch in the park while visiting Manhattan. I took a walk through the Brooklyn Bridge from the other side, and stayed in the park for a while. It's a great experience. The skyline is breathtaking. I recommend this for family and couples as well.Don't miss it.
Awesome!!!. We where there for the 9/11 anniversary. Took the Staten Island ferry to Staten Island. Great view of the lower Manhattan Skyline. You can see the new 1 World Trade Center.

Beautiful, can't miss it!. Manhattan skyline is a beautiful view of the great NYC! There's several boats and ferries that allow you to enjoy the skyline. I believe the best time to watch it is during the sunset :)
Our holiday apartment in Union City had skyline view! Awesome!. We sat on our decking - having breakfast watching the sun come up and having dinner watching the lights come on. A view to remember!

Great views. Numerous places to view the skyline. I'd recommend checking them out from various places to get the best appreciation of how big the city is.- Top of the Rock (Rockerfeller) - Middle of Brooklyn Bridge- Empire State Building at night- From Statue of LibertyOr helicopter if you can afford it!!
Amazing by day or night. Some great building and is beautiful when viewed away from Manhattan from water or from Brooklyn, especially at night.
Go on a boat trip to get the best view. We saw the skyline on the the Statue of Liberty trip and the free Staten Island ferry. It's a fantastic sight.
Breathtaking.. Even after having seen all the pictures and all the movies, there was no disappointment. Could not spend enough time, just gazing.

Top of the Rockefeller. Part of the Grayline Full Day Tour- last event of the day-up to the top of the Rock- on a beautiful sunny afternoon, you could for miles and miles! To all four points of the compass and told it is a much better vista than going up the Empire State! Two decks available at the top-on a clear day you can see almost- forever!

Film views. You feel like you're literally in the movies. It's an iconic skyline and from over the river in the newly developed liberty point area you get the ever changing light, life and buzz of the Big Apple. chill out and watch the ferries glide by.
Great breakfast!. Great breakfast place with great service! I suggest the french toast made with thick homemade bread. Breakfast comes with coffee and oj. A great bargain!
Spectacular. Take the Gray Line Bus route to Brooklyn at night and see the Tower and everything lit up, it was my 3rd trip to NYC, but this was the best.
Incredible views. From the hotel room or the top of the Rock, the skyline was incredible for a person from the Midwest. The views and clear skies could not have been better.
great views. great views can be windy but you can see in all directions for miles but everywhere you can there is a charge to see these views and lots of other tourists

Don't miss this view. See it from the waterfront anytime but especially at sunset and at night....take a trip across to New Jersey and view it from the other side as well. Bus from Port Authority-New Jersey Transit and get off at the waterfront/Marina for spectacular views .

Great view from Brooklyn. Went to Brooklyn during the day and thought Manhattan skyline view was good but not greatest we'd ever seen but on return for night time viewing was very impressed. So go for an evening meal in one of Brooklyn's great eateries and then take in the night view of the skyline.
lots of new construction. walk the high line and look at the new buildings going up. lots of pretty views and things are really changing
Stunning. The skyline looks amazing and stunning. The best way to view skyline is to take a Staten island ferry which is free. Riding ferry will help u get the glance of Manhattan plus sea ride.
Priceless. Though i had my ideas about the Mahattan Skyline nothing compares with the breathaking sun setting over it.
Enjoyable!. Actually we saw it on a Statue of Liberty boat trip. It was a beautiful day and it was just as nice as you expect.

Nothing like Manhattans skyline. You can see it hundred times over, from every angle and every light and it is still mesmerizing. You get a great view coming in from the Brooklyn bridge and the Queensboro bridge. And of course flying into La Guardia.
Just beautiful. Coming down from new jersey looking at the manhattan skyline is always a welcoming and wonderful feeling :). It is sooo beautiful

cloudy. it was cloudy when we saw it but we still can see buildings, which isnt that bad. dont go in the middle of the day, because the sun could make your photos dark. photography enthusiasts will know what i mean
Manhattan Skyline. Go to Brooklyn and walk back across the bridge..amazing. Fab views of the whole city and especially the Freedom Tower.
awesome. saw from the Cruise 42 ferry trip and the best one is the twilight tour which takes 1.5hrs. We were lucky that the weather was fine and clear but it was superb

Highly overrated!,,. Its no big thing, but its a city that us featured in movies so its famous. Nice enough to look at. Take a cruise or go for free on the Staten Island ferry to see other angles of the city. You are already there , so do it.
The best in the world.. Lucky if you get to view it from a friend's terrace. If not seek out a great restaurant to take in the night time lights!!!

Always impressive. The best view of the skyline is from the water, so plan on a ferry ride, a free ride to Staten Island, a ride to the Statue of Liberty, or a river cruise around Manhattan. A truly impressive vision of man's imagination on the fullest utilization of available land with astounding result.
Great Place to Stroll. With little snack shops on top, the skyline is a perfect place to stroll around and take pictures of the urban landscape.

Brooklyn Bridge. You must take the inspirational walk across this masterpiece and snap photo's the whole way - its a photographers paradise. Great views from the Brooklyn Promenade in Brooklyn Heights.

Fantastic view of Manhatten. The view from the ferry crossing from the statue of liberty is sight that i will always remember and the new Freedom tower that stands so proudly over the sky line is fantastic .

Took a Circle Tour on the Hudson River. Bought a VIP ticket and sat in a section on the boat that gave me the best views! Had someone serve me drinks and snacks (which I bought) as I took the two hour tour on the river. The tour guide told us everything about the different neighborhoods, who lived in some of them as well as the history of the Statue of Libery, Ellis Island and other places along the route. Fascinating ride where I learned a lot about Manhattan, the areas and the history.
Not worth the price. It is mildly entertaining but not worth $42 price of admission. Kevin Spacey narrates it, but you really don't get that much of a since of the NY skyline.

One of the most iconic skylines in the world!. Plenty of places to get your skyline view of this great city.Staten Island Ferry will wisk you away to Staten Island for free and give you a great view at the same time (both the skyline and statue of liberty). Another great place I found was in Brooklyn on Brooklyn Heights Promenade.

Weather permitted, get to the Empire State Building. Bad weather when we went, but beautiful otherwise. Give it a chance. The view at night will take your breath away. And it's a great place to take a date. The lights and murmur of the boat traffic lends to a romantic evening. my date loved it, and she said we should do it again. I think we will, and we will soon.

The World's Greatest Skyline. There is no greater and more romantic urban sight in the world than the skyline of Manhattan. Icons abound: The Empire State Building, The Chrysler Building, The Freedom Tower. You can't miss it.
Fantastic Skyline. Loved it all. From the Empire State Building to Top of the Rock. The new One World Trade Center is beautiful.

Take the Night Tour on the Bus. We had a hop on hop off pass for CitySights and NewYork Sightseeing buses. Take the Night Tour, once you get over to Brooklynn after dark and look back at Manhattan - WOW!!!!! Those tours start at 6 p.m. and run until 9 p.m. don't go until at least 7 p.m. to get the full effect.
Incredible transformation of old rail tracks. Beautiful raised park created from the disused rail tracks in Chelsea. Currently it is 1 mile long but I believe they have plans to extend.

Best Skyline in the World!. Remember that the best views are from NJ and Brooklyn! Take the Port Authority Path Tubes (Like a subway) to Hoboken, NJ and stroll along the Hudson River. Great photo opportunity.
Never gets old. One of he iconic skylines of the world. No need to battle Midtown to see it - Brooklyn and the East River Ferry have great views.
See it from the Air. The best way to see the NYC Skyline is from the Air. If you can afford it, that the helicopter trip. 15min is long enough to see almost everything important.

Lovely. This is always my favorite part of the city. One can enjoy it from different sites.... from the brooklyn bridge park.. on your way to sttaue of liberty.... the point is that you should be a bit out of Manhattan to see it... its even prettier at the night... must plan to see it !
A wonder. A have been to the highline numerous times, it’s an incredible park. The best time to visit in the evening as the Sun goes down.

New York skyline is a glistening jewelery box. The history of all our modern architecture can be seen in this epic panorama , It spreads out like a necklace in time to the feats of engineering and design. I love New York.

On top of the MET. Pretty good 360 degrees view but very unfulfilling food choices (mostly alcoholic drinks and chips, cookies/snacks), very limited seating for the throngs of people coming up. I was expecting a full restaurant but it was below my expectations as a whole.

No stars but plenty of bright lights. Brilliant in the day from the ESB but fabulous at night from Top of the Rock and also the Press Lounge Rooftop Bar (Ink 48) if you fancy a cocktail with a premium view.
Manhattan Skyline. It's the most beautiful sight a person can experience in a lifetime. Especially seeing the very awesome One World Trade Center that does stand out immensely.

Checked!. I grew up in a big city that I never had the urge to visit NYC. This year due to a big family gathering, we decided to meet them there and check it out. I was going to write an overall review about NYC but apparently I had to select an attraction. So, if you are looking for something specific, you may not find enough information here.As I predicted, NYC is like other big cities, but dirtier. The food may be great but we have our favorite restaurants back home that are very competitive, maybe except Chinese food. We had the best Chinese food in San Francisco, so NYC came a few years late. The thing I hate the most about NYC, apart from the piles of trash bags in every street corner and the rats, is the subway system. It's nothing like those in Asia or even Chicago. I have not been to DC or Boston but I think I can imagine. There are always delays and in many stations, if you going to the wrong direction and need to get off, you have to pay to change platforms. That is really not tourist friendly.We couldn't afford to stay at a hotel room in Manhattan, so we got a vacation rental in Brooklyn right by the station for $100. It was a very good price for 3 of us but I don't think we will ever do that again. The thing about vacation rental is that most of the owners live in their properties. They move out when someone is leasing it. Although they say they have clean sheets and towels, they are strangers. You don't know their living habits and you don't know what they clean and do not clean after every renter leaves. At least in hotels you know they clean the bathtubs and toilet bowls and provide clean towels and sheets. It's a phycology thing, I gather. It's better if we don't see it. For example, we were looking for extra blankets and found them in a closet with many other things... Well, maybe not every owner is like that. Honestly, if you can afford to stay anywhere in Manhattan and that's where you'll be most of the trip, do it. We got screwed by the rail system and taxis we ended up spending $50 a day for transportation between downtown and our place. Oh, I didn't mention the subway stations are not accessible. If your foot hurts, or you have difficulty walking but cannot afford a cab, you'll have to take the buses... providing you can walk to the bus stations.I've heard a lot about New Yorkers' attitude but the ones we encountered were very nice, except the box office staff for the cruise. We took the Watertaxi for a lower Manhattan ride. That was really nice. The staff was not when we asked for directions. Yeah, I know. Tourists are annoying everywhere. Ok, the Manhattan skyline. It's pretty, but other than some world famous landmarks it is not any prettier than Chicago and Hong Kong we have seen.We did not go to any broadway shows but we spent 2 hours in the M&M's store. That's the best time of the trip for me : )Now, will we go again? Unless we are attending a wedding of a family member, or Barry Gibb's concert, we probably won't go there again. Besides, we have been to New Orleans and San Francisco, we have hit all 3 unique cities in the US, mission accomplished!For you, if you like crowds, if you have not been to a big city, if you have not been to many cities in the world, please go. It's worth for you to have that experience.
Approaching the Holland Tunnel. The Manhattan skyline stretches out. That was my first glimpse of the New Freedom Tower from the New Jersey side. Beautiful!

Manhattan new name is Garbage Tanned Man wearing a hat. Manhattan became a garbage can. To all tourist that are interested in coming to NY. You will see garbage every in every inch of the whole city. It is amazing how New Yorkers do not care about having a clean city. I have traveled every corner in the USA and NYC is the dirtiest and messy. I do not understand why people like walking around dirty streets. I am ashamed to bring people to visit NYC.

beautiful walk, great day out. This is a lovely walk between Chelsea and the meatpacking district. It is artistic, trendy and fun. beautiful plants, great views of the city, interesting artwork and good food. definitely worth the time and exercise on a warm day.

Beautiful. We took the boat around Manhattan at sundown and just watching the city come alive, is amazing. so many buildings to admire.The bridges are spectacular. we kept moving from one side of the boat to the other so we wouldn't miss anything. the price was very reasonable.
Stunning. We took the 3 hour circle line cruise and saw the skyline all the way around the island…it is iconic!!
Skyscrapper monument. Manhattan skyline is breathtaking. Seeing all these tall buildings that house business and homes alike.No matter how often I see it, I need to pause and admire it.

The Best in the World. Who can argue that no matter what side you are on, the Manhattan skyline is absolutely the best in the world. Now with the completed Freedom Tower downtown, it adds a nice touch and a sense of completion to the skyline.

A nice respite from the busy city. Kids getting their toes wet in fountains, people lounging on wood lounge chairs, craft beers on tap, local food selections and beautiful landscaping. No its not a posh resort, its old railroad tracks above NYC repurposed as a multi use park. The food is great, the walk is nice but crowded because everyone wants to be up here. The beer and wine selection is great. Overall a great time and worth the trip or just an aside during a busy day.

Book a guide. For $250-300 book a guide (Family in New York are excellent) and take an night trip to see the skyline - trust me - the expense is worth it merely for the perspectives you will get….you would never find them as an independent traveller
Famous skyline. Go over to Brooklyn to view the lower Manhattan skyline you will not be disappointed, better still travel to Liberty island.
Do the night bus tour to Brooklyn. Kids loved seeing the bright lights of the big city at night, and seeing the city lit up from over the East River, as well as the Statue of Liberty.

Best view is by boat, you get the best pics. Best way to get this view without all other things in the way like other building and people is by boat. Have done the boat tours twice and you start around dusk to get the daylight pics and come back after sunset to get the pics of the city with all it's lights.
A must see. Got to be one of the most awesome views.Best way to admire is on the Statton island ferry .A must do

Serene Skyline!. Great views from several places - around Central Park reservoir, atop the Empire State Building, aboard the Hop On, Hop Off bus tours, Brooklyn Bridge and in the taxi as you drive from JFK Airport to the City! A surreal experience to see all of these skyscrapers in person and close up!
What's not to love?. Iconic NY skyline...from any prospective, just like in the movies.Walked across the Brooklyn Bridge, walked the High Line, took Ferry and loved every minute. I love New York!

What a view - Manhattan Skyline. Did the Brooklyn tour and night Hop on tour to really see the skyline, amazing. Need a fast camera to take it in. A lot of good facts from the bus guide while they navigate the crazy traffic
Always photogenic. We did the Circle Line Harbor Lights cruise. Great way to see the skyline both during the day (1st half of cruise) and at night (2nd half).

Staten Island Ferry. Staten Island Ferry is the way to see a most beautiful vision. Best part was the ferry is free! Make sure to get to the front of the boat early on return voyage; space is limited and fills quickly.

Manhattan Sky line. The most amazing views of NYC sky line are from Brooklyn Bridge, The Empire State Building and The Rock at Rockefeller Center. While walking in midtown Manhattan by Rockefeller Center, you will be full of owe from the 6th avenue stores. If you stand at the interception of 48 and 6th avenue and look up, the buildings seem to move with the clouds.For those who can not walk that much, there are tours to any point of interest in the city: up town. downtown, Brooklyn and Downtown........
fantastic. Just like on the TV!Brilliant, its a strange feeling, it takes a while to realise you're there!The buildings are fab.

Iconic Views. The Manhattan skyline is always a wonderful sight to see. I have seen it from the water, The Empire State Building, and Rockefeller Center. It is always an amazing experience and wonderful sight to see.
Beautiful Skyline. World famous skyline, loved the views from the free Staten Island Ferry and from the walking path on the Brooklyn Bridge.
Wow. Just amazing!!!!!!! We loved it. We saw it at sunset which is highly recommended. Saw it again in the day and was spectacular

Breathtaking. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and the views were amazing, we also did the hop on hop off water tour the view was just breathtaking. Also Top of the Rock at night, it really is a spectacular view.
Breath Taking. Beautiful anytime of the day or night! There aren't many places that are breath taking to me... but this is a must see.

Top of the Empire State Building. It is worth the rather long wait to see this. I enjoyed the Art-Deco on the way up, but not the long winding queues, just when you felt you were there another one opened up.
New York. New York. Gotta love New York. What a great city. Downtown, mid town and Uptown what a skyline. We love New York.
Fabulous views. We walked across the Brooklyn bridge at night and the views were wonderful, as were the views from Ellis Island during the day.

Rockefeller Centre gives the best View!. We loved the ride to the top of the Rockefeller Centre and the attraction is very well executed. There's also plenty to see and do at ground level if any friends/family don't like heights!

such a huge city. the skyline of manhatten day or night is amazing
the views are varied
look at it from on top of the metro looking across central park
lying in the bath at trump soho had excellent view of empire state building!
head to brooklyn and look north to the view
Absolutely exhilarating!. The most exciting, most thrilling and the friendliest place that I have ever visited! I would highly recommend a visit to NYC and certainly to see this awesome skyline!

Lovely views. The views were amazing, the sky ride was fun,
The staff not very helpful seemed bored and could be bothered with you

Well worth the boat trip. Fantastic 2 hour trip in the evening to see skyline at night. Brilliant on board tour guide.Annoying people who stood up to take photos did spoil trip towards the end, but hey I had some good pictures by then. Excellent value

It is beautiful and mesmerizing, in the day and the night.. The city of New York is famous for its Manhattan skyline. One might have seen it in pictures and or in movies but when you see it first time it is awesome. It takes away your breath. Before entering the city, we hit Statue of Liberty and while on the boat the skyline looked beautiful and inviting. Next day we had a chance to go around the sea on a boat again and the entire experience was fabulous, much better this time as we got much better view, while moving to all the bridges in the vicinity and different angles of the the same beautiful skyline. One can never have enough of it. In the night, it looks heavenly.
from Top Of The Rock. twilight views of Manhattan looking down/over the Empire State,& over Central Park. A true guage of how enormous this Metopolis really is!!
Sky at night. What a view! Stunning views. Took a bus tour around Manhattan at night. Would highly recommend to take in the city at night.

City lights bus tour a must!. Such a beautiful sight! Definitely a must at night. A lot of the bus tour companies do a night tour and take you over the Manhattan bridge so you can get a proper view of the skyline. Beautiful!
Best at night. Get over into Brooklyn at night to get some amazing views of the skyline all lit up. Great views can also be had from the water on the way to Liberty and Ellis islands.
Stunning. We found the best views from Staten island ferry, Brooklyn bridge and East river state park, Brooklyn.
Amazing Manhatan at night. Do the night bus tour to see manhattan skyline as you´ll discover the best of Manhattan at night. Simply fabulous
Must do. Beautiful view both during the day and night. Can sit down and enjoy the view/people watch, or walk through it .

Lives up to every movie expectation. This took our breath away every time we saw it in the fortnight we stayed in New York. Best seen from Williamsburg Pier at dusk. So beautiful, all the locals go there.

this will always be in my mind. this is NY.. the wonderful manhattan skyline.. nowhere in the world but NYC... just awe inspiring and I will remember this always... backed up with the loads of photos I took!
Unforgettable experience. Well worth the cost and the fact that you skip the Empire state queues. Staff very friendly and efficient.

18th birthday. The NYC experience was a wonderful, magical and a unforgettable experience.
We mainly got around walking and taking the subway (which was really easy to use)
Times Square area was always busy.
Central Park was lovely.

Average turist trap. Horrible city, seems like resonable prices - but they all want "tips" for anything close to the end of a rat. The trains and busses in and out of the city are incomprehensive and not cheap, taxis are pretty expensive and people most are rude and fake. Avoid, and hope Godzilla or someone similar wins!
Wow. Loved the view but took a while to get to see anything because of the amount of people which could be understood
From the top of the Empire State Building. Although I had done this many years ago, the view remains terrific and I would recommend everyone to do so.
Simply beautiful!. View it from the Top of the Rock, the Brooklyn & Manhattan bridges, and the Staten Island Ferry (especially on the way back to Manhattan).
Postcard views every day. Catch the subway to Brooklyn, go down to the waterfront and take in the view, then walk back across the bridge towards Manhattan, the views are perfect.

Awesome skyline. Take the hop on hop off evening tour into Brooklyn for the best nighttime views. During the day, head for one of the river cruises by pier 16 for breathtaking views of the city and Statue of Liberty.
Beautiful. No other sight more impressive than the Manhattan Skyline. Enticing view makes you want to never leave New York City.

New York Pass - the best way to enjoy EVERYTHING !. If you are going to NYC then I strongly recommend you invest in a New York Pass - (not be be confused with the very limited NY City Pass) there are lots of different ones out there but we think this is the best. We spent $130 for a 2 day pass and got free access to virtually everything that we could possibly cram in to 2 days of our 4 day trip - you can purchase as many days as you want but in those 2 days we took a cruise to the statue of liberty, went around Liberty Island, Ellis Island, Empire State Building and the Sky Ride, Top of the Rock, Night Cruise round Manhatten, Museum of Modern Art and several other places too - we packed a lot into those 2 days!!!. When we added up the total cost of entry for where we had been over those two days with the NYP it was well over $230 PLUS it gave us discount on our purchases at several places along route as well !!! All in all, it saved us a huge packet !!! You can buy them online or from lots of places around NYC but I would strongly suggest that you look around online first because depending on where you buy it will depend on potential extra options - by that I mean ... we bought ours in NYC from the Water Taxi people but later found out that if we had purchased through Grayline we could have gotten a free 1 day hop-on hop-off bus tour or heavily discounted longer bus tour pass or if purchased at that time through Top of the Rock we could have gotten a free photo deal so do check out the different locations you wish to visit first online and see what they offer with the NY Pass deal before you buy. If you can find time to squeeze in a trip to Dylans candy store during your Pass days then go ... it is the biggest sweet shop you will ever see !!! And you get 15% off everything with your Pass !!! Save at least 1 day (not a Pass day though !) for shopping ! Don't forget at the till point to tell them you are a visitor as many of the stores (including Bloomingdales and Macys) give you an extra 10% discount ! Most importantly - wear really comfy footwear - you'll need them ! Have fun xxxx
Stunning view. Walk over brooklyn bridge or Manhattan bridge and take in the awesome view of Manhattan, especially at night, it's amazing!
Big Apple!. I was there for 7 days and extended another day... to much to do, so little time... and so much stuff to see! Amazing!
Brilliant. Top of the rock is the best place to see manhattan skylineSimply stunningWife didn't like it as not good on heights

Ok but a little too pricey for what you get. It is a nice view, but it is a little too loud for my tastes, it is also far too expensive considering what you are actually getting. There are other better values.
Magical. We were taken to the hoboken side / Jersey City side of town by our family, and the view overlooking the Manhattan skyline was magical ... What a beautiful city!

No Skyline of Any Other U.S. City Is Like This. First, I must admit that I am biased, as I am a lifelong New Yorker.However, I have been to other cities, and frankly, I have never seen a skyline that rivals the one of New York City.Perhaps because NYC has such huge skyscrapers, is an island, and appears larger than life when viewing it from other areas ( such as the Promenade or Brooklyn Bridge Park).Anyway, it's worth the view, from the water or on land, day or night. Wonderful for picture taking, in any season.

Iconic image of Manhattan. Wow! Arriving in New York for the first time and seeing the Manhattan skyline just blew me away! Seeing it again from the water while visiting The Statue of Liberty was amazing. It was just how I had always imagined it, but better. One of my top experiences in the Big Apple!

the best skyline in th eworld seen up to now..... Crysler Building, Rockfeller Center, Empire State Building...all are very nice during the day and at the night lights...the most beautiful was the Crysler Bilding by night...Empire State Building gave the most interesting view on the NYC skyscrapers...nice view from the ferry to Styate Island of the South Manahattan skyline
top of the rock. picture postcard scene, booked time to see, it well organized and easy to find as it is at the rockerfella centre

No explanation needed!!. WOW!! Amazing skyline - wonderful for photos. There is no comparison to anything else in the US. The view is specially nice if you are staying at a hotel on a high floor and can see the whole city at night.

A Classic. Miss the Twin Towers but have always loved this skyline. I have always prided myself on being able to tell you the city in a movie or photo by the skyline. It is something that has amazed and amused me since I was a child. NYC has a fantastic skyline with the wide variety of building sizes and shapes.
Amazing . I love Manhattan the skyline is beautiful you definitely must see manhattan if you are traveling to new york city .......

Impressive at night. The view is great from anywhere I'm sure. We saw the skyline from Liberty Island during the day, and it was impressive from a distance. But at night, it really takes your breath away, especially from Top of the Rock, every direction looks amazing, from the lights of downtown Manhattan, to the darkness of Central Park.
Brooklyn. So much to see and so many great places to see it. Especially surprised by the view from dumbo in Brooklyn
Try the Brooklyn Ferry. It goes from the Wall Street Pier, to several stops in Brooklyn, and then back to Manhattan at 34th Street. A great way to see the skyline from the water.
City lights. I loved seeing the lights of the city at night. Also loved seeing the city from the Statue of Liberty.

Take this stroll. We strolled the Skyline on a Sunday, although there's a lot of people it's not over crowded where you are jam packed. You can walk as long or short as you wish. The view is very special, the seating and deck chairs along the way is nice invitation to top and rest. Loved the bench where you can slip your shoes off and sit and cool your feet off. The garden along the way is well planned and very beautiful. Noise from the city below, what noise. Great way to stroll and see the city below.
Impressive. It's been a dream of mine to see NY skyline and it lived up to my expectations. Defiantly to be seen at least once in your lifetime. A view I shall never forget.

Best viewed from Brooklyn or Jersey. If visiting the city for the first time, one of the best ways to truly capture the true size and beauty of the city is to view the entire skyline from either New Jersey or Brooklyn. Even if just for a quick stop with a few pictures, it is worth your time. Obviously this isn't the only way to view the skyline, but it allows you to see it all instead of just a small piece.

Amazing scenery both day and night but you need to find a good spot. Oner Ayan. In order to enjoy New York Skyline you need to get away from Manhattan. For a eastern view the best option would be the park at the bottom of Brooklyn Bridge, just walk across the bridge and stay on the southern side. For a western exposure I would suggest West New York, Boulevard East view, especially at night. If you are not familiar by crossing the East River, don't be intimidated, just catch the private buses on 42nd St at 8th Ave, ask if they go to "Boulevard East" and get off when you see the amazing view on you right. Return trip is the same, catch the frequent buses from across the street on Boulevard East. Other , more expensive options are of course the Rock and Empire State observatory. Empire State turned out to be a must for a first time visitor but avoid it afterwards, just like New Years Ball Dropping in the Times Square. The Rock (Rockefeller Center) is a more civilized trip but costs a lot. For a mid-town view go to the Central Park and stand a little north of the ice rink, you will catch great views of the Plaza Hotel and 59th St silhouette. Finally, for a downtown view either pay for an expensive boat trip/cruise, or catch the free Staten Island ferry from Battery Park. Oner Ayan

Just like in the movies. Took the Staten Island Ferry during the day and got the full Manhattan Skyline view from the Ferry. Tried to do the evening ride before we left, but ran out of time.I would definitely recommend both a day and night view from the ferry, and it costs nothing.
Very pretty. I like the skyline. It's like 5,000 buildings going up in the sky. It will be too polluted and crowded soon. But it's 5-Starrs
one thing you must so. If you do nothing else in new York you have to take a night time tour over to Brooklyn and view the Manhattan skyline! It really does take your breath away
Not worth it. Went to the top of Rockefeller Center. The journey was poorly managed, overpriced, and endlessly uncomfortable. We won't be back.

Stunning . Stunning views of a lovely city. Brooklyn bridge and Central Park a must too - only did these kind of 'attractions' my third time in NYC as all the other times was too busy with Times Square et al!

Walk to Brooklyn Makes the view that much better.. Don't be intimidated by Manhattan. We took a cab from our hotel to the entrance to the Brooklyn Bridge and then walked across. The walk offered many different views of the Manhattan Bridge, the river and of course the skyline. Take a couple hours to walk the water front in Brooklyn and take a lot of pics of the night time skyline.
Beautiful. Beautiful, especially at night. Even during the day with the backdrop of the skyline and the sail boats ... beautiful.
Lovely. Go over the Brooklyn bridge at night and look at manhattan from across the water. It's free which is fab. Alternatively use the free Staten Island Ferry.

Great but not the best out there. Like it or not, Shanghai has New York beat on visual grounds alone. When you think of the history of the architecture in New York, of course, it's more intriguing because so much of old Shanghai has been destroyed, whereas that period of history in New York is better preserved.
Great place to walk. Went at night, very safe, lots of people. Be prepared its over a mile. Restrooms at one end but tend to get crowded.

Brilliant!!. We went on a small cruiser which went to the Statue of Liberty and even though it was a cloudy day, it was a terrific cruise with excellent commentary given by one of the crew. Highly recommended!
Unending. There is nothing on Earth like the Manhattan skyline. There are so many places from which to appreciate it, in the morning, noon, or at night. The sight never, ever gets old.

Unforgettable from Every Perspective. You'll never forget the Manhattan skyline. Other cities are larger, but only Manhattan is Manhattan, and the skyline conveys its grandeur. Approaching a New York airport at night, or by day, from the top of the Empire State Building, or from any other vantage point, the Manhattan Skyline is unforgettable.

Lovely display of prosperity with grace!. The buildings are tastefully built and dove tailed with each other as if complimenting each other's rise into the sky!The night time lighting is also done skilfully to present a lovely blend of colours!

Ground Zero, wow Impressive!. Stunning, massive fountains have been built in what were the former world trade buildings. An overwhelming feeling of sadness, power and haunting beauty all at once. Extremely well designed and thought out. But that new World Trade Centre is CRAZY impressive, beyond any sky scraper I have seen. Tallest building in NYC and looks extraordinary with the Manhattan SKyline Just seems like it reaches into the heavens at it's point. Even if this is not your thing, you will be stunned at the marvel being built on this site. Check it out.

Incredible, breathtaking!!. Fully recommend the boat tour round Manhattan. It is an absolute must if you want to see it all. Pre-book to miss the queues, and make sure you have enough time, takes 90 minutes.
Always the best. I am always so excited to see this even as a New Yorker Can't imagine what tourists of the world think
How do you review a skyline?. The Manhattan Skyline is the most distinguished in the world and to enjoy it to the fullest, you need to see it from Queens, Brooklyn or New Jersey..
Beautiful. A magnificent skyline, best seen from top of the rock during the night or during a boattour. Worth the money and definitely a must during your stay.
Empire State Moonrise. Amazing to see dusk settle over Manhattan and the giant moonrise just as the lights were starting to show.
Amazing. The skyline is an amazing sight regardless of the time that you are viewing it. It is magical when lit up in the night, and eerie when you see it rising out of the morning fog.
manhattan. so beautiful. must see! so much to do and its free. i would love to go back, very picturesque xxxxxxxxxxx

Fantastic. The Manhattan skyline is really something to be experienced. How did all this get built? We are made in the image of God Almighty and He has given us creative minds to enjoy His creation and form wonderful things. It will be even so much better in His eternal Kingdom!
nice site! well worth the trip. nice new place, enjoyed it, lots of cool plants and buildings, good place to check out in the city. We liked the art installations all over the place
Just like you've imagined!. Just take a ride on a cruise from pier 16 or 17 or go to the wythe hotel's rooftoop during sunset. It's breathtaking!
Breathtaking every time. The New York City skyline is one of the most recognizable and beautiful skylines in the world. To see it in pictures doesn't give it justice.
Great Experience. Different perspective on the city, well worth the effort, could spend hours walking through the city afterwards, easy walk to Soho and restaurants.
Let's hear it for Eric Perez !. Eric Perez is awesome best access for Skyline. He was full of knowledge and made the bus tour wonderful.

excellent great holiday. Great views over NYC we did the Empire state building,but the view from the Trump Towers is better.
The Empire State Building is very busy but worth a look.
Amazing views from the water. Take the Staten Island Ferry or the East River Ferry for great views from the water. We saw it from several different views, those were the best.

Beautiful. This was one of things I was desperate to see, and it did not disappoint! I saw it from the staten island ferry, and I went across to Brooklyn, and it was just gorgeous. Photos do not do it justice - a must see.

Amazing.. The very best way to see the skyline is by Helicopter. If you don't like the thought of that. Join Joey and the crew on one of the Water Taxis. $30 for a 90min tour, jump on and off at various stations. Full of great information on New York. Get a full on view of The Statue of Liberty and they give everyone ample time to take pics.
Photos do not do justice. The pulsating energy of the city is felt. It cannot be captured in photos. I visited as a returning New Yorker. The city has not lost its vibe.
Awesome. What is there to complain about? Brilliant. Viewing the Manhattan skyline on a cloudless, sunny day - perfect!

New York City Skyline. Having lived in multiple cities while working in a business that required travel almost 75% of the time I almost always returned home to New York on the weekends an I must admit that the New York City Skyline is my favorite big city view. Worth the visit to any world traveler.

Undescribable. For a free view, you can never complain. I had spent a short time in NYC, and the skyline was astonishing. Everyday i would see it from a different angle or view and each time it would take my breath away!
sunset view to ny. We made a sunset sailing tour and could see the skyline of manhatten that looks great... its nice to see the skyline from the water and from the helicopter flight,

Skyline for free. Of course you'll have to see the Manhattan skyline when visiting New York! You can do this from many points. Take the Staten Island Ferry at night. It will take you to Staten Island for free, you'll get a nice view of the skyline as well as the Statue of Liberty. You could also go for a Sunday afternoon visit to Smorgasburg (must-try eating occasion close to the Brooklyn bridge) and see the skyline from there. If you want a view from up above, go and have a drink on a rooftop. Many rooftops terraces are open for free, so dress for the occasion and have a couple of cocktails while enjoying the night view!
Worth seeing. We have all seen it on the movies and television, but seeing it live is something special. Best viewed from a boat.

THE skyline!. It must be the most photographed skyline ever. And there sure is a reason for it. Everywhere you look, there is something so New York about it. No matter which section you look at, you instantly know where that specific section belongs. This was my first visit to NYC. All my life I have been looking at the pictures of NYC skyline with the Twin Towers standing there so tall and beautiful. I must say the new Freedom Tower still feels like it doesn’t belong there and I am sure, that in time, we'll all get used to it, but I just must say that I miss the Twin towers in the skyline. To take in the views: - go to Brooklyn Prospect Park by walking the Brooklyn Bridge (visit the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory below the Brooklyn Bridge – amazing) - go to the Roosevelt Island by the tram - take the Staten Island ferry - take the Circle line 3 hrs tour around Manhattan - go to the Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building - take the helicopter ride
splendid. excellently located hotel, close to famous attractions like Empire state, boattrip to liberty island, ground zero,...

Skyline like no other. Take the best skylines in the world- Dubai, Hong kong or London, but Manhattan skyline in NYC is undoubtedly the best. Best because not only Manhattan's skyline is the most lively but also because of the fact that it has architecturally significant buildings spanning in distinct historical and cultural periods that too in a wide range of styles. There are some specific places in NYC from where i got the most amazing views of the skyline, you could try too.1. At dusk from Rockerfeller Centre. - gives you a feel of how majestic the skyline is during sunset and you have Empire state building in the frame2. Early morning from Libery Island or while on the ferry to Liberty island- an opportunity to have Statue of Liberty and one world trade center building3. At night from Brooklyn Bridge park/ promenade- Brooklyn bridge and lower manhattan in the frame.

A magical view from any angle. Whether you're on the top of the Rockefeller Center or looking across the river from Brooklyn, the Manhattan skyline is magical. The collection of buildings forms a piece of art that mystifies everyone.

Majestic. Whether you see it from an island, a boat, or an airplane, the Manhattan Skyline is breathtaking. The financial center buildings nestled along Battery Park make for a stunning immediate look, but if you can see from high enough, the monoliths in midtown seal the deal. The twin towers will always be missed, but Freedom Tower is a nice, new icon to highlight the view.
Like No Other View. There are many cities with interesting skylines but the New York skyline has its own special character and personality. Got to be seen.
beautiful archtecture. one of the best views of the tall high risers in the world. it is breathtaking. miss the twin towers which was a main part of the Manhattan skyline.
Beautiful !!!. When you are on the ground it is hard to take it all in. I recommend you get high inside a building or get out on a sailboat in the harbor!?
Fantastic Views. Best way to get a great view of the skyline is to take either the NY Watertaxi tour or go on the Clipper City tour. Or take a trip over to New Jersey.
Amazing helicopter ride above Statue of Liberty!. Amazing helicopter ride above Statue of Liberty! Very pricey monopoly but fun experience at the height.

Starry eyed Manhattanite. Born and raised in NYC or as I like to say a "dyed in the wool NY'er " there is no place quite like it.No matter where in the world I go I love coming home to NYC.The skyline is never the same twice-every season brings another view just as sunrise and sunset do reflecting off the various surfaces.Looking West at sunset thru the canyon of growing architecture is as awesome as looking North on Lexington.Skyline sightseeing is a MAJOR FREE event!Paula@paulamarks.com

Centre of Universe. We had great weather which allowed us to do a lot of walking. Line ups to attractions was minimal. Went to a Yankees game which was a great experience. Great food such as Angelo's and Zaros.
A must see!. Try and view the skyline from either the Queens or Brooklyn side of the East River. Good both by day and even better by night.

View from Brooklyn!. The view of Manhattan Skyline is one of the greatest city views there is. The experience of sitting on a park bench in Brooklyn and watching the sun go down and the lights come on was the highlight of my first trip to New York.
One in it’s kind. The skyline is impressive, especially these old skyscrapers which I find very unique. Best to take a free ferry to Staten Island and you can admire the skyline in full grace.
sunset is magical. we were at the top oif the rock for sunset, despite the crowds it is quite magical...I would make sure you get there at least 45minutes ahead of the sunset as its gets quite packed

The new One World Trade Center makes the view even more dramatic. The new tallest building in the western hemisphere is a strikingly beautiful addition to the Downtown skyline, probably best seen from one of the river cruises (or from across the river) or from the Empire State Building. These different perspectives all have their own charm.Less of a headline but making a strong impression can be the sight of some of these buildings rising from behind the trees when you see them from Central Park. I found this to be a surprisingly interesting source of some great photos.
I expected more. Reading about it on the internet I thought I was better. Actually I think come squares in NY ans the Central Park are beautiful than skyline.

Take a step back. Manhattan Skyline is one of the best thing to see in NY for sure. But from where ? In order to get the best look you must get off the island. My 2 favorite spots are from New Jersey and Brooklyn. Brooklyn is easy, just cross the B. Bridge and get to the river, you'll see :) NJ Jersey is more complicated (no tube) but it pays off because view is amazing - check pictures.

Breathtaking!. You must see the Manhattan Skyline from the Brooklyn Promenade. Preferrably right before sunset so you can see the wonderful colors change from yellow to orange to black. Beautiful city....NYC!

Macy's Fireworks over the Hudson. Seeing the July 4th Fireworks over the Hudson River is a giant thrill. My 16yo grandson had a great view of the west side skyline before the fireworks began. Fantastic.

Breathtaking!. I have been to many cities with impressive Skylines, however nothing tops being in a window seat, on the correct side of the airplane to get a good view of the Manhattan Skyline. For example, I can still remember when I was 12 years old and we were flying from Albany, NY to home, connecting in Newark. I was sitting on the left side of the plane, window seat. Newark was landing to the south-west that day, so our approach took us over parts of NY adjacent to the Bronx, then we turned right and were all lined up on a 10-mile final ILS approach to RWY 22L. Therefore, the final 10 miles we were flying south, parallel to the Hudson River, and I was able to get a stunning view of the ENTIRE skyline from ~ 3,000 feet. Since then, I would have to say that Manhattan's Skyline takes the cake.

Manhattan. We spent 3 days here and it is fantastic full of everything you want its a must.The underground works well $2.50 a trip there is a massive choice of sites to take in we found that generally the people are very frindly and helpful.Great Place
Beautiful. It was great experience to see manhattan skyline from sea. The skyscrapers were competing with each other & making a impressive picture of Manhattan skyline.

Breathtaking+. Breathtaking ,I think is the only way this can be described, if you have not been there yet, put it on the bucket list, also ,many ways to see this, my favourite though was a helicopter trip around manhattan expensive at 2 to 300 $ for 20 to 30 mins, but the best views and photos you can get.enjoy.

breathtaking. You can stand and look for hours and never tire of the view. We visited Empire State building during the day and Rockafeller Centre at night. Both breathtaking and well worth the time. Get a NY Pass and jump the queue. My most vivid memory is the nighttime view and the number of aircraft lights you can see. It's absolutely amazing. There aren't enough words to describe the views. Take the time to see it. Can you believe people take the time to go up to see the view then turn their back on it to use their mobile. I would not have believed it if I had not seen it with my own eyes. Crazy people!!
Room with a View. The skyline can be best seen from the cruises or ferries. The landscape has changed so much since the loss of the twin towers. Best taken with a wide angle lens.
Great Experience. Great experience in Manhattan. HIghly recommend visiting. 5 days is a good amount of time to visit and hit the big attractions.

Simply Beautiful. When you want to see beauty at a distance this is a thing you should look out for. Lights, and the cold weather gives out a romantic aura... or if you just want to ponder about life... then this is the perfect place

A Must Do at Night. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan at dusk to Brooklyn and then walked back to Manhattan with the New York Skyline lighting the sky. Such beautiful colours and cloud formations, the city lights coming up as the sun set and the view for miles was exceptional; and all for free. We loved it.
Best view we found - Brooklyn Promenade. We stayed in Brooklyn Heights and had beautiful views of the Manhattan Skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. What a wonderful city and post-card scenery.

Iconic!. No other city in the world has such an iconic skyline.We took the boat tour out to Liberty Island, where we felt we got some of the best views of the NYC skyline. (You can actually get several great skyline views from out here - New Jersey, Manhattan, Brooklyn, and even some of Queens.)Another great spot for skyline views is Top of the Rock Observation Deck at Rockefeller Centre, and the rooftop garden at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.

Pleasant walk in Manhattan. Joining at 12th and waling up toward mid town, you are initially confronted with several cafes and ice cream parlours. Howver after a couple of blocks this becomes a pleasant walk with interesting views of the city and glimpses of the Hudson. The cottage garden planting is well maintained, and it is interesting being able to look into the various residences and patios either side of the walkway (presumably not so interesting for the residents!). Definitely worth a walk.

how to transform one thing into another. Tranquility and good thinking. Good place to see NY from another perspective.............................................................................................

Its amazing to see the height of all the buildings!. For a first time visitor you end up spending time looking up in amazement, it takes some time to get used to the hustle and bustle of the city too .....
Awe inspiring. Fantastic view, at night or during the day. Brilliant City full of wonderful architecture. One of my favourite views was from the New Jersey town of Hoboken.

amazing, from all sides at any time of the day. I've been in NYC a couple of times and every time the skyline is impressive, at any time of day. From the empire state, from the staten Island ferry etc. If you just browse in all the pictures attached in this items you're probably convinced

Best skyline in the WORLD! . Love love love New York skyline! Breathtaking😍 best city on earth! We go every year! 👍❤️ highly recommended as a place to put on your bucket list! You MUST see it at least once! **warning-seeing once may lead to a NYC addiction!**

A must see when in NYC !!!. Your trip to New York is incomplete without admiring the mesmerising beauty of the Manhattan Skyline !!! Take pictures, enjoy the different angles of the skyline, see where the rich and famous live...Personally I would recommend that you should enjoy this both in daylight and in the night...

A Must See. Whether it's via the Brooklyn Bridge, one of the observation decks, or from a boat tour of the city, you really should get a good vantage point of the Manhattan Skyline at some point during your trip.

VIEWED FROM HARBOR TAXI SUNSET STATUE OF LIBERTY TOUR. Absolutely perfect one hour trip. This is the view that one frequently sees when NYC is filmed in a movie. Can't you see it in your mind? the water, then the camera sweeping in to focus on the skyline? We loved the time of this trip because although it had been a hot July day, the 7:00 sunset cruise was cool. Other things we saw on this cruise besides the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan Skyline was the Brooklyn Bridge. See the photo below of the newest World Trade Center Bldg.

Pinch yourself to believe you are here!. The Manhattan skyline is stunning and can be seen from various vantage points notably the Top of the Rock however, for a free alternative consider viewing from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Statten Island ferry

A picture is worth a thousand words.. I have written many reviews for many things. For the first time I am purposely showing, for public viewing, a panorama of NYC, from the east (left) to the west side of Manhattan. This photo is comprised of 16 shots, perfectly positioned from east (where you can see the Empire State Building) to the west, where you see the QE II and the Intrepid in the West (Hudson River side docks).I only hope that my photo (16 stitched together) is done justice by the downsizing and such on the web, it may look like a very thin line across, so bump up the zoom for me please.I was atop a 40+ story building my cousin lived in when these shots was taken for one complete picture..
Wow. Its just wow, not what I expected to see but 100x better but do take warm clothes if viewing later at night as the cold creeps up on you....

Beautiful!. The Manhattan Skyline is worth travelling to NYC for. The skyline can be seen from different angles, i ve seen it from the Top of the rocks, Empire State, MET, New Jersey, Hooboken, Williamsburg, Brooklyn, The Standard Hotel high lane etc. One of the most photographed skylines in the world. If you havent been to NYC, what are you waiting for?

Remarkable!. I finally had the chance to board the Manhatten Skyline. My significant other and I had a blast. Special thanks to Eric Perez, who was very knowledgable during the ride! It just puts me in the greatest mood, when I come across happy individuals that lighten up other peoples day! Positivity has better turn outs!
Empire State Building at night. What an experience. The express pass is worth every penny! Skip ALL the lines on the way up and down. Yes, there are lines to the elevator coming down too.

City walk about. Always fun to get swept along in the sidewalk surge and see the sights. We did some ancestry research at the main library which is beautiful. They offer a genealogy section that is helpful.
The rest of the time was for "out of towner" gawking, noshing and catching a broadway show.

A wonderful experience.. As a visitor from a country that has very little high rise buildings, the Manhattan skyline is amazing, one has to see it to get the real feeling of it. Good for photos.
It was a nice experience. Enjoyed myself very much.
Beautiful Walk. Always nice to have a place to walk and to enjoy the scenery. There were a lot of people, but that is par for the course.
