Don't miss it!. When you are in NY, don't miss a chance to see Manhattan Skyline, especially at night time when all the lights on. Thousands of pictures you see before would not describe the real feeling when you were there in person. It is a must

Stunning !!. It's just another must see in manhattan, whether you choose to capture it from the Brooklyn bridge park or from the Statue of Liberty, the ESB/Rockfeller top of the rock, a sightseeing cruise going around the Hudson and easy rivers, you can't miss it.
Great pictures to be taken
Manhattan skyline. Nadia rose and Noel are great!!!!!!!!!!!!! I'm having the best time in New York City!!!!!!!!!!!!!!😄😃😀😃🌆🚖🚕🚍🇺🇸

Magnificent. We viewed the Manhattan skyline from the top of the rock observation deck. You get a good view of Central Park and a wonderful view of everything else. It's great to see something you only saw in the movies now in person.

Stunning. Take the night hop-on-hop-off bus and see the view from Manhattan Bridge.
The photos cannot do it justice. You have to see the Manhattan Skyline for yourself!

From the Staten Island Ferry, from Brooklyn Heights Promenade, and Brooklyn Bridge; in order of awesomeness. From the Staten Island Ferry (free Public transportation) which leaves Manhattan at the Southern tip, right next to Battery Park, you'll have a real Close-up of the skyline. Its from this angle you realise Manhatten is an island, With Hudson to the left (west) and East River on the other side. You miss some of the height of some of these high rises that makes Manhattan such an impressive town. When you enter the boat, walk upstairs and towards the far end of the boat (the one towards land). If you want a closer look at the Statue of Liberty, walk upstairs and to Your right. From the Brooklyn Height Promenade, you're obviously further away from the skyline. But you'll be rewarded With a view that's equally impressive. And for visitors in the summer, you can enjoy the views from one of the many benches in the shade. Last, and least, you'll see the Lower Manhattan high rises from the Brooklyn Bridge. Alas, as the walk way is in the middle of the bridge, views are restricted. At least when it comes to takng photos.

You can’t miss it. I rate the skyline 5 stars, but whatever you do, you can’t really miss it. In my opinion, one of the best ways to see the city is by going to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade (it’s free). You can also go to the Top of the Rock Observation Deck.
Always beautiful. It's always a site to see the Manhattan Skyline. Can't wait to go back at Christmas. Thanks for the memories.

Changing all the time!. I didn't believe it was so special! Some high buildings, so what? But it was a marvelous view and ever changing with the light or brightness of the day. Every building is different and some are really nicely decorated, even when big or high. The skyline is changing, not only during the day , but also in time, because they are still building new skyscrapers. The freedom tower is now strong, but new ones are being built: spectacular! Best view at Brooklyn Bridge Park, but also at Liberty Island.
Wow !!!! . Well the New York skyline is like no other. It's still beautiful and just amazing. Take a good camera and enjoy all the wonder the sky has !
Manhattan Skyline In winter. Its everything you imagined it would be with the added bonus of sharing as the sun was setting on what had been an unbelievably crisp clear winters day
round trip by boat. Don´t take the trip to the statue of liberty, its too crowded, much nicer is the round trip by boat. they pass the statue very close but also a lot of other signs

Like the films. Seeing the skyline from different positions is a must,whether it is from the top of one of the skyscrapers or from walking over the Brooklyn bridge towards Manhattan,just like you have seen on the films,great!!.
what a view!. Wow! The skyline view is really amazing.....definitely do the staten island ferry for a wonderful perspective on this.
simply superb. It is a skyline you dream about every single day. Love the view and love the spirit of this city. Has the best sunset view ever seen.

Lovely view. Have had several chances to view the Manhattan Skyline from various angles. Nice from boating on the Hudson but I prefer it from a distance. I think coming into Manhattan from Jersey is a great view and the people that live on that side of the river must have some very nice views both during the day and at night.
Wow, what a city!. From the Empire State Building or The Rockefeller Centre, New York is breathtaking morning noon or night. My favourite is still the Chrysler Building.

'Lovely sight to see Day or night'. Some excellent views to be seen from the Staten Island Free Ferry. It runs day and night so differing views can be captured day or sunset. Brilliant view from the memorial a couple minutes walk to the right of the Ferry terminal on Staten Island. Worth it.
Enjoyable. Lovely views. An enjoyable walk but you can also take the river ferry which is much more relaxing in the heat.

Beautiful walk across buildings with great views. if you want to escape for the turbulent areas in the city and desire some green and calm walk, this is the place to consider. You will walk around buildings, have unique views and can admire the hudson river and the statute of liberty with a different perspective. I enjoyed it and I like to to it from midtown to downtown as the arrival area is as very nice as well.

Top of the rock for the best panoramic view and photos. For the best panoramic view and photos go to top of the rock and you will be amazed at the views ( dont forget your camera ). Another place for some good views is the top of the empire state building ..hope this helps and enjoy NYC.
just like you'ld image. looking in to Manhattan you seen it, you know it. awesome! looking out from Manhattan its " Epic!! " end lass thing to do.

Unbeatable skyline. Nothing can beat Manhattan skyline, doesn't matter from which area you see. View during daylight and view during night are totally amusing and worth to check both. So here are my pick spot to check Manhattan skyline 1) top of the rock 2) from hudson, river cruise or even Staten Island free ferry 3) empire state building watch point 4) from Brooklyn Bridge park 5) helicopters tours. I tried 3 from these 5 and my experience was truly amazing! !!
I <3 New York !. New York is my go to destination ! I love to visit the Manhattan Skyline ! It is beautiful & amazing, so I definetly recommend it!

Breathtaking. I didn't get a true glimpse of the skyline until I was on the ferry to Liberty Island. What an amazing sight. I have never seen anything like it and it's moments like seeing this that will keep me coming back to NYC forever.

The best panorama is from the top of the rock. If you are a fellow traveler on a budget, go directly to top of the rock, it is an amazing view.
The panorama is something spectacular!
Impressive. Best from Rockefeller Center, Empire state building just too busy to get a relaxed view, although I liked the art deco style.
Spectacular. This is an iconic and spectacular view, especially with the new Freedom Tower, best viewed from the Hudson on a river cruise or the (free) Staten Island ferry.

Best views are from Jersey, specifically Weehawken and Jersey City. The NYC skyline is wonderful and very few places in the world are comparable. The best views are from New Jersey. Here are the top 3 spots.1. There is an original World Trade Center girder at the end of Grand Street in Jersey City, which is a street that perfectly aligns with the new Freedom Tower. Amazing views.2. The Chart House in Weekhawken (reviewed separately, 5 stars every time) is a restaurant on a pier in Weehawken. I like to make my reservation about 30 minutes before sunset so I can watch the lights come on in the city. This is my preferred restaurant for business dinners, especially with out of town guests. The view is aligned with the Empire State Building.3. The third place is also in Weehawken at Hamilton Park on JFK Blvd. This park is up on a cliff and is aligned with mid town and I am convinced that most photos of midtown Manhattan are taken from this spot.I hope this helps you find your perfect view of Manhattan.

Awe inspiring. From the moment we arrived we knew we would be getting neck ache, from looking up at all the sky scrapers. I have pictures of buildings I don't even know what they are, just so tall, I was amazed.
Manhattan. Beautiful and love ManhattanManhattan is a great place to stay with family and children, good food and shopping.

Always Magnificient. From early morning to late @ night Manhattan is a City of Excitement.Manhatten exudes power & success.It is a fantastic place & we never get tired of coming here,to witness the traffic,the fabulous shopping,the great shows,Cental Park & so much more.We are already looking forward to our visit there again next year.Highly recommended

Just beautiful!. Pictures just don't do it justice! I come from a tiny little town with three traffic lights so I may be easily impressed, but there is no place quite like NYC. Impressive is an understatement.
Visit is a must..!!!. Do see this....visible from a lot of points. We saw ours on new york river cruise. looks beautiful and inviting.

Great view from land, sea or air.. The circle line liberty cruise gives you a great view of the skyline, but the liberty helicopter ride is a must. Even on a rainy day like ours, it takes your breath away.
Best view from the dinner cruise ship Bateaux. Super nighttime views! The ship travels from Chelsea Pier 61 or so around and beyond the Brooklyn Bridge.

A must see, but it's not free. The skyline in Manhattan is a must see! The evening blaze of lights across Mid town is spectacular. The obvious locations may be crowded with tourists, but there is a reason, they are all iconic locations. Sooo, pick one, settle in for a wait in line and enjoy that you are in NYC, one of the most amazing Cities in the World!
Amazing. What can I say? After seeing this for years and years on TV and cinema I thought I knew what to expect - but the reality is 1000 times better!
Man, what a view.. When I went to Ellis Island I took the opportunity to put my camera on the break wall and catch the skyline with me in it. Man what a view.

Skyline Tour. We did like the tour around Manhattan. Down town Brooklyn and Harlem, not that much. Barely anything to see on those last two. Service was great. Even when a little bit of rain can down, they gave us a choice, go down or accept their rain gear. We took the gear. It was kind of fun. Advice, take the Manhattan tour only.

No place like NYC. When you're coming into the city and see that skyline from the distance, you're certain to get excited as you feel like you're entering this mythic place and know you'll have so many adventures here. I love seeing how the buildings change from neighbourhood to neighbourhood. So much character!

NEVER EVER get bored of this skyline. I've been living in NYC all my life and I've been to other cities and seen their skylines. Chicago, Seattle, Miami, Toronto, Montreal just to name a few have some great skylines. NYC skyline I can never get enough of and I'm going to tell you MY favourite spot to catch an excellent view of the NYC skyline. Drum roll please *drum roll plays*: GANTRY STATE PARK in Long Island City, Queens! Yay! Now, how to get there? Take the 7 train at either Times Square, Bryant Park or Grand Central on 42nd street and take it to Jackson Ave-Vernon BLVD in Queens. From there, follow the skyline till you reach the park and enjoy! You'll thank me later.There's other great places to see the skyline. East River Park, Brooklyn Bridge park in Brooklyn and the water taxi or East River Ferry will give you amazing views of NYC. Thank me later! (If you're new to NYC)

A park in the sky. A waiter recommended this attraction to us, we were really pleased he did, it was a nice elevated leisurely walk around some of the city, on a disused and renovated railway line. There are lots of plants and good views of places you wouldn't see ordinarily.

So many viewpoints. There is just so many places to watch this it's hard to pick a favorite. Each time you take a new look you find something new fascinating.The favorite places in my opinion is from Brooklyn, from a ferry, from the Top of the Rock and from the top of the Empire State Building.I would love to go on a helicopter ride, but my budget doesn't allow me to do that. If you have the money for it, I'm sure it's well worth it.
Nice. Do see this....visible from a lot of points. We saw ours on new york river cruise. looks beautiful and inviting.

Iconic man made view. If you arrive at Newark Airport you get a great view of the skyline as you travel into the city. To appreciate the view try and see it from all angles. Stroll the streets, look up and be amazed. For me the best views are free. Some of the individual buildings are masterpieces in design. All the parks give different views, the free Staten Island ferry gives great views of lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty.
ways to see skyline. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn Bridge Park and also via NY Water Taxi - great photo opportunities

It's Manhattan - what more do you want?. A city like no other has a skyline like no other. If you visit NYC and never get up high enough or far away enough to see the skyline, you're missing so much. See the skyline and be amazed by a truly beautiful city.

Breathtaking. What is it about the skyline that is so breathtaking? The view of the heights demonstrates the power of hard work and imagination. The views from the river at both sunset with the light bouncing off the buildings as well as at night with the glimmer of the city lights in the river are simply astounding.

Not bad at all. Seated right away. Excellent service. Family Style portions, good eats. It got very crowed after we arrived. It also got very noisey. Arrive early and don't plan on getting seated without a reservation. t.
Can't miss it!. See it from Brooklyn Bridge Park - incredible! Make sure you check it out at all times of day and take your camera!

July in the City. Probably the best time to visit Manhattan with all the beautiful buildings lit up in red white and blue, plus the city "stonehendge" where the sun aligns with the streets when it sets this time of year. Also can see skyline from NJ and Queens.

A vision of achievement. We miss the World Trace Center towers, but the Manhattan skyline is still a vision of the best that humankind has offered yet. Reaching for the top in liberty. Freedom to achieve or fail according to one's own efforts or failures. What other skyline represents that?

Beautiful Skyline from a Distance. The Manhattan Skyline is majestic and impressive by viewing it from a distance. The best view I saw was from Hoboken, New Jersey in the early evening. New York City with its various moods must be captured at various time and in different part of the city. Whether it is early morning walk in Central Park, busy shopping on Fifth Avenue throughout the day, or the Manhattan Skyline in early evening, these are all the charm of Manhattan. The Manhattan Skyline captures them all.

High Line park the best!. Highline Park, Empire State Building, Top of the Rock for fireworks! Could see NY, NJ fireworks at the same time! AWESOME view, no traffic later leaving the area like those down by the show. Also go to see the new light display for the Empire State Building that night (high tech LED lights!), and the new Freedom Tower even had their red, light, and blue showing!
worth to visit. Waiting the in the ticket lines even with NYCity pass is very boring...but the skylines are beautiful...
Amazing Park above the City. Well worth a walk along the skyline, beautiful views, yummy food stalls and if you go early its incredibly peaceful.

We Love Manhattan. Manhattan is the best city in the world. Walk, taxi or subway everywhere and feel safe. Great food and an amazing number of places to eat or have coffee. Always something to do in Manhattan.
Best Skyline in the World. During my visit to NYC I couldn't help but marvel at the amazing NYC skyline. There is nothing like it on this world.

Amazing. We took 3 separate water tours. The free Staten Island Ferry, the Liberty Island ferry, and the Circleline semicircle cruise. All were fantastic and we got to see the skyline from all angles. Seeing it from the Roosevelt Island tram was cool too.

Iconic and Beautiful. There are two ways to see this skyline properly. From Brooklyn near the Brooklyn Bridge, or by taking the Circle Line tour. And I recommend seeing it from both angles. I find the view most beautiful at dusk, especially from the Brooklyn side because the sun reflects off the buildings giving them a soft, romantic glow. I was there most recently a few weeks ago to take pictures for my blog www.redqueentales.blogspot.com and ran out of battery by the end of the night because I couldn't take my eyes off the view as it changed from day to night.Every time I see this skyline I get butterflies, it's like falling in love all over again.

Best View. I suppose everyone has an opinion, but in my view the best view was from Liberty Island.Standing next to the statue, looking out at Manhattan in late afternoon was priceless. Thought it was a better view than some of the high rise ones.
Manhattan. Look so much better in person. Try and see it from the water too! Clearly the best skyline in America.
You have to see it. You cannot go to New York and not go somewhere to get a photo of this - we saw it from the New York Water Taxi
Superb!. You can't really describe this, it has to be seen. But it's amazing, and jaw dropping. Try and get to see it from the other side of the East river, that's the best view of it.
Can't be beat!. Wondrous from all boroughs and angles, in all seasons and times of day. From a a plane, from Empire State, from Williamsburg, from Brooklyn Bridge...The Best.

Wow - lots of great views this weekend!. No matter where you go to observe the Manhattan skyline, you almost cannot get a bad view. We probably enjoyed it most from across the river, looking down from the entranceway to the Lincoln tunnel. (I wish I had a photo of that, with the tall towers illuminated in different colors of light.) I also enjoyed the view from over the reservoir in Central Park. It was all good, and there is only one Big Apple!

One of the best skylines in the world!. I haven't seen all the skylines, of course, but Manhattan's is the best of all I've ever scene Toronto, London, Paris, Tokyo, Hong Kong, etc. can't compare. My most recent trip to NYC found me viewing the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. I never tire of the view.
Breath taking. Oh the experience and the fun. Amazing. This city is amazing I just love it. Wish I could stay here forever. Must visit
Views of Manhattan. From any angle and at any time of the day or night the Manhattan skyline is fantastic - but most especially during the early evening.
Breathtaking. You just have to experience it! Take tons of pictures. It is an amazing view from any angle. I can't wait to go back!

Skyline second to none!!. It's generally considered that the three best skylines in the world are Hong Kong, Chicago, and New York. Each is special in a different way and each captivates and elicits a breathtaking response. While I've never personally seen the Hong Kong skyline and understand it is by far the densest of all the skylines in the world, for me the NYC and Chicago skylines are more impressive because of their sweeping views of the buildings from many different angles. On that basis it's difficult to separate the NYC and Chicago skylines since each is fantastic in its own right but for sheer awesomeness I'd have to give the NYC skyline the edge. The length of the skyline on both sides viewed from the Hudson and the East Rivers is incredible and very impressive. If you're a fan of architecture and skyscrapers in particular and are impressed by the sheer density and sweep of skylines NYC's is a must on everybody's list.
What a view!. Loved view as took ferry to Ellis Island! Seeing New World Trade Tower and not Twin Towers was a bit to adjust to but what a majestic view

The most iconic skyline on the planet!. There are so many ways to see this skyline but the round Manhattan cruise is perhaps the best. You see it from every angle and from every side of the isle of Manhattan so you can't fail to take an amazing photograph! Catch the subway to Brooklyn and walk back over the Brooklyn Bridge, the views out towards Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty are great but are eclipsed by the views of the futuristic monoliths that make up the skyline in downtown Manhattan. Not to be missed!
Gorgeous!. Beautiful view on a summer day in June! We took plenty of pictures on several cameras to capture the memories!

Best seen from the water or the top of the Rock. The view from the top of the Rockefeller centre are the best views of Manhattan,even better than the Empire State Building. There is more space,you get up there faster and there are three levels when you get up there.A fantastic way to view the skyline is either a day time cruise or Statin Island ferry,etc but the most spectacular way possible is on the dinner cruise. We went on the bateaux dinner cruise and after sailing to Brooklyn bridge the sun sets and the skyline is stunning in the dark on the return journey to the Chelsie Pier.

Most enjoyed from Brooklyn Bridge. There were many ways we viewed the skyline but our favorite was while walking from Brooklyn toward Manhattan across the Brooklyn Bridge in the morning before it got crowded.
Just like the movies!. We stayed at the Z Hotel in Long Island City and the view of Manhattan was just perfect from the rooftop bar. Amazing!
from liberty island cruise. great way to see the skyline. the various buildings, mix of old and new. Seems impossible so many people live there

You have to see this. Great view from Brooklyn bridge, walk to the middle of the bridge where you have no wires blocking your vieuw. It's nice to walk over the boardwalk towards the towers, a lot of people take pictures of the skyline, which is great! Don't miss this.

Awe Inspiring & Free. The Manhattan Skyline is spectacular from every angle and every rooftop. The pictures are from Williamsburg, Brooklyn and Roosevelt Island, but the views are just as amazing from the ferries, water taxis, cruises, rooftops, etc. and even from NJ....the best things in life are for free...

Amazing Week. I was amazed at New York never seen anywhere like it , the people were so nice and friendly and not cause you are tourist . Great hotel in Times Square (The Sheraton ) . Views were out of this world , if you go you Must go in a Helicopter over the City .
Manhattan from Brooklin. Trying to see the best view of Manhattan skyline? Go to Brooklyn....I will have certainly a good picture for your album!
By moonlight. It was breathtaking to see the skyline at night from the Jersey side. although my camera could not get it all in but some really good postcards helped. Do not miss it.

Surely a wonder of the world?!. The best place to see this from is across the water from Manhattan in Brooklyn Heights. Get off at Clark Street (on the 2/3 subway). The views at night are breathtaking. I lived on the promenade there for a year and I miss it now I spend most of my time in London. You will never tire of that amazing view.

well, yeah, there's only one..... as many times as we have been to nyc, its still great to see both the old and familiar, coupled with the new and monumental ( 9/11 memorial, for instance...) its seems as though something is being torn down, and another skyscraper is being erected in its place...constant renewal....

west side story. take a look from 'the jersey shore' eg hoboken,newport, especially at night.
cheap and easy to get there and so rewarding;quite stunning.
Wonderful. Beautiful skyline both from the Hudson and from Brooklyn Bridge. We walked across and it was well worth the effort and was also free. Would highly recommend.

Was tricked by sales people in the street. We thought we were going up the Empire State Building but ended up doing this sky line team park ride in the Empire state building, luckillywe had a New York Pass so it was included, otherwise it was $42 per person, a total rip off as far as I was concerned. Afterward we queued up for the Observation tower Empire state building
Wonderful view. Love Manhattan - fab views. Wonderful - loved every second. New York is one of my favourite places - if I was much younger I would consider spending a couple of years there.

What a view!. The Manhattan Skyline is fabulous as you walk across the Brooklyn Bridge heading towards Manhattan. Can't beat price of free!!! The walk will take about 45 minutes. Depending on your pace. Plenty of time to take in the splendid scenery. Highly recommend this event!
Magnificent sight. Viewed from the other side of the river the Manhattan skyline at night must not be missed, worth a visit to NY just to see.

Awesome. We viewed the skyline from many perspectives. On our first morning we caught the Liberty cruise at 9am and sailed across to the Statue, to be honest I was more in awe of the skyline and didnt really take much notice of the lady in green. The same day we walked across Brooklyn bridge and then caught the water taxi from brooklyn back over to lower manhattan, great views again... I never tire of the skyline, of course, a sunny day helps.
A must see experience. Taking in the sight of this amazing skyline helps to put Manhattan into perspective. A beautiful sight and one you need your camera to capture.

what! free in new york. 3 great things to do in New York for free. 1.Take a night time walk across the Brooklyn Bridge towards Manhattan and see the beautiful Manhattan Skyline lit up in all its glory and get exercise at the same time. Win win!. 2. Take the Staten Island ferry, listen to the announcer and pretend your in a movie and the view is brilliant as well!.3. Get down with the cool people and walk the High Line as it winds and meanders its leisurely way and get some lovely views of the Hudson River. Now go get a drink you deserve it.

Great. The Manhattan sky line is brilliant from the ground but we got to see it on New Years Eve first from a helicopter during the day then from a boat during a New Years Eve cruise. I would strongly recommend both

Breathtaking views. The Manhattan Skyline was a highlight of my stay in New York - often going up to the rooftop terrace bar of Pod 39 to soak in the stunning views of all the skyscrapers around. A highlight of my short stay in New York.
Best skyline in the world. As you make your way from jfk airport past Harlem you see the sky line of manhatton and it just hits you it's breathtaking
What's not too love about Manhattan Skyline <3. Whether from a rooftop of some building downtown or Top of the Rock from Midtown ... its just breathtaking!
The most famous in the world. The heart beats and sings with every view, from every spot. It's powerful and magical. Just waiting to come back soon...........

A testament to the diversity of the greatest city in the world. If the nyc skyline had been planned it would not be the sight it is today. It truly represents both the free spirit and the resilience that is nyc. Ride the no 7 train from Rawson st to Times Sq for an interesting view. Don't miss the view fron Brooklyn Promenade or Roosevelt island

Superheroes Live Here. Is there a more iconic skyline than New York City? Home to superheroes and to super food, shows, sites and normal people, it's hard not to get excited when seeing the skyline. It looks great day and night, from the North, South, East or West. Bring your camera, and start your NYC memories before you even arrive in the city.TIP: Tune into 1010AM on the radio for traffic (every ten minutes on the "1")

View from Brooklyn Heights. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and then on to Brooklyn Heights where we found a wonderful view of Manhattan. Afterwards we had ymmy icecream at the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory on the water. Then we walked back across the bridge to cool off at the David Letterman Show.
remember. Everyone should visit 9/11 and feel the emotions it will bring to you. If you have children very important for them to learn to REMEMBER!

The New York Skyline is timeless my favorite viewing locations.. If you are in NYC some of the best skyline views are from Top of The Rock Observation in Rockerfeller Center or from the Roof top Cafe in the Metropolitan Museum. Other favorites are from the Beach Bar in South street seaport...Great view of Bridge. However my absolute favorite skyline views are from the NJ side. The Liberty House restaurant in NJ has a fantastic view of the skyline. The Chart House in Weehawken NJ or the Sheraton Weehawken Hotel are also just a ferry ride across from Manhattan. There are many others but these offer great views and great food and drinks in their respective locations. Enjoy
Always breathtaking!. Probably the most famous skyline in the world. The addition of the new WTC helps to fill a void that has been there for quite awhile now.

Breathtaking. Maybe one of the most beautiful ways to enjoy the Manhattan Skyline is from the Brooklyn bridge Park. Choose your "spot" and relax. It is an amazing experience, very close to the city center and a vital break from the crowds of the heart of Manhattan.

Where to view the skyline. Take the Staten Island ferry or the Statue of Liberty ferry and watch the ever changing, magnificent skyline of New York City and surrounds. New Jersey is even gaining a notable view. A must for first-time visitors.
Amazing view!. It's hard to imagine that so many buildings, and sky scrapers would be on a relatively small island, but they are. Beautiful view from a distance.

Iconic Skyline. There are many great ways to view this iconic skyline, we saw it from Top of The Rock, Empire State and Circle Line City Cruise, all were spectacular and give a different perspective of the greatest skyline there is. Impressive by day and breathtaking at night you can't beat the views of this fabulous city and the people of New York are so friendly, if you never been all I can say is GO.

Wow. We saw the Manhattan skyline from Empire State Building and Top of the Rock at night. On a Circle Line full island cruise. From all perspectives the view is awesome. Get A New York Pass - you will get free access to those mentioned and lots more.We also chose a night cruise where you get views of SOL and Manhattan as the sun sets.We picked the Spirit of New York. Shame about the food.

Empire State and Top of the Rock. Go to the Top of the Rock in the daytime, the lines aren't that long and if you buy a CityPass (which I recommend) you walk right past the line for buying tickets and go on in. The Empire State Bld's lines are very long I am told but if you go at night (they are open till 2 am) No lines, No crowds

BEST SKYLINE WE HAVE EVER SEEN!. This is the place for viewing tall buildings! You can really see the skyline when you go down by Seaport Village near the East River and look back. Chicago has this perspective over on Museum Mile near the Art Institute of Chicago.

It's all about the view. We took the Circle Line Boat Tour, great way to get an overview of New York. See that fantastic Manhattan skyline. Guide knew his stuff and kept us entertained all the way round. Opportunities to take close up photos of Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn Bridge. Toilets were clean, which is unusual for a tour cruise. Highly recommended, a highlight of our New York trip.

Don't miss it!. If you're in New York you shouldn't miss the opportunity to have a look at the Manhattan Skyline. It's probably one of the most famous skylines in the world and I think the best time to look at it is in the evening when it's starting to turn dark.

Great, New York. Fantastic!. What a great idea! This is a fantastic way to make use of an old transport system. Not only is it peaceful and a great way to see New York, it is also a great alternative for pedestrians to get from one place to another. As far as it stretches. Hope it will continue to expand. :)

What can you say!. This is obvious - it has the wow factor every time, especially coming into town by cab from the airport, or seen from the water on a ferry. Photographed from every angle, including above!!

like in a movie. The manhattan skyline might be one of the most beautiful in the whole world. It's perfect and when you're there looking at it you feel like you're in a movie. A must see for everyone at any age!

oh!! what a treat to eyes. Forget nature for a moment and if you admire the marvel created by humans, Manhattan must be one of them, all the high rising towers with an unique innovation of construction architecture in each one of them it is a real treat to watch, best views are from Brooklyn side or from the Brooklyn bridge. Brooklyn bridge park Pier1 is one of the best places to watch the skyline, you often see photographers waiting in the evening times to get the picturesque view of Manhattan at the Sunset. you may also get a good view from the Brooklyn bridge itself, you may either take a subway to Brooklyn (High St) from New York, spend some time in the bridge park and then walk your way back to NY on the Brooklyn bridge or the reverse (walk from NY on the be\ridge, visit the park and take a subway to NY).

The atmosphere and lighting. The skyline is beautiful. The atmosphere is busy and full of people from all walks of life. It would have helped if the hotels had maps of the subway, Pennsylivian hotel did not
Stunning. A view to see from a Cruise liner, what a sight for sore eye and the Freedom tower is so dominant. fantastic

Lose yourself in serenity... Beautiful walk amongst plants, trees and flowers .. it's escapism and worth a visit. The walk is about 2 miles but you can exit at certain places or if you feel venturous continue and then walk back again - good exercise with scenery that you rarely get in a city.
Breathaking. Recommend the Semi circle line boat trip for a great view of all the iconic buildings and monuments.
Wow!. It you are not moved by this stunning skyline, you have no soul. A smorgasbord of concrete steel and glass - just beautiful.
Walked all over Manhattan. Enjoyed the skyline from within and also from the Brooklyn Bridge. Just breathtaking! Liked viewing the different skylines from the various parts of the city.
Amazing view.. This view is spectacular, we absolutely loved it. especially from over the lake in Central Park, we also loved the views from the top of the Empire State Building.

Amazing view. Great view if your seeing it from out on the water. So many different stories attached to the different buildings. The view is better at night if you like city lights of course but can be enjoyed at any time of day.

A view, the water, a walk. It is one of those quintessential things/places of NYC everyone must see. Best places to view: Brooklyn Promenade or from Astoria Park Waterfront in Queens. Boat trips are also a fun way to see it, but if you want to wander the city and see some more of the neighborhoods try the Promenade and Astoria. There's also the somewhat newly revamped DUMBO area of Brooklyn, that gives you the view nestled under a bridge . . . all good choices. Walk along the water's edge (well, as much as you can) and embrace the little view.

Awesome sight. The Manhattan skyline viewed from Dumbo, between the Brooklyn and Manhattan Bridges, is an awesome sight to behold especially when daylight fades, as the sun displays its splendours, and the city's bright lights are switched on against a dark velvet sky. Simply breath-taking!
Amazing. Watch out for neck pain :-) There is a lot of high and spectacular buildings! The skyline from the river is amazing.
Skyline. Enjoy the skyline doing a boat trip, from Liberty island or Ellis island. You don't need to go up to Liberty Statue to have a perfect view.

Great but enough?. The view from the rivers or the heights are impressive but one has to wonder how many more skyscrapers will be built. Surely even its granite foundations will start to sink eventually.

The most beautiful skyline in the world!. Ok fine, I haven't see the entire world, but after living in the city for several years I still often stops to take in the view. It is spectacular! walking across Brooklyn bridge or seeing it from Battery park, the water, a helicopter or plane or Brooklyn bridge park, it is a fantastic sight.

Beautiful. The skyline is absolutely beautiful, and breathe taking. It was not a disappointment at all. Those sunsets were amazing, the way the sun could peak between the buildings. It was so different from every angle .

Unbelievable! You have to see it in person!. The movies and television have shown many times the NYC skyline, but seeing it in person is much better. We visited the Top of the Rock in the GE building and took the Staten Island Ferry..both are a must for great views of NYC Skyline.

The Big City. New York is always wonderful and exciting to visit. There are so many things to see in Manhattan : The new Freedom Tower is beautiful, Times Square, Central Park. It is very different from other US cities because it really never sleeps ! Shopping, theaters, museums, restaurants, all in walking distance. You never get tired here ! There is so much to enjoy.

a pleasant skyline. The creation of such a skyline on the footsteps of old rails is a great idea and made very well. However, there are not enough shaded areas, important in summer days, and the view into the NY streets is of no interest. Go better to Central Parks.
Better than pictures!. No matter how many movies you've seen, songs you've heard - they can't compare to the real thing. Whether by night or by day, it remains impressive.

Buildings everywhere. The skyline defines New York City itself and there is no other like it on the rest of the planet. Beautifully designed buildings that are mixed with old to modern. Amazing to look at both day and night. An evening cruise on the Hudson river is a must to see all the lights from the many towers.
Love!. Absolutely lovely place! Take a subway to High st. and ypu are in another NYC. Quite and clear borrow with a fantastic view from Brooklyn Park.

Get away from the hustle bustle. NYC is crazy as everyone knows. But now you can get away from it and enjoy a leisurely walk in a park like setting. The walk way is located a couple stories above the street so the views are wonderful and the natural plantings are enjoyable to see. Take a boxed lunch and picnic right in the city.
DUH!. What really needs to be said about the Manhattan skyline? I have been here many times and it never gets old.
see it at night. Saw the lights twinkling across the river - magical. Try to get a distance away was well for a different view
Amazing. Amazing old building mixed with new ones. Just like imagined from watching movies etc. Best photos from on boats either round harbour or going to liberty

Viewed from the ESB.. Nothing to dislike; all good. Viewed from the top-most floor of the ESB...........Paid that litle cit extra to ge to the top of the Empire State to view skyline. Large murals of the workers who helped construct the building.

THE skyline!. Day or night the skyline is an incredible sight from wherever you view this be it Staten Island ferry or the Empire State. You can't go wrong and can never take a bad picture from whatever angle you view as you will always capture something different.
like a picture you already saw!. When you go to statue of liberty by boat you get a nice view at the skyline - the same as you already saw on pictures from new york.
Manhattan skyline. Best view of the skyline was from Liberty Island. Pay $18 for the Statue cruise. It is definitely worth it. View from the Empire State Building not bad either.
NYC from the top. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful, be it from the Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building, it is pretty amazing.

like wow!. Amazing city, easily the best I have ever been to. If you can't find what you want in NYC, it surely can't exist?
It is called the city that never sleeps for a reason though, not the place to go id you wish to relax...
Top of the Rock. go to Top of the Rock at the Rockefeller Centre rather than Empire State Building. There are no line ups! The view is wonderful, especially of central park.

breathtaking view. To see the breathtaking view of Manhattan skyline , i take the Staten ferry before the sun rises or when its about to sundown.It is just beautiful.Perfect for pictures too! Besides, the ferry is free.

Just As You'd Expect. The Manhattan Skyline can be viewed from many different vantage points, but perhaps the most memorable is the night view. We've looked back at it (& towards it) from the Staten Island Ferry (free), from Ellis Island and from the Queen Mary, as we cruised to Southampton from NYC. It's just exactly as you see it in the movies! I also like to think of the 'old' view that immigrants saw when they first arrived on ships - it must have been as thrilling then, as it is now, although not as crowded!
Poignant and magnificent. The best view of the lower Manhattan skyline is from Governors Island, a couple of dollars fare ride on the ferry.
Iconic. What can I say, it's the Manhattan skyline. It's been in so many movies and it continues in spite of the attempt to destroy it.
View from Boat. Took a boat trip to Staten Island and Ellis Island. We had a really fantastic view of the Manhattan Skyline from the boat. What a wonderful sight.
Breathtaking.... Need you say anything more about the Manhattan Skyline?? It is a view we could never tire of. Night or day, it's always picture perfect.
Amazing. well worth a walk along the skyline. Fab views of the streets below. What a clever idea. Also nice and much quieter then on the crouded pavement below !

Breath Taking. No matter how many times the skyline comes into view my breath is taken away. It could be from the Lincoln Tunnel, the George Washington Bridge or from Jersey Transit. Even the view from the Tappan Zee Bridge is awesome on a clea day
Liberty State Park, NJ. Its a fantastic panoramic view over manhattan from from Liberty State Park, New Jersey. try to go when the sun goes down ...

Good but not the best in the world. Although the Manhattan skyline is pretty good, I wouldn't say it was the best in the world.We viewed it from Brooklyn bridge and also Liberty Island, but for us it did not compare to Hong Kong from the Avenue of stars or Shanghai from The Bund, but of course this is just our view, you may think differently when you see it.
So iconic the memory will stay with you forever. Wherever you see the view it will leave you mesmerised. The staten island ferry gives you a free and unobstructed view of the whole of manhatton.

Incredible. There is simply nothing like it anywhere. Look at the skyline from Brooklyn Bridge Park, Governor's Island, Wall Street, Ellis Island, take the Circle Line, there is a dinner cruise or -- just look up. It is astounding. Come to New York and experience how culturally nuanced the city experience is and then -- it really is incredible.
Great views but a bit of a wait.. Had to book in and had an hour and a half wait but worth it in the end. Great views of Manhattan and the city lights at night are amazing.
The land of the skyscraper. From any vantage point and any time of day, the skyline is amazing. Would recommend the view from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Circle Tour sight-seeing boat.
Can't Be Beat. From the top of the Rock or Empire State Building, or from a ferry going around the island, you simply can't beat the view. Plain and simple.
unforgettable. I could stare over at you beautiful NYC until the sun goes down - oh wait.. now youre even more beautiful. Thank you Brooklyn for having one of the best views in the world!

overrated. I first saw about this in fox traveller channel in India and when I visited US now, I made sure my friend takes me here!
Honestly was expecting a bigger walkpath!
It was good in its own way... But was a lil disappointed :) cant say why...
Amazing. Don't forget while in NYC to step away from the city so you an get a feel for the magnitude. What a site!! We got a good look at it from Liberty Island. Breathtaking!
Wow. I have been coming to New York for many years and have watched the skyline change over the years, the best and cheapest way to get the best views are from the Staten Island Ferry.

New York at its best!. New York at night and from a high spot! This is what you want! This is quintessential New York and something that I want to do every time I am in New York. Could be a floor top bar or restaurant, could be a good location outside Manhattan or (if you are really lucky) the apt of friends in New York: grab a glass of wine and stare at what is in front of you...unforgettable! unmissable!
Madness in Manhattan. What is there not to like here? Overwhelming from the sky, the sea and on land. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge for great views.

It's stunning, exceptional and unforgetable. Not much to write here... Everybody must see it with no exceptions! During sunrise, daylight, sunset, night - it's STUNNING 24/7 no matter when You look on it. Will stay in Your memory probably for life...
What can I say?. It was as if I was watching a movie. I literally keep saying to my husband, "This is just like you see in the movies!"

Great view. Well we were on the Jersey side so we saw it alot. I cycled along the Jersey Shore, took the ferry then cycled along the Manhatten bike route.We also took the ferry to Staten Island and the view was great.
Breathtaking. We saw the Manhattan skyline from many vantage points and each time it was breathtaking. See it from tour buses, Liberty Island, a Circle Line Tour. You won't get tired of it.

Stunning. What a sight to see....simply amazing. During the approach to LaGuardia, you can see great views of the skyline from the window. As the ferry leaves Manattan on the way to the Statue of Liberty, the views of lower Manhattan are also great. Don't forget to go to the Top of the Rock to see fabulous views of the city.

Best Viewed from New Jersey. Based on previous reviews, we stayed in Edgewater, NJ and had a magnificant view of the West side of NYC and the skyline under a variety of conmditions and lighting. The ferries, which ruin every 10 minutes, make the commute to mid-town Manhattan effortless and the ticket includes free transfers to four local buses that will deliver you almost anywhere within lower Manhattan.

Full of art, mystery, and adventure!. I loved how there's so much art to see and interpret! Nothing has a name on it, therefore it's completely up to your imagination. It's a pretty long walk, but there's so much to see. I would recommend going at night, because of all the lights and you can see the ghosts in the window of the hotel. ;) Yes, ghosts, it's quite funny actually. At first they look like people in bathrobes staring at you as you walk, but they're holograms.

Beautiful!. What's not to like about the NYC skyline? From the first glimpse of it seen from an airplane window to seeing it from the Empire State observation deck or the Statue of Liberty or just sitting in Central Park, it is an amazing view. There is nothing like seeing it in person!

360 Spectacular view. At the 86th level of Empire State building,You can see panoramic view of NYC and Skyline that you would never imagine before. Booking in advance with fast pass ticket,you will not to wait in a very long cue. Don't forget to bring your jacket and camera,very windy and cold up there. Very good time is before sunset till night seen after sunset.
Amazing!. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful. We saw it from the top of the Empire State Building, Central Park, and the Statue of Liberty. It is breathtaking!!
Manhattan Skyline. By day or by night the skyline is breath-takingly beautiful. City sights hop on hop off buses is a great way to see the skyline and the city!
Trip to Statue of Liberty. Fantastic views of Mnhattan from the ferry to the Island and also from the pedastall at the Statue. The skyline view is well worth the trip alone.
NYC Fabulous as Ever !. With the last of the snow for the season still on the ground, it made for a beautiful trip, especially since the sun was out for most of our trip.
Overwhelming city skyline in the world!. Top city skyline in the world can say, to its overwhelming volume and height of cormmercial buildings, night loght view too!
What a view. The skyline is such a nice view from almost any location. When you see it from a ferry or from one of the other vantage points, it's just breathtaking.
Manhattan Skyline is unique in the world. The tall buildings in different shapes are simply awesome. One can see many famous building of Hollywood films in this area. This is worth visiting place.
In real so much better than on tv ;-). Very impressed sitting on the grass in Brooklyn Heights Promenade and seeing what you have seen a million times before on TV but this time for real.

Worth a look. More like an advert for New York, almost like a virtual tour, you sit in a seat which moves, so you can say it was an experience!
Its free with the New York Pass, so worth doing if you have purchased that.

Magnificent Skyline. Awe-inspiring, amazing, and absoluely beautiful to look at. My love and I were very blessed to be in NYC as a cool front came through and cleared out unseasonable heat and humidity. The clearing out left and absolutely great opportunity to take pics.
Hugely impressive!. Brilliant, well worth a trip to NYC. Lived up to expectation and didn't disappoint, well worth investigating your time!

Take the water taxi and your camera or cell phone. Get on the water taxi at Pier 79 and you can go around the tip of Manhattan and out around the Statue of Liberty. Great views of the skyline from various angles. See my review of Water Taxi.

Empire states building. Superb, so many interesting facts about this tower as you go up the first lift to the 80th floor, loads of old photos of it being built. You go up another 6 floors you get to the viewing deck. Be prepared to be blown away by the views. Worth the $25
Great for a walkabout. Good for picture for memory during evening, esp if you are on the ferry ride to The Statue of Liberty!
a VIEW. It always been a touristic place and unfortunately only gets worst.I personally believe in a better quality rather bigger qvantity

New York at it´s best. The Manhatten Skyline is a must see for every New York visitor. There are different points where it can be seen very good: e.g a trip with the Staten Island Ferry, liberty island or a sightseeing trip with one of the ships. Also it is very well known from pictures it is impressive to see it by one self.

Fantastic view. We stayed at the Hyatt Regency Jersey on the Hudson in May which is located on a pier over the Hudson River. Across from us was the Manhattan skyline which is just an incredible view. No matter what the weather!

a must for anyone visiting new york. it was wonderful from the start to the finish... it takes some walking and I have great problems... but there are so many resting benches and seats.. no problem....

Stunning!. The Manhattan Skyline is so familiar, even for NY first-timers, that it is like looking at an old friend. So many iconic buildings to pick out, so many places to view from. Three views really struck me: Liberty Island, top of the Rock and for a more unusual view, along the bridle path north of the reservoir in Central Park.

Breath taking!. It's Manhattan! Amazing! Wonderful to stare at the beautiful skyline. The mix of architecture, sky and water is like no where else. No twin towers, sadly but Liberty tower is breath taking.

jf kennedy blvd east weehawken--BEST PLACE to overlook manhattan. no view of the city from in the city or queens or brooklyn will compare to the manhattan skyline from weehaweken NJ. more specifically old glory park, donnelly memorial park, are great places to bring a lunch and picnic or just for a stroll and definitely photos.take the little jitney bus across from the ny/nj port authority bus terminal north side of 42nd street between 8th and 9th avenues. they are running at $3 now. (realize this is NOT a luxury coach ride or even as "good" as a typical city bus. people talk loudly to each other or on mobile phones, the music will frequently be blasting reggaeton or merenge and unless you love that music, you will want to gouge your ears off. and the ride is jerky and super uncomfortable, but for some will be worth the convenience and might be worth the urban cultural experience--sort of :-)http://www.jerseyjitneys.info/?page_id=30the more "suitable" option, but a bit less convenient is the NJT bus inside the port authority. takes some good gate navigation skills for each route but there are customer service desks both at the north and south buildings. these ones don't run as often or as late. the routes are 23, 128, 159, 165, 166, and 168 but check with ticketing or customer services inside the NY/NJ port authority terminal. cost now is $3.25 possibly went up recently.
Just beautiful. What more can be said about the NYC skyline? I mean, it is really beautiful! First time there since 9/11, so not seeing the twin towers did cause me to reflect back to that day.

Must see the day and night view. This is why I want to be in NYC,to see the skyline. There are a lot of places to see it,from Brooklyn Bridge,Long Island City but the best is from the water. If you join Statue cruise to visit Ellis Island,there will be a good place to capture it.

There is only "1" Manhattan!. NYC history everyone knows of. The Manhattan skyline is unique, of course. It's best viewed from 2 vantage points. First, take the ferry between the lower tip of Manhattan and Staten Island. It's free, would you believe? On a nice sunny afternoon, your eyes will absorb not only the beautiful lower part of Manhattan island. You'll see the Statue of Liberty from not too far (of course, the Statue should be viewed up close, via another ferry from the lower tip of the island, which will cover also other spots including an immigration hall, etc.). The skyline can/should also be viewed from the Brooklyn Heights area across from the downtown Brooklyn Bridge area. It's a short subway ride away.

911 preview. Went there Saturday, private entry for corporate sponsors. I enjoyed the memorial .exhibitis, brought tears to my eyes. Seeing different items of people including those from policeman,fireman, Employees who escaped the horror , reminded me of that day in America. It really touched me ; personal items displayed was well organized. I like the steel beams from the tower, the slurry wall, the quilt , the schist rock- the bedrock of NYC. Give yourself 3hours to walk and digest the exhibits.Very charged experience. We will never forget,

What's not to like?. So many different views from many different locations. I came home with a ton of pictures. Of course, most of the time the sky was blue and you could see for miles. Beautiful buildings and architecture...Brooklyn Bridge..so lovely.

its the best place to share a dream. been around the world several times, still NYC offers a taste of it all w/o leaving the country. Sure the lines are long (16 Million people there) but so are the shared memories>>>>>>>>>> See it from the NJ side

An excellent view. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge from Manhattan and ended up on the Brooklyn promenade to see the Manhattan skyline from a different perspective. The trek across the bridge is a lovely walk on a nice day and you see the skyline from different perspectives the further you get towards Brooklyn, Once down on the promenade you can visit the Ice Cream Factory and just sit and admire the views before taking the NY water taxi or ferry back which is what we did. Recommend seeing the Manhattan skyline for all visitors to NYC.

Catch the view. Get to the top of almost any building in Manhattan and you'll have a fab view. You could take the time (and face the tourists) by waiting on line for a trip to the top of the Empire State Building...but, there are many other venues available.Try the Chrysler Building, for example.Be aware that you'll be swamped with tourists...but if that's your thing, then enjoy!

Breathing view on a beautiful day. When taking a bus from NYC out of the Port of Authority, I have to make sure that I'm sitting on the side that I can view the NYC Skyline. I envy all those who live in New Jersey by the Hudson River who get to see it every day.

Stunning, one of a kind.. The manhattan skyline is a majestic view and varies from place to place. From Hoboken or jersey city it's the Hudson miracle landing area and the buildings are most beautiful you can see the Empire State Building, the Chrysler building, freedom tower, battery park city....... From the Staten Island ferry, you come up on the tip of the island and you can see the freedom tower. The east side is viewed from the BQE or Brooklyn heights and you can get an angle of the UN, apartment buildings and city hall ......it's a sight that you can readily identify.
Manhattan Skyline. Stayed in Manhatten but went on Harbour Cruise plus dinner. Fantastic night and great photo opportunity with the Manhatten Skyline at night plus the bonus.....Statue of Liberty

The BEST. One of the best views is from Roosevelt Island. Take the tram (a cool, cool way to travel) from 59th Street and 1st Avenue. Once over there, start walking and the entire city awaits you. Best view of the UN building and midtown.Another great view is from Brooklyn Heights. This gives you all of lower Manhattan, Brooklyn Bridge, etc. There is a lovely promenade over looking the city and on a warm summer evening, strolling the promenade as the lights turn on...oh my. It's why I live here, my friends.

Love Manhattan Skyline. Was in a training at Long Island City all of last week and we had the most amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline. WE had a long wall of glass overlooking the river and the skyline.We saw the bridge, Roosevelt Island and tram as well as the industrial part of that view. We always left before it got dark, so didn't get to appreciate the bright lights and all...but was still lovely all the same.Everyone should see this - at least once in their lifetime. Come to New York everyone! I also saw in Grand Central Terminal a picture with a quote that said...'a bad day in NY is better than a good day anywhere else'...I agree!!

Love Manhattan Skyline. Was in a training at Long Island City all of last week and we had the most amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline. WE had a long wall of glass overlooking the river and the skyline.We saw the bridge, Roosevelt Island and tram as well as the industrial part of that view. We always left before it got dark, so didn't get to appreciate the bright lights and all...but was still lovely all the same.Everyone should see this - at least once in their lifetime. Come to New York everyone! I also saw in Grand Central Terminal a picture with a quote that said...'a bad day in NY is better than a good day anywhere else'...I agree!!
totally awesome. Better by night than by day but totally awesome iconic yet a feeling that you must take that picture

Experiensing Manhattan Skyline. Hello, I was amazed by the beauty of the Skyline from the backside of the ferry to the Island. Standing there in the sunshine with kind breeze in my hair and salty drops of seawater gently hitting my face, gave me an unforgettable 4D memory.

best in the world!. Not just because I am from the area, the lights, neon, shapes of the various skyscrapers, you just can see it coming from a distance and get excited, like going to OZ! It is compact, and magic at night.the bridges light up, the streams of taxis.the only thing, I miss is the skyline is not the same without the twin towers.

A must see!. No trip to NYC is complete w/out a view of the skyline. Some of the best views are actually from the JERSEY boardwalk in Jersey City. You can easily get there on the PATH train. However, if going to Jersey is not something you want to do, try catching the view from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. You get an up close view of the skyline and it is absolutely AMAZING!

Right out of the movies!. I have been chauffeured over the Queensborough bridge many times at different hours of the day but my favorite is at night so I can take in the lit up NYC skyline. It is truly amazing. One glimpse and you know you are about to have so many life changing experiences. Just taking about it now is making me wanna book a flight outta here. Hopefully I will see you again real soon my old friend.

The Very Best!. See the Manhatten Syline from a variety of vantage points - The Statue of Liberty is one of the best; also, The Top of the Rock and Empire State Building give tremendous views as well. The very best skyline in the world!

A great view. Nice to be able to walk and see Manhattan from a different angle, but it still gets busy so don't expect to race along! A great idea and one which NYC deserves a great pat on the back for. I hope other cities follow the example and invest money in similar regeneration projects.

Why would you travel without seeing this. The one thing that makes New York is its skyline. The view is spectacular. Knowing there are millions of people milling about is breathtaking. There are multiple ways of seeing the skyline, and it is ever present when in the middle of it. Taking a step back and looking at it is one sight you won't soon forget.I highly recommend finding a spot listed in the various reviews to view the skyline.

Fantastic Sight. Seen from my Hilton Times Square hotel room, the Empire State Building and Statten Island Ferry - from whichever angle the skyline is not one to forget. You just want to keep looking.
Wow. You cannot fail to be impressed by the skyline of New York. Colourful and exciting. Buildings to impress anybody

Manhattan Skyline - what a view. We had our best views of the Manhattan Skyline when we took the Staten Cruises ferry over to Liberty Island for our tour of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. When you are standing on the Liberty Island looking back across the water there are the most amazing views of the skyline and photo opportunities. To see the new Freedom Tower is incredible and to recognise the view from so many films. Certainly recommend this.
breathtaking. beautiful from the Staten Island ferry in the sunshine. Lovely to see all the iconic buildings and the new World Trade Centre from across the Hudson River.

Awesome View!. We saw the skyline on our way out to the Statue of Liberty. It was one of the best ways to see this awesome skyline! We could also see the Brooklyn Bridge on our way out to the Statue of Liberty. Very awesome thing to see and totally recommend you check it out if you have the chance!!

Go across to Hoboken, NJ for the best views!. While exploring Manhattan on foot amid the tall skyscaper is an experience within itself; seeing the beautiful skyline from afar gives you a different perspective and leaves you in awe!There are primarily two ways to do seeing the Manhattan skyline and one of them is when you are doing a ferry ride tour of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Most tourist undertake this tour, so its pretty easy to go about with it. When you are on the Liberty Island (which hosts the Statue of Liberty), go across from behind the statue facing New York City and you will h(ave some nice views. You can also get the views when you are on the ferry and depending on where you are seated (on the outside deck ofcourse) you could be facing it either while departing NY or on your return journey. However, given that these ferries run only during daytime, you may want to see its during the night time too when it is beautifully lit.For this purpose, I would recommend that you go across from Manhattan to Hoboken (a part of New Jersey state). You can either take a "New Jersey Transit" train from New York Penn Station or you can also the "New York Waterway" from midtown Manhattan. I would recommend the later since it throws you right into the perfect place to take in the views at night and the area is good for a stroll too. Incase you are into photography, there are some perfect spots there too for long-exposure photography and you would not want to miss the beautifully lit skyline of Manhattan from here.There are some nice cafe and dining out places too right by the coastline and if you are a fan of "Cake Boss" then do check out his exclusive bakery / cafe here for a quick bite of celebrity food!

Whatever. Its overrated, hyped and not worth the stay. Smelly, fake people, poor or expensive shopping, buildings are just tall. Dont go as a tourist, spend your money on real people and good shopping and lovely sights - travel most of Greece, London, Oslo, Mallorca, Mallaga .. and relax ! Be friendly !
We saw the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. It was a great way to see the Manhattan Skyline from the water. We loved the view of the Statue of Liberty. Took lots of pictures. The ride is FREE.
Wow! What a view!. Unforgettable!Seen from various places - always amazing - but highly recommend the view from a boat!

This is New York City. Saw it on the end of New Jersey side. We were there on a cloudy night, not much to see except for the bright lights illuminated from the buildings in NYC. It is a completely different aspect of view and we are glad to have witnessed it even though the scenery was a bit obstructed by the fog.
Nice skyline. Best photographed from the Statue of Liberty ferry as well as the Brooklyn Bridge - great architecture

Night time view. view from empire state building was amazing
the q to get in was another story two hours wait
the view of the skyline from the boat was also great
Spectacular!. The Skyline from every vantage point is breathtaking...I suggest viewing from the empire state building at night.

The Big Apple!. Traffic is heavy and continuous. Very crowded but only to be expected here. Everything is dwarfed by the buildings but hey this is New York and was everything we expected it to be. Go with an open mind and you will not be disappointed.

Makes you feel like an ant. When you see the Manhattan skyline from afar it makes you realise just how small you are in this city. The view is spectacular and breathtakingly beautiful - you just can't get enough of it. Some great places to view the skyline are from the Brooklyn Bridge or the Staten Island ferry. Both give you great views and both are completely free!
Simply the Best. We have viewed this from the Empire State, The Rock and way back from the top of the Twin Towers. At night you can't beat the view from River Cafe across in Brooklyn
Wonderful view. It's really a very nice view . Need to bring your camera to capture the beautiful manhattan skyline .
Views of NY. Top of the Rock during the day. Empire state late afternoon and wait for the sun to go down! Great views from Hudson Bay cruise and back from Liberty Island.
skyline. manhattan skyline for us was best viewed on the brooklyn side of brooklyn bridge. great view and good atmosphere
Always inspiring. The skyline of New York is changing with so much building going on, but it's always inspiring and beautiful
Great Architecture. Every street and park in Manhattan provides a fantastic photograph. The skyline is unique and gorgeous.
NYC Skyline. What is not to like about the most famous skyline in the world. Viewing it from different areas you almost feel like you are looking at a movie set.
Nothing like it!. i recommend taking a cruise around the island to get some good shots of the skyline from various vantage points!

Why it is famous in the world. Manhattan Skyline is truly amazing. I've seen it from many movies, photos. But, when I get a eyewitness. It is more than imagination: majestic in order. You will have many great views from many directions: Brooklyn bridge, from the ferry to Liberty Island and top of Empire State Building

Imposingly beautiful!. Even though the weather wasn't that great, it was Worth the effort. i took the view from the Harbour front in Brooklyn. I got the full height and breadth of this famous concrete jungle.... breathtaking, imposing and beautiful to look at.
What a view !!. We saw the Manhattan skyline from the Empire State Building Observation Deck. It was amazing! What a city! We loved it! Thank you NYC!

Picture perfect. It was raining and late and I was tired and my friends dragged me to see the manhattan skyline from queens. It was worth it. It was beautiful. You need to go to see it at night. It looks like constellations.
Take a walk across the Brooklyn bridge. Great photo opportunity, you can get the Statue of Liberty in the background. Take the train to Brooklyn and walk back to the world trade center

Wow looks great day or night. Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn Bridge park to look back at Manhattan skyline was great. The free Staten Island Ferry is another great way to see the skyine for free. Going on Helicopter tour give you a different view of the city skyline. We ate at the Waters Edge restaurant in queens at night the sky line is amazing and you also have good view of the Queensbro 59th bridge.

View from the ferry across the Hudson River. While New York City's skyline is impressive no matter where you see it from, I would like to suggest an easy and cheap opportunity for looking at the Midtown section: Take the commuter ferry across the Hudson River between the NY Waterway terminal (on W39th Street, just north of the Javits Convention Center) and the Port Imperial Blvd on the New Jersey side.
Nothing like it.. I love Boston, San Francisco, Toronto and most of the other big cities, but there is nothing like New York.

A top 100 bucket list must. Incredible views not to be missed there is no where else like it in the world make sure you see it walking across the Brooklyn bridge and from the top of the rocker feller centre!
A Very Different World. I liked it, we liked the differences in architecture, the old with the new.It was difficult to see the base of a building then the top, what else could it be?
Beautiful. For different skyline views try the Brooklyn Heights Promenade area or in Williamsburg the park along the water!
Always a new thing to discover. This city is ever-changing and so dynamic! There is always a new feature but ESB and Chrysler still rule..

Viewed from the ferry...WOW!. This view can be enjoyed from the New York waterways ferry to port imperial ...these ferry operators were the guys who saved the passengers from the plane that landed on the Hudson River when the engine failed some years ago. The trip is a normal commuter route so not a tourist attraction in the usual sense but allows you to see all the famous sights including Chrysler tower, Empire State Building and Statue of Liberty. A must do trip when you go to NYC.

Picture Perfect!. Loved the look of the skyline from the Statue of Liberty cruise. Something straight out of a photo. Don't miss the chance! the free Staten Island Ferry will also afford a terrific view!
nice walk. It is a nice place to walk. I would avoid the weekends as it tends to be very very crowded. You get a great view of the Hudson River .

Incredible from any angle. New York's skyline is impressive no matter where you see it from. On the flight/drive in, be sure to keep your eyes open. It is spectacular to watch it grow on the horizon. Some will say it's best viewed from the south/east/etc, but there is something for anyone no matter which angle you catch it (including from directly below!).
Stunning!. Having seen this amazing view in many tv shows and films I was thrilled to finally see it in person. Amazing!
Manhattan a must. Was breathtaking especially taking the ferry to the statue of Liberty island. It was spectacular to see one to treasure.
Phenomenal. We saw the Manhattan skyline from the New York Water Taxi, it's truly a sight to behold and a must-see for anyone visiting New York.

ya think???. i'm a Jersey boy - i've lived here for 50 years, but always 15 minutes from the city. i've gone into manhattan 3 times a week for the last 30 years…and every time I look at the skyline my heart starts to race just a bit. this is it!!! there is nothing like it! yes - hong kong looks cool, and shanghai is interesting…but there is only one real skyline - and that is Manhattan!!!
Awesome. The skyline is mesmerizing. I have seen it everyday for the last two years and never was i left with a feeling other than wow!

Awe-inspiring skyline. I've seen this skyline hundreds of times in movies and photos, but seeing it in person is really an awesome experience. Moreover, when you're walking amongst them, they're so tall that you lose sight of the tallest like the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, and Freedom Tower.
Fantastic. you have seen the photos but the real things still takes your breath away!great views from the ferry to Liberty Island and top of Empire State Building

Iconic, doesn't disappoint!!. We were able to enjoy the Manhattan skyline from a variety of different vantage points. Brooklyn Heights Promenade is a great place to walk around and enjoy the view. There are also benches along the way if you want to just sit & take in all of the sights. We also took a water taxi which is a wonderful way to see all of the Manhattan skyline & get acquainted with the city. We also went to the Top of the Rock where you can get fabulous shots of central park and the empire state building, just to name a few. The new Freedom Tower makes the Iconic skyline look whole again. On my first trip to New York we took the Staten Island ferry & got some great pictures of Manhattan as well.

One of the world's most iconic skylines... Everyone has seen the Manhattan skyline; whether it's in our favourite movies, travel books or beamed across TVs around the world one unfortunate September day. Nothing quite beats seeing it from Top of the Rock Observation Deck though! There are many great ways to see New York's amazing skyline. Our favourite was Top of the Rock, as it best catches the endless sea of skyscrapers - from Central Park, Midtown Manhattan to the Financial District. It also provides the perfect photo opportunity for the impressive Empire State Building (something you can't do from Empire State itself!).New York is home to so many architectural marvels, it really is worthwhile making the effort to appreciate the Manhattan skyline in full. Other places we enjoyed views of it included the Statue of Liberty (especially of Financial District, home to NYC's tallest building - One World Trade Center) and of course, from the air flying into LaGuardia!
Awesome. A unique experience unlike anything experienced across the world previously. You could just stand and look for hours and hours.
Awesome!. It doesn't matter whether you view the skyline from the Rock; The Empire State Building; a helicopter; a cruise boat; from Brooklyn; during the daytime or at night, it is always amazing!
The most photographed city in the world. I've been to hundreds of cities and nothing is quite as special as the skyline of NYC. It has that combination of huge and modern with historic and charm.
Not to be missed. great views from the Circle Line cruise ferries on Hudson River and from the ferries out to the Statue of Liberty

Awesome. No other skyline in the world then what new York has to offer
One of the places too see Before you die
A mist forthose to go to NY. Prefer to see the skyline from Yop of thr Rock. It is an unobstructed view of the whole city. I lioked it more from there than the Empire State Building. TRy iy!
A very fine view!. For the best Manhattan skyline view, I recommend to visit the liberty island by ferry and have a look from there for the classic new york city skyline photograph!

Magical....and free. Stayed in NJ and watched the lights from the ferries and restaurants in Edgewater.....the best. There's an outside deck at a restaurant at Port Imperial thats worth a visit just to see the skyline... sushi looks good!
Breathtaking.... Though we are also from a Nice place in this world... Manhattan is Manhattan.. Do a heli tour if you van, and taste THE feeling...

The best and most recognisable skyline in the world. Brooklyn bridge is a good vantage point or indeed anywhere on the Brooklyn waterfront. We didn't take a boat or helicopter (wife doesn't travel well) but I would imagine they would be the best views.

Unbeatable views. An endless skyline of sky scrapers. Whether you see it from the New Jersey side or the Brooklyn side this view is amazing and well worth the side trip off Manhattan Island to take it in.

the original and best. other cities may have it but this is the one with history and style ! I Lower Manhattan from Brooklyn is the best view and if you time your visit for dusk then you get to see the colors change and the lights come on. watching a New York movie will never the the same again !

a romantic camino. It's fun, romantic, adventures and many colors. Make sure you are not hungry when you are walking in NY. eat first and then start walking to discover this amazing city. The Manhattan Skyline is magic and very creative. Also make sure you walk the Skyline with someone you really like it.

Great experience. Cannot recommend highy enough having a trip ofer New York in helicopter.
It's not as scary as imagined and a great way to take in the sights.

Well worth a visit. It is amazing to feel like you are standing on top of the whole of Manhattan Island and the views are breathtaking. It is humbling to look out over a bustling city and see everything below as small as ants. If you are in New York, you must visit this!

Top of the Rock. This is a "must do!" I have seen it both in the daylight and at night. I can't really say which one is best, because both have their advantages. I would say the night skyline is breathtaking!
Loved it. Saw this from new jersey and was great...PF Chang is also close by for you foodies..it was a great day
Thrilling!. Wow! Amazing skyline, and is beautiful to look at, especially during sunset. It is unbelievable to see these magnificent structures so high in the air!
Water Taxi. A must to have a tour at night on the water to see NY skyline.Info on tour done with humour and with historical facts.

Try it from the Brooklyne bridge. The bridge is beautiful as it is. But it has the walking spake over the cars moving. So, jump to the Brooklyne and then walk across the bridge. Pay attention to the story of the bridge

Iconic view of an iconic city. Whether walking across the Brooklyn Bridge , going to the top of the Empire state Building at midnight, take in the view from the Top Of The Rock during the day , the city looks magnificent.

Go see the skyline....its beautiful; take time!. We usually go to the Marriott Marquis and go to the restaurant on the top, it revolves and in 45 min you can see the entire city of new York; you do not have to buy a meal but can order a drink and a simple salad or appetizer. The napkins have a diagram and your waitress or waitor will show you where you are then and you can see all of the harbor lights and buildings; it is one of my favorite ways to see the Chrysler building; my favorite!
