Gave a real feel for the scale of the city. We saw this via the Staten Island ferry and while windy and cold, we managed to get great views both inside and outside of the ferry. It does get busy though so find a good spot and don't let go of it!

Simply unique!. On top of Empire State or Rockefeller, you see the most impressive man made structure on Earth.
being down on the ground and feel the city's vibe is even better.
Get up very early, if you want to go on top of one of the viewing platforms, else yous pend hours in line !

Breathtaking view!!!. Spot a view from any angle; from across the hudson or from high up in the air, the skyline never ceases to astonish.. The best city skyline I have ever seen. Don't miss the helicopter ride.

Can't beat these views. Breathtaking! I've seen the skyline from different places and at different times of day, but nothing beats the views from the Brooklyn bridge, crossing on a sunny day from Manhattan to Dumbo.
take a ferry trip with circle line for this view. The Tour guide was very knowledgeable about the area, and came out with some very historical facts about the area and Statin Island.
Breathtaking. If you are not impressed you never will be! Walk over Brooklyn Bridge and check out the view from Dumbo.
Breath taking night. Went to Top of the Rock, and got some great views. Get tickets in advance to avoid a long wait. I enjoyed the nighttime view.

Beautiful from every angle. Wherever you go in NY, you have different ways of experiencing the Manhattan Skyline.We took a helicopter tour, a cruise top of the Rock, Empire State building, the High Line, Brooklyn Bridge, the Brooklyn bank.You could claim it is always the same set of buildings,but the different places you look from, the different weather, the different time of day sunset, midday, at night make each view different and unique.Explore it as much as you can!
Everything you expected of this iconic view!. It was great to see it for real and not just on a TV show and it was every bit as fabulous as I was hoping it would be.
Grayline tour of the city. We hired the Grayline Sightseeing bus for 72 hrs and it was awesome. The night tour especially was beautiful and informative.

Of course a "must see" when in New York. We have seen the Manhattan skyline on two different ferry cruises. the first was on the Circle Line full island cruise - brilliant views of every part of the New York Islands as you do the full circuit of Manhattan Island. We then did the Statue Crusies trip to Liberty and Ellis Islands. The boats are crowded and is hopeless trying to get photos on the top deck. It is not so bad from the back of the first deck. The views of the skyline from Ellis Island are superb. It really is a must seen on a visit to New York.

best skyline view. Every New Yorker and most probably every guest has their opinion on the best view of Manhattan skylie. For me the best view was from New Jersey and we have tried all the different angles. Worth making the trip if you're staying on the other side of the river.
best skyline. choose a clearly day to go up ESB and TOR (And not windy). Sunset is awesome and late at night is a good experience as well.

Always impressive. Just visited the NYC auto show and, as usual, had to snap a few pix of the skyline. Its always so impressive and enjoyable. BTW, if you are in the are of the Javitts Convention center and want a clean, reasonably price, café style meal visit the Sunac foods market on 11th ave and 42nd st. I don't think you will be disappointed.

Iconic. Get a great view of the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge by taking the train to Brooklyn and walking back into Manhattan across the bridge. Another great view can be seen from taking the ferry to and from Staten Island.
Just Amazing!. The Manhattan skyline lets you behold the most amazing city in the world! I recommend it to anyone who visits the New York city!

The skyline never disappoints!. I have done them all..I grew up in Manhattan and now visit the city every chance I get. Just did Top of the Rock for the first time...cool to see the Empire State Building from this perspective. Statue of Liberty and new World Trade Center Bldg in distance. It all depends on the weather but well worth the $$$

A fantastic but equally sobre moment. Best way to see the skyline is by ferry - and there are several options - we chose a guided tour which included a ferry from Battery Park to The Statue of Liberty passing under Brooklyn Bridge!The other option is to go up The Rock - Rockefeller Centre. Chose to go an hour before sunset - this way you can witness an amazing sunset and see the NYC Skyline lit up.

COULD LOOK AT THIS FOREVER. Where ever you are – top of the Rock, Empire State, Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry or just walking the streets looking up – there is so so much to see. Wonderful day and night!

Truly Amazing!. Just has that wow factor! Whether viewed from top of the Rock or Empire, from a bus, Brooklyn Bridge or ferry it's just fantastic. Wore the camera out! My absolute favourite was seeing it from the ferry.

I look forward to this sight everytime I return home. If you call New York home, every time you return to the City, you likely get a little misty eyed when this skyline comes into view. It's an iconic sight, even after we lost the Twin Towers which anchored Manhattan at it's Southern end. Happily, you don't have to spend a lot of money to see it. A few good places to savor it are: Jersey City's Liberty Park; the inexpensive Staten Island Ferry; the Circle Line; any bridge over the East River including the Brooklyn Bridge; the Brooklyn waterfront; Long Island City... to name just a few.
Go To Brooklyn .... Catch the 2,3,4 or 5 to Borough Hall, Brooklyn. Walk down Montegue Street (TD Bank on the corner). Keep going until you hit the Prom ... then take a photo.

From Distance. As Machiavelli told us, that you have to climb the mountains to recognice the valley and move to the valley to learn about mountains: Hop to Brooklyn or to Jersey for the great view at the Manhattan skyline!

See the Manhattan Skyline from the Rock. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful but even more stunning from the Top of the Rock. Stay after sunset to get the whole experience of 360 views on a clear Spring or Summer night.

Stunning. Was in New York for my first time, visiting with my husband and 13 year old daughter.
Not usually a city lover, but from everywhere in the city the views across the skyline were stunning, by day and by night.
Camera working overtime from our helicopter flight, open top bus tours and the water.
Breathtaking!. Beautiful skyline that lives up to expectations. Get the subway to Brooklyn and then walk back across the Brooklyn Bridge for great views.

Stunning. Saw this amazing view from our hotel the New Yorker, cruise boat and top of the Rockerfeller centre - all slightly different views of it but all equally amazing - especially watching the sunrise in the background. Cant wait to go back!

What a skyline. Thus is such an icon that it has to be seen - and it does noes not disappoint from every angle. The best angle IMHO is from the water to get a real feel for the splendour of it. This does mean that you really do need to get on the water and either the Staten Island ferry or the Statue of Liberty ferry get you there.

Amazing!. One of the nicest ways to see the skyline is by riverboat. We got our riverboat ticket for about 10. Dollars each, it last about hour and half, and it is great. You see so much and we got really quite close to Statue of Liberty, the guide was good and told us lots about all the landmarks...most poignant was the space between two buildings where the Twin Towers once stood. Also pointed out was the pier that the Titanic was due to dock at if she had arrived in New York....it is now a golf driving range!

Tourists and NYers Love This View. From across the East River Manhattan looks like all the pictures (and films) you've seen that are taken of the City. Standing there you can see all the iconic buildings in one go. Plus it's a quick ride from Manhattan on the subway - so why not make the short trip and walk along a part of NY that was, until recently covered with warehouses etc. along with the Gantry Plaza where historically goods were hauled from the outer boroughs to Manhattan? Today instead of beat up warehouses and manufacturing plants there are pedestrian walks, high rise apartments and lots of open space. The world famous Pepsi Cola sign that used to be part of a bottling plant or something has been cleaned up and is being showcased. We have been to the wonderful River View restaurant several times, where if you time it right you can see Manhattan as the sun goes down and the lights in the buildings (Empire State etc.) come up - like magic.

Rockefeller v Empire State. Both brilliant. Different experiences. Felt Rockefeller had 'the edge' in my experience although both worth a visit and how can you come to New York and not experience these!
One of the best skyline. Excellent... Literally takes your breath away. I saw the statue of liberty on the background and seeing from the promenade near brooklyn bridge is a must

top of the rock. did the rockerfellar "top of the rock" it was a great experience. It has 3 levels and you get a great sense of the city from all sides.
we had a new york pass, so got our time and came back 2 hrs later and up we went with little waiting
Got to be the best sky line in the world. The views from any direction are great but the best one must be on the boat to liberty island must be one of the greatest sites in the world

The Best of NYC for Free. Get yourself down to the Staten Island Ferry dock. Ride the free ferry to and from Staten Island, and get great views of the Manhattan skyline, the new WTC tower, and the Statue of Liberty along the way. Walk an hour or two through one of New York's most interesting neighborhoods to the Brooklyn Bridge, and then another hour to cross into Brooklyn's Cobble Hill neighborhood where you'll find a plethora of restaurants serving dishes from 'round the world and at unheard-of-prices that you left back there in Manhattan. You had to eat anyway, so what more did the day cost you?? Nothing at all!!!! Don't miss it.

Oh yes, get as many views of it as you can. The Manhattan skyline is awe-inspiring. You can see it from the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, helicopter or boat tour, the free Staten Island Ferry, or the ferry to and from Liberty & Ellis Islands. Get your camera ready no matter how you see it. If you can be viewing it at sunset or sunrise, it is even more spectacular.

So nice. The Manhattan Skyline was lovely. We saw it from the free Staten Island Ferry, from the Brooklyn Bridge and fromManhatten itself. It was poignant and a real and all for free when you get there.
It is always exciting to see the Manhattan skyline. Staten Island Ferry, circle line or city sight seeing harbor tour are the ways to see the Manhattan skyline. Impressive!

Like no other!. Take the East River ferry over to Dumbo and get a fantastic view of the NYC skyline as well as a birds eye view of the Brooklyn Bridge. The skyline of NYC is incredible and to see if from the water is very worth it.

Magical. No matter the time of the year - the skyline always takes my breath away. We were able to enjoy it from the rooftop bar at the Empire and on a harbor dinner cruise. March is still cold - dress warm!
Wow !. Best viewed in my opinion from the River Cafe and at night. Magical. You really realise actually how many buildings there are!
Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is wonderful to see especially from the river. We went during the day time and also we went at the evening to see the buildings all lit up.
Fantastic views. Wonderful to view from "Top of the Rock" Rockefeller Centre building. Takes a while to get to the top but absolutely worth the effort.
A welcoming sight!`. Beautiful. Make plans for a ferry ride at dusk to truly see the city at its magical most. This city never sleeps and it is reflective in the most majestic skyline.

Memorable view from Brooklyn. Whether you choose to commit the view to memory, or to take lots of photos, the view of Manhattan skyline isn't one you'll ever forget. You'll also find lots of places from which you can take in the view during the day and at night. I particularly like the views from Brooklyn Bridge and from just outside the River Cafe in Brooklyn.
Gorgeous a bucket list item . The view is breath taking see it from sea and from the top of the rock or go over to Hoboken and see it which is lovely walk out on the peer and enjoy!!!

What A View!. I've been to New York several times now and I always get excited when I see that incredible skyline. When you first see it, it's so amazing and then it has a feel of not being real, an illusion. You can't believe you are actually going to this place. An emotional time for me was our first visit after 9/11. I knew the look would be different, but still a beautiful sight. One of my favorite times to view the skyline is at night. I've been on the Hudson River dinner cruises before and the skyline is just as awesome. I love to stand on the deck and view the scenery, taking everything in. Now that the Freedom Tower is complete, the skyline takes on a different look. It's as beautiful as ever, and there is a sense of pride that you feel. As we left from our last trip, I watched as we drove away. The sun had started to set and again I was in awe. I don't know when our next trip will be, but I know I'll be just as amazed as I was the first time that skyline came into view.

Beautiful. Coming from the UK the Manhattan Skyline is beautiful. We particularly thought it was breath taking from our top floor hotel balcony and from inside Central Park.We also viewed it during the day and at night from Top of the rock and Empire State building which was also beautiful.
What a sight. Just amazing to see from the top of the Empire State Building. Looks fantastic at night from Brooklyn and also from 'top of the rock'.
Mesmerising. Beautiful at all times of the day and night - can't take a bad photo of this you just need to be high enough - The helicopter experience provided amazing photos opportunities.
Yowsers!. Watching the light laser spectacular on the Empire State Building was awesome. The new One World Trade Center Tower is now also lit up now that the top has been reached.
Never get tired on Manhattan Skyline. I love it from NJ side and I adore it from Brooklyn and Queens side. I never get tired of it and I would recommend to anyone to take time and admire it.

Best seen from New Jersey!. I love taking the FREE bus from Port Authority South Wing (Gate 5) Sit on the right side of the bus facing forward. When the bus exits the Lincoln Tunnel, and drives around the bend, you will get THE BEST VIEW of Manhattan's WEST SIDE! The elevated view is great to snap a photo if you want. But, the view only lasts about 10 - 15 seconds depending on the speed. On a side note, the trip to IKEA is worth it especially if you like bottomless cups of coffee, inexpensive entrees that taste ok and/or watching planes take off/landing (lots at Newark Airport across the way). Plus, if nothing else, IKEA is a fun place to stroll and plop down on sofas and beds. Who knows you may pick up a frame for that great photo you just took. (Coming back, sit on the left side for an ok view-not as great as going, but ok. Buses operate every half-hour on Sat & Sun only.)The other great view is from the B/D train (Orange line) to Brooklyn because it crosses the Manhattan Bridge. You will see the Brooklyn Bridge and the NY skyline. Once in Brooklyn, make your way to DUMBO and enjoy some time on the riverside park and the view across the way. I understand there is a bike path there now which I have yet to try but it should give you a great view of Manhattan along the East River, as well.Another suggestion is the tram to Roosevelt Island. Surely, an aerial view of Manhattan's East Side and the island itself would be spectacular. Although I live here, I have yet to try it. I will this summer now that I am writing about it! :DFinally, the Staten Island Ferry is free and the best bargain for tourist who want to snap a photo of the Statue of Liberty fairly closeup.You will also have beautiful views of lower Manhattan's looming towers. Likewise, during the summer, two for one deal: Go to Governor's Island for a day of fun and spectacular views of Lower Manhattan and the Bridges of the East River. Sigh... so much to see, so much to do. I hope you have the time to take it all in. :) Enjoy!!

Unmissable. Whether you've just statrted or finished walking the Brooklyn Bridge, be sure to take a few minutes to look back at Manhattan and just take in the beauty of one of the most amazing cities on earth.Although a great view during the day, I think it looks amazing at night when Manhatten is all lit up. especially when you see it from the River Cafe.
Looks different.. Beautiful. Wish the twin towers were still there dominating the skyline. Nevertheless breathtaking views especially after dusk.

Famous view. Easiest to see from a clear sky on an airplane arriving at Newark Liberty airport but great from a cruise around the island. Pick out the sights you see in the movies. Just keep looking up like a tourist

There's no skyline like NYC's anywhere in the world!. Manhattan's skyline is beautiful day or night. During the day, you can see the skyscrapers, The Intrepid aircraft carrier, cruise ships along Manhattan's west side on the weekends; by night, it's the beauty of the lights in these buildings that permeate the city and night sky, including the Empire State Building which displays different colors to celebrate whatever occasion it is at the time (otherwise it's red, white, and blue). The skyline is best viewed from across the Hudson River in NJ (Hoboken or Weehawken) where public walkways along the river are available to take in the views. There's also the Staten Island Ferry, which is a 30minute ride to/from Manhattan/SI (which is free) from where you'll get a great view of lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty. Once on SI, take a stroll along the main entrance walkways for more views & photo ops.
Nothing So Impressive. From LIC, Brooklyn, Roosevelt Island, Staten Island Ferry...all spectacular....especially near sunset.

best seen at night. The Manhattan skyline is like no other. See it in the daytime, then either stay or come back and see it at night. the skyline at night is the best. The best place to see the skyline is from the Brooklyn promenade, under the Brooklyn Bridge. from that angle you can see all 3 bridges at once. Great place for photos if you are into photography.
Huge. NYC skyline is magnificent. You can go around Manhattan island by boat. Really is the best way to see it all.

World's best skyline. I live in NJ and work in NY. The NY skyline is amazing. Best viewed after sunset when you can view all of the lights. Of special note is the ever changing light color on the Empire State Building.

Wanna know the best places to see the skyline?. My job is to location scout in NYC, so please believe me when I say I've seen every angle of the sky line.Everyone knows about the view from Brooklyn Promenade/Empire Fulton Ferry/Brooklyn Bridge park view in DUMBO just under the Brooklyn Bridge. It's a lovely view, and a great area to visit!But if you want a different view to show the folks at home, here are some options. (NOTE i'll share NJ views of the skyline another time if people are interested. This is just the 5 boroughs)Water Taxi Port - S WilliamsburgKent Ave between S 8th and S 11th St has a walk way to the East River Ferry, and a great view. A bit desolate down there. Safe, but best to travel by day if you are concerned.Grand Ferry Park - WilliamsburgUp the block there is a small park at Kent Ave and Grand St. Not the best park, not the best view, but interestingEast River State Park - WilliamsburgHere's an up and comer. Sometimes they have live music, and on a beautiful summer day you'll see Brooklynites hanging out in this park. Great place to chill with the view.Hunters Point South Park - LIC (Long Island City)This neighborhood has really changed! Great little upscale park in an area most tourists' don't seem to visit. Walk north in the park to…Gantry State Park - LICIf you went to Hunter Point, you are all ready here. Why not walk a bit further North and see the famous Coke a Cola sign!Queens Bridge Park - QueensVernon Blvd and 41st Ave. Just under the 59th St bridge.Can be a bit sketcher here, especially at night, but this makes it one of the unvisited views. On summer nights, you can often catch locals playing baseball NYC style on the various ball fields. Proceed with a smidgeon of caution here. Be aware of your surroundings, don't leave cameras hanging out, and don't go alone. It's not really that bad, but better safe than sorry.And now, the pièce de résistance!Roosevelt Island - Look it up!Go to 59th St and 2nd Ave in Manhattan, take the tram across the river to Roosevelt Island. Travel to the southern tip for great views and the old Small Pox hospital, or north to the park with the light house.http://www.rihs.us/landmarks/renwick.html just to get you inspired.The whole island is like nothing in NYC. Not super cool or flashy, but one of a kind.Bonus points if you can find the original farm house. (The whole island was once owned by a single family. Try forgetting something at the market when you have to row across the east river!)Truly worth the effort to get here.Enjoy!

Where the skyscraper was born. The Manhattan Skyline is a wonder unto itself. Best of all, viewing it is free. Best vantage points: the Brooklyn Heights esplanade, the New Jersey banks of the Hudson, or Long Island City in Queens. Take the tram to Roosevelt Island, or a ride on the Staten Island ferry (for a modest ticket fee) and you'll see it from every angle.
It is great and Free. As beautiful during the days as its at night. It is freee and available from some many vantage points in the city

Awesome, must do. Saw this on a drizzly mor ING which meant the cloud shrouded skyscrapers looked brilliant. Always an exceptional sight that you would have seen in so many shows and images.Must see this with your own eyes.

One of a kind view. Some of the best viewing is actually from New Jersey (Hoboken... take the PATH train or Water Taxi). The Hudson River is wider and you get more of a panoramic view. The Prominade in lower Brooklyn is good and the view North from the Staten Island Ferry terminal at St. George in Staten Island is fabulous as well

View from the Brooklyn Bridge. I think the view of Manhattan from the Brooklyn Bridge is one of the greatest sights anywhere in the world. Some people are not aware that you can walk across the bridge on a walkway situated on top of the highway. The views are wonderful, especially on a gorgeous day. Do it!

Several vantage points to consider. Ok, so there are many ways to see the Manhattan skyline and they are all free:1. Walking across the brooklyn bridge2. picknicking under the brooklyn bridge, after riding the carousel, having grimaldi's pizza - there is either the area by the carousel or on the other side the new brooklyn bridge park (also getting some ice cream)3. walking the brooklyn promenade from brooklyn heights (train to court st) to brooklyn bridge4. taking the red hook ikea ferry (and hanging out on the water front in red hook and going to some restaurants in that area (red hook lobster rolls!) - definitely recommend - there is an outdoor restaurant here with minature golf) - get off the first stop and there is this old timey train car5. take the staten island ferry (haven't done this in awhile because I opt for red hook usually)6. rent a zipcar or take a taxi on the fdr drive from brooklyn or manhattan bridge all the way uptown... best at night7. Governor's island!! take the ferry over, rent a bike and ride around governor's island, take over some food for a picnic, although the water taxi beach has a good view of the skyline too8. An additional random one, the Equitable Tower ...

Spectacular and Overwhelmingly Beautiful. I loved the view of the skyline. We saw the skyline from the Brooklyn Promenade, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the Top of the Rock. It was everything I expected. When approaching the Brooklyn Promenade, the space opens and there it is, beautiful New York City and Lady Liberty. Almost unreal for my first time, being from the West Coast. A must see in life.

From any point, this is worth seeing. Head to central park for a unique view of this skyline, or head to one of the famous view points like Empire State Building or 30 Rock. Or catch the ride on the Staten Island ferry (free). Cross the Brooklin Bridge, or even go to Jersey City and Hoboken for the amazing view of Manhattan. Or just walk the streets, and look at that skyline from a way different perspective.
top of the rock and empire state. amazing, recommend visiting the empire state in the day and top of the rock late afternoon and stay until dark.

Breath taking view. Its exactly as you see in the movies. It gives you that real big city of the most powerful country of the world feeling. But the high rise buildings when visiting manhattan are not to be missed.
Brilliant.. One of the must sees! Best seen from the Staten Island ferry in the dark. The Top of the Rock is also very goon and less crowded.
Very nice view from Manhattan Bridge. And from the river, taking a cruise! Very impressive, specially at night when they are with their lights on!

Breathtaking. Managed to catch a glimpse of the Manhattan Skyline from the Empire state building, the NY water taxi and Weehawken, NJ. All views were awesome. In my personal opinion the view from Weehawken was the best.
Amazing!. We viewed the skyline from Brooklyn and walking back over Brooklyn Bridge and also from our river cruise. Amazing and has to be seen.
Awesome!. Breathtaking! See it at night from the free Staten Island ferry. Top of the rock or the Empire State will give you a birds eyes view, one of the best things I've done. It's awesome :)

In the flesh Manhattan is stunning, as long as you know where to get the best views.. Best seen from Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn Heights, Roosevelt Island and the Staten Island Ferry. All these things are free.
Views are amazing. We did the night bus journey and the view is amazing but beware make sure you get a bus with a see through roof as it was freezing.

View from Empire State and ferry both superb. If possible view in late afternoon on a sunny day. The shadows are so interesting. The new world trade centre looks fantastic. What an achievement in the face of such tragedy!
Amazing!. Amazing view! My first experience was in 2009. Feels like I'm coming home every time. Even better at night

A beautiful sight from every angle!!. We witnessed the Manhattan Skyline from Fort Wadsworth, from the Staten Island Ferry, from the ferry to Liberty Island and back....and other attractions. It was so beautiful each and every time! I couldn't decide if it was more spectacular during the day or evening....both were breathtaking!

Absolutely Amazing!!. We paid $50 for a car service from Brooklyn to Long Island just to see the Manhattan Skyline at night and get some photo's and it was worth it!! I got some amazing photo's that I plan on blowing up for the wall.

Spectacular views. My first ever views of the Manhattan Skyline occurred during a cruise on the Hudson River (reviewed separately), and it was like something I have never experienced before, and maybe never will again. The views of the Empire State Building, reconstruction of the twin towers site, and numerous other buildings have to be seen to be believed.

The best view ever!. Amazing view! It's a must see for everyone visiting New York City! I had the chance to see it both at night when arriving using the taxi and during the day coming back from Liberty Island: both experiences were moving and wonderful.

As seen on a movie. I'll always remember this landscape. If you want to enjoy it for free take an orange ferry from Manhatan to Staten Island and seat on your right side and do the opposite when travelling from Staten Island to Manhattan.
wow. this is great, both during the day and night with all the lights and high buildings, amazing experience. really no.1 in New York
beautiful. Loved the city lights. Viewed from top of the rock and the Empire state building. Great neon at Times Square.
Nothing like it!. There is no view like the Manhattan Skyline view. You have to see it at night. Just beautiful! Enough said!

There truly is nothing like it!. I've been visiting New York City from my younger years, and I lived there for years too; it is my second hometown. Yet every time I see the Manhattan skyline, I am still amazed at the scale of the skyscrapers, the variety of architectural styles, and the city life that the buildings sustain. And the ongoing changes to the skyline, for better or worse (the destruction of the old Twin Towers on 9/11, the construction of new buildings including Bank of America Tower and the new World Trade Center), are a reminder that time does not stand still, and neither does life in New York City.There are lots of good ways to enjoy the skyline too. The touristy way, Circle Line around Manhattan, is quite good, thanks to some nooks and crannies (and on-board narrations) that reveal some hidden details that most people overlook. A free ride on the Staten Island Ferry is also an excellent way to enjoy the Lower Manhattan views. Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge is probably my favorite way, though views from below the bridge along the East River waterfront are also excellent. Even glimpses from subway trains outside Manhattan (such as on the 7 train in Long Island City) are excellent.Sometimes instead of looking for big iconic skyscrapers such as the Empire State Building, I may look up from a park (such as Battery Park or Madison Square) and look at the architectural styles of the buildings surrounding me. And that's what I like about New York City; while just about any city these days can build a modern skyscraper, New York City is one of the few places in the world where skyscrapers also exist in older Neo-Gothic or Art Deco styles, and sometimes it's the cacophony of those different styles mixing together that makes New York City stand out.There truly is nothing like the Manhattan skyline. Enjoy the views to the fullest!

A TRIP. Take the ferry (free) to Statin Island round trip just for the air and the view. Also you can get off and walk around the island or bike and see the historic buildings and parks. There are several good places to eat. A good way to get out of the city.

The Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center. Do you want a magnificent view of the NYC? Then I recommend going to the Top of the Rock! What a breathtaking view from all sides. It rivals the Empire State Building for panoramic views of the city and beyond.

Breathtaking. Such an iconic view. I must have taken about 50 pictures. See it free from the Staten Island Ferry. The ferry leaves around every half an hour, the service is great and runs for 24 hours a day.I loved everything about the view, such a shame that the twin towers are missing, however the new WTC 1 is a great landmark.

Iconic images. Iconic images of the tall buildings are really appreciated from afar, however in amongst the tall buildings you get lost very easily, as everything is giant-like. These tall buildings do tend to block out the sun, but then anyone at some point would like to be in this concrete jungle with these giants at some point in their life, because there is nothing else quite like it.

A must see. One of the worlds most amazing skylines. A perfect view can be taken from across The Hudson in New Jersey. Also tours can be taken by boat around Manhattan. Or better yet, catch the Staten Island Ferry for free, and watch the Manhattan Skyline rise up behind you. Wonderful.

Iconic. The sky line is never tired here, seeing it for the first time with WTC 1 was great and the sight of the Empire state Building, WTC 1 and Chrysler building all sitting against the backdrop of the river was a highlight of this trip.
A great stroll to burn off brunch. I always recommend this to people that come and visit the city. A super 360 view and there is always something going on at the weekend in spring and summer!
Another must see in NYC. The most important attraction before entering the city of NYC is the skyline. It is the most attractive and luresome view of can have.
a wonderful stroll above the streets. a leisurely stroll while getting a view of the city usually not seen. i was amazed at the different architectures and appreciated seen up close.
my favorite view. is from the Stanton Island Ferry - this is free! It's the best view of the Manhattan skyline, the Brooklyn bridge, and the Statue of Liberty. Did I mention that ii is free?
Still one of the most beautiful views in the world. It's the Manhattan skyline, it's beautiful. Take a ride on a ferry at night to see it in all its glory.

A must see in New York. The cheapest way is to go to Battery Park and look for the South Ferry Terminal. It is a free ride, takes 25 minutes to get Staten Island and you can come back on the same ferry. The view coming back is outstanding; it is like in the Working Girl movie.Another good ride it to go to The Roosevelt Island Tramway. It is a short ride 5 minutes with spectacular aerial views. You can pay with the metro card.
Amazing! Day & Night!. The best place to check out NYC is on top of the Rockefeller Centre. Try and name the building with no cheating now!
Picture postcard. Amazing view just like out of the movies. Take the statin island ferry for excellent views or cross to Brooklyn. Views to take your breath away and appreciate the sheer size.

High High High. It was amazing just looking up at the buildings from street level. I do not like heights and felt I had vertigo just by looking at the buildings. To me NYC felt like any city but the Skycrapers make the huge difference.

Picture Perfect!. The Manhattan Skyline was simply an astounding view! Especially on a beautiful sunny day! We took a cruise around Manhattan so we were able to admire this gorgeous scenery from different angles!
Circle line boat trip. The circle line boat trip is a good way to see the Manhattan skyline which includes a great view of the Statue of Liberty
See it from the Rockefeller.. There's obviously a lot of different places to see this incredible view, but the best is from the Rockefeller. Or Brooklyn, depending on how dirty you want to go.

Go to Brooklyn Heights. Probably one of the best places to see the Manhattan Skyline is from Brooklyn Heights, across the Hudson River. Stroll along the walkway and enjoy the amazing views of the skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. Try to end your walk and lunch or dinner time and have a nice pizza in one of the famous pizza venues under the bridge.
Fantastic view. Did Empire State Building observatory 86th and 102nd observatories. A little pricey and weather was a problem on day we went but worth it when in NYC.
Iconic skyline. Viewed from most angles, Helicopter, boat & plane truly breath-taking, will not see another like it.
Beautiful! The best skyline in the world!. It's so amazing! You must take family pictures of this incredible skyline. I love NYC! It's so iconic and incredible!
Awesome. Seen from Cruise boat, Staten ferry and helicopter just one word, magnificent. Wonderful mix of architecture that just blends together so well.
See from the water. We went on a mini boat cruise and from a major cruise ship on our onward journey. We saw it at dawn, daytime and night. Amazing!
Brooklyn view. No dislikes! View it from either the free Staten Island ferry (bottom of Manhattan at Whitehall St or from pedestrianised Brooklyn Heights.

Jersey View of Manhattan Skyline is Outstanding. For a different perspective of the western Manhattan skyline, a trip to Liberty State Park in Jersey City is well worth it. You also will be treated to a different view - from the back and side - of the Statue of Liberty, which is a lot closer to New Jersey than anywhere in New York. You can picnic in the park and take the ferry to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty island from the park. You can take a ferry from Manhattan's west side to Liberty Park. There's also a restaurant in the park with good enough food and a great view of the skyline.

Amazing skyline views. We were amazed when we arrived in New York you can't imagine how huge the buildings are until you are in the street with them towering above you. I think it is even more amazing that there are so many huge building and beautiful architecture down every street. One of the places that everybody should experience
Beautiful. loved it. my little girl was thrilled to see the huge buildings and the old architecture amazed my wife and i.

A proove why New York is one of the best cities on earth. This proves why New York is among the best cities on the earth on all continents. This is even by locals one of the most desired neighborhood and as a visitor, one must absolutely pay a visit here.
Simply stunning. What can you say, it is just brilliant and breathtaking at the same time. everything youd expect it to be and much much more
Always impressive. Empire State Building worth the visit. Going over to Ellis Island gives a wonderful view of the Manhattan Skyline (as you can also do from Brooklyn).
Amazing. Just what you imagine it to be from tv and films but you're actually there. Only sad point is that the twin towers are missing.

awsome. never fails to impress seeing the skyline, go to rockafella for top of the rock, better than empire state !
Manhattan skyline. Amazing views! Took the ferry across to Staten Island and was mesmerised by the view of the Manhattan Skyline. Would recommend to anyone!

Sky @ Night. The views that my wife and I experienced were amazing as although we had seen intermittent views here and there from our bus tours of both Uptown and Downtown, we really only saw the real thing when we saw the cityscope from the top of the rock at dusk. Well worth the wait to gain entry.
Breathtaking. You really have to be there to appreciate the scale of this view. It is awesome and not to be missed if visiting this lovely city.

Manhatten skyline. Changing Skline with the new buildings being built on the site of the world trade centre. We took lots of photos as this is one of the most famous places in the world a fantastic place to see with your own eyes especially from the free Staten Island ferry.A tip when on the ferry stay to the back downstairs and when the ferry is pulling out go through the rear doors and wait! the skline will appear and we got some great photos from here

amazing. What a view breathe taken
the lights at night are so beautiful
the size of the buildings really are something else

Nothing Like It. There is no city on Earth that has a skyline like Manhattan. Just the awesome size and contrasts are nothing like anywhere else. It's always best to go to a higher floor on one of the buildings for a breathtaking view!

From Liberty Island. It is worth the boat ride!!! Great view of lower Manhattan. Get the Crown Tickets weeks ahead on line and you can still go up int he crown.

I LUV NY!. Whether you look at it from the top of the Empire State Building, on Top of the Rock, across the bridge, across the river, or just looking from the ground up, New York's Skyline is breathtaking - both day and night!My favourite view is from the ESB. You get a 360 view of Manhattan. Old and new buildings mix together to create a patchwork quilt of colours with different elevations divided by black strings of roadwork throughout the city.This is why NYC continues to drive millions of people to its tourist haven!

I don't think there is a better way to see the skyline, unless you opt to flight.

Gotta see it both during Day and Evening-great. Gotta see this view from above at the ESB (Empire State Building) and Top of the Rock-(Rockefeller Center). Go on a clear day and nice evening so you can experience the full splendor. take plenty of pictures and drag a family or friend along for this experience. Nice-very nice.

Simply stunning. It is simply stunning to view all the different architecture by day and absolutely jaw dropping to view the same at night. As for the her majesty, the Statue of Liberty, I think she comes into her own in the evening. All completely absorbing whether you view from land, river or air.Enjoy
very very good.. very good and proffecional service with a extraordinary view.strong recomendation to all Tourists are visiting the area.
WoW!. Great value for money, gives you time to take in the wonders of the whole city. We looked into booking before we left but decided to go adhoc as last time we had a foggy day.
Whats not to like?. My husbands first trip to NYC, so it was fun seeing it through a newcomer's eyes. No matter how often you see it, it is always spectacular.
Great view. We went to Brooklyn by boat. It was nice but the best was the great view of the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn!

a sight for sore eyes!!. We saw the manhattan skyline in the day time,via the ferry to the statue of Liberty, which was then very beautiful to be able to stand back and see the famous sights from a different perspective. The second was at night which i think was my favouite.We went on a wine and dine Bateaux with entertainment and it was just so romantic to see the skyline so beautifully lit,in all its colours.We would definatly do it again.

Make your holiday. What a skyline. We walked over the Brooklyn Bridge, took the Staten Island ferry, whata view! Top of the Rock, unbelievable!!!!

Walk over the Brooklyn Bridge. Excellent views of Manhattan skyline, Statue of Liberty and Brooklyn. Catch the subway to High Street Brooklyn and walk through the park to get to the steps for the bridge and cross over the East River to Manhattan.
great from the harbour. iconic view great from the harbour cruise had to bear the chilly wind but worth it, only regret didnt go back at night
Extraordinary. It is such a treat to overlook the whole city. Has to be seen to take in all the sights including the tragic site of 9/11.
Breathtaking!. Wow, day or night it is totally stunning - we had a perfect view from out of our 25th floor hotel room - we just could not stop staring at it!

Great to see!. The Manhattan Skyline is unlike any other I've seen...and I've been fortunate enough to have traveled to many cities around the world and seen many skylines. The Manhattan skyline is a magnificent sight, the architecture varies greatly and keeps you looking at it. By day and especially by night the skyline is great. I've seen it by boat as well as by kayak by night. We rented kayaks and traveled on the Hudson River from Chelsea Piers up to the Intrepid. The view was wonderful.

magnificant. The Manhattan skyline has a certain marvel that is unmatched anywhere else in the world. At first glance it looks like any other business building skyline, but after staring at it you are taken into a different dimension.
It's the Manhatten skyline!!!. What more can you say, iconic, beutiful, amazing, an absolute must see both in the day and at night.

Dissappointed. We weren't shown the safety VT, before we flew we shared the helicopter with 4 other people the view was stifled and the flight was just up and down the Hudson River and not over the city has expected. Certainly not worth the cost!

I miss the former skyline but appreciate and love the new one as well!. NYC skyline is as magnificant as the energy and the different cultures & people I always encounter when I visit!

Fantastic Views. Manahattan Skline is wonderful, would recommend to see it both in daylight and in darkness as it looks phenomenal in both. My favourite view is from the top of the rock (Rockefeller Center) views are also great from the Empire State, Liberty/Ellis Island.

My Surprise Gift in NYC!. I absolutely loved it and I cannot express how much this helicopter ride is worth trying. I was extremely shocked that we were going on this ride around NYC. I had never been on a helicopter ride before. We were an hour early and we were so anxious to get on that we asked if their was any possibility to move up our reservation. The staff arranged it all and moved us up! They were amazing. They gave us instructions and went over some of the rules we had to follow and the next thing you know we are walking towards the helicopter. The wind blowing through my hair and the loud noise was a bit intimidating. However, I was looking forward to it. We got the best seats in the helicopter. Make sure you sit on the left side. You will get the best views of the statue of liberty and Manhattan. You can see ground zero, the Yankees stadium and the buildings. It is an amazing view. I would definitely recommend everyone to try this at least once. Loved it! :)

Breathtaking? Yes Breathtaking!. Wanna really treat yourself to a sight that will last forever? Beg, borrow, rent or steal, (no. don't steal, but you get the point) a car and travel across one of the tunnels or George Washington Bridge just before the sun goes down to West New York, New Jersey. Go to the Easternmost part of West New York and find JFK Blvd. Find a place to park, grab a bench on the terrace and enjoy the scenery. It is stunning.
Sky line Day And Night. it doesn't matter what time of day or night you look at the skyline its always amazing and beautiful. Views are great from Top of The Rock and The Empire State.

A view to a thrill. Had company in town for the weekend. We went to Times Square after a Broadway show which you get an idea of midtown Manhattan and the large skyscrapers around it. Then in the evening we went to Water's Edge restaurant in Long Island City which has an amazing view of midtown, including the UN and eastside buidlings - Empire State, CIticorp, etc.)Then after dinner we took a drive from Long Island City through McGuiness Blvd. to Williamsburg. From there we went to the DUMBO (down under the Manhattan Bridge overpass) and the Brooklyn Bridge park. Here even the road goes by an area unobstructed by any buildings and you can see the Manhattan downtown and bridge (of the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges) skyline up close. You will recognize this view as many movies and New York shots shoot from this view.From there we took the local route south along the water until Atlantic avenue and then took the BQE north to the Brooklyn Bridge. The views all along the way are amazing. And driving on the Brooklyn Bridge into Manhattan you can not only see the skyline but up the East River with the other bridges and parts of Manhattan north.You can do this either daytime or nighttime. Just make sure the weather cooperates.
Always a great view. There are so many great views of the Manhattan Skyline, personally I never tired of looking at it, I viewed it and photographed it from so many different places, stunning.

Take the ferry. We went to get the circle line out to see Statue of Liberty very cold weather a police officer told us to take the Staten Island ferry it was free over and back in a hour wonderful views

Interesting but, in winter, not worth going just to see the skyline.. Interesting but, in winter, not worth going just to see the skyline. It is better to let go there doing the tour Free tour by foot, Downtown All-in-one. This site consists of a rail line that has been disabled and the location was made a hanging garden. In winter everything is covered by snow, so it's not as pretty as it should be in the spring.
when the sun is shining, take a walk on the skyline. I love the attention Ny gives to rehabilitation of old construction, the urban jungle is a real beauty walking the skyline

Brooklyn Bridge. Get the tube to City Hall then walk over Brooklyn Bridge for an amazing view of the Manhattan Skyline. Make sure you wrap up well as it gets windy on the top but the views make up for that.

From helicopter or just around the city. Love pictures from ferry and from Top of Rock . Take a walk on Brokling Bridge , not only Seaport, and Amazing pictures just walking around the city and looking up
New York The Most Amazing City Ever. We live in New Jersey & evertime we cross the George Washington Bridge, we are in awe. It is like no other place.
Go for the Empire State Building !. A few tall buildings to choose from - the Empire State Building was awesome. Go just before the sun sets - see it in daylight, and all the lights in the dark.

Amazing and Freezing. Great time and food, but very windy. Layer yourself and enjoy. Streets get a bit confusing so keep a map and always ask for clarity. GPS on phone come very handy for a new person. Have fun!!!
Excellent. Must see, we saw it from the Manhatten and Brooklyn Bridge and also the Water Cruise and also the Staton Island Ferry. Photographs are fantastic, its like a movie scene !

Best Skyline in the world. New York, New York There is nothing like seeing the Chrysler Building or Empire State Building at night! It's breathtaking and so familiar.

NY, NY. So good they named it twice. Well so the song says.....
We visited NY at the end of January, during the run up to Superbowl. The whole of Manhattan was manic, especially around Times Square where they had closed the roads for Superbowl tourist attractions.
You do need to get up the big buildings to see the city at its best though.

Wow!. Have seen it on the tv but when you are there it's totally different, all I could say during our trip was wow!

on top of the world. fanstastic experience - top of the rock go go go ......you wont see anything like it anywhere else on the planet.
The staff are amazing and entertaining and the views are awe inspiring

Walk in the cold. Loved the views of the streets from above but not the best in winter as the wind gets to you. It was nice to not have to be in the hustle and bustle of the streets and you can take in the view.
What can you say? It's the Manhattan Skyline.. It's inspiring and beautiful, that's what you can say. It makes you think of work, and ambition, and big shoulders, and the American Dream.

Skyline 2 day tour. As i exit my hotel across from MSG with my sisters, i was approached by a handsome young man with green eyes. He smiled and presented a rose to me and asked if i had any plans for the evening. i allowed him to sway me with a 2 day tour for 50 bucks and a free cruise around the statue of liberty. his name was matthew, and i must say i enjoyed my nightime tour the most like he said i would. passing thru the dimlights of times square was beautiful and well worth it. i give this tour a good 4 star.Kiara
Best city landscape. Manhattan skyline is an unique place in the world, where you can experience lot of feelings at the same time. Many buildings and history at the same. Totally recommended
Unbeateable view. Amazing views from across the other side of the Brooklyn bridge and also the Staten Island ferry. Just a beautiful city and an unbeatable skyline.

Wow. Spent first 48 hours saying Wow, Unbelievable and other various expletives. Never seen anything like it. Amazing experience. Try to view from as many different angles as possible and by day and night. Quite wired how it doesn't look quite so high and dense when viewed from the top of the Empire State.Definitely one for the bucket list.
The ferry. Do the ferry boat to Staten island, amaizing view, then the brooklyn bridge and the tower with helicopter
Great view!!.... from jersey. Crossing on the ferry to jersey, its cheap and its a good trip. The view from there is just amazing, also from brooklyn or queens!!
Absolutely Amazing. Everything, dreams are made of, we did this at night and the colours are vivid and you could still hear the hustle and bustle below

Nothing like it in the world! Sunset is the BEST. Any visitor to this city can't help but notice the skyline all around them. I have had the luxury of staying in a very tall hotel with an incredible view of the city skyline. I can say that my favorite and most beautiful photos are of the skyline, from a high vantage point, at sunset. The way the sun sets on the water casts a beautiful glow. Since I love photography, I tend to pay more attention to these things.........

Nothing like it in the world. Take the PATH train one stop from WTC to Exchange Place and drink in the breathtaking view over the Hudson. When you're done, go back, take a 2 or 3 train to Clark Street and walk down to the promenade in Brooklyn and drink in THAT breathtaking view. Don't think anything beats it. I never get tired of the view whether it's from the Empire State building, Brooklyn Bridge or a Ferry out to The statue of Liberty.Photos hopefully uploaded with this tell more than a 1000 words
Great. Well worth the cost and the fact that you skip the Empire state queues. Staff very friendly and efficient.
Stunning!. We took the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, so we got excellent views (and photos) of the Manhattan skyline....it just takes your breath away!

beautiful. probably the best in the world, from New Jersey or the other side of Brooklyn Bridge gives an amazing view
Best skyline in the World.... Go to Central park and from the center and tops of the hills in the park, take a shot of every side and get a great full skyline...beautiful!!!!

Both Empire State Bldg and Top of the Rock. We did both! Very cold both days. Rockefeller Center was better because skies were crystal clear. I used my outdated Flip video to take some shaky clips from Top of the Rock. I used my old digital SLR to shoot stills from ESB.
Must visit !!. It's a must must visit if u r being to NY. All members of the family will enjoy a lot here .... There something for everyone here !!!

Beautiful. The Manhattan skyline is possibly the most beautiful thing I've ever seen in my life, something about looking across the city from a hight... It's amazing! Words can't describe the views, you'd have to see it for yourself to understand exactly what I'm trying to say...
Empire State. I did it 30 years ago and again last week - hard to go past all round Manhattan skyline views on a clear day from top of the Empire State. Avoid the lines and go in February.
nr 1 in the world. number 1 skyline in the world. different views from a lot of places... harbor, empire state building, central park. GREAT

Perfect Summer Day!. We went here in the summer, it was so fun to be walking through the city above all the traffic & craziness happening below. I can't wait to go back & walk even further on the Skyline!
Heli ride. No comment, in the front a helicopter was magnificent.. 20 Minutes seeing the whole of Manhattan, Statue of Liberty and to Yankee Stadium and back.

Still the Best. Make sure you do this when in NYC
Empire State or the Rock give great views - relive all the movies you have ever seen

Empire State Building. A definate tick in the box, a must visit - go for the 102 view, hang on to your i phone cameras or small cameras, can be a little windy
There's very stringent security checks
Use the Ferry. The Manhattan Skyline is awesome viewed from the Staten Island Ferry, I got some amazing pictures of Manhattan and of the Statue of Liberty. (and the Ferry is free)

Just like the movies, beautiful!. At night there is no better picture than that of the NY
Skyline. Most recognized in the world, and for good reason.
That view can only be New York!!!!. Took the hop on hop off bus for a night trip the Manhatten skyline is spectacular interesting your guide too

Simply unbelievable!. A lot of people wrote that no word can describe the Manhattan skyline... absolutely right! It's unique in the World...Take a boat trip (I suggest at the sunset), a big breath and prepare yourself to see something that you will never forget!

Amazing day and night. It's a must to walk on Brooklyn bridge or do a boat trip to enjoy all the way the view of the Manhattan Skyline. I have not enough words to describe my fillings. It was the same view I've seen in many movies but I WAS THERE and it was REAL.
One World Trade Centre. Took the trip to Statue of Liberty again just to see how the skyline has changed. Magnificent. Real money and time saver to get the New York City Pass.

Best place to view so from a boat. Hop on the Staten Island ferry or take a boat tour around the island to ensure you get the best pictures. If you have a hood camera you can get some amazing shots for liberty island.
A must see. Take the free boat or the boat to Ellis Island and enjoy the view! It will be a view you will for sure never ever forget!
amazing!!. abolutely amazing, great food and choice of drinks. must go if in the manhattan area!! staff attentive and friendly

Just Huge!. Fantasic skyline. Midtown I think is the best. Going up the Rock (Rockafeller Center) or Empire State Building is one of the best ways to see the skyline. I think the Rock is about $30 to get to the top.
Boat ride to statue of liberty and boat ride to staten island are other options.

You really know you're in New York - breath taking!. Visited New York for 10 days after saving for 2 and a half years! This view, be it from a boat or Brooklyn truly takes your breath away. You know you've finally made it, it's there in front of you and you are here in the Big Apple! Emotional, well yes after all those movies/TV shows you've seen, it's great to be living the dream at least for a little bit!
Great view. This again was suggested by a friend of mine and have to say it was a great location to spot the NYC skyline :)
Free!. Do this from the free Staten Island ferry after dark if you can. You get to see the Statue of Liberty (from a bit of a distance) too.

Like nowhere else in the world. Manhattan's skyline is like nothing you've seen before or will ever forget. You'll probably have a favorite building (mine is the Chrysler Building) that you'll need to spot on subsequent visits to remind you you're truly in New York City. Impressive from the air, land, sea, and observation decks!

Walk it for the best experience. I was here last summer and the best way by far to explore this city is on foot. I paid and sat on a bus for about 20 minutes then got off as the bus took forever and decided to pull over for 15 minutes while they had a discussion. I kissed goodbye to the fare and decided to complete my tour on foot. It was a much better and more personal experience which finished at Ground Zero. I have been to most places in the world but this is by far my favorite city. I staged right in the centre of the city in Times Square and had the time on my life. I was also fortunate to work on a cruise ship for a couple of months and have pasted some excellent shots of the sky line as I came up the Hudson to Pier 88 early one morning. My best advice is to take some comfortable shoes and walk the city as you miss so much sitting on a bus and the shops in 5th Avenue are amazing as is Central Park and the must eat is a Cronut. They truly are a delicious pastry and something you are not able to buy anywhere else in the world.

Staton Island Ferry has good views, Subways work great. You can get great views of the Skyline from various spots around the city including the Rock Center, Empire State Building, and Staton Island Ferry. I have never been to NY before, but bought unlimited Metro pass for $31 for a week. Subways were easy once you figure out transfers and expresses. Zipped all around the city!
breathtaking. this is visible best from 12th Avenue, High Line, Brooklyn or Jersey City... you know what they say "whats the best part of Jersey City? The view of Manhattan"
Iconic. saw it from the bridges and from the Staten Island ferry, it´s a must see skyline, impressive and beautiful

Best in the world. In Hindi we would say "Saare Jehan se achha" which means better than anything else in the world.The Manhattan skyline has a monopoly on this - the absence of the twin World Trade Towers notwithstanding. Maybe it is because it is used so frequently in the movies and now in TV series.So one is so familiar with it. The familiar landmarks like the Chrysler Tower, Metlife Insurance building and of course the iconic Empire State building as they loom into view when you come in either from the airport or from New Jersey. Feels like coming home.
Amazing. Best view was from Liberty Island & Ellis Island. when we were there it was freezing but the sky was clear blue so made an excellent backdrop for our pictures. Will be back soon.
How do you review the Manhattan skyline?. It is there 24/7. Enjoy it from the Staten Island Ferry, which is a bargain and adventure in itself.
Wow. We walked from Brooklyn Bridge to chelsea via the Skyline and even in -12 it was fantastic. I want to come back and do it again in Summer!

NYC MUST SEE, OK !. Really nice. My first trip to NYC and I went two times, the first was from Brooklyn Heights, we took the subway to High street and walked to Brooklyn Bridge Park. Fantastic view. The second was from the city sight seeing ferry, bought a ticket to empire and the boat ticket was included for 40$ !! WORTH IT !! It goes from pier 78 wich is on 38th & 12 and goes all the way to United Nation building. Really really nice, you get to see it all ftom the perfect view.

Amazing lots of ways to experience it but make sure you do!. This is classic NYC and another must do on a visit to NYC there are a number of ways it can be seen but however you do it it's well worth it and you can get some excellent photo opportunities we found that the best way to experience the view was looking back from the ferry to Liberty Island or on a helicopter flight of which there are many choices on pier 6. A view you will never tire of!
Magnificent. The skyline views from the Statue of LIiberty are brilliant as the view from brooklyn bridge as you walk from the brooklyn side.

Visão legal, mas nada estonteante / View is nice, but not stunning. (English version below)A vista é bem legal, mas não é algo tão surpreendente. Mas de qualquer forma, vale a pena apreciar. Tive a experiência durante o dia, mas acredito que à noite seja muito melhor.The view is nice, but not surprising. Anyway, you should enjoy. I had the experience during the day, but I believe that at night it should be much better.
beautiful!. amazing view!! nice to pass time and truly enjoy the city. it would definitely be better when the weather is warm

Get both day and night views. We did top of the rock and empire state building, got views daytime and night. Lovely views but extremely cold in January during the snow so you can't stay appreciating the view for too long.

Must visit attraction. New york skyline is one of the most attractive and impressive sight to visit in Manhattan. We went there around 11 in the morning in September. The weather was cool with pleasant breeze and little sunny. We had a great time and enjoyed the skyline. One can also enjoy the skyline by boat ride and also in the local sight seeing tour or on your own by taking the Manhattan Superb Public transport. Enjoy the new york skyline. Would be even more enjoyable and worth the visit if you can see the sunset of the skyline.
Wow!. Never tire of this vista. Viewed from the ferry to Liberty Island and Ellis Island. We also viewed it from the Manhatten Bridge and the Brooklyn bridge.

greyline buses. The 48 hour tours of new york are a must.New York by night is breathtaking.Dislikes constant reminder to tourist by the guides to tip them and one of them was quite aggressive which made me more determined not to tip.

FROM EVERY ANGLE, IT’S A “WOW”!. From “The Top of Rock” at Rockefeller Center (looking down), to a boat ride out to the Statue of Liberty (looking up), the city skyline makes a lasting impression. We were there is early January when it was down to 5 degrees Fahrenheit in the sun, but it was bright and clear. We even caught beautiful sunset light from our hotel room on the 6th floor (see photos below).
Perfect blue skies and views. Viewing from the Empire State in the day and Rockefeller at night couldn't have been more perfect! January is cold but well worth it if views are clear.

have to go. U have to go... and if don't wan't don't have to stay to long, u don't need it.. Its free, its beautifull, and not common..Try to pass at tha chelsea market also, there is a stair just across the street

A row of icons. I'd always thought that the 'you feel like you're on a movie set in New York' was a bit cliched and, frankly, not what I wanted from a holiday. But so many things are so recognisable, and the skyline leads that list. Wonderful stuff.

wonderful. the weather was around - 20 very cold so wrap up if going on boat trip.We took the bus down and walked up to ground zero which is worth a visit.There is a lot of security checks so be prepared to take off your warm coat if you go in the winter every time you enter a building of interest.
NYC Skyline. Sensational view - unparalled! Its a view that becomes indelibly printed on your mind, once you've seen it, you never forget it!

Fabulous view from Brooklyn Bridge Park. Easy to get to on the subway. It was vey cold when we were there otherwise we would have walked back over the Brooklyn Bridge. If you want to take good photos you'll need to visit on a clear day.
All you imagined and more!. Try to be in a place near sunset so you can see it during the day and the lights at night in the same trip.

Worth every step!. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and round to Brooklyn Heights to view the Manhattan skyline after the sun had gone down and it was worth the long walk - it's such an iconic sight and it was thrilling to see it in the flesh. So beautiful with all the light reflecting on the water - another item ticked off the bucket list!
A must. Very nice to visit. A top in NY city. If you have enough time you must go there in NY because that is a very nice place

Manhattan Sky!. The view is breath-taking and amazing... if you go t o NYc.. you HAVE TO GO HERE!!... Although there are many options...but I think Empire State building gives the best view... yo have other options like the RockerFeller Center and one more which I cant remember

What a view!. Whats to be said about one of the most famous skylines in the world that you don't already know!? We were lucky enough to take in the view from the Ferry as we crossed to Liberty Island and to also view it from the Top of the Rock.

This is a dated ride that needs up dating. This is a video ride and needs up-dating it was probably good back in the 70's but is not worth the time or the extra expense you will not miss much by not going on this ride

Breathtaking. When you visit Liberty Island or Ellis Island, something I highly recommend, the view as you look back on Manhatten nearly steals your breath away. Especially when you see the Freedom tower standing tall, proud and yes, defiant, above the rest of the buildings. New York has a spirit no other city can hope to imitate and it's obvious in their skyline.
Relaxing walk. A great little get away if you want to take a stroll away from the masses. Make sure you stop off at one of the 'viewing stations' and watch the traffic go by.

New York New York!. We never tire of the New York skyline, no matter how many times we've been it still manages to grab our attention. When arriving from JFK by car the view before you descend in to the Midtown tunnel, that first view of the Chrysler Building, the Empire State and the ever growing towers at the WTC always take our breath away.One good way of getting a sense of the scale of the skyline is to take a ferry to Staten Island or a boat trip along the East River, especially at night.But the best place to view the skyline is from The Top of The Rock, the view of a Downtown is stunning.How We love New York!!

Go to Manhattan Bridge Park. Great views from either side of Manhattan bridge at this location. Very cold when we were there in January with an arctic gale blowing but still worth the visit. Many spots for great spots for photos but stingily recommend the left hand of the bridge after you walk down the pathway if you want to get the photo below.
The city of dreams. New york is the best city ever. I cannot describe how amazing it is. It is a MUST in everyone's life. I hope i'll go there again.
A must-see!. We enjoyed the skyline most from Liberty Island. You could see Manhattan on one side and Ellis Island on the other. Beautiful and iconic!

Beautiful at night. It was freezing the night we walked over the Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn Heights Promenade. It was worth the walk though because the view of the Manhattan Skyline lit up at night was incredible.
Wow. Nice visit amazing skyline day and night. Sad buildings are a mush mash thrown everywhere when you take a closer look. Trump are the least interesting, newer seems to skip the architecture

breath taking. Was a clear night, saw it from the Top of the Rock. You must go to Rockefeller Center , see the movie about how it was made, unbelievable that someone climbed so high in sky to make all the high rise buildings, then go upstairs view the city. Great restraurants by the ice skating rink also.

View it for free from the Staton Island Ferry!. Might be best seen from Brooklyn Heights, but the view from the Staton Island Ferry is also magnificent. That way you can see the Statue of Liberty while you´re at it!
Great Views and great Pictures. The skyline is amazing, one of the best in the world. There are many sights and amazing buildings to look at. Must see in New York.
Fantastic!. Fantastic! I liked everything about it . I thought the top of the rock was cool and need I say the view from the Empire State Building wow !
From the Jersey Side. Wonderful view from Weehawken. Makes waiting in traffic a lot easier. Hard to beat any where in the world. Weehawken in nearly straight across from ESB.

To die for. Best view of downtown is from Brooklyn Heights. Go to Pier 17, just behind famous Wall Street and get THE bridge (Brooklyn Bridge, of course). When you are in Brooklyn follow the indication for Brooklyn bridge Park which is just two minutes walking on your left, and enjoy.

What a View!. Magnificent view from the top of the Marriott Marquis and from the Brooklyn Bridge. Standing on the bank of the East River lower Manhattan, large chunks of ice floated by and added to the experience. The bar at the Marriott offers a great nighttime view.
Stunning Skyline. The Skyline speaks for itself. There's nothing quite like it in the world and it never fails to thrill.
Iconic. It gives me goosebumps every time I see it, usually from the Jersey side. If you want the whole thing, take the Circle Line, preferably at night when it's all lit up.

Sights for sore eyes!!!. Just as you always expected, all those iconic buildings drawing your eyes upwards all the time. Expect a few cricks in your neck but it is really all worth it. Try to see it from different viewpoints: we tried to look at it from the Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge even from our plane landing at JFK and of course from the street level.Even a week later we still say "wow remember that" when we look at the pictures we took.

Daily walks along the Hudson and its free. During our visit, we walked down along the Hudson daily, the walkway is excellent and takes you down to Battery park take in the sight of the statue of liberty as well and beyond. a good flat walk. NYC also has used the old ship loading piers very well turning them into parks that jot out onto the Hudson a great use of space and gives a excellent view up/down and take in the city skylineWalk the bridges as well a nise walk of the Manhattan bridge and back over the Brooklyn bridge a nice easy walk.The Staten island ferry is also another great way to see the skyline. its all free as well

Amazing day and night!. We actually stayed across the East River which in itself fave us fantastic views on the manhattan skyline . It's lovely to see during the day but at night it's amazing! You can literally pick out all the famous building; The Empire State Building, The UN , The Chrysler all as clear as day unless it's foggy and then it can vanish ! From our 10th floor hotel room the nighttime sight was fantastic!

Million dollar view. Of course, being in Manhattan affords great views of the city and from some tall buildings the sights are great - try the top of Radio City. But for the best view, take the ferry or the path across the Hudson to Jersey City, around night time, to see the most spectacular sight from the pier - the entire profile of NYC, from the lower tip of Manhattan up north to the George Washington Bridge, all alit in spectacular colors (with luck, there will be a moon above). I am very fortunate, since i live in the Penthouse apartment just off the ferry and get that view every evening - and watch the Empire State Building change its colors nightly (red and green for Christmas, Orange for Halloween, etc).

Capital of the World. From any angle, any vantage point, just look and take it in. There is no place like this on the face of the planet, and you're close to it. There's a bit of everywhere on the streets below, but look up, see the beauty, the art, the majesty of man's efforts.
Amazing. Amazing view - a must see on a visit to New York! Some great pictures and brilliant to pick out famous landmarks!

Incredible view of city, best viewed on clear morning or evening to view the lights of the city.. Manhattan skyline there is nothing like it in the world. The evening views of the city scape draped in lights of the city will capture your breath and take it away. Next best thing is a beautiful clear day, which we found in the morning.A treat to behold.Do schedule in to experience this.
Empire State Building. A must see at night! The lights from up high at night are just beautiful! You can see everything all around!
Manhattan Skyline. Its such a beautiful site, especially at nighttime when everything is lite up. You have to like scenery to appreciate the skyline.

Breath taking from Frank Sinatra's hometown at Christmas. I loved seeing this beautiful skyline. Our bus driver took us to Hoboken on the way back from the city and the view was great to see high up on this hill in Hoboken. It was so beautiful to see at night and in the daytime it is so nice to see as well . The Christmas lights were gorgeous and I would highly recommend seeing this if you are in the area.
beautifull. loved the beauty of the array of different colour lights that lights up the city at nights, that can be seen miles away across the river.
Breathtaking. Never fails to impress. Our memory card is packed with shots taken on foot from land, from the Staten Island ferry from sea and from The Empire State Building from air.
Beautiful from far away.. The sunset with Manhattan skyline was nice, but after going down there and walking around, I do not envy anyone who lives in that concrete jungle.
Lovely walk. A really nice walk and a great opportunity to see right out into the bay. Try and go on a clear day if possible, the view is amazing!
Great walk. New attraction. Easy to find. A different aspect to the usual. Walk from either north or south. Good view of river

Such an amazing view!. My fiance and i viewed the skyline from a Helicopter ride and it was 100% worth the money. Its a fab view and you need to see it from the air. The Empire State and The Rockefellar centre are great views of Manhatten too.

Excellent skyline, better at night. I never thought it could be so bright and amazing. We admired it from the airplane (day), from Roosevelt Island (day), Brooklyn Bridge (night) and Newark (day). Skyscrapers, beautiful architecture, gorgeous classic bridges, etc. You cannot miss this free attraction.

Spectacular. I took the night tour of Brooklyn Bridge and the Manhattan skyline and it was unbelievably beautiful. It was a chilly night but if you were dressed for the weather, it was a memory never to be forgotten. Good tour guide

Take a CircleLine boat tour to view the skyline from different points. Explanations added. Manhantan skyline is absolutely the most pictoresque attraction of Manhattan. It is not a single monument or a single building that gives the city the atmosphere. It is the combination of so many unique buildings such as the Empire State building, the Chrysler building and so many other skyscrapers that makes it In my trip to NYC I've seen the financial district skyline both from the ferry to Ellis Island and Statue of Liberty and the Circle Line sightseeing boat tour, and I advise on the circle line, they give lots of helpful information during the trip and since they circle the Manhattan island you get many points of view and lots of explanations about the buildings in the area.I absolutely also loved to see the Chrysler building from Queens where I stayed, at night.

Everything you see in the movies!. New York is one of those cities that the longer you're there, the more you love it. I was there 20 years ago, and the atmosphere is far more friendly now. The skyline is still amazing, with views from the iconic buildings, jus breath taking.
Identify the buildings. Harder than you think, even native new yorkers have trouble. Experience it from the staten island ferry, it's free.

So you think you've seen it all before !!!!. We thought we had, but not like this. When we booked this holiday, it was to celebrate our golden anniversary, and although we had flown in a helicopter before, this was to be a whole new experience. We arrived at the heliport by yellow cab, ( a first ), and found that we had to queue for about half an hour to get our flight tickets validated and our lifejackets fitted etc. this in no way distracted from the trip as it was quite reassuring to listen to the safety procedures. It was quite surprising to see the number of helicopters on the deck, and the frequency with which they took off and landed. It is a very slick operation. The views were astounding , with three or four circuits around the Statue of Liberty, ( which was closed, as were all other public buildings, due to the budgetary problems ). The very friendly pilot took care that everybody on board had ample photo opportunities, and all too soon the trip was over. We flew with Liberty Helicopters, and although pricey, it was more than worth it.

Excellent. If you nothing else on a trip to New York , you should do this!The concept is fantastic it has been beautifully done. You get views of Manhattan you would not otherwise see and no matter what the weather (it was pouring with rain the day I chose to go) it made absolutely no difference it was still lovely

Breath-taking from everywhere. Best viewed from a cruise (try Circle Line cruises) day/night.Another great view from the Emprie State/Top of the Rock, or any high-rise if you don't want to shell out for a view of buildings
massive new construction. Everytime I come to NYC, i can't get over how much building is going on. Wait until the park tower is completed next year and that skyline will be forever changed

Really informative. Great opportunity to get a good overview of the city which is difficult when the city is so large and so full of interesting attractions. Priced well for the experience. Informative and entertaining presentation.
Amazing. Honestly nothing can be more exciting that kiss the boy of your life looking at the manhattan skyline
