all the lights at night. we were there christmas and new year. so all the people and how everything stays open . how clean it was day and night . and all the christmas lights. fabulous
Beauty at Christmas. The only bad part was the very cold temps while we were there. The week after we had gone, the temps were back up in the 60's. Can predict the weather.

Top of the Roc. Once you get to the top of Rockefeller Center you forget the chaos getting there. My husband and I were lucky enough to get there just as the sun was setting. The views of Central Park are amazing as are the views of lower Manhattan.I would have given this attraction a 5 if it were not for the problems getting to the elevator that takes you to the top.
Manhatten skyline. Need a good clear night to appreciate the view but fabulous.The water taxi rep was very good and informative about New York
Manhattan. Manhattan is really a beautiful place. Mornings are filled with clear blue skies, and at night it has a fantastic silhouette of lights from the buildings. Truly a great sight to see.

Amazing. Wow!! What can I say that's not already been wrote about this place. I've visited New York in 2005 and the skyline is still as magical as the first time you see it. It's truly like the movies you see. A Mecca of buildings all shapes and sizes. We've visited cities all around the world and the New York skyline will never be beaten for the wow factor.

Beautiful and impressive. In July of 2013 I fulfilled my life dream of visiting NYC. I expected a lot since I read that much about the city and saw so many pictures in the last couple years. Now, I didn't get disappointed. Its a stunning, impressive city and the skyline is just fantastic, the most famous one worldwide and a great mixture of old buildings and newer ones. Whenever I get the chance again I'll go back!

I'll Take Manhattan!. Are you crazy? The Manhattan skyline is just great. And the best view is from the williamsburg bridge traveling from brooklyn to manhattan at dusk! The three sections of the view are downtown with its large buildings in the financial center, a low lying area where Little Italy,China Town, Chelsea and Kips Bay Reside and then it gets tall again with the Empire State building the UN and the rest of it going uptown.
Breathtaking. Saw Manhattan Skyline both during the day and the night and was an exceptional experience. Visited Statue of Liberty (pre-book advised) during the day and New Years cruise at night
Breathtaking. We arrived at Newark airport and were driven to the Waldorf Astoria. The skyline is exactly as you see on TV. Totally breathtaking.
the city is great. when you are in time square you will freak out the people are great ! the vibes are wonderful . the food is everywhere

its like being transported to another planet.... awesome views everywhere you look... if you are a photographer be careful when you choose to visit. We hired a car and drove across the Hudson river for great shots of the skyline, but we didn't choose well, as it was raining and foggy and we didn't take any images... will just have to visit again..another point photographers should note is that you can't take a tripod to any of the attractions and the security guards can get a bit funny about professional looking cameras... was really wanting to take pictures from top of Empire State Building at twilight but no tripods allowed... check your venue before you go...all in all a fantastic city with great views everywhere..
Stunning. Everywhere you are in NYC the skyline keeps on taking your breath away. Definitely go to the top of the strand for an awesome view of Empire State with a fab cocktail!
Awesome View. This view is pretty awesome and was much photographed on our recent trip to NYC. Best viewed, and captured, from a boat. It is pretty intimidating!

Amazing skyline!. Viewing the skyline was a must do on my trip to nyc. The best view in my opinion was from the Brooklyn bridge park at the empire fulton ferry. It is a breathtaking view where you can see many of the infamous skyscrapers as well as a close up of the brooklyn bridge.
Beautiful at dusk. We were on the last boat from Ellis island and the sun was setting behind us and the Statue of Liberty but the view of the skyline ahead was great!
Its all there. We drove in and it was there, we toured around and it was there .The best was the view from the E S B as that really made it there.You always know it when you see it.

Magnificent View- Best at Night. One of the best locations to get a great view of the Manhattan Skyline is while driving from New Jersey into New York on Route 3 East. The view on Saturday night January 4th was about as good as it gets. It was a crystal clear night and many of the buildings were lit up in bright Christmas colors. The largest building in the midtown Skyline, the Empire State Building, looked magnificent in very bright green and red colors. The Manhattan Skyline is a thing of beauty and should not be missed. Another great view of the Skyline could be had when airlines flying into Newark Airport take a southern approach to the runway. If you are lucky enough to be on the left side of the plane you will get a great view of the midtown skyline, as well as the Freedom Tower in the financial district and also the Statue of Liberty. When flying to Newark Airport book a seat on the left side of the plane and you might get a great view of this Skyline.
Beautiful. Nothing else needs saying, one of the most absorbing viewpoints in the world that can be taken in from many locations.
Viewed from Central park. Viewed on a frosty day from the edge of the big reservoir in Central Park. Amazing view. Excellent photo opportunity.

Best Skyline in earth!!. Wen in NYC, try to take room in as high a level as you can. No skyline like NYC skyline. I like that Xmas time they even light up the buildings in special colors. Makes you feel as if you in a movie setting
Always Beautiful. I never get tired of seeing the skyline. The sight is classic. Fabulous view driving in from New Jersey near the Lincoln tunnel.

We viewed it from the Staten Island Ferry!. We viewed the Manhattan Skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. It's free and is a (approx.) 20 minute ride to and from. It was a wonderful view in my opinion. There are many places you can the skyline and I"m sure most of them are fantastic.
Awesome!!!!. I live in New York, and I never get sick of seeing the skyline with all of the lights and the different heights and shapes of buildings.
Manhattan skyline delight!. Brilliant! See an amazing side of the city not normally available! Visited NYC twice before and can't believe we have never done this earlier. Thoroughly recommend!
The best skyline in the world!. There is no place on Earth anything remote like New York City, And the New York skyline says it all!

Fabulous!. We saw this fab skyline from the water taxi both in the day and when it got dark to and from the Statue of Liberty. Great skyline views also going across the Brooklyn Bridge. You could even book a helicopter ride to see it if you wanted.
Bright Big City!. The view is so stunning and unique that one forgets what is lying down there. Especially I love to see from Queens' side.
Beautiful. To get the full view make sure it is clear and go to the Empire State building or any high point, Brooklyn Promenade, Staten Island Ferry (free) or Jersey to get some great pictures.

Great view. For a nice view, go to Brooklyn (dumbo) at sunrise or sunset. Good photographing spots from right under the Brooklyn bridge. You can see the Statue of Liberty in the back too from there. Good viewing also from the Ellis island ferry or water taxis.
Skyline in nyork. Do the esb at night, breathtaking, if you can stand the queuing ,!!!it moves quicker than you think tho.

Iconic. Whether from plane, train or automobile, or just on foot, these views are amazing. A truly iconic skyline, there are so many vantage points around the city to see the Manhattan skyline from various perspectives in all its glory. I saw it from the top of the rock, crossing the Brooklyn bridge on foot, a helicopter ride and a boat cruise - each one different yet incredible! Can't wait to go back!

Every Buildings were Meant For Each Other. I took a picture of Manhattan Skyline with my family's photo in front of it. The view was awesome, every buildings like were made for each other, they completed the beautiful blue sky.
Manhattan skyline from the view at Brooklyn Heights. I enjoyed watching the change of light as dusk fell, from a great view at Brooklyn Heights, a great vantage point.

see it by helicopter!. we decided to splash out and spend our money on an amazing helicopter ride.
we are so glad we did its the best way to see the city skyline. a once in a life time experience so well worth the money.( just do it ! )when we went it was just over £100 each

Best views ever. You can do the obvious ones; the Top of the Rock or the Empire State Observation Decks; you could also take the boat on 42nd steet and 12th ave (pier 83) so you can have amazing views of Manhattan, Queens, Liberty Island and many more. Try buying the NY City Pass so you have access to all this by paying only once time (106 dollars).
Amazing to see first hand. Best viewed from across the water or in a taxi from the bridges etc. In the snow, it was extra special!

Yet Again. Never fails to impress and uinque in the world. My first trip to Manhatten was in 1986 and it was terrifying and you were advised not to leave the hotel after certain hours. It has so much and so much for the better.
Great View. Public bathrooms along the walk, clean, scenic and peaceful! We walked the whole way- its not too far and there are benches along the way.
Lady's Ny weekend. we had trouble with the town car taxi they say there a cab but don't trust them but had a wonderful time
Great service. I was impressed with the quality of the customer service we encountered. The staff were friendly and gave us the correct information.

Manhattan skyline. The battle continues between who has the best skyline , Hong Kong or New York . I guess it's a personal choice as both are so different . Best time to see Manhattan skyline is get up early and get across to Brooklyn and watch the sun rise over Manhattan . Then walk back over the Brooklyn bridge . Easiest way to get to Brooklyn is via the Metro .
Manhattan Holiday. Simply Amazed :)A Must Visit Place , luved dis place. Enjoyd wid my siblings . No doubt, evryone should go there to enjoy wid fam n frnds <3<3<3
Stunning. Everyone should see the newyork skyline once in their life I can't wait to go back again. I would reccommend seeing the view especially at night.... Stunning
Amazing Views!!. Best time to see the city is at sunset..absolutely once in a lifetime experience to witness such a sight..Brilliant!!

World best skyline. One of the great skylines of the world. There are literally many view points in all directions, I'd recommend the following. The trip from JFK into the city gives you a stunning view with the empire states building standing out in the centre - they will not build around it, and it looks magnificent. The view looking south from the Rockerfeller centre give you the empire states building and the financial centre further on. I'd also recommend the Staten Island ferry but to be honest the list is endless. A tip - go up the Rockerfeller just before dark so you get both day and night views.

Excelent tour. I love New York.. I liked the Hotels friendly staff that gave me advice and was so nice every time we went in and out. I liked the taxi drivers so friendly and helpful. The city, the peoples. Every one was nice and I dint feel lonely or bored at all. Thank God for the experience.

The most famous skyline in the world. No wonder the skyline is in all that many movies and pictures, it is definitely beautiful.There are several good ways to appreciate it. The cheapest way is the Staten Island Ferry, but it is not the best to take pictures since it shakes a little with the waves.If you want to take good pictures go to the Brooklyn Bridge or Elis Island.My advice to any urban landscape observation is to go at the end of the afternoon so you see the city with daylight and at night.
manhattan skyline. Manhatton skyline seen from Empire State building at sunset. Magnificent!!! time of year December all the buildings lit up. Chrysler building changing colours truly spectacular

Is a review necessary?. I have seen many skylines in many cities and all are beautiful. As a native I might be a tad prejudice but I am always wowed and I see the skyline very often. My thought is always how impressive it must be to visitors.
Staten Island Ferry. It's pretty commonly known, but take the free (yes, as in free, no hidden fees) Staten Island Ferry, for a fantastic view of One World Trade, and the Statue of Liberty.

great view. we saw the Manhatten Skyline from the boat on the trip to the Statue of Liberty. It was a beautiful day with clear blue skies so the skyline was probably at its best. The reflection from the sun in the windows it even more stunning. You really can't help but go wow. You would also see the skyline for free from the Staten Island Ferry. However on a lovely day the boat trip to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island is definitely a must do and good value.
World famous. Get the tour so to get amazing tips and hints about architecture, history and more. Beautiful at night.

Stunning Views. It is very worthwhile to stroll the shores of the East River in Brooklyn & Queens, just to see the views of Manhattan. Especially good places are Astoria Park in Queens; the Pulaski Bridge crossing the Newtown Inlet between Queens & Brooklyn; & the pier of the East River Ferry at Freeman Street, Greenpoint Park, the Empire-Fulton Ferry State Park, & the Brooklyn Bridge Park, all in Brooklyn. More unusual places include Wards Island, & in Brooklyn, Sunset Park (for a very distant view of Manhattan), & the Waterwalk in south Brooklyn's Bay Ridge neighborhood. Maybe best of all is the view from Roosevelt Island. And this is not even talking about the views from New Jersey, as well as from the Circle Line cruise!

Staten Island Ferry the way to go.. My wife and I brought her sister and niece from Brazil to the city on their recent visit to the States. This turned out to be one of the hightlights of the trip. If you don't know, the Ferry is FREE. That's right! they used to charge, but it has been free for several years. It takes an hour to go out and come back from Staten Island, and the views are excellent. The day we went was bright blue skies, but cold. Still, you could go out on the aft deck going out and the fore deck coming back for great photo ops of the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and the skyline stretching from Jersey City to Brooklyn. Gotta do it!
Absolutely beautiful. Such a magnificent thing to see, especially looking at Manhattan from the Statue of Liberty. BREATHTAKING.
Like No Other City. You have to view the skyline from outside of the city. It is different from all sides. My favorite is from Brooklyn and also looking over from the Jersey side is fabulous too.
wonderful location for a walk!. great walk and lots of tourists to say hello to! Walking through a sculpture garden and seeing the progress of the city from above
Just like the movies. Very very awesome view which truly lived up to its name. One of the best spots to take in the view would be the Liberty island. Every angle was picture perfect.

Urban Planning. This could have been destroyed, yet due to creative thinking, an upper-level park was build from the remains of an elevated subway track. A great way to take in the outdoors in urban NYC. It was a surprise. A gem. A nice way to pass time while on business in NYC.

Beautiful. Love this city's skyline. You can't help but get excited about seeing it and being there. So many great places to take exceptional pictures. We were lucky to have several beautifully clear days.
Beautiful and Impressive. Get the Ferry to Staten Island at the sound of Manhattan...it is free and you get to see the Statue of Liberty and the Manhattan Skyline from the best angle.

Unique track urban landscape. Walking along a special route in the urban landscape of New York - a unique experience that combines the attractions of Chelsea neighborhood - Food Market restaurants and art galleries opened in the area
What can you say. Best part of last visit was sitting at a friend's place in the village and looking out the window at the skyline. There is really no place like it...

World famous!. Just WOW! from every vantage point... especially if you are lucky enough to have a hotel room with that view (we did)! Whether seen from the Manhattan Bridge, Brooklyn, Staten Island or wherever... just awesome day or night!
Big City Lights. Amazing skyline, wonderful views during the daytime by taking the free Staten Island ferry for a ride around the harbour, and at night from the Brooklyn Bridge

Saw from water and from Brooklyn. It's a nice skyline but I don't think it is the best I have ever seen. I saw it two ways, from land and water and for me it wasn't that breathtaking. A little overhyped but it is still a good view so if you can, do see it.

Great reason to visit NYC. Just to see the NYC skyline is a reason to visit! we saw the skyline from a number of vantage points including the Staten Island Ferry which was free and gave us great views coming into downtown, from the top of the Rockefeller centre building and also walking through Central Park. Because the skyline is so famous you keep thinking of which movie you have seen the different views.

Spectacular. Saw the skyline from the Empire State however if you get the opportunity take a trip on the Statten Island Ferry (free). The journey from Battery Park to the Island takes 25 minutes and you get a view of the Manhattan Skyline from the ferry and have an added bonus of seeing the Statue of Libert and the Brooklyn Bridge.

Enjoy it in different ways. Look for rooftop bars and restaurants: we tried asiate for lunch, and the rooftop bar in the dreamlounge hotel. Excellent views, magical locations. Also a view from brooklyn on the skyline is worth while, as well as on teh ferry from staten island.

Beautiful by day ... spectacular on a summer night ... from these locations. I have seen NYC skyline from many angles. Of course you need to be farther away to appreciate it. My favorite view is from Brooklyn Heights Promenade over Brooklyn Bridge Park. You can see the Statue of Liberty, One World Trade Center, Brooklyn Bridge, Battery Park, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and more ... all in one view. The Brooklyn Heights neighborhood is a cozy place to hang out too. Other great views: from Long Island City, Weehawken NJ, and of course from a boat on the Hudson on a beautiful New Year's Eve night.

Nothing Else on the East Coast is Like It. This view needs to be seen by both day and night. Gorgeous. Breath-taking. Nothing else compares. The lights at night and the same view during the day are picturesque!
Nice walk above the city. Great walk that's away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. Set aside a good 2 hours to enjoy it.

magic. The size of the skyline with the varying buildings.On a clear night
the city lights are magic. It is the most spectacular city skyline I have seen.

No wonder they named it twice!!!. New York is an experience not to be forgotten, from tasting terrific meals to seeing all the sights, this was a visit I shall never forget! We stayed on the 20th floor of a hotel on the edge of the Theatre District with a Fire Station below us! The sight of the engine leaving was stupendous!Lots to do and see - the best views are from Central Park, and from the Bridges across the rivers, but by far and away is the view from the Staten Island ferry as the sun sets!! Beautiful!!

NY,NY. What a view, none other like it in the world. So many different locations to see this from. Brooklyn docks, Queens parks, the Jersey side. One of the best is from Bear Mountain in the fall, you can hold the entire city in the palm of your hand.
New York skyline at night. Probably the best skyline in the world. Must be seen at day and nigh time. Boat tour is good so that can be seen from water.

amazing views on a clear day. couple of days weather and visibility was bad, its important to check weather to ensure sightseeing on the best days. But its a surreal sight with hitech modern buildings next door to fabulous art deco styles

brilliant. Loved New York Manhattan . Beautiful view via the ferry . Amazing bridges . The skyline views are amazing you will love it especially at night with all the sparkling lights. What a beautiful sight of the skyline. When in NY make sure to do the ferry, and do the tour bus at night amazing sight of Manhattan and the bridges. Also one needs to go to Empire State and view the skyline during the day , one can take lovely pictures of Manhattan and the river, bridges as well as the tall buildings excellent view from there. You can also get a amazing view of skyline from island of the Statue of Liberty. Well recommended any time. New York is the place to be.!
Ravel Hotel Penthouse. Go here for a drink, just to see the skyline. Amazing view of the Bridges. Top of Empire State Building is amazing as well, but COLD in December.
brilliant skyline. Just loved it. It was amazing view. Beautiful city. You either love new york or you dont. The tall buildings, The hudson river and the bridges are amazing Love new york.
Take the ferry!. We took the East River Ferry to mid town after visiting the 9/11 Memorial; what a great ride! The skyline views are unmatched and seeing the bridges close up was another treat.
The Tree is Lit!. The Rockefeller Center Tree is lit and is absolutely gorgeous. The throngs of people drawn are like ants to a marshmallow! It is an experience to be enjoyed by young and old alike.

It still has the 'wow-factor'. The Manhattan skyline is probably the most photographed in the world. Of course you go here on your New York trip. Nice is the walk on Brooklyn Bridge, but you can't make nice photo's because of the steel cables. Better walk to the other side, go right under the bridge and walk to Brooklyn Heights. Here you have the best view at Manhattan and the bridges. For the best light, go early in the morning (or get here for the most beautiful sunset!).Another way to enjoy the skyline, is to take the (free!) ferry to Staten Island from Battery Park, downtown Manhattan. Be sure to leave with the last daylight, so you can return in the dark.
Unmissable view. This is one of the most fabulous skylines in the world, best seen from Brooklyn. Get the water taxi over and take it all in.
One of a kind. as native nyers, we are always thrilled when returning from somewhere else. we really love the view especially when the lights are starting to go on. Sheer Heaven
Epic. definitely worth seeing especially from a Helicopter i recommend Liberty helicopters (cheaper than their competitors and you still see everything.)
Impressive Manhattan. Very impressive buildings of almost unbelievable heights, but they have one drawback in that the streets are quite dull as the sun is blocked out.

Amazing!. The view from Brooklyn is absolutely breathtaking! So worthwile the walk over the bridge! Take the subway to Brooklyn and walk back to Manhattan, the best view! Love the skyline of Manhatten and the city of New York! Best city in the world :-)

A MUST see!!. This is an experience everyone should see, from ground level the buildings are magnificent but looking at the skyline wether it be daylight, night or on an overcast day is just breathtaking! Especially from the Hudson who would have thought concrete and glass could look so beautiful.

A must do!. I loved this walk! Such a beautiful hidden gem with great views of New York winding through all kinds of architecture. I can definitely recommend it as one of my favorite things to do in New York!

Breathtaking!. Try a night lights bus tour to see the skyline at night. We were on a bus that took us to Brooklyn and allowed us to look back at Manhattan. What a sight! So lovely. Everyone on our bus was in awe. Such a great experience.

The best views are in Brooklyn Heights or on the water. Go to the Promenade, preferably on a nice day, in Brooklyn Heights. Brooklyn is now gentrified chic, so you can eat well, visit a museum, gallery or shop while you're there. Subway to Borough Hall. (Don't complain about the BQE traffic below you - cripes, you're in NYC!!) Or take the FREE Staten Island Ferry way downtown, which you can take back and forth without getting off in Staten Island except to swap ferries at the terminal (totally understandable, sorry SI!).

Must do - best seen from a ferry. We tried seeing this from a ferry, bridges, Brooklyn and the Empire State Building.
The best view / photo opportunity was from a ferry on the Hudson River south of Manhattan.

Beautiful Skyline. The smells,sounds and sights are memorable. The view in the city is great from Empire State but also good from Newark airport. Even better, flying in or out of the city taking Manhattan never gets boring.
How can you not like it?. We get excited every time we get close and get a glimpse of the skyline. We love coming to NYC, especially around Christmas to see everything lit up.

Be prepared for a stiff neck!!. If you have never been to NYC the skylines are something of a wow factor you cannot appreciate how high the buildings are. Visit Empire State Building or travel on ferry to appreciate the sights and the awesome buildings. You can walk and look around you but be prepared for a stiff neck!!

History and Nature. Even though I had not heard of the skyline before my first trip to New York this year, it seemed like everyone else had! So it came as a pleasant surprise to find this raised nature strip on the city lo-mid west side. Like a garden or forest path in the middle of the Big Apple, with some funky 'theater' seating to 'view' parts of the city through large glass 'screens'. Great way to spend a bit of time away from the urban hubbub (although you will not get away from the crowds as this is a popular activity)

Breathtaking. Whether seeing this from the top of the rock, empire state building, cruise etc etc. This skyline is the most impressive in the world, totally surreal experience everytime you see it. Would highly recommend everybody see this once in their lifetime.

Never Gets Old. Whether you're looking at it from afar or as a part of it, this truly is the greatest skyline in the world. There are so many locations and ways to view it from: high buildings, ferries, bridges, helicopters... no view is disappointing. If you ever find yourself in the city, find some time to just appreciate this thing of beauty-- it really never does get old.

View from the Brooklyn Bridge. Start from the Brooklyn side, stop @ a good bakery before you cross to munch on a great sandwich from DUMBO area.The walk is short and sweet, but the BEST view of the city skyline. It shows the cluster of highrises from the battery, then the low-lying area of the "village" then the return to the epic skyscrapers of midtown. Very interesting from this vantage point!

always a beauty. the manhattan skyline is always a beauty: at daytime and at evening time...and from whatever side you look at it: the bustling Times Square, the Top of the Rock, the Statue of Liberty cruise...

empire state vs rockefeller center observatories. The view of Manhattan is spectacular from both - though different. You can actually see Central Park (and the Empire State building!) from the Rockefeller Center Deck. It is a new modern and very well executed Observatory. The Empire State Building has a 360 view of Manhattan and, of course, the romance of this well know observatory.

Great Path. We took about 3 hours for the following path. Could take longer.Take the Ikea water taxi from pier 11 (NYC) to Brooklyn (Free). You get water shots of the skyline as well as Statue of Liberty (SOL). Stroll over to the market next to Ikea, where you will find a small park with a dock. This gives you direct views of the SOL. Walk Up Van Brunt and find a café to have a late lunch or beer. Take bus to Pacific ($2.50). Walk new boardwalk all the way to the Brooklyn bridge. It is a green space, with walking and biking trails. The whole trip is loaded with Manhattan skyline views and panoramic opportunities. Eat a little ice cream at the creamery and then walk the Brooklyn bridge back. You will not get better cheaper photos of Manhattan skyline will spending a few hours strolling with your mate! Total round trip cost...$2.50 per person minus beer/food. :o)

do it by day, do it by night, but DO it. Or do it by helicopter, we did the first two, and the best place for it was the Statten Island Ferry, the best free ride in NY!!! but whatever you do on your trip, see the skyline both day& night, its the most spectacular, and dont walk past the pictures for sale on the broadwalk, they are quite good, ours looks great on our wall,

Stunning, from so many accessible viewpoints.. Let's face it, the Manhattan skyline is familiar to people throughout the world and probably the first image that comes to mind when you think of 'New York'. And wherever you are in the city, you can't fail to be aware of the impact of the skyscrapers around you. From the Observation Deck of The Empire State Building on a clear moonlit night - I can't tell you how stunning that 360* view is; simply jaw dropping. Night or day, the free trip on the Staten Island Ferry is the best way to appreciate the sheer scale of the skyline. And wherever you stay, check and see if there is access to the roof. From Battery Park I had fantastic views of The Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, New Jersey and best of all, the stunning new WTC1. My favourite building in the city!

The Greatest Skyline in the World. From afar the skyline looks magnificent. From above a maze of busyness. From below you get neck ache constantly looking up at the architectural array of styles and beauty.
Briiliant. Watch it from New Jersey side. The one I loved was exchange place in NJ. The PATH can take you here. It is one of the breath taking views.

The Best. What other city can you see all the buildings in the city. Only Manhattan due to the shape of the island. Some great viewing spots are:View from the west: take the Path train over to Jersey City, NJ and walk along the pier.View from the south: take the Staten Island Ferry (free) and sit outside on the ferry.View from east: walk out onto the Brooklyn Bridge and over into Brooklyn.And you need to see it at different times of the day. Looks different at daytime versus nighttime and even sunset.

How anyone could rate this less than 5 stars is beyond me. The most famous skyline in the world, a monument to humanity. Best view of it for me was from the Brooklyn Bridge and from Top of the Rock, but it's amazing from any angle.Seeing Manhattan for the first time was one of the experiences I had been looking forward to most in my life, and it didn't disappoint.

As seen on television ;-). The view on the Manhattan skyline from Broad Channel, from the Manhattan Circle Line and from Newark airport are all magnificent. I hae seen the skyline so many times on television and in movies, but seeing it for real is such a special experience. You have to see it at least once in your life!

Awe inspiring Skyline. Best view of the Manhattan Skyline is from the Kosciusko Bridge in Queens, especially at sunset when the lights in the buildings sparkle against the red sky. Additional great views from the Queens or northern Brooklyn waterfronts. Best sunrise views from New Jersey side of the Hudson River

Skyscapers galore. Stunning views over Manhattan from the top of Empire State building and Rockefellar. The new World Trade Centre 1 is Impressive. Now the tallest in New York City. It's amazing haw compact Manhattan is.
Unforgettable. Walk to Brooklyn via the bridge, go on the riverside path and then go up to the Brooklyn Heights... do it at sunset and you will feel as a moviestar!

Nothing in the world like it!. This is New York as you imagine it. Bigger, brasher,more amazing than you can ever imagine. Last time i saw it there were the twin towers but no more after 9/11, You can see it by helicopter or the circle line which is worth the trip. If you go on the Staten island ferry you also get a good view for pictures etc.
Always Amazing. I could spend all day staring at the Manhattan skyline but there are so many things to do in NY that that would be silly. Make sure you see it both at night and during the day.
New York Water Front. Great city to visit, walk around or gat a cab, otherwise take boat ride or have river cruise, anf I find I have to write a book
one to remember. It dose not matter if it is your 1st visit or your 100th visit it never fails to impress and get,s better as night fall,s.

Amazing! Will never see another skyline like it.....anywhere!!. We travelled on the circle line from the end of 42nd street all the way down the Hudson river. It takes around 2 hours so loads of opportunity to take great photos. We left at 4.oo pm so actually got photos of the sun setting behind the statue of liberty. Great pics of New Jersey and Fabulous pics of Manhattan at night!! 4.00 is the last boat trip, but has to be the best as u get to see it all light. Day, sunset and night. Although u have to see it in real to truly appreciate it.

World-famous skyline. If you are visiting NYC, and have more than a day or two, at some point it is definitely worth viewing Manhattan (yes, it is an island) from a distance to appreciate its skyline. Ideally the Manhattan skyline is viewed from the water's edge (across the East River in Brooklyn or Queens, or even from across the Hudson River in New Jersey).At night, the view of Manhattan's very vertical skyline all lit up and reflected in the water is fabulous. During the day that same view is also really memorable. You have seen the Manhattan skyline in many movies, but when you see it in person for the first time, it will knock your socks off.

The city that never sleeps. The sky line of new York City is one not to miss. Either the Manhattan skyline or Brooklyn new York skyline. U can see them by walking over many of the bridges and u can do this for free. Don't miss this chance when u are visiting

Where the World Comes to Gather. Having been born and raised in Manhattan, I have seen the skyline change many times over the years, most notably and tragically by the events of 9/11.The skyline is known world wide and, with the addition of the Freedom Tower is again becoming one that can remind us of possibilities and the indomitable spirit of the American way and of Freedom for those who seek it.I bit of trivia: I learned very recently that the reason the skyscrapers are only built at the south end of Manhattan and in mid town is the geologic composition of the island that was formed when the east coast of present day north America collided with the west coast of the African continent to form Pangia. The bedrock folded and compressed as a result of the collision to form a very solid base in those two areas and remained in place after the continents separated and the island was formed. That piece of information, and about $12, will buy you a Martini at most places in present day Manhattan!

More Special For After 9/11. I have lived in New York my entire life. The twin towers were beautiful. As I drive home each and every day on the Long Island Expressway from work I get the view of our still most beautiful skyline. In my mind, I can still see the vision of the twin towers. If you are visiting New York, you must see the skyline at night....all lit up in it's glory. It is a great site. If you can, see it from the water, especially at night,.

Trip around Manhattan. Took a schooner trip to see the views of Manhattan. The best! The trip was very nice and the crew was knowledgeable. It was a little crowded, but the views couldn't be any better. Definitely bring a pack of goodies to share.

The New York City skyline remains exciting. No matter how fed up I may become with life in NYC, the skyline never fails to thrill me! There are several ways to enjoy: either by taking the nr. 7 subway between Manhattan and Flushing, Queens, or by crossing a bridge; the D subway goes over the Manhattan Bridge. You can see the Lower Manhattan skyline from the (free) Staten Island Ferry.

Wonderful Adventure!!!. As much as I love our San Francisco skyline, Manhattan is . . . so much more. More, water view, more buildings, more everything. We were lucky enough to be there on warm days and gorgeous nights. For me, the most impressive view came from standing at the front of the Staten Island Ferry as we returned to the terminal at the tip end of Manhattan. Although that view from the top of the Empire State Building at midnight was a very close second.
Manhatten at sunset. There are many places to view this classic of skylines. I live in Clason point in the Bronx and this is where I took this picture.

The best view!. Manhattan Skyline is the most beautiful view I've ever seen. Looking at this metropolis from NJ side is amasing- you can feel all the energy and power of the city, all the beauty of the buildings and Hudson river just right there with little boats and yachts makes it even more special.

Awesome beyond compare!. Although its a concrete view, its a piece of heaven on earth.From North, South, East or West, you'll always be amazed and inspired.Each time I visit and take pictures, my fondness for it grows.A must do!

Awesome. Great view, great city, great place! Had an amazing trip to NYC. The view is something to behold from all angles, be it from the ferry to the Statue of Liberty or driving across the bridge from New Jersey. I spent 10days in NYC and it wasnt enough time to see/do all that I wanted to. Will have to go back again!
Fall in love in the Fall in NYC. Everyone needs to visit New York at least once in a lifetime. Our first trip an we loved it all. Saw all the big sites and loved them all.

Still the best. Is there any greater skyline on the planet than NYC? I think not. Despite the loss of the World Trade Center buildings, it is still the best skyline in the world. Now we get to enjoy the new additions to the skyline at the World Trade Center site.

More Than Just the View. When you first see it you may not think of words. You simply look and, for a moment, hold your breath involuntarily. Doesn't matter if it's from the from East River, across the Hudson River in New Jersey or on the Staten Island Ferry across the NY Harbor. You simply stare and themagnificence of a man-made wonder. Some of the best memories I have are from theLong Island Expressway (the major highway towards Midtown). You drive West up a slighthill with a panoramic view then dip down towads the Midtown Tunnel entrance where thebuildings suddenly seem close enough to touch across the River. Or you can take one of the elevated train ride above Queens and simply watch as the skyline unfolds while your car is noisily lurching above the streets and traffic below. The skyline can be seen for miles in any direction. It is beautifully eerie on nights when the low clouds or fog partially obscure the building tops. For those of us who have been lucky enough, we have seen it from the passenger seat or Flight Deck seat of an aircraft on approach to New York's LaGuardia Airport. Whether you're on the ground or in the air, the perspective is amazing. It does not rival Giza, The Grand Canyon or the Amazon for natural beauty or grandeur. I't simply New York. That's why we live here and why we visit here.

The main reason to see NYC. I cannot imagine not seeing it while in NYC. It is breathtaking. We first saw it at night - from Hornblower. We spent our New Years Eve on Hornblower - this experience was all about the view, and the view had it all. Music on Hornblower was awful, food so-so, service so-so, but still our New Years Eve was unforgettable, as we saw lights of New York and we were hypnotised by them.Next time, we took Stanton Island Ferry - free of charge - with our friends, on a sunny day in April.And again - the experience was amazing, we loved the view!I would not mind to take boat trip again - not for New Years Eve, but definitely next time in NYC I would like to have some jazz event on the boat, just to admire skyline again!

Sunset Circle Line. In the off=season the Circle Line does a half circle at 4 P.M. You get to see the lights coming on in the city and the sun set behind the Statue of Liberty. Fantastic guide too....David.

The most famous view in the world. What else to people come to New York want to see? What did the millions of immigrants coming to the shores and onto Ellis Island see? This is the premier attraction. Best seen:- a boat tour from the water. You can see the skyline, island and statue in one. - Brooklyn Bridge. With the bridge in the foreground, makes for great photos. - Columbia Heights promenade in Brooklyn. Not busy and unspoilt views of the city skyline.

One of the best skyline I ever saw. My wife and I just came back from New York this month. New York city has one of the best skyline in the world. There are two best locations to take a good picture of Manhattan Skyline for free: the first one is from Brooklyn Bridge, and you can take a picture of eastern Manhattan skyline, the second one is from the ferry between Staten Island and Manhattan, and you can get a good western Manhattan skyline pic. Those two are totally free.

So many great views; a treat for our son. We had many opportunities to view the Manhattan skyline from a variety of vantage points - the Empire State Building, from street level (being surrounded by it was interesting to our son), and from the harbor on the Staten Island Ferry. Its a free (once you're there) and wonderful sight.

I would call it the Highline. It is a must and everyone knows what it is and were it is -- literally elevated old train tracks they have converted to an oasis that runs from about 31st down to like 20th -- a park basically. Flowers, benches, trees, even some wood bleachers -- it is amazing, especially for the photographer, but even if you are not and just want a still -- do it!

Wow..... What can be said of this skyline? It simply has to be viewed. We viewed it from our hotel, from our airplane as it descended into LaGuardia, from Top of the Rock, from the Staten Island Ferry, from the Brooklyn Bridge, from the Empire State Bldg, and from Sheep Meadow in Central Park. Each view is different and fantastic.

where to find the views. liberty state park has great views, buts its time consuming for visitors. you could take a quick path train from the wtc to jersey city and see the same view right there from the waterfront piers to save time. if you do have extra time anywhere north up along the palisades also has great views, ie., weekhawken. other great views are east from lic and the new four freedoms park on roosevelt island (its fun to take the r.i. tram there too).the brooklyn hts promanade and the s.i. ferry also have wonderful, if more well known, views.lastly, don't forget the free rooftop views from various bldgs, such as metro hotel roof on 35th st (esb view), the new beer authority pub roof next to the port authority (nytimes bldg), the yotel deck, etc.
Viewed from the rockerfeller centre. Do the top of the rock experience early evening. Fantastic views over manhattan and the empire state building
Must see when in New York. watch the sun rise behind the buildings of manhattan is a must. can observe the size and beauty of this great city unfolding at dawn.
Great views. An interesting view of the backside of part of new York and the Hudson river. A clever development and planting programme which is a delight for the visitor

City view... so?. It's a city view....... what else is there to say. Yawn. Too many people, too much noise, traffic, traffic, traffic, crowds, crowds, crowds, steel, glass, concrete, steel, glass, concrete, steel, glass, concrete, steel, glass, concrete. Give me a tree!

Great views of the city.... We wanted to get some pictures of the skyline. We found the best location to be Liberty State Park in Jersey City. The park is free with ample parking and great views of Manhattan. The skyline is awesome, wish I had a chance to see it in person when the World Trade Center's were still standing.

Just stunning. We walked along to the bridge and waited for the water taxi back to manhattan. We saw the skyline transform as it got dark and I would definately recommend that you try and see this. There really is nothing like this view.

Peaceful oasis. We walked most if the Skyline and it was a nice stroll. It's a fantastic idea and a great way to get downtown a few blocks without the hustle and bustle of foot traffic and waiting to cross streets at lights etc. It does not have any great views but the trees and greenery are a refreshing change in Manhattan from sidewalks and grey buildings. We passed a little outdoor screening area, a guy playing some musical instruments and was a very calming walk with p,entry of places to stop and sit down and look at the changing autumnal foliage.

Breathtaking view of Manhattan at night from across the river!. We took one of the commuter ferries from Manhattan Island across to Brooklyn at about 7pm in the evening for dinner. The views at dusk of the skyline are breathtaking and give a great perspective of exactly how big NYC is. This was the best $4 we spent on the entire trip and if we had more time, would have definitely taken the trip a second time.
On a clear day.... Never tire of looking at the view...best by boat or when walking back to Manhattan on the Brooklyn Bridge.

Just like the movies. Yup, just an I imagined, the Manhattan skyline is well worth seeing and truly iconic in nature, especially from the Staten Island Ferry or crossing the Brooklyn Bridge. Try and see it from a distance in both day time and night time.

Empire state building. As someone who has visited New York, several times since 1987 to 2013, the empire state is still the real deal for the best views of the Big Apple. Its the oldest , but still the best.

Breath Taking View. Manhattan Skyline can be best viewed in day from the Libertina cruises and at night from the Brooklyn Bridge. Day and night both have their impact on the skyline and beleive me u have to experience this...words cannot describe the beauty of Manhattan Skyline.A must must visit place while in NYC.
Amazing. Absolutely amazing to see, especially at night when it is all lit up! Recommend going to New York just to see this!
Awsome view. Get to the tope of the Empire State Building at sunset and watch the city change from day to night, a friend reccomended it and I've got to say it was an awesome experince.

Breathtaking view - must visit. I was so much fascinated with Manhattan Skyline that I visited New York a second time so that I can revisit Manhattan Skyline! This place is simply amazing and nothing can beat the night's view of this skyline. You could either take a walk on Brooklyn bridge or go the Brooklyn Bridge Park for a breathtaking view.

What a view . If you've never been and you just read about it or see it on television then you will hear about the skylines beauty. Take time to experience it. It's like no other. When you are entranced in it you will notice that the sounds of the city to away and it's just you and the skyline.
Good travels!

The Standard top floor bar and lounge. no cover charge, couches and chair seating, heaters, glass panels to allow full view access of the skyline. go early. Not crowded. comfortable. great photo opportunity. fresh crepes made on site, adequate bar. location !! early evening at dusk not crowded. WHAT VIEWS!

Very good from every angle. Manhattan skyline is maybe the most photographed part of the city, and you can see it from different angles. We´ve make photographs from Statue of liberty/Ellis island and then also during our walking tour from Brooklyn bridge and from Brooklyn bridge park.

Beautiful, better than in pictures!. This was my first trip to New York and there were many things I looked forward to seeing. The Manhattan Skyline was on my list and was not at all disappointing. My husband and I went on a cruise and the view of the skyline from the ship was awesome. We also took a harbor and Statue of Liberty cruise that gave more amazing views. It is a definite MUST-SEE and is well worth taking in from various angles. As a matter of fact, I took a picture that is now on my mousepad.

great green walk and art. I felt like a fraud not going to MOMA or the MET while in NYC but I love walking and although there was no Picasso's on the walk it was a great way to combine a lovely walk with a bit of culture. It is a shame Banksy didnt tag something on it.....

Just stunning!. We spent a few hours in New York before sailing back to Southampton U.K. on the QM2 & got some amazing photos of the Manhattan skyline as we sailed away from it. The Manhattan skyline really does look fantastic from the water. Some photos look like paintings as it all looks surreal. You just can't stop staring at the wonder of those beautiful buildings.

Loved the view but doesn't match an aerial view.. The view from the Rockefeller center is wonderful, however because of the height of many of the Skyscrapers the overall view is limited. I am told a helicopter ride over the skyline is the only way to truly appreciate the vista of Manhattan at night.

Skyline like no other. Get to Top of the Rock and you will see a skyline like none other. This, along with the views from the Golden Gate Bridge overlook and The Grand Canyon, are the most impressive US views I have ever seen.

Iconic views that did not disappoint. During a 6 night stay in NY we went to Liberty and Ellis island and got beautiful views of the the Manhattan Skyline from the ferry over. It lived up to its iconic image. But we got even better views of it by walking over the brooklyn bridge an amazing experience in itself with incredible views, especially at dusk and night time. Well worth the walk.

Awesome Skyline From The Greatest City In The World. While there are boat rides that will charge you and arm and a leg to see the skyline. You can take a free ferry ride and see the skyline as well as the Statue of Liberty. All while making a quick stop at NYC's least talked about borough.

Stunning. The Manhattan Skyline is pretty much a city´s emblem, missing it would be like not visiting New York at all. And the best about is you can see it from so many different spots.I´ve been to NYC in 2002, 2003 and 2011 and never get tired of it.

Filmmakers view of Manhattan and great Greek food in Astoria.. Take N or Q train to last stop in Astoria, Queens (Ditmars exit.) Walk down 23rd St. to Astoria Park. View across East River to Manhattan used in skyline shots in films. While there, dine at Agnati for delicious Greek food.
impressive skyline. we were able to get different views from Manhattan skyline: fro,m the helicopter (15min flight; comany Heliny) from the ferry going to staten island, from Brookly bridge , ...
Stunning view. Bring a tripod and get some night shots from jersey!The skyline is so iconic, and another must see on your New York trip. This would be in a 48hr trip
Great view on the way back from Statue of Liberty. On the way back from a statue of liberty cruise, we were treated to a beautiful view of Manhattan, my favourite desktop wallpaper!!

yes. add it to your bucket list boys and girls, you don't wanna miss this. and i'm coming from a gorgeous, historical, modern and beautiful city with the Bosporus. and i still did not find it overrated
Go top of the Rock. Loved that you could get a glass of champagne whilst soaking up the views but quite pricey per glass!Turned off by the cost of the photos taken!

Amazing view of the Big Apple. So so soooo beautiful. It's just absolutely breathtaking. The Manhattan skyline is truly one of the most beautiful and iconic skylines you could ever have the privilege to see!

Impressive site.. It's worth taking a boat ride in the harbor so that you can see the beautiful Manhattan skyline. It just screams New York City, and is quite a sight.
I couldn't help but wonder what it was like when the Twin Towers were still there ...

Stay in NJ to get the best view of the Manhattan Skyline!. We stayed at the Hyatt in Jersey City NJ, and the view of Manhattan Skyline was breathtaking. The hotel is located directly across the Hudson from the 911 Memorial. Hopped on The Path subway that took us directly to the Memorial. This subway is located right beside the hotel, so we were able to park at the hotel and spend the day in NYC.

Incredible. No other skyline in the world can compare. This is the centerpiece of all metropolitan views and setting for hundreds of movies. Helicopter tour is the #1 best point of view but tour boat or Staten ferry is also great.
One of the best in the world!. I love the manhattan skyline, it looks different from all angles. I loved seeing it from the Staten Island ferry.

Magnificent. So many places to enjoy the skyline, but you should consider the "Top of the Rock" (observation deck at Rockefeller Center). Go at sunset and watch the color change across the city. It is breathtaking. And once the city lights take full effect, and the sky is dark, it will be a sight you'll remember forever.

There are so many ways to view the Skyline. There are so many ways to view the Manhattan Skyline. My favorite view is from the Dumbo section of Brooklyn because of the combination of art, food and a different perspective. Other places include: the Staten Island Ferry, Ellis Island, Fort Lee and the Gold Coast of New Jersey, the Tram to Roosevelt Island, from the air or on the Circle Line Cruise ship, and any number of skyscrapers (especially the Empire State building). For fun, visit an attraction and see how the skyline changes from place to place.
Great skyline. Great view of the NYC skyline from NJ. Up there with Hong Kong as the best city skylines in the world. Well worth a trip out to see and a pic or two
Picturesque. Just like all the movies. It was really neat to see it from the Staten Island Ferry (which was free)!
Take several views. There are so many different views to the Manhattan Skyline, try to sample a few of them: Brooklyn Bridge, Gantry Plaza Park, New Jersey, ...

Can't be missed. Excellent as viewed from the Manhattan Bridge (better, we were advised, than the Brooklyn Bridge, as you can see the latter from it!)
Trains passing are a bit noisy at first, but you get used to it.

Beautiful skyline. I was so lucky on my first visit to New York to fly the length of the Island before landing at LaGuardia airport. Just stunning. If you get a chance, make sure that you see it from Central Park also - one of the world's iconic experiences.
Beautiful. I crossed Brooklyn bridge and I had a spectacular view of Manhattan! It is aways beautiful! I could see many buildings and I was able to take a lot of pictures.

Best of both worlds. The Manhattan Skyline is one of those rare views you hardly find anywhere in the world. I was lucky to see it both during the day whilst on a cruise and at sunset/dawn when I took a long walk on the Brooklyn Bridge. The views are just amazing with beautiful spots for great pictures.
Beautiful. The sky line is the true New York scene. I especially enjoy viewing it in the evening. Nothing could be prettier.
Well worth the walk!. beautiful, interesting place to walk, look over the city and enjoy the lovely planting. best attraction in NYC.

Breathtaking views.. A fantastic place to visit. Very very busy at weekends, especially at night which I expected, so if you have young children it could be a bit difficult moving around. The skyline of Manhattan is amazing whichever angle you look from, whether from the Brooklyn side or coming back from a boat trip to Liberty Island etc.
Beautiful. There is nothing quite like the Manhattan Skyline. It's beautiful, whether it's during the day or all lit up at night!
Wow. Breathtaking. Loved the views from the top of the Rockafellar Building and from the Staten Island Ferry. Super fast lift up the tower and cheapest trip in town on the ferry!!

Awe inspiring. I'm from Chicago, so I didn't think I needed to see the New York skyline. I was wrong. We took an evening tour and viewed the skyline from the Brooklyn side of the river. The buildings and the statute of liberty in the twinkling evening lights was amazing.

Breathe Taking. There are several ways to see the manhattan skyline,by helicopter by water by coach or from the top of the rock.All give you spectacular views especially at night,we were told by our tour guide that friday night is best as all the offices are being cleaned for the weekend so a lot more buildings are lit up the view from Brooklyn bridge is to die for but in the end its down to you.I hope this review has been helpful to you if so check out my others and have a wonderful trip

Manhattan skyline from the water.. I'm not into going up tall buildings so I observed the skyline from various ground/water level vantage points. My favourite by far was from the Circle Line cruise during the day although it was pretty wonderful from the top of a hop on hop off bus as night settled and the lights came on. Definitely a must see as odten as possible at different times of day and night to get the feel of it all.
Interesting. It was an unusual experience. Quietime in the city and a great use of the disused railway line giving you time and space away from the hectic lifestyle of the city

Go, go go!. It is a beautiful walk with great views of Manhattan. It is a new acquisition of the city such as they turned an old train path into a walkway. You have some spots to eat or drink something up there but I suggest eating elsewhere. Its a must.

Amazing. Visited NYC from Oct. 9-13. Got a view of the Skyline from many different points of view. Whatever way you look at it, it is absolutely amazing. It's a great attraction because it is everywhere. When in Manhattan, just look up.
What can I say -- beautiful!. Gorgeous, especially at night. A great way to see the skyline is to walk the Brooklyn Bridge toward Manhattan as the sun is setting.
Truly in the sky. Great photo opportunities, very calm and beautiful, not to be missed. Great for strolling and sightseeing...
Another skyline view from..... We were visiting Stevens Institute of Technology in Hoboken, NJ on a crisp March morning...thought the skyline view of Manhattan was rather spectacular from there....
Gorgeous! View it from Ink48's rooftop bar. The Print Room at Ink48 is a great place to take in the skyline. 653 11th Ave at West 48th. Such a great New York City experience.

Go to Brooklyn at night. Everytime I am in NYC I make sure we go over a bridge into Brooklyn so we can look back at the NYC skyline. Its an incredible sight, always a highlight of our trip. How can you miss this?. It wouldn't be a trip to NYC without taking in the Manhattan Skyline. Try from Brooklyn heights or Staten Island for that really special view!

Beautiful photos to be had. Very picturesque, beautiful day and night, great picture opportunities too, loved it all, fab place to visit
beautiful to view at night. wow, amazing at night and day. its worth the trip . get on the red tour bus and see it by day and Night

Always a beauty. The Manhattan skyline is always magical--from an evening stroll through Battery Park to see the Statue of Liberty light up, to the views from the tops of the buildings you visit, to the first glimpse as you travel in from Jersey.

The new WTC is so impressive. The Manhattan skyline is so iconic and at day and night is so impressive. The new WTC looks so impressive and is a worthy replacement to the previous towers and provides a positive statement to the events of 911. We viewed the city from the Hudson

top of the world. we were going to pay to go up some building to see the skyline but instead met up with old friend and went to the top of her building for fantastic views. the harbor and Miss Liberty, Central Park,...

Still a great skyline. The newer buildings are smaller but still well crafted in the New York style. As the streets are so busy you need to stop and really look at the detail and style of New York. It's still a great feeling in one of the great cities in the world. At street level there is always something happening.....

Beauty. The best time to enjoy the Manhattan Skyline is when you land in New York at night. The view is breath taking and a must. On the ground with the busting street activities no beautiful I've no view- point.
Beautiful and amazing.. Truly a sight to see. Schedule your plane trip into NY at night and you will see what I mean. Even driving in from Queens, the view is already amazing.

Concrete Forest.
