Newyork!. What else is there to say? New york is huge. Goto china town and buy some bootleg raybans, gucci bags, and have a smoke. Great way to spend the day in manhattan.Apple store is always packed, hot dogs taste like crap. but hey! its the life
interesting. I enjoyed the whole trip and all of the sights because this was my first trip to New York everyone should visit New York at least one time

Manhattan skyline. Drove into Manhattan and we came over a hill and it was an awesome scene everyone in the car was impressed. The buildings had a powerful presence. As you get closer the impressions and feelings are overwhelming. Once you entered the city you are dwarfed by the amount and size of the buildings

You can't believe it!. This is like a lot of places in this city, an amazing place to see, specially if you do it with time, so you can have some amazing views of the sunset, and then with the night lights!!

View from NJ. I got an awesome view of the Manhattan skyline from the New Jersey side. Under the bright sunlight, the skyscrapers of New York City shimmers and the view was just breath-taking. I would suggest bringing a tripod for your camera as you can take photos with your friends with the whole group in it. This place takes very beautiful group photos of all sorts. Be it jump-shots or whatsoever. You can also do a very good panoramic shot of the whole skyline with the right camera. From the location I was at, there were a lot of joggers along the path. We asked many different people to take photos for us as a group, as new yorkers are really quite friendly about it. This is definitely a must-go!
Manhattan Skyline. This is such an awesome view, and having seen it from the topof the Empire State building, and also from the Billy Jean TennisCenter, it still gives me chills.
Wow. For us Aussies to get on our first trip to NYC was awesome. Fantastic view from the ESB and the top of the Rock. The New York skyline is just amazing

Interesting views of the NY skyline. 1. Ride the Metro tram (gondola) over the East River to Roosevelt Island. Get on at the east end of 59th Street. If you have an unlimited Metro card, it is free. Just swipe your Metro card as you would on the subway or bus. An inexpensive unique ride with great views of the skyline.2. Take the East River water taxi from the east end of 34th St. to the Williamsburg neighborhood in Brooklyn. Walk around a very interesting and energetic area - craftspeople, flea markets, unique food tents, restaurants, people watching. You can also take the L train - get off on Bedford stop, but you will miss an interesting boat ride.

View from Queens @ night. We rented a condo in Long Island City. We were so exhausted every evening that we almost missed this amazing skyline from the other side of the East River. Absolutely breathtaking. There are so many great ways to view the skyline; ferry rides, strolls or bike rides along the shore line in Brooklyn or over the bridges....I recommend viewing the skyline several different ways, they are are marvelous!
skyline worthwhile. it's a great walk (long!)..... but it's something you need to put on your "to do" list in NY. Sunset is a good time to go.

ALWAYS A DELIGHT. We took the ferry from 39th Street in New York to Weehawken, New Jersey. From that location the New York skyline is absolutely wonderful. We could see it all: downtown to uptown. Wonderful sight!The ferry trip is expensive: $8.50 each way for seniors.
Beautiful!. Iconic, but you have to leave the skyline buildings to see it. From the Brooklyn Side you can see everything and it is beautiful!

So much to see, so little time.. Manhattan has soooo much to see and explore. Full of excitement. Times Square. Statue of Liberty. Empire State Bldg. Broadway. Neighborhoods with character (Little Italy, Chinatown, Soho, Noho, Chelsea, etc.) and on and on. More than a week is needed and return trips are necessary. Very friendly.
Skyline. The skyline was beautiful on the ferry over to Governor's Island. Also a great place to visit. The island was nice to walk and view the Statue of Liberty with great photo ops.
Take the free staten island ferry. Hop on the free staten island ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and then get off the ferry and walk outside to see a terrific view of the Manhattan Skyline.

one of the best views ever. Something unforgettable - and you have many ways to do it, with all the observatory points available in the city. My favourite was from the Brooklyn Bridge, where you can also have a glimpse to the Liberty Statue.

Iconic. There is nothing that compares to the Iconic Manhattan Skyline & whether it is your first or fiftieth visit it really gives a fantastic feeling. It also doesn't matter if you are travelling by Plane, Train or automobile it is a sight that still makes me very giddy! You have to experience it!

Iconic sight. When you're in Manhattan you don't really get to see the skyline, You're in it and, while many of the buildings are individually magnificent, you can't get a full impression. Throughout the city, the view is dominated by two buildings which appear in view, wherever you are. In Midtown, the Empire State Building looms over everything. Its not much taller than (say) the Chrysler Building but stands out more, by virtue of its position. Looking downtown it is One World Trade Center that captures the eye.To get the full impact of the view, you have to be outside it. The first views are likely to be the distant skyline seen from JFK or the view as you drive through Jersey City as you approach the Holland Tunnel. Both give quite a breathtaking impression.Luckily for tourists there are two separate ways to combine viewing this iconic skyline with other free tourist 'must see'sFirst, take a stroll across Brooklyn Bridge. There's a wide pedestrian walkway above the traffic so it's easy and safe. Looking back you will see the Financial District skyline on the left, with helicopters buzzing round the Wall Street Heliport like flies. Just below the bridge on that side are the historic sailing ships, docked at Pier 15. To the right Midtown is visible in the distance, beyond the Manhattan Bridge.The second option is to take the free Staten Island Ferry. There is a frequent service from the ferry terminal adjacent to Battery Park. Take up station on the deck on the starboard side (That's right, you landlubbers). As the ferry turns to the right on leaving the terminal, the view back to Manhattan is unforgettable. But don't go away. Stay where you are for a fabulous view of the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island as you pass them.I almost forgot the third free option. Go into Central Park. This is well worthwhile for its own sake, but looking back from one of the lawns or open spaces, the skyline of the Midtown will become printed on your eyeballs.There are other options, if you are prepared to pay. Helicopter tours take off from the previously mentioned heliport, for about $150 each, or you can go up to the viewing platforms of the Empire State Building or the Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock) for $27 per head.
urban top of the world. is there anything better than that? great skyline and great memories. and the new freedom tower is a novelty but i ma sure it will be anitegral part of the skyline one day

Mancunian in New York !. To be in this city alone....not a problem, went for my 55th Birthday in 2012, the place welcomes you with open arms. So much to see and do. Check out the one and only "Real Tours New York" great guides and a good way to meet people from different walks of life. Little tip - To see the Statue of Liberty ! Quick return trip on the Staten Island Ferry it's free ! Great view of Manhatten on the way back. Try Lansky's for lunch you wont be disappointed. Central Park a must, wear comfy shoes. Enjoy!
Breathtaking. New York is worth the visit to look and the skyline. To look at the buildings you had only seen on TV and books and to be their looking at it is awe inspiring

Iconic. It's surely 1 of the most taken photographs in the world. As I spent some time in New Jersey I was fortunate that in the mornings I would get a day view of the skyline and in the evening I'd get the same view with all the lights of ESB etc shining bright. As well as New Jersey I'd personally recommend the Staten Island Ferry and Brooklyn Heights as the best places to take pictures from.

Is there any other view of New York?. You've just got to see Manhattan in this profile and a great way to access this view is from the Staten Island ferry. And the journey is free! This iconic city scene is a classic amongst all city views and your visit to New York would be missing a vital ingredient if you leave this out. Alternative ways to enjoy the view are from cruise boats, such as the ones out to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. However, if you savour the view in daylight it is nothing compared with the Manhattan skyline at night. The ferry and boat cruises offer great aspects but so too do some excellent restaurants on the edge of Brooklyn. The walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to Manhattan is also a fine experience and an excellent viewing opportunity.

breathtaking. Absolutely breathtaking - the views will stay with me forever !!Changes throughout the day. My favourite time was early evening when the buildings were just beginning to light up - amazing.
Iconic. NYC is known for so many things, and this is just one of themView it from many angles. The best being from the water or from Brooklyn bridge

Breathtaking. We did this a couple of ways...we walked over Brooklyn bridge, stopping every so often to look back in wonder, we then walked along the waterfront of Brooklyn, it was fantastic. Inadvertently found the view for once upon a time in America. Just great!

Among the most impressive. We took a Statue of Liberty cruise in the harbour which provides that added feature of seeing the viewing the skyline from many angles and vantage points. Having seen it prior to the devastation of 9/11 the absence of the "twin towers" was saddening yet seeing the new construction rising from those spaces and adding to the historic beauty of the Empire State Building, Chrysler Tower and so many other buildings just makes it more exciting and speaks to the need for a return trip as the new buildings are completed (2016 - 2020). The skyline is an impressive melange of time periods, architectural styles and building materials. It will leave you breathless.

Awesome!. New York City is one angel of a city. So much vibrancy. So much going on in every place you look! It is definitely a city for the senses - so much to do, so much to absorb. So much to just be in. Even as a local you can find new places to visit - it's a global village in the truest sense of the word. A cultural mesh of the major cultures around the world. Nice!

Iconic view, with many options for viewing.. I came in on the train from Boston and had awesome distant views of the city. I took a boat tour and saw the skyline from the water, then enjoyed the view at disk from the Empire State Building. Few skylines are so easily recognizable and accessible from so many varied viewpoints.

Its the best skyline in the world. How could you not love Manhattan? From Lady Liberty to the Empire State Building, from Central Park to the Top of the Rock, from the tunnels to the bridges, there is no place like Manhattan and no more distinctive skyline.

I LOVE NEW YORK CITY. I love New York City...................it's full of life, people walking, busy traffic, just busy, busy, busy...............lots of area's where you can get a great meal, happy hour, shopping, the list is endless................just bring some comfortable shoes and experience the joy AND friendly people EVERYWHERE.
Amazing. Take the Staten Island Ferry for an excellent view of the Manhattan skyline for free. There's very little waiting time and on the way across you get a good view of the Statue of Liberty

Must see. just returned fromUSA and spent 6 days in New York / Manhatten,the skyline Is just amazing ,saw it from the bay, from land ,by night and day.It is also good to see building or landmarks,that you have seen in a movie or onTV.we had an apartment in Manhatten and looking out our window at night seeing all the lights was better than any TV show.

Overwhelming. I lived in Manhattan for twenty years and never did the skyline fail to impress me. Today when I go back, or just see it from a distance on the drive o New England, it just brings back so many wonderful memories. From my apartment on Roosevelt Island I saw the Empire State Building and its changing colors every single day, but my favorite was, and still is, the beautiful Chrysler Building. In my heart I will always be a New Yorker and the skyline is part of my love for New York.

View from the bridge.. DUMBO, the area of Brooklyn under the Manhattan and Williamsburg bridges has a spectacular view of an amazing skyline. The stature and majesty of the buildings is remarkable. Take a free ferry around twilight and get a special treat, but spectacular 24 hours a day!
Spectacular. Nothing more needs to be said. Up there as best known landmark in the world. See it from up high for the best view.

A lot of skyscrapers. What can I say about the New York City skyline that has not already been said? Living in northern NJ all my life - it still impresses me. The local saying is that "you can tell you are from NJ when you can see the NYC skyline from the top of every hill." This is true. At the top of hills on roads in Passaic/Bergen counties you can see the skyline. I guess it is about 15 - 20 miles away. This is especially true from the hill on Rt. 208 in Hawthorne and Rt. 3 going towards the Linclon tunnel.

The ultimate New York Moment. You can't appreciate just how beautiful a cityscape this is until you're standing there, meditatively reflecting on Manhattan's gleaming, soaring monuments.The best way to experience the Lower Manhattan skyline is to get the train to Brooklyn, then walk over the bridge back to the island. No point walking the other way, with your back to this most spectacular of views.During my week of exploring Manhattan, I fell in love with the attitude of New Yorkers: the honesty, the normality, the total lack of "better than you" mentality you get from so many big city dwellers.New Yorkers are surprisingly modest, and despite it's grand scale, the Manhattan skyline somehow illustrates this modesty. You don't feel overwhelmed, you don't feel like "a little person", you never feel inferior. You feel a part of it. Manhattan is welcoming; from the people to the architecture, the minute you land on this incredible island, you instantly feel at home.

Loved The NY skyline. Fabulous saw it in lots of different ways .... from the Cocktail Bar at the top of the Standard Hotel in the meatpacking district to the Staten Island Ferry and it never fails to disappoint...simple the best way was in a taxi on our last night on a random bridge .... and the Taxi driver put New York New York on the radio WOW I love New York
Try Brooklyn Heights Prominade. The view from Brooklyn Heights is beautiful! We caught the skyline just before a storm yesterday. Amazing.
Best in the world?. Quite possibly. Try and get a peek when you land/take off from LGA or JFK. Another great view is from the Brooklyn Bridge.
Pretty spectacular. I saw this on a tour bus from New Jersey while we were driving towards the city. It is pretty spectacular and quite a sight.
WOW!!!. What can I say. It's NYC. The most iconic city in the US and certainly in the world. You simply can't get enough.
Unique. The skyline makes you stay speechless...There is nothing like that in the world, day and night, is just absolutely marvelous.

Easily recognizable. The N.Y. Skyline has changed with the twin towers not being a part ...But the new tower is beautiful and can be appreciated as the sun sets it stands tall and the center reflects the sun like no other..I am a New Yorker and take offense of the large Verizon logo on the skyline..If they have to advertise let them go to a times Square...

No Place Like It in the World. How can anyone NOT give this a five-star rating? True, you must view it from the distance (from a boat is best in my opinion), otherwise, you are not seeing the skyline. After all, that is what we are rating here: Manhattan Skyline. I can think of no other word than SPECTACULAR to describe it.
Beautiful. Great views from Brooklyn Promenade!!! Definitely worth going to see. While there, watch the sunset. really is beautiful.

Impressive, from a distance. Had high expectations. Met them to an extent, certainly from a distance (views from SI ferry, top of Empire State Building, etc), but get up close and wander around and it is less impressive (and we walked from Battery Park, Wall St, WTC, Lower Manhattan, Tribeca, SOHO, Greenwich Village to Union Sq).We were fortunate to have amazing weather (see photo from top of ESB) and the city wasn't too busy.
Fantastic. Beautiful in the sunshine and by night. Great view if you take the staten  island ferry. We also took a open bus at night and the views were spectacular

Familiar man made beauty. If you ever watch Hollywood movies, this skyline will be strangely familiar to you. We walked over the Brooklyn bridge several time for the view, at night as well as in daylight. There is a walkway above the vehicle lanes. Although it is all man made, there is something reminiscent of looking at a beautiful natural landscape here. Free, and really cool. Take your camera!
Magical. It was always a dream of mine to go to New York City and to see the Manhattan skyline both during the day and at night was magical! Dream come true!

Manhattan skyline. Magnificent view of all the iconic buildings. Went here at night time and it looked beautiful all lit up. Great place to take that special photo of all the skyscrapers. Absolutely stunning view.

Skyline. Saw the manhattan skyline from the pioneer boat trip . Fab trip really friendly people . Best to do on the sunset tour . Take a jumper as it gets cold . Take a wee bottle of wine , no refreshments on board . Sit back relax and see the amazing view

Fabulous!. You must see the skyline from one of the many boat trips on the river. In fact if you can fit it in you should do it twice! Once during the day when the skyline looks amazing - like a computer generation and then again at night when it has a magic of it's own with the lights shining on the water. Both trips have a wow factor that you will never forget.
Skyline. Fantastic place to take a stroll on a sunny day and ending up in the Meat Packing District for lunch. Sunday afternoons if the sun is out can get very busy.
Best free NYC attraction. Free. Open. Artsy. Great coffee shop offerings along the Highline and a nice place to visit/walk. A must if you are in the city for a long weekend.
Gr8. Great view, just like the movies. Beautiful buildings and very NYC. Do the empire state building to get a perfect overview of the city.
Beautiful!. The view is perfect-just like the postcards, the coffee cups. Once you see it, you know why it is plastered on all kinds of souveniers!
Outstanding idea.. Unexpected elevated beauty in Chelsea when you can leisurely stroll from 14th Street to 30th Street overlooking the City streets in a park-like setting.
What you see on TV is what you get. Iconic suberb totally american stunning just worth going to Big A to see. It gets you every time and everytime it is still amazing

Watch Manhattan from Brooklyn view. If you go down to the viewing point next to East River in Brooklyn side, you will be able to get a great view of the Manhattan Island and all the big towers.
Great place to relax, take a breath and enjoy the view!
fab. takes you breath away day or night a must for everyone to see once in their lifetime walk across Brooklyn bridge in the manhattan direction
Views to die for. Every view was like a movie scene...brilliant. Get your Empire state building ticket in the hotel. This will save you queuing at the state building.
awesome. brilliant and magical, so big, alight and breathtaking. Evening tour of Manhatton a must.Such an array of different buildings.
Wonderful Walk. A perfect place to stroll and take a break from the hustle bustle of the New York City streets. It's great for all ages too.

The view is awesome.. The view is awesome and even better, it's free as you're driving towards the Lincoln Tunnel. I would love to get off at the exit prior to the tunnel and get a picture. Maybe one of these days.

wow. go to see it from the free staten islend fairy.
go out in the evning and come back after dark so you can see it both ways.

New kid on the block. 1 World Trade Center is a welcome addition to the city's skyline. Where there were once two towers now there is one. It is a nicely sculptural piece of architecture. I would say best seen from a distance. That way you avoid the zoo that is the Ground Zero site. I don't need crappy tchotckes to remind me of what was lost that day including the freedoms that have been compromised in favor of security.

love it. I spent several nights across the Hudson River in a hotel with a view of Manhattan. I couldn't get enough of the skyline. I also spent an evening in the DUMBO area of Brooklyn seeing Manhattan from the other side of the East River. Beautiful. I highly recommend it. Another way to see it is to go to the top of the Empire State Building or the Top of the Rock, particularly at night. Every choice gives a different perspective.
Top of the Rock. Go to the rocker feller center at night. The best view I have ever seen! It is breathtaking but scary if you look down but the security is very reassuring. Amazing photo opportunity.
Bus tour. We took a bus tour and saw all of the city it was great nothing bad to say about this the bus tour was called grey line

Top of the Rock. This is the top of Rockefellar Square and is a reservation only elevator ride to the top for about $25. I went at night just before 11pm and saw Manhattan lit up at its best. Really great views!
Stunning. Who'd have thought a bunch of skyscrapers could look so stunning.Stunning views from the Empire Statue Building, day and night. Would recommend a helicopter ride.

You will get a stiff neck. Skyscrapers everywhere, its what we come over here for. A surprise round every corner. But it is still the Empire State Building that rings my bell, in the morning sun this is awesome. After a few days you will forget to look up, now you are a local.

Very good view. Manhattan has a very beautiful skyline which is probably the first thing any visitors to NYC appreciates. There are several ways you can enjoy the skyline (from atop one of the skyscrapers like Rockefeller building, walking along the Brooklyn bridge, taking the tram from Roosevelt Island or cruising along the river) which probably reveals a different view every time. Make sure you take lots of pictures - both at day and night.

Breathtaking!. Absolutely beautiful!!!! I wanted to make sure I got a picture of it but wasn't sure from what vantage point. We took the ferry to the Stature of Liberty and got a good pic. We also took a night tour into Brooklyn and those were some of the best pics I took!!! We crossed through the Manhattan Bridge so I was able to capture the Brooklyn Bridge with the Manhattan Skyline in the back!!!!

Top of the rock. Fantastic! The whole visit was so much more rewarding than the empire state. The journey through the building and even the journey in the lift and when your on the roof, your looking through glass panels rather than bars. Loved it

FROM THE TOP OF THE ROCK. Absolutely breath taking. We went right to the top and had a birds eye view of all of New York. There was a Kodak photographer that you could pay to take your pictures so of course we did. A very pleasant girl. You could see all the way to the Statue of Liberty.
Unforgetable views. We took a night tour of Manhattan.The views are amazing, plenty of stops for photo opportunities.We then went across the river....wow what views.You won't be disappointed.
Breathtaking Unforgettable Views. Amazing views of NYC and New Jersey. No TV programme or book will give you the feeling of this amazing city. The skyline of Manhattan is breathtaking.
Beautiful view!. I did not dis like anything but the beauty was a bit spoilt due to after Sandy works.. Photographers paradise!
Best View. If you want a good view of the Manhattan skyline, take a stroll across the Brooklyn Bridge. Every visitor to NYC should do it.

The best. A beautiful view from ocean or land. At a distance this island of Manhattan is bliss. Just imagining all the time and effort it took to turn this into the city it is. Really makes you appreciate humans and how much we can achieve.
twilight nights. This is an absolutely gorgeous skyline at night if you can get up the Empire state Building. What a Fabulous view from the 86th floor.

Diminishing returns. a bunch of tall buildings; initially of interest -> become wallpaper. The city is, essentially, an admin hub constrained by geography - combined the myth of exclusivity compels such architecture. Emperor's new concrete.
Metropolis. Iconic Skyline that can be viewed from all angles on the Circle Line Tours, Water Taxi's, Brooklyn Heights, Jersey City, Staten Island Ferry, Libery Island.

WOW!!. Visited liberty island views spectacular great photos!!!!!
Followed with helicopter trip, breathtaking!!!!!!!

Breathtaking Views. We had the most amazing evening onboard a dinner cruise and had the reviews of the manattain skyline. We were on the cruise for three hours and had plenty of photo opportunities. I highly recommend this to anyone visiting new York for the first time.
Night Tour. We took the night tour bus on the night we arrived to the city,which lasted about 2 hours, It was a great way to get a sense of the area and how to decide on what to see during our trip.

Man Made Wonder. The Manhattan skyline is amazing and is constantly changing. Now dominated by the new Freedom Tower, new skyscrapers will be joining it in the coming years.
We viewed the skyline from a boat trip which departed from Pier 57 for a 90 minutes excursion as far as the UN building and a close sail by the Statue of Liberty.
Breathtaking. You can check out the Manhattan skyline from several locations. The best in my opinion was from Brooklyn Pier, followed by Liberty Island and Roosevelt island.

Very Beautiful in Real Life. I have seen postcards and screensavers of the Manhattan Skyline but the view from the Staten Island Ferry and then from Staten Island itself were just amazing. Our photos with the skyline behind us were the perfect souvenirs.
a masterpiece. you cannot imagine how they were made! the twists, the heights, the colors, the designs, yet they were man made!
WOW. It's really spectacular. Crossing over the Brooklyn Bridge on top of a double-deck tour bus on a star filled nite, was really the best way to see the Manhatten Skyline.

A must see!. Good views from the Statue of Liberty ferry / Staten Island ferry.
Best view is from DUMBO (Brooklyn side) at sunset.

Impressive, very impressive. When you are walking down the streets in Manhattan you often come across individual skyscrapers or clusters of three or four but for an overall take on the skyline you really need to stand well back. In our experience the best way is to take the ferry to Staten Island, which is free and sails every 30 minutes, and view the buildings on the way back.

Best city skyline in the world!. Recommend taking the Staten Island ferry at night to see the skyline lit up. Can drink a few beers on the round trip of about 2 hours including transferring to the return ferry. Top of the Rock has the better view of Manhattan and Central Park than the Empire State Bldg. Also good views from the Statue of Liberty (go online for crown tickets well in advance) and by walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. Eat at Grimaldi's Pizza after walking across the bridge.

A MUST DO..... Stroll the Brooklyn bridge in the evening to watch the lights of the city come on. It's something you'll never forget. Watch out for bicycle riders, by staying out of their lane!! I thought I might be queasy walking over the bridge but not at all.

Manhattan Skyline from Staten Island Ferry. What a view from the Staten Island Ferry you I'll see! The ferry is free and as you pull away further from the dock you will see Manhattan rise up before you. AND you go right by the Statue of Liberty as a bonus! What a view! You will have to disembark when you reach Staten Island but hop back on another ferry for the return. Ferry ran every 20 minutes when we were there on 9/17/2013. Wish we had had more time for an evening ride. Would have been spectacular with all the lights on.
Wow. We stayed in Beckmann towers next to the United Nations right on the Hudson the skyline at night was brilliant mac Arthur park is here and you can get a good shot of the Chrysler building
Beautiful!. Beautifiul!. the best photo shot in the world!. the best way to get a photo is by boat or by the air!

Jersey Side View. You must travel to Boulevard East to view NYC! Seeing the city as a whole is phenomenal! Watching the tugs on the river or just taking in the view of the Freedom Tower or the Statue of Liberty is worth the visit. The night time view is so pretty, with the Empire State Building lite up in color. Don't want to go up to the Boulevard?? , just go to Sinatra Drive in Hoboken...you feel like you could reach out and touch the city !
Stunning!. Stayed with a friend in Hoboken and the skyline was absolutely incredible. I would recommend taking the fairy over to a quick bite and the view. Stunning!

Iconic. Best seen from either on the water or across the Brooklyn bridge.View from the Statten Island Ferry, which is free, take two trips if you have time, one in daylight, one in the dark. Ferry runs 24 hrs.

Seen from the air, the ground and the river..night and day an amazing view. Seen the pictures? Seen it in movies or TV shows?......it's every bit as good and more! New York, New York, so good they named it twice.

Amazing Place - A must do in your life!. I visited New York in Sept 2013, with Gf, - we bisited many special places - But I liked this place best of all - The skyline is so special, and whether in the daytime, or nighttime it looks amazing.Make the effort, to get slightly out of the way, to see it best Brooklyn bridge park, has the bonus of relaxing in a lovely park, or sitting on the benches on teh boardwalk overlooking the slyline, my favourite thing in NY!

Manhattan By Night. One of my favorites was taking a Harbor Cruise in the evening with Circle Line Sightseeing on Pier 83. The Manhattan Skyline at night is so beautiful it is hard to describe. We left just as it was starting to turn to dusk, which was very nice and when we turned around to come back it was dark. You can pick out all the buildings and bridges which are all lit up with beautiful lights. It was a wonderful thing to experience. Just loved it!!

Spectacular!. Take the *FREE* Staten Island Ferry to get great views of the Manhattan Skyline and the Statue of Liberty. Breathtaking! You can see the new World Tower as well - very sleek and futuristic. Worth the time to see!

Just like in the movies. Walk over the Bridge and get amazing views from the Brooklyn Bridge Park (Pier 1). You can just sit there and soak in the incredible skyline of Manhattan. It's the kind of view that creates the whole "Wow, I'm in NY" feeling. It's a must do for first-time visitors and anyone who loves the postcard-like Manhattan. Oh, and it's free!
A Must do. Either from Top of the Rock - Empire state building or from the river cruise if on the cruise try getting to the left hand side closest to the side ( no one gets in your way for photos)

Amazing!!!. One of the best views in a city is its skyline and New York has one of them. Its pretty amazing to watch the New York's skyline both in morning and at night as well. There are many places where you can go and enjoy the view. Some of my suggestions are-1. Steven Park, Hoboken, NJ.- 2. Staten ferry ride3. Liberty state park4. Walk on Brooklyn bridge from either direction but walk from Brooklyn to new York downtown is more recommended. All the above options are very good and feasible.
Nice spot for a sunny day. Nice spot for a sunny day, i was there with a friend, we could sit, talk a lot, see people walking around and not spend a penny while there.

take a bus trip. did the touristy thing this trip!! Took the grayline bus tour around manhattan. really fun and got to see things you don't always get to see when you are driving yourself. Also gives you a "refresher" on the city's layout!! Easy way to decide what you want to go back to see and you can get on and off the bus

A wonderful view on the skyline of Manhattan, New York. Probably the best place to overview the skyline of Manhattan, New York is from Union City on the westside of the Hudson river. The uphill park in the area of Union City provides stunning views on the Manhattan skyline, and even better, it is free and very quiet (not crowded at all). The best time will be just before sunset till it gets dark.How to get there:- Take the bus saying "Paterson/NY" at the front of the New York Times building, near Times Square ($3 one way). It takes you through the Lincoln tunnel within 10-15 minutes (depending on the traffic)- Get off at the first stop after the tunnel (Park Ave) and walk up park ave and go to the right at Highwood Terrace- At the end of this road you will find Hamilton Park. ENJOY THE VIEW!- To get back, take the same bus on the opposite side of the road through the tunnel

Stunning. You have to walk over the Brooklyn bridge and see the manhattan skyline, it's out of this world or you could catch the ferry to the Statue of Liberty and the manhattan skyline is stunning from there too.

Best places for skyline. Three great places to see the skyline.1) Jersey City Waterfront (the Newport area) at the end of Grand St. Amaziong view of Downtown and the new tower.2) Steven's Institute of Technology in Hoboken at the top of a hill overlooking Manhattan's midtown and downtown. There is a hidden location there with two beach seats making it a romantic look out at night.3) Palisade Ave. northern to Union City, NJ great skyline view of mid town and uptown NYC

Skyline at night. In the evening a walk along Broadway through Times Square by 42nd street is mindboggling to view the lighted signs, buildings and shopfronts. The variety of people, many dressed as Disney characters or Superheroes, is worth seeing.
A great view of NYC. We walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and onto Brooklyn Heights promenade.Looking back to NYC was breathtaking.Then onto Williamsburg for beers.

Spectacular. You have definetly got to see it from somewhere like the Empire State Building. You just pay 27 dollars and the view is over the whole city from all angles. it is absolutely amazing. It is also wonderful to be able to admire the new skyscrapers which are being built at ground zero.
Always enjoy the view!. The view is really amazing! Very Peaceful and quiet. Easy to get to as well. I stay in this area so I would recommend this to anyone wanting to take a breather!
Wow!. Movies just don't do it justice. I saw it via boat. The Staten Island Fairy, its free. It takes a while to wait for the next fairy to come and take you back. The view was worth it.
What architecture. It is the symbol of New York....and all that is exciting about this country. It gives me chills driving into town and seeing it off in the distance.
Brilliant.. Loved the whole thing. Such a Metropolis. Amazingly easy to get around, and people are so eager to help if you look as if you are "lost".

Spectacular Sunset. We took a cruise to Nova Scotia that left the New York City Pier at 4 PM. After dinner we got our bathing suits and got in the hot tub. It was the perfect time to watch the sunset over the New York City skyline. Many of us said it was the most spectacular sunset we had ever seen. I only wish I had my camera to share it.
Not good. The time frame of the bus is too short for the traffic in Manhattan. Only the timely option to Brooklyn is a differential. The others adds nothing the 2 regular lines.
A must see.... Enjoyed the view and all the people. A trip I have always wanted to make and will be back. I know there is always more to see and experience.

Iconic & Well Worth the mimimal effort to see this amazing skyline. The Manhattan Skyline, is well known worldwide, but when you see it in person it truly is something quite special. There are many angles to see it from, the 2 best ones I think, are either from Brooklyn Bridge Park, (Take subway to carter stn, and then back 5mins back to here).. Its amazing really, and the extra thing the photos don't let you experience, is the noise... almost a constant buzz from millions of people, cars, helicopter,s sirens all mixed together into a haze of sound, its incredible and I really love this aspect of manhattan.The other alternative, is take the staten island ferry, and watch the manhattan skyline behind you, or alternately on the return journey watch the skyline approach - with the added bonus of the statue of liberty of to the side also, and its free!! The best freebie in NYC for sure!Try both i you have the time, you will not be disappointed with either!
Manhattan. I loved every moment. Manhattan skyline is so majestic and hypnotic...it should be on everyone's bucket list!

Always brings a lump to my throat. I have been visiting NY for 15+ years and have been lucky to see the skyline from all angles. From the air/sea and road. My favourite view is from New Jersey looking across New York Harbour to Manhattan skyline

Best places to view. The best places to view the skyline are actually outside of the city! Try the DUMBO park (right under the Brooklyn/Manhattan Bridges) and the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. If you are in the city, the best places are Top of the Rock or Empire State Building.
amazing. I thought it would be a sight to see, but until you see it in the flesh so to speak, it was definitely a WOW factor.

Coming in on the 7 train. We traveled to NYC 4 days after the Storm last October and the only way onto Manhattan was by train from JFK. We came in on the 7 train. We caught a glimpse of the Empire State building a fare distance out from Penn Station and weren't convinced of what we had seen. You do get a better look at lower Manhattan before you duck into the tunnel.But the best way for us to see the skyline was from on the water. Any ferry ride will take you far enough away to take it all in. We were on the water at dusk, saw the Empire State light up and the Statue of Liberty.Another view is from Brooklyn Bridge which also takes in the Statue of Liberty.No matter which way you look at the skyline or how long you look at it, it is ever changing.

Excellent. Pictures don't do it justice. Get out there and see it for yourself, you won't be disappointed. We visited The Top of the Rock, Empire State Building and took the ferry to see the Statute of Liberty. While they are all great, I enjoyed the view from the ferry best. The way you gradually get to take it all in as you ride out to the island is great. The distance provides great perspective.
I luv NY. Lived here and can't get enough ever !!! There is so much to do and see . A photographer's delight year round . Easy to get around on your own and discover this wonderful city !
A "must see". Its free and its iconic. Get the FREE Staten island ferry for the best view. A trip to NYC isn't complete without seeing it!
I want to be a part of it. Nowhere compares to this city. It's awesome, tough, cinematic, romantic & fast paced!! I freakin love it!!

Iconic. Best viewing points in my opinion:
- Central Park
- Hoboken, New jersey - just across the river
- Staten Island Ferry
Beautiful View. The view you would expect from Manhattan. This is a must see on a visit to NYC. Take some kind of tour so you can see this scene. It looks like a post card.
Incredible. There is not another skyline in the world as incredibly beautiful at night as the Manhattan Skyline.

Review for the skyline not the sky ride ripoff. Totally iconic skyline we had a great view from statin island get on the stain island ferry late afternoon for the best light conditions for great photos, brilliant

As seen in movies. We saw the skyline from the Staten Island ferry and boy it was a sight!
Next time I want to see the skyline from New Jersey but taking the ferry is free and really good!
Amazing!!!!. Amazing!!! Seen the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge and the water taxi. Such an beautiful skyline, changing as you move around.

breathtaking!. I made my first trip to the Promenade during sunset and it was gorgeous! I got some great pictures on my phone but wish I had my good camera with me to get good sunset pictures of the Statue of Liberty.

Take a sunset cruise to see this at its best or just jump on the Staten Island ferry. Enjoy a sunset cruise to see the best of the New York skyline, or even just take the free ferry to Staten Island and back.
Do not bother with the advertised Skyline adventure within the Empire State building. Very disappointing.
Manhattan Skyline. Famous in pictures, magazines and a real amazing sight in life. New York, New York. The tall and the small blend so well and the Statue of Liberty is awesome.
Breathtaking. Awesome view of manhatten skyline from Staten Island ferry and Brooklyn bridge. Both are absolutely free to enjoy

WOW!. The view from The Empire State Building was jaw dropping but fantastic. You don't really appreciate the height until you are up there looking around and down.
A Must!

One of the most iconic views in the world. I took a lot of photographs from all different view points and still the find the Manhattan Skyline almost magical. It is one sight that , if you can, must be seen whilst visiting NY. Although I have seen the views on television/films it is so much nicer in the "flesh". There was perfect visibility due to great weather whilst I was there. The views from the water taxi and bridges is worth seeking out and taking photographs from.
Iconic!. You've seen it in the movies and on TV, but seeing it in real life is wonderful. Highly recommend doing it from the top of the Empire State Building.

The SKYLINE. We view the Sky Line Twice Once at during the day and the other at night. We arrived at the empire state as soon as it opened, no ques, and the only bit of advice i can give is, DO NOT listen to the guys outside trying to sell you tickets, we found it so much cheaper inside and when they advised the ques where so long we decide to risk it and surprise surprise no ques.
fab view pf historic buildings. Busy sidewalks but to be expected. Great ambience, good dining places on every corner. Will go back as was unique site

Stunning by day and even more stunning by night. We stayed at Port Imperial, and for each trip to Manhattan and back we viewed the Manhattan skyline. There were extra lights on some buildings on 9/11 including, in the distance twin vertical lights by the Freedom Tower, marking Ground Zero. Catch a ferry from Pier 39 to Port Imperial and stroll along the waters edge for a lovely night time view
You can see forever on a clear day. It is amazing to be so high above the city and see it all below. To be able to see all the tall buildings, the 9/11 Memorial and Central Park is a dream come true.

Iconic Skyline. Wonderful sight, whether looking in daylight or at night. Must be one of the best in the world. Looks fabulous from Liberty Island and when on the cruise ship, so nice to see the famous buildings from a distance.
Great!. Beautiful but a little crowded! Definitely check it out if you are in the Meatpacking Area. There is a bar up there too so you can stop and have a drink.

Take The Free Ferry For Best View Of Manhattan Skyline. We took the free ferry located near battery park. This take you past the statue of Liberty and gives you an incredible view of the skyline. Takes about 20-30 min round trip.
Amazing. Surreal experience seeing it for real and not on tele it was even more gorgeous than I had expected , nothing to dislike about it

Awsome. We were picked up from JFK by Airlink buses. The drive thru Queens was interesting and we entered Manhattan from the Queensboro Bridge. As you get closer to the island the skyline emerges and it really takes your breath away. It is the most famous skyline in the world.

Must see from anywhere and everywhere. We saw the skyline from numerous positions including the Empire State Building and the Staten Island Ferry. Every view is different but still breathtaking.Our hotel room at the Sofitel had a three sided balcony which was huge.We could view the Chrysler Building, Rockefeller and Empire State Building from the comfort if our 24th floor balcony and we could do it sitting down with a glass of champagne in our hands. Lazy but still breathtaking.
What sights !!!!. It was such a novelty to see this skyline and I was amazed to see it is just like all the pictures you see of it. Macy,s is brill too. The coffee is amazing also.
Stunningly beautiful. We saw the skyline from Liberty Island and it is lovely. We took lots of photos and we will view it from Brooklyn Bridge on our next visit to NYC

The view from Brooklyn Bridge.... ...particularly at night, was incredible, go to Brooklyn Bridge - City Hall subway and walk but watch out for demon cyclists in the cycle lane, they take no prisoners

Beautiful view from Brooklyn bridge!. Whether you are a first time or repeat visitor to New York City, you always look for its ever changing skyline from different locations. I believe the view from Brooklyn is one of the most beautiful one. Just do it!
Must see. It has a fantastic vye.specelie at night.Romantic to.Breath taking.We met some nice people from Italy up ther and we had a great time
Surreal. After seeing this on television for so many years it was rather surreal to be there in person. It is a sight I will never forget.
Day or night a delight. We enjoyed the Skyline from a boat, booked the sunset sailing tour. I can honestly recommend that just for everyone. It was one of our highlights in New York.
One of the great views of the world. Breathtaking every time. Nothing prepares you for it. View from the ferries or from Brooklyn Bridge.

Iconic!. That first view of the Manhattan skyline is breathtaking....especially at night! To see so many iconic buildings lighting up the night sky - the new World Trade Center, the Empire State Building, the Chrysler building - is awesome. We also took a boat tour around the Statue of Liberty and saw the skyline from the water...highly recommend this for great pictures! Also, the view from the top of Rockefeller plaza is also great - and you'll get the Empire State Building in your pics!

wow!. We stayed in NJ and had the opportunity to see the skyline every evening as we traveled by ferry across the Hudson river, what an amazing experience. This is the view of New York that I will keep in my "happy place"
Wow what a view. This is a must see for everyone. We viewed the skyline from the Hudson river during the day and at night. Awesome!!!
Magical. Night time at the top of the Empire State Building is a must! But the security is very strict and can be frustrating!
like no other!. The new World Trade Center One is a beautiful addition to the skyline! A sobering reminder of what once was....

Breath taking. You just do not get views like this many places in the world. My third visit and it still takes my breath away like the first.This year we did the bus tour again and saw it from the Manhattan bridge on our way in and out of Brooklyn. Also saw it from the Staten Island ferry and it is just simply one of those views that not only could you look at all day but one that you'll never forget.We stayed in New Jersey as we had a car and found this the easiest option for us and the bus in and out of the city everyday was made all the nicer with that view.I took plenty of pictures of this view from all different spots and people kept commenting on how good they were, however I just can't take credit for them as it wasn't anything I did the real beauty is the skyline. Whether you're viewing during the day or at night the view is just exceptional, truly breath taking.

High Flyers. We took the helicopter ride from pier six. However due to the balance required within the chopper I had a poor seat and was unable to take as many photos as I would have liked otherwise it was OK. My main grip is the fee charged for the security check and this you cannot get out of, $30 per person for a waft with a wand. Good bunch if you can get it. So be warned.
super lage. Die lage des hotels,bustouren durch ganz new york brooklynn harlem uptown downtown freedomtower 9/11 memorial empire state buildin liberty staten island

It's Manhattan!. How could you not give the Manhattan Skyline a 5 star rating. It's absolutely incredible. The best view I've had of it is taking off or coming into LaGuardia. There is a flat city out below you and then suddenly out of nowhere, surrounded by water looms a huge concrete jungle full of lights. Just.... so impressive!

Iconic view. WE stayed in Manhattan for two weeks and during this time we went on a night tour of New York. We went over Brooklyn Bridge etc and looked at the Empire State Building and Radio City lit up. At the end of the tour we visited a little ice cream parlour and stood outside and looked over the Hudson river at that iconic view as we ate our ice cream. Bliss!
Spectacular. Amazing sight not to be missed. If you are visiting NYC you would be silly not to experience this. The skyline is amazing at night with all the lights.

What a view!. we took the subway over to Brooklyn and walked down to the pier for the skyline view of Manhattan. What a spectacular view, worth the trip over. Walked back across the Brooklyn Bridge which was nice as well, took about 35 minutes to walk back

Memorable. The one great thing about New York is its skyline which ranges from the 105 story Empire State building to 1930 style architecture of about 20 stories. It is really the clash of the old and the new which is fascinating.We found the view best from one of the circle line ferries, or one going out to Ellis or Liberty Islands
joy ride. very good joy ride but people working soo rude and not enoughf information and very expensive tey have got to lower that prices little bit
Never gets old. Although it will never be the same after September 11, 2001, I always love seeing Manhattan from any which way I can. I love it. Always will.
breath taking. one of the reason to go to New york is to see the skyline. It is amazing depending on the time of the day and how the light falls in -great as well from the staten islanfd ferry
Night time with the lights is fantastic!. The view from Empire State and Brooklyn Bridge walk does it the most justice. So many iconic buildings to see.
Amazing sight to see!. Oh my, what can I say, it was beyond anything I had ever imagined. You just have to visit New York to experience it, simply breathtaking!
Breathtaking Manhattan Skyline. Breathtaking - you get a great view if you take the Night Bus tour which is included in a 2 day pass.

little Gem. New York is easy to get around the grid system is great,out of town not very clean!Subway easy to use and safe even at night time.Queuing can be wearing so go early or late.Beware of greedy Taxi drivers who are cheeky enough to ask for extra tips.Generally speaking New yorkers are friendly and approachable.

Dinner Cruise. We did a dinner cruise in the early evening on Sunday and loved the tour. The boat we took had a very nice dinner on it and a weel stocked bar and lounge with a DJ. After our dinner we spent most of our time on the top deck of the boat,view the Manhattan skyline, the lights, the Manhattan bridge and of course the Statue of Liberty. The weather was perfect for our cruise and I was very glad I took my camera with. Thoroughly enjoyed the evening and our host for the cruise, it was absolutely delightful.
very different. well worth the trip if you want to see a different side to new York. We walked south to north. Lots of photographers go here and also a nice place to relax

Another WOW !. This trip to The City we took the cruise around Manhattan Island. We had not done that in all our visits to NYC. What a beautiful skyline this city has. We saw it from every side. We were right up close to Lady Liberty. We had great photo opportunities to take all kinds of pictures of The City. The skyline left some in our party speechless.

Pier 13 in Hoboken - Perfect Views on a clear day. dont miss it !(crazy: must write at least 300 Characters, so I repeat: Perfect Views on a clear day // Perfect Views on a clear day // Perfect Views on a clear day // Perfect Views on a clear day //

Fantabulous Skyline. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! This is a "must do" in New York City! The place is renewed, fresh and really well organized. This place is full of energy, Spread across 6th, 7th & 8th Avenues spanning from the 42nd Street un till the 51st Street. Adding to the beauty are the major attraction called, Trinity Church, Empire State Building, Rockefeller Centre, Top of the Deck Observatory, Freedom Tower or One World Centre, Macy's (World's Largest Retail Store), Times Square, UNO & many more...
Simply breathtaking!. The amazing view will take your breath away at any time of the day, but it is best to see at night time. There is great food too, don't miss the street food!!
A New York walk. As a jazz nut went to birdlandjazz night club , walked Times Square, rode Staten Island ferry. The restaurants were what we expected good food and service.

Takes your Breath Away. What's not to like, the best way to see this is to walk over the Brooklyn Bridge at night time,it's out of this world and you can see around for miles...Just AMAZING and YES it does take your breath away.

Great place to visit. something new to see at every turn - great food (not only resturaunts, don't miss out on the street food) - great shops - music - plays - shows. I don;t know how anyone could ever get bored here!!!
what a view. We went over to Brooklyn to view the Skyline and where not disappointed you really have to see it to appreciate how awesome it really is.
concrete heaven. i was amazed on my first visit to new york i saw the manhattan skyline from the window of the plane and it was a beautiful night view i've ever seen...
Saw the new Freedom Tower. Amazing to see when you turn the corner and see how tall it is. great to see the site growing and healing.

There's nothing like it.. We took it in over a late afternoon, through sunset and into the evening on what was a beautiful, cloudless day. It's just magnificent to behold the change that sweeps over such an enormous vista.
Beautiful. The view is breathtaking? First time there and will have to come back to see all the sights. New York skyline is so pretty.
Unforgetable!. Its always a great deal of pleasure to be in NYC! I dont like the traffic though! I would love to spend more time in the city!

Top of the rock. The best views are from the top of the rock at night especially around 11 pm, closes at midnight, and the other great location is form the reservoir near 96th and Columbus, especially on a clear night.The circle line which is the harbour lights is another good way to see it, but make sure you are on the left side of the deck as you board, as the views on the way out are all on the left side and as the cruise comes back, it is on the right side, but by then the guided portion is pretty much done and it gets kinda chilly.

Iconic. Is this really something that can be reviewed? Of course the skyline looks different from different perspectives but for me it is mostly coming East with midtown to the right, the Chrysler Building and Empire State Building center and downtown absent the twin towers but now with Freedom Tower rising to the left. It's arguably one of the most iconic skylines in the world.

Dense concrete jungle. High view from Top of the Rock is better than Empire State Building (since you get to see ESB from TOR which is much prettier). View from the ferries, water taxi or sailboats both day and night is decent too.

Great things. You can find the best of the best in New York! You will love it and always love it! My friends around the world you can never be able to get New York from your mind as it will always linger in your blood stream

Night time sight seeing. We went up the Empire State in the daylight amazing . Then at sunset we went up Rockerfeller as you can see the Emipire in your night photos . Rockerfeller has 2 standing areas it's busy but worth it. Tickets from The big bus company got us no waiting pass.

Breathtaking. Try and look for your first glimpse of it from your flight if you're flying in...I almost passed out from excitement :) we flew to JFK and if you're sat on the right coming in from the east you'll see it! :D :D
WOW-even without the twin towers. Clean Safe and what great food. There is not place like NYC! the streets are clean and safe. Police are friendly. Central park carrage rides are fun.

Great. Its a lovely walk along the skyline - especially if the weather is warm. In the evenings a lovely breeze blows and makes for a cool and lovely after dinner walk. Soft greenery and great views to be seen along the way.
spectacular!. we got to take lots of pics from the top of the empire state building at sunset! nothing like it. gotta love new York!

LOVE THE CITY!. We loved absolutely everything!! Loved the hustle and bustle of the city and all the interesting people. The subways were a lot of fun and taxi service was prompt and not really very expensive.

A find in NY. Walking in the Manhattan Skyline is a delightful experience. The views, the design and the gardens are so enjoyable, a relaxing experience. Stop for a drink in the Meat Packing district.

Exhilirating. My son and I did a boat tour (NY Taxi, I think) of the major sites in NYC - Statue of Liberty, 9/11 Memorial, etc. The Manhattan skyline was a highlight. Breath-taking. So much history, activity.
My only regret is that I did not enjoy a full view of the skyline at night.

The most impressive skyline in the world.. Been to many cities around the world but there's no skyline as impressive as Manhattan.Day or night its soooo beutiful.People from all over the world are impressed.
Amazing. Just as you have seen in pictures, wonder full view from the Hudson as the sun goes down and the light come on.
Like no other. It is amazing to see how much it has changed especially with the new Freedom Tower. The mix of old and new with all of the lights and sounds

what a place to visit. I like the atmosphere and the wonderful look, It was so good to see and visit and to walk around it. it was a little crowded but it is worth it. I recommend it to all my friends and make sure you bring a light jacket for unexpected cold weather

Phuarrr!. This is definitely a place to visit at night. Breathtaking. There is nothing than can compare to this anywhere else around the world. Great photo-taking opportunity and the drive there is 100% worth it. A highlight of the New York/Manhattan area.
The best way to see the greatest skyline. Booked the flight at the hotel, arrived there and almost immediately took the flight across the Manhattan. Great experience ! I recomend this to everyone !

I'm one of many who may not feel that New York is where I want to live, but there's still an strong attraction whenever one glimpses the Manhattan skyline. skyline from queen mary 2. Leaving New York in a great oceanliner, wie took time to standon the deck drinking champagne , and See the sun goes down....
So when you must leave NY, do it this way and you Neven will forget this.
Great picture which we put with our cara and with Tour soul

Breathtaking. It was without a doubt one of the best things in NYC. The Skyline is amazing and there are no words to describe how beautiful it is.
During the day or at night you should take a moment to appreciate what humans can do. Beautiful !
Beautiful. Best seen from the Staten Island Ferry which is entirely free! Highly recommend seeing this both at night and during the day.

The View. Take a trip to the top of the Marriot Hotel in Times Square to The View. Sip (expensive!) cocktails and sample delicious food while your table gently turns 360deg for a perfect view of Manhatten by night.
WE LOVE THIS CITY. There is nothing about NYC that I disliked. Everyone was so nice. I love this place & hope to go back soon!

Beautiful views. One of my favourite places on earth. Took in the views from Empire State Building, top of the rock, Liberty Island and Brooklyn and at every angle you get a different view! A night the view from Brooklyn is simply breathtaking. I will be back soon..

from brooklyn heights promenade. i spent hours on this promenade to enjoy the view from late afternoon to sunset and night.
it's beautiful and i recommand it. it must really nice from Dumbo park too.
Skyline. Just a nice pleasant mile or 2 walk (especially if weather is good) at Train level with food and art stalls along the route. also good Photo opportunities of flowers and architecture.
Just beautiful.. How can anything be wrong with the amazing views from any high floor location or bridge. Nothing to dislike. Just wish I could be here during some fireworks time.
Bright Lights Big Apple. What is there NOT to like about this beautiful place! The bright lights of the big apple never fail to take my breath away.

Empire State Building and boat trip. NY has a beautiful skyline (although I prefer Chicago's skyline). In my opinion the best spots to check it are the Empire State Building and the boat trip (avoid the 3h boatrip, it's too long and it gets boring).

plenty to do, see a show,

Manhattan Skyline. People from around the Globe visit New York, one good reason among many, the beautiful skyline! a thrill to see from the airplane first time especially! The skyline is always changing due to new Construction! On a clear day you can get a great view!

The Skyline of all Skylines. Words cannot truly describe this skyline. Closest word? Awesome! Whether it be by day or by night the view of Manhattan is truly wonderful. If you have a camera that can do panoramic shots then use this function - you can get some seriously fantastic photographs.

Impressive. If you need to read a review to know that the Manhattan Skyline is sublime you really shouldnt leave the house. Its everything you saw in movies and tv shows all your life on a grand scale

So Breath taking. Something that you just have to go to when visiting NYC. We did it twice. The first was to see a sunset which was beautiful and the second to see it on a clear summers day.
