I was constantly looking for views and awed by it.. Went to Brooklyn, Liberty park in New Jersey and Liberty Island to get the best views.
Beautiful and getting more and more added to it right now. I also went to the top of Rockefeller Center, and got a nice 360* of the entire sicty.

Beautiful views. The views from the Staton Island Ferry were absolutely beautiful. Many great photo opportunities of the Manhattan skyline. I did feel a pang at the loss of the towers and their absence was noticeable, however the new Freedom Tower will look beautiful where the towers once stood.The best part of it all was the fact it was free! Everyone loves a freebie after all. Definitely worth a visit if you're visiting NYC.

always feels like home. whether seen by car, train, plane or boat, it always feels like home to me! I can think of few places so iconic that most people can pick it out in mere silhouette. Paris and Seattle and London only because of the Eiffel Tower, Space Needle and Wheel, respectively. pretty by day, breathtaking by night. It is where dreams are crafted and realized or destroyed
the best. Amazing view from the boat during the trip on the Hudson.The best Skyline in the world, full of towering skyscrapers forms also differ in their

NYC. Fantastic - you have to go ...... !! Like any major city it's noisy, dirty, got some people with bad attitudes but it's a city of dreams. Not as expensive as you'd think & the choice of food it amazing .... check out China Town, Little Italy & mid town deli's & diners.

One of the Modern Wonders of the World. Looking at NY's westside skyline from New Jersey you'll see a spectacular site, particularly when the sun is setting behind you and reflecting its colors in the glass walled skyscrapers. If you're impressed then you need to see the eastern skyline as well. The best place to see it is from just above the Brooklyn waterfront on the promenade in Brooklyn Heights. Go well before noon when the sun is high, lighting the face of the buildings and you'll be in for a treat better than the NJ view because the East River is so much narrower than the Hudson. Then go back at night and you'll see completely different spectacle. The buildings disappear in the dark sky but are emphasized by the lighted office windows where night staffs are busy working.

Get your tickets ahead of time!. Following the advice of others, we printed out our tickets from the Rockefeller Center website, and although the tickets were for a specific time period, no one seemed to bother checking. We avoided a long line of those who needed to purchase tickets, and were on the fast elevator almost immediately on our arrival.The trip to the top is fast, and having done the wait and ride up to the Empire State Building, must agree with others that this trip was tops. You can take photos above the glassed-in area, since there are two levels above the floor where the elevators take you. The view south, of the Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty, and No. 1 World Trade Center, is great, and looking north at Central Park and the rest of Manhattan is pretty impressive as well.We all wished we had time to ride up at sunset, to watch all the lights go on--and a nighttime trip wouldn't be bad either. We'll have to save those rides for next time.

NYC Travel Advisory. Due to recent political developments in NYC relating to the NYC Police Department and Stop Frisk which kept the residents and tourists safe has come under intense scrutiny. NYPD officers publicly stated that they will no longer go above and beyond to pro actively pursue criminals to PREVENT CRIME for fear of being sued for their actions. Some potential criminals have already rejoiced in this decision.This decision will have a negative impact on tourism because it is anticipated that the crime rate will rise substantially and mass police retirements in the next few years are anticipated. Please advise potential travelers to NYC take extra safety precautions when visiting, travelers checks, sight see in groups. do not go off alone and some common sense measures.In summary, police are not permitted to stop individuals whom just appear to be acting in a suspicious manner unless there is an actual crime in progress.  I urge Trip Advisor to please post this commentary so visitors can enjoy a safe visit. My many years experience as a NYC Police Officer and Detective should be considered since I have dealt with many crime victims when Police were told to lax some police enforcement duties in 1980's thru 1990's when the homicide rate climbed to 2000 per year as opposed to the past few years of just a few hundred. I too travel with my family and read Trip Advisor's reviews and want to feel safe when Im traveling.

Circle Line Cruise was the best way to see this!. We took the 3 hour cruise around the entire island. We had a beautiful morning and got to see and hear a lot about the city. Best way to go in my opinion.
Really?. This needs a review? This is a Wonder of the World from any angle. If possible get a look from the Brooklyn Bridge or the Brooklyn Heights Esplanade.

View from the Harbour. We took a 5-night cruise up the coast to Canada & the departure - leaving from NY port - provided an amazing perspective of NY's skyline as the ship first makes its way south along the city, starting from about 50th St!
Okay. We were kept waiting for about 45mins before getting into the ride - the ride was okay, but I wouldn't go again

Manhattan Tour. Great views and recommend going early to avoid crowds. Bring good walking shoes. Radio City Hall is also a great tour to take and you must also good early morning to avoid crowds and long wait times.
AWESOME!. What isn't to love about the skyline! While we miss the twin towers, the new tower is a welcomed addition. Second best only to Chicago.. :-)
Magnificent view. A magnificent view, NOT to be missed. Saw the view from the top of the hoho bus but you can also walk across the bridge.

View. Beautiful, both day and night. The architecture on some of the buildings is absolutely amazing. The only thing we disliked was a rude salesman at a camera store trying to sell us a camera. When we said we wanted to think about it, he got very angry and said we wasted his time.
awww. beautiful and breathtaking. no doubt better than the mountains and the sea combined. the city that never sleeps
View from Rockeffeler Center. Ii is unbelievable great view! You have to see!!! It is great when the sun is falling down and it is even better at night. But I dont like that fact it is crowdy.

Best from the old docks,. Now turned to gardens, walks, piers, restaurants and snack places and even a carousel at DUMBO. Anther place is at the new park area in Williamburg. Brooklyn waterside is the best place to see the city skyline now. And safe. And free.
Very beautiful. Words can't describe. Stayed at the Hyatt Regency Hudson in Jersey City NJ and had awesome day, night and morning views of this amazing skyline.
Iconic. Best seen on the Gray lines open top bus tour of Brooklyn at night for the classic photo shot.Or from the top of the Rockefeller centre.
amazing view. The view is great especially at night. A good idea is to take the ferry for Staten Island (free) and then come back, you'll see it from far away.

Absolutely stunning. New York skyline is one of those things that will last a life time in your memories, done a night trip on the hop on hop of bus there is no better way to see it especially when you see it from the Brooklyn side of the Hudson River .

Breathtaking!. Little needs to be said. This skyline has to be the most beautiful in the world. From the South with the Freedom Tower to the North with the Empire State Building, Chrysler Building and everything in between. Pictures are always lovely of the New York Skyline!

Absolutely beautiful. The skyline is viewed from different points around the city, and it's still beauftil from each different angle. I recommend taking a night tour as well either on the bus or a cruise to view it at night, which is a different type of experience.

Well-kept Secret?. Our older son who lives in lower Manhattan told us about the Skyline. We walked most of the distance on this elevated walkway on the west side of the island, starting about 14th street. At present, the Skyline ends in the Lower Thirties. It is landscaped and has art work on loan. The art on our visit was sculptured busts, some of famous people. Plant life included the biggest dogwood blossoms I've ever seen. At points, there are remains of an elevated railroad. Also places to sit and rest. As we walked uptown, New Jersey was on our left and Manhattan on our right. I've seen Manhattan from many angles over the past forty-some years, but this was a first.

What a view!. Stayed on the water in Jersey City and boy, what a view of the city do you have from here. We had perfect weather and enjoyed the views day and night. Jersey City is a great place to see the entire city skyline.
Ferry Ride. Take the free ferry ride to Staten Island. It offers perfect views of Statue of Liberty and Lower Manhattan.
So much to look at!. With the density of buildings there is a never ending list of things to look at and watch! The sunsets are lovely on the glassed buildings.

Circle Line Tour. Beautiful informative and fun! Get tickets ahead of time on line, makes things go faster. People are pushy at the side rail so be prepared for that and bring water, sunscreen and a hat!

best place on earth. look for places with a great (and free) view. some stores on the south side of union square - the millennium hotel bar overlooking WTC. take advantage of free space and find your own
Iconic View. You've seen it in films and on the TV but it still takes your breath away when you see it in person.

One of the best amazing skylines in the world. One of my friends said from the rockies - it's like the mountains but man made! Even when you leave manhattan you already notice the difference in construction. Other places have a downtown with sky scrapers but manhattan tops it on both the horizontal and vertical!!!
Skyline of a city that never sleeps. take the ferry form the financial district to Hoboken (14street)Great view on the skyline of Manhattan

Beautiful. Iconic view that was gorgeous. Waited a long time to visit New York and the wait was worth it. I enjoyed the feel of the city, the people, the vibe. Driving in yellow cabs and sweltering in the underground.Best way to see it is from Brooklyn.

Outstanding from the rooftop. Go to Thompson 60's rooftop and enjoy the breathtaking views. Good alternatives in Brooklyn at the Whytes and King and Grove, Brooklyn. Thompson you are in it, in Brooklyn you are looking at it.
Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing experience. We saw the skyline from the Brooklyn bridge in the evening and its one of those things that stays with you forever.

Love the skyline. The skyline is great in the day and night from all angles. We enjoyed it most from a night tour on double decker bus, you go to Brooklyn and from there have great views, we went at sunset and it was gorgeous.
Energy. The energy of the city is unmatched. Loved just walking along the streets, absorbing the hustle and bustle.
amazing view of city at 2 am!!!!. Amazing view of city at 2 am!!!! we arrived at 1 and no really line was there. recomend going late. Felt enough to visit only first level.

What a skyline. Most people have seen New York's skyline already [in person or photos] so there's not much that needs to be said about that. However, where are some good places to see it? Here are a few suggestions: (1) from the Staten Island Ferry, (2) from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, in Brooklyn, (3) from Brooklyn's DUMBO neighborhood - meaning near or between the Brooklyn & Manhattan Bridges walking along the East River [not really a river] waterfront, (4) the waterfronts in the Williamsburg or Greenpoint neighborhoods of Brooklyn (5) the Empire State Building or other tall accessible buildings, (6) the Staten Island promenade [get off the Staten Island Ferry in Staten Island and walk towards the September 11th Memorial, and (7) if you have a car, go to Weehawken, New Jersey [especially on a Friday or Saturday night] to Hamilton Park. This will put you directly across the Hudson River from Times Square. This night view is spectacular and if your camera can handle low light conditions, you'll get some great shots.
I missed the Twin Towers that we went to in May 2001. Didn't like the skyline with just ONE tall tower in place of 2. It looked different, not necessarily beautiful.
Awesome Don,t forget your camera, or camcorder. We enjoyed this best by night, using the hop on hop off tour buses, awesome sights, bus stopped occasionally for you to take photographs
Beautiful View. Took the Circle Line cruise at 7:00. Saw the skyline and Statue of Liberty in daylight and as sun was setting. Great time
Best part of NY. The Manhattan Skyline is simply amazing.I come from a big city but have never seen anything like it.I suggest a visit to the Top of the Rock for the best views.

Spectacular. We had a look at the skyline from many angles - from the Top of the Rock in the daytime, from the Empire State Building at midnight, from Brooklyn on a hop on/hop off night bus tour and from the Statue of Liberty Ferry. Always spectacular and fascinating - so many famous places to pick out and admire.

Still iconic!. Our teenagers had not been to Manhattan before and were blown away by the iconic buildings: Chrysler, Empire State and Rockefeller Centre. My husband and I had been fortunate to visit the WTC many years ago and had not been back since 9/11. You can not help but reflect on the massive loss represented by their absence.

It's Time To Show the Kids a Skyline That Rocks. Explaining to my kids what a skyline is over and over again is difficult to do when they have never seen it. So what better place to show them then one of the greatest cities in the world.The best place do see the views are definitely from one of the skyscrapers, Empire State building is a good option. However, we found taking a boat cruise or ride is much better. We did the circle line around 6 pm during the summer this way we still had daylight.And when we were coming back the sunset and the city was lit up in lights.You can see the pictures and also find more fun info about the Circle Line tour on my blog.Traveling the world is the best way to teach your kids and now they know very well what a skyscraper is.

One of the world's best highlights. A stunning vista - no matter where you see it from, it leaves a lasting impression. Have seen it several times this week from different positions, and each sighting is both different and special. Particularly love it as you fly in and watch it get closer and closer.

Great view from the Zephyr. We booked via Skyauction.com 2 trips with the Zephyr. We choose the day tour of 1 hour and the Oasis Tropical tour at 9pm for 2 hours. This way you get the best of both, day and night views of Manhattan skyline

Fantastic city, great people. First time as a family and it was fantastic everyone we encounter was so so nice with one exception a tut tut cyclist who tried to charge us 300 dollars for a ride. But apart from that 100% recommend a visit. Hotel one un would be hard to top. Impossible to get lost and every block an adventure, loved it, just agree a tut tut price before you board to avoided getting fleeced.

The world's most impressive skyline. This skyline is stunning and a view that you would never tire of seeing. Seeing it from a helicopter, the Empire State Building and the sightseeing buses were all great in their own right.

Stunning experience!. I've been in NY twice and if I had to suggest one thing to see I would choose the astonishing NY Skyline. You can see it from "the top of the Rock" (Rockfeller Center) or from the Empire State Building, but my favorite view is from Brooklin.Best time to live this fantastic emotion is at sunset time. You can see the City changing its colors and dressing its best evening dress. You 'll be bewitched by this city, charming as sexy lady and these images will reamin sculpted in you mint for the rest of you life!
TO DO. It is better to get on a ferry 45 minutes to one hour before the sun goes down. So you make the most of your cruise : day light, twilight and night time light to vary your pictures !!

Best by Boat!. We took the Circle Line boat tour at Pier 42. They have various cruise times, but we chose the shortest (1 hour) as we were with our two boys (14 and 12) and didn't want to go for too long. Great views of the Manhattan skyline and Brooklyn Bridge. The cruise went right by the Statue of Liberty, so lots of good photo opps. Afterwards there are some nice walking areas on Pier 42, and you can also rent bikes there if you wish (bike path all the way along the shoreline)
must do. what's not to like - iconic nyc. took the harbor lights boat tour which was crowded but we were glad we did - all the quintessential sights at dusk - beautiful

Beautiful views from all directions. Views of the Manhattan Skyline form Liberty State Park, NJ & Brooklyn Parks give a much better aspect and are just as fantastic as from the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock! Plus the views are FREE!

You need to see this. If you visit NYC please make the effort to see the SkyLine at night. It really is fantastic. We did the Night Tour that takes you over the Manhattan Bridge giving you a great view from the bridge & Brooklyn.

How did they do it?. Having seen the New York skyline from the circle line ferry tour down the Hudson River and also at night from one of the Hop on Hop off tour buses just makes me stand in amazement at the architecture of the buildings, the bright lights and I just keep saying how did they do it? Fit all those buildings in such a small area. It is incredible really and you have to see it to believe it.

Oh my. I have been in Manhattan several times but I have not seen it the way you can see it from the Brooklyn. You have to go there in the evening right around the time sun is going down. The colors are incredible. Somehow it is almost magical to see the skies darkening and the lights of Manhattan getting brighter..
Manhattan Skyline rooftop view. We rented a fifth floor walk up with access to the roof and spent most of our nights looking at the skyline, taking pictures, drinking wine and hanging out.

NYC. Saw the skyline at dusk from Brooklyn. The lights were just coming on in the buildings. It was the only place that I was able to see how tall the new World Trade Center is. When you are in Manhattan it is not a true perspective..
Rockefeller Center at the top. Great view from the top of the Rock. Tour gives some history and then you get two levels and inside and outside views of 360 NYC
Start spreading the news!. I just love NYC . So vibrant . Times Square is amazing . Go on the night tour with nycitysights to see the lights of manhattan from Brooklyn
stunning. go to brooklyn, walk brooklyn bridge, 20 min right at sunset, views r stunning! u can also take subway or do the hop on hop off night tour
Incredible city. New York is exciting a very safe place that once you get your bearings after arriving is extremely easy to move around
Beautiful. Took a boat ride to Statue of Liberty with going around Manhattan, very interesting whether seeing it close or from a distance.

Modern wonder of the world. This view is surely one of the best in the world, from any angle, any time of day, even better from Liberty Island or Staten Island ferry, on a hot sunny day this was one of those moments you never forget, the new parts of the World Trade Center also means it will change every day for a while, those buildings are going to do justice to the memory of 9/11.

Circle Line Tour. Really nice tour - would have been better if there were more open seating, rather than being stuck under life rafts on a gorgeous day. The tour guide was very knowledgable, funny but talked about things that we couldn't see for a few minutes after he finished talking about them...so it was sort like "wait, what did he say about that?"

Spectacular skyline. This is what you call a Skyline! The best was to see this skyline and even The Statue of Liberty is by a ferry. At that time we, my sister, brother, her husband and daughter too the Circle line. I goes right around the island of Manhattan, passing by the Mayor's house and of course the ever-present lady of New York - The Statue of Liberty on Liberty Island.The first time I saw it, I was in awe. It was green in colour. And you could go right up to the crown for an amazing view.This 'cruise' was a pleasant one and the weather was just nice! The NY skyline needless to say, was spectacular! A must for tourists.Pics are pre-9/11... I was atop South Tower. I shall never forget.This is my tribute to it ...spectacular view of the Skyline of NYC opposite the Empire State Building.
Great view. The Manhattan skyline is a beautiful view by day or night . We were impressed on how clean the city was and the level of security made us feel safe during out stay.

A famous skyline, the enormity of it you have to visit to appreciate!. So many people too and all living above ground level!A great skyline & testimony to human ingenuity and achievement but a little of westernized opulence too which can so easily be the envy of the third world, driving some to jealous reaction sadly rather than encouragement to strive to achieve - and share - for themselves.A city where people can become alive - or hide away behind a facade of plastique funded by money - if you have some and aren't joining the homeless who sleep rough on Church steps, etc.A memorable tour, casting interesting shadow memories primarily positive ones with a few more reflective ones too; and some great art deco in several buildings that really should be admired - Waldorf Astoria, Empire State Building Grand Central Station, Chrysler Building and others like the Frick House, Library and so-on.

Amazing!. We took a watertaxi that drove us out to the Statue of Liberty and back under the Manhattan Bridge and Brooklyn Bridge and back again. We left just as the sun began to set so we saw the NYC skyline in both daylight and during nightime with alle the beautiful lights. A must see if you go to the Big Apple!

One of the best ways to enjoy the NYC skyline. We chose to go at night and while still lots of people up there, we did get the opportunity to enjoy the NYC skyline without looking over other people's shoulders. Having experienced Empire State Building as well, I believe this was far more enjoyable!

Great View of Manhattan skylinefrom Jersey city. Great skyline , to have a un obstructed view you must visit the jersey city side ( take path train from WTC to exchange palce station ) and soon as you are out of the station you get a un obstructed view .
Wow. This is what every person dreams of seeing. Although you can view it in a picture online, it can not measure up. Just make sure you get to see it from Liberty Island
Don't miss this... Amazing view of New York...Prepare to spend plenty of time there as you may need to join a long queue..

Most Famous Skyline in the World!. There are so many sections of the skyline to enjoy. The best way to see ALL the skyline is from the Circle Line boat ride going completely around Manhattan Island. The Circle Line ride that goes in a crescent from the Hudson and all around lower Manhattan and up past the Brooklyn Bridge and back is a shorter version that gives you the best parts of the skyline. For a free ride take the Staten Island Ferry and enjoy the lower Manhattan skyline.

one of the world's best skylines.... Although I personally prefer the view of Hong Kong from Kowloon Island, Manhattan's skyline is of course excellent, and iconic. There are lots of good ways to see it - from the airplane (particularly if landing at LaGuardia), from across the Brooklyn Bridge, from LI City, from Hoboken or Jersey City, from a boat in the harbor or Hudon or East River...
Have to see it at night!!. We were able to see the Manhattan Skyline from the Manhattan Bridge, while on a tour bus, it's beautiful. Especially right when the lights are going on in the city!

Skyline from West New York - New Jersey.. Easy to find, going thru the Lincoln Tunnel to Kennedy Boulevard.Easy access to parking on the Streets, relaxed atmosphere, and spectacular views of Manhattan, with a nice and cool breeze during the summer months.Not crowded either, so you can take lot's of pictures and enjoy the magnificent lights, right in front of you.For food you have to go down to River Road, that runs parallel to Kennedy Boulevard.You can walk also going North, to explore a little more.For an eye level view, go down the hill and find a nice place near the water to take it all in.

Take a cruise for the best views. Where do I start? The skyline is iconic. However as many people don't actually leave Manhattan Island except to travel to the airport, they miss this!A few ways to get the best views of the skyline;- Take a boat cruise, the are a few providers, and various routes, i.e. just the bottom half of the Island, full Island- f you go to Liberty Island, you can get great views, both from the ferry and the from the Island- Take the Staten Island ferry- Walk across Brooklyn Bridge (you could get a water taxi back across)- A helicopter ride (a bit more pricey, and note, they can only fly over water).

See it twice !. During daytime it's interseting a fun to take a boat tour around Manhattan and enjoying both the skyline and additional features of NY such as lady liberty and Ellis Island. photo opportunities are great. Then again in the evening take the time to walk the Brooklyn bridge and enjoy the view of Manhattan by night. Watch out for bicycles though, since most of them don't carry a light when the speed on the bridge !

Must be viewed from water. You have to take the ferry to Liberty Island to truly see the skyline. There was such a peaceful beauty that emerged once the sun came out and some clouds showed up and painted the sky. Go early if you don't want a crowd. You will get herded like cattle on and off the ferry.

Love New York City. Arrived during heat wave and felt temperatures of 103+ Still loved every moment of our trip especially enjoyed navigating the city via subway and public transportation. Bought a 7 day metro pass and one of them de-magnitized on day 2 -- did not receive any help from subway employees - except to tell us to double-up through the turn styles -- which we did. Had a wonderful family vacation.

Jersey Side. Having seen the skyline from various places, at various times - i think the best view comes from Jersey side - Newport or Weehawken captures the skyline like no other place. Its amazing how you can sit for hours and stare at buildings !!
Iconic, fantastic. We had perfect, clear weather for our 5 day trip. Main views taken from the Top of the Rock, using the Sun & Stars ticket. Wonderful experience!

looks familiar. So every second movie you watch shows a shot of the New York sky line. Go over to the brooklyn side, this is the best place to get a great view and look back for those familiar buildings, impressive city.

great skyline. breath taking skyline u will not see this again. when u are in a taxi there is a bridge coming from the airport to times sqaure its about half way into the journey u can see the whole of new york amazing, best view...
Breathtaking. This is a must see if you visit New York City. It's beautiful all lit up at night, bit still beautiful during the day. The buildings are so tall and unique.
Beautiful. A must see if you head to NY. The view is just wonderful, head there in the afternoon so you can catch the sunset.
view from Central Park. Walk a bit into Central Park and turn around. We needs to pay to go up to the top of the Rock or the Empire State Building.

wow! a must see in new york city. what beautiful skyscrapers!! there are so many of them you need to view them from the water, a boat or from new jersey. many have tours or observation towers. new york city is hectic, crowded and traffic is everywhere!!
bring your walking shoes and your camera
Simply Breathtaking. No Picture will ever do this view justice. EVERY human being needs to experience it at least once to understand.
Manhatten Skyline. Beautiful view from the Staten Island Ferry! looking back from the Brooklyn Bridge. Looking up from below. Great to see it from many different vantage points!

The most extraordinary in the world. Okay, I admit it. I adore NYC. I can stare at her skyline all day and night. For the best view, take the subway over to Brooklyn and walk to the Brooklyn Bridge Park. Spectacular. (Although sometimes hard not to see that iconic image of the World Trade Cetner buildings burning. :(
Breathtaking. My initial view of an amazing skyline came on exiting the Lincoln tunnel. What an experience, will never witness another skyline like that, totally breathtaking.

EVER CHANGING. Some of us still remember and miss the World Trade Center, but this is New York, things change and remain exciting.
The Sky line from Brooklyn is different than from Liberrty State Park, or the west of the GW bridge, but seeing it in from a distance really gives one a feeling of the vitality and size of the city.
Unbelievable view - amazing. I had the joy of visiting New York a few years back and I must say this is one of the best views I have ever seen. Words can't describe how gorgeous the city is

Skyline or Skylines?. There are just so many views and vantage points of the Manhattan skyline. Wherever you go, there always seems to be a new view, but with some recognizable building; i.e., Empire State, the new World Trade tower, the Chrysler bldg, etc. I never tired of gazing at the view from yet another vantage point.

A different world altogether. A bit costly, and very captivating. New York just draws you in.. Love the place and will definately be back. Stayed in Midtown and travelked to Brooklyn and New Jersey...great. Also visited Boston, DC and Pittsburgh. Great variety, excellent Country.

The lights of Manhattan are amazing. The lights of Manhattan are amazing. We went up at 22:00 and loved it. No need to pay the $17 to go to the 102 floor. You see a little more but not enough to make it worth while. 102 floor is all enclosed so you can't feel the wind in you face. The 86 floor is where it is open. So good.
Amazing. Simply the best skyline in the world that I've seen, it is magnificent and if you can see it from the water around the harbor it's inspiring.
Brilliant. Just what you expect. Saw it from a Statue of Liberty Bay cruise on Zephyr. Took a million photos. You see all the famous landmarks and others we didn't know of.

Big and bigger. New York is odd.It is absolutely huge but feels on a human scale. People are a bit abrasive but very helpful. Maybe astringent is a better word. I loved cruising the bus routes to sight-see, and the subway to travel further afield. I loved the Guggenheim and the Met Museum, but they are sooo big! Likewise Central Park. It looks like a walk in the park, but it's an overland hike! Brooklyn bridge another superb hike. I ate in greasy diners and discovered some bizarre dishes, drank some excellent beer, saw a couple of new films and browsed for hours in bookshops.I can't think of anything I didn't like in NYC

I loved cruising the bus routes to sight-see, and the subway to travel further afield. I loved the Guggenheim and the Met Museum, but they are sooo big! Likewise Central Park.
