Late afternoon. The Empire State building is a must, we walked there from Times Sqyare very safe walk near Macys. A few restaraunts near the Empire state building to eat afterward

Nothing else like it in the world.. The NYC skyline is magnificent.. The architecture is as diverse as the city itself. I have been looking at it all my life and everytime I see it, it is just a wonderful sight. And you have to most likely be in NJ or a plane to enjoy it!

Nothing like it. NYC skyline is like no other! Whether in battery park, going over the Verazano Bridge or at the top of the Empire State Building you will be thoroughly impressed. Everyone needs to go once in their life. Glad I grew up here although I truly miss it living in AZ!

What an amazing sight!. After walking the Brooklyn bridge from Manhattan to Brooklyn, we stopped for a while at the Brooklyn Bridge Park at the base of the bridge. To me, this was one of the most beautiful views of the Manhattan skyline aside from arriving on the airplane or the Staten Island Ferry. This park was great. I would have loved to brought the picnic basket and a frisbee for a nice afternoon. I am personally from Houston (the wife from NYC) and I use to think that Houston had alot of big buildings but it has nothing in comparison to this concrete jungle. It amazes me about how far engineering and technology have come in the past 200 years. Have fun!
to be seen. Impressive view of all the buildings from any ferry (to Staten or Ellis islands) or from a helicopter.
what a site. beautiful site to see day and night go up to an observation site like rockafeller center. be sure and go during the day and again at night
Awesome!. I've travelled around many parts of the world and the Manhattan skyline stands alone as. It is an awesome view from Liberty Island.
Top Of The Rock. Great view of the city. Tickets are easily available the day you want to go up. No long lines and views from three different levels.
really cool. i loved going there and just walk through it. nice view, lots of flowers . beautiful. it's worth going there.
Spectacular. What can you say, superb. Top of the rock is cheapish and empire state is the expensive but iconiv view....pays your money....
Great photos!. Awesome! Took many pictures but would remember this anyway. Discovered one of the reasons for the slogan " I Love NY" Best view from the Brooklyn side.

Something to see!. It is as big and as impressive as you imagine! Great views from the Empire SB - we went both morning and evening. The harbor cruises also are a great for an overall view, especially at twilight.

NYC Views. One of the best views of NYC is inBrooklyn. There are hotels such as Le Bleu where you can go to the roofop bar and see the Skyline... Hoboken is another spot. For a hot day, you can get a ride on a boat that circles the island of Manhatten...

Nice view, but difficult to find freely accessible vantage points other than Brooklyn bridge park. It looks great in the morning and evening, but there are very little spots where the sight could be enjoyed. Probably a solo helicopter ride is the way to go

Tour Boat of Manhatten. The best experience that I ever had of viewing the Manhattan skyline was on a NYC boat tour. There are several tour boat operators in New York City. You can choose which option is best for you. The tour that I took was a 90 minute tour around Manhattan. It gave me a close-up of the skyline that you would not normally from other vantage points. Some of the views included the Empire State Building, Brooklyn Bridge, South Street Seaport, Battery Park, and the Chrysler Building to name just a few. The 90 minute cruise allowed me lots of picture opportunities. Here is a list of tour operators.Grayline New YorkCircle Line Sightseeing CruisesNew York Water Taxi

Brooklyn bridge. Walked over Brooklyn bridge which was cool - longer than expected. Head to old Fulton street for great pizza at juliana's, then walk down to water for an ice cream at ice cream factory ( next to famous river cafe). Then hop on ferry for 5 min trip back to Wall Street. Wonderful. That bit of Brooklyn has been regenerated beautifully post hurricane. Park, playground etc. Apparently even has sandy beach but we didn't go there.

Manhattan Takes Your Breath Away. Once you have seen the Manhattan skyline, you will never, ever be the same. It is by far the most breathtaking skyline I have ever seen, and I am from Los Angeles and have traveled the U.S. extensively. One of the best views was from the top of the Metropolitan Art Museum. Wow! Wow! Wow!
Picture perfect. What else could you expect from this world-famous skyline? NYC really is the world's best city! This is completely breathtaking!

The city never sleeps, so much to see & do. It's the buzz just being in Manhattan, lots of walking, sightseeing& trying to see as much as possible. I find it a little said when travelling by bus or metro that no one gets eye contact, most people have their personal devices in their ears listening to music. I guess this is the norm for the New Yorkers. I would like to see them interact with other people really. That is the only thing I don't like

Great NYC greenspace!. Amazing re-use of space that has transformed into a cool urban green space- reminiscent of Pacific North West (Green/ Industial look) the walk overlooks one of the newest coolest parts of NYC, MPD and its Chelsea Market, art galleries etc.

If you don't see the skyline from a good vantage point then you have not visited Manhattan. If you cannot see the skyline from a boat like the SI Ferry, or, even better, the Circle Line, then go to the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. If you are up for the walk, traverse the Brooklyn Bridge to get there. At about mid-span, look northward toward Manhattan and take in the cityscape.There are some great vistas from the NJ side of the Hudson, too.

Impressive and Iconic. Unquestionably the New York skyline is impressive and iconic. To truly experience the New York skyline it's best to see it from different angles and different times. From my trip here's what I found the best view:1) From the Rock at sunset to late evening2) Brooklyn Heights in the day time and then into the Brooklyn bridge park at night (essential)3) From Williamsburg- get off at Bedford Av and walk to the waterside4) From the Staten Island ferry on the return

Observation Deck at 30 Rock. A great view of the city. Done by appointments. Tip: Buy your ticket in advance (preferably on line if you can) in the NBC building. Follow the signs to purchase tickets. I also bought the map that identified many of the buildings. It was a little crowded at sunset, but that is to be expected because of the time of day.
From the boat around Manhattan. You really get a good sense of the Island and the areas and there is a great narrator on board. Loved every minute.
Beautiful experience. People are very friendly and kind. The climate was very good. You have to walk a lot . Everything is huge in Apple. I suggest that you should come and experience once.

Duality: Breath Taking and Ugly. There are places along both sides of the Island, along the Hudson and East River, that are absolutely incredible. The Hudson at Pier 23 is relaxing and beautiful yet the view of the Watchtower Building from the East River side is disruptive an seems out of place.I've seen it from the Empire State Building, the Statue of Liberty and at the highest point in Central Park that my Old Man, a born and bred New Yorker, hipped me to. Yet, after all of these years and various places that I've enjoyed seeing it, my favorite place to view it is still at Eagle Rock Reservation in my home state of New Jersey.

Wow! Wow! Wow! Wow! Wow! Wow! Wow!. Approaching from JFK in the twighlight with the lights coming on and the sunset behind this vista is picture postcard perfect.This is th world's ultimate city with all the noise, bustle, industry and activity one would expect.
Unique. I still turn around and look at it mesmerized on my way to the airport every time I take a trip! Such an energy..

Iconic. Such an iconic site - you think you know what you expect because you've seen it on TV shows or in movies? You're wrong. I thought I was ready for it, but it's spectacular to see in person. Make sure you see it during the day and at night, stunning at both times, and if you can, see it from NJ and from Brooklyn, or from the water (see "Water Taxi" for great options).Enjoy!

Better than ever. The New York skyline is even better with the new World Trade Center tower, the tallest in the western hemisphere. It is one of the most breathtaking sights in the world, in the premier city in the world.
Almost as amazing as Hong Kong. Seeing the City from a boat is amazing especially at night.Not quite Hong Kong but still very special!
Never ceases to amaze. Iconic and impressive, it's hard not to glance at the entirety of Manhattan and not step back and say "wow," at least to yourself. Best views are from the east, I think.
A stroll across the Brooklyn Bridge. Might be the best self-guided tour in NYC! Walk from Brooklyn into Manhattan, starting at the the Court St. subway stop.

A fantastic achievement by humans. This beautiful jungle of extraordinarily tall buildings of all designs and shapes... living in them, all sorts from all over the planet
... just makes me proud of the extent of human achievement.

Manhattan Skyline. For visitors who are not used to tall buildings, the Manhattan skyline is spectacular. Even for jaded native New Yorkers it can still be awe-inspiring. The skyline now has the new Freedom Tower at Ground Zero, best viewed from the Circle Line or other boat rides that go around Manhattan Island.

Manhattan Skyline. Manhattan's majestic and ever changing skyline needs to be seen from several viewpoints to appreciate its complexity. Make a day trip out of it. For all of Lower Manhattan, take a ride on the Staten Island Ferry, a free one-hour round trip from the Battery. For a view from the West walk over the Brooklyn Bridge and then double back to the Brooklyn Heights promenade or below from the new Brooklyn Bridge Park. To see it from the West, take the PATH train (NYC Metrocards accepted) from the WTC station across the Hudson River to Exchange Place, Jersey City. For the entire sweep of Manhattan, take PATH to Hoboken and walk north to the park located just north of the historic NJ Transit terminal and then continue onto the leafy campus at Stevens Institute for the outstanding view from Castle Point. For viewing the East Side, take the 7 train from Times Square or Grand Central to the first stop in Queens (Vernon Blvd/Jackson Av) and walk west to Gantry Park facing the East River at Hunters Point.

Prettiest Skyline Ever. Awesome wherever you are viewing it. But up close and personal is the best and you get this at the Brooklyn Heights Promenade which is across the island of Manhattan and in Brooklyn. You can take a cab but that will cost you. So take the 2 or 3 train to Clark street and you exit a whole new world and its just like you're in Europe. You walk throug great period brownstones. Ask anyone to help you find the Promenade. You get there in 3 minutes and see a sight most awesome. I go there whenever I can and its the first place I take my hometown friends to. Oh and don't go too early. Five thirty will be great. Behold the City that Never Sleeps. Lights in the building are open 24 hours. Behold the greatest city in the world.

Best view of NYC Skyscrapers is from Hamilton Park, NJ. There are many places to watch the New York Skyline; Brooklyn, Staten Island, Jersey City, Hoboken. THE BEST PLACE BY FAR: HAMILTON PARK, N.J. or actually anyplace along JF Kennedy Boulevard East in Weehawken, N.J. just north of the Lincoln Tunnel as you are exiting the Tunnel in N.J. from Manhattan. The view from the Staten Island Ferry is also Phenomenal but you have to fight for a good spot, pushed around a little. If you can deal with that, it is worth it.From the Brooklyn side the view is also Fantastic with The Manhattan and Brooklyn bridges. But the best view of the NYC Skyline is around Hamilton Park area on JF Kennedy Boulevard East in New Jersey. The best time to view the skyline from there is to get there 1-2 hours before sundown so you can take pictures while it is still Daylight and also catch the reflection on the buildings from the sun as it sets behind you and then watch the lights from the Skyscrapers emerge and get stronger as the Dusk turns in to darkness. It is something that has to be experienced with your own eyes.
Best city skyline on the planet. From the towering tower in the South to the towering towers in the north a city that never stops changing and improving

One of the best in the world!!. The iconic New York City skyline is among the best in the world!Boasting the Empire State, Chrysler and CitiCorp Buildings The New York skyline is also complimented by the the Freedom tower and landmark skyscrapers dotted about Manhattan. The view is best from the Brooklyn promenade in Brooklyn heights, from the aerial view of Roosevelt Islands Tramway and from any of the water taxis/ferries as well as the Staten Island Ferry - (free)!Be sure to try to get out on the water at dusk for the most dramatic lighting.Enjoy!

High Line to Liberty - nice walk..... After enjoying the High Line, a lovely west wide walk along the water is down as far as the boats departing for the Statue of Liberty. Advanced people watching and you really do see how some of the other half lives. And we saw a peacock !Nice...

Manhattan Skyline. The very best way to get an upclose view of the ENTIRE NYC skyline is aboard a Circle Line Tour Boat...without a doubt , from a 70 year old New Yorker!!! The view has changed drastically over the years and MUCH has been added: unfortunately, (with tears) some has been destroyed by vile acts of terrorism which has not only effected New York but our nation as a whole. The very best, stationary view, is from Long Island City nearby the iconic Pepsi-Cola sign. The best way to access this area is from the Vernon/Jackson station on the # 7 train. This location cannot be topped for great views of the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building (an art deco mastepiece of construction) and the United Nations Building. An excellent picture of Lower Manhattan as well as New York Harbor, is found at the Prominade in Brooklyn. This is especially beautiful around sunset. You'll have to look up traveling directions to get here but it is not too difficult. Come visit!! Most New Yorkers, if they are able, WILL be helpful in answering your questions and giving directions for traveling around NYC. NEW YORK CITY, MY HOME, AND I WELCOME YOU!!! Tom V E.

The Breathtaking Manhattan Skyline. If you're in NYC for the first or 100th time, you have to see the skyline. Nothing beats the beauty, the awe of landscape, especially at twilight on a clear day, with the sun setting over the EmpireState Building.

What a view. My heart pings every time I see the manhattan skyline. Lived here 60 yrs so far. Traveled the world. The manhattan skyline is the most recognized view in the world. I also had the luxury of a helicopter tour many years ago. Takes my breath away every time

Doe anything really need to be said?. Can you rate the Rocky Mountains or the Himalayas? The New York skyline is kind of in the same league, only it's a man made wonder. It's been recognized as awe inspiring since the early 1900s. One of my fondest memories was of returning to New York by ship, on a vessel loaded with Europeans and noticing the stillness that came over them as the ship headed up the harbor, past the Statue of Liberty, as the full force of the skyline came into view. For me it was just home, but i could see on their faces looks of awe and even some fear. The hole left by the collapse of the Twin Towers is almost filled and many new buildings have joined the party since that day in the harbor, but the skyline continues to be one of the most striking man made things on this earth.Incidentally, there are two skyline views. One is better known than the other. The best known is the harbor view, best seen from the water (either on the Staten Island ferry or a tour boat) or from a neighboring land mass (Brooklyn, staten Island, Liberty Island or NJ). The less known is known as the inner skyline and is the view of midtown, best seen from inside Central Park. Good vantage points for this view are the road at the north end of Sheep Meadow or the road that crosses the park at the north end of the Great Lawn at approximately 84th street. The latter has the added charm of including Belvedere Castle in the vista. I'm referring here to roads within the park, not to the transverse toads, which are all sunken below park level. While on them you can see nothing but their retaining walls.

See the Sky Line from the River. Go to South Street and take one of their cruises from there. There are several different options to choose from. You can get great views of the skyline from the water. Before or after your boat ride u can then visit the many shops or restaurants in the South Street area.

NYC The City That Never Sleeps. Tips:DO NOT!! ACCEPT CD's on street. Those guys will charge you $10 for it.Get a FREE!! Subway map at any of the stations from the attendant inside the booth.Get a FREE!! map of central park at the visitor center in Time SquareDon't eat in Midtown or in the restaurants in Time Square. The food isn't great and you overpay. The exceptions are HAVANA CENTRAL & O'LUNNY'S PUB.Eat at Agozar downtown.Buy candy by the pound at Economy Candy.Visit Washington Square park.Visit Top of The Rock. (Entrance on 50th Street between 5th and 6th ave.) Better views than the Empire State Building.Rockefeller Plaza has public bathrooms!!Get Ben & Jerry's Ice Cream at Rockefeller Plaza and get pizza at Harry's Pizza.Get a soup, salad, or sandwich at Cosi on 48th Street, or get a Burrito at Chipotle.Visit St. Patrick's Cathedral. Be polite take your hat off and provide a contribution. Don't take pictures during mass.DO NOT STOP and stare at the building while walking in the middle of the street or at a corner while the crossing the street.Don't take pictures with the characters in costumes.Walk everywhere or take the subway.Before taking a cab know exactly where you are going so they can't spot you are a tourist and make sure you has his meter on.If you take a cab from JFK to NYC the price is $52. No more.For a good picture of the skyline take the FREE ferry to Staten Island and back.You can also take the Path train to Hoboken and take a picture from the park close to the station and go to all the bars on Washington Street.Walk around Grand Central and look up at the stars.Go to Rockefeller Center and LOOK UP! the artwork there is pricless and visit the NBC Experience store.Go watch a taping of the Today show 7am - 9am. On Friday's in the summer show up extra early to be part of the FREE!! summer concert.Eat a Gyro at 6th AVE & 54th st by the CBS building.Walk the Highline it's FREE!Go get a sandwich at Whole Foods in columbus circle.Buy Souvenirs in ChinatownBuy Broadway tickets at the TKTS booth behind the red staircase.Ride the M10 bus uptown and back it's a nice way to view NYC for $2.25.Go to Tonnies Minis in Harlem and get THE BEST CUPCAKES in the city.If you need caffeine get a DARK ROAST coffee at Starbucks. Sign up for Groupon and see what NYC attraction discounts come up. It will help you do more during your visit.Save money and don't do the following unless you really want to.Take a carriage rideTake a Pedi cabRent a CitibikeEat in Time SquareBuy souvenirs in Time Square gift shops.Buy full price Broadway tickets unless you can't find discounted ones.Ride the subway at night. It's safe but if you get lost you might not someone around to ask for help.DO NOT buy cupcakes at Magnolia's they are dry and the frosting is horrible. (Tonnies Minis in Harlem are the best in town.)

..."As if we didn't need the extra air". Neil Sedaka's classic, "New York City Blues" contains the line, "I hear they're gonna build a sky-scraper there, As if we didn't need the extra air."Unlike just about any other City in the world (Hong Kong and Singapore being two possible exceptions), New York has no ability to grow outwards, it can only grow upwards....and up it does. The tallest building in New Jersey is the 54-floor Goldman Sach's building in Jersey City. Sitting on the West Bank of the Hudson River it dominates the Jersey shore. However, when compared to the East Side of the river, its only a mid-level building....absolutely nothing special at all.While you can walk around with your neck turned to the sky, to truly understand the scope of the New York City skyline, you need to get out of the City. Free options include the Staten Island Ferry (great views of Lower Manhattan), the Brooklyn Prominade, any subway that goes on the Manhattan or Williamsburg Bridge. One can also take the Circle Line Ferry (a costly option, but an interesting one).
See NYC at sunset. Top of the Rock is fabulous in the evening when the lights of NYC are on. It seems like you can see to the end of the earth.

The best skyline in the world. The skyline of Manhattan is the most breathtaking of all skylines. Ironically it's best viewed in its entirely from elsewhere. Go for a stroll across the Brooklyn Bridge or along the promenade in Brooklyn Heights for the best view at sunset. Drive over any of the East River bridges for an amazing, full view too. It's unforgettable!
Like no other!. I live in the heart of The city and it still takes my breath away. Like no other in the world. Very proud to be a New Yorker!

beyond words. You have to see it to appreciate it. A boat tour around Manhattan is a good way to see it all, also I imagine that the bus tours are great for getting in real close. For me seeing the entire skyline revealed is the best way.

Unique and in person-unforgettable. The manhattan skyline---a sight to behold, BUT not from inside manhattan. This obvious point is often forgotten. Go to new jersey and see the skyline light up as dusk becomes night. There are several restaurants located on the west shore of the Hudson River, and the waterfront in Hoboken is a good place to view. Just remember to be in place about a half hour before sunset. Watching the skyline light up is magical!

Excuse me?. The title says it all. I grew up in Brooklyn seeing the skyline from the Eastside. People do not realize the post cards are from Jersey. Army buddies that visited me from the South and Europeans and Asians can not believe the amount of rows and rows of tall buildings. Tell them when it was first begun and they are dumbfounded.

Always exciting. My favorite vantage point for the Manhattan skyline is from route 495 when you approach the city from the East. Fantastic, simply fantastic. Seen it so many times and it never fails to excite.
Does this even need a review?. It is the iconic skyline. How can you go wrong? Take the Staten Island Ferry for a FREE amazing photo opp.
Manhattan Skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is best viewed from the water. Circle Line tours are well done. You can also take a ride on the Staten Island Ferry and back.
Breathtaking. When you see it, you know it IS NYYou get a view of Central Park, The Wall Street Area.and the hustle and bustle that is New York.

Seen best from the water. The Manhattan skyline is unique and spectacular. Probably best seen from the water. The really cheap way is to take the Staten Island Ferry to Staten Island and back. The cost is minimal (last time I went on it was free), the trip is only about 20 minutes so you are not stuck on a boat for hours, and the views are the best

Depends on your point of view. Being an elongated, narrow north/south island, Manhattan actually has any number of wildly disparate skylines, so it depends on what you're looking at and where from. For this lifelong New Yorker, Manhattan is best viewed (a) from the air, in a helicopter tour, (b) from the water, almost anywhere but especially in the bay around its southern tip -- so you get to feel just a little of the awe and majesty of one of the world's greatest natural harbors, (c) from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, and especially (d) at a window table at the River Café -- destroyed by Superstorm Sandy but due to reopen around Labor Day 2013. The trick is to time your reservation around sunset if at all possible, so you can watch the sun disappear behind the Manhattan skyline, and see all its lights come up. One of New York's -- nay, the world's -- most beautiful experiences.
Stunning. Just looking at the skyline makes you feel so happy and special. It is a truly majestic view, and I would reccomend it to everybody!
The Best Skyline in the World. Loved everything. You have to see it to believe it...both in the day and in the night!!! Bring a camera, video and and your family.

Viewed from Brooklyn bridge&Dumbo/ Brooklyn park. Like any major city, the skyline is interesting. It was nice to look at from Brooklyn Park/ Dumbo area. There are decent views from there with Brooklyn Bridge in it and Manhattan bridge. We went at night and it was lovely.

Awesome visit to NYC. We heard so many intersting facts about the city. We saw many of the famous attractions. We were traveling in the comfort of a roomy, a/c shuttle with large enough windows for all to see well. The Tour Director, Mar, and our Shuttle Driver, Reeney, were fun and interacted with the group creating a very comfortable environment! No complaints from this happy Tourist!

Beautiful. Love the view of the skyline from the Newport Jersey City walkway. Viewed during the day from Liberty Park and in the evening from the walkway along the waterfront in Newport. Very nice walkway - would recommend if staying in Newport - within walking distance from hotels.
Excellent View!. The skyline always looks so interesting ... you hardly feel bored. However from NJ end you get even better view!

Beautiful. The skyline looked so different at dusk, when the last rays of the sun almost bathed the city in an orange gold veil- it was surreal. Must take the evening tour on the hop on bus and see the skyline from the other end of the Brooklyn bridge

man-made fence. architecture wonders, and not all look the same. However, too congested and too compact. Even the Rockfellar Centre and the Empire State Building fail to give me a majestic and imposing shock that the highrisers of such fame should offer. They are staying there with less rooms for a grandeur.
Beautiful. Just like in the movies. Stunning by day and even more stunning by night. New York really is the city that never sleeps.

It truly is awe-inspiring!. Viewing the Manhattan skyline from the waterfront, an overhead passing airplane, helicopter, or just walking through it is truly inspiring. The mass of architectural styles, colors, and especially the mingling people are conspire to leave an indelible impression on you that doesn't leave. Other megalopolis type cities have similar looks (Hong Kong, London) when viewed from certain vantages, but New York is though to beat. Especially with the Freedom Tower looming large over lower Manhattan as both an awesome feat of engineering and as a national symbol.

Never seems to bore you. The Manhattan skyline has a certain marvel that is unmatched anywhere else in the world. At first glance it looks like any other business building skyline, but after staring at it you are taken into a different dimension. One of mystic that is unexplainable.
Beautiful. Brilliant lights at night, make sure you arrange a night tour of Manhattan. The view from Brooklyn looking back at manhattan is simply breathtaking.
Best viewed from the Staton Island Ferry. Unmistakable skyline, we got our best view from the free ferry. It's also worth going up the Empire State, we got there early and there were no cues.
Breathtaking!!!!!!. The skyline is best viewed on on New Jersey side, atop the cliffs. The view will take your breath away.
NYC skyline - breathtaking. We used a boat tour (zephyr) to get around the island of manhattan and it was amazing!!! Being able to see all over NYC from the harbor was priceless.

Forever changing and always beautiful at night.. I am amazed at the skyline view everytime we visit the city. So many new buildings (One57 is awesome) and each one a masterpiece in its own right. I will never tire of visiting this city as it is in constant change.
unique. Go to Brooklyn Promenade by the metro and have this fantastic view of the skyscrapers and the bridge. I did it both at night and in the morning, 2 different awesome views!

Amazing. One of the best I've seen!. The Manhattan skyline really is incredible.. day and night! Seeing so many huge buildings together on such a small island really is something. However you go about seeing it (whether it's from the Top of the Rock, Empire State, Staten Island Ferry) - make sure you do! And you'll get some absolutely fabulous photos.
Wonderful!. Can't beat NYC! Loved the bus tour and Central Park! Great hotel and food! This is why I return twice a tear....shopping too...can't be beat!

Beautiful. Whatever your vantage point and the time of day you have to check out the wonderful skyline. We looked across all the skyscrapers from the Empire State Building, which was great, and I'm sure that there are plenty of other ways to look at it. We are taking the Staten Island Ferry tomorrow.

Lovely views from the Standard Hotel Highline. We met our friends at the Standard Hotel Highline Rooftop. Beautiful views with plenty of lounges to sit/lie on. Although the views were great, we felt that the place was geared toward a 20's to 30's crowd, who felt very comfortable laying on the sofas, drinking, smoking and flirting. Lovely views, but, some of our other friends got better photos and a more romantic evening, visiting Brooklyn, just over the bridge.

Nothing like it in the world. It's impossible not to get chills when you see the skyline. It's very touching to see how far the construction has come on the new freedom towers. Although I cannot imagine who will occupy the freedom towers, it is a gem to the skyline. Absolutely beautiful to see.
WOW!. We took the FREE Staten Island Ferry, gives an excellent view of the Skyline! Also a great view from above is at the Top of the Rock! 54 dollars for 2 people but well worth it! Views r amazing!

Magical....specially at night. The Manhattan skyline, a unique, unforgettable, and ever-changing landscape. NYC is like no other place in the world, and the skyline is just the start.It's just magical, day or night but I liked it really in night tour.
A great view. One of the most beautiful sites in the world is when you see the skyline of Mahattan for the first time, it really is magical.

Breathtaking!. Choose to enjoy the skyline at night at the top of the Empire State Building. Had to wait in a series of lines so getting to the top took awhile but it was worth it. A beautiful evening with a partial moon shining over the city. An unobstructed view is the reward. Just beautiful. We used a City Pass which was a nice deal.

How can you not be impressed?. See the skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. The Ferry is free and runs all day and all night. Also, classics like the Empire State Bldg and Rockefeller Center are both great places for a view.

still standing after all these years. like the intro to the old "grand central station" radio show, birthplace of a thousand dramas daily.... can't imagine it better seen than from the free staten island ferry, but it's great to glimpse from an inbound jersey transit train, as well
Seen from boat. We did the tour of the island from the boat, a must do for all travelers. The guide was relaxed, funny and very knowledgable.

A WOW!. As someone who has lived in NY most of my life, the views of the skyline are awesome. Some of the best places: Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Promenade in DUMBO, Staten Island Ferry, Brooklyn Heights Promenade. All are WOWS! For great pictures be there at sunrise or sunset.

Fab view from the top of the Rockafellas. The view was 360 degrees and we were there on a lovely day. You could see Central Park really well and the Yellow cabs below looked like dots from above. When you get in the lift for the 69 floors the lights go out and its like being on a ride in Florida. You get up the 69 floors in seconds.
Love it, love it, love it.. Beautiful views from the Murray Hill ~ Midtown area of NYC. These are classic City views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building.
Fun weekend with our daughter. Came in from Hoboken, NJ so the view of NYC from the other sideof the river was spectacular, especially at night. Public transportationis very good.
Simply gorgeous. It is absolutely beautiful enjoying a relaxing walk while looking at the town from 'one floor above the street'. The path is clean, the gardens well kept, the stairs frequent.

Trip the lights fantastic. Liked: Hop on/ Hop off night time bus tour, awesome city lights and trip to Brooklyn allows you to view the Manhattan Skyline.Disliked:Nothing, enjoyed it all. Take an umbrella with you and of course your camera
Take the Staten Island Ferry. The Staten Island ferry gives you a great view of the manhattan skyline and the Statue of Liberty....plus it's 100% free!!

Breath-taking. It just doesn't get much more exciting than this.My first trip to NYC and the first thing I saw from the plane is the skyline. Excitedly, I alerted my Mother and Sister who were both affected by the sight - two big grins.We were driving to the city from JFK before we saw it again, this time lit up as dusk continued to fall.The Empire State Building, Chrysler building, Rockefeller Center, and most importantly, Freedom Tower - you must see it.

Iconic and looks good wherever you are. Head to dumbo over in Brooklyn for the best place to photo the Brooklyn bridge and Manhattan skyline (and also eat the best pizza) and take a walk along the Brooklyn park highway overpass. A circle line cruise will take you around the whole island, and the views are good from the empire state/rockefeller deck and liberty island as well. There's nothing else like the Manhattan skyline in the world.

Best viewed from the air. Best seen from the air. Liberty Helicopter tours offer unprecedented views of the Manhattan skyline. Other great viewing options for the Financial District are Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn Heights Promenade and Governors Island. Great views of Central Park, West Side, East Side, Midtown, Time Square and Harlem from Top of the Rock, including best view of Empire State Building.

Beautiful!!!. Night and Day Beautiful!!!
Go down by the river as well.
Beautiful Skyline from any direction.
Take lots of pictures

Freedom Tower. So beautiful lit up red, white and blue. It was during the week before the 4th of July. Had a real feeling of patriotism after seeing it. Also lot of interesting information in the 9/11 museum.
Manhattan Skyline. Beautiful, especially at night! We enjoyed walking in Times Square. It is interesting to just sit and watch the crowds.
Sophisticated yet simple. Manhattan skyline could compete with more "natural" landmarks like the Swiss Alps.One of the most iconic sights in the world.

Wow! Incredible!. Truly an a view of the Manhattan skyline is something that everyone should see at once in their lives. A great spot to view this is from the emerging up market suburb of Dumbo which is down under the Brooklyn Bridge on the other side of the river. There is a walkway and a park and its a great view.

Skyline by tour boat.. We took the evening tour boat along the harbour front. It was spectacular. Very informative tour guide. Really looked just like you see in the movies and pictures of the Manhattan skyline
Smog. TOO MUCH SMOG!!!!!!!!!!!!! There is a orangey haze above the city. The Skyline would be better if the city was greener
Wonderful. This we went and seen by bus during the day and then we caught a bus from times square and went back and looked at it by niht and what a difference. How beautiful.

NYC from the air, from the water.. There is nothing like New York's Manhattan Skyline. I am sorry I never got to witness it before 911 with the Twin Towers, but this is one of the most magnificent sights you can ever see. I'm originally from Los Angeles and thought L.A. was big! It's nothing compared to New York City. My cousin who has lived there all of his 40 years told me he is sad because there is so much to see, so much to do, that he can't see or do all of it in his lifetime. I now understand. The buildings are so beautiful and NYC is packed with history. Manhattan is something you must do.
The best skyline you could ever see till date. I have travelled to many big cities but after seeing the Manhattan skyline both @Day and @nights, nothing looks so good! The best - that says it all..

See it at night from Brooklyn....Wow. Great view from across the Brooklyn Bridge looking at the lights on in the building. Try City bus tour in the evening. Many interesting neighborhoods. Also top of the Rock, less waiting time than other attractions.

Nothing Like it!. No words to describe how beautiful.. Right outside our hotel window, The Freedom Tower was lit up Red White and Blue. The river right there. WOW... Just WOW, Never get used to it....
wow. they approach was good and I enjoyed the ride. everything was explain really good. I like the night time scene. I like how going on the skyline, how the ear plugs work really good.
Fantastic View. The best way to see the skyline is to either take the subway to Brooklyn or take the Harbor Cruise. Beautiful buildings - all different shapes and sizes.
thrilling. exciting and beautiful-- amazing views in all directions from Roosevelt island point waters are clear

One of the most beautiful views in the world. See the skyline from many different points - from the Statue of Liberty, from an airplane and from one of the cruise boats. Try to imagine the buildings as young boys, trying to outgrow each other and competing, who will impress you more.

Breathtaking.... Absolutely spectacular at every angle! My favorite view was from Brooklyn Heights especially at dusk. Try to get there approx. half an hour before sunset - then you'll have perfect light for taking stunning pictures.You won't see the greatness of the city unless you look at it from the outside (try any observation deck, Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry, Williamsburg, Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn Bridge Park/Dumbo or even Central Park!)

No other city like NYC.. Which ever place you see the manhattan skyline it is totally awesome. So many places to view it from. I could just look at it forEVER. Everyone should see it at least once in their life.
breathtaking. Looks just like in the pictures and the movies! Also a good view from the other side of the Lincoln Tunnel, and it's free to cross!

The eighth wonder of the world!. City lights, wonderful shapes and sizes. The best view is from the NJ side, atop a cliff. You get to see the city skyline from the George Washington bridge all the way down to the stature of liberty. Sunset is beautiful!

Can't get much better than this.. The Manhattan skyline is one of the best in the world and when you see it for yourself you'll see why. If you like skylines this is a place to see and knock off your bucket list. Not to mention the many other things to do in New York.

See the City Skyline from the Top of the Rock!!. The Manhattan Skyline is incredible and is best viewed from up high. This leaves you two real options, Empire State or Rockefeller Center. The Top of the Rock is much better for seeing Manhattan in all its glory for several reasons:1: The perfectly centered view of Central Park (the view of Central Park is VERY obstructed from the ESB!)2. Opportunity to actually take pics of the Empire State building3. The location of TOTR is much better4. Less crowded than ESB
New York Holiday!. What a great City...full of energy and loads to see and do. It was extremely hot and humid when we visited but don't let that stop you from visiting.

Circle Line Tours. Our whole family took the 90 minute semi circle Cirle Line tour. It was a great tour - lots of cool facts about New York and the views were amazing. The tour guide was excellent! A VERY worthwhile trip for 90 minutes.
What else can I say?. This skyline is gorgeous and if it doesn't take your breath away when you see it, you're likely dead inside.

fascinating view. my first time in the US and I fell in love with New York. Manhattan skyline is fascinating. the view is great, relaxing, and exciting at the same time. all the modern skyscrapers and old buildings blend well together.

"Need to See". The skyline was very pretty. We saw it in the day. I would recommend seeing it at night if you are going to be visiting the area. You can see how they place so many buildings in such a little space. I would recommend these trips for older teens and adults. The city was a little crowded to move around with small children.

Beautiful!. Seen from the top of the Empire State, the Manhattan Skyline is really astonishing! Another good place to see the skyline (not as high as the Empire State) is the rotating restaurant on top of the Marriott in Times Square.
AMAZING. Never having been out of Australasia before. I found NYC so impressive and incredible. Don't miss it

Favorite viewing spots. I've been visiting New York regularly for the past thirty years and it is still my absolute favorite city in the world. My two favorite spots to view the Manhattan skyline from: (1) Brooklyn Bridge Park - picnic on the grass looking at the skyline over the East River, between Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge. Avoid Smorgasburg days though as it gets too crowded. 2) Brooklyn Heights promenade - just a lovely walk with an incredible view of the skyline, the Brooklyn Bridge, and the Statue of Liberty.

There is only ONE manhattan. When I came the first time (and all the other times) from JFK by taxi and I saw the skyline, it took my breath away, also when I had once an internal flight back from a visit to Buffalo we landed in the evening and the lightning of the whole of manhattan was also breathtaking.

I love New York!. The skyline is awesome!The magnificent architecture from old to new!The old buildings reflected in the modern glass structures create a wonderful sense of space!The best is seeing the skyline from the Hudson!

Great perspective. This is an amazing way to get a unique perspective of the city. So many great vantage points to view the streets, the architecture, works of art, and the people. A truly brilliant attraction, and a great way to avoid traffic.

Like No Other!. There really is no comparison to the Manhattan Skyline - anywhere in the world. The various skyscrapers - each with it's own style and beauty - tell a story of ambition, success and dreams in the Big City.On our recent visit to Manhattan, we found various ways to see the skyline...1. Go to the top - top of the Empire State Building, or Top of the Rock. Each offers unique views of the various buildings surrounding you....2. Take a cruise in the harbor...we used Statue Harbor Cruises, which took us up a bit of the East River, as well as the Hudson - so we could get great views of the city.3. Walk - or drive - or take a subway - across the Brooklyn Bridge...there's a place at the foot of the bridge called "Fulton's Landing" - which offers a FANTASTIC view of the skyline. We did this at sunset - and it was incredible. 4. Visit the Rooftop Sculpture Garden at the Metropolitan Museum of Art - which will give you a unique view of the skyline as it looms over the trees and beauty of Central Park. Wherever you choose to see it - just soak it in and enjoy it...it's beautiful!
Incredible. One of the most unique views in all of the U.S.! We saw it from Brooklyn when we were at Smorgasborg and also on a harbor cruise. Both provided beautiful landscapes!
Wow!!. Must take a ferry boat cruise for an awsome experience and great opportunities for taking amazing photos that will last a lifetime!

Best view of skyline from Weehawken and JFK Boulevard East.. Charrito's Restaurant 974 JFK Boulevard East, Weehawken, New Jersey. This is a great place for a 4th of July meal or just to sit on the patio and take in the skyline with snacks and drinks. They have a good view from inside as well and you can go to the second floor. It has a cute Mexican décor. Best to come early evening to see all the stages of the sunset and the lights of the city turning on. check out the thatched ceiling and nicely decorated bathrooms.To get here: From New York City take:1. the Midtown/West 39 St. ferry to Port Imperial, Weehawken, New Jersey. $8 It is on all the little maps you find around New York and even has dotted lines for the path the ferry takesor 2. from World Financial Center Ferry to Port Imperial Weehawken, New Jersey $13or3. Pier 11/Wall St. to Port Imperial, Weehawken, New JerseyWhen you exit the front of the Port Imperial Ferry Terminal walk across the street. Go down the street towards the trains. Enter the walkway and go up the stairs that take you over the road to the trains. Do not descend down to the trains but keep going on the walkway. You will come to a high set of metal stairs. These stairs will take you up to the terrace above. You will see Charrito's from the top of the stairs. You will come to JFK Boulevard East with its great decorative wall and viewing areas. This is a very safe area and the best view as there is a large police presence here and the roads are blocked off on July 4th. My teenage daughter and I had a great birthday celebration here with the fireworks in the foreground as we sat and ate our supper. Make sure you get the ferry information for the last ferry back to New York before you leave the terminal. Great activity for a family with boys age 6 -18 years where the romantic parents want to see the skyline but the boys can use up their energy and be delighted by the short ferry ride and some snacks to fill them up.

absolutely a must to see. The trip to statue of liberty provides you with (weather related) with fantastic pictures of the Manhattan skyline.Also the views from the Empire state building is something which should be included in your program

There's no view like it!. I took one of the Happy Hour river cruises to see both the NY and NJ skyline at night. It also provided a beautiful view of the Statue of Liberty in all of her glory. It was great to see the city from a different vantage point. I’ve seen it from the top of the Empire State Building, but seeing it from the river, was magnificent. In addition to seeing the shorelines, the cruise had food and drinks for purchase and there was music to dance the night away! It was a fun experience.

Beautiful at night. We took a 4th of July Cruise from the East River to the Hudson. The skyline was great during the day, but so pretty at night. The new Freedom Tower isn't finished yet, but is already very eye catching.
From Top of The Rock. No queues! Bought tkt mid-late morning & went straight up. Can also book for specific time e.g. Night time if you wish.

The best view of Manhattan and only five stories up. On the roof of the Metropolitan Museum of Art. Five floor up...just above the tree tops of Central Park with nothing between you and a 360 degree view of the skyline of Manhattan. The museum was packed but the Roof Garden was almost emty. Maybe most people don't know about it or don't take the time but it worht half an hour on top of the Met to enjoy the skyline of Manhattan..

I can view it over & over again!. And I do. Living in one of the boroughs, I have to often take the ferry across to Manhattan, this Sunday was a beautiful sun filled day,we took the ferry where outside seating gives you an amazing view, the Harbor to me is always breathtaking, the building that replaces the towers completes the setting, making it a view that brings tears to your eyes. The ferry ride from Staten Island to Manhattan is the best view you'll get... that day many many tourists were on the ferry, snapping pics..and as inspired as I was, to see the NY skyline bounce back from that terrible day...
Gorgeous. On a long summer's night the sun shines brightly down the long Manhattan streets. The views west to east are brilliant.

Memorable, captivating and beautiful. I've been looking at the skyline for 30+ years. Hard to see it these days with the missing Twin Towers but glad to see we're rebuilding. The skyline is amazing at night and try to see it from the boroughs on the morning after an especially stormy day as the gray buildings seem to come to life under the sun & blue skies
Weehawken NJ. The best view of Manhattan Skyline is from Weehawken New Jersy. On a summer fullmoon night its even Dramatic. Spectacular.

See it from Brooklyn. Walking the Brooklyn Bridge is a must! Walk both ways if you're up for it, or else catch the ferry at the base of the bridge. Be advised, there is construction on the pedestrian walkway at this time, but the protective awnings only block a small portion of the view, and give shade on a hot day.
Wow. Everything u expect and more! The new freedom tower looks amazing. The movies don't do it justice!! You need to see it from both a ferry and on top go one of the towers!
Super Cool!. This is fun, free and provides great views of this wonderful city. Very relaxing walk. Loved it very much.

Take the scenic curise .. the best way to see it !. What's not to like? The Best was seeing the St. of Liberty , Ellis Island , WTC , and of course the Empire State. Building . Also if you take this cruise ... look for pier 54 .. I was startled to hear this was the pier that the Carpathia docked with Survivors of the doomed Ship "The Titanic " .

NYC Skyline. I love theNYC Skyline. The view of spires including The Empire State Building, The Chrysler Building and now, The Freedom Tower, is inspiring. So much OF it! From so many angles.. I live in Manhattan but in all my years never 'did the Circle Line' until today, when my mom was in town on a bright summer day. I'd recommend that and will review it (with photos). But, how it relates is that I have a totally recharged appreciation now for the Manhattan Skyline, from so many perspectives. The classic sunset silhouette, with Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, WTC (once) etc. is the view from New Jersey, actually, across the Hudson River (Sunrise is quite nice for views from the East Side of Manhattan or Queens, and from some spots, sunset is awesome too, like from River Cafe (great place for a special occasion), under the Brooklyn Bridge, looking West at Sunset over Manhattan's East Side (and bridges). So circliing Manhattan on the boat today, after days of photographing classic 'skyscrapers' from the ground, and doing some touristy things (like Times Square), I saw the Empire State Building and Chrysler Building glistening in the sun, with the tour guide describing their conception and the rivalry between the two auto magnates for the tallest building. Now Manhattan is like a porcupine in the density of tall buildings. There's a new one (we also passed on the water), Freedom Tower, now completely built, and again there's some interesting history. All of New York has history, and taking it in from a skyline-level view makes sense. It's also beautiful, and an endless feast for artists, photographers, architects, and visitors. There's just too MUCH sklyline to review it as one monolithic attraction, IMHO. The attraction is the island of Manhattan itself, visually. See it from NY, NJ, the air, a tall building rooftop, or by boat. No wonder it is rated #1 attraction in New York. It IS New York. And 'the skyline' is iconic.

Downtown Manhattan - impressive!. The Manhattan skyline is very impressibe, especially when seen from the Ferry going to the Statue of Liberty. It is especially nice to see Freedom Tower 1 in progress.

" Stunning". Amazing skyline views from the Statue Cruise we took also from Central Park and not forgetting the fab views from Empire State Building and the Rockefeller building.

View that can't be beat. There are thousands of vantage points to gaze at the New York City skyline. There are two places which caught my eye. The first being the view from Hoboken. You can easily take the ferry from Battery park. It'll drop you right across the river. This place wasn't too crowded and isn't regularly frequented by tourists. Also, it's a great place to skip rocks! Walk along the shoreline and take the Path train back into the city. Another fairly obvious place to gaze at the skyline is Rockefeller Center. For about $20 you can take an express elevator all the way to the Top of Rockefeller Center. This is a must see and in my opinion, way better than the Empire State Building. It is recommended to either go during sunset or at night.

Seen from both sides. We also walked across the Brooklyn Bridge beginning on the Brooklyn side so we saw Manhattan from the East River Side. There is such a variety of building sizes and styles that it is a treat for the eyes. The views from the bus were short in duration, but my pictures let me revisit the skyline whenever I wish. Views from the Brooklyn Bridge were somewhat interrupted by the bridge support structures, but they were still impressive. Well worth the walk.

Truly Magnificent.. Has to be seen in "real time" to be believed! The splendid mix of design, materials and architecture are quite stunning when you consider how compacted they all are in this world famous district. Towering skyscrapers vying for superiority amongst themselves only to be eclipsed by the new World Trade Center building.Having walked the streets, endlessly, we took a cruise (included with NY Pass) around Manhattan which provided countless "Kodak" scenes. The cruise lasted 3 hours and circumnavigated the island. A commentary is provided that covers history and detail in depth and is highly informative. Refreshments are available on the boat which also has toilet facilities. Additionally, we walked over the Brooklyn Bridge pausing frequently to look back at the skyline and capture more unforgettable pictures. To walk the bridge without pausing takes about 20 minutes. There are vendors on the bridge selling water and knickknacks (should you desire) but be prepared to pay excessive prices from these guys.It's what you have seen in countless movies, now see it for yourself and enjoy the moment.

Beautiful! Take a harbor evening cruise to get a great overview!. Meets at Pier 83. The host of the Circle cruise line has been doing it for 30 year and he'll tell you all about the city!

The reason you came. There are so many things to se and do in NYC, but when you get a chance to see the city from the top of a building, from the water, from a helicopter, or from wherever you see it, it just is one of life great things.
*****. Well done!!! great!!! Good food, fast service, nothing more to add... all was up to standard!!!! Hope we come back again

Best views from a distance. We came by train from the underground to NYC and so we started our 8-day-holiday just in the middle of skyscrapers. But after strolling through streets and beeing so close to the skyscrapers, we also wanted to get some views from a distance and choose the following options:* Walk in Brooklyn (Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn Bridge park, all free of charge)* Walk from Brooklyn via Brooklyn Bridge to Manhattan (free of charge)* Staten Island Ferry (free of charge)* East River Ferries (4 $)* Circle Line (included in our NY city pass)All of these offered a unique and stunning kind of view on the breathtaking Manhattan skyline. Since all the options provide views from different angles, they are all worth being done. While the East River Ferry offered a good view on the midtown skyline with the Empire State Building, the Chrysler Building etc., the Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn Bridge Park, Brooklyn Heights and Staten Island Ferries are good for views on downtown Manhattan. The Circle Line tour then completed the view from the Western side on downtown and midtown.Also the views from above are very fascinating which we had from the top of the Empire State Building and the Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock).

Manhattan Skyline: How And Why It Got So Precisely Where It Is. I've often wondered why the world's primary and most universally recognized skyline looks like it does and how it got where it is in the first place. For those somewhat unfamiliar with New York's skyline, there are actually in a sense two sectors blending together: the classic midtown (think Empire State & Chrysler buildings) and lower Manhattan (think-sadly-Twin Towers and resolutely Freedom Tower Trade Center). With those questions in mind , I did a bit of research and got some interesting information which hopefully others find worth knowing as well. Certainly there are thousands who were sooner and much more scientifically informed about all this than I, but for the rest of us, here goes .The fact is there were and are virtually no other potentially strong enough candidates beyond precisely where they're situated. The issue is rare behemoth density of an exacting type of bedrock. Not many places have the natural structural mineral underpinnings necessary to function as the subterranean foundation absolutely necessary to shoulder a small army of skyscrapers above.The next time you look at the New York skyline remind yourself that everything is absolutely where it belongs. Somehow that's even a bit more reassuring about the strength of this great city's signature skyline as a lasting symbol, in the face of whatever challenges, of both our collective local and national resolve .

Saw it from a ship.... Breathtaking....so glad I got a chance to see it and have it be the background of a great picture I took. ;-) The ship was leaving and I almost missed it...and the Statue of Liberty!

This is New York. I never realised what an enormous city New York is, it is huge, what a view, an absolute must, there was nothing I disliked, what's to dislike, great photography opportunity.

Fabulous, simply fabulous. It was my first visit to New York, and I thought it was awesome! We saw the skyline from the Empire State Bldg observation deck (magnificent!), Top of the Rock at night (outstandinig), and the NY Water Taxi. What a treat!
Beautiful. What a great thing they did to beautify the old railroad. Really enjoyed the view and walk. Easy to get to.

Fantastic. Beautiful views from a number of locations but best I think from Staten Island ferry terminal on Staten Island. We went across at sunset and watched the lights come on as it went dark then went back across in the dark. When you get to Staten Island terminal turn right and walk all the way along to glass doors and to the outside where the views back to Manhatten are nothing short of spectacular

An iconic skyline!. There nothing better than seeing the Manhattan skyline when you are transferring from the airport, with The Empire State Building & the new trade tower towering, literally, from the other skyscrapers.

Empire State Building and Top of the Rock at night.. The views don't get any better than this! The Top of the Rock is not as crowded, they have controlled times for the elevators going up. The views great from both places.
ok-looking. Personally like the one in Hong Kong more. I took a cruise and the Manhattan's Skyline looks too crowded and not organized.

Great views. Worth doing if you are in NYC. Taller than the Empire State Building and good to get a view of Central Park and the Empire State from that height. Probably overpriced and had to queue for about 45 mins but worth doing if you are on a city break to NYC
Great view!. Viewed from on board the ferry to Liberty Island. The view during the one hour ferry ride was just awesome!
The best city views every!. NYC is the most amazing city and there is nothing like the Manhattan Skyline - check it out from Brooklyn, Dumbo.
Breathtaking.. Beautiful during the day and even more amazing during the night. For an amazing view, head down to Brooklyn Heights Promenade, not many tourists and gorgeous landscape shots.

Wow, incredible view from Staten Island Ferry. Water views of skyline are impressive. Seen it on TV my entire life and reality does not disappoint. The view from Brooklyn bridge is pretty incredible as well.

Amazing skyline. Nothing can typify New York more than its skyline. Must be one of the worlds most recognisable views. We found our best views were from the Top of the Rock for a Midtown view, aboard the Staten Island ferry for a great view of lower Manhattan and walking across Brooklyn Bridge also gave a classic third view. A photographers paradise!!
City view. Had fun taking photos with the Manhattan Skyline in the background to commemorate our vacation trip.

Just Look Up!. Whether it's your first time, or you've been many times before, take a moment, get out of the way of the mass of humanity, and look up. You'll see impressively tall buildings, an amazing variety of architectural styles, and some magnificent facades and sculptures. Make sure to go to different areas of town, as each one is different.

Famous skyline -- best from Top of the Rock. I visited Top of the Rock observatory while in town and was told, by a local who was also there, that they had never done it before -- but had done Empire State Building, but said it was better at Top of the Rock ... The skyline can be seen from various locations and observatories as well as, from ground level, from cruises and tour boats -- very beautiful, especially at dusk when the lights start to turn on.
Skyline, skyride. The time spent watching preview's before actually getting on the ride was time wasted. The actual ride was fun and entertaining.

Nice Place to Stroll. The Skyline is a great place to stroll during a warm summer day. There are grassy spots to have a picnic on or just relax and there is even a water floor for the kids to play on.
The best.. I love everything about it... the contrast... the most original... most impressive. What's not to love?
Top of the Rock. Love family pic on the beam at entrance.App did not locate landmarks south side of building.Elevators among 67-70 floors are nice.

40th Annisverary New York Trip. We really liked everything about New York, especially Central Park absolutely fabulous. Open top bus tours were a must great way of seeing NYC. Use the Staten Island Ferry to get really good pictures of the Statue of Liberty, the ferry is FREE
Fabulous!. The skyline was breathtaking! The sky scrapers are amazing. New York is what I was hoping for and more!!

nice walk, nice jazz, great idea. I don't know whose idea was this but really smart. a nice walk in the middle of interesting buildings. street musicians -good ones- are playing and at the end they sell food. to chill out.

A 'must see'. Worth seeing both from the Empire & the Rockefeller Top of the Rock. The Rockefeller blocks the view of Central Park from the Empire. It's nice to appreciate the Empire from the Rockefeller Centre though can't say the same other way around. Before I saw it, I originally didn't think it was worth it to line up a 2nd time to get the night view at the Empire but was glad we did! I recommend going in the late afternoon, getting dinner nearby and then going for the night viewing after 10pm.

We love Manhattan!. We took the NY Water Taxi from midtown down to Battery Park, to Brooklyn then out to view the Statue of Liberty. The view of Manhattan from the water was a classic. It's better than you think it will be just from views on TV. Seeing the new World Trade building going up added to the experience. NYC truly is one of the most exciting places we have ever been!
well worth ther effort. I saw the sky line from Empire state at night and top of the rock in day both were amazing.so worth the time spent in a queue
Legendary. Outstanding and beautiful.Best place to see it is from over the water on Staten Island or over in Jersey. I also liked the view from central park

Something to be admired. When you are here you know you are in one of the worlds most unique places. Tall buildings and so many things to do that make up this skyline that seems endless as you walk along it. Truly a sight to see.

I love New York.... The Manhattan skyline always gets me excited to enjoy life and interaction with people. The Freedom tower is absolutely beautiful; can't wait until it's finished. My fiance and I stayed at Crown Plaza which is of course, in the heart of Time Square. It is a great place to stay and be amidst all of the action of midtiown. If you have not visited Manhattan, add it to your plans... soon!

View it from the Brooklyn side at sunset!. Beautiful panorama from Prospect Park (I think) in Brooklyn. You can view sailboats, the Statue of Liberty, the Brooklyn Bridge and South Seaport all at once.

Great views to be had. Did Top of the Rock and the Empire State Rock during the day and Empire at night and that is probably the best way of doing it. It feels crazy to look down on things like Central Park from such a height. We got our passes to do both of these included in our 72 hour bus pass which cost us $120 and we got another pass to do something else as well.

Buildings, buildings and architectural works of art. The new York sky line is very impressive, there are old and new buildings and old jewels like the Chrysler tower. Manhattan is a busy place and consequently you see many buildings in construction. Definitively, take a camera. A photo is a must . It takes a short ride in the metro to get outside the Island of Manhattan. To make the things more interesting, you can take a ride back to the Island by ferry which cost more or less four dollars.We went to see it in a magnificent spring day.

Gets me everytime!!!. I make my way into the city at least once a week if not more and there is no feeling more exciting to me than that 1st glimpse of the NYC skyline. Tall buildings, dreams, and lights ... busy people a million different things to try and do!! It truly is a land of possibilities!!
What can you say about Manhattan!. The skyline is brilliant and the buildings wonderful don't miss. The area is so well laid out and street picture is a picture in itself.

"Amazing". Don't think theres anything like it! Make sure you do an evening harbour cruise, the skyline is amazing from the river. Even walking around in the city, you cant help but look up and be amazed!
Manhattan, the dream place to be in.. Once you have seen this, on other city or skyline will mesmerise you ever. Every thing, shopping , eating , time square , were great. Too crowded at times,
Beautiful!. Well worth a walk over the Brooklyn Bridge to have a pizza and an ice cream to! Saw it right before the sun went down while it was very hot.

Beautiful. New York City is unlike any other city in America. The buildings, the energy, the skyline, the great melting pot of cultures make it a great place to visit and take some classic photos. I loved it!
Fabulous. Great view of the skyline from different parts of NYC- New York at its best. New York is the city that never sleeps
Breath Taking..Nothing like it anywhere ... Nothing like it in the world.Check it out @ night while driving over 59/Queens Bridge or BQExpressway- Gotta Love It.

Unsurpassed Views. There is nowhere better to see the incredible skyline of New York! We all thoroughly enjoyed seeing so many of the wonderful sights, the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, Brooklyn Bridge, skyscrapers - fantastic! Wouldn't have missed it!
The best wiew I think is fdeom New Jeresy. on route 3 eeast just off the parkway a couple of miles unlees you are landing from the north into Newark airport on a clear day

From the FREE staton island ferry. Worth getting to the ferry terminal before mid day for a less crowded wait for the ferry. But it's free so well worth it for good photo opportunities of lady liberty and the manhattan skyline. There are two types of ferries though. One does not allow you to stand outside so if you don't want photo's through glass then avoid that one. I went in May so was glad to be inside and still got the best shots of manhattan from the ferry port. There is a cafe and good viewing platform at the port whilst you wait for the return ferry.
Slyline views from the Hudson. Take one of the cruises, you will have a different view of how beautiful the city really is..... a must.
Always great. Nice to see the new Freedom Tower nearing completion although it only reminds one of the terrible loss on 9/11
Impressive.. Always impressive. One never tires of seeing it. We had excellent weather, so the views in every direction were breathtaking.

As great as skylines come!. To me this is the view of New York that you need, not from the Rock or from the Empire state building. A great view of the Skyline beats all of that and is completely free.

Best seen from above. Really best to see this from the Empire State or Top of the Rock, or better still from a helicopter, we did all three and there isn't much to choose they all give you a good view. You don't appreciate the variety of buildings and the amount of green parks there are in New York until you get up high. Central Park is huge. Also if you go over the Brooklyn bridge the Manhattan skyline is best viewed on the way from Brooklyn to Manhattan rather than the other way round.

Clear sky a must. Best seen from the Hudson or East Rivers by boat, plenty of choices. Some can be seen from the free Staten Island Ferry or from the open topped Hop On Hop Off buses. Need a fine day with clear sky, mist and rain can spoil the views
Cool walk. It`s a great place to take a walk and enjoy the city. You can walk to the chealsea market and grab a great lunch at this beatiful market.

Great on a clear day. You can't help but be impressed by the Manhatten skylines are they are impressive - however not so much on a foggy or a rainy day.When the sun is shining you can't beat the views. For the best skyline I would suggest a ferry trip to the Statue of Liberty or to go over Manhattan or Brooklyn Bridge. Cameras at the ready!!
Awesome. Beautiful from Empire State Building during the day and breathtaking from Rockefeller Centre at night
beautiful. got to go up empire state building and top of the rock. amazing views. take a camera to capture all the skyline.
What a view. Great skyline so iconic. Best way to see it is on a boat ride especially at night time. You won't forget it.
The Night Tour. Has to be seen to be appreciated. Not to be missed so be sure to include it in any package tour being booked.

Good to see a new WTC. It is a beautiful building and the start of the rebuilding of the area. We visited ground zero the summer after 9/11 and it is good to realize that one part of the response to terror is to be an overcomer in every way possible.

Take the sunset cruise. This is a two hour cruise where you get to see both sides of Manhatten, travel under the Brooklyn bridge and get up close and personal with the Beautiful Statue of Liberty. We saw it all in the day time on the way down and the city lit up on the way back, it was really special.

View the skyline from a Tall Ship!. We sailed on the Clipper City Tall Ship from Pier 17 at the South Street Seaport and thoroughly enjoyed the lovely quiet sail out to the Statue of Liberty and back, with the spectacular views of Battery Park, the downtown skyline, Ellis Island and Liberty herself. This is a nice option if you've already been on a Circle Line tour. The Captain was friendly and funny. The hardworking crew managed the sails and were happy to have anyone assist. They were kind to a young 10 year old sailor who wanted to help with everything. Great two hours out in the harbor.
Incredible View. This is the best location to get pictures of the iconic skyline. Must visit to get perspective of the city as it is not as noticeable when you are in the middle of it.
Tour Bus sights. Via bus tour we saw many changes in the skyline. Tour guides pointed out the various buildings and provided some history as well as amusing stories..

Review of a skyline.... I can't believe there is a "spot" on Tripadvisor to "rate" the Manhattan Skyline.Anyhow, it is simply awesome. If you ever make it to New York, this is a "must see". you can go over to LIC and get an awesome view of it as well.Every time something new.
Great.. The classic wonderful view both day and night. Take a cruise around the island of Manhatten to see it at its best. Brilliant.

From Brooklyn. An amazing view, we took the subway to Clark Street and walked down to enjoy the sunset. As the sun is setting behind the buildings they all appear in silhouette. If we had more time, we would have worked out how to get to Hoboken across the Hudson River, to watch the sunset from that side, as the sun would be hitting the buildings, lighting them up and making them look all golden from that side.

Mesmerizing!. Whether walking on Brooklyn bridge on a velvety sunset, or late at night , climbing up the top of the Rock on a bright sunny day or taking the Staten Island ferry at dawn back to Manhattan, the skyline is absolutely mesmerizing. Walk on the High Line (a garden created on an repurposed train line as a linear park) if you want to feel part of the west side skyline... but still close to vibrant street-life below.New York never ceases to thrill and amaze us 24 hours a day!

All I'd Hoped it would Be. Saw the famous Manhattan skyline from the Circle Line boat trip. It was truly amazing and everything that you see on TV etc. This was my first trip to New York and I loved every minute.
is anything more stunning. Heart jumping views. never tire of them. the most gorgeous and meaningful skyline anywhere. For me "home"/

How original!. How fantastic is that instead of destroying something it was transformed into an area where family and friends can enjoy a fantastic and beautiful walk around an area which used to be industrial and unloved. Please take the time to travel there and walk around this skyline route. The diversity of people there alone will keep you entertained.

Never get tired of the view. There are so many great spots to view the Manhattan sklyine, but within the city, from across the East River and from the water. My favorite view is from the Brooklyn side of the Brooklyn Bridge. From within the city, I'd recommend the Top of the Rock because you can get the Empire State Building in your picture. Also the Circle Line cruise and the Staten Island ferry (free) offer views from the water.
AMAZING. I could have looked at the skyline forever! I absolutely loved it and every time I looked I noticed something different! AMAZING!
Wonderful view. A very typical view of new york! I caught a free ferry in finantial district, the trip passes near the statue of Liberty and in the round, the Skyline was the big attraction!

Saw it from Top of the Rock. It was amazing! This is def something you want to see once in your lifetime!I would recommend going to Top of the Rock VS Empire State Building. Two big differences- Top of the Rock actually allows you to go outside on two different floors so you can get shots with no wall. Secondly, You can get a beautiful shot of the Empire State Building from here as well.. You can even get the new Freedom Center.. and a GORGEOUS shot of Central Park

New WTB memorial opens. Pics of battery Park. Diane and I went on the Free Staten Island Ferry Saturday May 11,2013. GREAT view os the skyine from the Ferry. Good photo op for the Statue of Liberty. We then walked thru battery park, past Customs House. Just blocks away was the WTB new memorial. Saturday it was opejn, and the line moved rapidly. Good short walk affords alot of sights in Manhattan.

Spectacular at many angles. Being a New Yorker, I do have a few favorite places to view the Manhattan Skyline. One is from the City Island Bridge in the Bronx, about 15 minutes outside of the city. Another great location is the walk from Brooklyn to NYC on the Williamsburg Bridge. Finally, if you are driving from Long Island or Queens (or from one of the major airports), both the Whitestone and the Throgs Neck Bridge offer spectacular views day and night!

Nothing like this in the whole world!!. See it from Queens, across the Brooklyn Bridge.... Look south from uptown and north from downtown. The lights. The architecture. The scale. The promise of the city.

Most gorgeous skyline in the world!. There is no other skyline as beautiful as NYC. Okay, maybe I'm biased as this is my favorite city, but honestly, where else can you see so many famous landmarks? The view from Brooklyn Bridge (my personal favorite) is spectacular. Go to the Top of the Rock for an incredible view of Midtown's world famous skyscrapers, including Citicorp Tower and the Empire State Building. Truly stunning from any vantage point.

View Manhhattan from across the river. My favourite view of the whole trip my favourite 'attraction' you must view Manhattan from across the river it is amazing. Go on the 'free' Statten Island Ferry or on a bus

Stunning Skyline. You can't miss it, obviously if you're in NYC. It's simply captivating. I have had many opportunities to photograph the skyline. The Manhattan Skyline is different from so many angles. I have traveled to NYC and photographed the skyline from the Top of the Rock, the Empire State Building, many hotels and rooftops. The best views and photos I have taken are from Central Park, and the water. Take a trip to Ellis Island and see this view of the Manhattan skyline, either during the day or at night, it is stunning.
Walk towards Manhatten over Brooklyn Bridge. Walked from Brooklyn over the bridge. Very popular with visitors, but still a must :-) Amazing view of the skyline.
A must see!. A skyline like no other, a must see! Whether you view it during the day or at night it will blow you away, truly amazing.

The best skyline in da world. Simply the best. I have travelled to many cities in the world, and this is the best skyline in the world. Though I have seen it more than a thousand times, it still takes my breath away. Especially when I see it while driving from out of town on a clear, sunny winter morning. I also enjoy figuring out which buildings are which on a misty morning. It is one of the reasons I will always love NYC.
Exciting. While Manhattan's skyline is wonderful, I've felt sadness seeing it since 2001. I'm looking forward to seeing the change in the skyline since the new Freedom tower has gone up.
Amazing as always. Do we really need a review here? The skyline is beautiful and amazing as usual. Not sure what else to say...
different to any other. Familier -but always a surprise when seen from different vantage points. Like most tourists I suffered from "stiff neck syndrome
Best thing to see in NY.. This has to be one of the best attractions in new york.. Amazing.. take pictures if you can. I prefer the night view.. The Daytime is equally amazing.

Love the Manhattan Skyline!. From the Staten Island Ferry at sunset, the Manhattan Skyline is so beautiful! We also saw it from the water taxi on a cloudy day with some sun rays shining through. It's a DON'T MISS if you're in the area, filled with splendor and an amazing history!

Euphoric Indeed!. The beauty of New York is never ending. Now that the new Freedom Tower is taking shape and looking at a 2015 finish, it is amazing, stunning, and exciting knowing that this marvel will be a beacon of FREEDOM.
