It also sends a powerful message that those who wish us harm will not succeed,
Staten island ferry. For those who want to experience the impressive NYC skyline take the staten ferry . Its free and it has an amazing view of the skyline and statue of liberty!
To be done on a clear day or at night. When I went it was a sunny day giving the skyline a brilliant back drop for picture taking, and the same can be said for the night photos that i got as well.

What a sight, what a view!!!. Turly one of the worlds leading skylines when it comes to giving a city the face it deserves. The skyline of New York city is not just the most famous skyline we can think of but also shows beauty in time and age of architecture and design.Look at the skyline from the Staten Island ferry or walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to see how great it can be. It tops the list of Skylines, closely followed by Shanghai, Hong Kong or Chicago... Jaw dropping gorgeous!!!

I see it every day from my window. This is something you truly never tire of. Even post 9/11 it is spectacular and the new Freedom tower sparkles at night beautifully. go up any tall building to see it and you won't be sorry.
super!. Take the staten island ferry to get a great view of the skyline without spending any money. Also good views from Brooklyn heights on the other side of the bridge.

City that never stops. We saw the view from The Empire State Building, Top of The Rock and through many hours of walking and bus tours and what a City, it just never ends. When you are above the City you see the spread of the City with buildings as far as you can see from Battery Park to Harlem and from the East Side to the West it is incredible. New buildings alongside old buildings, small Brownstones among Skyscrapers what a variety of changes in one City. Breathtaking.

Skyline. You can get great skyline views uptown and downtown from the upper floors of the Federal Court house in Manhattan. Great skyline views can also be seen from the upper floors of both the Federal and State Court houses in Brooklyn. Admission is free and you ca also pop in on a trial
wow. we went up the rockerfella centre in the late afternoon and stayed there for sunset over manhatten, doing it this way you get great views of empire state and do both day/evening for one price

Highline- a great way to see the skyline. The highline provides a beautiful escape from the chaos and noise of the city below. We started at the southern most start point and meandered along the Highline taking in the views and absorbing the atmosphere. There are some great stalls along the way (both food and crafts) as well as some interesting peices of art. It's also a great way to spot some of Manhattan's more unusual grafitti. A great way to spend a couple of hours without spending too much money.

Where dreams are made. Getting to see the famous Manhattan skyline in "real life" is one of my favourite experiences of my life so far. I enjoyed the view from Liberty/Ellis Islands and also from Brooklyn Heights. I walked across the Brooklyn Bridge at night to see Manhattan lit up. Wonderful :)I hope to see the skyline again someday soon. Its something thats stayed with me ever since I saw it for the first time.
Is there anywhers else quite like this?. For us, the most exciting skyline on the planet, worth making the effort and spending the money to get up the high vantage points and taking the boat trips.
Awesome. Now I work in Jersey City so this is my constant view. The best part is watching the Freedom tower grow everyday and nearing completion. It is absolutely beautiful.

Best view is from the Ferry. Take the East River Ferry from Midtown to Manhattan - goes under Williamsberg, Manhattan & Brooklyn Bridges and into Terminal near Wall street.Photographers dream and fresh and healthy!

Wanted to live in Manhattan since I was ten!. Manhattan's skyline is one of the wonders of the modern world. And with all the new construction (and permits to build tall buildings in East Midtown) it is only going to get better. I like it from just about every angle. Visitors - don't discount the spectacular views you will get from places like Jersey City and Hoboken. Even though the skyline changes, it's always got a hint of magic for me.

A great view. saw this view coming in from the south (New Jersey) and, I can honestly say, having worked in London for 7 years, it is the best skyline in the world! The new Freedom Tower looks huge and its obviously a very special place in many New Yorkers heart

Unique, stunning,exciting,beautiful, THIS IS NYC. Again and again this sky line makes me wanting to go into this great, controversial city. I usually come from Secaucus and see different angles of the sky like.

One of my favourite parts of the city!. Love love love this view!! I never get bored of looking at it, it's one of my favourite parts of the city. There's a couple of ways to see it, probably the best, although expensive is to take a helicopter flight over the island, absolutely breathtaking views! You could also take the Staten Island Ferry, which is free. We took this trip about 30 minutes before sunset so we saw the skyline in the daylight and then as it was going dark on our way back. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge and go down to Brooklyn Bridge Park, go on a Circle Line river cruise or a bus tour. All great ways to see this incredible city!

No Comparison, this is New York.. To get the best view you need to be on the top of one of the larger buildings in Manhattan (WTC, Empire, Top of the Rock...) or be in an outer Borough. I suggest taking the Ferry to Staten Island (free) or Path to NJ for a great view. You can also walk across the Brooklyn Bridge which in its own right is an amazing NYC treat to do. This is a great thing to see (Manhattan Skyline) day or night, sunrise or sunset. Just appreciate the wonder of such a great city made up of people from all reaches of the globe. I really hope this helps you.

Rockefeller Magic. Viewed the Manhattan skyline at 11pm last July (summer) and it was breathtaking. We were advised by locals that it had a better view than the Empire State Building. We didn't do the Empire State because the view from the Rockefeller Center was amazing! We could see the Empire State building, we could see the Met LIfe building, the Brooklyn Bridge - just magic!

See the skyline from the view at Marriot Marques. Loved it all. So beautiful. The buildings the night life. Theatre and Museums. I walk more in NYC than any area I ever visit. See the high line now also. It is another beautiful walk thru and old refurbished above ground subway.
So Impressive. Got to see the skyline as the Queen Elizabeth sailed out of the harbor just before the sun went down. Of course saw the Brooklyn bridge and the Statue of Liberty as well.

Empire State at night will take your breath away !. We were give some very good advice. The Empire State at night and the Top of the Rock during the day. We were not disappointed. The Manhattan Skyline view during the night was one of the most beautiful city backdrops I have seen. It was a wonderful experience. By doing the Top of the Rock during the day you can clearly see the Empire State building.
The skyline is impressive. So beautiful. Warning, can put a kink in your neck from looking up at all the high buildings. So much to see

Breathtaking every time. No matter how many times i visit, I am always excited for the first viewing of the NY skyline. Love it. I love to view it from Top of the Rock and will hopefully get to view from Brooklyn Heights on one of my trips to the city this year.
New York New York. Absolutely breathtaking from the Statten Isaland ferry. The ferry is free and we had a perfect view with plenty of photo opportunities. Highly recommended.
Brilliant. The planting, the colours of spring, the installations, everything was wonderful about this great amenity for New York City.

Love the skyline. Beautiful skyline, especially at night. Lots of traffic noise, sirens, pedestrians but that is what makes NYC, NYC. A little scary to walk around Times Square these days, but the huge crowds help with a decent sense of security.

Brooklyn View. We took the subway to Brooklyn, very safe and the fastest way to get around in New York. You get off at the first station and walk down towards the water, the views are amazing. You also get amazing views of Booklyn Bridge.

must see. My wife and I get to New York City 2 or 3 times a year and I love going to the Empire state building and the top of the rock at rockafeller center just to see the awsome view! I cant wait till freedom tower opens!

The imperative to move to new york. Views New York see (other way to see New York)
A bit long! 3 hours, select a beautiful day, take place on the open deck.To get the best seats to do the tail!

What one thinks of when the word skyline is mentioned. The skyline of Manhattan is like no other, especially for height and density of the buildings at the southern end. For a great view, take a trip on the Staten Island Ferry, or the Governor's Island Ferry.
Stunning. Best viewed from Brooklyn Heights Park - less crowds and the higher elevation gives better photo opportunities.
Skyline. For the first time visitor the skyline is something else. The view from The Empire state building is a must.
Top of the rock v Empire State. Defo go to Rockefeller building, view are amazing, especially during the day. Empire State during night is good but a bit expensive
Fun for a sunny afternoon. Had a fun walk with our teen boys, something different. A little crowded but still interesting enough to do again..

Manhattan Skyline is unique!. One of a kind, & still growing! New additions all the time. Building boom is still going on & we have so many new sites to see. Never tired of looking at the nyc skyline!!!!! New Hotels, new office Buildings/Restaurants & new construction of Residential Buildings! New york never sleeps!

Most spectacular on earth. Even with the twin towers gone, NYC has the most amazing skyline you can see anywhere. Not only the buildings but add to that the bridges, lights, waterways and you see why it is the city that never sleeps
Stunning views at night. NY comes to life at night - sightseeing is no exception. Go up the Rockefeller building or Empire State at night for movie style vista.

plusieurs angles de vue. 1) surtout ne montez pas au Top of the Rocks : c'est une arnaque ($27 par personne) mais allez plutot dans un bar ou un resto panoramique pour le même prix (Rooftop at Jimmy's 15 Thompson St, Manhattan)2) prenez le ferry pour staten island, gratuit toutes les 25 mn environ3) belle vue du quartier de Dumbo , Brooklyn, et ne manquez pas le Dumbo Food market aux beaux jours (+ manège pour les enfants)4) prenez un chicken bus (2,5$ l'aller) fonctionnant jour et nuit et allez jusqu'à bergen 77Th street, vous verrez tout le côté Ouest de Manhattan pendant 30 mn!Le chicken bus se prend: on 42nd St, between 8th Avenue and 9th Avenue, on the NORTH SIDE OF 42nd St there is a BURGER KING restaurant. Directly in front of that BURGER KING is where the bus picks up. You are taking what we call a “chicken bus” so don’t expect a huge city bus. The chicken buses can be quite large, or medium size. The bus will say NEW YORK/BLVD EAST or just NEW YORK. If you want to make sure that you have the correct bus, confirm with the driver that the bus travels along BOULEVARD EAST.

It's not Chicago's but it is nice. I love city skylines and Manhattan's is right up there with the best, internationally. It is full of diverse high rises with unique lights. The Chrysler and Empire State Buildings are definitely assets.
Skyline is so amazing. Check it out from the Brooklyn bridge!! The city is amazing. Stay away from the tourist traps and just walk around on your own. You will find more great stuff

Always changing always great. No other place in North America has the wide variey of truly interesting buildings that reach for the sky. All over the city you get a different view - although the best is from a boat/ferry.
Great view from top of the Rock.. Go to the top of the Rock at night. You not only see all the lights of the Manhattan Skyline but you missed the crowds/

Can't beat it. It really is a fantastic sight to behold and even living in the city I am regularly awed by it when I catch a good look at it. Probably the best place to view it is from the top of Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock). This puts you smack in the middle of the city with 360 views of everything, it is quite stunning. Also Top of the Rock has short lines and not wait, unlike the Empire State Bldg which is the exact opposite. The WTC is going to be opening it's observation deck soon as well so that will probably be a good option as well. A trip to Brooklyn is also a great option too, you can walk along the water and get a great view of Manhattan from there

Self-guided walking tour. Have a nice walk through historic financial district. Download the audio and pdf map from this link:http://nyharborparks.org/visit/tour-new-york-freedom-trail-self-guided.htmlDownload it to your phone, plug in your earphones and start walking! Do it at your own pace.Excellent free experience and perfect way to learn about New York's revolutionary war.
Beautiful. I live in LIC so the view is always to die for every morning. Grab a picnic and try to name the buildings you are looking at!! There is an app but don't cheat...

Awesome. No matter where you see this from it is always spectacular. The free Staten Island ferry gives a great view from the water, the hop on/hop off Night Tour bus gives a great view from Brooklyn and the view from the Empire State is just breath-taking.

Its' NYC. How could you NOT love the NYC skyline.... what is not to love, except it's missing it's beautiful twin towers. Not to worry cause the Freedom Tower is a work in progress getting nearer to being the focal point to the NEW skyline!
top of the rock. great veiw from here, the elavator ride is very quick....so quick your ears slightly pop on the way up. Also has a glass top so you can look up and see the elavator going up!

sunset from rockefeller center. Great view from the top of the Rockefeller Center, unfortunately pretty expensive.
Take a sightseeing bus with the grey line
Love to look at Freedom Tower. Took a cruise to Statue of Liberty, what a great trip pictures of Manhatten skyline of pictures of Lady Liberty.
first impressions. New York is unique-sky scrapers from 1913 woolworth building to empire state chrysler Rockerfeller & finally the world trade centre- still not finished but getting there

Simply Breathtaking. This is probably the most iconic and amazing skyline in the world. As a first time visiter to NY I was excited to be going but the architecture and scale of the city live up to the hype.
Fantastic to look at. Go on the Water Taxi which has 3- stops great to see the area, it was wonderful to be up close to Statue of Liberty and to see Ground Zero being re built

Breathtaking sights. One of the best cityscapes in the world. Staggering in its urban beauty by day or night.
Take a cruise, visit the Top of the Rock or Empire State Building, visit a roof top bar/cafe, cross to Brooklyn or take a cruise and helicopter ride.

Excellent pictures to take from the circle line tour. Try the circle line tour to take pictures of the skyline and the statue of liberty. Unfortunately, the skyline is missing the twin towers which is sad

Go up the Empire State after sunset!. The lights of Manhattan are amazing. We went up at 22:00 and loved it. No need to pay the $17 to go to the 102 floor. You see a little more but not enough to make it worth while. 102 floor is all enclosed so you can't feel the wind in you face. The 86 floor is where it is open. So good.

manhattan. getting a taxi from jfk to manhattan is a magical experience in its self you dont get that bubbling excitement until you see that famous skyline just amazing its the moment you fall in love with nyc

Great views of Manhattan from Staten Island Ferry. I found the best views of Manhattan were from the free Staten Island Ferry, also get a good very of the Statue of Liberty, the journey is 15 mins there and 15 mins back, Ferry's leave every half hour.

This is what makes Manhattan Manhattan. I had to do the cruise twice because i was not satisfied doing it just once. Those skyscrapers makes you wonder what humanity has been able to achieve. It also makes you wonder why New York City, Manhattan in particular, is one of the best cities in the world! It is not just about the buildings, it is a tribute to humanity!

Top of the World!. Believe it or not, the Long island expressway gives you one of the best views of the Manhattan skyline. The top of the last bridge just before the midtown tunnel, Is over the Newtown creek. It's just west of the Van Dam street exit. When you see it you will want to yell, as most kids did, "Top of the World"! I did it when I was little and my kids all did it as well. Actually, we still do!
Always impressive. This is always a great site. We took the Staten Island ferry and it was a perfect way to have a look at this unique skyline from a distance. And the ferry is free!

Take too much for granted.... Live here 180 or so days a year while traveling other parts of the world. Oh, take so much for granted! This is a sight to behold...especially flying in on a clear night after being away for a spell. Worth every penny to visit. And if you are smart you can do it reasonably. There's lots to do, see and eat here without risking bankruptcy. Someone has said, "New York is the greatest collection of villages in the world!" Check out Times Square Church (51st and Broadway). It's in a grand Broadway Theater...no charge at services, great choir and an uplifting time for all. Congregants speak over 50 languages and their are headsets available for several languages.
Legal. Um dos pontos altos do local, altamente recomendado.one of the highest attractions at New York. You should visit it.

Manhattan View. A great way to see the Manhattan Skyline is to ride the Staten Island Ferry. Both ways give a fantastic view of all of the buildings, plus you sail right past The Statue of Liberty. Since the ferry is free to all, it is the cheapest way to see the Manhattan buildings and The Statue of Liberty. Why pay $40-50 per person for the Circle Line Boat Tours when you can pretty much see the same things for free on the ferry?
A must see by boat. We took a bus tour that also includes a boat tour of the Manhattan skyline and Statue of Liberty. I would recommend it because it's a view you just can't see from the city itself.

outstanding. loved the lights. the city has a buzz like no other city. its awake and the lights are on till late late. the bridges are nice and, from far, the traffic with the lights on at night actually look nice and add character.

Something I will NEVER Get Tired Of. This is one of the most impeccable scenes I have ever seen. Every time I travel down to the city, I look forward to the site of the amazing architecture of the hundreds of skyscrapers. Day or night, there is no place that looks quite like the Manhattan Skyline!
Wow. A sight you must see in person at least once,pictures do not do it justice.Many ways to get around the city to view all the different parts of it.

NickandDebbie. Catch it before, during and after sunset from either the Empire State Building (great for view of the Chrysler Building) or the Rockafeller (better pre-viewing experience and great for view of the Empire State Building)

Beautiful skyline. We saw the skyline whilste taking the Statan Island Ferry (which is free by the way) to see the Statue of Liberty and was more impressed with skyline than with anything else we saw. It unmistakable and unbeatable.
Newyork skyline. Hold on to your hat as when you walk around the city you are always looking up! Fantastic. Get up the Rockefeller centre and have a good look around.
Must see. This skyline is a NO-MISS in NY City. It reminds you that you are in one of the most vibrant cities in the world.

Look at the skyline during a boat trip.. We bought a ticket hop on hop off from City Sights and saw the skyline during a night tour with a bus and during a boat trip around Manhattan. The best way is the boat.

Unparalleled Skyline. From all vantage points, there's nothing like it! Whether you're on the Palisades Parkway, on the George Washington Bridge, standing in Central Park, decending into Newark's airport or simply walking around NYC, it's magical! Last month, we stayed at One UN hotel(44th & 1st) on the 36th floor and our view from the room was that of the Empire State and the Chrysler buildings. Talk about a spectacular site!

NY NY what a wonderful town. We visited New York for a week and took in all the best known sites but a trip on the Statan Island ferry is one of the best (and free) experiences with wonderfull views of lower Manhattan and Statue of Liberty. This is a must for anyone visiting the city.

Hop on and Hop off. We used the hop on and hop off bus to see the Manhattan Skyline. Overall the double decker buses were great but the night tour we took it rained and the pleixiglass on the top leaked so bad we went down below and did not see as much.
Amazing experience.. Seeing the Manhattan skyline is an amazing experience that everyone should have. It really is as awesome as people say it is.
Clear Day Must Do. Along Jersey City or Hobokan shore; forget about Brooklyn side also. Try walk across Brooklyn Bridge and enjoy the view.

Brooklyn Heights. Caught subway to the promenade at Brooklyn Heights, sat right by the waterside with Manhattan lighting up right in front of us. So peaceful, clean and so quiet. The surrounding area was immaculate, a very surreal evening, having only seen this on the television before. Never to be forgotten
Skyline at noon, beautiful view from the boat. We got the Citysights 90mins midtown cruise, the views of the Manhattan skyline and Statue of Liberty are breathtaking.

Astonishing !!. My personal top 4 (not necessary in this order)
1) From 68th floor of empire state
2) From Columbus Circle at Central park
3) From the Ferry to Staten Island
4) From the green Line

A-mazzzinggg!!!!!. I have the most amazing pictures and memories from NYC - you just have to visit New York and you will be the same.
Cannot describe what an inspring and interesting place this is! Will be visiting again as soon as I can!

What's to say except WOW. This city is one of a kind and just gorgeous. The view from the observation deck of the Empire State Building were awe inspiring. Beautiful city, beautiful skyline, beautiful people.

Partial views are free. You can view from Staten Island ferry or walking across Brooklyn bridge for free. Views from Empire State Bldg; Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center) and Grayline bus Night Tour are great but will cost you some money.
Exceptional views. Saw the skyline at night = brilliant from Top of the Rock and during the day from the Empire State Building, which far exceeded our expectations.

The One and Only. Always breathtaking, never get tired of the beautiful skyline . Of course it will never be the same after 9/11. The skyline is a tribute to New York's power and uniqueness, there is no other city like it.
unique. Manhattan is a paradise for lovers of architecture and crossing the river to Brooklyn to get a good view is a must when in NY.

Nothing like it... As with many travelers,... I have been to many of the workds great cities. NYC is one of these citites but the true gem amongst all its things to see and experience is the skyline. Simply put, there is nothing like it in the world. Whether viewing from the water, 30 rock or the top of the Empire State Building it is truly amazing.

Changes every time I look at it.. I'm sooooo lucky to be able to look across the river on a regular basis ( and anybody else who does ) and look at the skyline. It seems like it changes every few months... because of the constant construction and crane movings. But there is nothing like it at night on a clear evening.... lights everywhere shimmering of the water. Couldn't live without it!

Wow. We saw the skyline from the top of the Empire Building by day and The Top of the Rock by night. Wow although I did prefer the day view as we could see further afield but I think this is the best way of taking in what New York is all about and why it is so special and I think that everyone should see it at least once in their lifetime.
Fantsatic Walk. A must when you go to NYC. Quiet and peaceful considering middle of NYC. You won't regret doing this walk, in fact weather permitting it will be one of the best things you will do.

Stunning. Inspiring, magical and like no other I have ever seen. The skyline of NYC is simply unmissable.Favourite spots were looking across to Manhattan from Brooklyn or looking south over the city from the Rockefeller Building.
Circle line cruise. I took a semi circle line cruise and the veiws of the manhatton sky line were very good and also the commentary was good as it explained the veiw you were seeing
It's a Jungle. Seems to go on forever! When you look out at the skyline you just wanna see it all. There is so much energy in this city.

Wonderful! Both from Empire State Buildning or by boat. It is a beautiful town and the skyline is just awsome! Buy a New York Citypass the first thing you do when you arrive. It gives you free entrance and a fast lane through all the queues.

One of the world most beautiful skyline and view. This is definitely one of the view you want to see before you die. You see it thousands of times on TV and movies but to see it for yourself is breathtaking. The view in from New Jersey as you're approaching the bridge into lower Manhattan is beautiful. I took the Hudson river tour and we went up and down the river and seeing the skyline is amazing. It's overwhelming when you're in NY and I absolutely love the city. One of the best skyline in the world.

Breath taking. We were able to see the skyline from not only the Top of The Rock but of course from flying into JFK. It doesn't matter how many times I have flown, being able to see the skyline just makes the trip that much more beautiful.
Boat tour. Took a Night Cruise and then a daytime water taxi, both were great. The Cruise at Night had a meal and the sights were amazing
makes the trip worthwhile. During the day its amazing and at night its extra special. There is nowhere like it and its what makes New York special

Manhattan Skyline. Seen from the W Hotel in Hoboken,NJ,the perfect place to watch New York. The Hudson view rooms look right towards the Empire State Building and if you catch a firework display whilst there its nothing short of magic.
Boat trip from Battery Park. The weather was really hot and this was an excellent trip to see the Statue of Liberty and the Brooklyn Bridge.
Wow. This is my third trip to New York and the skyline always impresses. Best view is probably on the drive in from the airport.

Great!. we went to the empire state building when the sun was setting so we got pictures of the skyline in the daylight and night time. it was absoloutly amazing! we also went to the rockafeller center which had a view of central park which was really good!

It keeps expanding!. What a great escape from the hustle of the city. The Skyline takes you above the city navigating through no longer used railway routes. They've created a beautiful green space running for blocks in the middle of Manhattan.

Tips for the best views. The skyline is always breathtaking, and personally I can recommend the Top of the Rock for an aerial view, as well as Hoboken (New Jersey) for the costal view. There's public transportation to Hoboken for about 3$ and the train stop is right by the river.
Not to be missed. Whether you go to Empire State Building, Top of the Rock or a boat cruise, you can miss the beautiful New York skyline that never fails to impress!
What a view!. To all who have seen it, I'm sure you agree, it is really beautiful. Great viewing shots from Brooklyn and New Jersey will get you some beautiful pictures.

do not miss it. lack of time, to enjoy New York you need to book your hotel around the city to be able to explore the beauties of New York. there are loads to see and do in NYC. Dont miss to see New Jersey since you are already in New York.
Superb. The most famous skyline in the world, best viewed from the Top of the Rock observation Deck, and the Rockefeller Center. Simply breathtaking
disappointing. would have been good 15yrs ago found it very old fasioned poor value don't waist your money we had a NY pass so fine

Take a liberty cruise. Get a lady liberty cruise you will see the best skyline and the lady liberty, but liberty island was shut due to storm sandy ,so you can see only 10 metre away still worth to see
Unsurpassed view. We walked over the Brooklyn bridge just before sunset and loved the view. This is a must see if you are in NYC. It is fun to walk over the bridge from Manhattan too!

An amazing view of an amazing city. My personal opinion is the Rockerfella centre views were better than those up the Empire State. One reason only in that the clear Perspex glass allowing you unrestricted views of the whole city. If you can I recommend doing both but for me the views and the pictures I could take up there far outweighed the Empire State. You can get amazing pictures which will follow this review of Central Park etc which leave lasting memories.Once I upload my pictures I am sure you would agree.Thanks
Cool. It is awesomeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee. You can see the whole city beauty at a glance.. specially the lightings are pretty cool. and the sun set scene is breath taking.

Nothing like it!. Even though we have visited NYC previously we never grow tired of the skyline. This times we went up the Rockerfeller Centre at night. This is the best view and at nightime is the best time to see it. Another angle we tried this time was by taking the Subway to High St, Brooklyn and walking back to Manhattan over the Brooklyn Bridge. Easily walked in 40 minutes.

You'd never tire of this...... The Manhattan skyline truly is a sight to behold. Even during daylight hours, one can simply gaze in awe at the sheer beauty of it. However, when the lights come on - it's truly breathtaking! Stay in the borough of Brooklyn and enjoy this view when you awaken in the morning and again last thing at night. The sunsets are pretty amazing, too.

Nothing like it in the world. Period.. I never get tired of the airplane approach to La Guardia......the New York skyline---breathtaking! I do wish some of the mega-builders would lay off the city, though. Don't need a Frank Gehry vanity piece, thank you very much!
Ride the Staten Island Ferry for free. It was a fun ride and we saw the skyline, the Statue of Liberty, and did it all in just over an hour, AND it was FREE.
Views! Views! Views!. The walk across the Brooklyn Bridge at sunset is beautiful and worth every step! Not to even mention the Staten Island ferry view and the ride is FREE! I love this city!!!
Amazing!. Always amazing especially as the sun goes down at night! View from the Top of the Rock is my favorite but really any view of the skyline is usually impressive!

NY view but NJ perspective. I grew up seeing the skyline from the NJ side and it's still amazing. At night on the ferry, the lights are magical. Dinner and touring cruises are a great way to get acquainted and see some sites like the Statue of Liberty. For an out of the the way secret view, go to Blvd East in Weehawken. The park is a great stroll and the views are fabulous. Wall south past the park and see the site of the Burr-Hamilton duel.

Two views of the city. We opted to visit the Empire State Bldg. in the morning and do the Top of the Rock at sunset. Both were impressive and it was exciting to see the new building on the site of the destroyed World Trade Center nearing completion. New York never ceases to fascinate.
The bomb. No matter from which angle you look at it, it is amazing. From ferrys, NJ, top of buildings, ground, it is wonderful and makes you think of the possibilities in life. Endless!!!
New Life. All surroundings benefitted from this renewed touristic site of New York. Modern, alternative, innovative are just a few adjectives that suit this place. Must See!

A nice view from Dumbo across the river.. Truly an a view of the Manhattan skyline is something that everyone should see at once in their lives. A great spot to view this is from the emerging up market suburb of Dumbo which is down under the Brooklyn Bridge on the other side of the river. There is a walkway and a park and its a great view. Incredible!
Wow. When you first see the skyline it is fantastic. I pop into London regularly but the skyscrapers in New York are something else! I like the mix of modern and old buildings side by side.

Iconic. What's there to say, really? That's the place to be - now, as always.
The best tip is to take the subway and walk along the Brooklyn Promenade. Then, cross one of the bridges into Manhattan. And take your time.

Any view. I took pictures of the skyline during the day, at night, from the bridges and from the ground looking up. ALL the views are spectacular and interesting. I was unaware of all the detailed, fabulous architecture that spans all of Manhattan. It is fascinating if you take the time to actually LOOK at what is around you.
too many buildings. the skyline is best viewed from Brooklyn, the Staten island ferry or from top of the rock. Either way, it truly is a "concrete jungle"

Never tire of this view.. This just has to be my favourite view on earth. In my opinion best viewed from Brooklyn bridge park looking back to lower Manhattan. Always changing depending on the time of day or year and always looks so familiar from the movies.

Wow! What a sight!. No matter what angle you view the famous and iconic Manhattan skyline from you can't help but be impressed. Take a cruise or ferry along Hudson River to take in the splendour of the financial district skyscrapers, enjoy the multitude of architectural styles as you tour the streets on an open-top bus, look back towards midtown from Central Park for a great view or just look up and around you as you amble up and down the famous streets and avenues. For me the ultimate way to experience it is to take a bus/subway/walk to Brooklyn and capture the view from the other side of the river. At sunset it provides a breathtaking view of the skyline, and as night descends seeing the view with all the lights etc is magical.

Fantastic view from the Empire State Building at night!. Next time I would go up to the "Top of the Rock". There you get the view of the lighted Empire State Building, which complets the Manhatten Skyline at night!

We took Circle line semi circle tour and it was really interesting. We took our kids on a semi cirle tour as our youngest really wanted to see the Statue of Liberty. Going to the island is closed until July 2013 but the tour was still interesting and enjoyable.

No contest. With the anticipation of arriving at NYC, especially if you have driven a while to get there, the skyline shouts "Here I am! Come on in"! That being the operative phrase. Do not enter via the Lincoln Tunnel. Don't care if you are staying on the other side of the tunnel. Come in via the George Washington Bridge and see NYC from upper Manhattan as you make your way to Midtown. Also avoid the Penna Turnpike. It sucks with toll booths and limited access. Costs us about $60.00 in tolls to travel that road and pay the Lincoln Tunnel fee. We left via GW Bridge and avoided the expensive (cash only) turnpike. Spent less than 1/4 the money on tolls by coming through WVa back to KY.
9-11. Tall buildings, very modern. I went to the 9-11 memorial. Sad to see but it's the history. I like New York.Good restaurants, good food. Donut Pup is good.
spactacular. nothing like it, when you're here you know you've arrived in the capital of capitalism. Beautuful from atop the Empire State Building at night
Breathtaking!. My wife and I had a view of the Manhattan skyline from the NY taxi which was unbelievable. Highly recommended as it was a true sight to behold.
Worth a visit. Manhattan is still fascinating as ever with the water, skyscrapers and lights. What is there to dislike?
NYC. The most iconic skyline in the world. You always think you know the city as you have seen it on countless films and TV.
breath taking. hi from chicago and been to most big cities in the states buy New York is the greatest makes our skyline in chicago pale wish i could afford to live here

One of the greatest human works. I think Manhattan Skyline is one of the greatest human works.Let me propose watching Manhattan Skyline from Great Hill in Central Park. Great Hill is probably the highest point in the park. You are just to see the Manhattan Skyline over ponds and trees. It is very beautiful and easy to do it. In case you do not enough time to go Brooklyn, the Great Hill may be a good substitute.

Can't beat it! Really is almost surreal. A great trip everyone should do. Something for everybody, teens happy, parents happy. So many things to do. Suggest flea market on 39th, high line, Chelsea market, Staten island ferry (free) amongst others

Breathtaking. Saw this from Top-of-the- Rock, Empire State Building- 102nd floor and from Liberty Cruises on the water. All great. Empire State so Crowded, go on line and get express passes or don't bother. Queues 4 hours for those who didn't , I would have given up if that was me. Even though we jumped all the queues it was still crowded on the 102nd observatory floor. However, every time we saw it for the rest of the week we would say; 'we've been up there' so 'twas worth it, wouldn't do it again tho but you need to do it once!Top of Rockerfella centre much better than ESB and cruise even better. Really cold in March tho!
What a view!. A view of the skyline is breathtaking, a good place to see it is the Brooklyn Bridge. You will never tire of this from different angles and times of the day/night.
Stunning. We had the opportunity to go up high in multiple buildings and see the skyline to the north, south, day, and night. Hint: Take an iPhone and use the panorama feature to take pictures.

Whats not to like?. Iconic views of the Manhattan skyline - its like being in a movie - hard to believe you are really seeing it in person after being so familiar with in onscreen. Best part for me was coming in from the airport and you can just see the skyline - is that really Manhattan in the distance.....?!!! That was so exciting - the first glimpse....!

GREAT.. It was a breath taking experence visting the new york skyline. It is amazing view of all of new york. Vist the skyline at night because the bight lights of the city make your day. This over looks time square and all the big attractions in new york. Nothing would make your visit better to new york than visiting the skyline. As a new york native I though I saw it all till I went on the skyline, it ws amazing. Enjoy which is good.
See it from the Brooklyn Esplanade. From the Esplanade, from a Circle Line cruise, or from almost any place a little distance from Manhattan, the Manhattan skyline is stunning.
Family Getaway. It was very good,staff was very accomodating.Steps away from Broadway and Times Square, in middle of Theatre District. I would definitely recommend travelers to stay here.

Un matched. The view from the Hudson on the Water Taxi night tripis inbelievable, the variation in the buidlings and the lights twinkling will remain in my memory for ever. The Statue of Liberty lit at night is something else all together.
Amazing. This skyline does not even look real it's the best part of driving into NYC. Especially when you see the new trade center it's not finished until 2016 but still looks fantastic

Beautiful from any view. We got to see the amazing skyline of New York from many different points of view. From the top of Rockefeller Center, especially the highest outside viewing platform,the view was spectacular. It was especially cool seeing the Empire State Building from so high up just a short distance away. It was also beautiful viewing the skyline from the Harbor Cruise. It really gave a great perspective of where everything is in relation to everything else.We also had an interesting, but not as pretty a view, from the deck of the aircraft carrier Intrepid at the pier.But my favorote skyline view is and always has been, the view from Central Park looking out on all of the lovely buildings surrounding the park on all sides. I love to admire the Dakota, on the western side, with its appearance reminding me of its interesting past, the twin buildings nearby that look so regal, and of course, on the south side of the park, gazing at the beautiful Plaza, with its lovely mansard roof.
Beautiful!. What couldn't you like about the skyline of NYC. It's spectatular! From the Kimberly Hotel you have an amazing view of the Chrysler Building. Just beautiful!

View from Empire State Building. It is expensive to see the view but even worse if you have to wait in the lines to get to the top. We bought express pass tickets through our hotel concierge and saved all the wait time. Yes, the tickets cost approx. 15 to 20 dollars more, but on a busy day you can save a two hour wait time. Total price for ticket was around $50.00.

A must see in the dark too!!. The skyine is fantastic and you need to appreciate it both day and when it is all lit up. Compare photos that are on sale with the twin towers and now with the changed skyline.

If you didn't see New York City then you didn't see the World. New York first attraction is its atmosphere, powerful, eletric, amazing. I have been 8 times there and I'm from Italy. You must see the Manhattan skyline AT NIGHT from Brooklyin, from there you can hear the "voice" of NYC at night. This city is just the capital of the world and you didn't see the world if you didn't see it.

Beautiful. Wonderfull, best seen from anywhere but manhattan. Try an evening harbour cruise or going along Brooklyn bridge. Try and find a nice viewing spot shortly before sunset and sit and relax while the dusk sets in and the city nightscape gradually emerges.

Must see. Saw the skyline from a variety of places. Empire State good views downtown. Top of the Rock great views of Central Park and the Empire State Building. Staten Island ferry good views of lower manhattan. All great places to visit.

changed it for the worst. I did this trip 4 years ago and the bus tour parked to allow us to stand and see the manhattan skyline and it was the most amazing experience, but now they continue driving and only allow you to stand up on the bus to take photos. take the trip to Brooklyn on your own instead of doing the nighttime tour.
Fab. Go up the top of the rock rather than Empire state building. Its glass not cages and views are fantastic!
The Reason you come to New York City. This is the reason most people love to com to New York City is to see her skyline. She does Not disappoint!
unreal. views from the circle line where amazing and the new world trade tower really makes a difference....................................
Fantastic skyline. New York would not be New York without the skyscrapers. Amazing views from all around the city especially from Central Park.

Breathtaking. It is a breathtaking view. Best locations to see the skyline is from the Brooklyn side of the Brooklyn bridge. Night view is unbeleivable. Also you'see the great skyline if you take the Staten Island ferry or Statue of Liberty Cruise.

Top of the rock, If you have have to choose between the empire state building. If you have limited time go to the Top of the rock at Rockerfeller center.Empire state building is ok, but for the line up of people and the time it took to get get here, your better off at the rock
I love it! Nice Atmosphere. I loved everything its incriblde and the nice breakfast it's awesome and its fantastic and it's nice and awesome
View from Staten Island Ferry. We took the ferry on Easter Saturday 2013. Was a lovely journey, fabulous views on a fabulous day and even more fabulous, it was free!

One of those picture perfect moments. Stand on brooklyn heights promenade or walk the brooklyn bridge, these were my favourite 2 skyline views the top of the rock is in secound and the empire state building is in third. All are 5* and something you will never forget like seeing the eiffel tower or the colisseum for the first time! Its a must do and thats why its number 1 on tripadvisor!!!

Will be nicer when the World Trade Center is completed. NYC skyline is always breathtaking. Nice to view from across the East river at the promenade at the end of Montague Street in Brooklyn Heights. Also you can take a boat tour that goes aroudn the lower harbor sights or even the whoel sland if you have the time and approaches the Statue of Liberty for a closup view.

Unmistakable!. Wherever you are just look up, or around, and you are the set of so many movies. I just love the architecture old and new. The elegance of the Chrysler Buliding, Empire State and Flatiron Building right through to the modern Guggenheim, Number One World Trade Centre and so many others. The eclectic mix just works. The brownstone buildings have a charm, all of their own and walking through Central Park gazing at the unfolding scenes is just so wonderful. I guess you can tell that I fell in love with New York - actually we all did. My daughter was lucky enough to be working there and we joined her for a few days (not nearly long enough). Anyway 'nuff said. Unmistakable!

Empire State Building @ Night. Bright lights... Big city!!! Wow what a view... but man is it COLD!!! And the trip up to the observation deck was too long as they wan people to take a picture, stand in a line, and pack into the elevator like sardines. lol

Top of The Rock Observation is Excellent. We visited both the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock. The Top of the Rock in Rockefeller Center is so much better because you get an up close look at the Manhattan Skyline. If you only can visit one of these sightseeing venues definitely make it the Top of the Rock.
Breathtaking.. Amazing view of NYC. I can't wait to come back and take the helicopter ride and the boat to Ellis Island.

New Year Eve in a Limo. Had a tour of down town Manhattan in a Limousine on New Year Eve. The view from Queens over Brooklyn bridge towards Manhattan was enough to make you cry-the twinkling lights the sheer size of the buildings-awesome-a memory for life

Never get tired of it!. I work here, I'm lucky with floor to ceiling windows covering the entire wall, on the 32nd floor, the view of the skyline is the one part of my job I will always love! Wish I could say the same for the rest of the job, but there it is. Writing this review is an exercise in remembering the small things that make one happy, and this one makes this Noo Yawkah very happy!

A perfect work of art.. It is hard to imagine that tall buildings can be so beautiful . But clustered together as they are and viewed from across the river or from the Harbour one cannot avoid being bowled over by the sheer magnificence of it all.
Must see.. Beautiful views.We went at night when the city was all lit up.preferred this to during the day.Would visit on another trip.
Lovely. Lucky to have seen this in different places so got many views at different angles. The shapes and sizes of the buildings is great with old and new and more being added to it
Brooklyn Bridge. Do the walk over the bridge-- really nice views and you can get over and back in 30 min or so. Then have lunch in nearby China Town

A well known sight. The best way to see and appreciate the magnitude of the Manhattan skyline is to get a window seat and fly into LaGuardia airport, probably best on the left side of the plane. The flight passes about as close to the skyline as you can get. It is impressive. Otherwise, you will be out $25 a person to go to the rooftop of one of the many skyscrapers that gladly sell way overpriced tickets for an elevator ride.
Fantastic. Fantastic! Just as you imaging it would be Lots of great views from varios vantage points around the city
Big Cities Have Big Buildings. Sometimes I get a little sad that I pay so much to live in Manhattan and Jersey gets the best views for half the price.
AMAZING View. Wow the first time seeing this is amazing! If I lived there I don't think I would ever get sick of seeing this. Definitely makes me want to visit again!!
Skyline. The design of all these amazing buildings will keep you looking up, try and see the view of these buildings at night from the Top of the Rock.

A View From The Top. Visit the Top of the Rock at night for a stunning view of Manhattan and the New Jersey palisades. The city unfolds in a strings of colors and watch the signals change on the streets in Harlem.
Top of the Rock. This is the most spectacular view ever. The sun was shining and it was very cold and windy but this didn't detract from the view at all.
AMAZING!!!. I'm a New Yorker and I never get sick of the skyline. It's absolutely beautiful and amazing to see. If you are in New York city this is a must see!!
Great view. I love looking at the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn or the Brooklyn Bridge. Taking pics of it is much better than buying a poster or a postcard.

A Must See!. If you are in New York City you just have to see this! I went out on the Staten Island ferry which is free in order to get some great photos, but other ways include the Brooklyn Bridge and the Water Taxi...or if you're feeling a bit more elaborate you can even get a helicopter ride from Downtown Manhattan! But no matter how you decide to do it..DO IT!
Like No Other. See it from the Empire State Building, the Top of the Rock, or on the Staten Island Ferry from the water to get the full effect either by day or spectacularly at night.
not to miss in NYC. great ways to see the skyline are by helicopter, by boat (water taxi) or from a restaurant like the Waters edge
Gorgeous. What an impressive view. On a clear day, you see plenty and far. Amazing skyscrapers - unbelievable.
Fantastic. It's a fab place to visit, I would recommend everyone to come and see NY, you won't be disappointed.

Eat and enjoy!. My favorite way to take in the Manhattan skyline is from the Water's Edge restaurant in Long Island City. It's a short cab ride by either tunnel or the Queensboro bridge from Manhattan, depending on your starting point. We got there around 6, while it was still light outside, and watched the buildings begin to twinkle as the sun went down. By the time we finished dinner it was nighttime and the Chrysler Building was bright and beautiful. Dinner was pretty good, I think, but we were so entranced by the view that I couldn't say for sure :)

outstanding view at night from Jersey City!. went by car from Hoboken to Weehoken and it's wonderful the view. all the buildings illuminated with different colors. it's a must see view if you are there by night!
Fantastic. Viewing the manhattan skyline from the Staten Island ferry is just fantastic! It' was extremely cold but well worth it!

You must see this skyline at some time !!!. You have seen the movies and the news of the Manhattan skyline. I urge you to go and see it for yourself. As I have stated in my other tripadvisor reports the Statten Island ferry gives you a wonderful view or take a river cruise.
New York, New York!. Beautiful and totally not from this world. Everything about this city is exciting and an experience.
Great. Nothing to dislike its New York City on a Saturday if I have to explain you would understand ....everything was outstanding

Breathtaking!!. The view from brooklyn heights promenade is amazing and was the skyline from a helicopter tour and the new york water taxi. It is one of those memories that will stay with you till your next visit!!!!
Best view from Brooklyn. Best view from Brooklyn - take subway to Brooklyn - walk to seaside and you will have a great view to Manhattan and Brooklyn bridge - do also walk around in Brooklyn
Skyline beauty. There's nothing to dislike, unless you're there on a foggy night! It's the most beautiful city in world, especially when viewed from a distance on a crystal clear night!
Best view. Rockerfeller centre top of the rock has to be done. Sunset visit is a must. Sun and stars pass is great value.
Fantastic. We did the Empire state by day and then Top of the Rock by night - Both amazing. To see it both by day and night was worth the effort.

Beautiful, Stunning View - Day & Night. The skyline of Manhattan is always beautiful. It doesn't matter if you see it from the observation deck of Empire State Building, the Top of the Rock (Rockefeller Center), Brooklyn Bridge, New Jersey or the water. There are so many high-rise buildings in Midtown and Lower Manhattan; it has the densest skyscrapers in the world. While walking in the city, you will see skyscrapers surrounding you and there are 92 of which standing taller than 600 feet (183 m). Currently, Empire State Building regained the title of the tallest building in the city after the World Trade Center towers were destroyed by terrorist attacks in 2001. The 1,776-foot (541 m) One World Trade Center will be the tallest building when it is completed in 2013.We had the chance to enjoy Manhattan Skyline from Empire State Building at dusk, Rockefeller Center at night, Brooklyn Bridge and water taxi during daytime. All of them are worthwhile for you to experience. If you want to have good photos, you need to adjust your settings when in the boat. It is very difficult to have a good photo at night if you do not have a tripod which is not allowed at observation decks of Empire State Building and Rockefeller Center. New York City is so amazing that you must see it yourself. You will recognize those scenes like you saw on countless movies and TV series. The boat ride on the Hudson River will let you see the unpredictable and surprising beauty of the skyline from different angles. You have to find for yourself the best spot to see the skyline you like and of course it will take lots of time and walks.Next time I will try to see New York City from New Jersey to discover its beauty during day and night. The same advice here is doing your homework before you go and you will see all what you want as planned. Enjoy your stay in the Big Apple.
VERY INTERESTING TO VISIT. Circle LINE to see the Liberty Status.... so many things to see in a few days. I loved everything, even the meals and I am very special to eat.
Super skyline. Well this is what you come to see really. At night the lights look great and you can feel the pulse of the city.

When you know you are close. Just like with every good vacation, when you start to hear the sounds or smell the salty air you know you are close. With NYC it is when you begin to see the world famous Manhattan skyline. I think that no matter who you are when you see this skyline you get a little giddy inside knowing that something exciting is coming.
awsome. awsome views but pick a clear night to get best views of this marvolous city, a sight that will stay with you forever

Cool historical pathway. Walking path with great views from Meatpack to Jarvitz center worth every step. curves trough buildings and It is very close to many building and it must have been hell of a noice in the operating days. the Skyline closes at night
Great. Great views, and great light show at night! I love the feel of the city and I love New York City! I hate all the cabs, and the drunks but the rest is great

Monster Skyscrapers. We hopped on the FREE Staten Island Ferry to see the Statue of Liberty and lower Manhattan Skyline - it was really quite something, especially early in the morning when it was quite.
Just Beautiful at night!. We just came back form a 4 day trip to NYC! We rode the Staten Island Ferry across after dark just to see the Manhattan Skyline. We were not disappointed! A must see

Took the subway to Brooklyn and walked back across the Brooklyn Bridge. Great experience as you view the skyline. Great view of the city and harbor - Statue of Liberty included! Wonderful experience even on a cold day!

The most awe-inspiring skyline on the planet by far. The best way to see the Manhattan Skyline is to take the ferry to Staten Island and make the return trip to Manhattan. The ferry is free and it sails past the Statue Of Liberty and provides excellent photo ops along the way. The skyline is breathtaking. There is no greater city on Earth than NYC and there are no words to adequately describe the view as you sail toward the forest of majestic buildings, some in the grand art deco style and some modern that symbolize the Big Apple. I highly recommend this trip but it's even more mind boggling at night. You'll want to make this trip several times during your stay just to take it all in.

What a great way to see the lights!. We booked on the "Hornblower" cocktail cruise. The yacht was huge and as this was right after Hurricane Sandy there was hardly anyone on board - about 20-30 max when the boat holds up to 1000. However the views were breathtaking. The journey lasted about 2.30hours all in but a lovely smooth ride and great views of the Manhattan Skyline at night. It was a bit chilly so we kept coming inside for a warm up and some more cocktails and dancing but its a highly recommended tour and well worth the money.
Always a site!. Greatest skyline - you have to be a little far from Manhattan to enjoy it. It's amazing to see the skyline from Brooklyn or Hoboken.
Amazing. Best part of trip for me, went on the water taxi, which was brilliant. had great views and went really close to Liberty Island

Different aspects. We saw the Manhattan Skyline both from the observation deck of the Empire State Building and from the Top of the Rock. It's worth doing both as you get totally different aspects. We bought the audio commentary for the Empire State Building and it was extremely interesting in providing something of the history of everywhere you looked out upon. One other tip - it's definately worth paying a little extra to get the sun and stars tickets for the Top of the Rock. Manhatten at night is incredible.

Cruise/ Top of the Rock. The Manhattan Skyline is amazing! We saw it initially when visiting Top of the Rock at the Rockerfeller Centre however later went on a cruise around the main sites, it is just so breathtaking, the cruise itself was also very informative with information being provided about what we were actually seeing. Only cost $18 for 60 minutes but was very cold (do have a downstairs area which is enclosed however you can't go down when the cruise has started)

Stunning. What needs to be said? Stunning. Do not miss!! NO trip to NYC is complete without seeing this. If you can get to the other side of the Brooklyn Bridge, there is a small platform where you can hire bikes, which provides excellent views of the skyline for photographs.
Classic New York. Take Staten Island ferry (free) at dusk, sit on foreshore and wait till moonrise and the lights to come on ----magic
River cruise. Let's you take a step back and to really admire the beauty of the Manhattan skyline. You've seen it on films but nothing drops your jaw like seeing it in person.

Hudson cruise to Statue of Liberty. Absolutely loved this trip, jumped a cab to Battery Park then purchased two tickets for the boat, it only cost $18 each and lasted for a full 60 minutes. Be warned it can be very cold so wrap up, amazing chance to get some of the best pictures from your holiday

Wow..!. If you've never been...it's very cool! Lots of different architectural styles. And all the icons associated with NYC...I suggest you take the Hop-on Hop-off bus, to familiarise yourself to the city, if you're a first-timer.

just as you imagine it to be from the TV and films. Could not stop looking up wards fowards and every where lovely to see such iconic sights
Tak the tour bus they will describe what you are seeing.
rockfeller centre. the night view was absolutely awesome. The staff were very friendly and welcoming. Lovely place to eat at too.

Love Manhattan from a distance. I can see the skyline everyday from my apartment in NJ and I love it! Manhattan is truly beautiful seen from the outside, one of the most amazing skylines when the afternoon sun shines on its buildings.
No other urban skyline beats NYC Skyline. No other urban skyline beats NYC Skyline. The view from "The top of the rock" is something out of this world. The whole city is by your feet.

No Better Skyline in the United States. To really enjoy the skyline you need to see it from across the river, preferably at night. Though the best view ever is if you are lucky enough to sit in seat F (right side window) of a plane landing at La Guardia when they have the approach up the Hudson. It's simply stunning!
Good pancakes, bad omelett. Just no salt in the veggie omelett so it tasted nothing, pancakes good. Typical Amercan diner in a 70s interior style, staff friendly.

unique and awesome. Every time i see it I like it. Its wonderful and unique. It kind of defines New York for me. Even with such tall buildings, the street seems well lit, i guess due to light reflection from the glass builsings

Wow! Iconic!. Iconic, fantastic, bombastic, flamboyant, expansive, extravagant, amazing, stupendous,astonishing, breathtaking, marvelous, mind-blowing, monumental, overwhelming, phenomenal, smashing, gob-smacking, tremendous!
Cool to see, best at a distance. Definitely worth seeing, especially at sunrise/sunset. Best seen from Brooklyn Bridge Park, but best view is from a distance (i.e. from a plane landing at laguardia)
New York!. Nothing like actually seeing what you've only seen in movies and photos. What a memorable experience.

See the VIEW!. Best way to see the view, is from the View! Its on top of the Marriott Marque. The resturants revolves for a 360 degree view. Cocktails late at night is always a nice ending to a great day in New York! Dinners are awsome! Check it out. We had a dessert buffet... look out, the fruit and chocolate fountain was only the begining for this journey. Mean time the view just got better!
outstanding. Best view is from the Rock at Rockefeller Center. Combine it with skating and it is a beautiful thing
Breath taking Views. Saw the skyline from three different angles. By helicopter, by ferry and by foot. Absolutely amazing.

Magnificent. There are so many ways and places to see this magnificent view. The daytime views are great, but the views at night are truly breathtaking. Makes you feel like you're on top of the world.

Breathtaking. Went on the guided bus tour in the evening and experieneced the night time skline. Breathtaking. gh The evening is the only time to experience the true beauty of the area. I wouldn't like to pat the energy bills though
Best skyline in the world. From the empire state, top of the rock or the Staten island ferry, this is by far the best skyline you will ever witness. Day and night this will never cease to impress.
Fantastic. Iconic, well worth the effort. We did Empire State Building in the morning and Top of the Rock at Sunset

What is it about the Skyline that makes me feel so great?. One of my favorite places to view the Skyline is traveling by car over the Triborough (RFK) Bridge from Manhattan to Queens - this is often the way I will take to go to JFK Airport. When you come around the bend and look to your right, and there's the City, ah, it's fantastic. Magical. Insert your favorite superlative.Coming to Manhattan on the Staten Island Ferry is another great place to see the Skyline - however, there you are looking at it from the narrow southern end of the Island, and all the buildings are kind of scrunched together. Other great places to get a good view of Manhattan are coming over any of the eastern bridges (Brooklyn, Manhattan, Williamsburg, Queensborough) or approaching the Lincoln Tunnel from the west.

Its New York!. I saw Manhattan Skyline from three different places, which are Statue Island, Rockefeller Center and Empire State Building. The best is seeing from Empire State, since the place has great open area and not too crowded compare to rockefeller. But wherever you see the skyline, it is New York! Just enjoy your moment and seeing around!
That famous view. Saw the Manhattan skyline from the ferry going to see the Statue of Liberty. Stunning on a beautiful sunny day :)

Brooklyn Heights Promenade or Top Of the Rock!. I found that the two best views were from Brooklyn Heights Promenade (you can easily get there by subway) or the Rockerfeller Centre which over looks the park. The Empire Estate is the best at night as its taller and in the middle of the city. But honestly pop over to Brooklyn for a view of the skyline, its always quiet and a truely spectacular view. You can see the statue of liberty from there too.

Favorite Place In The World!. Although I've been to NYC several times, i can never get enough of the views. The most amazing skyline in the world! Take a ride on the Staten Island ferry at night for spectacular views!
Boom Boom room. Go to the Boom Boom Room for the best view of the city - check out the roof deck and jacuzzi. No sneakers or tennis shoes allowed - this is NYC after all!
beautiful!. I've seen the skyline during the day and at night. It's a lot more impressive at night. A true gem - Make sure to bring your camera!

Breathtaking Views!. A visit to top of the Empire State Building - spectacular views but very cold and windy the night we visited. Then a hearty meal at the Hartland Brewery restaurant at the base of the Empire State - another box ticked!
Wow. Wot a spectacular sight! Take the Statten Island ferry (its free) for the best view of the skyline. The night view is amazing when everything is lit up.

It incredible how american can transform places. It worth to visit to check how an old and unuseful train track can be transformed in a beautiful, gracious and usefull place.Congrats to the americans, they are fantastic to atract people to place.

Best view of the city during the day!. If you want to have the best view of the city this is the place to go, what I suggest is that you go to Observation deck during the day and you will get beautiful pictures with the Empire State Building on them but during the night I strongly recommend you go to the Empire State instead the pictures will blow your mind.

This is one of the reason I live in this great city!!!. The vista can change and does change from day to day. Only in NY can you see a plane in the sky one moment then watch it land in the river or on a ship

Top of the Rock. Visited the top of the GE/NBC building in Rockefeller Center (Top of the Rock) and found it was easy to get in and out and the views were great. Get the emailed picture of your party for $5.00....worth the price!

Better at night. We took the subway to Brooklyn to be able to see the Manhattan skyline from the docks right beside the Brooklyn bridge. We went during the day then later on in the evening and it's beautiful, but way better at night with all the lights.
Beautiful as ever. The NYC skyline is beautiful. I viewed it on a clear day from a boat on the river and it is breathtaking.
Awesome. Breathtaking to see for the first time at night. Manhatten wealth at its finest. Empire State Building stands out the most.
nyc skyline. best veiw from rockafella and emprie state building, alsom a river cruise is a good way to take in the sights
It dose not get any better. It just dose not get any better then the Manhattan Skyline. You have to come and see in person to believe it.
I live in New York City. No matter where I am in the city, I can see skyline. One of the prettiest is at the Central Park Ice Skating ring.
Its the best!. Loved it all, walk everywhere if you can, you see so much more. Take the airtrain to Jamaica Station from JFK and then the E subway line, takes you straight to Manhatten
Beautiful Architecture. The city is just amazing when it comes to the architecture and sheer magnitude of everything. A very friendly place fro those who want to see or shop around

Lovely View. The Manhattan skyline is always a sight to behold. I have lived here for 60 years and it never ceases to amaze me when I gaze at it from across the river or just look at it while standing in the midst of the splendor.

Wonderful, best enjoyed with a cocktail from one of the room bars. It's great from most directions. Be sure to cross the Lincoln Bridge into Jersey and take a picture from your car/bus, really great view from there.
Great experience in the winter. Go for the Rock and Empire state to really enjoy view from both sites of the city. Use NY pass or City pass

Wow!. Always stunning, whether looking in every direction from the Top of the Rock, or suddenly seeing the Empire State building appear lit up blue in the dusk when i'd dragged everyone down to see the Flatiron building, or the art deco splendour of the Chrysler building, or the frozen view from the deck of the Staten Island ferry, the Manhattan skyline never ceases to make me smile.

Wow it changed.... Been two and a half years since my last visit in NYC, from the big missing hole in the skyline where there the two towers used to be, to a new spectacular downtown skyline... Really something...
Absolutely stunning!. Cross the Brooklyn or Manhattan Bridges for phenomenal views of this amazing city. Bonus - it is free!
Unbelievable sight!. Cannot be described, you have to see it for yourself. Best view from water taxi at round about sunset.
Stunning in real life. You've seen it in the movies but to see it from every possible angle is even more stunning. Never gets boring, day or night

Like a Boss. The Manhattan Skyline is a really good site for you to see when you go to Manhattan. Manhattan is the first place that you plan to go when you go to New York (Not Brooklyn, Queens, or Flushing) Manhattan has one of the most beautiful skylines in the world. Bring a camera to take picture (but not at night because you can't see the skyline). The best places to see the Manhattan is Top of the Rock or one top of the Empire State Building.

Picturesque at Night. The view from a distance of the NYC skyline is like no other-the lights twinkle in the darkness while the full moon stood between the city and the sky. It is romantic and sensual; the sight illuminates all the senses; the night was warm and made walking a pleasure to take in the scenery of this beautiful, vibrant city.

Awesome. Do bring a camera. Nighttime is my favorite because there are so many colorful signs, lights on the fountains and statuary and buildings. A tripod would help, too. I love watching people from out-of-town - some who have never seen such tall buildings. I'm always amazed myself! The thing I dislike about wandering in NYC is seeing garbage strewn here and there along the sidewalks and gutters, and the people who would rather bump into you than walk an inch out of the way. But all in all, NYC is an experience because the skyline is like no other.
Unbelievable sight!. Cannot be described, you have to see it for yourself. Best view from water taxi at round about sunset.

Just like a movie and never feels real. We walked across the Brooklyn bridge to get the best view and down by the board walk, the views are amazing, its cliché i know, but it feels like a movie. The view you know so well from TV and feel like you know every building so well is just amazing, also along the way across the bridge, after the hoarding in place at the moment, there are rare views that offer brilliant photos. A must do is the view from Brooklyn. For you foodies out there who want that tradition NY pizza experience try Grimaldi's on your way back, it sits just under the bridge at Brooklyn and make amazing Pizza. This was our pit stop after an extra long walk from times Square. The address of the Pizza place is: 1 Front St New York, NY 11201, United States
Fantastic City!. The views from the Empire State Building were particularly breathtaking - would strongly recommend the audio tour - well worth the $10
Manhattan. The lights at night are amazing-like no where else in this country! The Empire State Building has different theme lighting-look it up on their web site and look forward to seeing it!
Beautiful. The Manhattan skyline is absolutely gorgeous. The best way to appreciate it is at night. Walk over the Brooklyn Bridge or hang out at the Brooklyn Promanade to just admire the view.
Manhattan Skyline from Brooklyn Pier. Fantastic in the day but more amazing at night. Watching the lights of the building sparkle especially with the sun setting behind it.
manhattan skyline. coming from a small village in the nort west of england we liked the total contrast.from just a few bungalows to the great metrolapis

Must See. Took in the view from the Rockefeller Center and The Empire State Building. Both very good views - make sure you do at least one at night - probably the Empire State Building is best at night. Also the views from lower Manhatton and Brooklyn are excellent.

Skyscraper Heaven !!. For the best ever view of the Manhattan skyline take a return trip on the Statten Island ferry at sunset. Depending on the weather if you have a fine evening with just a hint of cloud the buildings reflect the most amazing colours from light blue to pink to purple across the water. A photographers gem!Once the sun has set into the lull of darkness the skyline changes into a glow of fairy lights of varying colours....you can just get mesmerised by the lights and trying figure out the names of the buildings just by the shapes of the lights. One of the best highlights ever in NYC.
Iconic view. Has to be seen to be believed - you see this amazing view in numerous films and tv programmes, but nothing beats seeing it with your own eyes
WOW. Breath taking. Moving seeing the Freedom Tower during the day. At night from the river it is quite simply one of the modern wonders of the world!!!!

Stunning. Excitement, that is what the Manhattan skyline is. Possibilities, filled with dreams and hopes. The lights and the bulidings all lit up are beautiful. All different shapes and sizes, my breath gets taken away every time I see it. I especially love it when I fly into NYC
Hidden Gem!. Excellent walk outside the Times Square rush. Do the park and then go to Chelsea Market, best of NY.
NICE !. Very nice experience.. price worth it !!! Don't miss it you can book the excursion at front desk. leaves early in the morning !!!

Can't see the city for the skyscrapers.... ... and I wouldn't have it any other way. The Chrysler Building is always an Art Deco thrill; the Flatiron Building looks like it defies gravity. And the Empire State Building is fab at night.

Never tire of it!. So much to see. Each building must have a story and so interesting and different. Exhilarating feeling being in such a metropolitan city. Prepare for a sore neck from looking up too much.

Still The Best In The World. I've been to a lot of cities, on several continents, and still haven't seen anything to match the New York City skyline. Sure, I was born and grew up there, but I haven't lived in NYC for 45 years.
The skyline is still number one!
nice walk. Went in winter so everything looked a little bleak, but nice change to the avenues. Interesting graffiti and views of the docks.

great to see the city. wrap up warm it can get cold on the top of the bus and like your tour operator says dont stand up the traffic lights are very close to your head, its a great way to see the city and you can get on/off at most major areas of the city, 39 dollars get you the pass so that you can go up town or down town so you dont miss anything ,
Loved it!. Visiters be ready to bundle up! It's really windy out on the boat cruise but so worth seeing all the sites, especially on the water! Take a tour by boat to get the full effect!

Just like in the movies. Staying in NYC for 5 nights, we saw the skyline from Top of the Rock on our first day, from the Staten Island Ferry (free) on a bright and chilly morning and from the Brooklyn Bridge one even chillier evening! Everytime it looks beautiful and photoworthy - even for our first time, it feels familiar because of all the movies and does not disappoint!

Free views of Manhattan skyline. The Manhattan skyline can be enjoyed in many different ways. What is really nice is that the free ones are about the best ! Unless you want to fork out for a helicopter ride, walking across the Brooklyn Bridge or taking the free Staten Island ferry provide great views of the skyline. Of course, there are different views from water taxis, Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, etc. but the best for me was from Brooklyn Bridge. I couldn't afford the helicopter ride !

Sensational Night View. After a great dinner at Armando's , located in Brooklyn, we walked thru the steets of the Brownstones toward the river. As we walked toward the walkway railing: the Statue of Liberty was seen lit and in moonlight and toward the right THE BROOKLYN BRIDGE!!! The views were amazing and straight ahead were the city lights. I believe that every building in NYC remains with lights on throughout the night. Well worth a subway ride.
Big buildings. Big is most definitely beautiful. You cannot help being blown away by the views this city has to offer

Sight for sore eyes. Waited such a long time to see this and was not disappointed. As we drove up to the city the buildings looked fantastic, we didn't know which way to look first. Didn't like the rubbish along the roadside whilst driving through Queens on the way to New York City

See it from a helicopter!. I was lucky enough to enjoy an amazing helicopter ride around NYC. It was not a commercial flight, or I'd recommend the company. If you have the opportunity to take a helicopter around the City - do it! Amazing views of the Manhattan skyline, Coney Island, Central Park, the Statue of Liberty, Yankee Stadium, and more!
Fantastic. Till then, I had only seen this in movies but the view in real is out of the world - both during the day and night! You could gaze at if for ages!

You can't beat it.... OK, I am a New Yorker, so I have seen it my whole life. I have seen it from take-off and from landing. I have seen it from the World Trade Center (then), the Empire State Building, Top of the Rock, the Staten Island Ferry (free), Circle Line, Ellis Island Ferry, New Jersey Turnpike, and even from waiting in line at the Lincoln Tunnel coming over from New Jersey. You just can't beat it from any angle....

City of Lights. Creative architecture that over the centuries tells the story of the city's development through wars of independence, civil and world, along with the migration growth, then depression era, followed by financial boom, then bust and the tragedy of terror attacks. The city is alive with adventure both day and night :)
Spectacular at night!. Take the staten island ferry at night - its free and the views of downtown manhattan are fantastic. It also passes the statue of liberty.
Stunning view. Got an impressive view from Manhattan Bridge and a beautiful sunset view from the Staten Island Ferry.
Can't Get Enough. The Manhattan skyline is everything you see in movies or on television, and more. Try to see it from as many angles as possible, especially from Brooklyn.

The Best Things in NYC are Free..
