Whether seeing it from a plane or from the Belt parkway , in the morning or crossing the 59 street bridge during the evening, it's a beautiful site.Other free things..when I say free I mean admission.....Central ParkRiverside ParkStaten Island FerrySouth Street seaportGrants TombSt John The DevineRockefeller CenterTimes SquareAnd, lastly the sights and sounds of the city that never sleeps should be an additional backdrop to your experiences. Enjoy it.
ESB was lighted red-white-blue for Prez Weekend.. The area aroundt his landmark is amazing. Your on 34th street and can easily visit, Penn Station, Macy's, Healds Square and more.
amazing. We took the Staten Island Ferry and the skyline was just amazing and beautiful to look at.The day was clear and with beautiful blue skies :)A must trip to take when in the city.

Unparalleled. There is nothing like the NYC Skyline. While it is not the same without the World Trade Center - the new One World Trade Center is finally starting to take shape on the Skyline.See it! Photograph it!
Breathtaking. The Skyline will take your breath away more than once. At night its well lit up and during a clear day it's just like a scene from a movie.

Stunning!. WOrds can not describe the skyline! Go up in an evening helicopter so that you can explore it from the sky! The view from Roosevelt Island is a must, as is a water taxi and night trip across the Brooklyn Bridge!

Quite a view.... One needs to take the ferry that heads out towards the "Statue" to get the view which I feel is a must "Do" if one happens to be in NYC. While there might be other options for this, I feel that the view from the ferry is quite incomparable

In a word... WOW. I had the luck of being invited to dinner in the home of 6th generation native New Yorkers. They also just happen to live on the 28th floor of their building. The view as the sun went down was incredible. The building in the center of the picture is the United Nations and the very tall one is the 663' Trump Tower. To the left is the East River and beyond is Brooklyn.

If you know "the city," you can look at it over and over and always find a new thing that you missed! Look with a map. I like it all. Specially if you know its history. For example, you can identify old buildings, even those on 5th. Ave facing Central Park or the Metropolitan: old buildings have on their roof a tank of water, because during those years they did not have enough water pressure to extinguish fires. New buildings were made better, so the city codes changed to allow them to be water tank free.
Awesome. fourth trip to NYC...skyline always impresses....new freedom tower is beautiful and 9/11 memorial fountains are a wonderful tribute and thought provoking
Nice view. Not much to say, except that it's one of the nicest skylines in the world. Great view from the Brooklyn bridge, which is a nice bridge to walk across when the weather is good.

I'll be back!!. I was there last April..... I'll be back next April!!!
"I wanna wake up un the city that never sleeps....."

Enjoy the best Skyline ever. I did not know about this magical view from this place except from TripAdvisor , everyone please go there walk and enjoy a magical walk and you will also find the 9-11 memorial nearby I went there more than one in the say and sun set , its magic and romantic too if you have your couple ;)

Always Breathtaking!. Living within 3 hours drive from Manhattan, and being that it is my favorite city in the Nation, you can imagine that I try to go there as many times as possible. My husband could care less, since he would rather avoid the crowds and expensive tourist traps, but he knows that on any birthday, anniversary, or special holiday, I'll jump at the chance to go. Still, lover of the city or not, there is not a time when we've both not become excited at the sight of the Manhattan skyline as we get closer and closer on the highway. Rain or shine, to or from, it always makes us excited to see it, and equally sad to watch it disappear behind us. It is always breathtaking!

Unbelievable views from the air. Southwest Airlines evening flight from Midway (Chicago) to NYC (Laguardia) - we sat on the left side of the airplane. Breathtaking views of the statue of Liberty, World trade center memorial and the isle of manhattan in general. A truly rare treat.

Great to see from the top. The Manhattan skyline was great to see from the top. If you are on any building, over 30 floors tall, then it is worth having a look out at theshyline. From where I stayed, grand buildings like the Chrystler Tower Met Life Centre were very nice to see.If you look from the streets, you will end up with sprain in the neck.
ugly buildings. some of the ugliest buildings I've ever seen. Except for the Chrysler Building and a few others, it's boring, uninspired architecture in drab gray concrete.
Breathtaking!!. We saw this via a boat trip booked through Circle Line. Reasonably priced and the best way to experience the famous landmarks in full
Breath taking. Top of the Rockerfeller centre at sunset. Freezing cold in January but beautiful. Watching the city go from daylight to dusk and the lnight lights come on is one not to miss
Went on the Grey Line. The night tour looking across the Hudson from atop the double decker bus from Brooklyn was beautiful and overwhelming

Awesome. It is, truly, an awesome spectacle. You will never forget it once you've seen it. This place is so magical, it is my second visit. I have no doubt, it's magic will tempt me back again in the future.

You can't be disappointed!. The skiyline of Manhattan is the most recognizable in the world, and even the natives are awed by it. One of the best views is from the top road of the 59th Street (Ed Koch) Queensboro Bridge.

Amazing. The Manhattan skyline is something in movies that looks incredible but actually seeing it makes it so much better. We visited Top of the rock in the day time as you could see iconic buildings such as the empire state and central park. We then visited the Empire State building at night which looked amazing as the city was completely lit up.
amazing. Great to look at and relax. Took beautiful photos. Its a good place to look at and dream and dream...especially on a clear day

Picturesque. The skyline is breathtaking! Will be some much better when the world Trade Centre is all finished. We were lucky to get the boat out into the Hudson and walk along the Brooklyn Bridge when the sky was blue so it made the skyline so much better. If yopu want nice photos of it, do these things as soon as you see a blue sky!!
AWESOME!. We enjoyed the view at the Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center. It was just amazing! You can watch the 360 degrees view incl. Empire State Building ;)

AT NIGHT IT'S A REAL GEM - MAGICAL IN SNOW. On previous trips I had viewed the NYC skyline from the Empire States Building (do during daylight as well as at night) and from the circle boat tour of Manhatten. When visiting in 2011, we ate at a very noisy restaurant (great food, but, we couldn't have a conversation). Our hosts suggested we have a dessert at the Beekman Tower Hotel just north of the UN. On the top floor of this Art Deco hotel, the view was superb. So, on this trip I stayed at One UN Plazza Hotel and asked for a room with a view - far nicer than a hotel room overlooking a brick wall. The views of the skyline A1 at night or during the day - especially waking up on the Sunday to a sprinkling of snow. Pure magic!

Unforgetable. You must climb to the top of the Rockfeller Center and just enjoy the view. It's mandatory. Also, the Empire State builing, for it's history, it's also a very good experience. And please listen to the audioguide. It's the best!

Take the Path to Jersey City for the best view. I love the fact that you have to go to New Jersey to see the #1 attraction in NYC. For the best view of Lower Manhattan take the PATH one stop from the WTC to Exchange place. There's also a small 9/11 memorial made from twisted steel along the waterfront.

never viewed another skyline like this one!. It is truly a beautiful sky line. For the best views take a circle line or go to brooklyn or new jersy to look back. I is amazing at sunset, or if you are an early rise, sunrise.

Just like in the movies!! If you had to do only one thing in NYC, this should be it!. The Manhattan Skyline is everything you have expect to see and more! Its fascinating to see how this little strip of land stands tall, the skyline yearning to touch the sky! Day or night - both are as great! One can never tire seeing it - every time you see it, you will want to take your camera out and take "yet another shot"! The Staten Island ferry is a great way to see the New York Harbour (and the Statue of Liberty from a distance) - and its free. The view of the Manhattan Skyline receding in front of your eyes is amazing. Haven't still gone on top of the Empire State Building or the Top of the Rock, but I am sure they would be just as special! Most cities have laser shows to highlight their skyline once darkness sets in...well, Manhattan doesn't need any special laser show! Its fascinating just the way it is! If you just had time to do one thing in New York, just spend that time seeing the Skyline. Whether you see it from the ferry or from top of the high-rise, its immaterial! It will thrill and excite you as much! :)
A dream picture. Manhattan skyline, from New Jersey or even from the bridges, on a sunny day, is something to be seen and remembered.

Beautiful View Especially From The Ferry. We took the ferry over to Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. We also went up to the top of the Empire State Building. The views of the NY Skyline were sooo beautiful. Made you feel like you were in the movies. My favorite was from the ferry. I can not wait to go back next summer ! !

I Love NEW YORK. Sure, the NYC skyline is man-made. So What?! Its still beautiful to look at. I love the City and everything it has to offer. There is nothing like looking at the City skyline while on an evening stroll with your better half. Enjoy NYC!

Top of the Rock. Shouldn't be missed. A better experiance than Empire State. Look up in the elevator. Check out the upper level when you get to the top. The music room asigns you a color when you enter and the color follows you in the room, Kids love it.

A view with a thrill. Quite simply, the greatest man made skyline there is. Though I may be biased, being a native New Yorker, I have been all over the globe...and there's a reason they had to name this city twice...

Viewed from Staten Island, the Rockefella and the Empire State. Make sure you have a clear day with good visibility. I personally preferred the evening view from the Rockefella as I felt it less scary.

No Words to Describe. If you are a fan of NYC as much as I am (and I have only been once) you know that the Manhattan Skyline is just amazing. It is beautiful and worth spending a good 20/30 minutes on a sunny day appreciating how fantastic it is. Oh wonderful NYC...
Simply stunning. The Manhattan Skyline is as amazing in plain sight as it is in the movies, where ever you choose to view it from you won't be disappointed.
Awesome views of a magical city. We walked across the Brooklyn bridge to take in the skyline, and we went to the top of the Rockerfella Centre. What a vast and fascinating city - wonderful!

Go to Brooklyn, then walk the bridge. Why are you second guessing me? Go do it....NOW! You will never regret it. This is one of those things that I've always wanted to do but have never done, so my 5th trip to NYC was the time to do it, the things you haven't seen get fewer the more trips you make.....this was a breathtaking view even in the middle of winter. It was enjoyable and good for exercise. The skyline is the best from here
Lovely view and guide. If you wanne enjoy Manhatten Skyline from the best point of view, take the boat and you will experience the magic!
Excellent view from Jersey City. Manhattan's skyline can be very well appreciated from Jersey City, a few minutes away from Low Manhattan by PATH train.

Skyline. Nice to do if it is your first time to Empire state building. I believe the website said you had to buy tickets in advance but the tickets were being sold there too - unless i misunderstood? My bar was defective and they still started the ride - so we had to hold the bar down ourselves the entire time which made it hard to just enjoy the ride. I also thought it could have had more substance/detail - there is so much to NYC and i had hoped the ride would be more than just a ride - it is a greta learning opportunity but it was not maximized. I am still happy we did it - my daughter really enjoyed it and it also made the trip to the building worth it because the rest of our time in the building was very short - it was such a cold day, she looked in the binoculars for two seconds on the observatory deck and then wanted to get back inside!

Amazing view. I went to the place at night since it is open until midnight. The view at night is amazing with all the tall buildings and the lights and less crowds too so easier to make pictures without other people being parts of the pictures

Brilliant!. What can I say? It's an iconic view unlike any city I've been to before. The best way to see it is from the Rockefeller centre, walking over Brooklyn bridge or coming in on the Staten Island ferry. Great during the night and great during the day!
The best skyline in the USA. Best viewed from Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Plaza or the Empire State Building. An unmatched skyline unlike any other in the USA.

Top of the Rock. Put this on your list if you haven't experienced the Top of the Rock. The viewing is open until midnight so if you're walking around the city after 9 PM looking for something neat, check this site out. The lines during the day are very long. All the tallest buildings on the NYC skyline are visible and it offers a different perspective than other sites. TIP: No lines after 9 PM
Skyline of History. So many stories and histories can be traced from the Manhattan skyline, each with their uniqueness and memories.
Very well-known but great to see in real-life.. Just the fact that we know the image but have never seen it in real life made this a pretty cool thing-to-do while in New York for us.

Cool .... Seen from Brooklyn Bridge, Staten Island Ferry and Central Park
Just like I have seen in the movies and postcards, only BETTER =)

Can't get a bad view. I still get goose bumps every time I visit. The skyline is something you will never forget! For the classic NYC feel, go to the top of the Empire State bldg. It takes a bit longer bc of the crowd and the layout of the building, but it's worth it. Top of the Rock has a fantastic view that truly captures angles of NYC. It's also quicker to visit bc of the modern building. Take a camera!!
Enjoy the view from The View. A nice lounge on the top of the Marriott Marquis--great drinks and good appetizers with great desserts.

Spectacular Views. Manhattan is now one of my most favorite cities in the world! The skyline is incredible. The buildings and the architecture is outstanding. I love the visual history of the Manhattan Skyline!

Never fails to send me. I live in New York. Right now I am staying in Fort Lauderdale, but I look forward to the trip home and my first look at the skyline, which I adore. It's beautiful and it's home.

From the Rockefeller.. 360 degree views all around the top of the rock make it an excellent view point of the city. Outside observation decks and inside views too make it easy to stay up there (even in the cold) to take in the view and get that once in a blue moon shot. Go up there for sunset to see the skyline at both daytime and night time.

Dinner cruise viewing NYC skyline at night. We took a dinner cruise at night on the Hornblower Infinity. The night time skyline was beautiful. We were able to view the new "freedom tower " and a great view of the statue of liberty. The food was excellent and well presented. The staff was very friendly and helpful. A most relaxing trip and wonderful way to see the skyline!

Love the skyline!. There is nothing as beautiful as the NYC skyline! I never get tired of seeing it. I also love seeing the skyline in Times Square, especially at night. I will go back over and over and always enjoy seeing the NYC skyline
See it from the Ferry. The Manhattan skyline seen from the water may be the greatest urban landscape there is. You can check it out for free from the Staten Island ferry.
fantastic. Amazing, we could not stop looking up at the buildiings. The architecture is brill, each trying to be the highest tower to beat the others.
Super!!!!!. One cannot go to NYC and not do the skylkine. By boat or from Brooklyn.... By day or night it is fantastic!!!!!
Quintessential. Only one skyline matters... NYC is the classic, one and only. You can feel the heartbeat no matter what your view.

I'll Take Manhattan. There are so many places to get views of the NYC skyline from ground level places like Central park to observation decks like Top of the Rock and the Empire State Building, to the water taxis, ferries, and excursion boats to name a few. The only thing better than getting the view is being among the canyons formed by the buildings.
Beautiful skyline!. Best seen at night from across the water but impressive during the day too. Best places to photograph it are Brooklyn bridge park and top of the rock
Top of the Rock. Beautiful view, very organized, no line at all (Sunday afternoon) and even though it was a cold day the glass walls keep out the cold.

Pretty Impressive. Seeing the skyline in real life as opposed to in the movies - from every vantage point you really get to see some very special vistas. I particularly enjoyed the view from the Staten Island Ferry.
Skyline. Breathtaking views....the energy of the city is amazing. I would recommend anyone visiting. The lights and sounds are absolutely amazing.

relaxed in da city. i just liked the whole concept, pimping the old stuff into a beautiful oasis of green and strolling around. You go from a to b in a relaxed mode before you pick up the pace. A definite must-go!

I left my heart in NY. The reviews on TripAdvisor make me really proud of NYC. Even though I no longer live in NY State, I still visit NYC on a yearly basis. This will forever be my home, my city, and a place I consider the greatest on earth in terms of cultural and financial exertion and influence. The Manhattan skyline encompasses over a century of architectural history. There's just no other city that commands this diverse skyscrapers prowess that offer the best mixture of art deco to modern buildings. I think Chicago comes a close second, that's about it. Hong Kong is electric, Tokyo is bright, Shang Hai has gotten very tall. But they're not Manhattan !!!

Accidental Wonder. We got off accidetally at the Exchange stop on the NJ Path train and when we got to street level we were met with a fabulous view of the NYC skyline. I am a native NYC boy but each time I see the skyline after a while I notice it changes as new buildings are popping up (being built) all the time.
Christmas in NYC. NYC at Christmas, nothing like it. It was truly magical, Strongly recommend Bryant Park. We really enjoyed the outdoor art markets and Central Park was amazing.

Always a stunner. I grew up in New York and visit when I can. This is still a view that amazes me from many angles. Check it out from the Staten Island Ferry, any of the bridges, etc. Day or night, it's great.

Dream come true. I had always wanted to come to New York, even if it was just to see the skyline. The skyline is the best in the world, there is no competition whatsoever. Go to Brooklyn, queens or NJ to see the skyline, even if this is the only thing you do. Or better yet, walk down Brooklyn bridge and view the skyline from there.
All Outside the Window. What's not to like about the Manhattan skyline? The lights of theaters, the Hudson, Times Square, all within reach.
Day or Night. Well, it's not quite the same as before 2001, but the city skyline is impressive whether during the day or the fantastic lights at night
Would you rather.... ...look at Manhattan from New Jersey, Brooklyn, or Queens? Or look at New Jersey, Brooklyn, or Queens from Manhattan? Your call. Maybe looking at postcards would be a good clue.
must see. get on top of the empire state and see this view!!!! if you got kids with you do the sky ride as well...its fun if your a grown up as well!!!!
Astounding. This is probably what I was looking forward to most in my trip. Some of the best views of the skyline and the bridges we saw were from Brooklyn Bridge Park.

I live in New York and I am still amazed at the skyline. Every time I drive over the queensboro bridge I know why I live in NYC. Because it is the center of the universe and it has most definately one of the most stunning skylines in the world. That's it.
Spectacular. This is the reason you go to NYC. It is special. Take the river trip twice if you can. One in the evening and one in the day.
Amazing. If you are looking for a TimeLapse Photography....... New Jersey at Paulus Hook Pier, Amazing Panoramic Views or Manhattan without the bridges!

In Love. I am a Manhattan native, I have been having a love affair with the city since I can remember.. No one that has been here and has negative things to say has had the proper experience.. Manhattan, my home, and my first love..
Walking the Highline. It was cold and icy on a stunning blue day. There was quite alot to see from the Highline everyone should walk it that visits New York.
What can I say, it is superb. Lit at night from Dumbo or from Roosevelt Island (you can use the aerial tram to get there) or from a ferry this was superb more than expected

It is different than other tall buildings.... You may have seen tall buildings all over the world but skyline in Manhattan is really some to be amazed of. If you want to see it from the sea and see it free then the best way to do that is take free ferry to States Island back and forth.

What can you say?. Tokyo might have brighter lights and more people. Beijing might have larger crowds; but nothing compares with the Manhattan skyline - day or night.... if you haven't been - come... if you have been...look up and enjoy it again.
Smooth night cap. Mom and I stopped at the bar for a nap cap and caught the end of a game. It's a great place to unwind before bed.

It's the Manhattan Skyline, what else does one say?. Not sure what TripAdvisor wants me to say about the Manhattan Skyline - it's breath taking and I'm from a city with lots of tall buildings and a pretty great skyline itself... Still, it's Manhattan we're talking about and it is pretty exciting to see it in person.
Beautiful. Take a night tour to see the city at night. The Brooklyn Bridge lid up and of course Time Square! What you see on TV ora movie is what it is.

See it from Brooklyn!. Wander along the piers in Brooklyn and you get a magnificent view of the Manhattan skyline. I recently stood and watched helicopters landing! Turn to your left and the Statue of Liberty is visible, and you can watch the Staten Island ferry plying its route.

The Best Views are from Brooklyn. Take a train, or a bus or best of all walk across the Brooklyn Bridge but go across to Brooklyn. Once you are there go down to the Boulevard which is undergoing extensive improvements. From here take in the finest views you will ever see of the Manhattan Skyline. Do it in the day, then do it again at night when it is different again. Both are awesome.

Clear winter skies in NYC are so romantic for honeymooners!. I liked every bit of the skyline. The profile of the skyscrapers is impressive, but at the same time it gives us the idea of what modernity is all about. I love America.

It's the World as We Know It.. If you can get a little perspective, some say, the Skyline in Manhattan is fantastic. But all you have to do is walk down Lexington Avenue a few blocks; or go to Chinatown and look up Eldridge Street at the Empire State Building; or walk to Washington Square - and admire One World Trade Center under construction all the way down and beyond Thompson Street. I swear, after a while, the skyline seems to embrace you as you stroll the city.

Breathtaking. I had purchased a city pass, so made the most of it by visiting both the Top of the Rock and the Empire State building. Saw the empire state on an Incredibly clear day and could see for miles, and went to the top of the rock at nightime so you could clearly see the lights of the empire state building in every photo, as well as the chrysler building etc.If you want views of the whole of manhattan, then take a trip on one of the ferry's or the circle line cruise for some great photo opportunities.Alternatively, head across to the Brooklyn Bridge Park (either walk across the bridge, or take the subway) for some wonderful views, particularly of the southern end of Manhattan.

Beautiful city. Every borough of the city has it's own beauties to see. Get out and walk it! Central Park even in winter was so calm with heaps of dogs out and about. The view from Rockerfeller Plaza was great, full frontal of the Empire State but the Chrysler building was partially blocked. Buy tickets online for a schedualed ascent time.

Excellent View from the Staten Island Ferry. I absolutely enjoy viewing the Manhattan Skyline from on-board the Staten Island Ferry. It's absolutely breathtaking to see all those high rise buildings, especially on a clear day. The ferry is free and also gives an excellent view of the Statue of Liberty. Well worth it!
Iconic. Great skyline views from ferry to Liberty and Ellis Island. Couldn't stop taking photos. Ellis Island was a wonderful vantage point to photograph Statue of Liberty and Manhattan Skyline.

There are no words. It is spectacular... Day or night the Manhattan Skyline never ceases to amaze me. We got engaged at the top of the Empire State Building, we returned in July 2012 for our wedding in Central Park and we have spent a few other trips here too. Can't wait to be back to the best palce in the world.
Must do!. Take the free ferry to Staten Island and see the Skyline and The Statue of Liberty! Very nice!! Pick a cloud free day and enjoy!

Nothing can beat it.... There's nothing much to tell about the Manhattan skyline: seeing is believing.... This time around tough, in addition to the newly illuminated Chrysler Building, shining like a precious jewel in its LED lights, I was really intrigued by the centennial ball that was let to shine in the Manhattan skyline after it was dropped on New Year's Day. Make sure you check out its funky colors!

Breathtaking at all angles. Whether viewed from Brooklyn or Queens, Hoboken, Newport or Weehawken, the Empire State Building or Top of the Rock, the Manhattan Skyline is one of the most breathtaking views I've ever seen. Her true beauty emerges, however, at night, when the glimmering lights of Manhattan's skyscrapers dazzle the viewer, like jewels from Harry Winston's windows.
Must see. The skyline is a new way to visit New York. A lot of art, and views of new york. I totally recommand it, even in winter.
Amazing. Best skyline in the world, no can beat this city. Its the most lively city in the world. This city never sleeps, its constantly busy. Love it!
5TH AVE DURING DECEMBER!!!. most beautiful street decorations on 5th avenue near the Rockefeller XMAS tree... get your cameras out!
Manhattan Skyline. There's nothing else like it in the world. Especially enjoy seeing it from the Jersey side in some of the waterfront restaurants or ferries, away from the hustle and bustle.
Classic, on in NYC. The best views are from the air when flying into La Guardia or JFK. Alternatively, head overto LIC or Brooklyn for some evening views of the skyline at dusk. Gorgeous
Unforgettable. Although very chilly during October evenings, the view is unbelievable! We could decide between the ESB & TOTR so did them both & got some great pics from both!
See it from ground level and from the Empire State Building. It is particularly exciting at night when the avenues look like red and white stripes when seen from above.

I live here. Every day is a normal day for me. and if you take the time to look up, you will see the most amazing skylines In the world, Ney York is one of them. See the skyline from West new York, Union city, take a ferry across, and walking distance is a excellent platform and you can see ost of the skyline. Explore, see the world, enjoy

I found my place in Brooklyn. I walk on the Brooklyn bridge to Brooklyn and had an nice cream under the bridge. the skyline is the best : downtown, the bridge and far away the Empire state building and Chrysler Builing. My pictures are great!

Lights Action Camera. What can one say, from any vantage point, the Manhattan Sky Line is an incredible view? There is nothing like flying home at night and having your landing approach come over the city or on the New Jersey side.
Impressive. Impressive, yet not the best (I still prefer Toronto skyline). Possibly when all the towers are finished, in a couple of years, it would look even greater!

Breathtaking.... Lost for words to even try to describe this-amazing place, you need to see it to believe it!!!
Nothing at all to dislike about NYC - best place i have ever travelled to!

An awesome experience. The great views, coffee shops and bars and the politeness. Struggle with the forced tipping culture. Have done the tourist aim attractions before so spent a lot of time in the districts, soho, Greenwich,etc
Have to see it to realize just how big this city is. whether it is from top of the Empire State Building, or one a bus in New Jersey, you can't help but wonder at the size of this city.
a must. You must see it in day light, twilight, dawn and night time. Beautiful, beautiful beautiful beautiful, you may not take a tripod, so get a good camera and a steady hand.

No other equals. New York is a unique city in the world, no other skyline is so iconic as that of Manhattan. Worth being viewed from above at an observation deck or from below from a boat tour (try the Saten Island ferry, cheap great tour with the best possible view of the Statue of Liberty too)

Unbeatable. you just can't get enough of admiring the skyline, with building that tilt with the winds, very tall that they seem to be reaching higher into the skies. The more modern buildings bear different colors, some varying every few seconds

Breathtaking. From land sea or air the sky line is totally amazing.The sights and sounds of NYC blew us away.Take a night cruise on the river to see NYC by night, take a helicopter ride by day,go to the top of the rock or just simply walk around this great city.ThNk you New York !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
check different views. check the skyline from Hoboken, the sky (helicopter) and from the water. (staten island ferry is free and you get the statue of liberty as a bonus)

Best skyline in the world!. Well at least for me (so far?). It looks almost 3D and layered. Amazing during day and superb at night! I've been to a few cities with famous skyline but I think this one tops it all. My favorite view is when I drive in/ out of Manhattan through the bridges, I'll sigh a little stealing a glance from the tip of my eye~ :)
Awesome!. Nothing like it. NYC is the most exciting city in the world and no skyline compares with the magic and mystery of NY
amazing. love this iconic skyline - better in real life than all the picswell worth seeing. I have seen it lots and lots but am still impressed

Iconic View. Any visit to New York City starts and ends with a view of the Manhattan skyline - from the Jersey Turnpike, flying in to one of New York's three airports or arriving by train always starts with seeing Manhattan's skyscrapers - sad without the World Trade Center's Twin Towers since 9/11, though.
Beautiful. From Brooklyn bridge and Ellis island. Loved it all and could stare at it all day long! Come rain or shine you will be blown away for sure.

Always Magnificent. Amazing from all angles. Go on the free Staten Island ferry and see it from the sea, especially after dark, and if you can afford it, so a World Yacht trip. Dinner cruise is fantastic especially sailing under the Brooklyn Bridge.

good skyline. brilliant city easy to get around, lots to see, amazing people must see all the many sites, world trade centre memorial is a must see, very emotional and amercia doing a really good memorial here. also central park a must see lovely place.
beautiful. Quiet time of year...not crazy crowded everywhere.. Manhattan looked beautiful, weather was 50 degrees all weekend

NUMBER ONE THING TO DO IN NEW YORK. Was fortunate enough to see the Manhattan skyline in evening from my plane when were were coming back from Miami to LGA airport .Breathtaking beautiful and out of this world experience . My tip if you are flying down to Newyork is take a evening flight to LGA airport . That way you will have a free view of Manhattan skyline
Unique!. Beautiful from the water on a sunny day. The iconic buildings and bridges are what makes New York City.
View from Top of the Rock. Booked the Sunrise or Sunset session - breathtaking well worth a visit. Fast efficient service and very friendly staff.
Marvellous Manhattan. Loved everything about Manhattan - even the crowded streets & subway. Only dislike was the rude cab drivers & the badly maintained vehicles (no shock absorbers)

fantastic. just amazing all of it. great at New year although very busy people taking their positions at 8 in the morning

Wow!!! like being in Hong Kong!!!. we had a great time, central park was fun and carriage ride great, nice to see ice skating and people having a good time, visited empire state building and Macy's which is oppposite. None like it in the world!. It's a beautiful view, but of course you have to be outside Manhattan to see it. 30 Rock roof deck. Beautiful views, 360 degree sights better the Empire State bldgGo after new year, much less crowded

Terrific Manhattan views from Long Island city. Terrific views to be had from hotels in Long Island City, a quick jaunt over the queensborough bridge. What can you say that hasn't been said before-spectacular. My favourite manhattan skyline icon: the chrysler building, from any angle.

Awe inspiring!. THE NEW YORK CITY SKYLINE FROM THE TOP OF ROCKEFELLER CENTER: www.topoftherocknyc.com NYC’s skyline is rated the #1 NYC attraction by a lot of reviewers here, many of whom believe that sunset is the best time to view it. I agree. The top floors are called “Top of the Rock”. To avoid lines, get tickets in advance. I bought 2 adult tickets ($25 each) on-line when we were already in NYC. The ticket area took my confirmation # and printed our tickets, which we then took to the entrance. Since we wanted to be there at sunset, I chose our entry time by looking at this site: http://www.timeanddate.com/worldclock/astronomy.html?n=179&month=1&year=2013&obj=sun&afl=-12&day=1 I got entry tickets for 3:45 p.m. on January 3rd. Turns out, it was just perfect for not feeling rushed, seeing three 4-minute films (only available on the way to the top, not on the way down), walking around the top 3 floors, then watching twilight and the sunset. I LOVED watching the city lights come on slowly – in the buildings, on the bridges, in Central Park, and even the red and white streams of headlights and taillights – all so beautiful. We almost skipped the 3 little films, but are glad we didn’t. Top of the Rock is open 8:00 a.m. to midnight, 7 days a week, 365 days a year despite weather conditions. They have a good FAQs page at http://www.topoftherocknyc.com/visitor/faq/ Phone #s are 212-698-2000 or 1-877-NYC-ROCK (877-692-7625).

Difficult to miss. If you're in New York, you will have a difficult time avoiding this "attraction". The New York skyline is in the top 2 in the US (personal opinion, with Chicago being the other). My favorite views are from across the Brooklyn Bridge and on the Staten Island ferry. Both are basically free. New York is a beautiful place, but if you've been or are going, you'll know that without me telling you.
View from the rock\. What a view. Very colorful and beautiful. Thousands of lights make the city seem so much larger at night
Girls Weekend In NYC. To see the best...go to the empire state building at night..so so pretty at night..and one of the tour bus ppl said best time not as busy would be going after 5pm
jaw dropping. loved the night sky, loved the sunrise, the sun set, just jaw dropping. the unique light show at night from the different cars ect!
like a film set. New York is just one massive film set, there's a cop on every corner so you feel completely safe. A fantastic place to visit.
Fabulous and extensive. The skyline is such a combination of different styles of buildings which makes it very cosmopolitan!

Walk Brooklyn Bridge. Make dinner reservations around sunset in Brooklyn (try Henry's end). Yes it's a bit of walking but this way you get to see it in all its glory: sunset and lit up at night. You won't regret it / makes for some great photos!

Like being on a movie set. Be it on the Staten Island ferry as it leaves manhattan (back of boat) or when it returns (front of the boat), make sure you take your camera!!
Top of the Empire State Building! Be it facing North, South, East or West, be sure to take your camera and soak up manhattan in all its glory!!!

Manhattan Skyline - a must. The best and most inexpensive way to have a good view on Manhattan Skyline is to take Staten Island Ferry. Takes you an hour to do the trip and costs nothingANother thing which I would strongly recommend is the Top of Rock at Rockefeller Centre. Beautiful at night. The Christmas light were still up and the whole place looked great, especially at night, with the Rockerfeller Centre being especially nice. The Chrysler Building is still one of the most beautiful and comes into its own at night.

Got a 360o view of the city, which was awesome. The view was absolutely fantastic. New York people are so helpful and very friendly indeed. I really enjoyed my time there, and hopefully will be going back to NYC next year

Every time of day. from the river, from each cross street, look up down and around
especially at the Chrysler building - the most beautiful in NYC

Assuming this is the Skyline itself and not some business.... This is, perhaps one of the world's most famous views. From the Brooklyn side, you can see the Statue of Liberty through the Financial District and the new Freedom Tower rising from the ashes of the Twin Towers and many of the other famous buildings from yesteryear including the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building. The only problem with New York is, that with so many large and beautiful buildings, they often are blocking each other and you can't truly appreciate many of the smaller, lesser known buildings until you come right upon them. But... the views from afar are summed up in one word: superb.
Just great. Best of the best. Beautiful as always. Never seen anything so special especially at night. No other city or country can compare.
Wow. Go up to the Top of the Rock for small queues and better view at night of the skyline. The Empire State Building is great but the Top Of the Rock gave me much better photos
Breathtaking. You see the skyline on TV, but nothing beats viewing it yourself, so many vantage points around the city.

Right next to Empire State Building!. Looked right out the window to see the Empire State Building all lit up red and green! Also since we went in early in January, we went to see the tree in Rockefeller Center without crowds!

NY Postcard scene. The Manhattan Skyline has many memorable buildings. The Empire State Building is probably the most well known. The new tower at Ground Zero is also visible. The majority of the buildings on the Manhattan skyline however, are just buildings but they vary in colour, height and architecture and feature on many of the postcards for sale in NY. We changed hotels during our NY stay and our room on the 25th floor of the Double Tree at Hilton in 29th Avenue provided a wonderful view of the Empire State Building. We also enjoyed the Manhattan skyline from the Staton Island Ferry. The ferry pulls away from the Financial District (near Ground Zero) and travels past the State of Liberty to Staton Island. The ferry is free and is a comfortable ride. If you want to see the Manhattan Skyline, we suggest the ferry. Parts of the skyline can be seen from within Central Park.

Amazing!. Can be viewed from all over! Very cool to see the new main World Trade Center building from afar! And the Empire State Building is always a treat! One of the best spots to view the skyline is from Liberty State Park in NJ.

Everything you see in the movies. Although the day was bitter cold, we viewed the skyline from Brooklyn Promenade. The view is terrific and worth the wait in the cold. If you do this, you can easily walk to Brooklyn Bridge to walk this too.

Ma. This is an old disused train line which has been renovated .A well hidden gem, we found this by chance. You get a good view of some of the less well known areas of New York. You are in an elevated position above street level.It is used to display local artists works.It has lovely plants as well.

The distance is less then a mile, and you can go halfway, and turn back towards Manhattan after you get your photos taken.

Breathtaking!. We took the no 2 subway from Wall St over to Clark St station, Brooklyn, which is a 5 min (if that) walk down to the promenade with benches, overlooking the amazing view! Stunning at night

All around Manhattan. We went on the Circle Line boat tour around the whole of Manhattan and it was just amazing.
Fortunately we had a great and witty guide for our 3 hour trip; he certainly didn't disappoint!
The views all around the island were truly great and I would actually do it again just to see the sights!

quickly changing with the new WTC. the new World Trade center is starting to take shape and looking good, this is brining back the skyline to it's inspiring glory especially as seen from the staten island ferry or one of the harbor tours
A site to see. Saw the Skyline from a Harbor cruise and from Top of the Rock. Breathtaking at night. To see the lights.
One of a kind. The most recognizable skyline in the world. After a while you can name each building as if you were old friends...and love them too...
Amazing. Great view from any ferry. If you buy a hop on hop off bus ticket you get a free harbour cruise thrown in.

Viewed from a dinner cruise. For an enjoyable evening filled with spectacular sites of Manhattan, take a cruise in the East River. Make sure your cruise takes in The Statue of Liberty, it an awesome site at night.

Staten Island Ferry or Manhattan Bridge. Manhattan Bridge is fantastic for view of the Manhattan Skyline but unfortunately currently under construction so it does obstruct your view. Still worth taking a walk if nothing else for pictures of the bridge itself and the view of N. Jersey. Can't beat the Staten Island Ferry, it is free, great view of the Statue of Liberty and the skyline. It is also located right next to the Statue of Liberty boats, BTW the boats to the Statute of Liberty cost is $17 versus the $24 "tour" boat that only goes around the statue and you do not get to get off at the statue. Tickets to the crown are a bit more.

Great Cruise tour. Went on a City cruise trip and we chose the perfect day for it. Despite the cold the day was very sunny so the photos we took came out well. It took us from pier 78 round to Brooklyn and Manhattan bridges with a sea view trip of the Statue of Lberty, Liberty island and Ellis Island were closed to the public from the aftermath of Hurricane Sandy,

Night out on the town. I'm a NYer but there is something about this great city. Call it pulse, passion, buzz, energy, the people, broadway, skyscrapers, whatever you want that is simply INDESCRIBABLE!!!!!!
Terrific architecture in NYC. The hi rise building in NYC are exceptional, especially mid town. Chrysler Building, Rockfeller, Empire State, Flat iron, the most attractions per square mile.
GEORGEOUS. Breathtaking, there was nothing I did not like. People are so friendly. Take in the day sights and look at it at night. It is beautiful,
most beautifu l skyline in world. it is always breathtaking to see the Manhattan skyline, from amny different persectives. It has sense of history and architecture which is unsurpassed

Viewed from Staten Island Ferry. Had the chance to view the skyline when the ferry docked after doing a round trip to Staten Island, coming in a good picture was unavailable from the top deck, however the ferry then turned, and opened up a magnificent view, with a great photo opportunity. Tip- wait on top deck for your photo chance.

Manhattan Skyline. This is best seen from the Staten Island ferry (which is free) or Brooklyn. Buildings are constantly being demolished and rebuilt so the skyline had changed considerably from when I was last in New York in 2000.
Manhattan skyline nice day or night. Love to see the skyline from Brooklyn at night or on a river cruise by day. We were on the City lights night tour and the city was all lite up. It was awsome.

beautiful from top of the rock. Dont waste time in the empire building, go to top of the rock. its beautiful and a lot more open. The rockefeller center has a tour thats worth the time and the space at the top is more conducive to viewing.

Best place to see the Manhattan Skyline. The best place to see the Manhattan Skyline is in New Jersey in West New York. You really get a great view from there (you are literally standing on a cliff overlooking the river) and it is really mesmerizing. The best time to be there is at dusk when the last sunlight reflects off all of the glass on the buildings. It really just does something to you.  This is not a well kept secret and it is usually crowded there so expect to park a block or so away from the cliff, unless you're lucky. For all you romantics out there, you should go to the ChartHouse restaurant in Weehawken which is about a 20 minute drive from the cliff. The restaurant is frequented by celebrities (I met Patrick Ewing there once), offers a great view of the Manhattan skyline, and in the summer, they have a deck outside that is right on the water. The dress attire is business casual, the food is a little pricey but is well worth it ( approx.$150 for drinks, entrees, appetizers and desserts for 2). If you really want to impress, this is the place to be....bar none.
Great time in the Big Apple. The Manhatten Comfort Inn was charming and New Yorkers friendly and anxious to help.The shows were amazing All in all a great time!

Iconic View. The view of Manhattan from Jersey is just aces. It's awe inspiring. The turnpike, as you sit there admiring the view, not so much. But you just know once you finally get thru the Lincoln Tunnel into NYC - magical things will happen.
Awesome veiw. just awesome view nothing else in the world to match it during the day or during the twilight into night time great
Awesome on a clear night!. Take it all in from the "Top of the Rock" - it doesn't disappoint! Be sure to ask about visibility before buying a ticket though...
great skyline. as in so many photos, the sky line is gorgeous, worth seen. you have a first glimpse as you arrive the city from airports.

A view from the ferry. I worked in mid-town Manhattan and took the ferry in to work every day. I have hundreds of photos of one of the most majestic skylines I know - every inch of the island is filled with hustle and bustle that goes still on a frame. Worth a trip.
beautiful and breathtaking. We walked ontp the brooklyn bridge on a clear day and the sky line is just out of this world, no photos do it justice you have to see for yourself

A must see.. Great views from various boat trips or when you walk across the Brooklyn Bridge. Great to see in late fall/early winter in the late afternoon to see great colors hitting buildings and casting bridge shadows.
Even more amazing in reality. Having seen the Manhattan skyline on TV and in movies I thought I'd seen it but you really do need to view it for real to appreciate how impressive it is.
lovely. Take the free Satten island ferry for spectacular views of the skyline. Also quite close to the statue of liberty!

this skyline you must see. If your in Manhattan this skyline you must see. We caught the subway near to Brooklyn bridge and walked over stopping frequently to admire the view. You also get good views of Ellis Island and Liberty Island.
NYC at Christmas. Decorated for Xmas, beautiful. The Chrsitmas tree was beautiful, lights were everywhere. Time square was very crowded!
Classic view. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan and thoroughly enjoyed the view. A very windy day, but still a great memory!

I still miss the Twin Towers. I was able to take some really nice photos from the Brooklyn Bridge park as well as the Promenade. Those are two nice places to visit in Brooklyn;And you get a chance for some really good pictures of the skyline.
Amazing buildings/skyscrapers!. The buildings were all lit up for the holidays and were beautiful at night. We did a city tour at night to be able to see them.
Breathtaking. Amazing to see it in person and it looks exactly like all the pictures. Would have. Thought that such a large city would have smog but not so. very clean?
ENJOYED. This was enjoyed by all the family,and good value stunning views of manhattan not sure if i would do it on my next visit
Postcard moment. We looked over at NYC from across the river in NJ. What a view. Postcard panoramic shot from uptown to downtown
Something everyone ought to see at least once. I'm a NY native, so I grew up with the skyline. Nevertheless, it still gives me chills whenever I see it for the first time on any trip.
Amazing. very surreal looking at it for the first time. A truly breathtaking view and i never got board of looking at it.

We live in Weehawken, NJ and absolutely love Manhattan's skyline. Go to the NY NJ Port Authority on 42nd Street and 8th Avenue in Manhattan, then hop a bus to Weehawken's "Boulevard East". Get off on or before the 3rd stop, then walk toward the skyline. It will blow you away!
A 4 am view. We sailed up the Hudson aboard Queen Mary 2 and had fantastic views of the skylane,quite breath taking.
Great view. Must visit once to see manhattan skyline.we went on a cruise to see the skyline n its a beautiful view .

The Skyline of all skylines!!. Breathtaking!
This is the skyline that beats the rest I have seen in my life; a must see in my book.

How many skyscrapers?. So so many different styles and we especially liked the Woolworth one near to Ground Zero. At night they take on a whole new meaning especially at this time of year - lit up for Xmas - deffinite WOW factor - take time to 'look up'
amazing time. great weather, interesting displays for the Thanksgiving day parade, good shopping bargains, history of the city and Central park

It's the #1 Must-See. New York is New York. There's something fantastic about seeing the skyline of such a large, resilient city. And honestly, there are so many places to see it from that you can't go wrong. Each offers its own unique view of the city that never sleeps, so just go ahead and choose one, then another, then another...you get the point. The greatest things in life are free, folks, and that includes this view.

Catches your eye. Always admire this creation of mankind - buildings, bridges etc. Watch from the Staten Island Ferry, from Brooklyn Bridge pedestrian path, from Brooklyn side of East River, and from NJ bank of Hudson.
From Empire State Building or Liberty Cruise. We took photos from the Empire State Building and from the 1 hour cruise past the statue of Liberty. They look like postcards.
Woow!!!. We saw the skyline both from the Broolkyn Bridge and from a boat at sunset. The two times, it was a real dream we lived with my wife. The view is very impressive !

Need we say more?. The skyline is great and best viewed by walking over the Brooklyn Bridge. It's interesting to see the construction of the "Freedom Tower" in the place where the twin towers used to stand.
Birthday treat 2012. Liked it all. Didn't like queuing at airport. Shopping very good. Food large portions but good. Like the Irish bars good atmosphere
Nothing else like it. No matter if you see it from a plane, nearby shoreline or in the heart of the city this is part of what makes NYC what it is. Not sure how you could miss it.
Wow. We took in the views of the Sky line from the front of the Staten Island ferry and also the Brooklyn bridge its really amazing.
Breathtaking. We loved everything about it and are looking forward to our 7th visit staying at the Hotel Pennsylvania
Saw from the water.. As the ferry goes by, it is challenging to pick off the famous buildings that we all know of New York. We also went under the Brooklyn bridge and George Washington.

DON'T MISS!!!. Great attraction in Manhattan, (and it's free) prepare your camera to shot great neighbourhood pictures, you have all you need(good restrooms, fine food), excellent organization, you can go (after or before) to the Matpacking Dt, Chelsea Market, etc

#1 of 618 attractions in NYC. There's a reason this is the #1 attraction in NYC according to TripAdvisor. Words fail. So many different moods according to the time of day, the weather, and your altitude. Spend a few extra bucks and find a hotel room that will give you a good view.
Huge City. All the rush all the time...busy busy busy. Always something going on. Night life is incredible. The night lights uptown are unbelievable
Fabulous!. Enjoyed the skyline from the River Cafe in Brooklyn and it was absolutely beautiful. My second time to River Cafe and the view is well worth the trip to Brooklyn.
Central Park Tranquility. A bucolic harbor in a sea of havoc. Tranquility throughout presides. Boating, ice skating, poets' lane, artists, musicians, the zoo are all captivating.
City lights. Very cool on the flight in, Roof top bar had great view of radio towers as the colors of the lights changed.
gramercy park view. was just like a tiny neighborhood in nyc. The area was quaint for the park right there. It is close to the subway so you can go anywhere

Wonderful City at Xmas time. Liked every experience, would advise to taxi Big Yellow Taxi Tours 'Hop on & Hop' off bus.
If you want to visit and view ground zero you must book a free place on line to get best viewing time if you are only in NYC for a short while.

Take the 3-hour Trip around Manhattan. There is no other place in the world with such a recognizable city landscape. Simply put... amazing! One of my most favourite things to do when I go to NYC is to take the Circle Line Tour around Manhattan. Most of the time the guide is very informative and a person comes away with a better understanding of the building of a city and a nation. I would recommend this trip after a few days of walking to see the sights as it is a good time to give your legs a rest and see NYC. You can get snacks, coffee and beer on the trip and mostly you can relax and enjoy yourself!

Worth the money. This was an amazing show. Hesitated to spend the $ for a family of 5. It was a highlight and don't miss. Be sure to get tickets ahead, as it's difficult to get discounted tickets day of.

Beautiful - As always. There's not much to say about the Manhattan Skyline that hasn't already been said a hundred times. It's iconic, it's beautiful and it always brings a tear to my eye when I see it for the first time on the way from the airport.
Visit the empire state as the sun sets!. Visit the Empire State building at sunset for amazing views of the city. Maybe just watch out for the wind if you're a little scared of heights.
lovely. great fun, it was something we didn't know about so we just went along because it was there, lovely to see all over the city of New York
fantastic by day and truly awesome by night. well worth a trip into Brooklyn at night, even if it's just for the view of the skyline as you're crossing the bridge
Beautiful. One of my favorite sights that has its own beauty and history, no other city can duplicate!!!! I believe everyone should go see this city at least once in their lifetime!!!!!
wonderful view from Top of the Rock & Empire State!. Definitely do both to get a good perspective..and also catch a cruise to get great pics from the Hudson and of the Statue of Liberty
Manhattan Skyline - a must!. Does not matter if you see it in daylight or at night, it still looks great and very iconic. Either take a cruise, the ferry or a trip to Brookland, do it!
sky high. Rockerfeller building best done at night and Empire State in the morning. If its windy you will feel the buildings moving which is very strange.
Brooklyn. I went to Brooklyn with the metro and saw the beautiful skyline from their. Then walked over the Brooklyn Bridge.. amazing view all those skyscrapers!!
Amazing. One of the most beautiful sights at sunrise, all through the day and at sunset. And once you think the view is going to fade on go the lights, teinkling against thw dark New York sky.
Awesome!. The Manhattan Skyline is definitely amazing from all angles. We enjoyed taking lovely photos at daytime, sunset and night time.

The best!. The best skyline in the world! Recommed a visit to the top of the Marriott Marquis Top of the View for drinks and a rotating view. Really enjoyed the view of the Empire State Building from Union Square as well.
Unbelievable sunset. We were on a tour and saw the skyline during twilight hours which was amazing! Got a few good photos as well :)
Stunning from all angles. Viewed from Top of The Rock, Empire State Building, Statue of Liberty Cruise, Brooklyn and from Transit Train from Newark airport it's a skyline that never disappoints.

Best viewed from the best borough. ...which is Brooklyn, obviously :-)
Seriously though, until recently I lived very close to the Williamsburg waterfront, and the view is amazing. Basically walk on N 4th or N 5th through the towers towards the water and there's a brand new boardwalk that goes for several blocks along the waterfront -- absolutely beautiful.
Breathtaking. We went to the top of the Rock, nearest thing to magic in real life, did Empire State Building on previous trip and felt exactly the same.
An humanity's icon. Well... I will leave the picture I took from the Brooklyn Bridge Park talk to me. It says better than a thousand words !!... wow !
Nothing comes close. Whether viewing it from the Empire State or Top of the Rock or just a slow night of inbound traffic on Manhattan Bridge, it's guaranteed to take your breath away.
New york. Amazing view from night tour bus empire state building night view is amazing.Shopping great and subway greatvservice
"What a view!". So very different than living in the country.. Amazing !!The architecture so varied .. modern and very old and ornate.
really. do you need this described. Whereever you see it it it's the best. Jersey, Bronx, etc it still is the jewel of the world

Looks pretty but Chicago is better. Saw the Skyline from several points - ESB, TOTR, Brooklyn Heights Promenade, Harbor Cruise. Sure is great to look. Amazing views from the top, esp. with lights. In spite of all these, Chicago looked better.
beautiful. beautiful! can't wait to go back! everyone should go see it! No dislikes about it. You will not waste time in seeing this.
30 Rock. Best view in NYC. We didn't think it would be worth the price but we had a great time. We bought tickets ahead and didn't have to stand in line.
Nice views. Good to see it from the ferry to liberty island. Famous skyline, must see! Can also been seen on the ferry to Staten Island.
Beautiful and Celestial. I love the Manhattan skyline. I moved from the Old South some years back and I fell in love with it instantly. I'm never moving back!
Beautiful!. We've viewed the skyline from the Brooklyn bridge and then again the following year from the Circle Line Boat tour. Both worth doing at least once.
WoW! It is truly amazing!. Beautiful! I love the view. It is very impressive. If you have never been, be prepared to lose your breath!

Never ceases to amaze!. The Manhattan skyline by day or by night never ceases to amaze, from any place and any perspective. From the 24th floor of a south facing hotel room on 10th Ave and 42nd st. to the airplane window on approach to LGA, no matter where, this iconic sight just can't be beat.

Lost for words. In 2005 I went to a function in the Rainbow Room of Rockefeller Centre, and spent a good portion of the evening with my jaw dragging on the floor at the view - Central Park out one window, The Empire State building out the other and the Chrysler Building off to one side. I've seen the skylines in Tokyo, Hong Kong, London and other places, but nothing has this impact: quite remarkable!

Great adaptation of an old railway line. Beautiful and sensitive adaptation of an overhead railway line. I was surprised to find absolutely no litter or rubbish anywhere. The views from the skyline are fabulous.

AMAZING from Jersey. Stay at the Sheraton Licoln Harbor - 250 dollars and you can get a panaramic room with the most amazing view of the skyline and it's only a 5 minute ferry ride to mid manhattan. Next time I will stay here my entire NY visit and ferry back and forth.
First glimpse. It doesn't matter how many times I go to New York, that first glimpse of the Manhattan skyline is still one of those pinch yourself moments!
Wonderful iconic skyline. This is a wonderful iconionc skyline famous throughout the world for obvious reasons..Hard to beat especially when viewed from the Statten Island ferry
Iconic!. What can I say? It's magnificent, especially from a high floor!I don't know what else I can say. It's certainly a familiar spot!
Spectacular. We took the hope on hope off bus and were able to enjoy this as an evening tour.. just spectacular. The lights, the tour guide.. all wonderful

What's Not to Like?. If you don't like the Manhattan Skyline, you must not have a soul. This has got to be THE most beautiful skyline in the world. It is something to see in photos but looking at it in person is breathtaking. Seeing the skyline from Brooklyn with the Brooklyn Bridge in the frame is absolutely fabulous because you can get the full effect that way. If you have never been to NYC, do yourself a favor and go. It's the best city in the world and there is no place like it.
Awesome!. You just gotta go see it. The views are incredible and so not like any other place we have visited. It was a brisk cold day but this shows Manhattan at its finest.
so beautifull. go to the top of the rock and empire state and have the tours, they are so interesting. The views are breathtaking. You get a sense of how big everything is here.
A must see!. The walk along the Brooklyn Bridge is a must! Be sure to go just before the sun goes down. It is quite a trek, so make sure you are wearing comfortable shoes.
Empire State Building. Yes it's touristy, but fun and going up around midnight does away with having to deal with crowds. What a View!
Beautiful site to see. Like no other a must see a true respect of the city,if you haven't see this skline I reccomend that you do you won't be sorry,hope this helps you decide.

A site never to forget. This was my third trip to New York - 1st time was in 2000 and saw view from Empire State Building - Amazing!!! 2nd time in 2009 saw skyline at midnight from ESB - Amazing!!! 3rd time saw skyline at night from "Top of the Rock" and saw the ESB lit up - Amazing!!!! Nothing to dislike at all.

Well worth seeing from several vantage points.. The Manhattan Skyline is most impressive when viewed from such vantage points as the Brooklyn Bridge, the Staten Island Ferry, the Empire State Building and The Goethals Bridge (by car).
Beautiful. Always wanted to do this and it was a beautiful day for it, highly suggest it, just watch out for the crazy man from Iowa with the rubber chicken lol
gorgeous everwhere don't pay. Love the different architecture and the old water towers. You don't have to pay to go up a building to enjoy it.

Loved it!. This was the Big Apple in all its glory - only 2 weeks after "Sandy" had left a trail of devastation across the eastern seaboard
Couldn't get enough of the high rises
We loved the skyline here at RCS Northvale. There is nothing like seeing the entire city. It is a favorite pastime for our office. Can't wait to do it again! Great ferry ride.

Free trip. We went on the Statton Island ferry - free !!! Very few things are free in this city, But what an experience and we will return.
The views and photograph opportunities were great. We used the bus to get to Battery Park.

Fantastic!! Which viewing point do you use?. Like the majority of posts on Tripadvisor we thought the views of the Manhattan skyline to be fantastic, the question is which one was the best?We walked to Brooklyn via the famous Brooklyn Bridge, we went to "Top of the Rock", the Empire State Building and Central Park. Then you have to ask, when do I go? At night or in the daytime? We saw several of these sights both night and day and enjoyed a different perspective.The winner for us was "Top of the Rock" closely followed by the night view from Brooklyn viewing Manhattan from the foot of the Brooklyn bridge, however we would recommend all of them.
from the top of the Empire State. went up at 4pm to make sure we saw the sunset. I vomitted due to the Skyride at the top - queue was very long to get in, clastrophobic in the lifts
Beautiful via 3 hour circle line. Its ALWAYS a must do when I am home in New York! I love the Circle line it gives you a true sense of New York City And the best view ever of the skyline
Spectacular. There's not much more I can add to comments already made, except that, to appreciate it's total beauty, you have to see it in person. Pictures and movies simply do not do it justice
New York Crown. We thought best views from New Jersey and Central Park.Circle Line Boat trip also gave us some wonderful sights.Walking over Brooklyn Bridge another aspect.

Beautiful. It was so much fun to enjoy the ferry ride and see the skyline, was also free. The boat ride to the island was really cool. You could be inside or outside, the wait was not long at all. I would do it again.
Great views. We did the boat tour in the day and a bus tour at night and got to experience it all seeing the great views all round of such a great place

Manhattan skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge. We walked across the Brooklyn Bridge, and had a fantastic view of the skyline at night. Really beautiful!! Worthwhile way to spend some time while visiting the city.

Excellent from the staten island ferry. It is about a 30 minute ride on the ferry and you have to get off and run through the termal to catch a ferry back. You do get an amazing view of the skyline and, of course Liberty. It gets very busy and is jam packed trying to get a good view.
new york. it is the most spectacular skyline lovely to look at both by day and night. would recommend going to the top of the rock as you can see the empire state building from it
Breath Taking. It has to be seen to be belived. We viewed it from the Top of the Empire State building and the top of the Rock.
Empire State Building is awsome. Going to top of EMpire State Building isn't as quick as it once was (before 911), but it is still a terrific experience, and look of the entire city

Visit to New York. Loved Ellens Diner on Broadway, A must. See the musical show free as you eat,
Take a bike ride through Centeral Park,
Get tickets to visit site of 7/11
Stay in the Wellington Hotel 7th Avenue, very clean, not modern but super location and cheap,
Fluffys diner next to Wellington Hotel 7th Ave, great cheap food
Not bad. Little it rough around the edged, but clean & only 10mins walk to Empire State, NBC studios, little further & your at Maceys. Close to buses. Situated just down from bells kitchen.

The best. The skyline of this city is a true testament to the best Nd most beautiful that we can Build.
It is amazing.
From Hoboken, the pictures are amazing

Try to view the skyline from a variety of locations....... We tried to see the skyline from several vantage points..... the Brooklyn Bridge area, the ferry to the Statue of Liberty, the Tram to Roosevelt Island and Roosevelt Island itself.... very enjoyable additions to the trip. The tram is part of the subway system so only costs a minimal amount and allows you to see the Midtown skyline which includes the Chrysler Building and the Empire State Building..... The free ferry to Staten Island allows wonderful views of the lower Manhattan skyline.

The view from the restaurant at the top of the Mandalay Peninsula 80 Columbus circle was fabulous. We had dinner at the Asiate Restaurant on top of the hotel and it was an amazing view. Dinner was Prix Fixe at $90 per but very good.
Empire State Building.. Go to the Empire state building and pay for the 102nd floor upgrade. It's a great way to see the city. Best time was at sunset- light was amazing

Eye Candy. The Manhattan skyline, along with Chicago's, is one of the great sights to see on a clear day. We spent many hours just walking around and viewing. Even though we go to NYC yearly and lived there many years ago, we are still awed by the views. For those really interested in the views, I strongly recommend going to the Brooklyn Heights esplanade and looking back. I also think a trip on the Circle Line is great. Finally, go at dusk to the Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center. This gives a great view from up high. Sunsets are great and you can get the Empire State Building in the picture.
modern metropolis. Well, it is a typical big city scene with a lot of things to do, catering to people of all ages and taste. However, other than that it is congested, hard to park, and pricey.
Cruised from New York. Cruising out of New York was simply the best way to see the skyline. Beautiful blue skies and a clear view of the entire skyline made for excellent photos.
Iconic and well worth it!. Truly a beautiful skyline full of gems! Building the Freedom tower at the moment, but still gorgeous!

Iconic, breathtaking, instantly recognisable. Possibly the most familiar sight in the western world, and, to our mind, best viewed from the Top of The Rock, from under the Brooklyn Bridge (River Cafe area) or from the Fruit Street promenade on the edge of Brooklyn Heights. Wonderful day or night!!! And FREE!!!!
Spectacular view. Got a great view of the skyline from many places on our trip. What a beautiful way to view NYC. Especially loved the view at night!

Skyline. Wow - we did a boat trip and saw the skyline, the Staten island ferry is free and you just go over and back, you see the statue of Liberty and the skyline.
Seeing the freedom tower standing out as a beacon of hope to all was a great sight to see.
amazing. you can choose the spirit cruise to see the skyline, during a nice dinner and a great DJ...it can be a little cold, but it really worth!
Always a welcome sight. Each time I return to NY having grown up here, I always feel exhilarated and amazed at the skyline, even as jaded as I am.
Hazy. Unfortunately in 9 days in New York we didn't see any sunshine so the view was hazy. The night sky was better because the lights travel

World's most impressive skyline. A bit of an odd thing for people to be able to review (it's not like there's a single lookout point or attraction), but Manhattan's skyline is world famous with good reason. Places like The View in the Marriott offer some impressive views from within the skyline. For the more adventurous, my two favorite lookout points are from Weehawken and the Kosciusko Bridge on the BQE.Note this is not a pedestrian bridge, so don't take your eyes off the road!

Legendary skyline. Get onto or over the water for the best views. We took the free Staten Island Ferry and walked over the Brooklyn Bridge. Do both! If you take the ferry, make sure you are not crowded out by others by standing outside or go downstairs depending upon the boat. You'll have to get off the boat before returning; you can get the next back, but may have to run! We also took the subway over to Brooklyn (Clark Street) and had a look around the neighbourhoods on the harbour's edge. Entry to the bridge is easy and it's a pleasant walk over, if a bit congested with other walkers and cyclists.

The best views of Manhattan are from the Empire State Building. If you want the full New York City experience, be sure to visit the Empire State Building! Bring your camera, a little patience and be sure to dress warm if you see it in the fall/wintertimes. If you like taking pictures this is definitely the spot for the best views of the city!
brooklyn coast. we hired a bike and made a trip over the manhattan bridge, along the harbor and had beautifull views over the city, skyline.
Must do whilst in New York. The skyline has transformed this disused train line into an urban, tranquil space for all to enjoy. Great walk and timeout from the craziness of New York City!

Greatest Skyline I have seen so far.. The view from the empire State building was just great. Breathtaking Skyline
Price was a little bit on the high side even compared with other skylines (chicago (17Dollars)) and Toronto.
Excellent view. Spent the night at the View restaurant in the Marriott Hotel @1535 Broadway. What a lovely romantic view. Dinner was great. Lamb chops was on the money. Definitely ready to go back.

A view worth the ferry to Staten Island for 2 minutes. We took the Ferry to Staten Island just for this view. And wow! It is just out of this world! Everything you imagine and more. Definitely worth going to Staten Island if only for that

The Manhattan Skyline was my back yard. My home town is Weehawken New Jersey. It happens to be the Best place from which to view theManhattan Skyline! Go Thru the Lincoln Tunnel to Weehawken and exit the helix at Boulevard East. Continue on that street toward the waterfront and Alexander Hamilton Park.(you will seea very long black picket fence. Park on the street and walk into the small park to see the most glorious view of New York City that you can see. A nigh time view is even more amazing! When I was very little, my Dad taught me the names of all the famous buildings and huge ships that came into the harbor. You will not be disappointed.Take a lunch and sit on a bench. It also happens to be the spot where Aron Burr killed Alexander Hamilton in a gun duel, if you are a historian.

Best skyline I have ever seen. It is best seen during the day from at least 2 places: a ship on the Hudson river or (partially)Central Park. During the night it is superb from the deck of Empire State Building.
Loved the skyline!. The manhattan skyline is amazing - we did a cruise around part of manhattan and the skyline looks amazing!
The View. The View revolving buffet restaurant at the Marriot hotel Times Square. great views over Manhattan by night.

Continues to be amazing. I love to just sit and watch the skyline at night. All of the activity and colors are amazing. We had a breat views from our balcony where there was an outdoor bar and restaurant....breathtaking.
Better than the I'd imagined. Seen the skyline in photos and movies, but in reality it surpassed everything I'd imagined. Can't recommend it highly enough.
Top of the Rock. Awesome view of the Empire State Building and the rest of the skyline. Well worth doing and bring quarters for the telescopes

A View From The Staten Island Ferry. As a native New Yorker, it seems like I have walked every street in lower Manhattan. The sights, sounds and aromas of the city never bore me. It is magic every time I go to the city. But for a unique way to view NYC, visitors should take the Staten Island Ferry to and from Staten Island. It is Free and offers great views of the city skyline, the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and the great Port of NYC. Whenever I am in the area, I hop of the ferry and make the return trip immediately. It takes a little over an hour but it is such a peaceful visual experience. A MUST for New Yorkers and visitors alike.

NY has it all!. Love it or hate it, that is Manhattan!Full of color, billboards, Broadway signs and the everyday hustle and bustle of a big city.You never feel too small in Manhattan as the city invites you to forget everything else and just wonder around exploring the amazing stores, restaurants, bars, and (few) monuments.As the entry gate for millions of immigrants in the past, chancing the American dream and the land of prosperity, this city makes you believe everything is possible.
Greatest man-made view in the world!. It's the best! See it from Weehawken, or from the entrance to the Lincoln Tunnel. Or the ferry. Worth the trip.

top of the rock. great views of the city from Rockefeller Center with the lower level shopping centers and Lego-land just across the square. Great buying for the grand kids. Lego-land displays are "out of this world" and a must see experience for all ages. Watch out for the Dinosarus
Forget the compass. Beautiful no matter which direction you look! The awesome skylight flickers, shimmers and awes. Welcome to Manhattan!

Mesmerizing. What blew me away on my first trip to NYC were two things: the awe inspiring view that the Manhattan Skyline gives you....both in the day and the night. And then, the engineering that went into creating the NYC subway system. The skyline is something you can sit there and stare at for hours on end.

Gives me a thrill every time. In my opinion, the best place to view the Manhattan skyline is from the East River Ferry. You are on the water, with outdoor option if it's not cold, and it's a bargain to boot ($4.00). North Williamsburg stop is home to everything hip, try one of the eclectic restaurants and shops!
Wonderful. Best free thing for a tourist to see. Easily viewed from many locations in Brooklyn. The Manhattan Skyline defines the city. It also keeps you out of Times Square / Midtown Area.

Tuesday night the Empire State Bldg was BLUE!. There is nothing like the NYC skyline. One great place to see it at night is from the Bklyn Prominade.
But as you come across the Tri Boro is also beautiful.
So great to see this for real.... You need to travel away from the hustle and bustle of Manhattan to enjoy this, but it's worth it. Take the ferry to Staten Island: inexpensive and a great trip.

one of the best experiences in my life. probably most of you dream about going to NY, and you should definitly visitit's big, beautiful and you realize how small and insignificant you really are.I was with my girlfriend and we had such a good time, manhattan is wonderful and full of different cultures which was a new thing for me since my home town isn't so large.
Right out the window. What a great city. From The Bentley Hotel a great open view is available from the higher floors. Try a down East River view.
The top of the Rock. No disappointment here. Get in the queue to get your allocated elevator time and then go and have a coffee until that reserved time. No hassle
Awesome. A total different view of Manhatten with amazing, awesome tall,tall, buildings against the sunlight.Nothing to dislike
Amazing. I was so amazed just to be there and look! really amazing view of an amazing city! It's beautiful during the day and night!
