Wonderful. We cruised out on the qm2 and the view was wonderful - Statue of Liberty one side, Manhattan the other and Brooklyn Bridge behind us!

Nothing like it in the world. The Manhatten skyline is the most beautiful when it comes to Bog City skylines. When the sun is shining just right, the city glistens like rays... at night, its a show of lights, especially times square
A great sky line.. It is strange that even a sky line can be an attraction, however NYC's sky line is so large you have to be impressed.

Great walk. Was a great walk that was made . It was a meat market run. We even saw a Wedding done on it outside and it was beautiful. Just love the city. We saw plants bird houses and a little of everything . Just so nice.
Try it you will like it .

See Central Park and northern Manhattan from the roof of the Metropolitan Museum of Art.. There is a (terribly overpriced) bar on the roof and the views and atmosphere are great. Don't miss this, especially if you are going to the Met anyway.

Sky crappers and blue sky mixed together shaping its exuberance. Exquisite!! Manhattan Skyline is unique, a city of multiculturalism show off it splendid!! Sky crappers and blue sky mixed together shaping its exuberance
Open top bus trip.. Some of the couriers spent time telling us about their personal experiences, instead of concentrating on the sights. Others were excellent and knowledgable
A view to equal Hong kong. See it from the top of the Empire State Building at night and the Statton Island Ferry. Plus from Brooklyn over the Bridge or from QM2 :)

approaching from Queens. Luckily we were first to the coach at JFK airport so we got this first view just before the Tunnel Amazing! Be warned most other seats are behind tinted windows - so push your camera against the glass; otherwise they act just like mirrors of the bus interior - not the outside world
Breathtaking.. One of the most iconic skylines in the world, this did not disappoint.We saw it from the Empire State Building and on the ferry to Ellis Island.

Skyline. It is just so pretty, night or day. Such great design in the architecture, not just a bunch of buildings that had to be put up over the years. And I always managed to find my old friend, The Chrysler Building, no matter where I was.
Fantastic. What more can you say: for an English couple from a sleepy village it is awesome! Best view from free ferry to and from Staten Island
Breathtaking!. The view from the top of the Empire State Bldg as well as the Top of the Rock are amazing! Loved every minute of our trip to NYC and can't wait to go back.
There is nothing like it!. And glad to see that with the progress of the Freedom Tower, it is getting its old allure back, like it was when the World Trade Cetre was still there.

Lion King was excellent. Look at the othe shows before reserving tickets.. The theatre experice was like no other when you are sitting in the audience compared to what you see on television. It's a must see I wasn't disappointed one bit.
On the cheap views. My favorites are the Roosevelt Island Tram and the Staten Island Ferry. Great views for little or no cost.

Nothing like it. If possible, try to stay in a place where you can see the Manhattan skyline. Fortunately, we stayed on the 27th floor of a building with lots of windows. It was such a treat to be able to fall asleep while looking at the skyline every night.
There is such a thing as a free view. Of course you have to get to New York first, but you can just gaze at the skyscrapers for hours, and for free !

Wonderful & Mesmerizing. It will truly take your breath away! One of the best skylines in the world! We visited the Top of the Rock observatory and the views are for miles! I highly recommend! A must see!
Awesome. A must see place, it's where one turns into a kid again, so much to do and see, best place un the world and I'm going back in 5 weeks for Christmas and new years

Fabulous. We went on a 3 day bus tour that you could jump on a off whenever you wanted and going over to Brooklyn and looking back at the Manhatten skyline is something you just have to do. It's like a film set all lit up. Fabulous and a must do if you are going to New York.
sky. the city is full of sky scrapers, it is hard to see the sun even in the mid day, but if you go up one of them or have look at them from far away you will like to view.
Grey Line Brooklyn night tour. Well worth the money, travel over the Brooklyn bridge to see Manhattan from the other side of the East river at night
Amazing!. See it from the top of the Rockerfeller Tower...less busy than trying to get up the Empire State Building

Fantastic. The Manhattan skyline - WOW!!!! you could never get sick of this as there is just so much to see and many different ways of seeing it!!! Top of the Rock for me was probably best although we did a private ferry too!! TAlso the Empire State Building at Sunset (although if i do it again for sunset it will be at the Rockerfeller as like sardines in a tip and not nice) From Top of the Rock you can see right back to Harlem past Central park (north) and south to Statue of Liberty and basically the whole of Manhattan plus all the bridges!!! You can gaze for hours!!! Highly recommend Top of the Rock for this!!!
Breathtaking. We went up Rockafellerto see it which was great as it meant you got to see the Empire State building also

Of course its the best. Ok, maybe Hong Kong could take NYC, I haven't been there yet, but when I do visit HK I will see if I can write an updated review. Anyways, NYC's skyline is awesome. So huge, so many buildings, and I don't know why but I love the old school architecture with its emphasis on stone over glass and steel. Of course there is a lot of glass and steel in NYC too.Some other buildings around the world are nice, like the Petronas Towers, but in terms of an entire skyline, I'd say NYC takes the cake!
it looks even better then the posters. took a helicopter ride from down-town near the statsen island ferry it was amazing would highly recomend it .
From Staten Island Ferry. This tour is FREE, and the sights magnificent..esp at sunset, as the lights come-on within a wall of skyscrapers
Just like the movies!. Loved everything about it especially the Chrysler building. Take one of the open top bus tours to truly appreciate it.
Beautiful, stunning, breathtaking, worth the trip. I loved the whole experience, visited the Empire State Building and did a lot of shopping - very clean.
Best in the World. Do I really need to say more? The absence of the Twin Towers still brings a tear to my eye but the NYC skyline is the most breathtaking in the world.
Great. We bought a New York pass before we left NZ- so this event was free but it was a good 30 minutes of entertainment.
nice to see. it is what it is - a path above manhattan - nothing more nothing less. Its was a rainy day when I went so not enjoyable

Manhattan Skyline. Manhattan Skyline is still the best there is. Nothing in U.S. or Europe can compare with the sheer majesty of the same. Even given the tragedies which have occurred there 11 years ago and just a few days ago, it is what folks think of when they think of the USA.

Picture postcard. If you go to New York this tour is a must. Manhattan lit up at night I would consider as one of the wonders of this world. Not much to dislike apart that it was a bit cold out in the Hudson river.
It was truly beautiful!. Loved being here for the very first time! Was able to see most of the highlights in 3 days. Would come back!

Night view. check out empire state building at night! It was so quiet and peaceful. people kept their voices down. I loved the art deco and the fact that the 30's/40's atmosphere was retained. It is a little pricey.
Fun City. Brilliant city to visit - very fast and friendly lots to do and would recommend seeing Empire State at night and Rockefellow during the day
what a view. amazing vision of Manhattan from the Staten Island ferry and from DUMBO as well as Brooklyn heights promenade. Breathless views.

Cruises to Liberty Island, Spirit Cruises for dinner Staten Island Ferry for sunset. all of the above not to be missed for the experience and for the photos or video. Each are very well organized, don't let long lines intimidate you, moves right along and on time.

It neer gets old. No matter where or when I see my city shining, I am moved to tears. Flying in from out of town, approaching on top of a tour bus over the Manhattan Bridge, standing on Top of the Rock, perched on the overlook at Amsterdam Avenue and 145th Street, whereever, this is one gorgeous looking city.
Beautiful. Stunning view both at night and during the day . The view from the hotel was the best so much to see
BEAUTIFUL!!!!. It was breathtaking both daylight and at night! Saw it on several tours we took by boat and it's a MUST see!
Must see.. Just amazing. To get the entire aspect, take a boat cruise down the Hudson. Really get a good view all around and see how big it is. Also you can see the Statue of Liberty

fantastic views !. the manhattan skyline is breathtaking and especially the best time is during the sunset and then the lights glow up the entire skylne views ! its amazing to see, just that the weather can be a spoil sport if you on a high rise like, top of empire state or rockafellar ! but there are free views from either the pier or the free ferry to liberty statue..

As good as advertised... One of the many great things about NYC is the collection of amazing construction magic, both past and present. The skyline is one view but there is structural 'eye candy' everywhere. Being a photographer wanna-be, I never tire of seeing the colors and shapes at different times of the day. Many great cities are like this.

IT DOESN'T GET ANY BETTER THAN THIS. It's there, and it's free. Enjoy it! My favorite view is straight up 5th looking from the Village to the Empire State Building, but the skyline is the skyline is the skyline, and it's amazing.
second best skyline in the U.S.. The view from the Top of the Rock is amazing. Beautiful! The skyline from Staten Island is also worth the ferry trip.
Breathtaking. Night time views are breath taking no matter where you view them from especially along the waterfront
Not to miss. The Manhattan skyline is an item of wonder. it ranges from midtown with uptown and a portion of buildings at the southern end.

Very good based at Empire State Building so buy combo. very good. did make some of the party feel sick its like a rollercoaster - the children loved it. much cheaper than taking a helicopter over the city.In the ride the helicopter expierences problems and you crash into buildings etc... then you go on a rollercoaster. Its much cheaper to book and do both empire state and skyline on the same day, singularly the skyline is $19 adults book online.

Awesome!. You think you have seen the Manhatten skyline at night as its iconic and on lots of photos but until you have seen it at night for 'real' you haven't seen it at all. We took a World Yacht evening dinner cruise and it was well worth the money and has provided us with amazing memories that will live on and on.
Fantastic views. Lived up to expectations, viewed from Brooklyn and also Staten Island Ferry (Free). Viewed from above at the Top of the Rock - less frantic than ESB.

Do a Manhattan Cruise. Be sure to do the 3 hr circle cruise of Manhattan. Whether you're a first timer or have been to NYC before, it is a great way to see the city and really appreciate the size of Manhattan in particular. The view of the architecture and landmarks is unsurpassed.

Get it for free. I took the Staten island ferry - its free - and they run every 20/30 minutes across to the island.The journey itself is about 20 minutes and provides some great photographic opportunities from the ferry.On landing at the ferry terminal there are a range of sandwich/ drink shops not too many but enough to provide a choice. On exiting the Terminus there are 2 viewing areas that provide stunning views of the skyline, one elevated - with numerous benches to sit and have a picnic/ relax.Also provides a the opportunity to look around the island.Return trip provides more photographic opportunities including the statue of Liberty on both legs of the trip.The ferry terminus in Manhattan is next to Battery Park and opposite the oldest house in NY, so another tourist experience availble
Visit NY. Empire State Building at night!!! WOW Great photographic opportunities. Meet new friends. So many lights.

BEAUTIFUL DAY OR NIGHT. The Manhattan skyline is very nice to look at because it is on the island of Manhattan. There are many places to view the skyline as well as the Circle Line, a boat that goes around the skyline, the Staten Island Ferry, a fairly lg ferry boat that departs from lower manhattan every 30 min., and the Spirit of New York dinner up scale boat, (buffet dinner will range $65 ea. Other viewing spots are in Brooklyn, the Brooklyn Promenode in Brooklyn Heights, Brooklyn. You ae sure to enjoy the view any place.

Love this view. The Manhattan Skyline have to been seen both from New Jersey side and the Brooklyn side. It is a historic view and it is in constant chance do to the construction work taking place on Manhattan.

WOWWWWWWWWWWW !!!!!!. I truly believe that every person on earth should go to New York City at least once in their lifetime. . . . . And part of that experience should be to walk the Brooklyn Bridge, head to Dumbo down by the east River and marvel at that amazing skyline of Manhattan. By day it's wow, but by night it's Wowoweewah !!! Truly a sight to behold.
Unforgettable. I have been to New York on a number of occasions and never tire of the skyline. Fantastic! Great from the Circle Line boat tour.
Amazing views from Top of the Rock. The best unobstructed view was from Top of the Rock but the Empire state is definitely worth going to as well just for the architecture.
Day & Night. Viewed the skyline at night from The Rock and day from the Empire State. Both awesome - get the audio tours.

Use the Grayline hop on hop off bus.. Explanations on these tours add to first visits and tickets can last fior 3 days. Grayline is roofed and has vision form downstairs - helps you see the shops and avoid rain. You can't get off at night - for safety. (We used another service).
Get above street level. Wonderful way to see New York from a different aspect. Easy to get to and a delight to walk along the length of the skyline.
spectacular 180 degree views. The skyline from the Empire State Building is amazing. You can see the skyscrapers, East River, Hudson River, Statue of Liberty, Roosevelt Island and more.
30 Rock vs Empire State. 30 Rock has a much better view, but visiting the Empire State is pretty awesome... So if you MUST choose, go with 30 Rock.
you cant beat it. walk across Brooklyn bridge and see if from the middle, free from statten island ferry or from liberty / ellis ferry for $17
See it from the Brooklyn Bridge or a helicopter. Nothing quite like these views anywhere else. Walk the bridge for free and save up for the helicopter - it's worth it.
Beautiful. Make sure you stay up at night & go to a rooftop bar & enjoy the views. The rooftop bar @ the Hilton Fashion District was very relaxing with awesome views.

Thrilling view of the city. A simulated ride that gave a presentation of the city from a view within a helicopter cockpit. Free entry if you have purchased the New york city pass. You can then go onto the observation deck of the Empire State building
nothing like it. There is nothing like the NYC skyline! The Chrysler Building, The Empire State Building, great pre-war residential buildings on the upper east side, and now a Frank Gehry building.
Iconic. Seen from the Top of the Rock it's the best city view on the planet. The whole NY experience is like being on a giant movie set.
It's really good reviews. Manhattan skyline is really amazing. I never thought a place can be such more high buildings. Also the skyscrapers rears high into sky.
Unbelievable. From the Empire State building - gorgeous! Buildings as far as the eye can see - amazing by night too!
Night time view. The night time view of Manhattan from the Hudson is very different from the day.Especially the landmark towers of Empire,NBC and FreedomTower
not to be missed. Great venue and show.We are not fans of Franki Vally,but this did not matter.The colour and singing were fantastic

Nice. What can really be said about the skyline that has not already been said.
I can atleast say this: Go see it when you can.
Excellent. Stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel and they have a roof bar, extremely pleasant and refreshing after a long day in the city!!

Top of the Rock. Go to the Top of the Rock or the Empire State Building for a great view of the city! Even if it's cloudy, it's worth the wait. Don't buy tickets from vendors on the street, as they'll rip you off.
A unique skyline. Try to see this from any vantage point on a clear night it is truly unique. Try 'Top of the Rocks', a boat trip or even the view from Jersey City. Its magical.

NYC view. Circle line tours at 42nd St pier has excellent boat trips aound the island of Mahattan. Nice perspective and good especially on warm days.Great camera opportunities incliding the statue of Liberyt etc.

Nothing like it! Wow. This is an iconic American city. When you actually get to see this view in person ~ it is truly incredible. You just can't help but fall in love.We took a 3 hour circle line cruise around the whole of Manhattan Island our first day in town. I highly recommend this is you have the time (there are shorter versions, but they don't take you around the whole island). We came away really having a much better comprehension of the layout of the city and where we needed to head next. Our tour guide also shared a great deal of history and wonderful interest notes in a uniquely humorous manner.It is NYC! No place like it.
WOW. Best from the liberty island, breathtaking views, and very nice pictures, dont miss it. But avoid windy days, it was chilling that day, so we appeared shivering in all photos :)
Majestic view. Was able to see the Manhattan skyline from multiple points and each had it's own charm and beauty. New York City is the happening place and you can see anything and everything there.

More Than Awesome View. The impact of seeing the city from Top Of The Rock is unexplainable. It's breathtaking!! I recommend getting the audio tour. There is so much history that we don't think about so to hear it was very interesting.
Magnificent views. View from the Rockefeller tower was amazing at night despite having to queue for an hour. The lights of Manhattan were extraordinary.

One of the best skylines in the US. The Manhattan skyline is one big art museum of great skyscrapers. I really liked it. The only dislike is the traffic on the streets below. But, it's NYC, so it's par for the course.
Great View. THis is the best skyline in the world. You can see it from almost any viewpoint in the city. Or - take the ferry to NJ

One of a kind. I have grown up looking at the Manhattan Skyline. It has always been special to me-moreso after 9-11. It's beautiful, evocative and should not be missed by anyone who comes to this area.

BREATH TAKING ESPECIALLY AT NIGHT.. Amazing. I saw it multiple times on the circle line cruise and from the top of the rock. I've been wanting to come to NYC since forever and for me to finally see everything I saw in the movies/tv shows was awesome:)
Greyline NIght Tour and water taxi. So glad we waited until the evening to see the NYC skyline and statue of libery. It was breathtaking.
Amazing. Loved every minuite of New York the skyline is amazing, go to the Staten Island Ferry for a free trip.
Empire State. I love it ,and to be in New York and do not visit this building is like living in Miami Beach and do not swiming

MANHATTAN, NY - not anything as expected!. Manhattan is one of the most refined cities (YES refined). The people are wonderful. Classy all the way. We travelled from Washington State for a wedding. Stayed 6 days. The night after we arrived we did a 3 hour "night lights of NYC". Next day did a 6 hour "premimum tour of NYC". In those 9 hours we saw everything there is to see. They also included 2 boat cruises.The Statue of Liberty & Ellis Island are awe inspiring. Ground Zero at first was a let down then realized it is meant to represent rebirth of a city & continuing on which it does. A carriage ride through Central Park was great. Two things very obvious - NYC loves their Yankees, John Lennon & Mayor Giuliani. We were lucky to see a few celebrities just walking down the street. They smiled & waved. Just going about their business. The people are so beautfiul everywhere you turn you wonder who you are seeing & just dont recognise. The food is outstanding - ANYWHERE.. Hells Kitchen is unbelievable. Found 2 wonderful lounges - one in the Marriott Hotel looking down at Time Square. The other next to Centeral Park in the Columbia Mall (Time Warner Building). It had the most amazing view of the park & the edge of tall buildings surrounding it. Such a contrast. Relaxing to sit & have drinks at both. I LOVE NYC. It should be a must see for everyone. Just as important to older children to have on the bucket list as Disneyland. Its the real deal folks.

Simply beautiful!. This is like no other skyline in the world, especially at night. Try to get up high somewhere, or else save a little time as you descend into the Lincoln Tunnel to shoot some photos. (Stay in the left-hand lane if you are going to do that.) It is worth the visit!
Dont miss!. There are many cities, big cities, beautiful cities, but there is no city in the whole world as beautiful as New York at night! Dont miss out on that!
High Standard. Other places may have taller edifices but for sheer density no one can match the Manhattan Skyline from any angle.

View at sunset the best. We took the Staten Isl. ferry at 5pm to get a great view of the NYC skyline basked in sunlight. what a sight...and the ferry is free. also passes by the statue of liberty..new WTC buildings are going to be awesome when they are done
Nice. Best from Brooklyn Bridge. Walk from Brooklyn when sun is downing. Be careful, there are several bicycles on the Bridge.
One of a kind. New York City skyline is like the sky on a summer evening. Every light is the light of a separate world and the panorama is strewn with lights!

Skyline of New York City. The view is awesome from the ferry to Staten Island (free). The skyline and the Statue of Liberty are clearly visible. Pictures are easily taken from the ferry and the double-decker, hop-on, hop-off buses.

Helicopter agogo!. Twelve minutes in the air at around £100 per person( that includes the heliport fee) sounds alot but trust me its totally worth it! And i was nervous of doing it! Have no regrets at all, experience of a lifetime! View was out of this world!

Great from all aspects. Highlights being the skyline, brooklyn bridge and statue of liberty from our Circle Line Cruise.
Although loved the view of Central Park from Top of the Rock too.
Staten Island Ferry Ride. Great way to see Statue of Liberty and the NY City SkylineLiked the fact that there was no charge. It was hectic boarding but, went surprisingly fast.
Manhattan. Enjoyed all the sites we came to see. Fount the subway an excellent way to get where we wanted to go fast and reccommend the "Metro Card".
Amazing views. The best skyline in the world, you can view it from the Brooklyn bridge or from the ferry to the Statue of Liberty, either way it's a fantastic view.

What you see is what you get.. It is exactly the way it looks in pictures, probably a bit better in real life, and even better when you are amongst the buildings looking up. This is an experience one has to see atleast once in a lifetime. If possible, make sure you go here when your boss is paying, the hotel rates can pretty exhaustive.

Breath-taking in a weird, man-made sort of way. I'm a nature lover and didn't think I'd enjoy seeing so much concrete. Nor did i think it could be pleasing to the eye, but I was wrong. Everyone has to see the Manhattan skyline just once in their life. Truly inspiring to see the man-made beauty of the buildings. Our favorite views were from...the Staten Island Ferry, Central Park sheep meadow and the Brooklyn Bridge
See the skyline from the water. The view from the water is outstanding. Take a harbor cruise or a water taxi to get the full effect.

City who never sleeps, city you love. If you never been there, you've seen it in the movies. If you have been there, you know that New York is one of the worlds amazing cities. Even the skyline has changed a bit, you will never forget it. It's only the angle that changes...

WOW. Totally amazing views from Boat Trip, Top of the rock & Empire State.Be prepared, decide before you go what you want to see. My daughter planned & booked everything, I received an Itinerary! Best way to do it, we didn't miss much.DO NOT UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCES GET THE AIRPORT SHUTTLE BUS. IT TAKES 3 HOURS FROM TIMES SQUARE TO JFK!! Pay a few dollars more for a cab!

2 hour boat trip with Circle Line. We took the Habor Lights Cruise and watched the sunset and tha Manhattan Skyline ! We came by all the important things, Statue of Liberty, Brooklyn Bridge, United Nations...

Unmissable Views!. We stayed in New Jersey rather than NYC so we got to see the skyline in the daytime and the night time from the harbour in NJ, absolutely stunning, so peaceful and relaxing to just look at!

Transformed at Night. Sorry to say we were not impressed by day. We saw it first on a Circle Line tour and enjoyed this way of seeing the famous skyline but found many of the buildings plain slabs or even quite ugly and the list of celebrities who lived in some of them very boring. However, by night was a different story. Viewed first from the Top of the Rock it was magical and remained an exciting view throughout our trip by boat or on land.

Breathtaking. Viewed the skyline from the observatory decks of the Empire State Building and the Rock but still cant get enough of it. Viewed it again from a different perspective in a two-hour half-circle cruise on a clear day. The view was breathtaking. The cruise is a must for visitors who want to be familiarized with key sites and structures. How I wish I had time to get the night view from the observatory decks.
Simply breath taking. Just such a beautiful sight to see I suggest everyone gets a chance to see this. I get to see this everyday.
Top of the Rock. Best way to see the New York skyline. Liked everything from the short lines to the fabulous views, go a little before sunset so you get both daylight view and night view.
Awe Inspiring. Should be on everyones bucket list! Saw it from the water taxi during the day then at night time walked the Brooklyn bridge to view it again. Such an amazing view.
Wonderful. Wel this is world famous so what do I have to add. We were stunned by the sky line, New York is a busy city yet keeping its charm and Manhattan adds to the charm I would say,
Circle Line night cruise. We took a night harbour cruise as part of our City Pass. Wow! What an amazing city and especially beautiful at night.
Amazing!. Loved the view from boat trip around all of manhattan and also great view from Brooklyn. Highly recommend checking it out!
A night time must!. The skyline comes alive at night with the beauty of the lights. Especially lovely from any bridge looking over at the skyline.

SUNRISE OVER THE CITY. We were returning from a week long Carnival Cruise to Boston, Portland ME, St. John's New Brunswick and Halifax, Nova Scotia. While standing on the balcony of our stateroom, I observed a beautiful sunrise over Manhattan. Took advantage of the timing to see the city from a different perspective. Being a "Jersey Girl", have been in the city many times, but have never seen a sunrise, let alone from this vantage point. Met several travelers on this cruise who were seeing New York for the first time, and realized how fortunate we are to live so close to this magnificent city!

Nice walkway. Perfect for a Sunday afternoon stroll, if the weather is good.Great for people watching, too! It was a little busy the afternoon we were there, but we had a good time listening to the street musicians and enjoying the sights.

Jersey side!. Go to New Jersey to see the NYC skyline at night!!! Really worth it!!! Lots of park settings along the water for a great view.Dislike...travel.... however travel by bus seemed to be fine.

No skyline better!. Go on the Harbour Lights cruise at night to see the sky line lit up and Statue of Liberty at night! It is 2 hours and you can stay inside the boat for warmth or outside or even stand on the bow!

Amazing. Well, what can you say? It is the iconic view that most people think of when they think of an American city.If you look at at from a cross the Hudson at the Liberty Park (which is also a very cool place) you can see the skyline in one direction and the Statue of Liberty of to your other side. Not a bad view!
Iconic. It seems to get better every time I see it. Best viewed from the river - the free Staten island Ferry or one on the many cruises arounf Manhattan

See it at night!. We did a boat trip in the evening and nothing beats seeing the whole of Manhattan lit up - its amazing. We also took the tube over to Brooklyn in the evening so we could see the Manhattan skyline from there - recommended
Magical Manhattan. Unbeleivable skyline seen from a boat trip from the West Pier at night. Better than expected, truly magical and all those people still working in the lighted buildings!
Top of the Rock. Excellent views of the city skyline. Great photo opportunities. Take a wind jacket and use sun cream on a hot day
Best place to view from. best place to view from - either the train on the way into Penn Station or on the Staten Island Ferry
WHAT A VEIW. You should really take a boat ride to experience this. We were on the greyline boat tour. You just can't even imagine how large this city untill you actually are there.

Just fantastic!. The old, the new, the modern, the art deco, the lights, the people, the parks, the energy, yes it's just a city, but it's BIG!!! and BUSY!!! Can't wait to go again and see what we missed. 6 days is just not enough, you need at least 10 days to visit and enjoy every area.
Fantastic View 360. Recommend going to The Empire State Building for a great view of the entire city. Go early in the day to avoid the lines.

Doesn't disappoint. You don't get over this view from no matter what angle. Make sure you see it from the Hudson River, Empire State Building and Top of the Rock - it is amazing. Also - make sure you see it both during the day and at night. We went to the top of the Empire State at about 10.30pm - there were no crowds and the view was amazing. Don't be fooled - the whole island isn't covered in skyscrapers - but this adds to the effect of seeing the Empire State Building, the Freedom Tower and the Rockefeller Centre.

I MARVEL, EVEN SEEING IY EVERY DAY. A phenomenal view and truly awe-inspiring. The constant change in the skyline with the addition of old buildings and vacant sites making way for the new gives the feeling that this skyline is a living entity. The Freedom Tower as it rises at the southern tip is another demonstration of the tenacity of the New Yorker and the will to move forward.
Still NY. There are taller buildings in Shanghai and Dubai. But no city has the scope of high rise buildings, along with iconic ones from the early 20th century, that can match NY.

Best viewing places for the Skyline. Everybody knows what we are talking about. You've seen Manhattan Skyline in movies, on posters and pictures. Now if you are in New York, you need to know WHERE to go for the best shots, best views... My friends are so grateful when I take them out from the busy Times Square, crowded streets and superficial paid tours and show them where the best views of this great City can be caught.Of course, you can see the best on a clear day from the airplane before landing or right after departing, and also there's a breathtaking view from my apartment. But since I can not invite you all in my house, here are some great insider tips to see the best of New York's famous skyline. It has 2 parts: Downtown and Midtown & Upper Manhattan.The Downtown Skyline is amazingly viewable from Brooklyn Bridge Park (down under Brooklyn Bridge and Manhattan Bridge, in DUMBO, Brooklyn). Take A or C to High St. or F to York St and have a walk down to the park. (yes, there is also a bus, but don't be lazy, this new sparkling neighborhood worth to be seen). You can also see Downtown Skyline from the Staten Island Ferry (it's a free ride) or Statue Cruises Ferries ($17).Midtown is visible even from Lower Manhattan, from New York Marina (have a walk along the East River Park at around 23rd St, you can get here by M23 an M34 buses as well), but the best view is, of course from across the river, from Queens. Long Island City piers are just as amazing, just like the recently finished Williamsburg piers in Brooklyn. To get to LIC just take the 7 train to Vernon-Jackson, and again, don't be lazy to have a walk all the way down to the park. The now highly rated out-of-Manhattan neighborhood is just amazing.You can pay for a tour at Rockefeller center, on 86th floor's Top of the Rocks or just visit Empire State Building.If you insist to visit my house...all right, that's OK, I hear you. Just call ahead... I have to clean the dishes... :)Enjoy New York! Doesn't matter which Season, what kind of weather. New York is Stunning!

Not to be missed!. We were lucky to visit NYC when the visibility was good (late September 2012), so had plenty of opportunities to see the beautiful skyline. We went up both the Empire State Building (early morning) and Top of the Rock (just before sunset). Both were quite expensive and fairly crowded, but worth the hassle because of the views. On balance if I had to choose one, I'd go for ToTR, which is slightly more civilised, and which as a view of ESB! However, you will get a better view of the Chrysler Building from the ESB.However, there are plenty of places to get good and cheap (or free) views. Try going across Brooklyn Bridge and seeing the views from Brooklyn. Take the free Staten Island Ferry and get great views of Manhattan (and the Statue of Liberty) across the water. Go on the aerial tramway to Roosevelt Island - and walk along the western bank to get great views of the Empire State and Chrysler Buildings between other residential skyscrapers, as well as the UN Building.You must not visit New York City without searching out some good views of the iconic skyline!

from the park underneath the Brooklyn Bridge. from the park underneath the Brooklyn Bridge, accessed either by walking over the Brooklyn Bridge (the hard way) or taking the East River ferry that picks you up at a couple of points in Manhattan, and drops you at the park. Best viewed/photgraphed at daybreak on the first day there, when your up at 5.00am because of jet lag.
Great Skyline but not the best. Yea not the best, places like Dubai have raised the bar higher. But the walking around is much enjoyable
Wonderful. Take the open topped bus downtown loop tour for the experience of being in amongst the skyscrapers. If you want to see it from the river take the free Staten Island Ferry
Go to Brooklyn. Brooklyn is your best view IMO. Walk the bridge. It's AWESOME, great views. Watch out for cyclists however and bring your camera!
Beautiful!. There's not much more to be said about the Manhattan skyline that has not been said before. It is stunning, amazing and truly breathtaking.

Manhattan Skyline. It's as good as all the films, tv programmes and photos you see, if you can find a decent vantage point....usually you have to go as far away as Brooklyn to get a good view but it is well worth it at nite.

Amazing. This was one of the best things about visiting New York. You have to do it! See it at night and during the day. For the night experience I would recommend Grayline Bus Tours (Night Tour which including Brooklyn). For the day I would recommend travelling to Brooklyn by subway (ensure you do on a clear sunny day).

Love it.. Hard to navigate and bad for cell reception but nothing like it anywhere else in the world. I enjoy early in the morning jogs as the streets transition from dimly lit by street lamps to crisp mornings with the opening of businesses and the growing bustle of people rushing off to work...
Surreal!. Great during the day and at night! I took pictures during the day from the Statton Island Ferry and t night from the top of the Rockefeller Center! Amazing!
See it atop a bus at night. Took an open night bus trip to brooklyn and back across the bridge in summertime. A beautiful sight and interesting outing.

Stunning. I was really surprised at how emotional it made me feel to see the skyline come into view from our ship. I know "iconic" is a word that's wearing a bit thin from overuse now, but I can't think of a better one to describe this beautiful skyline
Its just like the post cards. the best way to see the skyline is by the ferry that takes you to see the statue of liberty, its a sight to behold

breathtaking. we have seen thsi from different views but the best must be from taking the east river ferry terminal 34 street down to brooklyn bridge..when leaving 34 street you rid estraight acroos the river giving incredible view of upper manhatten (empire state building chrysler bulding trump towers rockafeller building united nations) Then traveling down the east side of manhatten island as you go underneath the williamsburg bridge you wiil see an amazing view of the financial district highline buildings,,Stopping off at brooklyn bridge you will then ahave fantastic photo opportunities from accross the bay.All this ffor an incredible $4 per person .
Superb. I loved the new buildings and the new towers. I saw new buildings and they looked magnificent at night time

Stirring. The Manhattan skyline evokes a sense of lost nostalgia. Looking at it for the first time in person as I approached on the Staten Island ferry awoke a certain reverence as I saw the continued construction of the new world trade center tower and gazed over to the gaping hole in the sky adjacent to the rising cranes.The skyline tells the story of the city's past both recent and prehistoric and is an open book for anyone willing to read it's pages.
Sparkling. Amazing experience, see it from Brooklyn after walking the Brooklyn bridge, sparkling at night like a jewel.

Unforgettable. As we love NY very much, we always go to enjoy this breathtaking moment. A moment when you have a whole skyline of this amazing city right in front of you. Absolute must of every our visit to big apple.
Amazing views. Coming from London, UK, this city is unlike no other and the views are amazing!! I have never seen so many skyscrapers in one place!

Big city bright lights. The Manhattan skyline is amazing. See it from a rooftop or from Brooklyn to appreciate it the most. A clear night will give you the best results but either way it is still captivating.

NYC overflight at night ... diamonds. On my last flight into LaGuardia our landing was delayed and we had to spend an hour flying low and slow, back and forth over New York. It was perfect. My window seat allowed a panorama of diamonds and it was free. I don't know how you plan that but it sure was a show.
AWESOME!!. Even in the low clouds the Manhattan skyline was awesome. We viewed it from the Top of the Rock, from the Brooklyn Bridge and from a night bus tour. Spectacular!!!

AWESOME!. We thought that the view from our 41st floor hotel room was fantastic but when we saw it from the Top of the Rock well................................ AWESOME! This however doesn't beat your first view of this famous skyline when you are travelling from JFK towards the Manhatton tunnel on the freeway.
Manhattan Skyline is always impressive. I live in Manhattan, so see the skyline all the time, and never get tired of it. Enjoy it both during the day, and at night with all the buildings lit up.

The ci. The city has some of the most beautiful buildings, there is an electrifying and worldy feeling just walking aroun the financial distric or Time Square.The view from Top of the Rock at Rockefeller center is spectacular!The upper east side where we stayed was very lovely with different type of architecture very lovely, the area around The MET Museum and Central Park is totally beautiful.

Majestic charm. We experienced the skyline from various viewpoints and we loved all perspectives - from ferry to staten island , dumbo Brooklyn area, top of the rocks and the empire state - we never tired of it majestic charm
Always nice to see!. Best place to see it? Hoboken, NJ for sure. Take the PATH train from Manhattan to Hoboken and enjoy the view!
is there another city on earth that compares?. I have been to quite a few world cities. and still not found anything comparable to NYC. big cities have 100's of builds. NYC had 1000's

Great free activity, another perspective of the city. This was a neat vtivity to do, you get to see another comp,ete perspective of the city and how the buildings have de eloped over time. The use of the space is a real credit to those who came up with it. It was very popular the day we we t and allowed a breather from the hussle. Toilets and a few refreshment stalls located half way along it.
Very cool. Great to see the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge, or the top of Rockefeller, or from the Empire State building.
A nice walkway. this old train rail converted to a very nice walkway you can go there anytime. it might be a little windy over there...
Night tour on outdoor bus. The trip at night was wonderful, take a jacket. The guide was so informative and personable. She enjoyed her job.
Manhatton. The 9/11 memorial is a MUST, thake a tissue! A boat trip on the river is a great way to see the Manhattan skyline. Empire State is a great place to view the Manhatton sunset
awesome. This skyline is amazing either from the Rockefeller building or the staten island ferry. the best time to see the skyline is at dusk or dawn.
Always astonishing. It isworth the trip. Suggest from the free roundtrip Staten Island ferry rather than on expensive long lines cruises

NYC Skyline still beautiful but tinged with sadness. I had been to NYC many times in the 1990's but 2011 was my first visit since 9/11. Suffice to say the Manhatten skyline still takes my breath away but to see it without the Twin Towers lends it a bitter-sweetness. However I would urge everyone to visit NYC at least once in their lifetime and enjoy the best city skyline in the world!

Manhattan Skyline. An old train railway turned into a park overlooking the Hudson River. It was the first chilly day of the year, it was drizzling and cold.... we were walking and sight seeing at the Skyline... it was quite nice and creative to turn an old railway into something useful,, with shrubs garden along the railway....it was a nice walk overall.....
Saw it at night on our Princess cruise ship from Brooklyn. A clear night where we could see the Statue of LIberty, the Manhattan skyline and the Verrazono Bridge
Breathtaking view. The skyline is beautiful from any angle, at anytime. I love it most at sunset, or at night from the RFK, formerly the Triboro bridge.

Top of the Rock - The absolute view of Manhattan. Fantastic view on a clear day. Tickets have a time slot assigned, plan ahead and be punctual. We bought our tickets and then toured the recommend sites around the building while we waited.

Cool. we went on a dinner cruise, around manhatten at night Lovely to look at in the evening. had a 4 course meal with drinks, and dance the night away, to a lovely range of ecleptic sounds from the dj
incredible sight. quite simply put, this is impressive no matter where you see it from or what time of day. it is, however, particularly impressive at night.

Best seen from Jersey side at dark...on a clear night. Love the vista as I am driving home. Once you get out of the Lincoln Tunnel and circle up route 495 you will see the skyline twice as you curve around. The lights are amazing and I never get tired of looking at this spectacle as many times as I commute. Breathtaking.

Its still number one attraction in NY!. My wife and I were in New York the first week of September, on the occasion of our 25th wedding. It 'was a wonderful trip that we will remember with nostalgia and would highly recommend it to others. One of the many beautiful things seen was undoubtedly the skyline of Manhattan as seen from Brooklyn: the first morning, at sunrise at arround 6:15.The Brooklyn Bridge is spectacular from the prom, and after a breakfast made from Starbucks coffee nearby, we walked the Brooklyn Bridge on foot enjoying a city that was once going into the heart.Don't miss that when in New York!

Beautiful over the sea. When you look it over when coming back from a cruise, its the most breathtaking experience ever! the empire state building, the citi building, and the Rockefeller building = AWESOME!!
WOW!!. Seeing the skyline from the harbour or skyscraper gives you an appreciation of the scope and development of NYC. It also gives you a better orientation improving your navigation.
Breathtaking..... I am new to NYC (recently moved over from San Fran), and am in LOVE with the Skyline.... gorgeous Architecture and history, no matter what the weather....

Nothing compares. Whether from Queens, Brooklyn, New Jersey, or the plane , nothing beats NYC at night. 2 additional recommended viewpoints: 1) bottom of the Rock2) Dizzy's - the Lincoln Center Jazz club - located at Columbus Circle . Amazing view at night
Just like the movies!. The first moment I saw the Manhatten Skyline, I became all emotional as I have wanted to visit NYC since I was a little girl, and to me it was a dream come true.
Beautiful. Great as seen from hop on bus tour. It is a great way to see New York day and night. We also loved seeing New York from the Hudson as we took the boat cruise.
Wonderful Place. One of the most wonderful places to visit in the world. The city never sleeps and always has something to do.

Huge.. Go to the Brookling side and stand under the Brookling bridge close to the Manhattan bridge. There you will see a great Manhattan skyline like in many postcards. Walk to the left from this point getting away from the bridges and will see another great skyline without the bridges. just the buildings reflecting on the water. Stunning.
Breathtaking. The Manhattan skyline from the night loop bus tour from over in Brooklyn was breathtaking. The visability was not great but it was still incredible
One's dream personified. It was so iconic and we were given the best view of all by seeing it from a horse and carriage ride through Central Park
Always stunning!. Took the Statten Island Ferry which is free but still takes in the skyline and the Statue of Liberty, I think the better view is on the way back

Have your camera ready!. Nothing beats seeing these views. Beautiful by day, magnificent by night. Took a boat ride down to the Brooklyn Bridge and headed to the Empire State Building. Have your camera ready !
Never sleeps. 24 hour city . Lots of visible policing, always feel safe. Manhattan is just incredible, though New Yorkers are not the most pleasant people, but the city is mind blowing.
The best. I was born in NYC and still living here and am in awe every day!!! I have traveled all around the world and this is still a most incredible sight.
Beautiful @ 1:00am. We viewed from Empire State building @1:00 in the morning no lines or crowds awesome view! It's true what they say this city never sleeps.
Amazing. Like you are walking in a movie. There is no comparison to this. Not even Hollywood beats this place.... a must see for all
A walk above. Enjoy fresh air, beautiful gardens and a feeling of being between the clouds and the street. Nothing compares to this!
Top of the Rock. Great history and the views are just out of this world! It's great to see the Empire State Building from this height.....worth the entrance fee alone!
Not many things are free in New York - this is!. The Manhattan skyline is fab - and just like all the films and photos you see. See it at night from Brooklyn and - wow!

Fabulous. Unbelievably amazing, we went late night or I meant early morning 2:00 am .... the scene was outstanding. I'd love to visit again.
Great city and lots of fun

Fantastic views. We viewed the Manhattan Skyline from diferent locations, but for the best photo shots with your loved one, go on the Statue of Liberty cruise to Liberty Island where you will get fantastic views and will not be disappointed!

Fabulous view!. We were on a coach tour and the guide told us all to shut our eyes and face straight ahead until he told us to look to the right and open our eyes - when we did we were looking at the Manhatten skyline at night - what a lovely view!

Beautiful. This is a big colourful full of life city. Buzzing all the time. We lived 50metres from Times Square and could see the neon signs form our hotel room. Stayed at Milford Plaza. Great location.

Intoxicating Architectural Inviation to Dynamic City. The density of eclectic, distinctive buildings are a perfect invitation to the unique dynamic or New York City. The sight never fails to excite me, even in bad weather.

Landmark of human cuvilization. One of the most spectacular human made wonder that is newyork. No matter how many times you see NY skyline it still leaves you wanting more. I work across the river in jersey city and love this sight almost daily
Electric. For anyvisitor to New York its a special time when the Manhattan skyline comes into view, love it everytime.

the most wonderful thing about my city. as a native Nyer I have seen this skyline go through many changes Ive seen it from every angle...It never gets old or boring it is always breathtaking and beautiful...If u come to New York this is a must see especially at night..the cheapest way to see it is a train ride on the J,Q,B,D lines

Amazing Views. The best views of the skyline is from Jersey City. We stayed on the water-front in Jersey City instead of actually in NYC because we wanted to see NYC.....that is un-questionably the way to do it.
What a city skyline. Find a good elevated location or take the circle line for a great view of the city. I was able to see the new construction of Ground Zero and the New high rise towers coming up.
Look up, it's worth the effort. Absolutely amazing skyline. The detail on some of the buildings is breath taking. We even got into the habit of ducking into building lobbies and found some gems.

Great views of the city. During our stay we found views from the south end with the Staten Island ferry as well as at the Marriott View Lounge in Times Square. Both had amazing views worth checking out.
Beautiful. The skyline changes depending on your location and time of day, ever-changing and new every time you see it.
Awesome. Never thought that the reality would be as good as the pictures, it was sooo much better. Take the evening harbour cruise to see it in all of its glory
amazing views. Views of Manhattan skyline are like few in the world. Wether day or night, the views from many parts of the city are amazing.
Catch a ferry. We caught a ferry to New Jersey Port Imperial and got good views of the Skyline. It cost $9 each way each.
Amazing view. From Brooklyn Heights Promenade you have an amazing view of the Skyline of new York. The first time we saw the Skyline in the morning, but the view in the evening is even better.

Staten Island Ferry view. Wow - what a skyline. Take the Staten Island ferry - very user friendly and go onto ferry (with the masses) go up top - as far as possible.. and head to the right side of the ferry. Stand outside - don't bother sitting down.Once on staten island -0 you get on the boat and queue up to get on same ferry back. we went to the front - down low for the journey back and got lovely skyline pics.

There are several view points!. Okay, once in NYC you have to take time to see the skyline! It is breath taking if it's in good light or when you are at the right spot. Because, after all, it's just a few buildings! But the architecture of it all and the placing make it a remarkable view. Check it out from Dumbo (somewhere between the 2 bridges) or from the Brooklyn Bridge, when you're walking it. Take the Staten Island Ferry for another viewpoint. Have you ever taken the East River Ferry for a nice skyline view?

Great view from the harbour. My favourite way to see the skyline is from the Staten Island Ferry which is free with your metro pass. Best way to see the Statue of Liberty without going to the statue itself.

Brooklyn Bridge. Direct subway ride to City Hall/Brooklyn Bridge. Amazing views of the skyline, Statue of Liberty, 9/11 towers, Empire State Building, Chrysler Building, South St. seaport, architecture.
Not to be missed. Best views are from the Hudson river., Top of the rock or the night bus from the Brooklyn side, but you can pretty much get a good view from any high building
Classic view. We'll never forget the classic NYC skyline with the Twin Towers. But the skyline's ever-changing landscape is a testament to the city that never stops changing and growing.
Beautiful!. Seeing it from a boat (Circle Line Cruises) at night was breath-taking and from the Top of the Rock was spectacular!
Breathtaking.... You need to travel on the ferry to appreciate the true beauty... This aspect will provide scale to building sizes... you will appreciate the diversity of the architecture...

Must see skyline. We saw this during the day and at night. Have to say I enjoyed both. First saw it from the subway travelling from JFK and was impressed. Saw it from most angles and impressive any way.
Nice break from the chaos. Nice place to take a walk and lots of places to eat just off the Skyline, some interesting views of the city and the river.
Magnificient. I never get tired of it. Depending on the time of day, time of year, the skyline changes, moment to moment, season to season. Utterly gorgeous
Iconic skyline. You've seen it in the movies - fantastic to see it in person. If you arrive at night, it is even better.

Iconic. An iconic city skyline. We boarded a water taxi from Pier 17 to 44th Street, the weather was perfect and the view around the lower part of Manhattan is jaw dropping. Another way to view this is to walk from Brooklyn into Manhattan across the Brooklyn Bridge. A city walk you won't forget ina hurry.
Always worth a view. It has to be one of the most photographed skylines in the World and the new Trade Center buildings are beginning to take shape to return it to its original look but not the same.

It never gets old. NYC has a very recognizable skyline, and you can see it from Brooklyn and Queens. I recommend a boat ride around Manhattan Island, there are some restaurant boats that serve a meal while you see the entire island in 90 minutes.
A 'must do' if you visit NY.. A man made sight but impressive nonetheless. Go as the sun goes down to get the best effect as all the lights come on.
See the city. Very short queue in late evening! In good weather, provides a spectacular panoramic view of the city. Quite cold high up, so wearing warm clothing is advised.

Top of the world. The skyline if remarkable, so many buildings and incredible architecture and history. An unforgettable experience. A real joy whether you enjoy it from the street, a boat, and airplane, or the top of a building. Manhattan Rocks!

The Best Skyline in The World. One of the best views of the Manhattan skyline can be seen from the Esplanade in Brooklyn Heights. You can sit on a bench and watch the ferries coming in and out, or see the helicopters landing at the Downtown Heliport. Walk down the Esplanade to the Brooklyn Ice Cream Store or walk a bit further to the park below the Brooklyn Bridge. A great place for beautiful photos of both the Brooklyn Bridge and the skyline.
in any corner something great. The whole concrete jungle view, in any corner something new! try walk around, you should see a lots of typical locations from any movie or tv show....!

Manhattan Skyline - Great by Day and By Night. The skyline is always fascinating no matter what time of the day you see it. I suggest seeing it in the daytime and then once again at night in order to see the difference. You will enjoy both visits.
Stunning, no place like it!. Incedible views wherever you look. Different at every time of day & night. Uninterupted views from the ferry to & from the Statue of Liberty & Ellis island were amazing.

Star Spangled Skies. The Manhattan Skyline never fails to give me a thrill from any angle. It never gets old or routine. I particularly enjoy going to the top of the Empire State Building late at night and looking around. The new Freedom Tower under construction stands like a defiant spire in the place where our beloved towers are missing. I was fortunate to get to see them before the fall and am very pleased that this new construction is going up to fill the void.

Excellent views from the Top of the Rock and Time Square. NYC skyline never stops to amaze after over 30 years traveling there. I have the same relaxing feeling there as I am in a Cabo beach. Simply breathtaking
great view from our room in jersey city hyatt. the hyatt in jersey city has spectaculer view of lower manhattan . Get room at the end of the hotel. you can see the skyline from your bed.
Take the free ferry to Staten island. And you will see many aspects of this famous skyline that so many immigrants have seen over the centuries. A real treat.

Awesome. The skyline is just awesome. Especially seeing the new Freedom Tower which is just over half way built and is already taller than the Empire State Building. I have some amazing panorama photos taken from Staten Island.
The most amazing skyline!. This Skyline to me is the most beautiful skyline in the world. At night it is breathtaking! Quite simply - amazing!

Brilliant Manhattan. The Staten island Ferry is free and has to be one of the best tourist attractions ever because you can see the whole New York skyline at night and.....it is wonderful- all the buildings sparkling and shining in myriad lights- an absolute must do for all visitors

Best view from a cruise!. We saw the skyline from two different views: a bus tour of Brooklyn and a cruise. On the bus tour, the night light tour was beautiful. But the midtown harbor cruise provided the best views, plus awesome views of the bridges! So many iconic buildings; even though this was my first trip to NYC I recognized several of them.
Breathtaking!. Unbelievable skyline. Highly recommend doing the Brooklyn bridge walk and heading over to the Brookyln Promenade and taking in the views from there!

Magically Awesome. The scenery is so big,tall and majestic. One does not know where to look first. Each building is so different in it's own way. You can't hardly wait to see the Empire State Building.There are so many stories to be told about the building it is interesting to read.All these tall buildings on one little island called Mahattan. Which was bought from the Indians. A good reading in history books.It's a magical place,busy and noisy but in a good happy way.There is so muxh to see and do. Alot of walking involved too.
Fantastic. Great view. Insightful information by guide. Clean and organized. A must do and entire family enjoyed the view and amazed by the height of the skyline.

Hidden Gem to see the Skyline. If you want to take in a panoramic view of Manhattan and see the Statue of Liberty without the crowds, sneak over to Governors Island on the free ferry. Governors Island is one of those hidden gems where you can merge a history lesson with a great view of Manhattan at its finest. We recently took the ferry over to the island and enjoyed a sandwich and a beer on the manmade beach overlooking Manhattan. You can clearly see Liberty Island, Ellis Island, the Manhattan skyline, and the Brooklyn Bridge. After taking in a few tours and walking around, we took the ferry over to Brooklyn, had ice cream at the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory, and then walked across the Brooklyn Bridge to take in more of the Manhattan skyline. The Manhattan skyline is a “must see” for anyone who visits New York. Night or day, it is an amazing view!
What a view. There is nothing that tops the Manhattan Skyline. Perhaps best seen from Jersey across the river, or from a boat on the water.
Lovely. Check it out on the top floor of the Metropolitan Museum of Art, and you will get a great panoramic view! There is a garden & small cafe as well as a interesting mirrored sculpture.
Breathtaking!. The Manhattan Skyline is simply beautiful paricularly from the water if you take the ferry to the Statue of Liberty

Wonderful view from Brooklyn (at the Saturday "Smorgasburg" food fair). We were on a bike tour that stopped for lunch at the "Smorgasburg" -in Williamsburg (just near the Williamsburg bridge). We grabbed a delicious lunch from the wonderful market atmosphere and sat down overlooking Manhattan. The views were amazing. You could see all of the major buildings across the water. Simply spectacular!
Looking Up - Looking Across At. Whether from the Empire State Building, from the Brooklyn Bridge, from Ellis Island or from a ferry - this skyline never fails to delight.
Nothing else like it.. Try to be in a great spot to view the skyline at dusk. There is nothing like watching the lights come on in Manhattan. The roof top of the Met is a good spot.

Great view from the 47th floor of the Marriott!. We loved the revolving restaurant which showed us a lot of the beautiful Manhattan skyline. It was a clear day and the views were very special. There was information to tell us what buildings we saw, which was very helpful.
Always exciting. No matter what your vantage point, be sure to see the Manhattan Skyline. It is stunning on a clear day.
Urban green, love it!. Wow, what a brilliant idea, all urban cities should adopt this concept, beautify the city and attract commerce. Love it!
boat cruise. Took the Circle LIne 2 hr. tour around Manhattan, great views and picture taking opportunities. NIce history lesson from the host.

See it from many angles. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from walking the streets, from atop the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock, from a boat cruise around Manhattan, from the top of the Metropolitan Art Museum, from the grandstand in Times Square, from under the ground via subway, and from our hotel room which looked upon the top reaches of the Empire State Building. Obviously this skyline is not going anywhere and it's so in your face where ever you might be, but it still took our breath away with each view, and no two are the same. I was truly surprised with how clean the city is. You will find plastic bags of trash piled up waiting to be removed, daily, but litter is not prevalent along the streets. We walked and walked and walked the city, and thank goodness we brought good walking shoes. NYC is no time to go glamorous with your shoes. We expected to see many glamorous native New Yorkers walking the streets, but found only hardworking people of all ages, races, and gender, just like us, only slightly less patient, especially when you get in their way on the sidewalk. Most everyone we encountered was polite and helpful, not condescending or rude. I really was impressed with the city and although I would not want to live here, I do see why many others would. It really is a paradoxical city - very much representative of the rest of us in the country (albeit without our sense of moderation), yet very very different then the rest of us. I may come back to visit again someday, but maybe not as there are so many other places to visit. I am glad to have been here at least once in my lifetime. If I do come back it will be to visit the 9-11 museum when it is finished. That will be a tearjerker of a site. In this regard, we are all New Yorkers.
Cocktails at River Cafe at Sunset - Amazing!. Best way to spend the late afternoon watching the sunset, then stroll back across the Brooklyn Bridge

No place like NYC. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful. See it at night at the Top of the Rock observation deck. This gives a panoramic view of NYC. Lights are everywhere, draping the beautiful bridges, all of the buildings, billboards, and you have a direct view of the Empire State Building all lit up.My niece has run in the NYC Marathon & she ran through all seven boroughs, over the beautiful bridges. The space of NYC is amazing from up high.

New York, New York. Born and raised in NY, nothing lights up my heart like the NY skyline. I recommend anyone come to NY at least once, to view our beautiful skyline at night, all lit up from a distance. It was even more spectacular when the World Trade Center dominated, but the Freedom Tower is being built and will be a welcoming touch to the City.

Best seen from Top of the Rock. From the Top of the Rock you can see the Empire State Building and all of lower Manhattan lit up at night. The Crysler Building is in partial view but the bridges can be seen as well as Times Square and many other sights.
Over the top. Just beautiful. A must see.You see the city in an unimaginable way. The new WTC tower will soon be completed.

The most beautiful skyline. I love the Manhattan skyline! It's especially beautiful from the Ellis Island ferry. The tall and then the little shorter buildings are just beautiful. Don't forget to look up when you're in New York!
Views. No matter were you are this place just buzzes, lights,noise , it,s just amazing! A place you must see and absorb!

Top of the Rock. We visited the Top of the Rock and liked it better than the Empire State Building, 10 years earlier. There are no fences: they use thick glass to prevent you from jumping. Therefore, the view is much nicer.

Uptown the Art Museums, Natural History Museum and just a stroll on Madison Ave are all worthwhile. Bring comfortable shoes and have a ball.

Manhattan. Loved the varous districts, the restaurants, the museums, and the three shows we attended. Also enjoyed the taxis and their drivers. Found the streets cluttered with garbage bags every evening, and the subway system decrepit, although convenient and easy.

Night lights twinkling put out an invite to come and have fun. Who could not like such a vibrant city sitting there wating to be explored. There is always a lovely atmosphere in Manhattan and it is one of the few places I know where even the congestion of traffic is bearable. Yellow taxis every few seconds and car horns competing with one another

I wanted to cry. New York always been my dream destination and when i finally saw it from Newark airport in the distance, felt like cryng tthat I was finally seeing it for real and not from the tele.Regardless of where you see it from, just amazing. I saw it from Empire state and top of the rock. Worth seeing it via day and evening as looks different when all lit up. Worth watching as you leave Battery Park on a boat and look back in the distance. Another great way to see is by helicopter which we did at night.
Fabulous!. Seen from the empire state building at it is incredible and just as seen on movies and TV. Pictures really can't do it justice. This is a "must see" for any visitor to NYC.
NYC Skyline. A must see ... It is breathtaking! Take a boatride about dark & see all the skyline lit up! So beautiful!

Nothing Beats it .... Recently sat in awe of the NYC skyline from across the GWB from a lovely outdoor restaurant called Le Jardin. A great place to watch Manhattan day or night. Went up late evening and watched the city above. It was very beautifull and it is a nice place to take some photos. One thing you wont miss during the first visit.

Best City in the World. The view gives me chills every time I see it as I am landing and every time I leave I am always a little sad.
I see it every day and it still blows me away.. The best two places to take it in are from East river state park in williamsburg and from DUMBO, on the south side of the brooklyn bridge
Love the skyline. The Manhattan skyline gave me such a WOW from the various placed I had the chance visit and see the skyline from.
Mesmerising! Brooklyn Bridge at night!. The sheer beauty as day turns to dusk, over the hop on hop off Gray Line Bus Tour which was prompt, comfortable and excellent.

Be sure to visit the Brooklyn Heights Promenade. The view from the Brooklyn Heights promenade is a beautiful citiscape of the financial district. Good to visit at dawn or dusk. Don't miss it. You can dine on Henry Street nearby.

GO VISIT NEW YORK BUT STAY IN LONG ISLAND CITY. The city is amazing,,,but never sleeps. Want to visit New York City...do so but stay in Long Island City. It's just across the east river, 10 minute subway trip from Time Square.
THe Manhattan Skyline is awesome....great views from the Staten Island Ferry...which is free, 24/7.

Manhattan towers seen from the 300-foot-cliffs in New Jersey. For a fantastic view of Midtown Manhattan seen from a high point across the Hudson River, take a 10-minute bus trip through the Lincoln Tunnel to the city of Weehawken’s Hamilton Park. The location there is 300-feet above the River, looking straight on at the towers of Midtown Manhattan. New Jersey Transit Buses #128, 165, and 166 run every 5-to-20-minutes, 7 days a week, leaving Gate 212 of the Port Authority Bus Terminal (8th Ave & 42nd Street). Ask the bus driver to let you off at ‘Blvd. East’ & ‘Duer Place’ (this is the first stop along Hamilton Park). The neighborhood by the park consists of pleasant homes. Buy tickets for going and returning at the bus terminal in NY. Fare is $3.20 each way for an adult; less for seniors and children. Mid-to-late afternoon sunshine gives you terrific photos. This is a really a fantastic (and short) journey on a bright sunny day. See photo below from Wikipedia "Boulevard East".

From the Top of The Rock..and air plane. The skyline...WOW...we viewed it from open decked bus from Brooklyn..from the top of the rock...from Statue of Liberty boat..and from window of air plane...every view was great...

They are building the replacement for World Trade Center. While driving in from Route 3 I saw the new skyscraper that is being built near the site of the former World Trade Center. It looks interesting but you will never erase the shadow of the WTC. Never.
wow. breath taking, saw it from the empire state bulding nd wow ttalt amazing view. loved that u could see every thing, saw it in the day time nd at night.
Top of the Rock. Visit the top of the Rock at night where you can get a fantastic view of the Manhattan sky line along with the Empire State Building all lit up. Amazing.
Just as you imagine it is. Great view from Empire State building and the Staten Island ferry. Fabulous "down view" from the 102nd floor!

empire statue of liberty. dont go on a windy day and take a fleece with you.The staff werent particularly helpful infact rather rude but once you up there the sites are spectacular but can be abit cold especially if its cloudy.

Awesome, what more can I say. Everything, disliked that my camera wasn't good enough to show friends and family what I actually saw....

Veiw from the Rockefeller Centre. Go to the Rockefeller Centre- Top of the Rock for a veiw of the Manhatten sky line at night. Viewing area is great as glass with gaps for cameras and lots of seating to rest tired feet.
Greyline bus night tour. Thr Greyline night tour was fabulous the commentator a big dubious it the sight was magnificent and gave you a real idea of the size of Manhatten

Skyline view best from the bay. Take the free Staten Island ferry for a great view of the skyline. You also get a good view of the Statue of Liberty from the ferry.

Always Beautiful!. Loved the city lights and all of the activity in the city. We had some great photo opportunites all through the city and took advantage of the various events during the weekend.
We had a great time!
breathtaking. the view of the Manhattan skyline is breathtaking. Its worth it to take a taxi into the city, i recommened the queens midtown tunnel, the view right before it is the most impressive
Fabulous. Took the sailboat trip from Chelsea Pier - just over two hours with a super crew. fabulous views of the Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island and the skyline, would highly recommend.

Top of the world. This was a must do having been to new York more than 10 times and to not have done this is unforgivable you must do this once you can see everywhere

wow. Loved that you could see the city how you have envisaged it with all the fantastic tall sky scrapper buildings
it is truly stunning and blew me aware.. I went to the top of the rock to see the Empire state building in all it's glory and it didn't disappoint.
Dont miss your Tripod. wow! what a view. We kept staring at the skyline and took loads of pictures. We missed to take our tripod the first day and did not miss it the next day. :)

Great free ride in NYC. This ferry provided us with great views of NYC and the Statue of Liberty. We would recommend staying on after you get to Staton Island for a nice return trip with great views each way.
Quick ride. Avoid if you get easily get dizzy as the ride will swing you around the landmarks of New York City. Good experience if you were to go to Empire State Building Observation Deck.
