Still.... Still one of the most amazing in the world, with the new WTC 1 taking shape. For the rest is does not change much, but that is maybe a good thing.

Beautiful to take in.. This skyline will never get old. Don't forget to look up while you're walking around the city and through the streets. There's so many sites to see and architectural wonders to behold!!
view from the roof terrace a treat at night. from the tenth floor terrace, the noise of constant traffic fades and the delightful landmark buildings are lit to display their unique characteristics.

This is an easy one.... Is there really anything one could say except that beyond any possible question, no city's skyline in the Western hemisphere can come anywhere close to the overwhelming majesty and sheer breadth of that of my home town, New York? There's Midtown, with the Chrysler Building and the Bank of America Tower, and of course the Empire State Building standing somewhat alone and distinguished a few blocks south, and then further south still, the Financial District, with so many notable skyscrapers and now the buildings of the new World Trade Center close to completion (Brooklyn, too, in recent years has started to sport a rather respectable skyline of our own, the equal at least to those of any number of other major cities around the Americas). The night-time view of the Financial District from the Promenade in Brooklyn Heights, with the East River bridges in the foreground, the Statue of Liberty in the Harbor, and 1 World Trade towering over from the West Side, is always humbling to me, although I've lived here all my life.

Amazing.. It doesn't matter how you see the Manhattan Skyline as long as you see it. We saw it by boat and by bus in the day and at night. The night tour was just spectacular the whole skyline was just amazing all lit up and we even got to see the World Trade Center pillars of lights. The only downside of seeing the skyline at night was I couldn't get a good enough shot, a tripod is a must. A must do while in Manhattan.
Magnificent. Check out the skyline from the Circle Line Cruise, Staten Island Ferry, or a ferry to Governor's Island.

Nothing like it in the world.. Everything the peeks and valleys the sun reflection of the windows, the breeze if you're on the water, the sunrise, the sun set, it's awesome especially with a glass of wine.
Amazing view. Amazing to see at night, lots of lights, high buildings and character. Night tour by bus/boat is awesome

Highlight of the trip. Best thing we did was take the Gray line night loop tour on the open top bus. It was a beautiful night, and I will never forget the experience of seeing the manhatten skyline as we crossed over the manhatten bridge to Brooklyn with Frank Sinatra singing New York through the speakers, the whole bus singing along. It was the highlight of the trip for me!
awesome. awesome got a great view from top of the rock, empire states building and the circle line siteseeing cruise
Manhattan Skyline always amazes. I have seen the Manhattan Skyline from many angles, but recently saw it from the "dumbo" area in Brooklyn - one of the best views I have ever had.
For Your Viewing Pleasure. Viewing the 4th of JUly fireworks show is always incredible in Manhattan but seeing the city skyline before hand is always amazing.
Just incredible. The best possible view of the 'world capital'. Views of all of Manhattan, in all directions, are unbelievable.

Awe Inspiring. The Manhattan Skyline is just jaw dropping beautiful from almost any vantage point. Morning, dusk, and evening views are the best from the water or from Brooklyn. Take a water taxi ride, Liberty Island tours of the Staten Island Ferry to get an eyeful.

Stunning. Simply amazing, nothing quite like the NY Skyline, from the Empire State to the Chrysler, the new Freedom Tower and the mixture of new & old architecture the skyline is just stunning. You willl never forget your first view and and it still takes my breath away even after a number of visits.
One of the best in the world. with new WTC up and coming almost 104 floors and counting...this is one of the perfect skylines. best views are from NJ Liberty park.

Best View of the Skyline. The best view of the Manhattan Skyline was from the Jersey side of the Hudson River. We took a ferry from the Manhatan Waterway five short minutes to New Jersey. There is a walkway right along the river that is easy to find and beautiful to walk. We arrived later in the afternoon, and found a restaurant called the Waterside. Our table had a view of the city that was extraordinary. The skyline was beautiful during the late afternoon. As the sun set, the windows reflected the golden sun, and finally as dusk settled, the twinkling lights of the city reflected the beauty of amazing NYC. Took the ferry back to Manhattan, just as the Intrepid let off a fireworks display. Then we hopped the "free Waterway Bus" ( it is free with the $9 purchase of the ferry ticket. ) that took us back downtown and within a block of our hotel.

AWESOME. We viewed this from the Empire State building. it was around 5.30 tea time and the view was just breath taking! then as the evening drew closed the lights went on over the city which was like thousands of christmas trees being switched on. Would def visit again. There is a lovely souvenior shop at the top were we purchased a decoration for our christmas tree
Breathtaking ever single time. The one and only. It's spectacular -- even for me, and I grew up here! Coming in by plane on a clear night is one of the most memorable things you will ever see.
Fab view from Brooklyn. We took the nyc night tour which is worth it for the fab views crossing Brooklyn Bridge and at Brooklyn waterside

Take the free ferry to Staten Island. It’s free! Just hop on the ferry - it takes about 20 - 30 mins each direction. You’ll get a great view of the downtown skyline, Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island. Nothing to lose, and everything to gain.
amazing!. Best way to see Manhattan Skyline:- Top of the Rock- Empire State Building- Water Taxi Make sure you see the skyline at night as well. It's amazing!

Honeymoon. The great shopping and tourist sites. Broadway shows of course, every type of food imaginable. The owners and staff were great and so helpful. The art in the hotel was very original as well

Best from a boat. Fabulous view from a friends boat, best way to see it cheaper and not as dangerous as a helicopter!!
Breathtaking. Absolutely beautiful at night, One tip, from Staten Island,(free Ferry) or walk the Brooklyn Bridge...Amazing views!!

Skyline Park. Beatiful way of seeing some of New Yorks sights, toilets and refreshments on site, very handy!
Some lovely wood benches to recline on and enjoy the views and soak up the sun, a really good idea.

The NY Skyline is Becoming Complete, Even if VERY Different. Since 9/11 the NY skyline has changed. Ot's been eleven years but we are now nearing the completion of One World Center, also known by the men and woman who built it as the Freedom Tower. It now dominates the lower Manhattan skyline and a little sister, 2 World trade Center is casting long shadows across the streets below too. I love looking at the NYC skyline. I love the views of mid-town fro the Queens side. It's easy enough to get there and spend time just looking. Of course there are many cruise lines that make rounds of manhatten too. Just love it all!
view takes your breath away. I liked seeing the views Id seen on the tv all my life and now I was seeing them for real...The traffic spoiled the views and the constant honking of horns.
Awesome views. Just stunning. The night shot of the skyline from Water St, Brooklyn, is now my desktop picture. Check it out.

Beautiful and unique. There is nowhere more beautiful or recognisable than manhattans skyline, I found myself looking up just walking down the street, and when i left on the bus, i looked back for as long as i could, until i couldnt see it any more. Loved it

Something to Behold. The Manhattan skyline at night is certainly a spectacular thing. I was fortunate enough to be staying on one of the higher floors in the city so I had a pretty good view and at night, with all the lights down below, it was a rather amazing site.
So gorgeous!!!. I love the NYC skyline it's absolutely fantastic from all angels although taking the staten island ferry is my favorite
best view from Brooklyn. just take taxi to battery park in the afternoon, have a look allover the skyline. You can walk around and have a great view
awesome. breathtaking never failed to impress me...this is a view that will stay in my mind forever...on the boat trip it is seen from all angles and great for taking photo's....

a must see. We viewed the sky line on the open top bus tour at night, just as the sun was setting. It was fabulous. A must see.
Full On. love the all experience of our visit.the shops restaurants, the sites and the shows were all very good

Awesome. This view of NY is one of the most beautiful scene that one can see especially at night.The best way to see it from a ferry boat when you go to Liberty island (during the day only) or from the Brooklyn bridge at any time.

I love this city!. The city that never sleeps! You cannot be bored in this wonderful vibrant city. I have lived in this city for all of my life and even though I travel frequently, I am always happy to return home, as I did last night from the South of France!

Don't miss this opportunity.

view from brooklyn. we saw the skyline from brooklyn. if you can go over there it is truly worth it. we went early evening and watched the sun set over the water and watched the lights come on in manhatten...we were in a mexican restaurant called ALMA.

romance and walking. great place to do some walking while enjoying nature..its a wonderful placefor walking..get on at 33rd street and walk all the way down to 14th street...then take a look around the Chelsea market

the best.skyline in the world. One of the most famous and stunning skylines in the world. I love the view from the airport as all the buildings com into view

Best in the world. At any time of day or any time of the year, the Manhattan skyline is always awe-inspiring. The best views are either from the air or from the New Jersey side.

great view. lived up to expectations of dazzling lights. Great view from across the Hudson river in New Jersey. Better to look at from a distance to get full benefit

From tidal waves, nuclear bombs, King Kong and Asteroids, and other movies like escape from New York, Breakfast at Tiffanys to name a few, of TV shows like Sex in the City, make the skyline and walking around feel rather familiar, it's an odd feeling, not like discovering a new place but like returning to an old friend.
Amazing. When you first see this skyline travelling into New York from the airport it really does take your breath away

Also, the ferry that you take to get to the Statue of Liberty provides excellent views as well and is well worth the money to even just see the skyline!
Just great!. From wherever you look at the skyline it is just great! You can have the view from Central Park, Rockefeller Center, Brooklyn Bridge, etc. - you won't be disappointed!
Loved it!. We had the opportunity to se the Manhattan skyline. It was great from Jersey and while on the Hudson.

NEW YORK SKYLINE. I loved every minute of it!! Sitting in the Rivercafe restaurant under brooklyn bridge (A must vist restaurant for everyone, book in advance though) supping wine and the view is spectacular, i kid you not. Do it people!! you will love every minute!!
So very, very cool!. We went over to Brooklyn and took pictures of the Manhattan Skyline. What's not to like about that? Your pictures remind you of a postcard. A must-see!
very nice. Peaceful, calm, quiet. Very nice getaway. In a nice neighborhood too. A few food selections, some art.

Take money - everything is expensive. LOL
Classic. A nice view of downtown Manhattan can be had from the Exchange Place in Jersey City (if you happen to be in the area).
Times Square is awesome. Times Square and the theatre area is a sight to see but gets crowded and night, a bit claustrophopic.

Fabulous day or night. Fabulous from across the Hudson or East Rivers. Stunning from atop the Rockefeller Center. The daylight view is great, but the night lights are something to remember forever. Electricity is a great invention!

Top of the Rock, Circle Line Cruise and Walk the Brooklyn Bridge. The highlight of my trip was the New York skyline. I loved the Empire State Building, but enjoyed Top of the Rock more as it had the Empire State in its view. The Circle Line cruise at day and night are also amazing for the view. Also, walk the Brooklyn Bridge. The views really are breathtaking! Don't leave without seeing the view from the River, the Bridge and up VERY high!!!

This is New York!. The Manhattan Skyline is the iconic New York you see in film and photos. Its glittering, bejeweled and extremely alluring at night and a spectacular vista even during the day. We were lucky to view it from a friends apartment building rooftop - 45 stories high. A 360 degree view - the Rooftop had glass walls at till midriff height.
What a View. What can I say...I have been seeing the Manhattan skyline all my life. One of the reasons I have stayed in this area!
Nice view from plane and Empire State Building. Purchased a combo ticket for Skyride and observation floor....went in afternoon and lines were not bad...view was awesome..
Fantastic. A must see at night from any vantage point. Line up to get into the Emipre State Bld if you must at night but any high viewpoint would do.
Spectacular. Weather you see it from land, Boat, Air or top of a building it is spectacular. there is nothing to dislike.
nys. Ive been looking at the ny syline for many years - never get tired of going to Wehawken or Hoboken.and enjoying the view.
Can't get enough. We saw the skyline from; the Empire State Building, from a helicopter ride and the Staten Island Ferry. Breathtaking.
My walk around Manhattan. I liked the freedom and the fact that everything worked to precision. I walked to radio city hall,went to Times square and Avenue of the Americas.

Breathtaking. Viewed from free Staten Island ferry and Top of the Rock - enjoyed both but especially the free ferry from both the beginning before seeing Lady Liberty and from Staten Island after leaving the terminal.
manhattan skyline. Best of the best skyline, in a league of it's own, unlike any other skyline in the world Tallest buildings, & the most beautiful archatecture in the world, a mixture of old & new!

Simply Awesome. I had never seen one like that before. The beautiful buildings, the skyscrapers, the sea and Manhattan bridges made a grand scene. The night light added to the splendor. I went in a small cruise and by a bus. Worth visiting a place. will recommend all.

Almost looks fake!! 5*. The view of Manhattan skyline from Liberty Island and on the boats is truly unbelievable and something that anyone fortunate enough to visit New York, must witness. Amazing view.

Very beautiful from wherever you see it. I looked at the skyline from many points of observation, but it was always beautiful. We didn't get the chance to get a water point of vue except on the ferry that lead to the Statue of Liberty, but if we go back, we will definately take a cruise. Very beautiful from wherever you see it, day AND night.

New York, New York!!!. Nothing like it anywhere in the world!!!! The best!!! Something for everyone of all ages.
Always a pleasure to come back. Always something new.
And New Yorkers are the best in the world! Sure, hurried and pressured, but nice and warm.

There is nothing else like it.. This is one of those images you see printed often in artwork, shown in movies, and featured in ads. But seeing it in person is a "must do" for everyone. Breathtakingly gorgeous site you will always remember. The views from Top of the Rock are excellent and NYC features several helicopter tours that give fantastic views as well. All in all, a must see spot of America by far.
Amazing view. I am in love with New York,, the Manhattan skyline is not to be missed, Priceless view, makes you feel alive.

NYC skyline from the Staten Island Ferry. It's a different view from out there, on the water, away from the harbor... but what a wonderful sight !Early morning in the fog, full sun or lights on in the dark of the night... you must see it !

On The Manhattan. What a great view of a great city from "The Manhattan" on a sunset cruise up the river. Cruised out to The Statue of Liberty and then up The East River as the sun set and then back to the Hudson as the lights of the city lit up the sky...breathtaking.
Top of the Rock. Worth the time and money. Don't miss if you want a bird's eye view of the city. Takes about 1 hour. Take your camera.
best way to see. take an harbour cruise which takes 2 hrs fabulous veiws, but the statue of liberty is closed to visitors because of a fire

Like no other. The Manhattan Skyline is like no other in the whole world. Every block from Midtown South has sky scrapers one after another. Be careful walking and looking up to make sure as not to trip and fall.

AMAZING!. Really recommend seeing it both early morning and at night. Its magical!
Try to avoid the queues by arriving at the opening - you get the best chance to take pictures without masses of other tourists about.

Iconic views. A great way to see this is via the free Staten Island ferry, or via the water taxi service (which we used).
A startling view and a reminder of 9/11 when you see the new Freedom Tower rising up.

Top of the Empire State Building. What a view its like being on top of the world. When you are on the observation deck and you look around on a clear day, it such a wonderful sight you can see so much, like all the buildings,the rivers,central park, the bridges and the cars on the street looks like match box cars and the people looks likes ants. It is a really fun and cool place to see for the young and old. It a must see must visit to go.

Manhatton is one incredible place !. There is so much to see and do for everyone , My wife booked a ferry ride on the circle Line , I thought it would be boring and to my surprize it was the highlight of or trip ! We took the three hour tour that went all around manhatton , IT was AWSOME !!
Doesn't get better than NY. The NY skyline is the best anywhere! We saw it from the Top of the Rock and it was totally worth it! It was also gorgeous from Liberty and Ellis Island.

Take the Gray LIne tour!. The New York skyline is, without a doubt, impressive. The first day in NYC my wife and I walked about 4 miles trying to takein the skyline and the various neighborhoods and were exhausted at the end of the day. Plus, we had to contend with thousands of pedestrians and cars -- I know, that's New York, but I didn't like it. I hate crowds. The following two days we took the Gray Line Tours' Downtown and Uptown tours. Smartest thing we did. The driver does all the hard work while you take in the sights. The best part is you can hop off and on whenever you want, which gave us a chance to see things close up. Next time we go to New York we will have a much better idea of exactly what we want to see.
One of Kind. From any angle the Manhattan skyline is impressive and by night it looks magical especially from the top of the Empire State Building.
Nice site to see. Manhattan Skyline is very nice to see and it is good that you are able to get pictures from the Ferry ride.
Iconic. When in NY...has to be seen, doesn't it? The Staten Island Ferry service is free, and the cooling sea breeze provides some welcome relief from the high summer heat.

WOW, what a view!. Our first experience of the Manhattan Skyline was going over to Liberty Island and Ellis Island on the ferry, the buildings are so different with amazing architecture, better than any photo! Then again from Ellis Island, a boat cruise of lower Manhattan, from Brooklyn and then the Top of the Rock. It is just amazing to look at in the day light and then again at night.
Fantastic View. We went to the Empire State & the Rockfellor and found the Rockfellor ran rings around the Empire State!
From Central Park at Midnight.... Jump the fence inside the closed off Park inside Central Park, lay down, face up and look at the skyline and stars.

New York, New York. the city that never sleeps "The voice" did sing. And it doesn't matter how often you have been to Manhatten, its always impressive and breath taking. Its a nice trip around Manhattan with the boat, and its even more recommended during sundown or you'll never forget the picture of the skyline and streets by night seen from a helicopter. A must and not just once in your life!
Great view. We took the 90 min boat cruise around lower Manhattan, really spectacular views of the city. The tour guide is helpful and informative

Thrilling! – Signature of NYC. Nothing can beat the spectacular view of the Manhattan skyline, particularly when the entire structure is illuminated after dark! The best views of the Manhattan skyline, according to my view, can be had from the Liberty State Park in New Jersey, on board the Staten Island Ferry, the Brooklyn Bridge Park and from the top of the Brooklyn Bridge! And the best part is – all these observation points are free! In case you want to capture the best pictures of the illuminated skyline, don’t forget to take a tripod along with you.
Over Towering. There is nothing to dislike about observing the NYC skyline at night! All the buildings lit up like the biggest Christmas Tree.
Its amazing. Everyone has said it before me and its true, its amazing and just like every photo you will see of it.
Wow!. What can I say, the Manhattan skyline is a must especially from across Brooklyn Bridge if you do one of the open top bus tours.

There is no place like home!. Weather your approaching exit 14B on NJ Turnpike, In a high rise hotel in Manhattan on the water. The FDR, Westside Highway, In approaching the Holland Tunnel or Lincoln Tunnel or on the Circle Line, the any ferry. This is the home of the brave.
NICE ride. I live in ny so I can't too excited about it. I'm sure a visitor would find it awe inspiring. It's hard too miss and it's free. Enjoy!

Great evening. We had done most of the Broadway shows before and had difficulty picking one to see during this trip. The Jersey Boys however turned out to be a great evening with a good story line and great songs - well worth a visit if in New York.
Best City Skyline in the world.. Enjoy being in the city that never sleeps. Terrorist can attack it but they are only making it better. I felt like I could actually leave there. I love NY

Views to dream about. A view of the city at night from the top of the rock is just mind blowing. Recommend a harbour cruise and see the city from many different angles. Open top bus tour gives you great location of whats what and whats where the guides are great and really know there stuff

Over-rated..... Ever take a good look at the Manhattan Skyline from NJ or Queens or Brooklyn or Staten Island? Well I have and there's been just too much talk about how great this skyline is. Every been to Panama City? Now that's a skyline. I also like Skyline chili....

Great. The skyline is really amazing!! You can see it from the boat to the Statue of Liberty but I was fortunate enough to have a cruise down the river after dark on my band trip!! It was amazing to see Manhattan all lit up from the water versus just driving through the city. I think you can take river tours from various ports along the river. Worth a ride.

'sent shivers down my spine'. There was something about seeing the Manhattan skyline from a distance and from the Hudson River, that sent shivers down my spine. It was just such an impressive view and reminded me of so many films and TV shows I have watched for years!Cheesy I know, but it was good!
Amazing Manhattan. Took a dinner cruise on the Hudon River the view of the Manhattan skyline in the evening was unforgettable

Awesome. Duh. Well, they seem to be asking for a review of the Manhattan skyline. I guess unless you just came from outter space you will know that it is awesome. But TripAdvisor asked for a review and who am I to say no.

Neck & Neck. Sometimes we take a ride into the city just to see the skyline. It really is a site. We miss the twins towers, They were one of a kind, & our land mark as we would view the skyline at night. They say Paris is the City of Lights, well I think N.Y.C. is running neck & neck.

Tip for best view of Manhattan Skyline. The best place to be overwhelmed by the view is on the rooftop Bar 230 on Fifth - but don't eat there. Buy one tip - don't eat there. Buy one drink - then eat and drink somewhere else. Better views than Empire State or Rockefeller Centre

It's A Skyline.. It's hard to be impressed by the skyline of the city you live in; I've seen the Jersey City skyline *from* it more often than I've seen it. And as of about 11 years ago, it's got a big hole in it.If you're a skyline fan, then I'm sure ours is the best. You'll forgive me for neglecting to look as I trudge down into the PATH.
Amazing view. Took the night cruise and was amazed at how beautiful the skyline looked. Would definitely recommend!
View from the Empire State Bld.. We were on the double decker bus tour, when we visited the Empire State building, we had beautiful clear blue skies, the views were spectacular.
wow. took a greyline bus tour and LOVED every minute, guides brilliant, so full of facts and info and really brought the tour to life.
Just awesome, day or night. View it from the ground, go up the Rockerfeller Center, go up the Empire State, go around it in a boat - just see it from every angle and be amazed.

Manhattan skyline. Watch a great portion of the skyline from the ferry to Liberty Island. Watch it closer by from either the Manhattan Bridge or the Brooklyn Bridge. Pass the bridge on foot or by bike, then lay down in Brooklyn Bridge Park and enjoy the view with an ice cream. Another great place to enjoy nature and watch the skyline is central park. Skyline is smaller here, but nature is a little bigger.The skyline does get obscured by clouds at times. So choose a day with clear sky to watch the skyline. Meaning that a ride up the upper most deck on the Empire State Building (33/34th st - 5th avenue) will deliver you a crystal clear view all the way to Harlem and Brooklynn. Not just a foggy three hundred feet view. Another great view from the top is available at Top of the Rock (33/34th st - 5th avenue). Don't forget to watch the skyline at night as well.

Get a Circle Line cruise. This will give you really good view of New York skyline You can choose 1.5 hr, or 2 hr tours. It'a a bit pricey though. Much cheaper alternative is the boat leaving from the Government Island.
Stayed at the Hyatt Regency in Jersey City. Awesome views of the Manhattan skyline, superb hotel and fantastic service. Emailed in advance to upgrade room to see skyline and they did this for free!

This is not a joke!!!!. What a skyline!!! An endles painting of land, buildings and sky!! From wherever place you look at it, day or night, wheater your are placed up on a higher ground or on a lower one the view is magestic!!! Just Amazing!!!
Empire @ night. Did Empire @ night time ... totally different perspective than Top of Rock (which did early one morning). Plus less crowds later in evening
Manhattan views. Rockafella centre is a great place to view the skyline as you see over central park as it the rooftop cafe at the Museum of Art

Spectacular views. Legendary views. Great photo opps from Top of the Rock and Empire State, but also (and lots cheaper) the Roosevelt Island cable car, Circle Line full island cruise and Statue of Liberty or Staten Island ferry.
wow wow wow. bathed in sunshine glinting in the day. night time lit up was like looking upon a city of gold. absolutely breathtaking. could gaze forever at such a wonderous site

New York, is there anywhere else?. There is a reason that New York is flooded with so many foreign tourists: it is the most exciting, most animated city in the world, where everything is available for all taste.
And the shopping!!!
Everything you'e expect it to be. We saw the skyline from the Empire State building as well as from Liberty Island. It's a beautiful big skyline.

Just like you see on TV. Saw the skyline from the Staten Island ferry, from the Brooklyn Bridge, from the top of the Rockefeller Centre and from a helicopter flight over Manhatten. It was everything I'd expected - but still very poignant to have the gap where the Twin Towers used to be.
manhattan skyline. great from the Brooklyn Bridge - magnificent! see other boroughs also! wish we would of walked the bridge but driving you still see so much

How can you beat it?. From any angle, Brooklyn & Queens, the Bronx & Staten Island, East & Hudson River, Central Park, or in the center of the concrete jungle, the view is spectacular. It is a living breathing animal to be loved and cherished! Not to take anything away from Chi-town, but this was the most amazing city and view I have ever been lucky enough to explore, can't wait to go back!

just great. I did both top of the rock and the ESB and the view was fantastic. Though we went higher at the ESB (102nd floor) I prefered the view from top of the rock (since it was closer to central park and we could see the ESB).We also went back at night and it was interesting to see all the lights (and cooler in july).Admission is not cheap but it is worth it.
Glorious Daytime or Night!. Love the way we can pick out the glorious iconic buildings from across the majestic Hudson River day time or night!!
Stunning. Just like you see in the movies, I viewed NYC From the empire state building early in the morning and you could see for miles and miles. Loved it.

Great walk above the streets. A beautiful way to covert the disuse railway line. Get some great views of buildings and water front. Its free to get on and a nice leisurley walk from one end to the other

Getting more new buildings, and modern too.. This is a rather old, somewhat worn-out city, based on the age of the structures and the great luck of the USA that except for 9/11, it has not endured two world wars like Europe. New skyscrapers are finally going up and the skyline is becoming more modern.
Beautiful views. from the Top of the Rock to the top of the Empire State Building, the Manhattan skyline is incredible and the best picture taking.

My absolute favorite skyline in the United States. By far, the Manhattan Skyline is the greatest in the nation, and possibly the world. What I love most about New York City is the architecture and the skyscrapers. They have some absolutely amazing buildings in this city and its amazing to see the progress of the newest and soon to be biggest in the city, Freedom Tower. It will soon be yet another widely recognized landmark in New York's beautiful skyline. Go to the top of Rockefeller center for excellent panoramic views of the city, and or walk across the Brooklyn bridge or Manhattan bridge from Brooklyn to take in some beautiful views of the skyline from the East side.
Iconic. What's not to like? See it at different times of the day if possible. Just like in the movies, beautiful.
Beautiful. The skyline is beautiful in Manhattan. The view is stunning. Everyone should get a chance to view it.
beautiful at night. The most famous city skyline, easy to see from our Queens hotel. Also great from Empire tate bldg and Top of the Rock.

Stunning! But a work in progress. You really can't beat the skyline - I recommend taking the free Statten Island ferry to get a full view of it and then a night bus tour to Brooklyn to see it at night. The Freedom tower and a couple of other buildings are still going up which ruin the sight in the day a little bit but it still looks fab at night with the Freedom tower lit up in Red, white and blue.
World Famous and unique. There is nothing like the skyline. It is absolutely unique. People come from all over the world, and when they see it, they still are amazed
loved it. Fabulous make sure you take it in..The view from the water taxi is excellent and any time of day is impressive

Starting to rival London on the historic criterion. Although Hong Kong's and to some degree San Francisco's skyline are more visually interesting, Manhattan is no slouch in the sheer man-made beauty category. And with the events of the last 10 years, the history quotient has been pushed upward dramatically making it one of the world's gems.
Ok. The bus did not stopped so we could get pictures of the skyline?Its difficult to take picture when the bus travled in the night.

Dont miss. Whether you see it from Brooklyn or New Jersey, a boat or a tall building, You must get away from the canyon-like streets of midtown and see the sweep and grandeur of the skyline. This IS Manhattan!

Pretty pretty!. Best commercial place to observe the skyline imo is The Rock - due to the timed tickets there's not as many people as on the Empire State Building, plus there's no ugly fences, still its completely safe as there are several decks. Also cool - walking down the Brooklyn bridge and taking the Staten Island Ferry.
Best to see it from the water. Gorgeous tall buildings with a variety of architecture. We saw it from a sailing trip. You can see where they are building the replacement for the Twin Towers.

Breath taking. See it late at night from the top of the Empire State building and you will never forget it. The lights and sounds of Time square and 42nd St. We're awesome but the dirty streets and homeless people sleeping all over the city were a turnoff and sad. I don't remember that from my last visit 6 yrs ago.

Best place to view is Hoboken. Hoboken has the best views of Manhattan. The waterfront has an amazing park that overlooks all of Manhattan. The park is beautiful and calm, and the sunset along the waterfront is fantastic.

New York, New York. Frankie said it best ".......it's a helluva town" Enjoy the view from the air, the water, or in central Park, any way you do it will be the right way, cuz there's just one Manhattan skyline!!
Go to Queens at watch it from there.. One of the best points, is to see it from Long Island City. Take a walk in the park and enjoy the great view.

New York, New York A Hell of a Town. Took a 3 day trip there , what can you say? New York is New York no place like it but now it is cleaner. No it's not cheap, if you stay at a hotel they will tax you to death, I am surprised no tax for the air. The city has so much to offer but it is fast, very fast not like my easy going Fort Lauderdale.
Amazing!. Seen from the flight in, top of the Empire State and the Statue of Liberty. One of these places that you have to see!
Breathtaking. The views from the ferry out to the Statue of Libery and from the top of Top of the Rock did not disppoint. Both were spectacular and beautiful in their own way.
Great sight. viewed from many angles and i must say it is at its best viewed from brooklyn at night. Night tours are a great way to view the skyline or hop on a water taxi
Day & night. see it at both day and night, empire state was good, but i tought that the top of the rock was better.
Tall Tallest and Touching Sky. I am scared of Height but due to my so understanding guide I saw this beauty without fear. From every angle you can see the whole Manhattan .It is a beautiful city.
Excellent choice. We liked everything we did in NYC, its a beautiful and friendly city, we liked Time Square, we loved our room
NYC. We viewed the NYC skyline from Staten Island. Awesome! We rode over to Staten Island on the free ferry. We didnt do much over on that island. We saw the Statue of Liberty on the way. nice view!

Matchless. This is one reason for visitng New York City. You can see where the city zoned buildings for extra height when you see where the tallest buildings are clustered and where lower buildings are located.
Bright lights, big city. Bright lights, big city... great views from the open top bus tours and pics that will remain a great reminder of our yearly journey to NYC

Unlike anywhere else I've been. Iconic.. View from top of Rockerfella centre is amazing. The one thing you get a good view of from here that you don't get from top of he Empire State is, or course, the Empire State!

Better view of this from the Rockerfellar Centre. Go up the Top Of The Rock for a fantastic and unobstructed view of the entire city, including Central Park. Empire State Building view is not as good and is obstructed by railings.

Approach Manhatton Island from the sea!. One of the best ways to enjoy the New York skyline is to approach the city from the sea. Here the skyline just dominates the horizon as it rises out of the water between Jersey City and Brooklyn. We approached the city aboard the Queen Mary 2 and were transfixed as the city emerged out of the semi-darkness of the 05.30 hour lit up brightly by its iconic skyscrapers. It literally shone like a beacon of modernity and commerce in the gloom of the early hour. Approached from the south by sea you get a glimpse of just how high the Manhattan skyline actually is which is lessened somewhat when you look down upon it from the Empire State or Rockefeller buildings although these views are also well worth taking in.
Great place. Great skyline but go to either battery park or go out on one of the river cruises to be able to really enjoy it.

You have seen it on TV experience it in person.. How many TV shows and movies have you watched that included the Manhattan skyline. At some stage take the trip to NY and see it for yourself, the buildings and the man made canyons are a sight to behold definitely something to do before you die.
just like in the movies!. fabulous views of the skyline from Brooklyn. Walk the bridge and go to the oark to watch the sun go down on manhattan

Not só good as people say. Too much people and too much expensive for the kind of the attraction? We stay in lines too many time and there are too many people so it becomes difficult to relax and appreciate the view

Rockefeller Centre V Empire State. Save your money and time by going to the Rockefeller Centre rather than the Empire State. I will never get the two and a half hours I spent at the Empire State back. Rude staff, unorganised system for handling crowds, old and looking that way- needs a coat of paint, and to be honest, the views at the Rockefeller Centre is much better. I'am so sorry I wasted my day at the Empire State.

Great view. A good view in the day and even better at sunset/night fall with all the lights. Seeing all the buildings we have seen on television was really cool for my children. Then going into the city and visiting some of them was an unforgettable trip.
Manhattan Skyline. Showed my granddaughter Manhattan skyline and change in the city as it went from day -> night. Her first trip to NYC - she is a CA girl!
Fab!!. We did the Manhattan Skyline by Helicopter, boat, night time, hotel room on the 38th Floor and of course by day from Subway, taxi, train, bus and boat. What a great place - ENJOY!!!!

Best skyline in the USA maybe the world.. Hong Kong and Paris are both pretty awesome too. I just can't get to them as often as I do NYC. Try the Staten Island ferry or the Brooklyn Bridge walk. Both will give you fantastic vistas!
BEAUTIFUL NYC. No matter where I have been, it is always soothing to me to come back to NYC , greated by one of the greatest the skylines

Unforgettable. Glad I saw it (especially the somewhat poignant rebuilding of the two towers), but after a while I was "sky scrapered out". Worth being able to say I'd seen it, but I'm more a green spaces person. :)
Wonderful!. I live in Brooklyn, and love sitting in Brooklyn Bridge Park looking at the skyline! So beautiful and historic!
What a city!!!. not comparable with any other city. Great things to do, great shopping and dining! We were there for 4 nights and loved every minute!
great view. Walk on and look from the Brooklyn bridge, at sunset is very beautiful ! Take a dinner at Little Italia, lots of nice lots.
Lovely. I come from Milan, in Italy. In my life I went to London, Dubai, Abu Dhabi, Cairo, and many other cities but I've never seen a Skyline beautiful as the one of New York.

View the skyline from the Top of the Rock. See the Manhattan Skyline from the Rockefeller Centre. The best pictures can be taken from atop this building. Go in the early evening for great sunset shots.
the biggest and best. see it f rom all angles: from the air, from the water, from the land. unparalleled views. visit many times

Amazing view and free. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge from or to Manhattan and u will have the most beautiful view from the city.
When the sun sets the sky and the lights are just like a post card
There is also a wonderful park nearby and a place to get delicious ice cream
Don't miss it ,it will be the highlight of your trip

Always awe inspiring. We are from fairly small towns in the South, so getting to experience the skyline of Manhattan firsthand is a great experience. We have seen it in movies and television our whole lives - it is well worth coming to see it yourself. There are great views from all over, but we had great ones from Roosevelt Island and the Staten Island Ferry.
Top of the Rock. Go here instead of the Empire State Building. Much better view and short lines. Tri-level viewing area.
Skyline from staten island. Take the free ferry to state island to get the classic skyline view. Also great from pier 17 at night

Get a high up room to see this!!. It is stunning at night and when you go up the Empire state building its really like nothing i had experienced before.You can actually feel it sway while you are up there which is a wee bit unnerving!!!
Brilliant. One of the great views of the world - should be seen to be believed. A new tower rises where the Twin Towers once stood.

Tour Bus. We took the Grayline bus tour and did the night tour of New York which takes you over the Manhattan Bridge along the Brooklyn Promenade.....what a beautiful way to see the city at night. Our Tour Guide, Andrew Suite was very informative and a lot of fun!

See the West Side from the GW Bridge!!. We live across the bridge and drive in to the city often. Make time to walk the GW Bridge to get a beautiful view of the west side of NYC and the Hudson River. It is free!

Harbour Tour. Instead of doing the Liberty Island/Ellis Island tour which had a 1hr 45min wait, we got straight on the Harbour Tour from the Castle at Battery Park. It went very close to the Statue, Ellis Island and Brooklyn Bridge. It was great.

Beautiful New York. We stayed at the Club Quarters and we took the Grey Line hop on /off tour from 'ground 0' site to CentralPark and a 7 hour walk across New York from Central Park back to the hotel to 'feel the beat' .We did. What an amazing pulse this city has! Like nothing we experienced before. What an amazing architecture, what an enormous wealth. How hard to make a life in this city. Grey Line bus tour, a 'spanish speaking' staff group, very poor service level, The guide, 'Juan', I believe, the only english speaker except for the driver who was not allowed to speak to the tourists, was good, nice touchy stories about the past overlapping a deep personal frustration. Tour proved to be too expensive and useless as it was extremely fast, didn't get to take pictures nor to hear complete stories. Wouldn't take this tour. Central park the jazz saxoplayer. Wow, great! Times Square, crazy dangerous place. Too many homeless, deviant, angry raging groups. I feel for the policemen facing them. Felt good to see them around watching over us.5-th avenue, nice sight. Empire state nice view at the top. Too many loose cheap deal buggers. The nicest personnel in stores at L'Occitane and the best European store - Italian food market:Eataly- the best cappuccino in a very long time.The best calzone. Very good chocolate and icecream, great salami and prosciutto!! . The Hotel, Club Quarters was clean and comfortable. The room was big enough and the kitchenette was well equipped. Dissapointing coffee, very expensive treats on a tray in the room, room 208 had a wall as a wiew and no sunlight at all, the terrace at floor 20 facing the memorial site is very small, don't be fooled by the pictures shown on the hotel's site, the restaurant is not high end at all and it felt liket those poor 3 spanish speaking bartenders were there only for the tip and not for work so it felt very weird, at 10 they were already preparing the place for closing while the closing time was at 11, felt like poor fellows shooting themselves in the foot. What a joke for a restaurant, too bad for the beautiful view of the skyline. Gorgeous view!. The fellows at the reception were nice. All in one, would go back or who knows, maybe I will choose the Hilton at next block? The walk back to the hotel was great for a Saturday late afternoon.The inconvenience caused only by the scaffolds all over the place, the rats running around from point A to point B especially at dusk, the crazy homeless around corners, the shouting spanish speaking workers whistling when they see an elegant woman, that about the downside. And then the view of the city, the Architecture, the pulsing life, the cabs running around like crazy, the skyscrapers, the stores, all great to experience all over again. Let's not forget the Statue cruise. Nice experience, felt a little dry though. Nice personnel at the giftshop ! Oh, and the security checks, very sensational. Were escorted by an army boat on our way to the island, never got why but they must have had reasons. Felt good though with all the security forces around, really good! Hope this helps!

Excellent use of an old railway track!. A good walkway lined with weeds and plants. Nothing that special about it apart from the fact that it is a reclaimed rail track. Better than highrise on it eh? Bravo citizens!

Ok, so I'm biased. Ok, I love the Chicago Skyline, so I can't go 5 stars, but there's nothing like standing in Hoboken and looking across (or from the tippy top of some hills in neighboring towns) to the view. If you look hard enough, you can make out various buildings at night. Fun!

Best places to view & enjoy it. Take the Staten Island Ferry Free Ride at night or from Weehawken, New Jersey (best view is from the promenade), you must have a car to get there, which will take about 30 minutes or it'll take you a bout 3-4 hours trip with buses which isn't worth it!
Goosebumps. 3rd trip to new York, still excites, and how can you not enjoy it, astonishing that there are more and more skyscrapers being built, wow wow wow.
Best to see from a night cruise. We sailed on the Clipper at night - best way to see the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan Skyline at night.
City lights are awesome. Gorgeous city light and the amazing building structures, The air of the night in a city that never sleeps. Awesome , views!

See it from the Top of the Rock or the Brooklyn Bridge.. A glorious sight. It seems to go on forever.... We had fun picking out the points of interest that we had already been to... I recommend doing this at the end of a stay in NYC.
Take the free ferry to Statin Island and back. Some great photo opportunities from the ferry, don't pay for the pleasure when you can get it for free, also the cheapest beer in New York on board!

stunning!. When only there for a quick trip, head over to Jersey to Liberty State Park, forget the cruises and ferries and just enjoy the free view of Ellis Island and the Statue of Liberty. Save these for when you have the time to truly enjoy them.
Cant be matched. We did a twilight cruise, seeing the sun set and select on the buildings was amazing, then to see it all lit up at night - spectacular!
Views. Amazing views of the manhattan skyline with new World Trade Towers and their mirrored reflections from the Staten Island Ferry and great views also from the water taxi of the East River Ferry

Fun boat and bus trips. New York Water Taxi-smaller boats with lots of seating inside with big windows-takes you around Manhattan from Hudson to East River to see skyline, Statue, Brooklyn Bridge. Hop-on Bus Tour at night fantastic-goes over bridge to Brooklyn to view city-breathtaking!

Manhattan Skyline. The best place over the world ...
Each person who will be here to be impressed by the beauty of the architecture.
I hope that people have visited the United States must return here.
n addition, the life of the population is very diverse. Full of colorful impressions.
Magnificent Manhattan. This is probably one of the most amazing views you will see when your in Mahnattan. You must make sure you see it, otherwise your missing an amazing experience
Amazing. best seen from empire state buidling, top of the rock or the staten island ferry. Must see view is at night!!
Birthday Visit. Very busy in the evening at sunset. Booked ahead on the internet but not sure if you need to do that as appeared they moved peoples through fairly rapidly.

Beautiful in the daytime and evening. I walked the Brooklyn bridge and the view was great from Brooklyn and on the bridge. Also took an evening cruise and the view was thrilling. Loved going under the Brooklyn bridge, Washington Bridge and Manhattan Bridge.

Nice. Look from the left of the Hudson river to the Manhattan Skyline.
Very nice to look at. Take from WTC Memorial the path, it is jst one stop to Exchange Place. There at the river of the Hudon is also a nice Memorial for all those Jersey citisenz who lost their lifes at 9/11. Go and see!
Breathtaking !. Just watch the skyline... it will really take your breath away !!! Wish God had given us more than TWO eyes, to see this !!
Very impressive views. Brilliant-loved it. New York beat all my expectations. The skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge was wonderful to see.
Top of the rock. Better view of the city and not as crowded as Empire State Bldg. Staff was very pleasant and friendly.
Iconic. Worth trying from different angles, eg up high (Top of the Rock better than Empire State) plus views from the boats and over from New Jersey also good.

Beautiful City. NYC really is a beautiful city if you slow down long enough to actually look at it. The two best places to see the skyline in my opinion are 1) while on the ferry to/from Liberty Island, and 2) at the "Top of the Rock". Don't be surprised if you find yourself taking too many photos of the same thing, just trying to get that perfect shot.
Oh my word!. Do the 'top of the rock' trip at night, the view is awesome and you get to see the Empire State Building lit up in all its glory!!

Simply amazing. I had a chance to watch the skyline on the air (helicopter ride), on the water (river cruise) and on land (while walking in the street) - all views are amazing and offer some very special and fond memories! I can't recommend this enough!
Great Skyline. Wife and I viewed it from the hotel and from across the bay. We took a trip over to Hoboken, NJ and viewed it from there in one of the restaurants.

"Top of the Rock" & N.J. side too!. Top of the Rock, buy your tickets to go up about 45 minutes BEFORE sunset and stay up there until the lights of the city start to shimmer. Also, take the "Path" train to Hoboken and walk to the nearby park for some GREAT vistas of mid-town & lower Manhattan (must do)

Oz on the Hudson. Keep looking uo while you walk the city. There's nothing like it. The first view over the Jersey Palisades from the approaching train always gives me a kick. The twin anchors of the World Trade Center (now its replacement) and the Empire State Building announce that Oz is near.

Stunning!. The skyline is amazing and breathtaking! Top of the Rock gives you an excellent view. If you cross into New Jersey, you will get an even better view of the entire skyline. A circle island boat cruise gives you 360 views of the Manhattan skyline. A trip to Liberty Island also allows you amazing views.

WOW. I was in NYC on a day trip though Yankee Trails. To see NBC Stuido tour. Of course your in the heart of the Theater district. Plus all the tall buidlings. From the GRACE building. on Avenue of the Americas. A wierd shaped buidling across from Bryant Park. Buts its amazing all those tall buildings.

Probably the best city skyline in the world.. It doesn't matter from where you view it - New Jersey, Brooklyn, Liberty Island, Top of the Rock - the view is spectacular. What's more is that it looks amazing whatever the weather, day or night. Watching the sunset over lower Manhattan from Brooklyn Bridge Park is a must-see for a great skyline.
Beautiful!. The Manhattan Skyline was beautiful! At night, of course, it the best time to see it. But regardless of the time, it's a great view.
Best vantage points.... Top of the Rock sunset view. AMAZING! So is the night time view from Brooklyn of the Brooklyn Bridge and skyline.

So Many Moods. We saw the skyline from the Top of the Rock, The Empire State Building, and from the Circle Tours evening cruise. We also took our second CityBus (double-decker tour). There is so much to see and appreciate.

Had a Great Time. We walked alot, we saw so much more that way. Went to a Yankee game, saw ground zero, top of the rocks, the citysights tour bus is another good way to go. There is so much to see and do there. The dislike the Airlink van service to the airport. I will never use them again.

The perfect skyline all I ever dreamed it would be. Before I visited USA and lived in London during WW11 everything glamorous was in the american films I saw and yes it was better than I ever dreamed!

A newish way to see the skyline you shouldn't miss!. Seeing the skyline is always always so wonderful.Today, I tried the East River ferry for the first time. Wonderful, zooming between different stops, starting from E 34th Street and ending up near Wall Street. $4 for a singe ride ... Well worth it, for 25 minutes on the water, with amazing views; next time, I will buy the $12 day pass and get off at various stops. A lovely, lovely way to spend time and amazing views of the skyline.

See it by boat.. We took the boat tour of this and it was great! You get to see everything in 90 minutes and the guide was quite knowledgeable and entertaining, Bought you up close and personal with the Statue of Liberty also. Another must do!
One of the world's greatest. Never get tired of looking up and marvelling. Especially when you come out of a subway station and look up.

Definitely Number One. Apparently others agree with us that this is dynamite. On a recent short stay we made an effort to find a restaurant on the jersey side of the river where we could eat and enjoy the sunset with the skyline. It was stupendous, despite the so-so food.

nice view. New York's skyline can be best viewed from the Brooklyn Bridge. It is definitely one of the finest cityscapes the United States has to offer. No trip to the Big Apple can truly be completed without it. It's free, though walking on the Brooklyn Bridge might be too intensive for others. Nice views and photo opportunities for free!
Breath definately taken away... Its just like you see in the films. Amazing. Had wanted to go to NY all my life and I will never forget it.

Different Places, different views. If you want an unobstructed 360 degree view of the city I recommend going to the Top of the Rock in Manhattan. I also went to a park in Williamsburg (near the ferry) and I also got some great skyline shots of Manhattan from across the water. I didn't go up the Empire State building but I've heard it is all caged in and therefore difficult to get nice photos.
Empire State building!. go up Empire State Building for a great view! go up to the 88th floor, but be prepared to queue!!!! Is it worth going up to the 102nd floor? dont think so!
Fantastic. Awesome views - our favourite vantage point was from the Circle Line "Harbour Lights" cruise from the tip of Manhattan and from the East River as the sun was setting. Wonderful.
Like no other. It's what NYC is all about, nothing like it at dusk when the night show of lights starts and the city comes alive with people heading out

The View. The view of the skyline is unimaginable - you must see to believe!
Every thing on our trip was superb - more than I would have ever believed a city could be!
Great but Cold in winter. Great views and small lines in the morning during winter but also very very cold in January . I did not think it was worth paying for going up to the top top level.
Hot & cool at the same time.. The view was breathtaking! The decor was cool yet peaceful. The bed was fabulous. Romantic bathtub and shower, also with a view!
Rock beats Empire. Top of the Rock was much better than the Empire State Building for views, organisation and overall enjoyment
Beautiful!. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful! especially at sunrise and sunset. I wouldn't miss it! The best way to see it is by taking the bridge and looking back!

Worth viewing from several perspectives. Manhattan's Skyline is worth viewing from streets at night (see attached pic of the Empire State Building from outside Macy's).
Also, worth viewing from Brooklyn Bridge by day, from Queens (where the Empire State Building is seen towering over others).
Good view. Staten Island ferry, empire state building, rockefeller building or brooklyn bridge will give you a good view. or just walk through the burrough. Pretty good view.

Best vantage points for viewing Manhattan. Hoboken Train Station and the adjacent pier and park.Jersey City, Exchange Place.Brooklyn Bridge, Brooklyn sideRoosevelt Island (the tram is a dramatic ride if it's operational)Staten Island FerryFerry from Hoboken or Exchange Place to World Financial Center or Pier 11 (Wall St)If you are going to NYC, it's worth a trip to at least ONE of these places to take in the skyline.
The Rocky buildings of the East.. It is majestic. The evening is my favorite time to look at the skyline. Was born and raised looking at this view and I never get tired of it 50 years later.
Awesome! Super great experience. Theres nothing to say about manhattan skyline. Look is awesome. One of the best place to stay in your lifetime.
Awesome NYC. So much to take in, wherever you look it's amazing. You will not be dissapointed. Very modern and never the same design.
Nice. What can you say about the Manhattan Skyline. It's gorgeous! Having a view from the room definitely made the trip all that more exciting.

A long island city point of view. For a truly spectacular of Manhattan just take the 7 train to the first in queens.(Vernon Jackson) . Walk down 50th ave to the water front (5 min walk.) Gantry park will greet you with truly spectacular views and a beautiful park to walk through .

Awesome and breath taking. I'm a new yorker and every time I fly back home, I get the chills!
Make sure to visit The South Street Seaport and go over the Brooklyn Bridge to Brooklyn Heights and work Pier 1 and the Promenade. Visit Noodle Pudding a fab restaurant. Enjoy Brooklyn Icecream on Pier 1 as well.

This was incredible.. Nothing quite like the incredible Manhattan Skyline. Absolutely incredible. Whether viewing it from Central Park or the top of the Empire State Building. One of the best in the world I have seen.

Greatiest city on earth!. I was born and raised in NYC and there is no better skyline in all the world. This is especially true when viewed at sunrise and sunset. It is best to see it from a bridge or one of the many tour boats. You can walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and get a fabulous and breathtaking view.
Great views. Great city views, we love view from "Top of the Rock" most and also do the Grey Line Night tour on the open double decker bus whenever we are there

Couldn't be better.. From the East River shoreline in Manhattan you get a view of the so-so Brooklyn skyline. But from the Brooklyn side you get an unbelievable view. It's not so much any skyscraper in particular as the view of all of them bunched together. Truly magnificent.

Stunning!. We had a view of the Manhattan skyline from the Hudson and East Rivers on board a cruise. It is really spectacular. Our tour guide was full of information, which made the trip even better. The Freedom Tower and Tower 4, at the site of the old WTC, look amazing from the river. There's so much history here, it's a "must see"

Amazing. One of the most amazing things ive seen... couldnt stop smiling with excitement as we approached. A must see for everyone.There is not much more to add, you can't really miss it but the best place to see the skyline is either from one of the islands or from a sightseeing cruise. Highly recommended!
Breathtaking. Top of the Rock is best way to see NY skyline and by using a New York Pass, getting to the top was a breeze!
GREAT VIEW. This can be seen from MANY different locations - wonderful view, specifically at night!!! Also, don't miss the view from the side of Liberty Island.

Impressive and Exciting- and Mostly Free!. Difficult to exaggerate this. The Manhattan Skyline is a superb sight from whatever angle you use. Try and see it from ferries (especially at dusk and during the evening); from Brooklyn (try walking over the Brooklyn Bridge), from the shore of New Jersey; from planes landing at La Guardia Airport (for domestic flights only).

fire works. we went to the fire works with the empire state building in the back ground. AMAZING
the harbor fire boats stole the show too in my book just AMAZING all the way around

The BEST City in the World. Except for a few drunken panhandlers, who hassle you ~ a problem that Giuliani had no tolerance for while Bloomberg thinks that it's okay for Tourists to get hassled by drunks ~ Times Square was GREAT!

The Best. We went to Brooklyn Promenade for the 1st time this trip and enjoyed watching the sunset and the lights coming on across the city, so pretty.Earlier in the week we had gone over to Roosevelt Island on the cable car at night and the skyline was was lovely to see from that vantage point too. I had always seen the city at night from up high before, so this was a different and low cost way to see the view.

There is really no other skyline to compare. New York's skyline is quintessentially New York. It's dynamic and dignified and vibrant and pulsing with energy, even if you are seeing it while you circle to land at LaGuardia. There is no place quite like NYC. To my mind though, the best view of the Manhattan skyline is seen from Brooklyn.

Impressive. We went to the Top of The rock to see 4th of july fireworks and sunset... You should go too. You can buy a ticket that allows you to go twice the same day....The secon time is for sunset...It's worth the price
NY NY My kind of town. Make sure you hit both Rockefeller and Empire State. Makes you proud to be an American. Dress warm as that wind can be biting cold.
Day and night. amazing to see at night and during the day. Caught the fireworks over central park on Friday night from the top of the Rockefeller centre

Time Square, Empire State, Trump Tower. The skyline is impressive especially at night. You should wear a good walking/running shoes. Don't forget the camera. These places are so crowded, be prepared for the crowd especially in restaurants.

Must see!. Liked the boats as they were on time! Weather was a bit windy couldn't enjoy as much as I hoped. There were bar on the boat. We saw Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty, New Jersey, WTC, etc.

impressive. Excellent especially from brooklyn side.
We crossed the brooklyn bridge @ 5PM and could enjoy a nice sundown on the skyline.
We took the boat back to manhatten.

Empire State Building. Great way to see the skyline. BUT don't buy your express ticket from the vendors outside the building. They work on commission so the ticket costs more. Buy your express ticket inside the building. The express ticket allows you to bypass all the others that are waiting in que.

It is tough to beat!. The only skyline which catches me quicker than Manhattan is the ride into San Francisco. The skyline here is just beautiful with all the recognizable buildings -- making it fin to play games with children on your way into the city. The Chrysler building is just so spectacular! The city is beautiful and BEATING at all times of the day. I love the "feel" that I get just walking on the streets (of course, I prefer away from the maddening crowds -- and you truly know the definition of this if you walk around 42nd Street in the theater district. But the beauty is readily apparent to all at night, with the lights. And it is really nice to sit in the outside patio at the top of the Peninsula Hotel for a drink and savor the manificence of all that NYC is (do this at night when it is dark and the lights are shining everywhere).
Wow. Unbeatable views everywhere you look. It never stops amazing you as you look from any place in the city.
Best skyline I've ever seen!. We saw from the top of the Rock (very rainy day) and from the Empire State Building. If I had a preference, go for the Rock if the weather is cooperating!

Great views all around!. How could I not review the world's most famous skyline!!?? Here's a tip from a commuter - if you're ever in the Weehawken area, you'll have an excellent view, almost lined up in the center of the view (now this is towards Lincoln Tunnel, so be careful with the traffic). If you enjoy taking photos, definitely find a water tour, cruise, or just the water taxis. Always check out the colors of the Empire State Building- it changes often and you can google why the colors are the way they are at any time - for instance, the next two weeks, the tower is multicolored to match the rings in the Olympic logo.Definitely hop on one of the tours and try to catch a view from the water and NJ.

breathtaking at night. we were there during a lightening storm.It lit up Manhatten and the city looked awesome.Manhatten looks fantastic on any clear night but it we were very lucky to see it during the storm

Views from High buildings. You can see for miles on a clear day and you must experience it at night - it's breathtaking. The different heights, designs, colours and shapes give a truly visual experience that is so hard to put into words. The better the camera the greater detail that you will capture - but your memory is the best recorder!¬
Breath taking view!. From our 24th floor hotel room, the view of Manhattan was nothing short of breath taking, both at night and during the day! What an awesome sight!

So much to see...What ever you do, use the hop on hop off buses... We were in new York for a week, def not long enough. The buses were great, we covered so much more ground, with commentary than we ever could on our own.

city Lights Tour. Booked city lights tour as part of Grey Line bus package. Nice view of the city from Brooklyn. seeing the city lights from the bus as night placed Manhattan in new perspective. enjoyed it.
Great views from Boulevard East on the NJ Side. And a great site depending on how your flight may approach LaGuardia Airport. It's unique although the absence of the Towers reawakens sad memories.

Beautiful sight. I have visited many cities around the US, but I have to say NYC has one of the most beautiful skylines I've ever seen. Take a ferry to the City and see the lights at night--it's breathtaking. The view from the Empire State Building is amazing!
World Famous and a got to do. There is not much more to add, you can't really miss it but the best place to see the skyline is either from one of the islands or from a sightseeing cruise

Where to get great skyline views in NYC. This year the skyline is changing and it will be fun to have pics of the new World Trade Center Tower before they are actually done.#1 = large boat tour/cruise. Sounds cheesy, but a large (steady) boat which sails during dusk is the best. Circle Line is a great example (but get on board early...see my Circle Line review)#2 = Top of the Rock. You get the views of the cool buildings because you aren't on top of the tallest ones.#3 = Top of the Standard Hotel. If you can manage to get into a roof top party day or night, this is a unique view of the city in all directions. Downtown, the Hudson, and Midtown are all in different directions and you are positioned high up to see it all.
Life changing. One of the most amazing things ive seen... couldnt stop smiling with excitement as we approached. A must see for everyone.
Spirit Dinner Cruise. Views of Manhattan Skyline, Brooklyn Bridge, Statue of Liberty were awesome! Dinner was delicious, entertainment so great!
still the best. everything about it... i live here I see it every day and its still breathtaking even as it changes and renews itself

Go To The Brooklyn Promenade, Look and Tell Me if There's a More Profound Skyline Anywhere. Go to the Brooklyn Promenade, it gives a breathtaking view of the Downtown Manhattan skyline, don't forget your camera

Amazing city. Found it very busy and safe It is a bit expensive for food other than that awesome. You have to take a new York taxi, subway, do the whole tourist thing, and definately go to Canal street it's an eye opener,

Postcard Pretty. The sight of the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn or from the Manhattan Bridge is indeed a sight to be behold during the day time or the night time. just picture perfect. I can say the same of the New Jersey skyline.
Best Skyline in the Northeast. I travel many places and this skyline is amazing. Check it out from the top of the empire state and you will see majority of it. It's wonderful!

You had been expecting it - but it is for Real. The best way to see it is from the Circle Line Cruise = 3 hours right round ManhattenIf you have three hours to spare in New York - want to relieve your feet and have a grandstand view of the city the Circle Line is a good option. If you just want to see the main sites then don't do the full tour - the first hour covers most of these: the West Side, Ellis Island, Statue of Liberty, Downtown and Wall Street, the new WTC Building. Tip - at peak time times get there early so you get a good seat - by a window on the left (port) side
Just as i imagined it. Brilliant looked like an enormous film set.It was stunning ,the buildings were so high and so many different designs. All set off by the river and the Brooklyn bridge
NY Harbor. Views were spectacular. The water taxi was comfortable and clean, but I did not like the commentary. He was young, cocky and full of himself.
the skyline. there is really nothing else like it. plus you get to explore brooklyn heights which really should be part of everyone's visit to NY.

beautiful!!. One of the best view of new york is see from there. I love to see the top of the building and of course this is a great way to see it. Empire state building is my favorite view of the skyline
Best way to see it is from Brooklyn. From the lovely Brooklyn Heights Promenade, and Brooklyn Bridge Park. You can walk across the Brooklyn Bridge to get here, though the bridge gets so crowded.
Still takes my breath away. Nothing like driving down Park Avenue at sunset and seeing the lights start to rise on the beautiful buildings

Top o' the Marriott Marquis. Ate at the restaurant there in Times Square. Met a friend there who was also visiting (and staying at this hotel) and had the prix fix dinner. The meal was good but incredibly expensive! Not sure if it was worth the price.

Beautiful. From the Observation Deck of the Empire State Bldg, Manhattan is spectacular. At night the city shine under the lights. We really did enjoy our time in Manhattan even though their are tons of people.
Try a few sights. From Staten Island Ferry and from the Brooklyn dock area - the best. Sometimes a bit hazy but still amazing

One of the best world views. No dislikes about this skyline it was awesome and we went over to Brooklyn at night in a bus loop tour and the view was one of the best I have ever seen. The guide on the bus gave us lots of info. and going over the Brooklyn Brtidge was the best!!
lived in nyc for a long time and cannot get tired of it. it is fascinating at every time of day, whenever I look out my window I see it staring right back, proud to live in a city like this

Great way to see New York!. This was a great experience in New York, and was a great way to place all the pieces of the puzzle together, when seeing it from above. The helicopter was wonderful, and the pilot was friendly and ready to answer any questions. You don't get that close to the statue of liberty, so that was a slight disappointment, but you get to see Manhattan from a distance (gorgeous), central park, the different buroughs, and the Yankee stadium, amongst other things. It is expensive, so this is definitely a treat, but would recommend if you have the funds.
Amazing.. Night time tour was a good way to experience this, as well as the ferry over to Liberty Island. Awesome.
Gorgeous. The drive in to NYC from PA was dreery and rainy but I could still make out the skyline. It was even better when the clouds pulled away and the day turned to night.

What's not to like?. I'm a sucker. I'm the guy who is constantly stopping and looking up, with my jaw dropping to the ground. The architecture is sensational, and every new view makes me appreciate it more. Tiny, NYC-sized rooms, but that's to be expected. Clean, quiet-- exactly what we needed. All personnel were extremely pleasant and effective.We loved the location: we could walk (with luggage) the two blocks from Penn Sta. Entrance to the subway was one block from hotel. We're not massively into the touristy stuff, but if you are, it's an easy walk to Times Square/BWay/42nd St. We're big noshers, and there were some fun local places nearby in Hell's Kitchen. Just a few blocks to the High Line.

Wow. Just an overall Wow! Viewed it from the Brooklyn Promenade (at night) - totally amazing. Walked the whole promenade and just stopped every now and again and sat gazing! One of the most beautiful sights on earth...............
cruise. My advice is, take a cruise tour on Hudson river at night and enjoy the great view. This is one of the best and famous skylines in the world
Empire State Building lighting the way. From our corner suite in the Trump SoHo, we had a fabulous City view with the Empire State Building lighting the way.
Who will miss this????. The best way to see it is on a ferry while you r visiting statue of liberty or from the Brooklyn Bridge!!!!

Incredible. I took some pictures from the cruise ship of Manhattan Skyline which were breath taking. I can share this but only through a direct email. I want to protect the image as I have been told, they are incredible. It was taken when the sun was starting to set and the building seemed to glimmer with a glow that I have never seen before
Must See Manhattan Skyline. Several places to see the Manhattan Skyline at it's best at the Rock or Empire State Building. Enjoyed seeing it during the day and it was beautiful at night too.

Beautiful. This is an awesome skyline! It's something everybody should see. If you have never been to NYC you've seen it hundred of times in pictures, movies, etc. However when you see if in person, it really looks 100 times better. The Staten Island Ferry gives you a good view also from ellis island or liberty island.

Best seen from Staten Island Ferry. Best photos can be taken from the Staten Island Ferry or Top of the Rocks? Some amazing new buildings being built - one huge Skyscraper on Park Ave, One 57 and of course the new WTC Buildings

everywhere. we saw manhattan skyline from the open top bus, a river cruise & from walking over Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan and every view was as good as the other. We found it very moving to now see the "Freedom Tower" in the place where the "Twin Towers" originally stood and once fully completed will be a fitting memorial.

A must see. Too expensive though.. I did that from the Rockefeller center. Amazing view. Especially watching Central park in the middle of all these buildings. 25$ though to climb up to the viewing terrace is way too much.

Great souvenir pics. We took the (free) Staten Island ferry for the views over lower Manhattan and the Statue of Liberty. Great on a clear day, but we did not find much of interest once on Staten Island.

Magnificent!. Cities are known by their skylines and the New York City skyline is distinctive and powerful. I miss the Twin Towers, but, it is exciting to see the "Freedom Towers" being built up higher and higher every day!
may it not be destroyed by overbuilding. Going over the Triborough Bridge seeing the skyline is breathtaking. May the Empire Building always stand above all.
Great view from the Brooklyn Bridge. There are so many views of the Manhattan Skyline. Another great place to view the Skyline is from Roosevelt Island.

Not pretty, but big. To me, the skyline looks a little beat up and older, but the size itself is pretty amazing. It's certainly impressive as you go towards it ready to enter a massive, bustling city.

Sunny Day View of Empire State Building. Don't miss the 360 degree views from the 86th floor deck of Empire State Building---the city is constantly changing its face, even if you've been up there before!

The Manhattan Skyline. In order to get a good view of the New York skyline I took the Pathe train over to Hoboken, New Jersy where I had lunch at a cafe called Johnny Rockets. I got some great views over the Hudson River back towards Manhatten. I must admit, lower Manhatten did look different without the twin towers. I would recommend this to those visiting the city. I managed to cover all the main sites in Manhatten, The Bronx and Queens and left this until last. I hope you enjoy it.

Dying to see Evita....staring Ricky M.. He wasn't there..on the nite we had tickets or the 2nd nite that we rebooked.....watched first half...but lead singer for Evita was not good...couldn't take it ...very high nasal voice, words were not clear! Chicago,the musical was outstanding...thank,God..after flying from Indy!

wonderful city i love the hustle and bustle of the city the traffic i can do without and all of the taxi cabs. i like jazz in harlem at the lenox lounge. the jazz takes place all night until 4am no trouble no drama just very good jazz and food.

Still impressive. I've lived in NY for more than 25 years and never cease to be impressed by the skyline. The Brookly Height Promenade is the best spot to see the skyline in NY and sit on a bench and enjoy the activity in the harbor with the skyline as background.

Finally saw it live!. It was kinda incredible to see the skyline in real life, rather then from a television or a movie theatre! I walked 5 hours one day and another 4 hours the following just taking it all in and it was great.
Bucket list check-off!

A SKLINE NOT TO BE MISSED!. We tried to see the skyline from many different vantage points and different times of day. We were very fortunate to be in NY for a week of good weather so that made this easy. The view from the top of the Rock was spectacular and can easily be combined with the NBC experine Tour and the Rockefeller Center Tour. Seeing the lights of the city come on at night is also a must see.
Finally after many years we saw it.. It's something you have to see at least onces in your life!
