Incredible view.. The Manhattan Skyline is an awesome sight to see and well worth it. It is a photographers dream. You need to have a good camera and be willing to take many many pictures from all angles.

Everything that you expected............. You have probably seen it on film and have read that the New York skyline is a sight to be seen..................well, it definitely is. We took a bus trip to Woodbury Common and on both the outer and return trip we had a photo opportunity to snap the skyline. Awesome.............

Stunning. There is no doubt that NYC has an amazing skyline. In my opinion the best way to see it was by walking across the Brooklyn Bridge. We started the walk about 30mins before it started to get dark then found the perfect viewing spot on the bridge and waited until it got dark, as the sun set there was so many perfect photo opportunities and by going a bit earlier we secured our spot. Gorgeous!
Amazing view. Go across the river to Brooklyn at night the view along the Hudson river is amazing
Must see. Have to see it. Unfortunately, everyone wants to charge you to go on top of their buildings to see it! If the day is overcast save your money. The Top of the Rock def has the best view.
Picture Postcard. So good seeing this at night. Felt I was in a dream or on set of a movie as that was where I had seen it as a child. Had to pinch myself that this was reality. Wonderful!
View it from the Brooklyn Bridge. You can get a great view, especially of lower Manhattan and the new World Trade Center from the Brooklyn Bridge. The views are phenomenal.
Best City View in America. So many famous buildings in one view. No other American city compares.
Beautiful!. There are several ways to enjoy this...from the Empire State Building, from the Staten Island Ferry...so take it all in!!
Spectacular. Saw from various points - particularly from various bus tours.Good view from Broklyn
An Iconic Must. Breathtaking and unforgettable. Really brought home that we were in New York - especially at sunset.
excellent. we loved everything about manhattan and the skyline. Go for it

Harbor Cruise gives a spectacular view!. There are several Harbor tours, including the free Staten Island ferry where you can get an awesome view of the Manhattan skyline. Don't leave New York without taking a chance to see Manhattan from this angle as well.
nothing better than this... its a must for every NY tourist I would highly recommend the helicopter tours.
Staton Island Ferry. Free, uncrowded and some great views. Too bad there is no subway service on the island. Just exit, re-enter and enjoy the return trip..
Everyone should see it. Everyone should see New York as from the top floor and as the skyline itself.
The view from the Staten Is ferry was awesome.. ferry ride was free:). This was a great opportunity to take pictures of the Statue of Liberty and the NY skyline.
The Empire State buliding. Went up the Empire State,go early as it gets very busy

Soon to be excellent again. The Freedom Tower helps to fill out the terrible hole left in the skyline. It will never completely replace the Towers for many of us, but I look forward to seeing it completed. I will then emend this to the five stars that Manhattan deserves. For now, a work in progress.
Unique to Manhattan.. Try the empire state building or Top of the rock. Go at sunset to enjoy the scene in the light and after dark.
Fabulous. This is a great outing, really pretty and great for kids and adults alike. An easy maximum 1 hour walk . Interest scene and really unique. Don't miss this.
The sky line was unbelievable from the top of Rockefeller centre. It was great to go to the "Top of the Rock" It was unexpensive and there were no lineups
out of this world. out of this world,it seemed strange a first ever thing was so high around you ,but once you got used to it, it was lovely,i've never seen so many police cars and yellow taxi's
Top of the rock amazing!. View from the top of the rock is amazing. If your deciding between top of the rock and empire state def go for the rock, empire state doesnt even compare.

A must in NYC. Awesome spot if you're visiting the city! Me and my wife walked all over it before taking a ferry cruise on the east river. For free you got a great view on Manhattan, all you've seen in the movies is right there, for your own eyes! Definitely a must if you travel in New York, and great alternative to the Empire State Building observatory.

Great from any vantage point.. The view is amazing from every angle. No matter where you look from grab a photo. From the top of the rock or Staten island ferry or the Brooklyn bridge its simply great.

Second to none!. Manhattan is such an exciting city pulsing with life that to take it all in you need to find somewhere to view it and marvel at it. It doesn't matter if you choose to go up the Empire State Building or the Top of the Rock, or take a Harbour cruise! There are so many iconic buildings that you need to take the time to take them all in.
Amazing!. We viewed the night skyline from the water it was truely amazing
Breathtaking!. Did not disappoint. Check out the view from the Brooklyn Bridge (on foot), and Brooklyn Heights
Harbour Cruise. Please do the harbour dinner cruise. Brilliant. The Manhattan skyline at night is breathtaking!
Can't miss. The skyline is amazing and visible from so many spots in the city!
New York New York it's a wonderful town. I love New York I can't say anything bad, the skyline is amazing.
nyc skyline. it's a fine view! Human's aren't much, really, but this is quite an accomplishment.
must see. fantastic site day and night, well worth doing the hop on hop off bus tours, and they do one at night, only you can hop on or off that one.
Amazing. I live in Manhattan, and everytime I am on BQE overlooking Manhattan skyline, I just feel that it's amazing!

View from the Top!. It's an exciting ride in the Sky! It had given an awesome view from the top which was reflecting the whole New York indeed. The rows of Buildings, Cars, Humans everything were visible. The high rise buildings are just there and I'm above of them! Really cool!

From the East River Ferry. The sunset was incredible, we were at the South Seaport downtown Manhattan and walked the Brooklyn Bridge which apart from refurbishment work which blocked some views was amazing. We then walked to the River Cafe in Brooklyn for cocktails and then an unplanned but fantastic ferry ride on the East River Ferry at 8pm took as back up to 40th Street and a short walk to our hotel...ferry was $4 each !!!

Fabulous Manhattan Skyline. Being from the country maybe one of the reasons why we love the Manhattan Skyline or maybe just because it seems so familiar due to movies etc. Being able to pick out the Chrysler Building, Empire State Building and of course the Statue of Liberty... We saw the Skyline from the Jersey side many times during our 4 day escape into the city, as we travelled back and forth visiting friends etc.

Breath taking!. Take the 1 hour statue of liberty boat trip (does not stop on liberty island or ellis island). It takes you round Liberty Island with some fantastic views of the statue without batteling tourists and then over to the Brooklyn Bridge and there are fabulous views of the NY skyline.

Lucky to see Twin Towers in summer 2001. Unless you live under a rock then you all know by now what happened in Sept.2001. Fortunate enough to taken a wonderful ferry ride from New Jersey into NYC in summer 2001. Enjoyed views of bridges, Statue of Liberty and the beautiful Manhattan Skyline with the Twin Towers still intact. Appreciation of NYC and USA increased after you know what occurred. Memories luckily captured on film and in my heart. Thank you for the wonderful time !
unique skyline. What we all know and love about new york is the skykine. THe new addition of the freedom tower will complete the cahnges since 911.

The Greatest City on Earth!!. New York, New York... What else can you say? Looking at the skyline as you enter the city via the George Washington Bridge is nothing short of breathtaking. To think of the history dating back to the pre-revelotionary days gives you goose bumps. Even the small areas on both sides of the bridge have history....Ft. Lee on the NJ side and Ft. Washington on the NY side date back the the beginning of the revolution when the English drove Washington's army out of NY. His top General (Lee...father of the famous Civil War General Robert E. Lee) held the NJ side while Washington held the NY side....hence the names Ft. Lee and Ft. Washington. As a native New Yorker, I could go on forever on the history of NY but I must says that everyone in this country must see the skyline at least once in their life. If anyone has any questions on the history of New York or would just like to discuss it, feel free to email me at bonko99 at aol dot com. I would love to talk with you!!

No place like NYC. People, when in Times Square don't stand in the Middle of the side "walk" looking up "ooooh look at the tall building with the lights!!" Real NYer's are walking there too even realer NYer's are trying to pick pock you move to the curb LOL!WELCOME TO NY!
It's so cool. The first time you fly into NYC it's like you have been there before. All the buildings that you have seen in the movies and in pictures are all there
great view. Best from Brooklyn Bridge or the Staten island ferry
cute and original promenade. unique, but don't expect too much. The concept is exciting, the result is nice, but it's not much more than a promenade.
Jersey sight. I love taking the ferries just to see the Manhattan skyline esp at night The skyscraper shapes all seem to come to life
It could be more amazing. We was waiting so much time before entered there and then found it not so interesting.
Phew!. The view from the Ferry was lovely, but not seeing the Twin Towers was saddening
an amazing city. It is hard to imagine there could be a place where 8.2 million people live and work, but this city is that place. The skyline is a magnificent human-generated site to behold.
World famous. What can I say? this view is known to everyone and does not dissapoint.

Nothing in the world. Every thing inclufing the noise and sounds Memorial at WTC was very peacful and worth the visit.
Liberty,Governer's island, Staten island ferry,no expense on tne ferries,South street sea port, West side downtown.
I can go on and on
Absolutely Beautiful. We love the Manhattan Skyline every time we see it.

Greyhound Twilight Cruise. Take the Greyhoud Twilight Cruise. It's a 90-minute cruise which leaves from pier 78 and goes around the financial district on the East River to United Nations building. Back down to Statue of Liberty to end again at Pier 78. There is somebody onboard to point out interesting buildings. In our case this was a really entertaining and knowledgeable person. We enjoyed the cruise, sights are beautiful and we have some really nice pictures. The skyline is fantastic!Other option off course is Brooklyn Promenade which is free.
new york, new york. had to do the Empire State Bldg- quiet during January- and passed through the shop at the end without blowing my budget

View this from Long Island. Most people think the best view is from the water coming back from visiting the Statue of Liberty, but the best view of the skyline (the one you see from nearly all the films and newsrooms) is the one from Long IslandThe views are spectacular, both day and night
Love that Skyline. We took the Zephyr boat cruise. Well worth it. The skyline is impressive!
Best city in the world.. Nice views. You can really see all of New York City. Very very recommended.
Amazing. The view is just amazing! Also from the water once you are on a ferry from the Staten Isl
Manhattan at Night. Took the Grey Line night tour. Actually purchased a 72 hr. pass for the bus, and started with the night tour. Continued to use the hop on hop off feature for the rest of the trip

Top of Empire State. What a great view! Try to go on a clear day. Be careful of salesmen outside promising to whisk you to the back door & away from the long lines... the lines were not long & we were charged much more than a front door experience!
Chelsea. Don't miss the High Line!! Nice at any time of day or evening. We bought food in nearby markets and took it up there to eat. Always a great breeze.
Lovely. Amazing and what was even better is that on the open top bus at night, we went through the Manhattan bridge which gave us such a lovely view
a skyline you will never forget. there is no orther skyline like new york city very impressive i must say
Great from Land & Sea. Amazing viewed from Circle Line Boat trip and water taxi.
Chicagos skyline klår New Yorks!. Efter att ha sett Chicage så imponerade inte New Yorks skyline.
beautiful skyline. great views of the Manhattan skyline from Circle Cruise Line around Manhattan island
Great view. Got a great view from the ferry over to the statue of liberty. Also saw it at night on a night tour by bus but unable to get a great view of the statue of liberty.

Top of the Rock. We've done both the Empire State Bldg and the World Trade Center (pre 9-11), and this view from midtown is also very good. You can see Central Park from above, and ESBldg from a different perspective. Shorter lines too!
With love from Manhattan. NYC is a great city to explore.Always new things to do.God bless New york .Great vacation place .
Beautiful, especially at night.. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful, especially at night. We have an incredible picture taken from the Staten Island Ferry.
great views throughout the city. Our favorite views were from our boat trip and walking across Brooklyn bridge.
Beautiful!. Perfect spot for all of us tourist to take pictures :)

Take the PATH to Hoboken or Jersey City for an amazing view. For a great view that many tourists don't get to see head over to New Jersey. Hop on the PATH train from the WTC or the stations on 6th av (9th, 14th, 22nd, 33rd st) to Newport. Walk over to the waterfront for an amazing view of downtown Manhattan. Alternately get the PATH to Hoboken which is worth visiting in itself. Walk North up from the station up along Frank Sinatra Drive for a stunning view of Chelsea and Midtown. After the hustle and bustle of Manhattan, Hoboken is refreshingly quiet and using a tripod is no problem. One word of caution, the PATH doesn't run throughout the night so check the times before you head over.

Unforgettable, I love it. To me, the best place to see it is The Empire State Building. A little pricey. but you can get a combined entrance fee with many of the NY tours. Barring that, when you go to Ellis Island or the Statue of Liberty the view across the water is beautiful, an American classic.
Stunning and like no other. No matter where viewed from the Manhattan skyline is stunning like no other

Visited NYC 5 times in the last year, the Skyline always amazing. Take a free RT on the Staten Island Ferry and take photos. Make sure to walk around the ship to view the Skyline from all different angels. Go both at night and during the day.
breathtaking. My wife did not want to leave our room.We stayed at the Helmsly park lane hotel in a king executive overlooking the full length of Central park.
First thing to do when you arrive in NY. First thing to do when you arrive in NY, on your own, with friends, with your love... but day or night so different, so gigantic...

Awesome view. Love the skyline. Looked over while the plane is landing over Newwark liberty airport, saw it from State Empire building at midnight, watched during day time from the Top of the Rock. Every time is fascinating.

The High Line Elevated Park. Best walked on a day below 85 degrees F or in late afternoon when building shadows are cast. There is not a huge amount of horticultural diversity but certrainly enough to make the walk both pleasant and interesting. The planned blossom change from month to month is very effective. This Historic Manhattan landmark is on a budget dependent on fund raising and is not a city park. There are food concessions and cold drinks and a number of places to rest in the shade. The lower west side has quite a few interesting archetectural building designs and the place is very safe to walk..http://www.thehighline.org/

Top of the Rock. Amazing to see the city stretch out in front of you in all directions.The view from Hoboken is pretty amazing as well, just like all the famous pictures.Hadn't been to NYNY since 911 so was pretty sad for me to see it without it's mostfamous landmarks.
Beautiful..... There is nothing better than a quick getaway to NYC! I've been there many times and never tire of the beauty of the Manhattan skyline!
I love NYC. So easy to get around Time square is the greatest must visit at night tooI felt very safe at all timesNothing to dislike Fav restaurant Hard Rock Cafe
Just beautiful. What else can you say? It's Manhattan skyline. The best skyline of the world and you do not get tired of watching it over and over!

The Manhattan Skyline is still WOW. If there is anything that evokes NYC, it's our skyline. There are many places across the river that give a great view: Long Island City, Brooklyn Heights, and Liberty Park in New Jersey.
Great View!!. I usually watch from the boardwalk of Jersey city. It's a nice view of Manhatten Skyline. Immpressive view during night. Also can watch by boat/ferry.
New York Skyline. A beautiful view of the skyline can be seen from the Ferry going to the Statue of Liberty. You are out in the water and the city behind you....fabulous!
excellent from brooklyn. walk on brooklin bridge, visit the old brooklin and enjoy the skyline view from the promenade...
view it from NJ side, Hoboken. Stunning view over the river; if you have a car, drive up to the crest of the cliffs of NJ, or take a ferry over and view it from the bank.
Grayline Double Decker Bus Tour. Fantastic "Night Tour" across Brooklyn Bridge and view of Manhattan Skyline. Wow! A must-see!

Even Better than Expected. Just like seen on TV! It looks so much different depending on the time of the day, but for me the best was at night & the best way to see it was from the ferry which takes you for a cruise around the Statue of Liberty

Everywhere. Wherever you view of the skyline of Manhattan it will be amazing. I enjoyed these views during the day and only saw the night view from Long Island City which was also pretty awesome.
Overwhelming. Incredible buildings, lights, heights, and whats really great is to watch them from "little" holes in central Park, you just cant believe you´re there.
NY Views. We visit Top of the Rock where you can have a 360° view. Also from the ferry that goes around the Liberty Statue we take great pictures
Great!. Could see the entire Manhattan skyline from our hotel. Had a great view of the Empire State Building from our room.

the view from Dream PHD bar is best in the city. It was a really warm Summer evening and we sat outside on the terrace. and enjoyed a cocktail. Our waitress was lovely and knowledgeable. All cocktails were available including some really cool new ones!

Great view. It is awesome for taking pictures and sightseeing if you have binoculars (looks better at night of course). There are many places that you can go to in Jersey for the perfect view (Hoboken, Downtown Jersey City, Edgewater, West New York, etc.)

Nothing can beat this view.. :). I saw the pleasing view of Manhattan sky line from Newport.
It looks amazing, beyond words. From Newport you can travel into Manhattan by subway in just 10 minutes.
Specially, during clear night, the skyline looks more beautiful.
thumbs up.

Skyline. Very beautiful especially by boat. Impressive at night as well.
Quite interesting when helicopters fly by.
Amazing. We went to the Top of the Rock...day time...was great. My only regret is that we did not see the skyline at night...that would have been awesome.
Stunning. So beautiful. Go to the top of Ink48 at sunset and stay long enough for it to get dark - the view is stunning!
Best views. View from Top of the Rock is awesome, as it is on a boat from the Hudson.
One of the best views in America...inspiring. It's one of a kind. There is no other town like New York, New York. A day visit is documentary in nature, the night embracing.
Beautiful view of Manhattan skyline. Wonderful views from the ferries that cross the Hudson, go to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Island, and cross over to Jersey city!
View to die for. Went up the Empire State on what must have been the clearest day in history. The views we stunning and the only reason we didnt stay longer was the cold.

Stunning. I viewed the Manhattan skyline from Top of the Rock and a NY Waterway sunset cruise. I highly recommend both.I loved the sunset cruise. It was 1.5 hours. You get views of the city when it is still light outside, as the sun is setting and when it is dark. It takes you fairly close to the Statue of Liberty as well and stops there for a bit. There is commentary through the cruise as well which was nice. I absolutely loved it!

Who wouldn't want to see the Manhattan Skyline?. From our experience, the best way to view the Manhattan Skyline is through:a) Taking a boat cruise along the Hudson River.b) Visiting the Observatory at Empire State Building (or Rockefeller Centre, Top of the Rock). Either of these two will give you a great glimpse of the Manhattan Skyline looking north and south; the boat cruise has a night schedule and Empire State observatory is open until 0200 hours so I suggest you take a day visit and a night visit to maximize the Skyline view. This is not to miss when visiting NYC.
Fantastic. The skyline at night is fantastic...Even though you miss the "Towers" in the picture, it is an amazing city...
Always impressive. It never loses the ability to amaze. Thre really is nothing else like it in the world.

Can't see enough of it!. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from every angle and it never gets old. We saw it at twilight from a boat cruise, from under the Brooklyn Bridge on the Brooklyn side, from the Piers along the Hudson and East Rivers, from atop the Manhattan bridge, you name it. Love that view!!
Beautiful!. No words needed, just a definite must see! Best seen from the Statue of Liberty or Ellis Island.
Empire State. The view fantastic book via internet and get express tickets saves alot of queying
Unbelievable. We saw it at night and it was unbelievable. The buildings are so tall... it all looks so exciting and busy

from Brooklyn Bridge Park. walked Brooklyn Bridge to the Park and back to Manhattan. Excellent walk. Not to long. With photo stops and gazing...took about 45 minutes each way. If one is lazy, take subway to Brooklyn and walk back to Manhattan. View much better from Brooklyn to Manhattan. Not so much the other way around.
World Class!. What can you say but, "WOW." Any ferry ride will afford great views. Or walk the Brooklyn Bridge for spectacular views!
Breathtaking from every angle.. Take the 1 hour boat tour and te bus tour. You will see many angles of this awesome skyline...
Worth visiting. It runs from 12th st up to 30th street on the west side, and there are stairs every 100 metres. Go!
No other place like it.. See it from the top of the Rock. Fantastic view of the city.

Like being at the grand canyons except there buildings. You need to take time to look carefully at the buildings for the beautiful archetics of the building not just the heights of the buildings great city though
Beauty at its best. Everyday I wake up and go to sleep looking at the skyline, it's beautiful.
Manhattan at night. The view and the lights were exceptional. We took the boat ride to the Statue of Liberty and it was awesome.
Great, it's New York!. Went on 3 bus tours and they were great. Liked the one that went over the Brooklyn Bridge at night (was on the doubledecker)

Stunning view!. Seeing the Manhattan Skyline from one of the ferries or water taxis available in the city is priceless, the view is wonderful and many beautiful pictures can be taken there.There’s nothing quite like it, this it is a familiar view that most of us recognize from movies, television shows, etc, even if we’ve never been in NYC…..but actually being there and seeing it for yourself…. you will be flabbergasted!
What else is there to say. It is impressive and will be more so once the new Freedom Towers are completed.
The city that keeps going. The city was very clean and we felt safe at all times. This place is huge, even comparing it to Chicago
Unsurpassed. What's not to like? NYC's sky line is singular, gorgeous, breathtaking, and grand!

The best. No place else has this skyline; it's the greatest in the world. Everytime I see it from across the Hudson River, I get touched by it's ever changing beauty. Can't wait for the new World Trade Center to finish
What a view !!. Everything I thought it would be -- very impressive.
Check out Brooklyn Heights View!. This is my favorite location for viewing the Manhattan Skyline. And while in the Heights, check the sidewalk cafe's, too.
What can you say!. Looking at the sky line is like being in the middle of a movie set.
Beautiful day or night. Even if you cross over to New Jersey you get to see the beauty of the skyline from far.
Must do - a walk on Brooklyn bridge. I did a walk on the Brooklyn bridge in a sunny hot day and was wonderful.

Absolutely amazing - when in comes to US cities New York is the King. So many must see places. If you go to the Empire State Building and can afford it I would recommend the VIP tickets to reduce the wait in lines which can be brutal based on the number of people we walked past.
beautiful. This changes depending on where you are, but it is always interesting and beautiful.
Magical. It's the best skyline in the world - old and new side by side. Especially wonderful at night. Take a Staten Island ferry ride and watch the skyline in all its' splendor.

Beautiful Skyline. Take a boat cruise to see the sky line or the free Staten Island ferry. It's beautiful and if you take one of the paid cruises, they will tell you the history of the city, certain buildings and historical events. I would also recommend a night tour either by boat or by bus.
4th of July Beauty. We went to the Jersey Side on the pier to watch the Macy's 4th of July fireworks, the only word that would describe this is AWSOME!!!

Greatest Sky line in the world!. It is like no other skyline, truly breath taking. Many ways to view it, but the best is to take the circle line boat ride, or the shark out of the South Sea Seaport.It has to be viewed from far away. You have a great view coming from Queens, traveling West on the LI Expressway (495) or on the BQE traveling towards the City from Brooklyn.
One of a kind. The view is great from the Brooklyn bridge. Spend the money and take cruise, it's worth the time.

my first NY trip. I really loved to have picnic from different "Delis" at Central Park, Bryant Park, Battery Park.... The NY-Pass, Water Taxi, Hop on Hop off and Manhatten Cruising makes able to see the most attractions of NY.At most I liked the walk on Highline-Garden, starting at 30th Str, leaving at 21. Str, crossing Chelsea (Chelsea Market from 9th to 10th Ave) and back on the Highline from meatpacking district in the dark. I really didn´t like the bad trafficat rush hour.
Unique. We went to the top of the Rock and the Empire State. No queues at the beginning of July. V. well organised.
There's no view better than the NY skyline!. There's nothing to dislike. On a clear day, the skyline from Empire State Building is forever! Go early though - the queues can be up to 4 hours.
Magnificent. An overall picture of this diverse and bustly(not to mention famous) city. Best viewed from one of the ferries or the Brooklyn Bridge
Manhattan's ace.. It is so impressive, in fact is so awsomethat at first sight of it it takes your breathaway.
Beautiful!. The view you saw so many times in movies etc... Now it's impressing to see it by yourself

Top of the Rock. Great observation tower- recommend over Empire
expensive - three levels of viewing - mini movie before entering observation area - clean - fancy - kids will love it
Sky Line. The Manhattan Skyline was awesome. I went on the Empire State Building lookout. You could see for miles, incredible!!!!
Dazzling skyline. Just walking and looking up at the tall buildings is fun. While you are looking up check out some of the beautiful buildings.

Many places to see the skyline.. From inside the city, the two obvious choices are the Empire State Building, and the Top of the Rock. The Top of the Rock is by far the best with way more room to move around and take a look at everything below. You can also see the Empire State Building from it.Other great places are Brooklyn Bridge Park in Brooklyn as well as many sites in Jersey City, Hoboken, or Weehawken NJ.
Best view from Top of the Rock. Fabulous views on a clear day. Great view of the Empire State Bldg.

The city that never sleeps! You will have a great time in the best City on Earth!. Maybe you can tell I am from New York! Flew in for two days and lived life like I never left! You DON'T need a vehicle when you have the best transportation stsyem on the planet! Get some NYC Pizza.. Nothing like it in the world!

Unforgettable. 23rd June 2012 sat in Liberty State Park watching Sara Bareilles in concert with the backdrop of the sun setting over Manhattan & The Empire State Building lit in rainbow colours. I felt so lucky....its a moment I will never forget.
July 4th in NYC --- brilliant fireworks and skyline views!. There is nothing better than July 4th in NYC. The crowd is happy and patriotic and Macy's does a great job with the fireworks!

A wonderful holiday destination.. Need at least 2 weeks here to get the best from your visit. Plan your trip around the New York Pass. Great value, and certainly motivates you to visit sites that you may not have thought of. Went to the Yankee Stadium to watch a game. Fantastic. Try to buy tickets direct as ticket boxes add a large chunk of commission!What I didn't like was prices shown on anything you buy, did not include local tax. Very frustrating when not use to this . If possible stay away in high season, just so hot and endless crowds
unique & varying. living in NY and crossing the bridges into it daily, one can still never tire of the view. it changes day-to-day, hour by hour....facets of the beauty of human urbanism on Earth
world's best. Nothing beats the Big Apple - -even better is a room on the Hudson.
So Iconic. viwed by night on way to dinner in Yonkers, it was lovely
Best in the world!. The best, most picture perfect skyline ever! One of the most familiar in the world, and for goo reason!
New York as you imagine it. Breathtaking skyline from above, a little claustrophobic from below
Great experience. really impressive, a wonderful combination of art and building, history and modern art. Sunset view is sure a great experience
New York needs to visited at least once in your life. My daughter and myself walked or caught the subway all hours of the day and night and never felt threatened.

unforgetable. Anytime, any occasion, skyline attract me the most. I have been to NYC not less than 8 times but I budget my time specially for the Manhattan skyline. My family also enjoyed at lot during our recent visit to NYC.
Here's a tip on a great way to see the skyline!. Be sure to sign up for a 2 day hop on/hop off bus pass...it includes a cruise that's awesome!

as seen from a yacht. Beautiful.. Through a company called SideTours, 5 other guests and I were taken on an evening cruise on a 30-foot sailboat. We saw the Manhattan Skyline, Statue of Liberty, Ellis Island, and New Jersey from the harbour.
Great views. Loved the views from the DUMBO area of Brooklyn and from the cruise around Manhattan Island
Loved it!!. Nothing it was well worth it, especially the cocktails
Night time. We rode the double decker bus on the night tour and saw the Manhattan skyline at sunset. Beautiful
Interesting and Amazing!. We just loved NY...period....the buildings, the people, the food, the shows, the attractions. It is a very exciting and fun place to visit!

A Great Deal!. There are several ways to enjoy the skyline.On a cruise around the island which is rather expensive, but one sees it all. My suggestion is to take the IKEA ferry from the base of Wall street at the pier.During the week one must spend $15 p.p. at IKEA in order to have a free ride over & back....eat lunch there while looking at Ms Liberty, BUTsave those receipts! Or go on the weekend for free....make sure you time your ride back near sunset to see lower Manhattan in all it`s glory. An other option is to take the ferry from East 34th St to Brooklyn and Queens,ride down from the 1st stop in Queens to Dumbo in Brooklyn.....get off and enjoy wandering around that historic area...plenty of places to eat...all prices....visit the carousel, a bookstore or the few galleries,enjoy chocolate from Jacques Torres, then get another ticket back to the Wall Street area(great views) or in the summer continue on to Govenor`s Island where one can walk,rent a bike, or go on the jitney to explore the island, and take in the skyline views of lower Manhattan...also one can see the Statue of Liberty. Last idea....just get on the Staten Island Ferry and ride over and back for the same view.
Beautiful!. So many things to see and the architecture is amazing, but overwhelming!

Simply the best you ll ever see. The best skyline in the world....from the top of a building such as the Empire State Building in the heart of Manhattan or from a distance such as the free ferry to Staten Island that passes by the statue of liberty, the view of this skyline is the most impressive you ll ever see in your life.

Just like you've seen in the films. Take the Gray line 'hop on/ hop off' bus and do the Brooklyn night tour...the skyline is best viewed from Brooklyn and as it says in the title... '...it's just like in the movies...' amazing view and so clearly now etched in my mind.
Unbeatable. The spirits lift as ono as one sees the skyline coming in from the airport
You can't beat the skyline in NY. For a great view head to the roof of Ink48 in Hell's Kitchen and treat yourself to a view and drink.

Getting there. It's wonderful and the new towers are stunning! I believe they hold a significance in their height and although I had heard about the people from NYC being rude, they are not and they adore the English - v sweet;)
Awesome. The lights were awesome! Perfect everyday. Love it!
great from Brooklyn Bridge. There are many ways to see the Skyline.... best while walking across Brooklyn Bridge
Must See. We saw the Manhattan Skyline from a range of locations however the best views were from the ferry over to the Statue of Liberty and from the Top of the Rock.

Still excites!. Moved out of NYC 34 years ago but I still get a thrill when I travel down to the city and get a glimpse from route 17. Crossing the Hudson on the GWB affords a great view. The skyline has changed over the past few years but I still refer to NYC as my hometown.

THE ROCK ROCKS!!!!. It was a lovely clear afternoon when we booked to go to the top of the Rockefeller Center. I was happy to know we could stay as long as we wanted to, so we waited till all the lights came on and New York sparkled. We fell in love with Central Park after a tour and it was great to see just how huge it is from way up high. I took lots of photos being able to walk all around the top of the building. There's nothing but air between you and New York from the top of the Rock. It was a "HIGH" point during our week in New York.
NYC Skyline. The lights were amazing and the changing colors of the Empire State Building were a sight to behold!
the one, the only, the original. All other skylines on earth come in second to the original
What can I say about a legendary view?. Exactly what I expected it to look like. Saw it from different places and at different times of the day and evening. Superb.
Amazing view of an amazing city.. Had the priviledge to visit NY. Will never forget the view, and the achievement of human effort, everything compact into 1 city.

Green energy above the traffic. Loved that a thing so derelict has been transformed into an amazing public space. The energy and imagination that has gone into creating this wonderful garden space to be enjoyed by all is really amazing and inspiring. A highlight of our trip to NYC..
Liberty. Great trip on the Circle Line on a sunny day, the 75 min one is long enough though
Can't be bettered. Perfect at night, perfect during the day. Love it!
What's there to say..... The Manhattan Skyline is awesome. Take time to recognize and enjoy all the different types of architecture.
a place to love. I completely loved this place in Manhattan, it has it all. It's a great place for all of the fotography lovers. If you go to Brooklin you can get the best views of this place.
Wait until the new WTC towers are up!. I wonder if anyone has ever rated this average?! The view from the ferry to the Statue of Liberty is impressive.
OMG. Totally breathtaking!!! By far the best city skyline the world has to offer.

Rock on. Way too much hype!!We bought express tickets off a touter on the street coust us 80 dollars but allowed us the skip the ques.The 3d flight is impressive but by the time we reached the top if was jammers. You could hardly get outside onto the deck and it was a pushing match to get anywhere near the barriers resulting in no photos and a frazzled head.I could wait to get back down and felt no satisfaction whatsoever for our efforts.Go to the rockafella its beautiful down there and its a lot more orderly and mannerly up top plus you see the exact same things!!

Great Views of the Manhattan Skyline from Jersey City, NJ. There's a wonderful promenade along the west side of the Hudson that provides unobstructed views of Manhattan, especially in the afternoon and early evening when the sun is on the building and then as the lights come on on all of the skyscrapers.
Amazing. Breathtaking, and it's amazing to see it change during sunrise in the morning. Specially the view towards the new World Trade Center tower still under construction.
empire state 3 hour que not pleasant when crowded. cab fare very reasonable plenty of value restaraunts,plenty to do

Just look at the ever evolving alway breathtaking!. Gone but not forgotten the WTC but in it's place a big "F-U" to the losers that tried to take us down! New colorful lights abound at the tops of mid-towns buildings . Always a treat
The Skyline. Took the 3 hour ferry around the island of Manhattan. WELL WORTH IT. And we learned a lot about the history of the area.

Impressive!. The view from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade at sunset is fantastic! And don't forget to taste the delicious ice cream from the Brooklyn Ice Cream Factory!
Best view in the world. Great to look at. We still miss the towers, but the skyline sends chills up and down me. I still love to look at it no matter how many times i see it.

Breathtaking, better than I could have hoped for!. Manhattan, my God, you are beautiful.... you took my breath away...I only wish the weather had been warmer, so I could have stood watching you for longer !

Best View of the City. On our recent trip to NYC, we found two low cost ways to see this beautiful skyline - Staten Island Ferry and from the fourth floor of the Metropolitan Museum. The Staten Island Ferry gave a great view of the skyline from the south and southeast. It was a free ride on the ferry. The view from the Met was also excellent. It is so impressive to see the high rise buildings all along Central Park. It is also free to all visitors with a paid admission to this gem of the city. All of these views were wonderful. This is a spectacular city!
Good little extra. Fab little added extra to the Empire State and a good way to jump a lot of the queues for the top! Definitely worth the extra!

New york, new york so nice they named it twice!. Everyone must visit new york at least once!!! Its such an exciting city. You could never be bored. From shopping to sightseeing and then a Broadway Musical or two in the evening! I am addicted and cant wait to go back

Beautiful at night on the city bus tour. We purchased a 48 hour city tour bus ticket with Grayline bus tours, which was extremely handy so we saw the skyline at night on this. Very impressive.

Ever-changing and great!. The Manhattan skyline is one of those views that is instantly recognizable from almost any angle. We grow up seeing it in movies, TV, and pictures. It's always changing, yet it is always familiar. My wife and I are lucky to live in NJ, where some of the best views are available. We have seen it from the Jersey City waterfront, as it comes into view on Route 3, and from Skyline Drive. Last night we saw it from the Lincoln Tunnel helix as the last daylight was fading. It's amazing how weather and changing light can make a familiar view seem brand new. Formerly, the WTC twin towers were the major landmark. Now the Freedom Tower is rising to bring a new life to the skyline.
great as always. the new world trade center is getting higher and higher, take the path train to newport and sit down outside to enjoy the view!
Beautiful!. We loved looking at the view from the boat, from the bus, from the plane, and on foot. What a beautiful city!
Manhattan Skyline excellent. The above is a beautiful site to see, spectacular!

Tranquil. Get away from the hectic streets and take a stroll along this green and calming walk.Fabulous views, rest areas, plants. Great walk

Stunning. Wow this is awesome amd as a seasoned trvaeller, one of the best in the world with beaitufully artistically designed architecture that magically blends together despite the age differences.

Icing on the cake of a Manhattan visit. When I first arrived in Manhattan, all I could see were dingy roads, towering buildings, and hasty commuters rushing by. I did not like it. Manhattan grew on me with time, however, and the skyline was one of the first things I fell in love with.If, like me, Manhattan fails to live up to your expectations at first, go see the skyline. If your love story with Manhattan is already going strong, go see the skyline. It'll only make it better. Schedule a dusk cruise, or better still, go to the Brooklyn Bridge Park or some similar remote location around that time, and watch as the city lights up against the darkening sky. It's magical. It's romantic. In my book, it ranks among some of the most beautiful sights on earth.

Just Beautiful. You will really enjoy the sky line both ways..
Amazing Skyline. The New York skyline is world know. It has changed in recent years but it is still beautiful. The best is from Hoboken NJ.
Beautiful view. Very magnificent, best seen from the top of the empire state building or from the other side of the river on the Brooklyn side (via the Gray Hound double decker bus night tour)

Super - Free Views from a real Jersey Boy. Four of my favorite places to view the Manhattan skyline from are, not surprisingly, in New Jersey (born and raised, but soon to be an ex-patriot).1. Hoboken: The little Hudson Riverside "pier" next to the Castle Point Skate park on Frank Sinatra Dr.BONUS: Besides the view there is the shaded canopy and benches that make relaxing as you the visit even more pleasant.2. Liberty State Park, NJ - Terrific views of the financial district. If you go to the end of the drive you can park free for up to 2 hours instead of the longer term lot where you park if taking the ferries to Ellis Island or Statue of Liberty.BONUS: Take in the NJ 9/11 Memorial that frames the 9/11 site and the new World Financial Tower and stop in the beautifully restored Jersey Central Railway Depot.3. Weehawken Heights: The last exit in NJ before the Lincoln Tunnel, off Rt. 3 and a left at the 2nd light will take you to a terrific elevated view of midtown opposite the cruise terminals and aircraft carrier Intrepid as well as the site of the Hamilton-Burr duel where Alexander Hamilton lost his life. You can usually find a place to park along JFK Blvd. History with a view... what a free deal!4. Rockefeller Lookout - Off the Palisades Interstate Parkway near the George Washington Bridge (about 1 mi. north). A view of the Westchester County, the Bronx and northern tip of Manhattan (look for the Cloisters in Fort Tryon Park).BONUS: About 2 mi. north is exit 2 which you can use to drive down to the river and along the base of the Palisades. There is a boat basin where you can park for an excellent view of the GW Bridge and a surprisingly bucolic drive along Henry Hudson Dr. as well as a few small waterfalls (if there's been some rain). Best of all you can pull over under the GW Bridge for an awesome view form a most unusual angle. Finally as you reach the end there is a historic center with displays and information about the Revolutionary War and George Washington.
Night sky. Took the Night Tour on Grayline bus and saw the Skyline at night from Brooklyn. It s just like in the movies
Not as cool as expected. Walked full length on very hot day. Possibly would have been better if not as hot. A neat concept, but kind of underwhelming as tourist attraction.
What a view. Once you have seen it there is nothing else! The lights buildings and over all effect especially at night.
Top of the Rock. Went to Top of the Rock for the night skyline and had a fun family time looking at the city lights and the interactive light room.

Top-of-the-Rock was "Outstanding". Though I have a deathly fear of heights, I bit the bullet and took the clear-glass-ceiling elevator to the 67th floor of Rockefeller Center. I'm so glad I did. The view was so spectacular that I forgot about my fears. Don't be intimidated by the long lines at the ticket booths; they move quickly.
easy to see from all around. great place to see the skyline is from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Fulton Ferry park under the bridge as well as from the elevated Subways in Queens and Brooklyn.
take the circle line. The 3 hour tour goes all around the new york island. Very nice. Tour director made it fun also.

Helicopter ride to remember. This cost about $150 PER PERSON, includes insurance, fuel and all the taxes. Although only 15 mins long it is something that you would not do again and is worth the money - there is so much to see and the the pilot will give you a very detailed tour guide of all of the famous sites and we circled the statue of liberty two or three time and it is the best way to see her in all her glory. Spectacular!. Whether you choose the Rock, the Empire State, or Brooklyn Promenade to admire the asymmetric patchwork of steel, glass, and concrete known as Manhattan Skyline, be ready for your heart to start beating faster and your attempt to describe what you see sound like a complete nonsense. Take a moment to compare the distinctive architecture of each skyscraper. Admire the old style constructions peacefully neighboring with the very recent ones. Think retrospectively. Imagine Manhattan Skyline 20, 50, or 1,000 years ago. Put your camera away, close your eyes and hear the New York City. And finally, make it re-appear in the rays of sunset before exploring every street and path of this urban jungle.

One of the best skylines in the world. Ok so I live here, perhaps I'm a bit biased. I still firmly believe that NYC has one of the best skylines in the entire world, a skyline you should see during the day and at night. And don't be turned off by rain, as long as it's not sheeting down, you might get some great cloud views as the rain breaks up. Even foggy views are pretty neat because to watch the skyline get gobbled by fog is kind of freaky and sci-fiction like...and fog doesn't usually last too long so try again later in the day or the next day to get the clear views. The places I recommend viewing are: Manhattan Bridge pedestrian path (or take the Q/N/D/B across the bridge); Brooklyn Bridge pedestrian path; Brooklyn Heights promenade; Roosevelt Island; Staten Island ferry; Long Island City; 59th Street Bridge (if you can handle the noise of the traffic); Williamsburg Bridge (even with the mesh barriers it's still a fantastic view and don't forget about New Jersey either. Take a water taxi across the river or the path train and wander the water front. Fantastic views.

Breathtaking Skyline on LGA approach. Got a great view of the Manhattan Skyline on our nighttime landing approach to LaGuardia Airport (LGA) from the South. It was breathtaking - more spectacular than I imagined. Had never seen that angle/view before. Even saw fireworks going off around west side mid-town at 11:00 PM that Sunday night. Wish we could have circled for another view. :-D

A walk on Brooklyn Bridge. Enough of museums; this is a beautiful, warm, sunny day, and things will happen outside! So we went for crossing the East River on the Brooklyn Bridge.This is, as I recall, the first serious bridge built between Manhattan and Brooklyn. I remember seeing a documentary on this, flagging the engineering prowess its construction represented. This was at the end of the 19th century. It was the longest suspension bridge in the world for some 20 years, since its inauguration in 1883. The bridge has a pedestrian pathway built in its center, above the automobile traffic level. At times of public transportation strikes or catastrophes (such as nine eleven), it is the main means of crossing the river, to the point that it may sway, or “wobble”, when too many people are using it! Not today though! People, mostly tourists but also lots of locals, are walking or running it, or biking it. A bunch of school kids stopped us, and Cynthia enthusiastically answered their questions, in response to some school assignment.

Make Time to Walk the Highline, Manhattan's garden-in-the-sky. For years, an abandoned, elevated railway reminded West Side residents of a different New York, when trains serviced the warehouses dotting the riverfront to supply the stores and markets of the city. Perched just a few stories up, a group of imaginitive citizens were [finally] able to pursuade the authorities to let them develop an elevated garden on these tracks, beginning at 14th Street and continuing up to 28th Street so far - with expansion up to 30th St. still to come. It can be reached by elevators in several locations if climbing stairs is not an option. Since its opening, it has become one of the jewels of smaller parks in Manhattan, almost like strolling the hanging gardens of Babylon. It is intimate, ever-changing and simply desinged, and you leave with the thought: Why didn't this get done sooner? PLEASE: Do Not Miss This; it will take your breath away and leave you feeling gently elated.

Magnificent. I have lived my entire life in NYC and to this day I still marvel at the skyline, especially at night. My hope here is to share my favorite vantage points with those of you visiting the city. Reading some of the previous reviews I have seen the most popular choices mentioned (Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, Liberty State Park, Circle Line, etc,) and they all offer breathtaking views and perspectives. But my own personal favorites are the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, which can be easily reached by bike, car or a healthy walk over the Brooklyn Bridge. My second favorite is from the Roosevelt Island Promenade, which can be reached via the Roosevelt Island Tram. The final vantage point I would recommend is the Brooklyn Bridge Park, located in the D.U.M.B.O. neighborhood (Down Under The Manhattan Bridge) but because of it's somewhat remote location I think a daytime visit there would be best in that case. I mention these as an amateur photographer as they provide a little more proximity with all of the "sweep" and grandeur of the other locations. Enjoy
