Every scyscraper lover dream. I wanted to visit NYC for years and even we didn't had best weather the impression was as i was imaging it from all the pictures i saw. Impressive from Statue ferry, impressive from Brooklyn, Impressive from ESB and also from the TOTR.
And we were there at the time Freedom tower became the tallest in NYC.

You´ll get a stiff neck ... .. from looking up all the time. When I first arrived, I felt quite claustrophobic, but adjusted over a day or so. It´s such an iconic sight, you can´´t stop photographing it.

Oh So Familiar. First view of the skyline was from the Staten Island Ferry (on the return trip). Have seen this view from the south on many occasions on tv and in movies. It was very exciting to see this live. Breathtaking! :)
Beautiful both day & night. Fantastic when it's a clear day/night. Not so great when it's not as you can not see the top of the Empire State Building.
I miss you Twin Towers. I love this Skyline. I can see it everday on the way to work, and I always smile thinking of the good times I have had and the good times to come!! I Love NYC.

New York skyline. I just love the New York skyline the best way to see it is without a doubt from a boat and you don't have to pay that much for it either you can either get the Staten Island ferry which is free through the subway system or you can go to the statue of Liberty and you can see the skyline on the boat on the way across. If you can afford it there is many tours available. It is without a doubt something you must see in New York.
Classic.. What more can you say about the skyline? It is classic and magical. Don't miss it.
Circle Line. The circle line ferry was excellent. We took the six oclock so were able to view the skyline day duck and night. Well worth the ticket.
What a view!. Amazing place, so familiar thanks to the amount of coverage of Manhattan on tv and cinema, like walking onto a film set! Everything you ever thought it would be ..and more!
The Roc. love the view from the top of the Roc, and also the roof of the Met is wonderful too
awsome. best seen from the staten island ferry which is free

WOW..a living sculpture. The skyline is incredible....varied, exciting, dynamic. You can walk the streets or view from on high or down below or take a boat ride to get the sillouette. Any way you look from any direction it is worth the trip.
Excellent. Nothing beats the manhattan skyline. Perfect views on clear days and also at night
Amazing. Get on the Ferries to Staten Is or Eillis Is to get a real appreciation of the skyline! Also, Brooklyn Bridge has a great view too.
The heart of the country. Breath-taking. Everyone needs to do it once! If we only still had the Twin Towers.......

Always worth seeing. Whether you do it from the opposite side of the brooklyn bridge or you do it from the bridge itself.... or if you are lucky enough from the plane window seat.. wow that is a view. To get the best one fly out of la guardia sometime and make sure you have the window seat A

On the Staten Island ferry. Lovely to see the skyline of Manhattan. Take the staten Island ferry (Free) to get a view of the Statue of Liberty and Manhattan. A little bit of fun. You can pretend you are "Working Girl."
Good Views. Room view was good. Weather was cloudy for us, but I am sure on a clear day its great

No other view like it. It just keeps drawing you back!!! a bit like a guilty pleasure.
I dont see you can ever get tired of looking at this view

Getting better all the time. Since September 2001 the NYC Skyline has neen missing the WTC. Now that the Freedom Towers are finally nearing completion, the NYC Skyline will finally look whole again. Looking forward to that time.
Best from NJ-based eyes. The NY Skyline is wonderful. It can be seen from many places in NJ, Brooklyn and lower NY islands. So beautiful and enchanting.
Great view from New Jersey. On a sunny day the view is really awe-inspiring, especially now that the World Trade Center is being built, filling a previously empty space.
stunning views. Very cold but looked beatiful from top of Empire State building/

Three different views. We saw New York from the Empire State Building at night, from the Top of the Rock during the day, and from the Circle Line cruise. All of the views were exactly what you’ve seen in every tv show, movie, and photo. The difference is that you’re there, in person. If someone were going to see the three views we saw, I would recommend what we did--ESB at night but the TofR and cruise during the day. This way, you get to see all the lights spread out below you, but you really want those daytime shots from TofR looking south over Central Park to the north.We used the CityPass. In 3 1/2 days, we used all of the tickets. Yes, we didn’t see EVERYTHING at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, but we couldn’t have anyway--we saw pretty much everything there that we wanted to see in the time allotted.

I love it!. The Manhattan skyline is something I never tired of when visiting New York. It is somewhat unique day or night.You can obviously view it from different places and I did a few. Favourite ones though are off the circular boat tour and the helicopter. Great views from different angles. The boat trip was extremely good value for money and idylic on a warm sunny day. Very informative too.
Amazing at Sunset. I would highly recommend taking one of the boat cruises out and seeing the Manhattan Skyline and Statue of Liberty at sunset. This was one of the highlights of our trip.
Amazing!. Great photo opportunities and a truly amazing skyline

Amazing. Empire State building was amazing the view is out of this world. We went on a sunny day but I have heard from friends that have been up on a night also which is amazing. If sunny day definitely go up you can see for miles and also see the Statue of Liberty

Love every angle. The Manhattan Skyline is something I never get tired of. I like even better from the air or from the East River or Hudson.For those new to NYC, get a cruise around the island to get a great variety of views.

Awe inspiring. That's what the skyline of Manhattan does to me every time I visit. I particularly like the first time you get a glimpse of it when you drive into the city from the airport.A new place I've visited that gives you a great vies of the skyline is the Brooklyn Bridge Park. Just sit in one of the benches and soak in the scenery while you rest.
the city of cities. The view is super breathtaking from this angle:1. Top of the Rocks2. Dumbo

Spectacular from every angle. The Staten Island ferry will provide you with a great view, as well as the Empire State Building and the Top of the Rock. Navigating around New York provides you with a range of different viewpoints. Whilst I think the Top of the Rock provides the very best vantage point, the city skyline is spectacular and can be enjoyed from a myriad of locations. Best of all, it's free!
No other site can compete.. This is a must !!! when in NYC. breathtaking views
Iconic View. On my arrival, it was so exciting to drive towards the city which was backlit by unbelievable sunset - the skyscrapers looked stunning
Stunning.. This was exactly as I pictured it so many times in my head. So beautiful
Fabulous views!. We visited the Empire State building during the day and the Top of the Rock at night to see the beautiful views of the skyline both day and night.
Realy the best place ever.. This place is where i get peace of mind, its amazing how a person can sit for hours here and no know how fast time moves.

A site not to miss. There are more sparkly skylines - like the one in Hong Kong. There are skylines with taller buildings - like the one in Chicago. But New York's skyline is historic, and majestic and dense with incredible variety. It has a different personality during the day than at night, from close-up and far away. The Circle Line gives visitors a good close up view. To get a better view of the skyline take the ferry over to New Jersey and drink it in from across the river.
Awesome view from Ink48. The view from the Kimpton hotel at Ink48 is my favorite view of the city and it is right around the corner from The OUT
Best at Night. Bright and Bold View of the tall buildings. took alot of pictures on tour!

A joy to come home to. When I travel I love seeing new and interesting places. I enjoy arriving in new places and taking in the vista of the city/town from afar. But nothing takes my breath away as much as coming home to NYC and being greeted by the skyline. I know then that I truly live in the best city in the world.

Skyline via the Weehawken Ferry. I've been to many ports all over the world and the New York CitySkyline is by far the best. Day or night it's magnificent. Take a tour, boat ride, midnight sail or just the ferry to cross you will be glad you did.

Long Island City Waterfront. Jump the no.7 subway to Jackson Boulevard (one stop form Grand Central). Walk 10mins to the East River waterfront. Absolutely one of the best views of Manhattan you will get (UN building, etc.) Lovely boardwalks/landscaping, great for a picnic, sunbathing, etc. Don't forget to check out some of the really great bars (Dominie's Hoek, Vernon Blvd/2 mins from subway exit), cafes (Cafe Henri, 50th/next to subway exit) and restaurants (the must visit historic Waterfront Crab House (Borden Ave/10mins from subway). Finally, for another fantastic Manhattan skyline view stay on/get back on the no.8 subway ride a couple of stops further (Court Square) - then change trains + ride it right back wonderful views from the raised track/between the buildings, etc - really worth half-an-hour especially if you've got a pass!
Go to Hoboken and look!!. Take the path, have lunch in Hoboken and wander about looking at the skyline...
it is a dream. there iw nothing better in new york city than manhattan skyline.

Most impressive at night!. The Manhattan Skyline is most impressive at night. One of the best places to see the skyline is from “Top of the Rock” or from the Brooklyn Bridge Park. Enjoy my night photos!
Svein-Magne Tunli from Bergen, Norway – tunliweb.no
Skyline photos. Great viewed from the Brooklyn water side park - other side of the Brooklyn Bridge.
The most beautiful skyline. Try checking it out from the Hudson river or Brooklyn Bridge
wonderful. the People!!!! the movement the Life of New York!!!! Very interesting all
Winter in the city. it was cold but the bright lights were worth it, times square was two blocks away.
Awesome. What a sight!,,, it's amazing!top of the rock in the evening,and empire state in the day.
Beauty within the Concrete jungle!. Manhattan Skyline is a wonderful site for anyone's eyes. I'm quite lucky to enjoy the view almost everyday.

No place like NYC. I've traveled the world and no where is there such a magnificent skyline that is teamed with such history and skyscraping architecture. It is ever changing and that is why I love it. I do miss the twin towers but I am hopeful and encouraged to see the Liberty tower shaping up as a new beacon on the city skyline.

Very impressive. The Skyline really is one of the most impressive things you can see in New York. The only probem is, you're often so much a part of it, you can't really step back and appreciate it. I've always wanted to do the Circle tour by ferry to check it out, but the weather this time was rainy, chilly, and not agreeable, so opted instead to go to the "Top of the Rock" - totally recommend as a great way to take your time and take in the grandeur of the New York skyline from every angle.
From the Empire State Building. Awesome views. Yup, the wait is long, but you can get the express pass that gets you up to the elevators, you'll still wait, but not for 2.5 hours.
Top of the Rock. It's the best place to see the skyline -- since you get to see the Empire State Building as well.

Magnificent & Spectacular. Nothing in the US provides me with the thrill I get from seeing the Manhattan Skyline from the sky or the gound. It is compelling and with the new WTC 1 now rising (higher than the iconic Empire State building now), it is a vision to behold.
Take a helicopter ride. The Manhattan skyline is wonderful - try a helicopter tour from the downtown heliport
Incomparable!. Energy galore! Beautiful. Love to see it from the Staten Island Ferry at sunset, or from the George Washington Bridge at night.
Must see view!!!. Beautiful sight even when it's overcast! A must have photo!!
Always one of the highlights. We approached Manhattan by train from the south. The kids were bowled over seeing the skyline - huge excitment.
Beautiful City View. This is an awesome sight at night...The city all lit up and now you are part of it...it is special.
Really pretty :). It was so pretty, I love it. It is really something worth viewing. Haha.
Lovely and impressive. Skyline is lovely in the morning.... enjoy while being jet-lagged.
See it from Brooklyn!. Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and you can see most of the Manhattan skyline from Brooklyn.
View it from the Reservoir. I think the best view of the Manhattan Skyline is from the Reservoir in Central Park at sunset.
World Famous!. So awesome to see one of the most famous sights in the world!
is there a more famous skyline?. it's beautiful from any direction. Near or far. Take the Staten Island ferry for the best - FREE - view of the city, statue of liberty, and a boat ride in NY harbor!
Amazing must do !. It's an experience to soak in .... Best at sunset from the Rockefeller towers or empire state

Amazing. You can see the whole city, how Central Park looks like. I could even see where my grandmother lived in Queens cause i can see Shea Stadium. Worth the ride up there, it doesn't take long either.
Excellent view. Excellent view. One of the best places I have visited.
A must see. At least once in your life you should have a look at Manhattan skyline from a boat.
Fantastic skyline. Ever changing, loved the old and new buildings side by side

Great view!. You should check out the skyline from the South Seaport view in Lower manhattan. Just get off 4/5/6 Train in Manhattan and walk to John St..follow it to the seaport. You can go up to the food court which has a second floor deck. You can see the view of Manhattan bridge, Brooklyn Bridge and Williamsburg bridge.
awesome view. we went across to brooklyn to see the skyline. It was beautiful

Room with a view. Among the best skylines in the world, whether it is from Empire State Building, Top of the Rock or one of the many cruises, day or night, the views, the crowds, the enthusiasm is just awesome. Night views are better. The one thing though is that there are just TOO many people
Spectacular View. Never miss this wonderful skyline! Bring home the view with a nice auto shutter camera for the nite shots.

Go to the top of the rock. On our last day in New York, we ventured up to Top of the Rock and it was well worth it. Beautiful views of Manhattan in every direction. I was able to capture some great photos that remind me of the amazing time on our vacation there.

Viewed from Top Of The Rock. Can see the Empire State Building...Go into Rockerfeller Square and the lines are not too bad. Beautiful view of Central Park, the water all around Manhatten. Go on a sunny day to see the beauty of the area.
Quite the view. It truly is something to see. We took a night tour on one of the open top buses and although a moving bus is not ideal for taking photos, it was still worth seeing it.
excellent. Lots of fun and many thing outdoor to do you will enjoy it

Get neckache in Manhattan.. New York is a culture shock first and foremost, with anyone who is visiting for the fist time being in total awe of the Metropolis that it is. You will get a neckache as you are constantly looking up at the never ending tall buildings of Manhattan. There are so many significant buildings and landmarks that you may have seen before on your TV screen, but seeing them 'in the flesh' is an experience you will probably never forget, as such, see a trip to New York as a sightseeing tour rather than a holiday, because you will neither get, or want to rest.
GREAT VIEW. We love the manhattan skyline. It's great to see all the buildings.
Empire State Building. The Empire State Building at sunset afforded stunning views of the sparkling city that is New York.

Top of the Rock ROCKS!!. We went to the Empire State Building and Top of the Rock. Both had great views, but Top of the Rock was much better experience. The security lines were super fast, staff was very family friendly, the whole process from street to view was about 15 minutes verses the Empire State Building. The ESB was at least an hour. The first level of Top of the Rock is enclosed with glass, not a metal fence, so it felt safer with small children. The second and third levels are open and provide amazing views and photo opps.

Best viewed on the Staten Island Ferry. You should go on the Staten Island Ferry (go during the day and again at night) - the ferry is FREE - to get the best views of the Manhattan Skyline. It is amazing and a great photo opportunity!
New York first sight. The iconic skyline was everything and more, we enjoyed every minute, the only dislike we had was we was not there long enough
Real New York. What a pleasure to see the New York Skyline!It was an fantastic experience once again!
Loved it. Loved the Skyline. We saw it coming in on the 100th anniversary of the Titanic Memorial cruise, and this was definitely a highlight of our trip
Beautiful. I just get emotional about this, the best skyline ever, even tho' the twin towers are missing it still ahs a magical feel.
TOP OF THE WESTERN WORLD. Wonderful views from the Empire State Building - especially at night. The new Freedom Tower near the old WTC site is well along and a nice new landmark for the apple
Loved it!. New York just is so great and with no comparison. Loved the manhattan skyline as well!

Skyline to DIE for. one of the best skyline in the world. you have to visit new port area and see the New York skyline....its simply the best. We had been there during freezing winter and it was so much of fun watching the skyline and sipping hot coffee on the shore...
nothing quite like it. Try and see it at sunset, from empire state, rockerfeller centre or a cruise, amazing!

Stunning.. Take the ferry to see the Statue of Liberty. Look back toward Manhattan and let your jaw hit the floor. Then, as if it couldn't get any better, turn around and you will be starring at lady liberty herself. glorious!

Look up, or walk up the Empire State Building for a great view!. Near Central Park, you can enjoy the skyline of a certain part of Manhattan that will then seduce to enter further into its various other warrens. The city becomes a mythical place to explore and discover great eats, curious bars, incredible art galleries, odd shops, cool clothing, toy stores and most any kind of entertainment you wish...all along you are accompanied by the shadows of some charming old and ebulliently new buildings. Look up or walk up the Empire State building...enjoy!
Great view if you're into city scapes.. I can't believe how much is built into such a small space. Prefer looking at if from a distance then actually being there. Being there gets old, fast.

River Cafe. Our favorite view of Manhattan was from the River Cafe in Brooklyn. Our reservations were at sunset so we enjoyed the skyline by daylight and watched in awe from our window seat as the lights of Manhattan slowly grew brighter and brighter. Dinner and service were also fantastic!
Wow - stunning view!. Just so beautiful!! A must-see. Just love it! Take a bus tour or a trip on the Hudson River to really appreciate it!
Manhattan skyline. Saw the Manhattan Skyline from a cruise ship . which was an awsome location.

amazing site of NY. From top of the rock you can really enjoy the skyline. It is open until 11pm, so go during the night to see the beautiful lights!! We went to both (Rockerfella and Empire).. Rockerfella won hands down - less lining up, more "entertainment" and vew is astounding
spectacular view. Absolutely fantastic! What's not to like - absolutely fabulous there is no other view like it ! For maybe except Miami :)
adrenelin rush. We saw it from the air, from Empire State, from the Hudson River and it always lived up to expectations
Beautiful view from the reservoir in Central Park. Enjoyed the beautiful weather and view of the West side and Mid town from the walk around the reservoir in the park
Picture perfect. We enjoyed pointing out all the buildings and items to our girls that they usually see on TV. It was their first trip so they enjoyed everything about the City
NYC from NJ. The best view!!!! you have to come to Blvd East, In NJ and you will love the view!!!!
Top of the Rock visit. Fun, albeit touristy. I had my nine year old daughter, and it was fun and not as crowded as Empire State Building.

this view always brings a smile to my face. I grew up in New Jersey and moved to NYC for about 4 years. Since I was young, I always remember driving into the city and seeing the skyline on my way in. Day or night, it was just stunning. Of course it's changed over the years, but it's still beautiful. Moving to NYC, for two of those years I lived in Brooklyn heights and gained a whole new appreciation. Yes, NYC is loud, crowded, and it can smell. When it's hot it's hot and when it's cold it's cold. This city can kick your butt, but it's New York. And it truly is one of the greatest cities in the world- with the most recognizable and beautiful skylines.Don't pay $ to see this. Go across the river, somewhere- NJ or Bk. Or go on a ferry ride, take a water taxi, there are plenty of ways to see NYC for free.
See it at night. Views great from Staton Island Ferry (which is free), Liberty Cruise and Harbour Cruise.

Best seen from the River Cafe. Just under the Brooklyn Bridge, on the Brooklyn side, this cafe/restaurant serves great cocktails at the bar with a wonderful view on Manhattan skyline and the Statue of Liberty.

fantastic. We enjoyed an evening dinner cruise as part of a wedding party, the weather couldn't have been better and we came to the view from the water point so well known from films just as the sun disappeared, the lights came on, it was magical and the boat stooged about for a bit giving everyone the fullest opportunity for photo shots. Same with the Statue of Liberty coming in close although by this time it was dark and limiting for photo's. The only missing element was a captains commentary highly recomended when the weather is right
New York York. It was a fantastic trip from start to finish,Empire State building acaentral Park and Harbour Cruise well worth doing.
Rockefeller. Amazing view.Very expensive but very well organised and very busy. Good gift shop to buy postcards etc but again quite pricey.

The two best spots. The two best spots for viewing the new york skyline:
1) Staten Island Cruise headed in the direction of Manhattan.
2) Atop the Empire State Building (except you miss the ESB since you are on it).
3) From the Brooklyn Bridge walkway.

it's amazing!. I saw at day and night... and I loved the view at night!
Is shocking to see the lights and shapes of buildings...if they're going at night, prepare your flash My camera was not enough and the pictures did not turn out as good as I would have liked.
great. dislike the exagerate of internal kitch decoration
Specially from Brooklyn Bridge!!!. Breathtaking from Brooklyn Heights!!! Get there walking through the bridge
Manhattan skyline- see it from a boat. Breathtaking skyline. Easiest way to see it- take the Staten island ferry round trip. Well worth the price- IT'S FREE!!
Beautiful Skyline. The best way to see the Manhattan Skyline is to go on a boat tour on the Hudson River. You can see almost every important tower in NY.
Absolutely Amazing. I saw the skyline from The top of the Empire State Building and from Liberty Island and it is breathtaking - a must see!

Awesome!. The skyline is awe-inspiring whether viewed on foot from below, from the circle line, crossing one of the many bridges into the city or from the top of the Empire State Building. I'll never forget it.
So beautiful. So beautiful at night and during the day. You need to see it at least one time!
Circleline Cruise. This was a brillinat wayto see the skyline protrayed in so many movies, it was great just to be there and see all the Island in its glory
superb views. superb views and breathtaking.good value for money
Beautiful. Awesome sight to see while in New York best seen at night on a harbor crusie.

The Best Skyline in the World. New York is the best city in the world for many reasons.
It is sch an amazing place.
No place like New York. This is my 3rd visit to New York and I would go back tomorrow as there is nowhere in the world like it.
One never tires of the Manhattan Skyline. Remains an imposing view of the city as an entry into city life. Best viewed from Brooklyn side or Staten Island Ferry.
Heart-stopping!. We took a tour to see it, walked over Brooklyn Bridge to see it, took the Staten Island Ferry to see it - heart-stopping every time!

A day in New York. We went in with friends for a walking tour of Little Italy and China Town. After which we drove outside the city for dinner but the restaurant had a beautiful view of the skyline in the setting sun.

Path train to NJ. For the best view of the skyline at night catch the path train to new jersey from 23 and 6 and for only $2 it is the best view. Get off at Newport do some shopping in New Jersey with a lower tax rate, watch the savings and then see Manhattan island at night. stunning
the best. the peaceful and majestic sight from any angle especially the Hudson side

Must see!. I always wondered what's the fuss about the Manhattan Skyline & now I know. The views from the ferry are fantastic when the weather is good of course! The tour guide was very informative about it too telling us all the little known facts. It is worth taking a ferry even for a short ride as the views are rewarding.

Too Much to Describe. Enjoy it by day to see how many buildings you can count and identify. Enjoy it by night and see how many lights you can count. Vantage points from throughout the five boroughs provide you with many different perspectives. See how many you can exerience.
30 rock. went to 30 rock to see the skyline at sunset. the views were great but it was crazy crowded.

A view from the Top. So you want to see the skyline? Well you may want to consider my personal favorite place to sit amongst the skyline- Top of the Tower at the Beekman Hotel. Located near the United Nations on 49th st and 1st ave. We enjoyed a commanding view of the mid town skyline- Citibank, Empire State, Trump, UN while sipping fresh and tasty cocktails and small plate foods at this elegant and classy rooftop location that exudes romance and sophistication.
Fantastic. This is even better than in the movies and is best seen from the boat or when seeing statue of liberty
Skyline from Central Park. Very surreal and picturesque! Skyline from Pier 17 or boat cruise was fantastic. Skyline from Central Park provided an incredible feeling especially from boats on lake.

Great view at night on the of Empire State Building.. The first time I went, I did not make advance reservations, that was a mistake because the lines are long!!!! I learned my lesson and walked right up with our reservations for 9PM to look at the awesome view!
Breathtaking. if youre lucky enough to have a window seat on your plane you get a breathtaking view of the skyline on your approach to the airport!
Gorgeous to see from a boat. Beautiful skyline, worth doing a boat tour around the island to see the skyline.

Great Experience. I am not a stranger to city skylines. However, looking at this skyline was just fantastic. It is so iconic. There are many ways which I was able to view the skyline. We walked over the Brooklyn Bridge and got a fantastic view, we took the Staten Island Ferry and got a wonderful view, but my favorite view of all was from the top of Rockefeller Center. It was just wonderful to see the Empire State Building and the rest of the Manhattan skyline from there. I don't think you can go wrong with any of the viewing areas and you can pick a favorite for yourself!
Awesome viewed from off-shore.. Awesome viewed from the statue of liberty boat trip or from Hoboken

Oz (as Pete Hamil says). No matter how many times I find myself in Manhattan, it is always like the first time. Dazzling sculpture garden of buildings. I doubt I shall ever be so jaded that I fail to look up!
Brooklyn. Walk Brooklyn Bridge from Brooklyn to Manhattan. This way you still have plenty of energy to discover wonderful Brooklyn Heights and on the walk you have a great view.

The skyline all other are judged by!. Any where you go in the City, there are great skyline views to be seen. Don't forget to cross either the Hudson or East rivers to get even more amazing views of the dramatic Manhattan skyline!

Live near nyc and love it. I love seeing the ny skyline. The best views are from the promenade in Brooklyn Heights or from Jersey City. You can also take a boat trip around Manhatten and get spectacular views.. Enjoy
Went to the View Restaurant in Times Square at the Marriott Hotel. Graet views and great food. Staff very good. Advise you to book before going
Not really a site to go to. A great view of Manahttan is from Brooklyn, and you can walk across the bridge to complete the experience.
Breathtaking!. Simply amazing. You have to see the Skyline when you come to NYC. It is breathtaking.

Wait, wait, wait. But the view is awesome!!!. Long lines all the way, but after that you got what you paid for! Great views. Take your time to take great pictures. Must wait to get the right spot for that, but the Empire State Building is a must go!!!
Rockefeller Centre. Go to the Rockefeller early in the morning and get a hazy amazing view of NYC without the crowds!
Once in a lifetime experience. Great ferry ride, helicopters landing & taking off like giant Dragonflies, the statue of Liberty etc. an awesome combination!
Nice. Nice view. Great to see all the buildings. Mixture of old and new.
as viewed from the empire state building at night. spectacular overwhelmingly beautiful view at night
Spectacular view. One of the most well known skylines and it lived up to it's reputaion.

Ride the Staten Island Ferry (free) at dusk to see the most beautiful skyline.. Our Taxi cab driver said to not miss this. I have been on the ferry several times but never at dusk. I could not believe the beauty.
Night light cruise. Absolutely beautiful to watch the setting sun over the Manhattan skyline. But bring warm clothes - it gets cold on the river after sunset.
Top of the rock obseration tower.. Great a little pricey at 25 dollars per person to get in a lift. But not to be missed.

it's even better than what you hve heard...grand than you hve imagined.... from childhood i had heard of this greatest city on earth...and it's magnificient skyline bears testimony to the grandness of this city.even with the ominous absence of the twin-towers, a clear view on a clear cloudless day or a lit up view of the night-time will make you stop in your tracks and pay a silent tribute to the craftsmanship of man!check te views from Liberty Island/ Ellis Island/ Staten Island, Top of the Rock, Empire State roof, Newport shore (NJ) - wherever the view is afforded....see it, it sticks fr a lifetime.
Nice unique place. Go and enjoy also chelsea markte nearby after you spend some time there

breathtaking.. in the day go on a boat trip to see the best views of the skyline, at night there is a night trip to brookly, be sure to go when its dark beautiful view of the skyline. don,t forget your camara.
Incredible view - Vista Increible. Have a great view walking on Brooklyn Bridge. The night view is amazing!

Wow!. Seeing the Manhatten skyline from Newark Airport was exciting, but the view from the Empire State Building was amazing. We had bought the tickets before we went and were fast tracked to both viewing platforms. Fantastic!!!!

Something you need to experience. Looking at the Manhattan Skyline is something you really need to experience. Do it from one of the boroughs outside of Manhattan to get a overwhelmed, or do it from the "top of the rock" to get a great overview.

On a good day with no clonds nice view!. It's a big city,towers going up to the sky, i like the top of the empire state building and the rock you get the best views the UN is nice and time square and yes the new freedom tower in down town i hope in time it gets better!
High rise viewing. Do the Empire state at night and as late as possible(we queued for 2 hours)The Rockerfeller is must for early morning,great views and no queues.

Just OK nothing to die for. Hmmm this place is just ok . Food was not that great as i would have imagined it to be . Atmosphere so so . You can go here but if you did not you really did not miss something

Breathtaking, day or night.. The Manhattan Skyline is beautiful to view, day or night. The best spots to appreciate it from are: 1. From New Jersey, and 2. From Astoria and Long Island City. In fact, if you can, take the #7 Train from Grand Central Station to Queens and get off on the first stop, Vernon Blvd. You'll find all new buildings along the waters edge. The view of the midtown Manhattan's skyline is spectacular. Another fantastic spot to appreciate it from is from Downtown Brooklyn, specifically the promenade in Brooklyn Heights.

Reviewing the skyline?. You can see different views of the skyline from different parts of the city. We first saw the skyline when we travelled in a yellow cab from JFK, over a small hill in the room and there it was. Beautiful! We saw other views from the Brooklyn Bridge and the Staten Island Ferry. No matter where you look at the Manhattan skyline from it is impressive.
The best in the World. We seen it by boat by tour bus by airplane and by helicopter both day and night it just gets better and better.
unusaul. its beautiful, pretty unusual, and fun. something should see while in NY
Dazzled by the lights. This is amazing at night! There's no other skyline that looks as good. What a view from Brooklyn Heights. The perfect place for a proposal.
Imposing. First time in the States, New York is impressive but hard work if you don't like crowds
Breadth taking and beautiful. There was nothing to dislike the view was post card perfect

Lovely walk. Fab morning walking the skyline - so pretty up there and so much to see.
It's a must do.
Must see. World famous we went to the Empire State to see. The queues weren't too bad and the sights were fantastic. 360 degrees view of NYC!!
Perfect way to see the city!. - a Circle Line Cruise around Manhattan. It was very nice.

Great views from NJ. The best view of the NYC skyline is across the Hudson River in NJ. You can take NY Waterways Ferry and see the buildings and skyline in all its glory. Depending on the time of day and the season the city takes on a different view.

The Greatest Skyline on Earth. To me, there just isn't any other city skyline in the world that can outdo New York's. So many tall buildings in such a relatively small geographical area, combined with the rivers and the bridges produce a unique, must see experience, especially at night, with all the lights. A visit to New York must be on everyone's bucket list. It remains the greatest city on Earth.
Staton Island Ferry. Free and the view is amazing at night. After kids in bed, I loved just sitting by the window at night looking at the city. It is beautiful.
excellent views. great views saw the skyline from empire state go up when its starting to get dark
Always a spectacular sight!. See it and take it in. Try to wander slowly and let your chiropractor take care of the New York Neck later.
manhattan skyline. Stunning! What more can I say! Great views all over Manhattan from the Empire State or The top of the Rock!

Add to your "see before I die" list. I've lived in Manhattan for over 15 years now and I never tire of the skyline. It's instantly recognizable, you should even recognize individual building, and it's heart-stoppingly impressive.My recommended skyline tour would be something like this:Take the 59th Street Bridge from the airport, preferably at night. Try the Brooklyn Heights Promenade at lunchtime, preferably with a sandwich from Lassen & Hennings. Have dinner at a waterfront restaurant in New Jersey. Go to the top of the Empire State building on a quiet evening.
Worth the visit. Best to see it from Liberty Island, and at night if possible.
Fab skyline!. New World Trade Centre Buliding will be amazing once finished
Great walk. Lovely novel way to get through the the west of the city. Clean green and great views.
city view atop the Rock. Great view of ny skyline. Views of central park, empire state building and Statue of Liberty. Not terribly crowded at top. Nicest view at sunset.
Astounding. Great views, but best done at night to get some great shots

We did night and day views...read on. Friends told us to walk across Brooklyn Bridge by day and take the bus night tour and we did both. The bridge walk takes approx 20 mins and as you leave the bridge on the Brooklyn side take the left hand path of two and exit down the steps. Walk under the bridge and back on yourself and it takes you to the waterfront for some great pics of the bridge and the skyline.We took a night time bus tour which was well worth it as it stops in Brooklyn for photos. Its breezy on the open top bus as it travels along so wrap up well.

Fast Track the Empire State Building Visit. If you don't mind standing in a que for hours then I recommend you pay the higher price and get the fast track ticket for the main deck and observation deck at the top. We were so glad we did.

Breathtaking views. I was desperate to see a decent view of Manhattan's skyline during mine and my boyfriends recent trip to New York. Of course we saw beautiful views from The Empire State and Top of The Rock, but for the skyline views we chose to walk across Brooklyn Bridge and we were definitely not disappointed!We walked across on a beautiful sunny day at the beginning of March and we could see for miles. The skyline was breathtaking, it was amazing to see it all in one hit right before our eyes.New York is a beautiful city and I would highly recommend hunting down a good spot for a skyline view to really appreciate just what a beautiful place it really is.

The reason to visit NY. Go up the Empire State Building / take a camera and enjoy - one of life's 'must do' things - really loved this, tip - to get a local into conversation ask them if the river that you can see is the Mississippi :)

Center of the known world..... I live in suburban So. California. but split my time there with So. New Mexico. It amazes me how so much can be centered in a relatively small area. No end of things to do and see. Don't particularly care for the extreme crowded nature; everyone is in a hurry, and you get bumped, jostled and sometimes manhandled, but no one is about to offer an, 'excuse me'. That said, there were a couple of times when strangers surprised me by overhearing our needs, and offering directions or advise. My cousin lived there for 20 years, and said he got used to New York's ways, but when he finally moved back to California recently, he was glad to leave.
Amazing!. Try to slow down and take it all in. 30 Rock is the perfect place to see it all, plus there are little to no lines
Harbour Cruise. Skyline was fantastic and great way to get your bearings. Sensational
The Best View..... is from the Staten Island Ferry. And it's free!! Enjoy the view of the Statue of Liberty.

can't believe there is a reviewing for this but why not. seeing the skyline makes me smile every single time and makes me proud to call myself a new yorker. love it and it's a definite must see if you are a tourist!
oh lala. if u can find words to describe the view then u have a serious problem with ur eyes!!is magnificent !

I wore my camera out on Manhattan Skyline views.. Day or night the Manhatttan skyline is breathtaking. Try taking it by day and night from the Brooklyn Bridge, Empire State Building or Rockafella Centre. We also walked the Highline ( old disused railway line turned into a walkway/park above street level) and got some amazing views and photos.
Best in the world. Simple amazing. Ever changing, but always amazing.

Top of the Rock and Empire State Building Views plus Statue Cruises Views. All great views, the best skyline view was from the 86th floor Empire State Building but with clear blue skies all week we were spoiled for views.
wow. it is amazing. it looks sooo cool and brilliant. i loved it. it looks even better at night from the distance when all the lights are shining bright

Great views from top of the rock and ESB. Great views from the top of the rock and the ESB. Slightly different perspectives from each, woth the trip to both. Go early or late to beat the mid day rush!

What can I say. I grew up in West Texas. As far away from New York as you can get. No matter what I do and what my circumstances are, this skyline amazes me. My jaw still drops and makes me look like a "Country Bumpkin"!
A world's landmark. It is a traditional well known view and it is cool to see it live.

From The River Cafe, DUMBO, The View at the Marriot Marquis, our 29th floor suite at the Doubletree Times Square. Wonderful views from all of the above plus from the Staten Island Ferry and a corner table at Asiate, overlooking Columbus Circle
Top of the Rock Spectacular. For a great view of the city visit Top of the Rock

Nothing compares. Nothing compares to the iconic Manhattan skyline. It is so recognizable even if it is your first visit there. Get some great pics from Ellis Island/Statue of Liberty or from the Brooklyn Bridge.
Amazing. You must go and see it, its just like what you see on t.v.
The Highline. Walked the Highline and Brooklyn Bridge - both interesting and great views. Looking forward to doing the Highline again when the project is complete.

What? Am I really rating the skyline? OK I'll play.... Lots of buildings all packed in together. Just like every other city, the New Yorkr skyline is unique. But nice that there are so many beautiful buildings all packed in together. A different view from everywhere around Manhattan. Beautiful at night and of course it is free so what's not to like?
Iconic. Best to see it from either StatonIsland Ferry (Free) or the circle line around Manhatton
Skyline. Great for pictures. Best pictures can be taken from Brooklyn.

the skyline is gorgeous. you get a great view from the brooklyn promenade, the staten island ferry (it takes about a half hour in each direction and it's free!) and well as new jersey. both daylight views and nightview views - very different - are fabulous!!

Experience the feel of the city. There is just too much to do in New York, so you're going to have to choose what you want to do, and keep in mind that while the public transit is amongst the worlds best, it still takes time to get around the island. Simply being in New York is fun though and hopefully all that you choose to do will satisfy you. Just looking up, along the canyon walls of windows will remind you that you are in a special place
Unforgetable. pre booked visit up the Rockafella centre and went at night. although there were queues, we didnt have to wait too long

Magical. When you see the skyline you light up. This is life...The fast life is here and as soon as you see Manhattan you know you will wait 3 hours at Whole Foods and a taxi will prob hit 5 people to get you where you need to be. This is Manhattan and it is AWESOME.
Looks like a city burried in stars. You will need to find a taller buiding to get the best view.

From the Top of the Rock at Rockefeller Center. Fresh air, good views 360 degrees, You can see ALL of Manhattan on a clear day. A bit crowded, but they keep it to a reasonable number so everyone can see.

We drove to new jersey by mistake but the view of the city is breathtaking!. Classic - stand at a busy corner and look up and point as if you are showing your friends something amazing and soon you will have a crowd around you. So fun.

Magical. The skyline of Manhattan has been spectacular since the first skyscrapers went up. Over the years it has become even more impressive. I love when watching a movie seeing those most special buildings and know that it is my city!
Do you have to ask?. Manhattan is the only skyline, city and street scene one can get tired off and the next day long to. This is NYC and there's no other. It's magical. And it gets only better.

A wonder of the modern world. Being a Queens resident for my first 21 years, I saw the Empire State Building almost every day. Now an LA resident, I miss the sights, smells and energy of Manhattan and its skyline. See it from the top of the Empire State building at night (no waiting lines!!) or from a room at the Marriott Marquis (Times Square's videos) or from a boat ride to the Statue.
Manhattan Skyline. Beautiful from the water in the daytime or the nightime
great skyline. just special. There is something about New York and the varying building that form the skyline and backdrop for perfect photos
Ny NY. Liked everything, people , places, food, shows, shopping,

Amazing Skyline. All the buildings make the Manhattan skyline one of the world's most famous and recognizable one! It looks even better from the top, ie from Empire State building or Rockefeller Centre.
Empire view. We checked out the Skyline from the top of the Empire State Building and all I can say is 'WOW' - what an experience. Would recommend this to anyone visiting New York
Iconic - even without the WTC. We really enjoyed the view of this from the Circle Line tour today. Lots of explanations of the relevant buildings. The history is, of course, very interesting. Go see!
Great Place to visit!!. The Skyline is the perfect place to take a walk and relax for a moment in one of the most trendy neighborhoods in Manhattan, its a top notch attraction!!
Try top of the Roc. The views a fantastic Queues were short and well managed not cheap but an experience not to be missed
Nothing Like It. There really is no other skyline like it. To see what you have seen on TV and movies endless times with your own eyes is quite the experience.

The view of views. If you look at a trip to New York as a sight seeing tour rather than a holiday, then the hustle and bustle is all worth it especially when Manhattan is seen from one of the viewing towers. It is absolutely staggering to see this Metropolis in all its glory and think that it was originally bought for the equivalent of just $24.The Empire State Building offers breathtaking views of the city and there aren't many travellers to New York who won't want to go up it, if for no other reason than to say that they have been up it. But if you only intend to go up one of the viewing towers, bear in mind that if you go up the Empire State Building, you are up it, so by default you cannot take any pictures of it. The Top of the Rock (GE building) at Rockefeller Plaza however, offers far superior views of Manhattan and sits between the Empire State building and Central Park and offers fantastic views of both and is a much better viewing experience than the Empire State Building, is much more interactive, is spread out over 3 floors, so is not as busy and has free wi-fi, so you can face-time your friends and family and show them Manhattan in real time
wow. what can you say thats not been said before.looks amazing in daylight at night its just a myriad of lights,fantastic!!!
Out of this world. View from the Rockerfeller Center is the best. We also enjoyed from the top of the PH-D bar at the Dream Downtown Hotel.
The Rock. Go at nighttime the spectacle is superb. Dress warm, it can be cold up there.

You never tire of the view. Viewed for the first time from a boat at night, which was very atmospheric. At day time from the Statue of Liberty its dramatic.Viewed from the Empire State Building and Rockefellar is excilerating and another favorite spot is Central Park.
wow!. Nearly all my photos are af the skyline...I just could not stop snapping away.Views from Empire State just blew me away
how can you rate a skyline?. very nice.especially at night with all the lights and typical nyc atmosphere
Tall buildings. First trip and never realized how many buildings or how tall the buildings are in Manhattan
What Can I Say!. The Greatest City on Earth and the Greatest Skyline!
Top of the Rock. We had excellent weather and a clear day. We were able to visit all three floors at the top of Rockefeller Center and had great views of Central Park and the Empire State Building.
Never to Be Forgotten. Its reminder of 9/11/2001, its current skyline having returned to that of the 1960's
Awe inspiring!. You can see it in the movies all you want, but until you laid your own eyes on it, you won't believe it!
great view from Dream hotel downtown. Seeing the different architecture of the skyline and the buildings lit at night
what to say, get on the water and watch it. ferry to elis island, brooklyn and manhattan bridge crossing have very nice vista points. I like it a much at sun set.
Open Top Bus. Great view of skyline doing the nightime loop to Brooklyn on the open top bus
Incredible. The view from the Empire is absolutely breath taking, we have been twice and I will go and see the view every time.

So beautiful at sunset. Walk across the Brooklyn Bridge and watch the Manhattan skyline at sunset. Go either to the little platform on the Brooklyn side or theBrooklyn Bridge Park on the right side of the bridge. Amazing place to watch the sunset or just the awesome skyline.
NY Skyline. We viewed the skyline arriving and from Brooklyn and the Staten Island Ferry. It is fabulous.

No view like Manhattan. There truly is no view that rivals the cityscape that is Manhattan, whether from the east or from the west. It is truly intimidating while at the same time inviting, breeding a feel of familiarity with the fear of the unknown...
Top View. See it from the Rockefeller Centre 'Top of the Rock' as well as or instead of the Empire State Building as yoir view then includes the Empire State Building.
Must see photo op. If you are in new york this is a view that can't be missed, and its free
Beautiful. I got to enjoy the skyline from the Empire State Building and The Top of the Rock. I also seen one from in the daytime and one at sunset and both of the times the view was beautiful.
It is what you go to NYC to see!. Get a window seat on your arrival in to LaGuardia and get the most fantastic views of Manhattan.

Peace & quiet in the heart of the Big Apple. I read an article in our local paper; otherwise, I wouldn't have known about it. I think that mostly locals use it. It's a little bit of quiet right in the heart of the city. Start at 30th and walk all the way down to about 11th, an extremely pleasant walk. Views of the Empire State bldg. are a treat. We were there before the foliage and flowers, but the weather was perfect (March). If you go in the summer, take water, because it will be very sunny. When you exit, it's a few blocks to the subway.
Great view from Staton island Ferry. Took the free Ferry at night I thought I will be the only one doing a round trip, there was a lot of others.
Beautiful. Couldn't ask for better weather to see the skyline on our 1st ever trip to NYC.CAn't wait to return!!!!
Check it out from Brooklyn. Good to see it in real life rather than the movies.

Free views. Best view is from Top of the Rock of course, but I've also enjoyed gazing at the skyline from the Brooklyn Bridge, from Hoboken on the river, from the Staten Island Ferry (FREE!), and Circle Line on NYE, all were fantastic, and many of them free :D

From the Jersey Shore. We stayed just over the Hudson on the west side of Manhattan in a beautiful apartment. Every day we would bus it down to The Lincoln Tunnel and across to Manhattan. It would take 15 to 20 minutes and we loved it. Every day we really appreciated what we were viewing across the river from the bus. The magnificent Manhattan skyline. By morning it would look magnificent against beautiful blue skies and by night all lit up it really was a site to behold. Our apartment was right on the water's edge and we could see all the famous landmarks. The Empire State Building, The Chysler Builing etc etc and all the way down to the construction site where the World Trade Centre Buildings once stood. This stirred up many emotions but made me realise how strong and motivated the people of New York have been moving forward from such an horrific event. I thoroughly recommend doing what we did and doing the trip to downtown Manhattan each day. It really was an experience.

Day or night, its amazing!. We got the best view on our trip a few weeks ago on the Staten Island Ferry! Amazing views of the financial district on a clear day, and the ferry is free :)There are probably so many different equally awesome spots to take photos, its such a huge city, the towers (Empire State Building and Top of the Rock) also offer amazing views of the city, bring your camera everywhere in NY!
beautiful!. the view is breathtaking as always. Specially at night the lights are amazing and breath taking and will leave you staring at it for hours.

The true Soul of New York City. This iconic symbol of all that is New York City is seen best from the Brooklyn Promenade, the Staten Island ferry, crossing the 59th St. Bridge(Queensboro Bridge) from Queens to Manhattan, on a Circle Line or NY Waterway Cruise, from New Jersey vantage points just a short bus ride from the Port Authority bus terminal, or those adventurous enough (and with the finances) to take a helicopter ride. (I haven't done that one)
Wonderfull place to be there. Its a lifetime experience to see the Manhattan downtown and times square
Breathtaking. Even better than we expected.It really is awesomwe
From the empire state building. Loved this went up to the 80th floor, which was plenty.Rented the headphones, well worth it for the local info you heard.

One of the worlds wonders.. I particularly like to look at the Manhattan Skyline from my Brooklyn neighborhood of Williamsburg. First stop on the L train off Manhattan. Get off the train and walk down to the waterfront. On the weekends sometimes there are fleamarkets and you can layout in one of the parks listening to the water and looking at the Manhattan skyline. An incredible sight and quality of life experience.

On a sunny day, make sure you walk the skyline. A beautiful walk along this disused railway line which gives a different perspective to the city. There is plenty of seating along the way and, when we were there in December, a stall selling spiced hot chocolate and snacks. I would imagine that it is perfect in the summer too, with lounger furniture available. Don't take a bottle of wine though as this is banned. Don't forget your camera.

Stunning. We visited for New Year and went out on a New Years cruise. The view of the skyline at night time was amazing and fireworks over lady liberty an extra treat. Top of the Rock and Empire state building also visited for views and personally Top of the Rock was my fave so if it was one or the other it would definitely be that.

Top of Rock vs Empire State Building. Top of the Rock (Rockafeller Center Observation Deck) rules and Empire State Building Drools. The Rock had a great view, modest crowd and the whole experience worked better. Empire State building was a miserable experience. First of all skip the "interactive ride experience". Perhaps the worst application of this kind of motion ride I have ever experienced. Not updated since Twin towers were destroyed. Poor graphic resolution, jarring ride without a good reason to do so, voice over by Kevin Bacon, the script was so bad he should be ashamed. Wait for the elevator, get six stories to your destination and wait some more or hike it yourself and was very crowded on "top" get to the top and find out for ONLY another $13.00 per person you can go another 16 stories to the needle observation tower. What a rip-off. Had to take the kids but hated every second of the experience. Hope I never have to go again for any reason.Top of the Rock rules would be happy to visit it again, much better experience.
View was aweome. Not sure if it was just the location of the room, but amazing. View of the Twin Towers Memorial. The reconstruction, though, not such a great view.
Top of the rock. The skyline was enjoyable although very misty, took good photos

From the Empire State Building. We stayed in the Empire State Building from about 4pm until 8pm so we saw it in the day, evening and night. The most amazing views ever.
On the 102nd floor, you are not outside like you are on the 86nd floor.
Fabulous. A must see. City tour bus ia a great way of seeing the sights.

Amazing view. What's there to say about the skyline. It's magnificent. ESB, Freedom Tower, Chrysler Building.. Rockefeller Center.. any man on earth should've seen these buildings. But now I'm even more curious about the Burj Dubai tower.
fantastic. fantastic especially viewed from Brooklyn. Also great from the Brooklyn Bridge however can be a little wiindy on the bridge plus beware of cyclists.
Should be on ALL bucket lists. Nothing like it in the world! An awesome and perfect experience that people from other parts of the country and the world must see!
Top of the Rock. Wow!!! The best view in the city! Top of the Rock is one of my most recommended places to go.

Skyline is beautiful. You must have seen many movies based in New York - but when you see the skyine from Liberty island, you can see why everybody wants to be photographed standing with the skyline in the background. It is beautiful.
The best skyline in the world!. To really get the full effect, get on the Circle Line or come over to the Jersey side -- expecially after dark!

Very good organized, beatiful view. We went on top of the Rockfeller center - top of the rock. In our opinion this view point is better than the Empire State building because it is much more organized and yo don't have to stand hours in line.
Perfect use of a free afternoon. The weather cooperated and we took some time to waste some time. Worth a stroll.
Postcard, but for real. My favorite city in the world ! Everytime in NYC looks like magic !
What can I say but WOW!. Never fails to delight. Always worth having a look both in daylight and at night.
Breath-taking. A truly remarkable sight. The greatest view of the Manhattan Skyline I witnessed was across the bridge from Dumbo. Something everyone should witness in their lifetime.

Great use of old space. It is in a fantastic neighbourhood. DONT forget to stop for lunch at the chelsea market when you are on the manhattan skyline. It is off the skyline, (underneath) halfway through.
Beautiful from the top of the rock. great visit but long lines, really great views of central park and the Hudson river
Stunning. Exciting to see regardless of the time of year or weather.
C'mon, this is World Class!. Go to Weehawken, NJ to see one of the best skylines in the U.S. Just awesome!
Top of the Rock.. Top of the Rock. The view over Central Park is epic, and don't forget the skating rink....

Lovely during the day but spectacular at night!. We saw the skyline from the Empire State building at night, top of the Rock daytime and from the water on a ferry during the day. All views were great and different. Try them all
Overwhelming. The views of the Manhatten skyline will never leave you once you have seen it.
Makes great Facebook Pictures. Walking over the Brooklyn Bridge or taking the Ferry around the south of Manhatten. The views are stunning!

Two Great Viewpoints. Thoroughly enjoyed the views of the Manhattan Skyline from both the Empire State Building and the top of the Rock. Each offers a completely different perspective of the city skyline.
skyline form Rockefeller centre. did this on a clear sunny day...a must! well worth the money. went mid morning - no ques!
Makes you sing a Sinatra song.. Gorgeous and a bit overwhelming. The old and the new all mixed together, fantastic.
Very cool. It was really cool to see the skyline. The kids were in awe.
Great sight on a clear day. Night time especially. Good views particularly on a clear night from the Brooklyn Bridge.

Free from staten island ferry. Just south of ground zero sight is the South Ferry by bus stop or subway, at the very end of Manahttan is the free staten island ferry, this departs every 15 minutes, is completely free of charge and a great way to see the whole of Manhattan as well as the statue of liberty.
The View. Watched the skyline from The View at the Marriott. Great spot to have a drink and enjoy the beautiful scenery.
see it all from the top of the rock!. you can see the best veiw of central park and manhattan
Brilliant views from The Rockafella Centre, Empire State Building and The View in the Marriot Hotel. Best views at night from Empire State Building and during the day at The Rock, sunset at The View

Do the World Yacht Dinner Cruise at Night. The skyline is amazing - when boarding and setting sail the sun is going down and this is simply wonderful to see - then when the boat sets sail - the lights on the skyline come alive!!
A trick to know. See the skyline from Brooklyn Hights or from the NJ side at night.
Breathtaking. What could be a better photo? WTC is under construction so photos show a work in progress.
Beautiful!. Weather was amazing for March-cool but sunny and the skyline was amazing!
Beautiful. A site to behold. If you aren't going to the statue/Ellis Island, take the Staten Island Ferry for a free view of this amazing city.
From the Staten Island Ferry. Free ferry, short trip, ideal if you have a busy tourist schedule
Wonderfull. see it from brooklyn and you will not regret, you can see all of downtown of NY, you much love the city

BEAUTIFUL. ABSOLUTELY BEAUTIFUL. MUST SEE NEW YORK SKYLINE!!
Also, check out my new travel blog. I just recently posted about New York City and it's wonderful attractions!
macilewis.blogspot.com

Its My Daily View!. Incredible skyline visable from the balcony of my friend's place. Best views are Brooklyn Bridge and the Brooklyn Promenade but try the East Ruver Water Taxi for a real treat. For 60 years of travel, this has always been my favourite view from every angle.
amazing. it was really nice to see all the buildings from the water.. especially on a sunny day.

A must see in New york. The sky line was gorgeous at night. The feeling is incomparable. this ride gives you more than you expect to see .
It’s unique
Amazing city. The best skyline in the world, does not disappoint!

Lovely Place. Service is Best I've had.. The service is great here. The staff is very friendly and always on guard to help your needs. It's honestly the best I've had. Overally, the service stands out the most.
Beautiful. we took a night bus tour and saw the skyline all lit up at night and it was gorgeous. seeing where the twin towers should have been was a bit sad but otherwise, very nice
Gorgeous!. See it from the Brooklyn Bridge (you can walk across) or from Liberty Island. Great view!
Awesome Skyline both day and night. You must see the skyline from the water too - either the FREE Staten Island Ferry or a Circle Line Cruise
evryone must see it. i would say please who ever comes nyc and did not go to skyline u must it is very very beautiful
Worth the stroll. A garden with a view in a concrete jungle. loops around the West side of Manhattan

Go to The Palisades in Brooklyn Heights. The Palisades over the BQE offers the most spectacular view of lower Manhattan.
And don't forget to stroll through the Heights, some of the most beautiful residential streets in New York.
Unique. The view that you can only get in NYC. The building, parks, atmospehere are unique to New York.
Love Manhattan. Loved everything. People well helpful and kind. New York is safe and clean.

Unique and worth the experience. You can see it in movies and photos, but walking through the streets of Manhattan is special. The Top of the Rock is the best place to view the skyline, as it shows you the Empire State Building and a closer view of Central Park. The views from Staten Island, Hoboken NJ, and Brooklyn are also interesting and cover other angles. Finally, walking below the skyscrapers and looking up is a great experience.
Breathtaking!!. Take the Subway to Brooklyn Heights, walk down the road and just wonder at the amazing skyline in front of you!! Just terrific !!
The highest buildins in the world. Skyline was perfect but this 50 floored buildings were so near to each other and because of their shadows can not appear in the streets of manhattan
The Apple. No skyline compares to it anywhere that I have ever been to. See it from Brooklyn or NJ for the best view.
Outstanding View. The view of the Manhattan Skyline is incomparable! To see the structures and have the feeling you could almost touch them is awesome.

Nice. So much to see in New York. From seeing the city from the top of the Empire State Bldg, right down on town square people watching and checking out all of the architecture, it's just a great city!
It's nice, but it's missing something.... which will never be replaced. Everytime I visit is an experience.
the skyline is unparalled and i've been around the world.. we went to the River Cafe, need I say more, NYC at night is heaven, it's so beautiful!

None Like It. There so many great vantage points, Brooklyn Heights Promenade, Liberty State Park, South Street Seaport. But driving in from Long Island on the LIE as you near the Mid-town Tunnel, there is an awe inspiring stretch that seems right out of the Wizard of Oz!
One thing to do. There is so much to see and do this ride gives you the chance to see more than you may be able to

Must see in NY!. Beautiful at night! I recommend boat ride, rather quick than long once, they will provide all on the history and current info as well as show all the best of the skyline! Definitely its a must see in New York.
tranquility. An amazing place to chill out and see a different side to NYC
perfection. evryone has to see once it was really good experince for our familiy it was first time though but really had fun

Lots of good places to get a good view. Of course, the view is world-famous and wonderful. To see it at its best, though, you usually need to leave Manhattan. The view from the Brooklyn Heights Promenade is spectacular, especially at night. This is easily reached by taking the 2 or 3 subway to Clark Street and walking a few short blocks down Clark Street to the water. (Other subway stations also serve the area, though they are a bit farther from the Promenade.) Beautiful neighborhood too -- well worth seeing in itself. Walking across the Brooklyn Bridge provides a good view as well, though the Promenade view seems more panoramic. You can also take the Staten Island ferry, perhaps going in the late afternoon and returning as the lights go on in the evening. In addition, there can be very good views from the New Jersey side of the Hudson. The higher you are, the better. In both New Jersey and New York, the highways approaching Manhattan can provide spectacular views. Within Manhattan, you can get a wonderful skyline view from Central Park. All the tall buildings that line the park also frame it. Obviously, you also get a great perspective from the Empire State Building, though that costs money and usually involves an irritating wait.
breathtaking. I love coming over the Queensboro bridge, especiall at night and seeing THAT view.

Fantastic View. The very best view of the Manhattan Skyline is from Brooklyn. There is a small park and walking path in Brooklyn Heights along the water. From here you get a great view of the skyline and it's free.An alternative is the Staten Island Ferry - inexpensive or the ferry from New Jersey. There are several that give good views. These charge a fee.

Go to the Battery [Downtown]. Here is where you can really walk and see where the Hudson and East rivers come together. Watch cruise ships exiting the Hudson on their way to who knows where with people dining on their 4,000 calorie a day repastes. Take the Staten Island Ferry, go the the Statue of Liberty [the copper came from Karmoy, Norway] and go to Ellis Island. Just walk around downtown, see the New York Stock Exchange, Trinity Church - go inside and see my favorite building 17 State Street. Then dinner or lunch at Franuces Tavern where G Washington said farewell to his troops.

East River Ferry to see the NY Skyline. We took the East River Ferry from E. 34th Street to near Battery Park and the South Seaport area/Wall Street. $4 for the ride, and it was terrific for seeing the skyline! We got off and walked through the So. Seaport area, having a great cup of coffee at Jerry's Coffee. There is a free weekend ferry from where we got off to Ikea- the store subsidizes the ferry so people from Manhattan can go to the store and back, but you can just go for the ride if you want. This ferry is a wonderful inexpensive way to see the NYC skyline!
NYC, Feb 2012. Brilliant. Go just before the sun is due to go down. Beautiful to see NYC lighting up.

Its expensive but well worth it and the organisation staff are brilliant; professional, kind and efficient. Best thing to do at the end of your holiday so you know what you are looking at and can see where you've been!

We took a trip out on the Manhattan by Sail at sunset sailing out of South Street Seaport, and we got to see the skyline from the harbour, in daylight, sunset and also at night as we sailed only to the sound of the wind in the sails.No commentary, no noise, no traffic, just the sound of the wind and a most beautiful sight as we sailed out to Statue of Liberty at Sunset. Seeing it lit up at night is simply marvellous, it is one of those sights that you will never forget and we thought this was a most special way of seeing the skyline for a first time. Building

We could see everything from the Verrazzano Narorows Bridge and the rising Freedom Tower in the south to the buildings near Central Park in the north. Fantastic photo opportunity. Best view of the New York skyline is from The Rockafella center, Top of the Rock observation deck, Just as its getting dark, It can get busy at this time though as everybody wants That 1 special photo,
stunning. we saw the skyline from stattan island ferry in the day time and the evening the ferry is free and a must do in New York

the best at night!. It is amazing, yeah... The best idea is to admire it at night, from the deck of Staten Island Ferry - they are FREE and go all day, all night (there's a short break at dawn...). Half an hour one way. A thrilling experience!

The most beautiful sunrises and sunsets, that always make me love NYC. Definitely worth the trip to the other side of the hudson....in weehaken blvd east. Sunrise and sunset are the most beautiful times. Living in Weehawken I get to see one or the other everyday....and it always takes my breath away. if your visitng the New York area, go youll get beautiful pics with the breathtaking Manhattan skyline as your backdrop. Even in the middle of the day its a beautiful site to see.If you go to port authority ask information about buses that got to blvd east it should only be like 3 USD. Seriously try to check it out at sunset or sunrise the magnitude of the buildings and the colorful sky are just something youll always remember

From any angle, it's a winner. We mourned with the Twin Towers fell and some people thought that others were being horrible when it was said that our skyline was forever altered. We weren't being disrespectful to those who perished, we just realized that our city was forever altered spiritually and physically. It still hurts to see movies that show the skyline with the Towers. However, we are mourning, remembering, rebuilding and our skyline is still impressive. Go to Jersey and see the sunrise, go to Brooklyn or Long Island City and see the sunset. Take a ride on the Staten Island Ferry or Roosevelt Island Tram and take a gander or stand in the middle of Central Park at look up and around. Drive into Manhattan over the 59th Street Bridge or RFK Bridge and enjoy the scenic route. Stand on the Brooklyn Promenade at dusk or hike through Palisades Park in Jersey. Ride around the perimeter via bicycle: start at W 125 Street and go down the West side, hook around at Battery Park and head back uptown past South Street Seaport. Be brave and take to the streets at 34th street, get back on the path in the upper east 70's (parts of the path are under construction).

weehawken NJ has the best view!. weehawken NJ has the best view! The skyline is best seen from the hills on NJ side. There is a tiny street off JFK Blvd, where you can line yourself up with 42nd Street. It's breathtaking. I take all visitors there for WOW moment.
Best in the world. There is no other city like NY, and there is no other skyline like Manhattan's. The view from Brooklyn and NJ is spectacular.

Best Spot to see New York Skyline. Here is one of the best kept secrets of New York. The best place to see the New York City skyline is ........ The Brooklyn Heights Promanade. I go here fairly often and rarely see tourists,so here's how you get there:Take the R train from Manhattan to the Court St stop in Brooklyn. It's the first stop in Brooklyn. After you exit the train, look for the Montague Street exit. When you reach the street, ask any passerby which direction to walk to the Promanade (prom-a-nod) then walk along Monague Street to the end and you are on it. If you get to Brooklyn Borough Hall, you went the wrong way.This view is awesome and you'll feel like a local. And the best part is it's FREE!Recommended to see the movie, Moonstruck with Cher, before coming here to get in the mood.
Beautiful. Great to see especially at night from the NJ side of the river or a boat.
pictures. for best pictures of the skyline take the FREE statin island ferry. Take your pics from there
Wow!. Grand, awe-inspiring! You have to see it to understand!
WOW. what more needs to be said HUGE buildings !!! A must see for everyone !!

where to view. We walked the Brooklyn Bridge which is free and affords a really splendid view of the skyline. this is a must see, but where do i go to see it?. if you are from out of town, why not drive (in NJ) to Liberty State Park. you can park your car (easily) and there is a long prominade from which you can see the skyline from one of the best viewing places. and you have all the time you want to look.
