World Class Skyline. The Manhattan skyline is world class. You can't help but be impressed when faced with the imposing mass of skyscrapers this collection presents. Even by Hong Kong standards, its beautiful, mesmerizing and impossible to not admire. You would find it easy to argue that this is the finest collection of skyscrapers in the world. Having admired the skyline from many locations over the years, we concentrated our efforts on viewing the lower Manhattan area from the Top of the Rock Observatory during our recent trip to NYC. Here we were afforded wonderful views of the lower Manhattan skyline as well as nice uptown and central park views. You won't help but see the Manhattan Skyline when visiting NYC. Just make sure to stop and think about what you are seeing from time to time, it really doesn't get much (if any) better than this.

Greatest Skyline in the World!. The view of the Manhatten Skyline is exceptional at any angle or location as they all have unique prospectives, any one of them is awe inspiring. The size and scope is amazing. My favorite view is from Hamilton Plaza in Weehawken N.J. It sits high above the river on the Cliff's of the Palasades. You can see from the George Washington Bridge to the Verranzano Bridge and everything in between. It sits directly across from the Empire State Building and offers pictures of a life time. Day or night is is spectacular.
What more can you ask for. A sight to die for, fiurst timer in NYC and one that will be back

Spectacular...both day and night!. The best way to see the skyline is from the water, and there are plenty of choices. There are tours, like The Circle Line, that bring you around the island of Manhattan; there are dinner cruises; there are water taxis, especially down by the South Street Seaport; take a round-trip ferry ride to New Jersey and back, which can be both time and cost effective, especially if you want to check out Hoboken, a cool college town with bars, restaurants, and shopping, all within walking distance from the ferry terminal on the Jersey side.There's nothing like the return trip to the city, from Hoboken, on the ferry, once the sun has gone down.

The Most Incredible Skyline in the World. I've seen a good bit of the world, and NYC never fails to thrill me...espcially from the GW Bridge at night...The view from The Cloisters ordriving down thhHenry HUdson.....It's a glorious sight seen from a distance....

!Beautiful!. From every corner or place the skyline of Manhattan is gorgeous.
I specially like from Brooklyn Promenade.

See it at its best from the water. Iconic. Take the Staten Island ferry, it's free and you'll get the best views of Manhatten and the Statue of Liberty. Also go up the Emipre State building for a fantastic panorama.

ONE OF THE WORLD'S MOST BREATHTAKING VIEWS. It is breathtaking particularly if seen from a distance say for example from the Brooklyn side of the bridge, or from the Staten Island Free Ferry, or from a Circle Line Harbour Cruise, or from New Jersey, or wherever.After dark the Manhattan Skyline transforms itself into the world's biggest light show especially the Downtown Financial District if viewed from Brooklyn Heights or if you really want to push the boat in The River Restaurant, a gourmet paradise, immediately below The Brooklyn Bridge, from where the views of the Manhattan Skyline are brilliant.Each time I visit NYC and I have done so over 50 times, I still get excited when I first glimpse sight of the Manhattan Skyline from the taxi on route from JFK or Newark.
Hidden Treasure. Walk the Brooklyn Bridge. After you are over the bridge go and do some shopping and have some pizza and ice cream.

Unique and Unforgettable. The Manhattan skyline, a unique, unforgettable, and ever-changing landscape. NYC is like no other place in the world, and the skyline is just the start. So where to go to get some great views?You may get your first glimpse if taking a taxi from LGA or JFK to Manhattan via the 59th Street (aka Queensboro or Ed Koch Queensboro) Bridge or on the Long Island Expressway to the Midtown Tunnel.Great views can be had from the [free] Staten Island ferry, Governor's Island, the Brooklyn Bridge (walk across it), the Top of the Rock observatory at Rockefeller Center (great view of the Empire State Building), the Brooklyn Heights Promenade, and from one of the many boat rides around Manhattan including Circle Line. Another idea is to check out one of the many rooftop bars in NYC, as some have great views. For a meal with a view, there are many options, but one of the most frequently recommended places is The River Cafe which sits along the water under the Brooklyn Bridge on the Brooklyn side.There are many other places to catch different views of the NYC skyline, so explore the city and enjoy!
Beautiful!!. Manhattan is magical... history, glamour, excitement... easy to get around by walking, bus or taxi
